record.title: 880-03 Fatʹḥ al-Mubdiʻ fī sharḥ al-Muqniʻ : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jabara qulūb al-ʻulamāʼ bi-amdād jadhrihi al-matīn, wa-fataḥa la-hum bāb istikhrāj al-majhūl min al-maʻlūm al-razīn, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lah, Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ashhadu anna Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh sayyid al-mursalīn, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-inna al-Muqniʻ al-manẓūm ʻalá baḥr al-ṭawīl fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah, lil-Imām al-muḥaqqiq wa-al-ḥabr al-mudaqqiq, Abī al-ʻAbbās Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-shahīr bi-Ibn al-Hāʼim al-Shāfiʻī, ṭayyaba Allāh tharāh wa-jaʻala al-jannah maʼwāh, lammā kāna min abdaʻ kitāb fī al-jabr nuẓim, wa-ajmaʻ mawḍūʻ fīhi ʻalá miqdār ḥajmihi ruqim, ṭalaba minnī baʻḍ al-aʻizzah ʻalayy min al-fuḍalāʼ al-mutaraddidīn ilayy an aḍaʻa ʻalayhi sharḥan yaḥullu alfāẓah, wa-yubayyinu murādah, wa-yuqayyidu muṭlaqah, wa-yaftaḥu mughlaqah, fa-ajabtuhu ilá dhālik bi-ʻawn al-Qādir al-Mālik, ʻalá wajh laṭīf wa-manhaj munīf, wa-sammaytuhu bi-Fatʹḥ al-Mubdiʻ fī sharḥ al-Muqniʻ ..."
Secundo folio: qawluhu ʻalá al-Nabī al-Muṣṭafá.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "al-Muqniʻ fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah" in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "al-Muqniʻ fī al-jabr."

The text of "al-Muqniʻ fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah" starts with: "Bi-ḥamdi Ilāhī abtadī mā uḥāwilu // wa-uhdī ṣalātan maʻ salāmin yushākiluh. ʻAlá al-Muṣṭafá khayr al-anāmi wa-ālihi // wa-aṣḥābihi thumma al-duʻā yatawāṣalu. Li-fakhri al-zamān al-muntamī li-Jilāwatin // ʻAlīyin ʻalayhi suḥbu jūdin hawāṭilu ..." And it ends with: "... Wa-abyātuhā tisʻun wa-khamsūna unshiʼat // bi-al-Aqṣá wa-shahri al-yumni fa-hiya tuṭāwilu. Rabīʻun min al-ʻāmi alladhī ḍabṭu ʻaddihi // bi-Dālin wa-Ḍādin fa-al-thanā mutakāmilu." "al-Sharḥ: Ay bi-ʻām arbaʻah wa-thamānimiʼah, idh al-Dāl fī al-ḥisā̕b al-madhkūr [ḥisāb al-jummal], bi-arbaʻah, wa-al-Ḍād bi-thamānimiʼah ..."

Colophon: "Tamma al-sharḥ al-mubārak ʻalá yad al-faqīr Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī al-Shāfiʻī, li-muntaṣaf Dhī al-Qaʻdah min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-sittah wa-sabʻīn, sanat 1176. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed commentary was completed by the hand of the poor Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī al-Shāfiʻī in the middle of Dhū al-Qaʻdah, 1176 [of the Hijrah = 28 May, 1763]. May God pray on our Master and Lord Muḥammad and on his family and companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Muḥsin al-Qayṣarī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Aḥmadu Allāh ʻalá an qaṣara salāmat al-ṭabʻ ʻalá nawʻ al-insān, wa-aḍmara fī ṭayy ṣudūrihim ḍurūb al-awdhān [al-awzān], wa-ḥallāhum bi-natāʼij fikr tuzrī ʻalá al-laʼālī al-manthūrah fī aḥshāʼ al-buḥūr, bul tuzrī bi-al-farāʼid al-manẓūmah fī qalāʼid nuḥūr al-ḥūr, ḥamdan dāʼiman ghayr maqṭūʻ, wa-ashkuruhu shukran musbaghan bi-al-uṣūl wa-muzayyalan [wa-mudhayyalan] bi-al-furūʻ, mā wuqifa fī ghāyāt al-āyāt ʻalá al-fawāṣil wa-al-aʻjāz, wa-kushifa bi-kaff al-bayān qināʻ al-rayb ʻan wujūh al-iʻjāz ..."
Secundo folio: ʻinda kaffihi al-maʻarrāt ʻan al-kaff.
15.5 x 20.3 cm; written surface: 9x 16 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard.

In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī" preceded by the the word "Qāla" (He said) and the commentary by the word "Qultu" (I said), in red; markings in red; many commentaries on the margins; text within red frame surrounded by a larger frame; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī."

On folios 1b-2a: "... Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi kalimāt ... fī tashrīḥ mushkilāt al-Mukhtaṣar fī ʻilm al-ʻarūḍ al-mansūb ilá al-Imām al-kāmil bi-Abī [Abī] ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad, al-maʻrūf bi-Abī al-Jaysh al-Anṣārī al-Andalusī ... daʻatnī ilá taʼlīfihā ishārāt ṣadarat min Janāb al-Amīr al-muʻaẓẓam wa-al-Ṣadr al-mufakhkham ... Sulaymān Bīk ibn al-Amīr al-aʻẓam wa-al-Wazīr al-akram ... Amīr Ṭāshiḥūn Bīk ..."

Colophon: "... Wa-hādhā ākhir mā aradnāh min 'Bayān mushkilāt al-Mukhtaṣar fī ʻilm al-ʻarūḍ al-mawsūm bi-Andalusī', ḥāmidan wa-shākran lillāh taʻālá ʻalá ilhām al-taḥqīq wa-inʻām al-tawfīq. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-al-shukr la-hu ʻalá al-tamām, wa-lil-Rasūl afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Qad tamma al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb. Subḥāna Rabbika Rabbi al-ʻizzati ʻammā yaṣifūn, wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "... This is the end of what we intended to clarify of the problems of the compendium on the science of prosody, titled 'al-Andalusī'. I praise and thank God Most High for inspiring me and helping me to finish it. Praises and thanks to God for the completion. May the best prayer and peace be upon the Messenger [Prophet Muḥammad]. The book is completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King. Praise be to the Lord, the Lord of Might, far is He from what they falsely attribute to Him. May peace be upon the messengers, and praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
record.note: Title from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻāmil al-ʻallāmah, al-ʻumdah al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, jāmiʻ ashtāt al-faḍāʼil, baqīyat al-salaf al-amāthil, Abū ʻAbd Allāh Aḥmad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī al-Shāfiʻī al-Makkī, aʻāda Allāh ʻalaynā min barakātihi wa-barakāt ʻulūmihi al-bāhiyah al-bāhirah, wa-afāḍa ʻalaynā wa-ʻalá al-Muslimīn min fayḍ madad buḥūr funūnihi al-zākiyah al-fākhirah, wa-taghammadahu bi-raḥmatih wa-askanahu baḥbūḥat Jannatih. Āmīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ikhtaṣṣa Nabīyanā Muḥammadan, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, bi-Kitābihi alladhī akhrasa al-fuṣaḥāʼ wa-aʻjaza al-bulaghāʼ ʻan al-tafawwuh bi-mithl aqṣar sūrah min suwarih, bal āyah min āyātih, wa-bi-jawāmiʻ al-kalim, wa-badāʼiʻ al-ḥikam, wa-ʻaẓīm al-khulq fī sāʼir aqwālih wa-afʻālih wa-ḥālātih ..."
Secundo folio: wa-ṣifātihi wa-shamāʼilahu lā tustaqṣá.
15.5 x 20.7 cm; written surface: 11 x 16.5 cm; 25-27 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; with the verses of al-Hamzīyah of al-Būṣīrī in red; markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb lillāh taʻālá Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, ʻumdat al-muḥaqqiqīn, wa-ruḥalat al-muḥaddithīn, wa-ṣadr al-mudarrisīn, Abī ʻAbd Allāh Aḥmad Shihāb al-Dīn al-Haythamī, al-shahīr bi-Ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī, saqá Allāh qabrahu bi-al-raḥmah wa-al-ruḍwān wa-askanahu fasīḥ al-jinān. Āmīn. Yā Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

On folio 1a: Biographical information about al-Būṣīrī, and some verses of his poetry, quoted from the commentary of al-Jawjarī (Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Munʻim, 1418-1484) on "al-Burdah" (another well-known panegyrical poem by al-Būṣirī priaising the Prophet Muḥammad), stating that al-Būṣīrī died in the year 695 of the Hijrah (1295/1296) at al-Mārastān al-Manṣūrī in Cairo.

On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhu 'al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah', thumma balaghanī anna al-nāẓim sammāhā 'Umm al-Qurá', tashbīhan la-hā bi-Makkah, bi-jāmiʻ annahā ḥawat bi-ṭarīq al-taṣrīḥ, aw, al-īmāʼ mā fī akthar al-madāʼiḥ, wa-ḥīnaʼidhin sammaytuhu 'Afḍal al-qirā li-qurrāʼ Umm al-Qurá' ..."
"al-Hamzīyah" of al-Būṣīrī starts with: Kayfa tarqá ruqīyaka al-anbiyāʼu // yā samāʼan mā ṭāwalathā samāʼu. It ends with: Mā aqāma al-ṣalāta man ʻabada Allāha wa-qāmat bi-Rabbihā al-ashyāʼu.

Colophon: "Wa-wāfaqa al-farāgh min itmām hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, khāmis ʻashar Rabīʻ al-Awwal, min shuhūr sanat khams wa-sabʻīn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá [Allāh] ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Wa-kutiba bi-rasm Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, muftī al-Muslimīn, mufīd al-ṭālibīn, Mawlānā al-Shaykh Aḥmad ibn Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Shaykh, al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil al-zāhid al-wariʻ, Mawlānā al-Shaykh Ismāʻīl, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakatihimā fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah, wa-jaʻalahu huwa wa-salafuhu fī shafāʻat Sayyid al-Mursalīn, wa-ḥsharahumā taḥta liwāʼihi Yawm al-Qiyāmah. Innahu ʻalá mā yashāʼu qadīr, wa-bi-al-ijābah jadīr. Wa-ghafara Allāh li-man saʻá fī hādhihi al-nuskhah, wa-li-kātibihā, wa-li-man naẓara fī dhālik wa-daʻā bi-khayr. Āmīn. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on blessed Monday, 15 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 1075 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [6 October, 1664], may the best prayer and peace be upon him. Praise be to God alone. May [God] pray on the one who no prophet comes after him [Prophet Muḥammad]. Copied for our Master and Lord, the learned scholar, the muftī of the Muslims, the benevolent to the students, our Master Shaykh Aḥmad, the son of our Master and Lord, the learned laboror, the ascetic and righteous scholar, our Master Shaykh Ismāʻīl, may God benefit us with their blessing in this world and the Hereafter. May he and his predecessor be granted the intercession of the Master of the Messengers [Prophet Muḥammad] and be gathered under his banner on the Day of Resurrection. He [God] does what He pleases, and readily answers the requests. May God forgive whoever participated in this copy, its copyist and the reader who offers an invocation of welfare. Amen. There is no power nor might except in God the Almighty and All Powerful."

record.title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 1 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī anzala al-Qurʼān kalāman muʼallafan munaẓẓaman, wa-nazzalahu bi-ḥasab al-maṣāliḥ munajjaman, wa-jaʻalahu bi-al-taḥmīd muftataḥan, wa-bi-al-istiʻādhah mukhtataman, wa-awḥāhu ʻalá qismayn mutashābihan wa-muḥkaman, wa-faṣṣalahu suwaran, wa-suwaruhu āyāt, wa-mayyaza baynahunna bi-fuṣūl wa-ghāyāt, wa-mā hiya illā ṣifāt mubtadiʼ mubtadiʻ, wa-simāt munshiʼ mukhtariʻ, fa-subḥāna man istaʼthara bi-al-awwalīyah wa-al-qidam, wa-wasama kull shayʼ bi-al-ḥudūth ʻan al-ʻadam, anshaʼahu kitāban sāṭiʻan tibyānuhu, qāṭiʻan burhānuhu, waḥyan nāṭiqan bi-bayyināt wa-ḥujaj, Qurʼānan ʻArabīyan ghayr dhī ʻiwaj, miftāḥan lil-manāfiʻ al-dīnīyah wa-al-dunyāwīyah ..."
Secundo folio: wa-ʻalá jamīʻ al-Muhājirīn wa-al-Anṣār.
18.5 x 28 cm; written surface: 12 x 19.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; central medallion on cover and flap.

In good naskh/ruqʻah script; in black ink on white paper; headings and markings in red; many notes and commentaries on the margins; the titles of the sūrahs within decorative designs, colored in red, blue, black, green and gold; catchwords.
On the label of the front cover: "al-Juzʼ al-awwal min Tafsīr al-Kashshāf, min al-Fātiḥah li-ghāyat al-Aʻrāf, mudhahhab wa-muṭallā ruʼūs al-suwar."
At the head of the text on folio 1b: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Lā yamassuhu illā al-muṭahharūn. Tanzīl min Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with: "ʻAn Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayh: Man qaraʼa Sūrat al-Aʻrāf jaʻala Allāh Yawm al-Qiyāmah baynahu wa-bayna Iblīs saddan, wa-kāna Ādam shafīʻan [la-hu] Yawm al-Qiyāmah."

record.title: 880-03 Kashf al-lithām ʻan asʼilat al-anām : manuscript / Ḥusayn ibn Muḥammad al-Maḥallī.
record.note: Title from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Ḥamdan li-man faqqaha fī al-dīn man irtaḍāhu min ʻibādih, fa-salakū minhāj al-rashād ʻalá wafq murādih, wa-ṣalātan wa-salāman ʻalá Sayyid al-Mursalīn, al-qāʼil 'Man yarid Allāh bi-hi khayran yufaqqihhu fī al-dīn', wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-al-tābiʻīn wa-tābiʻīhim bi-iḥsān ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi wa-iḥsānah, wa-muʼammil min Allāh faḍla jūdihi wa-imtinānah, Ḥusayn ibn Muḥammad al-Maḥallī al-Shāfiʻī: Lammā kathura al-suʼāl ʻan waqāʼiʻ al-aḥwāl, wa-zāda al-ishtighāl fī al-ḥall wa-al-irtiḥāl, wa-qalla man yujību al-sāʼil bi-al-manqūl, wa-iʻtamad al-muftīyūn [al-muftūn] ʻalá jawāhir al-ʻuqūl, wa-rubbamā ajābū fī al-wāqiʻāt bi-ghayr mā qarrarahu al-aʼimmah min al-manqūlāt, aradtu an ajmaʻa mā yartāḥu bi-hi al-labīb wa-yakshufu al-karb ʻan kull muhimm gharīb ..."
Secundo folio: al-sukhūnah wa-al-burūdah wa-māʼ diyār Thamūd.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16.2 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 37 quires, mostly unnumbered).

In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; titles of the legal issues on the margins, preceded by the word "maṭlab" (question, issue, matter), catchwords.
At the head of folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Kashf al-lithām ʻan asʼilat al-anām, taʼlīf al-Imām al-ʻallāmah al-Shaykh Ḥusayn al-Maḥallī, raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: Quotations from the poetry of the author and his son Aḥmad.
On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhu Kashf al-lithām ʻan asʼilat al-anām ..."

Author's colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Wa-hādhā ākhir mā aradnā jamʻahu, jaʻalahu Allāh khāliṣan li-wajhihi al-karīm wa-mukhalliṣan min hawl al-karb al-ʻaẓīm, wa-fataḥa ʻalá man talaqqāhu bi-qalb salīm."

Translation of the author's colophon: "God is more knowledgeable. This is the end of what we wanted to compile. May God render it purely for the sake of His gracious face, and a means for deliverance from the torment of the horrible distress [Judgment Day]. May He reward him who wholeheartedly accepts it."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-hādhihi al-nuskhah nuqilat min musawwadat muʼllifihā al-Shaykh Ḥusayn al-Maḥallāwī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-ʻulūmihi wa-al-muslimīn. Thumma inna al-muʼallif bayyaḍa wa-jamaʻa nuskhatahu fī 15 shahr Shawwāl, sanat 1155. <Āmīn>. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah yawm al-Arbaʻ al-mubārak, 14 shahr Rajab al-ḥarām, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah khamsah wa-thamānīn <1175>. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb. In tajid ʻayban fa-sudda al-khalalā // jalla man lā fīhi ʻaybun wa-ʻalā."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This copy was transcribed from the draft of its author al-Shaykh Ḥusayn al-Maḥallāwī, may God benefit [us] and the Muslims by his sciences. The author then wrote and compiled a fair copy, on 15 Shawwāl, 1155 [13 December, 1742]. <Amen>. This copy was completed on blessed Wednesday, 14 Rajab, 1185 [23 October, 1771]. <1175>. God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. If you were to find a blemish close the gap // Mighty and Sublime is the One in whom no blemish exists."

record.title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 3 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.

Incipit: "Sūrat al-Kahf. Makkīyah. Wa-hiya miʼah wa-iḥdá ʻashrata āyah. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Laqqana Allāh ʻibādahu wa-faqqaqahum kayfa yuthnūna ʻalayhi wa-yaḥmadūnahu ʻalá ajzal naʻmāʼihi ʻalayhim, wa-hiya niʻmat al-Islām, wa-mā anzala ʻalá ʻabdihi Muḥammad min al-Kitāb, alladhī huwa sabab najātihim wa-fawzihim, wa-lam yajʻal la-hu ʻiwajan, wa-lam yajʻal la-hu shayʼan min al-ʻiwaj qaṭṭ. Wa-al-ʻiwaj fī al-maʻānī ka-al-ʻiwaj fī al-aʻyān ..."
Secundo folio: Allāh waladan mutaʻalliq bi-al-mundharīn.
18.5 x 24.8 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 18 cm; 22 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather.
In good naskh/ruqʻah script; in black ink on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: Two partially legible ownership statements: 1. "Mālik hādhā al-mamlūk [... ... ...]". 2. "Qad ishtaraytu hādhā al-tafsīr fī [... ... ...]. Seal of "Muḥammad Ismāʻīl".

Colophon: No colophon. The work ends with the commentary on Sūrat al-Nās (Chapter 114, the last sūrah of the Qurʼān) and a pious invocation by the author: "Qāla ʻabd Allāh al-faqīr ilayhi: Wa-anā aʻūdh bi-himā [al-Muʻawwidhatayn], wa-bi-jamīʻ kalimāt Allāh al-kāmilah al-tāmmah, wa-alūdhu bi-kanaf raḥmatihi al-shāmilah al-ʻāmmah min kull mā yaklimu al-dīn wa-yathlimu al-yaqīn ... wa-asʼaluhu bi-khuḍūʻ al-ʻunq wa-khushūʻ al-baṣar, wa-bi-mā ʻunītu bi-hi min muhājaratī ilayhi, wa-mujāwaratī wa-murābaṭatī bi-Makkah wa-muṣābaratī ... wa-bi-mā laqītu min kadḥ al-yamīn wa-ʻaraq al-jabīn fī ʻamal al-Kashshāf ... bayna ẓahrānay al-Ḥaram wa-bayna yaday al-Bayt al-Muḥarram, ḥattá waqaʻa al-taʼwīl ḥaythu wujida al-Tanzīl, an yahaba lī khātimat al-khayr, wa-yaqiyanī maṣāriʻ al-sūʼ, wa-yatajāwaza ʻan faraṭātī Yawm al-Tanād, wa-lā yafḍaḥanī bi-hā ʻalá ruʼūs al-ashhād, wa-yaḥullanī Dār al-Maqāmah, min faḍlihi, bi-wāsiʻ ṭawlihi wa-sābigh thawābih. Innahu Huwa al-jawwād al-karīm, al-raʼūf al-raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tamm. (Seal of Muḥammad Ismāʻīl)."

record.title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 2 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.

Incipit: "Sūrat al-Aʻrāf Makkīyah, ghayr thamān āyāt: 'Wa-salhum ʻan al-Qaryah' ilá 'Wa-idh nataqnā'. Wa-hiya miʼatān wa-khams āyāt. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Kitāb: Khabar mubtadaʼ maḥdhūf, ay, huwa Kitāb, wa-unzila ilayka ṣifah la-hu, wa-al-murād bi-al-Kitāb al-sūrah, fa-lā yakun fī ṣadrika ḥaraj minhu, ay, shakk minhu, ka-qawlihi: Fa-in kunta fī shakk mimmā anzalnā ilayka, wa-maʻná al-shakk ḥarijan, li-anna al-shākk ḍayyiq al-ṣadr ḥarijuhu, kamā anna al-mutayaqqin munshariḥ al-ṣadr munfasiḥuhu, ay, lā tashukka fī annahu muzal min Allāh, aw, ḥarij min tablīghih, li-annahu kāna yakhāfu qawmahu wa-takdhībahum la-hu wa-iʻrāḍahum ʻanhu wa-adhāhum, fa-kāna yaḍīqu ṣadruhu min al-adāʼ wa-lā yanbasiṭu la-hu, fa-ammanahu Allāh wa-nahāhu min al-mubālāh bi-him ..."
Secundo folio: wa-qalīlan nuṣiba bi-tadhakkarūn.
19.5 x 29.5 cm; written surface: 12 x 22 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather with flap (in 23 unnumbered quires).
In beautiful naskh script; in black ink on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and commentaries on the margins; text within double red frame; catchwords.
On the label on the front cover: "al-Juzʼ al-thānī min Tafsīr al-Qurʼān lil-Shaykh Jār Allāh al-Zamakhsharī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu. 1166."
On folio 1a: "al-Juzʼ al-thānī min Tafsīr al-Qurʼān al-ʻAẓīm, lil-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah Jār Allāh al-Zamakhsharī."

The commentary on Sūrat al-Kahf ends with: "ʻAn Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Man qaraʼa Sūrat al-Kahf, kadhā, min ākhirihā kānat la-hu nūran min qarnihi ilá qadamih, wa-man qaraʼahā kullahā kānat la-hu nūran min al-arḍ ilá al-samāʼ. Wa-ʻanhu, ʻalayhi al-salām: Man qaraʼa ʻinda maḍjaʻihi: 'Qul innamā anā basharun mithlukum', kāna la-hu fī maḍjaʻihi nūr yatalaʼlaʼu ilá Makkah taḥshū dhālika al-nūr malāʼikah yuṣallūna ʻalayhi ḥattá yaqūm, wa-in kāna maḍjaʻuhu bi-Makkah kāna la-hu nūr yatalaʼlaʼu min maḍjaʻihi ilá al-Bayt, ḥashū dhālika al-nūr malāʼikah yuṣallūna ʻalayhi ḥattá yastayqiẓa ..."
Colophon: "Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá ʻUmar Afandī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, fī yawm al-Jumʻah, rābiʻ ʻishrīn shahr al-Qaʻdah, sanat 1166."

Translation of the Colophon: "The copy was completed by the hand of the poor to God Almighty, ʻUmar Afandī, may God forgive him and his parents, on Friday, 24 al-Qaʻdah, 1166 [of the Hijrah = 22 September, 1753]."

record.title: 880-01 Kitāb fī maʻrifat al-burj wa-al-manāzil wa-maʻrifat al-qamar wa-al-awtād : manuscript.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhā 'Kitāb fī maʻrifat al-burj wa-al-manāzil wa-maʻrifat al-qamar wa-al-awtād'. Iʻlam innaka idhā aradta an taʻrifa burj al-qamar, fa-unẓur mā maḍá min al-shahr al-ʻArabī wa-zid qadrahu, wa-zidhu khamsah, wa-aʻṭi li-kull burj khamsah, wa-ibtadī min burj al-shams, fa-al-muntahī ilayhi huwa burj al-qamar ..."
Secundo folio: suʻūd maqdam naṭḥ Thurayyā.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 17.5 cm; 12-18 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; several astrological/astronomical charts and diagrams; catchwords.
On folio 1a: A poem in nine verses (in broken Arabic and unbalanced rhythm), by an anonymous author, praising a dignitary named "al-ʻĪsāwī" and his noble Hashemite descent.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... fa-innahu lā yukmilu sabʻat ayyām ḥattá yará al-ʻajab min al-maṭlūb wa-yaṣīru tibʻan la-hu, kamā yatbaʻu al-walad ummahu, wa-al-kawkab burjahu. Wa-al-āyah hiya: 'ʻAsá Allāh an yajʻala baynakum wa-bayna alladhīna ʻādaytum minhum mawaddah', wa-hiya ṣifat al-khātim, kamā tará al-masʼalah al-thāniyah. Wa-Allāh taʻālá aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ ..."

record.title: 880-02 Tuḥfat al-aḥbāb fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb : manuscript / Badr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Māridīnī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh muyassir al-ḥisāb, wa-muhawwin al-ṣiʻāb, wa-musayyir al-ḥussāb, aḥmaduhu ḥamdan yaftaḥu lanā min al-khayrāt kulla bāb, wa-ashkuruhu shukran yaʻṣimunā bi-hi min al-artiyāb, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lah shahādata ʻabdin awwāb, wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluhu, al-nāṭiq bi-al-ṣawāb, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-jamīʻ al-aṣḥāb. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Māridīnī: Hādhā mukhtaṣar fī ʻilam al-ḥisāb, yusahhil li-man yurīdu al-shurūʻ fī al-farāʼiḍ min ulī al-albāb, mushtamil ʻalá muqaddimah wa-thalāthat abwāb wa-khātimah yatimmu bi-hā al-kitāb. Sammaytuhu: Tuḥfat al-aḥbāb fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb ..."
Secundo folio: al-aṣlī thalāthat anwāʻ.
15.7 x 21 cm; written surface: 10 x 17 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two quires).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Tuḥfat al-aḥbāb fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb, kitāb mukhtaṣar fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb, lil-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, Sibṭ al-Māridīnī, ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-Allāh aʻlam."
On folio 1a: Two ownership statements: "Mulk al-faqīr Muḥammad Aḥmad ʻAlī ʻĪsá al-Najjārī". "Dakhala fī mulk al-faqīr Aḥmad Ḥijāzī".
On folio 1a: Miscellaneous quotations in poetry and prose.
Colophon: "Wa-fī hādhā al-qadr kifāyah lil-mubtadiʼ. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn."
Translation of the colophon: "What was introduced in sufficient for the beginner. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions."

record.title: 880-02 Īḍāḥ al-mubham min maʻānī al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Munʻim al-Damanhūrī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Allāhumma iʻānah. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-mulhim lil-ṣawāb, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-nāṭiq bi-al-ḥikmah wa-faṣl al-khiṭāb, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-kirām wa-al-tābiʻīn, wa-man tabiʻahum bi-iḥsān ʻalá al-dawām. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu Aḥmad al-Damanhūrī, ballaghahu Allāh al-āmāl wa-razaqahu al-tawfīq fī al-aqwāl wa-al-afʻāl: Qad saʼalanī baʻḍ al-ṭalabah al-mubtadiʼīn an ashraḥa Sullam al-manṭiq sharḥan yakūnu fī ghāyat al-līn wa-an lā azīda ʻalá ḥall alfāẓihi, li-yaẓfara bi-fahm maʻnāh man huwa min ḥuffāẓihi, fa-ajabtuhu li-dhālik mustaʻīnan bi-al-Qādir al-Mālik, musammiyan īyāhu bi-Īḍāḥ al-mubham min maʻānī al-Sullam, ṭāliban min al-Samīʻ al-Baṣīr an yanfaʻa bi-hi kamā nafaʻa bi-aṣlihi, innahu ʻalá dhālika qadīr ..."
Secundo folio: al-afhām wa-Allāh ʻalam ʻalá al-dhāt al-wājib al-wujūd.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 10 x 16 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in three unnumbered quires).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of the "al-Sullam" and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Īḍāḥ al-mubham min maʻānī al-Sullam, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Damanhūrī al-Ḥanafī, fasaḥ Allāh fī muddatih wa-nafaʻa bi-hi, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. M M."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Fī nawbat al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-Bārī ʻabduhu Muḥammad Aḥmad ʻAlī Zahūrah al-Najjārī, Allāh sitruhu."

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā aradnā kitābatahu. Nasʼalu Man waffaqanā la-hu an yanfaʻa [bi-hi]. Innahu ʻalá dhālika qadīr. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tamma al-sharḥ. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what we wanted to write. We ask Him who enabled us for what we accomplished to benefit [us] by it. He is able on doing this. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. The commentary is concluded. God is more knowledgeable.

record.title: 880-02 Intikhāb al-Iqtiḍāb : manuscript / Saʻīd ibn Abī al-Khayr ibn al-Masīḥī.
record.note: Title from colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning of the manuscript is missing. The text starts with: "... minhu dalālah mā, wa-laysa maʻa hādhā bi-muṭṭaridah, mithl anna al-nawʻ al-wāḥid in kānat la-hu aṣnāf mukhtalifah fa-abyaḍuhā abraduhā, wa-alladhī minhā aḥmar aw aswad aḥarruhā, mithl inna hādhā ayḍan laysa bi-mustamirr fī kull al-anwāʻ, fa-iʻlam dhālik. Kam hiya al-ashyah [al-ashyāʼ] allatī iḍṭarrat al-aṭibāʼ ilá tarkīb al-adwiyah al-mufradah? Sittah: Aḥaduhā, ikhtilāf maqādīr al-amrāḍ; wa-al-thānī, ikhtilāf jihāt istiʻmāl al-adwiyah; wa-al-thālith, taṭyīb ṭaʻm al-dawāʼ li-yashula shurbuhu ..."
Secundo folio: wa-in kāna murakkaban min thalāthah.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 12.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two unnumbered quires).
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the question are written in purple; catchwords.

Author's colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir al-masāʼil al-ṭibbīyah al-mushtamilah ʻalá jumal min ʻilm al-ṭibb, quṣida bi-hā li-takūna madkhalan lil-mubtadī wa-tadhkirah lil-muntahī. Wa-fī dhālika kifāyah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This is the end of the medical issues which included miscellaneous aspects of the science of medicine, intended to be an introduction to the beginner and a memorandum to the accomplished. Enough said. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. Amen. It is concluded."

Copyist's colophon: "Tamma Kitāb 'Intikhāb al-Iqtiḍāb', masʼalah wa-jawāb, fī khamsah min Dhī al-Qaʻdah al-ḥarām alladhī huwa min shuhūr <khamsah> sittah wa-sabʻīn baʻda al-miʼatayn wa-al-alf bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh taʻālá ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The book of 'Selection from the Compendium', in the form of question and answer, was completed on 5 Dhū al-Qaʻdah, 1276 [of the Hijrah = 25 May, 1860] by the help of God Almighty and His abundant benevolence. May God Almighty pray on our Master Muḥammad and his family and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 al-Tadhhīb fī sharḥ al-Tahdhīb : manuscript / ʻUbayd Allāh ibn Faḍl Allāh al-Khabīṣī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 2a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Inna aḥaqq mā yatazayyanu bi-nashrihi manṭiq al-qāṣī wa-al-ḥāḍir, wa-yatawashshaḥ bi-dhikrihi ṣudūr al-kutub wa-al-dafātir, ḥamd Allāh, jalla jalāluh, ʻalá al-āyah al-muzhirat al-riyāḍ, wa-shukruhu, ʻamma nawāluh, ʻalá naʻmāʼihi al-mutraʻat al-ḥiyāḍ, alladhī sharrafa nawʻ al-insān bi-ḥilyat al-idrāk, wa-zaīnat al-ifhām, wa-khaṣṣaṣahu bi-idrāj durar al-maʻānī fī jawāhir al-alfāẓ ʻalá sharṭ al-intiẓām ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr ilá Allāh al-ghanī ʻUbayd Allāh ibn Faḍl Allāh al-Khabīṣī ... lammā raʼaytu al-mukhtaṣar al-musammá bi-al-Tahdhīb, al-mansūb ilá ... Saʻd al-Millah wa-al-Dīn Masʻūd al-Taftāzānī ... kitāban mushtamilan ʻalá akthar masāʼil al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah fī tamhīd al-qawāʻid al-manṭiqīyah ... sharaḥtuhu sharḥan yubayyinu muʻḍilātih wa-yufassiru mushkilātih ... wasamtuhu bi-al-Tadhhīb fī sharḥ al-Tahdhīb ..."
Secundo folio: al-muḥaṣṣilūn ʻan fahm rasāʼilihi.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 14 cm; 18 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard (in 6 unnumbered quires)
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Tahdhīb in red; few notes on the margins; catchwords.

Author's colophon: "Hādhā ākhir mā aradnā īrādahu fī 'Sharḥ' al-kitāb. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb ... Thumma jazā Allāh khayran man taʼammala ṣanʻatī wa-qābala mā fīhā min al-sahw bi-al-ʻafw, wa-aṣlaḥa mā akhṭaʼtu fīhi bi-faḍlihi wa-fiṭnatih. Wa-astaghfiru Allāh min sahwī, fa-innī muʻtarif bi-qillat al-biḍāʻah wa-rijlī fī miḍmār tilka al-ṣināʻah, idh lam yatayassar ilayya al-iṭṭilāʻ ʻalá al-kutub al-manṭiqīyah illā ʻalá 'Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah', wa-istakhrajtu minhu al-masāʼil ʻalá ḥasb dhihnī wa-dahāʼī, wa-istafadtu minhu al-fawāʼid ʻalá qadr fahmī wa-dhakāʼī, fa-katabtuhā fī hādhā al-kitāb bi-tabṣirah li-man tabaṣṣar, wa-tadhkirah li-man arāda an yatadhakkar. Wa-Allāh al-mustaʻān wa-ʻalayhi al-tiklān. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This is the end of what we wanted to introduce of the 'Commentary' on the book. God is more knowledgeable of what is correct, to Him is the reference and returning ... Also, may God reward well him who investigates my work and forgives what he finds of inattentiveness, or corrects what mistakes I made, according to his favor and perspicacity. I ask God's forgiveness for any forgetfulness, and admit my meager knowledge and the lack of the agility of my leg in the arena of this art; as I was not able to inspect the books on logic, except 'the Commentary on al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah', of which I extracted the issues according to my mind and intelligence, and acquired benefits from it according to my understanding and acumen, which I recorded in this book, as an instruction for him who wants to ponder, and a memorandum for him who wants to remember. Help comes from God, and on Him is the reliance. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and on his family and companions and grant them peace. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Īḍāḥ al-mubham min maʻānī al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Munʻim al-Damanhūrī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-mulhim lil-ṣawāb, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-nāṭiq bi-al-ḥikmah wa-faṣl al-khiṭāb, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-kirām wa-al-tābiʻīn, wa-man tabiʻahum ʻalá al-dawām. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu Aḥmad al-Damanhūrī, ballaghahu Allāh al-āmāl wa-razaqahu al-tawfīq fī al-aqwāl wa-al-afʻāl: Qad saʼalanī baʻḍ al-ṭalabah al-mubtadiʼīn an ashraḥa Sullam al-manṭiq sharḥan yakūnu fī ghāyat al-līn, wa-an lā azīda ʻalá ḥall alfāẓihi, li-yaẓfara bi-fahm maʻnāhu man huwa min ḥuffāẓihi, fa-ajabtuhu li-dhālika, mustaʻīnan bi-al-Qādir al-Mālik, musammaiyan la-hu bi-Īḍāḥ al-mubham min maʻānī al-Sullam, ṭāliban min al-Samīʻ al-Baṣīr an yanfaʻa bi-hi kamā nafaʻa bi-aṣlihi, innahu ʻalá dhālika qadīr ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-nisbah bayna al-thalāthah fī risālatinā.
16 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 15.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark brown leather on spine and flap.
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of "al-Sullam" and markings in red; some commentaries on the margins; catchwords.

Author's colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā aradnā kitābatahu. Nasʼalu Man waffaqanā la-hu an yanfaʻa bi-hi. Innahu ʻalá dhālika qadīr. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Āmīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This is the end of what we wanted to write. We ask Him who enabled us for what we accomplished to benefit [us] by it. He is able on doing this. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace.
Copyist's colophon: "Waqaʻa al-farāgh min kitābatihi yawm al-Ithnayn, fī khāmis ʻashar yawman min shahr Ṣafar, sanat 1194, arbaʻah wa-tisʻīn wa-miʼah wa-alf."
Translation of the copyist's colophon: "Copied on Monday, 15 Ṣafar, 1194 [of the Hijrah = 21 February, 1780]."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-ʻālim bi-al-kullīyāt wa-al-juzʼīyāt, al-hādī lil-ʻuqūl ilá ḥall ṣiʻāb al-maʻqūl bi-ṭuruq iktisāb al-taṣawwurāt wa-al-taṣdīqāt, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-jāmiʻ li-ajnās al-kamālāt wa-al-faḍāyil, al-mukhtār min afḍal al-anwāʻ wa-al-[...?] ashraf aṣnāf al-urūmāt wa-al-qabāʼil, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi [...] dhawī al-ʻuqūl al-zakīyah wa-ṣāʼibī al-anẓār, wa-ʻalá al-tābiʻīn wa-man tabiʻahum bi-iḥsān min dhawī al-anwār wa-badīʻ al-asrār. Ammā baʻd, fa-qad kuntu sharaḥtu fīmā maḍá kitāb al-Sullam sharḥan badīʻ al-itqān, mushtamilan ʻalá farāʼid al-taḥqīqāt wa-nikāt al-tadqīqāt wa-badāʼiʻ al-ʻirfān, dhallaltu fīhi ṣiʻāb al-mushkilāt ʻalá ṭarīq al-tamām, wa-istakhrajtu minhu mustawdaʻāt asrār wa-ẓarāʼif afhām, wa-ẓafirtu minhu bi-daqāʼiq anẓār wa-mukhabbaʼāt asrār, ihtadaytu fīhi ʻalá gharāʼib nikāt wa-ʻarāʼis abkār, thumma raʼaytu anna al-himam al-ān qad qaṣurat, wa-al-ʻuqūl fī hādhā al-zamān qad taballadat wa-takaddarat, fa-ṣaraftu al-himmah thāniyan naḥwa al-ikhtiṣār wa-al-iqtiṣār ʻalá al-taḥqīqāt wa-nabdh al-aghyār, māzijan lil-sharḥ bi-al-shurūḥ imtizāj al-māʼ bi-al-rāḥ wa-al-jasad bi-al-rūḥ ..."
Secundo folio: fīmā akhrajahu al-aʼimmah.
17 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 16 cm; 22 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in five unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Sullam in red; some commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb sharḥ al-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Mullawī al-Shāfiʻī ʻalá matn al-Sullam fī ʻilm al-manṭiq."
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Sharḥ al-Sullam, lil-Shaykh al-Mullawī, nafaʻanā Allāh taʻālá bi-hi. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk ʻabduhu al-faqīr Nablālī, ghafara Allāh la-hu."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah yawm al-Thalāth al-mubārak, li-sittah (6) khalat min shuhūr alf wa-miʼah thamāniyah wa-tisʻīn, sanat 1198 min al-Jihrah [al-Hijrah] al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām."

Translation of the colophon: "This copy was written on blessed Tuesday, six having passed from the months of the year 1198 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [probably 6 Jumādá al-Thāniyah, 1198 = 27 April, 1784], may the best prayer and peace be upon him."

record.title: 880-03 al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kīmiyāʼī : manuscript / Ṣāliḥ ibn Naṣr Allāh ibn Sallūm al-Ḥalabī.
record.note: Titles of the two treaises from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of "al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kīmiyāʼī": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūl Allāh, wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā Kitāb al-ṭīb [al-ṭibb] al-kīmiyāwī alladhī ikhtaraʻahu Baraklistūsh [Barākalsūs: Paracelsus, 1493-1541], yashmalu ʻalá muqaddimāt wa-maqālāt. al-Muqaddimah al-ūlá fī taʻrīf al-kīmiyāʼ, wa-li-bayān al-ḥājah ilayhā, wa-al-gharaḍ minhā. Fa-naqūlu: al-Kīmiyāʼ lafẓ Yūnānī, fī aṣlihi khimiyā, wa-maʻnāhu al-taḥlīl wa-al-tafrīq, wa-baʻḍ al-nās yuṭliqu ʻalayhā al-ṣināʻah al-Hirmisīyah. Wa-qāla qawm: Yuṭlaqu ʻalayhā amr al-kahanah. Wa-awwal min ightaraʻahā [ikhtaraʻahā] huw Hirmis al-Thulth [al-Muthallath] al-Miṣrī, wa-ʻallamahā al-kahanah. Wa-baʻd dhālika shāʻat ḥattá waṣalat ilá al-Yūnān, wa-ṣannafū fī dhālika kutuban wa-rasāʼil, ilá al-Islāmīyīn, wa-allafū fīhā kutuban kathīrah wa-rasāʼil ʻadīdah. Wa-al-maqṣūd min dhālika iṣlāḥ al-maʻdin [al-maʻādin] wa-taghyīrihā min al-fasād ilá al-ṣalāḥ, ka-qalb al-nuḥās fiḍḍah wa-al-fiḍḍah dhahaban, ilá an jāʼa Barākāshūsh al-Ḥirāfī [Barākalsūs al-Jirmānī], fa-ghayyara al-gharaḍ min ṣināʻat al-kīmiyāʼ, wa-jaʻalahu min aqsām ṣanʻat al-ṭibb, wa-sammāhu istāgharā bi-al-Lātīnīyah, wa-maʻnāhu jamʻ al-mukhallafāt wa-tafrīquhā, wa-hādhā al-ism makhṣūṣ bi-ṣināʻat al-ṭibb al-kīmiyāʼī ..."
Secundo folio of "al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kīmiyāʼī": wa-al-kīmiyāʼ al-ṭayyibah [al-ṭibbīyah] wa-qad tuṭlaqu al-kīmiyāʼ ʻalá al-ḥikmah.

Incipit of "Kīmiyāʼ bāsilīqā (or, al-Kimiyāʼ al-malakīyah)": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ʻalá manbaʻ al-ḥikmah fī al-ʻālamīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi alladhīna iqtabasū min mishkāt nūrih, fa-hum hudāt al-dīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-qad allafa fī ṣināʻat al-ṭibb al-kīmiyāʼī Faraliyūsh [Qarūliliyūs: Croll, Oswald, approximately 1560-1609] kitāban mukhtaṣaran mufīdan li-malik zamānih, wa-huwa yashmalu ʻalá maqālatayn, fa-aradnā an nanqulahu min al-Lātīnīyah ilá al-ʻArabīyah, li-yakun [li-yakūna] bihā tamām al-nafʻ, wa-sammá hādhā al-kitāb Kimiyā nalīqā [bāsilīqā], yaʻnī al-Kimiyāʼ al-malakīyah ..."
Secundo folio of "Kīmiyāʼ bāsilīqā (or, al-Kimiyāʼ al-malakīyah)": min al-akhlāṭ al-fāsidah.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16.5 cm; 21-26 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding with flap; dark brown leather on the edges (in four unnumbered quires).
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and keywords in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: Two ownership statements: "[... ...] Abū Ghazālah". "Tamallaka hādhā al-kitāb al-faqīr Fatʹḥ Allāh Abū Ghazālah, ʻufiya ʻanhu".

Colophon of "al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kīmiyāʼī": "... Wa-hādhā ākhir mā ikhtarnāhu wa-naqalnāhu min kitāb Shinārtūsh al-Ḥirāfī [Sināritūs al-Jirmānī: Daniel Sennert, 1572-1637], alladhī fī ṣināʻat al-ṭbb, wa-min Qarabādīn Wāfarbūsh [Wāqiriyūs: Johann Jacob Wecker, 1528-1586] min [fī] taqṭīr al-arwāḥ wa-al-adʹhān. Wa-bi-hi tamma al-kitāb. Wa-Allāh al-mahdī ilá al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of "al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kīmiyāʼī": "This is the end of what we selected and translated from the book of Senartus the Germanic [Daniel Sennert, 1572-1637], which is about the profession of medicine, and from Qarabādīn (Pharmaceutics) of Wāqirbūs [Wāqiryūs: Johann Jacob Wecker, 1528-1586] about the distillation of spirits and oils, by which the book is concluded. God is the one who guides to what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on him who no prophet comes after him [Prophet Muḥammad]. Amen. Amen."
Colophon of "Kīmiyāʼ bāsilīqā (or, al-Kimiyāʼ al-malakīyah)": "Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Wa-al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. H."

Translation of the colophon of "Kīmiyāʼ bāsilīqā (or, al-Kimiyāʼ al-malakīyah)": "God is more knowledgeable. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on him who no prophet comes after him [Prophet Muḥammad]. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. H."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The first leaf is missing. Starts with: "... Abtadá [Abtadī], aw, ibtidāʼī, aw, uʼallifu, aw, taʼlīfī. Wa-ibtadaʼa bi-al-Basmalah taʼassiyan bi-al-Qurʼān al-ʻazīz, wa-imtithālan li-muqtaḍá qawlihi, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, fīmā akhrajahu al-aʼimmah 'Kull amr dhī bāl lā bubdaʼu fīhi bi-bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm fa-huwa ajdham', ay, maqṭūʻ al-barakah, wa-fī riwāyah 'bi-ḥamd Allāh', rawāhu Abū Dāwūd wa-ghayruhu, wa-ḥassanahu Ibn al-Ṣalāḥ wa-ghayruhu ..."
Secundo folio: alladhī ka-al-saḥāb wa-min bayānīyah.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 14.5 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Sullam in red; some commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
Colophon: "Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn."
Translation of the colophon: "It is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Naḥmaduka yā man afāḍa ʻalá riyāḍ ʻuqūlinā ghuyūth saḥāʼib al-taṣawwurāt wa-al-taṣdīqāt, wa-aṭlaʻa fī samāwāt baṣāʼirinā shumūs maʻrifat al-kullīyāt wa-al-juzʼīyāt. Wa-nashhadu an lā ilāha illā anta waḥdaka, lā sharīka lak, al-munʻim ʻalá ajnās al-makhlūqāt bi-anwāʻ al-hibāt. Wa-nashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduka wa-rasūluk al-mabʻūth bi-al-burhān al-wāḍiḥ wa-al-qawl al-shāriḥ wa-al-āyāt al-bayyināt, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi mā tarannamat ashkāl al-ghuṣūn bi-anfās al-nasamāt, wa-afṣaḥa dhū manṭiq ʻammā fī khazāʼin ḍamīrihi min al-mukawwināt. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu rājī al-ghufrān Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān, aḥsana Allāh ʻamalah wa-ballaghahu fī al-dārayn amalah: Lammā manna al-Mawlá al-laṭīf ʻalá hādhā al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf bi-qirāʼat al-Sharḥ al-ṣaghīr ʻalá al-Sullam li-Shaykhinā al-ruḥalah al-Ustādh al-Mullawī, ʻalá muʼallafihi wa-ʻalayhi ruḍwān al-Rabb al-akram, wa-bi-qrāʼī dhālika al-kitāb li-jamm ghafīr min maharat al-ṭullāb, wa-taḥaṣṣala minhā mā yassarahu Allāh taʻālá min taqrīrāt sharīfah wa-taḥqīqāt badīʻah munīfah wa-nikāt almaʻīyah wa-daqāʼiq lawdhaʻīyah naẓamtuhā fī silk al-taṣnīf wa-jaʻaltuhā ḥāshiyah ʻalá hādhā al-Sharḥ al-munīf ..."
Secundo folio: wa-tasāhala fī mawāḍiʻ kathīrah.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16.5 cm; 25-30 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; black cloth on spine and flap (in nine numbered quires).
In good naskh script (except quire 9 which is written in fair naskh/ruqʻah script), in black ink, on white paper; many commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Ḥāshiyat al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah wa-al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah al-Shaykh al-Ṣabbān ʻalá Mullawī al-Sullam. Manṭiq."

Author's colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu: Tamma tabyīḍ hādhihi al-Ḥāshiyah ʻalá yad muʼallifihā al-faqīr ilá raḥmat Mawlāh, Muḥammad al-Ṣabbān, ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-al-ghufrān wa-al-iḥsān, wa-kāna tamām tabyīḍihā yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ li-arbaʻ layālin baqiyat min shahr Muḥarram al-ḥarām, ifttitāḥ sanat 1197, sabʻ wa-tisʻīn wa-miʼah wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-salām."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author said: The fair copy of this Gloss was completed by the hand of its author, the poor to the mercy of his Lord, Muḥammad al-Ṣabbān, may God bestow upon him forgiveness and favor, having been completed on Wednesday, four nights remaining from the month of Muḥarram, the beginning of the year 1197 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [1 January, 1783], may the best prayer and the most perfect peace be upon Him."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihā yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ ayḍan, baʻda al-ẓuhr, tāsiʻ ʻashar yawm maḍá min shahr Rabīʻ al-Thānī, ʻaqiba mawlid Sayyidinā al-Imām al-Ḥusayn, sanat 1225, khamsah wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, ʻalá yad kātibihā, bi-yadihi al-fāniyah, al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-ʻAlī al-Bārī, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Farghalī al-Anṣārī nasaban al-Khazrajī qabīlatan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban al-Ṭahṭāʼī baladan al-Azʹharī iqāmatan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-li-muḥbbīhi wa-li-man naẓara fīhi wa-daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah wa-al-raḥmah, wa-li-man wajada ʻayban wa-aṣlaḥahu. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-sallam."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "It was copied also on Wednesday, in the afternoon, 19 days having passed from the month of Rabīʻ al-Thānī, after the birthday of our Master al-Imām al-Ḥusayn, in the year 1225 [of the Hijrah = 24 May, 1810], by the perishing hand of its copyist, the poor servant, who admits his inability and his insufficiency, he who hopes for the forgiveness of his Mighty Lord the Creator, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Farghalī al-Anṣārī nasaban al-Khazrajī qabīlatan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban al-Ṭahṭāʼī baladan al-Azʹharī iqāmatan, may God forgive him, his parents, his teachers, his loved ones, him who looks into it and invokes God to forgive him and have mercy upon him, and him who finds a blemish in it and corrects it. May God prey on our Master Muḥammad and grant him peace."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Akhḍarī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Allāhumma lā sahl illā mā jaʻaltahu sahlan. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala qulūb al-ʻulamāʼ samāwāt tatajallá fīhā shumūs al-maʻārif, wa-wassaʻa dawāyir afhāmihim fa-awlajahum qibāb al-mukhaddarāt min ʻarāyis al-maʻānī wa-al-laṭāyif, wa-ḥabāhum bi-ḥadāyiq al-ʻuqūl fa-tanāwalū min thamarātihā, fa-aṣbaḥt āfāq ʻuqūlihim mushriqah bi-aqmār al-ʻulūm, fa-fāqū man ʻadāhum min al-wará, wa-istaqwaw ʻalá dhurá al-majd wa-ʻalaw ʻalá manābir al-ʻizz bimā sabaqa lahum fī al-Kitāb al-marqūm, fa-tāhū fī riḥāb al-ʻilm wa-ʻaraṣāt al-fahm ʻalá bisāṭ ḥujaj al-maʻqūl ..."
Secundo folio: ṭalaban li-taḥqīq al-manqūl.
13 x 20 cm; written surface: 7 x 13.5 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap (in 5 numbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on light bluish-green paper; few notes on the margisn; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ al-Sullam lil-Akhḍarī. Sharḥ al-Sullam lil-Akhḍarī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá raḥmatan wāsiʻah. Āmīn."

On folio 2a: "Wa-baʻd, fa-lammā waḍaʻtu al-urjūzah al-musammāh bi-'al-Sullam al-murawnaq fī ʻilm al-manṭiq', wa-jāt [wa-jāʼat], bi-ḥamd Allāh, jumlatan [jumaluhu] kāfiyah, wa-li-maqāṣid <fī fann ʻilm> fannihā ḥāwiyah, rāwadanī baʻḍ al-ikhwān min al-ṭalabah, akramahum Allāh, al-marrah baʻda al-marrah, ʻalá an aḍaʻa ʻalyahā sharḥan mufīdan yabuththu mā inṭawat ʻalayhi min al-maʻānī, wa-yashīdu mā taqāṣara fīhā min al-mabānī, fa-ajabtuhu li-dhālika ṭalaban [ṭāliban] min Allāh ḥusn al-tawfīq ilá manābiʻ al-taḥqīq, wa-in kuntu lastu ahlan li-dhālik, wa-lākin ḥamalanī ʻalayhi tafāwulī. Wa-lam aḍaʻhu li-man huwa aʻlá minnī, bal li-amthālī min al-mubtadʼīn. Fa-Allāh Allāh, yā akhī al-iʻtidhār wa-tark al-iʻtirāḍ ʻalá al-muʼminīn, wa-iltamis al-ʻudhr li-akhīka al-muʼmin, wa-sāl [wa-sal] Allāh ilayhi fī al-duʻāʼ wa-li-wālidayya bi-al-maghfirah wa-al-raḥmah, raḥimaka Allāh taʻālá. Wa-Allāh walī al-tawfīq ..."
On folio 2b: The text of 'al-Sullam al-murawnaq fī ʻilm al-manṭiq' starts with: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī qad akhraja // natāʼij al-fikr li-arbāb al-ḥijā ..."

Colophon: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhā [min] kitābat hādhā al-sharḥ al-ʻaẓīm yawm al-Ithnayn, khams ʻashar Shaʻbān al-mubārak, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat tisʻah wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼatayn baʻda al-alf, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihā [wa-aḥwajihim] ilá Rabbihi al-Jawwād, Ibrāhīm Ḥasan Amīn al-Dīn, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu, wa-ghafara la-hu wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "It is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. This great commentary was concluded on Monday, the fifteenth of blessed Shaʻbān, of the year 1229 [of the Hijrah = 2 August, 1814], by the hand of the poorest of mankind and the neediest to his Benevolent Lord, Ibrāhīm Ḥasan Amīn al-Dīn, may God pardon him and forgive him who offers and invocation for his forgiveness. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Taʻlīm al-mutaʻallim ṭarīq al-taʻallum : manuscript / Burhān al-Dīn al-Zarnūjī.
record.note: Title of "Taʻlīm al-mutaʻallim ṭarīq al-taʻallum" from incipit (folio 9b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of the excerpt from "Majālis al-abrār wa-masālik al-akhyār": "Aʻūdhu billāh min al-Shayṭān al-rajīm. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Majlis al-ḥādī wa-al-thalāthūn: Fī bayān ṣadaqat al-fiṭr wa-aḥkām al-ʻīdayn wa-bayān al-bidaʻ fīhi [fīhimā]. Faraḍ Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi wa-sallam, zakāt al-Fiṭr ṭuhratan lil-ṣiyām min al-lahw wa-al-laghw wa-al-rifth wa-ṭuʻmatan lil-masākīn. Wa-hādhā al-Ḥadīth min ḥisān al-Maṣābīḥ, rawāhu Ibn ʻAbbās, wa-huwa yadullu ʻalá wujūb ṣadaqat al-Fiṭr, li-anna al-farḍ fī al-lughah bi-maʻná al-taqdīr, wa-fī al-sharʻ bi-maʻná al-ījāb. Wa-lafẓ al-Shāriʻ dāra bayna al-maʻná al-sharʻī wa-maʻná [wa-al-maʻná] al-lughawī, yataʻayyanu ḥamluhu ʻalá al-maʻná al-sharʻī mā amkana, li-anna al-ghālib min ḥāl al-Nabī, ʻalayhi al-salām, taʻrīf al-aḥkām dūn al-lughāt, fa-ʻalá hādhā yakūnu al-maʻná anna wujūb ṣadaqat al-Fiṭr ʻalá al-insān li-fāʼidatan ..."
Secundo folio of the excerpt from "Majālis al-abrār wa-masālik al-akhyār": bi-al-mubāsharah wa-baʻḍuhum bi-al-mushāhadah.

Incipit of "Taʻlīm al-mutaʻallim ṭarīq al-taʻallum": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī faḍḍala banī Ādam bi-al-ʻilm wa-al-ʻamal ʻalá jamīʻ al-ʻālam, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Muḥammad Sayyid al-ʻArab wa-al-ʻAjam, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābih yanābīʻ al-ʻulūm wa-al-ḥikam. Wa-baʻd, fa-lammā raʼaytu kathīran min ṭullāb al-ʻilm fī zamāninā yajiddūna ilá al-ʻilm wa-lā yaṣilūn, wa-min manāfiʻihi wa-thamarātihi, wa-hiya al-ʻamal bi-hi wa-al-nashr yuḥramūn, limā annahum akhṭaʼū ṭarāʼiqahu wa-tarakū sharāʼiṭ [sharāʼiṭahu] <annī>, wa-kull man akhṭaʼa al-ṭarīq ḍalla, wa-lā yanālu al-maqṣūd qalla aw jalla, aradtu wa-aḥbabtu an ubayyina lahum ṭarīq al-taʻallum ʻalá mā raʼaytu fī al-Kitāb wa-samiʻtu min asātīdhī ulī al-ʻilm wa-al-ḥikam rajāʼ al-duʻāʼ lī min al-rāghibīn fīhi al-mukhliṣīn bi-al-fawz wa-al-khalāṣ fī Yawm al-Dīn mā istakhartu lillāh taʻālá fīhi, wa-sammaytuhu 'Taʻlīm al-mutaʻallim ṭarīq al-taʻallum', wa-jaʻaltuhu fuṣūlan ..."
Secundo folio of "Taʻlīm al-mutaʻallim ṭarīq al-taʻallum": fī taʻẓīm al-ʻilm wa-ahlih.
15 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 17 cm; 15 lines per page. Written surface for the excerpt from "Majālis al-abrār wa-masālik al-akhyār": 13.5 x 19 cm; 17-19 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding.

"Taʻlīm al-mutaʻallim ṭarīq al-taʻallum" is written in good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes on the margins; catchwords. The excerpt from "Majālis al-abrār wa-masālik al-akhyār" is written in fair naskh/ruqʻah script.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb bi-hi Taʻallum al-mutaʻallim."
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá."
At the head of folio 2b: An endowment statement: "Waqf al-marḥūm ʻAbbās Bāshā."
Folios 3b-9a are blank; text of "Taʻlī al-mutaʻallim ṭarīq al-taʻallum" (folios 9b-30a).
On folio 9b: "Munājāt [Munājāh]. Lā ilāha illā Allāh, Muḥammad Rasūl Allāh. Lā ilāha illā Allāh, Muḥammad Rasūl Allāh. Hādhā kitāb Taʻlīm mutaʻallim."

Colophon of the excerpt from "Majālis al-abrār wa-masālik al-akhyār": No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... Naʻam. Inna hādhihi al-ayyām ayām faraḥ wa-surūr, lākin yanbaghī an yakūna iẓhār al-faraḥ wa-al-surūr fīhā bi-mā kāna mubāḥan aw mustaḥabban, ka-al-ightisāl wa-al-taṭayyub wa-lays [wa-libs] aḥsan al-sayyiʼāt [al-thiyāb?] al-mubāḥah allatī takūn jadīdah aw ghasīlah ʻalá mā sayajīʼ, lā bi-mā kāna ḥarām [ḥarāman], ka-libs al-ḥarīr wa-al-khawḍ fī al-bāṭil, li-anna al-ʻīd innamā summiya ʻīdan li-annahu taʻālá yaʻūdu fīhi ʻalá al-muʼmin bi-al-maghfirah wa-al-iḥsān, fa-yajibu ʻalayhim an yajtanibū al-maʻṣiyah wa-al-ṭughyān ḥattá yakūnū min ahl al-saʻādah wa-al-ruḍwān, lā min ahl al-shaqāwah wa-al-khidhlān. Wa-qad ḥukiya ʻan baʻḍ al-ʻārifīn annahu [marra] yawm al-ʻīd bi-qawm yalʻabūn wa-yaḍḥakūn, fa-qāl: In kāna tuqubilla min hāʼulāʼ lazimahum an yashkurū wa-laysa hādhā fiʻl al-shākirīn, wa-in kāna lam tuqubilla [yutaqabbal] minhum lazimahum an yakhāfū wa-laysa hādhā fiʻl al-khāʼifīn. Thumma yanbaghī an yuʻlam anna baʻḍ al-nās qad zaʻamū anna ..."

Colophon of "Taʻlīm al-mutaʻallim ṭarīq al-taʻallum": "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh awwalan wa-ākhiran. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām. Wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khayr al-anām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn. 18 Dhī al-Ḥijjah, sanat 1191."

Translation of the colophon of "Taʻlīm al-mutaʻallim ṭarīq al-taʻallum": "Praise be to God at the beginning and at the end. Praise be to God for the completion. May prayer be upon our Master Muḥammad, the best of mankind, and upon his family and all his companions. 18 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, the year 1191 [of the Hijrah = 17 January, 1778]."

record.title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
record.note: Title of "al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qafīyah" from reference sources.
Title of "Fatḥ Rabb al-Barīyah bi-sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah" from incipit (folio 17b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfīyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-lil-shiʻr mīzānun yusammá ʻarūḍahu // bi-hā al-naqṣ wa-al-rujḥān yadrīhimā al-fatá. Wa-anwāʻuhu qul khamsataʻshara kulluhā // tuʼallafu min juzʼayni farʻayni lā siwá ..."
Secundo folio of the al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qafīyah: Wa-qul watidun in zidta ḥarfan bilā imtirā.

Incipit of Fatḥ Rabb al-Barīyah bi-sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī waḍaʻa ʻilm al-ʻarūḍ li-yuʻrafa bi-hi awzān al-manẓūm, wa-jaʻala afkāranā qāfiyah li-āthār al-ʻulamāʼ bi-al-manṭūq wa-al-mafhūm, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyid al-Mursalīn wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā sharḥ ʻalá al-Khazrajīyah al-manẓūmah ʻalá baḥr al-ṭawīl fī ʻilm al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qawāfī, naẓm al-ʻallāmah Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn Abī Muḥammad ʻAbd Allāh ibn Muḥammad al-Khazrajī al-Mālikī al-Andalusī, yaḥullu alfāẓahā wa-yubayyinu murādahā wa-yaftaḥu rumūzahā, wa-sammaytuhu bi-Fatḥ Rabb al-Barīyah bi-sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah. Wa-Allāh asʼalu an yanfaʻa bi-hi wa-yajʻalahu khāliṣan li-wajhihi ..."
Secundo folio of "Fatḥ Rabb al-Barīyah bi-sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah: ālah yuʻrafu bi-hā miqdār.

Incipit of Treatise on the new meters in Arabic poetry (folio 79a): "Fāʼidah. Baḥr al-mutadārak istakhrajahu al-Akhfash min baḥr al-mutaqārib, wa-ikhtalafa fīhi ʻan al-Khalīl; fa-qāla al-akthar: 'Naṣṣa ʻalá ṭarḥihi wa-laysa ʻindahu shiʻran [shiʻrun].' Wa-qāla qawm: 'Lam yamnaʻhu wa-lam yuthbithu, immā li-annahu lam yablughhu, wa-tadārakahu al-Akhfash, wa-li-hādhā summiya al-mutadārak' ..."
Secundo folio of Treatise on the new meters in Arabic poetry: wa-qīla dakhalahu al-qaṭʻ wa-jarat al-ʻillah fīhi majrá al-zuḥāf.

Incipit of Treatise on the sixteen classical meters of Arabic poetry including phrases quoted from the Qurʼān (folio 81a): "Wa-hādhihi abyāt tajmaʻu ʻarūḍ al-abḥur al-sittata ʻashar, bi-istishhād bi-āyāt min al-Qurʼān al-Karīm lil-Bīr, raḥimahu Allāh wa-raḍiya ʻanhu: Ṭawīl. Ṭawīlun madá al-hijrān man kuntu ahwāhu // adhāba fuʼādī wa-al-taṣabburu afnāhu. Faʻūlun mafāʻīlun faʻūlun mafāʻilun // wa-lā taqtulu al-nafsa allatī ḥarrama Allāhu ..."
Secundo folio of Treatise on the sixteen classical meters of Arabic poetry including phrases quoted from the Qurʼān: Mustafʻilun fāʻilun mustafʻilun faʻilun.

9 x 12.5 cm; written surface for al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah: 5 x 7.5 cm; 7 lines per page. Written surface for Fatḥ Rabb al-Barīyah bi-sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah: 5 x 7.5 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding; cover heavily damaged.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red and blue; some notes on the margins; some wormholes; no catchwords.
On folio 1a: "al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah fī al-qawānīn al-ʻarūḍīyah, taʼlīf al-Shaykh Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Andalusī al-Khazrajī, raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Four verses on poetry naming the fifteen classical meters of Arabic poetry, and a note stating that the sixteenth meter "al-Mutadārak" was mentioned by al-Akhfash (al-Akhfash al-Awsaṭ, Saʻīd ibn Masʻadah, died approximately 830).
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr Muḥammad al-Tadmurī."

On folio 28a: A collation and correction note: "Balagha muqābalatan wa-qirāʼatan wa-taṣḥīḥan min Mawlānā wa-Sayyidinā al-Shaykh al-fāḍil wa-al-baḥr al-zākhir, ḥāwī al-kamālāt wa-al-faḍāʼil, al-Shaykh Yaḥyá al-Faraḍī al-Shāfiʻī, ḥafiẓahu Allāh [Probably: Yaḥyá ibn Taqī al-Dīn al-Faraḍī, active 1619]. Katabahu al-faqīr Muḥammad Shaʻʻāl."

al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah ends with: "... Wa-qad kamult sittan wa-tisʻīna fa-alladhī // tawassaʻa fī dhā al-ʻilmi tūsiʻuhu ḥubbā. Wa-yasʼalu ʻAbdu Allāhi dhā al-Khazrajīyu min // muṭāliʻihā itḥāfahu minhu bi-al-duʻā."
Half of folio 84 is torn up. On folio 84b are written some verses of poetry in Maghribi script.
Colophon of al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah: "Tammat. Katabahā Muḥammad al-Ḥurr, ʻufiya ʻanhu."
Translation of the colophon of al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah: "It is completed. Copied by Muḥammad al-Ḥurr, may he be pardoned."

Colophon of Fatḥ Rabb al-Barīyah bi-sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah (folio 79a): "Tamma Fatḥ Rabb al-Barīyah bi-sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah fī salkh shahr Ramaḍān, yawm al-Thalāth, min sanat ithnayn wa-sabʻīn wa-tisʻimiʼah bi-al-Mashhad al-Aqdas, ʻalá musharrifihi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥurr, ʻafá Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of Fatḥ Rabb al-Barīyah bi-sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah: "Fatḥ Rabb al-Barīyah bi-sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah was completed at the end of the month of Ramaḍān, on Tuesday, of the year 972 [of the Hijrah = 11 May, 1565], at al-Mashhad al-Aqdas, may prayer and peace be upon him who dignified it by his presence [Probably the eight Shiʻī Imām, ʻAlī al-Riḍā ibn Mūsá, died 818 or 819], by the hand of the poor servant Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥurr, may God pardon him. Amen."
Colophon of Treatise on the new meters in Arabic poetry. No colophon. Text ends with: "... wa-hādhihi al-abḥr al-thalāthah takhruju min dāʼirat al-mutashābih. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb."
Colophon of Treatise on the sixteen classical meters of Arabic poetry including phrases quoted from the Qurʼān: "Tammat."
Translation of the colophon of Treatise on the sixteen classical meters of Arabic poetry including phrases quoted from the Qurʼān: "It is completed."

record.title: 880-03 Dīwān : manuscript / Abū Tammām Ḥabīb ibn Aws al-Ṭāʼī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Hādhā 'Dīwān' nādirat al-falak wa-wāsiṭat ʻiqd al-dahr fī ṣināʻat al-shiʻr, naẓm al-Imām al-humām al-ḥādhiq al-fahhām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallām, al-Shaykh Abī Tammām Ḥabīb ibn Aws al-Ṭāʼī. Ḥarf al-Hamzah. Qāla yamdaḥu Khālid ibn Yazīd al-Shaybānī, wa-hādhā ʻalá al-tartīb alladhī rattabahu Abū Bakr al-Ṣūlī, wa-jaʻalahu thamāniyat aṣnāf: Yā mawḍiʻa al-Shadanīyati al-wajnāʼi // wa-muṣāriʻa al-īlāj wa-al-isrāʼi. Addi al-salāma muʻarrifan wa-muḥaṣṣiban // min Khālidi al-maʻrūfi wa-al-hayjāʼi ..."
Secundo folio: Wa-taʻarrafat ʻirfān zākhiratin wa-lam.
16.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 15.5 cm; 14 lines per page.
Binding: In buckram binding with black leather on spine with decoration in gold.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red, some in bold black script; catchwords.
Colophon: "Bi-yad kātibihi ʻAbd al-Aḥad Karjī. Fī 12 T 1 [Tishrīn al-Awwal], sanat 1856."
Translation of the colophon: "By the hand of its copyist ʻAbd al-Aḥad Karjī. On 12 Tishrīn al-Awwal [October], 1856."

record.title: 880-03 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Tafsīr al-Jalālayn. Al-Rubʻ al-awwl : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Ṣāwī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī anzala al-Furqān muṣaddiqan li-mā bayna yadayhi wa-hudan wa-bushrá lil-muttaqīn, Qurʼānan ʻArabīyan ghayra dhī ʻiwaj, mawʻiẓatan wa-dhikrá lil-muʼminīn. Wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lah shahādatan nadkhulu bi-hā al-Firdaws āminīn. Wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, al-ṣādiq al-amīn, al-munzal ʻalayhi al-Kitāb, minhu āyāt muḥkamāt hunna umm al-Kitāb, wa-ukhar mutashābihāt, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi alladhīna ūtū al-ʻilm darajāt. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-dhalīl Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Ṣāwī al-Mālikī al-Khalwatī: Lammā kāna ʻilm al-tafsīr aʻẓam al-ʻulūm miqdāran wa-arfaʻahā sharafan wa-manāran, idh huwa raʼīs al-ʻulūm al-dīnīyah wa-raʼsuhā wa-mabná qawāʻid al-Sharʻ wa-asāsuhā, wa-kāna kitāb al-Jalālayn min ajall kutub al-tafsīr wa-ajmaʻa ʻalá al-iʻtināʼ bi-hi al-jamm al-ghafīr min ahl al-baṣāʼir wa-al-tanwīr ..."
Secundo folio: al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá Ustādhinā al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Dardīr.
16 x 23 cm; written surface: 11 x 17 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: In dark red leather binding with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion (in 39 unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā al-Rubʻ al-awwal min Ḥāshiyat al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Ṣāwī ʻalá Tafsīr al-Jalālayn, nafaʻanā Allāh bihim ajmaʻīn. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat al-Rubʻ al-awwal min Ḥāshiyat al-Ṣāwī fī 13 al-Qaʻdah, sanat 1289, ʻalá yad kātibihi li-nafsihi Ṣāliḥ Salāmah ibn al-marḥūm al-Ḥājj ʻAlī Salāmah, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-li-aḥbābihi al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Yā Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-azwājihi wa-dhurriyatihi wa-ahl baytihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran."

Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning. The copy of the First quarter of the Gloss of al-Ṣāwī was completed on 13 al-Qaʻdah, 1289 [of the Hijrah = 12th January 1873], by the hand of its copyist, for himself, and for whomever God wills after him, the poor to God Almighty, Ṣāliḥ Salāmah ibn al-marḥūm al-Ḥājj ʻAlī Salāmah, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters and his Muslim loved ones. Amen. O Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family, his wives, his descendants, the people of his household and his companions, and grant them abundant peace."

record.title: 880-03 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Tafsīr al-Jalālayn. Al-Rubʻ al-thānī : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Ṣāwī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Sūrat al-Aʻrāf. Makkīyah. Summiyat bi-dhālik li-dhikr Ahl al-Aʻrāf fīhā, min bāb tasmiyat al-shayʼ bi-juzʼih. Makkīyah, taqddama anna al-Makkī mā nazala qabla al-Hijrah, wa-in bi-arḍ al-Madīnah. al-Thamān āy. Wa-muntahāhā: Innā lā nuḍīʻu ajra al-muṣliḥīn. Wa-qawluhu: Aw al-khams āy, wa-muntahāhā: wa-innahu la-Ghafūrun Raḥīm. Allāh aʻlam bi-murādih bi-dhālik. Hādhā aḥad aqwāl, taqddama jumlah minhā, wa-qad dhakar hādhā al-qawl al-Khāzin, bi-qawlihi: Hiya ḥurūf muqaṭṭaʻah, istaʼthara Allāh bi-ʻilmihā ..."
Secundo folio: wa-limā kāna al-Nabī mukallafan bi-al-tablīgh lil-kuffār.
16 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 17 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: In dark red leather binding with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion (in 32 unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā al-Rubʻ al-thānī min Ḥāshiyat al-ʻAllāmah al-Ṣāwī ʻalá al-Jalālayn fī tafsīr al-Qurʼān, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi dunyā wa-ukhrá. Āmīn."

Author's colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu: Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taswīd hādhā al-juzʼ yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, thālith ʻashar Shaʻbān al-mubārak, sanat khams wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min Hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf, ʻalayhi afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, bi-Mashhad al-Imām al-Ḥusayn, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-ʻannā, wa-maddanā min madadih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-Nabī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá yawm al-Dīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author said: The draft copy of this part was completed on blessed Thursday, 13 blessed Shaʻbāh, 1225 of the Hijrah of Him to whom belongs nobleness and honor [13 September, 1810], may the best prayer and peace be upon him, at the Shrine of al-Imām al-Ḥusayn, may God be pleased with him and with us, and bestow upon us his of his power. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad the Illiterate Prophet, and on his family and companions and grant them abundant peace, until Judgement Day. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, waqt al-ḍuḥá, al-thānī wa-al-ʻishrīn min Dhī al-Ḥijjah, sanat 1289 min Hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf, ʻalá yad kātibihi li-nafsihi, wa-li-man shāʼa Allāh min baʻdihi, al-faqīr Ṣāliḥ Salāmah ibn al-marḥūm al-Ḥājj ʻAlī Salāmah al-Sakandarī baladan al-Mālikī madhhaban al-Ashʻarī ʻaqīdatan al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-li-aḥbābihi wa-lil-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-Nabī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Ghayr anna al-nuskhah allatī kutibat minhā kathīrat al-taṣḥīf, ghazīrat al-taḥrīf, li-ʻadam wujūd nuskhah ṣaḥīḥah maʻa jumūd al-qarīḥah."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The copy was completed on blessed Thursday, at dawn, the twenty-second of Dhū al-Ḥijjah, of the year 1289 of the Hijrah of Him to whom belongs nobleness and honor [20 February, 1873], by the hand of its copyist, for himself, and for whomever God wills after him, the poor Ṣāliḥ Salāmah ibn al-marḥūm al-Ḥājj ʻAlī Salāmah al-Sakandarī baladan al-Mālikī madhhaban al-Ashʻarī ʻaqīdatan al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters, his loved ones and all Muslims. Amen. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, the Illiterate Prophet, and on his family and companions, and grant them abundant peace. However, the copy from which this copy was transcribed had many distortions and numerous corruptions, for the lack of a sound copy, in addition to the stifling of disposition."

record.title: 880-03 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Tafsīr al-Jalālayn. Al-Rubʻ al-thālith : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Ṣāwī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-awwal wa-al-ākhir, al-bāṭin wa-al-ẓāhir. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-ṭāhir al-fākhir, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābih dhawī al-ʻulā wa-al-mafākhir. Wa-baʻd, fa-lammā intahá al-kalām ʻalá takmilat al-Jalāl al-Suyūṭī, fa-nashraʻu al-ān fī al-kalām ʻalá taʼlīf Shaykhihi al-Jalāl Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Maḥallī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-himā wa-bi-ʻulūmihimā fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah, wa-nasʼalu Allāh al-iʻānah ʻalá al-badʼ wa-al-khitām wa-al-mawt ʻalá kamāl al-īmān wa-al-Islām. Qāla, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi: Sūrat al-Kahf summiyat bi-dhālik li-dhikr qiṣṣat aṣḥāb al-kahf fīhā, min bāb tasmiyat al-shayʼ bi-ism baʻḍihi. Wa-Sūrah mubtadaʼ, wa-Makkīyah khabar awwal, wa-miʼah ilkh. khabar thānin ..."
Secundo folio: istiʻmāl al-jumlah fī al-khabar wa-al-inshāʼ.
16 x 23 cm; written surface: 10 x 16.5 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: In dark red leather binding with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion (in 35 unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā al-Rubʻ al-thālith min Ḥāshiyat al-Ṣāwī ʻalá al-Jalālayn."

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir al-Rubʻ al-thālith. Wa-qad tamma ʻalá yad kātibihi li-nafsihi wa-li-man shāʼa Allāh min baʻdihi, al-faqīr Ṣāliḥ Salāmah ibn al-marḥūm al-Ḥājj ʻAlī Salāmah, ḥīna iqāmatihi bi-al-Iskandarīyah, bi-maqām Walī Allāh Sayyidī al-Shaykh Salāmah al-Rās, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-ʻulūihi, wa-ḥsharanā fī zumratih, fī 23 J 1 [Jumādá al-Ūlá], sanat 1290 min Hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-azwājihi wa-dhurrīyatihi wa-anṣārihi, wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Subḥāna Rabbika Rabb al-ʻIzzah ʻammā yaṣifūn, wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This is the end of the Third quarter. Completed by the hand of its copyist, for himself and for whomever God wills after him, the poor Ṣāliḥ Salāmah ibn al-marḥūm al-Ḥājj ʻAlī Salāmah, during his staying in al-Iskandarīyah [Alexandria, Egypt], at the shrine of Walī Allāh Sayyidī al-Shaykh Salāmah al-Rās, may God benefit us by his sciences, and gather us to his group, on the Day of Resurrection. [Dated] 23 Jumādá al-Ūlá, the year 1290 of the Hijrah of Him to whom belongs nobleness and honor [19 July, 1873]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family, his companions, his wives, his descendants and his supporters, and grant them abundant peace, until Judgement Day. Praise be to God, the Lord of Might, far is He from what they ascribe to Him. May peace be upon the messengers. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-03 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Tafsīr al-Jalālayn. Al-Rubʻ al-rābiʻ : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Ṣāwī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Sūrat Ṣ Makkīyah, wa-yuqālu lahā Sūrat Dāwūd. Makkīyah, ay, kulluhā, aw thamān, aw li-ḥikāyat al-khilāf. Ṣ. Allāh aʻlam bi-murādihi bi-hi. Taqaddama ghayr marrah anna hādhā al-qawl aslam li-annahu [li-anna] tafwīḍ al-amr al-mutashābih li-ʻilm Allāh taʻālá huwa ghāyat al-adab. Wa-iʻlam inna fī lafẓ Ṣ qirāʼāt khamsah, al-sabʻah ʻalá al-sukūn lā ghayr, wa-al-bāqī shādhdh, wa-huwa al-ḍamm wa-al-fatḥ min ghayr tanwīn wa-al-kasr bi-tanwīn wa-bi-dūnih, fa-al-ḍamm ʻalá annahu khabar li-maḥdhūf, ʻalá annahu ism lil-sūrah, ay, hādhihi al-sūrah Ṣ, wa-muniʻa min al-ṣarf lil-ʻalamīyah wa-al-taʼnīth ..."
Secundo folio: wa-qīla ghayr dhālik.
16 x 23 cm; written surface: 11 x 16.5 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: In dark red leather binding with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion (in 41 unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā al-Rubʻ al-rābiʻ min Ḥāshiyat al-Ṣāwī ʻalá al-Jalālayn bi-al-tamām."

Author's colophon: "Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi yawm al-Thulāthāʼ al-mubārak, li-arbaʻ baqayna min shahr Rabīʻ al-Thānī, sanat 1228, thamān wa-ʻishrīn baʻda al-miʼatayn wa-al-alf min Hijratihi, ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-Nabī al-Ummī wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama ajmaʻīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "It was completed by the praise of God and His help, on blessed Tuesday, four nights remaining from the month of Rabīʻ al-Thāni, of the year 1228 of his Hijrah [i.e., Prophet Muḥammad's = 27 April, 1813], may prayer and peace be upon him. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, the Illiterate Prophet, and on his family and all his companions, and grant them peace."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ al-mubārak, al-muwāfiq khamsat ayyām maḍat min shahr Rabīʻ al-Thānī [rubbamā Rabīʻ al-Awwal], sanat 1291, iḥdá wa-tisʻīn wa-miʼatayn baʻda al-alf, min Hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, ʻalá yad kātibihā, li-nafsihi wa-li-man shāʼa Allāh min baʻdihi, al-ḥarī bi-kull malāmah, al-faqīr Ṣāliḥ ʻAlī Salāmah, ghafara Allāh la-hu, wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-mashāyikhihi, wa-li-ikhwānihi, wa-aḥbābihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-kānat kitābatuhā bi-ḍarīḥ Shaykhinā al-marḥūm al-Shaykh Salāmah al-Rās, najjānā Allāh bi-barakātihi min sharr al-Waswās, ghayra annahā kutibat min nuskhah ghazīrat al-taṣḥīf kathīrat al-taḥrīf, maʻa jumūd al-qarīḥah wa-ʻadam wujūd nuskhah ṣaḥīḥah. Allāhumma ṣalli ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá āl Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá azwāj Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá dhurrīyat Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá aṣḥāb Sayyidinā Muḥammad, ʻadada mā fī ʻilm Allāh. Allāhumma bi-jāhihi ʻindaka an takhtuma la-nā bi-al-īmān."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The copy was completed on blessed Wednesday, five days having passed of the month of Rabīʻ al-Thānī [probably Rabīʻ al-Awwal], of the year 1291 of the Hijrah of him to whom belongs nobleness and honor [Prophet Muḥammad = 22 April, 1874], may God pray on him and grant him peace, by the hand of its copyist, for himself, and for whomever God wills after him, he who deserves all blame, the poor ʻAlī Salāmah, may God forgive him, his parents, his masters, his brethren, and all his loved ones. Written at the tomb of our Master, the departed Shaykh Salāmah al-Rās, may God spare us by his blessings the evil of al-Waswās [i.e., He who inspires wicked thoughts, Satan the Devil]. However, this copy was transcribed from a copy which had numerous distortions and many corruptions, in addition to the stifling of disposition and the lack of a sound copy. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, the family of our Master Muḥammad, the wives of our Master Muḥammad, the descendants of our Master Muḥammad and the companions of our Master Muḥammad, as many times existing in God's knowledge. O God, end our life with faith, as we invoke You, through his high status [Prophet Muḥammad's] with You."

record.title: 880-03 Dīwān Ibn al-Fāriḍ : manuscript / edited by ʻAlī Sibṭ ibn al-Fāriḍ.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn ʻalá al-qawm al-kāfirīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alldhī ikhtaṣṣa ḥabībah al-asná, wa-qarana ismahu al-sharīf bi-aʻẓam asmāʼihi al-ḥusná, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lah, walī ʻibādihi wa-ḥabīb ʻubbādihi, wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh wa-ḥabībuhu wa-khalīluh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi al-shurafāʼ wa-aṣḥābihi al-khulafāʼ, wa-ʻalá ikhwānihi min al-anbiyāʼ, wa-man ittabaʻahu min al-awliyāʼ, ṣalātan tanshuru nafaḥātihā ʻalá arwāḥihim al-ṭāhirah ... Qāla al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-dhanbihi, al-mughtarif min nahr ʻaṭāʼihi, ʻAlī Sibṭ al-Shaykh ʻUmar ibn al-Fāriḍ ... naẓartu fī dīwān Shaykhinā ... fa-raʼaytu al-nussākh jahilū baʻḍ kalāmihi wa-mā ʻarafūhu, wa-ishtabaha ʻalayhim shayʼ min jināsihi fa-ṣaḥḥafūhu wa-akhrajūhu bi-dhālika ʻan aṣlih wa-lam yaruddūhu ilá ahlihi, fa-istakhartu Allāh taʻālá wa-istaʻantu bi-hi fī taḥrīr hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah ... muʻtamidan fī dhālika ʻalá nuskhah min atharihi muḥarrarah ... talaqqaytuhā min waladihi al-Shaykh Kamāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ..."
Secundo folio: wa-istakhartu Allāh taʻālá wa-istaʻantu bi-hi.
10 x 16 cm; written surface: 7.2 x 11.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: In indigo cardboard with dark red leather on spine.
In small naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; text within red frame; markings in red and green; some leaves are affected by water; catchwords.

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Qad ḥallat hādhihi al-dīwān fī mulk al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr ʻAlī al-ʻAẓmī, ghafara Allāh la-hu. Āmīn. Ghurrat Rabīʻ Awwal, sanat 1261, aḥad wa-sittīn [10 March, 1845]."
The introduction of Sibṭ ibn al-Fāriḍ (folios: 1b-12a); the Dīwan (folios 12a-52a).
At the head of the text on folio 1b: A decorative design in black, red and green with two hexagonal flowers.
On folio 52b: Miscellaneous quotations and anecdotes in a different hand.

Colophon: "Tamma al-Dīwān al-mubārak bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá fī awākhir Jumādá al-Thānī, sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-tisʻah wa-thalāthīn. Wa-al-khayr yakūn. Ghafara Allāh li-kātibihi wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah. M M."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed Dīwān is completed by the help of God Almighty, at the end of Jumādá al-Thānī, 1139 [of the Hijrah = 21 February, 1727]. Let goodness prevail. May God forgive the copyist and those who offer an invocation for his forgiveness. M M."

record.title: Indenture placing William Roberts into the service of John Higgins, staymaker.
record.note: "This indenture witnesseth that [William Roberts, the son of Ann Roberts of Melton Mowbray ...] doth put h[im]self apprentice to [John Higgins of Melton Mowbray, aforesaid staymaker] to learn h[is] art, and with h[im] after the manner of an apprentice to serve from the [twenty fifth day of December which was in the year of Our Lord one thousand seven hundred and fifty [sic?] unto the full end and] term of [seven] years ... And the said [John Higgins in consideration of the sum of ten pounds of lawfull money of Great Britain ... paid by the said Ann Roberts the receipt of which is hereby acknowledged] the said apprentice in the art [or mistery (?) of a staymaker] which he now useth shall teach and instruct or cause to be taught and instructed the best way and manner that he can finding and allowing unto h[is] said apprentice sufficient meat, drink, washing, lodging and all other necessaries during the term [apparel excepted which the said Ann Roberts is to find and allow during the said term] ... In witness whereof, the parties above named to these indentures interchangeably have set their hands and seals the [fourth] day of [February] in the [twenty fifth] year of the reign of our Sovereign Lord [George the Second] ... in the year of our Lord 17[52]."
The signature of "Jno. Higgins" appears next to a red wax seal. Also signed at bottom: "Sealed and delivered (being first duely stamped) in the presence of us, John Smith son, John Smith jun."
The left margin includes three blind-embossed "VI Pence" tax stamps.
