record.title: 880-03 Maʻālim al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ al-awwal : manuscript / al-Ḥusayn ibn Masʻūd al-Baghawī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla al-Shaykh al-ajall, al-Sayyid Nāṣir al-Ḥadīth, Rukn al-Dīn, Abū Muḥammad, al-Ḥusayn ibn Maḥmūd al-Baghawī, raḥimat Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi: al-Ḥamdu lillāh dhī al-ʻaẓamah wa-al-kibriyāʼ, wa-al-ʻizzah wa-al-baqāʼ, wa-al-rifʻah wa-al-ʻalāʼ, wa-al-majd wa-al-thanāʼ, taʻālá ʻan al-andād wa-al-shurakāʼ, wa-taqddasa ʻan al-amthāl wa-al-nuẓarāʼ, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi wa-ṣafīyaihi, Khātim al-Anbiyāʼ, wa-imām al-atqiyāʼ, ʻadad dharrāt al-thará wa-nujūm al-samāʼ, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh al-Malik al-Salām, al-muhaymin al-ʻallām, shāriʻ al-aḥkām, dhī al-jalāl wa-al-ikrām, alladhī akramanā bi-dīn al-Islām, wa-manna ʻalaynā bi-Nabīyinā Muḥammad, ʻalayhi al-salām, wa-anʻama ʻalaynā bi-Kitābihi al-mufarriq bayna al-ḥalāl wa-al-ḥarām, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá ḥabībihi wa-khīratihi min khalqihi, Muḥammad Sayyid al-anām, ʻadad sāʻāt al-layālī wa-al-ayyām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi nujūm al-ẓalām, wa-ʻalá jamīʻ al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-malāʼikah al-bararah al-kirām ..."
Secundo folio: akhbaranā Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Wāḥid.
20 x 29.5 cm; written surface: 11 x 22.5 cm; 31 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion and tooled with decorative design.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1b: "... fa-saʼalanī jamāʻah min aṣḥābī al-muḥaṣṣilīn wa-ʻalá iqtibās al-ʻilm muqbilīn kitāban fī 'Maʻālim al-Tanzīl wa-tafsīrih', fa-ajabtuhum ilayhi muʻtamidan ʻalá faḍl Allāh taʻālá wa-taysīrih ..."

At the head of folio 2a (in a different hand): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Faṣl fī faḍl tilāwat al-Qurʼān al-ʻAẓīm wa-taʻallumihi wa-taʻlīimihi ʻalá al-dawām [Chapter on the virtue of the recitation of the Glorious Qurʼān and learning and teaching it, continuously]."
On the edges of the leaves of the lower side of the codex: "al-Niṣf al-awwal min Tafsīr al-Baghawī."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with the commentary on Sūrat Banī Isrāʼīl (Sūrat al-Isrāʼ: Chapter 17), as follows: "... Wa-ruwiya ʻan Jābir ibn ʻAbd Allāh, qāl: Qāla Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Inna afḍal al-duʻāʼ al-Ḥamdu lillāh, wa-afḍal al-dhikr Lā ilāha illā Allāh. Wa-ruwiya ʻan Samrah ibn Jundub, qāl: Qāla Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Aḥabbu al-kalām ilá Allāh arbaʻ: Lā ilāha illā Allāh, wa-Allāh akbar, wa-Subḥān Allāh, wa-al-Ḥamdu lillāh, lā yaḍurruka bi-ayyihinna badaʼt, aw, kamā qāl. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām. Āmīn."

record.title: 880-03 Muqtabas min Tafsīr al-Qurʼān. Al-Juzʼ al-awwal : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Khāzin al-Baghdādī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá afḍal al-khalq, Muḥammad Sayyid al-Mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥābatihi ajmaʻīn. Qīla inna al-wārithūn min al-rijāl ʻasharah: al-Ibn wa-ibn al-ibn wa-in safal, wa-al-ab wa-al-jad wa-in ʻalā, wa-al-akh sawāʼun akāna li-ab wa-umm aw li-ab aw li-umm, wa-ibn al-akh lil-ab wa-al-umm aw lil-ab wa-in safal, wa-al-ʻamm lil-ab wa-al-umm aw lil-ab wa-ibnāhumā wa-in safalū, wa-al-zawj wa-al-muʻtaq. Wa-al-wārithāt min al-nisāʼ sabʻ ..."
Secundo folio: yarithu bi-al-farḍ al-mujarrad.
14.5 x 18 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 12.5 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard (in 11 mostly numbered quires); dark red leather on spine.
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "al-Juzʼ al-awwal. Hādhā Muqtabas min Tafsīr al-Qurʼān li-ʻAlāʼ al-Dīn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-maʻrūf bi-al-Khāzin."

Colophon: "Qad tamma al-muntakhab min al-juzʼ al-awwal min Tafsīr al-Khāzin. Wa-yalīhi al-thānī. ʻAlá yad kātibihi wa-muʼallifihi al-faqīr ilá Allāh Muḥammad Ismāʻīl ibn Ḥasan Ismāʻīl ibn Khalīfah Ibrāhīm. Fī 18 Jumād Ākhir, sanat 1331 H."

Translation of the colophon: "The selection from the first part on the Commentary of al-Khāzin is completed. It will be followed by the second part. By the hand of its copyist and author [i.e. transcriber], the poor to God Muḥammad Ismāʻīl ibn Ḥasan Ismāʼīl ibn Khalīfah Ibrāhīm, on 18 Jumād Ākhir, of the year1331 H [27 March, 1913]."

record.title: 880-03 Dīwān Ibn al-Fāriḍ : manuscript / edited by ʻAlī Sibṭ ibn al-Fāriḍ.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alldhī ikhtaṣṣa ḥabībah al-asná bi-maqām qāb qawsīn aw adná, wa-qarana ismahu al-sharīf bi-aʻẓam asmāʼihi al-ḥusná, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh, walī ʻibādihi wa-ḥabīb ʻubbādihi, wa-ashhadu anna Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh wa-ḥabībuhu wa-khalīluh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-shurafāʼ wa-aṣḥābihi al-khulafāʼ wa-al-ḥulafāʼ, wa-ʻalá ikhwānihi min al-anbiyāʼ, wa-man ittabaʻahu min al-awliyāʼ, ṣalātan tanshuru nafaḥātihā ʻalá arwāḥihim al-ṭāhirah wa-tusbighu niʻamahā ʻalayhim bāṭinatan wa-ẓāhirah ..."
Secundo folio: dhālika ʻalá nuskhah kānat ʻindī.
14.5 x 19 cm; written surface: 10 x 15 cm; 14-21 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, some of the leaves are written in good naskh; in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some of the poems are fully vocalized; catchwords.
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Fī nawbat al-ʻabd al-faqīr li-Mawlāhu al-qadīr ʻAbd al-Bāsiṭ ibn al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Fākhūrī, ʻufiya ʻanhu."
The introduction of Sibṭ ibn al-Fāriḍ (folios: 1b-15b); the Dīwan (folios 15b-78a).

Colophon: "Tamma al-Dīwān al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih al-mustaṭāb, bi-minnat al-Malik al-Wahhāb tatmīman, ʻalá yad afqar al-wará, khādim al-fuqarā, ʻAbd al-Bāsiṭ ibn al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Fākhūrī al-Khalwatī al-Bakrī, ʻufiya [ʻanh]. M. 21 Shaʻbān, sanat 1269."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed Dīwān is completed in its entirety, by the praise of God and His agreeable help, and by the Graciousness of the Abundant Giving King, by the hand of the poorest of mankind, servant of the poor ones [the Sufis], ʻAbd al-Bāsiṭ ibn al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Fākhūrī al-Khalwatī al-Bakrī, may he be forgiven. M. On 21 Shaʻbān, 1269 [of the Hijrah = 18 May, 1853]."

record.title: 880-03 Dīwān Ibn al-Fāriḍ : manuscript / edited by ʻAlī Sibṭ Ibn al-Fāriḍ.
record.note: Title from the preliminary leaf.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-mā tawfīqī illā billāh. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alldhī ikhtaṣṣa ḥabībah al-asná bi-maqām qāb qawsīn wa-adná, wa-qarana ismahu al-sharīf bi-aʻẓam asmāʼihi al-ḥusná. Wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh, walī ʻibādihi wa-ḥabīb ʻubbādihi. Wa-ashhadu anna Muḥammad ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh wa-ḥabībuhu wa-khalīluh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-shurafāʼ wa-aṣḥābihi al-khulafāʼ al-ḥulafāʼ, wa-ʻalá ikhwānihi min al-anbiyāʼ, wa-man ittabaʻahu min al-awliyāʼ, ṣalātan tanshuru nafaḥātihā ʻalá arwāḥihim al-ṭāhirah wa-tusbighu niʻamahā ʻalayhim bāṭinatan wa-ẓāhirah, wa-sallama taslīman. Qāla al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-dhanbihi, al-mughtarif min nahr ʻaṭāʼ Rabbihi, ʻAlī Sibṭ al-Shaykh ʻUmar ibn al-Fāriḍ, al-rājī karam Rabbihi al-fāʼiḍ, ʻafá Allāh ʻan khaṭaʼih, wa-ghamarahu wa-tadārakahu bi-raḥmatih: Naẓartu fī nusakh min Dīwān Shaykhinā, qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu wa-sharaḥ ṣadrahu bi-al-naẓar wa-sarrahu, fa-raʼaytu al-nussākh jahilū baʻḍ kalāmih wa-mā ʻarafūh, wa-ishtabaha ʻalayhim shayʼ min jināsih fa-ṣaḥḥafūhu wa-akhrajūhu bi-dhālika ʻan aṣlih ..."
Secundo folio: fa-aqbala ilayya waladuhu an ajtahid
15 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 15.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather; cover embossed with hexagonal medallion and tooled with decorative design.
In good naskh/ruqʻah script; in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords.
On the preliminary leaf: "Dīwān Ibn al-Fāriḍ."
On the preliminary leaf: "ʻImrān ibn Ḥusayn."
At the head of folio 1a: "James Samuel. 1860."
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Dīwān Sayyidī Sharf al-Dīn ʻUmar ibn al-Fāriḍ, raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: "Istaʼjara al-Ḥājj Muṣ[ṭafá] ibn ʻAbd Allāh Shumays al-bāyikah fī sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-thalāth fī ghurrat Rabīʻ al-Awwal khālī khams taʻshar yawm [22 November, 1691]."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mimmā manna Allāh taʻālá bi-hi ʻalá ʻabdihi Zāhid al-Zarzūr fī sanat 1255 [1839/1840], ghafar Allāh ʻanhu wa-wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."
On folio 44a: An ownership statement: "Intaqala hādhā al-majmūʻ al-sharīf ilá yad al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-Shaykh Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh Himmāt."
On folio 44a: A reader's note: "Naẓara fīhi Muḥarram al-Qabbānī ibn Ḥijāzī al-Qabbānī."
The introduction of Sibṭ Ibn al-Fāriḍ (folios: 1b-9b); the Dīwan (folios 9b-43a).

Colophon 1 (folio 43a-43b): "Tamma Dīwān al-muḥaqqiq wa-al-ḥabr al-mudaqqiq, Sulṭān al-ʻUshshāq ʻalá al-iṭlāq, al-Shaykh Sharaf al-Dīn ʻUmar ibn al-Fāriḍ, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu wa-raḥimah. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi fī yawm al-A[ḥad] al-mubārak, tāsiʻ ʻishrīn shahr al-Ḥijjah al-ḥarām, khitām ʻām tisʻ baʻda al-alf [1 July, 1601]. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih."

Translation of colophon 1: "The Dīwān of the erudite and learned Master, Sultan of the Lovers [i.e. the Sufis], al-Shaykh Sharaf al-Dīn ʻUmar ibn al-Fāriḍ, may God forgive him and have mercy upon him. Written on blessed Sunday, 29 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, the end of 1009 [of the Hijrah = 1 July, 1601]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and on his family and on his companions."

Colophon 2 (folio 43b-44a): "Wa-kāna al-farā[gh] min hādhā al-Dīwān al-mubārak nahār al-Thalāthah fī al-ʻishr al-akhīr min shahr Shaʻbān al-mubārak, sanat thalāth wa-miʼah wa-alf [13 May, 1692], ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr ilá Mawlāhu, Asʻad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻUmar al-Duwaykī nasaban al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi fī kull waqt wa-ḥīn wa-sallam."

Translation of colophon 2: "The copy of this blessed Dīwān was completed on Tuesday of the last tenth of blessed Shaʻbān, 1103 [of the Hijrah = 13 May, 1692], by the hand of the poor and despised servant to his Lord, Asʻad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻUmar al-Duwaykī nasaban al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, may God forgive him, his parents and all and entire Muslims. Amen. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and on his family and companions in all times and periods."

record.title: 880-03 al-Durr al-mukhtār, sharḥ Tanwīr al-abṣār : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥaṣkafī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ḥamdan laka yā man sharaḥta ṣudūranā bi-anwāʻ al-hidāyah sābiqan, wa-nawwarta baṣāʼiranā bi-tanwīr al-abṣār lāḥiqan, wa-afaḍta ʻalaynā min ashiʻʻat sharīʻatika al-muṭahharah baḥran rāʼiqan, wa-aghdaqta ladaynā min biḥār minaḥika al-muwaqqarah nahran fāʼiqan, wa-atmamta niʻmataka ʻalaynā ḥaythu yassarta ibtidāʼ tabyīḍ hādhā al-sharḥ al-mukhtaṣar tijāh wajh manbaʻ al-sharīʻah wa-al-durar wa-ḍajīʻayhi al-jalīlayn Abī Bakrin wa-ʻUmar, baʻda al-idhni minhu, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi alladhīna ḥāzū min minaḥ fatḥ kashf fayḍ faḍlika al-wāfī ḥaqāʼiqan ..."
Secundo folio: tadqīq tuḥayyir al-afkār.
16 x 23 cm; written surface: 8 x 15 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In green buckram binding.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; phrases of "Tanwīr al-abṣār" and markings in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "al-Durr al-mukhtār", and an illegible stamp.
On folio 1b "... wa-sammaytuhu bi-al-Durr al-mukhtār, sharḥ Tanwīr al-abṣār, alladhī fāqa kutub hādhā al-fann fī al-ḍabṭ wa-al-taṣḥīḥ wa-al-ikhtiṣār ..."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with "Kitāb al-Ṭalāq" (Book on divorce), "Bāb al-Kināyāt" (Chapter on the indirect indications of intent), as follows: "... wa-naḥwa: Aʻtidī, istabriʼī raḥimaki, anti wāḥidah, anti ḥurrah, ikhtārī, amruki bi-yadiki, sarraḥtuki, fāraqtuki; lā yaḥtamilu al-radd wa-al-sabb; fa-fī ḥālat al-riḍá, ay, ghayr al-ghaḍab wa-al-mudhākarah, tatawaqqafu al-aqsām al-thalāthah taʼthīran ʻalá nīyat al-ḥālif lil-iḥtimāl, wa-al-qawl la-hu bi-yamīnihi fī ʻadam al-nīyah, wa-yakfī taḥlīfuhā la-hu fī manzilihi, fa-in abá rafaʻathu lil-ḥākim, fa-in nakala farraqa baynahuma.̄ Mujtabá ..."

record.title: 880-03 al-Durr al-mukhtār fī sharḥ Tanwīr al-abṣār. Al-Juzʼ 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥaṣkafī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ḥamdan laka yā man sharaḥta ṣudūranā bi-anwāʻ al-hidāyah sābiqan, wa-nawwarta baṣāʼiranā bi-tanwīr al-abṣār lāḥiqan, wa-afaḍta ʻalaynā min ashiʻʻat sharīʻatika al-muṭahharah baḥran rāʼiqan, wa-aghdaqta ladaynā min biḥār minaḥika al-muwaffarah nahran fāʼiqan, wa-atmamta niʻmataka ʻalaynā ḥaythu yassarta tabyīḍ hādhā al-sharḥ al-mukhtaṣar tijāh wajh manbaʻ al-sharīʻah wa-al-durar wa-ḍajīʻayhi al-jalīlayn Abī Bakrin wa-ʻUmar, baʻda al-idhni minhu, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi alladhīna ḥāzū min minaḥ fatḥ kashf fayḍ faḍlika al-wāfī ḥaqāʼiqan ..."
Secundo folio: al-afkār li-Shaykh Shaykhinā Shaykh al-Islām.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 17 cm; 26 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion (in 30 unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; phrases of "Tanwīr al-abṣār" and markings in red; many commentaries on the margins with some corrections; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "al-Juzʼ al-awwal min al-Durr al-mukhtār, sharḥ Tanwīr al-abṣār."
On folio 1a: "Iḥfaẓ kitābiya hādhā yā Kaykabahj."
On folio 1b "... wa-sammaytuhu bi-al-Durr al-mukhtār fī sharḥ Tanwīr al-abṣār, alladhī fāqa kutub hādhā al-fann fī al-ḍabṭ wa-al-taṣḥīḥ wa-al-ikhtiṣār ..."

Colophon: "Tamma al-niṣf al-awwal bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-juzʼ al-sharīf yawm al-Sabt, nahār thamāniyah wa-ʻishrūn yawman khalawna min shahr Rajab al-khayr, min shuhūr sanat 1242 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-taslīm. Kātibuhu al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá al-Sayyid Muḥammad al-Ghūlī al-Manfalūṭī al-Ḥanafī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn, wa-li-man daʻá la-hu bi-al-maghfirah. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The first half is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and on his family and companions and grant them peace. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. Amen. This noble part was completed on Saturday, 28 Rajab, of the year 1242 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and the most perfect peace be upon him, by its copyist the poor to God Most High, al-Sayyid Muḥammad al-Ghūlī al-Manfalūṭī al-Ḥanafī, may God forgive him, his parents, the Muslims, and him who invokes forgiveness for him. Amen. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 al-Iqnāʻ fī ḥall alfāẓ Abī Shujāʻ : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Shirbīnī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla Sayyidunā wa-Mawlānā wa-Shaykhunā wa-qudwatunā ilá Allāh taʻālá, Syakh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, wa-wārith ʻulūm Sayyid al-Mursalīn, Shams al-Dunyā wa-al-Dīn, Muḥammad al-Khaṭīb al-Shirbīnī al-Shāfiʻī, khātimat al-muḥaqqiqīn wa-ṣadr al-mudarrisīn, ṭayyaba Allāh tharāh wa-aḥsana mathwāh. Āmīn: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alldhī nashara lil-ʻulamāʼ aʻlāman, wa-thabbata lahum ʻalá al-ṣirāṭ al-mustaqīm aqdāman, wa-jaʻla maqām al-ʻilm aʻlā maqām, wa-faḍḍala al-ʻulamāʼ bi-iqāmat al-ḥujaj al-dīnīyah wa-maʻrifat al-aḥkām, wa-awdaʻa al-ʻārifīn laṭāʼif sirrih, fa-hum ahl al-muḥāḍarah wa-al-ilhām, wa-waffaqa al-ʻāmilīn li-khidmatihi fa-hajarū ladhīdh al-manām, wa-adhāqa al-muḥibbīn ladhdhata qurbihi wa-unsihi, fa-shaghalahum ʻan jamīʻ al-anām ..."
Secundo folio: yaqaʻu ʻalá kull maʻbūd bi-ḥaqq aw bāṭil.
21 x 30.4 cm; written surface: 13.5 x 21 cm; 33 lines per page.
Binding: In dark red leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion and tooled with geometric decoration.
In good medium naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Mukhtaṣar fī al-fiqh ʻalá madhhab al-Shāfiʻī" of Abū Shujāʻ in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Iqnāʻ fī ḥall alfāẓ Abī Shujāʻ, taʼlīf Shams al-Dunyā wa-al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Khaṭīb al-Shirbīnī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-askanahu fasīḥ jannatih bi-raḥmatih. Āmīn. M M M."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Āla bi-al-shirāʼ al-sharʻī ilá nawbat afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim ilá raḥmat al-Barr al-Jawwād, Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥajj Muṣṭafá ibn al-Ḥajj ʻAlī al-Ḥafarjī, ʻafá Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Sanat 1129 [of the Hijrah = 1716/1717]."
On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhu bi-al-Iqnāʻ fī ḥall alfāẓ Abī Shujāʻ ..."
Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taḥrīrihi nahār al-Aḥad, fī shahr Dhī al-Qaʻdah, min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-thamāniyah."
Translation of the colophon: "Copied on Sunday, [date of the day not mentioned], of the month of Dhū al-Qaʻdah, 1108 [of the Hijrah = May/June, 1697]."

record.title: 880-03 Fatḥ al-qarīb al-mujīb fī sharḥ alfāẓ al-Taqrīb : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Qāsim al-Ghazzī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Shams al-Dīn Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Qāsim al-Ghazzī al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih wa-ruḍwānih. Āmīn: al-Ḥamdu lillāh tabarrukan bi-Fātiḥat al-Kitāb, li-annahā ibtidāʼ kull amr dhī bāl, wa-khātimat kull duʻāʼ mujāb, wa-ākhir daʻwá al-muʼminīn fī al-Jannah dār al-thawāb ... Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā kitāb fī ghāyat al-ikhtiṣār wa-al-tahdhīb, wa-ḍaʻtuhu ʻalá al-kitāb al-musammá bi-al-Taqrīb, li-yantafiʻa bi-hi al-muḥtāj min al-mubtadiʼīn li-furūʻ al-sharīʻah wa-al-dīn ... Wa-iʻlam innahu yūjadu fī baʻḍ nusakh al-kitāb, fī ghayr khuṭbatihi, tāratan bi-al-Taqrīb, wa-tāratan bi-al-Ikhtiṣār; fa-li-dhālika sammaytuhu bi-ismayn: Aḥaduhumā Fatḥ al-qarīb al-mujīb fī sharḥ alfāẓ al-taqrīb, wa-al-thānī: al-Qawl al-mukhtār fī sharḥ Ghāyat al-ikhtiṣār ..."
Secundo folio: ablagh min al-raḥīm.
16.5 x 24 cm; written surface: 11 x 19 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 9 unnumbered quires).
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "al-Taqrīb" in red; some notes and comments on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: "Qad tamma naskh hādhā al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Mali al-Wahhāb. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak fī iḥdá wa-ʻishrīn shahr Rajab al-muʻẓẓam alladhī aḥad shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-thamānīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-azká al-taḥīyah, ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-rājī ʻafwa al-Jalīl, Sayyid Aḥmad Qindīl, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-kāffat al-Muslimīn. Wa-al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rab al-ʻĀlamin. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "This book was copied by the help of God the Abundant Giving King. This blessed book was completed on the 21st of the glorious month of Rajab, 1280 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [1 January, 1864], may the best prayer and the purest peace be upon Him, by the hand of the poor to God, who hopes for the forgiveness of the Glorious One, Sayyid Aḥmad Qindīl, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslim. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Fatḥ al-Jalīl ʻalá Sharḥ Ibn ʻAqīl : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī.
record.note: Title from introduction (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn ʻalá al-qawm al-kāfirīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī rafaʻa qadra man inkhafaḍa li-rubūbīyatih, wa-aʻazza man intaṣaba li-nuṣrat dīnih wa-iqāmat ḥujjatih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad, dhī al-jāh al-rafīʻ, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ulī al-qūwah fī al-dīn wa-al-ḥiṣn al-manīʻ. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-maurtajī shukr al-masāʻī Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī, ḥaffahumā Allāh wa-al-Muslimīn bi-al-ṭāqah al-khafīyah, wa-askanahumā wa-muḥibbīhimā al-ghuraf al-ʻalīyah: Qad ṭalaba minnī baʻḍ al-aḥbāb, ajzala Allāh lī wa-lahum al-thawāb, al-marrata baʻda al-marrah, an aktuba ḥāshiyatan ʻalá Sharḥ Qāḍī al-Quḍāh bi-al-diyār al-Miṣrīyah, Bahāʼ al-Dīn ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAqīl ibn Abī Ṭālib ..."
Secundo folio: wa-atá bi-hādhihi al-jumlah li-yatamayyaza al-muṣannif ʻan ghayrih.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 11 x 17.5 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; black cloth on spine and flap (in 24 numbered quires).

In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; phrases of Ibn ʻAqīl preceded by the word "Qawluhu" (his saying) in red; markings in red; some notes on the margins; some wormholes (mostly on the margins); catchwords.
On the preliminary leaf: "Aḥmad al-Shaykh Idrīs."
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-ʻAllāmah al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī ʻalá Sh. [Sharḥ] al-ʻAllāmah Ibn ʻAqīl ʻalá matn al-Alfīyah li-Ibn Mālik. Raḥima Allāh al-jamīʻ. Āmīn. Āmīn."
At the head of folio 1a: "Yā Kubaykij. Yā Kubaykij. Yā Kubaykij."
On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhā Fatḥ al-Jalīl ʻalá Sharḥ Ibn ʻAqīl ..."

Colophon: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh awwalan wa-ākhiran, bāṭinan wa-ẓāhiran. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, kullamā dhakarahu al-dhākirūn wa-ghafila ʻan dhikrihi al-ghāfilūn. Qāla muʼallifuhu: Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh mā jamaʻtuhu min durar al-kalimāt wa-ghurar al-ʻibārāt ʻalá sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah. Wa-Allāh subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá aʻlam. Qad wāfaqa al-farāgh min naskh hādhihi al-Ḥāshiyah yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak, 18 Shaʻbān, sanat 1247, ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr Ḥasan al-Basyūnī al-Shāfiʻī al-Damanhūrī. Āmīn. Tamm. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God in the beginning and in the end, implicitly and explicitly (esoterically and exoterically). May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, as long as he is remembered by those who remember him, and as long as he is forgotten to be remembered by those who forget to remember him. Its author said: 'It is completed, by the praise of God, what I compiled of the jewels of words and the blazes of statements, on the commentary of the Learned One [Ibn ʻAqīl]. God, may He be praised and glorified, is more knowledgeable'. The copy of this Ḥāshiyah (Gloss) was completed on blessed Saturday, 18 Shaʻbān, 1247 [of the Hijrah = 10 January, 1832], by the hand of its copyist, the poor Ḥasan al-Basyūnī al-Shāfiʻī al-Damanhūrī. Amen. It is completed. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Tamrīn al-ṭullāb fī ṣināʻat al-iʻrāb : manuscript / Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir wa-lā tuʻassir. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, wa-al-baḥr al-humām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, al-muḥaqqiq al-ḥujjah, Zayn al-Dīn, Abū al-Walīd, Khālid al-Azharī al-Shāfiʻī, fasaḥa Allāh taʻālá fī muddatih, wa-aʻāda ʻalá al-Muslimīn min barakatih. Āmīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī rafaʻa qadra man aʻraba bi-al-shahādatayn, wa-naṣaba al-dalīl ʻalá wujūd dhātih, wa-khafaḍa qadra man lam yajzim bi-waḥdānīyatih, wa-lam yaʻtarif bi-qadr ṣifātih. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad alladhī ḍamma shaʻatha al-dīn wa-jāʼa al-fatḥ [bi-al-fatḥ] al-mubīn, wa-kasara jaysha al-munāfiqīn, wa-askana al-ruʻba fī qulūb al-kāfirīn bi-barakātih, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-dhurrīyātih, ṣalātan wa-salāman dāʼimayn, ʻadada ḥarakāt kull lafẓ wa-sakanātih ..."
Secundo folio: wa-ājilu ḥalla maʻānīhā ʻalá shurrāḥihā.
15 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 15.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap (in 24 numbered quires).
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; phrases of "al-Alfīyah" of Ibn Mālik in red; titles of the chapters in large bold script; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Tamrīn al-ṭullāb fī ṣināʻat al-iʻrāb, iʻrāb al-Shaykh al-ʻAllāmah Khālid al-Azharī li-Alfīyat Ibn Mālik, raḥimahumā Allāh taʻālá raḥmatan wāsiʻah. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: "al-Thaman ʻan [?] fiḍḍah 105."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Malaka hādhā al-kitāb min faḍl Allāh al-ʻAlī al-Wahhāb, kathīr al-dhunūb wa-al-masāwī [... ... ...], satara Allāh ʻuyūbahu wa-ghafara dhunūbahu wa-wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Wa-dhālika fī sanat 1118 [of the Hijrah = 1706/1707]."
On folio 2a: "... wa-sammaytuhu Tamrīn al-ṭullāb fī ṣināʻat al-iʻrāb ..."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with the section on "Idghām" (Gemination/Assimilation of the letters), as follows: "... wa-qāla al-Shāṭibī, baʻda an naqala annahu ism maṣdar: Wa-yuḥtamalu an yuḍbaṭa bi-fatḥ al-Khāʼ ʻalá annahu jamʻ khayr, faqad ḥaká al-Farrāʼ qawm ..."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Ushmūnī ʻalá al-Alfīyat. Al-Juzʼ 2 : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ushmūnī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "al-Tawkīd. Huwa fī al-aṣl maṣdar, wa-yusammá bi-hi al-tābiʻ al-makhṣūṣ. Wa-yuqālu akkada taʼkīdan, wa-wakkada tawkīdan, aw, huwa bi-al-Wāw akthar. Wa-huwa ʻalá nawʻīn: Lafẓī, wa-sayaʼtī, wa-maʻnawī, wa-huwa al-tābiʻ al-rāfiʻ iḥtimāl irādat ghayr al-ẓāhir, wa-la-hu alfāẓ ashāra ilayhā bi-qawlihi: Bi-al-nafsi aw bi-al-ʻayni al-ismu ukkidā // maʻa ḍamīrin ṭābaqa al-muʼakkadā. Ay, fī al-ifrād wa-al-tadhkīr wa-furūʻihimā. Fa-naqūlu: Jāʼa Zaydun nafsuhu, aw, ʻaynuhu, aw, nafsuhu ʻaynuhu, fa-najmaʻu baynahumā ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-Hindān anfusuhumā wa-aʻyunuhumā.
16.3 x 22,7 cm; written surface: 8 x 14.5 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central red medallions (in 49 quires, numbered 41-89).

In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of "al-Alfīyah" of Ibn Mālik, and headings and markings in red; numerous commentaries on the margins of the folios of quires 41-55; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "al-Juzʼ al-thānī min Sharḥ al-Ushmūnī ʻalá al-Alfīyah, bi-al-tamām wa-al-kamāl."

Colophon: "Tamma wa-kamula hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak yawm al-Jumʻah, li-khams layālin maḍat min shahr Muḥarram al-ḥarām, iftitāḥ sanat thamāniyah wa-thamānīn wa-miʼah wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-taslīm, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād ilayhi taʻālá, Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Qāḍī al-Thīwī [?] baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan, bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed book was concluded and completed, on Friday, five nights having passed from the month of Muḥarram, the beginning of the year 1188 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [18 March, 1774], may the best prayer and the most perfect peace be upon him, by the hand of the poorest of His [God's] servants, may He be glorified, ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Qāḍī al-Thīwī [?] baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan, by the praise of God and His help. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and on his family and companions and grant them abundant peace."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Shudhūr al-dhahab fī maʻrifat kalām al-ʻArab : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Yūsuf ibn Hishām.
record.note: Title from the printed versions.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla Sayyidunā wa-Mawlānā al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil, jāmiʻ ashtāt al-faḍāʼil, waḥīd dahrih wa-farīd ʻaṣrih, ṣadr al-muḥaqqiqīn, barakat al-Muslimīn, Jamāl al-Dīn Abū Muḥammad ʻAbd Allāh ibn Yūsuf ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Hishām al-Anṣārī, fasaḥa Allāh fī qabrih: Awwal mā aqūlu innī aḥmadu Allāh al-ʻAlī al-Akram, alladhī ʻallama bi-al-qalam ʻallama al-insān mā lam yaʻlam, thumma utbiʻu dhālik bi-al-ṣalāh wa-al-taslīm ʻalá al-mursal raḥmatan lil-ʻālamīn wa-imāman lil-muttaqīn wa-qudwatan lil-ʻāmilīn, Muḥammad al-ummī wa-al-rasūl al-ʻArabī, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-hādīn, wa-ṣaḥbihi al-rāfiʻīn li-qawāʻid al-dīn ..."
Secundo folio: baʻda an nafá al-kalām fa-al-murād nafy al-kalām al-lafẓī.
15.8 x 22.7 cm; written surface: 7 x 12.7 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion (in 21 numbered quires)
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Shudhūr al-dhahab fī maʻrifat kalām al-ʻArab" in red; few notes on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Muqaddimat al-Taqwīmāt al-naḥwīyah, li-kātibihi wa-muʼallifihi Jamāl al-Dīn Abū Muḥammad ʻAbd Allāh ibn Hishām al-Anṣārī, raḥimahu Allāh."

Author's colophon: "Wa-qad ataytu ʻalá mā aradtuhu fī sharḥ hādhihi al-muqaddimah. Wa-lillāh <al-ḥamd>, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá al-ḥamd wa-al-minnah, wa-Īyāhu asʼalu an yajʻala dhālika khāliṣan li-wajhihi al-karīm maṣrūfan, wa-ʻalá al-nafʻ bi-hi mawqūfan, wa-an yaghfira lī khaṭīʼatī Yawm al-Dīn, wa-an yudkhilanī bi-raḥmatihi fī ʻibādihi al-ṣāliḥīn bi-mannihi wa-karamih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-taslīm ʻalá afḍal al-makhlūqīn Sayyidinā Muḥammad Khātim al-Nabīyīn wa-al-Mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-al-tābiʻīn. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm ..."

Translation of the author's colophon: "I have completed what I intended of the commentary on this introduction. Praise and thanks be to God Almighty. I beseech Him to accept it purely for the sake of His benevolent face, to make it beneficial, to forgive my sin on Judgement Day, and to gather me with his righteous servants, by His benevolence and generosity. May prayer and peace be on the Best of Creatures, our Master Muḥammad, the Seal of the Prophets and Messengers, and on his family, companions and followers. God suffices us, He is the best advocate. There is no power no might except in God the Almighty the All Powerful ..."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihi fī yawm al-Ithnayn, 23 Ramaḍān al-mukarram, sanat 1156, alf wa-miʼah sittah wa-khamsūn, li-ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-salām. Tammat bi-ʻawn Allāh."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The copy was completed on Monday, the 23rd of noble Ramaḍān, the year 1156 [of the Hijrah of the Prophet = 10 November 1743], may the best prayer and the most perfect peace be upon Him. It was completed by the help of God."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Mughnī fī al-naḥw : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥīm.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-fāṭir al-ḥakīm, al-qādir al-karīm, al-munshī al-ʻālī al-ʻaẓīm, muḥyī al-bālī al-ramīm, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Rasūlihi al-karīm, al-raʼūf al-raḥīm, Muḥammad, al-musharraf ʻumūman bi-inʻāmihi al-ʻamīm, wa-khuṣūṣan bi-naḥw qawlihi taʻālá: 'Wa-innaka la-ʻalá khuluqin ʻaẓīm', wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-azwājihi ilá yawm lā yanfaʻu māl wa-lā banūn, illā man atá Allāh bi-qalb salīm. Ammā baʻd, fa-qad yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-muḥtāj ilá ʻafw Rabbihi al-Malik al-Laṭīf, Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn Muḥammad al-ʻUmarī al-Mīlānī: Wa-lammā lam yakun lil-kitāb al-musammá bi-al-Mughnī, alladhī fī ʻilm al-naḥw, sharḥ, wa-huwa min muṣannafāt ustādhī ... Fakhr al-Millah wa-al-Dīn, Aḥmad ibn Ḥasan al-Jābardī ... fa-qad khaṭara bi-bālī an ashraḥa la-hu sharḥan kāshifan li-kunūz maʻānīhi al-ṣaḥīḥah wa-wāḍiḥan li-rumūz alfāẓihi al-ʻaẓīmah ..."
Secundo folio: ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥīm al-ʻUmarī al-Mīlānī.
14.3 x 19.7 cm; written surface: 8 x 14.5 cm; 14 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding with flap.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes on the margins; the phrases of "al-Mughnī" by the words "Qawluhu" (His saying), some of which are in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Kāfiyah fī al-naḥw, wa-yusammá bi-Mughnī al-Akrād."
At the head of folio 2a: "Kitāb Mughnī al-Akrād, Sharḥ al-Kāfiyah fī al-naḥw. 1115."
On the left margin of folio 2a: An ownership statement: "Malakahu ʻAbd al-Ḥamīd, min naskh ʻAbd Allāh al-Kurdī."

Colophon: "Tamma bi-ʻawn Allāh Sharḥ al-Kāfiyah bi-Mughnī al-Akrād. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Wa-al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Sharḥ al-Kāfiyah bi-Mughnī al-Akrād was completed by the help of God. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on all his family. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on Him who no prophet comes after Him. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Muqaddimah al-Azharīyah fī ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah : manuscript / Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger, based on incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá jamīʻ al-aḥwāl, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīk lah, al-munazzah kalāmuhu ʻan al-alfāẓ bi-al-ḥurūf fī al-maqāl. Wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, al-mumayyiz bayna al-hudá wa-al-ḍalāl, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ʻalá ālihi alladhīna jaʻalahum Allāh maṣdaran li-ṣaḥīḥ al-afʻāl, wa-ʻalá aṣḥābihi al-mawṣūfīn bi-al-salāmah min al-laḥn fī al-aqwāl, ṣalātan wa-salāman dāʼimayn, lā yatimmu bi-hā naqṣ wa-lā zawāl. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Mawlāh al-ghanī, Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Abī Bakr al-Azharī: Qad saʼalanī man aʻtaqidu ṣalāḥahu, wa-lā tasaʻunī mukhālafatuhu an ashraḥa Muqaddimatī al-Azharīyah fī ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah allatī amlaytuhā li-baʻḍ al-ṭalabah sharḥan laṭīfan, fa-ajabtuhu ilá dhālik, ṭāliban lil-thawāb wa-targhīban lil-ṭullāb, jaʻalahu Allāh khāliṣan li-wajhihi al-karīm wa-mūjiban lil-fawz ladyahi bi-jannāt al-naʻīm, innahu ʻalá dhālika qadīr wa-bi-al-ijābah jadīr ..."
Secundo folio: istiʻmāluhu fī al-ḥadd.
15.7 x 22 cm; written surface: 10 x 16 cm; 20 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap (in 5 unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; phrases of "al-Muqaddimah al-Azharīyah fī ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah" in red; few corrections on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: "Wa-fī hādhā al-ghāyah lil-mubtadī. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā li-hādhā, wa-mā kunnā li-nahtadī lawlā an hadānā Allāh. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran dāʼiman abadan ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Tammat. Kātib hādhā al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-qadīr Ṣāyim Sulaymān al-Maymūn, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-mutaṭahharīn, al-fāʼizīn bi-Jannat al-Samīʻ [al-Naʻīm], wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "What was introduced is enough for the beginner. Praise be to God who guided us to this, we would not have been guided if God did not guide us. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and on his family and companions and give them abundant, continuous and everlasting peace, until Judgement Day. It is completed. Copied by the poor to his Mighty Lord, Ṣāyim Sulaymān al-Maymūn, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and his virtuous companions, the attainers of the Gardens of Bliss, and give them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Muwaṣṣil al-ṭullāb ilá Qawāʻid al-iʻrāb : manuscript / Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-mulhim li-ḥamdih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, rasūlihi wa-ʻabdih, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih wa-jundih. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-ghanī, Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī: Hādhā sharḥ laṭīf ʻalá 'Qawāʻid al-iʻrāb', saʼalanīhi baʻḍ al-aṣḥāb, yaḥullu al-mabānī wa-yubayyin al-maʻānī, sammaytuhu: 'Muwaṣṣil al-ṭullāb ilá Qawāʻid al-iʻrāb', nāfiʻ in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Bāʼ mutaʻalliqah bi-fiʻl maḥdhūf, taqdīruhu aftatiḥu, yuqaddaru muʼakhkharan li-ifādat al-ḥaṣr ʻinda al-bayānīyīn wa-lil-ihtimām ʻinda al-naḥwīyīn ..."
Secundo folio: maḥdhūf taqdīruhu ʻalayhi.
14 x 20 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 15.5 cm; 18 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; dark red leather on spine.
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; phrases of "al-Iʻrāb ʻan qawāʻid al-iʻrāb of Ibn Hishām, in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ Qawāʻid al-iʻrāb al-kubrá, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-ʻallāmah, al-wāthiq bi-Rabbihi al-ʻAlī, Abī ʻAbd Allāh Khālid al-Azharī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-askanahu fasīḥ jannatih, bi-mannihi wa-karamih, bi-jāh Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements: 1. "Fī nawbat al-muftaqir ilá [... ... ...], sanat 1038 [of the Hijrah = 1628/1629]. 2. "[... ... ...] bi-al-shirāʼ al-sharʻī fī 10 Ṣafar al-khayr, sanat 1058 [of the Hijrah = 6 March 1648]."
On the label of the front cover: "Sharḥ Qawāʻid al-iʻrāb al-kubrá, lil-Shaykh Khālid al-Azharī. Numrah 14."

Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb, wa-ḥarrarahu bi-yadihi al-fāniyah fī jawf al-layl, li-nafsihi, wa-li-man shāʼa Allāh min baʻdihi, faqīr raḥmat Rabbihi, al-muḥtāj ilá ʻafwihi wa-karamih, Abū al-Ḥasan ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Rāziq al-Damīrī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-furūʻihi wa-ḥawāshīhi, wa-li-man yanẓuru fīhi wa-yasʼalu Rabbahu dhālik, innahu ʻalá mā yashāʼu qadīr. Fī Jumād al-Awwal, sanat sabʻ wa-sabʻīn wa-tisʻimiʼah, aḥsan Allāh ʻāqibatahā bi-khayr. Āmīn.

Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed. Copied in the depth of the night, by the perishing hand of the poor to the mercy of his Lord, who is in need of His forgiveness and generosity, Abū al-Ḥasan ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Rāziq al-Damīrī al-Shāfiʻī, for himself, and whomever God wills after him, may God forgive him, his parents, his branches [i.e., descendants] and his peripheries [i.e., relatives], and whomever looks into it and beseeches his Lord for the same, for He is mighty to do what He wills. On Jumād al-Awwal, 977 [of the Hijrah = October/November, 1569], may God ends it well. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Muwaṣṣil al-ṭullāb ilá Qawāʻid al-iʻrāb : manuscript / Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-mulhim li-ḥamdih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, rasūlihi wa-ʻabdih, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih wa-jundih. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-ghanī, Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī: Hādhā sharḥ laṭīf ʻalá 'Qawāʻid al-iʻrāb', saʼalanīhi baʻḍ al-aṣḥāb, yaḥullu al-mabānī wa-yubayyin al-maʻānī, wa-sammaytuhu: 'Muwaṣṣil al-ṭullāb ilá Qawāʻid al-iʻrāb', nāfiʻ in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Bāʼ mutaʻalliqah bi-fiʻl maḥdhūf, taqdīruhu aftatiḥu, yuqaddaru muʼakhkharan li-ifādat al-ḥaṣr ʻinda al-bayānīyīn wa-lil-ihtimām ʻinda al-naḥwīyīn ..."
Secundo folio: bi-hi aḥsana ḥālan minhu bi-ghayrihi.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 16.5 cm; 20 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; front cover missing; central medallion of back cover and flap (in 5 unnumbered quires).
In good large naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; many underlined phrases; catchwords.

Colophon: "Nasakhahā al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, Yūsuf ibn ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Asīr, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi al-dhanb al-kabīr wa-al-ṣaghīr, innahu ʻalá dhālika qadīr, wa-li-sāʼir al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt. Āmīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Tammat. [Signature]."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied by him who confesses his shortcoming and insufficiency, Yūsuf ibn ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Asīr, may God forgive the major and minor shortcoming of his and his parents; for He is able to do so, and [also forgive] all believers, men and women. Amen. Praise be to God. it is completed. [Signature]."

record.title: 880-03 Mughnī al-labīb ʻan kutub al-aʻārīb : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Yūsuf ibn Hishām.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻallāmah Jamāl al-Dīn, ruḥalat al-rāghibīn, ʻumdat al-bulaghāʼ al-muʻtabarīn, Abū Muḥammad, ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻābid al-nāsik al-qudwah, Jamāl al-Dīn Yūsuf ibn Hishām al-Anṣārī, nafaʻa Allāh bi-ʻulūmihi wa-barakātihi al-Muslimīn: Ammā baʻda ḥamd Allāh ʻalá afḍālih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad wa-ālihi, fa-inna ūlá mā taqtariḥuhu al-qarāʼiḥ wa-aʻlá mā tajnaḥu ilá taḥṣīlihi al-jawāniḥ, mā yatayassaru bi-hi fahm Kitāb Allāh al-munzal, wa-yattaḍiḥu bi-hi maʻná Ḥadīth Nabīyihi al-mursal, fa-innahumā al-wasīlah ilá al-saʻādah al-abadīyah ..."
Secundo folio: al-ṭālib bi-adná ilmām.
15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 14.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In yellow cardboard with flap; dark brown leather on spine and flap.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; numerous commentaries and some corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb Mughnī al-labīb ʻan kutub al-aʻārīb, taṣnīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻallāmah al-farīd al-awḥad, ruḥalat al-ṭālibīn wa-ʻumdat al-muʻtabarīn, Abī Muḥammad Jamāl al-Dīn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Yūsuf ibn Hishām al-Anṣārī, nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi al-Muslimīn, wa-adāma barakatahu ʻalá al-ʻālamīn. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Qad dakhala hādhā al-kitāb fī mulk al-ḥaqīr al-faqīr al-fānī, Muḥammad al-Khālidī al-Naqshabandī, bi-al-shirāʼ al-sharʻī wa-al-wajh al-marʻī, min al-Shaykh Ḥasan dallāl al-kutub, bi-thaman qadruhu miʼah wāḥidah wa-arbaʻīn qirshan faqaṭ. 21 Jumād al-Awwal, sanat 1271 [of the Hijrah = 9 February 1855]." 2. "Mulk al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá al-Sayyid ʻAbd Allāh al-Ṣaʻīdī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn. Thaman 258."

On folio 258b: Two ownership statements, as follows: 1. "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Malakahu min faḍl ʻĀlim al-Ghayb, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn Shuʻayb, ḥāmidan muṣalliyan musalliman." 2. "Thumma al-faqīr Muḥammad al-Damīrī. 1113 [of the Hijrah = 1701/1702]."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihi wa-qirāʼatih, nahār al-Ithnayn, [2?] min shahr Rajab al-ḥarām, min shuhūr sanat tisʻīn wa-tisʻimiʼah, bi-al-Madrasah al-ʻAṣrūnīyah, al-kāʼinah bi-Ḥalab al-maḥmīyah, ʻalá yad afqar ʻibād Allāh wa-aḥwajihim ilá raḥmatih, Ḥusayn ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Ḥalabī al-Ḥanafī al-Azharī, athābahu Allāh ʻalá qaṣdihi al-jamīl, wa-ḍāʻafa la-hu al-ajr al-jazīl. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyid al-Mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn, ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied and read on Monday, [2?] Rajab, 990 [of the Hijrah = 2 August 1582], at al-Madrasah al-ʻAṣrūnīyah, in protected Aleppo, by the poorest of God's servants and the neediest to His mercy, Ḥusayn ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Ḥalabī al-Ḥanafī al-Azharī, may God reward him for his well-intended endeavor, and abundantly multiply his recompense. May prayer and peace be upon the Master of the Messengers, and on His family and all His companions, until Judgement Day. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. It is completed. It is completed. It is completed."

record.title: 880-03 Fatḥ al-Qarīb al-Mujīb fī Sharḥ alfāẓ al-Taqrīb : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Qāsim al-Ghazzī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Shams al-Millah wa-al-Dīn, Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Qāsim al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih wa-ruḍwānih. Āmīn: al-Ḥamdu lillāh tabarrukan bi-Fātiḥat al-Kitāb, li-annahā ibtidāʼ kull amr dhī bāl, wa-khātimat kull duʻāʼ mujāb, wa-ākhir daʻwá al-muʼminīn fī al-Jannah dār al-thawāb, aḥmaduhu an waffaqa man arāda min ʻibādih lil-tafaqquh fī al-dīn wa-ʻalá wafq murādih, wa-uṣallī wa-usallimu ʻalá afḍal khalqih Muḥammad Sayyid al-Mursalīn ..."
Secundo folio: ʻibādī ʻannī fa-innī qarīb.
16 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 14 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; light brown leather on spine, edges and flap (in 15 numbered quires).
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "al-Taqrīb" in red; few notes on the margins; text within red and blue frame; catchwords.

Wa-iʻlam innahu yūjadu fī baʻḍ nusakh hādhā al-kitāb, fī ghayr khuṭbatihi, tasmiyatuhu tāratan bi-al-Taqrīb, wa-tāratan bi-Ghāyat al-Ikhtiṣār; fa-li-dhālika sammaytuhu bi-ismayn: Aḥaduhumā 'Fatḥ al-Qarīb al-Mujīb fī Sharḥ alfāẓ al-Taqrīb', wa-al-thānī: 'al-Qawl al-mukhtār fī Sharḥ Ghāyat al-ikhtiṣār ..."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskh hādhā al-kitāb yawm al-Aḥad al-mubārak, fī [6?] shahr Jumād Awwal, min shuhūr sanat 1235, ghafara Allāh li-muʼallifihā wa-shāriḥihā wa-kātibihā wa-qārīhā wa-mālikihā. It is completed. It is completed. It is completed. Copied by the poor Ḥasan al-Ruwaynī, may God forgive and his father and all Muslims. Amen. M M M."

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, Shams al-Millah wa-al-Dīn, Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Qāsim al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh taʻālá bi-al-raḥmah wa-ruḍwān. Āmīn: al-Ḥamdu lillāh tabarrukan bi-Fātiḥat al-Kitāb, li-annahā ibtidāʼ kull amr dhī bāl, wa-khātimat kull duʻāʼ mujāb, wa-ākhir daʻwá al-muʼminīn fī al-Jannah dār al-thawāb. Aḥmaduhu an waffaqa man arāda min ʻibādih lil-tafaqquh fī al-dīn wa-ʻalá wafq murādih, wa-uṣallī wa-usallimu ʻalá afḍal khalqih, Muḥammad Sayyid al-Mursalīn, al-qāʼil: 'Man yurid Allāh bi-hi khayran yufaqqihuh fī al-dīn' ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-thānī al-Qawl al-mukhtār.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 16 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; dark brown leather on spine (in 11 unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "al-Taqrīb" in purple; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folios 1b-2a: "... Wa-iʻlam innahu yūjadu fī baʻḍ nusakh hādhā al-kitāb, fī ghayr khuṭbatihi, wa-tasmiyatuhu [tasmiyatuhu] tāratan bi-al-Taqrīb, wa-tāratan bi-Ghāyat al-Ikhtiṣār; fa-li-dhālika sammaytuhu bi-ismayn: Aḥaduhumā 'Fatḥ al-Qarīb al-Mujīb fī Sharḥ alfāẓ al-Taqrīb', wa-al-thānī: 'al-Qawl al-mukhtār fī Sharḥ Ghāyat al-ikhtiṣār ..."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min nisākhat sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah Muḥammad ibn Qāsim, ʻalá [yad] afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim li-ʻafw Mawlāh, al-jānī Muḥammad al-Sarasī, fī yawm al-Thalāth al-mubārak, al-muwāfī li-sabʻat ayyām khalat min shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal al-muʻaẓẓam, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1276, sittah wa-sabʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, min Hijrat man la-hu al-majd wa-al-sharaf, Sayyidinā Muḥammad, [ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi] wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy of the commentary of the learned scholar Muḥammad ibn Qāsim was completed, by the [hand] of the poorest servant, and the neediest to the forgiveness of his Lord, the transgressor Muḥammad al-Sarasī, on blessed Tuesday, seven days having passed from the glorious month of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, of the year 1276 [4 October 1859] of the Hijrah of Him to whom belongs glory and honor, our Master Muḥammad, [may God pray on him] and on his family and companions and grant them peace. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Farāʼiḍ al-Sirājīyah : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Sayyid al-Sharīf al-Jurjānī.
record.note: Title from the printed version.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá khayr khalqih, Muḥammad wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, Sirāj al-Millah wa-al-Dīn, Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Rashīd al-Sajāwandī, nawwara Allāh taʻālá marqadahu, baʻdamā tayammana bi-al-Basmalah: al-Ḥamdu lillāh ḥamda al-shākirīn, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá khayr al-barīyah, Muḥammad wa-ālihi al-ṭayyibīn al-ṭāhirīn. Qāla Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: 'Taʻallamū al-farāʼiḍ wa-ʻallimūhā al-nās fa-innahā niṣf al-ʻilm'. Hākadhā riwāyat al-fuqahāʼ. Fa-al-farāʼiḍ jamʻ farīḍah, wa-huwa mā quddira min al-sihām fī al-mīrāth. Wa-innamā jaʻala al-ʻilm bi-hā niṣf al-ʻilm, immā li-ikhtiṣāṣihā bi-iḥdá ḥālatay al-insān, wa-hiya al-mamāt, dūna sāʼir al-ʻulūm al-dīnīyah, fa-innahā mukhtaṣṣah bi-al-ḥayāh ..."
Secundo folio: fa-takfīn al-rajul bi-akthar min thalāthat athwāb.
12.5 x 20 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 16 cm; 18-19 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; leather mostly torn out; central medallion on flap.
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; numerous commentaries on the margins; some leaves repaired; the first two leaves replaced; catchwords.
Title on the upper edge of the codex: "Sharḥ al-Sirājīyah fī ʻilm al-farāʼiḍ."
Colophon: "Tammat bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb. Katabahu aḍʻaf al-ʻabīd, Shukr Allāh ibn Sulaymān, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi."

Translation of the colophon: "It was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King. Copied by the feeblest of the servants, Shukr Allāh ibn Sulaymān, may God forgive him and his parents, and bestow His favor upon them and upon him."

record.title: 880-02 al-Fatḥah al-insīyah li-ghalq al-Tuḥfah al-Qudsīyah : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title of "al-Fatḥah al-insīyah li-ghalq al-Tuḥfah al-Qudsīyah" from incipit (folio 1b).
Title of Sharḥ al-Raḥbīyah from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of "al-Fatḥah al-insīyah li-ghalq al-Tuḥfah al-Qudsīyah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu li-man qismatuhu ʻalá al-dawām ʻādilah, wa-niʻamuhu ʻalá mamarr al-duhūr wa-al-ayyām ʻāʼidah, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ashraf mabʻūth, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi, mā inqaḍá irth wa-wārith wa-mawrūth. Wa-baʻd, fa-inna al-Tuḥfah al-Qudsīyah fī ikhtiṣār al-Raḥbīyah fī al-farāʼiḍ, naẓm al-ʻAllāmah Abī al-ʻAbbās Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Hāʼim al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatihi wa-ruḍwānih, wa-albasahu malābis ʻafwihi wa-ghufrānih, lammā ishtaddat ḥājat al-mutafahhimīn la-hā ilá ḥall mabānīhā wa-ibrāz maʻānīhā wa-taḥrīr dalāʼilihā, saʼalanī man tajibu al-ʻināyah bi-hi min al-ṭalabah, wa-la-hu gharaḍ ṣaḥīḥ fī ijābat mā ṭalabahu, an ashraḥahā sharḥan yafī bi-dhālik, fa-ajabtuhu rājiyan al-ʻafw min al-Qādir al-Mālik, wa-sammaytuhu: bi-'al-Fatḥah al-Insīyah li-ghalq al-Tuḥfah al-Qudsīyah ..."
Secundo folio of "al-Fatḥah al-insīyah li-ghalq al-Tuḥfah al-Qudsīyah": taʼassiyan bi-qawlihi taʻālá Ṣallū ʻalayhi.

Incipit of "Sharḥ al-Raḥbīyah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-mā tawfīqī illā billāh, ʻalayhi tawakkaltu, wa-ilayhi unīb. al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ʻāqibah lil-muttaqīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyid al-Mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhā 'Sharḥ mukhtaṣar ʻalá al-Muqaddimah al-Raḥbīyah fī al-farāʼiḍ', nāfiʻ in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá. Qāla: 'Awwalu mā nastaftiḥu al-maqālā // bi-dhikri raḥmati Rabbinā taʻālā. Fa-al-ḥamdu lillāhi ʻalá mā anʻamá // ḥamdan bi-hi yajlū ʻani al-qalbi al-ʻamā'. Aqūlu: Iftataḥa hādhihi al-urjūzah bi-Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, thumma bi-al-ḥamd taʼassiyan bi-al-Kitāb al-ʻAzīz, wa-murāduhu bi-al-istiftāḥ al-ibtidāʼ, wa-al-maqālā maṣdar qāla, wa-al-alif fīhi lil-iṭlāq ..."
Secundo folio of "Sharḥ al-Raḥbīyah": mā dāma ismī fī dhālika al-kitāb.
13.5 x 18.5 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 11.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "al-Tuḥfah al-Qudsīyh" and "al-Urjūzah al-Raḥbīyah" in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Fatḥah al-insīyah li-ghalq al-Tuḥfah al-Qudsīyah, taʼlīf Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā, Qāḍī al-Quḍāh, Shaykh al-Islām, Abī Yaḥyá Zakarīyā al-Shāfiʻī al-Anṣārī, aʻāda Allāh ʻalaynā wa-ʻalá al-Muslimīn min barakātih fī al-dunyā, bi-Muḥammad wa-ālihi. Āmīn."

Colophon of "al-Fatḥah al-insīyah li-ghalq al-Tuḥfah al-Qudsīyah": No colophon. Text ends with: "Fāʼidah. Man lā yarithu li-māniʻ qāʼim bi-nafsihi ka-al-riqq wa-ghayrihi min al-mawāniʻ lā yaḥjibu aḥadan ʻan farḍih, wa-man lā yarithu li-taqaddum ghayrihi ʻalayhi yuḥjabu wa-in lam yarith; fa-fī abawayn wa-akhawayn lil-umm al-suds, wa-al-bāqī lil-ab, li-annahumā yasquṭāni bi-hi. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Colophon of "Sharḥ al-Raḥbīyah": "Wa-qad kamula hādhā al-sharḥ al-mubārak. Wa-asʼalu Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, an yanfaʻa bi-hi kātibahu wa-qāriyahu wa-al-nāẓira fīhi, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Allāhumma ṣali afḍala ṣalāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallim ʻadada maʻlūmatika wa-murāda kalimātika, kullamā dhakaraka al-dhākirūn wa-ghafila ʻan dhikrika al-ghāfilūn."

Translation of the colophon of "Sharḥ al-Raḥbīyah": "This blessed commentary is completed. I beseech God, may He be praised and glorified, to benefit by it its author, its reader and him who examines it. He suffices me and He is the best advocate. O God! Pray on our Master Muḥammad, the best prayer, and on his family and companions and grant them peace, as much as the amount of Your knowledge and the intention of Your words, whenever You are remembered by those who remember You and whenever You are neglected to be remembered by the neglectful."

record.title: 880-03 Kitāb al-Kharāj : manuscript / Abū Yūsuf Yaʻqūb ibn Ibrāhīm.

Nuskhat kitāb Abī Yūsuf Yaʻqūb ibn Ibrāhīm al-Qāḍī ilá Amīr al-Muʼminīn al-Rashīd fī al-kharāj: Aṭāl Allāh baqāʼ Amīr al-Muʼminīn, wa-atamma la-hu al-iʻzāz fī tamām min al-niʻmah wa-dawām min al-karāmah, wa-jaʻala mā anʻama ʻalayhi mawṣūlan bi-naʻīm al-ākhirah alladhī lā yanfadu wa-lā yazūlu, wa-murāfaqat al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Inna Amīr al-Muʼminīn saʼalanī an aṣnaʻa la-hu kitāban jāmiʻan yuʻmalu bi-hi jibāyat al-kharāj wa-al-ʻushūr wa-al-ṣadaqāt wa-al-jawālī wa-ghayr dhālik, mimmā yajibu ʻalayhi al-naẓar fīhi wa-al-ʻamal bi-hi, wa-innamā arāda bi-dhālika rafʻ al-ẓulm ʻan al-raʻīyah wa-al-ṣalāḥ li-amrihim ..."

On folio 1a: "Thamanuhu 35."

On folio 1a: Ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Min kutub Darwīsh Muḥammad ʻAbd Allāh Zādah, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn." 2. Two illegible stamps. 3. "Tamallakahu al-faqīr ilayhi, ʻazza shaʼnuhu, al-Sayyid ʻAbd Allāh al-Murādī, al-Muftī bi-Dimashq al-Shām, ʻufiya ʻanhu."

At the end of the colophon: Two verses of invocation, as follows: Tamma al-kitābu bi-ḥamdi Allāh dhī al-jūdī // muḥyī al-ʻiẓāmi wa-mujrī al-māʼa fī al-ʻūdi. Yā qāriʼa al-khaṭṭi qul billāh mujtahidan // ighfir li-kātibihi yā khayra maʻbūdī.

Colophon: "Tamma Kitāb al-Kharāj. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah, wa-ṣalawātuhu ʻalá Muḥammad, Rasūlihi wa-ʻabdih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh kafá, samiʻa Allāh li-man daʻá. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Fī thāmin ʻashar yawm maḍat min shahr Shawwāl, sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-khamsah wa-thalāthīn min al-Hijrah al-Muḥammadīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. ʻAlá yad afqar al-ʻibād ilá Allāh wa-aḥwajihim ilayhi, Ibrāhīm al-ʻAjūnī, kātib hādhā. M M M."

Translation of the colophon: "Kitāb al-Kharāj is completed. Praise be to God alone. May His prayers be upon Muḥammad, His Messenger and servant. Praise be to God, and that is enough. God listens to him who invokes Him. God suffices us. He is the best advocate. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. Copied on 18 Shawwāl, 1135 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [22 July 1723], may the best prayer and peace be upon him, by the hand of the poorest of the servants of God and the neediest to Him, Ibrāhīm al-ʻAjlūnī. M M M."

record.title: 880-02 al-Iqnāʻ fī ḥall alfāẓ Abī Shujāʻ : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Shirbīnī.
record.note: Title from folio 3a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit (folio 2b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alldhī nashara lil-ʻulamāʼ aʻlāman, wa-thabbata lahum ʻalá al-ṣirāṭ al-mustaqīm aqdāman, wa-jaʻla maqām al-ʻilm aʻlā maqām, wa-faḍḍala al-ʻulamāʼ bi-iqāmat al-ḥujaj al-dīnīyah wa-maʻrifat al-aḥkām, wa-awdaʻa al-ʻārifīn laṭāʼif sirrih, fa-hum ahl al-maḥaḍarah wa-al-ilhām, wa-waffaqa al-ʻāmilīn li-khidmatihi fa-hajarū ladhīdh al-manām ..."
Secundo folio: li-dhālika ṣadrī sharaʻtu.
15 x 21 cm; written surface: 10 x 15 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In dark red leather with flap.

In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Mukhtaṣar fī al-fiqh ʻalá madhhab al-Shāfiʻī" of Abū Shujāʻ in red; numerous notes and commentaries on the margins of the first 300 leaves; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: An ownership statement, dated the beginning of Shaʻbān, 911 of the Hijrah (7 January 1506), indicating that the codex was the property of the Abbasid Caliph in Egypt "Abū al-Ṣabr Yaʻqūb" (Yaʻqūb ibn ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz, al-Mustamsik billāh, 1447-1521), and that he gave it as a gift to Qānṣūh al-Ghūrī (Sultan of Egypt and Syria, died 1516), as follows: "Min mumtalakāt afqar al-ʻibād ilá Allāh ʻabduhu al-khāḍiʻ li-ʻizz jalālihi wa-majdih, Amīr al-Muʼminīn Abī al-Ṣabr Yaʻqūb, al-Khalīfah al-ʻAbbāsī, fī sanat 911 Hijrīyah, hadīyah min Amīr al-Muʼminīn wa-Khalīfat Rasūl Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, ilá ẓill Allāh fī arḍih, al-Sulṭān Qānṣūh al-Ghūrī. Fī ghurrat Shaʻbān, sanat 911 Hijrīyah."

On folio 1a: A statement indicating that the copy was edited by Abī Yaḥyá Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī (Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad, approximately 1423-approximately 1520), as follows: "ʻUniya bi-tanqīḥihā wa-taṣḥīḥihā Shaykh al-Islām wa-muftī al-anām, Abī Yaḥyá Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī, ghafara Allāh la-hu. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ al-Khaṭīb ʻalá Abī Shujāʻ, raḥimahumā Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."

On folio 2a: "Kitāb al-Iqnāʻ fī ḥall alfāẓ Abī Shujāʻ, taʼlīf al-Imām al-ʻallāmah wa-al-ḥabr al-fahhāmah, Ustādhunā wa-qudwatunā, al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Shirbīnī al-Khaṭīb, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-bi-ʻulūmihi, wa-raḥimahu Allāh raḥmatan wāsiʻah fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah, wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn, bi-faḍlihi wa-karamih. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 3a: "... wa-sammaytuhu bi-al-Iqnāʻ fī ḥall alfāẓ Abī Shujāʻ ..."

On folio 475b: A statement indicating that the present codex became the property of Qānṣūh al-Ghūrī (Sultan of Egypt and Syria, died 1516), and that it was added to the Royal Library in the month of Shaʻbān, 911 of the Hijrah (January/February 1506): "Min kutub Sulṭān al-khāfiqīn wa-al-barrayn wa-al-baḥrayn, Jalālat Malik Miṣr wa-al-Shām al-muʻaẓẓam, Mawlānā al-Sulṭān Qānṣūh al-Ghūrī, ʻuzza naṣruhu, wa-khallada Allāh mulkahu. Āmīn. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. Dakhala fī Khizānat al-Kutub al-Mulūkīyah fī shahr Shaʻbān, ʻām iḥdá ʻashar wa-tisʻimiʼah Hijrīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-azká al-taḥīyah. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-sharḥ al-mubārak yawm al-Arbaʻ al-mubārak, thālith ʻashar Rabīʻ al-Awwal alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat tisʻimiʼah wa-iḥdá ʻashar min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad kātibihi, afqar al-khalq wa-aḥwajihim ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-faqīr ʻAlī al-Mināwātī baldatan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, al-Aḥmadī ṭarīqatan, ibn al-marḥūm ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-Qāḍī Yūsuf al-Nuʻaymī laqaban, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. M. Ḥarrartuhu mujtahidan // wa-laysa yakhlū min ghalaṭ. Qul lilladhī yalūmunī // man huwa alladhī mā sāqiṭ [saqaṭ]. Kamula al-kitābu takāmalat // diyamu al-surūri li-ṣāḥibih. Wa-ʻafá al-Ilāhu bi-faḍlihi // wa-bi-jūdihi ʻan kātibih. Sanat 911. Tisʻumiʼah wa-iḥdá ʻashar Hijrīyah."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed commentary was completed on blessed Wednesday, 13 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 911 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [24 August 1505], may the best prayer and peace be upon him, by the hand of its copyist, the poorest of mankind and the neediest to God Almighty, the poor ʻAlī al-Mināwātī baldatan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, al-Aḥmadī ṭarīqatan, ibn al-marḥūm ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-Qāḍī Yūsuf al-Nuʻaymī laqaban, may God forgive him, his parents, him who offers invocation for his forgiveness, and all Muslims. Amen. Amen. Amen. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and on his family and companions and grant them peace. There is no power nor might except in God the All Mighty the All Powerful. God suffices us, He is the best advocate. M. I copied it diligently // but it is not free of mistakes. Tell him who blames me // who is he who does not make mistakes. The book is completed. Perfect are // the continuous rains of happiness for its owner. May God forgive, by His favor // and by His generosity, its copyist. Dated in the year 911 of the Hijrah [1505/1506]."

record.title: 880-03 Kanz al-daqāʼiq : manuscript / Abū al-Barakāt ʻAbd Allāh ibn Aḥmad al-Nasafī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 2b): "... wa-sammaytuhu bi-Kanz al-daqāʼiq ...".
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aʻazza al-ʻilm fī al-aʻṣār, wa-aʻlá ḥizbahu fī al-amṣār, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Rasūlihi al-mukhtaṣṣ bi-hādhā al-faḍl al-ʻaẓīm, wa-ʻalá ālihi alladhīna fāzū minhu bi-ḥaẓẓ jasīm. Qāla Mawlānā al-ḥabr al-niḥrīr, ṣāḥib al-bayān wa-al-banān fī al-taqrīr wa-al-taḥrīr, kāshif al-mushkilāt wa-al-muʻḍilāt, mubayyin al-kināyāt wa-al-ishārāt, manbaʻ al-ʻulá, ʻalam al-hudá, afḍal al-wará, ḥāfiẓ al-ḥaqq wa-al-millah wa-al-dīn, shams al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, wārith ʻulūm al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn, Abū al-Barakāt ʻAbd Allāh ibn Aḥmad ibn Maḥmūd al-Nasafī, afāḍa Allāh ʻalayhi anwār raḥmatih, wa-taghammadahu bi-maghfaratih, wa-askanahu baḥbūḥat jannatih: Lammā raʼaytu al-himam māʼilah ilá al-mukhtaṣarāt, wa-al-ṭabāʼiʻ rāghibah ʻan al-muṭawwalāt aradtu an ulakhkhiṣa al-Wāfī, bi-dhikr mā ʻamma wuqūʻuh wa-kathura wujūduh, li-yakthura fāʼidatuh wa-yatawaffara ʻāʼidatuh, fa-sharaʻtu fīhi baʻda iltimās ṭāʼifah min aʻyān al-afāḍil wa-afāḍil al-aʻyān alladhīna hum bi-manzilat al-insān lil-ʻayn wa-al-ʻayn lil-insān, maʻa mā bī min al-ʻawāʼiq, wa-sammaytuhu bi-Kanz al-daqāʼiq ..."
Secundo folio: lā balghaman aw daman.
17.5 x 26.5 cm; written surface: 18 x 19 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In dark green buckram; cover embossed with central medallion.
In good large naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; few notes and correction on the margins; catchwords.
On folios 1a-1b: Table of contents.
On folio 2a: "Kitāb Kanz al-daqāʼiq, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, imām dahrihi wa-farīd ʻaṣrihi, Abū al-Barakāt ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Nasafī, ʻalá madhhab al-Imām al-Aʻẓam Abū Ḥanīfah."
Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih, wa-ghafara Allāh li-man katabah."
Translation of the colophon: "The blessed book is completed by the praise of God and His help. May God forgive him who wrote/copied it."

record.title: 880-03 Matn al-Burdah : manuscript / Sharaf al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd al-Būṣīrī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Amin tadhakkuri jīrānin bi-Dhī Salami // mazajta damʻan jará min muqlatin bi-dami. Am habbati al-rīḥu min tilqāʼ Kāẓimatin // wa-awmaḍ al-barqu fī al-ẓalmāʼi min Iḍami ..."
Secundo folio: Ayaḥsabu al-ṣabbu anna al-ḥubba munkatimun.
13 x 19 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16 cm; 7 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap.
In beautiful large naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; text fully vocalized, within double red frame; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Matn al-Burdah lil-Imām Muḥammad al-Būṣīrī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih fī yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ, al-muwāfiq arbaʻah wa-ʻishrīn yawman min shahr Allāh al-ḥarām Rajab, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-thalāthimiʼah wa-thalāthah min al-Hijrah, ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr ilá Allāh, Muḥammad Abū Muṭāwiʻ al-Suḥaymī al-Ḥusaynī al-Shāfiʻī, Imām wa-Khaṭīb Masjid al-Shuhadāʼ bi-al-Jamālīyah, bi-Miṣr al-maḥrūsah, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh, wa-ashhadu anna Muḥammadan Rasūl Allāh."

Translation of the colophon: "It is completed by the praise of God and His help, on Wednesday, 24 Rajab, 1303 of the Hijrah [28 April, 1886], by the hand of its copyist, the poor to God, Muḥammad Abū Muṭāwiʻ al-Suḥaymī al-Ḥusaynī al-Shāfiʻī, the Imām and Preacher of Masjid al-Jamālīyah, in protected Cairo, may God forgive him, his parents and the Muslims. Amen. I confess that there is no god but God, and I confess that Muḥammad is the Messenger of God."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Burdah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Shīrāzī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad al-Muṣṭafá, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-mujtabīn, ruḍwān Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhim ajmaʻīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu adhall ʻibād Allāh Fakhr al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr, ghafara Allāh la-hum: Lammā kānat al-qaṣīdah al-mawsūmah bi-al-Kawākib al-durrīyah, al-musammāt [al-musammāh] bi-al-Burdah al-Nabawīyah, al-mansūbah ilá al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Sharaf al-Millah wa-al-Dīn, Abī ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd al-Dulāṣī al-Būṣīrī, rawwaḥa Allāh rūḥahu wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahu wa-wassaʻa marqadahu, mushtamilah ʻalá fawāʼid sharīfah wa-nikāh [wa-nikāt] laṭīfah lam yattafiq la-hā sharḥ yudhallilu ṣiʻābahā wa-yukhriju min qishrihā lubābahā, thumma iltamasa minnī zumrah min al-khillān wa-ṭāʼifah min khullaṣ al-ikhwān an aktuba la-hā sharḥan yanḥallu bi-hā alfāẓuhā wa-maʻānīhā, wa-tankashifu bi-hā ʻibārātuhā wa-maqāṣiduhā, wa-kuntu ataʻallalu bi-laʻalla wa-ʻasá wa-sawfa, wa-rubbamā li-qillat biḍāʻatī, ḥattá tawassalū bi-mā lā yasaʻunī mukhālafatuhu, fa-ajabtuhā [fa-ajabtuhum], sāʼilan mutaḍarriʻan an yanfaʻa bi-hi, wa-Allāh al-muwaffiq wa-al-muʻīn ..."
Secundo folio: laylat al-Jumʻah khāliyan fī manzilī.
15 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 16 cm; 13-17 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding.
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some explanations in Persian within the text (probably by a copyist); catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ-i Qaṣīdah-i Burdah."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements with two illegible stamps: 1. "Dakhala fī tamlīk mulk al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muḥtāj ilá raḥmat Rabbihi al-qadīr Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad, al-kātib bi-Bāsh Muḥāsabah." 2. "Istalama min khayr mustalim al-ʻabd al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn al-Mawlá [... ... ...], ghafara Allāh la-hu."

Colophon: "Tamma. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Qiṭʻah: Mā in madaḥtu Muḥammadan bi-maqālatī // lākin madaḥtu maqālatī bi-Muḥammadi. Hadānā ilá al-Raḥmāni min ẓulmati al-hawá // fa-lawlāhu mā kunnā ilá al-ḥaqqi yahtadī [nahtadī]. Wa-idhā al-rijālu tawassalū bi-wasīlatin // fa-wasīlatī khayru āli Muḥammadi. ʻAlayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Qad intahá hādhihi al-risālah fī 22 Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, sanat arbaʻ wa-ʻishrīn wa-alf. sanat 1014 [1024]."

Translation of the colophon: "It is completed. God is more knowledgeable of what is correct, to Him is the reference and returning. A poem: I did not praise Muḥammad by my discourse // rather, I praised my discourse by Muḥammad. He guided us to the Merciful One from the darkness of desire // were it not for him we would not have been guided to the truth. If men were to seek an aid // my aid will be the righteous Muḥammad's family. May prayer and peace be upon Him. This epistle was completed on 22 Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, the year 1024 [of the Hijrah = 6 September, 1605]."

record.title: 880-03 Mirʼāt al-uṣūl fī sharḥ Mirqāt al-wuṣūl : manuscript / Mullā Khusrū Muḥammad ibn Farāmurz.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 3a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī karrama banī Ādam bi-al-ʻaql al-qawīm, wa-hadāhum bi-nūr tawfīqihi ilá al-ṣirāṭ al-mustaqīm. Sharraʻa la-hum lil-aḥkām [al-aḥkām] bi-ṭawlihi al-ʻamīm, wa-waffaqa baʻḍahum li-istinbāṭihā bi-faḍlihi al-fakhīm, li-yakhlaw ʻan al-murdiyāt fa-yanjaw ʻan [min] ʻadhāb al-jaḥīm, wa-yuḥallaw bi-al-munjiyāt fa-yujallū bi-al-naʻīm al-muqīm. Wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka la-hu shahādatan ʻan al-ḍamīr al-ṣamīm, wa-tanfaʻu yawma lā yanfaʻu māl wa-lā banūn illā man atá Allāh bi-qalb salīm ..."
Secundo folio: lā dirʻ hayyin al-ḥuṣūl.
15.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 14.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In honey-colored leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion.
In good naskh/ruqʻah script; in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Mirʼāt al-uṣūl fī sharḥ Mirqāt al-wuṣūl."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements: 1. "Tamallakahu al-faqīr Muḥammad ʻAṭāʼ Allāh ibn Muḥammad Saʻīd al-Ayyūbī, ghufira lahumā. Āmīn." 2. "Tamallakahu Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ʻAṭāʼ Allāh al-Ayyūbī al-Anṣārī, ghufira lahumā. Fī 4 Muḥarram, sanat 300 [1300? of the Hijrah = 15 November, 1882?]."
On the edges of the leaves of the lower side of the codex: "Mirʼāt al-uṣūl fī Mirqāt al-wuṣūl."
On folio 3a: "... wa-sammaytuhu: Mirʼāt al-uṣūl fī sharḥ Mirqāt al-wuṣūl ..."
Colophon: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb."
Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King."

Spine title: A walk from Minehead, 1801.
