record.title: 880-03 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Raḥbīyah li-Sibṭ al-Māridīnī : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Birmāwī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī manna ʻalá al-ʻulamāʼ bi-jazīl faḍlihi al-fāʼiḍ, wa-arshadahum ilá bayān ṭuruq al-sunan wa-al-farāʼiḍ, mumīt al-khalāʼiq wa-mufnīhā, wa-wārith al-arḍ wa-mā ʻalayhā, qasam al-arzāq wa-al-ājāl li-qismatihi ʻādilah, wa-wasiʻa al-anām iḥsānuhu bi-niʻmatihi ʻāʼilah. Aḥmaduhu ʻalá athná [asná] al-mawāhib, wa-ashkuruhu ʻalá niʻamihi, fa-shukruhu farḍun wājib ... Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi ḥawāshin ʻalá Sharḥ al-Māridīnī ʻalá al-Muqaddimah al-Raḥbīyah ..."
Secundo folio: fī al-aṣl bi-maʻná al-tarbiyah.
16 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 16.5 cm; 23-25 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark brown leather on cover and flap.
In fair naskh script, in different hands; in black ink, on white paper; some commentaries and key words on the margins, in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Ḥāshiyat Shaykhinā al-ʻallāmah al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Birmāwī al-Shāfiʻī ʻalá Sharḥ al-Raḥbīyah li-Mawlānā Sibṭ al-Māridīnī, raḥimahum Allāh. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā taḥaṣṣala jamʻuhu, bi-ḥasbi mā yassarahu Allāh taʻālá bi-faḍlihi wa-mannihi. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Hādhā ākhir kalām al-muʼallif, raḥimahu [Allāh]. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah yawm al-Jumʻah al-mubārak, yawm rābiʻ wa-ʻishrīn min Rajab al-mubārak, sanat alf wa-miʼah [... ... ...] afḍal al-ṣalāh [... ...]."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what was gathered, according to what God Almighty facilitated by His favor and generosity. God suffices us. He is the best advocate. This is the end of the words of the author, may [God] have mercy upon him. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and his companions, and grant them peace. This blessed copy was completed on blessed Friday, the twenty-fourth of blessed Rajab, of the year one thousand one hundred [... ...], may the best prayer [... ... ...]."

record.title: 880-02 al-Talwīḥ ilá kashf ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanqīḥ : manuscript / Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar al-Taftāzānī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aḥkama bi-Kitābihi uṣūl al-Sharīʻah al-gharrāʼ, wa-rafaʻa bi-khiṭābihi furūʻ al-Ḥanīfīyah al-samḥāʼ, ḥattá aḍḥat kalimatuhu al-bāqiyah rāsikhat al-asās, shāmikhat al-bināʼ, kashajarah ṭayyibah, aṣluhā thābit wa-farʻuhā fī al-samāʼ, wa-awqada min mishkāt al-Sunnah li-iqtibās anwārihā sirājan wahhājan, wa-awḍaḥa li-ijmāʻ al-ārāʼ ʻalá iqtifāʼ āthārihā qiyāsan wa-minhājan, ḥattá ṣādafta biḥār al-ʻilm wa-al-hudá tatalāṭamu amwājan, wa-raʼyta al-nās yadkhulūna fī dīn Allāh afwājan ..."
Secundo folio: li-mā iqtaṣara fīhi ʻalá ḍabṭ al-marām.
19 x 27.5 cm; written surface: 13 x 19.5 cm; 33 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with central medallion.
In hasty ruqʻah script, text mostly undotted; in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On the label of the front cover: A statement indicating that the cover belonged to another book: "al-Juzʼ al-thālith min al-Nahr al-fāʼiq bi-sharḥ Kanz al-daqāʼiq li-Sirāj al-Dīn ʻUmar ibn Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-shahīr bi-Ibn Nujaym, min Kitāb al-Bayʻ ilá ākhir al-Shahādah."

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Talwīḥ ilá kashf ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanqīḥ, taʼlīf al-ʻAllāmah Saʻd al-Millah wa-al-Dīn al-Mawlá Saʻd al-Dīn, saqá Allāh maḍjiʻahu shaʼābīb al-ghufrān wa-askanahu fasīḥ al-jinān, wa-raḍiya ʻanhu wa-ʻan muʼallifī al-aṣl, wa-raḥimahum Allāh ajmaʻīn bi-mannihi wa-mannih [wa-yumnih]. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih."
On folio 1a: A partially legible lending statement: "ʻĀriyat Mawlānā al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim [...] Manṣūr al-Khawāyilī [?] al-Shāfiʻī [... ... ...] wa-Muḥammad [... ... ...]."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... kamā fī masʼalat 'ghasl al-marāfiq', fa-inna al-muʻallil yurīdu anna al-ghāyah al-madhkūrah fī al-āyah ghāyah lil-ghasl, wa-al-ghāyah lā tadkhulu taḥta al-mughayyā, fa-lā tadkhulu al-marāfiq fī al-ghasl, wa-al-sāʼil yurīdu annah ghāyah lil-isqāṭ fa-lā tadkhulu fī al-isqāṭ fa-tabqá dākhilah fī al-ghasl. Fa-law ṣarraḥa bi-al-muqaddimah al-maṭlūbah la-taʻayyan manʻuhā, thumma lā yakhfá anna hādhā al-mithāl laysa min qabīl al-qiyās, bal yaʻimmu al-adillah. Fa-in qulta: Kayfa yakūnu hādhā al-mithāl min al-qawl al-mūjib wa-al-muʻallal, innamā yaltazimu ʻadam dukhūl al-mirfaq taḥta al-ghasl, wa-al-sāʼil lā yaltazimu dhālik. Qultu al-muʻtabar min al-qawl bi-al-mūjib iltizām mā yalzam al-muʻallil bi-taʻlīlih min ḥaythu innahu muʻallal, wa-huwa hunā lā yaltazimu illā ʻadam dukhūl al-mirfaq taḥta mā huwa ghāyah la-hu, wa-qad iltuzima min al-sāʼil, fa-ẓahra bi-mā dhakarnāh anna al-muṣannif, raḥimahu Allāh, law awrada makān masʼalat taʻyīn al-nīyah masʼalat ḍamān al-sariqah wa-naḥwihā, li-takūna tanbīhan ʻalá al-aqsām al-thalāthah, la-kāna ansab. Qawluhu ..."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Alfīyat Ibn Mālik : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAqīl.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla Muḥammadun huwa ibnu Māliki // Aḥmadu Rabbī Allāha khayra Māliki. Muṣalliyan ʻalá al-Rasūli al-Muṣṭafá // wa-ālihi al-mustakmalīn al-shurufā. Wa-astaʻīnu Allāha fī Alfīyah // maqāṣidu al-naḥwi bi-hā maḥwīyah ..."
Secundo folio: [al-lughaw]īyīn, wa-huwa fī al-lughah ism li-kull mā yutakallamu bi-hi.
22.5 x 16 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; brown leather on spine and flap.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of the "Alfīyah" in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Sharḥ al-Alfīyah lil-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Ibn ʻAqīl, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi wa-bi-barakāt ʻulūmihi fī al-dīn wa-al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn. Āmīn."
The "Alfīyah" ends with: Fa-aḥmadu Allāha muṣalliyan ʻalá // Muḥammadin khayri rasūlin ursilā. Wa-ālihi al-ghurri al-kirām al-bararah // wa-ṣaḥbihi al-muntakhabīna al-khiyarah."

Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhā al-kitāb yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, ākhir yawm min shahr Muḥarram al-mubārak, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah thamāniyah wa-sabʻīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad al-faqīr Muḥammad al-Ḍāhirī al-Dalajī al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Yā ayyuhā al-qārī istaghfir li-man katabā // fa-qad kafatka yadāhu al-naskha wa-al-taʻabā. Billāhi yā mustafīdan min fawāʼidihi // lā tabkhalanna bi-an tadʻū li-man katabā."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed book is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. There is no power nor might, except in God, the Almighty the All Powerful. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and on his family and all his companions. This book was completed on blessed Thursday [probably Monday], the last day of the blessed month of Muḥarram, of the year 1178 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [30 July 1764], may the best prayer and peace be upon Him, by the hand of the poor Muḥammad al-Ḍāhirī al-Dalajī al-Mālikī, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. O Reader invoke [God] to forgive him who wrote // for his hands have spared you the burden of copying and toil. By God, O You, who profits from its benefits // Do not miserly refrain from offering an invocation on behalf of him who copied."

record.title: 880-02 Mughīth al-nidā ilá Sharḥ Qaṭr al-nadá : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Shirbīnī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a: "... wa-sammaytuhu Mughīth al-nidā ilá Sharḥ Qaṭr al-nadá ..."
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī baʻatha Muḥammadan, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam raḥmatan lil-ʻālamīn, wa-anzala ʻalayhi Qurʼānan ʻArabīyan, aʻjaz bi-aqṣar sūrah minhu fuṣaḥāʼ al-ʻālamīn, wa-rafaʻa man jazam bi-tawḥīdihi, wa-intaṣaba munkhafiḍan li-adāʼ ḥuqūqihi fī al-ʻāmilīn. Wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu, lā sharīka lah, shāhādatan ṣādiratan ʻan al-yaqīn. Wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā wa-Nabīyanā Muḥammadan, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, al-makhṣūṣ bi-al-shafāʻah al-ʻuẓmá Yawm al-Dīn, ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-azwājihi wa-dhurrīyatihi wa-ahl baytihi, wa-adām dhālika ilá abd al-ābidīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu faqīr raḥmat Rabbihi al-qarīb, Muḥammad al-Shirbīnī al-Khaṭīb, ghafara Allāh taʻālá dhunūbahu, wa-satara fī al-dārayn ʻuyūbahu: Hādhā mā daʻat ilayhi ḥājat al-mutafahhimīn li-Qaṭr al-nadā wa-ball al-ṣadā fī al-naḥw lil-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, Muḥammad Abī ʻAbd Allāh Jamāl al-Dīn ibn Hishām al-Anṣārī ..."
Secundo folio: wa-sammaytuhu Mughīth al-nidā ilá Sharḥ Qaṭr al-nadā.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 14 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding; cover embossed with central medallion (in 15 numbered quires).

In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Sharḥ Qaṭr al-nadá wa-ball al-ṣadá" in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; at the head of each quire a statement indicating that the present copy was collated with the author's own copy, as follows: "Balagha muqābalatan ʻalá aṣlihi, wa-huwa naskhat al-muʼallif", catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Mughīth al-nidā ilá Sharḥ Qaṭr al-nadā wa-ball al-ṣadā, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Muḥammad al-Shirbīnī al-Khaṭīb, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakātihi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: 1. Mulk al-faqīr Aḥmad al-Ḥammāqī al-Ḥanafī bi-al-shirāʼ al-ṣaḥīḥ." (Stamp). 2. "Malaka hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak min faḍl Allāh tabāraka wa-taʻālá al-faqīr Abū al-Ṭayyib al-Sharbaqī."
At the head of folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá ʻalá ahl al-ʻilm bi-al-Azhar, nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi, wa-maqarruhu bi-Ruwāq al-Akrād."

Collator's/owner's statement (at the head of the copyist's colophon): "Balagha muqābalatan ʻalá aṣlihi, wa-hiya nuskhat al-muʼallif bi-khaṭṭihi, laylat al-Ithanayn, thānī laylah min shahr Shaʻbān alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat wāḥid wa-thamānīn wa-alf, wa-al-muqābil la-hu mālikuhu al-faqīr Abū al-Ṭayyib al-Sharbanī [al-Shirbīnī (?), al-Sharbaqī (?)], ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu, wa-ghafara la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Yā Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the collator's/owner's statement (at the head of the copyist's colophon): "The collation with the original copy, which is the author's copy, in his own handwriting, was completed on the night of Monday, the second night in the month of Shaʻbān, of the year 1081 [of the Hijrah = 1 May 1669], the collator being, its owner, the poor Abū al-Ṭayyib al-Sharbanī [al-Shirbīnī (?), al-Sharbaqī (?)], may God pardon him and forgive him, his parents and all and entire Muslims. O Lord of the Universe."

Copyist's colophon: "Qāla al-muṣannif, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhu ʻalá yad muʼallifihi, Muḥammad al-Khaṭīb al-Shirbīnī, yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ, sābiʻ ʻishrīn Rabīʻ al-Awwal, min shuhūr sanat tisʻ wa-khamsīn wa-tisʻimiʼah, min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-azká al-salām. Wa-qad wāfaq al-farāgh min naql hādhā al-sharḥ al-ʻaẓīm, min khaṭṭ muʼallifihi, yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ al-mubārak, salkh al-Qaʻdah al-ḥarām, sanat 1079, min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-salām, wa-dhālika ʻalá yad afqar al-khalq ilá ʻafw Rabbihi al-karīm al-muʻṭī, ʻAbd al-Ṣamad ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Jawwād al-Daysaṭī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-man daʻā lahumā bi-al-maghfirah wa-ḥusn al-khātimah, wa-li-mashāyikhihi, wa-li-ikhwānihi, wa-li-kull al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The author, may God Almighty have mercy upon him, said: It was completed by the hand of its author, Muḥammad al-Khaṭīb al-Shirbīnī, on Wednesday, 27 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, of the year 959 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [23 March 1552], may the best prayer and the purest peace be upon Him. This great commentary was transcribed from the handwriting of its author, on blessed Wednesday, the end of Dhū al-Qaʻdah, of the year 1079 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [1 May 1669], may the best prayer and the most perfect peace be upon Him, by the hand of the poorest of mankind to the forgiveness of his Abundant Giving Lord, ʻAbd al-Ṣamad ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Jawwād al-Daysaṭī, may God forgive him, his parents, him who invokes [God] to forgive them and grant them a favorable end, also his teachers, his brethren, and all and entire Muslims. Amen. Amen. Praise be to God alone."

record.title: 880-03 ʻUjālah ʻalá Sharḥ Ibn Hishām li-matnihi Shudhūr al-dhahab : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Amīr.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Ḥamd Rafīʻ al-Jalāl aṣlun li-shudhūr al-niʻam, wa-shukr Dhī al-Afḍāl yanṣubu liwāʼ al-iqbāl wa-yajlū al-ghamm, wa-ṣalātan wa-salāman li-man khafaḍa al-ḍalālāt, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ulī al-faḍl wa-al-karāmāt. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu Muḥammad al-Amīr, ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-luṭfihi al-khaṭīr: Hādhihi ʻUjālah ʻalá Sharḥ Ibn Hishām li-matnihi Shudhūr al-dhahab, ijtanabtu fīhā mā ishtahara wa-iḍṭarab, wa-ramat bi-hi al-alsun min kull ḥadb, fa-aqūlu mustaʻīnan billāh taʻālá: Bismillāh ilkh. al-Bāʼ ḥarf jarr aṣlī, aw, zāʼid; fa-ʻalá al-awwal hiya lil-istiʻānah ..."
Secundo folio: wa-lā yaqdaḥu fī dhālik ʻadam taʻalluqihā.
22.5 x 16.5 cm; written surface: 12 x 19 cm; 28 lines per page.
Binding: In red cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap.

In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; the phrases of "Sharḥ Shudhūr al-dhahab fī maʻrifat kalām al-ʻArab" preceded by the word "qawluhu" (his saying); catchwords.
Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā yassarahu Allāh taʻālá. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."
Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what God Almighty facilitated. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and companions, and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-03 Tuḥfat al-gharīb. Al-Sifr 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr al-Damāmīnī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-kafá. Qāla al-muṣannif, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: al-Bāb al-thānī min al-kitāb, fī tafsīr al-jumlah wa-dhikr aqsāmihā wa-aḥkāmihā. Aqūlu: al-Bāb mubtadaʼ, wa-al-thānī ṣifah la-hu, wa-fī tafsīr al-jumlah khabaruhu, wa-min al-kitāb immā ḥāl min al-ḍamīr al-mustakinn fī al-khabar, wa-lā yaḍurru hunā taqdīm al-ḥāl ʻalá ʻāmilihā al-maʻnawī li-annahu ẓarf. Wa-qad ṣarraḥ Ibn Burhān bi-jawāzih, li-tawassuʻihim fī al-ẓarf, wa-immā ḥāl min al-mubtadaʼ ʻalá ḥadd, wa-mā ajāzahu Sībawayh fī qawl al-shāʻir: 'Li-mayyata mūḥishan ṭalalu', idh ṣāḥib al-ḥāl ʻindahu huwa al-nakirah, wa-huwa ʻindahu marfūʻ bi-al-ibtidāʼ, wa-laysa fāʻilan kamā yaqūlu al-Akhfash ..."
Secundo folio: khabarīyah idhā kānat ṣifah aw ṣilah.
16.5 x 13 cm; written surface: 7.8 x 12.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding with flap; dark brown leather on spine and flap.

In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Mughnī al-labīb ʻan kutub al-aʻārīb" preceded by the word "qāla" (he said), and the commentary by the word "aqūlu" (I say) in red; some wormholes with loss of some text; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ Mughnī al-labīb lil-Damāmīnī."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Ishtarāhu [... ... ...] Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn. [... ... ...] fī Jumādá al-Ūlá, ʻām 1269 [February/March 1853] [... ...]."

Colophon: "Wa-li-yakun infiṣālī min al-kalām fī al-sharḥ ʻalá hādhā al-wajh al-ḥasan, wa-li-nakuffa al-qalam ʻan shawṭihi fa-qad aṭaltu la-hu al-rasan. Hādhā wa-anā min ahl al-taqṣīr, fa-mā lī wa-lil-taṭwīl! Wa-Allāh al-masʼūl an yamunna bi-ḥusn al-khātimah, fa-huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Khātim al-Nabīyīn, wa-fātiḥ al-hidāyah lil-khalq ajmaʻīn, Muḥammad Badr al-Tamām wa-Misk al-Khitām, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi maṣābīḥ al-ẓalām. Wa-al-taḥīyāt al-ṭayyibāt awṣaltu ilayhi wa-ilayhim wa-al-salām. Tamma al-sifr al-awwal bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhu baʻda ʻaṣr yawm al-Sabt, thāmin ʻishrīn shahr Dhī al-Ḥijjah, khitām sanat 966, aḥsana Allāh ʻāqibatahā. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Let my halting the talk about this commentary be at this favorable phase, and let us stop the pen from its race, as I have lengthened its halter, though I am a person of slackness; so, what do I have to do with elaboration! God is in charge of endowing us with favorable end. He suffices me, for He is the best advocate. May prayer be upon the Seal of the Prophets, the provider of guidance to all mankind, Muḥammad, the Full Moon and the Musk of Conclusion, and upon his family, the torches in darkness. May my pleasant salutations and greetings reach Him and them. The first book is concluded by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. It was completed on Saturday afternoon, 28 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, the end of the year 966 [of the Hijrah = 11 October 1559], may God end it favorably. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 Mukhtaṣar al-Ṣiḥāḥ : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr al-Rāzī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh bi-jamīʻ al-maḥāmid ʻalá jamīʻ al-niʻam, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá khayr khalqih Muḥammad, al-mabʻūth li-akhyar al-umam, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih mafātīḥ al-ḥikam wa-maṣābīḥ al-ẓulam. Qāla al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá raḥmat Rabbihi wa-maghfiratih, Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr ibn ʻAbd al-Qāhir al-Rāzī, raḥimahu Allāh: Hādhā mukhtaṣar ʻalá ʻilm al-lughah, jamaʻtuhu min kitāb 'al-Ṣiḥāḥ' lil-Imām al-ʻallāmah Abī Naṣr Ismāʻīl ibn Ḥammād al-Jawharī, raḥimahu Allāh, lammā raʼaytuhu aḥsan uṣūl al-lughah tartīban, wa-awfarahā tahdhīban, wa-ashalahā tanāwulan, wa-aktharahā tadāwulan, wa-sammaytuhu "Mukhtaṣar al-Ṣiḥāḥ", wa-iqtaṣartu fīhi ʻalá mā lā budda li-kull ʻālim faqīh, aw ḥāfiẓ, aw muḥaddith, aw adīb, min maʻrifatih wa-ḥifẓih, li-kathrat istiʻmālih wa-jarayānih ʻalá al-alsun ..."
Secundo folio: sabʻat mawāzīn naṣara yanṣuru naṣran.
13.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 16.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding; dark brown leather on spine.
In Farsī script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Ṣāḥib hādhā al-kitāb adhnab al-ʻuṣāh wa-aḥqar al-ʻibād, ʻĀrif Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Walī Afandī ibn al-Ḥājj Shaykh Muḥammad Afandī ibn Rasūl ibn Ḥasan, ghafara Allāh la-hum ajmaʻīn bi-ḥurmat Sayyid al-Mursalīn." (Stamp of ʻĀrif Muḥammad).
At the head of folio 1b: "Lughah. Mukhtār al-Ṣiḥāḥ."
Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with: "... wa-naẓīruhu qawl Dhī al-Rummah: Alā yā islamī yā dāra mayya ʻalá al-bilá // wa-lā zāla munhallan bi-jarʻāʼiki al-qaṭru."
On folio 294a: A fatwá, in Ottoman Turkish, on marriage, "... katabahu al-Muftī ʻAbd Allāh bi-al-Dār [bi-Dār] al-Salṭanah al-ʻAlīyah."

record.title: 880-02 Tāj al-ʻarūs min jawāhir al-Qāmūs : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Murtaḍá al-Zabīdī.
record.note: Title from folio 12a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi astaʻīn. Aḥmadu man qalladanā min ʻiqd ṣiḥāḥ jawhar ālāʼih, wa-awlānā min sayb lubāb mujmal iḥsānihi wa-ʻaṭāʼih, wa-afāḍ ʻalaynā min qāmūs birrihi al-muḥīṭ fāʼiq karamih wa-bāhir isdāʼih. Wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lah, shahādatan yūridunā ṣidq qawlihā al-maʼnūs mawārid aḥibbāʼih wa-mashārib aṣfiyāʼih. Wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammadan al-sayyid al-murtaḍá, wa-al-sanad al-murtajá, wa-al-rasūl al-muntaqá, wa-al-ḥabīb al-mujtabá, al-miṣbāḥ al-muḍīyʼ al-muzhir bi-mishkāt al-sirr al-lāmiʻ al-muʻlam al-ʻujāb, wa-al-ṣubḥ al-lāmiʻ al-musfir ʻan khabāyā asrār nāmūs al-ṣidq wa-al-ṣawāb ..."
Secundo folio: maṭāliʻ al-ʻizz al-abadī.
14.2 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 15 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; central medallion embossed on spine and flap.
In beautiful naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; text within blue and red frames; catchwords.
On folios 1a-11b and folios 104a-110b: Miscellaneous quotations from different sources in prose and poetry, written in fast ruqʻah script, in different hands.
On folio 12a: "Kitāb Tāj al-ʻarūs min jawāhir al-Qāmūs, jamʻ al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad Murtaḍá al-Ḥusaynī, khādim ʻilm al-lughah bi-Miṣr, sāmaḥahu Allāh bi-mannihi wa-karamih."
The text of "Tāj al-ʻarūs min jawāhir al-Qāmūs" (folios 12a-103b).

At the end of the colophon: A reader's statement, by ʻAbd Allāh, a fifth generation descendant of the well-known Sufi, ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Nābulusī (1641-1731), dated 1262 of the Hijrah (1846), as follows: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Min niʻam Allāh taʻālá. Qad ṭālaʻa fīhi ʻAbd Allāh ibn ibn ibn ibn Sayyidī al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Nābulusī, quddisa sirruhu, sanat 1262 [of the Hijrah = 1845/1846]."

The present segment ends with: "... wa-ʻalá Allāh al-tuklān, bi-al-ḍamm, maṣdar, wa-tāʼuhu ʻan wāw, li-annahu min al-tawakkul, wa-huwa iẓhār al-ʻajz wa-al-iʻtimād ʻalá al-ghayr; wa-al-maʻná: Lā iʻtimād wa-lā iftiqār illā ilá Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, wa-huwa al-ghanī, lā ilāha illā Huwa, wa-lā rabba ghayruhu, wa-lā khayra illā khayruhu. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam."

Colophon: "Katabahu bi-yadihi al-fāniyah al-faqīr ilá Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Khalīfī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-man naẓara fīhi wa-daʻā lahum bi-al-maghfirah, fī 21 Ṣafar, sanat 1183. Wa-qad qūbila bi-aṣlihi, ʻalá yad muʼallifihi, al-ʻabd al-faqir ilá Allāh taʻālá, Muḥammad Murtaḍá al-Ḥusaynī al-Zabīdī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu wa-sāmaḥahu bi-karamihi, wa-dhālika fī 24 Ṣafar, sanat 1183, bi-manzilī fī ʻAṭfat al-Ghassāl, bi-Miṣr al-Qāhirah, ḥarasahā Allāh taʻālá wa-sāʼir bilād al-Islām."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied by the perishing hand of the poor to God, may He be praised and glorified, Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Khalīfī al-Shāfiʻī, may God forgive him, his parents, and him who reads the book and offers an invocation for their forgiveness, on 21 Ṣafar, the year 1183 [of the Hijrah = 26 June 1769]. It was collated with its original copy, by its author, the servant, poor to God Almighty, Muḥammad Murtaḍá al-Ḥusaynī al-Zabīdī, may God forgive and pardon him by His benevolence, on 24 Ṣafar, of the year 1183 [of the Hijrah = 29 June 1769], at my home, in ʻAṭfat al-Ghassāl, in Cairo, may God Almighty protect it and all the lands of Islam."

record.title: 880-03 Asʼilat al-Qurʼān al-Majīd wa-ajwibatuhā : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr al-Rāzī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-kāmil, al-fāḍil al-ʻallāmah, muftī al-farīqayn, sayyid al-mufassirīn, baqīyat al-salaf, ustādh al-khalq, Zayn al-Millah wa-al-Dīn, ḥujjat al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr ibn ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Rāzī, mattaʻa Allāh al-Muslimīn bi-ṭūl ḥayātih: Hādhā mukhtaṣar jamaʻtu fīhi unmūdhajan yasīran min asʼilat al-Qurʼān al-Majīd wa-ajwibatihā, fa-minhu mā naqaltuhu min kutub al-ʻulamāʼ, illā annī naqqaḥtuhu wa-khallaṣtuhu, wa-minhu mā fataḥa Allāh taʻālá ʻalayya bi-hi, bi-sabab mudhākarat akh lī min ikhwān al-ṣafā fī dīn Allāh wa-maḥabbat Kitābihi ..."
Secundo folio: wa-ʻalayhi atawakkalu wa-ilayhi ataḍarraʻu.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 9 x 15.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In buckram binding, with dark brown leather on spine.
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; catchwords.
On folio 1a (in pencil): "Tafsīr baʻḍ āyāt min al-Qurʼān al-Karīm li-Abī Bakr al-Rāzī."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with the questions and answers relatied to Sūrat al-Kāfirūn (Chapter 109), as follows: "... wa-qāla al-Zamakhsharī mā yaruddu al-wajh al-thānī, wa-dhālika annahu qāla: Lā aʻbudu, urīda bi-hi al-ʻibādah fīmā yustaqbalu, li-anna 'Lā' lā tadkhulu illā ʻalá muḍāriʻ fī maʻná al-istiqbāl, kamā anna 'Mā' lā tadkhulu ʻalá muḍāriʻ fī maʻná al-ḥāl; fa-al-jumlatān al-ūlayān li-nafī al-ʻibādah fī al-istiqbāl ..."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ dībājat al-Miṣbāḥ : manuscript / Yaʻqūb ibn ʻAlī al-Burūsawī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī lā yablughu kunhahu jādd, ay, lā yaṣilu ilá taṣawwurihi bi-ḥaqīqatihi kull man yajiddu fī iktisābihi bi-ayy ṭarīq kāna, min al-naẓar wa-al-riyāḍah, wa-in waṣala ilá taṣawwurihi bi-wajh yumayyizuhu mā ʻadāhu. Wa-qīla 'ḥādd', bi-al-ḥāʼ al-muhmalah, ʻalá maʻná annahu lā yablughu kunhahu man atá bi-ḥaddihi, fa-laysa shayʼ, li-khulūwihi ʻan hādhihi al-fāʼidah, aʻnī al-ishārah ilá ʻadam al-wuṣūl bi-ayy ṭarīq kāna, ʻalá anna fīhi īhām jawāz al-taḥdīd bi-dūn al-bulūgh ilá al-kunh wa-huwa buṭʼ. Wa-lā yuḥṣī, ay, lā yaḍbiṭu ʻadad niʻamihi ʻādd. Wa-fī al-Kashshāf 'Wa-in taʻuddū niʻamahu lā tuḥṣūhā', ay, lā taḍbiṭū ʻadadahā. Ḥāra, ay, ṣāra mutaḥayyiran fī baḥr ʻirfānihi. Arwāḥ al-ʻālimīn, bi-kasr al-lām. Wa-nāra, ay, ṣāra mustanīran bi-anwār iḥsānih. Ashbāḥ, jamʻ shabaḥ. al-ʻĀlamīn, bi-fatḥ al-lām ..."
Secundo folio: Mukhtār al-Ṣiḥāḥ. al-Dībājatān, al-ḥaddān.

record.title: 880-01 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ Bānat Suʻād : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir wa-aʻin. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣalawātuhu wa-taslīmātuhu ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Hādhā, wa-qad qaṣadtu, arshadaka Allāh, iqtiṭāf shayʼ min al-zubad allatī imtakhaḍahā badīʻ zamānihi wa-waḥīd awānihi Shaykhunā al-Imām ḥujjat al-adab wa-tarjumān al-ʻArab, Abī Muḥammad Jamāl al-Dīn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Yūsuf ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Hishām al-Anṣārī, amtaʻa Allāh bi-baqāʼihi wa-adāma la-hu [ʻulū (?)] irtifāʻihi, min qaṣīdat ṣāḥib Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, Kaʻb ibn Zuhayr ibn Abī Sulmá, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, al-maʻrūfah bi-'Bānat Suʻād', ibtighāʼan li-tawaṣīlihā ilá al-mubtadiʼīn wa-naḥwihim, in kāna [al-kalām (?)] murtafiʻan ʻalá hādhā al-namaṭ min al-mutaʻallimīn, wa-kāna aḥsan mā yadullu ʻalá kalāmihi minhu, fa-sharaʻtu fī dhālika mutawakhkhiyan al-talkhīṣ wa-al-takhlīṣ, mufṣiḥan ʻammā aḍmarahu min alqāb al-iʻrāb bi-al-tanṣīṣ, mustajīban li-man wajabat ṭāʻatuhu wa-ʻammat barāʻatuhu, mustaʻīnan billāh subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, wa-Huwa khayr muʻīn. Qāla Kaʻb ibn Zuhayr ..."
Secundo folio: li-mā baʻdahu wa-huwa matbūlu.
13.5 x 18 cm; written surface: 9 x 13 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding, with dark brown leather on spine.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Bānat Suʻād" and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Fī shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat 896 [of the Hijrah = January/February 1491]. al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm [...]."
On folio 1a: A reader's statement: "Qad tasharrafa bi-al-naẓar fīhi al-faqīr ilayhi taʻālá Muḥammad al-ʻAlamī al-Ḥanafī, ʻufiya ʻanhu."

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā lakhkhaṣtuhu min kalām Shaykhinā, abqāhu Allāh taʻālá wa-raḍiya ʻanhu, tāratan bi-maʻná lafẓihi, wa-tāratan bi-ṣarīḥihi, wa-tāratan bi-ghayr dhālik, ḥattá lā yakīʻa al-mubtadī min al-naẓar fī kalāmihi, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, idhā tadarraba ʻalá hādhā al-qadr. Wa-min Allāh nastamiddu al-tawfīq ilá arshad ṭarīq. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what I summarized from the discourse of our Master, may God Almighty preserve him and be pleased with him, sometimes by paraphrasing his words, sometimes by his own words and sometimes by other means, so that the beginner will not be hindered from looking into his discourse, may God be pleased with him, if he were trained with this amount. It is from God that we derive guidance to the rightest course. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and his family and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 al-Isʻād ʻalá Bānat Suʻād : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Bājūrī.
record.note: Title from folio 2b: "... wa-sammaytuhā bi-al-Isʻād ʻalá Bānat Suʻād ..."
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī wa-rajāʼī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī anṭaqa Kaʻban bi-dhikr Suʻād tafāʼulan bi-hā, fa-fāza bi-al-isʻād, wa-sahhala ʻalayhi ṭarīq al-rashād, fa-jaʻalahu min asʻad al-ʻibād. Wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu, lā sharīka lah, shahādatan tunjī qāʼilahā min hawl Yawm al-Tanād. Wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, sayyid al-ʻabīd wa-al-asyād, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ulī al-tawfīq wa-al-sadād, alladhīna taʼayyadū fī maḥabbatihi, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-mazajūhā al-akbād. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-Karīm, ʻabduhu al-Bājūrī Ibrāhīm, lā zāla maḥfūfan bi-al-alṭāf wa-al-niʻam, wa-maḥfūẓan min al-āfāt wa-al-niqam: Iʻlam anna al-madḥ rās māl al-shāʻir alladhī yuʻawwilu ʻalayhi wa-maqṣaduhu alladhī yarjiʻu fī al-tawassul lil-umūr ilayhi ..."
Secundo folio: wa-yalūḥu ṣidquhu fa-atbaʻuhu.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 18 cm; 29 lines per page (in 4 unnumbered quires).
Binding: Unbound (in 4 unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: Miscellaneous quotations in poetry.
On folio 10b: A statement indicating that the manuscript was collated with the author's copy: "Balagha muqābalatan ʻalá nuskhat al-muʼallif."
Folios 37-38 are blank; text folios 1b-36b.

Colophon: "Tamma taḥrīr hādhihi al-ḥāshiyah al-sharīfah yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, fī shahr Shawwāl, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-arbaʻah wa-thalāthīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-azká al-taḥīyah. Wa-ghafara Allāh lanā wa-li-wālidaynā wa-mashāyikhinā wa-li-sāʼir al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. ʻAlá yad kātibihā, al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, Muḥammad al-Shirbīnī al-Minūfī ibn al-marḥūm al-Ḥājj Aḥmad ʻAṭā al-Minūfī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, kullamā dhakaraka al-dhākirūn wa-ghafila ʻan dhikrihi al-ghāfilūn."

Translation of the colophon: "This noble gloss was written on blessed Thursday [date not specified] in Shawwāl, of the year 1234 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [July/August, 1819], may the best prayer and the purest greeting be upon Him. May God pardon us, our parents, our teachers and all Muslims. Amen. Copied by the poor to God Almighty, Muḥammad al-Shirbīnī al-Minūfī ibn al-marḥūm al-Ḥājj Aḥmad ʻAṭā al-Minūfī al-Shāfiʻī, may God pardon him, his parents and all Muslims. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, whenever You are mentioned by those who remember, and whenever he is neglected to be remembered by the negligent."

record.title: 880-03 Maqṣūrat Ibn Durayd : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan ibn Durayd.
record.note: Title from colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yā ẓabyatan ashbaha shayʼin bi-al-mahā // rātiʻatan bayna al-ʻAqīqi wa-al-Liwá. Amā tará raʼsiya ḥāká lawnuhu // ṭrrata ṣubḥin taḥta adhyāli al-dujā ..."
Secundo folio: Wa-ḍarrama al-naʼyu al-mushittu jadhwatan.
15 x 20.7 cm; written surface: 11 x 17.5 cm; 6-9 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding with flap; dark brown leather on spine and flap; front cover missing.

In beautiful naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; folios 1, 2, 14 and 15 are replaced and written in a different hand; folios 3a to 13b have interlinear Persian translation, in red; some notes on the margins ; catchwords.

Maqṣūrat Ibn Durayd, starts with: "Yā ẓabyatan ashbaha shayʼin bi-al-mahā // rātiʻatan bayn al-ʻAqīqi fa-al-Liwá." It ends with: Aw an urá mukhtaḍiʻan li-nakbatin // aw li-ibtihājin faraḥan aw muzdahá."
Colophon: "Tammat Maqṣūrat Ibn Durayd. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdahu. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdahu, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The Maqṣurah of Ibn Durayd is completed. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on Him who no prophet comes after Him, and on his family and companions and grant them peace. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 Dīwān : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn Aḥmad al-Buraʻī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ikhtaṣṣa ḥabībahu al-asná bi-maqām qāb qawsayn aw adná, wa-qarana ismahu al-sharīf bi-aʻẓam asmāʼihi al-ḥusná, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lah, walī ʻibādih wa-ḥabīb ʻubbādihi, wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, wa-ḥabībuhu wa-ṣafīyuhu wa-khalīluh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi al-shurufā wa-aṣḥābihi al-khulafā, wa-ʻalá ālihi min al-anbiyāʼ, wa-man ittabaʻahu min al-awliyāʼ, wa-sallama ʻalayhim taslīman kathīran, raḥmatan min Allāh wa-takrīman. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā Dīwān laṭīf sharīf jāmiʻ li-mā qālahu al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Raḥīm al-Buraʻī min al-qaṣāʼid al-Nabawīyāt wa-ghayrihā, raḥimat Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi, wa-nafaʻanā bi-barakātihi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah bi-mannihi wa-karamihi. Āmīn."
Secundo folio: wa-kullamā lāḥa barq al-ghawri mubtasiman.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding with flap; central medallion on cover and flap (in 13 numbered quires).

In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the beginning of each poem starts with "Wa-qāla raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu" (He said, may God be pleased with him) in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
At the head of folio 1b: A decorative design in purple and black.
On folios 123a-124b: A love poem, by al-Buraʻī.
On folios 124b-128b: 37 pieces of "Mawwāl" (a form of popular folk poetry), by al-Buraʻī.
Folios 129-130 are blank; text folios 1b-128b.
Colophon: (folio 122b): "Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu [lillāh]. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "It is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence, entirely and completely. Praise [be to God]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Lāmīyat al-ʻArab : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Ḥusayn al-ʻUkbarī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Aqīmū banī ummī ṣudūra maṭīyikum // fa-innī ilá qawmin siwākum la-amyalu. al-Kalām fī hādhā al-bayt ʻalá thalāthat ashyāʼ: ʻAlá al-fāʼ, wa-ʻalá siwá, wa-ʻalá amyal ..."
Secundo folio: Wa-lī dūnakum ahlūna sīdun ʻamallasun.
14.5 x 19.3 cm; written surface: 9 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In dark blue cardboard.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some corrections on the margins; markings in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ Lāmīyat al-ʻArab, lil-Shaykh al-fāḍil al-kāmil, Abī al-Baqāʼ al-ʻUkabarī al-Miṣrī [sic.], raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn."
At the upper right margin of folio 1b: "Qāʼiluhā al-Shanfará al-Azdī."

"Lāmīyat al-ʻArab" starts with: "Aqīmū banī ummī ṣudūra maṭīyikum // fa-innī ilá qawmin siwākum la-amyalu. Fa-qad ḥummati al-ḥājātu wa-al-laylu muqmirun // wa-shuddat li-ṭīyātin maṭāyā wa-arḥulu ..." and ends with: Tanāmu idhā mā nāma yaqẓá ʻuyūnuhā // ḥithāthan ilá makrūhatin tataghalghalu."

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir al-qaṣīdah al-mawsūmah bi-Lāmīyat al-ʻArab. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh awwalan wa-ākhiran. Wa-qad nusikhat ʻalá nuskhah nusikhat fī Makkah al-Musharrafah, ḥarasahā Allāh taʻālá. ʻAllaqahā bi-yadihi li-nafsihi, jaʻala Allāh yawmahu khayran min amsihi, afqar al-wará ilayhi, subḥānuhu, Ibrāhīm ibn Maḥmūd, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-li-kull al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. ʻAshīyat thālith ʻĪd al-Aḍḥá, sanat alf wāḥid wa-tisʻīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of the poem titled 'Lāmīyat al-ʻArab'. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and companions and grant them peace. Praise be to God, in the beginning and at the end. Copied from a copy written in Makkah al-Musharrafah, may God Almighty protect it, on the eve of the third day of 'ʻĪd al-Aḍḥá' of the year 1091 [of the Hijrah; i.e., 12 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 1091 = Friday, 3 January, 1681], by the hand of the poorest of mankind to God, may He be glorified, Ibrāhīm ibn Maḥmūd, may God render his day better than his yesterday, for himself, may God forgive him, his parents, his teachers and all Muslims entirely. Amen."

record.title: Eugene Griswold ledger : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.

record.title: Way Bills Sent from Columbia Office of Wells, Fargo & Co. : manuscript.
record.note: Title from title page.

record.title: 880-03 Dīwān al-Waʼwāʼ al-Dimashqī : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Waʼwāʼ al-Dimashqī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir. Yā Karīm. Qāla Abū al-Faraj Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Waʼwāʼ al-Dimashqī al-Ghassānī yamdaḥu al-Sharīf al-ʻAqīqī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn. Yā Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Taẓallama al-wardu min khaddayhi idh ẓulimā // wa-ʻallama al-suqmu min ajfānihi al-saqamā. Wa-lam arid bi-liḥāẓī māʼa nāẓirihi // illā saqā nāẓirī min rīyihi bi-ẓamā ..."
Secundo folio: Tamalmalat suḥbuhu min ṭūli mā suḥibat.
13.3 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 15 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding, cover embossed with gold central medallion and tooled with triple gold frame.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes on the margins; text within red frames; the text on folios 1b-2a framed in black and gold; catchwords.

On folio 1a: A reader's note dated 28 Ṣafar, 1232 (17 January 1817): "Naẓara fīhi al-faqīr al-Sayyid Muḥammad ibn Salīm al-Maḥāsinī fī ghurrat Ṣafar 28, fī al-ghurfah alladhī kāna fīhi al-Shaykh Ismāʻīl al-Kayyālī 1232, ʻufiya ʻanhumā."
On folio 1a: A reader's note: "Ṭālaʻa fīhi al-faqīr ilayhi ʻazz shaʼnuhu Sulaymān ibn Aḥmad al-Maḥāsinī, ghufira lahumā."

On folio 1a: Ownership statements, as follows: 1. "al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-munʻim. Thumma malakahu awlād al-marḥūm Muḥammad Saʻīd al-Maḥāsinī, wa-hum: al-Faqīr ʻAbd Allāh, wa-Aḥmad, wa-Asʻad, wa-ʻAlī, wa-Ḥasan, wa-Ḥusayn, Ghuhfira lahum. Āmīn. Sanat 1168 [lil-Hijrah = 1754/1755]." 2. "Dakhala fī mulk al-faqīr Rajab ibn [...]. al-Thaman ghurūsh, siʻruhu [...]. 1085 [lil-Hijrah = 1674/1675].". 3. "Thumma ṣāra min kutub al-ʻabd al-faqīr Fatḥ Allāh al-Rādiʻī [al-Barādiʻī (?), ghafara Allāh dhunūbahu. Āmīn.". 4. "Thumma ṣāra min kutub al-ʻabd al-faqīr Aḥmad al-Maḥāsinī, ghafara [Allāh] la-hu bi-mannihi. sanat 1139 [lil-Hijrah = 1726/1727]." 5. "Dakhala fī mulk al-faqīr Muḥammad Salīm al-Maḥāsinī ibn al-marḥūm Muḥammad Asʻad al-Maḥāsinī fī 5 Ramaḍān, 1232 [19 July 1817]." 6. "al-Ḥamdu lillāh taʻālá. Thumma ṣāra min kutub al-ʻabd al-faqīr Muḥammad Saʻīd ibn Aḥmad ibn Sulaymān." 7. "Thumma malakahu al-ʻabd al-faqīr Muḥammad al-Maḥāsinī, ghufira la-hu."
On folio 1a: Five verses of poetry praising al-Shaykh Rajab al-Ḥarīrī."
On folio 1a: "Abū al-Faraj. Hādhā Dīwān al-Waʼwāʼ al-Dimashqī."
On folio 35a: Two pieces of "Mawāliyā" (a form of popular folk poetry) by al-ʻInāyātī (probably the poet: Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad al-ʻInāyātī, 1525 or 1526-1605 or 1606).
On folio 35b-36a: Miscellaneous selections from the poets: Abū Nuwās, Ibn al-Muʻtazz, Nafṭawayh, Ibn Wakīʻ, Ṣarīʻ al-Ghawānī, Dīk al-Jinn, Kushājim.

On folio 36a: Five verses of poetry "li-Mawlānā ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-ʻImādī [probably: ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-ʻImādī, 1570 or 1571-1641 or 1642, the Muftī of Damascus]. Katabahu al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr [...] fī 25 Muḥarram, sanat 1087 [9 April 1676]."
On folio 36b: An invocation.
On folios 37a-37b: Miscellaneous quotations in poetry.
On folio 37b: Five verses of poetry: "Katabahu ʻabduhu al-faqīr [... ... ...] fī 19 shahr Muḥarram, sanat 1087 [3 April 1676].
On folio 37b: An ownership statement: "Min kutub al-faqīr Muḥammad Saʻīd al-Maḥāsinī."
On folio 37b: A reader's statement: "Naẓara fīhi al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Aḥmad ibn Darwīsh al-Zurbābī, qaraʼahu fī ghāyat mā yakūnu min al-kamāl."

Colophon (folio 34b): "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihi yawm al-thāmin wa-al-ʻishrīn min shahr Shawwāl al-mubārak min shuhūr sanat khams wa-khamsīn wa-alf, ʻalá yad faqīr ʻafw Rabbihi al-jamīl, Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl, khādim Ḥaḍrat Nabī Allāh Yaḥyá."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed on the 28th of the blessed month of Shawwāl, of the year 1055 [of the Hijrah = 17 December 1645], by the poor, who is in need of the gracious forgiveness of his Lord, Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl, the custodian of [the shrine of] the Prophet of God, Ḥaḍrat Yaḥyá [John the Babtist]."

record.title: 880-03 Dīwān Ibn Sanjar : manuscript / ʻĪsá ibn Sanjar al-Ḥājirī.
record.note: Title of Dīwān Ibn Sanjar supplied by cataloger.
Title of Dīwān Ibn al-Nabīh supplied by cataloger.
Title of Fatwá and rebuttal supplied by cataloger.
Title of Panegyrical poem supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Dīwān Ibn Sanjar: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir. al-Ḥamdu lillāh jāʻil al-lisān tarjumān qalb al-insān, wa-mufaḍḍiluhu bi-al-ʻaql wa-al-bayān ʻalá sāʼir al-ḥayawān. Aḥmaduhu ḥamda muʻtarif bi-ālāʼih, wa-uṣallī ʻalá Muḥammad khayr anbiyāʼih ṣalātan lā tablá jiddatuhā wa-lā tataghayyaru ʻalá madá al-azmān bahjatuhā. Yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Allāh al-ghanī bi-hi, al-mutawakkil ʻalayhi, ʻUmar ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻUmar ibn al-Ḥasan ibn Khūjā ʻAlī al-Fārisī: Ammā baʻd, fa-inna al-adab ajmal mā iltaḥafathu al-himmah, wa-ʻarafathu hādhihi al-ummah, wa-al-shiʻr min aʻlá marātibihi wa-ajmal madhāhibihi, li-takhlīdihi maḥāsin al-maʻālī, wa-ilḥāqihi al-khāmil al-munkhafiḍ bi-al-nabīh al-ʻālī ..."
Secundo folio of Dīwān Ibn Sanjar: bi-al-Ḥājirī taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih.

Incipit of of Dīwān Ibn al-Nabīh: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī baththa arwāḥ al-ʻuqūl fī ajsād al-ṣuwar, wa-ʻammara al-basīṭah bi-anwāʻ al-ḥayawān, wa-ikhtaṣṣa minhā bi-al-nuṭq al-bashar, khalaqa al-insān, ʻallamahu al-bayān, wa-aẓhara asrāra ḥukmihi bi-wāsiṭat fahmihi, wa-jaʻala badāʼiʻ ṣanʻatihi maydānan li-jawalān sawābiq ʻilmihi, fa-istakhlaṣa al-insān li-ʻibādatihi wa-shukrih ..."
Secundo folio of Dīwān Ibn al-Nabīh: al-Ghanī lā yarḍá li-ʻibādihi al-kufr.

Incipit of Fatwá and rebuttal: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh mulhim al-ṣawāb, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá man ūtiya al-ḥikmah wa-faṣl al-khiṭāb, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-al-aṣḥāb, ṣalātan dāʼimah ilá Yawm al-Ḥisāb. Wa-baʻd, fa-al-dāʻī ilá raqm hādhihi al-ḥurūf wa-taḥrīrihā, wa-al-bāʻith ʻalá kitābatihā wa-tasṭīrihā, qaḍīyah juzʼīyah, laysat min al-qaḍāyā al-kullīyah, wa-lā mushkilah khafīyah, bal hiya wāqiʻat ḥāl, kutiba fīhā suʼāl, mulakhkhaṣuhā anna insānan qurrira ʻalayhi nafaqah li-zawjatihi wa-awlādih, thumma qaṣada an yuwazziʻa al-nafaqah ʻalá kull minhum ʻalá ḥidah, wa-an yaḍumma awlādahu ilayhi, fa-ujība ilá murādih ..."
Secundo folio of Fatwá and rebuttal: ḥatfihi bi-ẓilfihi, wa-hākadhā daʼb ahl al-ḥamāqah.

Incipit of the panegyrical poem by Bahāʼ al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Ḥusayn al-ʻĀmilī: "Qāla al-Shaykh Bahāʼ al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn al-Mawlá Ḥusayn ibn ʻAbd al-Ṣamad al-ʻĀmilī al-Ḥārithī yamdaḥu Shaykh al-ʻaṣr, al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Bakrī al-Ṣiddīqī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhumā: Yā Miṣru suqyan laki min jannatin // quṭūfuhā yāniʻatun dāniyah. Turābuhā ka-al-tibri fī luṭfihi // wa-māʼuhā ka-al-fiḍḍati al-khāliṣah ..."
Secundo folio of the panegyrical poem by Bahāʼ al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Ḥusayn al-ʻĀmilī: Fa-in kunta taḥsubunī minhumu.
15 x 21.3 cm; written surface: varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: In cardboard binding with flap; dark brown leather on spine and flap.
In large and fast naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords.
On the leaf pasted to the back of the front cover and on the preliminary leaf: Miscellaneous quotations.
On the preliminary leaf: A reader's statement: "Ṭālaʻa [wa-]naẓara fī hādhā al-majmūʻ Muḥammad al-Tarābulusī, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhu."
On folio 1a: "Dīwān al-Amīr Ḥusām al-Dīn ʻĪsá ibn Sanjr ibn Bahrām al-Irbilī al-Ḥājirī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Wa-yalīhi ayḍan Dīwān Kamāl al-Dīn ibn al-Nabīh, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá."

On folio 1a: Two statements by an owner/copyist : 1. "Min kutub man katab al-Hurayrī min Ḥalab." 2. "Min manni man manna bi-hi // mina al-nawāli al-arḥabi. ʻAlá faqīri ʻafwihi // al-Shamsī al-Hurayrī al-Ḥalabī."

On folio 1a: An owner's statement: "Sāqahu sāʼiq al-qadar ilá silk mulk al-ʻabd al-ʻājiz al-fānī, ʻUmar ibn al-marḥūm al-Ḥājj Barāhīm [Ibrāhīm] Zaytūn, ghafara Allāh taʻālá dhunūbahumā wa-satara fī al-dārayn ʻuyūbahumā, bi-al-shirāʼ al-sharʻī, wa-dhālika fī awāʼil shahr Ṣafar al-khayr, min sanat ithnayn wa-sittīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf [1262 of the Hijrah = 29 January 1846]. Bi-thaman 6."
Folios 48-50 are blank.
On folio 51a: "Dīwān al-Qāḍī Kamāl al-Dīn Abī al-Ḥasan ʻAlī ibn al-Nabīh, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, wa-raḥima amwāt al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn."

On folio 51a: Two statements by an owner/copyist : 1. "Min kutub man katab al-Hurayrī min Ḥalab." 2. "Min manni man manna bi-hi // mina al-nawāli al-arḥabi. ʻAlá faqīri ʻafwihi // al-Shamsī al-Hurayrī al-Ḥalabī."
Folios 120b-124b are blank.
On folio 125a: Four verses of poetry.

On the left margin of folio 126a, the copyist quoted two verses of poetry by Fatḥ Allāh al-Baylūnī al-Ḥalabī (Fatḥ Allāh ibn Maḥmūd al-Baylūnī, 1570-1632), and two verses by another poet whose name could be read.

On folio 126b: A reader's statement (not the copyist/owner, al-Hurayrī): "Atá ʻalá mā fīhi kitābatan< rājī luṭf Allāh taʻālá al-khafī al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr Ramaḍān ibn Mūsá al-ʻUṭayfī al-Ḥanafī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. [Written and transcribed by him who hopes for the hidden graciousness of God Almighty, the poor and despised, Ramaḍān ibn Mūsá al-ʻUṭayfī al-Ḥanafī, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. Amen.]"
Colophon of Dīwān Ibn Sanjar: No colophon.

Colophon of Dīwān Ibn al-Nabīh: "Tamma al-Dīwān al-Nabīhī bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi, ʻalá yad kātibihi al-Darwīsh Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Hurayrī, raḥima Allāh man taraḥḥama ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Fī al-ʻushr al-awwal min Jumādá al-Ūlá, sanat sitt wa-ʻishrīn wa-alf Hijrīyah, ʻalá Muhājirihā alf alf taḥīyah."

Translation of the colophon of Dīwān Ibn al-Nabīh: "The Dīwān [Collected poems] of Ibn al-Nabīh is completed by the praise of God Almighty, His help and His abundant benevolence, by the hand of its copyist al-Darwīsh [the Dervish] Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Hurayrī, may God have mercy upon him who invokes God's mercy upon him [the copyist], and upon the Muslims. Amen. Dated on the first tenth of Jumādá al-Ūlá, of the year 1026 of the Hijrah [7-9 May 1617], may thousand thousand greetings be upon Him."

Colophon of Fatwá and rebuttal: "Wa-nasʼalu Allāh al-sadād wa-al-hidāyah ilá ṭarīq al-rashād. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, man lā nabī baʻdah. Qāla dhālika wa-katabahu faqīr ʻafw Allāh al-matīn, Muḥibb al-Dīn ibn Taqī al-Dīn al-Ḥamawī al-Ḥanafī, ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-luṭfihi al-khafī. Āmīn. Wa-min khaṭṭ [khaṭṭihi] naqalahu rāqimuhu al-Hurayrī."

Translation of the colophon of Fatwá and rebuttal: "We invoke God to lead us unto the right path, and direct us unto the guided course. Praise be to God. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, who no prophet comes after him. This is said and written by the poor to the firm forgiveness of God, Muḥibb al-Dīn ibn Taqī al-Dīn al-Ḥamawī al-Ḥanafī, may God treat him according to His hidden graciousness. Amen. It is from his handwriting [i.e., al-Ḥamawī's] that al-Hurayrī transcribed this copy."

Colophon of the panegyrical poem by Bahāʼ al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Ḥusayn al-ʻĀmilī: No colophon. The poem ends with: Lā zāla ḥussāduka fī dhillatin // wa-muqlatin dāmiyatin dāmiʻah. Wa-lā baraḥta al-dahra fī ʻizzatin // wa-niʻmatin wāsiʻatin ḍāfiyah."

record.title: 880-02 al-ʻArf al-nadī fī sharḥ Qaṣīdat Ibn al-Wardī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Ghamrī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 2a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-ʻawn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī nasaja fī al-azal thiqat al-naṣīḥah bi-iʻtizāl dhikr al-aghānī wa-al-ghazal, wa-nasaja naṣāʼiḥ al-niḥal wa-al-milal bi-ṣāliḥ al-aʻmāl fī al-qawl wa-al-ʻamal, wa-waṣafa bi-al-nuṣḥ baʻḍ anbiyāʼihi al-mursalīn, fa-qāla ḥikāyatan ʻanhu: 'Wa-anā lakum nāṣiḥun amīn', fa-jadīrun bi-hādhā al-waṣf sharafan an yakūna sharaf al-shams fī dāʼirat al-ḥamal, wa-sharaf al-qamar idhā tawassaṭa khaṭṭ al-samāʼ wa-iʻtadal, qawluhu al-ḥaqq, wa-lā ḥujjah li-man ʻadhal, wa-la-hu al-khalq wa-al-sabq lil-jidāl wa-al-jadal ... Wa-baʻd, fa-inna 'al-Qaṣīdah al-Wardīyah al-Lāmīyah' al-manẓūmah min baḥr al-ramal, wa-waznuhu: fāʻilātun fāʻilātun fāʻilun, marratayn, al-musammāh bi-Naṣīḥat al-ikhwān wa-murshidat al-khillān, wa-hiya khamsah wa-sabʻūn baytan, wa-fī baʻḍ al-nusakh sabʻah wa-sabʻūn baytan, maʻa ṣighar ḥajmihā wa-ghazārat ʻilmihā, ḥawat min al-mawāʻiẓ wa-al-ādāb mā lā yuḥīṭu bi-hi kitāb ... wa-sammaytuhu 'al-ʻArf al-nadī fī sharḥ Qaṣīdat Ibn al-Wardī ..."
Secundo folio: baytan maʻa ṣighar ḥajmihā.
14.2 x 19.7 cm; written surface: 9 x 15 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In green buckram binding, with dark leather on spine (in 8 numbered quires).

In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of the poem of Ibn al-Wardī "Naṣīḥat al-ikhwān wa-murshidat al-khillān" in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-ʻArf al-nadī fī sharḥ Qaṣīdat Ibn al-Wardī, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Ghamrī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-ʻulūmihi. Āmīn. Āmīn."
At the upper left corner of folio 1a: An ownership/copying statement: "Mulk kātibihi al-faqīr Saʻīd al-Safārīnī al-Ḥanbalī."

The poem of Ibn al-Wardī "Naṣīḥat al-ikhwān wa-murshidat al-khillān" starts with: "Iʻtazil dhikr al-aghānī wa-al-ghazal // wa-qul al-faṣla wa-jānib man hazal", and ends with: "Wa-ʻalá al-āli al-kirāmi al-suʻadā // wa-ʻalá al-aṣḥābi wa-al-qawmi al-uwal. Mā nawá al-rakbu bi-ʻushshāqin ilá // abyuti al-ḥayyi wa-mā ghanná ramal."

Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu, raḥimahu Allāh: 'Faraghtu min taʼlīfihi yawm al-Jumʻah, khāmis Rabīʻ al-Thānī, sanat thalāthīn wa-alf. Wa-wāfaqa al-farāgh min dhālik yawm al-Ithnayn, li-sittah baqīna min shahr Dhī al-Qaʻdah, sanat 1226, alf wa-miʼatayn wa-sittah wa-ʻishrīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá yad al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, al-rājī ʻafwa Mawlāhu al-qadīr, Saʻīd ibn Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd ibn <ibn> al-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Muḥammad al-Safārīnī al-Ḥanbalī, raḥimahu Allāh raḥmatan wāsiʻah. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Its author, may God have mercy upon him, said: I finished authoring it on Friday, the fifth of Rabīʻ al-Thānī, of the year 1030 [of the Hijrah = 27 February 1621]. Copied on Monday, six nights remaining from the month of Dhū al-Qaʻdah, of the year 1226 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [Monday, 9 December 1811], may the best prayer, peace and greeting be upon Him, by the hand of the poor, who confesses his shortcoming and inadequacy, and aspires for the forgiveness of his Mighty Lord, Saʻīd ibn Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd ibn <ibn> al-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Muḥammad al-Safārīnī al-Ḥanbalī, may God have abundant mercy upon him. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Qaṭr al-nabātayn : manuscript / Taqī al-Dīn Abū Bakr ibn ʻAlī ibn Ḥijjah al-Ḥamawī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 3a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Kitāb Qaṭr al-nabātayn. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla Shaykhunā, fāḍil hādhā al-ʻaṣr wa-qāḍīhi, al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻallāmah, malik al-mutaʼaddibīn, Abū al-Manāqib, Taqī al-Dīn. Abū Bakr ibn Ḥijjah al-Ḥamawī al-Ḥanafī, munshiʼ Dawāwīn al-Inshāʼ al-sharīf bi-al-diyār al-Miṣrīyah wa-al-mamālik al-Islāmīyah, nawwara Allāh taʻālá maṭāliʻ khawāṭirih bi-shumūs al-adab wa-zawāhirih: Ammā baʻd ḥamd Allāh alladhī tanazzaha kalāmuhu ʻan muʻāriḍ wa-munāẓir, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Nabīyihi alladhī anzala al-Qurʼān fī madḥihi, fa-aḥjama ʻinda dhālik kull shāʻir, fa-inna al-Shaykh al-Imām al-qudwah al-ʻallāmah Abā ʻAbd Allāh Jamāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Nubātah al-Miṣrī, abqā Allāh taʻālá nabātahu wa-raʻāh, wa-mattaʻa ahl al-dhawq al-salīm bi-ḥalāwat dhālika al-nabāt al-ḥasan wa-janāh, in taʼakhkhara fī al-sabq ʻan fuḥūl al-mutaqaddimīn ʻaṣran fa-qad taqaddma ʻalayhim bi-badīʻihi wa-gharībihi bayānan wa-siḥran ..."
Secundo folio: wa-kayfa taṣbiru ʻalá mā lam tuḥiṭ bi-hi khabaran.
13 x 17.5 cm; written surface: 11 x 15 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap (in 8 numbered quires).
In beautiful naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red and green; markings in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Dakhala fī mulk al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Maḥārī [?], ʻufiya ʻanhumā fī shahr Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, sanat 1086 [June/July 1675]." 2. "Fī nawbat al-faqīr Aḥmad [...], ʻufiya ʻanhu. 15."
On folio 1a: "Dīwān Ibn Nubātah wa-Ibn Ḥijjah al-Ḥamawī."

The play on words in the title of the work "Qaṭr al-nabātayn" is seen in this quotation from folio 3a: "... wa-lammā taḥaqqatu anna 'al-nabāt al-Ḥamawī' la-hu bi-al-diyār al-Miṣrīyah qīmah, sammaytu mā jamaʻtuhu hunā min naẓmī wa-naẓm Ibn Nubātah 'Qaṭr al-nabātayn', li-yaṣīra lil-'Qaṭr al-Nubātī' tathniyah bi-'Qaṭr al-nabāt al-Ḥamawī', wa-tataḥallá al-adhwāq al-salīmah bi-dhikr al-ṣifātayn [al-ṣifatayn] ..."
At the end of the text (folio 71b): A reader's statement: "Ṭālaʻa fīhi wa-daʻā li-mālikih bi-al-baqāʼ al-ʻabd ʻAlāʼ al-Fakhrī, laṭafa Allāh bi-hi."
On folios 72a-72b: Miscellaneous quotations in a different hand.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with: "... wa-lawlā khishyat al-iṭālah la-awradtu maḥāsin taqārīẓihim hunā, lākinna al-ijmāʻ ʻalá anna Abā Bakr huwa al-muqaddam wa-khulāṣat hādhā al-ʻiqd al-munaẓẓam. Wa-lillāh al-ḥamd wa-al-minnah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-ṭayyibīn al-ṭāhirīn wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn. M."

record.title: 880-02 al-Mukhtaṣar al-shāfī ʻalá matn al-Kāfī : manuscript / Muḥammad al-Damanhūrī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-ʻawn. Ḥamdan li-man sharrafanā bi-man huwa Sayyid al-kāmilīn, wa-anzala ʻalayhi fī wāfir al-Kitāb al-Mubīn: 'Wa-mā ʻallamnāhu al-shiʻra, wa-mā yanbaghī la-hu, in huwa illā dhikrun wa-Qurʼānun mubīn'. Wa-ṣalātan wa-salāman ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi al-fāʼizīn al-muṭahharīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr Muḥammad al-Ḥudaynī al-Damanhūrī: Innī qad kuntu waḍaʻtu ḥāshiyah ʻalá matn al-Kāfī, wa-jamaʻtu fīhā mā yusirru dhawī al-ʻuqūl, fa-hiya ḥarīyah bi-an yataʻāṭāhā al-mukhliṣūn bi-al-qabūl, thumma innahu ʻanna lī an akhtaṣira minhā lil-mubtadiʼīn kalimāt tuʻīnuhum ʻalá fahm maʻnāhu al-wāfī, yastaʻīnūna bi-hi ʻalá taṣḥīḥ kalām al-shuʻarāʼ, bi-ʻawn al-Qādir al-Kāfī, wa-li-dhā sammaytuhā 'al-Mukhtaṣar al-shāfī ʻalá matn al-Kāfī ..."
Secundo folio: bi-maḥdhūf khabar thānin ʻan al-shukr.
16.3 x 22.7 cm; written surface: 10 x 17.5 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 4 unnumbered quires).

In clear naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; some phrases of al-Kāfī preceded by the word "qawluhu" (his saying) in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; markings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Ḥāshiyat al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, Shaykhunā al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Damanhūrī ʻalá matn al-Kāfī fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qawāfī. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-sallam."
On folios 34b-35b: Two different lists of the sixteen classical meters of Arabic poetry with verses of poetry to help memorizing them.
Folio 36 is blank.

Colophon: "Ilá hunā waqafat al-aqlām, fa-nasʼalu Allāh al-ʻafwa ʻan zallat al-aqdām, bi-jāh Sayyidinā Muḥammad, khayr al-anām, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-kirām, wa-man tabiʻahum bi-īmān ilá al-khitām. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min al-ḥawāshī al-mukhtaṣarah fī shahr Dhī al-Ḥijjah, sanat 1230 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah fī ʻishrīn shahr Dhī al-Ḥijjah, sanat 1266, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād ilá Allāh taʻālá, Ṣāliḥ Ḥusayn Abū al-ʻAṭā, al-mujāwir bi-al-Azhar, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-lil-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, wa-al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-amwāt. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi, wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "Herein the pens stopped; we implore God's forgiveness for the slip of the feet, by the high status/intercession of our Master Muḥammad, the best of mankind, his noble family and companions, and those who followed them faithfully until the end. These abridged glosses were concluded in the month of Dhū al-Ḥijjah, of the year 1230 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [November/December 1815], may the best prayer and peace be upon Him. This blessed copy was completed on 20 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, of the year 1266 [of the Hijrah = 27 October 1850], by the hand of the poorest of the servants to God Almighty, Ṣāliḥ Ḥusayn Abū al-ʻAṭā, "al-mujāwir" at al-Azhar [i.e., a student/scholar living in the vicinity of the Mosque], may God forgive him, his parents, the Muslim men and women, the believers, men and women, the living among them and the dead. O Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 al-Aḍwāʼ al-bahijah fī ibrāz daqāʼiq al-Munfarijah : manuscript / Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a: "... wa-sammaytuhu bi-al-Aḍwāʼ al-bahijah fī ibrāz daqāʼiq al-Munfarijah."
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla Sayyidunā wa-Mawlānā al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-humām, al-ʻālim al-kāmil wa-al-awḥad al-fāḍil, Shaykh al-ṭarīqah wa-maʻdin al-faḍl wa-al-ḥaqīqah ... Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-askanahu fasīḥ jannatih, wa-nafaʻanā wa-al-Muslimīn bi-barakatih: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-mufarrij lil-karab ʻaqiba al-shiddah, al-munjī li-khullaṣ ʻibādihi min ghayāhib al-ẓulam al-muʻaddah, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyid al-Anām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-ghurr al-kirām. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā mā ishtaddat ilayhi ḥājat al-mutafahhimīn lil-Munfarijah, qaṣidat al-Imām al-ʻallāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá, al-rabbānī, Abī al-faḍl Yūsuf ibn Muḥammad ibn Abī Yūsuf al-Tawzarī al-aṣl, al-maʻrūf bi-Ibn al-Naḥwī, ʻalá mā qālahu al-ʻAllāmah Abū al-ʻAbbās Aḥmad ibn Abī Zayd al-Bajāʼī, shāriḥuhā ..."
Secundo folio: shāriḥuhā, aw, Abī ʻAbd Allāh.
14.5 x 20 cm; written surface: 9 x 15.5 cm; 19-25 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding with black buckram on spine and the four corners.

In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; with the phrases of "al-Munfarijah" in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; many wormholes on the margins with some loss of text; the last two leaves are written in a different hand in good naskh/ruqʻah script; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb al-Aḍwāʼ al-bahijah fī ibrāz daqāʼiq al-Munfarijah, li-Shaykh al-Islām, ilkh." "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Munfarijah li-Shaykh al-Islām Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī."
al-Munfarijah starts with: Ishtaddī azmatu tanfarijī // qad ādhana layluki bi-al-balaji. It ends with: Wa-idhā bika ḍāqa al-amru fa-qul // Ishtadī azmatu tanfarijī.

Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Tamma al-sharḥ bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ʻawnihi fī ḥādī ʻashar Dhī al-Ḥijjah al-ḥarām, khitām sanat 881, thamāniyah wāḥid wa-thamānīn. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ashraf khalqihi, Muḥammad, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih, kullamā dhakarahu al-dhākirūn wa-ghafila ʻan dhikrihi al-ghāfilūn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "Its author, may God Almighty have mercy upon him, said: The commentary is completed by the praise of God Almighty and His help, on 11 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, the end of the year 881 [of the Hijrah = 5 April, 1477]. May prayer and peace be upon the most noble of His [God's] creation, Muḥammad, his family and his companions, whenever he is mentioned by those who remember him, and whenever he is neglected to be mentioned by those who neglect to remember him. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-03 al-Qaṣīdah al-Hamzīyah fī madḥ Khayr al-Barīyah : manuscript / Sharaf al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd al-Būṣīrī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Kayfa tarqá ruqīyaka al-anbiyāʼu // yā samāʼan mā ṭāwalathā samāʼu ..."
Secundo folio: Wa-ghadā kullu bayti nārin wa-fīhi.
15 x 21 cm; written surface: 9 x 14.5 cm; 15-17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In beautiful naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi qaṣidat al-Hamzīyah lil-ʻārif al-muḥaqqiq Muḥammad al-Abūṣīrī, raḥima Allāh dawḥahu wa-nawwara ṣarḥahu. Āmīn. M."

On folio 1a: A panegyrical poem, in eleven verses, praising the Prophet Muḥammad, by an anonymous author. It starts with: "Li-baʻḍihim. Aqrabu al-nāsi manzilan wa-maḥallan // min ḥabīb al-qulūbi Yawma al-Qiyāmah ..." And ends with: "... Wa-waṣaltum fa-ballighūhu salāmī // ayyada Allāhu rakbakum bi-al-salāmah."
"al-Hamzīyah" of al-Būṣīrī starts with: Kayfa tarqá ruqīyaka al-anbiyāʼu // yā samāʼan mā ṭāwalathā samāʼu. It ends with: Mā aqāma al-ṣalāta man ʻabada Allāha wa-qāmat bi-Rabbihā al-ashyāʼu.
Colophon: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi. Āmīn."
Translation of the colophon: "It is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
record.note: Title from folio 4b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ikhtaṣṣa Nabīyanā Muḥammadan, ṣallá Allāh [ʻalayhi] wa-sallam, bi-Kitāb akhrasa al-fuṣaḥāʼ wa-aʻjaza al-bulaghāʼ ʻan al-tafawwuh bi-mithl aqṣar sūrah min suwarih, bal āyah min āyātih, wa-bi-jawāmiʻ al-kalim, wa-badāʼiʻ al-ḥikam, wa-ʻaẓīm al-khulq fī sāʼir aqwālih wa-afʻālih wa-ḥālātih, wa-kharaqa la-hu khawāriq al-wujūd bi-muʻjizāt abharat al-ʻuqūl, wa-qaṣurat ʻan iḥṣāʼihā astiqṣāʼ al-mādiḥīn li-siyarihi wa-āyātih ..."
Secundo folio: al-nās fī hādhihi al-funūn.
17 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 15 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in six numbered quires).
In fair naskh script/ruqʻah, in black ink, on white paper; with the verses of al-Hamzīyah of al-Būṣīrī in red; markings in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Ibn Ḥajar. Kitāb al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-ʻumdah al-fahhāmah, khātimat al-muḥaqqiqīn, al-Shaykh Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Ḥajar, ʻālim Makkah, taghammadahu Allāh taʻālá bi-raḥmatih wa-ruḍwānih. Āmīn."

On folio 4b: "... wa-sammaytuhu 'al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah', thumma balaghanī anna al-nāẓim sammāhā 'Umm al-Qurá', tashbīhan la-hā bi-Makkah, bi-jāmiʻ annahā iḥtawat bi-ṭarīq al-taṣrīḥ, aw, al-īmāʼ, ʻalá mā fī akthar al-madāʼiḥ al-Nabawīyah, wa-ḥīnaʼidhin sammaytuhu 'Afḍal al-qirā li-qurrāʼ Umm al-Qurá' ..."
"al-Hamzīyah" of al-Būṣīrī starts with: Kayfa tarqá ruqīyaka al-anbiyāʼu // yā samāʼan mā ṭāwalathā samāʼu. It ends with: Mā aqāma al-ṣalāta man ʻabada Allāha wa-qāmat bi-Rabbihā al-ashyāʼu.

Colophon: No colophon. The text ends abruptly with the commentary on verse 46 (Wa-idhā ḥallati al-hidāyatu qalban // nashaṭat lil-ʻibādati al-aʻḍāʼu), as follows: "... Jāʼa Aʻrābī ilá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, fa-qāl: Yā Rasūl Allāh, ataynāka wa-mā lanā ṣabī yaghiṭṭ wa-lā baʻīr yaʼiṭṭ, ay, mā lanā baʻīr aṣlan, li-annahu idhā wujid lā budda an yaʼiṭṭ. Fa-qāma, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, yajurru ridāʼahu ḥattá ṣaʻida al-minbar, fa-rafaʻa yadayhi ilá al-samāʼ wa-daʻā, fa-mā radda yadahu ilá naḥrihi ḥattá iltaqat al-samāʼ bi-abrāqihā, wa-ʻādū yaḍḥakūn, fa-ḍaḥika Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, ḥattá badat nawājidhuhu, thumma qāl: 'Lillāh darr Abī Ṭālib, law kāna ḥayyan la-qarrat ʻaynāhu. Man yunshidunā qawluhu?' Fa-qāla ʻAlī, karrama Allāh ..."

record.title: 880-03 al-Kāfī fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qawāfī : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbbād al-Khawwāṣ.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāhi ʻalá al-inʻām, wa-al-shukru la-hu ʻalá al-ilhām, a-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khayr al-anām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-sādah al-aʻlām. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā taʼlīf kāfī fī ʻilamay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qawāfī. Wa-Allāh al-muwaffiq, wa-ʻalayhi al-tawakkul. al-Awwal: Fīhi muqaddimah wa-bābān wa-khātimah. Fa-al-muqaddimah fī ashyāʼ lā budda minhā: Aḥruf al-taqṭīʻ allatī tatʼallafu minhā al-ajzāʼ al-ʻashrah, yajmaʻuhā qawluka 'Lamaʻat suyūfunā' ..."
Secundo folio: wa-ʻarūḍuhā wāḥidah ṣaḥīḥah.
15.2 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 14.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Matn al-Kāfī fī ʻilamay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qawāfī."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Min kutub al-faqīr Aḥmad [...] al-Shāfiʻī."
On folio 1a: Miscellaneous quotations in poetry.

Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu: Hādhā ākhir mā awradnā jamʻuhu; fa-lillāh al-ḥamd awwalan wa-ākhiran, sitran wa-ʻalāniyatan. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn, bi-Raḥmatika, Yā Arḥam al-Rāḥimīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Nammaqahu ʻabd [al-ʻabd] al-ḍaʻīf Muḥammad al-Kharbūtī, fī shahr al-Malāṭiyah [Malāṭiyah], sanat iḥdá wa-tisʻūn wa-miʼah wa-alf."

Translation of the colophon: "Its author said: This is the end of what we mentioned to compile. Praise be to God, in the beginning and at the end, covertly and overtly. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and all his family and companions. By Your Mercy. O Most Merciful. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. Copied by the feeble servant, Muḥammad al-Kharbūtī in the city of Malāṭiyah [Malatya, Turkey], in the year 1191 [of the Hijrah = 1777 or 1778]."

record.title: 880-03 al-Kāfī fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qawāfī : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbbād al-Khawwāṣ.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāhi ʻalá al-inʻām, wa-al-shukru la-hu ʻalá al-ilhām, a-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khayr al-anām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-sādah al-aʻlām. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā taʼlīf kāfī fī ʻilamay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qawāfī. Wa-Allāh al-muwaffiq, wa-ʻalayhi al-tawakkul. al-Awwal: Fīhi muqaddimah wa-bābān wa-khātimah. Fa-al-muqaddimah fī ashyāʼ lā budda minhā: Aḥruf al-taqṭīʻ allatī tatʼallafu minhā al-ajzāʼ ʻashrah, yajmaʻuhā qawluka 'Lamaʻat suyūfunā' ..."
Secundo folio: wa-bābān wa-khātimah. Fa-al-muqaddimah.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 7 x 11 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 2 numbered quires).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in bold script; markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Matn al-Kāfī fī ʻilamay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qawāfī ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl."
On folio 1a: Miscellaneous quotations in poetry and prose, in different hands.

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mimmā manna Allāh bi-hi ʻalá ʻabdihi al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Muʻṭī Muṣṭafá min Mīt al-Naḥḥāl, Daqahlīyah, fataḥa Allāh ʻalayhi futūḥ al-ʻārifīn bi-jāh Sayyid al-Mursalīn."

Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu: Wa-hādhā mā awradnā jamʻahu. Wa-lillāh al-ḥamd awwalan wa-ākhiran, sirran wa-ʻalāniyatan. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman."

Translation of the colophon: "Its author said: This is what we mentioned to compile. Praise be to God in the beginning and at the end, covertly and overtly. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and on his family and companions and grant them abundant peace."

record.title: 880-03 ʻUqūd al-jumān fī ʻilm al-maʻānī wa-al-bayān : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Rabbi yassir. Qāla al-faqīru ʻābidu al-Raḥmān // al-ḥamdu lillāhi ʻalá al-bayāni. Wa-afḍal al-ṣalāti wa-al-salāmi // ʻalá al-Nabīyi afṣaḥi al-anāmi. Wa-hādhihi urjūzatun mithlu al-jumān // ḍammantuhā ʻilma al-maʻānī wa-al-bayān ..."
Secundo folio: Wa-fī al-kalāmi faqduhu lil-ẓāhiri.
14.5 x 20 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; few notes and corrections on the margins; some wormholes on the margins without loss of text; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Matn alfīyat al-maʻānī wa-al-bayān, lil-Shaykh Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī al-Shāfiʻī, nafaʻanā Allāh wa-īyākum [bi-hi] ajmaʻīn, wa-ʻafā ʻanhu wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. M."
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa lillāh taʻālá hādhā al-kitāb Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."

On folio 35b, the author states that he completed his treatise on Sunday, the end of Jumād al-Thānī, of the year 900 of the Hijrah (5 April, 1495), in one thousand verses: "Wa-tamma dhā al-naẓmu bi-taysīri al-Aḥad // salkha Jumāda al-Thānī fī yawmi al-Aḥad. Min ʻāmi thalāthīna wa-sabʻīna allatī // baʻda thamāni miʼatin lil-Hijrati. Fī alfi baytin ka-al-nujūmi tuzhiru // wa-ka-al-riyāḍi fāḥa minhu al-zaharu."

Colophon: "Allāhumma infaʻ bi-hā man qaraʼahā wa-man samiʻahā, wa-man takallama bi-kalimah ṭayyibah li-ṣalāḥihā, wa-Allāh fī ʻawn al-ʻabd mā dāma fī ʻawn akhīhi, wa-al-salām. Katabahu Rujayb al-Ḥalfāwī al-Fayyūmī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu wa-ʻan al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn, wa-ghafara la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah. Āmīn. Wa-al-rajāʼ fī wajh al-Karīm al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, al-Tawwāb al-Ḥalīm. Wa-mā tawfīqī illā billāh, ʻalayhi tawakkaltu, wa-Huwa Rabb al-ʻArsha al-ʻAẓīm, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá. Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min katbihā yawm al-Thalāth, thamāniyat ʻashar Dhī al-Ḥijjah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām min Allāh, wa-min al-malāʼikah, wa-al-muʼminīn, wa-al-khalq jamīʻan; li-annahu lam yazal yazdādu min al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām min al-khalq, bayna yaday Mawlāhum, subḥānuhu; fa-huwa al-shafīʻ alladhī lā yuraddu fī shafāʻatihi abadan. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh. Sanat 1153."

Translation of the colophon: "O God! Benefit by it him who reads it, him who hears it, and him who utters a pleasant word for its improvement; for God shall assist the servant if the servant assists his brother. Peace! Copied by Rujayb al-Ḥalfāwī al-Fayyūmī, may God pardon him and all Muslims. May God forgive him, his parents, and him who invokes forgiveness on his behalf. Amen. Hope comes from the realm of the Generous One, the Merciful, the Compassionate, the Forgiver, and the Patient One. My success comes from God only, on Him I depend, He is the Lord of the Mighty Throne. May He be praised and glorified. It is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. The copy was completed on Tuesday, 18 Dhī al-Ḥijjah, of the year 1153 [of the Hijrah of the Prophet = 6 March, 1741], may prayer and peace be upon him, from God, from the angels, the believers and all mankind, because he [the Prophet] receives increased prayer and peace, offered from the creatures, to their Lord, may He be praised, on his behalf; for He is the Intercessor whose intercession can never be rejected. Praise be to God."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ Alfīyat Ibn Mālik fī al-naḥw : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAqīl.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla Muḥammadun huwa ibnu Māliki // Aḥmadu Rabbī Allāha khayra Māliki. Muṣalliyan ʻalá al-Rasūli al-Muṣṭafá // wa-ālihi al-mustakmalīn al-shurufā. Wa-astaʻīnu Allāha fī Alfīyah // maqāṣidu al-naḥwi bi-hā maḥwīyah ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-kalim ism jins wāḥiduhu kalimah.
15.7 x 21.3 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 18 numbered quires).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of the "Alfīyah" in red; numerous and some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ Alfīyah Ibn Mālik fī al-naḥw lil-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Ibn ʻAqīl al-Qurashī al-Hāshimī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Intaqala fī mulk Aḥmad ibn al-Ḥājj Ḥusayn sanat 1147 [of the Hijrah = 1734/1735]." 2. "Intaqala hādhā al-kitāb bi-al-shirá al-sharʻī fī mulk al-faqīr al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-Mannān, Aḥmad [...]. Sanat 1154 [1741/1742]."
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā [al-kitāb] lillāh taʻālá Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."
On the upper left corner: "ʻAdad karārīsihi ʻadad 18."

The commentary of Ibn ʻAqīl on the "Alfīyah" of Ibn Mālik starts with: "al-Kalām al-muṣṭalaḥ ʻalayhi ʻinda al-naḥwīyīn ʻibārah ʻan al-lafẓ al-mufīd fāʼidah yaḥsunu al-sukūt ʻalayhā. Fa-al-lafẓ jins yashmal al-kalām wa-al-kalimah wa-al-kalim ..."
The "Alfīyah" ends with: Fa-aḥmadu Allāha muṣalliyan ʻalá // Muḥammadin khayri rasūlin ursilā. Wa-ālihi al-ghurri al-kirām al-bararah // wa-ṣaḥbihi al-muntakhabīna al-khiyarah."

Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfiqih, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim ilá Allāh taʻālá, Raḍwān ibn Salāmah ibn Muḥammad Ṣaqr, yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, fī tisʻah wa-ʻishrīn khalat min shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat 1120, ʻishrīn wa-miʼah wa-alf. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

Translation of the colophon: "The book was completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence, by the hand of the poorest of the servants and the neediest among them to God Almighty, Raḍwān ibn Salāmah ibn Muḥammad Ṣaqr, on blessed Monday, twenty nine days having passed from the month of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, of the year 1120 [of the Hijrah = 18th June 1708]. Praise be to God alone."

16 x 23 cm; written surface: 12 x 17 cm; 15 lines per page.

On the front cover: "Alfīyat Ibn Mālik."
On folio 1a: "Alfīyat Ibn Mālik, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn."

Raqqat wa-rāqat lafẓuhā // Alfīyatu Ibnu Māliki. Sanat 1202 [1787/1788]."
On folio 37b: Quotations of four verses (two by two) from two anonymous poets.
Folios 38-39 are blank; text of al-Alfīyah: Folios 1b-37b.
Colophon: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. M."
