record.title: 880-03 al-Mufaṣṣal fī al-ʻArabīyah : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi [nastaʻīn]. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ajall Jār Allāh, al-zāhid al-ʻallāmah, ustādh al-zamān, Shaykh al-ʻArab wa-al-ʻAjam, fakhr Khawārizm, Abū al-Qāsim Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu: Allāh aḥmadu an jaʻalanī min ʻulamāʼ al-ʻArabīyah, wa-jabalanī ʻalá al-ghaḍab lil-ʻArab wa-al-ʻaṣabīyah, wa-abá lī an anfarid ʻan ṣamīm anṣārihim, wa-amtāz wa-anḍawī ilá al-ḍayf [lafīf] al-Shuʻūbīyah wa-anḥāz, wa-ʻaṣamanī min madhhabihim alladhī lā [lam] yujdi ʻalayhim illā al-rashq bi-alsinat al-lāʻinīn wa-al-mashq bi-asinnat al-ṭāʻinīn, wa-ilá afḍal al-sābiqīn wa-al-muṣallīn uwajjihu afḍal ṣalawāt al-muṣallīn, Muḥammad, al-maḥfūf min Banī ʻAdnān bi-jamājimihā wa-arjāʼihā [wa-arḥāʼihā] ..."
Secundo folio: al-nāzil min Quraysh fī surrat baṭḥāʼihā.
15.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 12 cm; 9 lines per page.
Binding: In dark red leather cover embossed with central medallion.

In good naskh script; in black ink on white paper; headings and markings in red; numerous commentaries on the margins and interlinear of the Part one; no commentaries on the margins of Part two; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb al-Mufaṣṣal fī al-ʻArabīyah, taʼlīf al-ʻAllāmah, Shaykh al-ʻArab wa-al-ʻAjam, fakhr Khuwārizm, Abū al-Qāsim al-Zamakhsharī."

On folio 1a: Three ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Wa-qad dakhala fī nawbat al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, fī mulk mamlūk Mālik al-Mulūk, Mullā ʻAbd Allāh ibn Mullā Maḥmūd ibn Mullā ʻUthmān ibn al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Raḥbī fī Baghdād." 2. "Sāqahu sāʼiq al-qaḍāʼ wa-al-qadar ilá nawbat al-ʻabd al-faqīr, al-muqirr bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, al-muftaqir ilá raḥmat Rabbihi al-Mawlá al-Qadīr, al-Sayyid Aḥmad Bīk al-Muʼayyad ibn al-marḥūm Naṣūḥ Bāshā ʻAẓm Zādah, ghafara Allāh, tabāraka wa-taʻālá, li-wālidayhi, wa-jaʻala al-Jannah maʼwāhum, bi-ʻafwihi wa-karamih. Āmīn. Fī 10 J. [Jumādá al-Ūlá or al-Thāniyah], sanat 1244 [18 November or December, 1828]." Stamp of Aḥmad Muʼayyad and five other illegible stamps. 3. "Waqaʻa fī nawbat al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, Munllā ʻAbd Allāh ibn Mullā Maḥmūd al-Raḥbī, sanat 1187 [1773/1774]."

On folio 242b: An ownership statement: "Wa-qad dakhala fī nawbat al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr Mullā ʻAbd Allāh ibn Mullā Maḥmūd ibn Mullā ʻUthmān ibn al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Raḥbī, fī Baghdād." Four illegible stamps.

Colophon: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih ʻalá yad al-faqīr Maḥmūd ibn al-Shaykh ʻĀshūr ibn Ḥasan al-Julaymāwī [?] aṣlan wa-al-[...] maskanan, ʻufiya ʻanhumā."

Translation of the colophon: Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. It was completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence, by the hand of the poor Maḥmūd ibn al-Shaykh ʻĀshūr ibn Ḥasan al-Julaymāwī [?] aṣlan wa-al-[...] maskanan, may God forgive both of them."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ khātimat Qaṭr al-nadá wa-ball al-ṣadá : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ʻUlaysh.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī tafaḍḍala ʻalá al-ʻālamīn bi-Qaṭr al-nadā, wa-balla ʻan albāb awliyāʼihi al-ʻālimīn rīq al-ṣadā, wa-ashraqa fī ṣudūrihim durar fawāʼid ʻawārif al-maʻārif, fa-tasābaqat adhhānuhum fī istikhrāj farāʼid maʻārif al-ʻawārif, wa-takaffala bi-naẓm al-laʼāliʼ fī silk al-taṣnīf aʼimmah aʻlām, fa-badhalū al-juhd fī rafʻ khudūr ʻarāʼis al-ʻulūm, wa-lāsīyamā fī maydān barāʻat al-khitām ..."
Secundo folio: al-mustaqīm. Faṣl. Ishtahara annahu lughah.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 18 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; black cloth on spine and flap (in 2 numbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; ; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi khātimat al-ʻĀlim al-ʻāmil, wa-al-fāḍil al-kāmil, Shykhinā wa-Shaykh mashāyikhinā, ʻallāmat ahl ʻaṣrih, al-Shaykh Muḥammad ʻUlaysh, li-Sharḥ al-Qaṭr fī fann al-naḥw, ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl."

Colophon: "Qāla jāmiʻuhā al-ḥaqīr Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ʻUlaysh: Tamma tabyīḍuhā fī al-Jāmiʻ al-Azhar al-anwar, tujāh al-Miḥrāb al-Qadīm, baʻda ṣalāt al-ʻaṣr, li-tisʻ layālin min Shaʻbān, in baqiyat, sanat khams wa-arbʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Wa-al-maʼmūl mimman iṭṭalaʻa ʻalá hādhihi al-kalimāt an yaghuḍḍa al-ṭarf ʻammā yaqifu ʻalayhi min al-ʻatharāt, fa-innī min al-qāṣirīn al-muqṣṣirīn, wa-al-muʼmin yaltamisu al-ʻuthr li-akhīhi, wa-lāsīmā in kāna min al-mubtadiʼīn. Asʼaluka Allāh an tajʻalanī wa-ikhwānī min alladhīna daʻwāhum fīhā: Subḥānuka Allāhumma, wa-taḥīyatuhum fīhā Salām, wa-ākhir daʻwāhum an al-Ḥamd lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Its despised author, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ʻUlaysh, said: The fair copy was completed at the illustrious al-Azhar Mosque, in front of the 'Old Miḥrāb', after the afternoon prayer, nine nights remaining from Shaʻbān, of the year 1245 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [14 February 1830], may the best prayer and peace be upon him. It is requested from him who reads these words to bypass any of the shortcomings, as I am one of those inadequate and negligent persons; for the believer seeks to find an excuse for his brother, specially if he is one of the beginners. I beseech you O God to grant me and my brethren to be among those whose invocation in it [i.e., al-Jannah (Paradise)], is 'Praise be to Thee O God', their greeting is 'Salām' (Peace), and their last supplication is 'Praise be to God Lord of the Universe'."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ Qaṭr al-nadá wa-ball al-ṣadá : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Yūsuf ibn Hishām.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-fāḍil al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Jamāl al-Dīn wa-tāj al-qurrāʼ, tadhkirat Abī ʻUmar wa-Sībawayh wa-al-Khalīl wa-al-Farrāʼ, Jamāl al-Dīn, Abū Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Yūsuf ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Hishām [Hishām] al-Anṣārī, fataḥa [fasaḥa] Allāh qabrahu. Āmīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh rāfiʻ al-darajāt li-man inqaḍḍa [inkhafaḍa] bi-jalālih, wa-fātiḥ al-barakāt li-man intaṣaba bi-shukr afḍālih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá man maddah [maddat] ʻalayhi al-faṣāḥah wa-al-balāghah ruwāqahā, wa-shaddat bi-hi al-balāghah niṭāqahā, al-mabʻūth bi-al-āyāt bāhirat al-ḥujaj, al-munzal ʻalayhi Qurʼān ʻArabī ghayru dhī ʻiwaj, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-hādīn wa-aṣḥābihi alladhīn shāda [shādū] al-dīn, wa-sallama wa-sharrafa wa-karram. Fa-hādhihi nuktah [nukat] jarartuhā [ḥarratuhā] ʻalá muqaddimatī al-musammāt [al-musammāh] bi-Qaṭr al-nadā wa-ball al-ṣadā, rāfiʻah li-ḥijābihā, kāshifah li-niqābihā, mukmilah mutammimah li-fawāʼidihā, kāfiyah li-man iqtaṣara ʻalayhā, wāfiyh bughyata man janaḥa min ṭullāb ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah ilayhā. Wa-Allāh al-maʼūl [al-masʼūl] an yanfaʻa bi-hā kamā nafaʻa bi-aṣlihā, wa-an yudallila [yudhallila] lanā ṭuruq al-khayrāt wa-subulahā, Innahu Jawwād Karīm Raʼūf al-Raḥīm [Raḥīm]. Wa-mā tawfīqī illā billāh, ʻalayhi tawakkaltu, wa-ilayhi unīb. al-Kalimah qawl mufrad. Tuṭlaqu al-kalimah fī al-lughah ʻalá al-jumal al-mufīdah ..."
Secundo folio: niṭāqahā, al-mabʻūth bi-al-āyāt bāhirat al-ḥujaj.
14.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 15.5 cm; 12 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding; cover embossed with central medallion.

In large clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Qaṭr al-nadá wa-ball al-ṣadá" preceded by the Arabic letter Ṣād (Ṣ; for "Aṣl" = original) in red, and the commentary preceded by the Arabic letter Shīn (Sh; for Sharḥ = commentary) also in red; markings in red; many notes and corrections on the margins and interlinear (some in Persian); catchwords.

Colophon: "Tammat kitābat hādhihi al-risālah [yawm] al-Khamīs, ʻalá yad al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muḥtāj [... ... ...] Muḥammad, wa-qad kāna dhālika fī [3 (?)] ghurrata shahr Jumād al-Ūlá, sanat 815, thamānī miʼah wa-khamsata ʻashar Hijrīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-azká al-taḥīyah."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy of this epistle was completed on Thursday, by the hand of the poor, the despised and needy [... ... ...] Muḥammad, on [3 (?)], the beginning of the month of Jumād al-Ūlá, of the year 815 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [20 August 1412], may the best prayer and the purest greeting be upon Him."

record.title: 880-02 Mujīb al-nidā ilá Sharḥ Qaṭr al-nadá : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Aḥmad al-Fākihī.
record.note: Title from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh rāfiʻ al-darajāt li-man inkhafaḍa li-ʻizzihi wa-sulṭānih, al-mufīḍ ʻalá man naḥḥāhu wa-qaṣadahu saḥāʼib ʻafwihi wa-ghufrānih, al-mughnī bi-wāsiʻ faḍlihi man iftaqara li-jūdihi wa-iḥsānih, al-fāʻil li-mā yashāʼ fa-lā muʻānid la-hu fī fiʻlihi, wa-lā mumāthila la-hu fī shaʼnih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad alladhī baʻathahu Allāh min khulāṣat al-ʻArab bi-al-āyāt wa-al-muʻjizāt al-jammah, wa-naṣabahu li-tamyīz aḥwāl al-ʻibād wa-bayān aḥkāmihim min al-ḥall wa-al-ḥurmah, wa-naʻatahu bi-ṣifāt al-kamāl ..."
Secundo folio: li-wajhihi al-karīm wa-sababan lil-fawz bi-jannāt al-naʻīm.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 17 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 3 quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Qaṭr al-nadá wa-ball al-ṣadá" in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah al-Fākihī ʻalá al-Qaṭr."
On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhu Mujīb al-nidā ilá Sharḥ Qaṭr al-nadā ..."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... Rābiʻuhā fiʻl al-amr al-musnad ilá al-wāḥid, naḥwa Istaqim. Khāmisuhā afʻāl al-istithnāʼ, ka-khalā wa-ʻadā, wa-naḥwihimā, naḥwa qāmū mā khalā Zayd, wa-mā ʻadā ʻUmar. Sādisuhā afʻal fī al-taʻajjub, naḥwa mā aḥsana Zaydan. Sābiʻuhā ism al-ʻiʻl ghayr māḍin, ka-ūhi wa-nazāli. Thāminuhā al-maṣdar al-wāqiʻ badalan min al-lafẓ bi-fiʻlihi, naḥwa ḍarban Zaydan. Wa-ʻudda fī al-awḍaḥ mimmā ḥujiba fīhi al-istitār afʻal al-tafḍīl ..."

record.title: 880-03 Ḥāshiyat al-Sujāʻī ʻalá al-Qaṭr : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ḥamdan li-man rafaʻa fī al-dārayn qadr aḥbābih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad alladhī khafaḍa al-kufr maʻa aṣḥābih, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-jundihi wa-sāʼir aḥzābih. Āmīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhā taʻlīq laṭīf ʻalá Sharḥ al-Qaṭr li-muʼallifihi al-ʻAllāmah Ibn Hishām, nafaʻanī bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn al-Malik al-ʻAllām. Qawluhu: 'Qāla al-Shaykh, ilkh.', aṣluhu qawala, bi-fatḥ al-wāw, fa-qulibat alifan li-taḥarrukihā wa-infitiāḥ mā qablahā, lā bi-kasrihā, wa-illā la-atá muḍāriʻuhu yaqālu, ka-khāfa yakhāfu, wa-lā bi-ḍammihā, wa-illā kāna lāziman, maʻa annahu mutaʻaddin. Wa-al-shaykh fī al-lughah man ṭaʻana fī al-sinn, thumma uṭliqa iṣṭilāḥan, ʻalá man kāna fāḍilan, wa-law ṣabīyan, fa-huwa majāz, bi-iʻtibār anna man ṭaʻana fī al-sinn yuʻaẓẓamu raḥmatan wa-shafaqatan bi-hi ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-murād annahu yurjaʻu ilayhi fī tadhakkur al-masāʼil.
16.5 x 22.8 cm; written surface: 11 x 17.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap.

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Sharḥ Qaṭr al-nadá wa-ball al-ṣadá" preceded by the word "Qawluhu" (his saying) in red; headings and markings in red; few commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
At the head of folio 1a: "Kāmil lā kharma fīhi, wa-ʻadad karārīsihi 10, wa-awrāquhu 96."
On folio 1a: "Ḥāshiyat al-Sujāʻī ʻalá al-Qaṭr."
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Taʻlīq laṭīf ʻalá Sharḥ al-Qaṭr lil-ʻAllāmah Ibn Hishām, wa-mā hunā lil-ʻAllāmah al-Sujāʻī, nafaʻanā Allāh bihimā wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

At the end of the colophon, the copyist quoted a poem in eight verses, about the pleasure a scholar derives from learning and scholarship, as follows: "al-Aṣl min hādhihi al-abyāt lil-Imām al-Subkī [probably al-Shāfiʻī], wa-al-tashṭīr li-Maḥmūd Barbīr al-Rashīdī." The poem starts with: Saharī li-tanqīḥ al-ʻulūm aladhdhu lī // min kulli maḥbūbin ladá al-ʻushshāqi. And ends with: Wa-aladhdhu min hādhā wa-hādhā kullihi // naqrī li-ulqī al-ramla ʻan awrāqī.

Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhā: Wa-kāna al-farāgh min dhālik laylat al-Jumʻah min Shaʻbān alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-sabʻah wa-sabʻīn. Qāla kātibuhā al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-wafī, al-Sayyid Aḥmad ibn al-marḥūm ilá [Allāh] taʻālá al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá ibn al-marḥūm ilá Allāh taʻālá al-Sayyid Aḥmad ibn al-marḥūm ilá Allāh taʻālá al-Sayyid Muḥammad al-Mansifī al-ʻAdwī baladan al-Azharī waṭanan wa-iqāmatan al-Ḥanafī madhhaban al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan al-wāʻiẓ waẓīfatan, ʻammahu Allāh bi-luṭfihi wa-karamih. Āmīn. Kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihā, li-man manna Allāh ʻalayhi bi-hi, al-mudawwan ismuhu fī al-ṭurrah, al-Sayyid Aḥmad al-madhkūr, ẓahīrata yawm al-Ithnayn, al-sābiʻ li-shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, al-muwāfiq li-sanat thalāthah wa-sittīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, baʻda Hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf. Nuqilat min nuskhah intihāʼ kitābatihā 3 Dhī al-Qaʻdah, sanat sittah wa-khamsīn, ʻalá yad Muḥammad al-Ruwayʻī, ʻufiya ʻanhu, bi-Alāy al-Ghārdiyān al-Thānī, ḥāla iqāmatihi bi-al-thaghr al-Iskandarī, jaʻalahu Allāh ʻāmiran."

Translation of the colophon: "Its author said: It was completed on Friday night, in the month of Shaʻbān [date of the day not given], of the year 1177 [of the Hijrah = February/March, 1764]. Its copyist -- the poor to his faithful Lord, al-Sayyid Aḥmad ibn al-marḥūm ilá [Allāh] taʻālá al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá ibn al-marḥūm ilá Allāh taʻālá al-Sayyid Aḥmad ibn al-marḥūm ilá Allāh taʻālá al-Sayyid Muḥammad al-Mansifī al-ʻAdwī baladan al-Azharī waṭanan wa-iqāmatan al-Ḥanafī madhhaban al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan al-wāʻiẓ waẓīfatan -- may God treat him according to His graciousness and generosity, Amen, said: The copy was completed, by him whom God bestowed His grace upon, whose name is recorded above, and is mentioned, as al-Sayyid Aḥmad, on the noon of Monday, 7 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 1263 [23 February 1847] of the Hijrah of him to whom belongs glory and honor [Prophet Muḥammad]. It was transcribed from a copy completed on 3 Dhī al-Qaʻdah, of the year 56 [probably 1256 = 27 December 1840], by Muḥammad al-Ruwayʻī, may God forgive him, of the Guards Second Regiment, while he was stationed at the Seaport of Alexandria [Egypt], may God prosper it."

record.title: 880-02 Sirāj al-qārī al-mubtadī wa-tadhkirat al-muqrī al-muntahī : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn ʻUthmān ibn al-Qāṣiḥ.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning of the manuscript is missing; the text starts with: "... wa-zidtu fīhi fawāʼd layst min hāʼulāʼ al-shurūḥāt, wa-sammaytuhu 'Sirāj al-qārī al-mubtadī wa-tadhkirat al-muqrī al-muntahī', wa-asʼalu Allāh taʻālá an yanfaʻa bi-hi kamā nafaʻa bi-aṣlihi, innahu qarīb mujīb. Wulida al-Shāṭibī fī ākhir sanat thamān wa-thalāthīn wa-khams miʼah bi-Shāṭibah, wa-hiya qariyah bi-Jazīrat al-Andalus, min bilād al-Maghrib. Wa-qawluhum al-Ruʻaynī, nisbah ilá qabīlah. Akhadha al-qirāʼah ʻan Abī al-Ḥasan ʻAlī ibn Hudhayl bi-al-Andalus, ʻan Abī Dāwūd Sulaymān, ʻan Abī ʻAmr al-Dānī muṣannif kitāb al-Taysīr ..."
Secundo folio: wa-qawluhu wubbalā, al-wubbal jamʻ wābil.
15 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 14.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion.
In good naskh script, in black ink on white paper; the verses of "al-Shāṭibīyah" and markings in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
al-Shāṭibīyah (Ḥirz al-amānī wa-wajh al-tahānī), starts with: Badaʼtu bibismi Allāhi fī al-naẓmi awwalan // tabāraka raḥmānan raḥīman wa-mawʼilā.

al-Juzʼ al-awwal (Part one) of the manuscript ends on folio 128a, with the commentary on the following verse: "Sa-amḍī ʻalá sharṭī wa-billāhi aktafī // wa-mā khāba dhū jiddin idhā huwa ḥasbalā", as follows: "Hādhā ākhir al-juzʼ al-awwal min kitāb 'Sirāj al-qārī', wa-yatlūhu fī awwal al-Juzʼ al-thānī 'Bāb Farsh al-ḥurūf', in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá."
al-Juzʼ al-thānī (Part two), starts on folio 128a, as follows: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Bāb Farsh al-ḥurūf. Sūrat al-Baqarah ..."

Colophon: No colophon. The text ends abruptly with the commentary on the verse: "Wa-tubdī ʻalá aṣḥābihi nafaḥātuhā // bi-ghayri tanāhin zarnaban wa-qaranfulā", as follows: "... wa-al-zarnab wa-al-qaranful dūna al-misk wa-al-mandal fī al-ṭīb, fa-ḥasuna tashbīhuhu al-ṣalāh ʻalá aṣḥābihi bi-dhālika li-annahum fī al-ṣalāh tibʻan li-Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, fa-li-hādhā aṣābathum nafaḥātuhā wa-barakātuhā ..."

record.title: 880-03 al-Qāmūs al-muḥīṭ wa-al-qābūs al-wasīṭ : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Yaʻqūb al-Fīrūzābādī.
record.note: Title from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. al-Ḥamdu lillāh munṭiq al-bulaghāʼ bi-al-lughāh [bi-al-lughāt] fī al-bawādī, wa-mūdiʻ al-lisān alsana al-lusun al-hawādī, wa-mukhaṣṣiṣ ʻurūq al-qayṣūm wa-ghaḍā al-qaṣīm bi-mā lam yanalhu al-mubḥir wa-al-ḥādī, wa-mufīḍ al-ayādī bi-al-rawāyiḥ wa-al-ghawādī, al-mujtadī wa-al-jādī, wa-nāqiʻ ghullat al-ṣawādī bi-al-ahāḍīb al-bawādī, wa-dāfiʻ maʻarrat al-ʻawādī bi-al-karam al-mumādī, wa-mujrī al-awdāʼ min ʻayn al-ʻaṭāʼ li-kull ṣādī ..."
Secundo folio: wa-kull kalimah ʻarraytuhā min al-ḍabṭ fa-innahā bi-al-fatḥ.
17.5 x 26.7 cm; written surface: 13 x 19 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In dark red leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion."
In good and small naskh script, in black ink, on white thick paper; headings in red and bold script; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the lower side: "al-Qāmūs al-muḥīṭ."
On the back of the preliminary leaf: An index of contents: Bāb al-Hamzah to Bāb al-Yāʼ.

On folio 1a: Two verses of poetry on how to lookup a word in "al-Qāmūs al-muḥīṭ", as follows: "Idhā rumta fī al-Qāmūsi kashfan li-lafẓatin // fa-ākhiruhā al-bābu wa-al-badʼu lil-faṣl. Wa-lā taʻtabir fī badʼihā wa-akhīrihā // mazīdan wa-lākinna iʻtibāraka lil-aṣli." And two other verses listing and explaining the five abbreviations/symbols used in the al-Qāmūs al-muḥīṭ, as follows: Wa-mā fīhi min ramzin bi-ḥarfin fa-khamsatun // fa-Mīmun li-maʻrūfin wa-ʻAynun li-mawḍiʻin. Wa-Jīmun li-jamʻin thumma Hāʼun li-qaryatin // wa-lil-baladi al-Dālu allatī uhmilat fa-ʻī." These four verses are also written in a different hand on the front of the preliminary leaf.

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Tasharrafa bi-tamallukihi al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá raḥmat Rabbih, Muṣṭafá ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Ḥalabī al-Ḥusaynī al-Muṭṭalibī, ʻafā ʻanhumā Rabbuhumā wa-bawwaʼahumā al-Jannah. Āmīn." 2. "Fī mulk afqar al-wará ilá ʻafw Rabbihi, Sulaymān ibn Aḥmad, al-shahīr bi-Ibn Jaʻfar Āghā, ʻafā ʻanhu Mawlāhu, wa-khatama la-hu bi-al-Ḥusná, fī 25 Rabīʻ al-Thānī, sanat 1290 [lil-Hijrah = 22 June, 1873]."
On folio 1b: "... wa-asmaytuhu bi-al-Qāmūs al-muḥīṭ wa-al-qābūs al-wasīṭ ..."

On the left margin of folio 339a, after the colophon, statements by two readers, as follows: 1. "Ṭālaʻa fī dhālik, wa-kataba ʻanhu nuskhatan, al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Munʻim ibn Kamāl al-Dīn, ibn al-Shaykh [...], ghafara Allāh la-hu, wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Fī sanat 1003 [of the Hijrah = 1594/1595]." 2. "Wa-kadhālika ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ghamrī, sāmaḥahu [Allāh], fī sanat 1005 [1596/1597]." An illegible stamp.

Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu al-multajī ilá Ḥaram Allāh taʻālá, Muḥammad ibn Yaʻqūb ibn Muḥammad al-Fīrūzābādī, ʻafā Allāh taʻālá ʻanhum: Hādhā ākhir al-Qāmūs al-muḥīṭ wa-al-qābūs al-wasīṭ ... Wa-qad yassara Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, itmāmahu bi-manzilī ʻalá al-Ṣafā, bi-Makkah al-musharrafah, tujāh al-Kaʻbah al-muʻaẓẓamah ... Wa-faragha min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-ʻAlī Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz al-Fattūḥī al-Ḥanbalī, ʻafā Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu, wa-ʻan wālidayhi, wa-ʻan Ahl al-Sunnah wa-al-Jamāʻah ajmaʻīn. Fī rābiʻ ʻasharī Jumādá al-Ūlá, sanat arbaʻ wa-sittīn wa-tisʻimiʼah, aḥsana Allāh taʻālá ʻāqibatahā, wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl."

Translation of the colophon: "Its author, who is taking refuge at the Sanctuary of God, may He be praised, Muḥammad ibn Yaʻqūb ibn Muḥammad al-Fīrūzābādī, may God forgive them, said: This is the end of Qāmūs al-muḥīṭ wa-al-qābūs al-wasīṭ ... God, may He be praised and glorified, facilitated its completion, in my home, located at al-Ṣafā, in honorable Mecca, facing the exalted Kaʻbah ... This copy was completed by him who hopes for the forgiveness of his Lord the Most High, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz al-Fattūḥī al-Ḥanbalī, may God, Most High, forgive him, his parents and the entire Ahl al-Sunnah wa-al-Jamāʻah. On 14 Jumādá al-Ūlá, 964 [of the Hijrah = 25 March 1557], may God, the Most High, end it favorably. God suffices us, He is the best advocate."

record.title: 880-02 Kashf al-wujūh al-ghurr li-maʻānī Naẓm al-durr : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻAlī al-Kāshānī.
record.note: Title from folio 4a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī khalqa bi-qudratihi ṣubḥ al-wujūd ʻan ghasaq al-ʻadam, fa-jaʻalahu āyah mubṣirah, li-yuqīma ʻalayhi dalīlan, wa-fataqa bi-ḥikmatihi ratqa al-jamʻ fī ʻayn al-qidam, fa-faṣṣala kulla shayʼ tafṣīlan, khalaqa al-ʻālam mirʼātan majlūwah bi-rūḥ Ādam, fa-shāhada fīhi ʻaynahu ʻiyānan, wa-aṭlaʻa min samāʼ al-dhāt shumūs al-asmāʼ wa-aqmār al-ṣifāt hidāyatan wa-bayānan ..."
Secundo folio: rābiṭat khurūj al-kalimāt al-azalīyah.
15.2 x 20.8 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In dark red leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion and corners designs (in 17 quires, mostly numbered)
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; many commentaries and some corrections on the margins; markings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: An index of contents for the "Introduction" of the book: "Fahrasat mā fī 'Muqaddimat' hādhā al-sharḥ min al-fuṣūl. Wa-jaʻala al-muqaddimah qismayn yaḥtawiyān ʻalá jamīʻihā, wa-hiya ʻasharah. Taḥta kull qism khamsat fuṣūl. [al-Qism al-awwal]: al-Faṣl al-awwal fī maʻrifat al-dhāt. al-Thānī fī maʻrifat al-ʻawālim. al-thālith fī maʻrifat al-rūḥ al-aʻẓam wa-al-nafs al-kullīyah wa-mā tawallada minhumā min al-āthār. al-Rābiʻ fī maʻrifat al-insān wa-khilāfatih. al-Khāmis fī maʻrifat al-nubūwah wa-al-wilāyah. al-Qism al-thānī: Fī maʻrifat al-mawājīd. Wa-hiya khamasat fuṣūl: al-Awwal fī al-maḥabbah. al-Thānī fī al-shukr. al-Thālith fī al-wajd wa-al-wujūd. al-Rābiʻ fī al-jamʻ. al-Khāmis fī al-tawḥīd."

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ al-Tāʼīyah, Naẓm al-sulūk, al-musammāh bi-Kashf al-wujūh al-ghurr li-maʻānī naẓm al-durr, lil-Qāshānī, nafaʻa Allāh [bi-hi], taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-awḥad, Jamāl al-Islām, Abī al-Thanāʼ Maḥmūd ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Qāshānī, qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu wa-ṭayyaba fawḥahu. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Statements by owners, as follows: 1. "Min niʻam Allāh taʻālá ʻalá ʻabdihi [... ... ...]." Signiture. 2. "Laqad anʻama Allāh al-ʻaẓīmu bi-faḍlihi // ʻalá ʻabdihi al-muḥtāji yudʻá Sulaymānā. Bi-mulkin li-hādhā al-sharḥ wa-qabalahu // tamallakahu min fayḍi Mawlāhu Raḥmānā."
On folio 4a: "... wa-sammaytuhu Kashf al-wujūh al-ghurr li-maʻānī Naẓm al-durr ..."

After the colophon: A reader's statement: "Yā man ṭālaʻa fī hādhā al-majmūʻ, wa-ḥāwala al-lawm wa-al-khumūʻ, wa-khāfa sharāb al-dhāt, wa-ghāba ʻan al-maladhdhāt, Ushkur li-man ḍabaṭa hādhā al-majmūʻ, wa-udʻu Allāh la-hu an yuḥsina ʻindahu nazlahu wa-yublighahu fī marqá al-kamālāt amalah, wa-an yakūna ʻinda tajallīhi bi-al-ʻahd al-ʻālī fī al-yawm al-aṭamm wa-al-mawqif al-aʻamm bi-al-luṭf wa-al-raḥmah musāʻidan, wa-an lā yukhayyiba fī [...] ʻindahu la-hu maqṣadan. Wa-al-salām."

On the left margin of the colophon: An owner's/editor's statement: "Qāla mālik hādhā al-majmūʻ: Ṭāla mā aẓmaʼtu al-nafs wa-ajwaʻtu al-ḥiss wa-aqlaqtu al-fikr wa-akthartu min al-takrār wa-al-dhikr, wa-ajhadtu al-ʻayn bi-al-naẓar, wa-amaghtu al-dhawq li-nayl al-ẓafar fī muṭālaʻat hādhayn al-sharḥīn al-ʻajībayn al-gharībayn, fa-adhāqanī Allāh minhumā mā law qultuhu aw tafawwahtu bi-hi qālū ḍalla wa-jāwaza al-ḥudūd. Wa-innī bi-faḍl Allāh aṣlaḥtu minhumā bi-ḥasb al-dhawq mawāḍiʻ kathīrah, wa-hiya ladayka shahīrah ʻalá ḥasb al-dhawq wa-al-wijdān. Wa-fawqa kull dhī ʻilm ʻalīm fī al-dhawq wa-al-kashf wa-al-ʻayān. Fa-inn tajid ʻayban fa-sudda al-khalal wa-saddid mā kāna min al-khaṭaʼ wa-al-khaṭal, fa-innī asʼaluka billāh alladhī lā ilāha illā huwa, al-aḥadī al-dhāt, al-wāḥidī al-ṣifāt, yā man yuṭāliʻu fī hādhā al-majmūʻ, aw yatamallakuhu wirāthatan aw shirāʼan aw ghayr dhālik an lā yansānī min al-duʻāʼ wa-al-salāmah min al-mahālik. Wa-iʻlam inna hādhā al-majmūʻ ʻindī bi-manzilat al-rūḥ, li-annahu kāna sababan lil-futūḥ, fa-ibḥath bi-al-dhawq wa-al-jidd, wa-īyāka taʻdiyat al-ḥadd. Wa-kun billāh ʻan kull ghayr lāhin. Wa-hādhihi waṣīyatī minnī ilayk. Wa-al-salām."
On folio 167a: An owner's statement: "Malakahu min niʻam al-Miḥsān al-faqīr Sulaymān al-Ḥanafī al-Khalwatī."

On folio 167a: An editor's note: "Qāla Sulaymān al-fānī: Qābaltu hādhā al-sharḥ, aʻnī al-Qāshānī, min awwalihi ilá ākhirihi, fī majālis ʻadīdah mauqābalata naṣab, ʻalá qadr al-juhd, fa-ushdud yadayka bi-hi, fa-innahu jawharah lā qīmah la-hā illā al-muhaj wa-al-arwāḥ, fa-ijʻalhu daydanak fī al-ghudū wa-al-rawāḥ. Wa-hā naḥnu nasʼal al-Fattāḥ an yaftaḥa la-nā bāb al-wuṣūl wa-al-najāḥ, innahu ʻalá mā yashāʼ qadīr, wa-bi-al-ijābah jadīr. Katabahu al-fānī al-walhān al-muḥibb Sualymān al-Ḥanafī al-Khalwatī, kāna Allāh la-hu. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā aradnā īrādahu fī hādhā al-mukhtaṣar min sharḥ al-qaṣīdah, bi-qūwat Allāh al-muqtadir. Wa-Allāh al-muwaffiq fī itmām al-kitāb lil-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhu ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá al-Raḥmān, Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Sakarān. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābih wa-tābiʻīhi ilá yawm al-dīn. Tamma iftitāḥ shahr Rajab al-fard, sanat 909."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what we intended to introduce in this compendium about the commentary on the poem [i.e., of Ibn al-Fāriḍ], by the power of the Almighty God. God is the one who facilitated the completion of the book in the right way. To Him is the reference and returning. It was completed by the hand of the poor to the Merciful One, Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Sakarān. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on Him who no prophet comes after Him [Prophet Muḥammad], on his family, his companions and his followers, until Judgement Day. It was completed the beginning of the month of Rajab, of the year 909 [of the Hijrah = 30 December 1503]."

record.title: 880-02 Dhakhāʼir al-aghlāq fī sharḥ Turjumān al-ashwāq : manuscript / Ibn al-ʻArabī.
record.note: Title from colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning of the manuscript is missing (probably around 13%; 20 leaves); text starts with: "... bi-ḥukm mā fī al-nafs min alam al-buʻd wa-wujūd al-ṣadd wa-al-hajr alladhī huwa naʻt lāzim kamā dhakarnāh, fa-kāna fīhi ḥarārah, li-anna zafarāt al-ashwāq allatī hiya aṣwāt nīrānihā sakhkhanathu, wa-ẓuhūruhā lil-ʻayn tuẓhiru la-hu al-mulāḥaẓah lil-aʻyān, idhā kāna lā yanbaghī la-hu an yanẓura ilá ghayr maḥbūbihi ilá an yaghliba ʻalayhi maqām naẓarihi bi-ʻayn Allāh, aw, maqām ruʼyat Allāh fī kull shayʼ, fa-ḥīnaʼidhin yartafiʻu ʻinda al-bukāʼ wa-al-zafarāt bi-hādhā al-mashhad al-karīm, wa-huwa al-ghāyah allatī yaṣilu ilayhā al-ʻārif ..."
Secundo folio: Bāna al-ʻazāʼu wa-bāna al-ṣabru idh bānū.
10.5 x 15.7 cm; written surface: 5.7 x 11 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding with flap.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of "Turjumān al-ashwāq" in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 169a: A poem in 14 verses.
On folio 169b: Miscellaneous alchemical and popular medical quotations.

Author's colophon: "Qāla al-muʼallif: Kāna sabab sharḥī li-hādhā 'al-Turjumān' suʼāl ṣāḥibayya, al-Masʻūdī Abī Muḥammad ʻAbd Allāh Badr ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Jibshī al-Ḥādī, wa-suʼāl al-walad al-bārr Ismāʻīl ibn Sūdak ibn Nūrī min madīnat Ḥalab, wa-qad samiʻa min baʻḍ al-fuqahāʼ qawlan ankarahu, wa-huwa annahu ismahu [samiʻahu yaqūlu anna qawl] al-Shaykh fī awwal al-Turjumān, innahu qaṣada bi-mā fīhi min al-abyāt al-ghazalīyah ʻulūman wa-asrāran wa-ḥaqāʼiq, laysa bi-ṣaḥīḥ, innamā faʻalahu al-Shaykh ḥattá lā yunsaba ilayhi lisān al-ghazal, maʻa mā huwa ʻalayhi min al-dīn wa-al-ṣalāḥ, fa-dhakar lanā [dhālika] al-wald ʻImād al-Dīn Ismāʻīl, fa-sharaʻtu fī sharḥihi bi-Ḥalab, wa-ḥaḍara samāʻ baʻḍihi wa-dhālika [dhālika] al-Faqīh al-mutakallim, wa-jumlah min al-fuqahāʼ bi-qirāʼat Kamāl al-Dīn Abī al-Qāsim ibn Najm al-Dīn al-Qāḍī Ibn al-ʻAdīm, bi-manzilinā, wathīqat [waffaqahu] Allāh. Wa-aʻjalanā al-safar, wa-atmamnāhu bi-Akhḍar [bi-Aqsarā], ay, fī al-tārīkh al-madhkūr. Wa-lammā samiʻahu dhālika al-ʻāmil [al-qāʼil], qāla li-ʻImād al-Dīn Ismāʻīl 'Mā baqītu baʻda hādhā attahimu aḥadan min ahl hādhihi al-ṭarīqah fīmā yatakallamūn bi-hi min al-kalām al-muʻtād, wa-yushīrūna bi-hi ilá ʻulūm iṣṭalaḥū ʻalayhā bi-hādhihi al-alfāẓ'. Wa-ḥasuna ẓannuhu, fa-intafaʻa. Fa-hādhā kāna sabab sharḥī li-hādhā al-Turjumān. Tammat Risālat Dhakhāʼir al-aghlāq fī sharḥ Turjumān al-ashwāq. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

Translation of the author's colophon: "The author said: The reason for my commentary on this 'Turjumān' was the request of my two associates: al-Masʻūdī Abī Muḥammad ʻAbd Allāh Badr ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Jibshī al-Ḥādī, and the righteous son Ismāʼīl ibn Sūdak ibn Nūrī, from the city of Aleppo, because he [they] heard some of the scholars rejecting to be true, what the Shyakh [Ibn al-ʻArabī] claims, at the beginning of the 'Turjumān', that the love verses denote [divine] sciences, secrets and facts, rather, he [Ibn al-ʻArabī] said this in order not to be accused of flirting, as he is known to be of high status of religion and righteousness. When the lad ʻImād al-Dīn Ismāʻīl mentioned [this] to us, I started the commentary on it [al-Turjumān] in Ḥalab [Aleppo], where it was listened to by that faqīh [scholar] who talked/grumbled about it, in addition to a number of fuqahāʼ [scholars], as it was being read by Kamāl al-Dīn Abī al-Qāsim ibn Najm al-Dīn al-Qāḍī Ibn al-ʻAdīm, at our home, may God grant him success. However, we were pressed to travel; hence, I completed the commentary at Aqsarā, that is at the afore mentioned date [the date is not given]. When that person heard it [the commentary], he told ʻImād al-Dīn Ismāʻīl: 'I will, henceforth, never accuse anyone of the members of this way [i.e., the Sufis] about the ordinary parlance they use, while they allude by it to some knowledge they have agreed upon, among themselves, by using these terms'. His assumption was correct, and he benefitted by it. This was the reason for my commentary on this 'Turjumān'. The epistle of 'Dhakhāʼir al-aghlāq fī sharḥ Turjumān al-ashwāq' is completed. Praise be to God alone."

Copyist's colophon: "Ḥarrara[hu] kātibuhu al-faqīr ilá Allāh al-ghanī al-wadūd, khādim al-niʻāl, al-ḥaqīr, Munlā Maḥmūd al-Kurdī al-Quṣayrī, min aʻmāl Anṭākiyah, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi, wa-dhālika fī shahr Muḥarram al-ḥarām, min shuhūr sanat sabʻ wa-tisʻīn wa-tisʻimiʼah."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied by the poor to the rich and loving God, servant of the soles (shoes, sandals), the despised, Munlā Maḥmūd al-Kurdī al-Quṣayrī, [who is from a location] in the region of Anṭākiyah [Antioch (Turkey)], may God forgive him and his parents and be pleased with them and with him, in the month of Muḥarram, of the year 997 [of the Hijrah = November/December 1588]."

record.title: 880-02 al-Shāfiyah : manuscript / ʻUthmān ibn ʻUmar ibn al-Ḥājib.
record.note: Title from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, Khātim al-Nabīyīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-ṭayyibīn al-ṭāhirīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-qad saʼalanī man lā yasaʻunī mukhālafatuhu an ulḥiqa bi-muqaddimatī fī al-iʻrāb muqaddimah fī al-taṣrīf ʻalá naḥwihā wa-muqaddimah fī al-khaṭṭ, fa-ajabtuhu sāʼilan mutaḍarriʻan an yanfaʻa bi-himā kamā nafaʻa bi-ukhtihimā, wa-Allāh al-muwaffiq. al-Ṣarf ʻilm bi-uṣūl tuʻrafu bi-hā aḥwāl abniyat al-kalām allatī laysat bi-iʻrāb. Wa-abniyat al-ism al-uṣūl thulāthīyah wa-rubāʻīyah wa-khumāsīyah, wa-abniyat al-fiʻl thulāthīyah wa-rubāʻīyah, wa-yuʻabbaru ʻanhā bi-al-fāʼ wa-al-ʻayn wa-al-lām ..."
Secundo folio: wa-huwa ṣuʻfūq wa-khurnūb ḍaʻīf.
11.5 x 17.8 cm; written surface: 6 x 12 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding; dark brown leather on spine.
In good naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on white paper; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: Quotations about marriage and divorce according to Islamic law.
At the head of folio 1b: "al-Shāfiyah".
On folios 35a-37b: Miscellaneous quotations and fatwas in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish.
Folios 38 and 39 are blank.

On the front of the back cover: A reader's statement: "Ṭālaʻa fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu, dāʻiyan li-mālikihi bi-ṭūl al-baqá wa-al-irtiqá, al-ʻabd al-dāʻī ilá man qadruhu sāmī ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Shāmī, ʻufiya ʻanhu."

Colophon: "Tammat al-Muqaddimah bi-ḥamd Allāh al-Malik al-Mutaʻāl, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf Yūsuf ibn Jamāl. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi, khayr āl, mā taʻāqabat al-ayyām wa-al-layāl, fī thālith ʻashar min Ramaḍān al-mubārak, min shuhūr sanat khams wa-tisʻīn wa-tisʻimiʼah."

Translation of the colophon: "The 'Introduction [i.e., al-Shāfiyah]' was completed by the praise of God, the King Most High, by the hand of the feeble servant Yūsuf ibn Jamāl. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and on his family, the best of families, as long as the days follow the nights, on the thirteenth of blessed Ramaḍān, of the year 995 [of the Hijrah = 19th July 1587]."

record.title: 880-03 al-Fawāʼid al-Ḍiyāʼīyah : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Aḥmad al-Jāmī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 2b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit (folio 2b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu li-Walīyihi wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-mutaʼaddibīn bi-ādābih. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi fawāʼid wāfiyah li-ḥall mushkilāt al-Kāfiyah, lil-ʻAllāmah al-mushtahir fī al-mashāriq wa-al-maghārib, al-Shaykh Ibn al-Ḥājib, taghammadahu Allāh bi-ghufrānih wa-askanahu buḥbūḥat jinānih, naẓamtuhā fī silk al-taqrīr wa-simṭ al-taḥrīr, lil-walad al-ʻazīz Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn Yūsuf, ḥafiẓahu Allāh, subḥānuhu, ʻan mūjibāt al-talahhuf wa-al-taʼassuf. Wa-sammaytuhā bi-al-Fawāʼid al-Ḍiyāʼīyah, li-annahu li-hādhā al-jamʻ wa-al-taʼlīf ka-al-ʻillah al-ghāniyah, nafaʻahu Allāh bi-hā wa-sāʼir al-mubtadiʼīn min aṣḥāb al-taḥṣīl. Wa-mā tawfīqī illā billāh. Wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl ..."
Secundo folio: bi-dalīl qawlihi taʻālá 'Ilayhi yaṣʻadu al-kalim al-ṭayyib'.
14.5 x 19.5 cm; written surface: 7 x 15 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding.
In fair naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on white paper; numerous commentaries on the margins and interlinear; markings in red; some headings on the margins in red; catchwords.
On the label pasted on the spine: "al-Fawāʼid al-Ḍiyāʼīyah."
At the head of folio 2a: "Hādhā Jāmī Sharḥ Kāfī."

On folio 175b: An advice "waṣīyah" in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish, in 16 lines, from a certain Nūr al-Dīn Zādah to his "murīd" (disciple/devotee). Starts with: "Fa-iʻlam: Hādhā waṣīyat Nūr al-Dīn Zādah li-murīdihi: Ūṣīka bi-mā awṣá Allāh taʻālá anbiyāʼahu, ʻalayhim al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, an aqīmū al-dīn wa-lā tatafarraqū fīhi, wa-bi-taqwá Allāh wa-ṭāʻatihi; inna Allāh maʻa al-taqwā [al-taqwá] wa-alladhīna yakhshūn ..."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-hādhihi al-amthilah waqaʻat ʻalá tartīb taṣrīfihā al-wāqiʻ fī kutub al-taṣrīf, wa-baʻḍhā li-mā huwa maʻa al-ḍamīr al-bāriz ka-al-munfaṣil, wa-baʻḍuhā li-mā huwa maʻa ghayr al-ḍamīr al-bāriz ka-al-muttaṣil, ka-mā asharnā ilayhi, wa-al-nūn al-mukhaffafah tuḥdhafu [lil-sākin], ay li-iltiqāʼ al-sākin al-madhkūr baʻdahā, wa-fī baʻḍ al-nusakh lil-sākinayn, ay, li-iltiqāʼ al-sākinayn, ka-qawl al-shāʻir [Lā tuhīnna] al-faqīra ʻallaka an tarkaʻa yawman wa-al-dahru qad [rafaʻah], ay, Lā tuhīnanna, ḥudhifat al-nūn [al-mukhaffafah li-iltiqāʼihā al-sākinah allatī baʻdahā wa-ubqiyat fatḥat mā qablahā] ..."

record.title: 880-03 al-Fawāʼid al-Ḍiyāʼīyah : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Aḥmad al-Jāmī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit (folio 1b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu li-Walīyihi wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-mutaʼaddibīn bi-ādābih. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi fawāʼid wāfiyah li-ḥall mushkilāt al-Kāfiyah, lil-ʻAllāmah al-mushtahir fī al-mashāriq wa-al-maghārib, al-Shaykh Ibn al-Ḥājib, taghammadahu Allāh bi-ghufrānih wa-askanahu buḥbūḥat jinānih, naẓamtuhā fī silk al-taqrīr wa-simṭ al-taḥrīr, lil-walad al-ʻazīz Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn Yūsuf, ḥafiẓahu Allāh, subḥānuhu, ʻan mūjibāt al-talahhuf wa-al-taʼassuf. Wa-sammaytuhā bi-al-Fawāʼid al-Ḍiyāʼīyah, li-annahu li-hādhā al-jamʻ wa-al-taʼlīf ka-al-ʻillah al-ghāʼibah [al-ghāniyah], nafaʻahu Allāh bi-hā wa-sāʼir al-mubtadiʼīn min aṣḥāb al-taḥṣīl. Wa-mā tawfīqī illā billāh. Wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl ..."
Secundo folio: min kitābihi wa-badaʼa bi-taʻrīf al-kalimah.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 6 x 12 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding. In dark brown leather; cover embossed with central medallion.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Kāfiyah in red; some commentaries and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Fawāʼid wafīyah li-ḥall mushkilāt al-Kāfiyah."

Colophon: "Kataba al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr Jalāl ibn Ḥasan ibn Jalāl, fī tārīkh salkh shahr Rabīʻ al-Thānī, sanat alf wa-wāḥid wa-ʻishrīn min Hijrah [al-Hijrah] al-Nabawīyah. Tammat bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied by the poor and despised, who admits his shortcoming and inadequacy, Jalāl ibn Ḥasan ibn Jalāl, at the end of the month of Rabīʻ al-Thānī, of the year 1021 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [29 June 1612]. It was completed by the help of God Most High."

record.title: 880-02 Kifāyat al-mubtadī : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Pīr ʻAlī al-Birkiwī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-inna kull kalimah ishtiqāqīyah in tajarrada māḍīhi [māḍīhā] al-mufrad al-mudhakkar al-ghāʼib ʻan ḥarf zāʼid yusammá mujarradan wa-aṣlīyan, wa-in ishtamala ʻalayhi yusammá mazīdan fīhi dhā ziyādah. Wa-al-mujarrad in kāna māḍīhi al-mufrad al-mudhakkar al-ghāʼib ʻalá thalāthat aḥruf yusammá thulāthīyan mujarradan, wa-in kāna ʻalá arbaʻat aḥruf yusammá rubāʻīyan mujarradan, wa-al-mazīd fīhi in zīdat fīhi ʻalá al-thulāthī yusammá mazīd al-thulāthī wa-thulāthīyan mazīdan fīhi, wa-in zīdat fīhi ʻalá al-rubāʻī yusammá mazīdan [mazīd] al-rubāʻī wa-rubāʻīyan mazīdan fīhi ..."
Secundo folio: min jins wāḥid wa-ḥurūf al-ʻillah.
14.7 x 20.7 cm; written surface: 9 x 15 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: In green cardboard with flap; dark brown leather on spine and flap.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; few commentaries on the margins and interlinear (some in Ottoman Turkish); catchwords.
On cover: "Matn Kāfiyat Ibn al-Ḥājib."
On folio 1a: "Matn Kāfiyat Ibn al-Ḥājib fī ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl. M."
At the head of folio 1b: "Hādhā Kitāb Kāfiyat Ibn al-Ḥājib."

Text ends with: "... Wa-ammā al-nāqiṣ wa-al-lafīf fa-yuḥdhafān ayẓan [ayḍan] idhā kāna mā qablahumā maḍmūman aw maksūran, naḥwa ughzunna wa-irminna wa-qunna wa-uṭwunna, wa-in kāna maftūḥan ḥurrikat al-wāw bi-al-ẓamm [bi-al-ḍamm] wa-al-yāʼ bi-al-kasr, naḥwa ukhshunna wa-ikhshīnna wa-ījūnna wa-ījīnna, wa-yaʻūdu [wa-taʻūdu] al-lām al-maḥdhūfah lil-jazm fīhimā maftūḥatan bi-dukhūlihimā [naḥwa] li-yaghzūnna wa-li-yarmīnna wa-li-yaṭwīnna, wa-lam yaghzūnna wa-lam yarmīnna wa-lam yaṭwīnna."
Colophon: "Tammat al-kitāb."
Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed."

record.title: 880-03 Durrat al-ghawwāṣ fī awhām al-khawāṣṣ : manuscript / al-Qāsim ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥarīrī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir, wa-ṣalli wa-sallim ʻalá Nabīyika. Qāla al-Shaykh al-ajall, al-Imām al-awḥad, Abū Muḥammad al-Qāsim ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥarīrī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Ammā baʻd ḥamd Allāh alladhi ʻamma ʻibādahu bi-waẓāʼif al-ʻawārif wa-khaṣṣa man shāʼa minhum bi-laṭāʼif al-maʻārif, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad, Nabīyihi al-ʻāqib, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ulī al-manāqib, fa-innī raʼytu kathīran mimman tasannamū asnimah al-rutab wa-tawassamū bi-simat al-adab qad ḍāhaw al-ʻāmmah fī baʻḍimā [baʻḍ mā] yafruṭu min kalāmihim wa-tarʻufu bi-hi marāʻif aqlāmihim ..."
Secundo folio: shariba, ishtaffa, ay, yatanāhá fī al-shurb.
16 x 20.8 cm; written surface: 10 x 15.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Durrat al-ghawwāṣ fī awhām al-khawāṣṣ, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Abū Muḥammad al-Qāsim ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥarīrī al-Baṣrī, raḥiamahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: Five verses of poetry by Ibn al-Naqīb (could not be identified), praising al-Ḥarīrī's "Durrat al-ghawwāṣ fī awhām al-khawāṣṣ".

On folio 1a: A statement giving the date of birth and death of al-Zamakhsharī (Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar, 1075-1144), as follows: "Wulida al-Zamakhsharī yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ al-sābiʻ min Rajab, sanat 467, wa-tuwuffiya sanat 538."

Author's colophon: "Qāla al-muʼallif, raḥimahu Allāh: Fa-hādhihi al-awhām fī al-hijāʼ athbattuhā ʻan al-ʻiyān wa-iltaqaṭṭuahā [wa-iltaqatṭhā] min kutub jamāʻat al-aʻyān, wa-laʻalla khawāṭirahum balaghat [hafat] bi-hā nisyānan, wa-aqlāmuhum khaṭarna [khaṭrafat] bi-hā ṭughyānan. ʻAlá annī lam aqṣudu bi-mā allaftuhu min hādhā al-kitāb, wa-fataḥtu fīhi min maghāliq al-ṣawāb, an unaddida hafawāt [bi-hafawāt] al-awhām wa-ʻatharāt al-aqlām; wa-anná yaʻtamidu dhālika labīb, wa-hal yatbaʻu [yatatabbaʻu] al-maʻāyiba illā maʻīb; Wa-man ẓanna mimman yulāqī al-ḥurū // ba bi-an lā yuṣāb fa-qad ẓanna ʻajzā. Wa-an [wa-anā] arjū an yaqaʻa hādhā al-kitāb ilá man yasturu al-maʻībah, wa-yadraʼu bi-al-ḥasanah al-sayyiʼah, wa-an ukfá ifrāṭ man yanṭuqu ʻan al-hawá wa-yajhalu anna li-kulli imriʼin mā nawá. Wa-min Allāh, ʻazza wa-jall, astalhimu al-tawfīq lil-maqāl al-muʻtaliq bi-al-iṣābah lil-fiʻāl, al-mujtalib ḥusn al-inābah, innahu bi-karamihi wa-lī al-ijābah. Innahu ʻalá kull shayʼ qadīr wa-bi-al-ijābah jadīr. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "The author, may God have mercy upon him, said: I recorded these delusive errors in the language, as I witnessed them, and picked them from the books of a group of eminent authors. However, their minds might have forgetfully overlooked them, or, their pens might have raved with them inattentively. Nevertheless, I did not intend, by what I wrote in this book, and by unlocking the doors to what is correct, to criticize the lapses of delusions and the pitfalls of pens; for no intelligent person does this on purpose, or, traces the shortcomings of others, except the disgraceful; For he who goes to war and thinks // he will not be stricken, thinks wrong. I hope this book will fall in the hands of him who hides the shortcoming, and covers the fault with perfection. I also hope to be spared the excessiveness of those who talk indiscriminately, and forget that everyone will be rewarded according to his intention. From God, may He be praised and glorified, I seek success for what I say, to be congruent with correct deeds, and to bring about the best result; for God, by his benevolence, answers invocations. He can do what He wills and is worthy of answering the requests. Amen. Amen. Amen. Peace be upon the messengers. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 Natāʼij al-afkār : manuscript / Muṣṭafá ibn Ḥamzah al-Aṭahʹlī.
record.note: Title from folio 3a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala al-alfāẓ qawālib al-maʻānī, wa-faḍḍalahā ʻalá sāyir al-aṣwāt bi-naẓm durar ḥurūf al-mabānī, wa-bi-faḍlihi rafaʻa al-khaṭaʼ ʻan al-aʼimmah ʻāmmatan, wa-bi-takwīnihi kāna [kānat] al-afʻāl tāmmah, wa-lā yasaʻu ẓurūf taʻrīf mawṣūlāt naʻmāʼihi, wa-lā yataʼattá bi-al-ishārah iẓhār muḍmarāt ālāʼihi, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá man ūtiya jawāmiʻ al-kalim min bayn al-mursalīn, Muḥammad, alladhī aʻraba ʻan ḥujaj al-dīn lil-ʻālamīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-jāzimīn, al-ʻāmilīn bi-marfūʻāt aḥkāmihi, wa-al-mumtāzīn ʻan ahl al-khafḍ bi-al-iḍāfah ilá manṣūbāt aʻlāmih ..."
Secundo folio: fī al-Islām wa-abdil bi-maghfiratika.
13 x 18.8 cm; written surface: 7 x 12 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding with flap; dark brown leather on spine and flap.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; phrases of "Iẓhār al-asrār" and markings in red; many commentaries and some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 3a: "... wa-sammaytuhu bi-Natāʼij al-afkār ..."

On the left margin of the colophon: A note stating that the author died in the year 1098 of the Hijrah (1686/1687), as follows: "Intaqala shāriḥ [al-shāriḥ] min al-fanāʼ ilá al-baqāʼ. Thamān wa-tisʻīn wa-alf."
On folio 208b: A stamp of "Sulaymān Khudā Bandah. 1249 [of the Hijrah = 1833/1834]."

Author's colophon (folio 207b): "Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min taswīd Sharḥ al-Iḍhār [Iẓhār] al-asrār bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-ʻAzīz, ʻalá yad aḍʻaf al-wará al-Shaykh Muṣṭafá, fī al-ḍaḥwah al-kubrá min yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ, al-sābiʻ wa-al-ʻishrīn min Ramaḍān al-mubārak, min sanat khams wa-thamānīn wa-alf."

Translation of the colophon: "A rough copy of 'Sharḥ Iẓhār al-asrār' was completed, by the help of God the Almighty King, by the hand of the feeblest of mankind, al-Shaykh Muṣṭafá, on the noon of Wednesday, 27 of blessed Ramaḍān, of the year 1085 [of the Hijrah = 25 December 1674]."

record.title: 880-02 Natāʼij al-afkār : manuscript / Muṣṭafá ibn Ḥamzah al-Aṭahʹlī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala al-alfāẓ qawālib al-maʻānī, wa-faḍḍalahā ʻalá sāyir al-aṣwāt bi-naẓm durar ḥurūf al-mabānī, wa-bi-faḍlihi rafaʻa al-khaṭaʼ ʻan al-aummah ʻāmmatan, wa-bi-takwīnihi kāna [kānat] al-afʻāl tāmmah, wa-lā yasaʻu ẓurūf al-kināyāt taʻrīf mawṣūlāt naʻmāʼihi, wa-lā yataʼattá bi-al-ishārah iẓhār muḍmarāt ālāʼihi, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá man utiya [ūtiya] jāmiʻ al-kalim min bayn al-mursalīn, Muḥammad, alladhī aʻraba ʻan ḥujaj al-dīn lil-ʻālamīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-jāzimīn, al-ʻālimīn bi-marfūʻāt aḥkāmihi, wa-al-mumtāzīn ʻan ahl al-khafḍ bi-al-iḍāfah ilá manṣūbāt aʻlāmih ..."
Secundo folio: al-barīʻah wa-maqṣūran ʻalá maḥḍ al-fawāʼid
13.5 x 19.3 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 15 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; text within double red frame; markings in red; few notes corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On cover: "al-Natāʼij Sharḥ al-Iẓhār."
On the preliminary page: Different lists for the names of "Aṣḥāb al-Kahf" (People of the Cave/Seven Sleepers), the name of their dog, and incantations associated with their names.
On the back of the preliminary leaf: Partial index of contents.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Natāʼij al-afkār lil-Shaykh Muṣṭafá ibn Ḥamzah, Sharḥ Iẓhār al-asrār lil-ʻAllāmah al-Burkuwī, raḥima Allāh al-mātin wa-al-shāriḥ wa-al-kātib wa-sāʼir al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Three ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Dakhala hādhā al-kitāb fī mulk al-faqīr Ḥusayn Ilyās al-Nābulusī fī Dhā al-Qaʻdah 1251 [February (Shubāṭ - Fibrāyir)/March (Ādhār - Māris) 1836]." 2. "Fī nawbat al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-Ghanī, Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Aṣbaḥī al-Maydānī, fī Shawwāl, sanat 1261 [October (Tishrīn al-Awwal - Uktūbir 1845]." 3. "Qad malaka hādhā al-kitāb al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Sayyid al-Ḥājj Aḥmad Āghā Rikāb Zādah, bi-al-shirāʼ al-sharʻī, bi-thaman qadruhu KH [25], fī Rabīʻ al-Thānī, 1280 [September (Aylūl)/October (Tishrīn al-Awwal) 1863]."
At the head of folio 1b: "Natāʼij al-afkār ʻalá al-Iẓhār."
On folio 2a: "... wa-sammaytuhu bi-Natāʼij al-afkār ..."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with: "... naḥwa lā rajula ẓarīfun bi-al-rafʻ, wa-ẓarīfan bi-al-naṣb, wa-immā maʻṭūfah nakirah bi-lā takrīr lā, fa-yurfaʻu ḥamlan ʻalá maḥallihi al-baʻīd, wa-yunṣabu ḥamlan ʻalá lafẓihi, aw, maḥallihi al-qarīb, wa-lā yajūzu bināʼuhu li-wujūd al-faṣl bi-al-ʻāṭif, wa-li-dhā lam yataʻarraḍ la-hu, li-anna kalāmahu fī jāʼiz al-bināʼ, wa-innamā lam yataʻarraḍ li-ḥukm sāʼir al-tawābiʻ ayḍan li-annahu lā naṣṣa ʻanhum fīhā, ghayra annahu naqala ʻan al-Andalusī anna mā ʻadāhumā tawābiʻ al-munādá. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Ḍawʼ al-Miṣbāḥ : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Qazwīnī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "[Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm]. Inna: Min al-ḥurūf al-mushabbahah bi-al-fiʻl, al-nāṣibah lil-ism wa-al-rāfiʻah lil-khabar. Fa-ismuhu aḥaqq: Tafḍīl lil-ḥaqq, min ḥaqqa al-amr idhā thabuta, aw, min ḥaqqaqtuhu idhā athbattuhu, aw, min ḥaqq al-fiʻl idhā wajaba, aw, lil-ḥaqīq, bi-maʻná al-jadīd. Wa-li-kull wajh: Muḍāf ilá 'mā' mawṣūlah, bi-maʻná alladhī, aw, mawṣūfah, bi-maʻná shayʼ wa-ṣilatihi, aw, ṣifattihi. Yatawashshaḥ: Yatazayyan, muṭāwiʻ washaḥa; yuqālu: Washshaḥtuhā fa-tawashshaḥat, aṣluhu min al-wishāḥ, wa-huwa shayʼ yunsaju min adīm ʻarīḍan wa-yuraṣṣaʻu bi-al-jawāhir, wa-tashudduhu al-marʼah bayna ʻātiqihā wa-kashḥihā. Maʻa mā baʻdahu: Aʻnī qawluhu bi-dhikrihi. Ṣudūr: Jamʻ ṣadr, bi-maʻná awwal; wa-fī al-Ṣiḥāḥ: Ṣadru kull shayʼ awwaluhu, ay, awāʼil. al-Kutub: Jamʻ kitāb, wa-huwa maʻrūf. Wa-al-dafātir: Wa-hiya al-karārīs ..."
Secundo folio: lākin al-murād hunā al-bayāḍ.
13 x 18.3 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 12.8 cm; 20 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding; dark brown leather on spine.

In medium and good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; numerous commentaries on the margins and interlinear; the phrases of "Ḍawʼ al-Miṣbāḥ" preceded by the phrase "Qāla al-Sharḥ" (the Commentator said) in red; markings in red; catchwords.
On the back of the front cover: "Yā Kubaykij. Maʻrūf Karjī."
On the back of the front cover (in pencil): "Sharḥ al-Lubāb fī al-naḥw" (probably "al-Lubāb fī ʻilm al-iʻrāb" of Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Isfarāyīnī, died 1285).
At the head of the preliminary leaf 1: "Qāḍī Juq."
On the preliminary leaf 1: An owner's statement: "Hādhā kitāb Qāḍī Juq. Ṣāḥibuhu ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz. Qad malaktuhu bi-shirāʼ ṣaḥīḥ. Qīmatuhu Rublah 35 [35 Rubles]."

On preliminary leaf 1: Illegible statements in the Latin script, an illegible stamp and a statement in Ottoman Turkish in five lines, titled "ʻAn matrūkāt Jaʻfar Bāshā [About the bequests of Jaʻfar Bashā]."

On the upper left corner of preliminary leaf 1: A teacher's note, dated beginning of Muḥarram, 1121 of the Hijrah (13 March 1709), in al-Qusṭanṭīnīyah (Istanbul), as follows: "Badaʼto bi-ifādatihi wa-taʻlīmihi fī maḥrūsat Qusṭanṭīnīyah, fī Madrasat ʻAlī Bāshā ʻAtīq, fī awwal al-Muḥarram, sanat aḥad wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼah wa-alf min Hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf, al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilayhi Muḥammad Madarsawī."
On folio 1a: Miscellaneous quotations in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish."
On folio 1a: An owner's statement: "Kitāb Qāḍī Juq. Ishtaraytu hādhā al-kitāb li-ajl waladī Muḥammad ibn Shams al-Dīn."
On the front of the back cover: "Qāḍī Jīq."

On folio 95b: A statement indicating that the commentary on the commentary of book one is completed and will be continued by the commentary on the commentary of book two, as follows: "Tamma Sharḥ Sharḥ al-bāb al-awwal bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi; fa-al-ān nashraʻu mustaʻīnan billāh fī Sharḥ Sharḥ al-bāb al-thānī; innahu walī al-iʻānah. al-Bāb al-thānī: Fī al-ʻawāmil al-lafẓīyah al-qiyāsīyah. Qaddamnā al-qiyāsīyah li-iṭṭirādihā. Qāla al-shāriḥ: Lā khafāʼa anna al-muṭṭarid yastaḥiqqu al-taqdīm ʻalá ghayr al-muṭṭarid, li-anna mā lā yaṭṭaridu fī kalāmihim jará majrá al-shādhdh al-nādir, ay, al-sāqiṭ ʻan al-qiyās ..."
At the end of the colophon: Two collation statements, as follows: "Balagha muqābalatan [The collation is completed]." and "Takarrara muqābalatan [The collation is repeated]."
Colophon (folio 122a): "Tamma Sharḥ Sharḥ al-bāb al-thānī bi-ḥusn ʻināyat Allāh taʻālá wa-ḥusn al-tawfīq, tārīkh sanat sabʻ wa-arbaʻīn wa-tisʻimiʼah. Tammat."

Translation of the colophon: "The Commentary on the Commentary on chapter two was completed by the benevolent care of God Almighty and good fortune, in the year 947 [of the Hijrah = 1540/1541]. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Iʻrāb al-Ājurrūmīyah : manuscript / Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī.
record.note: Title of Iʻrāb al-Ājurrūmīyah from folio 1a.
Title of al-Masʼalah al-mulaffaqah wa-al-jawāb ʻanhā min al-arbaʻat madhāhib from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Iʻrāb al-Ājurrūmīyah (folio 1b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá mā anʻama, wa-ashkuruhu ʻalá mā fahhama wa-ʻallama, wa-uṣallī wa-usallimu ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-Nabī al-karīm, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi <wa-sallam>. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-ghanī, Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī, ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-luṭfihi al-khafī: Bismi: Jār wa-majrūr, mutaʻalliq bi-maḥdhūf ittifāqan, wa-qaddarahu baʻḍuhum fiʻlan, naẓaran ilá annahu al-aṣl fī al-ʻamal lil-afʻāl, wa-qaddarahu baʻḍuhum maṣdaran marfūʻan ʻalá al-ibtidá [al-ibtidāʼ] naẓaran ilá anna al-maqām maqām abtadī, wa-al-taqdīr ʻalá al-awwal: Bismi Allāh abtadiʼ, wa-innamā qaddarnāhu mutaʼakhkhiran ṭalaban lil-ikhtiṣāṣ wa-al-ihtimām, wa-al-taqdīr ʻalá al-thānī Bismi Allāh ibtidāʼī ..."
Secundo folio of "Iʻrāb al-Ājurrūmīyah": wa-al-taqdīr ibtidāʼī mustaqirr.

Incipit of al-Masʼalah al-mulaffaqah wa-al-jawāb ʻanhā min al-arbaʻat madhāhib (folio 39b): "Ṣūrat al-Masʼalah al-mulaffaqah min al-arbaʻat madhāhib ʻalá mā raʼaytuhu bi-khaṭṭ baʻḍihim: Mā qawlukum, dāma faḍlukum, fī shurūṭ nikāḥ al-ṣabī alladhī yaṣiḥḥu nikāḥuhu bi-hā, bi-ḥaythu idhā wujidat ṣaḥḥa wa-ḥaṣala bi-hi al-taḥlīl lil-muṭallaqah thalāthan, wa-idhā takhallafat aw takhallafa sharṭ minhā lā yaṣiḥḥu nikāḥuhu wa-lā yaḥṣulu al-taḥlīl. Afīdū al-jawāb ..."
Secundo folio of "al-Masʼalah al-mulaffaqah wa-al-jawāb ʻanhā min al-arbaʻat madhāhib": al-sharīf laʻana Allāh al-muḥallil wa-al-muḥallal la-hu.
15.3 x 20.3 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 15.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; brown leather on spine and flap.

1. "Iʻrāb al-Ājurrūmīyah": In large and good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; phrases of al-Ājurrūmīyah in purple; markings in red; catchwords. 2. "al-Masʼalah al-mulaffaqah wa-al-jawāb ʻanhā min al-arbaʻat madhāhib" is copied in a different hand, in fair naskh and black ink with catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb fī ʻilm al-naḥw, lil-Shaykh Khālid al-Azharī, Iʻrāb al-Ājurrūmīyah, ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-yalīhi ṣūrat al-Masʼalah al-mulaffaqah wa-al-jawāb ʻanhā min al-arbaʻat madhāhib."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Dakhala hādhā fī ḥiyāzat Muḥammad Amīn ibn al-marḥūm al-Ḥājj Mūsá Afandī, khādim al-ʻilm al-sharīf wa-khalīfat al-ṭarīqah al-Qādirīyah, wa-huwa min sulālat Sayyidī Abī Ayyūb al-Anṣārī, ṣāḥibī Sayyid al-Awwalīn wa-al-Ākhirīn, Sayyidinā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-azwājihi wa-zurrīyatihi [wa-dhurrīyatihi] wa-man tanāsala minhum ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Āmīn. Thumma innī qad aʻṭaytu hādhā al-kitāb ilá thamarat fuʼādī, waladī Ibrāhīm Kāmil yataṣarrafu fīhi kayfa yashāʼ fī fiʻl al-khayrāt li-ikhwānihi al-Muslimīn, jaʻalahu Allāh min al-ʻulamāʼ al-fāʼidhīn [al-fāʼizīn] bi-riḍāʼ Allāh taʻālá, wa-min suʻadāʼ al-dārayn. Āmīn. Kātibuhu Muḥammad Amīn al-madhkūr bi-hādhā aʻlāh, wa-huwa wālid Ibrāhīm Kāmilah, ḥafiẓahu Allāh. Āmīn."
Colophon of "Iʻrāb al-Ājurrūmīyah": "Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-raḍiya Allāh ʻan baqīyat al-ṣaḥābah ajmaʻīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of "Iʻrāb al-Ajurrūmīyah": "God is more knowledgeable. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. May God be pleased with all the rest of the companions. Amen."

Colophon of "al-Masʼalah al-mulaffaqah wa-al-jawāb ʻanhā min al-arbaʻat madhāhib": "Fī Jumād al-Awwal, min shuhūr sanat alf wa-khamsah wa-sabʻīn Hijrīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-azká al-taḥīyah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of "al-Masʼalah al-mulaffaqah wa-al-jawāb ʻanhā min al-arbaʻat madhāhib": "In Jumād Awwal, of the year 1075 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and the purest peace be upon him. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah fī uṣūl ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah : manuscript / Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-ghanī, Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Abī Bakr al-Azharī, ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-luṭfihi al-khafī, wa-ajrāhu ʻalá ʻawāʼid birrihi al-ḥafī: al-Ḥamdu lillāh rāfiʻ maqām al-muntaṣibīn li-nafʻ al-ʻabīd al-khāfiḍīn janāḥahum lil-mustafīd, al-jāzimīn bi-anna tashīl al-naḥw ilá al-ʻulūm, min Allāh, min ghayr shakk wa-lā tardīd, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-muʻrib bi-al-lisān al-faṣīḥ ʻan mā fī ḍamīrihi min ghayr gharābah wa-lā tanāfur wa-lā taʻqīd, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ulī al-faṣāḥah wa-al-balāghah wa-al-tajrīd. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā sharḥ laṭīf li-alfāẓ al-Ājurrūmīyah fī uṣūl ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah, yantafiʻu bi-hi al-mubtadī, wa-lā yaḥtāju ilayhi al-muntahī, ʻamiltuhu lil-ṣighār fī al-fann wa-al-aṭfāl, lā lil-mumārisīn lil-ʻilm min fuḥūl al-rijāl ..."
Secundo folio: al-rijāl, ḥamalanī ʻalayhi Shaykh al-waqt.
15.7 x 21.3 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 15 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; light brown leather on spine and flap (in 8 quires, some numbered).
In beautiful naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; the phrases of al-Ājurrūmīyah in red; numerous commentaries on most of the leaves; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah fī uṣūl ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah, tālīf al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá al-Shaykh Khālid al-Azharī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: "ʻIddat karārīs 8 thamāniyah." "ʻIddat awrāq 76 sittah wa-sabʻīn."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements: 1. "Wa-hiya mulk al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad Munīf ibn al-Ḥājj Sulaymān Munīf ibn al-Ḥājj [...] al-Wakīl, ghafara Allāh taʻālá la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn." 2. "Thumma intaqala bi-al-bayʻ al-sharʻī ilá mulk al-faqīr Muḥammad al-ʻAlmāwī ibn ʻĀmir al-ʻAlmāwī al-Fayyūmī al-Ḥiṣrī."
On folio 70a: Two verses of poetry in praise of Arabic grammar, with parsing of the first verse.
On folio 70b: A sample letter in Ottoman Turkish, in 9 lines, dated: M 18, sanat 218 (probably 18 Muḥarram, 1218 = 7 April 1839).
On the endpaper: A love poem in a crude hand.

Colophon (folio 69a): "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā yassarahu Allāh taʻālá min ḥall alfāẓ al-Ājurrūmīyah li-Mawlānā farīd ʻaṣrihi wa-waḥīd dahrihi al-Shaykh Khālid al-Azharī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tammat. Tamām. M. M."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what God Almighty facilitated of the commentary on the phrases of al-Ājurrūmīyah of our Master, the unique of his time and the single of his era, al-Shaykh Khālid al-Azharī, may God Almighty have mercy upon him, and benefit us and all Muslims by him. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. It is completed. Completed. M. M."

Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā Sharḥ laṭīf li-alfāẓ al-Ājurrūmīyah fī uṣūl ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah, yantafiʻu bi-hi al-mubtadī, in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá, wa-lā yaḥtāju ilayhi al-muntahī, ʻamiltuhu lil-ṣighār fī al-fann wa-al-aṭfāl, lā lil-mumārisīn fī al-ʻilm min fuḥūl al-rijāl, ḥamalanī ʻalayhi Shaykh al-waqt wa-al-ṭarīqah, wa-maʻdin al-sulūk wa-al-ḥaqīqah, Sayyidī wa-Mawlāy, al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá, Sayyidī al-Shaykh ʻAbbās al-Azharī ..."
Secundo folio: al-naḥwīyīn, huwa al-lafẓ, ay al-ṣawt.
16 x 21.7 cm; written surface: 8 x 15.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 5 unnumbered quires).
In good and clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Ājurrūmīyah in red; catchwords.

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā dhakarnā ʻalá hādhihi al-Muqaddimah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh awwalan wa-ākhiran, bāṭinan wa-ẓāhiran. Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi yawm al-Ithnayn al-mushārak [al-mubārak], arbaʻah wa-ʻishrūn yawman min shahr Shawwāl, sanat 1271. Allāhumma yā ʻaẓīm al-minnah hab li-kātibihā al-Jannah, bi-jāh al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what we commented upon this Introduction. Praise be to God in the beginning and at the end, implicitly and explicitly. It was completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. Copied on blessed Monday, 24 days [having passed] from the month of Shawwāl, of the year 1271 [of the Hijrah = 10 July 1855]. O God of abundant benevolence, grant its author/copyist Paradise, by the grand status of the Prophet, may God pray on him and grant him peace."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah fī uṣūl ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah : manuscript / Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-ghanī, Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Abī Bakr al-Azharī, ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-luṭfihi al-khafī, wa-ajrāhu ʻalá ʻawāʼid birrihi al-ḥafī: al-Ḥamdu lillāh rāfiʻ maqām al-muntaṣibīn li-nafʻ al-ʻabīd, al-khāḍiʻīn janāḥahum lil-mustafīd, al-jāzimīn bi-anna tashīl al-naḥw ilá al-ʻulūm, mann Allāh, min ghayr shakk wa-lā tardīd, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, al-muʻrib bi-al-lisān al-faṣīḥ ʻammā fī ḍamīrihi min ghayr gharābah wa-lā tanāfur wa-lā taʻqīd, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ulī al-faṣāḥah wa-al-balāghah wa-al-tajrīd. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā Sharḥ laṭīf li-alfāẓ al-Ājurrūmīyah fī uṣūl ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah, yantafiʻu bi-hi al-mubtadī, in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá, wa-lā yaḥtāju ilayhi al-muntahī, ʻamiltuhu lil-ṣighār fī al-fann wa-al-aṭfāl, lā lil-mumārisīn fī al-ʻilm min fuḥūl al-rijāl, ḥamalanī ʻalayhi Shaykh al-waqt wa-al-ṭarīqah, wa-maʻdin al-sulūk wa-al-ḥaqīqah, Sayyidī wa-Mawlāy, al-ʻārif bi-Rabbihi al-ʻAlī, Sayyidī al-Shaykh ʻAbbās al-Azharī ..."
Secundo folio of Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah: huwa al-lafẓ ay al-ṣawt.

Incipit of Jawhart al-tawḥīd: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá ṣilātihi // thumma salām Allāh maʻ ṣalātihi. ʻAlá Nabīyin jāʼa bi-al-tawḥīdi // wa-qad khalā al-dīnu ʻan al-tawḥīdi. Fa-arshada al-khalqa li-dīni al-ḥaqqi // sayfuhu wa-hadyuhu lil-ḥaqqi ..."
17 x 24 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 16.5 cm; 22 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark brown leather on spine and flap (in 5 numbered quires).
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Ājurrūmīyah in red; some commentaries on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Shaykh Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Abī Bakr al-Azharī, ʻalá al-Ājurrūmīyah fī ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah, taʼlīf al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah wa-al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, Sayyidī wa-Mawlāy, al-Shaykh Khālid al-Azharī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi wa-bi-ʻulūmihi. Āmīn. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: A grammatical and logical definition of "al-Waḍʻ al-nawʻī" (Specific coining of words).

On folio 1a: Two riddles, as follows: 1. A riddle in three verses, without giving its explanation: "Innī raʼytu ghulāman // awratha qalbī khubālan. Qad ṣāra kalban wa-qirdan // wa-ṣāra baʻdu ghazālan. Wa-[lī] fī dhāka dalīlun // fī qawli Rabbī taʻālá." 2. A riddle in one verse with its explanation: "Wa-mā mithluhu fī al-nāsi illā mumallakan // abū ummihi ḥayyun abūhu yuqāribuh. Wa-al-maʻná: Wa-mā mithl al-mamdūḥ, ay, Ibrāhīm, fī al-nās ḥayyun yuqāribuhu wa-yushābihuhu fī al-faḍāʼil, illā mumallakan, ay, rajulan uʻṭiya al-mulk, wa-huwa Hishām, abū ummihi, ay, umm dhālika al-mumallak, abūhu, ay, Ibrāhīm al-mamdūḥ, ay, lā yumāthiluhu aḥad illā ibn ukhtihi, wa-huwa Hishām. A H."

Colophon of "Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah" (folio 48b): "Qāla al-muʼallif: Wa-hādhā ākhir mā aradnā dhikrahu ʻalá hādhihi al-Muqaddimah. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb, wa-Huwa ḥasbunā wa-niʻma al-wakīl, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah bi-ḥamd [Allāh] fī yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, thamāniyat yawman [ayyām] maḍat min shahr Shaʻbān al-mubārak, sanat alf wa-miʼatayn sitt wa-sabʻīn <Wa-Allāh aʻlam> khalat min baʻd al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah ʻalá sākinihā [muhājirihā] afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Tamma hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak ʻalá yad kātibihi li-nafsihi al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, rājī ʻafwa Rabbih al-Qadīr, Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥājj Ḥamad al-Fāwī baladan, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Khifnī ṭarīqatan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-li-ikhwānihi wa-li-kāffat al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. M."

Translation of the colophon of "Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah": "The author said: This is the end of what we intended to mention about this Introduction, but God is more knowledgeable of what is correct, to Him is the reference and returning. He suffices us and He is the best advocate. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, on his family and his companions and grant them peace. This blessed copy was completed, by the praise of [God], on blessed Thursday, eight days having passed from the blessed month of Shaʻbān, of the year 1276 [18 February 1860] <God is more knowledgeable> of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and peace be upon Him. This blessed book was completed by the hand of its copyist for himself, the poor and despised, who confesses his shortcoming and inadequacy, he who hopes for [the forgiveness] of his Mighty Lord, Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥājj Ḥamad, al-Fāwī baladan, al-Māliki madhhaban, al-Khifnī ṭarīqatan, may God forgive him, his parents, his teachers, his brethren and all and entire Muslims. Amen. M."

Jawharat al-tawḥīd ends abruptly with: "... Wa-ikhtīra an asmʼahu tawqīfīyah // kadhā al-ṣifātu fa-iḥfaẓ al-samʻīyah. Wa-kullu naṣṣin awhama al-tashbīhā // awwilhu aw fawwiḍ wa-rum tanzīhā. Wa-nazzih ..."
