Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā Sharḥ laṭīf li-alfāẓ al-Ājurrūmīyah fī uṣūl ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah, li-yanfaʻa bi-hā al-mubtadī, in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá, wa-lā yaḥtāju ilayhi al-muntahī, ʻamiltuhu lil-ṣighār fī al-fann wa-al-aṭfāl, lā lil-mumārisīn fī al-ʻilm min fuḥūl al-rijāl, ḥamalanī ʻalayhi Shaykh al-waqt wa-al-ṭarīqah, wa-maʻdin al-sulūk wa-al-ḥaqīqah, Sayyidī wa-Mawlāy, al-ʻārif bi-Rabbihi al-ʻAlī, Sayyidī al-Shaykh ʻAbbās al-Azharī ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-hamzah wa-al-mīm wa-hiya baʻḍ ḥurūf.
17 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 17.5 cm; 26 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; brown leather on spine and sides.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Ājurrūmīyah in red; some commentaries and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the back of the front cover: "Sharḥ al-Shaykh Khālid."
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah al-Shaykh Khālid ʻalá al-Ājurrūmīyah fī ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah, nafaʻanā Allāh taʻālá bi-hi. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: Miscellaneous quotations from Arabic poetry.
On the right side of the colophon: Quotations from al-Nawāwī and Ibn Khillikān about the death and funeral of Aḥmad ibn Ḥanbal in Baghdad.
On the left side of the colophon: An illegible stamp.

Colophon: "Tammat ʻalá yad kātibihā al-muftaqir ilá Mawlāhu al-Jawwād, ʻabduhu wa-faqīruhu [... ... ...] ʻufiya ʻanhu, wa-li-wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhihi al-nuskhah fī yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ al-mubārak, ʻishrīn shahr Shaʻbān al-muʻaẓẓam, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1174. Ashhada ʻalá nafsihi al-ʻabd al-faqīr [... ... ...] annahu awqafahā ʻalá ṭalabat al-ʻilm min zurrīyatihi [dhurrīyatihi] ishhādan ʻalayhi, waqfan ṣaḥīḥan sharʻīyan. Hādhā mā shahid bi-hi ʻalá nafsihi kadhālika taḥrīran fī tārīkhihi. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-Nabī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "It was completed by the hand of its copyist who is in need of his Abundant Giving Lord, the poor [... ... ...], may he be pardoned, his parents and all Muslims. O Lord of the Universe. This copy was completed on blessed Wednesday, the twentieth of the glorious month of Shaʻbān, of the year 1174 [of the Hijrah = 27 March 1761]. The poor servant [... ... ...] bears witness on himself that he has made this copy an endowment to "ṭalabat al-ʻilm" (sudents of Islamic studies) from his descendants, testifying that the endowment is correct and legally authorized. This is what he attests on himself, also in writing, in the same date. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, the Illiterate Prophet, and his family and companions and grant them peace. Amen. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah : manuscript / Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Kafrāwī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala lughat al-ʻArab aḥsan al-lughāt, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-marfūʻ al-rutbah fawqa sāʼir al-makhlūqāt, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-manṣūbīn li-izālat shiyat al-ḍalālāt, ṣalātan wa-salāman dāʼimayn mutalāzimayn ilá yawm yukhfaḍu fīhi ahl al-zaygh, wa-yujzamu wa-tanqaṭiʻu fīhi al-taʻalluqāt. Wa-baʻd, fa-qad saʼalanī baʻḍ al-muḥibbīn ilayya al-mutaraddīn ʻalayya al-marrah baʻda al-marrah an ashraḥ matn al-Ājurrūmīyah lil-Imām al-Ṣinhājī sharḥan laṭīfan yakūnu mushtamilan ʻalá bayān al-maʻná wa-iʻrāb al-kalimāt, wa-an ukthira fīhi min al-amthilah, li-mā annahu lam yaqaʻ la-hā sharḥ ʻalá hādhihi al-ṣifāt ..."
Secundo folio: ʻibārat al-Kūfīyīn wa-al-jarr ʻibārat al-Baṣrīyīn.
15 x 21 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding with central medallion.

In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Ājurrūmīyah in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; some leaves seem to be missing after folio 1, as is evident from the text and the catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-Shaykh Ḥasan al-Kafrāwī ʻalá matn al-Ājurrūmīyah fī ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah, ghafara Allāh la-hu. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: A partially legible statement by the copyist/owner: "Katabahu li-nafsihi wa-li-man [...] min baʻdihi, al-faqīr [... ... ...] al-Ḥanafī."
On the upper left corner of folio 1a: "Yā Kubaykij iḥfaẓ hādhā min al-ʻaraḍah [al-araḍah]."
On the upper left corners at the beginning of some quires, ownership statements, as follows: "Aḥmad al-Salmūnī" and "Mulk Aḥmad al-Salmūnī."

Colophon: "Wa-qad intahat tatimmat mā ʻallaqahu Ustādhunā al-ʻAllāmah al-Shaykh Ḥasan al-Kafrāwī al-Shāfiʻī ʻalá matn al-Ājurrūmīyah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi. M. M."

Translation of the colophon: "Completed is the rest of the commentary of our teacher the learned scholar al-Shaykh Ḥasan al-Kafrāwī al-Shāfiʻī on the text of al-Ājurrūmīyah. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and his family. M. M."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah : manuscript / Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Kafrāwī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala lughat al-ʻArab aḥsan al-lughāt, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-marfūʻ al-rutbah fawqa sāʼir al-makhlūqāt, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-manṣūbīn li-izālat shubah al-ḍalālāt, ṣalātan wa-salāman dāʼimayn mutalāzimayn ilá yawm tukhfaḍu fīhi ahl al-zaygh, wa-yujzamu wa-tuqṭaʻu fīhi al-taʻalluqāt. Ammā baʻd, fa-qad saʼalanī baʻḍ al-muḥibbīn ilayya, al-mutaraddīn ʻalayya al-marrah baʻda al-marrah an ashraḥ matn al-Ājurrūmīyah lil-Imām al-Ṣinhājī sharḥan laṭīfan yakūnu mushtamilan ʻalá bayān al-maʻná wa-iʻrāb al-kalimāt, wa-an ukthira fīhi min al-amthilah, li-mā annahu lam yaqaʻ la-hā sharḥ ʻalá hādhā [hādhihi] al-ṣifāt ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-fāʻil ḍamīr mustatir fīhi wujūban.
16.5 x 24 cm; written surface: 10 x 15.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; black cloth on spine and flap.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Ājurrūmīyah in red; few commentaries and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Kafrāwī, taʼlīf al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, al-Shaykh Ḥasan al-Kafrāwī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. ʻalá al-tamām. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: A date: "Sanat 1165 Hijrīyah [= 1751/1752]."
On folio 3b: Two illegible stamps.
On folio 7a: Two ownership statements, as follows: "Mulk al-faqīr Imbābī Salīm, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-imtalakahu minhu bi-al-bayʻ Ibrāhīm Furayj."
On folio 19b: An ownership statement, as follows: "Mukk al-faqīr Aḥmad Muḥammad [... ...]."

On folio 27b: An ownership statement, as follows: "Hādhā taʻallaqahu al-faqīr al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-qadīr Aḥmad Muḥammad, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu bi-faḍlihi al-ʻamīm, bi-jāh Sayyid al-Awwalīn wa-al-Ākharīn, Sayyidinā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi [wa-sallam]."
On folio 42b: An illegible stamp.
On folio 54b: An ownership statement, as follows: "Mulk al-faqīr al-Shaykh Ḥamādah [al-Mishkāmī (?)]."
On folio 56b: An ownership statement, as follows: "Mulk al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muḍṭar ilá raḥmat Rabbihi Ḥamādah, ghafara Allāh [la-hu], wa-lī mashāyikhihi [wa-li-mashāyikhihi]. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 57a: An ownership statement, as follows: "Mulk al-faqīr Aḥmad."
On folio 83a: An ownership statement, as follows: "Mulk al-faqīr Ibrāhīm Furayj."

On folio 98b: Three ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Mulk al-faqīr Ṣadaqah, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-lī [wa-li-wālidayhi]." 2. "Mulk faqīr Ḥamādah Ṣadaqah ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz." 3. "al-Faqīr Ḥamādah Ṣadaqah ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz."
At the end of the colophon: A Hijrī date: "Sanat 1267 [= 1850/1851]."
On the left side of the colophon: A Hijrī date: "Fī Ramaḍān al-muʻaẓẓam, sanat 1201 [= June/July 1787]."
Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb wa-ilyahi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and companions and grant them peace. Amen. It is completed."

record.title: 880-03 al-Ājurrūmīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ājurrūm.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Kalām huwa al-lafẓ al-murakkab al-mufīd bi-al-waḍʻ, wa-aqsāmuhu thalāthah: ism wa-fiʻl wa-ḥarf jāʼa li-maʻná. Fa-al-ism yuʻrafu bi-al-khafḍ wa-al-tanwīn wa-dukhūl al-alif wa-al-lām wa-ḥurūf al-khafḍ, wa-hiya: Min wa-ilá wa-ʻan wa-ʻalá wa-fī wa-rubba wa-al-bāʼ wa-al-kāf wa-al-lām wa-ḥurūf al-qasam, wa-hiya al-wāw wa-al-bāʼ wa-al-tāʼ. Wa-al-fiʻl yuʻrafu bi-qad wa-al-sīn wa-sawfa wa-tāʼ al-taʼnīth al-sākinah. Wa-al-ḥarf mā lā yaṣluḥu maʻahu dalīl al-ism wa-lā dalīl al-fiʻl ..."
Secundo folio: fīhā wa-lil-afʻāl min dhālika.
11 x 15.5 cm; written surface: 7 x 11.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In good and large naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; catchwords.
Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb."
Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable of what is correct."

record.title: 880-02 al-Iḥrāz fī anwāʻ al-majāz : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 2b): "... wa-sammaytuhu 'al-Iḥrāz fī anwāʻ al-majāz' ..."
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Imām al-ʻārif bi-Mawlāhu wa-al-nāshiq min rawḍ al-maʻārif rayyāhu, al-ātī banānuhu bi-al-bayān, wa-al-mūlī al-maʻānī fī al-tibyān, badīʻ al-maʻānī al-daqīqah, wa-maṣdar talaqqī maʻrifat al-majāz wa-al-ḥaqīqah al-bāʻithah ilayhi li-faḍlihi al-dawāʻī, Sayyidī al-Shaykh Aḥmad najl al-Sujāʻī: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-hādī man yashāʼu ilá ṣirāṭihi al-mustaqīm, al-mubīn ḥaqīqat al-majāz ilá al-sharīʻat al-samaḥāʼ wa-al-dīn al-qawīm ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad.
17 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 6.5 x 13 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in three unnumbered quires).
In beautiful and large naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of the original poem in purple; some commentaries and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah al-Sujāʻī ʻalá 'Manẓūmatihi' fī al-majāz, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-biʻulūmihi. Āmīn."

The original poem of al-Sujāʻī starts with: Ḥamdan li-Rabbī khāliqi al-ḥaqīqati // kadhā al-majāzi Munzili al-Sharīʻati. Tumma ṣalātan lil-Rasūli al-hādī // wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-amjādi. It ends with: Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá mā qad hadā // maʻa al-salāmi lil-Nabīyi Aḥmadā. Wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-aʼimmah // wa-man qafāhum min jamīʻ al-ummah.
Folios 24-26 are blank; text folios 1b-23b.

Colophon: "Intahá. Askananā Allāh bi-mannihi al-Ghurfah al-ʻAlīyah, wa-jamaʻa lanā bayna khayray al-Dārayn, bi-jāh Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad khayr al-barīyah, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-kirām, wa-ʻalá sāʼir atbāʻihim, wa-ʻalaynā maʻahum ajmaʻīn bilā inqḍāʼ. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "It is completed. May God, by his benevolence, make us dwell in the Lofty Room, and grant us to have the blessings of the two Abodes, by the high status of our Master and Lord Muḥammad, the best of mankind, may God pray on him, his family, his noble companions, on all their followers, and on all of us with them, without cessation. Amen. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Mukhtaṣar Sharḥ Talkhīṣ al-Miftāḥ : manuscript / Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar al-Taftāzānī.
record.note: Title from printed versions.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Naḥmaduka yā man sharaḥa ṣudūranā li-talkhīṣ al-bayān fī īḍāḥ al-maʻānī, wa-nawwara qulūbanā bi-lawāmiʻ al-tibyān min maṭāliʻ al-mabānī [al-mathānī], wa-nuṣallī ʻalá Nabīyika Muḥammad, al-muʼayyid bi-[da]lāʼil al-iʻjāz bi-asrār al-balāghah, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-muḥrizīn qaṣabāt al-sabq fī miḍmār al-faṣāḥah wa-al-barāʻah. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Allāh al-ghanī, Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar, al-madʻū bi-Saʻd al-Taftāzānī, hadāhu Allāh sawāʼa al-ṭarīq, wa-adhāqahu ḥalāwat al-taḥqīq: Qad sharaḥtu fīmā maḍá 'Talkhīṣ al-Miftāḥ' fa-aghnaytuhu bi-al-iṣbāḥ ʻan al-miṣbāḥ, wa-awdaʻtuhu gharāʼib nukat samaḥat bi-hā al-anḍār [al-anẓār], wa-washshaḥtuhu bi-laṭāʼif fiqar sabakathā yad al-afkār, thumma raʼaytu al-kathīr min al-fuḍalāʼ, wa-al-jamm al-ghafīr min al-adhkiyāʼ yasʼalūnī [yasʼalūnanī] ṣarf al-himmah naḥwa ikhtiṣārih wa-al-iqtiṣār ʻalá bayān maʻānīhi wa-kashf astārih ..."
Secundo folio: bi-baqīyat āthār al-salaf adrāj al-riyāḥ.
16.5 x 22.3 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 13.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Talkhīṣ Miftāḥ al-ʻulūm" in red many commentaries on the first 28 leaves; folios 176-183 are written in a different hand; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb ʻArūs al-afrāḥ ʻalá Talkhīṣ al-Miftāḥ, taʼlīf al-Imām al-ʻālim al-muḥaqqiq Saʻd al-Dīn Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar al-Taftāzānī, ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-mā huwa ahluhu. Āmīn."
"ʻArūs al-afrāḥ" is a commentary by al-Subkī (Taqī al-Dīn ʻAlī ibn ʻAbd al-Kāfī, 1284-1355), not by al-Taftāzānī.

On folio 1a: A reader's statement: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Kāna shurūʻunā fī qirāʼat hādhā al-sharḥ ʻalá Sayyidinā al-Qāḍī al-ʻAllāmah Ḥasan ibn Ismāʻīl al-Maghribī [... ... ...], thālith ʻashar shahr [... ...], sanat 1180 [... ... ...], bi-ḥaqq Muḥammad wa-ālihi [... ... ...]."

Colophon: "Khatam Allāh lanā bi-al-khayr wa-al-ḥusná, wa-yassara lanā al-fawz bi-al-dhukhr al-asná, bi-ḥaqq al-Nabbī wa-ālihi al-akramīn wa-ṣaḥbih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām. Tamma al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim ilá Allāh. Wa-Huwa ḥasbunā wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam taslīman. Ghafara Allāh li-kātibihi wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Allāhumma. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "May God seal our life with a happy end, and enable us to attain the splendid treasure, by the intercession of the Prophet and his honorable family and his companions. Praise be to God for the completion [of the book]. The book was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King, by the hand of the poorest of mankind and the neediest to God. He suffices us. He is the best advocate. There is no power nor might except in God, the Most High, the All Powerful. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and his family and grant them abundant peace. May God forgive its copyist, his parents and all Muslims. Amen. O God. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 al-Tabarrī min maʻarrat al-Maʻarrī : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Ḥāfiẓ al-Suyūṭī: Dakhala yawman Abū al-ʻAlāʼ al-Maʻarrī ʻalá al-Sharīf al-Murtaḍá, fa-ʻathara bi-rajul, fa-qāla al-rajul: Man hādhā al-kalb? fa-qāla Abū al-ʻAlāʼ: al-Kalb man lā yaʻrifu lil-kalb sabʻīna isman. Qultu: Qad tatabbaʻtu kutub al-lughah fa-ḥaṣṣaltuhā, wa-qad naẓamtuhā fī urjūzah sammaytuhā 'al-Tabarrī min maʻarrat al-Maʻarrī', wa-hiya hādhihi: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Lillāhi ḥamdun dāʼimu al-walīyi // thumma ṣalātuhu ʻalá al-Nabī. Qad naqal al-thiqātu ʻan Abī al-ʻAlā // lammā atá lil-Murtaḍá wa-dakhalā. Qāla la-hu shkhṣun bi-hi qad ʻathara // Man dhālika al-kalbu alladhī mā abṣarā? Fa-qāla fī jawābihi qawlan jalī // muʻayyiran li-dhālika al-mujahhili. al-Kalbu man lam yadri min asmāʼihi // sabʻīna mūmiyan ilá ʻalāʼihi ..."
Secundo folio: Wa-thamthamun wa-kālibun wa-miblaʻun.
16.5 x 22.8 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 15.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire)
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; markings in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Risālah fī asmāʼ al-kalb, musammāh bi-al-Tabarrī min maʻarrat al-Maʻarrī, li-ḥāfiẓ ʻaṣrihi Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī, raḥimahu Allāh wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Āmīn."

On folio 9b: An anecdote about "Kalb al-māʼ, also called al-Qundus" (otter, beaver), and quotations from Ibn Diḥyah (probably Ibn Diḥyah al-Kalbī, ʻUmar ibn al-Ḥasan, 1149 or 1150-1235 or 1236), from ʻAjāʼib al-makhlūqāt (probably of al-Qazwīnī, Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad, approximately 1203-1283), and a riddle in five verses of poetry attributed to al-Sharīf al-Mūsawī (probably al-Sharīf al-Murtaḍá).
On folio 10a: Miscellaneous quotations about dogs.
The "Urjūzah" of al-Suyūṭī ends with: Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh hunā tamāmu // thumma ʻalá Nabīyihi al-salāmu.

Colophon: "Tammat al-Risālah, wa-ghālibuhā min khaṭṭ muʼallifihā, ḥāfiẓ waqtihi, al-Jalāl ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Suyūṭī, raḥimahu Allāh wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Wa-qad ṣaḥḥaḥtuhā ʻalá khaṭṭ al-madhkūr, <sanah> fī Rabīʻ al-Thānī, sanat 1179."

Translation of the colophon: "The treatise is completed. Most of it was taken from the handwriting of its author, the 'ḥāfiẓ' (erudite scholar) of his time, al-Jalāl ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Suyūṭī, may God have mercy upon him and benefit us by him. I collated it with the handwritten copy of the afore mentioned author, during the month of Rabīʻ al-Thānī of the year 1179 [of the Hijrah = September/October 1765]."

record.title: 880-03 al-Kāfiyah : manuscript / ʻUthmān ibn ʻUmar ibn al-Ḥājib.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "[Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm]. al-Kalimah lafẓ wuḍiʻa li-maʻná mufrad; fa-hiya ism wa-fiʻl wa-ḥarf, li-annahā immā an tadulla ʻalá maʻná fī nafsihā, aw, lā. al-Thānī al-ḥarf. Wa-al-awwal immā an yaqtarina bi-aḥad al-zminah al-thalāthah aw lā. al-Thānī al-ism. wa-al-awwal al-fiʻl. Wa-qad ʻulima bi-dhālika ḥadd kull wāḥid minhā. al-Kalām mā taḍammana kalimatayn bi-al-isnād, wa-lā yataʼattá dhālika illā fī ismayn, aw, ism wa-fiʻl. Wa-al-ism mā dalla ʻalá maʻná fī nafsih ghayr muqtarin bi-aḥad al-azminah al-thalāthah, wa-min khawāṣṣihi dukhūl al-lām wa-al-jarr wa-al-tanwīn ..."
Secundo folio: al-thānī al-ism wa-al-awwal al-fiʻl.
9.5 x 14.8 cm; written surface: 4 x 10.5 cm; 7 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding with flap.

In good Farsī script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; text within red frames surrounded with larger frames, leaving space for the many notes and commentaries that are present; ample space between the lines for interlinear commentaries that are also present; catchwords.
On the front of the preliminary leaf: "Kitāb Kāfiyah sharīf."
On the back of the preliminary leaf: "Ṣāḥib kitāb ʻAbd al-Wahhāb. Sanat 1200 [of the Hijrah = 1785/1786]."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with: "... al-Tanwīn nūn sākinah tatbaʻu ḥarakat al-ākhir, lā li-taʼkīd al-fiʻl, wa-huwa lil-tamakkun wa-al-tankīr wa-al-ʻiwaḍ wa-al-muqābalah wa-al-tarannum, wa-yuḥdhaf min al-ʻalam. Wa-min thammata qīla: Hal tarīna wa-tarūna wa-tarīnna wa-ughzuwanna wa-ughzunna wa-ighzinna, wa-al-mukhaffafah tiḥdhafu lil-sākinayn wa-fī al-waqf, fa-yuraddu mā yuḥdhafu wa-al-maftūḥ mā qablahā tuqlabu alifan."
At the back of the endpaper: A statement in Ottoman Turkish, dated 5 R 1 (Rabīʻ Awwal), Jahārshanbah, 1139 of the Hijrah (Wednesday, 31 October 1726).

record.title: 880-02 al-Anwār al-bahīyah fī sharḥ Naẓm al-Ājurrūmīyah : manuscript / Ḥusayn ibn Muḥammad al-Maḥallī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī rafaʻa maqām aḥbābih, wa-naṣaba la-hum manābira min nūr yawma ḥisābih, wa-aṣlaḥa aḥwālahum li-nidāʼihi wa-khiṭābih, wa-khafaḍa aʻdāʼahu bi-ʻilal ʻiqābih, fa-juzimū bi-ʻadam al-wuṣūl ilá ladhīdh sharābih. Aḥmaduhu ḥamda mawṣūf bi-jazīl thawābih, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lah shahādatan nanjū bi-hā min ʻadhābih, wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh wa-ṣafwat anjābih, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-muʻribīn bi-al-lisān al-faṣīḥ ʻan khiṭābih. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr Ḥusayn ibn Muḥammad al-Maḥallī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn, wa-jaʻalahu sāliman min al-naqṣ fī Yawm al-Dīn: Hādhā sharḥ laṭīf ʻalá al-Manẓūmah al-Ājurrūmīyah fī ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah, naẓm al-Shaykh al-Imām al-shahīr bi-al-ʻAmrīṭī, yaḥullu alfāẓahā wa-yubayyinu murādahā, sālikan fīhi aqrab al-masālik, li-yarghaba fīhi man huwa ahl li-dhālik, rājiyan min Allāh al-qabūl wa-bulūgh al-maʼmūl, fa-innahu khayr masʼūl. Wa-sammaytuhu 'al-Anwār al-bahīyah fī sharḥ Naẓm al-Ajurrūmīyah' ..."
Secundo folio: lā yaʻlamūn fa-al-ʻulamāʼ hum khayr khalq Allāh.
15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 10 x 16.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 3 unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of Naẓm al-Ajurrūmīyah and markings in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb yusammá al-Anwār al-bahīyah fī sharḥ Naẓm al-Ājurrūmīyah, lil-faqīr Ḥusayn al-Maḥallī al-Shāfiʻī, ʻufiya ʻanhu. Āmīn. M."

Naẓm al-Ājurrūmīyah of al-ʻAmrīṭī was complete in Jumādá (al-Ūlá - al-Thānīyah) of the year 976 of the Hijrah (November - December 1568). It starts with: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī qad waffaqa // lil-ʻilmi khayra khalqihi wa-lil-tuqá. Ḥattá naḥat qulūbuhum li-naḥwihi // lākin li-ʻiẓmi shaʼnihi lam taḥwihi. Fa-ushribat maʻná ḍamīri al-shāni // fa-aʻrabat fī al-ḥāni bi-al-alḥāni ..." It ends with: "Fa-Yā Ilāhī ilṭif bi-nā fa-nattabiʻ // subla al-rashādi wa-al-hudá fa-nartafiʻ. Wa-fī Jumādá al-sādisi al-sabʻīnā // baʻda intihāʼi tisʻatin miʼīnā. Qad tamma naẓmu hādhihi al-muqaddiamah // fī rubʻi alfin kāfiyan man aḥkamah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh madā al-dawāmi // ʻalá jazīli al-faḍli wa-al-inʻāmi. Naẓmu al-faqīri al-mushrifi al-ʻAmrīṭī // Dhū al-ʻidhri wa-al-taqṣīri wa-al-tafrīṭi. Wa-afḍalu al-ṣalāti wa-al-taslīmi // ʻalá al-Nabī al-Muṣṭafá al-Karīmi. Muḥammadin wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-al-āli // ahli al-tuqá wa-al-ʻilmi wa-al-kamāli."
Folios 29-30 are blank.

Author's colophon: "Wa-fī hādhā al-sharḥ kifāyah lil-mubtadī, jaʻalahu Allāh nāfiʻan, wa-li-ʻadam al-futūḥ dāfiʻan, bi-mannihi wa-karamih. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Qad furigha minhu fī ʻāshir al-Muḥarram, sanat 1165. Āmīn. Āmīn. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This commentary is sufficient for the beginner. May God render it useful and a repellant for failures, by His benevolence and generosity. Amen. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. Completed on the tenth of Muḥarram, of the year 1165 [29 November 1751]. Amen. Amen. O Lord of the Universe."

Copyist's colophon: "Nuqilat min al-musawwadah lil-faqīr Ḥusayn al-Maḥallī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Khutimat nahār al-Sabt al-mubārak, iḥdá wa-ʻishrīn khalat min shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat alf wa-miʼah sabʻah wa-thamānīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. M."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "Transcribed from the rough copy of the poor Ḥusayn al-Maḥallī al-Shāfiʻī, may God forgive him, his parents and the Muslims. Amen. Amen. Amen. Completed on blessed Saturday, 21 nights having passed from the month of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, of the year 1187 [of the Hijrah = 12 June 1773]. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. M."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah fī uṣūl ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah : manuscript / Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī.
record.note: Title from folio reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-ghanī, Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Abī Bakr al-Azharī, ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-luṭfihi al-khafī, wa-ajrāhu ʻalá ʻawāʼid birrihi al-khafī [al-ḥafī]: al-Ḥamdu lillāh rāfiʻ maqām al-muntaṣibīn li-nafʻ al-ʻabīd, al-khāfiḍīn janāḥahum lil-mustafīd, al-jāzimīn bi-anna tashīl al-naḥw ilá al-ʻulūm, mann Allāh, min ghayr shakk wa-lā tardīd, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-muʻrib bi-al-lisān al-faṣīḥ ʻammā fī ḍamīrihi min ghayr gharābah wa-lā tanāfur wa-lā taʻqīd, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ulī al-faṣāḥah wa-al-balāghah wa-al-tajrīd. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā Sharḥ laṭīf li-alfāẓ al-Ājurrūmīyah fī uṣūl ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah, yantafiʻu bi-hi al-mubtadī, wa-lā yaḥtāju ilayhi al-muntahī, ʻamiltuhu lil-ṣighār fī al-fann wa-al-aṭfāl, lā lil-mumārisīn fī al-ʻilm min fuḥūl al-rijāl, ḥamalanī ʻalayhi Shaykh al-waqt wa-al-ṭarīqah, wa-maʻdin al-sulūk wa-al-ḥaqīqah, Sayyidī wa-Mawlāy, al-ʻārif bi-Rabbihi al-ʻAlī, Sayyidī al-Shaykh ʻAbbās al-Azharī ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-dāl wa-al-qāf wa-al-alif wa-al-hamzah.
16 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16.5 cm; 23-29 lines per page.
Binding: In pink cardboard with black cloth on spine.
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Ājurrūmīyah and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah al-Shaykh al-Azharī, raḥimahu Allāh, nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi al-ṭālibīn."

On folio 1a: Partially legible ownership statement, dated in the year 1269 of the Hijrah (1852/1853): "Dakhala fī nawbat [...] ibn al-Ḥājj [... ... ...] la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-athābahu wa-athābahumā al-Jannah, bi-faḍlihi wa-jūdihi wa-karamih, [innahu] ʻalá mā yashāʼu qadīr wa-bi-al-ijābah jadīr. Sanat 1269."
On folio 26a, in a crude and different hand: An attempt to parse the statement "Lā ilāha illā Allāh".

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā awradnā dhikrahu ʻalá hādhihi al-Muqaddimah. Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-ahl baytihi al-ṭayyibīn al-ṭāhirīn wa-sallama taslīman kathir [kathīran], nahār al-Ithnayn, fī Ṣafar al-khayr, sanat 1269. Raḥima Allāh kātibahu Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥājj Muṣṭafá al-Turkah, wa-muʼallifahu al-Sayyid Khālid al-Azharī, raḥmatan wāsiʻah. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what we intended to mention about this Introduction. It was completed by the praise of God and His help. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family, his companions and the people of his household, the virtuous and the pure, and grant them abundant peace, on Monday in Ṣafar [probably the second day of the month = 15 November 1852]. May God have abundant mercy upon its copyist Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥājj Muṣṭafá al-Turkah, and its author al-Sayyid Khālid al-Azharī. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī ibn Manṣūr al-Bijāʼī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī naḥat naḥwahu qulūb aṣfiyāʼih, wa-aqarrat bi-rubūbīyatihi alsinat awliyāʼih, muʻribatan bi-al-faṣīḥ ʻammā fī ḍamīr ṣadrihim, muʻarrifatan bi-al-ṣaḥīḥ fī wurūdihim wa-ṣudūrihim, ḥamdan dāʼiman ʻalá mā fataqa wa-rataq, wa-uṣallī ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad alladhī naṭaqa fa-ṣadaqa ṣalātan dāʼimah abadan amad al-abad, fa-lā uḥṣī la-hā ʻadadan, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-sādah al-aṭhār wa-ṣaḥbihi al-kirām al-safarah al-abrār, mā adbara bi-ẓalāmihi layl wa-asfara bi-ḍiyāʼihi nahār. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi taʻlīqah sanīyah, mustaʻān bi-hā, in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá, ʻalá ḥall alfāẓ al-Jurrūmīyah [al-Ājūrrūmīyah], tuʻīnu al-rāghib wa-tunabbihu al-ṭālib, fa-al-mubtadī [fa-lil-mubtadī] mithlī tabṣirah, wa-al-ṭālib [wa-lil-ṭālib] al-niḥrīr tadhkirah, qāṣirah ʻan al-iṭnāb, sālimah min al-ishāb ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-ghamz ka-qawl al-ākhar ḥawājibunā.
15.5 x 20.7 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 11.2 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap.
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Ājurrūmīyah in red; some commentaries and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah lil-ʻAllāmah al-Bijāʼī, qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahu. Āmīn."
On the upper left corner of folio 2a: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Min niʻam Allāh subḥānuhu [wa-taʻālá ʻalá] ʻabdihi al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn [...] al-Ḥanbalī al-Imām [...]." And two illegible stamps.
On the left margin of folio 6a: A collation statement, as follows: "Balagha muqābalatan ʻalá ḥasab al-imkān."

Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb al-mubārak. Wa-hādhā ākhir mā tayassara min al-taʻlīq. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran dāʼiman ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi yawm al-Khamīs, awāsiṭ shahr Jumādá al-Ākhirah, sanat 1016. ʻAllaqahu li-nafsihi al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, Muḥammad ibn al-marḥūm ʻAbd al-Wāḥid al-Khawāyikī. Wa-hādhā al-kitāb Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah lil-ʻAllāmah al-Bijāʼī, raḥimahu Allāh."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed book is concluded. This is the end of what was facilitated of the commentary. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions, and grant them abundant and perpetual peace, until Judgement Day. Copied on Thursday, during the middle of Jumādá al-Ākhirah, of the year 1016 [of the Hijrah = 4 October 1607]. Copied for himself, by the poor who admits his disability and insufficiency, Muḥammad ibn al-marḥūm ʻAbd al-Wāḥid al-Khawāyikī. This book is 'Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah' of the Erudite scholar al-Bijāʼī, may God have mercy upon him."
