Incipit of the first copy of al-Ghunyah ʻan al-Munyah fī al-fiqh ʻalá madhhab al-Imām Abī Ḥanīfah al-Nuʻmān (folio 1b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā li-ṭāʻatih, wa-ijtanabanā ʻan maʻṣiyatih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl. Qāla Abū al-Layth: Fa-innī jamaʻtu masāʼil Munyat al-muṣallī fī hādhā al-kitāb, wa-Allāh al-muwaffiq lil-ṣawāb. Kitāb al-ṭahārah. Qāla, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Li-kull shayʼ ʻilm, wa-ʻilm al-īmān al-ṣalāh. Masʼalah: Mā al-farq bayna al-īmān wa-al-kufr. Jawābuhā: Tark al-ṣalāh ..."
Secundo folio of the first copy of al-Ghunyah ʻan al-Munyah fī al-fiqh ʻalá madhhab al-Imām Abī Ḥanīfah al-Nuʻmān: Jawābuhā lā yathbutu min al-ṣalāh.

Incipit of the second copy of al-Ghunyah ʻan al-Munyah fī al-fiqh ʻalá madhhab al-Imām Abī Ḥanīfah al-Nuʻmān (folio 39b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā li-ṭāʻatih, wa-ijtanabanā ʻan maʻṣiyatih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl. Qāla Abū al-Layth: Fa-innī jamaʻtu masāʼil Munyat al-muṣallī fī hādhā al-kitāb, wa-Allāh al-muwaffiq lil-ṣawāb. Kitāb al-ṭahārah. Qāla, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Li-kull shayʼ ʻilm, wa-ʻilm al-īmān al-ṣalāh. Masʼalah: Mā al-farq bayna al-īmān wa-al-kufr. Jawābuhā: Tark al-ṣalāh ..."
Secundo folio of the second copy of al-Ghunyah ʻan al-Munyah fī al-fiqh ʻalá madhhab al-Imām Abī Ḥanīfah al-Nuʻmān: raʼs wa-ghasl al-rijlayn ilá al-kaʻbayn.

Incipit of Shurūṭ al-ṣalāh (folio 69b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Bāb shurūṭ al-ṣalāh, wa-hiya thamāniyah. al-Awwal: al-Wuḍūʼ bi-al-māʼ al-muṭlaq, aw al-tayammum bi-al-turāb ʻinda ʻadam al-māʼ. Wa-al-thānī: Ṭahārat al-thawb min al-najāsah al-khafīfah wa-al-ghalīẓah ..."
Secundo folio of Shurūṭ al-ṣalāh: al-madhkūrah fasudat ṣalātuhu.

Incipit of Muqaddimah fī al-ṣalāh (folio 74b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ʻāfiyah lil-muttaqīn, wa-lā ʻudwāna illā ʻalá al-ẓālimīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Qāla al-Faqīh Abū al-Layth al-Samarqandī, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayh: Iʻlam bi-anna al-ṣalāh farīḍah qāʼimah wa-sharīʻah thābitah, wa-ʻurifat farīḍatuhā bi-al-Kitāb wa-al-Sunnah wa-ijmāʻ al-ummah ..."
Secundo folio of Muqaddimah fī al-ṣalāh: al-Nabī ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam.
16 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 11 x 16 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In dark red leather with flap; central medallion on cover and flap.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; headings and keywords in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Ghunyah ʻan al-Munyah fī al-fiqh ʻalá madhhab al-Imām Abī Ḥanīfah al-Nuʻmān, raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn. Wa-yalīhi Shurūṭ al-ṣalāh. Wa-yalīhi Muqaddimat Abū al-Layth."
On folio 39a: "Kitāb al-Ghunyah ʻan al-Munyah fī al-fiqh ʻalá madhhab al-Imām Abī Ḥanīfah al-Nuʻmān, raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-yalīhi Shurūṭ al-ṣalāh. Wa-yalīhi Muqaddimat Abī al-Layth."
On folio 69a: "Kitāb Shurūṭ al-ṣalāh ʻalá madhhab al-Imām al-Aʻẓam Abī Ḥanīfah al-Nuʻmān, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."
On folio 74a: "Kitāb Muqaddimat Abī al-Layth al-Samarqandī ʻalá madhhab Abī Ḥanīfah al-Nuʻmān, raḥimahu Allāh raḥmatan wāsiʻah wa-nafaʻa bi-ʻulūmihi al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Colophon of the first copy of al-Ghunyah ʻan al-Munyah fī al-fiqh ʻalá madhhab al-Imām Abī Ḥanīfah al-Nuʻmān: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu [lillāh] Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon of the first copy of al-Ghunyah ʻan al-Munyah fī al-fiqh ʻalá madhhab al-Imām Abī Ḥanīfah al-Nuʻmān: "Praise be to God alone. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and his companions and grant them abundant peace until Judgement Day. Praise be [to God] Lord of the Universe."

Colophon of the second copy of al-Ghunyah ʻan al-Munyah fī al-fiqh ʻalá madhhab al-Imām Abī Ḥanīfah al-Nuʻmān: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon of the second copy of al-Ghunyah ʻan al-Munyah fī al-fiqh ʻalá madhhab al-Imām Abī Ḥanīfah al-Nuʻmān: "Praise be to God alone. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and his companions, and grant them abundant peace until Judgement Day. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. Amen. It is completed."
Colophon of Shurūṭ al-ṣalāh: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Tammat 'Shurūṭ al-ṣalāh' bi-ḥamdihi wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of Shurūṭ al-ṣalāh: "God is more knowledgeable. 'Shurūṭ al-ṣalāh' is completed by His [God's] praise, His help, and His abundant benevolence. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. Amen. Amen."

Colophon of Muqaddimah fī al-ṣalāh: "Tammat Muqaddimat Abī al-Layth bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of Muqaddimah fī al-ṣalāh: "Muqaddimat Abī al-Layth (Introduction of Abī al-Layth) was completed by the praise of God Almighty, His help and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and companions. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 al-Zahr al-ghāʼif fī Mawlid Ashraf al-Khalāʼiq : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Suḥaymī.
record.note: Title of al-Zahr al-ghāʼif fī Mawlid Ashraf al-Khalāʼiq from folio 2a.
Title of the second manuscript "Mawlid al-Nabī" supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of al-Zahr al-ghāʼif fī Mawlid Ashraf al-Khalāʼiq (folio 1b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī manna ʻalaynā bi-ījād al-Muṣṭafá ashraf al-khalāʼiq, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi dhawī al-qadr al-fāʼiq. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-ghanī, Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Suḥaymī al-Azharī al-Ḥasanī: Inna laylata mawlidihi, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, limā ḥaṣala lil-dīn bi-hā surūr, wa-thabuta al-faraḥ wa-al-surūr lil-khalāʼiq bi-wujūdihi, wa-kāna yanbaghī lanā taʻẓīm shaʼnihi, ʻanna lī an atakallama ..."
Secundo folio of al-Zahr al-ghāʼif fī Mawlid Ashraf al-Khalāʼiq: ʻalá baʻḍ mā yataʻallaqu bi-tilka al-laylah.

Incipit of Mawlid al-Nabī (folio 38b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-ʻAlī al-Akram. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Qāla Allāh taʻālá, wa-Huwa aṣdaq al-qāʼilīn: 'Laqad jāʼakum rasūlun', huwa Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, 'min anfusikum', ay, ʻArabī mithlukum wa-nasabūhu [wa-nasabuhu] minkum lā min ghayrikum, 'ʻazīzun', ay, shadīdun wa-shāqq 'ʻalayhi mā ʻanittum', ay, ʻanatukum, ay, mashaqqatukum wa-ḍararukum dunyā wa-ukhrá ..."
Secundo folio of Mawlid al-Nabī: al-ḥarb wa-aṣarrū ʻalá al-ʻinād.
17.5 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 7 x 12 cm; 11 lines per page.
Binding: In dark blue cardboard with black cloth on the spine; the first copy is in four numbered quires.

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; extensive commentaries on the margins of the first manuscript; the leaves of the second manuscript are pasted over with pages seem to have been taken from a ledger book; catchwords.
On the fly leaf (in pencil): "Mawlid lam yuṭbaʻ", a date: "8/4/45" and an illegible word in Latin script.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Mawlid al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, lil-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Suḥaymī, bi-al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."
At the head of folio 1a (in pencil), a name of an owner, or, reader: "Kāmil Ilāhī."
On the upper left corner of folio 1a: "Bi-al-zahr. al-Zahr fī al-aṣl ism lil-nawr alladhī yakūnu fī al-basātīn."
On folio 2a: "... musammiyan la-hu bi-al-Zahr al-ghāʼif fī Mawlid Ashraf al-Khalāʼiq ..."

Under the colophon (folio 37b): An invocation of the "Shahādah" (The Islamic Profession of faith statement), recorded by a reader, or, an owner, as follows: "Awdaʻtu fī hādhā al-kitāb shahādata 'An lā ilāha illā Allāh, wa-anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-Rasūluh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Muḥammad al-Ṭabbākh."

On folio 38a: "Hādhā 'Mawlid' al-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah, wa-al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, al-Shaykh Yūsuf Abū Jamālah, aḥad ʻulamāʼ al-Jāmiʻ al-Aḥmadī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn. M. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-Nabī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Billāh in naẓarat ʻaynāka mā katabat // yadu al-faqīri ilá ghufrāni Mawlāhu. Fa-iqraʼ la-hu Umma al-Kitābi wa-qul // Allāhu yajʻalu Dāra al-Khuldi maʼwāhu. M."

Colophon of al-Zahr al-ghāʼif fī Mawlid Ashraf al-Khalāʼiq (folio 37b): "Nasʼalu Allāh an yanfaʻanā bi-barakatihi. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi, wa-sallama taslīman. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon of al-Zahr al-ghāʼif fī Mawlid Ashraf al-Ahalāʼiq: "We ask God to benefit us by its blessing. Amen. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and companions, and grant them abundant peace. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

Author's colophon of Mawlid al-Nabī: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā yassarahu Allāh taʻālá min jamʻ hādhihi al-Aḥādīth al-sharīfah fī Mawlidihi, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayh. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translations of the author's colophon of Mawlid al-Nabī: "This is the end of what God Almighty facilitated of the compilation of these noble Hadiths, about the 'Mawlid' of the Prophet, may God pray on him. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and companions, and grant them peace."

Copyist's colophon of Mawlid al-Nabī: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-Mawlid al-Sharīf, ʻalá yad kātibihi Muḥammad Aḥmad Khāṭir, aḥad al-mujāwirīn bi-al-Jāmiʻ al-Aḥmadī. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālih. M. Sanat 1313

Translation of the copyist's colophon of Mawlid al-Nabī: "The copy of this Noble Mawlid was completed by the hand of Muḥammad Aḥmad Khāṭir, one of the 'mujāwirs' [i.e., one who lives in the vicinity of a mosque] at al-Jāmiʻ al-Aḥmadī. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and his family. M. The year 1313 [of the Hijrah = 1895/1896]."

record.title: 880-02 Takhmīs al-Witrīyah : manuscript / ʻUmar ibn Muḥammad al-Sirāj al-Warrāq.
record.note: Title of Takhmīs al-Witrīyah from reference sources.
Title of Takhmīs al-Burdah from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Takhmīs al-Witrīyah: "Ḥarf al-Alif. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Badaʼtu bi-dhikri Allāhi madḥan muqaddamā. Wa-uthnī bi-ḥamdi Allāhi shukran muʻaẓẓamā. Wa-akhtumu qawlī bi-al-ṣalāti wa-innamā. Uṣallī ṣalātan tamlaʼu al-arḍa wa-al-samā // ʻalá man la-hu aḥlā [aʻlā] al-ʻulā mutabawwaʼu ..."
Secundo folio of Takhmīs al-Witrīyah: Arāhu mina al-āyāti akbara āyatin.

Incipit of Takhmīs al-Burdah (folio 74b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Mā bālu qalbika lā yanfakku dhā alami. Mudh bāna ahlu al-Ḥimá wa-al-Bāni wa-al-ʻAlami. Wa-inhalla madmaʻuka al-qānī bi-munsajim. Amin tadhakkuri jīrānin bi-Dhī Salami // mazajta damʻan jará min muqlatin bi-dami ..."
Secundo folio of Takhmīs al-Burdah: Kam waqfatin laka bayna al-arsumi al-muthuli.
13 x 16.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 13.5 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some of the verses in red; very few notes on the margin; no catchwords.

On the back of the front cover: An ownership statement: "Hādhihi takhuṣṣu ʻĀrif al-Dimashqī al-ʻArabī"; an illegible signature (in pencil); and the title of the second manuscript (in pencil): "Bi-ākhirihi Takhmīs al-Burdah".
On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Witrīyah, naẓm al-Shaykh al-faqīh al-wāʻiẓ Majd al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr ibn Rashīd al-Baghdādī, raḥimahu Allāh."
On folio 1a: Several partially legible ownership statements, an illegible stamp, two dates 1117 (1705/1706) and 121 [1121] (1709/1710), and several crude geometrical designs in black and red.

On folio 1a: Two verses dating the construction of a palace in "ḥisāb al-jummal" (alphabetical reckoning) as follows: "Lammā intahá bināʼ man // yantasibu al-fakhru ilayh. Arrakhtuhu qaṣran saʻīdan // qaṣayna [quṣira] al-majdu ʻalayh".

On folio 73a: Two verses of poetry about God's benevolence to His creation (mankind and animals): "Wa-kayfa akhāfu al-faqra wa-Allāhu rāziqī // wa-rāziqu hādhā al-khalqa fī al-ʻusri wa-al-yusri. Takaffala bi-al-arzāqi lil-khalqi kullihim // wa-lil-waḥshi fī al-ṣaḥrāʼi wa-al-ḥūti fī al-baḥri."
On folio 93a: Two partially legible ownership statements and a circular geometrical design.
On folio 74a: "[... ...] al-Burdah fī [...] al-madīḥ"; and a statement recording the loaning of the manuscript: "ʻIndī ʻāriyah ilá akhīnā [...] Muḥammad al-Ṭawāqī."
On folio 74a: An ownership statement dated in the year 1122 of the Hijrah (1710/1711): "al-Ḥamdu lillāh taʻālá. Fī nawbat al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Ṭawākhī al-Ḥanafī. Sanat 1122."

On folio 74a: An ownership statement dated in the year 138 [1138] of the Hijrah (1725/1726): "Bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá nuskhat al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-rājī ʻaʻwa Rabbihi al-Ghaffār, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥājj ʻAlī al-ʻAṭṭār. Sanat 138 [1138]."

On folio 74a: An ownership statement dated 5 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 1159 of the Hijrah (19 December 1746): "Malakahu min faḍl Rabbihi al-Mannān al-ʻabd al-ḥaqīr ilayhi, ʻIzzat [ibn] ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Sukkarī, bi-al-shirāʼ al-sharʻī, min al-Ḥājj Aḥmad al-Sukkarī, wa-dhālika fī khāmis Dhī al-Ḥijjah, sanat 1159. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidianā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi al-ṭāhirīn wa-ṣaḥābatihi nujūm al-dīn, wa-sallama taslīman kathīran mubārakan, ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ikhwānihi al-nabīyīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

On folio 74a: A reader's statement, dated on the night of Monday, 28 Muḥarram 1161 of the Hijrah (29 January 1748), as follows: "Naẓara fīhi afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajuhum ilá al-Malik al-Jawwād, ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Ḥayy ibn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-ʻImād, dāʻiyan li-ṣāḥibihi ʻAbd al-Wahhāb al-Sukkarī bi-al-saʻādah wa-al-baqá [wa-al-baqāʼ], wa-kunnā mujtamiʻīn bi-qaṣrihi, laylat al-Ithnayn thāmin ʻishrīn al-Muḥarram al-ḥarām, li-sanat 1161, wa-kāna ḥāḍiran maʻanā Shaykhunā al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn Shaykhinā al-Shaykh ʻAlī khaṭīb al-Sinānīyah, wa-al-Shaykh Muḥammad ibn fakhr al-fuḍalāʼ al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Khayyāṭ, li-sanat 1161."

On folio 74a: A reader's statement dated in [Jumādá al-Ūlá] of the year 1282 of the Hijrah (September/October, 1865): "Ṭālaʻa fīhi wa-fahim baʻḍ takhmīsihi, wa-mā huwa ḥāwī ʻalá baʻḍ naʻtihi wa-karāmatihi wa-masrāhu <wa-masrāhu>, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, al-faqīr Aḥmad al-ʻArbīnī fī ḥā [Jumādá al-Ūlá (?)] sanat 1282."

Colophon of Takhmīs al-Witrīyah: No colophon; text ends with: "... Idhā ḍāqat bika al-ayyāmu yawman // fa-thiq bi-al-Wāḥidi al-Ṣamadi al-ʻAlīyi. Tawassal bi-al-Nabīyi wa-ṣāḥibayhi // fa-mā khāba al-tawassul bi-al-Nabīyi."

Colophon of Takhmīs al-Burdah: No colophon; text ends with: "... Mā rannaḥat ʻadhabāti al-Bāni rīḥu ṣabā // wa-aṭraba al-ʻīsa ḥādī al-ʻīsi bi-al-naghami. Wa-ighfir li-munshidihā wa-irḥam muʼallifahā // bi-jāhi Man madḥuhu fī Nūna wa-al-Qalami."

record.title: 880-01 Mawlid Rasūl Allāh : manuscript.
record.note: Title from folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit (folio 2b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Fa-subḥāna man baʻatha fīnā afḍal al-khalāʼiq ʻalá al-iṭlāq, bashīran wa-nadhīran, wa-subḥāna man khalaqahu fa-aḥsanahu taṣwīran, wa-ṣānahu min al-adnās wa-al-arjās, wa-ṭahharahu taṭhīran, wa-naqalahu min al-anbiyāʼ, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhim, wa-kullun minhum ghadā bi-hi ilá Rabbihi lāʼidhan mustajīran ..."
Secundo folio: wa-Idrīsu bi-sababihi rafaʻahu ilayhi.
13 x 21 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16.5 cm; 9-15 lines per page.
Binding: In paper wrapper.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some words and some verses of poetry in red; markings in red; few notes on the margins; text fully vocalized; catchwords.
On the flyleaf (in pencil): "Mawlid Nabawī."
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Mawlid al-Rasūl, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, majmūʻ min baʻḍ al-Mawālid, ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl."
On folio 2a: "Hādhā Mawlid Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh."

The Mawlid ends with an invocation, as follows: "... Wa-ukhṣuṣṣ Allāhumma bi-barakat hādhā <hādhā> al-duʻāʼ al-wālidīn wa-al-mawlūdīn, wa-al-ḥāḍirīn wa-al-ghāʼibīn, wa-mā saʼalnāka min khayr fa-aʻṭinā, wa-mā lam nasʼalka fa-ibtadiʼnā, wa-mā qaṣurat ʻanhu āmālunā wa-aʻmālunā min al-khayrāt fa-ballighnā wa-anta rāḍin ʻannā bi-faḍlika wa-iḥsānika, Yā Arḥama al-Rāḥimīn."
Colophon: "Subḥāna Rabbika, Rabbi al-ʻIzzati ʻammā yaṣifūn, wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabbi al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to Thy Lord, the Lord of Might, far is He from what they [falsely] ascribe [to Him]. May peace be upon the messengers, and praise be to God Lord of the Universe. Amen. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-ʻālim bi-al-kullīyāt wa-al-juzʼīyāt, al-hādī lil-ʻuqūl ilá ḥall ṣiʻāb al-maʻqūl bi-ṭarīq iktisāb al-taṣawwurāt wa-al-taṣdīqāt. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-jāmiʻ li-ajnās al-kamālāt wa-al-faḍāʼil, wa-al-mukhtār min afḍal al-anwāʻ wa-ashraf aṣnāf al-urūmāt wa-al-qabāʼil ..."
Secundo folio: fīhi bi-bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 8 x 16 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Sullam in red; few corrections; many commentaries on the margins and interlinear; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ al-Sullam. Manṭiq."

Colophon: "ʻAllaqahu bi-yadihi al-fāniyah aḥqar al-wará wa-khādim al-fuqarā, faqīr ʻafw Rabbihi al-Ghafūr, asīr waṣmat dhanbihi, Manṣūr ibn al-Sayyid al-Ḥājj Muṣṭafá Ghannām, ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-al-luṭf wa-al-ikrām, wa-dhāka ayyām al-mujāwarah bi-al-Jāmiʻ al-Azhar, ḥāla ḥuḍūrihi ʻalá muʼallifih, adām Allāh al-nafʻ bi-hi. Wa-waqaʻa al-farāgh minhu salkha shahr Shaʻbān, min shuhūr sanat 1166."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied by the perishing hand of the most wretched of mankind, servant of the poor ones [the Sufis], the poor to the forgiveness of his Forgiving Lord, captive of the disgrace of his sin, Manṣūr ibn al-Sayyid al-Ḥājj Muṣṭafá Ghannām, may God treat him with kindness and benevolence, during his "mujāwarah" (residency) at al-Jāmiʻ al-Azhar, while he was attending [the lectures] of the author, may God perpetuate his benefit. Completed at the end of the month of Shaʻbān, of the year 1166 [of the Hijrah = 1 July 1753]."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Waraqāt fī uṣūl al-fiqh : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Imām al-Kāmilīyah.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyid al-Mursalīn, Ḥabīb Allāh, Abī al-Qāsim Muḥammad, Khātam al-Nabīyīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhā taʻlīq ʻalá al-Waraqāt al-mansūbah li-Shaykh al-Islām, al-baḥr al-rabbānī, ʻAbd al-Malik Imām al-Ḥaramayn, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-arḍāh, wa-nafaʻanā bi-barakātih, saʼalanī baʻḍ al-ʻāmilīn fī waḍʻihi ʻalayhā ..."
Secundo folio: wa-qawluhu 'Hādhihi waraqāt' ishārah ilá taqlīlihā.
15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 10 x 16 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "al-Waraqāt" in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ al-Waraqāt fī uṣūl al-fiqh, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Kamāl al-Dīn ibn Imām al-Madrasah, taghammada [taghammadahu] Allāh bi-al-raḥmah wa-al-ruḍwān, wa-askanahu fasīḥ al-jinān. Āmīn. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: A quotation from the Hadith and the date, year 1265 of the Hijrah (1848/1849): "Qāla ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām: 'Innamā al-aʻmāl bi-al-nīyāt, wa-innamā li-kull imriʼin mā nawá'. Sanat 1265."

On folio 1a: Seven verses of poetry enumerating the ten kinds of wounds/injuries (to the face and head), the penalties imposed on those who inflict them on others and the fines "ushūr" which they should pay, according to the Shāfiʻi tradition: "Wa-qad naẓama baʻḍuhum al-jurūḥ allatī fīhā qiṣāṣ wa-qadr arshihā, fa-qāl: Fa-khāriṣatun shaqqat wa-dāmiyatun farat ..."
At the head of some leaves: An endowment statements: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá bi-al-Azhar, bi-Khizānat Aḥmad al-Dayrabī, bi-Ruwāq Ibn Maʻmar, bi-Ḥārat al-Basāyinah."
At the lower right side of the colophon: A signature in the name of "Aḥmad al-Hāshimī al-Ḥanafī", probably the copyist, or, an owner, or, a reader.

Author's colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-hādhā ākhir mā tayassara min al-kalām ʻalá hādhihi 'al-Waraqāt', maʻa qillat al-biḍāʻah wa-shughl al-bāl wa-kathrat al-dhunūb. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran dāʼiman ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

Translation of the author's colophon: "God is more knowledgeable of what is correct, to Him is the reference and returning. This is the end of what was facilitated of the discourse about these 'al-Waraqāt' [leaflets], despite my insufficiency, the preoccupation of the mind and the many shortcomings. There is no power nor might except in God the All Mighty the All Powerful. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and companions, and grant them abundant and perpetual peace until Judgement Day. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. It is completed. It is completed. It is completed."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ Umm al-barāhīn fī ʻilm al-kalām : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Manṣūr al-Hudʹhudī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī shahidat bi-wujūdihi jamīʻ al-kāʼināt, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-mabʻūth bi-al-āyāt al-wāḍiḥāt, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-al-tābiʻīn la-hum fī al-karāmāt ilá Yawm al-Dīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūl Allāh. al-Ḥamd huwa al-thanāʼ bi-al-lisān bi-al-jamīl min al-awṣāf, wa-al-afʻāl, ka-al-ʻilm wa-al-jūd bi-al-minan, wa-huwa ḍidd al-dhamm ..."
Secundo folio: bi-maʻrifat Allāh taʻālá wa-rusulih.
15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 14 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; with the phrases of "Umm al-barāhīn fī ʻilm al-kalām" in red; numerous commentaries and few corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ al-Sanūsīyah lil-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-Shaykh Muḥammad ibn Manṣūr al-Hudhudī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatihi. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: Two pieces of poetry, in two and four verses respectively: An invocation and an advice to seek God not man for help.
At the head of some leaves: An endowment statement: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá ʻalá ṭalabat al-ʻilm bi-al-Azhar bi-Ḥārat al-Bashbīshī."
On the upper margin of folio 27a: A collation statement, as follows: "Balagha muqābalatan bi-jamīʻ al-hawāmish ḥasba al-ṭāqah."

Colophon: "Tamma al-sharḥ al-mubārak, bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi, tāsiʻ ʻashar Rabīʻ al-Awwal, min shuhūr al-sanah al-thālithah ʻashar baʻda al-miʼah wa-al-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, wa-dhālika ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād ilá Allāh, Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Najāḥī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-man daʻá lahum bi-al-maghfirah. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed commentary was completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence, on 19 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, of the year 1113 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [24 August 1701], by the hand of the poorest of the servants to God, Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Najāḥī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban. May God forgive him, his parents and those who invoke forgiveness for them. Amen. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Gharāmī ṣaḥīḥ : manuscript / Yaḥyá ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Qarāfī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla faqīr raḥmat rabbihi al-Kāfī, Ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Aṣbahānī, mustamiddan min Allāh taʻālá, Dhī al-Mathānī: al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī qabila bi-ṣaḥīḥ al-nīyah man hājara ilayh, wa-kafá bi-ḥusnihā man tawakkala ʻalayh, wa-waṣala al-ḍaʻīf al-munqaṭiʻ bi-marāsīl birrih, wa-sakkana nafsahu ʻan al-iḍṭrāb wa-al-ʻilal fī baḥrihi wa-barrih, wa-rafaʻahu wa-asnadahu bi-ḥubbihi, wa-jaʻalahu mudrajan fī silsilat ḥizbihi ..."
Secundo folio: ḍābiṭ ʻan mithlihi ilá muntahāh.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 16.5 cm; 22 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with black cloth on spine.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Gharāmī ṣaḥīḥ" are underlined; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ 'Gharāmī ṣaḥīḥ' lil-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah Ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Aṣbahānī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."
On folio 1b: "... Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā sharḥ laṭīf al-ḥajm, ḥawá fī ʻilm al-Ḥadīth min al-fawāʼid al-jamm, ʻamiltuhu ʻalá Manẓūmat al-Ḥāfiẓ Ibn al-Farḥ al-Ishbīlī ..."
At the head of folio 1a: "Sharḥ Gharāmī ṣaḥīḥ."

At the end of the author's colophon: A note indicating that the author finished writing his work on Wednesday, 12 Rajab, of the year 972 of the Hijrah (23 February 1565), as follows: "Dhukira ʻan al-Shaykh, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, annahu faragha min taʼlīfihi yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ, thānī ʻashar Rajab, sanat tisʻimiʼah wa-ithnayn wa-sabʻīn min al-Hijrah, ʻalá Muhājirihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. M."

Author's colophon: "Jaʻalanā Allāh min sullāk ṭarīq al-rashād, wa-yubqī [wa-abqá] sāʼir aʻmālinā ʻalá al-sadād, wa-akhadha bi-aydīnā Yawm al-Maʻād, bi-Muḥammad Sayyid al-ʻIbād, wa-jaʻala dhālika khāliṣan la-hu, innahu ʻalá kull shayʼ qadīr, wa-Huwa niʻma al-Mawlá wa-niʻma al-naṣīr. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the author's colophon: "May God make us walk in the correct path, render all our deeds appropriate, and hold our hand on the Day of Return [i.e. Judgement Day], by the intercession of Muḥammad, the Master of Worshipers. May He render it [the book] purely for His sake. He is able to do what He wills. He is the best Master and the best deliverer. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Muwaṣṣil al-ṭullāb ilá Qawāʻid al-iʻrāb : manuscript / Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir. Yā Karīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-mulhim li-ḥamdih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, rasūlihi wa-ʻabdih, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih wa-jundih. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-ghanī, Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī: Hādhā sharḥ laṭīf ʻalá 'Qawāʻid al-iʻrāb', saʼalanīhi baʻḍ al-aṣḥāb, yaḥullu al-mabānī wa-yubayyin al-maʻānī, sammaytuhu: 'Muwaṣṣil al-ṭullāb ilá Qawāʻid al-iʻrāb'. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Bāʼ mutaʻalliqah bi-fiʻl maḥdhūf, taqdīruhu aftatiḥu, yuqaddaru muʼakhkharan li-ifādat al-ḥaṣr ʻinda al-bayānīyīn wa-al-ihtimām ʻinda al-naḥwīyīn ..."
Secundo folio: al-jarr naṣṣa ʻalá dhālika Ibn Mālik.
14 x 18.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 14 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases "Iʻrāb ʻan qawāʻid al-iʻrāb" in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ Qawāʻid al-iʻrāb, lil-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-ʻumdah al-qudwah, farīd ʻaṣrihi wa-waḥīd dahrihi, al-Shaykh Khālid al-Azharī, raḥimahu Allāh, wa-raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, wa-nafaʻa bi-ʻulūmihi al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn."
On folio 1a: A stamp of an owner: "Hādhā kitāb ʻAbd Allāh al-Dhawbī".

A note at the end of the colophon indicates that the copyist "Muḥammad ibn Ṭāhā al-Balīsarī" made this copy for his son "Ṭāhā ibn Muḥammad ibn Ṭāhā al-Balīsārī: "Bi-rasm al-walad al-ʻazīz al-Shaykh Ṭāhā ibn Muḥammad ibn Ṭāhā al-Balīsārī, amtaʻa Allāh fī ḥayātihi, wa-huwa qāṭin yawmaʼidhin bi-al-Madrasah al-ʻUmarīyah." A second note after the first note indicates that the copy was transferred to another owner: "Thumma intaqala ilá yad faqīr ʻafw al-Mālik, Muḥammad ibn Nāṣir al-Dīn Mālik."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihā nahār al-Aḥad, fī khāmis shahr Shaʻbān al-muʻaẓẓam, fī sanat 976, bi-qalam aḍʻaf al-ʻibād ʻamalan wa-aktharihim zalalan, Muḥammad ibn Ṭāhā al-Balīsārī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn.

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed on Sunday, the fifth day of the glorious month of Shaʻbān, of the year 976 [of the Hijrah = 23 January 1569], by the pen of the feeblest of the servants in deeds, and the greatest of them in shortcomings, Muḥammad ibn Ṭāhā al-Balīsarī, may God forgive him, his parents and all and entire Muslims. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 al-Naṣīḥah al-kāfiyah li-man khaṣṣahu Allāh bi-al-ʻāfiyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad Zarrūq.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn, wa-Huwa ḥasbī, wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil, Sayyidī Aḥmad al-maʻrūf bi-Zarrūq al-Burnusī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn: al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá minnat al-Islām, wa-al-shukr la-hu ʻalá niʻmat al-samʻ wa-al-baṣar wa-al-kalām, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-sādah al-kirām. Ammā baʻd, fa-al-naṣīḥah min al-īmān, wa-al-taḥaqquq bi-hā ʻalāmat al-īqān, wa-aʻẓam al-nās jahlan man jahila nafsahu wa-ahmala aḥwālahu ḥattá dakhala ramsah ..."
Secundo folio: al-yad ʻalá maghābinihi wa-dhālika naqṣ li-wājibihi.
15 x 20 cm; written surface: 10 x 16.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; keywords and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Naṣīḥah al-kāfiyah li-man khaṣṣahu Allāh bi-al-ʻāfiyah, lil-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻĪsá, al-shahīr bi-Zarrūq al-Burnusī al-Fāsī, raḥimahu Allāh wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Āmīn. M. M."
On folio 1a: Several "fawāʼid" (anecdotes) and "istighāthah" (invocation) in seven verses of poetry.

Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhā Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻĪsá al-Burnusī al-Fāsī, ʻurifa bi-Zarrūq: Najazat 'al-Naṣīḥah al-kāfiyah li-man khaṣṣahu Allāh bi-al-ʻāfiyah' sanat sabʻ wa-sittīn wa-thamānimiʼah fī al-Jāmiʻ al-Azhar bi-al-Qāhirah al-maḥrūsah, bi-Ruwāq al-Riyāqah, bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taʻlīqihā fī sābiʻ shahr Rajab al-fard, min shuhūr sanat ithnayn wa-thalāthīn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. M."

Translation of the colophon: "Its author, Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻĪsá al-Burnusī al-Fāsī, known as Zarrūq, said: 'al-kāfiyah li-man khaṣṣahu Allāh bi-al-ʻāfiyah' was completed in the year 867 [of the Hijrah = 1462/1463], at al-Jāmiʻ al-Azhar, in protected Cairo, at Ruwāq al-Riyāqah, by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions, and grant them peace. The copy was completed on the seventh day of the month of Rajab al-fard, of the year 1032 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [7 May 1623], may the best prayer and peace be upon him. M."

record.title: 880-02 Manẓūmah fī al-maʻfūwāt : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn al-ʻImād al-Aqfahsī.
record.note: Title from reference sources (See: Brockelmann, GAL, II, 94, no. 4; Suppl. II, 110, S. 94)
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad. al-Ḥamdu lillāhi maʻ ḥusni al-thanāʼi ʻalá // isdāʼihi niʻaman tatrā bi-minnatihi. Thumma al-ṣalātu ʻalá al-Mukhtāri min Muḍarin // wa-ālihi thumma ṣaḥbin thumma shīʻatihi ..."
Secundo folio: Najāsatun waqaʻat fī al-dami qad sukibat.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 15.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Manẓūmat Ibn al-ʻImād al-Aqfahsī ʻalá madhhab al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb. Allāhumma ighfir li-nāẓimihā wa-kātibihā wa-qārīhā, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Sanat miʼah wa-ithnayn baʻda al-alf."

Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed. God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. O God forgive its author, its copyist, its reader, and all Muslims. Amen. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. Amen. Year 1102 [of the Hijrah = 1690/1691]."

record.title: 880-02 Risālah fī ḥaqq shurb al-dukhān : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr Sājaqlīzādah.
record.note: Title of Risālah fī ḥaqq shurb al-dukhān from folio 1a.
Title of Imʻān al-naẓar fī sharḥ al-Maqṣūd fī al-taṣrīf from reference sources (See: Brockelmann: S II, 657, 25)
Title of Sharḥ al-Basmalah from colophon (folio 19b)
Title of Risālah fī wajh al-shubah fī qawlihi 'Allāhumma Ṣalli ʻalá Muḥammad' from folio 20a.
Title of Risālah fī bayān mabná al-Islām from 20b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Risālah fī ḥaqq shurb al-dukhān (folio 1a): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-ʻawn. Saʼala sāʼil ʻan ḥukm mā iʻtādahu ahl al-zamān min maṣṣ al-dukhān min thuqb al-ʻīdān, fa-taʼammaltu burhatan min al-zamān, fa-wajadtu fīhi thalāthat maʻān, fa-sa-ūridu kullan minhā bi-bayān; ikhtiṣāṣuhu bi-al-fasaqah, wa-qaṣd al-lahw, wa-nahy al-sulṭān. Fa-ʻalá al-awwal yakūnu huwa min dhī al-fasaqah ..."
Secundo folio of Risālah fī ḥaqq shurb al-dukhān: No secundo folio.

Incipit of Imʻān al-naẓar fī sharḥ al-Maqṣūd fī al-taṣrīf: "Rabbi tammim bi-al-khayr wa-sahhil. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-wāhib kull mawhūb min al-mirṣād wa-al-maqṣūd wa-al-maṭlūb, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá ḥabībihi Muḥammad al-mawdūd, wa-afḍal al-rusul, wa-ashraf al-mawjūd, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-āmirīn bi-al-maʻrūf wa-al-nāhīn ʻan al-munkar al-maʻrūf. Allāhumma ighfir dhunūbanā al-māḍiyah fī al-aqwāl wa-al-afʻāl, wa-aṣliḥ aʻmālanā al-ātiyah fī al-ḥāl wa-al-istiqbāl, wa-urzuqnā ṣaḥīḥāt al-nīyāt fī abwāb al-khayrāt, wa-iḥfaẓnā min al-iʻtidāʼ [?] yawm al-ʻaraḍāt ..."
Secundo folio of Imʻān al-naẓar fī sharḥ al-Maqṣūd fī al-taṣrīf: wa-qad qultu in al-kalām lil-istighrāq.

Incipit of Sharḥ al-Basmalah (folio 11b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ʻallamanā mā lam naʻlam, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Muḥammad alladhī huwa ṣāḥib al-ʻilm, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi alladhīna kānū khayra amam. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi qiṭʻah min al-suṭūr, maʻa qillat al-biḍāʻah wa-kathrat al-futūr, kull [wa-kull] al-Tasmiyah wa-al-Taḥmīd wa-al-Taṣliyah, li-yakūna lil-mubtadiʼīn tabṣirah wa-tadhkirah, jamaʻtuhā min muṣannafāt al-ʻulamāʼ al-aʻlām bi-iltimās baʻḍ azkiyāʼ [adhkiyāʼ] al-ṭālibīn al-kirām, ghayr mujtanib ʻan al-basṭ wa-al-taṭwīl, li-takūna shāfiyah li-man huwa ʻan al-fahm ʻalīl. Wa-unshiduka wa-lā [allā] taṭʻan bi-jahlī, inna ʻilmī ʻalá miqdār iḥsān al-karīm ..."
Secundo folio of Sharḥ al-Basmalah: al-Bāʼ, wa-min ḥaqq al-ḥurūf al-mufradah an tuftaḥa.

Incipit of Risālah fī wajh al-shubah fī qawlihi 'Allāhumma Ṣalli ʻalá Muḥammad': "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. La-hu al-ḥamd, wa-ʻalá Nabīyihi al-ṣalāh, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-kirām. Wa-baʻd, samiʻtu al-Sayyid al-ajall al-abjal, qudwat al-aṣfiyāʼ wa-ashwaq al-awliyāʼ, Ṣafī al-Ḥaqq wa-al-Dīn, ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Ḥasan al-Safar, quddisa sirruhu, qāl kathīran [kathīrun] aqwal [aqwāl] al-ʻulamāʼ fī tawjīh al-tashbīh alladhī yataḍammanuhu qawlunā 'Allāhumma Ṣalli ʻalá Muḥammad wa-ʻalá āli Muḥammad kamā ṣallayta ʻalá Ibrāhīm', ih. min ḥaythu inna hādhihi al-ʻibārah yaqtaḍī an yakūna [takūna] ʻalá al-Nabī al-Muṣṭafá, ʻalayhi afḍal al-ṣalawāt wa-akmal al-taḥīyāt, aqall wa-adwan min al-ṣalāh ʻalá Ibrāhīm, ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, idh wajh al-tashbīh fī al-mushabbah bi-hi aqwá min al-mushabbah ..."
Secundo folio of Risālah fī wajh al-shubah fī qawlihi 'Allāhumma Ṣalli ʻalá Muḥammad': No secundo folio.

Incipit of Risālah fī bayān mabná al-Islām: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-taysīr. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-Ghazzālī, Ḥujjat al-Islām, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Ghazzālī, qaddasa Allāh taʻālá rūḥahu wazād fī aʻlá al-jinān futūḥahu: Iʻlam inna mabná al-Islām ʻalá umūr arbaʻah: Maʻrifat al-nafs, wa-maʻrifat Allāh taʻālá, wa-maʻrifat al-dunyā, wa-maʻrifat al-ākhirah. Ammā al-ūlá, fa-yajibu ʻalá kull insān an yaʻrifa nafsahu, li-annahu matá lam yaʻrif nafsahu lā sabīla ilá an yaʻrifa Allāh taʻālá ..."
Secundo Risālah fī bayān mabná al-Islām: law arsala malik min mulūk al-arḍ ghulāmah.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 17.5 cm; 25-35 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with black cloth on spine.
In fair naskhtaʻlīq script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On the back of the front cover (in "copia" pencil): "Risālat Shurb al-dukhān -- Sharḥ Maqṣūd Birkiwī -- Sharḥ al-Basmalah li-Āq Kirmānī -- Risālah fī wajh al-shubah li-Ibn Kamāl Bāshā -- Risālah fī mabná al-Islām lil-Ghazzālī."
At the head of folio 1a (in red): "Risālah fī ḥaqq shurb al-dukhān li-Sāchaqlī al-Marʻashī, raḥmat Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi."
At the head of folio 1b (in red): "Imʻān Sharḥ Maqṣūd li-Birkawī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá."
At the head of folio 11b: "Sharḥ Basmalah li-Āq Kirmānī."
At the head of folio 20a (in red): "Hādhihi Risālah fī wajh al-shubah fī qawlihi 'Allāhumma ṣalli ʻalá Muḥammad', li-Ibn Kamāl Pāshā Zādah."
At the head of folio 20b (in red): "Risālah fī bayān mabná al-Islām lil-Imām al-Ghazzālī, raḥmat Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi."

On folio 29b: A quotation by the copyist, about "al-jumlah al-sharṭīyah" (conditional sentence/clause), dated in the year 1245 of the Hijrah (1829/1830), in the city of Malāṭiyah (Malatya, Turkey), ends with: "... Ḥarrarahu Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī az ʻArbakrī, fī baldat Malāṭiyah, aʻṭāhu [Allāh] min al-ajr al-jazīl [jazīl] al-ʻaṭīyah, wa-baʻʻada ʻanhu al-āfāt wa-al-balīyah fī al-dunyawīyah wa-al-ukhrawīyah, bi-ḥurmat Khayr al-Barīyah, fī sanat 1245, fī Madrasat al-Ūlá, min al-fawq, min madāris Jāmiʻ Kabīr. Allāhumma ḥarrim laḥm kātibihi ʻalá al-nār bi-ḥurmat Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-mikhyār, wa-bi-ḥurmat Sayyid al-Abrār, wa-Rasūl [wa-al-Rasūl] al-ghaffār. Āmīn. Yā Allāh. Yā Sattār. Yā Karīm, Yā Ghaffār."

Colophon of Risālah fī ḥaqq shurb al-dukhān: "Ḥarrarahu Sājaqlīʹzadah al-Marʻashī [... (?)] akramahu Allāh subḥānuhu bi-al-saʻādah al-sarmadīyah. Tammat 'al-Risālah al-Dukhānīyah' min yad [Muḥammad ibn] ʻAlī [az ʻAr]bakrī, fī waqt al-ḍaḥwah min Jahārshanbah [... ... ...]."

Translation of the colophon of Risālah fī ḥaqq shurb al-dukhān: "Authored by Sājaqlīʹzadah al-Marʻashī [... (?)], may God Almighty honor him with everlasting bliss. 'al-Risālah al-Dukhānīyah' was completed by the hand of [Muḥammad ibn] ʻAlī [az ʻAr]bakrī, on the forenoon of Wednesday [... ... ...]."

Colophon of Imʻān al-naẓar fī sharḥ al-Maqṣūd fī al-taṣrīf: "Hādhā ākhir mā katabahu al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn Pīr ʻAlī al-Birkawī, ghafara Allāh taʻālá lahumā wa-li-jamīʻ al-muʼminīn min Sharḥ kitāb al-Maqṣūd, lil-Imām al-Aʻẓam wa-al-humām al-afkham, Maw[lānā] sirāj al-millah [wa-]al-ummah, wa-muqtadá al-aʼimmah, Abī Ḥanīfah al-Kūfī, ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-luṭfihi al-jalī wa-al-khafī. Wa-akthar mā dhakarnā fīhi min al-tawajjuhāt wa-al-taʻlīlāt wa-al-taḥqīqāt wa-al-iʻtirāḍāt wa-ajwibat asʼulat [asʼilat] al-qawm mā manshāʼuhu [manshaʼuhu] [under it: nashaʼa min] khāṭirī wa-muṭālaʻat bāṭinī, min ghayr ītiḥāl [intiḥāl] ka-ītiḥāl [ka-intiḥāl] ghayr [al-ghayr], fa-laysa al-khabar ka-al-muʻāyanah. Tamma bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-nuṣratih. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām, wa-ʻalá Rasūlihi al-salām. M. M. M."

Translation of the colophon of Imʻān al-naẓar fī sharḥ al-Maqṣūd: "This is the end of what was written by the poor Muḥammad ibn Pīr ʻAlī al-Birkawī -- may God Almighty forgive both of them and all believers -- of the Commentary on the book of al-Maqṣūd, of the Greatest Imām and the magnanimous gallant, our Master, light of the community and the nation, and the exemplar of the imāms, Abū Ḥanīfah al-Kūfī, may God treat him with His conspicuous and hidden kindness. Most of what we introduced in it [the commentary] of objectives, investigations, researches, objections, and answers to the questions of inquirers, originated in my own mind and were the perusal of my own intellect, without any plagiarism, like the plagiarism of others; for hearing is not the same as inspection. It is completed by the help of God and His support. Praise be to God for the completion, and peace be upon His Messenger. M.M.M."

Author's colophon of Sharḥ al-Basmalah: "Hādhā ākhir mā jamaʻnā wa-tamām mā katabnā bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá wa-ḥusn tawfīqih īyāhā [īyānā]. al-Ḥamdu lillāh fī kull ān wa-awqāt, wa-ʻalá Rasūlihi akmal al-taḥīyāt. Tammat bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-alṭāfih. Allāhumma aḥsin ʻāqibat umūrinā khayran bi-raḥmatik, Yā Arḥam al-Rāḥimīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the author's colophon of Sharḥ al-Basmalah: "This is the end of what we compiled, and the completion of what we wrote, by the help of God Almighty, and His abundant benevolence towards us. Praise be to God now and then. May the most perfect peace be upon His Messenger. It was completed by the help of God and His kindness. O God! Grant our affairs a favorable end by Thy mercy. O Most Merciful of all merciful ones. Amen."

Copyist's colophon of Sharḥ al-Basmalah: "Tammat al-risālah al-marghūbah 'Sharḥ al-Basmalah' al-Sharīf [al-Sharīfah], li-Āq Kirmānī, min yad Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī az ʻArbakrī, al-mulaqqab bi-Kūrt Maqṣūd Dhādah [Zadah]. akramahum Allāh taʻālá bi-al-falāḥ wa-al-saʻādah, fī baldat ʻArbakr, fī Madrasat al-Thālith ʻUthmān Bāshā, aʻṭāhu Allāh fī al-dārayn mā shāʼ, waqt al-ḍuḥá, fī yawm Sihʹshanbah, min yawm al-thālith min Rabīʻ al-Ukhrá, sanat thalāth wa-arbaʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, min [Hijrat man] la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf. M.M.M."

Translation of the copyist's colophon of Sharḥ al-Basmalah: "The desirable epistle 'The Noble Commentary on the Basmalah', of Āq Kirmānī was completed by the hand of Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī az ʻArbakrī, nicknamed Kūrt Maqsūd Dhādah [Zādah], may God Almighty bestow upon him success and happiness, in the city of ʻArbakr, at the School of al-Thālith ʻUthmān Bāshā, may God grant him his desire in both abodes, in the forenoon of Tuesday, the third day of Rabīʻ al-Ukhrá [al-Ākhir], of the year 1243 of [the Hijrah = 24 October 1827] of Him to whom belongs glory and honor. M.M.M."

Colophon of Risālah fī wajh al-shubah fī qawlihi 'Allāhumma Ṣalli ʻalá Muḥammad': "Tammat al-risālah al-sharīfah li-Kamāl Pāshā Zādah, raḥmat Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi, wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi fī al-dārayn, min yad, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī [erasure]. M.M.M. Sanat 1243"

Translation of the colophon of Risālah fī wajh al-shubah fī qawlihi 'Allāhumma Ṣalli ʻalá Muḥammad': "The noble epistle of Kamāl Pashā Zādah, may the mercy of God be upon him, and may He benefit us by him in the two abodes, is completed, by the hand of Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī [erasure], in the year 1243 [of the Hijrah = 1827/1828]. M.M.M."

Colophon of Risālah fī bayān mabná al-Islām: "Tammat al-risālah al-marghūbah min yad Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī az ʻArbakrī, fī baldat ʻArbakr, sanat thalāth wa-arbaʻīn wa-miʼatān wa-alf, min [Hijrat man] la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf."

Translation of the colophon of Risālah fī bayān mabná al-Islām: "The desired epistle is completed by the hand of Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī az ʻArbakrī, in the city of ʻArbakr, in the year 1243 of [the Hijrah of] Him to whom belongs glory and honor [1827/1828]."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah : manuscript / Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Kafrāwī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala lughat al-ʻArab aḥsan al-lughāt, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-marfūʻ al-rutbah ʻalá sāʼir al-makhlūqāt, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-manṣūbīn li-izālat shubah al-ḍalālāt, ṣalātan wa-salāman dāʼimayn mutalāzimayn ilá yawm tukhfaḍu fīhi ahl al-zaygh, wa-tujzamu wa-tanqaṭiʻu fīhi al-taʻalluqāt. Ammā baʻd, fa-qad saʼalanī baʻḍ al-muḥibbīn ilayya, al-mutaraddidīn ʻalayya al-marrah baʻda al-marrah an ashraḥ matn al-Ājurrūmīyah lil-Imām al-Ṣinhājī sharḥan laṭīfan yakūnu mushtamilan ʻalá bayān al-maʻná wa-iʻrāb al-kalimāt, wa-an ukthira fīhi min al-amthilah, li-mā annahu lam yaqaʻ la-hā sharḥ ʻalá hādhihi al-ṣifāt ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-jārr wa-al-majrūr mutaʻalliq bi-maḥdhūf.
17 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 11 x 19 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Ājurrūmīyah and headings in red; some corrections and few commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a (in pencil): "Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah lil-Ṣinhājī."

Colophon: "Yā nāẓiran fīhi sāl [sal] billāhi marḥamatan // ʻalá al-muṣannifi wa-istaghfir li-kātibihi. Wa-uṭlub li-nafsika min khayrin turīdu bi-hi // wa-baʻda dhālika ghufrānan li-ṣāḥibihi. Qad tamma hādhā al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb. Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhu fī yawm al-Arbaʻ al-mubārak, al-muwāfiq arbaʻata ʻashar shahr Jumād Ākhir, sanat 1280. Wa-nasaʼl kull man istafāda min hādhā al-kitāb shayʼ [shayʼan an] yaqraʼa al-Fātiḥah li-kāffat al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "O you who is looking into it [the book], by God! Request mercy // for its author and forgiveness for its copyist. Request for yourself whatever benefit you desire // then request forgiveness for its owner. This book was completed by the help of God the Abundant Giving King. It was concluded on blessed Wednesday, corresponding to the fourteenth day of the month of Jumād Ākhir, of the year 1280 [of the Hijrah = 14 November 1863]. We request all who benefited something from this book to read 'al-Fātiḥah' on behalf of all Muslims. Amen. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Thabt al-Sharqāwī : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Ḥijāzī al-Sharqāwī.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī baʻatha rusulan mubashshirīn wa-mundhirīn, wa-khaṣṣa min baynihim Sayyidanā Muḥammadan, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, bi-baqāʼ sharīʻatihi ilá Yawm al-Dīn, wa-qayyaẓa lahā fī kull ʻaṣr man yanshuruhā wa-yaḥfaẓuhā min iftirāʼ al-wāḍiʻīn wa-jaḥd al-muʻānidīn, fa-ittaṣala bi-dhālika sanaduhā ilá ṣāḥibihā, ʻalayhi afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-taslīm. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu kathīr al-masāwī, ʻAbd Allāh ibn Ḥijāzī al-mashhūr bi-al-Sharqāwī: Lammā kāna maʻrifat al-asānīd min al-dīn, wa-man lam yakun la-hu sanad fa-huwa ka-al-laqīṭ ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-fiqh wa-fī al-aḥzāb wa-al-awrād.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 9.6 x 17 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and keywords in red; few notes on the margins; some pages are partially smudged; catchwords.

On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Waqafa wa-ḥabasa wa-taṣaddaqa bi-hādhā al-sanad al-ʻaẓīm Shaykhunā al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Wahhāb al-Takhātī, wa-jaʻala maqarrahu fī al-Azhar, bi-ḥārat al-Bashābishah, fī khizānatihi al-mujāwirah li-khizānat al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Kharāwilī, waqfan ṣaḥīḥan sharʻīyan, fa-man baddalahu baʻdamā samiʻahu fa-innamā ithmuhu ʻalá alladhīna yubaddilūnahu. Inna Allāh samīʻ ʻalīm."
On folio 1a: Four verses of poetry by ʻAlī ʻAzīz al-Ṭanṭāwī (could not be identified), praising the book and its author.

Colophon: "Wa-qad intahá mā aradnā jamʻahu min hādhihi al-ʻujālah, yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak, al-khāmis ʻashar min Shaʻbān, sanat sabʻa ʻashrata wa-maiʼatayn baʻda al-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-taḥīyah. Wa-qāla kātib al-aḥruf, al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-Raḥīm bi-al-nās, Ibrāhīm Badawī al-mashhūr bi-al-Naḥḥās: Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihā yawm al-Khamīs, tāsiʻ ʻashar al-Qaʻdah, min shuhūr sanat 1321, iḥdá wa-ʻishrīn wa-[thalāth] miʼah wa-alf. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam. M."

Translation of the colophon: "What we intended to compile in this quickly prepared work was completed on blessed Saturday, the fifteenth of Shaʻbān, of the year 1217, of the Hijrah of the Prophet [11 December 1802], may the best prayer and peace be upon Him. The transcriber of the letters, the poor to his Lord the Merciful to people, Ibrāhīm Badawī, known as al-Naḥḥās, said: The copy was completed on Thursday, the nineteenth of the month of al-Qaʻdah, of the year 1321 [of the Hijrah = 24 January 1904]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and his family and give them peace. M."

record.title: 880-02 al-Durrah al-muntaḍirah fī al-najāsāt al-maʻfw ʻanhā : manuscript / Aḥmad al-Shurunbulālī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī tafaḍḍalā // fa-sahhala al-amra alladhī qad aʻḍalā. Wa-asqaṭa al-ʻusra alladhī qad kānā // fī al-umami al-māḍīna idh aḥyānā. Bi-al-raḥmati al-ʻuẓmá allatī qad ʻammati // jamīʻa khalqihi wa-ayḍan tammati. Nubūwatun bi-hā al-Rasūlu al-ʻArabī // Muḥammadu al-Mukhtāru ʻan kulli nabī ..."
Secundo folio: Min mā ghusil aw wuḍuwun aw maraq.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 15 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair and thick naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Durrah al-muntaḍirah fī al-najāsāt al-maʻfw ʻanhā, lil-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, farīd ʻaṣrihi wa-waḥīd dahrihi, al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Shurunbulālī, ʻafá Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu, wa-raḥimahu, wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Three verses of poetry about objects left by the Prophet: "Naẓm fī mukhallafātih ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Qad khallafa al-Muṣṭafá al-Mukhtār amtiʻatan // min baʻdihi lam takun irthan li-insāni ..."

al-Shurunbulālī's treatise ends with: "... Wa-in tará [tara] al-zallata fī al-maqālī // fa-iṣfaḥ ʻani al-jānī al-Shurunbulālī. Wa-Aḥmadi al-isma ʻasá an yaḥmudā // fī ḥashrihi ʻan ṣafḥi mā bi-hi iʻtadá. Sammaytuhā al-Luʼluʼah al-muntaḍirah // wa-aḥmadu Allāha ʻalá mā yassarah. Thumma al-ṣalātu wa-al-salāmu al-awfá // ʻalá al-Nabīyi aṣli kull al-shurafā. Wa-al-āli wa-al-ṣuḥbi wa-kulli mūmini // mā dāma sulṭānu mufīḍi al-minani."

Colophon: "Tammat al-Manẓūmah bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād ilá Allāh taʻālá Aḥmad al-Samājīlī, ʻafá Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu bi-mannihi wa-karamih. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-ʻiddat abyāt hādhihi al-Manẓūmah thalāthumiʼat bayt. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."

Translation of the colophon: "The Manẓūmah [treatise in verse] was completed by the praise of God, His help and abundant benevolence, by the hand of the poorest of the worshipers to God Almighty, Aḥmad al-Samājīlī, may God Almighty forgive him by His grace and generosity. Amen. Amen. The verses in this "Manẓūmah" are three hundred in number, but God is more knowledgeable."

record.title: 880-01 Dhāt al-durar fī ʻilm al-raml : manuscript.
record.note: Title from (folio 1a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-qadīm al-azalī // al-mūmini al-muhayymini al-fardi al-ʻalī. Subḥānuhu rabbun raḥīmun wārithu // mumītunā muḥyī al-ʻiẓāmi al-bāʻithu. Muṣalliyan ʻalá al-Nabīyi al-ʻArabī // azká ṣalātin ʻadduhā lam yuḥsabi ..."
Secundo folio: Fa-awwalu al-shahri yakūnu aẓharā.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 17.5 cm; 20-24 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; few notes on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi al-urjūzah al-musammāh 'Dhāt al-durar fī ʻilm al-raml', taʼlīf al-Imām al-Muʻizz alladhī ikhtaṭṭa al-Qāhirah, fī ḍarb al-raml, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu wa-ʻannā, wa-mashāyikhinā, wa-wālidīnā, wa-al-Muslimīn. Wa-ḥarrara dhālika li-nafsihi, bi-yadihi al-fāniyah, al-faqīr ʻAlī ibn Ḥasan Nāmizah al-Udfuwī, ʻufiya ʻanhu. M."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... Wa-man nawá amran wa-laysa yudrikuh // min baʻdi ḥīnin yaʼtīhi [yaʼtihi] wa-yamlikuh. Wa-rubbamā dallat ʻalá al-safīnati // wa-al-ḥāmili al-najībati al-amīnati. Bashshir raʻāka Allāhu bi-al-ghulām // wa-unṭuq bi-mā jarat bi-hi aḥkām. Wa-qad tadūmu lawʻatu al-masjūn // li-annahā dalīluhu al-maḍmūn ..."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Waraqāt : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Maḥallī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá [... ... ...]. Hādhihi waraqāt qalīlah, tashtamilu ʻalá maʻrifat fuṣūl min uṣūl al-fiqh, yantafiʻu bi-hā al-mubtadī wa-ghayruhu. Wa-dhālika, ay, lafẓ uṣūl al-fiqh, muʼallaf min, yaʻnī murakkab, juzʼayn, aḥaduhumā uṣūl, wa-al-ākhar fiqh, mufradayn, min al-ifrād muqābil al-tarkīb, lā al-tathniyah wa-al-jamʻ. Wa-al-muʼallaf yuʻrafu <yuʻrafu> bi-maʻrifat mā ullifa minhu. Fa-al-aṣl alladhī huwa mufrad, al-juzʼ al-awwal, mā buniya ʻalayhi ghayruhu, ka-aṣl al-jidār, ay asāsuhu, wa-aṣl al-shajarah, ay ṭarafuhā al-thābit fī al-arḍ ..."
Secundo folio: ʻalá tarkihi wa-yakfī fī ṣidq al-ʻiqāb.
15 x 20 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; with the phrases of "al-Waraqāt" of Imām al-Ḥaramayn al-Juwaynī in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Waraqāt, lil-ʻAllāmah Jalāl al-Dīn al-Maḥallī al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh wa-nafaʻanā bi-ʻulūmihi. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Dakhalat fī al-mulk [mulk] al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Ḥasan Yūsuf ibn al-marḥūm Ḥasan ibn al-Ḥājj ʻAlī [... ... ...] al-Ghazzālī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn wa-li-man daʻā lahum bi-al-maghfirah. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. M."
On folio 1a: Miscellaneous quotations in poetry and prose.
On folio 12b: Scribbled quotations in poetry and prose (mostly illegible).
Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillā̕h waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Man lā Nabī baʻdah. Allāhumma ighfir lanā wa-lil-Muslimīn."
Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on Him Who no Prophet Comes after Him. O God. Forgive us and the Muslims."

record.title: 880-01 Kashkūl : manuscript.

2. Title of Khāfiyah fī ʻilm al-khaṭṭ al-sharīf from incipit (folio 13a).

5. Title of Aḥādīth ʻalá ḥurūf al-muʻjamah from incipit (folio 35b)
6. Title of Miʻrāj al-Nabī from folio 38b.
7. Title of Naṣīḥat al-ikhwān wa-murshidat al-khillān from reference sources.

9. Title of Miscellaneous proverbs supplied by cataloger.
10. Title of al-Lumaʻ al-yasīrah fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb from incipit (folio 78b).

1. Incipit of ́ʻIlm al-khaṭṭ (folio 1b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Qāla al-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, wa-al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, farīd zamānih wa-waḥīd awānih, al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá al-Ḥusaynī al-Naqshabandī, al-shahīr bi-ʻIṣām al-Dīn, nafaʻa Allāh al-Muslimīn bi-ʻulūmih, wa-aʻāda ʻalaynā min barakātihi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn. ʻIlm al-khaṭṭ, iḍāfatuhu immā bayānīyah, bināʼan ʻalá al-mutabādar, aw, lāmīyah [kalāmīyah (?)], wa-hiya immā bi-maʻná al-ʻahd al-dhihnī, aw, bi-maʻná al-istighrāq. Thumma, al-khaṭṭ fī al-lughah bi-maʻná al-katb wa-al-kitābah, yuqālu khaṭṭa bi-al-qalam, ay, kataba, wa-al-jamʻ khuṭūṭ, bi-al-ḍamm ..."
Secundo folio of ́ʻIlm al-khaṭṭ: ʻanz, wa-kānat ʻanz sūʼ.

1a. Incipit of the excerpt from the unidentified medico-religious treatise (folio 12a): "Tadbīr al-yaqẓah. Iʻlam inna al-insān lā yaṣluḥu an yuḍīʻa zamānahu baṭālatan, fa-yamḍī kulluhu fāsidan. Qāla ʻUmar ibn al-Khaṭṭāb, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu: In [Innī] la-akrahu an ará aḥadakum sahlalan [sahlan], yaʻnī lā fī ʻamalin dīnī wa-lā fī ʻamalin dunyawīyah [dunyawī] ..."

2. Incipit of Khāfiyah fī ʻilm al-khaṭṭ al-sharīf: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-kafá, wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīna iṣṭafá. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-ghanī al-qadīr, Ḥujayj ibn Qāsim, man huwa bi-al-Waḥīdī shahīr: Qad saʼalanī baʻḍ al-ikhwān, mimman huwa mashhūr bi-al-ṣalāḥ wa-al-ṣilah wa-al-iḥsān, an uwallifa la-hu 'Khāfiyah fī ʻilm al-ḥarf al-sharīf', wa-ūdiʻahā min kull maʻná laṭīf, wa-ubayna fīhā mā khafiya fī al-khāfiyah al-Aflāṭūnīyah, wa-al-Shamsīyah, wa-al-Qamarīyah, wa-al-Shāmūrīyah, wa-al-Tankalūthīyah, wa-al-Jaʻfarīyah, wa-al-Ghazālīyah, wa-al-ʻArabīyah, wa-al-Būnīyah, wa-al-Sabʻīnīyah, wa-mā akhfathu al-awāʼil ..."
Secundo folio of Khāfiyah fī ʻilm al-khaṭṭ al-sharīf: [jadwal] ʻadad al-wazn ḥarārah yubūsah.

3. Incipit of Najāt al-ghāfilīn wa-tuḥfat al-ṭālibīn: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī zayyana qulūb al-muʼminīn bi-al-īmān wa-al-akhlāq al-ʻiẓām, wa-bayyana lahum al-ḥalāl wa-al-ḥarām, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad alladhī istanqadha ummatahu bi-al-tablīgh al-ʻiyān [wa-al-ʻiyān] wa-al-iʻlām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi alladhīna hum ka-al-aʻlām. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu afqar al-mawjūdāt bi-khāliq al-kāʼināt, Aḥmad Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn Muṣṭafá, ḥsharahumā Allāh taḥta liwāʼ al-Muṣṭafá: Qad saʼalanī baʻḍ al-ṭullāb an ajmaʻa risālah fī al-kabāʼir wa-al-ṣaghāʼir wa-al-akhlāq al-razāʼil [al-radhāʼil], fa-ajabtuhu ilá dhālik ... wa-sammaytuhā Najāt [Najāh] al-ghāfilīn wa-tuḥfat al-ṭālibīn ..."
Secundo folio of Najāt al-ghāfilīn wa-tuḥfat al-ṭālibīn: wa-yamīn al-ghamūs huwa ḥalf al-rajul.

4. Incipit of ʻIlm al-Firāsah (folio 29b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi 'Qiṭʻah min kitāb al-Firāsah wa-fī ʻilm al-siyāsah ayḍan', taʼlīf Arisṭāṭālīs al-Ḥakīm, firāsatan minhu ilá al-Malik al-Iskandar. Qāl: Iʻlam ayyuhā al-Malik Iskandar, inna ʻilm al-firāsah ʻilm kabīr, wa-ʻalá qadīm al-zamān istaʻmalathu al-awāʼil wa-tafākharat fīhi ..."
Secundo folio of ʻIlm al-Firāsah: wa-fī ʻilm al-siyāsah mā yughnīka.

5. Incipit of Aḥādīth ʻalá ḥurūf al-muʻjamah (folio 35b): "Aḥādīth ʻalá ḥurūf al-muʻjamah. Ḥarf al-Alif: Allāhumma ṣallī [ṣalli] wa-sallim wa-bārik ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-qāʼil: al-ʻUlamāʼ warathat al-anbiyāʼ. Wa-ṣallī [Wa-ṣalli] wa-sallim wabārik ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-qāʼil: al-Ḥummá min fayḥ Jahannam, fa-aṭfiʼūhā bi-al-māʼ ..."
Secundo folio of Aḥādīth ʻalá ḥurūf al-muʻjamah: Ḥarf al-Khāʼ. Allāhumma ṣallī.
5a. The excerpt from "Sharḥ al-Mūjaz" (folio 38a) starts with: "Ṣifat ayārij min 'Sharḥ al-Mujaz'. Ayārij fīqrā, ay, al-murr. Qāla al-Shaykh: Huwa ayārij al-ṣabr, wa-qad qurin bi-al-dāraṣīnī ..."

6. Incipit of Miʻrāj al-Nabī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala 'Laylata [Laylaha] usriya bī' min khaṣāʼiṣ hādhā al-Nabī al-bashīr, wa-jaʻalahu fīhā malādhan wa-zukhran [wa-dhukhran] wa-hādiyan wa-munqidhan wa-nāṣiḥan li-ummatihi, wa-lahum nadhīr. Wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdah lā sharīka lah, shahādatan tunjī qāʼilahā min ḥarr al-saʻīr ..."
Secundo folio of Miʻrāj al-Nabī: li-iqāmat hādhā al-dīn al-shahīr.

6a. Incipit of the first invocation (folio 56b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī khalaqa al-khalq wa-nashara al-ʻulūm, wa-ajrá al-aflāk wa-sakhkhara al-nujūm, wa-anzala fī ʻilmihi al-manṭūq wa-al-mafhūm, wa-yaʻlamu al-amr al-ẓāhir kamā yaʻlamu al-sirr al-maktūm ..."

6b. Incipit of the second invocation (folio 57a): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī taṭawwala wa-takarram, wa-jāʼa wa-irtafaʻa fī ʻulāh, Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, yaʻlamu dabīb al-namlat al-sawdāʼ ʻalá al-ṣakhrah al-ṣammāʼ, wa-yaʻlamu mustaqarruh [mustaqarrahu] wa-mathwihi [wa-mathwāh], al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, yarḥamu kulla shayʼ, wa-yamhulu al-ʻuqūbah ʻalá man ʻaṣāhu ..."

7. Incipit of Naṣīḥat al-ikhwān wa-murshidat al-khillān (folios 57b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Iʻtazil dhikra al-aghānī wa-al-ghazal // wa-quli al-faṣla wa-jānib man hazal. Wa-daʻi al-dhikrá li-ayyām al-ṣibā // fa-li-ayyāmi al-ṣibā najmun afal ..."
Secundo folio of Naṣīḥat al-ikhwān wa-murshidat al-khillān: Lā taqul qad dhahabat arbābuhu.

Secundo folio of Miscellanea on magic, devination, etc.: Wa-hādhā murabbaʻ ʻadadī wa-ḥarfī.

9. Incipit of Miscellaneous proverbs (folio 76a): "ʻAbd al-shahwah adhall min ʻabd al-riqq. al-Ḥāsid mughtāẓ ʻalá man lā dhanba lah. Kafá bi-al-ẓafar shafīfan [shafīʻan (?)] lil-mudhnib. Rubba sāghin [sāʻin] fīmā yaḍurruhu. Wa-qāl ..."
Secundo folio of Miscellaneous proverbs: al-ḥirmān maʻa al-ḥirṣ. Wa-min kalāmihi.

10. Incipit of al-Lumaʻ al-yasīrah fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb (folio 78b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-ʻumdah, Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻImād, al-shahīr wāliduhu bi-al-Hāʼim, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad Khātam al-Nabīyīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn: Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi 'Lumaʻ yasīrah fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb', yuḍṭarru ilá maʻrifatihā man yurīdu al-shurūʻ fī al-farāʼiḍ, nāfiʻah, in shāʼa Allāh ..."
Secundo folio of al-Lumaʻ al-yasīrah fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb: wa-thalāthīn fī al-ḍarb yanqasimu ʻalá thalāthah.

11. Incipit of Extracts from Nuzhat al-majālis fī adhkār al-ṣabāḥ (folio 88b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Laṭīfah dhakarahā fī Kitāb Nuzhat al-majālis fī adhkār al-ṣabāḥ. ʻAn al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, annahu qāl: Ḥubbiba ilayya min dunyākum thalāth: al-Ṭīb, wa-al-nisāʼ, wa-qurrat ʻaynī fī al-ṣalāh ..."
Secundo folio of Extracts from Nuzhat al-majālis fī adhkār al-ṣabāḥ: wa-anā ḥubbiba ilayya min al-dunyā thalāth.

12. Incipit of Urjūzah fī al-manṭiq (90a): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī li-ʻabdihi // naylu al-sanāʼi lā la-hu fī ḥamdihi. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāhi kamā yastawjibu // li-ʻizzihi al-ʻālī alladhī lā yughlabu. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāhi alladhī burhānuhu // an laysa shānun fīhi illā shānahu ..."
Secundo folio of Urjūzah fī al-manṭiq: Mā lam tuʼayyad bi-ḥuṣūl al-ālah.

Secundo folio of Treatise on magic, occultism, folk medicine, etc.: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm.

14. Incipit of Duʻāʼ Jaljālūtīyah (folio 110a): "Hādhā Duʻāʼ Jaljālūtīyah li-Ḥaḍrat [li-Ḥaḍrah] Sayyidinā ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib. Badaʼtu, bismi [bi-bismi] Allāhi rūḥī bi-hi ihtadat // ilá sharaf [kashfi] asrārin bi-bāṭinihi inṭawat. Wa-ṣallaytu fī al-thānī ʻalá khayri khalqihi // Muḥammadin man zāḥa al-ḍalālata wa-al-ghalat. Ilāhī laqad aqamtu [aqsamtu] bismika dāʻiyan // bi-nūrin jalā jalāluhu [jaljaluhu] fa-tajaljalat ..."
Secundo folio of Duʻāʼ Jaljālūtīyah: wa-ikfi jamīʻ al-mukīdīn min kaydihim.

15. Incipit of Manẓūmah fī al-akl wa-al-shurb wa-al-dukhān wa-al-qahwah wa-ghayr dhālik (folio 112b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-muʼallif, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah: ʻAlayya atá shahru al-ṣiyāmi wa-lam akun // muḥaḍḍira ashyāʼin min al-qūti wa-al-adam. Wa-mā ʻāyanat ʻaynāya jisman al-ṣāʼimi [li-ṣāʼimin] // taqawwá bi-ghayri al-qamḥi wa-al-samni wa-al-laḥmi. Fa-anʻim bihā qūtan wa-adman wa-ladhdhatan // li-taqwiyati al-abdāni fī al-fiṭri wa-al-ṣawmi. Li-kulli ṭaʻāmin ṣīgha minhu ladhādhatun // wa-manfaʻatun tasrī ilá muntahá al-jismi ..."
Secundo folio of Manẓūmah fī al-akl wa-al-shurb wa-al-dukhān wa-al-qahwah wa-ghayr dhālik: Yuqālu lahā shiʻrīyatun in tafattalat.

16. Incipit of Treatise on plants, animals and the natural phenomena (folio 115a): "Shajarat al-Qirmiz, wa-hiya shajarah taḥmil al-qirmiz fī faṣl al-rabīʻ ʻinda hubūb rīḥ al-janūb, wa-yujmaʻu wa-yudaqqu, wa-yulqá fī ināʼ ṣufr, wa-yughmar bi-al-māʼ, wa-yuṭbakhu bi-nār layyinah, fa-yaḥmarru ḥumrah shadīdah, fa-yuṣaffá māʼuhu, wa-yuṣbaghu bi-hi baʻda an yuḥalla al-shabb fī al-māʼ bi-al-ṭabkh, wa-yughmasu fīhi al-thawb, thumma yughmasu fī māʼ al-qirmiz wa-yujaffafu, fa-lā yanqaṭiʻu ṣabghuhu wa-law ghusila bi-māʼ al-qilī ..."
Secundo folio of Treatise on plants, animals and the natural phenomena: wa-yunaqqī al-jild wa-al-aʻḍāʼ al-ʻaṣabīyah.

17. Incipit of Min kitāb Ibn al-Quff al-Mutaṭabbib al-Masīḥī (folio 118b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla Abiqrāṭ: al-ʻUmr qaṣīr, wa-al-ṣināʻah ṭawīlah, wa-al-waqt ḍayyiq, wa-al-tajribah khaṭirah, wa-al-qaḍāʼ ʻasir. Qāla al-shāriḥ: Inna sharḥ hādhā al-faṣl fīhi arbaʻata ʻashara baḥthan ..."
Secundo folio of Min kitāb Ibn al-Quff al-Mutaṭabbib al-Masīḥī: wa-hiya al-tajribah wa-al-baʻḍ al-ākhar ʻasir.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surfaces: vary; lines per page vary.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings, key words and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
The pages of the codex are numbered (in pencil) in Indian numerals: 1-254.

On folio 1a: An index of contents, as follows: "Fihrist al-kitāb. 1. ʻIlm al-khaṭṭ, lil-Sayyid Muṣṭafá al-Ḥusaynī. 27. Najāt [Najāh] al-ghāfilīn, li-Aḥmad Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn Afandī. 57. ʻIlm al-firāsah, li-Arisṭāṭālīs. 69. Aḥādīth ʻalá ḥurūf al-muʻjamah [al-muʻjam]. 77. Miʻrāj al-Nabī, ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. 119. Fawāʼid min ʻilm [al-ʻilm] al-rūḥānī. 157. ʻIlm al-ḥisāb, li-Ibn al-Hāʼim. 181. Urjūzah fī al-manṭiq, lil-Raʼīs Ibn Sīnā. 115. Naẓm lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-Qāḍī ʻUmar ibn al-Wardī. 200. Fawāʼid manthūrah. 229. Fī al-ʻumr al-ṭabīʻī wa-fī qiṣarih wa-fī al-ṣināʻah."

At the head of folio 14b: "Najāt [Najāh] al-ghāfilīn."

On the left margin of the colophon (folio 29a): A statement by the copyist indicating that he transcribed his copy from the edition printed in Cairo, at the end of Rajab, of the year 1268 of the Hijrah (20 May 1852): "Wa-naqaltu dhālika [tilka] al-risālah ʻan risālah ṭubiʻa [ṭubiʻat] bi-naẓārat aṭmaʻ al-ʻibād ilá alṭāf Rabbihi, al-rājī Muḥammad Rajāʼī. At the head of folio 38b: "Hādhā Miʻrāj al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam."
At the head of folio 57b: "Lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-Qāḍī ʻUmar ibn al-Wardī mūṣiyan li-ibnihi, raḥimahum Allāh taʻālá ..."

On folio 90a: "Urjūzah fī al-mantiq lil-Raʼīs Abū ʻAlī ibn Sīnā, raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn."
On the margin of folio 97b: "Wa-qad nuqilat hādhihi al-nuskhah ʻalá nuskhah muʼarrakhah fī 16 Dhī al-Ḥijjah, sanat 1173."
On folio 98a: A Ḥadīth quoted from al-Ṣaḥīḥayn.

Under the colophon of Min kitāb Ibn al-Quff al-Mutaṭabbib al-Masīḥī (folio 126a): The copyist wrote the following statement, as an orthographic riddle, with the letters connected without spaces: "Nuskhatunjalīlatunsamatfaʻalatfahiyaminmannimanman[naʻalá]muḥsininʻaláḤusayninbi-naskhihā [Nuskhatun jalīlatun samat fa-ʻalat fa-hiya min manni man manna [ʻalá] muḥsinin ʻalá Ḥusaynin bi-naskhihā]."

1. Author's colophon of "́ʻIlm al-khaṭṭ" (flolio 11b): "Wa-qāla al-muʼallif: Qad istarāḥa al-qalam ʻan taʼlīf hādhā al-sharḥ ʻalá 'ʻIlm al-khaṭṭ' al-mukhraj min 'al-Nuqāyah', al-mushtamilah ʻalá arbaʻata ʻashar ʻulūman [ʻilman], lil-Imām al-Suyūṭī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-nafaʻanā Allāh bi-ʻulūmihi, ʻalá yamīn muʼallifihi al-faqīr Muṣṭafá al-Ḥusaynī al-Naqshabandī al-shahīr bi-ʻIṣām al-Dīn, fī ʻasharah min al-Ṣafar [Ṣafar] al-khayr, sanat arbaʻ wa-sittīn wa-miʼah wa-alf. Qad sawwadnāhu ʻasharata sāʻah. Thumma hādhā awwal mā waḍaʻtu al-qalam fī hādhā al-ʻilm."

Translation of the author's colophon of "́ʻIlm al-khaṭṭ": "The author said: The pen has rested from authoring this commentary on 'ʻIlm al-khaṭṭ' (Science of handwriting/orthography), which was extracted from 'al-Nuqāyah', that includes fourteen sciences, of al-Imām al-Suyūṭī, may God be pleased with him and may He benefit us by his sciences, by the right hand of its author, the poor Muṣṭafá al-Ḥusaynī al-Naqshabandī, known as ʻIṣām al-Dīn, on the tenth of blessed Ṣafar, of the year1164 [of the Hijrah = 8 January 1751], having drafted it in ten hours. Also, this is the first of what I have penned of this science."

1. Copyist's colophon of "́ʻIlm al-khaṭṭ" (flolio 11b): "Tamma taḥrīruhu ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-Karīm al-Raḥīm, Ḥusayn ibn al-Ḥājj Muṣṭafá Abū ʻAwdah al-Ḥakīm, fī yawm al-khāmis ʻashar min Muḥarram, sanat thamānīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min al-Hijrah."

Translation of the copyist's colophon of ́ʻIlm al-khaṭṭ: "Copied by the hand of the poor servant to his Generous and Merciful Lord, the Physician Ḥusayn ibn al-Ḥājj Muṣṭafá Abū ʻAwdah, on 15 Muḥarram, of the year 1280 of the Hijrah [2 July 1863]."

1a. Colophon of the Excerpt from the unidentified medico-religious treatise: "Thumma tafná al-ṭabīʻah al-ḥayawah [al-ḥayawīyah]; kamā dhakarnā, wa-dhālika huwa al-mawt al-ṭabīʻī wa-al-ḥimām al-maqdūr lil-anām. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-ghaybihi wa-aḥkam."

Translation of the colophon of the Excerpt from the unidentified medico-religious treatise: "Then the vital nature perishes, as we mentioned; due to the fact that this is the natural death and the destined fate of mankind. However, God is more knowledgeable of His hidden secrets and He is the wisest."

2. Colophon of Khāfiyah fī ʻilm al-khaṭṭ al-sharīf (folio 14a): "Wa-hādhā huwa al-ʻilm al-sharīf alladhī akhadha jamīʻ al-nās ajzāʼuhu [ajzāʼahu], wa-hiya jumlah jāmiʻah tusāʻidu fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Tammat."

Translation of the colophon of Khāfiyah fī ʻilm al-khaṭṭ al-sharīf: "This is the noble science whose elements were adopted by all people, an integrated whole, that helps in this world and the hereafter. It is completed."

3. Colophon of Najāt al-ghāfilīn wa-tuḥfat al-ṭālibīn: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī manaḥanā bi-jamʻ hādhihi al-risālah al-mufīdah al-wajīzah, al-musammāh bi-Najāt al-ghāfilīn irshād al-ṭālib, al-Ākhirah wa-al-najāh fī Yawm al-Dīn, al-mansūbah ilá al-ḥabr al-fāḍil wa-al-ʻālim al-kāmil, Aḥmad Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn Afandī ibn Muṣṭafá Afandī, ʻāmalahu al-Mawlá bi-al-Luṭf. Tamma ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-Karīm al-Raḥīm, Ḥusayn ibn al-Ḥājj Muṣṭafá Abū ʻAwdah al-Ḥakīm bi-Dimashq maḥrūsat al-Shām, ajallahā Allāh taʻālá. Fī ghurrat Muḥarram al-ḥarām, sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-thamānīn. Sanat 1280. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon of Najāt al-ghāfilīn wa-tuḥfat al-ṭālibīn: "Praise be to God -- Who, by compiling this useful short epistle, titled 'Najāt al-ghāfilīn irshād al-ṭālib', which is attributed to the eminent authority and the perfect scholar, Aḥmad Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn Afandī ibn Muṣṭafá Afandī, may the Lord treat him with kindness -- granted us the Hereafter and deliverance on Judgement Day. It was completed by the hand of the poor servant to his Generous and Merciful Lord, Ḥusayn ibn al-Ḥājj Muṣṭafá Abū ʻAwdah, the Physician in Damascus, in protected Syria, may God Almighty exalt It. Dated, the beginning of the sacred month of Muḥarram, of the year 1280 [of the Hijrah = 18 June 1863]. It is completed."

4. Colophon of ʻIlm al-firāsah (folio 35a): "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb. Wa-qad kamula mā sayyamnāhu [sammaynāhu] ʻIlm al-firāsah, ʻalá ḥasb al-imkān, wa-taraknā mā lā yalīqu dhikruhu mimmā lā yaḥtāju ilayhi al-insān, wa-billāh al-mustaʻān, wa-ʻalá karamihi wa-jūdihi al-tiklān fī kull waqt wa-awān. Fī sanat 1278."

Translation of the colophon of ʻIlm al-firāsah: "God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. Completed is what I called "ʻIlm al-firāsah" (science of physiognomy), as much as it is possible, having left what is not worthy to be mentioned of what people do not need. Help is sought from God; on His generosity and openhandedness is the reliance, in every time and duration. In the year 1278 [of the Hijrah = 1861/1862]."

5. Colophon of Aḥādīth ʻalá ḥurūf al-muʻjamah. No colophon. Text ends with information about the birth and death of al-Ḥusayn, and a Ḥadīth about al-Ḥasan and al-Ḥusayn: "... Wa-qāla ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam fī al-Ḥasan wa-al-Ḥusayn: Allāhumma innī uḥibbuhumā, fa-uḥibbu man yuḥibbuhumā. Tammat [It is completed].
5a. The excerpt from "Sharḥ al-Mujaz" ends with: "... yudaqqu wa-yunkhalu al-thurbah, dirhamān, maʻa ʻasal wa-māʼ fātir."

6. Colophon of Miʻrāj al-Nabī: "Wa-hādhā mā [in]tahá ilaynā min ḥadīth al-Miʻrāj. Wa-astaghfiru Allāh min al-dhiyādāt [al-ziyādāt] wa-al-nuqṣān. Wa-billāh al-tawfīq, wa-la-hu al-imtinān. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-qad tammat ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, Ḥusayn ibn Ḥājj Muṣṭafá Abū ʻAwdah al-Ṭabīb, fī 10 Rajab, sanat 1274. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

Translation of the colophon of Miʻrāj al-Nabī: "This is what reached us of the account of 'al-Miʻrāj'. I seek forgiveness from God for whatever additions or omissions. Success comes from God. To Him is the gratitude. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. Completed by the hand of the poor servant to God Almighty, the Physician Ḥusayn ibn Ḥājj Muṣṭafá Abū ʻAwdah, on 10 Rajab, of the year 1274 [of the Hijrah = 24 February 1858]. Praise be to God alone."

6a. The first invocation ends with: "... Anzala Āyat al-Kursī, wa-jaʻalahā afḍal al-Qurʼān al-Ḥakīm, fa-hiya khamsūn kalimah mā samiʻa bi-mithlihā Mūsá al-Kalīm, unzilat maʻa sabʻīn alf malak karīm, wa-kharrat li-haybatihā al-aṣnām, wa-huwa iblīs al-rajīm, fa-innahā idhan taṭrudu al-jinn, wa-tubṭilu al-siḥr, wa-tashfī al-saqīm, wa-taḥruthu al-māl lil-musāfir wa-al-muqīm, wa-khaṭbuhā ʻamīm, wa-fayfuhā jasīm. Subḥānuhu, wa-Huwa al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm."
6b. Colophon of the second invocation: "Tamma al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb. Sanat 1274."
Translation of the colophon of the second invocation: "The book is completed by the help of God, the Abundant Giving King. In the year 1274 [of the Hijrah = 1857/1858]."

7. Colophon of Naṣīḥat al-ikhwān wa-murshidat al-khillān: No colophon. The poem ends with: "... Wa-ṣalātun wa-salāmun abadan // lil-Nabīyi al-Muṣṭafá khayri al-duwal. Wa-ʻalá al-āli al-kirāmi al-suʻadā // wa-ʻalá al-aṣḥābi wa-al-qawmi al-uwal. Mā nawá al-rakbu bi-ʻushshāqin ilá // aymani al-ḥayyi wa-mā ghanná ramal."

8. Colophon of Miscellanea on magic, etc.: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... bal kāna qabla al-ʻawālim kullihā ajmaʻīn. Anta iḥāṭatī min jamīʻ al-salāṭīn wa-al-shayāṭīn, wa-ʻawnī ʻalá al-abʻadīn wa-al-aqrabīn, wa-wijhatī ʻalá al-ajnās al-mukhtalifīn, Īyāka naʻbudu bi-al-ifrād ..."

9. Colophon of Miscellaneous proverbs: No colophon. Text ends with an invocation attributed to the Prophet, as follows: "Wa-qāla ʻalayhi al-salām: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Allāhumma innī aʻdadtu li-kull hawl 'Lā ilāha illā Allāh', wa-li-kull hamm wa-ghamm 'Mā shāʼa Allāh', wa-li-kull niʻmatin 'al-Ḥamdu lillāh', wa-li-kull rakhāʼ wa-shiddah 'al-Shukru lillāh', wa-li-kull uʻjūbah 'Subḥāna Allāh', wa-li-kull dhanbin 'Astaghfiru Allāh', wa-li-kull muṣībatin 'Innā lillāh', wa-li-kull ḍīqatin 'Ḥasbiya Allāh', wa-li-kull qaḍāʼ wa-qadar 'Tawakkaltu ʻalá Allāh', wa-li-kull ṭāʻah wa-maʻṣiyah 'Lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh'."

10. Colophon of al-Lumaʻ al-yasīrah fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb: "Wa-fī hādhā al-qadr alladhī awradnāhu kifāyah li-man waffaqahu Allāh taʻālá. Tammat ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-Karīm, Ḥusayn ibn al-Ḥājj Muṣṭafá Abū ʻAwdah al-Ḥakīm, fī ghurrat M [Muḥarram], sanat 1280 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah. M."

Translation of the colophon of al-Lumaʻ al-yasīrah fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb: "The amount we introduced herein is sufficient for him whom God Almighty has enabled to succeed. Completed by the hand of the poor servant to his Generous Lord, the Physician Ḥusayn ibn al-Ḥājj Muṣṭafá Abū ʻAwdah, in the beginning of Muḥarram, of the year 1280 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [18 June 1863. M."

11. Colophon of Extracts from Nuzhat al-majālis fī adhkār al-ṣabāḥ: No colophon. Text ends with: "... Hādhā, wa-al-munhá ilaykum, saḥat sajāyil al-niʻam ʻalaykum, inna [innā] kathīrūn al-ashwāq, wa-rājūn min Allāh qurb al-talāq, nāshirūn ʻankum alwiyat al-thanāʼ, dāʻūn lakum fī al-ṣabāḥ wa-al-masāʼ. Wa-al-marjū min murūwatikum al-kāmilah wa-ʻulū himmatikum al-shāmilah. Tammat."
12. Colophon of Urjūzah fī al-manṭiq: "Tammat al-Urjūzah al-manṭiqīyah bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusni tawfīqh."
Translation of the colophon of Urjūzah fī al-manṭiq: "The Urjūzah (Poem) on logic was completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence."

13. Colophon of Treatise on magic, occultism, folk medicine, etc.: No colophon. Text ends with: "... Lil-jamāʻ. Yuʼkhadh dam al-ʻaṣāfīr al-dhukūr ḥīna tadhbaḥuhum, wa-taʻjin bi-hi daqīq ʻadas, wa-tajʻal banādiq, fa-idhā aradta al-jamāʻ dawwib wāḥidah wa-iṭlī bi-hā iḥlīlaka tará al-ʻajāʼib min dawām al-intiʻāṭ. Fāʼidah: Man kataba hādhihi al-asmāʼ ʻalá ayy shayʼ yurīdu bayʻahu fa-inna al-nufūs targhabu fī shirāʼihi, wa-hiya hādhihi: Q Q A W Ḥ Y D."

14. Colophon of Duʻāʼ Jaljālūtīyah: No colophon. Text ends with: "... Yā qawmanā ajībū daʻiyā [dāʻiya] Allāh wa-āminū bi-hi yaghfir lakum min dhunūbikum wa-yajirkum min ʻadhābin alīm. Wa-man lā yujib dāʻiyā [dāʻiya] Allāh fa-laysa bi-muʻjizin fī al-arḍ, wa-laysa la-hu min dūnihi awliyāʼ, ulāʼika fī ḍalālin mubīn. Yā Allāh. Yā Muʻīn. Tamm."

15. Colophon of Manẓūmah fī al-akl wa-al-shurb wa-al-dukhān wa-al-qahwah wa-ghayr dhālik (folio 99b): "... Fa-yā Rabbi kun li-Ibn al-Shubukshīyi sātiran // wa-kun ghāfiran mā qad janāhu mina al-ithmi. Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh."

Translation of the colophon of Manẓūmah fī al-akl wa-al-shurb wa-al-dukhān wa-al-qahwah wa-ghayr dhālik: "... O My Lord! Protect Ibn al-Shubukshī // Forgive what he committed of vice. It was completed by the praise of God."

16. Colophon of Treatise on plants, animals, and the natural phenomena: No colophon. Text ends with: "... al-Kaḥlāʼ. Wa-hiya nabt ʻalá sāq, wa-lahā afnān wa-waraq layyin mithl waraq al-rayḥān, wa-wardatuhu kaḥlāʼ ḥasanat al-manẓar, wa-lā yarʻāhā shayʼ ghayr al-naḥl, wa-hiya taḥmilu bizran lā yuntafaʻu bi-hi, wa-tanbutu fī al-barārī, wa-taṣburu ʻalá al-ʻaṭash. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."
17. Colophon of Min kitāb Ibn al-Quff al-Mutaṭabbib al-Masīḥī: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Wa-katabahu al-faqīr Ḥusayn ibn Muṣṭafá Abū ʻAwdah al-Ḥakīm, sanat 1281."

Translation of the colophon of Min kitāb Ibn al-Quff al-Mutaṭabbib al-Masīḥī: "But God is more knowledgeable. Copied by the poor Muṣṭafá Abū ʻAwdah, the Physician, in the year 1281 [of the Hijrah = 1864/1865]."
