record.title: Letter from Edward Fullbrook to an unidentified recipient : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.

"In the matter of a petition filed on behalf Edward Fullbrook, formerly of Summer-town, St Giles', Oxford, and late of Woodcott, Southstoke, Oxford, Yeoman, being a person of unsound mind, and a prisoner in the gaol of Oxford Castle, in the County of Oxford. Whereas it appears to the court, by the record of William Henry Ashhurst, esq. one of Her Majesty's Justices of the Peace for the said county, made and certified to the court by the said Justice of the Peace, according to the statue in that behalf, that the said prisoner is of unsound mind, and therefore incapable of taking the benefit of the said act in such manner as a person of sound mind might do ... it is ordered and appointed, that application shall be made to the court for the discharge of the said prisoner, at the court-house, in Portugal Street, Lincoln's-Inn-Fields, on the 25th day of November 1839, at the hour of ten in the forenoon precisely, in order that the court may proceed to the discharge of said prisoner, if otherwise entitled thereto according to the true intent and meaning of the said act."--London Gazette, 1839 November 1.

The Mr. Meyer referenced in the letter may likely be William Meyer, Stallmeister and Master of the Horse, who was a part of the royal household. He retired from royal service in 1871. The Lord Albemarl referenced in the letter may likely be William Keppel, 4th Earl of Albemarle, who was the Master of Horse, under Lord Melbourne.

record.title: 880-01 Sharḥ al-ʻAwāmil al-miʼah : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu li-man wajaba ʻalaynā thanāduhu [thanāʼuhu], wa-li-man lā yazūlu min ḥubb [jamm (?)] al-naʻīm [al-niʻam (?)] alaynā ghināhu, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Muḥammad Sayyid al-anām, wa-ʻalá [ālihi wa-aṣḥ]ābihi al-kirām. Wa-baʻd, lammā raʼayutu [al-ṭālibīn yaṭlubū]na sharḥan lil-ʻAwāmil [lil-Shaykh al-Imām ʻAbd al-Q]āhir li-ḥall iʻrābahā [aradtu an ubayyina iʻrābahā bi-qa]dr ṭāqatī ..."
Secundo folio: wa-tashīlan lil-ṭālibīn wa-arjū minhum al-thanāʼ al-jamīl.
11 x 16.3 cm; written surface: 5.5 x 11.2 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with central medallions on covers.

In fair naskh taʻlīq script, in black ink, on white paper (few pages tinted in pink); some leaves replaced by different hands in fair naskh script; some notes on the margins; text within red frame; the first leaf is half torn, some text is lost; catchwords.
On the label pasted to the front cover: "Sharḥ ʻAwāmil ʻatīq."
At the head of text on folio 1b: "Sharḥ ʻAwāmil ʻatīq."
Colophon: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb."
Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed by the help of God the Abundant Giving King."

record.title: 880-02 Ghāyat al-maqṣūd li-man yataʻāṭá al-ʻuqūd : manuscript / Abū al-ʻAbbās Aḥmad ibn ʻUmar al-Dayrabī al-Shāfiʻī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ḥarrama al-sifāḥ wa-aḥalla al-nikāḥ lil-khāṣṣ wa-al-ʻāmm, wa-bayyana al-ḥarām wa-al-ḥalāl min al-nisāʼ, ʻalá lisān man arsalahu raḥmatan lil-anām. Aḥmaduhu, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, ʻalá mā manaḥanā min al-anʻām, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu, lā sharīka lah, al-Malik al-ʻallām. Wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabdahu wa-rasūlah ashraf al-anām, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābih, ṣalātan wa-salāman dāʼimayn mutalāzimayn bilā infiṣām. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, Aḥmad al-Dayrabī al-Shāfiʻī al-Ghunaymī: Qad saʼalanī wālidī wa-baʻḍ al-ikhwān min al-anām, aḥsana Allāh lī wa-lahum ka-al-mabdaʼ al-khitām, an aktuba shayʼan min al-masāʼil al-sharīfah al-mutaʻalliqah bi-al-nikāḥ ʻalá madhhab al-Shāfiʻī wa-Mālik wa-Aḥmad wa-Abī Ḥanīfah, fa-ajabtuhum li-dhālik ..."
Secundo folio: Abī Ḥanīfah al-Nuʻmān wa-al-Imām.
16.5 x 23.4 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 18 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 7 unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a and folio 68b: "Hādhā Kitāb al-Ankiḥah ʻalá madhhab al-Aʼimmah al-arbaʻah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."
On folio 2a: "... wa-sammaytuhu Ghāyat al-maqṣūd li-man yataʻāṭá al-ʻuqūd."

Author's colophon: "Wa-iʻlam innahu qad ḥaṣala al-shurūʻ fī taʼlīf hādhā al-mukhtaṣar [crossed over] al-muʼallaf fī al-sanah al-sādisah al-kāʼinah baʻda al-miʼah wa-al-alf. Thumma ḥaṣala lī mawāniʻ fī athnāʼihi manaʻatnī ʻan itmāmihi, minhā al-tazwīj fī al-sanah al-madhkūrah, wa-al-humūm fī ṭalab al-maʻīshah, wa-al-ghalāʼ al-shadīd alladhī lam nara li-ghayrinā min ahl ʻaṣrinā mithlahu fī al-sanah allatī baʻdahā, ḥattá māta ghālib al-nās fīhā jūʻan, lā aʻāda Allāh mithlahā."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Know that the writing of this compendium [crossed over] book started in the year 1106 [of the Hijrah = 1694/1695]. Then, in the meantime, some hinderances occurred to me that prevented me from completing it, of which was my marriage in that mentioned year, worries about securing a living, and the severe high rise in prices, the following year, which we had not seen like it happening to others of our era; that most people died of hunger that year. May God repeat not what was like it."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah yawm al-Thulāthāʼ al-mubārak, rābiʻ yawm fī Rabīʻ al-Thānī, sanat 1196. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This copy was completed on blessed Tuesday, 4 Rabīʻ al-Thānī, of the year 1196 [of the Hijrah = 17 March, 1782]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and on his family and companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī al-mukhtār : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Jazūlī.
record.note: 1. Title of Sūrat al-Kahf from folio 1b.
2. Title of Biography of al-Jazūlī supplied by cataloger.
3. Title of Dhikr al-ṣalwah [al-ṣalāh] ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-faḍāʼiluhā from folio 21b-22a.
4. Title of Asmāʼ al-Nabī supplied by cataloger.
5. Title of Ṣifat al-Rawḍah al-Sharīfah from folio 36a.
6. Title of Duʻāʼ qabla al-shurūʻ bi-qirāʼat Dalāʼil al-Khayrāt from folio 38b.
7. Title of Dalāʼil al-khayrāt from folio 16a.
8. Title of Duʻāʼ khatm Dalāʼil al-khayrāt from folio 132b.
9. Title of Ādāb ṣalawāt al-istikhārah from folio 138a.
10. Duʻāʼ Sayyid al-ṣalawāt ʻalá Sayyid al-Sādāt from folio 142b.
11. Title of Duʻāʼ Kanj al-ʻArsh from folio 145a.
12. Title of Invocation containing magical words and phrases supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of Sūrat al-Kahf (folio 1b): "Sūrat al-Kahf Makkīyah, wa-hiya miʼah wa-ʻashrat āyāt. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī anzala ʻalá ʻabdihi al-Kitāba wa-lam yajʻal la-hu ʻiwajan ..."
Secundo folio of Sūrat al-Kahf: Kaburat kalimatun takhruju min afwāhihim.

2. Incipit of Biography of al-Jazūlī (folio 15b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Khayr Khalqihi Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Ammā baʻd, wa-li-nuqaddim baʻḍ al-taʻrīf bi-muʼallif al-kitāb, lā shakka anna dhālika ḥaqqun wa-thawāb ..."
Secundo folio of Biography of al-Jazūlī: al-Imām al-ʻĀlim al-ʻāmil al-walī al-kabīr.

3. Incipit of Dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-faḍāʼiluhā (folio 21b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā lil-īmān wa-al-Islām, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad Nabīyihi alladhī istanqadhanā bi-hi min ʻibādat al-awthān wa-al-aṣnām, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-nujabāʼ al-bararah al-kirām. Wa-baʻd hādhā, fa-al-gharaḍ fī hādhā al-kitāb 'Dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, nadhkuruhā maḥdhūfat al-asānīd li-yashula ḥifẓuhā ʻalá al-qāriʼ, wa-hiya min ahamm al-muhimmāt li-man yurīdu al-qurb min Rabb al-Arbāb ..."
Secundo folio of Dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-faḍāʼiluhā: wa-faḍāʼilihā nadhkuruhā maḥdhūfat al-asānīd.

4. Incipit of Asmāʼ al-Nabī: "Asmāʼ Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, miʼatān wa-wāḥid. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman. Allāhumma ṣalli wa-sallim ʻalá man ismuhu Muḥammad, Aḥmad, Ḥāmid, Maḥmūd ..."
Secundo folio of Asmāʼ al-Nabī: Shahīd, Mashhūd, Bashīr, Mubashshir.

5. Incipit of Ṣifat al-Rawḍah al-Sharīfah: "Wa-hādhihi Ṣifat al-Rawḍah al-Sharīfah. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Hādhihi Ṣifat al-Rawḍah al-Mubārakah allatī dufina fīhā Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam wa-ṣāḥibāhu Abū Bakr wa-ʻUmar, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhumā wa-irḥamhumā [wa-raḥimahumā] ..."
Secundo folio of Ṣifat al-Rawḍah al-Sharīfah: [The second half of the colored representation] of Ṣifat al-Rawḍah al-Sharīfah.

6. Incipit of Duʻāʼ qabla al-shurūʻ bi-qirāʼat Dalāʼil al-khayrāt: "Yuqraʼu hādhā al-duʻāʼ qabla al-shurūʻ bi-qirāʼat Dalāʼil [al-khayrāt]. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Allāhumma inná [innā] nawaynā al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, imtithālan li-amrika, wa-taṣdīqan li-Nabīyika wa-maḥabbatan fīhi wa-shawqan ilayhi wa-taʻẓīman li-qadrihi ..."
Secundo folio of Duʻāʼ qabla al-shurūʻ bi-qirāʼat Dalāʼil al-khayrāt: ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam.

7. Incipit of Dalāʼil al-khayrāt: "Hādhā mabdaʼ ḥizb [al-ḥizb] al-awwal min yawm al-Jumʻah, bi-ḥamd Allāh. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Allāhumma ṣalli ʻalá Muḥammad wa-azwājihi wa-dhurrīyatihi kamā ṣallayta ʻalá Ibrāhīm, wa-bārik ʻalá Muḥammad wa-azwājihi wa-dhurrīyatihi kamā bārakta ʻalá Ibrāhīm, innaka ḥamīdun majīd ..."
Secundo folio of Dalāʼil al-khayrāt: ḥamīdun majīd. Allāhumma.

8. Incipit of Duʻāʼ khatm Dalāʼil al-khayrāt (folio 132b): "Hādhā Duʻāʼ khatm al-Dalāʼil [Dalāʼil] al-khayrāt. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Allāh [Allāhumma] ishraḥ bi-al-ṣalāh ʻalayhi ḍudūranā, wa-yassir bi-hā umūranā, wa-farrij bi-hā humūmanā, wa-ikshif bi-hā ghumūmanā, wa-ighfir bi-hā dhunūbanā, wa-iqḍi bi-hā duyūnanā, wa-aṣliḥ bi-hā aḥwālanā ..."
Secundo folio of Duʻāʼ khatm Dalāʼil al-khayrāt: wa-balligh bi-hā āmālanā.

9. Incipit of Ādāb ṣalāt al-istikhārah (folio 138a): "Ādāb ṣalāt al-istikhārah. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṣalāt al-istikhārah. Yuṣallá idhā irtafaʻat al-shams bi-qadr rumḥ, wa-baʻda rutbat al-maghrib rakʻatayn, bi-nīyat al-istikhārah li-ʻamal al-yawm wa-al-laylah, yuqraʼu fī awwalihimā, baʻda al-Fātiḥah, hādhihi al-āyah: 'Wa-Rabbuka yakhluqu mā yashāʼu wa-yakhtāru, mā kāna lahumu al-khīratu. Subḥāna Allāh ʻammā yushrikūn' ..."
Secundo folio of Ādāb ṣalāt al-istikhārah: fa-innka taqdiru wa-lā aqdiru.

10. Incipit of Duʻāʼ Sayyid al-ṣalawāt ʻalá Sayyid al-Sādāt (folio 142b): "Hādhā Sayyid al-ṣalawāt ʻalá Sayyid al-Sādāt. Allāhumma ṣalli ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad ʻabdika wa-Rasūlika, al-Nabī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá āl Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-azwājihi ummahāt al-muʼminīn, wa-dhurrīyatihi, wa-ṣaḥbihi, kamā ṣallayta ʻalá Ibrāhīm, wa-ʻalá āl Ibrāhīm, fī al-ʻālamīn. Innaka ḥamīdun majīd ..."
Secundo folio of Duʻāʼ Sayyid al-ṣalawāt ʻalá Sayyid al-Sādāt: Allāhumma wa-bārik ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad.

11. Incipit of Duʻāʼ Kanj al-ʻArsh (folio 145a): "Hādhā Duʻā-yi Kanj al-ʻArsh. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Lā ilāha illā Allāh, Muḥammad Rasūl Allāh. Lā ilāha illā Allāh, Ādam ṣafī Allāh. Lā ilāha illā Allāh, Idrīs rafīʻ Allāh. Lā ilāha illā Allāh, Ibrāhīm khalīl Allāh ..."
Secundo folio of Duʻāʼ Kanj al-ʻArsh: wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn.
12. Incipit of Invocation containing magical words and phrases (folio 176a): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Am min manamū fājurudubānī halikah malikah ..."
12 x 20.27 cm; written surface: 6.5 x 13.5; 10 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather; cover tooled with geometric design and embossed with central medallion .

In good naskh script, in black ink on white paper; headings in red; text within a frame in red, blue and gold and an outer frame in blue and gold; some pages with interlinear Persian translation; catchwords.
On the back of the first flyleaf: A statement in Ottoman Turkish.
On the back of the fourth flyleaf: A date: "11 Rabīʻ Awwal sanat 229" (probably 1229 of the Hijrah = 3 March 1814), under it another date: "28 Mārt sanat 227" (could not be identified).
The invocation on folio 14b ends with the date: "Fī sanat 1247" (In the year of the Hijrah 1247 = 1831/1832).
On folios 36b-37a: A colored drawing of "al-Rawḍah al-Sharīfah" (Tomb of the Prophet).
On folio 41a: An unfinished invocation of prayer on the Prophet.
At the end of Duʻāʼ Sayyid al-ṣalawāt ʻalá Sayyid al-Sādāt (folio 143b): Two verses of poetry in Persian in praise of the Prophet.
Folio 144 is blank.
The text from folio 156b onward is mixed with Persian phrases.
On folio 176b: An ownership statement: "Ṣāḥibuhu wa-mālikuhu Ḥājj Bayt Allāh al-Ḥarām al-Ḥājj Rashīd Āghā al-Sindijī."

On the first end flyleaf: Names of seven sultans, as follows: "Sulṭān Bāyazīd [Abū Yazīd Bisṭāmī, Ṭayfūr ibn ʻĪsá, died 874?, nicknamed Sulṭān al-ʻĀrifīn], Sulṭān Ibrāhīm Adham [Ibrāhīm ibn Adham, died approximately 777], Sulṭān Maḥmūd Ghazawī [probably, Mahmud, Sultan of Ghazni, 971-1030], Sulṭān Ismāʻīl, Sulṭān Sanjar Māḍī [probably, Sanjar, Sultan of the Seljuks, 1084 or 1086-1157], Sulṭān ʻAlī [...], Sulṭān Abū Saʻīd al-Khayr."
On the back of the third end flyleaf: A magic square with the Arabic word "wifq/wafq" (numerical harmony, used for divination)
On the front of the fourth flyleaf: A statement in Persian.

1. Sūrat al-Kahf ends with: "Qul innamā anā basharun mithlukum yūḥá ilayya innamā ilāhukum ilāhun wāḥidun. Fa-man kāna yarjū liqāʼ Rabbihi fa-li-yaʻmal ʻamalan ṣāliḥan wa-lā yushrik bi-ʻibādati Rabbihi aḥadan."

2. Biography of al-Jazūlī ends with: "... Rabbi yassir wa-lā tuʻassir. Rabbi zidnī ʻilman wa-fahman wa-tammim bi-al-khayr bi-raḥmatika, yā arḥam al-rāḥimīn. Wa-ākhir daʻwānā al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

3. Dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-faḍāʼiluhā ends with: "... Wa-qīla li-Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Araʼayta ṣalāt al-muṣallīn ʻalayka mimman ghāba ʻanka, wa-man yaʼtī baʻdaka, mā ḥāluhumā ʻindaka, fa-qāl: Asmaʻu ṣalāt ahl maḥabbatī wa-aʻrifuhum, wa-tuʻraḍu ʻalayya ṣalāt ghayrihim ʻarḍan."

4. Asmāʼ al-Nabī ends with: "... Allāhumma, Yā Rabb, bi-jāhi Nabīyika al-Muṣṭafá, wa-Rasūlika al-Murtaḍá, ṭahhir qulūbanā min kull waṣf yubāʻidunā ʻalá [ʻan] mushāhadatika wa-maḥabbatika, wa-amitnā ʻalá al-Sunnah wa-al-Jamāʻah wa-al-shawq ilá liqāʼika, Yā Dhā al-Jalāl wa-al-Ikrām. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."
5. Ṣifat al-Rawḍah al-Sharīfah ends with: "... Qāla lī Abū Bakr: Hādhā wāḥidun min aqmāriki, wa-huwa khayruhum, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam kathīran, [ṣalātan] tāmmatan dāʼimatan ilá Yawm al-Dīn."

6. Duʻāʼ qabla al-shurūʻ bi-qirāʼat Dalāʼil al-khayrāt ends with: "... Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn taslīman kathīran dāʼiman ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

7. Colophon of Dalāʼil al-khayrāt: "Allāhumma ighfir li-muʼallifihi, wa-li-qārīhi, wa-li-kātibihi, wa-irḥamhum, wa-ijʻalhum min al-maḥshūrīn fī zumrat al-nabīyīn wa-al-ṣiddīqīn wa-al-shuhadāʼ wa-al-ṣāliḥīn Yawm al-Qiyāmah, bi-faḍlika wa-iḥsānika, Yā Arḥam al-Rāḥimīn."

Translation of the colophon of Dalāʼil al-khayrāt: "O God! Pardon its author, its reader and its copyist. Have mercy upon them. Let them be resurrected with the fold of the prophets, the righteous, the martyrs and the pious, on the Day of Resurrection, by thy favor and kindness, O Thou, who art the Most Merciful of all Merciful."

8. Colophon of Duʻāʼ khatm Dalāʼil al-khayrāt. The "Invovation" ends with: "... Astaghfiru Allāh al-ʻAẓīm ʻadada al-nisāʼ wa-al-rijāl. Astaghfiru Allāh al-ʻAẓīm ʻadada khalqihi, wa-riḍá nafsihi, wa-zinata ʻarshihi, wa-midāda kalimātih."

Translation of the end of Duʻāʼ khatm Dalāʼil al-khayrāt: "... I seek forgiveness from the Mighty God the number of women and men. I seek forgiveness from the Mighty God the number of His creatures, the satisfaction of His spirit, the weight of His throne, and the ink of His words."

9. Colophon of Ādāb ṣalāt al-istikhārah. The text ends with: "... Wa-in kunta taʻlamu anna hādhā al-amr sharrun lī fī dīnī wa-maʻāshī wa-ʻāqibat amrī, aw, ʻājil amrī wa-ajalih, fa-iṣrifhu ʻannī wa-iṣrifnī ʻanhu, wa-iqdir lī al-khayr ḥaythu kāna, thumma irḍinī bi-hi, Yā Arḥam al-Rāḥimīn."

Translation of the end of the text of Ādāb ṣalāt al-istikhārah: "... If You know that this matter is bad for me in my faith, my livelihood and what will happen to me, now and then, I implore You to avert it from me, and me from it. Ordain that good befalls me wherever I am, and make me content with it. O Thou who are the Most Merciful of all Merciful."

10. Duʻāʼ Sayyid al-ṣalawāt ʻalá Sayyid al-Sādāt ends with: "... wa-sallim taslīman kadhālika ʻalá jamīʻ al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihim wa-ṣuḥbatihim wa-al-tābiʻīn, wa-ʻalá ahli ṭāʻatika ajmaʻīn, min ahl al-samāwāt wa-ahl al-araḍīn, wa-ʻalaynā maʻahum, bi-raḥmatik. Yā Arḥam al-Rāḥimīn."

11. Duʻāʼ Kanj al-ʻArsh ends with: "... wa-bi-ḥaqq ismika al-maknūn ʻalá surādiq al-ʻarsh an tajʻalanī min aḥibbāʼika wa-awliyāʼika, wa-an takfinī sharra kull man yaridunī bi-sūʼ, wa-bi-ayy ḥikmat [ḥikmah] shiʼt bi-raḥmatik. Yā Arḥam al-Rāḥimīn. Āmīn."

The Invocation containing magical words and phrases ends with: "... aljā min nanjā min bi-ḥaqq Ṭūr Sīnāʼ tanbutu bi-al-duhni wa-ṣibghin lil-ākilīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

record.title: 880-03 Alfīyat al-ʻIrāqī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn al-Ḥusayn al-ʻIrāqī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Alfīyat al-ʻIrāqī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Yaqūlu rājī Rabbihi al-muqtadiri // ʻAbdu al-Raḥīm ibn al-Ḥusayn al-Atharī. Min baʻdi ḥamdi Allāhi dhī al-ālāʼi // ʻalá imtinānin jalla ʻan iḥṣāʼi. Thumma ṣalātun wa-salāmun dāʼimun // ʻalá Nabīyi al-khayr dhī al-marāḥimi. Fa-hādhihi al-maqāṣidu al-muhimmah // tūḍiḥu min ʻilmi al-Ḥadīthi rasmah. Naẓamtuhā tabṣiratan lil-mubtadī // tadhkiratan lil-muntahī wa-al-musnidi. Lakhkhaṣtu fīhā Ibna al-Ṣalāḥi ajmaʻah // wa-zidtuhā ʻilman tarāhu mawḍiʻah ..."
Secundo folio of Alfīyat al-ʻIrāqī: Wa-Muslimun baʻdu wa-baʻḍu al-Gharbi.
15.3 x 21.3 cm; written surface: 8 x 14.4 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: In yellow cardboard.
In fair ruqʻah script, in black ink on white paper; few corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Alfīyat ʻIrāqī, bāb 2. Risālah fī al-muṣṭalaḥ. Alfīyat al-Ḥadīth lil-ʻIrāqī."
On folio 1a: An illegible stamp.

On folios 24a-26a: A quotation from a treatise by al-Bāzilī (probably, the Shāfiʻī scholar Muḥammad ibn Dāwūd al-Bāzilī, 1441-1519), about some of the controversial issues between the Shafiites and the Ḥanafites.

Colophon of Alfīyat al-ʻIrāqī: "Tammat wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūl Allāh, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-man wālāh, ʻalá yad kātibihā li-nafsihi al-fāniyah, ʻAbd al-Hādī ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Hādī al-Miṣrī al-Tabtabī al-Azharī. Tamma naqluhā yawm al-Jumʻah al-mubārak, sabʻ Jumād Awwal, sanat 1169 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah."

Translation of the colophon of Alfīyat al-ʻIrāqī: "It is completed. Praise be to God, and prayer and peace be upon the Messenger of God, and upon His family, His companions, and His followers. Copied by the perishing hand of ʻAbd al-Hādī ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Hādī al-Miṣrī al-Tabtabī al-Azharī, for himself. The transcription of the copy was completed on blessed Friday, 7 Jumād Awwal, of the year 1169 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [8 February 1756].". 7 Jumād Awwal falls on Sunday not Friday.

The quotation from the treatise by al-Bāzilī on the controversial issues between the Shafiites and the Ḥanafites starts with: "Fāʼidah muhimmah naqaltuhā min risālah lil-Bāzilī, qāla fīhā: Qāla al-Subkī [probably, Tāj al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn ʻAlī al-Subkī, approximately 1327-1370]: Taṣaffaḥtu kutub al-Ḥanafīyah fa-wajadtu jamīʻ al-masāʼil allatī baynanā wa-bayna al-Ḥanafīyah fīhā khilāf thalāthata ʻashara masʼalah, sitt masāʼil minhā lafẓīyah wa-al-bāqī maʻnawīyah, wa-lā taqtaḍī mukhālafatunā lahum wa-lā mukhālafatuhum lanā takfīran wa-lā tabdīʻan ..."

The quotation from the treatise by al-Bāzilī on the controversial issues between the Shafiites and the Ḥanafites ends with: "... Wa-lammā raʼá ahl al-ḥaqq hādhihi al-dasīsah ankarūhā wa-taghayyarū ʻanhā, wa-lam yaqṣidū anna nafs al-lafẓ huwa ḥaqīqat al-dhāt, li-annahu badīhī al-fasād, wa-innamā qaṣadū dafʻ tamwīhihim, wa-anna al-ism ḥaythu yudhkaru bi-waṣf aw khabar, fa-innamā yurādu bi-hi al-musammá. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-ḥaqīqat al-ḥāl, wa-ʻindahu taḥqīq kull maqāl. Tammat."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ Alfīyat Ibn Mālik fī al-naḥw : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAqīl.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir, Yā Karīm Qāla Muḥammadun huwa ibnu Māliki // Aḥmadu Rabbī Allāha khayra Māliki. Muṣalliyan ʻalá al-Rasūli al-Muṣṭafá // wa-ālihi al-mustakmalīn al-shurufā. Wa-astaʻīnu Allāha fī Alfīyah // maqāṣidu al-naḥwi bi-hā maḥwīyah ..."
Secundo folio: munfaṣilan maʻa al-ityān bi-hi muttaṣilan.
18.5 x 27 cm; written surface: 13 x 19 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 19 unnumbered quires).

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of the "Alfīyah" preceded by the letter Ṣ [i.e., Muṣannif] and the commentary by the letter Sh [Sharḥ] both in red; headings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Malakahu al-Sayyid Aḥmad ibn al-Sayyid Ḥāfiẓ, aʻāda Allāh ʻalaynā min barakātihim. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: A "ṭughrāʼ" style signature and an illegible stamp.
On folio 189b: Some doomsday predictions, from the year 1245 to 1295 (1829-1878), in a different hand.

Colophon: "Ammā baʻd, fa-biʻawn Allāh al-Ḥannān al-Mannān qad kamula naskh hādhā al-sharḥ al-munṣān, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-ḥaqīr al-fānī, Aḥmad ibn Sayyid Ḥāfiẓ ibn Qāḍī Ḥulwān. Wa-ṣallá [Allāh] ʻalá Sayyidinā [Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam]."

Translation of the colophon: "Henceforth, by the help of God, the Merciful the Benefactor, the copy of this virtuous commentary was completed by the hand of the wretched and evanescent servant, Aḥmad ibn Sayyid Ḥāfiẓ ibn Qāḍī Ḥulwān. May [God] pray on our Master [Muḥammad and on his family and companions and grant them peace]."

record.title: Sermons : manuscript.
record.note: Binding: contemporary calf, rebacked, new endpapers.
Last page has "Dorrathy" inscribed in the upper right corner and "Daly" inscribed further down.

record.title: 880-02 Ḥawāshin ʻalá Ḥāshiyat Mukhtaṣar Sharḥ Talkhīṣ al-Miftāḥ : manuscript / Ismāʻīl ibn Ghunaym al-Jawharī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ḥamdan li-māniḥ al-bayān wa-fātiḥ abwāb al-tibyān, wa-ṣalātan wa-salāman ʻalá man khuṣṣa bi-badīʻ al-asrār, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-bararah al-akhyār. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr ilá al-Mawlá al-Kabīr, Ismāʻīl ibn al-Shaykh Ghunaym al-Jawharī, manaḥahu Allāh al-tawfīq al-bāṭinī wa-al-ẓāhirī: Hādhihi Ḥawāshī ʻalá al-Mukhtaṣar lil-ʻAllāmah al-Taftāzānī, tataḍammanu īḍāḥ mā katabahu ʻalayhi ḥafīduhu al-Mawlá Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Yaḥyá ibn Saʻd al-Dīn min al-maʻānī. Wa-qad iqtaṣartu ʻalá mā kataba ʻalayhi min al-mawāḍiʻ, wa-albastu ʻarāʼisa maʻāniyahu ḥulala ʻibārātin lāḥat kawākibuhā fī samā al-maṭāliʻ ..."
Secundo folio: anʻamtu ʻalaykum min al-injāʼ wa-ghayrihi.
16 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 11 x 17.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; black cloth on spine and flap (in 18 numbered quires).

In large naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Sharḥ Talkhīṣ Miftāḥ al-ʻulūm" preceded by the word "Qawluhu" (his saying) in red; markings in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Ḥāshiyat al-ʻĀlim al-ʻAllāmah, wa-al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, al-Shaykh Ismāʻīl Ghunaym al-Jawharī, ʻalá Mukhtaṣar al-ʻAllāmah al-Taftāzānī, raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn."

On folio 168a: An ownership statement, dated Jumādá al-Ūlá, 1315 of the Hijrah (September/October 1897): "Intaqalat hādhihi al-nuskhah fī Kutubkhānat al-faqīr ilayhi taʻālá Aḥmad al-Zuhrī al-Hāshimī, al-Ḥanafī madhhaban, al-Ziyādī manshaʼan, al-Miṣrī tarbiyatan wa-iqāmatan, al-Azharī taʻalluman, al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan, al-Ashʻarī ʻAqīdatan, fī Jumādá al-Ūlá, sanat 1315." Signature.
On folio 168: A drawing of a branch with leaves under a geometrical design.
Colophon: "Hādhā mā wujida bi-khaṭṭ al-muʼallif. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "This is what was found in the handwriting of the author, but God is more knowledgeable of what is correct; to Him is the reference and returning. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and companions, and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ ʻalá al-Taṣrīf al-ʻIzzī : manuscript / Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar al-Taftāzānī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad. Inna arwá zahr yakhruju fī riyāḍ al-kalām min al-akmām, wa-abhá ḥibar tuḥāku bi-banān al-bayān wa-asnān al-aqlām ḥamd Allāh subḥānuhu ʻalá tawātur naʻmāʼihi al-zāhirah al-ẓāhirah, wa-tarāduf ālāʼihi al-mutawātirah al-mutaẓāhirah, thumma al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad, al-mabʻūth min ashraf jarāʼim al-anām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-aʼimmah al-aʻlām wa-azimmat al-Islām. Wa-baʻd, fa-inna al-ʻAllāmah al-fāḍil al-kāmil, ṣāḥib al-maʻqūl wa-al-manqūl, mudarris al-farīqayn, sulṭān al-muḥaqqiqīn, burhān al-mudaqqiqīn, Saʻd al-Ḥaqq wa-al-Millah wa-al-Dīn, fakhr al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, Masʻūd ibn al-Imām al-fāḍil, sulṭān al-quḍāh, ʻUmar, al-Qāḍī al-Taftāzānī, bayyaḍ Allāh ghurrat aḥwālih, wa-awraqa aghṣāna āmālih, yaqūlu: Lammā raʼaytu Mukhtaṣar al-Taṣrīf alladhī ṣannafahu al-Imām al-fāḍil al-kāmil al-ʻālim, qudwat al-muḥaqqiqīn, ʻIzz al-Millah wa-al-Dīn al-Zinjānī, raḥiamah Allāh, mukhtaṣaran ..."
Secundo folio: al-shayʼ li-yakūna ʻalá baṣīrah fī ṭalabih.
15.2 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 16.5 cm; 20 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap (in seven numbered quires).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of the al-Taṣrīf al-ʻIzzī in red; some commentaries on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ Taṣrīf al-ʻAllāmah al-Imām al-ʻIzzī, lil-ʻAllāmah al-muḥaqqiq al-mudaqqiq, bi-ittifāq al-mukhālif wa-al-muwāfiq, al-ʻAllāmah al-Shaykh Saʻd al-Dīn, ʻalayhi raḥmat Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement, dated in the year 1121 of the Hijrah (1709/1710), as follows: "Fī nawbat al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-Qadīr, al-faqīr Yūsuf Chalabī, ʻufiya ʻanhu. Āmīn. Bi-jāh Sayyid al-Mursalīn. Sanat 1121."
On folio 1a: Miscellaneous verses of poetry.
Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Tamma al-kitāb al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh."

Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning. The blessed book was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. Praise be to God."

record.title: 880-02 al-Tuḥfah al-nadīyah ʻalá al-Tuḥfah al-Wardīyah : manuscript / Abū al-Ḥasan Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Bakrī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit (folio 1b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī wa-ʻawnī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh rāfiʻ qadr man khafaḍa nafsahu muntaṣiban bi-al-jazm li-khidmatihi, wa-mutḥifihi bi-al-tuḥfah al-abadīyah bi-al-wurūd li-riyāḍ jannatih, wa-tazyīn afʻālihi bi-lawāʼiḥ al-qabūl al-mawṣūl bi-raḥmatih. Aḥmaduhu ḥamda man jadda fī ṭalabih bi-al-harab ilayhi min saṭawāt qudratih, wa-ashkuruhu shukra man zādat ʻalayhi al-niʻam li-tawālī shukrihi li-jamāl aḥadīyatih ... Ammā baʻd, fa-qad suʼiltu qadīman an aḍaʻa ʻalá al-Tuḥfah al-Wardīyah, lil-ʻAllāmah Ibn al-Wardī, sharḥan mujarradan min al-iṭnāb ... fa-aḍrabtu ʻan dhālika ... ilá an tajarrada al-ʻazm li-dhālika fī yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ, sābiʻ ʻasharī al-Qaʻdah al-ḥarām, ʻāma arbaʻ wa-ʻishrīn wa-tisʻ miʼah, wa-anā bi-Makkah al-Musharrafah ... fa-sharaʻtu fī hādhā al-sharḥ, mulaqqiban la-hu bi-al-"Tuḥfah al-nadīyah ʻalá al-Tuḥfah al-wardīyah" ..."
Secundo folio: wa-Huwa ḥasbī. Qāla al-muṣannif.
15 x 21 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 13 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "al-Tuḥfah al-wardīyah" in red; headings in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Tuḥfah al-nadīyah ʻalá al-Tuḥfah al-Wardīyah, lil-Shaykh al-ʻumdah al-fahhāmah, Abī al-Ḥasan al-Bakrī, nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam ʻalá Muḥammad Nabīyihi wa-ʻabdih, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-jundih wa-sallam."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement, as follows: "Intaẓama fī mulk muḥarririhi wa-nāmiqihi al-ḥaqīr al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥawjarī, ghafara Allāh la-hu, wa-satarah ʻaybahu, wa-ʻafá daynahu wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Wa-wāfaq al-farāgh min naskh hādhā al-kitāb ṣubḥ yawm R [al-Ghadīr (?)] al-mubārak, sābiʻ ʻashar al-Ḥijjah al-ḥarām, sanat 1007, wa-Abīb sanat 1314, huwa Ḥazīrān sanat 1610, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-dhalīl al-ḥaqīr, Muḥammad ibn al-faqīr Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥawjarī aṣlan, al-Miṣrī mawlidan, al-Jāwirī sakanan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-man naẓara fīhi wa-daʻā lahum [la-hu] wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-tābiʻīhi wa-sallam taslīman kathīran. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah.

Translation of the colophon: "The copy of this book was completed on the morning of the blessed day of R [al-Ghadīr (?)], the seventeenth of sacred al-Ḥijjah, of the year 1007 [of the Hijrah = 11 July 1599], corresponding to [the Coptic month of] Abīb [Epip], of the [Coptic] year 1314, and Ḥazīrān [June] of the year 1610, by the hand of the poor, despicable and wretched servant, Muḥammad son of the poor Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥawjarī aṣlan, al-Miṣrī mawlidan, al-Jāwirī sakanan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, may God forgive him, his parents, him who looks into it [the manuscript] and implores [God] on their [his] behalf, his parents' and all Muslims. May God pray on, and grant peace to, our Master Muḥammd, and grant his followers abundant peace. Praise be to God alone.

record.title: 880-02 Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Ashraf al-Samarqandī.
record.note: Title of "Risālah fī ādab al-baḥth" from incipit (folio 1b).
Title of "al-Sharḥ al-Masʻūdī" from the colophon (folio 60b) and reference sources.
Title of "Awrād al-usbūʻ" from folio 61a.
Title of "Ḥāshiyah ʻalá al-Sharḥ al-Masʻūdī" supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth (folio 1b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi astaʻīn. al-Minnah li-wāhib al-ʻaql. Hādhihi Risālat [Risālah] fī ādāb al-baḥth, yaḥtāju ilayhā kull ʻālim mutaʻallim [wa-mutaʻallim], li-takūna ḥāfiẓah la-hu fī al-baḥth min al-ḍalālat [al-ḍalālah], wa-tusahhila ʻalayhi ṭarīq al-fahm. Wa-hiya, wa-in kānat mutadāwalat [mutadāwalah] bayna al-muḥaqqiqīn, lākinnahā mā kānat manẓūmah fī silk wa-majmūʻah fī ʻiqd, aradtu naẓm manthūrihā wa-jamʻ maʼthūrihā tuḥfatan lil-akh al-ʻazīz, malik al-ṣudūr wa-al-aʻyān, sharaf al-amāthil wa-al-aqrān, sharaf al-Millat [al-Millah] wa-al-Dīn, ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ..."
Secundo folio of Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth: adāma Allāh ayyāmahu.

Incipit of al-Sharḥ al-Masʻūdī (folio 11a): The beginning is missing; starts with: "[... wa-sharḥihā (?), wa-lākinnahu hunāka yufīd bi-al-tafaṣṣulī [bi-al-tafṣīlī (?)], wa-hunā qad yufīdu bi-al-ijamālī. Wa-al-musnad, wa-qad yuqālu la-hu al-ḍidd ayḍan, mā yakūnu al-manʻ mabnīyah ʻalayhi, ayy, mabnīyan bi-hi, wa-muʼayyalan [wa-muʼawwalan] bi-sababihi, kamā sayajīʼu amthilatuhu ʻan gharīb Muslim ..."
Secundo folio of al-Sharḥ al-Masʻūdī: inna kalāmakum mutaʻalliq bi-al-musnad.

Incipit of "Awrād al-usbūʻ" (folio 61a): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Fa-hādhihi 'Awrād al-usbūʻ' min 'Kitāb al-Dhakhīrah', wa-fīhi fuṣūl. al-Faṣl al-awwal. Qāla Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Man ṣallá laylat al-Sabt thamānī rakaʻāt, yaqraʼu fī kull rakʻah 'Fātiḥat al-Kitāb' marratan ..."
Secundo folio of "Awrād al-usbūʻ": rakaʻāt yaqraʼu fī kull rakʻah.

Incipit of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá al-Sharḥ al-Masʻūdī (folio 65b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Minnah ʻalaynā. Ah. Salaka ṭarīqat al-ʻamal bi-al-Ḥadīth maʻnan, li-anna ḥaqīqat al-ḥamd ʻinda al-muḥaqqiqīn iẓhār al-ṣifāt al-kāmilah dūna al-qawl al-makhṣūṣ; lā yuqālu kayfa yaṣuḥḥu al-thanāʼ bi-mā huwa madhmūm, ʻaqlan wa-sharʻan. Wa-qad qīla al-minnah tahdumu al-ṣanīʻah. Wa-qad qāla Allāh taʻālá: 'Wa-lā tubṭilū ṣadaqātikum bi-al-mann wa-al-adhá', al-āyah ..."
Secundo folio of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá al-Sharḥ al-Masʻūdī: fa-lam yaʼti [yaʼti] fī dhālika al-maqām kamā yaqtaḍīhi al-ḥāl.

9.5 x 14.4 cm; written surface of "Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth": 5 x 8.5 cm; 9 lines per page. Written surface of "al-Sharḥ al-Masʻūdī": 5.5 x 8.5 cm; 9 lines per page. Written surface of "Awrād al-usbūʻ": 7 x 11 cm; 11 lines per page. Written surface of "Ḥāshiyah ʻalá al-Sharḥ al-Masʻūdī: 6 x10.5 cm; 13-15 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather with flap; paper wrapper pasted to the cover, flap, and spine.

In fair naskh, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; few notes and corrections on the margins of some of the manuscripts; the phrases of the third manuscript (Ḥāshiyah ʻalá al-Sharḥ al-Masʻūdī) preceded by the word "Qawluhu" (His saying), in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: An ownership statement, dated: Rajab, 1161 of the Hijrah (June/July 1748): "Fī mulk afqar al-ʻibād ilá al-Malik al-Jawwād al-Ḥaqīqī, Muḥammad ibn Yaḥyá al-Dusūqī. Fī shahr Rajab, sanat 1161."
On folio 10a: An illegible stamp.
On folios 61a-65a: A collection of prayers and invocations for the days of the week, titled "Awrad al-usbūʻ" extracted from "Kitāb al-Dhakhīrah".
On folio 65a (in red): An ownership statement: "Ṣāḥib wa-mālik Aḥmad ibn [... ... ...], ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi [wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi]."
On spine: Call numbers: 114 and 194.A8.M7a.971.
Inside back cover: An ownership statement: "Ṣāḥib hādhā al-kitāb [... (?)] al-muḥtāj Muḥammad Zamān ibn Anwarī ibn Nūr ʻAlī ibn Ṣalāḥ Yaʻqūb al-Jarrārī, ʻafá ʻanhumā al-Bārī."

Colophon of "Risālah fī ādab al-baḥth": "Tammat hādhihi al-risālah ʻalá yad ʻabd [al-ʻabd] al-ḍaʻīf, ḥaqīr [al-ḥaqīr], al-faqīr [...?] ibn Muḥammad, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi."

Translation of the colophon of "Risālah fī ādab al-baḥth": "This epistle was completed by the hand of the feeble, despicable and poor servant [...?] ibn Muḥammad, may God forgive him and his parents, and treat them and him with kindness."

Colophon of al-Sharḥ al-Masʻūdī (folio 60b): "Wa-qad waqaʻa al-farāgh ʻan taswīd hādhā al-sharḥ al-musammá bi-Masʻūdī ʻalá yad ḥaqīr [al-ḥaqīr] al-faqīr Aḥmad ibn Ḥājjī Niʻmat Bādī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-ḥasana [wa-aḥsana] ilayhimā wa-ilayhi fī shahr Jumādá al-Ākhir, yawm ʻishrīn, wa-huwa yawm al-Jumʻah minhā, tārīkh sanat iḥdá wa-sabʻīn tisʻmiʼah [wa-tisʻimiʼah, Allāh wa-aʻlam [wa-Allāh aʻlam] bi-al-ṣawāb."

Translation of the colophon of al-Sharḥ al-Masʻūdī: "The copy of this commentary, titled al-Masʻūdī, was completed by the hand of the despicable poor Aḥmad ibn Ḥājjī Niʻmat Bādī, may God forgive him and his parents, and be kind to them and to him, in the month of Jumādá al-Ākhir, the twentieth day of it, which is Friday, of the year 971 [of the Hijrah = 14 February 1564], but God is more knowledgeable of what is correct."

Awrād al-usbūʻ ends with (folio 65a): "... wa-idhā faragha min ṣalātihi, yaqūlu: Yā Nūr, Yā Raḥmān, Yā Raḥīm, [Yā] Bāqī, Yā Qayyūm, Iftaḥ lī abwāb raḥmatika wa-maghfiratika wa-ḥinna ʻalayya, yadkhulu al-Jannah. Wa-aʻtiqnī min al-nār, yaqūluhā sabʻ marrāt, wa-ghafara [ghafara] Allāh la-hu sittīn maghfirah; wāḥidah yuṣliḥu bi-hā dhanban, wa-tisʻah wa-khamsīn la-hu fī al-Jannah, wa-lā yaʻlamu thawābahu illā Allāh ʻazza wa-jall. Tammat."

Colophon of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá al-Sharḥ al-Masʻūdī (folio 128b): "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Malik [al-Malik] al-Wahhāb, ʻalá yad ʻabd [al-ʻabd] al-ḍaʻīf Aḥmad ibn Ḥājjī Niʻmatbādī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi, bi-raḥmatika, Yā Arḥam al-Rāḥimīn. Tārīkh sanat iḥdá wa-sabʻīn wa-tisʻimiʼah."

Translation of the colophon of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá al-Sharḥ al-Masʻūdī: "The book was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King, by the hand of the feeble servant Aḥmad ibn Ḥājjī Niʻmatbādī, may God forgive him and his parents, and be kind to them and to him, by Thy mercy, O Most Merciful of All Merciful!. Dated in the year 971 [of the Hijrah = 1563/1564"

record.title: 880-02 al-Iqnāʻ̄ fī ḥall alfāẓ Abī Shujāʻ : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Shirbīnī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... ṣifatān mushabbahatān buniyatā lil-mubālaghah, min maṣdar raḥima, wa-al-Raḥmān ablagh min al-Raḥīm, li-anna ziyādat al-bināʼ tadullu ʻalá ziyādat al-maʻná ghāliban, kamā fī qaṭaʻa bi-al-takhfīf wa-qaṭṭaʻa bi-al-tashdīd, wa-qaddama Allāh ʻalayhā [ʻalayhimā] li-annahu ism dhāt, wa-humā ismā ṣifah, wa-qaddama al-Raḥmān ʻalá al-Raḥīm li-annahu khāṣṣ, idh lā yuqālu li-ghayr Allāh taʻālá, bi-khilāf al-Raḥīm, wa-al-khāṣṣ muqaddam ʻalá al-ʻāmm ..."
Secundo folio: al-jumlah, sawāʼ ajuʻilat fīhi al lil-istighrāq.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 15.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In light brown leather with flap (in 32 numbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Mukhtaṣar fī al-fiqh ʻalá madhhab al-Shāfiʻī" in red; extensive commentaries on the margins; catchwords.

The text end with: "... wa-law awdaʻahu waraqatan maktūbun fīhā al-ḥaqq al-muqarr bi-hi, ka-miʼ́at dīnār wa-talafat bi-taqṣīrihi, ḍamina qīmatahā maktūbatan wa-ujrat al-kitābah, kamā qāla al-Shaykhān, bi-khilāf mā law atlafa thawban muṭarrazan, fa-innahu yalzamuhu qīmatuhu wa-lā yalzamuhu ujrat al-taṭrīz, li-anna al-taṭrīz yazīdu qīmat al-thawb ghāliban, wa-lā kadhālika al-kitābah, fa-innahā qad tunqiṣuhā."

Colophon: "Tammat yawm al-Thulāth al-mubārak, khāmis ʻashar Ṣafar, min shuhūr sanat sittah wa-sittīn wa-alf, ʻalá yad kātibihi wa-mālikihi, al-muḥtāj li-ʻafw Rabbihi al-Karīm, ʻAbd al-Mughīth ibn ʻAbd al-Muḥsin ibn ʻAlī ibn al-Khaṭṭāf ibn Aḥmad al-Badrī al-Samhūdī al-Shāfiʻī [changed to al-Mālikī], ghafara Allāh taʻālá la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn, wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah. Āmīn. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm."

Translation of the colophon: "It was completed on blessed Tuesday, 15 Ṣafar, of the year 1066 [of the Hijrah = 14 December 1655], by the hand of the needy to the forgiveness of his Generous Lord, al-Mughīth ibn ʻAbd al-Muḥsin ibn ʻAlī ibn al-Khaṭṭāf ibn Aḥmad al-Badrī al-Samhūdī al-Shāfiʻī [changed to al-Mālikī], may God Almighty forgive him, his parents, the Muslims, and him who invokes forgiveness on his behalf. Amen. There is no power nor might except in God the Almighty and All Powerful."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Samarqandīyah al-ṣaghīr : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī al-ḥamdu la-hu ḥaqīqatan, wa-huwa li-ghayrihi majāz, al-muḥīṭ ʻilmuhu bi-asrār al-balāghah wa-wujūh al-barāʻah wa-dalāʼil al-iʻjāz. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-murashshaḥ [al-muwashshaḥ (?)] bi-al-āyāt wa-al-dalāʼil, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-man tabiʻahum ilá Yawm al-Dīn bi-al-fawāḍil wa-al-faḍāʼil ..."
Secundo folio: wa-washshaḥtuhā bi-laṭāʼif al-ṭarāʼif.
16 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 14.5 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap, dark red leather on spine and flap (in 3 unnumbered quires).
In clear and large naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "al-Samarqandīyah" and markings in red; extensive commentaries on the margins of the first two quires; catchwords.
On the label on the front cover: "Sharḥ fī ʻilm al-istiʻārāt li-Sayyidī Muḥammad al-Maghribī."
On folio 1a: "al-Mullawī ʻalá al-Samarqandīyah."

On folios 1b-2a, the author states that the present work is an abbreviation of his larger work: "... Ammā baʻd, fa-qad kuntu sharaḥtu risālat al-Imām al-Samarqandī fī al-istiʻārāt, wa-washshaḥtuhā bi-laṭāʼif al-ṭarāʼif ... thumma inna baʻḍ al-ikhwān saʼalanī an aṣrifa al-himmah naḥwa ikhtiṣārih wa-al-iqtiṣār ʻalá bayān maʻānīhi ... fa-ajabtuhu ilá dhālik ..."
The author states on folio 2b that he benefited from the work of his teacher "Shaykhinā Sayyidī ʻAbd Allāh ibn Muḥammad al-Maghribī al-Qaṣrī al-Kinkisī [could not be identified]".

Colophon: "Tamma hādhā al-sharḥ bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, wa-dhālika yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, li-ʻashrat ayyām baqīna fī Rajab, sanat 1200, ʻalá yad kātibihi al-faqīr Aḥmad al-Nashāʼī al-Shāfiʻī al-Ashʻarī al-Aḥmadī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-mashāyikhihi, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, wa-li-man daʻá la-hu bi-al-maghfirah, wa-li-man raʼá fīhi khalalan wa-aṣlaḥah."

Translation of the colophon: "This commentary was completed by the help of God and His abundant benevolence, on blessed Thursday, ten days remaining from Rajab, of the year 1200 [of the Hijrah = 18 May 1786], by the hand of its copyist, the poor Aḥmad al-Nashāʼī al-Shāfiʻī al-Ashʻarī al-Aḥmadī, may God forgive him, his parents, his teachers, all Muslims, him who invokes forgiveness on his behalf, and him who finds a fault in it and corrects it."

record.title: 880-02 Īḍāḥ al-mushkilāt min matn al-Istiʻārāt : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Munʻim al-Damanhūrī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī manna ʻalaynā bi-idrāk al-ḥaqāʼiq, wa-khaṣṣanā bi-mā ishtamalat ʻalayhi anwāʻ al-majāz min al-daqāʼiq, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá man istaʻāra al-kāmilūn min kamālih, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-mutajarridīn lil-nasj ʻalá minwālih. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu Aḥmad al-Damanhūrī ... Hādhā mā ishtaddat [ilayhi] al-ḥājāt min bayān Risālat al-Samarqandī fī al-istiʻārāt, qad iltamasa minnī baʻḍ al-mubtadiʼīn ṭāliban minnī al-ījāz fī al-ʻibārah ʻalá wajhin mubīn, fa-ajabtuhu mustaʻīnan bi-hi subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá fī al-tawfīq lil-sadād ... musammiyan li-mā zabartuhu bi-Īḍāḥ al-mushkilāt min matn al-Istiʻārāt ..."
Secundo folio: fī risālatinā Kashf al-lithām ʻan mukhaddirāt al-afhām.
16 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; dark red leather on spine (in 2 numbered quires).
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Risālah al-Samarqandīyah fī al-istiʻārāt in red; few commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Sharḥ al-Samarqandīyah lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Damanhūrī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. M."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: "Mulk al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, rājī ghufrān al-dhunūb, al-fānī al-dhalīl, Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad al-Ṣaymarī, ghafara Allāh dhanbahu, la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn." "Mulk al-faqīr [... ... ...] al-Ḥanafī al-Azharī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu."
At the upper left corner of folio 1a: "Sharḥ [...] lil-Shaykh al-Damanhūr[ī]."

Colophon: No colophon; text ends abruptly with: "... ʻalá madhhab al-Sakkākī, aw, istiʻārah taḥqīqīyah ʻalá madhhab ṣāḥib al-Kashshāf wa-mukhtār al-muṣannif, aw, ithbātuhu takhyīlan ʻalá madhhab al-salaf, wa-bayna mā yujʻalu zāʼidan ʻalayhā tarshīḥan qūwat al-ikhtiṣāṣ bi-al-mushabbah bi-hi, fa-ayyuhumā aqwá ikhtiṣāṣan wa-taʻalluqan bi-hi fa-huwa al-qarīnah, wa-mā siwāhu tarshīḥ, khaṣṣa bayān al-farq bayna al-qarīnah wa-al-tarshīḥ bi-al-maknīyah, li-annahu lā iltibās bayna ..."

record.title: 880-02 Risālah fī fann al-munāẓarah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr Sājaqlīzādah.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-ṣalātun wa-salāmun ʻalá rusulih. Yaqūlu al-bāʼis al-faqīr Muḥammad al-madʻū bi-Sājiqlī Zādah, akramahu Allāh taʻālá bi-al-falāḥ wa-al-saʻādah: Hādhihi Risālah fī fann al-munāẓarah, ʻamiltuhā laka yā walad wa-li-amthālika al-mubtadiʼīn, bāraka Allāh fīhā laka wa-li-man arādahā ghayraka. Wa-hādhā al-fann lā shakka fī istiḥbāb taḥṣīlih, wa-innamā al-shakk fī wujūbih ..."
Secundo folio: ilá al-sābiʻ wa-huw ṭarīq ahl al-lughah.
17 x 24 cm; written surface: 10 x 17.5 cm; 24 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap, dark red leather on spine and flap (in 1 quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; extensive commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Risālat Sājiqlī Zādah fī al-adab, ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Colophon: "Tammat al-risālah al-musammāh bi-al-Waladīyah fī al-ādāb bi-Sājiqlī [li-Sājiqlī] Zādah, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayhi raḥmatan wāsiʻah. Wa-sawwadahu al-ḥaqīr al-faqīr, al-mudhnib al-muḥtāj ilá Rabbihi, al-faqīr Nadhīr walad Ṣāḥib Ibrāhīm Siʻirkūjukdī, min maḥāll Siʻir, az jūn, fī balad la-hu ʻAyn Tāb, fī waqt al-ʻaṣr, yawm Jahār Shanbah, fī thamānī Ramaḍān, sanat 1192. Allāhumma ighfir lanā wa-li-wālidaynā, wa-lā tadharnā, wa-li-aḥbābinā, wa-li-aqribāʼinā, wa-li-jamīʻ ummat Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Yā Muʻīn. Yā Ilāh. Yā Ilāh. Yā Ilāh. M."

Translation of the colophon: "The epistle titled 'al-Waladīyah fī al-ādāb' of Sājiqlī Zādah, may God have abundant mercy upon him, is completed. Copied by the wretched poor, the sinner, who is in need of his Lord, the poor Nadhīr walad Ṣāḥib Ibrāhīm Siʻirkūjukdī, from the regions of Siʻir, currently in the city of ʻAyn Tāb, in the afternoon of Wednesday, 8 Ramaḍan, of the year 1192 [of the Hijrah = 30 September 1778]. O God! Forgive us and our parents. Do not forsake us, and our loved ones, our relatives and all the community of Muḥammad, may God pray on him and grant him peace. Amen. O Supporter! O God! O God! O God! M."

record.title: 880-02 Fatḥ al-Wahhāb bi-sharḥ al-Ādāb : manuscript / Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-ʻawn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-Wahhāb al-Mannān, al-murshid lil-dalīl wa-al-burhān. Aḥmaduhu ablagha ḥamd ʻalá jamīʻ niʻamihi, wa-asʼaluhu al-mazīd min faḍlihi wa-karamih. Wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh, al-wāḥid al-ʻallām. Wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabdahu wa-rasūlahu afḍal al-anām, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi al-ghurr al-kirām. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā sharḥ li-kitāb al-ʻAllāmah Shams al-Millah wa-al-Dīn al-Ḥusayn al-Samarqandī, raḥimahu Allāh, al-musammá bi-Ādāb al-baḥth, yaḥullu alfāẓahu, wa-yuẓhiru murādahu, wa-yuḥaqqiqu masāʼilahu, wa-yuḥarriru dalāʼilahu ... wa-sammaytuhu 'Fatḥ al-Wahhāb bi-sharḥ al-Ādāb ..."
Secundo folio: al-niʻam, wa-al-raḥīm ʻalá mufīḍ daqāʼiqihā.
16.5 x 24 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16.5 cm; 16-21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 2 unnumbered quires).

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth" in red; extensive commentaries on the pages of the first quire (on the margins and interlinear); catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon; text ends abruptly with: "... li-anna al-muʻallal mā dāma muʻallalan yakūnu al-taʻlīl ḥaqq, li-yaʻlama ḥaqqīyat dalīlih, aw, buṭlānah, wa-laysa lil-sāʼil an yaṭluba ḥaqqīyatah; fa-idhā ghuṣiba al-taʻlīl fa-qad fāta al-gharaḍ, wa-li-annahu law jawwaza dhālika fa-al-muʻallal qad yaghṣibuhu ayḍan fī dalīlihi, wa-al-sāʼil qad yaghṣub kadhālika fa-yulzam baʻdahumā ..."

record.title: 880-03 Kitāb al-Miṣbāḥ : manuscript / Nāṣir ibn ʻAbd al-Sayyid al-Muṭarrizī.
record.note: Title from folio 2b ("... wa-tarjamtuhu bi-kitāb al-Miṣbāḥ ...") and reference sources (See: Brockelmann. S 2:312).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ammā baʻd ḥamd Allāh dhī al-inʻām, jāʻil al-naḥw fī al-kalām ka-al-milḥ fī al-ṭaʻām, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad Sayyid al-Anām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi muʼayyidī al-Islām, fa-inna al-walad al-aʻazz, lā zāla ka-ismihi Masʻūdan, wa-ilá ahl al-khabar [al-khayr (?)] mawdūdan, lammā istaẓhara Mukhtaṣar al-Iqnāʻ wa-kashafa ʻanhu bi-ḥifẓihi fuḍlat al-qināʻ, wa-aḥāṭ bi-mufradātihi ḥifẓan ..."
Secundo folio: bi-mufradātihi ḥifẓan wa-atqana mā fīhi.
14.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 7 x 10.5 cm; 9-11 lines per page.
Binding: In buckram cover with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap; cover embossed with central medallion.

In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper (some pages are tinted yellow); headings and markings in red; extensive commentaries on the margins and interlinear; some leaves seem to be missing between folios 41 and 43; catchwords.
On folio 1a: An invocation in Ottoman Turkish and Arabic.
Colophon: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn al-tawfīq, sanat [... (date illegible)]."
Tranaslation of the colophon: "The book was completed by the praise of God and favorable success, in the year [... (date illegible)]."

record.title: Recipe book : manuscript.
record.note: Binding: full calf front board with blind stamped ornaments and a dedication to Dr. Johann Baptista von Dreschern, dated 1745.

record.title: 880-02 Zahr al-kimām fī qiṣṣat Yūsuf ʻalayhi al-salām : manuscript / ʻUmar ibn Ibrāhīm al-Awsī.
record.note: Title from reference sources (See: Ziriklī 5:39) and the printed version.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with part of the second session, as follows: "... qadm, tatajāfá junūbuhum ʻan al-maḍājiʻ, wa-umdud anāmil yad ʻawn Rabbihim, wa-lā tatashabbath bi-arjāʼ banī al-hawá fa-innahā radmuka yanhāru ʻalayk. al-Ḥabīb maḥbūb, wa-ʻayn al-ḥāsid tará al-ʻuyūb, wa-al-ʻishq ʻinda al-ʻuqalāʼ min ashadd al-dhunūb. Unẓur ikhwat Yūsuf ajmaʻīn kayfa qālū: Inna abānā la-fī ḍalālin mubīn ..."
Secundo folio: law qaṣadta hādhihi al-marʼah al-ṣāliḥah.
15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16 cm; 18-20 lines per page.
Binding: Dark brown leather on spine and in remnants of front cover, with later paper wrapping; back cover deteriorated, exposing multiple layers of manuscript waste that comprise the board.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On the upper left corner of folio 70a: An ownership statement, as follows: "Bi-ḥamd Allāh waḥdah. Mimmā sāqahu sābiq al-taqdīr, bi-yad al-ʻināyah wa-al-taysīr, li-ʻabdihi al-faqīr ilayhi, ʻazza shaʼnuhu, Muḥammad al-Ḥanbalī, ʻufiya ʻanhu, bi-mannihi wa-karamih. Āmīn." Stamp of the owner. The same stamp occurs on several other pages.
On folios 148a-150a: Miscellaneous verses of poetry, in a different hand.
Colophon: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-nasʼalu Allāh al-ʻAẓīm al-hidāyah ilá sawāʼ ṭarīqih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."
Translation of the colophon: "It is completed by the praise of God and His abundant benevolence. We implore the Almighty God [to grant us] guidance to His correct way. Praise be to God alone."

record.title: 880-02 Lubāb al-taʼwīl fī maʻānī al-tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ al-awwal : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Khāzin al-Baghdādī.
record.note: Title from folio 2b: "... wa-sammaytuhu: Lubāb al-taʼwīl fī maʻānī al-Tanzīl ..."
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālih. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī khalaqa al-ashyāʼ fa-qaddarahā taqdīran, wa-ṣawwara shakl al-insān fa-aḥsanahu taṣwīran, wa-manaḥahu bi-al-ʻaql [al-ʻaql] wa-jaʻalahu samīʻan baṣīran, wa-sharrafahu bi-mā ʻarafahu min al-ʻilm wa-nawwara qalbahu tanwīran, wa-hadāhu ilá maʻrifatihi fa-yā lahā niʻmatan wa-faḍlan kabīran ..."
Secundo folio: thumma lam yarḍa minnā sard ḥurūfih.
20.2 x 30 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 21.5 cm; 29 lines per page.
Binding: In light brown leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion (in 62 numbered quires).
In large naskh script, in black ink on white paper; the verses of the Qurʼān are written in red; very few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On the label pasted to folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Lubāb al-taʼwīl fī maʻānī al-Tanzīl, lil-ʻAllāmah Abū al-Sarmadī, wa-qad allafahu wa-katabahu, wa-tamma fī shahr Muḥarram al-ḥarām, sanat 114 Hijrīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-salām."

On folio 2a, the author states that he benefited from "Maʻālim al-Tanzīl" of al-Baghawī: "... wa-lammā kāna kitāb 'Maʻālim al-Tanzīl' alladhī ṣannafahu al-Shaykh ... Ẓahīr al-Dīn Abū Muḥammad al-Ḥusayn ibn Masʻūd al-Baghawī ... min ajall al-muṣannafāt fī ʻilm al-tafsīr ... aḥbabtu an antakhiba min ghurar fawāʼidihi ... mukhtaṣaran jāmiʻan li-maʻānī al-tafsīr wa-lubāb al-taʼwīl ..."

The first part ends with the commentary on verses 164 and 165 of Sūrat al-Anʻām (Qurʼān: Chapter 6:164-165): "... Wa-lā taziru wāziratun wizra ukhrá ... inna Rabbaka sarīʻu al-ʻiqāb, wa-innahu la-ghafūrun raḥīm."

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-murādih wa-asrār Kitābih. Tamma [al-Juzʼ al-awwal min] Lubāb al-taʼwīl fī maʻānī al-Tanzīl. Yatlūhu, in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá [al-Juzʼ al-thānī] fī tafsīr Sūrat al-Aʻrāf. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taʻlīqihi awwal shahr Muḥarram al-ḥarām, iftitāḥ <ʻām> sanat 114 [1114] min Hijrat man la-hu mazīd al-sharaf, ʻalayhi afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad faqīr raḥmat Rabbihi, al-maʻrūf bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, rājī ʻafwa al-Malik al-Qadīr, ʻAbd Allāh ʻAbd al-ʻĀl ibn Murād, ghafara Allāh la-hu, wa-li-man raʼá ʻayban fa-satarah, wa-ajruhu ʻalá Allāh."

Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable of His purpose and the secrets of His Book. [the First part of] 'Lubāb al-taʼwīl fī maʻānī al-Tanzīl' is completed. It will be followed, God Almighty willing, by [the Second part], with the commentary on Sūrat al-Aʻrāf [Qurʼān: Chapter 7]. The copy was completed at the beginning of the sacred month of Ramaḍān, the start of the year 114 [1114] of the Hijrah of Him who possesses the highest honor [28 May 1702], may the best prayer and peace be upon Him, by the hand of the poor to the mercy of his Lord, he who is known for [his] incapacity and insufficiency, who pleads for the forgiveness of the Mighty King, ʻAbd Allāh ʻAbd al-ʻĀl ibn Murād, may God forgive him, and him who finds a blemish [in the copy] and covers it up [i.e. corrects it]; for his reward will be from God."

record.title: 880-01 Mawlid al-Nabī : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... fa-lammā balagh mā balagha [mablagh (?)] al-rijāl akhadha ʻalayhi abūhu ʻAbd Munāf al-ʻahd wa-al-mīthāq an lā yaḍaʻa hādhā al-nūr illā fī al-arḥām al-ṭāhirāt min al-nisāʼ al-khayyirāt, fa-qabila al-ʻahd min abīhi wa-alzamahu nafsahu, kull dhālika ijlālan li-nūr Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Qāla Abū al-Ḥasan al-Bakrī: Balaghanā annahu nazala bi-Makkah qaḥṭun wa-jadhb [wa-jadb (?)] wa-ḍīqun shadīd ..."
Secundo folio: fa-lam yazl Hāshim kadhālika.
17 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 15.5 cm; 12 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 12 unnumbered quires).
In large clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; markings and keywords in red; few notes and on the margins; catchwords.
Leaves 16-20 are blank.

Colophon: No colophon; text ends abruptly with: "... wa-qāla lī ilá ayna turīdu. Fa-qultu: ilá waladī anẓuru ilayhi. Fa-qāl: Ḥīla baynaka wa-baynahu thalāthat ayyām qallamā tanqaḍi [tanqaḍī] al-thalāthat ayyām li-ziyārat al-malāʼikah, wa-baʻda dhālika kull ahlihi yanẓurūnahu, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Wa-qad qīla fī dhalika al-maʻná shiʻran: Li-mawlidi al-Muṣṭafá al-aṣnāmu qad nukisat // ʻalá ..."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah fī uṣūl ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah : manuscript / Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-ʻalayhi tawakkulī. Yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-ghanī, Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Abī Bakr al-Azharī, ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-luṭfihi al-khafī, wa-ajrāhu ʻalá ʻawāʼid birrihi al-ḥafī: al-Ḥamdu lillāh rāfiʻ maqām al-muntaṣibīn li-nafʻ al-ʻabīd, al-khāfiḍīn janāḥahum lil-mustafīd, al-jāzimīn bi-anna tashīl al-naḥw ilá al-ʻulūm, mann Allāh taʻālá, min ghayr shakk wa-lā tardīd, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-muʻrib bi-al-lisān al-faṣīḥ ʻammā fī ḍamīrihi min ghayr gharābah wa-lā tanāfur wa-lā taʻqīd, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ulī al-faṣāḥah wa-al-balāghah wa-al-tajrīd. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā Sharḥ laṭīf li-alfāẓ al-Ājurrūmīyah fī uṣūl ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah, yantafiʻu bi-hi al-mubtadī, in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá, wa-lā yaḥtāju ilayhi al-muntahī, ʻamiltuhu lil-ṣighār fī al-fann wa-al-aṭfāl, lā lil-mārisīn lil-ʻilm min fuḥūl al-rijāl, ḥamalanī ʻalayhi Shaykh al-waqt wa-al-ṭarīqah, wa-maʻdin al-sulūk wa-al-ḥaqīqah, Sayyidī wa-Mawlāy, al-ʻārif bi-Rabbihi al-ʻAlī, Sayyidī al-Shaykh ʻAbbās al-Azharī, nafaʻanī Allāh bi-barakātih, wa-aʻāda ʻalayya wa-ʻalá al-Muslimīn min ṣāliḥ daʻawātih, innahu ʻalá mā yashāʼu qadīr wa-bi-al-ijābah jadīr ..."
Secundo folio: al-Ājurrūmiyah fī uṣūl ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah.
17 x 23 cm; written surface: 8 x 13.5 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In paper wrapper.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Ājurrūmīyah in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the paper wrapper (in pencil): "al-Shaykh Khālid al-Azharī fī al-naḥw. Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah."
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah lil-Shaykh Khālid." Partly legible singnature: "Muḥammad [...?]."

On folio 1a: "Fāʼidah. Qāla fī Sharḥ al-Nuṣūṣ: Yanbaghī li-kull ṭālib ʻilm an yaktuba hādhihi al-ḥurūf ʻalá ẓahr kull kitāb li-yaḥṣula la-hu bi-dhālika al-qudrah ʻalá fahmihi bi-idhn Allāh taʻālá, wa-bi-barakātihā bi-al-maʻná, wa-Allāh al-muʻīn, wa-huwa hādhihi: 111 H 1111 hiya ʻAbbās Marāyatuhu H Ḥ 1111 Mā Ḥ 111 M H. Tammat."

Colophon: No colophon: Text ends abruptly with: "... Wa-al-khāmis idhmā, ka-qawlika: Wa-innaka idhmā taʼati mā anta āmirun // bi-hi talfa man īyāhu taʼmuru ātiyan. Fa-idhmā ḥarf sharṭ ʻalá al-ṣaḥīḥ, wa-taʼti fiʻl al-sharṭ wa-huwa majzūm wa-ʻalāmat jazmihi ḥadhf al-yāʼ, wa-talfa jawāb al-sharṭ wa-ʻlāmat jazmihi ḥadhf al-yāʼ ayḍan. Wa-al-sādis ay, naḥwa qawlihi taʻālá: Ayyā mā tadʻū fa-la-hu al-Asmāʼ al-Ḥusná, fa-ayyā ism sharṭ jāzim ..."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah fī uṣūl ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah : manuscript / Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-ghanī, Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Abī Bakr al-Azharī, ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-luṭfihi al-khafī, wa-ajrāhu ʻalá ʻawāʼid birrihi al-ḥafī: al-Ḥamdu lillāh rāfiʻ maqām al-muntaṣibīn li-nafʻ al-ʻabīd, al-khāfiḍīn janāḥahum lil-mustafīd, al-jāzimīn bi-anna tashīl al-naḥw ilá al-ʻulūm, mann Allāh taʻālá, min ghayr shakk wa-lā tardīd, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-muʻrib bi-al-lisān al-faṣīḥ ʻammā fī ḍamīrihi min ghayr gharābah wa-lā tanāfur wa-lā taʻqīd, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ulī al-faṣāḥah wa-al-balāghah wa-al-tajrīd. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā Sharḥ laṭīf li-alfāẓ al-Ājurrūmīyah fī uṣūl ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah, yantafiʻu bi-hi al-mubtadī, in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá, wa-lā yaḥtāju ilayhi al-muntahī, ʻamiltuhu lil-ṣighār fī al-fann wa-al-aṭfāl, lā lil-mārisīn lil-ʻilm min fuḥūl al-rijāl, ḥamalanī ʻalayhi Shaykh al-waqt wa-al-ṭarīqah, wa-maʻdin al-sulūk wa-al-ḥaqīqah, Sayyidī wa-Mawlāy, al-ʻārif bi-Rabbihi al-ʻAlī, Sayyidī al-Shaykh ʻAbbās al-Azharī, nafaʻanī Allāh bi-barakātih, wa-aʻāda ʻalayya wa-ʻalá al-Muslimīn min ṣāliḥ daʻawātih, innahu ʻalá dhālika qadīr wa-bi-al-ijābah jadīr ..."
Secundo folio: al-ʻārif bi-Rabbihi al-ʻAlī.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Ājurrūmīyah in red; markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah lil-Shaykh Khālid." Partly legible signature: "Muḥammad [...?]."

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-hādhā ākhir mā aradnā dhikrahu ʻalá hādhihi al-Muqaddimah. Wa-qad tamma mā alḥaqa bi-hi al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, wa-naqalahu bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Āmīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-Muqaddimah al-mubārakah al-sharīfah fī yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, khamsat ayyām khalat min shahr J [Jumādá] al-Ākhir, ʻalá yad kātibihā, sanat 1237, baʻda Hijratihi, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable of what is correct, to Him is the reference and returning. This is the end of what we intended to mention about this Introduction. The poor and wretched servant completed what he added and appended to it, by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. Amen. This blessed and noble copy was completed, by the hand of its copyist, on blessed Thursday, five days having passed from the month of Jumādá al-Ākhir, of the year 1237, after the Hijrah of the Prophet [27 February 1822], may God pray on Him and on His family and companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-01 Mishkāt al-Miṣbāḥ : manuscript.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī tawaḥḥada bi-al-kalimāt al-muʻjizah, wa-ikhtaṣṣa bi-hi al-Asmāʼ al-Ḥusná wa-al-afʻāl al-mutqanah, māḍiyan wa-adhalan [wa-azalan] wa-ḥālan wa-mustaqbalan, wa-faḍḍala banī Ādama wa-ʻallamahum al-ḥiraf li-takūna sababan li-maʻāshihim wa-zukhran [wa-dhukhran] li-nubl al-farq, wa-ṣarafa qulūb al-ʻālimīn naḥwa al-ṣafā, fa-ilayhi inṣarafū, wa-ṣayyara afʼidat al-ʻulamāʼ mishkāt maṣābīḥ al-maʻānī, fa-ʻayn al-ḥaqq aʻrabū, wa-rafaʻa qadrahum wa-naṣaba rāyātihim, fa-lillāh darruhum ʻālimīn, thumma lillāh darruhum ʻālimīn muʼallifīn ... wa-baʻd, fa-qad ṭāla mā jāla fī ṣadrī wa-dāra fī khaladī an ashraḥa kitāb al-Miṣbāḥ sharḥan bi-'Mishkāt al-Miṣbāḥ', li-yakūna mithla nūrihi ka-mishkāt fīhā miṣbāḥ sharḥan yuzīḥu ṣiʻābahu ..."
Secundo folio: [fa-aghnā]nī bi-maghānim āthārihi ghāyat al-ighnāʼ.
13.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 15 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; text within red frames; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ al-Miṣbāḥ al-naḥwī."

On folio 1a: Four verses of poetry on the different names of sleep during daytime, as follows: "Taqsīm al-nawm ʻalá al-nahār. al-Nawmu min baʻdi farḍ al-ṣubḥi 'ʻaylūlah' // fa-qurra wa-ʻinda al-ḍuḥá fa-al-nawmu 'faylūlah'. Wa-hiya al-futūru wa-qabla al-mayli qīla la-hu // idh zāda fī al-ʻaqli ay bi-al-qāfi 'qaylūlah'. Wa-al-nawmu baʻda zawāli al-shamsi qīla la-hu // idh kāna qabla ṣalāti al-farḍ 'jaylūlah'. Wa-baʻda ʻaṣrin yusammá ḥaythu yūrithu mā // bi-hi al-halāku wa-naqṣu al-ʻaqli 'ghaylūlah'."
On folio 1a: Six verses of poetry, praising the founders of the four traditions of Islamic law. "Fī madḥ al-Aʼimmah": Abū Ḥanīfah, Anas ibn Mālik, al-Shāfiʻī and Aḥmad ibn Ḥanbal.
At the end of the colophon: A statement in Ottoman Turkish.

Colophon: "Tamma al-kalām bi-ḥamd al-Malik al-ʻAllām, wa-afḍal al-ṣalāh ʻalá Afḍal al-Anām, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-kirām, wa-aṣḥābihi al-ʻiẓām, thumma al-tābiʻīna lahum ilá Yawm al-Qiyām. Tammat. Ṣāḥibuhu wa-mālikuhu [...] Ḥusayn ibn Ḥusayn. Tārīkh sanat khamsah wa-sabʻīn wa-alf. Tammat fī shahr Jumāzá [Juamādá] al-Ūlá, fī yawm arbaʻah, fī waqt al-ḍuḥá. Tammat [fī] Madrasat al-Zakah [al-Zakāh (?)], fī Makā [Makkah (?)], Madrasat al-Zakah [al-Zakāh (?)] ʻUthmān Afandīyah. Tammat."

Translation of the colophon: "The discourse was completed by the praise of the All Knowing King. May the best prayer be upon the Best of Mankind [Prophet Muḥammad], and his noble family, his great companions, and their followers, until Judgement Day. It is completed. Its possessor and owner is [...] Ḥusayn ibn Ḥusayn. Dated in the year 1075 [of the Hijrah]. It was completed in the month of Jumādá al-Ūlá, on the fourth day, in the morning [23 November 1664]. It was completed [at] Madrasat al-Zakah [al-Zakāh (?)], in Makā [Makkah (?)], Madrasat al-Zakah [al-Zakāh (?)] ʻUthmān Afandīyah. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 al-Kāfiyah : manuscript / ʻUthmān ibn ʻUmar ibn al-Ḥājib.
record.note: 1. Title of al-Kāfiyah from colophon (folio 26b).
2. Title of Iʻrāb dībajat al-Miṣbāḥ from folio 29a.
3. Title of al-Miṣbāḥ from incipit (folio 66a): "... wa-tarjamtuhu bi-kitāb al-Miṣbāḥ ..."
4. Title of al-ʻAwāmil al-miʼah from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of al-Kāfiyah (folio 2b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Kalimah lafẓ wuḍiʻa li-maʻná mufrad, wa-hiya ism wa-fiʻl wa-ḥarf, li-annahā immā an tadulla ʻalá maʻná fī nafsihā, aw, lā. al-Thānī al-ḥarf, wa-al-awwl immā an yaqtarina bi-aḥad al-azminah al-thalāthah, aw, lā. al-Thānī al-ism, wa-al-awwal al-fiʻl. Wa-qad ʻulima bi-dhālika ḥadd kull wāḥid minhā. al-Kalām mā taḍammana kalimatayn bi-al-isnād ..."
Secundo folio of al-Kāfiyah: bi-al-ḍammah rafʻan wa-al-fatḥah naṣban.

2. Incipit of Iʻrāb dībājat al-Miṣbāḥ (folio 29b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī lā yablughu kunhahu jādd, wa-lā yuḥṣī ʻadada niʻamihi ʻādd, wa-ḥāra fī biḥār ʻirfānihi arwāḥ al-ʻālamīn, wa-nāra bi-anwār iḥsānihi ashbāḥ al-ʻālamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá man lam yara lil-kufr atharan illā ṭammahu wa-maḥāh, wa-lā rasman illā azālahu wa-ʻaffāh, Muḥammad al-mabʻūth bi-al-hudá wa-al-nūr ..."
Secundo folio of Iʻrāb dībājat al-Miṣbāḥ: maʻa sāqihā fī maḥall al-naṣb.

3. Incipit of al-Miṣbāḥ (folio 65a): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ammā baʻda ḥamd Allāh dhī al-inʻāmi jāʻili al-naḥwi fī al-kalāmi ka-al-milḥi fī al-ṭaʻāmi, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi Sayyid al-Anām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi muʼayyid[ī] al-Islām, fa-inna al-walad al-aʻazz, lā zāla ka-ismihi Masʻūdan, wa-ilá ahl al-khayr mawdūdan, lammā istaẓhara Mukhtaṣar al-Iqnāʻ, wa-kashafa ʻanhu bi-ḥifẓihi fuḍlat al-qināʻ, wa-aḥāṭa bi-mufradātihi ḥifẓan, wa-atqana mā fīhi min al-naḥw maʻnan wa-lafẓan, aradtu an ulmiẓahu min kalām al-Imām al-muḥaqqiq wa-al-ḥabr al-mudaqqiq Abī Bakr ʻAbd al-Qāhir ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Jurjānī ..."
Secundo folio of al-Miṣbāḥ: hādhā al-Mukhtaṣar wa-nafaytu ʻan kull minhā.

4. Incipit of al-ʻAwāmil al-miʼah (folio 83b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Muḥammad wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-inna al-ʻawāmil fī al-naḥw ʻalá mā allafahu al-Shaykh al-Imām ʻAbd al-Qāhir ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Jurjānī, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayhi, miʼat ʻāmil, wa-hiya tanqasimu ilá qismayn: Lafẓīyah wa-maʻnawīyah. Fa-al-lafẓīyah minhā tanqasimu ilá qismayn: Samāʻīyah wa-qiyāsīyah. Fa-al-samāʻīyah fīhā aḥad wa-tisʻūn ʻāmilan, wa-al-qiyāsīyah fīhā sabʻat ʻawāmil, wa-al-maʻnawīyah fīhā ʻadadān, fa-al-jumlah miʼat ʻāmil ..."
Secundo folio of al-ʻAwāmil al-miʼah: qāʼim wa-al-thāmin al-tafdiyah.
13 x 21 cm; written surface: 7 x 15 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; dark brown leather on spine.

The four manuscripts were written in the same hand, in good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes on the margins and interlinear; some corrections on the margins; some phrases in red; markings in red; catchwords.
On the back of the front cover: "Fāʼidah li-bukāʼ al-ṭifl" (A recipe/invocation to stop a baby from crying).

On folio 1a: A statement indicating that the codex contains four manuscripts, as follows: "Yashmalu hādhā al-majmūʻ ʻalá arbaʻat kutub: al-Awwal 'Matn al-Kāfiyah', wa-al-thānī 'al-ʻAwāmil', wa-al-thālith 'al-Miṣbāḥ fī al-naḥw', wa-al-rābiʻ 'Iʻrāb al-Miṣbāḥ'. Tamm." And a statement in English, as follows: "In this book are five tracts": 1. al-Kāfiyah li-Ibn al-Ḥājib. 2. Iʻrāb Dibājat al-Miṣbāḥ. 3. Iʻrāb al-Miṣbāḥ (actually a continuation of the previous treatise). 4. al-Miṣbāḥ. 5. al-ʻAwāmil fī al-naḥw (Miʼat ʻāmil).

On folio 2a: Three ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Dakhala fī mulk aḥqar al-wará, rājī luṭf Allāh, Ṣāliḥ al-Jarrāḥī." 2. "Dakhala hādhā al-majmūʻ fī mulk al-Sayyid ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn al-Sayyid Muḥammad al-Baddāwī, fī sanat 1157 [of the Hijrah = 1744/1745]. 3. "Malaka hādhā al-kitāb ʻAbd al-Munʻim, ṭabīb, walad Ḥannā ʻAṭāyā."
On folio 2a: Miscellaneous verses of poetry in Ottoman Turkish.
On folio 27a: An ownership statement, as follows: "al-Thānī al-ʻAwāmil. Dakhala fī Mulk Ṣāliḥ al-Jarrāḥī."
Folios 27b-28b are blank.
On folio 29a: "al-Thānī al-ʻAwāmil", "Iʻrāb Dībājat al-Miṣbāḥ" (in pencil).
Folio 34 is blank.
On folio 35a: An ownership statement, as follows: "Iʻrāb al-Miṣbāḥ", "Dakhala fī mulk Ṣāliḥ al-Jarrāḥī", and a stamp of "Ṣādiq Muḥibb Āl Muḥammad".
At the head of folio 35b: "Cont. of previous ff." (continuation of Iʻrāb dībājat al-Miṣbāḥ).
On folio 65a: An ownership statement: "al-Miṣbāḥ" (in pencil), "Dakhala fī mulk Ṣāliḥ al-Jarrāḥī."
On folio 83a: An ownership statement: "al-ʻAwāmil", "Dakhala fī mulk Ṣāliḥ al-Jarrāḥī."

On folio 89a: A statement indicating change of ownership, as follows: "Qad intaqala min kutubīyat al-muntaqil ilá raḥmatihi taʻālá, Mūsá Nawfal al-Ṭarābulusī al-Naḥwī, wa-dakhala fī mulk al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, Niqūlā ibn al-Qiss Yūsuf ibn al-marḥūm Jubrān Zurayq al-Qaṣīr, al-Shāmī waṭanan, wa-al-Urthūdūksī madhhaban, fī sanat 1791 Masīḥīyah."
On folio 89a: An illegible stamp, and a quotation on Arabic grammar in Ottoman Turkish.

1. Colophon of al-Kāfiyah (folio 26b): "Tamma kitāb al-Kāfiyah allatī li-man qaraʼahā wāfiyah, ʻan yad aḥqar al-wará, Uways ibn Muṣṭafá, qāḍiayn bi-Jazīrat Mays muʼabbadan, jaʻalanā Allāh fī al-Jannah mukhalladan. Wa-arjū mimman istafāda min hādhā al-kitāb duʻāʼ mustajāb, bi-Umm al-Kitāb. Wa-al-farāgh min al-taḥrīr wa-al-irqām waqaʻa fī khayr al-awqāt wa-al-ayyām, min shahr Jumādá al-Ūlá, fī yawmihi alladhī awwalīyāt wa-ākhir, li-sanat alf wa-arbaʻ wa-khamsīn min Hijrat Rasūl Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, ʻalayhi afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-kirām."

Translation of the colophon of al-Kāfiyah: "The book of 'al-Kāfiyah', which is sufficient to him who reads it, was completed by the hand of the most wretched of mankind, Uways ibn Muṣṭafá, a permanent judge at the Island of Mays [probably the Greek island of Meis/Megistē], may God make us live in al-Jannah [Paradise] permanently forever. I request whoever benefits from this book to offer an acceptable invocation, by [reciting] "Umm al-Kitāb" [i.e. "al-Fātiḥah" (the first sūrah of al-Qurʼān) on my behalf]. The completion of the transcription and the provision of the diacritics were completed on the best times and days of the month of Jumādá al-Ūlá, the beginnings and end [of it], of the year 1054 [July/August 1644] of the Hijrah of the Messenger of Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn [Prophet Muḥammad], may the best prayer and peace be upon Him, and upon his noble family and companions."
2. Colophon of Iʻrāb dībājat al-Miṣbāḥ (folio 64b): "Tamma hādhā al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Wahhāb."
Translation of the colophon of Iʻrāb dībājat al-Miṣbāḥ: "This book was completed by the help God, the Abundant Giving."

3. Colophon of al-Miṣbāḥ (folio 82b): No colophon. Text ends with:"... al-Thānī qawluhu taʻālá: Qul bal millata Ibrāhīma Ḥanīfan, bi-iḍmār nattabiʻu, li-dalālat 'Kūnū Hūdan aw Naṣārá', wa-minhu: Man faʻala hādhā, fa-qultu Zayd, bi-iḍmār faʻalahu, wa-al-iḍmār bi-dūn dhālika lā yajūzu, wa-qarīb min hādhā al-iḍmār ʻalá sharīṭat al-tafsīr, li-anna al-dāll ʻalayhi lafẓ ayḍan, illā annahu yaʻqubuhu. Wa-fī al-awwal mā sabaq min al-kalām. Tamm [It is completed]."

4. Colophon of al-ʻAwāmil al-miʼah (folio 88b): No colophon. Text ends with: "... fa-hādhihi miʼat ʻāmil, fa-lā yastaghnī al-ṣaghīr wa-al-kabīr, wa-al-waḍīʻ wa-al-rafīʻ ʻan maʻrifatihā wa-istiʻmāliha. Tamm [It is completed]."

record.title: 880-01 Iʻrāb al-Kāfiyah : manuscript.
record.note: Title of Iʻrāb al-Kāfiyah supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Title of Sharḥ al-ʻAwāmil supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Iʻrāb al-Kāfiyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Kalimah: Mubtadaʼ, wa-al-lām fīhā li-taʻrīf al-jins, ay, li-taʻayyina al-māhīyah, li-anna al-ḥadd li-bayān al-māhīyah, lā li-taʻrīf jamīʻ al-afrād min ḥaythu al-ifrād, wa-lā li-taʻrīf fard min afrād al-māhīyah al-murādah, fa-lā takūnu lil-istighrāq wa-al-ʻahd, wa-lā yalzamu idhā īrīda [urīda] bi-hā al-maṣlaḥah an takūna lil-ʻahd ..."
Secundo folio of Iʻrāb al-Kāfiyah: mutaʻalliq bi-taḍammun aw ṣifah.

Incipit of Sharḥ al-ʻAwāmil: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... wa-huwa al-istighrāq, wa-mathaluhu kull muḍāf ilá nakirah, wa-lā khafāʼ fī tamayyuz baʻḍihā ʻan baʻḍ, illā fī taʻrīf al-ḥaqīqah, fa-innahu in quṣida bi-hi al-ishārah ilá al-māhīyah min ḥaythu hiya hiya, lam yatamayyaz [...] asmāʼ al-ajnās allatī layst fīhā dalālah ʻalá al-baʻḍīyah wa-al-kullīyah, naḥwa rujʻá wa-dhikrá ..."
Secundo folio of Sharḥ al-ʻAwāmil: fa-yajūzu an yakūna bi-sabab al-tasmiyah.
11.5 x 18.5 cm. Written surface for Iʻrāb al-Kāfiyah: 8 x 12.5 cm; 18-21 lines per page. Written surface for Sharḥ al-ʻAwāmil: 8 x 15 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap.

Iʻrāb al-Kāfiyah is copied in good to fair naskh script; in black ink, on white paper; headings on the margins in red; markings in red; catchwords. Sharḥ al-ʻAwāmil al-miʼah is copied in fair naskh; markings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: An ownership statement, as follows: "Mimmā munna bi-hi ʻalá rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi [...] Muḥammad [... ...]. Fī ghurūsh. Sanat 1267 [of the Hijrah = November/December 1850]." Stamp of "Muḥammad ibn Ṣāliḥ al-Qaysī".
On folio 1a (in copia pencil): "Ḥāshiyat naḥw".
Colophon of Iʻrāb al-Kāfiyah: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Tārīkh sanat W~W [date could not be deciphered]."

Translation of the colophon of Iʻrāb al-Kāfiyah: "The book was completed by the help of God the Abundant Giving King. To Him is the reference and returning. Dated in the year W~W [date could not be deciphered]."

Colophon of Sharḥ al-ʻAwāmil al-miʼah: "Fa-hādhihi miʼat ʻāmil, fa-lā yastaghnī al-ṣaghīr wa-al-kabīr, wa-al-waḍīʻ wa-al-rafīʻ ʻan maʻrifatihā wa-istiʻmālihā. Tammat bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon of Sharḥ al-ʻAwāmil: "These are the one hundred words whose knowledge or use cannot be dispensed with by the young or the adult, nor by the inferior or the superior. It was completed by the help of God and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family, and all his companions. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-03 Marāḥ al-arwāḥ : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī ibn Masʻūd.
record.note: 1. Title of Marāḥ al-arwāḥ from reference sources.
2. Title of Mabādiʼ fī al-taṣrīf from reference sources.
3. Title of Bināʼ al-afʻāl from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of Marāḥ al-arwāḥ (folio 1b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-muftaqir ilá Allāh al-wadūd, Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī ibn Masʻūd, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi. Iʻlam inna al-ṣarf umm al-ʻulūm wa-al-naḥw abūhā, wa-yaqwá fī al-dirāyāt dārūhā, wa-yaṭghá fī al-riwāyāt ʻārūhā, fa-jamaʻtu fīhi kitāban muʼannath [mawsūman] bi-al-Marāḥ [bi-Marāḥ] al-arwāḥ, wa-hwa lil-ṣabī janāḥ al-najāḥ wa-rāḥun raḥrāḥ, wa-fī muʻaydatihi ḥīna rāḥ mithl tuffāḥ aw rāḥ. Wa-billāh aʻtaṣmu ʻammā yaṣimu wa-astaʻīn, wa-huwa niʻma al-Mawlá wa-niʻma al-muʻīn ..."
Secundo folio of Marāḥ al-arwāḥ: ilá sabʻat abwāb.

2. Incipit of Mabādiʼ fī al-taṣrīf (folio 39b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ʻāfiyah lil-muttaqīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá khayr al-khalq Muḥammad wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn. Iʻlam inna al-taṣrīf fī al-lughah al-taghyīr, wa-fī al-ṣināʻah taḥwīl al-aṣl al-wāḥid ilá amthilah mukhtalifah li-maʻānin maqṣūdah lā taḥṣulu illā bihā. Thumma al-fiʻl, immā thulāthī wa-immā rubāʻī, wa-kull wāḥid minhumā immā mujarrad aw mazīd ..."
Secundo folio of Mabādiʼ fī al-taṣrīf: fa-in kāna māḍīhi ʻalá faʻala.

3. Incipit of Bināʼ al-afʻāl (folio 61b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Iʻlam inna abwāb al-taṣrīf khamsah wa-thalāthūn bāban, sittah minhā lil-thulāthī al-mujarrad. al-Bāb al-awwal: Faʻala yafʻulu, bi-wazn naṣara yanṣuru, wa-ʻalāmatuhu an takūna ʻayn fiʻlihi, maftūḥan fī al-māḍī wa-maḍmūman fī al-muḍāriʻ, wa-bināʼuhu lil-taʻdiyah ghāliban, wa-qad yakūnu lāziman. Mithāl al-mutaʻaddī, naḥwa: Naṣara Zaydun ʻUmaran. Wa-mithāl al-lāzim, naḥwa: Kharaja Zaydun ..."
Secundo folio of Bināʼ al-afʻāl: ghāliban wa-qad yakūnu lāziman.
10.5 x 17.5 cm; written surface: 5 x 12 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather; flap missing; cover embossed with central medallion.
In good naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on white paper; keywords and headings in purple; few notes on the margins in arabic and Ottoman Turkish; catchwords.
On the label pasted to the front cover: "Yāzim ʻArabī".
On the back of the front cover: Scribbles in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish, and crude drawings.
On folio 1a: A statement in Ottoman Turkish about converting the "tāʼ" of "iftaʻala" and its derivitives in Arabic morphology into a "ṭāʼ" after the letter "ṣād".

At the head of folio 1b: A statement in Ottoman Turkish about the morphlogical rule of "qalb" (conversion) in Arabic morphology, with the word "Maraḥ" inside a trianglular shape (probably referring to "Marāḥ al-arwāh").
At the head of folio 39b: "Hādhā Kitāb ʻIzzī."
On folio 61a: Scribbles in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish.
At the head of folio 61b: "Bināʼ."
On folio 71a: Miscellaneous scribbles.
On folio 72b-front of the back cover: Scribbles in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish and "ṭughrā" style signitures..
1. Colophon of Marāḥ al-arwāḥ (folio 39a): "Tammat. Tamām ūldī. M M M."
