Translation of the colophon of Marāḥ al-arwāḥ: "It is completed. It is done."

2. Colophon of Mabādiʼ fī al-taṣrīf: No colophon. Text ends with: "... fa-in iqtaḍá al-qiyās ibdāl, aw naql, aw iskān, fa-ifʻal, wa-illā ḥarf al-faʻl ghayr al-ṣaḥīḥ ka-al-ṣaḥīḥ, wa-qad yakūnu fī baʻḍ al-mawāḍiʻ lā yataghayyaru al-muʻtallāt fīhi maʻa wujūd al-muqtaḍá, naḥwa ʻawira wa-iʻtawara wa-istawá, wa-ghayr dhālik, fa-baʻḍuhā lā yataghayyaru li-ṣiḥḥat al-bināʼ, wa-baʻḍuhā li-ʻillah ukhrá. M M M."
3. Colophon of Bināʼ al-afʻāl: "Tammat al-kitāb. Katabahu Muḥammad al-Walī [?]. Ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi."
Translation of the colophon of Bināʼ al-afʻāl: "The book is completed. Copied by Muḥammad al-Walī [?]. May God forgive him and his parents and treat them and him with kindness."

Colophon of al-Amthilah al-mukhtalifah min al-thulāthī al-mujarrad (folio 72a): "Tammat al-Amathilah bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá, sanat 1211, ghurrat Jumādá al-Ākhir. Katabahu al-faqīr Muḥammad, al-maʻrūf [... ...] Muḥammad al-Amīn."

Translation of the colophon of al-Amthilah al-mukhtalifah min al-thulāthī al-mujarrad: "The Examples were completed by the help of God Almighty, in the beginning of Jumādá al-Ākhir, of the year 1211 [of the Hijrah = 2 December 1796]. Written by the poor Muḥammad [... ...], knows as [... ...] Muḥammad al-Amīn."

record.title: 880-02 al-Kāfiyah : manuscript / ʻUthmān ibn ʻUmar ibn al-Ḥājib.
record.note: 1. Title of al-Kāfiyah from reference sources.
2. Title of al-Miṣbāḥ from reference sources.
3. Title of al-ʻAwāmil al-miʼah from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of al-Kāfiyah (folio 3b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Tammim bi-al-khayr. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻallāmah, afḍal al-mutaʼakhkhirīn, majd al-ʻArab wa-quiblat al-adab, Jamāl al-Dīn, Kamāl al-Islām, Abū ʻAmr ʻUthmān al-Mālikī, al-maʻrūf bi-Ibn al-Ḥājib, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, jalla jalāluh: al-Kalimah lafẓun wuḍiʻa li-maʻnan mufrad, wa-hiya ism wa-fiʻl wa-ḥarf, li-annahā immā an tadulla ʻalá maʻnan fī nafsihā, aw lā ..."
Secundo folio of al-Kāfiyah: aw fī fiʻl wa-ism.

2. Incipit of al-Miṣbāḥ (folio 49b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-tammim bi-al-khayr. Ammā baʻd ḥamd Allāh dhī al-inʻāmi, jāʻili al-naḥwi fī al-kalāmi kā-al-milḥi [ka-al-milḥi] fī al-ṭaʻāmi, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad, Sayyid al-Anām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi, muʼayyidī al-Islām, fa-inna al-walad al-aʻazz, lā zāla ka-ismihi masʻūdan, wa-ilá ahl al-khayr mawdūdan, lammā istaẓhara Mukhtaṣar al-Iqnāʻ, wa-kashafa ʻanhu bi-ḥifẓihi fuḍlat al-qināʻ, wa-aḥāṭa bi-mufradātihi ḥifẓan, wa-atqana mā fīhi min al-naḥw maʻnan wa-lafẓan, aradtu an ulmiẓahu min kalām al-Imām al-muḥaqqiq ʻAbd al-Qāhir ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Jurjānī ..."
Secundo folio of al-Miṣbāḥ: saqá Allāh tharāh.

3. Incipit of al-ʻAwāmil al-miʼah (folio 86b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūlihi Muḥammad wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-inna al-ʻawāmil fī al-naḥw, ʻalá mā allafahu al-Shaykh al-Imām ʻAbd al-Qāhir ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Jurjānī, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayhi, miʼat ʻāmil, lafẓīyah wa-maʻnawīyah. Fa-al-lafẓīyah minhā samāʻīyah wa-qiyāsīyah. Fa-al-samāʻīyah minhā aḥad wa-tisʻūn ʻāmilan, wa-al-qiyāsīyah minhā sabʻat ʻawāmil, wa-al-maʻnawīyah ʻadadān ..."
Secundo folio of al-ʻAwāmil al-miʼah: ʻalayhi bi-thiyāb al-safar.
15.5 x 20 cm; written surface: 7 x 11 cm; 9 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; dark red leather on spine; back cover missing.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; many commentaries on the margins and interlinear on most of the pages; catchwords.
On folio 1a: A sample sermon for the Friday prayer.
On folios 1b-3a: Miscellaneous quotations on Arabic grammar, mostly in Arabic, some in Ottoman Turkish.
On folios 48b-49a: Miscellaneous quotations on Arabic grammar, mostly in Arabic, some in Ottoman Turkish.
On folios 83b-86a: Miscellaneous quotations on Islamic law, the Hadith, and Arabic grammar, mostly in Arabic, few in Ottoman Turkish.
On folio 92a-92b: Miscellaneous quotations in Ottoman Turkish.
1. Colophon of al-Kāfiyah (folio 48a): "Tammat bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá, fī shahr Ramaḍān, fī yawm Jahā[r]shanbah, fī yad ʻAbd al-Raḥmān. Tārīkh 6~W [could not be deciphered]."
Translation of the colophon of al-Kāfiyah: "It was completed by the help of God Almighty, in the month of Ramaḍān, on Wednesday, by the hand of ʻAbd al-Raḥmān. Dated 6~W [could not be deciphered]."

2. Colophon of al-Miṣbāḥ (folio 83a): "Tamma al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb, ghāfir al-adhnāb, Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Taḥrīr fī yawm Yak Shanbah. Kātibuhu ʻabd [al-ʻAbd] al-ḍaʻīf, al-mudhnib, al-muḥtāj ilá raḥmat Allāh taʻālá, ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Yādkār, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, wa-al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt. Āmīn. Yā Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tārīkh 8~W [could not be deciphered]."

Translation of the colophon of al-Miṣbāḥ: "The book was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King, who forgives the sins, Lord of the Universe. Copied on Sunday, by the feeble servant, the sinner, who needs the mercy of God Almighty, ʻAbd al-Rḥmān ibn Yādkār, may God forgive him, his parents, all Muslim men and women, and the believers, men and women. Amen. O Lord of the Universe. Dated 8~W [could not be deciphered]."
3. Colophon of al-ʻAwāmil al-miʼah (folio 91b): "Tamma al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb, ghāfir al-adhnāb. Tammat. Tammat. Tammat. Tammat."

Translation of the colophon of al-ʻAwāmil al-miʼah: "The book was completed by God, the Abundant Giving King, the forgiver of sins. It is completed. It is completed. It is completed. It is completed."

record.title: 880-03 Maṭāliʻ al-anẓār fī sharḥ Ṭawāliʻ al-nawār : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Iṣfahānī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... maṣdar, naqūlu: Raṣaftu al-ḥijārah fī al-bināʼ arṣufuhā raṣfan, idhā ḍamamta baʻḍahā ilá baʻḍ. Thumma bayyana annahu ʻalīm bi-al-ʻilm, lā ʻalīm bi-al-dhāt, wa-anna ʻilmahu wāḥidun yuḥīṭu bi-al-maʻlūmāt allatī lā yatanāhá ʻadduhā wa-iḥṣāʼuhā, fa-inna ʻilamahu wāḥidun yataʻallaqu bi-kull shayʼ min al-kullīyāt wa-al-juzʼīyāt wa-al-maḥsūsāt wa-al-maʻlūmāt. Qāla Allāh taʻālá: Wa-huwa bi-kull shayʼ ʻalīm. Wa-qāla Allāh taʻālá: Wa-mā tasquṭu min waraqatin illā yaʻlamuhā, wa-lā ḥabbatin fī ẓulumāt al-arḍ, wa-lā raṭbin, wa-lā yābisn illā fī kitābin mubīn ..."
Secundo folio: ʻalayhi, qāla Allāh taʻālá: Inna Allāh wa-malāʼikatahu yuṣallūna ʻalá al-Nabī.
13 x 18 cm; written surface: 8 x 11.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some of "Ṭawāliʻ al-anwār" preceded by the word "Qāla" (He said), and the commentary by the word "Aqūlu" (I say) both in red; markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
At the head of folio 1a (in pencil): "Kitāb fī al-uṣūl majhūl." "ʻAdad 545". "Khaṭṭ".

On folio 127a: The author writes: "al-Kitāb al-thānī fī al-ilāhīyāt, wa-fīhi abwāb. al-Awwal fī dhāt Allāh, wa-fīhi fuṣūl. Lammā faragha min al-kitāb al-awwal, fī al-mumkināt, sharaʻa fī al-kitāb al-thānī 'al-Ilāhīyāt', wa-dhakara fīhi thalāthat abwāb. al-Bāb al-awwal fī dhāt Allāh, al-thānī fī ṣifātih, al-thālith fī afʻālih ..."
On the end leaf: "Ṣifat al-dawāniq wa-al-ḥubūb" (On some ancient measures and their divisions and values).
Colophon: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām, wa-lil-Rasūl afḍal al-salām."
Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God on the completion, and the best peace be upon the Messenger."

record.title: 880-02 Tadhkirat ulī al-albāb wa-al-jāmiʻ lil-ʻajab al-ʻujāb : manuscript / Dāʼūd ibn ʻUmar al-Anṭākī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a. "... wa-sammaytuhu bi-Tadhkirat ulī al-albāb wa-al-jāmiʻ lil-ʻajab al-ʻujāb ..."
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Subḥānuka. Yā mubdiʻ mawādd al-kāʼināt bi-lā mithāl sabaq, wa-mukhtariʻ ṣuwar al-mawjūdāt fī akmal niẓām wa-nasaq, wa-munawwiʻ ajnās al-mizāj al-thānī natāʼij al-awāʼil, wa-muqssim furūʻahu al-mumayyazah ḥasba al-fawāʻil wa-al-qawābil, wa-muzayyin jawāhirahu bi-al-aʻrāḍ, wa-al-majmūʻ bi-al-khawāṣṣ, wa-mulhim istikhrājihā bi-al-tajārib wa-al-qiyās man ikhtarta min al-khawāṣṣ ..."
Secundo folio: al-ʻaql al-salīm wa-al-ṭabʻ al-qawīm.
13.5 x 19.5 cm; written surface: 16.5 x 25 cm; 29 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; cover embossed with central medallion.
In fair and small naskh script, in black ink on white paper, headings and markings in red; few notes on the margins; catchwords.
On the back of the front cover: "ʻAyshah min Dayr Abū Mishʻal. al-Shaykh Khiḍr. Imḥammad al-Barāhīm min Būrīn. al-Tujjār hum. Fī 27 al-Qaʻdah, sanat 1296 [12 November 1879]."
On folio 1a: Medicinal recipes.
On folio 2a: "... sammaytuhu bi-Tadhkirat ulī al-albāb wa-al-jāmiʻ lil-ʻajab al-ʻujab ..."

On folio 199b: A poem attributed to al-Imām ʻAlī on the benefits of "al-Zanjabīl" (Ginger): "Qaṣīdah min naẓm al-Imām ʻAlī, karrama Allāh wajhahu, fī manāfiʻ al-zanjabīl". It starts with: "Ayā ṭāliban lil-zanjabīli manāfiʻan // khuṣiṣta min al-Mawlá bi-kulli karāmatī. Fa-man yashtakī al-barda al-qadīma bi-ṣulbihi // wa-awjāʻihi fī kulli waqtin wa-sāʻatī. ʻAlayka bi-mithqālayni min baʻdi ṣaḥqihi // yuḍāfu ilayhi nāqiyan shahdu naḥlatī ..."
The poem attributed to Imām ʻAlī is followed (folios 199b-200a) by medicinal prescriptions of some materia medica, each one of which starts with word "Ṣifah" (Prescription).

al-Bāb al-rābiʻ (Chapter four) of the book, starts on folio 200b, as follows: "al-Bāb al-rābiʻ min abwāb al-Tadhkirah. Fī tafṣīl aḥwāl al-amrāḍ al-juzʼīyah wa-istiqṣāʼ asbābihā wa-ʻalāmātihā wa-ḍurūb muʻālajatihā al-khāṣṣah bi-hā ..."

al-Bāb al-rābiʻ "Chapter four" ends abruptly, with an incantation, as follows: "... asʼaluka bi-jamīʻ asmāʼika kullihā, bi-al-ʻArabīyah Yā Marrīkh, wa-bi-al-Fārisīyah Yā Mahrām, wa-bi-al-Rūmīyah Yā Rams, wa-bi-al-Yūnānīyah Yā Ārīs, wa-bi-al-Hindīyah Yā Anjār. Asʼaluka bi-ḥaqq ṣāḥib al-banīyah al-ʻulyā illā [idhā (?)] mā aḥbabta wa-aṭaʻta wa-qaḍayta ḥājatī wa-ajabta taḍarruʻī, fa-innī arghabu ilayka an tafʻala lī kadhā wa-kadhā bi-ḥaqq Rubyāyīl al-malak al-muwakkal bi-umūrika, wa-qurbānuhu namir aw sinnawr, yafʻalu bi-hi mā marra. Wa-ammā daʻwatuhu allatī taẓāfarat bi-hā al-akhbār, wa-tanāqalathā ahl hādhā al-shān fī al-aqṭār bi-al-inhirār fa-hiya makhṣūṣah bi-qamʻ al-aʻdāʼ wa-qatlihim tuʻmalu ʻalá mā dhukira min al-hayʼīyah wa-al-istiqbāl wa-al-bakhūr wa-takrār al-daʻwah, wa-hiya hādhihi: Yā nār al-ḥamīyah, wa-yā kāfī al-razīyah, wa-muzīl al-mulūk ʻan karāsīyihā, wa-muḍrim kalab al-ḥasāyif [?], wa-mudhill al-jabbārīn, wa-mubīḥ dimāʼ al-salāṭīn, wa-al-aṣl ..."

Colophon (folio 199a), at the end of "al-Bāb al-thālith" (Chapter three) whose materia medica contents are arranged alphabetically: "Wa-wāfaqa al-farāgh min itmām hādhihi al-nuskhah nahār al-Ithnayn, khāmis ʻashar Dhī al-Qaʻdah al-ḥarām, min shuhūr sanat thalāthah wa-miʼah wa-alf. Katabahā bi-yadihi li-nafsihi, al-rājī luṭf Allāh, ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Ghafūr al-Jawharī, ghafara Allāh [la-hu] wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon at the end of Chapter three: "This copy was completed on Monday, the fifteenth day of the sacred month of Dhī al-Qaʻdah, of the year 1103 [of the Hijrah = 29 July 1692]. Copied by the hand of ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Ghafūr al-Jawharī, for himself, he who aspires for the kindness of God, may God forgive [him], his parents and all Muslims. Amen. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Mawlid al-Muṣṭafá : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī baʻatha fīnā Rasūlahu al-Aʻẓam wa-Nabīyahu al-akmal al-afkham, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama wa-sharrafa wa-karrama wa-ʻaẓẓam. Ammā baʻd, fa-inna aṣdaq al-ḥadīth Kitāb Allāh, wa-khayr al-hudá hady Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Wa-qad qāla taʻālá fī Kitābihi al-mubīn, wa-huwa aṣdaq al-qāʼilīn: Laqad jāʼakum rasūlun min anfisikum, ʻazīzun ʻalayhi mā ʻanittum ..."
Secundo folio: ʻalayhim wa-ʻalá umamihim.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 9 x 16 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In paper wrapper.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; extensive commentaries on the margins and interlinear; catchwords.
On folio 1a: The copyist rewrote, in clear script, the lines at the end of the manuscript (16 in number) which were cramped together for lack of space.

Mawlid al-Muṣṭafá ends with: "... Thumma lammā balagha, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, ʻishrīn sanah, ʻāda ilá al-Shām fī tijārah, wa-maʻahu Abū Bakr, fa-saʼala Baḥīrā ʻanhu, fa-aqsama la-hu innahu nabī. Thumma lammā balagha al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, khamsan wa-ʻishrīn sanah, rajaʻa ilá al-Shām ayḍan fī tijārah li-Khadījah, wa-maʻahu ghulāmuhā Maysarah, ay ʻabduhā, fa-kāna yará malakayn yuẓillānuhu min al-shams, wa-raʼat dhālika Khadījah ayḍan lammā rajaʻu. Wa-baʻda rujūʻihi bi-naḥw thalāthat ashhur tazawwajahā, wa-ʻumruhā arbaʻūn sanah, bi-ʻarḍ minhā ʻalayhi, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhā. Thumma lammā balagha, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, arbaʻīn sanah arsalahu Allā̕h taʻālá raḥmatan lil-ʻālamīn, wa-rasūlan ilá kāffat al-khalq ajmaʻīn, ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam, wa-bāraka ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-tābiʻīhim, afḍala salām wa-afḍala barakah, ʻadada muʻlūmāt Allāh wa-ʻadada kalimātih, abada al-ābidīn wa-dahra al-dāhirīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."
Colophon: "Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih."
Translation of the colophon: "It was completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence."

record.title: 880-02 Kifāyat al-ṭālib al-rabbānī li-Risālat Ibn Abī Zayd al-Qayrawānī : manuscript / Abū al-Ḥasan ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Khalaf al-Manūfī al-Shādhilī al-Mālikī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: Incipit missing; text starts with: "... yaday kull amr minhum. Wa-thabata fī baʻḍihā ayḍan. Qāla Abū Muḥammad ʻAbd Allāh ibn Abī Zayd al-Qayrawānī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-arḍāh, ʻA: Wa-hiya riwāyatunā, wa-al-riwāyah al-ṣaḥīḥah ʻadam thubūtihā, wa-ʻalá thubūtihā suʼālān: Aḥaduhumā annahu ʻabd yuqāl [ʻabbara bi-qāla], wa-huwa fiʻl māḍin yuḥká bi-hi mā waqaʻa, wa-taʼlīf al-kitāb mustaqbal lam yaqaʻ, fa-al-munāsib an yuʻayyana fa-yaqūlu [yuʻabbara bi-yaqūlu]. Ujība bi-ajwibah, minahā: Innahu yastaʻmilu al-māḍī mawḍiʻ al-mustaqbal, tanzīlan la-hu manzilat al-wāqiʻ, li-annahu [lammā] wa-thiqa min nafsihi bi-ījād hādhā al-taʼlīf ṣāra ka-al-muḥaqqaq al-mawjūd, li-anna ghalabat al-ẓann ka-al-yaqīn fī mawāṭin min al-sharʻ ..."
Secundo folio: fī surratihi, wa-jaʻala anfahu bayna fakhidhayhi.
16 x 23 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 35 mostly numbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; with the phrases of Risālat Ibn Abī Zayd al-Qayrawānī in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ al-mubārak, fī thamāniyah wa-ʻashr yawman khalat min shahr Rajab, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 8 wa-tisʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, baʻda Hijratihi, ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn al-Sayyid Aḥmad al-Sharīf nasaban al-Mālikī madhhaban, ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy of this blessed book was completed on blessed Wednesday, 18 days having passed from the month of Rajab, of the year 1298 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may prayer and peace be upon Him, by the hand of the poor Muḥammad ibn al-Sayyid Aḥmad al-Sharīf nasaban al-Mālikī madhhaban, thoroughly and perfectly. Praise be to God in all circumstances."

record.title: 880-03 Tafsīr al-Jalālayn : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Maḥallī, Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Abī Bakr al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻAllāmah al-muḥaqqiq, Jalāl al-Dīn al-Maḥallī al-Shāfiʻi, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayhi: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Sūrat al-Kahf Makkīyah. Alā, Wa-iṣbir nafsaka. al-Āyah. Miʼat āyah wa-ʻashr āyāt, aw, khamsata ʻashara āyah. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-huwa al-waṣf bi-al-jamīl al-thābit lillāh ..."
Secundo folio: fīhi abadan, huwa al-Jannah.
17 x 24 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 14.5 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 30 unnumbered quires).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of the Qurʼān in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: The present manuscript ends abruptly with the part of the commentary on verse 51 of Sūrat Yāsīn (Qurʼān: 36:51), as follows: "... fa-lā yastaṭīʻūn tawṣiyatan, ay, yūṣū, wa-lā ilá ahlihim yarjiʻūn, min aswāqihim wa-ashghālihim, bal yamūtūna fīhā. Wa-nufikha fī al-ṣūr, huwa qarn al-nafkhah al-thāniyah lil-baʻth, wa-bayna al-nafkhatayn arbaʻūn sanah. Fa-idhā hum, ay, al-maqbūrūn, min al-ajdāth, al-qubūr, ilá Rabbihim ..."

record.title: 880-03 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Tafsīr al-Jalālayn. Al-Juzʼ al-thānī : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Ṣāwī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad Sayyid al-Mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-lammā intahá al-kalām ʻalá taklimat [takmilat] al-Jalāl al-Suyūṭī, fa-nashraʻu al-ān fī al-kalām ʻalá taʼlīf al-Jalāl al-Maḥallī, wa-awwaluhu min ibtidāʼ Sūrat al-Kahf. Wa-nasʼalu Allāh al-iʻānah ʻalá al-badʼ wa-al-khitām ..."
Secundo folio: manṣūb bi-fiʻl maḥdhūf [crossed over] muqaddar taqdīruhu jaʻalahu.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 11 x 17.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: In dark red leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion (in 59 numbered quires).
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-juzʼ al-mubārak, sittah wa-ʻishrūn yawman khalat min shahr Dhī al-Qaʻdah, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1274, arbaʻah wa-sabʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, min Hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf, wa-dhālika ʻalá yad kātibihi, al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-Dusūqī al-Zaghlūl ibn Ibrāhīm al-Zaghlūl al-Ṣafatī baladan wa-al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban wa-al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-lil-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-amwāt, innahu samīʻun, qarībun, mujīb al-daʻawāt, khuṣūṣan man raʼá khalalan wa-aṣlaḥah, wa-daʻā lī bi-al-maghfirah. Allāhumma ighfir lanā wa-irḥamnā bi-raḥmatik, yā arḥam al-rāḥimīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Yā qāriʼa al-khaṭṭi wa-al-ʻaynāni tanẓuruhu // lā tansa ṣāḥibahu billāh wa-udhkuruhu. wa-idʻū la-hu daʻwatan lillāh khāliṣatan // laʻallahā fī ṣurūf al-dahr tanfaʻuhu."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy of this blessed part was completed twenty-six days having passed from the month of Dhū al-Qaʻdah, of the year 1274 of the Hijrah of Him to whom belongs glory and honor [8 July 1858], by the hand of its copyist, the poor to God Almighty, al-Dusūqī al-Zaghlūl ibn Ibrāhīm al-Zaghlūl al-Ṣafatī baladan wa-al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban wa-al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan, may God forgive him, his parents, and Muslim men and women, the living among them and the dead, for He is the All Hearing One, the close at hand, and He who answers invocations, specially he who finds a fault and corrects it and invokes forgiveness on my behalf. O God! Forgive us and have mercy upon us, by Your compassion, O You who is the Most Merciful of all merciful. Amen. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and on his family and companions and grant them peace. O you who reads this script, looking at it by the eyes // Do not forget, by God, its writer, rather remember him. Offer on his behalf to God a pure invocation // that might benefit him in the adversities of time."

record.title: 880-03 Lawāqiḥ al-anwār fī ṭabaqāt al-akhyār. Al-Juzʼ 2 : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn Aḥmad al-Shaʻrānī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... ṣaḥiba aṣḥāb al-Shaykh Abī al-Ḥajjāj al-Uqṣurī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, ḥīna kāna bi-Qūṣ, wa-tajarrada wa-huwa fī bidāyatihi, thumma rajaʻ ilá al-thiyāb wa-al-muzāraʻāt wa-ghayrihā, thumma ṣaḥiba al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm ibn Miʻḍād al-Jaʻbarī al-madfūn bi-Bāb al-Naṣr min al-Qāhirah al-maḥrūsah, thumma aqāma bi-Akhmīm, wa-bi-hā māta ʻalá ḥālah sharīfah jalīlah laṭīfah, yataẓāharu bi-al-niʻam wa-al-ghiná ʻan al-nās, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu ..."
Secundo folio: yaqūlu anā ʻayn al-ḥaqq.
19.5 x 29.2 cm; written surface: 13 x 22.5 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings, keywords, and markings in red; few corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 167b: The author states: "... Wa-li-yakun dhālika ākhir al-ṭabaqāt, wa-qad aḥbabtu lī an ulḥiqahā bi-dhikr nubdhah min al-aṣḥāb al-ʻulamāʼ al-ʻāmilīn min ahl madhhabinā faqaṭ, tabarrukan bi-dhikrihim wa-nashr al-ʻabīr makanihim [wa-nashran li-ʻabīr maslakihim], raḍiya Allāh ʻanhum ajmaʻīn."

Colophon: No colophon; text ends abruptly, as follows: "... wa-dakhal ʻalayhi zāʼiran yawman, fa-wajadahu ʻuryānan, fa-qāl: Naḥnu idhā ghasalnā thiyābanā nakūnu kamā qāla al-Qāḍī Abū al-Ṭayyib al-Ṭabarī: Qawmun idhā ghasalū jamāla thiyābihim // lazimū al-buyūta ilá farāghi al-nāsi. Aw, kamā qāla ghayruhu: Qawmun idhā ghasalū al-thiyāba raʼaytahum // labisū al-buyūta wa-zarrarū al-abwābā. Wa-kāna al-Shaykh Abū al-Ḥasan al-Astarābādhī mujtahidan, fī al-ʻibādah ʻibratan, wa-kāna yaktubu ..."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Taṣrīf al-ʻIzzī : manuscript / Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar al-Taftāzānī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: Incipit missing; text starts with: "... wa-ilayhi al-zulfá, wa-Huwa ḥasbu man tawakkala ʻalayhi wa-kafá. Fa-hā anā fī al-maqṣūd bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Maʻbūd, fa-aqūlu: Lammā kāna min al-wājib ʻalá kull ṭālib li-shayʼ an yataṣawwara dhālika al-shayʼ li-yakūna ʻalá baṣīrah fī ṭalabih, wa-an yataṣawwara ghāyatahu li-annahu huwa al-sabab al-ḥāmil ʻalá al-shurūʻ fī al-ṭalab, badaʼa al-muṣannif bi-taʻrīf al-taṣrīf ʻalá wajh yataḍammanu fāʼidatahu ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-aṣl al-wāḥid hiya al-māddah.
15 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 14 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Taṣrīf al-ʻIzzī in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Tamma al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb."
Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning. The book was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King."

record.title: 880-02 Mujīb al-nidā ilá sharḥ Qaṭr al-nadá́ : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Aḥmad al-Fākihī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... al-taʼnīth qābilah la-hā, aw, dāllah ʻalayhā, fa-lā yujmaʻu hādhā al-jamʻ naḥwa rajul, wa-Zaynab, wa-Wāthiq, wa-Ṭalḥah, wa-Sībawayh, wa-Daqq Naḥruhu, wa-lā naḥwa ḥāʼiḍ, wa-sābiq, wa-ʻallāmah, wa-jarīḥ, wa-ṣabūr, wa-sakrān, wa-aḥmar. Fa-idhā tawaffarat hādhihi al-shurūṭ, fa-yurfaʻu ḥīnaʼidhin kull min al-ism wa-tilka al-ṣifat bi-al-wāw al-maḍmūm mā qablahā, wa-law taqdīran, niyābatan ʻan al-ḍammah, ka-jāʼa al-Zaydūn wa-al-ʻāqilūn ..."
Secundo folio: wa-naḥwa ism wa-bint li-anna al-ʻiwaḍ ghayr al-hāʼ.
17.5 x 26.5 cm; written surface: 12 x 20 cm; 33 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In clear medium naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Qaṭr al-nadá wa-ball al-ṣadá" in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 45b: An ownership statement, as follows: "Malaka hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah al-faqīr ilá raḥmat Allāh Muḥammad ibn al-marḥūm Sālim ibn al-Faqīh ʻAlī al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh lahum wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Author's colophon (folio 45b): "Wa-li-yakun hādhā akhir mā aradnā īrādahu ʻalá hādhihi 'al-Muqaddimah'. Wa-al-suʼl min faḍl man iṭṭalaʻa fīhi ʻalá khalal an yubādira ilá iṣlāḥihi in lam yakun al-jawāb fīhi ʻalá wajh ḥaasan, li-yakūna mimman yadfaʻu bi-allatī hiya aḥsan, lākin baʻda muṭālaʻatihi fī dhālika mā yataḥaqqaqu bi-hi al-khalal, wa-baʻda mushāwaratihi fī dhālik ahla fannihi, fa-inna wāḍiʻahu muʻtarif bi-qiṣar al-bāʻ wa-kuthr al-zalal, wa-lawlā ṭamaʻuhu fī an yakūna min al-thalāthah allatī idhā māt ibn Ādam inqaṭaʻa ʻamaluhu illā minhā, mā kashafa faḍāʼiḥahu wa-lā ʻaraḍa fiʻlahu li-taklīm al-alsinah al-jāriḥah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā li-hādhā, wa-mā kunā li-nahtadiya lawlā an hadānā Allāh."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Let this be the end of what we intended to introduce about this 'Introduction'. I request the favor of him who reads it to correct what needs to be corrected, if the answer is not right, that he may be counted with those who act according to what is better. But let that be after the necessary consultation, in order to authenticate the error, and after deliberation with those who are knowledgeable of the subject, since the author admits his limitation and his many mistakes. However, if it were not for his striving to achieve those three traits which last after a man dies, he would not have ventured to uncover his shortcomings, or, to expose what he did to the slander of wounding tongues. Praise be to God who guided us to this, for we would not have been guided if God did not guide us."

Copyist's colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ḥusn tawfīqih wa-ʻawnihi wa-barakatih, wa-luṭfihi wa-ḥusn tadbīrih, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-rājī raḥmat Rabbihi al-Ghanī al-Karīm, ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn ʻAbd al-Bāsiṭ ibn Aḥmad al-Salamūnī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-kull al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-kāna [al-farāgh] minhu yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, mustahall shahr Shaʻbān al-mukarram, sanat tisʻ wa-thamānīn wa-tisʻimiʼah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-raḍiya Allāh ʻan aṣḥāb Rasūl Allāh ajmaʻīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The blessed book was completed by the praise of Almighty God, His abundant benevolence, His help, His blessing, His kindness and Providence, by the hand of the poor and wretched servant, who aspires for the mercy of his Affluent and Generous Lord, ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn ʻAbd al-Bāsiṭ ibn Aḥmad al-Salamūnī, may God forgive him, his parents and all and entire Muslims. It was completed on blessed Thursday, the beginning of the noble month of Shaʻbān, of the year 989 [of the Hijrah = 10 September 1581]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, on his family and companions and grant them peace. May God be pleased with all the companions of the Messenger of God."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Alfīyat Ibn Mālik : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Ibn al-Nāẓim.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-tawfīq wa-al-iʻānah. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-fāḍil al-muḥaqqiq al-ṣadr al-kāmil Badr al-Dīn Abū [Abū] ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Mālik al-Ṭāʼī, raḥimahu Allāh: Ammā baʻd ḥamd Allāh subḥānuhu bi-mā la-hu min al-maḥāmid ʻalá mā asbagha min niʻamihi al-bawādī wa-al-ʻawāʼid, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, al-mursal raḥmatan lil-ʻālamīn wa-qudwatan lil-ʻāmilīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-ṭāhirīn, wa-al-salām ʻalá sāʼir ʻibād Allāh al-ṣāliḥīn, fa-innī dhākir fī hādhā al-kitāb urjūzat wālidī fī ʻilm al-naḥw al-musammāh bi-al-Khulāṣah, muraṣṣiʻuhā bi-sharḥ yaḥullu minhā al-mushkil wa-yaftaḥu min abwābihā kull mughlaq ..."
Secundo folio: an yakūna fiʻlan nāṣiban lil-mustathná.
18.5 x 27 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 19.5 cm; 29 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In medium naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of the "Alfīyah" in red; numerous commentaries and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: Miscellaneous quotations about Arabic grammar and a quotation "fāʼidah" from al-Jalāl al-Bulqīnī (Ibn al-Bulqīnī, ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻUmar, 1361 or 1362-1421), about a certain statement "wa-al-jibāb al-rafīʻ" used as a divorce oath in Egypt.
On folio 1a: A partially legible ownership statement: "Bi-taqdīr al-Malik [al-Wahhāb] qad insalaka fī silk [...] al-faqīr [... ... ...]."
Some leaves seem to be missing between folios 1 and 2.

Colophon: "ʻAllaqahu li-nafsihi, faqīr ʻafw Allāh, ʻAlī ibn ʻAlī al-Bahnasī baladan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-man daʻá la-humā bi-al-maghfirah wa-li-jamiʻ al-Muslimīn. Wa-waqaʻa al-farāgh minhu yawm al-Aḥad, khāmis shahr Rajab al-fard, sanat tisʻīn wa-thamānimiʼah, aḥsana Allāh ʻāqibatahā, bi-Muḥammad wa-ālihi. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tammat al-nuskhah wa-kamulat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied by the poor to the forgiveness of God, ʻAlī ibn ʻAlī al-Bahnasī baladan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, for himself, may God forgive him, his parents, and him who invokes God's forgiveness on behalf both of them and all Muslims. It was completed on Sunday, the fifth day of the unique month of Rajab, of the year 890 [of the Hijrah = 27 July 1485], may God end it favorably, by the intercession of Muḥammad and his family. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. The copy was concluded and completed by the praise of God and His help."

record.title: 880-03 al-Munṣif min al-kalām ʻalá Mughnī Ibn Hishām. Al-Juzʼ 1 : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Shumunnī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... wa-hiya al-mawt li-annahā muqaddarah, yuqālu muniya la-hu, ay, quddira la-hu, wa-al-dawlah fī al-ḥarb, an tudāwila iḥdá al-fiʼatayn ʻalá al-ukhrá, yuqālu kānat lanā ʻalayhim al-dawlah, wa-al-jamʻ al-duwal. Wa-al-dūlah bi-al-ḍamm fī al-māl, yuqālu ṣār al-fayʼ baynahum dūlatan yatadāwalūnahu, yakūnu marratan li-hādhā wa-marratan li-hādhā, wa-al-jamʻ dūlāt wa-duwal. Wa-qāla Abū ʻUbīd: al-Dūlah bi-al-ḍamm ism al-shayʼ alladhī yutadāwalu bi-ʻaynihi, wa-al-dawlah bi-al-fatḥ al-fiʻl. Wa-qāla baʻḍuhum: al-Dawlah wa-al-dūlah lughatān bi-maʻnan. Qāla Muḥammad ibn Sallām al-Jumaḥī: Saʼaltu Yūnus ʻan qawl Allāh taʻālá li-allā takūna dawlatun, fa-qāl: Qāla Abū ʻAmr ibn al-ʻAlāʼ: al-Dūlah bi-al-ḍamm fī al-māl, wa-al-dawlah bi-al-fatḥ fī al-ḥarb. Qāl: wa-qāla ʻĪsá ibn ʻUmar: Kiltāhumā takūnu fī al-ḥarb wa-al-māl. Qāla Yūnus: Ammā anā, fa-wa-Allāh, lā adrī mā baynahumā ..."
Secundo folio: wa-dhālika li-anna al-kalām innamā huwa fī al-lafẓ.
15 x 21 cm; written surface: 11 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.

Binding: In light brown leather with flap; cover and flap pasted over with marbled paper of colored flowers in green, orange, and brown; the cover seems to have belonged to another manuscript, as indicated on the front cover, as follows: "Juzʼ awwal min Ḥashiyah ʻalá Lāmīyat al-Ṭughrāʼī (Part one of a Gloss on the Lāmīyah of al-Ṭughrāʼī)", and the flyleaf: "Lāmīyat al-Ṭughrāʼī".
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrase of "al-Mughnī" preceded by the work "Qawluhu" (His saying) in red; marking in red; catchwords.

Part one ends as follows: "... Qawluhu: Anā [Anbaʼanā] Abū Saʻīd, ilá ākhirihi: Daḥā al-layl yadḥū aẓlama, wa-al-yarandaj bi-muthannāh taḥtīyah maftūḥah, fa-rāʼ maftūḥah, fa-nūn sākinah, fa-dāl muhmalah maftūḥah, fa-jīm: al-Jild al-aswad. Wa-fī al-sharḥ: Law juʻila hādhā al-bayt min qabīl al-tajrīd, naḥwa: Lahum Dār al-Khuld, la-amkan. Wa-ʻalayhi, fa-lā ziyādah wa-lā naqṣ."

Colophon: "Tamma al-Juzʼ al-awwal bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, fī al-yawm al-mubārak, sābiʻ ʻashar Shaʻbān al-mukarram, ʻāma ithnayn wa-thalāthīn wa-tisʻimiʼah, aḥsan Allāh ʻāqibatahā bi-Muḥammad wa-ālihi. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Yatlūhu fī al-juzw al-thānī: Ḥarf al-Qāf."

Translation of the colophon: "The First part is completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence, on the blessed day, the seventeenth of the honored month of Shaʻbān, of the year 932 [of the Hijrah = 8 June 1526], may God end it well, by the intercession of Muḥammad and His family. God suffices us, He is the best advocate. It will be followed in Part two by the letter Qāf."

record.title: 880-03 Faṣl maʻqūd fī maʻānī ʻawāmil al-iʻrāb : manuscript / Jirmānūs Farḥāt.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "A. [al-Alif]. Iʻlam inna al-Alif qismān: Layyinah wa-mutaḥarrikah, fa-al-layyinah tusammá alifan, wa-al-mutaḥarrikah tusammá hamzatan. Qāla baʻḍuhum: al-Alif idhā taḥarrakat ṣārat hamzatan, wa-al-Hamzah idhā sukkinat wa-muddat ṣārat Alifan. Fa-al-layyinah hiya allatī lā yubtadaʼu bi-hā li-annahā lā taqbalu al-ḥarakah aṣlan, wa-tusammá al-ḥarf al-hāwī, wa-lahā maʻānī taʼtī ʻinda ākhir al-faṣl, wa-ammā al-hamzah fa-hiya taqbalu al-ḥarakah, wa-hiya nawʻān ..."
Secundo folio: wa-saʼala, wa-qaraʼa, wa-ilá, wa-mā ashbaha dhālik.
17 x 17.5 cm; written surface: 6.5 x 14 cm; 16 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark brown leather on spine and corners.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; few corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the flyleaf: "Sharḥ al-ʻawāmil [ʻawāmil] al-iʻrāb."
At the head of folio 1b: "Hādhā faṣl fī maʻqūd maʻānī ʻawāmil al-iʻrāb."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with: "... wa-ḥurūf al-nidāʼ takhtaṣṣu bi-al-ism al-mufrad, illā yā, fa-innahā tadkhulu al-jumlah al-ismīyah, naḥwa: Yā laʻnata Allāh ʻalayhi, wa-al-jumlah al-fiʻlīyah, naḥwa: Alā yā isqiyānī, wa-Alā yā usjudū, wa-tadkhulu al-ḥarf ayḍan, naḥwa: Yā layta qawmī yaʻlamūn, wa-Yā rubba muʼminin hunāka laqītuhu; fa-Yā fī hādhihi al-mawāḍiʻ kullihā immā lil-tanbīh, wa-immā annahā dākhilah ʻalá munādá muqaddar ..."

record.title: 880-01 Sharḥ al-ʻAwāmil al-miʼah : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi [nastaʻīn]. al-Ḥamdu Allāh, li-Man wajaba ʻalaynā thanāʼuhu, wa-li-Man lā yat wal [lā yazūlu] min ṣabb al-niʻam ʻalaynā ghināʼuhu, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Muḥammad Sayyid al-Anām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-kirām. Wa-baʻd, fa-innī lammā raʼayutu al-ṭālib ibn [al-ṭālibīn] yaṭlūbu [yaṭlubūna] sharḥan lil-ʻAwāmil lil-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qāhir li-ḥall iʻrābihā, aradtu [an] ubayyin [iʻrābahā] baʻd qāḍī [bi-qadr ṭāqatī], wa-lam azid ʻalá iʻrābihā kalāman illā mā kāna bi-al-ziyādah ḥarīyan, bi-wisʻah [tawsiʻatan] lil-mubtadiʼīn wa-sabīlan [wa-tashīlan (?)] lil-ṭālibīn, wa-arjū minhum al-thanāʼ al-jamīl fī al-ḥāl, wa-min Allāh al-thawāb al-jazīl fī al-māl, wa-mā tawaffuqī illā billāh, wa-ʻalayhi tawakkaltu, wa-ilayhi unīb ..."
Secundo folio: fāʻil raḍiya, wa-al-fiʻl maʻa fāʻilih jumlah ismīyah.
10.5 x 14.5 cm; written surface: 7 x 9.5 cm; 11 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather.
The manuscript is copied in several hands, in naskh and naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon; text ends abruptly with: "... wa-al-thālith an yaʻmal muʻarraf [muʻarrafan] bi-lām al-taʻrīf, wa-hādhā aḍʻaf min al-awwalayn, li-kawnihi maʻrifatan fī al-ṣūrah wa-al-maʻná, wa-li-dhālika lā yaʻmalu illā fī al-ḍarūrah. Wa-al-muḍāf, wa-huwa kull ism uḍīfa ilá ism ākhar, ay, al-wāw ʻāṭifah, al-muḍāf marfūʻ bi-annahu ʻaṭf ʻalá jumlah sābiqah bi-ṭarīq al-badal, aw, marfūʻ bi-annahu khabar mubtadaʼ maḥdhūf ay, wa-al-sādis al-muḍāf, wa-al-mubtadaʼ maʻa khabarihi jumlah ismīyah maʻṭūfah ʻalá jumlah mutaqaddimah, wa-al-wāw ibtidāʼīyah. Huwa, ḍamīr marfūʻ munfaṣil marfūʻ maḥallan bi-annahu ibtidāʼ kull ..."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Mashāhid : manuscript / Ismāʻīl ibn Sawdakīn al-Nūrī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a and the colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá mā jāʼa bi-hi min kunūz al-maʻārif al-Ilāhīyah, wa-fataḥa wa-manna bi-hi min al-ādāb al-Rabbānīyah, wa-manaḥa wa-asmaʻa ahl al-fahm bi-mannihi alsinat al-ḥaqāʼiq fa-anṣaḥa, wa-sharaḥa ṣudūrahum bi-mā amlāhu ʻalá lisān tarjumān al-asmāʼ al-Ilāhīyah lammā tarjama ʻanhā wa-sharaḥa, ḥattá bāna li-dhawī al-ʻirfān bi-nūr al-bayān sabīl al-maʻārif wa-ittaḍaḥ ..."
Secundo folio: tawajjuhan makhṣūṣan li-taqyīd.
14 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 16.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather; dark red leather on spine; gold medallion on cover.

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Kitāb al-Mashāhid" preceded with the word "Qawluhu" (His saying) in red; headings in red; few corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ al-Asrār. al-Matn lil-Shaykh al-Akbar, al-Sharḥ li-Ibn Suwaydikīn, wa-huwa ibnuhu [?]. Wa-hādhā Kitāb Sharḥ al-Mashāhid li-Ibn Suwaydikīn, raḥimahu Allāh wa-amaddanā bi-madadihimā. Āmīn."

On folio 24b: An undated "Ijāzah" (a certificate of authorization), given by an unnamed Shaykh to his student, al-Shaykh Maḥmūd ibn Ibrāhīm al-Ghazzī (could not be identified), authorizing him to transmit the books which were authorized and transmitted to the Shaykh by his own teachers, in the following subjects: al-Tafsīr, al-Ḥadīth, al-Ālāt, and al-Taṣawwuf (Science of commenting on the Qurʼan, the Hadith, Sciences of the Arabic language, and Sufism).

Colophon: "Wa-al-Ḥamdu lillāh ḥaqqa ḥamdih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Tamma Kitāb Sharḥ al-Mashāhid bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi. Ghafara Allāh li-qārīhi wa-jabara kātibahu, wa-ghafara la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God, fully and thoroughly. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and grant Him abundant peace. The Book of al-Mashāhid was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. May God forgive its reader, gratify its copyist, and forgive him and his parents. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Shāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥusaynī Nuqrahkār.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim Jamāl al-Dīn Abū ʻAmr ʻUthmān ibn Abī Bakr al-Mālikī, athābahu Allāh taʻālá al-Jannah: al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khātim al-nabīyīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-qad saʼalanī man lā yasaʻunī muḍāyaqatuhu, wa-lā tuwāfiqunī mukhālafatuhu an ulḥiqa bi-muqaddimatī fī al-iʻrāb muqaddimah fī al-taṣrīf ʻalá naḥwihā, wa-muqaddimah fī al-khaṭṭ, fa-ajabtuhu, sāʼilan mutaḍarriʻan an yanfaʻa bi-himā kamā nafaʻa bi-ukhtihimā, wa-Allāh al-muwaffiq ..."
Secundo folio: awwalan taṣrīfahu thumma dhakara mawḍūʻahu.
17 x 22 cm; written surface: 7 x 16.5 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 5 unnumbered quires).
In fair and small naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; many commentaries on the margin; markings in red; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. The text ends abruptly with: "... wa-illā la-kānat al-kalimah al-muʻrabah ʻalá ḥarfayn faqaṭ, ay, thalāthat uṣūl, lā akthara min dhālik, iḥtirāz ʻan an yakūna baʻdahā arbaʻat aḥruf uṣūl. Fa-in kathurat ziyādatuhā maʻa hādhihi al-sharāʼiṭ, fīmā ʻurifa bi-al-ishtiqāq, naḥwa aḥmar, fa-yuḥmalu mā lam yuʻraf ishtiqāquhu ʻalayhi; fa-afkal, wa-huwa al-raʻdah, afʻal, limā dhakarnā al-ān, wa-al-mukhālif, al-qāʼil bi-annahu faʻlal, mukhṭiʼ, wa-iṣṭabl ka-qarṭaʻb, fa-ḥukima bi-aṣālat al-hamzah, li-annahu mā thabata ziyādat al-hamzah fī mithl ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Ṭbb al-Nabawī : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Dhahabī.
record.note: Title from colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aʻṭá kulla nafsin khalaqahā, wa-ahdāhā, wa-alhamahā fujūrahā wa-taqwāhā, wa-ʻallamahā manāfiʻahā wa-maḍārrahā, wa-ibtalāhā wa-ʻāfāhā, wa-amātahā wa-aḥyāhā. Wa-ashhadu anna Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh ..."
Secundo folio: al-qurbāt baʻda imtithāl al-awāmir wa-ijtināb al-manhīyāt.
13 x 17.3 cm; written surface: 8 x 14.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; folios 1-11 and 111-116 are written in a different hand; catchwords.
A slip is attached to the spine with a letter addressed to two brothers, Asʻad and Saʻīd Chalabī.
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr ilayhi taʻālá, Maḥmūd najl al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Salām Abī Ghazālah, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhumā. Āmīn. Sanat 1274 [lil-Hijrah = 1857/1858]."
Colophon: "Tamma al-Ṭibb al-Nabawī lil-Dhahabī, ʻalá yad mālikihi al-faqīr Maḥmūd ibn ʻAbd al-Salām Abī Ghazālah, ʻufiya ʻanhumā bi-mannihi. Fī sanat 1274."

Translation of the colophon: "The book of 'al-Ṭibb al-Nabawī' of al-Dhahabī was completed by the hand of its owner, the poor Maḥmūd ibn ʻAbd al-Salām Abī Ghazālah, may both of them be forgiven by His grace. In the year 1274 [of the Hijrah = 1857/1858]."

record.title: 880-02 Fatḥ al-Bāqī bi-sharḥ Alfīyat al-ʻIrāqī : manuscript / Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit missing. Text starts with: "... al-ʻilm bi-al-tasāhul fī al-taṣḥīḥ, wa-li-hādhā qāla Ibn al-Ṣalāḥ: Mā infarada, ay, al-Ḥākim, bi-hi, ay, bi-taṣḥīḥihi, lā bi-tajrīḥihi faqṭ, wa-lā mā shārakahu ghayruhu fī taṣḥīḥihi, fa-dhāka in lam yakun ṣaḥīḥan fa-huwa ḥasan, mā lam yuradda, bi-tashdīd al-dāl, bi-ẓuhūr ʻillah tūjibu ḍaʻfahu, fa-Ibn al-Ṣalāḥ jaʻala mā infarada al-Ḥākim bi-taṣḥīḥihi wa-lam yakun la-hu mardūd ..."
Secundo folio: lil-taqlīl bināʼan ʻalá al-aṣaḥḥ.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 16.5 cm; 22-27 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion.
In good naskh script, in black ink on white paper; phrases of the Alfīyah of al-ʻIrāqī in red; text within double red frame; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
Author's colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-raḥimahu: Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taʼlīfihi ʻāshir shahr Rajab, sanat [sitt] wa-tisʻīn wa-thamānimiʼah, 896."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author, may God forgive him and have mercy upon him, said: It was completed on the tenth of the month of Rajab, of the year 896 [of the Hijrah = 28 May 1491]."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak, thāmin shahr Shawwāl al-ḥarām [crossed over], min shuhūr sanat khamsah wa-ʻishrūn [wa-ʻishrīn] wa-miʼah baʻda al-alf, 1125, min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-azká al-salām. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This noble copy was completed on blessed Saturday, the eighth of the sacred [crossed over] month of Shawwāl, of the year 1125 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [28 October 1713], may the best prayer and most perfect peace be upon Him. There is no power nor might except in God, the Most High, the All Mighty. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, on his family and companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Manāqib al-Shāfiʻī : manuscript / Fakhr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn ʻUmar al-Rāzī.
record.note: Title of Manāqib al-Shāfiʻī from reference sources.
Title of Nathr al-laʼālī from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Manāqib al-Shāfiʻī. The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... aḥabbu ilayya wa-ilá kull Muslim min an yuḥshara fī Allāh taḥta rāyat Qaṭarī ibn al-Fujāʼah al-Māzinī al-Khārijī. Wa-kāna al-Rashīd muttakiʼan [muttakiʼan], fa-istawá jālisan wa-qāl: Ṣadaqta wa-bararta la-an takūna taḥta rāyatī [rāyati] rajulin min ahl bayt Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, khayrun min an takūna taḥta rāyat Khārijī ṭaghá wa-baghá, lākinnā [lākin], mā ḥujjatuka ʻalá anna Qurayshan kullahum aʼimmah wa-anta minhum ..."
Secundo folio of Manāqib al-Shāfiʻī: bi-al-ʻArabīyah, qāla al-Shāfiʻī.

Incipit of Nathr al-laʼālī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Hādhā kitāb nathr min kalām Amīr al-Muʼminīn wa-Imām al-muttaqīn, ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib, karrama Allāh wajhahu, ʻalá tartīb ḥurūf al-hijāʼ. Ḥarf al-Alif. Aymān al-marʼ tuʻrafu bi-īmānih. Akhūka man wāsāka fī al-shiddah. Iẓhār al-ghiná min al-shukr. Ādāb al-marʼ khayrun min dhahabih ..."
Secundo folio of Nathr al-laʼālī: al-ʻaysh fī al-amn. Rutbat al-ʻilm.
Manāqib al-Shāfiʻī: 16 x 21 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15.5 cm; 19 lines per page. Nathr al-laʼālī: Written sufrace: 10.5 x 16 cm; 17-20 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; brown leather on spine and flap.
In fair naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink on white paper; many corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the margin fo folio 111b: A collation statement: "Balaghat al-muqābalah baʻda al-kitābah."

On folio 115a: Two ownership statements, and a "Was here meme", as follows: 1. "Ṣāḥibuhu wa-mālikuhu ʻAbd ibn Ḥusayn ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Faqī ʻAbd al-Raḥmān." 2. "Ṣāḥibuhu wa-mālikuhu Munllā Muḥammad ibn Ḥusayn Āghā ibn Ṭalī Āghā." 3. "Katabahu ʻAbd Allāh fī qaryat Arbīl. Gharībun. Gharībun. Gharībun. Fa-sayakfīkahum Allāh."
On folio 115b: Three statements in Ottoman Turkish, dated: Thursday, 1170 Rajab (March 1757); Friday 1178 Rajab (December 1764), and Tuesday afternoon, 1179 Dhī al-Qaʻdah (April 1766).
On folio 115b: A medicinal recipe.

Colophon of Manāqib al-Shāfiʻī: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb, ʻalá yad aḍʻaf al-ʻibād, Aḥmad al-faqīr in [ibn] Jaʻfar al-faqīr ibn Muṣṭafá al-faqīr, al-muntasib bih Jānī Zādah, ghafara Allāh lahum wa-li-jamīʻ al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, wa-al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-amwāt, wa-al-ḥamdu Allāh [lillāh] Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Fī tārīkh sanat thalāth wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼah wa-al-alf, fī shahr Shaʻbān al-Muʻaẓẓam."

Translation of the colophon of Manāqib al-Shāfiʻī: "The book was completed by the help of God, the Abundant Giving King, in the hand of the weakest of the servants, the poor Aḥmad son of the poor Jaʻfar son of the poor Muṣṭafá, known as Jānī Zadah, may God forgive them and all believers, men and women, and Muslim men and women, the living among them and the dead. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. In the glorious month of Shaʻbān of the year 1123 [of the Hijrah = September/October 1711]."
Colophon of Nathr al-laʼālī: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb wa-tawfīqih wa-ḥusn hidāyatih, fī sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-arbaʻ wa-ʻishrūn [wa-ʻishrīn] min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah."

Translation of the colophon of Nathr al-laʼālī: "The book was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King, His benevolence and His perfect guidance, in the year 1124 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [1712/1713]."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Mukhtaṣar Sharḥ Talkhīṣ al-Miftāḥ : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Yaḥyá ḥafīd al-Saʻd al-Taftāzānī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... min al-takallum fī al-ḥāl dūna al-istiqbāl, fa-yajibu an yakūna mā ḍaraba ṣādiq al-inkār bi-al-ḍarūr[ah] al-ḍarb fī aḥad al-azminah minhu al-thalāth, ay, al-ḥāl. Wa-kadhā mā yuqālu inna al-akhbār al-ījābīyah al-istiqbālīyah kullahā kādhibah li-intifāʼihā fī al-ḥāl. Wa-wajh al-dafʻ annahu bi-qaṣd muṭābaqat al-nisbah al-istiqbālīyah, wa-lā yakhfá annahu lā dafʻ li-mujarrad al-taqyīd bi-aḥad al-azminah al-thalāthah ..."
Secundo folio: huwa al-ikhbār ʻan kawn al-mashhūd bi-hi.
14.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; black cloth on spine (in 6 unnumbered quires).

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Sharḥ Talkhīṣ Miftāḥ al-ʻulūm" preceded by the word "Qawluhu" (His saying) in red; some corrections on the margins and interlinear; catchwords.

Author's colophon: "Hādhā ākhir ma qaṣadnā īrādahu min al-fawāʼid al-laṭīfah wa-al-farāʼid al-sharīfah allatī akhadhtu baʻḍahā min mashāhīr al-aʼimmah al-aʻlām wa-mutaʼkhkhirī al-aʼimmah al-kirām, aʻlá Allāh darajatahum fī al-jinān, ilá Yawm al-Qiyāmah, wa-istakhrajtu kathīran minhā bi-qarīḥatī al-qarīḥah wa-fikratī al-jarīḥah, ʻalá Sharḥ al-Talkhīṣ, al-musammá bi-al-Mukhtaṣar, fī fann al-maʻānī wa-al-bayān, al-mansūb ilá jaddī, lā zāla ka-ismihi saʻdan fī al-Jinān. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Nabīyihi al-mukarram Muḥammad, wa-ālihi, wa-ṣaḥbihi, wa-wārithīhim kullihim, wa-ḥizbihi. Wa-Allāh ʻawnī kull waqt wa-zaman, fī al-yusr wa-al-ʻusr wa-ilmām al-fitan. Wa-Allāh taʻālá aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran kathīran."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what we intended to introduce, of the elegant benefits and of the precious gems, some of which I selected from the works of the former renowned and authoritative masters, and the latter noble teachers, may God elevate their status in the Gardens of Bliss, until Judgement Day. I extracted, by my ulcered intellect and my wounded thought, many of these [glosses] on "Sharḥ al-Talkhīṣ", titled "al-Mukhtaṣar", on the art of rhetoric and eloquence, authored by my grandfather, who is still, like his name, blissfully living, in the Gardens of Bliss. May God pray on His Noble Prophet Muḥammad, his family, his companions and all their heirs, and his party. God is my support in all times and circumstances, in affluence, in hardship, and during the accumulation of trials. God Almighty is more knowledgeable of what is correct, to Him is the reference and returning. There is no power nor might except in God, the All Mighty and the All Powerful. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them abundantly abundant peace."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Maqāṣid : manuscript / Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar al-Taftāzānī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... khilāfan lil-Karrāmīyah. Wa-ammā ittiṣāfuhu bi-al-sulūb wa-bi-al-iḍāfāt al-ḥāṣilah baʻdamā lam yakun, ka-kawnihi ghayr rāziq li-Zayd al-mayyit wārithan li-ʻAmr al-mawlūd wa-bi-al-ṣifāt al-ḥissīyah al-mutaghayyirah wa-al-taʻlīqāt, ka-kawnihi ʻāliman bi-hādhā al-ḥādith wa-qādiran ʻalayhi, fa-jāʼiz, wa-kadhā bi-al-aḥwāl al-mutaḥaqqiqah, baʻdamā lam yakun, ka-al-ʻālamīyāt al-mutajaddidah bi-tajaddud al-maʻlūmāt ʻinda Abī al-Ḥasan al-Baṣrī, ʻalá mā sa-yajīʼu taḥqīq dhālik. Wa-bihādhā yandafiʻu mā dhakarahu al-Imām al-Rāzī ..."
Secundo folio: wa-lā nizāʻa fī anna ittiṣāf al-wājib.
13.5 x 17.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 14 cm; 23 lines per page.

Binding: In dark red leather with flap; the quires are wrapped in a printed sheet in Ottoman Turkish, with an empossed seal and a stamp of some department of taxation, with the amount of taxes required from a person named ʻAlī Tawfīq ibn Aḥmad al-Munajjid.

In small naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "al-Maqāṣid" preceded by the word "Qawluhu" (His saying) in red or gold; headings in bold script; many commentaries on the margins; many commentaries on the margins; text within double gold frame; catchwords.
At the head of folio 1a: "Sharḥ Maqāṣid. Nuqṣān."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: " ... wa-yaddaʻūn annahu thabat bi-al-tawātur naṣṣ kull min al-sābiqīn ʻalá man baʻdah. Wa-yarwūn ʻan al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayh, annahu qāla lil-Ḥusayn, raḍiya Allāh ʻanh: Ibnī hādhā imām ibn imām akhū imām abū aʼimmah tisʻah, tāsiʻuhum qāʼimuhum. Wa-yatamassakūna tāratan bi-annahu yajibu fī imāmihim al-ʻiṣmah wa-al-afḍalīyah, wa-lā yūjad fīman siwāhum. Wa-al-ʻāqil yataʻajjabu min hādhihi al-riwāyāt al-mutawātirāt allatī lā athara lahā fī al-qurūn li-mā marra aṣlan, fa-hum wa-lā dūnahu ʻan ghayrihi ..."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Īsāghūjī : manuscript / Ḥusām al-Dīn al-Ḥasan al-Kātī.
record.note: 1. Title of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī of al-Kātī from reference sources.
2. Title of al-Muṭṭalaʻ (Sharḥ Īsaghūjī) of al-Anṣārī from incipit.
3. Title of al-Fawāʼid al-Fanārīyah of al-Fanārī from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī of al-Kātī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-wājib wujūduhu, al-mumtaniʻ naẓīruhu, al-mumkin siwāhu wa-ghayruhu, al-ṣādir bi-ikhtiyārihi sharrahu wa-khayrahu, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Muḥammad alladhī intashara bi-hi nahyuhu wa-amruhu. Ammā baʻd, fa-inna kitāb al-Shaykh al-Imām, qudwat al-ḥukamāʼ Athīr [al-Dīn] al-Abharī, ṭayyaba Allāh tharāh wa-jaʻala al-Jannah mathwāh, al-mashhūr bi-Īsāghūjī, lammā kāna ʻalá al-ikhwān mutaʻassiran, wa-ʻalá baʻḍihim mutayassiran, aradtu an aktuba bi-iltimāsihim awrāqan tuzīlu taʻassur [taʻassurahu] wa-tuʻimma tayassurahu. Wa-Allāh khayr al-muyassirīn wa-al-muwaffiqīn ..."
Secundo folio of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī of al-Kātī: al-ʻulūm minhā Īsāghūjī.

2. Incipit of al-Muṭṭalaʻ (Sharḥ Īsāghūjī) of al-Anṣārī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī manaḥa aḥibbatahu bi-al-luṭf wa-al-tawfīq, wa-sabar bi-him sabīl al-taṣawwur wa-al-taṣdīq. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ashraf khalqihi Muḥammad al-hādī ilá sawāʼ al-ṭarīq, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-ḥāʼizīn lil-ṣidq wa-al-taḥqīq. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā sharḥ li-kitāb al-ʻAllāmah Athīr al-Dīn al-Abharī, raḥimahu Allāh, al-musammá bi-Īsāghūjī fī ʻilm al-manṭiq, yaḥullu alfāẓah, wa-yuyassiru murādah, wa-yaftaḥu mughlaqah, wa-yuqayyidu muṭlaqah, ʻalá wajh laṭīf wa-manhaj munīf. Wa-sammaytuhu "al-Muṭṭalaʻ". Wa-Allāh asʼalu an yanfaʻa bi-hi, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl ..."
Secundo folio of al-Muṭṭalaʻ (Sharḥ Īsāghūjī) of al-Anṣārī: bi-ḥamd Allāh, rawāhu Abū Dāwūd.

3. Incipit of al-Fawāʼid al-Fanārīyah of al-Fanārī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ḥamdan laka Allāhumma ʻalá mā lakhkhaṣta lī min munaḥ ʻawārif al-afāḍil, wa-khallaṣtanī min miḥan ʻawārif al-faḍāʼil, wa-ṣalāt [al-ṣalāh] wa-al-salām ʻalá ʻāmmat man manaḥahum ūlá al-fawāḍil, lāsīyamā ʻalá Muḥammad al-manʻūt bi-aʻlá al-shamāʼil, wa-al-mabʻūth min akram al-qabāʼil, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-muhtadīn bi-awḍaḥ al-dalāʼil ..."
Secundo folio of al-Fawāʼid al-Fanārīyah of al-Fanārī: jihat waḥdah an yaʻrifahā.
13.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 6 x 12.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap.

The three manuscript are written in the same hand, in fair naskh script, in black ink, on thin blueish paper; some headings and markings in red; many commentaries on the margins of the first manuscript; very few notes on the margins of the second and third manuscripts; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ Īsāghūjī li-Ḥusām Kātī. Sharḥ Īsāghūjī li-Shaykh al-Islām. Sharḥ Īsāghūjī lil-Fanar [lil-Fanārī]."
Text folios 1b-89a; folios 90-92 are blank.

1. Colophon of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī of al-Kātī: "Wa-li-yakun hādhā ākhir mā katabnā min al-awrāq li-īḍāḥ mā fī kitāb Īsāghūjī. Wa-Allāh al-muwaffiq. Fī 2 Rajab, min shuhūr sanat 1268, ʻalá yad Hāshim al-ʻUmarī. ʻAlá yad al-faqīr Hāshim al-ʻUmarī."

Translation of the colophon of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī of al-Kātī: "This will be the end of the leaves that we wrote for the elucidation of the book of Īsāghūjī (Isagoge). God is the provider of success. On 2 Rajab, year 1268 [of the Hijrah = 22 April 1852], by the hand of Hāshim al-ʻUmarī. By the hand of the poor Hāshim al-ʻUmarī."

2. Colophon of al-Muṭṭalaʻ (Sharḥ Īsāghūjī) of al-Anṣārī: "Tamma hādhā al-kitāb, bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb, ʻalá yad al-faqīr Muḥammad Hāshim al-ʻUmarī, fī 22 Shaʻbān, sanat 1268."

Translation of the colophon of al-Muṭṭalaʻ (Sharḥ Īsāghūjī) of al-Anṣārī: "This book was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King, by the hand of the poor Muḥammad Hāshim al-ʻUmarī, on 22 Shaʻbān, year 1268 [of the Hijrah = 11 June 1852]."

3. Colophon of al-Fawāʼid al-Fanārīyah of al-Fanārī: No colophon. Text end abruptly with: "... kadhā ajābū. Wa-huwa, ay, al-qiyās, qismān, li-annahu immā iqtirānī, in lam yakun ʻayn al-natījah, aw, naqīḍahā, madhkūran fīhi bi-al-qawl ṣūratan, ka-qawlinā: Kull jism muʼallaf, wa-kull muʼallaf muḥdath, fa-kull jism muḥdath, wa-huwa laysa madhkūran fī al-qiyās bi-al-fiʻl, lā nafsuhu, wa-lā naqīḍuhu, bal ..."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá al-Fawāʼid al-Ḍiyāʼīyah : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Ghafūr al-Lārī.
record.note: 1. Title of Ḥashiyah ʻalá "al-Fawāʼid al-Ḍiyāʼīyah" from reference sources.
2. Title of Sharḥ al-Kāfiyah of al-Dawlatābādī from reference sources.
3. Title of ʻAwn al-Wāfiyah fī sharḥ kitāb al-Kāfiyah from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá al-Fawāʼid al-Ḍiyāʼīyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamd maṣdar al-maʻlūm, wa-al-lām lil-jins, aw, al-istighrāq, ay, kull ḥamd, min al-adhal [al-azal] ilá al-abad, min ayy ḥāmid kān, wa-yuḥtamal an yakūna maṣdar al-majhūl, aw, al-qadr al-mushtarak bayna al-maṣdarayn, fa-inna maqām ḥamdihi, subḥānuhu, yulāʼimuhu al-istīʻāb, kamā yulāʼimuhu al-istighrāq, wa-yuḥtamalu an yakūna al-ḥāṣil bi-maʻná sipās va sitāyish ..."
Secundo folio of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá al-Fawāʼid al-Ḍiyāʼīyah: jaʻl an yadulla bi-maʻná al-dāllah.

2. Incipit of Sharḥ al-Kāfiyah of al-Dawlatābādī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn <tammat>. Qawluhu: al-Kalimah lafẓ wuḍiʻa li-maʻná mufrad, wa-fīhi ʻasharat ashkāl. al-Awwal anna al-alif wa-al-lām fīhā lā yajūzu an yakūna lil-jins wa-lā lil-ʻahd. Ammā al-awwal, fa-li-annahu law kāna lil-jins lazima ijtimāʻ al-naqīḍayn, wa-banānuhu [wa-bayānuhu] anna al-jins yadullu ʻalá kathrīn [kathīrayn] mukhtalifiayn bi-al-ḥālayn, wa-al-tāʼ ʻalá al-waḥdah, fa-bayyana an al-kathrah wa-al-waḥdah al-taḍādd ..."
Secundo folio of Sharḥ al-Kāfiyah of al-Dawlatābādī: bi-kalimah li-anna al-ʻArab lam yaḍaʻhā [taḍaʻhā].

3. Incipit of ʻAwn al-Wāfiyah fī sharḥ kitāb al-Kāfiyah: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi [nastaʻīn]. al-Ḥamdu Allāh [lillāh] alladhī sharaḥ ṣudūranā li-kashf al-maʻānī wa-al-bayān, wa-ṣarafa qulūbanā naḥwa badāʼiʻ al-ʻulūm wa-al-bayān. Rafaʻa bi-ḍaḍlā [bi-faḍlihi] li-arbāb al-ʻilm marātib al-kamāl, wa-naṣaba bi-luṭfihi li-aṣḥāb al-faḍl manāṣib al-ijlāl. Fa-naḥmaduhu ʻalá mā awlānā min al-fiʻl al-ʻaqīl, wa-nashkuruhu ʻalá mā aʻṭānā min al-faḍl al-jazīl ... Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-mudhnib ... Kamāl ibn ʻAlī ibn Isḥāq ... Innī kuntu sharaḥtu abyāt al-Wāfiyah ... thumma raʼaytu ... an ashraḥahā thāniyan sharḥan wāfiyan ... wa-sammaytuhu bi-Risālat ʻAwn al-Wāfiyah fī sharḥ kitāb al-Kāfiyah ..."
Secundo folio of ʻAwn al-Wāfiyah fī sharḥ kitāb al-Kāfiyah: li-annahu ḥamāhu ilá ḥifẓ.
12.5 x 20 cm; written surface: 7 x 13.5 cm; 19-21 lines per page.
Binding: In dark green buckram with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap.

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Fawāʼid al-Ḍiyāʼīyah in the first manuscript preceded by the work "Qawluhu" (his Saying) in red; the text of some of its pages within red frame; very few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

1. Colophon of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá al-Fawāʼid al-Ḍiyāʼīyah: "Tammat al-Ḥāshiyah al-mansūbah li-ʻAbd al-Ghafūr bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min taswīd hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah waqt al-ẓuhr, yawm al-Jumʻah, min shahr Rajab, min sanah balaghat tisʻan wa-sittīn wa-alf."

Translation of the colophon of Ḥashiyah ʻalá al-Fawāʼid al-Ḍiyāʼīyah: "The gloss attributed to ʻAbd al-Ghafūr was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King. To Him is the reference and returning. The drafting of this noble copy was completed at noontime, on Friday, in the month of Rajab, of the year 1069 [of the Hijrah = 28 March 1659]."

2. Colophon of Sharḥ al-Kāfiyah of al-Dawlatābādī: "Tamma al-Risālah al-mansūbah li-Mawlānā Shihāb al-Dīn, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayhi, wa-ʻalá akhawāt [ikhwān] al-dīn, bi-ḥurmat man yashfaʻu Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-kamula."

Translation of the colophon of Sharḥ al-Kāfiyah of al-Dawlatābādī: "Completed is the epistle attributed to Mawlānā Shihāb al-Dīn, may the mercy of God be upon him and upon the brethren in the faith, by the reverence of Him [Prophet Muḥammad] who intercedes on Judgement Day. It is completed."

3. Colophon of ʻAwn al-Wāfiyah fī sharḥ kitāb al-Kāfiyah: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... fa-inna al-mafʻūl al-awwal min bāb aʻṭaytu bi-manzilat al-fāʻil, wa-al-thānī bi-manzilat al-mafʻūl, wa-aṣl al-fāʻil an hiya [yaliya] fiʻlahu wa-yataqaddama ʻalá [mafʻūlih (?)], fa-lidhālika jāza ḍarab ghulāmahu Zaydun, li-anna Zaydan wa-in kāna muʼakhkharan ʻan ghulāmihi lafẓan lākinnahu muqaddamun ʻalyhi rutbatan, fa-innahu lawlā anna Zaydan ..."

record.title: 880-03 Taḥrīr al-qawāʻid al-manṭiqīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Quṭb al-Taḥtānī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla: al-Maqālah al-thāniyah fī al-qaḍāyā wa-aḥkāmihā, ilá ākhirihi. Aqūlu: Lammā faragha min mabāḥith al-qawl al-shāriḥ sharaʻa fī mabāḥith al-ḥujjah, wa-lammā tawaqqafa maʻrifatuhā ʻalá maʻrifat al-qaḍāyā wa-aḥkāmihā waḍaʻa al-maqālah li-bayān dhālik, warattabahā muqaddimah wa-thalāthat fuṣūl. Ammā al-muqaddimah, fa-fī taʻrīf al-qaḍīyah wa-aqsāmihā al-awwalīyah, ay, al-ḥāṣilah bi-ḥasab al-qismah al-ūlá ..."
Secundo folio: fīhā al-khurūj al-ṭabīʻīyah.
13 x 19.5 cm; written surface: 6 x 11 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: Dark brown leather on spine, and remnants on cover.

In good naskh script, in black ink, on greyish and white paper; the phrases of al-Sullam preceded by the word "Qāla" (He said) and the commentary by the word "Aqūlu" (I say); some phrases and marking in red; extensive commentaries on the margins and interlinear; some diagrams; some inserts; catchwords.
On the back of the front cover: An invocation in Arabic: "Hādhā duʻāʼ sharīf", and several calculations.
On the front flyleaf: Verses of poetry in Ottoman Turkish, and an illegible stamp.

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Min kutub Muḥammad Adīb ibn Muḥammad ʻAlī al-Kīlānī. Fī sanat 1277 [of the Hijrah = 1860/1861]." 2. "Dakhala ilá silk mulk al-ḥaqīr ilá Rabbihi al-ghanī, Subḥān [Subḥānuhu], Ṣiyāmī ibn Sulaymān, ghafara dhunūbī al-Malik al-Mannān."
Under the copyist's colophon: Verses of poetry in Ottoman Turkish.

Author's colophon: "Wa-li-yakun hādhā ākhir mā aradnā īrādahu fī hādhihi al-awrāq. Wa-al-ḥamdu li-Wājib al-Wujūd wa-mufīḍ al-arzāq. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá afḍal al-bashar, Muḥammad, ʻalá al-iṭlāq, al-mabʻūth li-tatammum makārim al-akhlāq, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-aṭhār. Tammat bi-ʻawn Allāh."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Let this be the end of what we intended to introduce in these leaves. Praise be to Him Who is Existent by Necessity, the Overflower of Sustenance. May prayer and peace be on the best of mankind, without exception, Muḥammad, who was sent to fulfil the high moral standards, and on his family and his virtuous companions. It was completed by the help of God."

Copyist's colophon: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-naḥīf al-mudhnib, al-muḥtāj ilá raḥmat Allāh taʻālá, Muṣṭafá ibn Rustum, ʻan zumrat Ghulāmiyān ʻAjamiyān, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamʻ [wa-li-jamīʻ] al-Muslimīn. Wa-qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah fī awāʼil Rajab al-murjib, fī shahr Qusṭanṭīyah, fī waqt al-ḍuḥá, fī sanat ithnā wa-sittīn wa-tisʻimiʼah."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The book was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King, by the hand of the feeble and debilitated sinner, who needs the mercy of God Almighty, Muṣṭafá ibn Rustum, of the Ghulāmiyān ʻAjamiyān group, may God forgive him, his parents and all Muslims. This noble copy was completed in the morning, in the beginning of awesome Rajab, of the year 962 [of the Hijrah = 1 June 1555), in the city of Qusṭanṭīyah (Constantinople)."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-ʻAqāʼid al-Nasafīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Mūsá al-Khayālī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Qāla al-shāriḥ al-niḥrīr, ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-luṭfihi al-khaṭīr, baʻdamā tayammana bi-al-tasmīyah. Aqūlu: Fī taʻqīb al-tasmiyah bi-al-taḥmīd iqtidāʼun bi-uslūb al-Kitāb al-Majīd, wa-ʻmalun bi-mā shāʻ, bal waqaʻa ʻalayhi al-ijmāʻ, wa-imtithālun li-Ḥadīthay al-ibtidāʼ, wa-mā yutawahhamu min taʻāruḍuhmā, fa-madfūʻ, immā bi-al-ibtidāʼ ʻalá al-ʻurfī al-mumtadd, aw, bi-ḥaml aḥadihimā ʻalá al-ḥaqīqī wa-al-ākhar ʻalá al-iḍāfī, ka-mā huwa al-mashhūr ..."
Secundo folio: qawluhu bi-sāṭiʻ ḥujajih
15 x 23 cm; written surface: 5.5 x 13.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: The ten unnumbered quires are inside a dark brown leather cover (13.5 x 20.5 cm), smaller in size than the quires of the manuscript (15 x 23 cm).

In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Sharḥ al-ʻAqāʼid al-Nasafīyah" of al-Taftāzānī in red; extensive commentaries on the margins and interlinear; text within double red frame; catchwords.
The leaves of the manuscript are numbered evenly (2, 4, 6. etc. -96) in East Arabic (Indian) numerals.
On folio 1a: Miscellaneous quotations.

Author's colophon: "Wa-Allāha asʼalu an yuthībanī bi-hi jamīla al-dhikr fī al-dunyā, wa-jazīla al-ajr fī al-ākhirah, ḍāriʻan ilá man yanẓuru min ʻālimin fī ʻamalī an yastura ʻithārī wa-zalalī, wa-yusaddida bi-sadād faḍlihi khalalī, wa-yuṣliḥa mā ṭaghá bi-hi al-qalam, wa-zāgha ʻanhu al-baṣar, wa-qaṣura ʻanhu al-fahm, wa-ghafal ʻanhu al-khāṭir; fa-al-insān maḥall al-nisyān, wa-inna awwal nāsin awwal nāsi [al-nāsi]. Wa-ʻalá Allāh al-tiklān."

Translation of the author's colophon: "I implore God to grant me, because of it [the book], a pleasant memory in this world, and an abundant reward in the Hereafter. I beg the scholar who looks into my work to cover my tripping and errors, to correct by his favor my faults, to amend what the pen overstepped, what the vision neglected, what the intellect missed, and what the mind forgot; for man is prone to forgetfulness, as the first person who forgot was the first human being. On God is the reliance."

Copyist's colophon: "Tamma taḥrīr hādhā al-kitāb al-mustaṭāb, al-mansūb ilá al-fāḍil al-mudaqqiq al-almaʻī, aʻnī bi-hi al-Mawlá al-Khayālī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá raḥmatan ilá kāffat al-anām [al-ayyām (?)], ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá al-khafīyah wa-al-jalīyah min alṭāf Rabbihi al-Qadīr, Ibrāhīm Ilhāmī ibn al-Ḥājj Ḥasan, al-madʻū bi-Takhmīs Zādah al-Mūllawī, ʻalayhimā al-raḥmah wa-al-ghufrān al-abadī, fī yawm Panjshanbah, huwa al-khāmis wa-al-ʻishrūn min shahr Rajab al-murjib, li-sanat ithnā wa-tisʻīn baʻda al-miʼah wa-alf min Hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf. Allāhumma ṣalli ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ikhwānihi min al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn, wa-sallim taslīman kathīran. Wa-al-ḥamdu Allāh [lillāh] Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Tamm. Yā ayyuhā al-ikhwān: Arjū minkum an lā tansawnī min al-duʻāʼ, fa-inna al-kātib yafná wa-al-khaṭṭ yabqá; fa-al-kātib yaḥtāju ilá al-duʻāʼ, wa-al-khaṭṭ yaḥtāj bi-al-tansīkh ilá al-baqāʼ, ḥattá yakūna wa-sīlatan ilá al-duʻāʼ."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The copy of this dainty book, attributed to the eminent, established and sagacious scholar, I mean, Mawlānā al-Khayālī, may God Almighty have mercy upon him to the end of days, was completed by the hand of the poor to the hidden and conspicuous kindness of his Almighty Lord, Ibrāhīm Ilhāmī ibn al-Ḥājj Ḥasan, nicknamed Takhmīs Zādah al-Mūllawī, may everlasting mercy and forgiveness be upon both of them, on Thursday, the twenty-fifth of the awesome month of Rajab, of the year 1092 of the Hijrah [19 August 1778] of Him to whom belongs nobleness and honor [Prophet Muḥammad]. O God pray on Him and on His brethren the prophets and messengers, and grant them abundant peace. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. Amen. It is completed. O brothers! I beseech you not to forget me in your prayer; for the writer perishes but the script remains, the scribe needs invocation, and the script needs copying to survive; hence becomes a means for invocation."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Risālah al-ʻAḍudīyah : manuscript / Abū al-Qāsim ibn Abī Bakr al-Samarqandī.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī khaṣṣa al-insān bi-maʻrifat awḍāʻ al-kalām wa-mabānīhi, wa-jaʻala al-ḥurūf uṣūl kalimihi wa-ẓurūf maʻānīh, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá al-mushtaqq min maṣdar al-faḍl wa-al-ḥikam, al-jāmiʻ li-maḥāsin al-afʻāl wa-makārim al-shiyam, al-mawṣūl bi-alfāẓihi anwāʻ al-saʻādah wa-al-hudá, al-muḍmir fī ishārātihi aṣnāf al-ḥikmah wa-al-tuqá, Muḥammad, al-madhkūr ismuhu fī al-Tawrāt wa-al-Injīl, wa-ʻalá ālihi, muẓhir al-ḥaqq wa-mubṭil al-abāṭīl ..."
Secundo folio: al-najm fī al-ʻalam.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 9-10.5 x 13-14 cm; 13-17 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap.

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; with the phrases of "Risālat al-waḍʻ" in red; markings in red; some notes and commentaries on the margins; the first leaf has been replaced and re-written in a different hand; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Muḥaqqiq al-Samarqandī fī ʻilm al-waḍʻ ʻalá al-Risālah al-ʻAḍudīyah, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. M."
Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb. Tamma Sharḥ Risālat al-Waḍʻ lil-Mawlá ʻAḍud al-Millah wa-al-Dīn, taʼlīf al-Mawlá ʻAlī al-Samarqandī, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayhimā ajmaʻīn."

Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. The commentary on 'Risālat al-Waḍʻ' of al-Mawlá ʻAḍud al-Millah wa-al-Dīn, written by al-Mawlá ʻAlī al-Samarqandī, may God have mercy on both of them, is completed."

Volume 1, spanning the period 21 September 1812 - 24 December 1814, is written in brown ink in a single hand on paper watermarked 1810; bound in contemporary quarter reversed calf over marbled boards.

Volume 2, spanning the period 7 February 1819 - 30 September 1820, is written in brown ink in a single hand on paper watermarked 1816; bound in contemporary marbled wrappers, with remains of red wax seal to upper cover.

Binding: contemporary full leather with blind-tooled panels.

Pagination: pages 5b-6, 13-30.

record.title: 880-03 al-Mukhtaṣar : manuscript / Khalīl ibn Isḥāq al-Jundī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit (folio 1b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṣalla [Ṣallá] Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-muḍṭarr li-raḥmat [raḥmah] Rabbihi, al-munkasir khāṭiruhu li-qillat al-ʻamal wa-al-taqwá, al-ʻArūsī ..."
Secundo folio: fī madhhab al-Imām al-Mālikī.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 13.5 cm; 12 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather; spine damaged.
In fair West Africa style script; headings in red; few notes on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb fiqh fī madhhab al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Ibn Mālik, wa-qad katabahu al-Shaykh al-ʻArūsī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn." It is not clear who "al-Shaykh al-ʻArūsī" is. He is also mentioned in the incipit as "al-ʻArūsī". He could be a copyist or a teacher.
Some leaves seem to be missing after folio 1.
On folio 92a: A date (by a reader or an owner): "Yawm al-Thulāthāʼ, 3 Shaʻbān, sanat 1322 Hijrīyah [13 October 1904]."

Colophon: The colophon (folio 437a) is written in a different hand, on modern paper (printed with blue lines) and dated Dhū al-Ḥijjah 968 (August/September 1561): "Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah fī shahr Dhū al-Ḥijjah al-mukarram, sanat 968, tisʻimiʼah thamāniyah wa-sittūn Hijrīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-adhká [wa-azká] al-salām. Āmīn. M."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was completed in the noble month of Dhū al-Ḥijjah, of the year 968 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [August/September 1561], may the best prayer and purest peace be upon Him. Amen. M."

record.title: 880-03 al-Kashf wa-al-bayān ʻan tafsīr al-Qurʼān : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Thaʻlabī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... al-ālihah ilāhan wāḥidan, wa-an yushrika bi-hi ghayrahu. Yuʼminū: Yuṣaddiqū dhālika al-shirk. Samiʻtu baʻḍ al-ʻulamāʼ yaqūlu: Wa-an yushrika bi-hi baʻda al-radd ilá al-dunyā law kānū yuʼminū yuṣaddiqū dhālika al-shirk, fa-li-dhālika dhakarahu bi-lafẓ al-istifhām. Naẓīruhu qawluhu wa-law ruddū laʻādū ilá mā nuhū ʻanhu. Fa-al-ḥukm lillāh al-ʻAlī al-Kabīr. Huwa alladhī yurīkum āyātihi wa-yunzilu lakum min al-samāʼi rizqan bi-idrārin ..."
Secundo folio: [... ... ...] fa-lā yadrī al-qawm illā wa-qad aẓallahum maʻahu al-juyūsh.
17.5 x 26 cm; written surface: 13 x 20.5 cm; 31 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather; cover tooled with geometric design; spine damaged.

In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of the Qurʼān preceded by the phrase "Qawluhu ʻaʻālá" in red; the quotations preceded by indicative phrases (e.g., Qāla, Akhbaranī, akhbaranā, etc.) in red; keywords in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
At the head of folio 1a: "Tafsīr al-Qurʼān."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with the commentary on Sūrat al-ʻAlaq (Qurʼān: Chapter 96), as follows: "... fa-atá Waraqah, fa-dhakara la-hu dhālik. Fa-qāla la-hu Waraqah: Abshir thumma Abshir, wa-anā ashhadu annka alladhī bashshara bi-hi Ibn Maryam, wa-annka ʻalá mithl nāmūs Mūsá, wa-annaka nabīyun mursal, wa-annka sa-tuʼmaru bi-al-jihād baʻda yawmika hādhā, wa-la-in adrakanī dhālika la-ujāhidanna maʻak. Fa-lammā tuwuffiya Waraqah, qāla Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Laqad raʼaytu al-Qiss fī al-Jannah, ʻalayhi thiyāb al-ḥarīr, li-annahu āman bī, wa-ṣadaqanī, yaʻnī Waraqah. Wa-qāla Waraqah fī dhālik: Fa-in yaku ḥaqqan yā Khadījah fa-iʻlamī ḥadīthaki īyānā fa-Aḥmad mursal ..."

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... wa-iʻtabara al-Muṣ [al-muṣannif] maʻa al-ṣalāḥīyah ḥuṣūl al-istiḥqāq bi-al-fiʻl, wa-li-hādhā akhadha al-tarkīb fī taʻrīfihi. Wa-ammā wujūd al-iʻrāb bi-al-fiʻl fī kawn al-ism muʻraban fa-lam yaʻtabirhu aḥad. Fa-li-dhālika yuqālu lam tuʻrab al-kalimah wa-hiya muʻrabah. Wa-innamā ʻadal al-Muṣ ʻammā huwa al-mashhūr ʻinda al-jumhūr, min anna al-muʻrab ikhtalafa ākhiruhu bi-ikhtilāf al-ʻawāmil, li-anna al-gharaḍ min tadwīn ʻilm al-naḥw an yaʻrifa bi-hi aḥwāl awākhir al-kalimāt man lam yatatabbaʻ lughat al-ʻArab wa-lam yaʻrif aḥkāmahā bi-al-samāʻ minhum ..."
Secundo folio: min hādhā al-qabīl ghāyat al-amr.
14 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 7 x 15.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; front cover missing; cover and flap embossed with central medallion.

In small good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and marking in red; many notes on the margins and interlinear; some inserts; text within triple frames to leave space for the notes and comments; leaves numbered in East Arabic (Indian) numerals (8 to 200); catchwords.

Colophon: "Qad istarāḥ min kamad al-intihāḍ li-naql hādhā al-sharḥ min al-sawād ilá al-bayāḍ al-ʻabd al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Jāmī, waffaqahu Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá waẓāʼifa ʻubūdīyatih, lil-iʻrāḍ ʻan muṭālabat al-aʻwāḍ wa-al-aghrāḍ. Sanat 1148."

Translation of the colophon: "The poor servant, ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Jāmī, has [now] rested from the worry of arousing to move this commentary from rough drafting to fair drafting. May the Glorious and Almighty God, grant him success to fulfill the duties of his servitude, that he may refrain from asking for rewards or benefits. [Copied] in the year 1148 [of the Hijrah = 1735/1736]."

record.title: 880-02 Taqyīdāt ʻalá Risālat al-Imām al-Samarqandī fī al-istiʻārāt : manuscript / Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad al-ʻAṭṭār.
record.note: Title from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-ʻawn. Ḥaqīqat ḥamdika Yā Mawlāy naʻjizu ʻan al-majāz ilayhā, wa-lā tuḥīṭu ʻuqūlunā al-makaddarah bi-al-kadarāt al-basharīyah bi-mā ladayhā. Kayfa, wa-qad ʻalimta ʻajza khalqika ʻan ḥamdika wa-qudsika, fa-ḥamadta bi-kalāmika al-qadīm al-azalī nafsaka bi-nafsika. Fa-rashshiḥnā Allāhumma li-iṭlāq al-tajrīd ʻan shawāʼib al-taqyīd, wa-ṣalli wa-sallim ʻalá afḍal khalīqatika alladhī nabaʻa min ḍiʼḍiʼayy al-balāghah wa-al-faṣāḥah ..."
Secundo folio: fa-hādhihi ʻashr hiya al-mabādiʼ.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 11 x 18 cm; 29 lines per page.
Binding: In folded thick paper wrapper.
In small and packed ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the paper wrapper (in pencil): "Taqyīdāt ʻalá Risālat al-Samarqandī fī al-istiʻārāt lil-Shaykh Ḥasan al-ʻAṭṭār."
On folio 1b: "... Taqyīdāt ʻalá Risālat al-Samarqandī fī al-istiʻārāt ... Yaqūlu ... Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad al-ʻAṭṭār al-Shāfiʻī al-Miṣrī al-Azharī ..."

At the upper left corner of folio 1a: Two verses of poetry praising the virtues of death, as follows: "Qad qultu idh madaḥū al-ḥayāta wa-aṭnabū // fī al-mawti alfu faḍīlatin lā tuʻrafu. Minhā amān liqāyatin bi-liqāʼihi // wa-firāqu kulli muʻāshirin lā yunṣifu."

Colophon: "Raqamahu bi-qalamihi afqar al-wará wa-aḥwaj al-fuqarā ilá luṭf Rabbihi al-khafī Ḥanafī ibn Shāhīn al-Shāfiʻī al-Ṣayrafī, waqāhu Allāh sharra nafsihi, wa-jaʻala ʻalayhi asʻad al-ayyām yawma an yaḥulla bi-ramsihi. Wa-kāna farāghī min dhālika ṣabīḥata yawm al-Aḥad al-mubārak, awwal min Rajab al-fard, sanat 1250, alf wa-miʼatayn wa-khamsīn min Hijrat al-Muṣṭafá, ʻalayhi afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-salām."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied by the poorest of mankind and the neediest of the poor to the hidden kindness of his Lord, Ḥanafī ibn Shāhīn al-Ṣayrafī, may God protect him from the evil of his soul, and make his happiest days the day he descends into his grave. It was completed on the morning of blessed Sunday, the first day of Rajab al-fard, of the year 1250 of the Hijrah of al-Muṣṭafá [3 November 1834], may the best prayer and the most perfect peace be upon Him."

record.title: 880-02 al-Wāfiyah fī sharḥ al-Kāfiyah : al-sharḥ al-mutawassiṭ : manuscript / Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad ibn Sharaf Shāh.
