Binding: In dark red leather cover with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion and tooled with decorative frame.

In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Bānat Suʻād" in red, some in green; markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; many wormholes with loss of text; catchwords.

On folio 1a: Part of a colophon of an unknown treatise, by the same copyist, which seems to have been part of the present codex, as follows: "... thalāthīn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-azká al-salām, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqr [al-faqīr], al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad al-Ziftāwī al-Shāfiʻī al-Aḥmadī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-muʼallifihā, wa-mālikihā, wa-li-man daʻā lahum bi-al-maghfirah. M."
On folio 101b: Three magic squares of "awfāq ʻadadīyah" (numerical harmonies).

On folios102a-103a: An excerpt from an unidentified work of anecdotes and folk tales about humans who have metamorphosized into birds, frogs, animals, insects, plants, and planets (Venus, Mars, etc.).
On folios 103b-104a: A letter in Ottoman Turkish.

On folios104b-105a: Scribbles and notes, in red and black, as follows: "Kātibuhu ʻAbd al-ʻAlīm Maʻtūq, bi-Kūm al-Qāḍī, bi-Markaz Kafr al-Dawwār Buḥayrah"; "Kātibuhu Muḥammad Muḥammad, qubṭān bi-Kūm al-Būṣ, tabaʻ Markaz Abū Ḥimṣ, bi-Mudīrīyat Buḥayrah"; and a testimony by ʻAbd al-ʻAlīm Maʻtūq, about a transaction of buying and selling aquantity of cotton and furniture, dated October, 1901.

On the end leaf: Statements by two sailors, as follows: "Kātibuhu al-ʻabd al-faqīr Muḥammad Muḥammad ʻAbd Allāh al-Sūdānī, qubṭān tabaʻ Markaz Abū Ḥimṣ, bi-Mudrīyat Buḥayrah, bi-Nāḥiyat Wajh Buḥayrī"; "Muḥammad Dakrūrī, qubṭān maʻ Markaz Abū Ḥimṣ [...]."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-sharḥ al-mubārak, yawm al-Aḥad al-mubārak, khāmis ʻashar shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, min shuhūr sanat thalāthīn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-azká al-salām, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād ilá Rabbihi, wa-aghnāhum bi-hi, al-faqr [al-faqīr] al-ḥaqīr, al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi <al-ʻafw> al-ghafūr al-qadīr, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Salām al-Ziftāwī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, al-Aḥmadī ṭarīqatan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-lil-nāẓir fīhi, wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah, wa-li-muʼallifihi, wa-li-man kutiba bi-ismihi, Mawlānā al-Shaykh al-ʻAllāmah, al-ʻumdah al-fahhāmah, al-shābb al-saʻīd al-rashīd, Sayyidī Abū Bakr al-Kurdī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-lil-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn, wa-li-man daʻā lahumā bi-al-maghfirah. Āmīn. Āmīn. Ām[īn]."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy of this blessed commentary was completed on blessed Sunday, 15 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, of the year 1030 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and the purest peace be upon Him, by the hand of the poorest of the servants to his Lord, and the richest by Him, the poor and wretched, who admits his sin, his disability, and his insufficiency, and aspires for the forgiveness of his Forgiving and Mighty Lord, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Salām al-Ziftāwī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, al-Aḥmadī ṭarīqatan, may God forgive him, his parents, him who looks into it [the book], and him who invokes forgiveness on his behalf, on behalf of its author, and for him to whom it was copied, our Master, the erudite scholar and the judicious authority, the felicitous and discerning young man, Sayyidī Abū Bakr al-Kurdī, may God forgive him, his parents, all Muslims, and those who invoke forgiveness for them. Amen. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 al-Majālis al-sanīyah fī al-kalām ʻalá al-Arbaʻīn al-Nawawīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Ḥijāzī al-Fashnī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; the text starts with part of the first session: "... al-muṭṭaliʻ ʻalá ḍamāʼir al-qulūb idhā hajasat, al-ḥasīb ʻalá al-khawāṭir idhā ikhtalajat, alladhī lā yaghrubu ʻan ʻilmihi mithqāl dharrah fī al-samāwāt wa-al-arḍ idhā taḥarrakat aw sakanat, al-muḥāsib ʻalá al-naqīr wa-al-qiṭmīr, wa-al-qalīl wa-al-kathīr min al-aʻmāl wa-in khafiyat ..."
Secundo folio: an yaḥḍura amān Allāh fa-li-yaḥḍur.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 8.5 x15; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion and tooled with broad frame (in 22 numbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white thick paper; headings and keywords in red, some notes and commentaries on the margins; catchwords.

At the end of al-Majlis al-thānī wa-al-arbaʻīn "Forty-second session" (folio 208b), the author writes: "Wa-hādhā ākhir al-Majālis al-sanīyah fī al-Arbaʻīn al-Nawawīyah, wa-nakhtumuhā bi-'Majlis al-khitām', fa-naqūlu, bi-faḍl al-Malik al-ʻAllām: Khātimat al-kitāb fī Majlis al-khitām ..."

Colophon: No colophon; the text ends abruptly with "Majlis al-khitām", as follows: "... wa-qad qīl: Idhā mudda al-ṣirāṭu ʻalá Jaḥīmin // taṣūlu ʻalá al-ʻuṣāti wa-tastaṭīlu. Fa-qawmun fī al-Jaḥīm lahum thawīyun // wa-qawmun fī al-jināni lahum maqīlu. Wa-bāna al-ḥaqqu wa-inkashafa al-ghiṭāʼ // wa-ṭāla al-waylu wa-ittaṣala al-ʻawīlu. Fa-idhā ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Shamsīyah : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn ʻUmar al-Qazwīnī.
record.note: Title of 1. al-Shamsīyah from reference sources.

Title of 4. al-Shamsīyah from reference sources.

Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of title 1. al-Shamsīyah: "Muṣannaf. Hādhā Shamsīyah. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Maqālah al-thāniyah fī al-qaḍāyā wa-aḥkāmihā, wa-fīhā muqaddimah wa-thalāthat fuṣūl. Ammā al-muqaddimah fa-fī taʻrīf al-qaḍīyah wa-aqsāmihā al-awwalīyah. al-Qaḍīyah qawlun yaṣiḥḥu an yuqāla li-qāʼilihi innahu ṣādiq fīhi, aw, kādhib fīhi ..."
Secundo folio of title 1. al-Shamsīyah: al-nisbah in kānat nisbah yaṣiḥḥu.

Incipit of title 2. Sharḥ al-Shamsīyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla: al-Maqālah al-thāniyah fī al-qaḍāyā. Ah. Aqūlu: Lammā faragha min mabāḥith al-qawl al-shāriḥ sharaʻa fī mabāḥith al-ḥujjah, wa-li-mā tūqafu maʻrifatuhā ʻalá maʻrifat al-qaḍāyā wa-aḥkāmihā. Wa-al-maqālah li-bayān dhālik ..."
Secundo folio of title 2. Sharḥ al-Shamsīyah: wa-al-maḥkūm bi-hi wa-maʻná inḥilālihā.

Incipit of title 3. Sharḥ al-Shamsīyah: "<Qāla>. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla: Wa-rattabtuhu ʻalá muqaddimah, wa-thalāth maqālāt, wa-khātimah. Aqūlu: al-Risālah murattabah ʻalá muqaddimah, wa-thalāth maqālāt, wa-khātimah. Ammā al-muqaddimah fa-fī māhīyat al-manṭiq wa-bayān al-ḥājah ilayhi wa-mawḍūʻihi. Wa-ammā al-maqālāt, fa-ūlāhā fī al-mufrādāt [al-mufradāt], wa-al-thāniyah fī al-qaḍāyā wa-aḥkāmihā, wa-al-thālith [wa-al-thālithah] fī al-qiyās. Wa-ammā al-khātimah fī [fa-fī] al-aqyasah wa-ajzāʼ al-ʻulūm ..."
Secundo folio of title 3. Sharḥ al-Shamsīyah: taṣawwarnā al-insān wa-ḥakamnā ʻalayhi.

Incipit of title 4. al-Shamsīyah: "Shamsīyah. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Wa-rattabtuhu ʻalá muqaddimah wa-thalāth maqālāt wa-khātimah, muʻtaṣiman bi-ḥabl al-tawfīq min wāhib al-ʻaql, wa-mutawakkilan ʻalá jūdihi al-mufīḍ lil-khayr wa-al-ʻadl, innahu khayr muwaffiq wa-muʻīn. Ammā al-muqaddimah, fa-fīhā baḥthān: al-Awwal fī māhīyat al-manṭiq wa-bayān al-ḥājah ilayhi ..."
Secundo folio of title 4. al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah: mutayaqqan li-anna wujūd lāzim al-dhihn.

Incipit of title 5. al-Fawāʼid al-Fanārīyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ḥamdan laka Allāhumma ʻalá mā lakhkhaṣta lī min minaḥ ʻawārif al-afāḍil, wa-khallaṣtanī min miḥan ʻawāṣif al-faḍāʼil, wa-ṣalātan ʻalá ʻāmmat man laḥiqahum ulī al-fawāḍil, lāsīyamā ʻalá Muḥammad, al-manʻūt bi-aʻlá al-shamāʼil, wa-al-mabʻūth bi-akram al-qabāʼil, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-muhtadīn bi-awḍaḥ al-dalāʼil ..."
Secundo folio of title 5. al-Fawāʼid al-Fanārīyah: mabāḥith Īsāghūjī wājiban ʻalayhi.

Incipit of title 6. Īsāghūjī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻAllāmah, afḍal al-mutaʼakhkhirīn, qudwat al-ḥukamāʼ al-rāsikhīn, Athīr al-Dīn al-Abharī, ṭayyaba Allāh tharāh wa-jaʻala al-Jannah mathwāh: Naḥmadu Allāh ʻalá tawfīqihi, wa-nasʼaluhu hidāyat ṭarīqihi, wa-nuṣallī ʻalá Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-ʻitratih ajmaʻīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi risālah fī al-manṭiq, awradnā fīhā mā yajibu istiḥḍāruhā [istiḥḍāruhu] li-man yabtadiʼu fī shayʼ min al-ʻulūm ..."
Secundo folio of title 6. Īsāghūjī: wa-huwa al-ʻaraḍ al-mufāriq.

Incipit of title 7. al-Waṣīyah of Abū Ḥanīfah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Sayyid al-Mursalīn Muḥammad wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn. Hādhā kitāb al-Waṣīyah, lil-Imām al-Aʻẓam Abī Ḥanīfah. Raḍiya Allāh ʻan imām al-aʼimmah, hādī al-ummah, kāshif al-ghummah, farīd waqtih, awḥad ʻaṣrih, mūḍiḥ al-ṭarīqah, muẓhir al-ḥaqīqah, ḥusām al-sharīʻah, al-mujāhid ʻalá al-taḥqīq, Abī Ḥanīfah Nuʻmān ibn Thābit, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-arḍāh ..."
Secundo folio of title 7. al-Waṣīyah of Abū Ḥanīfah: wa-tawfīqihi wa-kitābatihi fī al-lawḥ al-maḥfūẓ.

Incipit of title 8. Risālah fī ʻilm ādāb al-baḥth: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Aḥmaduka Allāhumma, yā mujīb kull musāʼil, wa-uṣallī ʻalá Nabīyika al-mabʻūth bi-aqwá al-dalāʼil, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-mutawassilīn bi-aʻẓam al-wasāʼil, mā jará al-baḥth bayna al-mujīb wa-al-sāʼil. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi risālah lakhkhaṣtuhā fī ʻilm al-ādāb, mujtaniban ʻan ṭaraf al-iqtiṣād wa-al-ikhlāl wa-al-iṭnāb, wa-Allāh asʼalu an yanfaʻa bi-hā maʻāshir al-ṭullāb. Wa-mā tawfīqī illā billāh, ʻalayhi tawakkaltu, wa-ilayhi al-maʼāb ..."
Secundo folio of title 8. Risālah fī ʻilm ādāb al-baḥth: ʻalayhā wa-ibṭālihi sanadah.

Incipit of title 9. Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī fann al-ādāb: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Yā man waffaqanā li-waẓāʼif al-baḥth fī al-taḥrīrāt wa-al-taḥqīqāt, wa-yā man yassaranā li-numayyiza samīnahā ʻan saqīmihā fī al-taqrīrāt wa-al-tadqīqāt, ṣalli ʻalá man ṣaḥḥaḥa al-sharīʻah al-gharrāʼ bi-aṣaḥḥ al-taṣḥīḥāt ..."
Secundo folio of title 9. Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī fann al-ādāb: al-murād wa-ammā al-muʻāraḍah al-taḥqīqīyah.

Incipit of title 10. Sharḥ Ādāb al-baḥth al-ʻAḍudīyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Hādhā mabnī ʻalá anna lāmay al-mulk wa-al-jins tadullān ʻalá ikhtiṣāṣ al-ḥamd bi-hi taʻālá, kamā ṣarraḥa bi-hi al-muḥaqqiq al-sharīf, quddisa sirruhu, fī ṣadr ḥāshiyat al-Kashshāf wa-ghayrihi. Laka al-ḥamd. Jaʻala Allāh taʻālá mukhāṭaban, tanbīhan ʻalá al-qurb ..."
Secundo folio of title 10. Sharḥ Ādāb al-baḥth al-ʻAḍudīyah: ʻalá al-Nabī, ʻA M, bi-al-ṣalāh ʻalá ālihi.

Incipit of title 11. al-ʻAḍudīyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Laka al-ḥamdu wa-al-minnah, wa-ʻalá Nabīyika al-ṣalāh wa-al-taḥīyah. Ammā baʻd, idhā qulta bi-kalām, in kunta nāqilan fa-yuṭlab al-ṣiḥḥah, aw, muddaʻiyan fa-al-dalīl, wa-lā yumnaʻu al-naql wa-al-muddaʻá illā majāzan, idhā al-manʻ [muniʻa] ṭalab al-dalīl ..."

Incipit of title 12. Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth of al-Birkuwī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Risālat al-Birkilī Muḥammad Afandī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ḥabībihi Muḥammad, ʻalayhi al-salām wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-iʻlam inna al-munāẓir idhā naqala khabaran fa-li-khaṣmihi ṭalab al-ṣiḥḥah faqaṭ idhā lam yaʻrifhā, wa-in iddaʻāhā fa-al-dalīl wa-al-tanbīh bi-dhālik, fa-in atá bi-hi fa-la-hu manʻ baʻḍ muqddimātihi, aw kullihi mujarradan ..."

Incipit of title 13. Risālah fī ʻilm ādāb al-baḥth by Kemalpaşazade: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu li-man ḥafiẓa al-muʼminīn min al-khaṭaʼ wa-al-khalīl [wa-al-khalal] fī munāẓaratihim bi-al-mukhālifīn wa-al-jadal, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūlihi Muḥammad al-amam [al-Imām (?)] al-akmal wa-ṣaḥbihi al-aḥbār al-uwal. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi 'Risālah fī ʻilm adāb al-baḥth', mughniyah ʻammā ʻadāhā min al-risālah al-mutadāwalah bayna al-muḥaṣṣilīn wa-al-mutaḥaṣṣilīn ..."
Secundo folio of title 13. Risālah fī ʻilm ādāb al-baḥth by Kemalpaşazade: lajāj wa-taʻannut wa-li-fāʼidat al-munāẓarah mufawwitan.

Incipit of title 14. Risālah fī ʻilm ādāb al-baḥth of Ṭāshkubrīzādah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-ʻawn wa-al-nuṣrah. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī lā māniʻ li-ʻaṭāʼih, wa-lā muʻāriḍ li-qaḍāʼih, wa-lā munāqiḍ li-inshāʼih, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Sayyid Anbiyāʼih, wa-sanad aṣfiyāʼih, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābih adillat awliyāʼih. Wa-baʻd, fa-qad kuntu katabtu ʻiddah min al-suṭūr, maʻa qillat al-biḍāʻah wa-kathrat al-futūr fī ʻilm al-munāẓarah wa-al-ādāb, wa-qad qaṣadtu al-ān sharḥahā bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb ..."
Secundo folio of title 14. Risālah fī ʻilm ādāb al-baḥth of Ṭāshkubrīzādah: wa-sharʻahu afḍal al-sharāʼiʻ.

Incipit of title 15. Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī fann al-ādāb by ʻAlī al-Fardī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Yā man waffaqanā li-waẓāʼif al-baḥth. Wa-kalimat 'Yā' mushtarikah bayna al-aḥwāl al-thalāthah, fa-lā yaḥtāju [taḥtāju] ilá tawjīh al-ʻAllāmah, wa-al-murād bi-hā ghāyat maʻnāhā, wa-hiya al-ijābah. Wa-al-tawfīq, lughatan, jaʻl al-asbāb muwāfiqah al-musab [lil-musabbib (?)], wa-iṣṭilāḥan, khalq al-qudrah ʻalá al-ṭāʻah. Wa-al-baḥth, lughatan, al-taftīsh, wa-iṣṭilāḥan ithbāt al-muddaʻá bi-al-dalīl, nafyan wa-ithbātan ..."
Secundo folio of title 15. Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī fann al-ādāb by ʻAlī al-Fardī: fī al-khārij ʻalá taqdīr taʼkhīr al-dībājah.
15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: Remnants of dark brown leather on cover.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes, commentaries and corrections on the margins; some texts within red frames; some markings in red; some inserts; catchwords.
On the label on the front cover: "Hādhā Shamsīyah. Yāzim."
On folio 1a: An excerpt from an unidentified work on logic (in 22 lines), the page is written upside down.
On folios 3a, 7b, and 8a: stamp of "ʻAbd Allāh Muẓhir Nūr Ilāhī".
At the head of folio 15b: "ʻAllāmā-yi Quṭb. Ṣāḥib."
At the head of folio 156b: "Hādhā al-kitāb Ḥajar Kūbrī."
Colophon of title 1. al-Shamsīyah: "Hādhā ākhir al-kalām fī hādhihi al-risālah. Tammat bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb, min yad ʻabd [al-ʻabd] al-ḍaʻīf ʻAlī ʻUthmān ibn ʻUthmān. al-Sanah 1216."

Translation of the colophon of title 1. al-Shamsīyah: "This is the end of the discourse on this epistle. It was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King, by the hand of ʻAlī ʻUthmān ibn ʻUthmān. Year 1216 [of the Hijrah = 1801/1802]."

Colophon of title 2. Sharḥ al-Shamsīyah: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb, 'bak gavyandah' [?], fī majlis Shaykh Muḥammad ʻAlī Afandī, al-mudaqqiq, al-maʻrūf bi-Tasfanī, wa-huwa ustādhunā ʻUthmān ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥamīdī, ghafara Allāh [la-hu] wa-li-wāliday[hi], wa-lil-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-amwāt, bi-Raḥmatika, Yā Arḥam al-Rāḥimīn. al-Sanah 1217."

Translation of the colophon of title 2. Sharḥ al-Shamsīyah: "The book was completed 'orally' [?], by the help of God, the Abundant Giving King, at the court of Shaykh Muḥammad ʻAlī Afandī, by the meticulous scholar, known as Tasfanī, who is our teacher, ʻUthmān ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥamīdī, may God forgive [him], his parents, and the believers, men and women, the living among them and the dead, by Your Mercy, O You Who are the Most Merciful. In the year 1217 [of the Hijrah = 1802/1803]."

Colophon of title 3. Sharḥ al-Shamsīyah: "Tammat al-kitāb. Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min taḥrīr hādhihi al-nuskhah al-shaʻrīfah [al-sharīfah] fī yawm al-Jahārshanbah, waqt al-zawāl, min shahr Jumāzá [Jumādá] al-Ākhir, min yad ʻabd [al-ʻabd] al-ḍaʻīf al-mudhnib al-muḥtāj ilá raḥmat al-Ḥakīm al-Murshid ilá ṭarīq [al-ṭarīq] al-mustaqīm wa-shafāʻat al-Nabīyihi [Nabīyihi], ʻUthmān ibn ʻUthmān, ghafara Allāh lahumā, wa-al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, fī Jabal Mandah, fī majlis Shaykh Muḥammad ʻAlī Afandī, al-mudaqqiq al-maʻrūf Bik Farīndah, wa-huwa ustādhunā. al-Sanah 1216."

Translation of the colophon of title 3. Shsrḥ al-Shamsīyah: "The book is completed. This noble copy was completed at sunset, on Wednesday, in the month of Jumādá al-Ākhir, by the hand of the feeble and sinner servant, who needs the mercy of the Wise Guide to the straight road [God], and the intercession of His Prophet, ʻUthmān ibn ʻUthmān, may God forgive both of them, and the believers, men and women, in Jabal Mandah [could not be identified], at the court of Shaykh Muḥammad ʻAlī Afandī, nicknamed Bik Farīndah, who is our teacher. In the year 1216 [of the Hijrah = 14 October 1801]."
Colophon of title 4. al-Shamsīyah: "Tammat bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb, Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Sanat 1216."
Translation of the colophon of title 4. al-Shamsīyah: "It was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King, Lord of the Universe, in the year 1216 [of the Hijrah = 1801/1801]."
Colophon of title 5. al-Fawāʼid al-Fanārīyah: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb sanat 1216."
Translation of the colophon of title 5. al-Fawāʼid al-Fanārīyah: The book was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King in the year 1216 [of the Hijrah = 1801/1802]."
Colophon of title 6. Kitāb Īsāghūjī: "Qad tammat hādhā al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb."
Translation of the colophon of title 6. Īsāghūjī: "This book was completed by the help of God, the Abundant Giving King."

Colophon of title 7. al-Waṣīyah of Abū Ḥanīfah: No colophon. The treatise ends with: "... wa-ahl al-Jannah fī al-Jannah khālidūn, wa-ahl al-nār fī al-nār khālidūn, li-qawlihi taʻālá fī ḥaqq al-muʼminīn: Ulāʼika aṣḥāb al-Jannah hum fīhā khālidūn, wa-fī ḥaqq al-kuffār: Ulāʼika aṣḥāb al-nār hum fīhā khālidūn. Tammat. Tammat [It is completed. It is completed]."

Colophon of title 8. Risālah fī ʻilm ādāb al-baḥth: "Hādhā ghāyat mā yurādu fī hādhā. Tamma [Tammat] hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah. Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Wahhāb. Sanat 1217." Under the colophon: "Hādhihi risālah min al-ādāb. Tammat. Ṭāsh Kubrī."

Translation of the colophon of title 8. Risālah fī ʻilm ādāb al-baḥth: "This is the end of what was intended to be introduced about this [art]. This noble copy is completed. The book was completed by the help of God the Abundant Giving, in the year 1217 [of the Hijrah = 1802/1803]." Under the colophon: "This is an epistle about the etiquette [of debate]. It is completed. Ṭāsh Kubrī."
Colophon of title of 9. Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī fann al-ādāb: "Tammat al-risālah bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb, min yad ʻUthmān ibn Ayyūb, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, sanat 1216."

Translation of the colophon of title 9. Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī fann al-ādāb: "The treatise was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King, by the hand of ʻUthmān ibn Ayyūb, may God forgive him and his parents, in the year 1216 [of the Hijrah = 1801/1802]."
Colophon of title 10. Sharḥ Ādāb al-baḥth al-ʻAḍudīyah: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb, sanat 1217."
Translation of the colophon of title 10. Sharḥ Ādāb al-baḥth al-ʻAḍudīyah: "The book was completed by the help of God the Abundant Giving King, in the year 1217 [of the Hijrah = 1802/1803]."
Colophon of title 11. al-ʻAḍudīyah: "Tammat bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Wahhāb al-Risālah al-ʻAḍudīyah fī baḥth al-ādāb."
Translation of the colophon of title 11. al-ʻAḍudīyah: "al-Risālah al-ʻAḍudīyah fī baḥth al-ādāb was completed by the help of God the Abundant Giving."
Colophon of title 12. Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth of al-Birkuwī: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Tammat. Tammat."

Translation of the colophon of title 12. Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth of al-Birkuwī: "God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning. It is completed. It is completed."
Colophon of title 13. Risālah fī ʻilm ādāb al-baḥth by Kemalpaşazade: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb lil-muʼminīn sabīl al-ṣawāb, sanat 1216."

Translation of the colophon of title 13. Risālah fī ʻilm ādāb al-baḥth by Kemalpaşazade: "The book was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King who [leads] the believers in the right path, in the year 1216 [of the Hijrah = 1`801/1802]."

Colophon of title 14. Risālah fī ʻilm ādāb al-baḥth of Ṭāshkubrīzādah: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām, wa-ʻalá Rasūlihi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tammat. Tammat Ṭāsh Kubrī min yad ʻUthmān ibn Ayyūb ʻAlī, min Qaḍāʼ al-Sūkūt, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi, fī bilā[d] Qusṭanṭinīyah, fī Madrasat Bak Kūy [Bakirköy (?)], fī shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, fī yawm al-Aḥad, sanat 1216."

Translation of the colophon of title 14. Risālah fī ʻilm ādāb al-baḥth of Ṭāshkubrīzādah: "Praise be to God on the completion, and prayer and peace be upon His Messenger. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. It is completed. [The copy of the epistle of] Ṭāsh Kubrī was completed by the hand of ʻUthmān ibn Ayyūb [ibn] ʻAlī, from the Qaḍāʼ al-Sukūt [could not be identified], may God forgive him and his parents, and be kind to them and to him, in the region of Qusṭanṭinīyah [Constantinople/Istanbul], at Madrasat Bak Kūy [Bakirköy (?)], on Sunday, in the month of Rabīʻ al-Awwal of the year 1216 [of the Hijrah = 12 July 1801]."

Colophon of title 15. Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī fann al-ādāb by ʻAlī al-Fardī: "Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min kitābat hādh [hādhihi] al-Risālah al-musammá bi-Ḥusayn Afandī min yad aḥqar al-ʻibād al-rājī. Tammat sanat 1217."

Translation of the colophon of title 15. Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī fann al-ādāb by al-Fardī: "The copy of this epistle, titled Ḥusayn Afandī, was completed by the hand of the most wretched servant, who aspires for [God's mercy], in the year 1217 [of the Hijrah = 1802/1803]."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat Shāh Ḥusayn : manuscript / Shāh Ḥusayn al-ʻAjamī.
record.note: Title of title 1. Ḥāshiyat Shāh Ḥusayn from folio 1a.
Title of title 2. Qarah Ḥāshiyah from folio 37a.
Title of title 3. Sharḥ al-Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of title 1. Ḥāshiyat Shāh Ḥusayn: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Salaka ṭarīq. Ih. Iʻlam inna min daʼb al-muṣannifīn an yabtadiʼū fī awwal taṣānīfihim bi-kalām mushtamil ʻalá lafẓ al-ḥamd, baʻda an yaḥṣula al-tayammun bi-al-tasmiyah li-yaḥṣula al-imtithāl bi-Ḥadīthay al-ibtidāʼ janānan aw talaffuẓan min kitābah, wa-in kāna al-imtithāl ḥāṣilan bi-himā ayḍan, li-ḥuṣūl nashāṭ al-mutaʻallim wa-raghbat al-muʼallif sabab al-dalālah al-ẓāhirah ʻalá kawn al-muʼallaf ghayr aqṭaʻ ..."
Secundo folio of title 1. Ḥāshiyat Shāh Ḥusayn: kamā lā yakhfá idh qad qīla.

Incipit of title 2. Qarah Ḥāshiyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-muftaqir ilá Allāh al-Ghanī, Abū al-Fatḥ ibn Abī al-Naṣr al-Saʻdī, fataḥ Allāh ʻalayhi al-saʻādah, wa-ʻalá man amʻana fīhā bi-ʻayn al-ʻināyah wa-al-iʻānah. Qawluhu: 'al-Minnah ʻalaynā. Ih. Man salaka ṭarīq al-ʻamal bi-al-Ḥadīth maʻnan, li-anna ḥaqīqat al-ḥamd ʻinda al-muḥaqqiqīn iẓhār al-ṣifāt al-kamālīyah, dūna al-qawl al-makhṣūṣ. Lā yuqālu: Kayfa yaṣuḥḥu al-thanāʼ bi-mā huwa madhmūmun ʻaqlan wa-sharʻan, idh qad qīla al-minnah tahdumu al-ṣanīʻah ..."
Secundo folio of title 2. Qarah Ḥāshiyah: fī al-ʻalāʼiq al-badānīyah wa-al-ʻawāʼiq al-ṭabīʻīyah.

Incipit of title 3. Sharḥ al-Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-qad qāla al-Imām al-muḥaqqiq wa-al-humām al-mudaqqiq, sulṭān al-ḥukamāʼ al-mutaʼakhkhirīn, jāmiʻ jamīʻ faḍāʼil al-ʻulamāʼ al-mutaqaddimīn, Mawlānā Shams al-Millah wa-al-Dīn al-Samarqandī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-ghufrānih, wa-askanahu bi-aʻlá jinānih: al-Minnah ʻalaynā, man munna ʻalayhi, li-Wāhib afḍal al-niʻam, alladhī huwa niʻmat al-ʻaql, wa-dhālika al-Wāhib huwa Allāh taʻālá wa-taqaddas ..."
Secundo folio of title 3. Sharḥ al-Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth: al-ghalaṭ fī al-munāẓarah wa-al-abḥāth.
14.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 15 cm; 20-23 lines per page.
Binding: Remnant of dark brown leather on spine and cover.

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth" of al-Samarqandī preceded by the word "Qawluhu" (His saying) in red; some commentaries on the margins in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Ḥāshiyat Shāh Ḥusayn."
On folio 37a: "Qarah Ḥāshiyah lil-Adab al-Masʻūdī."

Colophon: of title 1. Ḥāshiyat Shāh Ḥusayn: Text ends with: "... Qawluhu: 'Wa-ammā fī ghayr dhālika al-qiyās', ay, al-qiyās al-khalfī. Qawluhu: 'An lā yadhkura lafẓ al-thābitah, li-anna[hu] qāla fī ṣadr al-kalām al-aʻyān al-thābitah', fa-lā wajha li-qawlihi, wa-al-kalām fī al-aʻyān al-thābitah, wa-innamā qāla, 'fa-al-nasab lā yajūzu an yakūna al-thābitah fī ṣadr al-kalām', bi-maʻná al-mawjūd al-khārijī, sawāʼ kāna taʻaddadat fīhā al-akwān wa-tajaddadat ʻalayhā al-aʻṣār, aw lā. Fj. Yaṣduqu ʻalá mā kāna fī anna al-ḥudūth kamā lā yakhfá. Tammat [It is completed]."

Colophon of title 2. Qarah Ḥāshiyah: The text ends with: "... Qawluhu min al-tardīd al-madhkūr, fa-ẓahara anna al-jawāb min amthāl hādhā al-manʻ laysa illā bi-ṭarīq al-tardīd wa-ithbāt annahu ghayr muḍirr, kamā sabaqa fī al-mithāl ghayr al-muḍirr fī al-tanbīh al-sābiq, fa-li-tudhkar. Tamm. Tamm [It is completed]."

Colophon of title 3. Sharḥ al-Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth: The text ends with: "... law kāna dhālika al-taqdīr thābitan fī nafs al-amr yatimmu mā dhakarnā min al-dalīl sāliman min al-manʻ al-madhkūr, wa-in lam yakun dhālika al-taqdīr thābitan fī nafs al-amr yalzamu thubūt al-ʻillīyah, wa-illā yalzamu irtifāʻ al-naqīḍayn, wa-bi-hi yaḥṣulu al-maṭ[lūb], kamā fī al-shuqq al-awwal. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm [It is completed. It is completed. It is completed]."

record.title: 880-03 al-Muṭṭalaʻ : manuscript / Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī fataḥ [manaḥa] aḥibbatahu bi-al-luṭf wa-al-tawfīq, wa-yassara lahum sulūk al-taṣawwur wa-al-taṣdīq, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ashraf khalqih, Muḥammad al-hādī ilá sawāʼ al-ṭarīq, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih al-ḥāʼizīn lil-ṣidq wa-al-taḥqīq. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā sharḥ li-kitāb al-ʻAllāmah Athīr al-Dīn al-Abharī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, [al-musammá, ṣaḥḥ] bi-Īsāghūjī fī ʻilm al-manṭiq, yaḥullu alfāẓah wa-yubayyinu murādah, wa-yaftaḥu mughlaqah, wa-yuqayyidu muṭlaqah, ʻalá wajh laṭīf wa-manhaj munīf. Wa-sammaytuhu "al-Muṭṭalaʻ ..."
Secundo folio: lā taʻāruḍ bīhā [baynahumā].
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 15.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Īsāghūji" of al-Abharī in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ Īsāghūjī ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl."

Colophon: No colophon; text ends abruptly with: "... wa-kalāmuhu yadull ʻalá takhṣīṣ al-ḥadd bi-dhawāt al-murakkabāt, fa-takhruju al-basāʼiṭ, fa-innahā innamā tuʻrafu bi-al-rusūm, lā bi-al-ḥudūd, wa-yuʻtabaru fī al-ḥadd al-tāmm taqdīm al-jins ʻalá al-faṣl, li-anna al-faṣl mufassir la-hu, wa-mufassir al-shayʼ mutaʼakhkhir ʻanhu. Qīla: Lā yumkinu taʻrīf al-ḥadd ..."

record.title: 880-03 Īsāghūjī : manuscript / Athīr al-Dīn al-Abharī.
record.note: Title of Īsāghūjī from incipit and colophon.
Title of Masāʼil al-īmān al-muqaddas from folio 4b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Īsāghūjī: "Īsāghūjī, ay, madkhal mukhtaṣar fī al-manṭiq. Bāb dalālat al-lafẓ wa-taqsīmuh. al-Lafẓ al-dāll yadullu ʻalá mā wuḍiʻa la-hu bi-al-muṭābaqah, wa-ʻalá juzʼayhi bi-al-taḍammun in kāna la-hu juzʼ, wa-ʻalá mā yulāzimuhu fī al-dhihn bi-al-iltizām ..."
Secundo folio of Īsāghūjī: jawāb mā huwa maqūl.

Incipit of Masāʼil al-īmān al-muqaddas: "Masāʼil al-īmān al-muqaddas. al-Amānah al-ṣādiqah wāḥidah faqṭ, hiya amānat al-Sayyid al-Masīḥ Yasūʻ allatī bi-nafsihi ʻallamahā li-rusulihi al-ithnay ʻashar awwalan. Fa-hum waʻaẓūhā bi-qūwat al-Rūḥ al-Quds fī al-dunyā kullihā, wa-tilka bi-ʻaynihā masakathā al-Kanīsah al-Muqaddasah al-Rūmāniyah dāʼiman wa-ḥafiẓathā bilā ʻayb ..."
Secundo folio of Masāʼil al-īmān al-muqaddas: Allāh taʻālá ʻaraf dhātahu bi-al-tamām.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 17 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Īsāghūjī. Athīr al-Dīn al-Abharī" (in pencil).
Colophon of Īsāghūjī: "Tamma al-kitāb, ay, al-kutayyib al-musammá bi-Īsāghūjī, bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá."
Translation of the colophon of Īsāghūjī: "The book, that is, the booklet named "Īsāghūjī", was completed by the help of God Almighty."

Masāʼil al-īmān al-muqaddas ends with: "... al-Īmān al-ṣādiq yaʻtaqidu anna jamīʻ al-nās sa-yaqūmūna bi-ajsādihim wa-yaruddūn jawāban ʻan kull afʻālihim, wa-al-ṣāliḥīn yaʼtūn ilá al-ḥayāh al-muʼabbadah, wa-al-fāsidīn ilá al-nār al-dāʼimah, kamā qāla Rabbunā Yasūʻ al-Masīḥ alladhī la-hu al-karāmah wa-al-majd. Āmīn."

record.title: 880-03 Taḥrīr al-qawāʻid al-manṭiqīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Quṭb al-Taḥtānī.
record.note: Title of manuscript 1. Taḥrīr al-qawāʻid al-manṭiqīyah from reference sources.
Titel of manuscript 2. Tanqīḥ al-uṣūl from reference sources.
Title of manuscript 3. al-Fawāʼid al-Fanārīyah from reference sources.
Title of manuscript 4. al-Tawḍīḥ fī ḥall ghawāmiḍ al-Tanqīḥ from incipit (folio 53a): "... wa-sammaytu hādhā al-kitāb bi-al-Tawḍīḥ fī ḥall ghawāmiḍ al-Tanqīḥ ...".
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of manuscript 1. Taḥrīr al-qawāʻid al-manṭiqīyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla: Wa-rattabtuhu ʻalá muqaddimah wa-thalāth maqālāt wa-khātimah. Aqūlu: al-Risālah murattabah ʻalá muqaddimah wa-thalāth maqālāt wa-khātimah. Ammā al-muqaddimah fa-fī māhīyat al-manṭiq wa-bayān al-ḥājah ilayhi wa-mawḍūʻihi ..."
Secundo folio of manuscript 1. Taḥrīr al-qawāʻid al-manṭiqīyah: li-imtināʻ tawajjuh al-nafs naḥwa al-majhūl al-muṭlaq.

Incipit of manuscript 2. Tanqīḥ al-uṣūl: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... al-maʻṣiyah tubīḥu al-mujāwarah ʻalá mā bayyanā min qabl. Faṣl. Ikhtalafū fī al-amr wa-al-nahy, hal lahumā ḥukm fī al-ḍidd am lā. Wa-al-ṣaḥīḥ innahu in fawwata al-maqṣud bi-al-amr yuḥarram, wa-in fawwata ʻadm al-maqṣūd bi-al-nahy yajib, wa-in lam yufawwit fa-al-amr yaqtaḍī karāhiyah, wa-al-nahy kawnuhu sunnah muʼakkadah yaʻnī idhā amara bi-al-shayʼ, fa-ḍidd dhālika al-shayʼ in fawwata al-maqṣūd bi-al-amr fa-faʻala al-ḍidd yakūnu ḥarāman, wa-in lam yufawwithu yakūnu fiʻluhu makrūhan ..."
Secundo folio of manuscript 2. Tanqīḥ al-uṣūl: kull al-iʻtiqādāt kadhālika.

Incipit of manuscript 3. al-Fawāʼid al-Fanārīyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ḥamdan laka Allāhumma ʻalá mā lakhkhaṣta lī min munaḥ ʻawārif al-afāḍil wa-khallaṣtanī min miḥan ʻawāṣif al-faḍāyil, wa-ṣalātan ʻalá ʻāmmat [man] laḥiqahum ulī al-fawāḍil, lāsīyamā ʻalá Muḥammad al-manʻūt bi-aʻlá al-shamāʼil wa-al-mabʻūth bi-akram al-qabāʼil, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-muhtadīn bi-awḍaḥ al-dalāʼil ..."
Secundo folio of manuscript 3. al-Fawāʼid al-Fanārīyah: min ḥaythu nafʻuhā fī al-īṣāl ilá al-maṭlūb.

Incipit of manuscript 4. al-Tawḍīḥ fī ḥall ghawāmiḍ al-Tanqīḥ: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ḥāmidan lillāh taʻālá awwalan wa-thāniyan, wa-li-ʻinān al-thanāʼ ilayhi thāniyan, wa-ʻalá afḍal rusulihi wa-ālihi muṣalliyan, wa-fī ḥablatih [ḥalbat] al-ṣalāh mujalliyan wa-muṣalliyan. Wa-baʻd, fa-inna al-ʻabd al-mutawassil ilá Allāh taʻālá, bi-aqwá al-dharīʻah, ʻUbayd Allāh ibn Masʻūd ibn Tāj al-Sharīʻah, saʻada jadduhu wa-najaḥ jidduhu, yaqūlu: Lammā waffaqanī Allāh taʻālá bi-taʼlīf kitāb Tanqīḥ al-uṣūl aradtu an ashraḥa mushkilātihi wa-aftaḥ mughlaqātihi, muʻriḍan ʻan sharḥ baʻḍ al-mawāḍiʻ allatī man lam yaḥullahā bi-ghayr iṭnāb lā yaḥulla la-hu al-naẓar fī dhālika al-kitāb ..."
Secundo folio of manuscript 4. al-Tawḍīḥ fī ḥall ghawāmiḍ al-Tanqīḥ: ilá janābihi wa-tazyīn dībājat.

14 x 20.5 cm; Manuscript 1: Written surface: 6.5 x 16 cm; 19-21 lines per page. Manuscript 2: Written surface: 7 x 16 cm; 23 lines per page. Manuscript 3: Written surface: 6.5 x14.5 cm; 21 lines per page. Manuscript 4: Written surface: 7 x 16 cm; 23 lines per page (folios 52b-181b) and 9.3 x 16.5; 21 lines per page (folios 182a-196b).
Binding: In cardboard cover with flap; black cloth on spine.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; some headings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
Inside the front cover: "Hādhā kitāb Quṭb al-Dīn al-Shīrāzī."
On folio 1a: "[Kitā]b Quṭb al-Dīn al-Shīrāzī" (in red).
At the head of folio 1b (in pencil, in Roman script): "Taḥrīr al-qawāʻid al-manṭiqīya."
At the upper left corner of folio 26a (in pencil, in Roman script): "Tanqīḥ al-uṣūl (fragm.)."
At the head of folio 36b (in pencil, in Roman script): "al-Fawāʼid al-Fanārīya."
On folio 52a: "Hādhā Kitāb Tawḍīḥ" (in red).
At the head of folio 52a (in pencil, in Roman script): "al-Tawḍīḥ li-ḥall ghawāmiḍ al-Tanqīḥ."
Under the colophon on folio 196b: A statement in Ottoman Turkish about an earthquake.
On the end leaf: A list in 7 lines, in Ottoman Turkish, about a certain will with various quantities and amounts.

Colophon of manuscript 1. Taḥrīr al-qawāʻid al-manṭiqīyah: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb, fī yawm al-Jumʻah [crossed over], Dūshanbah, fī waqt al-ḍuḥá, fī Madrasat Būrayjah wa-Madrasat ʻAbd al-Ghaffār Afandī, al-shahīr bi-Tabārak Zādah, fī zamān Salīm Kirāy Khān, khallad Allāh khilāfatahu. Tārīkh sanat 1084."

Translation of the colophon of manuscript 1. Taḥrīr al-qawāʻid al-manṭiqīyah: "The book was completed by the help of God, the Abundant Giving King, on Friday [crossed over] Monday, in the morning, at Madrasat Būrayjah and Madrasat ʻAbd al-Ghaffār Afandī, known as Tabārak Zādah, in the reign of Salīm Kirāy Khān [probably Selim Giray Khan of Crimea, 1631-1704], may God eternalize his caliphate. Dated in the year 1084 [of the Hijrah = 1673/1674]."

Colophon of manuscript 2. Tanqīḥ al-uṣūl: The text ends abruptly with: "... fa-ʻalá hādhayn, ay, ʻalá al-madhhabayn al-akhīrayn, yakūnu al-istithnāʼ takalluman bi-al-bāqī fī ṣadr al-kalām baʻda al-thunyā, ay, al-mustathná, fa-fī qawlihi la-hu ʻashrah illā thalāthah, ṣadr al-kalām ʻashrah wa-al-thunyā thalāthah wa-al-bāqī ..."

Colophon of manuscript 3. al-Fawāʼid al-Fanārīyah: "Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah al-mubārakah fī yawm Dūshanbah, fī waqt bayna al-ṣalātayn, fī zamān Salīm Kirāy Khān, fī Madrasat Burayjah, fī yad al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-muḥtāj ilá raḥmat al-Jabbār, Ḥusayn ibn ʻAbd al-Ghaffār Afandī, al-shahīr bi-Tabārak Zādah. Tārīkh sanat 1084."

Translation of the colophon of manuscript 3. al-Fawāʼid al-Fanārīyah: "This noble and blessed copy was completed on Monday, between the two prayers, during the reign of Salīm Kirāy Khān [probably Selim Giray Khan of Crimea, 1631-1704], at Madrasat Būrayjah, by the hand of the feeble servant, who needs the mercy of the Mighty One, Ḥusayn ibn ʻAbd al-Ghaffār Afandī, known as Tabārak Zādah. Dated in the year 1084 [of the Hijrah = 1673/1674]."

Colophon of manuscript 4. al-Tawḍīḥ fī ḥall ghawāmiḍ al-Tanqīḥ: "Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min taswīd hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah fī shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, fī yawm Sihʹshanbah, fī waqt al-ẓuhr, fī Madrasat Qashīlā Sarāy, fī zamān Murād Kirāy Khān, khallad Allāh khilāfatahu, fī tārīkh aḥad wa-tisʻīn wa-alf."

Translation of the colophon of manuscript 4. al-Tawḍīḥ fī ḥall ghawāmiḍ al-Tanqīḥ: "The drafting of this noble copy was completed in the month of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, on Tuesday, at noon, at Madrasat Qashīlā Sarāy, during the reign of Murād Kirāy Khān [probably Murād Giray Khān of Crimea, reigned 1678- 1683; lived 1627-1696], may God eternalize his caliphate. Dated in the year 1091 [of the Hijrah = April 1680]."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Risālah al-ʻAḍudīyah : manuscript / Mullā Muḥammad al-Ḥanafī al-Tabrīzī.
record.note: 1. Title of Sharḥ al-Risālah al-ʻAḍudīyah from reference sources.
2. Title of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Risālah al-ʻAḍudīyah supplied by Hartford Seminary.
3. Title of al-Risālah al-ʻAḍudīyah from reference sources.
4. Title of Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī al-ādāb from reference sources.
5. Title of al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah from reference sources.
6. Titel of Risālah fī muqaddimāt al-ʻulūm supplied by Hartford Seminary.
7. Title of Bayān al-ʻaks al-mustawī lil-muwajjahāt from folio 87a.
8. Title of al-Risālah al-Waladīyah fī ādāb al-baḥth wa-al-munāẓarah from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of Sharḥ al-Risālah al-ʻAḍudīyah: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi [nastaʻīn]. Laka al-Ḥamd. Jaʻla Allāh taʻālá mukhāṭaban tanbīhan ʻalá al-qurb, wa-li-anna al-lāʼiq bi-ḥāl al-ḥāmid an yulāḥiẓa al-maḥmūd awwalan, wa-ḥāẓiran [wa-ḥāḍiran], wa-mushāhadan, thumma bi-ḥamdihi [yaḥmaduhu]. Wa-istabān minhu wajh taqdīm qawlihi laka ʻalayya al-ḥamd, wa-in kān al-muqām li-kawnihi muqām al-ḥamd yaqtaḍī taqdīmahu ..."
Secundo folio of Sharḥ al-Risālah al-ʻAḍudīyah: bi-anna al-manhī ʻanhu huwa minnah lā imtinān.

2. Incipit of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Risālah al-ʻAḍudīyah: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi [nastaʻīn]. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá ifhām al-khiṭāb, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Rasūlihi al-mabʻūth li-iẓhār al-ṣawāb, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-mutaʼaddibīn bi-khayr al-ādāb. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi fāʼidah fāʼidah ʻujāb, bal zāʼidah lā tadkhulu fī al-ḥisāb, ʻalá al-sharḥ al-mashhūr bayna ulī al-albāb, lil-Risālah al-sharīfah al-ʻAḍudīyah fī al-ādāb, takshufu ʻan wujūh maqāṣidihi al-niqāb ..."
Secundo folio of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Risālah al-ʻAḍudīyah: wa-lām laka ayḍan yaḥtamilu an yakūna.

3. Incipit of al-Risālah al-ʻAḍudīyah: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Laka al-Ḥamdu wa-al-minnah, wa-ʻalá Nabīyika al-ṣalāh wa-al-taḥīyah. Idhā qulta bi-kalām, in kunta nāqilan fa-yuṭlabu al-ṣiḥḥah, aw, muddaʻiyan fa-al-dalīl ..."

4. Incipit of Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī al-ādāb: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yā man waffaqanā li-waẓāʼif al-baḥth. Wa-kalimat 'Yā' mushtarakah bayna al-aḥwāl al-thalāthah, falā yaḥtāju ilá tawjīh al-ʻAllāmah, wa-al-murād bi-hā ghāyat maʻnāhā, wa-hiya al-ijābah ..."
Secundo folio of Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī al-ādāb: wa-bi-al-taḥqīqāt al-muḥaqqaqāt aʻnī al-dalāʼil.

5. Incipit of al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Maqālah al-thāniyah fī al-qaḍāyā wa-aḥkāmihā, wa-fīhā muqaddimah wa-thalāthat fuṣūl. Ammā al-muqaddimah fa-fī taʻrīf al-qaḍīyah wa-aqsāmihā al-awwalīyah. al-Qaḍīyah qawl yaṣiḥḥu an yuqāla li-qāʼilihi innahu ṣādiq fīhi aw kādhib ..."
Secundo folio of al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah: fī qawlinā Zaydun huwa ʻālimun.

6. Incipit of Risālah fī muqaddimāt al-ʻulūm: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala mabādiʼ al-ʻulūm wasīlatan ilá maqāṣidinā, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad alladhī arshadanā bi-muqaddimāt ilá maṭālibinā. Fa-lā budda li-kull ṭālib an yaʻlama qabla al-shurūʻ fī maṭlūbihi wa-maqṣūdihi muqaddimat al-ʻilm al-mashrūʻ fīhi, li-anna al-ʻulūm ka-al-wuḍūʼ fī al-ṣalāh fī al-tawaqquf, wa-lā yūjadu al-ṣalāh bi-lā wuḍūʼ, fa-li-dhālika lā yaḥṣulu al-ʻilm bi-lā taqdīm muqaddimah, li-anna al-muqaddimah mā yatawaqqafu ʻalayhi al-shurūʻ fī al-ʻilm ..."
Secundo folio of Risālah fī muqaddimāt al-ʻulūm: ʻilm al-naḥw bi-uṣūl yuʻrafu bi-hā.
7. The poem in Ottoman Turkish on logic, starts with: "Hādhā Bayān al-ʻaks al-mustawī lil-muwajjahāt."

8. Incipit of al-Risālah al-Waladīyah fī ādāb al-baḥth wa-al-munāẓarah: "Bismillāh wa-bi-ḥamdihi, wa-ṣalātun wa-salām ʻalá Rasūlihi. Yaqūlu al-bāʼis al-faqīr Muḥammad al-madʻū bi-Sājiqlī Zādah, akramahu Allāh, subḥānuhu bi-al-falāḥ wa-al-saʻādah: Hādhihi risālah fī fann al-munāẓarah ʻamiltuhā laka yā walad wa-li-amthālika al-mubtadiʼīn, bāraka Allāh fīhā laka wa-li-man arādahā ghayruka. Wa-hādhā al-fann lā shakka fī istiḥbāb taḥṣīlihi, wa-innamā al-shakk fī wujūbihi ka-ghāyah ..."
Secundo folio of al-Risālah al-Waladīyah fī ādāb al-baḥth wa-al-munāẓarah: al-ṣuwar immā nāqil aw lā.
13.5 x 21 cm; written surface: varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: Remnant of dark brown leather on cover and flap.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some phrases and markings in red; some notes, commentaries and corrections on the margins; some texts within red frames; catchwords.
Inside the front cover: A statement about male and female slaves and the status of their offspring and their relation to their masters, according to Islamic law.
On the front leaf: Miscellaneous quotations in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish.
On folio 1a: Miscellaneous quotations on logic.
On folio 45a: An excerpt from an unidentified work on logic about the concept of "manʻ" (prohibition); the text has been crossed over.

On folio 87a-87b: A poem in Ottoman Turkish on logic, with a title in Arabic, as follows: "Hādhā Bayān al-ʻaks al-mustawī lil-muwajjahāt." It ends with the Arabic phrase: "Tammat shurūṭ al-ashkāl al-arbaʻah bi-ḥasab al-jihah lil-Fāḍil al-Ḥinjālī [?] al-Bahsanī, sanat 1214 [1799/1800]."

On folio 102b: Two excerpts: The first is from an unknown work about "al-taqaddum" (precedence) in Islamic law. The second is about the names of God and their number, quoted from Lawamiʻ al-sibāt [al-ṣifāt (?)] of al-Imām al-Rāzī (Probably "Lawāmiʻ al-bayyināt fī al-asmāʼ wa-al-ṣifāt" of Fakhr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn ʻUmar al-Rāzī, 1149 or 1150-1210).
1. Colophon of Sharḥ al-Risālah al-ʻAḍudīyah: "Tammat bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb, sanat 1178."
Translation of the colophon of Sharḥ al-Risālah al-ʻAḍudīyah: "It was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King, in the year 1178 [of the Hijrah = 1764/1765]."
2. Colophon of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá al-Risālah al-Ḥanafīyah: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb, sanat 1177."
Translation of the colophon of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá al-Risālah al-Ḥanafīyah: "The book was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King, in the year 1177 [of the Hijrah = 1763/1764]."
3. Colophon of al-Risālah al-ʻAḍudīyah: "Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah fī awāsiṭ shahr Jumādá al-Ākhir. Tamm."
Translation of the colophon of of al-Risālah al-ʻAḍudīyah: "This noble copy was completed in the Middle of Jumādá al-Ākhir. It is completed."

4. Colophon of Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī al-ādāb: "Qad tammat al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik dhī al-raḥmah al-kathīrah, ʻalá yad al-ḥaqīr Walī ibn Yūsuf, fī sanat arbaʻah wa-sittīn wa-miʼah wa-alf min Hijrat man irtadá bi-al-ghurar al-sharaf, wa-ṣallá Allāh taʻālá ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ʻalá sāʼir al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn ajmaʻīn. Sanat 1164."

Translation of the colophon of of Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī al-ādāb: "al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah was completed by the help of God, the King of abundant mercy, by the hand of the wretched Walī ibn Yūsuf, in the year 1164 of the Hijrah of Him who is garbed with magnanimous honor. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, on his family and on all the prophets and messengers. Dated in the year 1164 [of the Hijrah = 1750/1751]."
5. Colophon of al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah: "Wa-li-yakun hādhā ākhir al-kalām fī hādhihi al-risālah. Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb, sanat 1166."

Translation of the colophon of al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah: "Let this be the end of the discourse on this epistle. The book was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King, in the year 1166 [of the Hijrah = 1752/1753]."

6. Colophon of Risālah fī muqaddimat al-ʻulūm: The text ends with: "... Fa-ʻalayka ayyuhā al-ṭālib al-mustabṣirah [al-mustabṣir] maʻrifat muqaddimāt hādhihi al-umūr, wa-ahlamtahā [fa-in ahmaltahā] lā tanālu maqāṣidaka wa-maṭālibaka, fa-lā tanfaʻka. Tammat bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá."

Translation of the colophon of Risālah fī muqaddimāt al-ʻulūm: The text ends with: "... O discerning student! You must know the introductions to these subjects; because if you were to neglect them you will not be able to achieve your goals and pursuits. Subsequently, these will be of no benefit to you. It was completed by the help of God Almighty."
7. Colophon of the poem in Ottoman Turkish on logic: "Tammat shurūṭ al-ashkāl al-arbaʻah bi-ḥasab al-jihah, lil-Fāḍil al-Ḥinjālī [?] al-Bahsanī, sanat 1214."

Translation of the colophon of the poem in Ottoman Turkish on logic: "The conditions for the four patterns in regard to objective, by the Notable al-Ḥinjālī [?] al-Bahsanī, were completed, in the year 1214 [of the Hijrah = 1799/1800]."
8. Colophon of al-Risālah al-Waladīyah fī ādāb al-baḥth wa-al-munāẓarah: "Tamma sanat 1189."

Translation of the colophon of al-Risālah al-Waladīyah fī ādāb al-baḥth wa-al-munāẓarah: "It was completed in the year 1189 [of the Hijrah = 1775/1776]." Under the colophon is a verse of poetry in Ottoman Turkish.

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Mukhtaṣar al-Muntahá : manuscript / ʻAḍud al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Aḥmad al-Ījī.
record.note: Title from the flyleaf.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... ay, lā yūjibu dhālika ījāban awwalīyan, bal bi-al-ʻaraḍ, li-annahu yusahhilu al-ṣafrāʼ, wa-intiqāṣuhu ʻalá al-badan yūjibu tabarrudahu, wa-innamā al-bārid fa-huwa al-mubarrid bi-al-dhāt, wa-hādhā ghayr al-dhātī wa-al-ʻaraḍī bi-al-maʻná al-mutaqaddim. al-Khāmis, jaʻl al-natījatayn muqaddimah min muqaddimatay al-burhān bi-taghyīrin mā, wa-yusammá muṣādarah ..."
Secundo folio: ilá lafẓ kathīr li-maʻná kathīr.
13.5 x 18 cm; written surface: 9 x 13.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion.
In small good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings, corrections, and collations on the margins; No catchwords.

On the front of the flyleaf: "Mukhtaṣar Muntahá"; "Sharḥ Mukhtaṣar al-Muntahá. ʻAḍud"; "Yā Kubaykij"; An ownership statement: "Min mumlakāt al-faqīr Aḥmad Najīb, ʻufiya ʻanhu, [wa-]wālidayhi wa-ikhwānihi, 15 M [Muḥarram], sanat 1284 [of the Hijrah = 19 May 1867]"; A partially legible stamp, in the name of Muḥammad ... On the back of the flyleaf, the stamp reads: "Muḥammad sanat 1183 [of the Hijrah = 1769/1770].

Colophon: "Wa-qad waqaʻa al-farāgh lil-qalam ʻan sakb al-ʻabarāt ʻalá wujūh al-ṣafaḥāt, wa-wuṣulihi limā yatamannāhu bi-asraʻ al-ḥarakāt, ʻalá yaday al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-faqīr ʻAbd Allāh ibn Aḥmad ibn Yūsuf, najjāhum Allāh fī al-dārayn ʻan al-taʼassuf, fī baldat Anqarah, yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ, al-rābiʻ min shahr Ramaḍān al-mubārak, sanat tisʻīn wa-thamānimiʼah. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "The pen stopped shedding tears on the faces of the pages, having reached what it hoped for in the fastest of movements, by the hand of the feeble and poor servant, ʻAbd Allāh ibn Aḥmad ibn Yūsuf, may God deliver them all from regret in the two abodes, in the city of Anqarah [Ankara (Turkey)], on Wednesday, the fourth of the blessed month of Ramaḍān, of the year 890 [of the Hijrah = 23 September 1485]. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 al-Ḥāshiyah al-Sharīfīyah ʻalá al-Mukhtaṣar al-ʻAḍudī : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Sayyid al-Sharīf al-Jurjānī.
record.note: Title of al-Ḥāshiyah al-Sharīfīyah ʻalá al-Mukhtaṣar al-ʻAḍudī from colophon (folio 151b).
Title of Masāʼil al-taḥrīm supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of al-Ḥāshiyah al-Sharīfīyah: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qawluhu: al-Ḥamd lillāh, ardafa al-tasmiyah bi-al-taḥmīd fī muftataḥ al-kalām, iqtiḍāʼan li-mā warada fī al-akhbār iqtidāʼan bi-ṭarīqat al-akhyār wa-adāʼan li-baʻḍ ḥuqūq mā istaghraqathu min ḍurūb al-iḥsān allatī min jumlatihā al-tawthīq li-mithl hādhā al-taṣnīf al-ʻaẓīm al-shān ..."
Secundo folio of al-Ḥāshiyah al-Sharīfīyah ʻalá al-Mukhtaṣar al-ʻAḍudī: ilá ṣirāṭin mustaqīm wa-kāna.

Incipit of Masāʼil al-taḥrīm: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qawluhu: Hātān masʼalatān mimmā yataʻallaqu bi-al-taḥrīm, ay, hātān masʼalatān min al-masāʼil allatī tataʻallaqu bi-al-taḥrīm, aw, allatān humā mutaʻalliqatān bi-al-taḥrīm. Qawluhu: Iḥdāhumā, innahu yajūzu an yuḥarrama wāḥid mubham min ashyāʼ muʻayyanah, khaṣṣaṣa al-wāḥid wa-al-ashyāʼ bi-al-ṣifatayn, li-anna taḥrīm wāḥid muʻayyan min al-ashyāʼ al-muʻayyanah mimmā lā khilāf fī jawāzih, kamā anna taḥrīm wāḥid mubham min al-ashyāʼ al-mubhamah lā shakka fī imtināʻih ..."
Secundo folio of Masāʼil al-taḥrīm: al-jins hunā bal akthar mā yuṭlaqu.
12.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 6 x 14-14.5 cm; 20-21 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather; back cover missing.
In good medium naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; the phrases of the original texts preceded by the word qawluhu in red; catchwords.

Colophon of al-Ḥāshiyah al-Sharīfīyah ʻalá al-Mukhtaṣar al-ʻAḍudī: "Tammat al-Ḥāshiyah al-Sharīfīyah ʻalá al-Mukhtaṣar al-ʻAḍudī ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-rājī ilá raḥmat Rabbih al-Ghanī, ʻAlī ibn Mīrzā Ḥusayn al-Astarābādī, ʻufi[ya] ʻanhumā bi-ḥaqq Muḥammad wa-ālihi al-ṭāhirīn."

Translation of the colophon of al-Ḥāshiyah al-Sharīfīyah ʻalá al-Mukhtaṣar al-ʻAḍudī: "al-Ḥāshiyah al-Sharīfīyah ʻalá al-Mukhtaṣar al-ʻAḍudī was completed by the hand of the feeble servant, who aspires for the mercy of his Rich Lord, ʻAlī ibn Mīrzā Ḥusayn al-Astarābādī, may both of them be forgiven, for the sake of Muḥammad and his virtuous family."

The text of Masāʼil al-taḥrīm ends with: "... wa-ammā idhā kāna al-murād taṣawwur mā quṣida bi-lafẓ wa-tarattaba ʻalayhi al-aḥkām al-sharʻīyah bi-al-nisbah ilá man yaʻlamu al-Muṣḥaf wa-al-aqsām al-thalāthah, lākinnahu lam yaʻrif anna al-Qurʼān ʻalá ayyihimā yuṭlaqu fa-lā, idh takhṣīṣuhu bi-al-qism al-awwal mumtāz ʻan al-ākharayn, wa-yuʻlamu annahu al-dalīl wa-turattabu ʻalayhi al-aḥkām. Qawluhu: Man manaʻa al-tilāwah wa-al-mass muḥdathan, in urīda al-ḥadath al-aṣghar."
Colophon of Masāʼil al-taḥrīm: "Tammat bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb."
Translation of the colophon of Masāʼil al-taḥrīm: "It was completed by the help of God the Abundant Giving King."
On folio 1a: "Ḥāshiyah bar Mukhtaṣar-i uṣūl."

On folio 153a: A quotation about the definition of "al-qaḍāʼ wa-al-qadar" (divine decree and destiny), from "Sharḥ Mafātīḥ lil-Qāḍī Nāṣir al-Dīn al-Bayḍāwī" (Bayḍāwī, ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUmar, -1286?; the work could not be identified).

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá al-Muḥākamāt : manuscript / Ḥabīb Allāh Mīrzā Jān al-Shīrāzī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

On the front leaf: "Ḥāshiyat al-Mazājān [al-Mīrzā Jān] ʻalá al-Muḥākamāt"; "Ḥāshiyat Mīrzā Jān ʻalá Sharḥ al-Ṭūsī ʻalá al-Ishārāt wa-ʻalá Muḥākamāt al-Shīrāzī, byana Sharḥay al-Ishārāt lil-Imām al-Rāzī wa-al-Ṭūsī, raḥimahum Allāh."

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Muḥ[ākamāt]. Bal yakfī fī ithbātihi immā mujarrad mulāḥaẓat taṣawwurātihi aw al-naẓar al-sābiq. Aqūlu: Lā budda ʻalá man yatatabbaʻu fuṣūl al-kitāb anna kathīran min al-aḥkām al-muṣaddarah bi-al-tashbīh yustanbaṭu min al-naẓar fī al-faṣl al-sābiq ʻalá ṭarīq al-fikr wa-al-iktisāb, wa-in kāna baʻḍuhā mimmā yakūnu istinbāṭuhā min al-faṣl al-sābiq ʻalá sabīl al-iktisāb, fa-al-farq bayna al-baʻḍ al-awwal wa-bayna al-muṣaddar bi-lafẓ al-ishārah immā li-suhūlat al-kasb minhā wa-ʻadamuhā ..."
Secundo folio: al-muqaddamah bi-al-qaḍīyah la-kāna aḥsan.
11 x 20 cm; written surface: 6 x 13.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather with flap.

In fair small and closely written naskh script, in black ink, on white paper (some pages tinted blue or red); some wormholes with loss of text; headings, some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the label pasted to the front cover: "[Ḥ]āshiyah ʻalá al-Muḥākam[āt] lil-Ṭūsī fī al-ḥikmat [al-ḥikmah]."
On the front leaf: An ownership statement: "Istaṣḥabahu al-faqīrān Shahr ibn Ḥāfiẓ Muḥammad Ṣāliḥ sanat 1208, wa-Yūsuf al-Rasnawī ʻafá [... al-ʻafw (?)] al-ghanī."
On folio 1a: Two ownership statements: "Istaṣḥabahu al-faqīr Ibrāhīm Asʻad Bāshā Zādah"; "Istaṣḥabahu al-faqīr Aḥmad Kamāl nāla mā fī bālihi min al-āmāl" (in pencil).
On folio 1a: A defaced endowment statement "waqf".

Colophon: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá man huwa afḍal al-anām wa-al-ikrām [bi-al-ikrām]. Qad faraghtu min taswīd hādhihi al-ḥāshiyah al-jalīlah al-sharīfah al-mutaʻalliqah bi-al-Muḥākamāt wa-al-sharḥ al-sharīf lil-Ishārāt, min muṣannafāt al-fāḍil al-ʻālim Mullā Mirzā Jān, fī yawm al-Sabt min shahr Dhī al-Ḥijjah al-ḥarām, fī baldat al-Aṣfāhān, fī Madrasat al-Jiddah al-ʻAlīyah, wa-anā al-mudhnib al-ḥaqīr al-muḥtāj ilá Luṭfihi al-kathīr, Khawājah Muḥammad ibn Ḥājjī Muṣṭafá al-Barzī. Allāhumma faqqih [faqqihhu] lil-ʻilm wa-al-ʻamal wa-al-tawbah wa-al-inābah, bi-ḥaqq al-Nabī wa-ālihi al-amjād. Fī sanat sittīn baʻda al-alf."

Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God on the completion. May prayer and peace be upon Him who is the worthiest of mankind of honor [Prophet Muḥammad]. I finished drafting this glorious and honorable Gloss on al-Muḥākamāt, the venerable Commentary on al-Ishārāt, authored by the notable scholar Mullā Mirzā Jān, on Saturday, in the sacred month of Dhī al-Ḥijjah, in the city of al-Aṣfāhān [Iṣfahān (Iran)], at Madrasat al-Jiddah al-ʻAlīyah, I, the wretched sinner, who needs His [God's] abundant kindness, Khawājah Muḥammad ibn Ḥājjī Muṣṭafá al-Barzī. O God! Teach him to indulge himself in scholarship, work, repentance, and penitence, for the sake of the Prophet and His glorious family. Dated in the year 1060 [of the Hijrah = 26 November 1650]."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat Shāh Ḥusayn : manuscript / Shāh Ḥusayn al-ʻAjamī.
record.note: Title of manuscript 1. Ḥāshiyat Shāh Ḥusayn from reference sources.
Title of manuscript 2. Qarah Ḥāshiyah from folio 55a.
Title of manuscript 3. Sharḥ al-Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth from reference sources.
Title of manuscript 4. Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Waḍʻīyah from reference sources.
Title of manuscript 5. al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah from incipit (folio 143a): "... wa-sammaytuhu bi-al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah fī al-qawāʻid al-manṭiqīyah ..."
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of manuscript 1. Ḥāshiyat Shāh Ḥusayn: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qawluhu: Salaka ṭarīqat al-ʻamal. Iʻlam inna min adāb al-muṣannifīn an yabtadiʼū fī awwal taṣānīfihim bi-kalām mushtamil ʻalá lafẓ al-ḥamd, baʻda an yaḥṣula al-tayammun bi-al-tasmiyah, li-yaḥṣula al-imtithāl bi-Ḥadīthay al-ibtidāʼ, wa-huwa awlá min al-ibtidāʼ janānan wa-talaffuẓan min ghayr kitābah, wa-in kāna al-imtithāl ḥāṣilan bi-himā ayḍan ..."
Secundo folio of manuscript 1. Ḥāshiyat Shāh Ḥusayn: bi-al-fiʻl wa-qad yakūnu bi-al-qawl.

Incipit of manuscript 2. Qarah Ḥāshiyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qawluhu: al-Minnah ʻalaynā. Ih. Salaka ṭarīq al-ʻamal bi-al-Ḥadīth maʻnan, li-anna ḥaqīqat al-ḥamd ʻinda al-muḥaqqiqīn iẓhār al-ṣifāt al-kamālīyah, dūna al-qawl al-makhṣūṣ. Lā yuqālu: Kayfa yaṣuḥḥu al-thanāʼ bi-mā huwa madhmūmun ʻaqlan wa-sharʻan, idh qad qīla al-minnah tahdumu al-ṣanīʻah ..."
Secundo folio of manuscript 2. Qarah Ḥāshiyah: Allāh taʻālá al-ẓāhir annahu.

Incipit of manuscript 3. Sharḥ al-Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Rasūlihi Muḥammad wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-qad qāla al-Imām al-muḥaqqiq wa-al-humām al-mudaqqiq, sulṭān al-ʻulamāʼ al-mutaʼakhkhirīn, jāmiʻ jamīʻ fuḍalāʼ al-ʻulamāʼ al-mutaqaddimīn, Mawlānā Shams al-Millah wa-al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Samarqandī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-ghufrānih, wa-askanahu bi-aʻlá jinānih: al-Minnah ʻalaynā, man munna ʻalayhi, li-Wāhib afḍal al-niʻam, huwa niʻmat al-ʻaql, wa-dhālika al-Wāhib huwa Allāh taʻālá ..."
Secundo folio of manuscript 3. Sharḥ al-Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth: wa-ʻalá al-thānī wijdān mā yūṣilu ilá al-maṭlūb.

Incipit of manuscript 4. Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Waḍʻīyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī khaṣṣa al-insān bi-maʻrifat awḍāʻ al-kalām wa-mabānīhi, wa-jaʻala al-ḥurūf uṣūl kalimihi wa-ẓurūf maʻānīhi, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-mushtaqq min maṣdar al-faḍl wa-al-ḥikam, al-jāmiʻ li-maḥāsin al-afʻāl wa-makārim al-shiyam, al-mūṣal bi-alfāẓihi anwāʻ al-saʻādah wa-al-hudá, al-muḍmar fī ishārātihi aṣnāf al-ḥikam wa-al-tuqá, Muḥammad al-madhkūr ismuhu fī al-Tawrāt wa-al-Injīl ..."
Secundo folio of manuscript 4. Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Waḍʻīyah: al-imārah ʻalá qāmatih.

Incipit of manuscript 5. al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī abdaʻa niẓām al-wujūd wa-ikhtaraʻa māhīyāt al-ashyāʼ bi-muqtaḍá al-jūd, wa-anshaʼa bi-qudratihi anwāʻ al-jawāhir al-ʻaqlīyah, wa-afāḍa bi-raḥmatihi muḥirrikāt al-ajrām al-falakīyah, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá dhawāt al-anfus al-qudsīyah al-munazzahah ʻan al-kudūrāt al-insīyah, khuṣūṣan minhum, ʻalá Muḥammad, ṣāḥib al-āyāt wa-al-muʻjizāt, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-tābiʻīn lil-ḥujaj al-bayyināt ..."
Secundo folio of manuscript 5. al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah: wa-al-amāthil quṭb al-aʻālī malik al-maʻālī.
13.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 7 x 14.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Dark brown leather on spine, with remnant of it on cover.

In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of the original texts preceded by the word "Qawluhu" (His saying) in purple; some headings and markings in purple; some commentaries and corrections on the margins; texts within double purple frames; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Shāh Ḥusayn. Qarah Ḥāshiyah. Masʻūd Rūmī. Ḥanafīyah min al-ādāb. ʻAlī Qūshjī ʻalá al-Waḍʻīyah. Taṣawwurāt. Taṣdīqāt min al-manṭiq."
On folio 1a: A statement dated in the year 1138 of the Hijrah (1725/1726): "Yā ḥafīẓ Kubaykij. Sanat 1138." And two triangular designs in purple.
At the head of folio 1b: "Shāh Ḥusayn."
On folio 55a: "Qarah Ḥāshiyah."
At the head of folio 93a: "Masʻūd Rūmī."
On folio 125a: An excerpt from a gloss on a commentary on the Qurʼān.
At the head of folio 126a: "ʻAlī Qūshjī."

To the right of the colophon of manuscript 4 (folio 140b), the copyist wrote two verses of poetry: "al-Khaṭṭ yabqá zamānan baʻda kātibihi // wa-kātibu al-khaṭṭ taḥta al-arḍ madfūnā. Yā Rabbi ighfir li-ʻabdin kāna kātibahu // Yā qāriʼa al-khaṭṭi qul billāhi āmīnā."
On folio 142a: "Taṣawwurāt."
On folio 143a: "... wa-sammaytuhu bi-al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah fī al-qawāʻid al-manṭiqīyah, wa-rattabtuhu ʻalá muqaddimah wa-thalāth maqālāt wa-khātimah ..."

Colophon: of manuscript 1. Ḥāshiyat Shāh Ḥusayn: "Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min hādhihi al-kitābah wa-al-taḥrīr ʻalá yad al-ḍaʻīf al-faqīr, al-muḥtāj ilá raḥmat al-Malik al-Qadīr, al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá ibn Murtaḍá, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi, bi-luṭfihi wa-karamihi lā bi-istiḥqāqihi. Fī sanat arbaʻata ʻashar wa-miʼah wa-alf."

Translation of the colophon of manuscript 1. Ḥāshiyat Shāh Ḥusayn: "The copying and editing was completed by the hand of the feeble poor who needs the mercy of the Mighty King, al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá ibn Murtaḍá, may God forgive him and his parents and treat them and him with kindness, for His benevolence and generosity, not for his [the copyist's] deservingness. In the year 1114 [of the Hijrah = 1702/1703]."
Colophon of manuscipt 2. Qarah Ḥāshiyah: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām, wa-ʻalá Rasūlihi afḍal al-salām. Tamma, bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá wa-luṭfihi, taḥrīruhu, fī sanat khamsata ʻashar wa-miʼah wa-alf."

Translation of the colophon of manuscipt 2. Qarah Ḥāshiyah: "Praise be to God for the completion. May the best peace be upon His Messenger. The copy was completed by the help of God Almighty and His benevolence, in the year 1115 [of the Hijrah = 1703/1704]."
Colophon of manuscript 3. Sharḥ al-Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth: "Tamma al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb. Ḥurrira fī sanat khamsat ʻashar wa-miʼah wa-alf."

Translation of the colophon of manuscript 3. Sharḥ al-Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth: "The book was completed by the help of God, the Abundant Giving King. Copied in the year 1115 [of the Hijrah = 1703/1704]."

Colophon of manuscript 4. Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Waḍʻīyah: "Tamma Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Waḍʻīyah al-Jurjānī [lil-Jurjānī]. Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min hādhihi al-kitābah wa-al-taḥrīr ʻalá yad al-ḍaʻīf al-faqīr, al-muḥtāj ilá raḥmat al-Malik al-Qadīr, al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá ibn Murtaḍá, al-mansūb ilá al-Qarahʹḥiṣār al-Sharqī, ghafara Allāh lahu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi, fī yawm al-Jumʻah, waqt al-ishrāq, min al-shahr al-Shaʻbān al-sharīf, sharrafanā Allāh wa-sāʼir al-muʼminīn bi-amthālih, li-sanat thalāthata ʻashar wa-miʼah wa-alf."

Translation of the colophon of manuscript 4. "The commentary on 'al-Risālah al-Waḍʻīyah' of al-Jurjānī is completed. The transcription of this copy was completed by the hand of the feeble poor, who is in need of the mercy of the Mighty King, al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá ibn Murtaḍá, of al-Qarahʹḥiṣār al-Sharqī [Eastern Qarahʹḥiṣār], may God forgive him and his parents, and treat them and him with kindness, at sunrise, on Friday, in the noble month of Shaʻbān, may we and all Muslims be honored by months like it, of the year 1113 [of the Hijrah = 6 January 1702]."

Colophon of 'al-Maqālah al-ūlá' (First article) of al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah (manuscript 5, folio 149a): "Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min hādhihi al-kitābah wa-al-taḥrīr ʻalá yad ʻabd [al-ʻabd] al-ḍaʻīf al-faqīr al-muḥtāj al-rājī ilá raḥmat al-Malik al-Qadīr al-Kabīr, al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá ibn Murtaḍá, ʻafā ʻanhumā al-ʻafw al-ʻAlī, bi-luṭfihi. Fī sanat 11103 [1113 of the Hijrah = 1701/1702]. M."

Translation of the colophon of 'al-Maqālah al-ūlá' (First article) of al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah (manuscript 5, folio 149a): "The transcription of this copy was completed by the hand of the feeble poor servant, who needs the mercy of the Almighty Great King, al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá ibn Murtaḍá, may the Most High forgive both of them by His abundant kindness. Dated in the year 11103 [1113 of the Hijrah = 1701/1702]. M."

Colophon of manuscript 5: "Wa-li-yakun hādhā ākhir al-kalām fī hādhihi al-risālah. Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min hādhihi al-kitābah wa-al-taḥrīr ʻalá yad al-ḍaʻīf al-faqīr, al-muḥtāj ilá raḥmat al-Malik al-Qadīr, al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá ibn Murtaḍá, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi. Li-sanat thalāthata ʻashar wa-miʼah wa-alf."

Translation of the colophon of al-manuscript 5. "Let this be the end of the discourse in this epistle. The transcription of this copy was completed by the hand of the feeble poor, who needs the mercy of the Almighty King, al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá ibn Murtaḍá, may God forgive him and his parents, and treat them and him with kindness. In the year 1113 [of the Hijrah = 1701/1702]."

record.title: 880-02 al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah fī al-qawāʻid al-manṭiqīyah : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn ʻUmar al-Qazwīnī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a: "... wa-sammaytuhu bi-al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah fī al-qawāʻid al-manṭiqīyah ..."
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh [alladhī] abdaʻa niẓām al-wujūd wa-ikhtaraʻa māhīyāt al-ashyāʼ bi-muqtaḍá al-jūd. Anshaʼa bi-qudratihi anwāʻ al-jawāhir al-ʻaqlīyah, wa-afāḍa bi-raḥmatihi ḥarakāt al-ajrām al-falakīyah, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá dhawāt al-anfus al-qudsīyah al-munazzahah ʻan al-kudūrāt al-insīyah, khuṣūṣan ʻalá Muḥammad ṣāḥib al-āyāt wa-al-muʻjizāt, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-tābiʻīn lil-ḥujaj al-bayyināt ..."
Secundo folio: wa-sharaʻtu fī thabtihi wa-kitābatih.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 10 x 16.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Matn al-Shamsīyah fī ʻilm al-manṭiq lil-Kātibī, ʻufiya ʻanhu. Āmīn."
In the introduction (folio 1b), the author states that he presented his book to a certain dignitary: Shams al-Dunyā wa-al-Dīn Abū al-Muẓaffar Muḥammad ... ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Juwaynī.

Colophon: "Wa-li-yakun hādhā ākhir al-kalām fī hādhihi al-risālah. Tammat kitābatuhā bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Let this be the end of the discourse on this epistle. The copy was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Shamsīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Quṭb al-Taḥtānī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Inna abhá durar tunẓam bi-banān al-bayān, wa-azhar zahr yuntharu fī ardān al-adhhān, ḥamdu mubdiʻ anṭaq al-mawjūdāt bi-āyāt wujūb wujūdih, wa-shukr munʻimin aghraq al-makhlūqāt fī biḥār afḍālih wa-jūdih. Talaʼlaʼa fī ẓulam al-layālī anwār ḥikmatihi al-bāhirah, wa-istanār ʻalá ṣafaḥāt al-ayyām athār salṭanatihi al-qāhirah ..."
Secundo folio: fīhā al-khurūj al-ṭabīʻīyah. wa-lam azal udāfiʻu qawman baʻda qawm.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 14 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 21 quires, some numbered)

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; some diagrams on the categories in logic; the phrases of al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah are written in red, or preceded by the word "Qāla" (He said) and the commentary by the word "Aqūlu" (I say) in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "al-Quṭb ʻalá al-Shamsīyah."
On folio 2a: "Sharḥ al-Quṭb ʻalá al-Shamsīyah lil-Kātibī fī ʻilm al-manṭiq."

Colophon: "Wa-li-yakun hādhā ākhir mā aradnā īrādahu fī hādhihi al-awrāq. Fa-al-ḥamdu li-Wājib al-Wujūd wa-mufīḍ al-khayr wa-al-arzāq. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá man faḍal al-bashar ʻalá al-iṭlāq, Muḥammad, al-mabʻūth li-tatmīm makārim al-akhlāq, wa-ʻalá ālihi maṣābīḥ al-dujá, wa-aṣḥābihi mafātīḥ al-ḥijá. Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih ṣabīḥat yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak, li-thalāth layālin baqīna min shahr Rajab al-fard, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1210, ʻashr wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām."

Translation of the colophon: "Let this be the end of what we intended to introduce in these leaves. Praise be to Him Who is Existent by Necessity, the Overflower of Good and Sustenance. May prayer and peace be on the best of mankind, without exception, Muḥammad, who was sent to fulfil the high moral standards, and on his family the lamps in darkness, and on his companions the keys of acumen. It was completed by the praise of God Almighty, His help and His abundant benevolence, in the morning of blessed Saturday, three nights remaining from the unique month of Rajab, of the year 1210 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and peace be upon him."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ Īsāghūjī : manuscript / Muṣliḥ al-Dīn al-Surūrī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala al-manṭiq khāṣṣat al-insān, wa-ṣayyarahu ṣāḥib al-maʻānī wa-al-bayān. Wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyaih Muḥammad dhī al-nuṭq wa-al-tibyān, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi alladhīna fāqū ʻalá ahl al-lisān. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-Surūrī ibn Shaʻbān: Lammā kāna baʻḍ al-ikhwān shāriʻan fī al-manṭiq bi-al-idhʻān, arāda min al-dāʻī al-rājī ḥawāshī li-Sharḥ Īsāghūjī, fa-jamaʻtu min al-ḥawāshī wa-al-shurūḥ mā yufīdu al-tawḍīḥ fī al-mashrūḥ ..."
Secundo folio: alladhī yalzamu min farḍ ʻadamuhu muḥāl.
15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 15.5 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: In a yellow thin cardboard cover that used to belong to a printed edition of Nahj al-Balāghah.

In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of the commentary of al-Kātī preceded by the word "Qāla" and the gloss of al-Surūrī by "Aqūlu" in red; No notes or corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-Surūrī ʻalá Ḥusām Kātī. M."

On folio 1a: An endowment statement (waqf): "Waqf. Waqafa hādhā al-kitāb al-Sayyid Ḥasan ibn al-marḥūm al-Sayyid ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Ṣawwāf waqfan ʻāmman sharʻīyan ʻalá man yantafiʻu bi-hi min al-Muslimīn, wa-ashraṭa ʻalayhi al-naẓar ilá akhīhi al-Sayyid ʻAlī al-Ṣawwāf, thumma min baʻdihi ʻalá awlādihi al-arshad fī al-arshad, thumma min baʻd inqirāḍihim ʻalá awraʻ fuqahāʼ al-Shāfiʻīyah. Taḥrīran fī 7 Rabīʻ Awwal, sanat 1222."
Colophon: "Wa-li-yakun hādhā mā aradnā dhikrahu min al-ḥawāshī ʻalá Sharḥ Īsāghūjī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. M."
Translation of the colophon: "Let this be what we intended to mention of the glosses on the Commentary on Īsāghūjī, may God have mercy upon him [sic.]."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ Umm al-barāhīn fī ʻilm al-kalām : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Manṣūr al-Hudʹhudī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī shahidat bi-wujūdihi jamīʻ al-kāʼināt, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-mabʻūth bi-al-āyāt al-wāḍiḥāt, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-al-tābiʻīn lahum fī al-karāmāt ilá Yawm al-Dīn. al-Ḥamd lillāh wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. al-Ḥamd huwa al-thanāʼ bi-al-lisān bi-al-jamīl min al-awṣāf, wa-al-afʻāl, ka-al-ʻilm wa-al-jūd bi-al-minan, wa-huwa ḍidd al-dhamm alladhī huwa al-thanāʼ bi-al-qabīḥ min al-awṣāf wa-al-afʻāl ka-al-jahl wa-al-bukhl ..."
Secundo folio: al-Shaykh, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu.
17 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 14.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 3 quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Umm al-barāhīn fī ʻilm al-kalām" in red. No commentaries or corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ al-Sanūsīyah."
On folio 28a: An excerpt (crossed over) from an unidentified work about the benefits of prayer.
Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihā 5 Muḥarram, sanat 88, thamāniyah wa-thamānūn wa-miʼatān baʻda alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Āmīn."
Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed on 5 Muḥarram, of the year 88, [i.e., 1288 of the Hijrah of the Prophet], prayer and peace be upon Him. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 al-Qaws al-tāmm fī masʼalat al-aqdām : manuscript / Aḥmad ʻAyyād.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-Malik al-ʻAllām, dhī al-jalāl wa-al-ikrām, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Sayyid al-anām wa-miṣbāḥ al-ẓalām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-jillah al-aʻlām. Wa-baʻd, fa-qad waqaʻa al-baḥth wa-al-suʼāl ʻan masʼalat al-aqdām allatī dhakarahā baʻḍ al-mashāyikh li-maʻrifat waqt al-ẓuhr, wa-hiya ithnay ʻashar ḥarfan, kull ḥarf li-shahr min al-shuhūr al-Qibṭīyah ..."
Secundo folio: li-kull khamsat ayyām khamsat ayyām.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 15 cm; 10-20 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Wa-hādhihi risālah tusammá al-Qaws al-tāmm fī masʼalat al-aqdām, jamʻ al-Shaykh Aḥmad ʻAyyād, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, wa-aʻāda ʻalaynā min barakātihi. Āmīn."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-li-raʼs al-ʻAqrab wa-al-Ḥūt wyh, ay, sittat aqdām wa-rubʻ. Wa-li-raʼs al-Qaws wa-al-Dalw ḥyh, ay, thamāniyat aqdām wa-rubʻ. Wa-li-raʼs al-Jadī ṭk, ay, tisʻat aqdām wa-thulth, ʻalá hādhihi al-ṣūrah ..."

record.title: 880-02 Kifāyat al-muqtaṣid al-ḥamīd ʻalá Khulāṣat al-tawḥīd : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Barr al-Ṣaʻīdī al-Ḥawtakī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aqāma ʻalá wujūdihi al-burhān, wa-amaranā bi-al-taklīf li-baʻḍ ṣifātihi al-wāḍiḥah fī al-bayān, wa-aʻadda li-dhālika mā lā yuʻayyanu [?] min naʻīm al-jinān, wa-asʻda aḥbābahu bi-ruʼyat dhātihi al-ʻalīyah fī al-iʻlān, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá man iṣṭafāhu al-Raḥīm al-Raḥmān ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu ... ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Barr al-Ṣaʻīdī al-Ḥawtakī ... Hādhihi masāʼil shāmilah ghayr ghāmiḍah jaʻalatuhā khidmatan li-manẓūmat Shaykhinā ... ʻAlī al-shahīr bi-al-Najjār ... wa-sammaytuhā Kifāyat al-muqtaṣid al-ḥamīd ʻalá Khulāṣat al-tawḥīd ..."
Secundo folio: yaqūlu lam yaqul qāla.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 12 x 16.5 cm; 24-26 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of the verses of Khulāṣat al-tawḥīd in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā sharḥ Kifāyat al-muqtaṣid al-ḥamīd ʻalá khulāṣat al-tawḥīd, lil-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil al-ʻallāmah Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Ḥawtakī, nafaʻanī Allāh bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Wa-qad waqafahā al-madhkūr [?] li-kull man arāda al-nafʻ bi-hā waqfan ṣaḥīḥan sharʻīyan, wa-al-nāẓir ʻalá dhālika Sayyidī wa-Mawlāy wa-thiqatī al-Shaykh ʻAlī, nāẓim al-matn, nafaʻanī Allāh bihim, wa-darajanī maʻahum yawm al-fazaʻ al-akbar. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Kataba hādhā wa-ḥaḍarahu al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Karīm Muṣṭafá al-Asyūṭī, tābiʻ al-Shaykh Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Qāḍī, maddahu Allāh bi-madadihi ilá Yawm al-Qiyāmah. Āmīn." Followed by an invocation in five verses of poetry.
Colophon: No colophon. The text ends with an invocation and prayers on the Prophet Muḥammad.

record.title: 880-02 Tadqīqāt nafīsah ʻalá ākhir al-Taḥrīr : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Ujhūrī al-Shāfiʻī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Bāb Ummahāt al-awlād. Khatama al-muṣannif kitābahu, kaghayrihi, bi-abwāb al-ʻitq, rajāʼ an yuʻtiqahu Allāh min al-nār, wa-akhkhara ʻanhā hādhā al-bāb, li-anna al-ʻitq fīhi yastaʻqibu al-mawt alladhī huwa khātimat amr al-ʻabd, wa-yatarattabu al-ʻitq fīhi ʻalá ʻamal ʻamilahu al-ʻabd ..."
Secundo folio: sawāʼ al-munjaz wa-al-muʻallaq.
17 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16.5 cm; 23-25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 2 numbered quires).
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of Taḥrīr Tanqīḥ al-Lubāb in red; some commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Tadqīqāt nafīsah ʻalá ākhir al-Taḥrīr, lil-Imām al-humām al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Ujuhūrī al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá."

Colophon: "Wa-wāfaqa al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-khatm al-mubārak yawm al-Aḥad, li-arbaʻ layālin maḍayna min Rajab al-fard, min shuhūr sanat 1177, sabʻah wa-sabʻīn, bi-taqdīm al-sinīn ʻalá al-muwaḥḥadah, wa-miʼah wa-alf min al-Hijrah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy of this blessed conclusion was completed on Sunday, four nights having passed from the unique month of Rajab, of the year 1177 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [8 January 1764], may the best prayer and peace be upon Him. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Umm al-barāhīn fī ʻilm al-kalām : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn ʻalá al-qawm al-kāfirīn. Hādhihi ʻaqīdah fī al-tawḥīd, fa-man ʻarafa maʻāniyahā nafat ʻanhu al-taqlīd wa-yaʻrifu rabbahu annahu faʻʻālun li-mā yurīd. al-Ḥamdu lillāh, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūl Allāh. Iʻlam inna al-ḥukm al-ʻaqlī yanḥaṣiru fī thalāthat aqsām: al-Wujūb wa-al-istiḥālah wa-al-jawāz. Wa-kullun yanqasimu ilá ḍarūrī wa-naẓarī. Fa-al-wājib mā lā yutaṣawwaru fī al-ʻaqlī [al-ʻaql] ʻadamuhu ka-ittiṣāf al-jurm bi-al-ḥarakah wa-al-sukūn ..."
Secundo folio: ḥaqīqat al-wujūd fa-huwa alladhī
15.5 x 22 cm; written surface: 11 x 16 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; keywords in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi mauqaddimah fī al-tawḥīd, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Sayyidī Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Āmīn. M."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Dakhalat fī mulk al-faqīr ilá Allāh ʻabduhu Muḥammad al-Najjārī. Fiḍḍah 1."
On folio 1a: An invocation by Muḥammad Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Najjārī.

Colophon: "Intahá bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi. Wa-kafā. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīna iṣṭafá. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah sanat 1177, awwal shahr Muḥarram al-ḥarām. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn. M. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "It was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. This is adequate. May prayer and peace be upon His servants whom He has chosen. God suffices us, He is the best advocate. There is no power nor might except in God the Almighty the All Powerful. This blessed copy was completed in the year 1177 [of the Hijrah], in the beginning of the sacred month of Muḥarram [12 July 1763]. Praise be to God in all circumstances. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad. May God pray on him and grant him peace. Amen. Āmen. M. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and companions, and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Muʻaddil al-ṣalāh : manuscript / Muḥammad Afandī al-Burkawī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a and the paper wrapper.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī amara ʻibādahu bi-iqāmat al-ṣalāh wa-taʻdīlihā, wa-jaʻalahā raʼs al-dīn wa-ʻurwat al-Islām wa-afḍal aʻmālihā, wa-nūran wa-najātan wa-miftāḥan, wa-muṭfiʼ al-nīrān, wa-burhānān wa-mīzānan fāriqan bayna al-kufr wa-al-īmān, wa-ʻimādan wa-asāsan wa-qurrat ʻayn al-ḥabīb, wa-awwal mā yuḥāsabu bi-hi al-ʻabd, wa-kaffārat al-dhunūb, wa-khayr al-aʻmāl ..."
Secundo folio: wa-qad waqaʻa ilayya fī hādhā al-shān ishārah.
15 x 21 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 14.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In paper wrapper.
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; many wormholes with some loss of text; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Muʻaddil ṣalāh."
On the paper wrapper (in pencil): "Kitāb Muʻaddil al-ṣalāh."

Colophon: "Tamma taṣnīfuhu bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá wa-tawfīqih. Tamma kitāb hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah fī baʻd al-fajr, fī yawm thamāniyah wa-ʻashar min shahr Dh[ī] al-Qaʻd[ah], fī sanat tisʻ wa-tisʻīn wa-alf. Ḥarrarahu al-faqīr al-mudhnib al-muḥtāj ilá raḥmat Rabbihi al-Malik al-Wahhāj, Muḥammad ibn ʻUthmān, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi."

Translation of the colophon: "It was written by the help of God Almighty and his benevolence. The transcription of this noble copy was completed after dawn, on the eighteenth of the month of Dhū al-Qaʻdah, of the year 1099 [of the Hijrah = 14 September 1688]. Copied by the poor sinner who needs the mercy of his Lord, the Glorious King, Muḥammad ibn ʻUthmān, may God forgive him and his parents, and all believers, men and women, may He treat both [his parents] and him with kindness."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ masʼalat al-ʻitq al-manhajīyah al-mukhrajah bi-al-ṭarīqah al-jabrīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
record.note: Title of manuscript 1 "Sharḥ masʼalat al-ʻitq al-manhajīyah al-mukhrajah bi-al-ṭarīqah al-jabrīyah" from folio 1a and incipit (folio 1b).
Title of manuscript 2 "Taqyīd ʻalá kalām Shaykh al-Islām wa-ʻalam al-aʻlām fī sharḥ manhajihi ʻalá taqdīr al-khamsah al-awsuq bi-al-niṣāb" from incipit (folio 7a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of manuscript 1 "Sharḥ masʼalat al-ʻitq al-manhajīyah al-mukhrajah bi-al-ṭarīqah al-jabrīyah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm.
