In large good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; text fully vocalized; headings and markings in red; some wormholes without loss of text; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Fī nawbat al-faqīr Aḥmad al-Bābilī al-Shāfiʻī. Fī sanat 1196 [of the Hijrah = 1781/1782]. 2. "Dakhala fī nawbat afqar al-ʻibād al-faqīr ʻAlī al-Suyūfī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-man daʻā lahumā. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with the section on the messengers and prophets: "Faṣlun fīmā yajibu lahum, wa-yastaḥīlu, wa-yajūzu", as follows: "... Wa-kullu man ṣaddaqa kādhiban numī // lil-kadhibi alladhī bi-hi dhāka rumī. Wa-huwa ..."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Waraqāt : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Maḥallī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Hādhihi waraqāt qalīlah, tashtamilu ʻalá maʻrifat fuṣūl min uṣūl al-fiqh, yantafiʻu bi-hā al-mubtadī wa-ghayruhu. Wa-dhālika, ay, lafẓ uṣūl al-fiqh, muʼallaf min juzʼayn mufradayn, min al-ifrād muqābil al-tarkīb, lā al-jamʻ, wa-al-muʼallaf yuʻrafu bi-maʻrifat mā ullifa minhu. Fa-al-aṣl alladhī huwa mufrad, al-juzʼ al-awwal, mā buniya ʻalayhi ghayruhu ..."
Secundo folio: ʻalá tarkihi, wa-yakfī fī ṣidq al-ʻiqāb.
14.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 10 x 15 cm; 23-24 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (wrapped in a thick sheet of paper folded to 16.5 x 25 cm).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; with the phrases of "al-Waraqāt" of Imām al-Ḥaramayn al-Juwaynī in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ al-Waraqāt, lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻĀlim al-ʻAllāmah al-muḥaqqiq Jalāl al-Dīn al-Maḥallī al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh, wa-nafaʻanā bi-ʻulūmihi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn. Bi-Muḥammad wa-ālihi." "Sharḥ al-Waraqāt, lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻĀlim al-ʻAllāmah al-muḥaqqiq Jalāl al-Dīn, raḥimahu Allāh."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: 1. "al-Ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Mulk al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Yaḥyá ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Mūsá ibn Ḥusayn al-Anbābī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn." 2. "Hādhā al-sharḥ fī ḥiyāzat al-faqīr Abū al-Widd Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Sūdī." + A faded and illegible stamp.

On folio 1a: An endowment statement "waqf": "Awqafa wa-ḥabasa wa-sanada [?] wa-taṣadda[qa] al-ʻabd al-faqīr Abū al-Widd Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Sūdī jamīʻ hādhā al-majmūʻ: Sharḥ al-Waraqāt, wa-sharḥ al-Qawāʻid, wa-Sharḥ al-Azharīyah, ʻalá ṭalabat al-ʻilm bi-al-Jāmiʻ al-Azhar, wa-juʻilat [... ... ...] taḥta yad al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Baddāwī al-Mālikī, thumma min baʻdihi li-aʻlam al-Mālikīyah [... ... ...], wa-lā yuʻār akthar min kurrās wāḥid. Wa-laʻana Allāh man khālafa, aw, ghayyara, aw, baddala. Taḥarruran, fī sābiʻ ʻashar Jumādá al-Thānī, sanat 1065 [lil-Hijrah = 24 April 1655]."
On folio 12b (at the right of the colophon): A collation statement: "Balaghat muqābalatan. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."

Colophon: "ʻAllaqahu li-nafsihi, wa-li-man shāʼa Allāh taʻālá min baʻdihi, faqīr ʻafw Rabbihi, al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, Yaḥyá ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Anbābī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-mashāyikhihi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, wa-dhālika fī shahr Shaʻbān al-muʻaẓẓam qadruhu, ʻāshir yawm, sanat thalāthah wa-sittīn wa-tisʻ miʼah, aḥsana Allāh ʻāqibatahā, bi-Muḥammad wa-ālihi. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied for himself and for whoever God wills after him, by the poor who needs the forgiveness of his Lord, the poor servant to God Almighty, Yaḥyá ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Anbābī, may God forgive him, his parents, his shaykhs, and all Muslims, on the tenth day of the exalted month of Shaʻbān, of the year 963 [of the Hijrah = 29 June 1556], may God end it favorably, by Muḥammad and his family. But God is more knowledgeable of what is correct."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Samarqandīyah al-ṣaghīr : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī al-ḥamdu la-hu ḥaqīqatan, wa-huwa li-ghayrihi majāz, al-muḥīṭ ʻilmuhu bi-asrār al-balāghah wa-wujūh al-barāʻah wa-dalāʼil al-iʻjāz. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-murashshaḥ bi-al-āyāt wa-al-dalāʼil, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-man tabiʻahum ilá Yawm al-Dīn bi-al-fawāḍil wa-al-faḍāʼil. Ammā baʻd, fa-qad kuntu sharaḥtu risālat al-Imām al-Samarqandī fī al-istiʻārāt, wa-washshaḥtuhā bi-laṭāʼif al-ṭarāʼif, wa-ʻawārif al-maʻārif, wa-nafāʼis al-ʻibārāt, wa-daqāʼiq al-iʻtibārāt, thumma inna baʻḍ al-ikhwān saʼalanī an aṣrifa al-himmah naḥwa ikhtiṣārih wa-al-iqtiṣār ʻalá bayān maʻānīhi wa-kashf asrārih, maʻa takthīr al-fawāʼid wa-al-ityān bi-al-amthilah wa-al-shawāhid, li-mā annahu lam yaqaʻ li-hādhā al-matn sharḥ ʻalá hādhā al-wajh... fa-ajabtuhu ilá dhālik ..."
Secundo folio: wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 9 x 16 cm; 21 lines per page.

Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap, dark red leather on spine and flap (in 3 unnumbered quires). The cover used to belong to "Kitāb a-Rawḍah al-Zāhirah bi-mā yataʻallaqu bi-al-Basmalah al-bāhirah lil-ʻAllāmah al-ʻAshmāwī", as indicated by the label pasted to the front cover.
In clear and large naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "al-Samarqandīyah" in red; few notes and commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ ʻalá Muqaddimat al-Samarqandī lil-Shaykh al-ʻĀlim al-ʻAllāmah Sayyidī al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Mullawī al-Shāfiʻī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: Two pieces of Ṣūfī poetry.
On folio 1b the author states that he benefited in writing his treatise from his teacher "... min fayḍ Shaykhinā ʻAbd Allāh ibn Muḥammad al-Maghribī al-Qaṣrī al-Kunkusī [could not be identified]".

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min raqm hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah nahār al-Thulāth al-mubārak, min shuhūr sanat 1268, alf wa-miʼatayn wa-thamāniyah wa-sittīn, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim ilá ʻafw Rabbihi, Idrīs Sabwā. Allāhumma ighfir li-kātibihi wa-mālikihi wa-li-wālidaynā wa-li-mashāyikhinā wa-al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-amwāt. Tammat."

Translation of the colophon: "This noble copy was completed on blessed Tuesday, of the year 1268 [of the Hijrah = 1851/1852], by the hand of the poorest of the servants and the neediest to the forgiveness of his Lord, Idrīs Sabwā. O God! Forgive its copyist, its owner, our parents, our shaykhs, and Muslim men and women, the living among them and the dead. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Muqaddimah fī faḍl ʻĀshūrāʼ : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Ujhūrī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ʻāqibah lil-muttaqīn, wa-lā ʻudwān illā ʻalá al-ẓālimīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, khātim al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Fa-hādhihi 'Muqaddimah fī faḍl ʻĀshūrāʼ', taʼlīf al-Imām al-fahhāmah, al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Ujhūrī al-Mālikī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu. Āmīn. ʻĀshūrā bi-al-madd, ka-tāsūʻā, wa-ḥaká baʻḍuhum qaṣrahā, wa-huwa shādhdh. Wa-huwa mushtaqq min al-ʻushr, alladhī huwa ism lil-ʻadd wa-al-maʻná ..."
Secundo folio: Firʻawn, wa-wulida Mūsá, wa-ukhrija Yūnus.
17 x 24 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 19.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; keywords and markings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Muqaddimah fī faḍl ʻĀshūrāh [ʻĀshūrāʼ], lil-Imām al-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah, al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Ujhūrī al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-lil-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam".

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-lawlā mā kādūhu bi-hi, min annahum ḥālū baynahu wa-bayna al-māʼ, lamā qadirū, idh huwa al-shujāʻ wa-al-qarm alladhī lā yaḥūlu wa-lā yazūl. Wa-lammā manaʻūhu wa-aṣḥābahu al-māʼ thalāthan, qāla baʻḍuhum: Unẓurū ilayhi, ka-annahu kabid al-samāʼ, lā tadhūqu minhu qaṭratan ḥattá tamūta ʻaṭashan. Fa-qāla la-hu al-Ḥusayn: Allāhumma uqtulhu ʻaṭashan. Fa-lam yurwa, maʻa kathrat shurbihi lil-māʼ, ḥattá māta ʻaṭashan. Wa-daʻā al-Ḥusayn bi-māʼ yashrabuhu, fa-ḥāl rajulun baynahu wa-baynahu bi-sahm ḍarabahu, fa-aṣāba ḥanakahu. Fa-qāla: Allāhumma uqtulhu ʻaṭashan, fa-ṣāra yaṣīḥu, al-ḥarru fī baṭnihi wa-al-bard fī ẓahrihi, wa-bayna yadayhi al-thalj wa-al-marāwiḥ, wa-khalfahu al-kāfūr, wa-yaṣīḥ al-ʻaṭash, fa-yuʼtá bi-sawīq wa-māʼ wa-laban, law sharibahu khamsah la-kafāhum, fa-yashrabuhu, thumma yaṣīḥu fa-yusqá kadhālik, ilá an inqadda baṭnuhu. Wa-lā zāla al-qatl bi-ahlihi, ay, al-Ḥusayn, wāḥid baʻda wāḥid ..."

record.title: 880-02 Asʼilah ʻan aḥkām fiqhīyah atat min al-jihah al-qiblīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Kabīr.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Naḥmaduka Yā mujīb kull sāʼil, wa-muyassir maqāṣid al-wasāʼil, wa-nuṣallī wa-nusallimu ʻalá Nabīyika, alladhī minhu baḥr al-ḥikmah sāʼil, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ṭurūs al-rasāʼil. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr, dhū al-bāʻ al-qaṣīr, rājī al-fawz wa-al-amal, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Suyūṭī al-shahīr bi-al-Kinānī: Hādhihi 'Asʼilah ʻan aḥkām fiqhīyah atat min al-jihah al-qiblīyah', wa-rufiʻat ilá khātimat al-dahr wa-ṭirāz ḥullat al-ʻaṣr ... Ustādhunā ... al-muḥaqqiq al-Amīr ... fa-ajāba ʻanhā bi-ajwibah ... thumma innī khiftu ʻalayhā min al-ḍayāʻ ... fa-naẓamtu farāʼidahā fī silk wāḥid ..."
Secundo folio: hal yuʻmalu bi-hādhā al-ʻurf wa-lā tumakkanu minhu al-ināth.
16 x 23 cm; written surface: 8 x 14 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In clear medium naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; keywords and marking in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: Two pieces of poetry on how to aquire knowledge (three verses and five verses respectively).

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá aʻlam. Tammat bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá ṣabḥata yawm al-Jumʻah al-mubārak, thānī shahr al-Ḥijjah al-ḥarām, alladhī huwa min shuhūr ʻām ithnay ʻashar wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min Hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf, ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr Muḥammad Aḥmad al-Kinānī [defaced] al-Suyūṭī [defaced], tābiʻ al-quṭb al-shahīr al-Ustādh al-Amīr, naẓamahu Allāh fī silk aḥibbāʼihi, bi-jāh Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "God Almighty is more knowledgeable. It was completed by the help of God Almighty, on the morning of blessed Friday, the second day of the sacred month of Dhū al-Ḥijjah, of the year 1212 of the Hijrah of Him to whom belongs glory and honor [7 May, 1798], by the hand of its writer [i.e., collector/editor], the poor Muḥammad Aḥmad al-Kinānī [defaced] al-Suyūṭī [defaced], follower of the renowned authority, al-Ustādh al-Amīr, may God include him with those whom He loves, by the honor of Muḥammad, his family and his companions. Amen. Praise be to God alone. May prayer be upon Him who no prophet comes after Him. It is completed."

record.title: 880-03 Qiṣṣat al-Miʻrāj : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Ghayṭī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Baynamā al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, ʻinda al-Bayt, fī al-ḥujr, bayna al-nāyim wa-al-yaqẓān, muḍṭajiʻan bayna rajulayn, idh atāh Jibrīl wa-Mīkāyīl, wa-maʻahumā malak ākhar, fa-qāla awwaluhumā: Ayyuhum huwa. Fa-qāl: Awsaṭuhum huwa khayruhum. Fa-iḥtamalūhu, ḥattá jāʼū bi-hi Zamzam, fa-istalqawhu ʻalá ẓahrihi, fa-tawallāhu minhum Jibrīl, fa-shaqqa min thaghrihi naḥrahu ilá asfal baṭnihi. Thumma qāla Jibrīl li-Mīkāyīl: Ītinī bi-ṭisht min māʼ Zamzam kaymā uṭahhira qalbahu wa-ashraḥa ṣadrahu ..."
Secundo folio: wa-Mīkāyīl ʻan shamālih.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; many notes, commentaries, and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi nubdhah jalīlah li-Mawlānā al-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah Shams al-Dīn Muḥammad Najm al-Dīn al-Ghayṭī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-askanahu fasīḥ jannatih, wa-nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-[bi]barakāt ʻulumihi fī al-dunyā. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements: 1. "Mulk al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá ʻAbd al-ʻAlīm [...] Aḥmad [...]." 2. "Mulk al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá al-Shaykh al-ʻAllāmah [... ... ...]." And a "sanad" (chain of transmission), as follows: "Sanad Shaykhinā al-Shaykh al-Qalatī, fīhā al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-ʻa[...] ʻan al-ʻAdawī bi-sanadih."

On folio 1a: Four verses of poetry about babies who talked as infants, in the cradle: "Naẓama baʻḍuhum fī abyāt, fa-qāl: Takallama fī al-mahdi al-Nabīyu Muḥammadun // wa-Yaḥyā wa-ʻĪsá wa-al-Khalīlu wa-Maryamu ..."

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran dāʼiman abadan, ilá Yawm al-Dīn." At the left of the colophon, in a different hand, probably the owner "ʻAbd al-ʻAlīm" mentioned above: "Kātibuhu, rājī tawbat Rabbihi al-Amjad, ʻAbd al-ʻAlīm Muḥammad Aḥmad."

Translation of the colophon: "But God is more knowledgeable of what is correct, to Him is the reference and returning. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them abundant, continuous, and perpetual peace until the Day of Judgement." At the left of the colophon, in a different hand, probably by the owner "ʻAbd al-ʻAlīm" mentioned above: "Written by him who aspires for repentance from his Glorious Lord, ʻAbd al-ʻAlīm Muḥammad Aḥmad."

record.title: 880-02 Muqaddimah fī uṣūl al-dīn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Shirbīnī.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah al-wariʻ al-ṣāliḥ, Muḥammad Shams al-Dīn al-Shirbīnī al-Khaṭīb, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. Faṣl fīmā yajibu ʻalá al-mukallaf iʻtiqāduh fī ḥaqq Allāh taʻālá, wa-naṣb al-mawāzīn, wa-wazn al-aʻmāl, wa-inṣāf al-maẓlūm, wa-baʻth al-rusul, wa-ḍmān al-rizq ..."
Secundo folio: wa-Muslimah wa-man lā yaʻrifu Allāh.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 14 cm; 17-31 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the last three pages (9b-10b) are written in a different hand; catchwords.

On folio 1a: A "Fāʼidah" (useful advice), quoted from "Asrār al-ḥurūf" of Abū al-ʻAbbās Aḥmad al-Būnī (died 1225), on the invocation "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm" (In the Name of God the Merciful the Compassionate).

Colophon: "Tammat 'al-Muqaddimah' bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, bi-al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, 21 khalat min Shaʻbān, sanat 1236. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "The 'Introduction' was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence, completely and perfectly, 21 [nights] having passed from Shaʻbān, of the year 1236 [of the Hijrah = 24 May, 1821]. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, his family, and his companions, and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Bāʻithat al-gharām fī al-taʻalluq bi-ghilmān al-ḥammām : manuscript / Ḥasan al-Shāmī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāhi atamma al-ḥamdi // muṣalliyan musalliman min baʻdi. ʻAlá al-ḥabībi al-Muṣṭafá dhī al-majdi // Muḥammadin wa-ālihi wa-al-jundi. Mā dāma dhū ḥubbin asīra wajdi ..."
Secundo folio: Kaʼannamā awthaqahu bi-qiddi.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 11 x 16 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Bāʻithat al-gharām fī al-taʻalluq bi-ghilmān al-ḥammām, naẓm al-adīb al-māhir al-niḥrīr al-bāhir, al-Shaykh Ḥasan al-Shāmī, raḥimahu Allāh wa-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm."
Colophon: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm."

Translation of the colophon: "It was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. Praise be to God alone. There is no power nor might except in God the Almighty the All Powerful."

record.title: 880-01 Muqaddimah muhimmah fī maʻrifat al-qīrāṭ wa-al-dīnār wa-al-dirham wa-al-dāniq wa-al-ḥabbah wa-makhraj al-qīrāṭ : manuscript.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi 'Muqaddimah muhimmat fī maʻrifat al-qīrāṭ wa-al-dīnār wa-al-dirham wa-al-dāniq wa-al-ḥabbah wa-makhraj al-qīrāṭ', wa-hiya mimmā taʻummu al-ḥājah ilayhā, wa-taḥtājuhā al-nās fī maʻāyishihim wa-muʻāmalātihim, wa-yuftaqaru ilayhā fī abwāb al-fiqh, ka-al-zakāh wa-al-waṣāyā wa-al-farāʼiḍ. Wa-idhā naẓarta ilá baʻḍ al-maqāṣid fa-ʻammim. Wa-hiya tashtamilu ʻalá ʻasharat fuṣūl ..."
Secundo folio: fa-makhrajuhu min arbaʻah wa-ʻishrīn
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16 cm; 20-22 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Muqaddimah mubārakah fī maʻrifat al-qīrāṭ wa-al-dīnār wa-al-dirham wa-al-dāniq wa-al-ḥabbah wa-makhraj al-qīrāṭ, wa-hiya mimmā taʻummu al-ḥājah ilayhā, wa-taḥtājuhā al-nās fī maʻāyishihim. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Awdaʻtu hunā shahādat an Lā ilāha illā Allāh wa-anna Muḥammadan Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran dāʼiman. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."
On folio 1a: A reader/owner statement: "Kitāb nafīs jiddan, raḥima Allāh muʼallifahu."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mimmā anʻama Allāh ʻalá ʻabdihi al-faqīr Aḥmad al-ʻAshshī, ʻufiya ʻanhu. Āmīn."
Text folio 1b-7a.

On folios 7b-8a (by the same hand): A chapter on the multiplication and division of even numbers and fractions. Starts with: "Faṣl. Idhā ḍarabta ṣaḥīḥan wa-kusūran fī mithlihim, fa-ibsuṭ al-ṣiḥāḥ min jins al-kusūr, thumma iqsimhā ʻalá maḍrūb al-makhrajayn." It ends with: "... fa-iʻrif dhālik. Hākadhā kull mā yaridu ʻalayk, tansibu nisbat al-maḍrūb fī al-maḍrūb wa-taʼkhudh al-maḍrūb fīhi, wa-huwa al-thalāthat arbāʻ."

On folios 8b-9b: A chapter on the number of verses of the Qurʼān, its words, and its letters, etc. It starts with: "Faṣl fī jumlat āy al-Qurʼān wa-kalimātih wa-ḥurūfih ..." It ends with: "... Mā yunqaṭu min asfal miʼatay alf wa-sabʻ wa-sabʻūn alfan wa-arbaʻumiʼah wa-arbaʻ. Intahá."
On folio 9b: "Ḥadīth Abī ʻAbd Allāh ibn Ayyūb ʻan ʻadad ḥurūf al-Qurʼān ..."
On folio 10a: A quotation from the commentary of Abū Isḥāq Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Thaʻlabī (died 1035) of Sūrat al-Anʻām.

Colophon (folio 7a): "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm."

Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, on his family and his companions and grant them peace. It was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. God suffices us, He is the best advocate. There is no power nor might except in God the Almighty the All Powerful."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Asmāʼ Allāh al-Ḥusná : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Shanawānī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ṭalaba min ʻibādihi duʻāʼahum la-hu bi-Asmāʼihi al-Ḥusná, fa-imtathalū, fa-aʻṭāhum maṭlūbahum, wa-fāzū bi-khātimat al-ḥusná, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá man fāza fī dunyāhu wa-ukhrāhu bi-al-maqām al-asná. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-ʻAlī, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Shanawān al-Shāfiʻī al-Azharī: Hādhā Sharḥ laṭīf ʻalá Asmāʼihi taʻālá al-Ḥusná al-jalīlah, wa-ḍaʻtuhu li-yashula ʻalá al-dhākir maʻrifat maʻānīhā, fa-yastaḥḍiruhā, wa-law ijmālan, li-tanāla [li-yanāla] al-niʻam al-ʻaẓīmah ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-zakāh wa-al-ṣawm fa-inna kullan minhā.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 9 x 17.5 cm; 24 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ Asmāʼ Allāh al-Ḥusná, taʼlīf al-ʻAllāmah al-ḥabr al-fahhāmah, farīd dahrihi wa-waḥīd ʻaṣrihi, shaykh al-muḥaqqiqīn, mufīd al-ṭālibīn, al-ʻumdah, Shaykhunā al-Shanawānī al-ʻaẓīm, ʻufiya ʻanahu, wa-nufiʻnā bi-ʻulūmihi dunyā wa-ukhrá. Amīn. Amīn. Amīn."
On folio 1a: Several quotations in poetry and prose.

Author's colophon: "... Wa-mā dhakartuhu fī hādhihi al-ʻujālah min maʻānī al-asmāʼ wa-al-khawāṣ bi-ḥasab mā tayassara fī waqt, wa-laqad taraktu al-tawassuʻ fīhi li-ḍīq al-waqt wa-shughl al-bāl wa-jumūd al-qarīḥah. Wa-anā astaghfirū [astaghfiru] Allāh mimmā irtakabtu fīhi. Wa-billāh al-tawfīq. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, Khātim al-Nabīyīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-salām ʻalá al-mursalīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn [... ... ...]."

Translation of the author's colophon: "... What I mentioned in this hastily prepared work about the meanings of [God's] names and attributes, was done according to the available time, having avoided expanding it, because of tight time, anxiety of mind, and stifling intellect. I seek forgiveness from God for whatever [error] I committed in it. From God comes success. God suffices us. He is the best advocate. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, the Seal of the Prophets, and on his family and all his companions. May peace be upon the messengers. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe [... ... ...]."

record.title: 880-02 Tafsīr Sūrat al-Qadr : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Kabīr.
record.note: Title from the printed version.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit (folio 2b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala li-kullin qadran, wa-anzala al-Qurʼān raḥmatan wa-shifāʼan wa-dhikrá, wa-ḥaththa fīhi ʻalá ḥusn al-tadbīr wa-al-dhikrá, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyid al-anām al-mukhtaṣṣ bi-mawākib Laylat al-Qadr wa-al-Isrāʼ ... Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Amīr, ʻafā Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu [wa-ghafara la-hu, ṣaḥḥ], wa-laṭafa bi-hi. Āmīn. Hādhā mā yassarahu Allāh taʻālá khidmatan li-Sūrat al-Qadr, jaʻaltuhu ʻuddatan lil-mudhākarah fīhā bi-al-Jāmiʻ al-Azhar wa-al-masjid al-anwar ..."
Secundo folio: lil-maqām, ay, naḥnu ʻalá mā naḥnu ʻalayhi.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 9 x 18 cm; 29 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some commentaries and corrections on the margins; markings in red; the verses of "Sūrat al-Qadr" in purple and red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Risālat al-Shaykh al-Amīr fī al-kalām ʻalá Sūrat al-Qadr, bi-al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl."

On folio 1b: A quotation from Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Bāqī al-Zurqānī (1645-1710) from his commentary on "al-Mawahib al-ladunīyah bi-al-minaḥ al-Muḥammadīyah" of Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Qasṭallānī (1447 or 1448-1517 or 1518), used as a prelude for "Tafsīr Sūrat al-Qadr", as follows: "Tanbīh. Dhakar Sayyidī Muḥammad al-Zurqānī fī sharḥihi ʻalá al-Mawāhib al-ladunīyah, fī awāʼil 'Mabḥath al-Baʻth', fī Sh. [Sharḥ] qawlihi: Awwal mā akramahu Allāh taʻālá bi-nubūwatihi, anazala ʻalayhi al-Qurʼān. Wa-qāla ākharūn: Innamā nazala al-Qurʼān jumlatan wāḥidah fī Laylat al-Qadr ilá Bayt al-ʻIzzah, thumma nazal nujūman, bi-ḥasb al-waqāʼiʻ, fī thalāth wa-ʻishrīn sanah ..."
The date of copying is given in Hartford Seminary list as 1252 of the Hijrah.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihā, wa-muqābalatihā, wa-tahmīshihā, yawm al-Aḥad, 22 Muḥarram, sanat 1292, ʻalá yad kātibihā li-nafsihi, wa-li-man shāʼa Allāh min baʻdihi, al-faqīr Ṣāliḥ Salāmah, ḥīna iqāmatihi bi-al-Iskandarīyah, razaqanā Allāh shafāʻat Khayr al-Barīyah."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed, collated and footnoted, on Sunday, 22 Muḥarram, of the year 1292 [of the Hijrah = 28 February 1875], by the hand of its copyist, written for himself, and to whomever God wills after him, the poor Ṣāliḥ Salāmah, during his sojourn in Alexandria. May God grant us the intercession of the Best of Mankind [Prophet Muḥammad]."

record.title: 880-03 al-Qaṣīdah al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Sharaf al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd al-Būṣīrī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Kayfa tarqá ruqīyaka al-anbiyāʼu // yā samāʼan mā ṭāwalathā samāʼu. Lam yusāwūka fī ʻulāka wa-qad ḥā // la sanan minka dūnahum wa-sanāʼu ..."
Secundo folio: Ḥabbadhā ʻiqdu suʼdudin wa-fakhārin.
16.7 x 23 cm; written surface: 9 x 14.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; text fully vocalized; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Matn al-Hamzīyah ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl. M."
al-Hamzīyah ends with: Mā aqām al-ṣalāta man ʻabda Allāha wa-qāmat bi-Rabbihā al-ashyāʼu.

Colophon: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi, ʻalá yad kātibihā wa-mālikihā ʻAbd Allāh Aḥmad al-Ṣaʻīdī al-ʻAadwī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-man naẓara fīhi wa-daʻā lī. H."

Translation of the colophon: "It is completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence, by the hand of its copyist and owner, ʻAbd Allāh Aḥmad al-Ṣaʻīdī al-ʻAadwī, may God forgive him and his parents, and him who looks into it and invokes [God] on my behalf. H."

record.title: 880-03 al-Qaṣīdah al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Sharaf al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd al-Būṣīrī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Kayfa tarqá ruqīyaka al-anbiyāʼu // yā samāʼan mā ṭāwalathā samāʼu. Lam yusāwūka fī ʻulāka wa-qad ḥā // la sanan minka dūnahum wa-sanāʼu ..."
Secundo folio: Wa-idhā ḥallati al-hidāyatu qalban.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 16 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; text fully vocalized; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: A quotation from an unidentified work, about a dream concerning al-Sirāj ibn al-Fāriḍ al-Saʻdī (probably Ibn al-Fāriḍ, ʻUmar ibn ʻAlī, 1181 or 1182-1235) about praising the Prophet Muḥammad, in which he says: "Ará kulla madḥin fī al-Nabīyi muqaṣṣiran // wa-in bālagha al-muthnī ʻalayhi wa-aktharā. Idhā Allāhu athná billadhī huwa ahluhu // ʻalayhi fa-mā miqdāru mā yamdaḥu al-wará."
One leaf seems to be missing between folios 1 and 2.
al-Hamzīyah ends with: Mā aqām al-ṣalāta man ʻabda Allāha wa-qāmat bi-Rabbihā al-ashyāʼu.

Colophon: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihā yawm al-Sabt, li-ʻishrīn khalat min shahr Ramaḍān al-muʻaẓẓam qadruhu, sanat khamsah wa-thalāthīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām." To the left of the colophon: "Abyātuhā 457."

Translation of the colophon: "It is completed by the praise of God, and His abundant benevolence. Copied on Saturday, twenty [days] having passed from the glorious month of Ramaḍān, of the year 1235 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and peace be upon Him." To the left of the colophon: "Abyātuhā 457 [in 457 verses]."

record.title: 880-02 Maṭlaʻ al-nayyirayn fīmā yataʻallaqu bi-al-qudratayn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Kabīr.
record.note: Title from folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Naḥmaduka Allāhumma yā man tafarrada bi-al-ījāz wa-al-taʼthīr, wa-taqaddasa ʻan al-shirk wa-al-ʻanād fī ʻumūm al-ikhtiyār wa-al-taqdīr, wa-nuṣallī wa-nusallimu ʻalá man jabara ʻulamāʼ ummatihi bi-amdādihi fa-iktasabū min asrār ḥikmatihi, wa-qāmū bi-amr Allāh bayna ʻibādih ... Ammā baʻd, fa-innahu qad rufiʻa suʼāl mutaʻalliq bi-afʻāl al-ʻabd wa-madkhalīyatihi fīhā, wa-mā yataʻallaqu bi-dhālika min ikhtiyār wa-kasb, maʻa abḥāth manshaʼihā ..."
Secundo folio: Wa-khayrun min al-dunyā wa-mā fīhā ʻindanā.
16.5 x 22 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair medium naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Maṭlaʻ al-nayyirayn fīmā yataʻallaqu bi-al-qudratayn, taʼlīf al-Ḥabr al-humām Shaykhunā al-Shams al-munīr wa-al-ʻalam al-shahīr, Sayyidī Muḥammad al-Amīr, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-bi-ʻulūmihi. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. M."
On folio 2a: "... sammaytuhā Maṭlaʻ al-nayyirayn fīmā yataʻallaqu bi-al-qudratayn ..."
On folio 11b: Miscellaneous quotations in a different hand.

Author's colophon: "Wa-fī hādhā al-qadr kifāyah li-man kāna la-hu qalb, aw, alqá al-samʻ wa-huwa shahīd. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillā waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam taslīman kathīran dāʼiman ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Tamma wa-kamula." On the left margin of the author's colophon: "Taḥrīran fī 20 shahr Shaʻbān, sanat 216 [1216], ʻalá yad al-Shaykh Badawī al-Batanūnī."

Translation of the author's colophon: "What was introduced herein is enough for him who has a heart, or, would listen and bear witness. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, his family, and his companions, and grant them abundant peace until Judgment Day. It is completed and concluded." On the left margin of the author's colophon: "Dated, the 20th of the month of Shaban, of the year 216 [1216 of the Hijrah = 26 December 1801], by the hand of al-Shaykh Badawī al-Batanūnī."

record.title: 880-02 Mawlid al-Muṣṭafá : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī baʻatha fīnā Rasūlahu al-Aʻẓam wa-Nabīyahu al-akmal al-afkham, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama wa-sharrafa wa-karrama wa-ʻaẓẓam. Ammā baʻd, fa-inna aṣdaq al-ḥadīth Kitāb Allāh taʻālá, wa-khayr al-hady hady Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Wa-qad qāla Allāh taʻālá fī Kitābihi al-mubīn, wa-huwa aṣdaq al-qāʼilīn: Laqad jāʼakum rasūlun min anfisikum, ʻazīzun ʻalayhi mā ʻanittum ḥarīṣun ʻalaykum bi-al-muʼminīn raʼūfun raḥīm fa-in tawallaw fa-qul ḥabiya Allāh lā ilāha illā huwa ʻalayhi tawakkaltu wa-huwa Rabb al-ʻarsh al-ʻaẓim ..."
Secundo folio: al-hidāyah wa-al-imāmah wa-al-raḥmah.
17 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Mawlid Sayyid al-Awwalīn wa-al-Ākhirīn, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, li-Ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī, mukhtaṣar min 'Mawlidihi al-Kabīr', nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-bi-barakātihi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah, ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ al-mubārak, 11 khalat min shahr Rabīʻ Ākhir alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1267 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-taslīm, ʻalá yad al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, ʻAbd Allāh Tamīm al-Ṣāfūrī baladan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban al-Ashʻarī ʻaqīdatan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-wālid wālidayhi, wa-li-mashāyikhihi, wa-li-ikhwānihi fī Allāh taʻālá, wa-li-man qaraʼa fīhi wa-daʻá li-kātibihi bi-al-ʻafw wa-al-maghfirah, wa-lil-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad al-Nabī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This noble copy was completed on blessed Wednesday, eleven days having passed from the month of Rabīʻ Ākhir, of the year 1267 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [13 February 1851], may the best prayer and the most perfect peace be upon Him, by the hand of the poor wretched, who admits his shortcoming and inadequacy, Allāh Tamīm al-Ṣāfūrī baladan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban al-Ashʻarī ʻaqīdatan, may God forgive him, his parents. the father of his parents, his Shaykhs, his brethren in God Almighty, he who reads it and invokes forgiveness and pardon for its copyist, and all Muslims. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May God pray on Our Master and Leader Muḥammad, the Illiterate Prophet, on his family, and on his companions, and grant them peace. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 al-Kawākib al-sanīyah ʻala al-Manẓūmah al-Yāsamīnīyah : manuscript / Ḥusayn ibn Muḥammad al-Maḥallī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jabara kasranā bi-ḥusn al-muqābalah, wa-afāḍ ʻalaynā mazīd niʻamihi al-fāḍilah, wa-jaʻala al-amwāl waṣlatan li-khayrātih al-shāmil [al-shāmilah] li-taḥṣīl shuʻūb al-saʻādah al-mutaʼaṣṣilah ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr Ḥusayn ibn Muḥammad al-Maḥallī al-Shāfiʻī ... Hādhā taʻlīq laṭīf wa-taḥrīr sharīf ʻalá al-Urjūzah al-Yāsamīnīyah fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah ... māzijan lil-sharḥ bi-al-mashrūḥ ka-imtizāj al-māʼ bi-al-rāḥ wa-al-jism bi-al-rūḥ, musammiyan la-hu bi-'al-Kawākib al-nisbīyah [al-sanīyah] ʻalá al-Manẓūmah al-Yāsamīnīyah' ..."
Secundo folio: al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah iḥtiyāl ḥasan yutawaṣṣalu bi-hi ilá istiʻlām al-majhūl.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 16.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "al-Yasamīnīyah" in red; markings in red; some wormholes without loss of text; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb [Sharḥ] al-Urjūzah al-Yāsamīnīyah fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah, lil-faqīr Ḥusayn al-Maḥallī al-Shāfiʻī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu. M."
On folio 1a: "Fāʼidah" (useful quotation) from al-Qalyūbī (could not be identified) on the benefits of reciting the "Shahadah" (Islamic profession of faith) and the prayer on the Prophet.
Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā aradnā jamʻahu fī hādhihi al-muqaddimah li-hādhā al-sharḥ, wa-lillāh al-ḥamd, wa-al-minnah lil-faqīr Ḥusayn al-Maḥallī al-Shāfiʻī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu. Āmīn. M."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what we wanted to compile in this introduction of this commentary. Praise be to God, and indebtedness to the poor Ḥusayn al-Maḥallī al-Shāfiʻī, may God pardon him. Amen. M."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ Ādāb al-baḥth al-ʻAḍudīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Allāhumma laka al-ḥamd ʻalá mā ʻallamtanā min al-ādāb wa-alhamtanā min sulūk ṭarīq al-ṣawāb, wa-nasʼaluka al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Nabīyika al-munazzah fī maḥāsinihi ʻan al-manāẓir, al-mabʻūth ilá kāffat al-nās bi-Kitāb afḥamat āyātuhu kull muʻāriḍ wa-munāqiḍ wa-mumāniʻ wa-mukābir, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi hudāt al-dīn wa-ḥumāt manhaj al-yaqīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu rājī al-ghufrān, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān, aḥsana Allāh ʻamalahu wa-ballaghahu fī al-dārayn amalah: Hādhihi ḥawāshī sharīfah wa-taqyīdāt munīfah waḍaʻtuhā ʻalá Sh. [Sharḥ] al-Ādāb al-ʻAḍudīyah lil-muḥaqqiq Mullā Ḥanafī ..."
Secundo folio: ḥāḍiran ilkh. Ay, wa-al-aṣl fīmā hādhā shaʼnuhu.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 11 x 18 cm; 26 lines per page.
Binding: The two quires are inside a marbled cover with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap.

In fair medium and dense naskh script; in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Ḥanafī's commentary is preceded by the word "qawluhu" (his saying) in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the label pasted to the front cover: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Ādāb al-ʻAḍudīyah lil-Shaykh al-Ṣabbān."
A leaf seems to be missing between folios 1 and 2.

Author's colophon: "Tamma tabyīḍ hādhihi al-Ḥāshiyah al-sharīfah ʻalá yad muṣannifihā al-faqīr ilayhi, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān, anʻama Allāh ʻalayhimā bi-ruḍwānih, laylat al-Jumʻah al-mubārakah, li-laylatin baqiyat min Ṣafar, sanat tisʻ wa-sabʻīn wa-miʼah wa-alf, min al-Hijrah al-Naywah [al-Nabawīyah], ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām."

Translation of the author's colophon: "The fair copy of this noble Gloss was completed by the hand of its author, the poor to Him, the Almighty the Sublime, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān, may God bestow His favor upon both of them, on Friday night, one night remaining from Ṣafar, of the year 1179 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and peace be upon Him."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah yawm al-Thulāth, thamāniyat ʻashar khalat min shahr Ṣafar, sant alf wa-miʼatayn wa-thamānīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This noble copy was completed on Tuesday, eighteen nights having passed from the month of Ṣafar, of the year 1280 [of the Hijrah = 4 August 1863]. May God pray on Him [Prophet Muḥammad], and on his family and companions, and grant them peace. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Lubb al-albāb fī ʻilm al-iʻrāb : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥusaynī Nuqrahkār.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi tammim bi-al-khayr. al-Ḥamdu lillāh qāshiʻ ghamām al-ghumūm, wa-qāṣiʻ humām al-humūm, alladhī lā yablughu kunha ḥikmatihi al-bālighah wasāwis hawājis al-ḥukamāʼ, wa-lā yaḥṣuru niʻmatahu al-ʻāmmah al-ʻāddūn fī al-arḍ wa-al-samāʼ, alladhī manaḥanā qalban dhā lubbin ḥāfiẓan wa-lisānan lāfiẓan ... Wa-baʻd, fa-inna lubb al-albāb fī ʻilm al-iʻrāb lā yakhfá ʻalá dhawī al-albāb, innahu kathīr al-fawāʼid, jamm al-ʻawāʼid, ṣaghīr al-ḥajm, wajīz al-naẓm, muḥtawin ʻalá qawāʻid sharīfah wa-fawāʼid laṭīfah, mushtamil ʻalá daqāʼiq al-asrār al-ʻArabīyah, munṭawin ʻalá al-mabāḥith allatī hiya miftāḥ al-ʻulūm al-adabīyah ... mā lā yūjad fī ghayrihi min al-muṭawwalāt wa-al-mukhtaṣarāt, wa-lam yashraḥhu aḥad min fuḍalāʼ al-dahr wa-ʻulamāʼ al-ʻaṣr ..."
Secundo folio: illā ammahā wa-lā maẓannah illā hammahā.
15 x 26 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 18 cm; 37 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion.

In clear, small and compact naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the beginning of the phrases of 'Lubb al-albab fī ʻilm al-iʻrāb' overlined in red; extensive commentaries on the margins and interlinear; text within red frames; catchwords.
Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb, fī awākhir Jumādá al-Ukhrá, fī sanat tisʻ wa-tisʻīn wa-alf. Ghafara Allāh li-qāriʼihi wa-li-nāẓirihi wa-li-kātibihi."

Translation of the colophon: "The book was completed by the help of the Abundantly Giving King, at the end of Jumādá al-Ukhrá, of the year 1099 [of the Hijrah = 1 May 1688]. May God forgive its reader, he who looks into it, and its copyist/author."
On the preliminary leaf: "Kitāb Lubb al-albāb fī ʻilm al-iʻrāb."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ Īsāghūjī : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Dalajī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ḥamdan li-man naṭaqat mawjūdātuhu bi-rubūbīyatih, wa-afāḍa ʻalá anwāʻ maṣnūʻātih ajnās al-niʻam biḥikmatih wa-raḥmatih, wa-ṣalá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad ashraf al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-azkiyāʼ, wa-al-tābiʻīn la-hum bi-iḥsān ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Dalajī: Hādhā taʻlīqun laṭīf ʻalá sharḥ Shaykh al-Islām li-matn Īsāghūjī, nāfiʻ in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá li-man aḥsana nīyatah wa-ṭahhara ṭawīyatah ..."
Secundo folio: qāla Ibn al-Mullā fī sharḥihi ʻalá al-Mughnī.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 10 x 16.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in seven numbered quires).

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of Sharḥ Shaykh al-Islām are preceded by the word "qawluhi" (his saying) in red. These phrases are also written in full on the margins in red; Some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Ḥāshiyat al-Dala[j]ī ʻalá Isākhūjī."

Colophon: No colophon. The text ends abruptly with: "... wa-ammā indirāj waḥdat al-kull wa-al-juzʼ, fa-li-anna al-mawḍūʻ fī qawlinā 'al-Zanjī aswad' huwa baʻḍuhu fī qawlinā 'al-Zanjī laysa bi-aswad' huwa kulluhu, fa-ikhtilāfuhumā mustalzimun li-ikhtilāf al-mawḍūʻ, fa-law ittaḥada ittaḥadat kulluhā, wa-al-waḥadāt al-bāqīyah tandariju taḥta waḥdat al-maḥmūl. Ammā indirāj al-qūwah wa-al-fiʻl, fa-li-anna al-maḥmūl fī qawlinā: 'al-Khamr fī al-dann laysa bimuskir' huwa ʻadam shurbihi. Wa-fī qawlinā: 'al-Khamr fī al-dann muskirun' huwa shurbuhu. Wa-ammā indirāj waḥdat al-iḍāfah fa-li-anna al-maḥmūl fī qawlinā: 'Zaydun abu li-ʻAmar' huwa mutawallidun minhu ʻAmr. Wa-ammā indirāj waḥdat al-makān fī waḥdat al-zamān ..."

record.title: 880-02 Muqaddimat Risālat ādāb al-baḥth wa-sharḥuhā : manuscript / Muḥammad al-Ḥanafī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Tawakkaltu ʻalá Allāh. Laka al-Ḥamd. Jaʻla Allāh mukhāṭaban tanbīhan ʻalá al-qurb, wa-li-anna al-lāʼiq bi-ḥāl al-ḥāmid an yulāḥiẓa al-maḥmūd awwalan ḥāḍiran, wa-mushāhadan, thumma yaḥmaduhu. Wa-istabān minhu wajh taqdīm qawlihi 'laka' ʻalá al-ḥamd, wa-in kān al-muqām, li-kawnihi muqām al-ḥamd, yaqtaḍī taqdīmahu. Wa-yaṣuḥḥu an yakūna al-taqdīm lil-taʻẓīm wa-al-sharaf, wa-an yakūna li-taʼkīd al-ikhtiṣāṣ al-mustafād min kalimat Allāh ..."
Secundo folio: wa-huwa man naṣaba nafsahu li-ithbāt al-ḥukm.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 8 x 15.5 cm; 20 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "al-ʻAḍudīyah" in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Muqaddimat Risālat Ādāb al-baḥth wa-sharḥuhā, lil-Shaykh ʻAḍud al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Ḥanafī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-al-raḥmah wa-al-ruḍwān, wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Āmīn. M."

On folio 1a: Three verses of poetry on the necessity of acquiring knowledge, as follows: Idhā kāna yuʼdhīka ḥarru al-maṣīf // wa-faṣlu al-kharīf wa-bardu al-shitā. Wa-yulhīka zahr zamān al-rabīʻ // fa-akhdhuka lil-ʻilmi qul lī matá. Fa-shammir wa-jāhid wa-kun faṭinan // fa-inna al-ʻulūma tazīnu al-fatá."

Colophon: "Tamma wa-kamula. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-taslīm ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, thāmin ʻashar min Dhī al-Qaʻdah, sanat 1154 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-taslīm, bi-khaṭṭ al-faqīr Mūsá al-ʻAntarāwī ibn al-Shaykh Aḥmad Yamānī ibn al-Shaykh Mūsá, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Wa-Allāh al-mukawwal [al-muwakkal] fī al-qabūl."

Translation of the colophon: "It is concluded and completed. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. Prayer and peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, on his family and all his companions. Dated on blessed Thursday, the eighteenth of Dhī al-Qaʻdah, of the year 1154 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and the most perfect peace be upon Him. In the handwriting of the poor Mūsá al-ʻAntarāwī ibn al-Shaykh Aḥmad Yamānī ibn al-Shaykh Mūsá, may God forgive him and his parents. God is the guarantor of acceptance."

record.title: 880-03 al-Fawāʼid al-Ḍiyāʼīyah : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Aḥmad al-Jāmī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 3b)
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: Text starts on folio 3b, as follows: "al-Ḥamdu li-walīyihi, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-mutaʼaddibīn bi-ādābihi. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi fawāʼid wāfiyah li-ḥall mushkilāt al-Kāfiyah, lil-ʻAllāmah al-mushtahir fī al-mashāriq, wa-al-mushtahir fī al-mashāriq wa-al-maghārib, al-Shaykh Ibn al-Ḥājib, taghammadahu Allāh bi-ghufrānih wa-askanahu buḥbūḥat jinānih, naẓamtuhā fī silk al-taqdīr wa-simṭ al-taḥrīr lil-walad al-ʻazīz Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn Yūsuf, ḥafiẓahu Allāh ʻan mūjibāt al-talahhuf wa-al-taʼassuf, wa-sammaytuhā 'al-Fawāʼid al-Ḍiyāʼīyah', li-annahu li-hādhā al-jamʻ wa-al-taʼlīf ka-al-ʻillah al-ghāʼīyah, nafaʻahu Allāh wa-sāʼir al-mubtadiʼīn min aṣḥāb al-taḥṣīl ..."
Secundo folio: al-lisān lahā iltiʼāmun.
10.5 x 18.5 cm; written surface: 6 x 13.5 cm; 16-23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; extensive commentaries on the margins and interlinear; text within red frame; no catchwords.
On folio 1a: A quotation from al-Muḥīṭ.
On folio 1b: "Jāmī. Zayd Abū ʻĀlim" (in red); Miscellaneous "Fawāʼid", quotations, and invocations in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish.

On folio 2a: Three ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Tamallakahu al-faqīr al-muḥtāj ilá Allāh al-qadīr Muḥammad ibn Muṣṭafá." 2. "al-Faqīr Muḥammad ibn Shaʻbān." 3. "Ṣāḥibuhu wa-mālikuhu Ḥusayn ibn ʻUmar" (the statement is repeated).
On folio 2a: A stamp "Qul huwa Allāh aḥad. al-Sayyid ʻAbd al-Ṣamad" and an illegible stamp.
On folio 2a: "Hādhā kitāb Munlā Jāmī"; "Jāmī" (in red);
On folio 2a: A "Fāʼidah" and a verse of poetry: A complaint/grievance: "Ṣubbat ʻalayya maṣāʼibun law annahā // ṣubbat ʻalá al-ayyāmi ṣirna layāliyā."

On folio 3a: Several ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Thumma tamallakahu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-ʻAzīz al-Sayyid ʻAlī ibn al-Ḥājjī Darwīsh, ʻufiya ʻanhumā." 2. "Thumma tamallakahu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-Jalīl, al-Sayyid Aḥmad ibn Khalīl al-faqīr, ʻafá ʻanhumā al-Qadīr. Sanat 1183 [lil-Hijrah = 1769/1770]." 3. "Thumma tamallaka[hu] al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá raḥmat Rabbihi al-khabīr al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá ibn Ḥājjī Maḥmūd al-Malaṭī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi. Sanat 1150 [lil-Hijrah = 1737/1738]." 4. "Usʻida bi-mulkihi al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-ʻAzīz, ʻAlī ibn ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz, ʻufiya ʻanhumā." 5. "Mimmā sāqahu [sāqathu] al-azmān, bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Mannān, ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ ibn Muṣṭafá, al-Amāsī al-waṭan wa-al-[...], ʻufya ʻanhumā, asʻada Allāh ḥālahumā bi-al-ṣafá, ʻāmalahumā sarmadan bi-al-baqāʼ, wa-aʻṭá jazāhumā bi-al-liqāʼ." 6. "Thumma tamallakahu al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr ilá Rubb [...] al-Ghafūr, Muḥammad ibn [... ... ...], sanat 1105 [lil-Hijrah = 1693/1694]." Stamp of ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ. 7. "Thumma tamallakahu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-ʻAzīz Khalīl ibn ʻAlī min awlād Shaykh [... ... ...], raḥmat Allāh ʻalayhim.". 8. "Thumma tamallakahu al-ʻabd al-faqīr wa-sharaʻa bi-idhn Rabbihi al-Qadīr [... ... ...]. Sanat 1142 [lil-Hijrah = 1729/1730]."

Colophon: No colophon; text ends abruptly with: "... fa-kayfa yuʼaththiru al-muḍāf ilayhi mā yuḍāduhu, aʻnī manʻ al-ṣarf wa-al-isnād, li-anna al-aʻlām al-mushtamilah ʻalá al-isnād min qabīl al-mabnīyāt naḥwa Taʼabbaṭa Sharran, fa-innahā bāqiyah fī ḥāl al-ʻalamīyah ʻalá mā kānat ʻalayhi qabla al-ʻalamīyah, fa-inna al-tasmiyah bi-hā innamā hiya li-dalālatahā ʻalá qiṣṣat al-ʻalamīyah gharībah, fa-law taṭarraqa ilayhā ..."

record.title: 880-03 al-Shifā bi-taʻrīf ḥuqūq al-Muṣṭafá : manuscript / ʻIyāḍ ibn Mūsá ibn ʻIyāḍ al-Yaḥṣubī.
record.note: Title from colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... wa-annahu lam yakun fī al-ʻArab illā wa-la-hā ʻalá Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wilādah aw qarābah. Wa-ʻinda Ibn ʻAbbās wa-ghayrihi, maʻná qawlihi taʻālá 'illā al-mawaddah fī al-qurbá', wa-kawnuhu min ashrafihim wa-arfaʻihim wa-afḍalihim ʻalá qirāʼat al-fatḥ, wa-hādhihi nihāyat al-madḥ. Thumma waṣafahu baʻdu bi-awṣāf ḥamīdah, wa-athná ʻalayhi bi-maḥāmid kathīrah, min ḥirṣihim ʻalá hidāyatihim wa-rushdihim wa-islāmihim wa-shiddat mā yaʻnatuhum wa-yaḍurr bi-him fī dunyāhum wa-ukhrá hum [wa-ukhrāhum] ..."
Secundo folio: tabban khabar al-ʻadhāb.
12 x 20 cm; written surface: 5.8 x 13.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on thin paper; headings in red; some notes on the margins and interlinear, in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish; text within red frame; catchwords.

Colophon: "Qad tayassara al-farāgh min taḥrīr hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah, al-mawsūmah bi-'al-Shifā fī taʻrīf ḥuqūq al-Muṣṭafá', min yad al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-naḥīf, Aḥmad ibn al-Ḥājj Muḥammad, al-mulaqqab bi-al-Naẓīf, bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Laṭīf, ghafara Allāh lahumā wa-satara ʻuyūbahumā, fī baldat Qusṭanṭinīyah, ḥamāhā Allāh min al-balīyah, fī Rajab, sanat 1180."

Translation of the colophon: "The completion of this noble copy, titled al-Shifā fī taʻrīf ḥuqūq al-Muṣṭafá', was facilitated by the help of the Gracious King, in the hand of the feeble and debilitated servant, Aḥmad ibn al-Ḥājj Muḥammad, nicknamed bi-al-Naẓīf, may God forgive both of them and cover their blemishes, in the city of Qusṭanṭinīyah [Istanbul, Turkey], may God protect it from calamity, during [the month of] Rajab, of the year 1180 [of the Hijrah = 3 December 1766-1 January 1767]."

record.title: 880-02 Thabt al-asānīd wa-al-ijāzāt : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Kabīr.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-awwal al-ākhir, al-shāfiʻ, al-muqaddim al-muʼakhkhir, al-jāmiʻ. Wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh, wa-anna Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, shahādat ʻabd dhalīl khāḍiʻ, mutamassik bi-al-Sayyid al-sanad al-shāfiʻ, ṣalawāt Allāh wa-salāmuhu ʻalayhi, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi, wa-kull man ṣaḥḥat nisbatuhu ilayh, min matbūʻ wa-tābiʻ. Āmīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr Abū Muḥammad Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Amīr, ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-luṭfihi al-khaṭīr: Hādhihi 'Jumal min masānīd al-anām mashāyikh al-Islām' alladhī [alladhīna] ijtamaʻnā bi-him wa-ludhnā bi-janāḥihim, laʻalla Allāh yukrimunā bihim wa-yunīlunā manālahum ..."
Secundo folio: iltamas minnī ijāzatan li-mā samiʻahu minnī.
17.5 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in four unnumbered quires)
In fair large naskh script, in black ink, on thick paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: A defaced "waqf" (endowment) statement: "Awqafa hādhā [,,, ,,, ,,,] al-Najjārī."
On folio 1a: "Ijāzah fī al-Ḥadīth. 5."

Colophon: "Wa-natawassalu ilá Allāh al-Raʼūf al-Raḥīm bi-jamīʻ man dhukira fī hādhā al-raqīm an lā yuḥwijanā ilá ghayrihi ṭurfata ʻayn, wa-an yalṭufa bi-nā fī al-dārayn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Allāhumma ikhtim lanā wa-al-Muslimīn bi-al-īmān, bi-jāh al-Nabī wa-ālihi [wa-āl] baytihi. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "We implore God Almighty, the Merciful, the Compassionate, by all those who were mentioned in this text, not to be in need, for a blink of an eye, except for Him, and to be kind to us in the two abodes. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, his family, and his companions, and grant them abundant peace until Judgement Day. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. O God! Seal us, and the Muslims, with faith, by the honor of the Prophet and his household. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf Qashsh.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala manṭiq al-ʻulamāʼ sullaman li-dhawī al-afhām wa-al-baṣāʼir, wa-manna ʻalayhim bi-al-ʻuqūl wa-al-ḥujaj al-wāḍiḥah wa-al-ashāyir, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-mabʻūth min akram al-ʻashāyir, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi dhawī al-hudá wa-al-bashāyir. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr li-raḥmat Rabb al-Falaq, Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh Yūsuf ibn al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Karakī (al-Gharaqī ?): Hādhā 'Sharḥ laṭīf ʻalá matn al-Sullam', yaḥullu alfāẓahu wa-yubayyinu ṣaʻbahu wa-murādah, intakhabtuhu min sharḥ muʼallifihi ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Akhḍarī al-Mālikī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi, wa-min sharḥ al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Damanhūrī al-Shāfiʻī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi, maʻa fawāʼid min ghayrihimā ..."
Secundo folio: ay ʻan arbāb al-ḥijā.
16.5 x 24 cm; written surface: 14 x 19 cm; 22-32 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two unnumbered quires).
In large naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Sullam in red; some notes and corrections; on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: Miscellaneous quotations in poetry and prose.

Colophon: No colophon. Texts ends with: "... wa-innamā lam yubayyin al-muṣa[, al-Akhḍarī] al-ʻaqīm minhā, li-anna hādhā al-mukhtaṣar innamā waḍaʻahu, kamā qāla, fī muʻẓamihi, awqāt al-ʻajalah wa-al-ḍīq, wa-dhālika fī wasaṭ al-shitā, sanat iḥdá wa-arbaʻīn wa-tisʻimiʼah, wa-illā fa-qad waḍaʻa ahl hādhā al-fann li-tafṣīl al-muntaj min al-ʻqīm jadāwil, fa-li-tuṭālaʻ fī maḥallihā wa-ʻiwaḍ al-ikhtiṣār. Intahá. Wa-tatbaʻu al-natījah al-akhass, ay, al-khissatayn min tilka al-muqaddimāt. Wa-al-khissah al-salb wa-al-juzʼīyah wa-al-sharaf shayʼān, al-ījāb wa-al-kullīyah, fa-al-muqaddimah al-sālibah khasīsah wa-law kānat kullīyah, wa-al-juzʼīyah khasīsah wa-law kānat mūjibah. Fa-idhā ishtamalat muqaddimāt al-qiyās ʻalá khissah aw khissatayn fa-al-natījah tābiʻah li-dhālik. Fa-khissat al-salb wujidat fī al-ḍarb al-thānī min al-shakl al-awwal."

record.title: 880-01 Risālah fī al-fiqh mukhtaṣarah min matn al-Manhj : manuscript.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-iʻānah. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá afḍālih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālih. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā mukhtaṣar qalīl al-mabānī, kathīr al-maʻānī, fī al-fiqh ʻalá madhhab al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-arḍāh, intakhabtuhu min al-kutub al-muhadhdhabah, wa-washshaḥtuhu bi-ʻibārāt mustanadīyah, jaʻalahu Allāh manhaj irshād lil-ṭālibīn, wa-ghāyat maṭmaʻ naẓar al-qāṣidīn. Āmīn."
Secundo folio: ka-al-wuḍūʼ wa-sunna ʻalayhi.
17 x 24 cm; written surface: 11 x 18.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two quires)
In fair naskh script, closely-written, in black ink, on thick paper; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Risālah fī al-fiqh mukhtaṣarah min matn al-Manhj li-Shaykh al-Islām, taʼlīf al-Imām, ʻalayhi al-raḥmah wa-al-ruḍwān, wa-nafaʻanā bi-him ajmaʻīn."

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Tamma tabyīḍuhā fī 16 Rabīʻ Ākhir, sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-sabʻah wa-khamsīn, ʻalá yad afqar al-wará, rājī ghafr al-masāwī, Muḥammad Abū al-Khayr al-Qalamāwī. Wa-kāna dhālika li-iḥdá wa-ʻishrīn khalawna min shahr Rabīʻ al-Thānī, sanat 1295, alf wa-miʼatayn wa-khamsah wa-tisʻīn Hijrīyah. Wa-al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable of what is correct, to Him is the reference and returning. The fair copy was completed on 16 Rabīʻ Ākhir, of the year 1257 [of the Hijrah = 7 June 1841], by the hand of the poorest of mankind, who aspires for the forgiveness of the blemishes, Muḥammad Abū al-Khayr al-Qalamāwī. Copied twenty-one nights having passed from the month of Rabīʻ al-Thānī, of the year 1295 of the Hijrah [24 April 1878]. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 Risālah fī fann al-munāẓarah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr Sājaqlīzādah.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Bismillāh wa-bi-ḥamdihi, wa-ṣalātun wa-salāmun ʻalá rusulihi. Yaqūlu al-bāʼis al-faqīr Muḥammad al-madʻū bi-Sājiqlī Zādah, akramahu Allāh subḥānuhu bi-al-falāḥ wa-al-saʻādah: Hādhihi Risālah fī fann al-munāẓarah, ʻamiltuhā laka yā walad wa-li-amthālika al-mubtadiʼīn, bāraka Allāh fīhā laka wa-li-man arādahā ghayraka. Wa-hādhā al-fann lā shakka fī istiḥbāb taḥṣīlih, wa-innamā al-shakk fī wujūbih kifāyah. Wa-al-munāẓarah fī al-ʻurf hiya al-mudāfaʻah li-yaẓhara al-ḥaqq ..."
Secundo folio: kawn al-taʻrīf akhaṣṣ muṭlaqan.
14.7 x 20.7 cm; written surface: 9 x 14 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some commentaries on the margins and interlinear; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb Waladīyah min fann al-ādāb."
On folio 1a: "Mawḍūʻ al-ādāb thalāthah: Manʻ, naqḍ, muʻāraḍah."
Colophon: "Tammat al-Risālah al-Waladīyah min al-ādāb ʻalá yad al-ʻabd ..."
Translation of the colophon: "The epistle of al-Waladīyah, on the art of [debate] was completed by the hand of the servant ..."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ Alfīyat al-Muṣṭalaḥ : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad al-Ṣaʻīdī al-ʻAdawī.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Ḥamdan li-man rafaʻa lil-ʻulamāʼ marātib wa-mazāyā, wa-faḍḍalahum ʻalá man siwāhum min al-barāyā, wa-ṣalātan wa-salāman ʻalá rafīʻ al-janāb wa-sayyid al-albāb, Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad, Sayyid al-Sādāt, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi, wa-man tabiʻahum fī al-aʻmāl al-ṣāliḥāt. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, ʻAlī al-Ṣaʻīdī al-ʻAdawī al-Mālikī: Lammā tafaḍḍala al-Mawlá al-karīm bi-ḥuḍūr hādhā al-kitāb min awwalihi ilá ākhirihi, wa-akhadhahu ʻan al-mashāyikh al-thiqāt, wa-ijāzatuhum la-hu, wa-bi-muṭālaʻatihi maʻa al-ikhwān, wa-ẓahara shayʼ mimmā yataʻallaqu bi-ḥall al-sha[rḥ], aḥbabtu an aḍaʻahu maʻa mā aḍummuhu ilayhi min kutub hādhā al-fann wa-min ḥāshiyat ... al-Shaykh Manḍūr al-ʻŪfī ..."
Secundo folio: wa-dhālika ay ṣidq.
16 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 16.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in nine unnumbered quires).
In hastily written naskh script, in black ink on laid paper; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Ḥāshiyat al-ʻAllāmah al-muḥaqqiq, imām al-ʻaṣr, ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad al-ʻAdawī, ʻalá sharḥ Shykh al-Islām ʻalá Alfīyat al-Muṣṭalaḥ, ʻamma nafʻuhā. Āmīn."

Author's colophon: "Hādhā mā tayassara jamʻuhu, wa-kāna min faḍl Allāh al-ʻAẓīm waḍʻuhu, maʻa qiṣar bāʻī wa-qillat iṭṭilāʻī, fa-in kāna ṣawāban fa-huwa min faḍl Mawlānā al-Karīm al-Wahhāb [ṣaḥḥ], wa-in kāna khaṭaʼan fa-huwa min ḍaʻf fahmī wa-lā ʻujāb. Fa-Yā Allāh, Yā Karīm, Yā Raḥmān, Yā Raḥīm, adriknā bi-raḥmatika, wa-ilḥaqnā bi-isʻāfātika, wa-illā kunā min al-hālikīn, wa-kāna saʻyunā fī ḍalāl mubīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Najazahu jāmiʻuhu al-faqīr ʻAlī al-Ṣaʻīdī al-Mālikī, yawm al-Thulāthāʼ, sādis ʻashar Shawwāl, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-sabʻah wa-sittīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This is what was facilitated to be compiled and to be written, by the favor of God Almighty, despite my impotence [literally short span] and lack of knowledge. If it is correct, it is by the favor of our Generous and Abundant Giving Lord. If it is wrong, it is because of my feeble understanding, for this is not a surprise. O God, O Generous One, O Merciful, O Compassionate, come fast to us with Your mercy, and bestow upon us Your aid. Otherwise, we would be among the perishable ones, and our endeavor would be a manifested delusion. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and his companions, and grant them peace. Its poor compiler, ʻAlī al-Ṣaʻīdī al-Mālikī, completed it on Tuesday, the sixth of the month of Shawwāl, of the year 1167 [of the Hijrah = 6 August 1754]."

Copyist's colophon: "Yaqūlu kātibuhu: al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhihi al-ḥāshiyah yawm al-Khamīs, ḥādī ʻashar al-Ḥijjah alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-thalāthah wa-sabʻīn. Aḥsana Allāh ʻāqibatanā bi-faḍlihi wa-karamih."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "Its copyist says: Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and his companions, and grant them peace. This gloss was completed on Thursday, the eleventh day of the month of al-Ḥijjah, of the year 1173 [of the Hijrah = 25 July 1760]. May God grant us a good end, by His favor and generosity."

record.title: 880-01 Takhmīs al-Qaṣīdah al-Suwayjiʻīyah : manuscript.
record.note: Title of Takhmīs al-Qaṣīdah al-Suwayjiʻīyah supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of "Takhmīs al-Qaṣīdah al-Suwayjiʻīyah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ashraf al-mursalīn, Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Fuʼādī ghayra waṣlika mā tamanná // wa-laylu shabībatī qad māta mannā. Wa-lammā zādanī al-tabrīḥu annā // samiʻtu suwayjiʻa al-asalāti ghanná. ʻAlá maṭlūlati al-ʻAdhabāti ranná ..."
Secundo folio of Takhmīs al-Qaṣīdah al-Suwayjiʻīyah: Uʻallilu muhjatī wa-asūsu nafsī.

The first panegyrical poem in five verses starts with: "Wa-kam lillāh min luṭfin khafīyin // yadiqqu khafāhu ʻan fahmi al-zakīyi". It ends with: "Tawassal bil-Nabīyi fa-kull ʻabdin // yughāthu idhā tawassala bi-al-Nabīyi."
The second "Takhmīs" starts with: "Ilzam bāba Rabbika wa-utruk kulla dūnin // wa-isʼalhu al-salāmata min dāri al-futūni". It ends with: "Lā tukthir hammaka mā quddir yakūnu."

The second panegyrical poem starts with: "Yā nafsu nilti al-munā // fa-istabshirī wa-salī // hādhā al-ḥabība wa-hādhā Khātima al-Rusuli". It ends with: "Wa-al-sābiqīna ilá al-Islām qāṭibatan // wa-al-tābiʻīna bi-iḥsānin wa-kulli walī".
16.8 x 25 cm; written surface: 10 x 17 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good calligraphic naskh script, in black ink, on cream colored thin paper; markings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi 'Qaṣīdat al-Suwayjiʻīyah' fī madḥ Sayyidinā Muḥammad khayr al-barīyah bi-al-tamām. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh". Followed by two didactic verses, as follows: "Wa-mā min kātibin illā sa-yablá // wa-yubqī al-dahru mā katabat yadāhu. Fa-lā taktub zamānaka ghayra shayʼin yusirruka fī al-Qiyāmati an tarāhu."

Colophon of "Takhmīs al-Qaṣīdah al-Suwayjiʻīyah" (folio 8b): "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-Bārī, Sulṭān Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad al-Huwārī al-ʻAdawī al-Mālikī madhhaban. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon of "Takhmīs al-Qaṣīdah al-Suwayjiʻīyah": "It is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence, by the hand of the poor to his Lord the Creator, Sulṭān Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad al-Huwārī al-ʻAdawī al-Mālikī madhhaban. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and companions and grant them peace. Peace be unto the messengers. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

Colophon of the second "Takhmīs" (folio 10a): "Tammat bi-ḥamdi Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusni tawfīqihi ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-Bārī Sulṭān ibn Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad al-Huwārī al-ʻAdawī al-Mālikī madhhaban, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn. Tammat."

Translation of the colophon of the second "Takhmīs": "It was completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence, by the hand of its copyist, the poor to his Lord the Creator, Sulṭān ibn Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad al-Huwārī al-ʻAdawī al-Mālikī madhhaban, may God forgive him, his parents, and the Muslims. Amen. O Lord of the Universe. Peace be unto the messengers. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 al-Ḥadīth al-musalsal bi-yawm ʻĀshūrāʼ : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Ṣaghīr.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-iʻānah, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Ḥamdan li-man manna ʻalaynā bi-al-niʻam al-wāfirah allatī min jumlatihā ittiṣāl al-sanad. Wa-ṣalātan wa-salāman ʻalá afḍal man ḥumida min al-khalq, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-muḥibbīhi wa-ḥizbih. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn al-Imām al-Amīr, ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-luṭfihi wa-jabara qalbahu al-kasīr: Qad manna Allāh, subḥānuhu, min faḍlihi, wa-la-hu al-ḥamdu wa-al-minnah ʻalá ʻabīdihi, bi-akhdh 'Musalsal ʻĀshūrāʼ' ʻalá ustādhihi wālidihi mirāran ʻadīdah fī sinīn, bi-ḥaḍrat jamʻ min fuḍalāʼ al-anām wa-ʻulamāʼ al-Islām ..."
Secundo folio: aqwá iʻtimād, al-ḥujjah al-thabt al-sanad.
17 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 13.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: The leaves of the manuscript are wrapped in a court form 22.5 x 34 cm, folded to 17 x 22.5 cm.

"Musalsal ʻĀshurāʼ" is in fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; keywords in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords. The wrapper is written in fair ruqʻah script, in purple.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā al-Ḥadīth al-musalsal bi-yawm ʻĀshūrāʼ, taʼlīf al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Amīr, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam.

The wrapper is a handwritten sample Egyptian court form, undated, titled "Ṣūrat indhār" (Warning "sample" form), in 25 lines. It starts with: "Ṣūrat indhār. Innahu fī yawm ----- bināʼan ʻalá ṭalab al-Sayyid Khalīl al-Zarrū, tājir minī fātūrah, bi-Shāriʻ Amīr al-Juyūsh, tabaʻ Qism al-Jamālīyah ...". It ends with: "... Wa-li-ajl an yakūna dhālika maʻlūman ṭaraf al-muʻlan ilayhā, qad turikat wa-sullimat ilayhā nuskhah minhādhā [min hādhā] al-indhār bi-maḥall iqāmatihā, mutakallaman, kamā dhukira aʻlāh wa-bulligh. Rasm hādhā Millīm -----."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-risālah yawm al-Aḥad, fī 9 khalat min shahr Muḥarram, sanat 1258, thamāniyah <thamāniyah> wa-khamsīn [wa-miʼatayn] wa-alf, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr Ḥusayn al-Nazlī. Kātibuhu al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr Ḥusayn al-Nazlī al-Shāmī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu. Āmīn. Kutibat hādhihi al-risālah fī al-Jāmiʻ al-Azhar." At the left of the colophon, over "al-Nuzlī", a continuation of the name of the copyist, as follows: "Ibn Ṭāhā ibn Saʻd al-Adham, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi."

Translation of the colophon: "This epistle was copied on Sunday, 9 days having passed from the month of Muḥarram, of the year 1258 [of the Hijrah = 20 February 1842], by the hand of the poor servant Ḥusayn al-Nazlī. Its copyist the poor and wretched Ḥusayn al-Nazlī al-Shāmī al-Shāfiʻī, may God forgive him. Amen. This epistle was copied at al-Jāmiʻ al-Azhar." At the left of the colophon, over "al-Nuzlī", a continuation of the name of the copyist, as follows: "Ibn Ṭāhā ibn Saʻd al-Adham, may God forgive him and his parents."

record.title: 880-02 Fatḥ al-Malik al-Jawwād bi-tashīl qismat al-tarikāt ʻalá baʻḍ al-ʻibād : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻUmar al-Dayrabī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yā Rabb yassir wa-aʻin. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī lā yakhlifu al-mīʻād, alladhī tawallá qismat al-mīrāth bi-nafsihi, ʻalá arbābihi min al-ʻibād, li-yakūna qāṭiʻan lil-nizāʻ wa-al-shiqāq wa-al-ʻinād. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad afḍal al-ʻibād, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-fāʼizīn min Allāh bi-ghāyat al-murād, ṣalātan wa-salāman dāʼimayn mutalāzimayn ilá al-ḥshr wa-al-maʻād. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, Aḥmad al-Dayrabī al-Shāfiʻī al-Ghunaymī: Qad iṭṭalaʻtu ʻalá risālah li-baʻḍ ahl al-ʻaṣr min al-ʻibād, tataʻallaqu bi-qismat al-mīrāth fī al-masāʼil al-ghāyilah, wa-hiya ghayr mūfiyah ... fa-aḥbabtu an aktuba fī dhālika risālah mūfiyah bi-al-murād, wa-sammaytuhā: 'Fatḥ al-Malik al-Jawwād bi-tashīl qismat al-tarikāt ʻalá baʻḍ al-ʻibād' ..."
Secundo folio: ʻashr, fa-in qasamtahā ʻalá al-ithnayn.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 2 unnumbered quires).
In clear medium naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; few corrections on the margins; some overlined keywords; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Risālah fī al-mīrāth."
Text folios 1b-13b; folios 14-16 are blank.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-waqaʻat hādhihi al-masʼalah lil-Qāḍī Shurayḥ, fa-qaḍá fīhā bi-dhālik. Fa-ghaḍibat al-ukht wa-jāʼat ilá ʻAlī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, tashkū Shurayḥan. Fa-wajadathu yurīdu an yarkab, fa-manaʻathu al-rukūb, wa-amsakat rikābahu, wa-qālat: Yā Amīr al-Muʼminīn, inna Shurayḥan ẓalamanī. Qāl: Wa-mā dhāk. Qālat: Inna akhī māta wa-taraka sittamiʼat dīnār, fa-aʻṭānī Shurayḥ dīnāran wāḥidan. Qāl: Laʻala akhāki taraka ibnatayn wa-umman wa-zawjah wa-ithnay ʻashara akhan wa-anti. Qālat: Naʻam. Qāl: Dhālika ḥaqquki. Wa-tarakahā wa-maḍá. Fa-wuṣifat hādhihi bi-al-kubrá bi-al-nisbah ilá ..."

record.title: 880-02 Rafʻ al-ilbās ʻan wahm al-Waswās : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn al-ʻImād al-Aqfahsī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-iʻānah. Aḥmadu Rabbī rāfiʻa al-ilbāsi // bi-al-ʻilmi raḥmatan li-jamīʻi al-nāsi. Ḥamda fatan yaṭlubu lil-mazīdi // min faḍlihi li-waʻdihi al-ḥamīdi ..."
Secundo folio: ʻAn damihi kadhā yakūnu awlá.
15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 17.5 cm; 19-22 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In large naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some corrections on the margins; no catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Rafʻ al-ilbās ʻan wahm al-Waswās, lil-faqīr Muḥammad ibn Muslim al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh taʻālá la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Six verses of poetry, attributed to the author, on the five levels of "taqdīm" (precedence), during prayer: "Li-muʼallifihi, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhu, fī marātib al-taqdīm al-khamsah." They start with: "Khudh jumlata al-taqdīm fa-huwa khamsatun // wāḥiduhā bi-al-ʻillati al-muḥassah." And end with: "Fa-ka-al-imāmi maʻa al-maʼmūmi // taḥillu li-Muslimin jāda bi-al-manẓūmi."
Colophon: No colophon. The text ends abruptly with: "... Ilá al-najāsati allatī fī al-manfadhi // fa-innahu yuʻfá wa-dhā huwa alladhī ..."

Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed. God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. O God forgive its author, its copyist, its reader, and all Muslims. Amen. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. Amen. Year 1102 [of the Hijrah = 1690/1691]."

record.title: 880-02 al-Durr al-thamīn fī Mawlid Sayyid al-awwalīn wa-al-ākhirīn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Ḥasan al-Munayyir al-Samannūdī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 2a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī anār jamīʻ al-wujūd bi-mawlid khayr al-anām, wa-abraza shams wujūdihi fī Rabīʻ al-Awwal, saʻd al-suʻūd, fa-nukkisat lidhālik al-aṣnām, wa-khalaqa nūrahu qabla ījād [al-khalq], fa-kāna dhālika al-nūr yadūru bi-al-qudrah ḥaythu shāʼa al-Malik al-ʻAllām, thumma naqalahu min ashraf al-aṣlāb wa-aṭhar al-arḥām, ilá an ẓahara fī ashraf al-ayyām ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu ... Muḥammad al-Munayyar al-Samānūdī: Qad sharaḥ ṣadrī an ūrida qiṣṣat Mawlid Sayyid al-Mursalīn ... Wa-sammaytuhu bi-al-Durr al-thamīn fī Mawlid Sayyid al-awwalīn wa-al-ākhirīn ..."
Secundo folio: al-faqīr al-maṣūl al-ḥaqīr al-muqaṣṣir.
16 x 23 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 18.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in four unnumbered quires).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; keywords and markings in red; the text of the first 29 leaves within black frames; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb al-Durr al-thamīn fī mawlid Sayyid al-awwalīn wa-al-ākhirīn, ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly, as follows: "... wa-idhā marra laylan ashraqat al-anwār min bayn ʻaynayh, tasṭaʻu ka-al-miṣbāḥ. Wa-kānū yusammūnahu ahl Makkah 'Miṣbāḥ al-Ḥaram' li-kathrat nūrih. Qāl: Wa-lammā tazāyadat akhbār ʻAbd Allāh wa-tasāmaʻat bi-hi al-qabāʼil, ijtamaʻa al-aḥbār min al-Yahūd bi-al-Shām, wa-takallamū ʻalá qurb mawlid Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-annahu ẓahar abūhu ʻAbd Allāh, wa-annahu sayakūnu ʻalá hadyihi halākuhum wa-kharāb ..."

record.title: 880-01 Natījat afkār dhawī al-majd fī taḥrīr abḥāth wa-baʻd : manuscript.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī la-hu al-amr min qablu wa-min baʻdu, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyid walad Ādam, al-ṣādiq al-maṣdūq fī al-waʻd, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābih, al-bālighīn bi-maḥabbatihi aqṣá marātib al-saʻādah wa-al-majd. Wa-baʻd, fa-qad saʼalanī aʻazz ikhwānī wa-awḥad khillānī, ballaghanī Allāh wa-īyāhu marātib al-saʻd, an aḍaʻa la-hu risālah laṭīfah tataḍammanu abḥāth wa-baʻd, fa-ajabtuhu ilá dhālik, rājiyan min al-Qādir al-Mālik an yahdiyanā ilá aslak al-masālik. Wa-sammaytuhā: 'Natījat afkār dhawī al-majd fī taḥrīr abḥāth wa-baʻd' ..."
Secundo folio: taʻalluq kull minhumā bi-al-taʼlīf.
16 x 23 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; keywords and markings in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi 'Natījat afkār dhawī al-majd fī taḥrīr abḥāth wa-baʻd', taʼlīf al-kabīr al-miqdār al-Ḥanafī, al-Shaykh al-Zuhrī al-Hāshimī al-Ḥanafī, Fataḥa Allāh [la-hu (?)]. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn." Also: "Hādhihi 'Natījat afkār dhawī al-majd fī taḥrīr abḥāth wa-baʻd', lil-faqīr ilá luṭfihi al-khafī Aḥmad al-Zuhrī al-Hāshimī al-Ḥanafī al-Maḥallī al-Azharī."

Colophon: "Yaqūlu kātibuhā Muḥammad ʻAlī Ḥasan: Innī naqaltuhā min musawwadat muʼallifihā, ṣabīḥat ʻāshir yawm min shahr Ramaḍān, ʻalá yad al-muʼallif, fī sanat alf wa-thalāthimiʼah wa-thalāthat ʻashar. Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Tamm. Qāla muʼallifuhā al-faqīr ilayhi al-Ghanī, Aḥmad al-Zuhrī al-Ḥanafī: Qad faraghtu minhā sādis yawm min shahr Ramaḍān, sanat 1313."

Translation of the colophon: "It copyist, Muḥammad ʻAlī Ḥasan, says: I copied it from the rough draft of its author, in the morning of the tenth day of the month of Ramaḍān, under the supervision of the author, in the year 1313 [of the Hijrah = 24 February 1896]. But God is more knowledgeable. It is completed. Its author, the poor to Him, the Affluent [God], Aḥmad al-Zuhrī al-Ḥanafī, said: I finished writing it on the sixth day of the month of Ramaḍān, of the year 1313 [of the Hijrah = 20 February 1896]."

record.title: Literary writings in Arabic poetry and prose : manuscript.
record.note: 1. Title of Risālat ʻAbd al-Laṭīf Afandī ilá al-Mawlá ʻAbd Allāh Afandī ibn ʻUmar Afandī from folio 1a.
