Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of Risālat ʻAbd al-Laṭīf Afandī ilá al-Mawlá ʻAbd Allāh Afandī ibn ʻUmar Afandī (folio 1b): "Hādhihi Risālah li-ʻAbd al-Laṭīf Afandī, al-maʻrūf bi-Unsī, kāna qāḍiyan bi-Dimashq al-Shām fī sanat 1075, wa-tuwuffiya bi-hā, katab bi-hā ilá al-Mawlá ʻAbd Allāh Afandī ibn ʻUmar Afandī muʻallim al-sulṭān ʻUthmān, wāliduhu wa-huwa Qāḍī al-ʻAskar, yatashakká fīhā min muʻānāt baʻḍ al-khuṭūb, wa-hādhihi al-risālah min al-amthāl wa-al-nawādir. Wa-hiya hādhihi ..."
Secundo folio of Risālat ʻAbd al-Laṭīf Afandī ilá al-Mawlá ʻAbd Allāh Afandī ibn ʻUmar Afandī: mā warāka yā ʻIṣām.

2. Incipit of Aqall mā yaḥfaẓuhu al-adīb (folio 8b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh walīyi al-niʻami // al-wāsiʻi al-faḍli al-ʻamīmi al-karami. Abdaʻa maṣnūʻātihi wa-aḥkam // wa-ʻallama al-insāna mā lam yaʻlam. Karramahu bi-al-ʻaqli wa-al-īmāni // wa-al-ʻilmi wa-al-ḥikmati wa-al-bayāni. Wa-khaṣṣa bi-al-faḍli ulī al-albābi // wa-zayyana al-ʻulūma bi-al-ādābi ..."
Secundo folio of Aqall mā yaḥfaẓuhu al-adīb: Wa-waqafat aṭmāʻu ahli al-naẓmi.

3. Incipit of Maqāmāt al-Zamakhsharī (folio 42b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-aḥmaduhu ʻalá mā adraja lī min ālāʼih fī taḍāʻīf ibtilāʼih, wa-mā razaqanī min darak al-ghibṭah bi-mā adhāqanī min mass al-sukhṭah, wa-mā tahaddala ʻalayya min thamar alṭāfihi ḥattá istamkant aṣābiʻī min iqtiṭāfih ... Hādhihi Maqāmāt anshaʼahā al-Imām Fakhr Khuwārizm, Abū al-Qāsim Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī, wa-alladhī nadabahu li-inshāʼihā annahu uriya fī baʻḍ ighfāʼāt al-ṣubḥ, ka-annamā ṣawwata bi-hi man yaqūlu la-hu: Yā Abā al-Qāsim, ajal maktūb wa-amal makdhūb, fahabba min ighfāʼihi tilk mashkhūṣan bi-hi mimmā hālahu wa-rawwaʻah ..."
Secundo folio of Maqāmāt al-Zamakhsharī: fīhim wa-rafʻ al-ʻaqīrah bi-al-nashīd.

4. Incipit of Ẓarāʼif al-akhbār (folio 83b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Khudh ḥadīthan tawashshat bi-hi al-qarāṭīs, fa-aḍḥat bi-ḥusnihi tatabāhá, raqqa lafẓan wa-rāqa maʻnan wa-maghnan, wa-fāqa luṭfan bi-sabkihi wa-tazāhá, wa-huwa māttafaqa [mā ittafaqa] lī min ẓarāʼif al-akhbār alladhī lam yaʼti bi-aʻjab minhā abū al-ʻajab, wa-huwa al-falak al-dawwār ..."
Secundo folio of Ẓarāʼif al-akhbār: dhāt ashjār wa-azhār wa-aṭyār wa-anhār.

5. Incipit of Takhayyulāt waʻirat al-maslak (folio 92b): "Nūn wa-al-qalami wa-mā yasṭurūn. Mā Hārūt wa-nafthuh, wa-baḥthuhu ʻammā yufarriqu bi-hi, wa-ḥaththuhu bi-laʻib [bi-al-laʻib] bi-al-ʻuqūl min al-bayān, wa-bayānuhu lil-ʻiyān, fa-innahu ṣaʻb al-markab, mumniʻ [mumtaniʻ (?), mumtiʻ (?)] al-mufrad wa-al-murakkab, wa-dūna iftirāʻ bikrihi wa-ṣidq sinn bakrihi takhayyulāt wa-ʻirat al-maslak, shāmikhat al-ʻirnīn ʻan an tuslak, bal dūna manālihi kharṭ al-qatād, wa-tafattut akbād, wa-taqaṭṭuʻ aktād, illā li-man dhallala Allāh la-hu jawāmiḥ azimmatih, wa-awdaʻahu sajīyatahu bi-rummatih ..."
Secundo folio of Takhayyulāt waʻirat al-maslak: wa-idhā ajāba ḥayyar.

6. Incipit of Dīwān ʻUmar ibn ʻAbd al-Jalīl al-Baghdādī (folio 99b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi shadharah min kalām Shaykhinā al-ʻallāmah al-muḥaqqiq wa-al-fahhāmah al-mudaqqiq, al-ʻārif billāh Sayyidī al-Shaykh ʻUmar ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Jalīl al-Baghdādī al-Ḥanafī, qaddasa Allāh taʻālá rūḥahu, wa-jaʻala min al-raḥīq al-makhtūm ghabūqahu wa-ṣabūḥahu, wa-nafaʻanā bi-barakātih fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn ..."
Secundo folio of Dīwān ʻUmar ibn ʻAbd al-Jalīl al-Baghdādī: Wa-al-ṣafā bi-al-ghayri in kāna ṣafā.

7. Incipit of Risālat Ismāʻīl ibn ʻAbd al-Karīm al-Jarrāʻī (folio 107a): "Fa-in rumtu al-farār lā ará lī musʻifan. Shiʻr. Wa-in shakawtu amrī lam ajid lī munṣifan. Ṣighāru zamāninā ṣārū kibāran // wa-qad ghaḍiba al-zamānu ʻalá al-kibāri. Fa-mā lī lā ará man yakhshá ʻāran // wa-lā ḥurran min al-makrūhi jārā ..."
Secundo folio of Risālat Ismāʻīl ibn ʻAbd al-Karīm al-Jarrāʻī: fa-lā aqurru fī baytī.

8. Incipit of Miscellaneous poems, by miscellaneous poets (folio 147a): "Ibn al-Sayyid al-Andalusī. Marīḍu al-jufūni bi-lā ʻillatain // wa-lakinna qalbī bi-hi mumraḍu. Aʻāna al-suhāda ʻalá muqlatī // bi-fayḍi al-dumūʻi fa-lam tughmaḍi. Wa-mā zāra shawqan wa-lākin atá // yuʻarriḍu lī innahu muʻriḍi ..."
Secundo folio of Miscellaneous poems, by miscellaneous poets: Afalā rathīta li-man yabītu.
10.5 x 16 cm; written surface: varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: Bound with flap; remnants of dark brown leather on spine and flap.
In good to fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some comments on the margins; catchwords.
On the front cover: Miscellaneous calculations
On the lower edge: "Majmūʻ rasāʼil adabīyah."
On folio 1a: "Risālah lil-marḥūm ʻAbd al-Laṭīf Afandī al-maʻrūf bi-Unsī, Qāḍī Dimashq, kataba bi-hā li-baʻḍ aṣḥābihi, wa-hiya farīdah fī bābihā."
On folio 1a: "Wa-fīhi majmūʻ kutub. Kutubuhu 10."
On folio 8a: "Aqall mā yaḥfaẓuhu al-adīb, naẓm al-fāḍil al-adīb al-marḥūm Aḥmad Bīk al-Kīwānī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. M."
Folios 40b-41b are blank.
On folio 42a: "Hādhihi Risālat al-Zamakhsharī wa-Maqāmātuh."
Folios 82a-83a are blank.
Folios 91b-92a are blank.
Folios 98b-99a are blank.
At the head of folio 99b: "Dīwān al-Baghdādī."
Folios 104a-106b are blank.

On folio 107a: "Hādhihi al-Risālah li-ṣāḥibinā Abī al-Fidā Ismāʻīl ibn ʻAbd al-Karīm al-Jirāʻī al-Ḥanbalī al-Dimashqī, ʻamilahā lil-Raʼīs al-ʻUmdah Sanāʼ al-Dawlah wa-al-Mulk Sulaymān Abū al-Rabīʻ Fayḍ al-Dīn, Raʼīs al-Kuttāb bi-al-Dīwān al-ʻUthmānī wa-al-Ṭughrāʼī, kāna Allāh la-hu, fī shahr Jumādá al-Thāniyah, sanat 1200 [of the Hijrah = April 1786]."
Dīwān al-Baghdādī starts with: "Kullu yawmin lam yarākum naẓarī // ghariqat ʻaynī bi-baḥri al-ʻibari ..."
Folios 145a-146b are blank.
Folios 160b-161a are blank.
On folio 161b: A list of some merchandize and calculations, dated 18 Shawwal 1222 of the Hijrah (19 December 1807).

1. Colophon of Risālat ʻAbd al-Laṭīf Afandī ilá al-Mawlá ʻAbd Allāh Afandī ibn ʻUmar Afandī. No colophon. The text ends with: "... Fa-hā anā qad nathaltuhā bayna yadayhi li-taqbīl dhuyūlih, wa-akuff duʻāʼihā mabsūṭah tilqāʼ madyan samāʼ qabūlihi, mā lamaʻa bāriq wa-unjiza waʻd ṣādiq. Wa-hādhā ākhiruhā. M. Wa-al-inṣāf, innahā min amtan al-inshāʼ wa-ajwadih."

2. Colophon of Aqall mā yaḥfaẓuhu al-adīb: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ʻawnihi fī niṣf Jumādá al-Thānī, sanat 1196, sitt wa-tisʻīn wa-miʼah wa-alf." At the left of the colphon (in red): "Balagha muqābalatan ʻalá aṣl ṣaḥīḥ, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd Kamāl al-Dīn Muḥammad, al-ʻĀmirī al-ḥayy, al-Ḥusaynī, al-shahīr bi-Ibn al-Ghazzī [probably: Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Ghazzī, 1760-1799], ghafara Allāh la-hu. M."

Translation of the colophon of Aqall mā yaḥfaẓuhu al-adīb: "It was completed by the praise of God Almighty and His help, in the middle of Jumādá al-Thānī, of the year 1196 [of the Hijrah = 28 May 1782]." At the left of the colophon: "The collation was completed with a correct original, by the hand of the servant Kamāl al-Dīn Muḥammad, al-ʻĀmirī al-ḥayy, al-Ḥusaynī, known as Ibn al-Ghazzī [probably: Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Ghazzī, 1760-1799], may God forgive him. M."
3. Colophon of Maqāmāt al-Zamakhsharī: "Wa-naḥmadu Allāh ʻalá nawālih, wa-al-salām ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad wa-ālih. Tammat."
Translation of the colophon of Maqāmāt al-Zamakhsharī: "We praise God for His favor, and peace be upon His Prophet Muḥammad and his family. It is completed."

4. Colophon of Ẓarāʼif al-akhbār. No colophon. The text ends with: "... fa-idhā bi-ṣayḥatin min nāḥiyat al-shamāl, irtajat lahā tilka al-ṭulūl, fa-nahaḍtu ḥattá anẓura mā hādhā al-amr alladhī ṭará, fa-rafastu al-liḥāf ilá wará, fa-intabahtu, fa-idhā al-amr manām wa-aḍghāth aḥlām. Wa-al-salām ʻalá al-dawām. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

5. Colophon of Takhayyulāt waʻirat al-maslak: No colophon. Text ends with: "... Wa-quṣārá al-qawl, wa-mā yaqūluhu fīhi Zaydun wa-ʻAmr, inna la-hu awṣāfan warāʼ dhālik baʻīdat al-manāl wa-al-masālik, yaʻrifuhā man yaʻlamu idhā ṭāla waṣf al-qalam. Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

6. Colophon of Dīwān ʻUmar ibn ʻAbd al-Jalīl al-Baghdādī: No colophon. Text ends with: "Antumu al-rūḥu allatī aḥyā bi-hā // wa-munāya wa-quṣārá waṭarī. Antumu ḥissī wa-kullī bāṭinan // antumu saʻyī wa-antum baṣarī."

7. Colophon of Risālat Ismāʻīl ibn ʻAbd al-Karīm al-Jirāʻī: No colophon. Text ends with: "... fa-nasʼaluhu, subḥānuhu, al-tawfīq wa-al-sadād ilá mā yarḍāh. Innahu al-karīm al-jawwād. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah."

Colophon of Miscellaneous poems by miscellaneous poets: No colophon. The text ends with selections from the poetry of Abū Nuwās (approximately 756-approximately 810), on wine and disparagement of Bedouin life, as follows: "... Fa-daʻ li-dhī nāqatin masākinahu // wa-malʻaban lil-ḍibābi wa-al-warali. Wa-ʻuj ilá majlisin bi-hi ṭaribat // ḥūru al-ẓibā lil-shadwi wa-al-ghazali."

record.title: Collection of prayers and invocations in Arabic prose and poetry : manuscript.

Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Dalāʼil al-khayrāt" (folio 1a): The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-faḍāʼilihā, adhkuruhā maḥdhūfat al-asānīd, li-yashula ḥifẓuhā ʻalá al-qāriʼ, wa-hiya min ahamm al-muhimmāt li-man yurīdu al-qurb min Rabb al-Arbāb. Wa-sammaytuhu Kitāb 'Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī al-Mukhtār', ibtighāʼan li-marḍāt Allāh taʻālá wa-maḥabbatan fī Rasūlihi al-Karīm Muḥammad ..."
Secundo folio of "Dalāʼil al-khayrāt": ʻashran wa-lā yusallimu ʻalayka aḥad.

2. Incipit of "Qaṣīdat al-Burdah" (folio 88b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam. al-Burdah, lil-Shaykh al-Imām Sayyidī [Muḥammad ibn] Saʻīd ibn Ḥammād al-Būṣīrī, raḥimahu Allāh. Amin tadhakkuri jīrānin bi-Dhī Salami // mazajta damʻan jará min muqlatin bi-dami ..."
Secundo folio of "Qaṣīdat al-Burdah": Ayaḥsabu al-ṣabbu anna al-ḥubba munkatimun.

3. Incipit of "Qaṣīdat Umm Hānī" (folio 103b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad wa-ālih. Qaṣīdat Umm Hānī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhā: Mā lil-masākīni mithlī mukthirī al-zalali // illā shafāʻata khayri al-khalqi wa-al-rusuli. Yā mudhnibīna qifū bi-bābihi wa-salū // bi-hi al-mafāza tanālū ghāyata al-amali ..."
Secundo folio of "Qaṣīdat Umm Hānī": ʻasá ʻināyatu luṭfi Allāhi talḥaqunī.

4. Incipit of "al-Ḥizb al-kabīr" (105b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām Abū ʻAbd Allāh Sayyidī Abī al-Ḥasan al-Shādhilī, raḥimahu Allāh: Aʻūdhu billāh min al-Shayṭān al-rajīm. Wa-idhā jāʼaka alladhīna yuʼminūna bi-āyātinā fa-qul salāmun ʻalaykum. Kataba Rabbukum ʻalá nafsihi al-raḥmata annahu man ʻamila mikum sūʼan bi-jahlihi thumma tāba min baʻdu wa-aṣlaḥa fa-innahu ghafūrun raḥīm ..."
Secundo folio of "al-Ḥizb al-kabīr": wa-lam takun la-hu ṣāḥibatun.

5. Incipit of "Ḥizb al-baḥr (folio 117b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad wa-ālihi. al-Ḥizb al-Baḥr, lil-Shaykh al-Imām Sayyidī Abī al-Ḥasan al-Shādhilī, raḥimahu Allāh. Yā ʻAlī. Yā ʻAẓīm. Yā Ḥalīm. Yā ʻAlīm. Anta Rabbī, wa-ʻalayka ḥasbī. Fa-niʻma al-Rabbu Rabbī, wa-niʻma al-ḥasbu ḥasbī. Tanṣuru man tashāʼ, wa-Anta al-ʻAzīzu al-Raḥīm ..."
Secundo folio of "Ḥizb al-baḥr": wa-al-shukūk wa-al-awhām al-sātirah lil-qulūb.

6. Incipit of "Adʻiyah" by Abū al-Ḥasan al-Shādhilī and others (folio 120b): "Wa-min duʻāʼihi, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu: Allāhumma ighfir lī, usturnī wa-lā tafḍaḥnī fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah, wa-dhakkirnī, wa-fahhimnī, wa-irḥamnī, wa-farriḥnnī ..."
Secundo folio of "Adʻiyah": shayʼ illā min dhikrika wa-ṭāʻatik.

7. Incipit of "Ḥizb" of Abū al-ʻAbbās al-Mursī (folio 143b). "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam. Ḥizb al-Shaykh al-kāmil, al-quṭb al-wāṣil, al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá, Sayyidī Abū al-ʻAbbās al-Mursī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Āmīn. Aʻūdhu billāh min al-Shayṭān al-rajīm. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, maliki yawm al-dīn ..."
Secundo folio of "Ḥizb" of Abū al-ʻAbbās al-Mursī: ʻalayhim wa-lā al-ḍāllīn.

8. Incipit of "Ḥizb al-najāh" (folio 157b): "Yatlūhu [i.e. Ḥizb of Abī al-ʻAbbās al-Mursī] Ḥizb al-najāh, li-Mawlānā Abī al-Ḥasan al-Shādhilī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-Qādir, al-Fard al-Ḥakīm al-Fāṭir, al-Ṣamad al-Karīm, al-Bāʻith Nabīyahu bi-jawāmiʻ al-kalim ..."
Secundo folio of "Ḥizb al-najāh": al-kalim wa-badāʼiʻ al-ḥikam.

9. Incipit of "Ḥizb" of al-Nawawī (folio 162b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-baḥr al-humām, Sayyidī Abī Zakarīyā Yaḥyá al-Nawawī: Bismillāh. Allāhu Akbar. Allāhu Akbar. Aqūlu ʻalá nafsī, wa-ʻalá dīnī, wa-ʻalá ahlī, wa-ʻalá awlādī, wa-ʻalá mālī, wa-ʻalá aṣḥābī, wa-ʻalá amawālihim alf bismillāh. Allāhu Akbar. Allāh Akbar ..."
Secundo folio of "Ḥizb" of al-Nawawī: wa-ʻalá aṣḥābī wa-ʻalá adyānihim.

10. Incipit of "al-Waẓīfah al-Zarrūqīyah" (folio 166a): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-baḥr al-humām, Abū ʻAbd Allāh Sayyidī Aḥmad Zarrūq, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakātihi. Āmīn. Aʻūdhu billāh min al-Shayṭān al-rajīm. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ilāhukum ilāhun wāḥidun. Lā ilāha illā Huwa. al-Ḥayyu al-Qayyūm ..."
Secundo folio of "al-Waẓīfah al-Zarrūqīyah": wa-ilayhi al-maṣīr. Ilāh mā fī al-samāwāt.

11. Incipit of "Mā arsala al-Raḥmānu aw yursilu" (folio 173a): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam. 11. x 15.5 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 12; 12 lines per page.

1. Colophon of "Dalāʼil al-khayrāt": "Intahá Kitāb 'Dalāʼil al-khayrāt' bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ḥusn ʻawnihi wa-tawfīqih al-jamīl wa-yumnih. Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhu awāʼil Rabīʻ al-Nabawī al-mufaḍḍal, ʻāma khamsīn wa-miʼah wa-alf, ʻalá yad ʻubayd Rabbihi wa-asīr dhanbih, Aḥmad ibn Masʻūd Banānī, ghafara Allāh [la-hu] wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of "Dalāʼil al-khayrāt": "The book of 'Dalāʼil al-khayrāt' was completed by the praise of God Almighty, His help, His gracious benevolence and His blessing. It was completed in the beginning of the esteemed month of Rabīʻ al-Nabawī [i.e., al-Awwal], of the year 1150 [of the Hijrah = 29 June 1737], by the hand of the little servant of his Lord, and the hostage of his sin, Aḥmad ibn Masʻūd Banānī, may God forgive him, his parents, and all Muslims. Amen."
2. Colophon of "Qaṣīdat al-Burdah": "Intahat 'al-Kawākib al-durrīyah fī madḥ Ashraf al-Barīyah' bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn ʻawnih."
Translation of the colophon of "Qaṣīdat al-Burdah": "'al-Kawākib al-durrīyah fī madḥ Ashraf al-Barīyah' [Qaṣīdat al-Burdah] was completed by the praise of God and His abundant benevolence."
3. Colophon of "Qaṣīdat Umm Hānī": "ʻAlayka azká ṣalāti Allāhi mā ṭalaʻat // shamsun wa-mā sāra sārin fī madā subuli. Intahat."

Translation of the colophon of "Qaṣīdat Umm Hānī": "May the purest prayer from God be upon You, as long as the sun rises // and as long as a traveler crosses the expanse of distances. It is completed."

Translation of the colophon of "Ḥizb" of Abū al-ʻAbbās al-Mursī: "The blessed 'Ḥizb' is completed by the praise of God and His abundant benevolence."
8. Colophon of "Ḥizb al-najāh": "Intahá bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn ʻawnih."

9. Colophon of "Ḥizb al-Nawawī": "Intahá bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn ʻawnih."

10. Colophon of "al-Waẓīfah al-Zarrūqīyah": "Intahat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn ʻawnih."

record.title: 880-02 Laṭāʼif al-minan fī manāqib al-Shaykh Abū al-ʻAbbās al-Mursī wa-Shaykhihi al-Shaykh Abū al-Ḥasan al-Shādhilī : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAṭāʼ Allāh al-Sakandarī .
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻĀlim al-ʻāmil, al-ʻārif Tāj al-Dīn Abū al-ʻAbbās Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn ʻAṭāʼ Allāh, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-nawwar ḍarīḥahu: al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī fataḥa li-awliyāʼihi bāb maḥabbatihi, wa-anshaṭa nufūsahum min ʻiqāl al-quṭʻah, fa-qāmū la-hu bi-wujūb khidmatih, wa-amadda ʻuqūlahum bi-nūrihi fa-ʻāyanat ʻajāʼib qudratih, wa-ḥarasa qulūbahum min al-aghyār, wa-maḥā minhā ṣuwar al-āthār ḥattá ẓafirat bi-maʻrifatih ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-ẓāhir al-bāṭin kadhālika.
15 x 21 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard cover; black cloth on spine (in 16 numbered quires).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper (some tinted red); keywords and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb Laṭāʼif al-minan fī manāqib al-Shaykh Abū al-ʻAbbās al-Mursī wa-Shaykhihi al-Shaykh Abū al-Ḥasan al-Shādhilī, taʼlīf al-Shaykh Aḥmad ibn ʻAṭāʼ Allāh, [ʻafā Allāh] taʻālá [ʻanhum] ajamʻīn."
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá." The word "Waqf" is also written at the head and margins of some pages.

On folio 1a: A quotation from "al-Ṭabaqāt al-kubrá" of al-Shaʻrānī (ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn Aḥmad, approximately 1493-1565 or 1566) on the power of "al-Awliyāʼ" (holy men) to fulfill the needs of their visitors.
On folio 1a: Three pieces of poetry (2 by 2 by 3 verses each), the first is by Ibn Ḥayyān (?).
On folio 5a: "... wa-sammaytuhu 'Laṭāʼif al-minan fī mabāqib al-Shaykh Abū al-ʻAbbās wa-Shaykhihi Abū al-Ḥasan'."
Some leaves seem to be missing between folios 138 and 139.

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir al-kitāb. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣalawātuhu ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm." At the end of the colophon in a different hand (in red): "Kitāb Laṭāʼif al-minan. Sanat 1043."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of the book. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May His prayers and abundant peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, upon his family, and his companions. God suffices us. He is the best advocate. There is no power nor might except in God the All Mighty, the All Powerful." At the end of the colophon, in a different hand (in red): "The book of Laṭāʼif al-minan. The year 1043 [of the Hijrah = 1633/1634]."

record.note: Title from incipit.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī sharaḥ qulūb muddāḥ Nabīyihi al-Muṣṭafá, wa-abāḥa lahum dukhūl jannat al-intisāb ilayhi, fa-nālū maqāman wa-sharafan. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ashraf al-khāṣṣ wa-al-ʻāmm, Muḥammad, nabīyihi wa-ḥabībihi wa-rasūlihi wa-khalīlihi wa-najīyihi, ṣallá Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ʻalá aṣḥābihi hudāt al-khalq ilá al-ṭarīq al-aqwam. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-ghanī, ʻAlī al-Shībīnī al-Shāfiʻī al-Ashʻarī: Hādhihi taʻlīqāt sanīyah li-ḥall baʻḍ alfāẓ al-Hamzīyah. Fa-aqūlu wa-billāh al-mustaʻān, wa-ʻalayhi al-iʻtimād wa-al-tiklān: Qāla al-Shaykh al-ʻallāmah al-Mawlá Sharaf al-Dīn Abī ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd ibn Ḥammād ibn Muḥsin ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Ṣinhāj ibn Hilāl al-Ṣinhājī al-Shahīr bi-al-Dilāṣī, nisbah ilá Dilāṣ wa-ilá Būṣīr, li-kawn aḥad abawayhi min wāḥidah wa-al-ākhar min al-ukhrá, fa-nusiba ilayhimā ..."
Secundo folio: naḥwa kayfa Zayd aw ghayr ḥaqīqī.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 19 cm; 17-24 lines per page.
Binding: The six quires are inside a marbled cover with flap; black cloth on spine and flap.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of al-Hamzīyah in red; some notes corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Hamzīyah lil-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Shībīnī, nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Tammat al-Qaṣīdah al-Hamzīyah bi-madīḥihi, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhā al-taʻlīq al-laṭīf ṣabīḥat yawm al-Jumʻah, rābiʻ ʻashar al-Ḥijjah, khitām sanat 1198, alf wa-miʼah thamāniyah wa-tisʻīn min Hijrat al-Nabī Muḥammad, khātim al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn, ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The Hamzīyh poem in praise of Him [Prophet Muḥammad], may God pray on Him and grant Him peace. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, his family, and his companions, and grant them peace. This graceful commentary was completed on Friday morning, the fourteenth of al-Ḥijjah, the end of the year 1198 of the Hijrah [29 October 1784] of the Prophet Muḥammad, the seal of the prophets and messengers, may God pray on Him, and grant peace to Him, to His family, and to all His companions."

record.title: 880-02 al-Durr al-jusām fī sharḥ shurūṭ al-maʼmūm wa-al-imām : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Ḥasan al-Munayyir al-Samannūdī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir wa-lā tuʻassir. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala al-ṣalāh min afḍal al-ʻibādāt, wa-akkada al-jamāʻah fīhā, wa-ḍāʻafa li-man qāma bi-hā al-ujūr wa-al-ḥasanāt. Wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdah, lā sharīka lahu, shahādatan addakhiruhā li-yawm al-ḥasarāt ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu ... Muḥammad ibn Ḥasan al-Samānūdī: Saʼalanī baʻḍ al-ikhwān ... an aḍaʻa sharḥan laṭīfan ʻalá 'Shurūṭ al-imāmah' allatī naẓamahā al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah ... shams al-millah wa-al-dīn ... Muḥammad al-Janzūrī al-Shāfiʻī ... fa-ajabtuhu ilá dhālik ... wa-sammaytuhu bi-'al-Durr al-jusām fī sharḥ shurūṭ al-maʼmūm wa-al-imām' ..."
Secundo folio: al-Raḥīm ṣifatān mushabbahatān buniyatā lil-mubālaghah.
16.5 x 23.3 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In large naskh script, in black ink, on thick paper; the verses of al-Jnazūrī and markings in red; extensive commentaries on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Durr al-jusām fī sharḥ shurūṭ al-maʼmūm wa-al-imām, taʼlīf al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, Shaykh al-Islām, al-Shaykh Muḥammad ibn Ḥasan al-Samānūdī, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhu. Āmīn. M."
On folio 1a: Ḥadīth "Yakhruju min al-nār man kāna fī qalbihi mithqāl dharratin min īmān." And an explanation of the meaning of "dharrah", how much it weighs in regard to a seed of barley and mustard.

The poem of al-Janzūrī starts with: "Qāla al-faqīr Muḥammadu al-Janzūrī // al-ḥamdu lillāh al-ʻAlī al-Ghafūrī. Thumma al-ṣalātu wa-al-salāmu sarmadā // ʻalá al-Nabīyi al-Hāshimīyi Aḥmadā ... Abyātuhā ʻishrūna fī thalāthah // tammat ʻalá sittīn fī dhī al-ḥālah ..." It ends with: "... Muḥammadu al-mabʻūthu min Umm al-Qurá // al-Hāshimī al-mukhtāru afḍalu man qará. Wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-kirām // wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamāmi."

Author's colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā yassarahu Allāh bi-mannihi wa-karamih. Wa-asʼalu Allāh an yanfaʻa bi-hi kamā nafaʻa bi-aṣlihi, wa-an yajʻalahu khāliṣan li-wajhihi al-karīm. Wa-al-maṭlūb mimman iṭṭalaʻa ʻalá hādhā al-sharḥ an yadrá [yadraʼa] bi-al-ḥasanah al-sayyiʼah, wa-an yanẓura fīhi bi-ʻayn al-ʻafw wa-al-riḍá, lā bi-ʻayn al-sukhṭ wa-al-jafā, fa-qad qalla an yaslama muṣannaf min al-hafawāt, aw, yanjuwa muʼallif min al-ʻatharāt, wa-al-insān maḥall al-khaṭaʼ wa-al-nisyān, khuṣūṣan fī hādhā al-zamān alladhī kathurat fīhi al-shawāghil wa-al-humūm, wa-ʻaẓumat fīhi al-kirbāt wa-al-ghumūm. Fa-nasʼalu Allāh taʻālá an yunjiyanā min āfātih, wa-an yamanna ʻalaynā wa-mashayikhinā wa-muḥibbīnā bi-ḥusn al-khātimah, wa-an yudkhilanā al-Jannah min ghayr sābiqah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh awwalan wa-ākhiran. Tamma bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. M."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This is the end of what God facilitated by His benevolence and generosity. I implore God to make it useful as He made useful its origin, that it may be rendered purely for His gracious face. I request those who look into this commentary to cover the bad with good, and to view it by the eye of forgiveness and satisfaction, not by the eye of discontent and loathing; for rarely a book is free from errors, or an author of pitfalls, because man is prone to fault and forgetfulness, specially, in this time in which concerns and anxieties increased, and troubles and worries intensified. We implore God Almighty to deliver us from its afflictions, and to bestow upon us, upon our shaykhs and beloved ones, an agreeable end, and to admit us into Paradise without a precedent. Praise be to God in the beginning and at the end. It was completed by the help of God and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, his family, and his companions, and grant them peace. Amen. M."

record.title: Grüntliche Vürweissung artlichs unnd zierlichs schreibens : manuscript.
record.note: Title from cover.
Binding: contemporary vellum wrappers.

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ Īsāghūjī : manuscript / Muḥyī al-Dīn al-Tālijī.
record.note: 1. Title of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá 'Sharḥ Īsāghūjī' from reference sources.
2. Title of Sharḥ Hikmat al-ʻayn from reference sources.
3. Title of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá 'Sharḥ Īsāghūjī' from reference sources.
4. Title of Kitāb Īsāghūjī from Incipit (folio 153b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ Īsāghūjī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Qāla: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-wājib wujūduhu. Aqūlu: Iftataḥa kitābahu bi-al-ḥamd, baʻda al-ibtidāʼ bi-al-tasmiyah, li-anna adāʼ al-wājib min shukr naʻmāʼihi wājib. al-Ḥamd huwa al-waṣf bi-al-jamīl, ʻalá jihat al-taʻẓīm wa-al-tabjīl ..."
Secundo folio of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ Īsāghūjī: khalá ʻan muṭābaqat al-iʻtiqād.

2. Incipit of Sharḥ Ḥikmat al-ʻayn: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ammā baʻd ḥamd Allāh fāṭir dhawāt al-ʻuqūl al-nūrīyah, wa-muẓhir khafīyāt asrār al-rubūbīyah, al-mubdiʻ bi-nūrihi al-mushriq muḥarrikāt al-ajrām al-ʻulwīyah, al-mukhtariʻ bi-ʻilmihi al-kāmil muskīyāt al-ajsām al-suflīyah, al-muḥyī mawāt yanābīʻ al-futūr al-nawʻīyah, al-munīr li-qawābil al-ʻulūm bi-maṣābīḥ al-fikr wa-al-rawīyah ... fa-inna ... Shams al-Millah wa-al-Dīn ... Muḥammad ibn Mubārakshāh al-Bukhārī ... yaqūlu: Qad iltamasa minnī baʻḍ ikhwānī ... an aktuba li-kitāb Ḥikmat al-ʻayn, min muṣannafāt al-Mawlá ... Najm al-Millah wa-al-Dīn Abī Bakr ʻUmar al-Kātī al-Qazwīnī ... sharḥan yudhallilu min alfāẓihi ṣiʻābahā ..."
Secundo folio of Sharḥ Ḥikmat al-ʻayn: min tilka al-anẓār wa-al-anẓār allatī minhā.

3. Incipit of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá 'Sharḥ Īsāghūjī': "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn. Qāla: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-wājib wujūduhu. Aqūlu: Iftataḥa kitābahu bi-al-ḥamd baʻda al-ibtidāʼ bi-al-tasmiyah, li-anna adāʼ al-wājib min shukr naʻmāʼihi wājib. al-Ḥamd huwa al-waṣf bi-al-jamīl ʻalá jihat al-taʻẓīm wa-al-tabjīl ..."
Secundo folio of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá 'Sharḥ Īsāghūjī': bi-al-jamīl ʻalá jihat al-taʻẓīm wa-al-tabjīl.

4. Incipit of Kitāb Īsāghūjī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻAllāmah, afḍal al-mutaʼakhkhirīn, qudwat al-ḥukamāʼ al-rāsikhīn, Athīr al-Dīn al-Abharī, ṭayyaba Allāh tharāh, wa-jaʻala al-Jannah mathwāh, wa-raḍiya ʻanahu wa-arḍāh: Naḥmadu Allāh ʻalá tawfīqihi wa-nasʼaluhu hidāyat ṭarīqih, wa-nuṣallī ʻalá Muḥammad wa-ʻashīratih wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi risālah fī al-manṭiq, awradnā fīhā mā yajibu istiḥḍāruhu li-man yabtadiʼu fī shayʼ min al-ʻulūm, mustaʻīnan billāh, innahu mufḍī al-khayr wa-al-jūd. Wa-sammaytuhā Īsāghūjī, al-lafẓ al-dāll bi-al-waḍʻ, yadullu ʻalá tamām mā wuḍiʻa la-hu bi-al-muṭābaqah, wa-ʻalá juzʼayhi bi-al-taḍammun, in kāna la-hu juzʼ, wa-ʻalá mā yulāzimuhu fī al-dhihn bi-al-iltizām ..."
Secundo folio of Kitāb Īsāghūjī: ʻalá al-ḥayawān al-nāṭiq bi-al-muṭābaqah.

15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: For manuscript 1. 8.5 x 15.5 cm; 15 lines per page. For manuscript 2. 11.5 x 17.5 cm; 20-25 lines per page. For manuscript 3. 6.5 x 13.5 cm; 17-19 lines per page. For manuscript 4. 4.5 x 13 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; dark brown leather on spine.

The first manuscript is written in clear large naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; few notes on the margins; catchwords. The second manuscript is written in fair naskh/taʻlīq script; extensive commentaries on the margins and interlinear; catchwords. The third manuscript is written in good naskh script; some notes and corrections on the margins; the phrases of the original preceded by the word "Qāla" (he said) and the commentary with the word "Aqūlu" (I say), both in red; catchwords. The fourth manuscript is written in clear naskh/taʻlīq script; headings and markings in red; some commentaries on the margins; the text within red frame; catchwords.
On the lower edge: "Ḥikmat al-ʻayn. Manṭiq. Ḥusam Kātī."

On the flyleaf: "Mā fī al-kitāb: Muḥyī al-Dīn min al-manṭiq. Ḥikmat al-ʻayn. Ḥusam Kātī. Sharḥ ajzāʼ qaḍīyah. [... ... ...]. Qad jumiʻat fī sanat ithná wa-sabʻīn baʻda al-miʼatayn wa-al-alf. Dālijī, sallamahu Allāh taʻālá ilá ākhir al-dunyā wa-baʻdahu fī ṭabaqat al-Nājiyah, ʻinda Allāh al-Aʻlá. Sanat 1272, 12 Ṣ [Ṣafar (?)], wa-al-shahr alladhī waḍaʻtu tārīkhahu sanat 1288, Dhī al-Qaʻdah, 22. Wa-huwa Ibn Masʻūd Zaʻfarānī, bi-Būlāq. Stamp of 'Ḥusayn Bālī Nūr Ilāhī'."
On the flyleaf (in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish): "Min al-bāb ilá al-miḥrāb. Arbāb nārān chūq. Mizāj nās taḥṣīldan riḍāʼī thiqah maydān yūq."
On folio 1a: Fragments from an unidentified text patched to the surface of the leaf.
At the head of folio 1b: "Hādhā Muḥyīddīn."
There are 15 blank leaves between folios 79 and 80, and 18 blank leaves between folios 115 and 116.
On folio 80a: "Hādhihi Ḥikmat al-ʻayn wa-mirzājān ʻalá al-Ḥikmat al-ʻayn awzarnah [?] wa-Sayyid ʻalá al-Ḥikmat al-ʻayn dafʻah Sayyid wa-ithbāt al-wājib."
There are 18 blank leaves between folios 115 and 116.
On folio 116a: "Ḥusam Kātī wa-Muḥyī al-Dīn."
There is one blank leaf between folios 144 and 145.
On folio 152b: Part of the introduction to the fourth treatise.
There are four blank leaves between folios 152 and 153.
On folio 153a: Miscellaneous quotations on logic and a stamp of "al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá" and two illegible stamps.
On folio 165b: Miscellaneous quotations in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish.

1. Colophon of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá 'Sharḥ Īsāghūjī': No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... fa-immā an yaḥtāja al-ʻaql fī al-ḥukm ilá takrār mushāhadah, yatarattabu al-maḥmūl ʻalá al-mawḍūʻ, li-inḍimām qiyās khafī ilá tilka al-qaḍāyā, wa-li-annahu law kāna dhālika al-tartīb ittifāqīyan lamā kāna dāʼiman aw aktharīyan, aw lā yaḥtāju, fa-in iḥtiyāj [iḥtāja] fa-hiya al-mujarrabāt, wa-in lam yajtamiʻ [yaḥtaj (?)] ilá takrār al-mushāhadah fa-hiya al-ḥadasīyāt, wa-mithāluhā mā dhukira fī al-sharḥ. Qāla: wa-al-wasaṭ mā yaqtarinu bi-qawlinā, li-annahu aqūlu ʻarrafū al-wasaṭ bi-annahu ..."

2. Colophon of Sharḥ Ḥikmat al-ʻayn: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... bal yajibu an yakūna tamām al-fayḍ wa-an yakūna ikhtilāf al-fayḍ ʻanhu bi-sabab ikhtilāf al-qawāʼil. Wa-qad faraḍnā anna al-imkān al-lāzim lil-māhīyah kāfin qabūluhu al-fayḍ ʻan Wājib al-Wujūd, fa-wajaba an yakūna mawjūdan dāʼiman li-imtināʻ takhalluf al-maʻlūl ʻan al-ʻillah, wa-illā, ay, wa-in lam yakun kāfiyan tawaqqafa, ay, al-fayaḍān, ʻalá sharāʼiṭ, wujūdīyah kānat, aw, ʻadamīyah, ḥattá yastaʻidda al-māhīyah li-qabūl al-wujūd ʻan Wājib al-Wujūd, fa-yakūnu ..."

3. Colophon of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá 'Sharḥ Īsāghūjī': "Wa-li-yakun hādhā ākhir mā katabnā min al-awrāq li-īḍāḥ mā fī kitab [kitāb] Īsāghūjī. Qad Tammat al-awrāq bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Khallāq, allatī hiya al-musammá bi-Ḥusām Kātī, min yad aḍʻaf al-ʻibād Khalīl ibn I[br]āhīm, ayyadahu dar dīnihi dawman al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Sanat 1123. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá 'Sharḥ Īsāghūjī': "Let this be the end of what we wrote in these leaflets to elucidate what is in the book of Īsāghūjī. The leaflets were completed by the help of the King Creator, i.e., the work of Ḥusām Kātī, by the hand of the feeble servant Khalīl ibn I[br]āhīm, may The Merciful Compassionate confirm him always in his religion. In the 1123 [of the Hijrah = 1711/1712]. It is completed. It is completed. It is completed."
4. Colophon of Kitāb Īsāghūjī: "Tamma al-awrāq bi-ʻināyat al-Malik al-Razzāq, ʻalá yad ʻUmar ibn Muḥammad, fī waqt al-ʻaṣr, fī yawm Jahārshanbah, fī Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, sanat 1157."

Translation of the colophon of Kitāb Īsāghūjī: "The leaflets were completed by the care of the King Provider, by the hand of ʻUmar ibn Muḥammad, in the afternoon of Wednesday, in Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, of the year 1157 [of the Hijrah = 14 May 1744]."

record.title: 880-02 al-ʻUqūd al-jawharīyah bi-al-juyūd al-mashrafīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Laṭīf al-Bishbīshī.
record.note: 1. Title of al-ʻUqūd al-jawharīyah bi-al-juyūd al-mashrifīyah supplied by Hartford Seminary. The title is also mentioned in Beinecke's Landberg MSS 261 (folio 2b).
2. Title of Nūr al-ʻuyūn fī talkhīṣ siyar al-amīn al-maʼmūn from incipit (folio 24b)
3. Title of Kitāb al-Ikhtilāj from reference sources.
4. Title of Bushrá al-kaʼīb bi-liqāʼ al-ḥabīb from incipit (folio 55b)
5. Title of Iljām al-ʻawāmm ʻan ʻilm al-kalām from folio 77a and reference sources.
6. Title of Ṣalāḥ al-arwāḥ wa-al-ṭarīq ilá Dār al-Falāḥ from reference sources and Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of al-ʻUqūd al-jawharīyah bi-al-juyūd al-mashrifīyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-ghanī, Aḥmad al-Bishbishī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu: al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ʻallama bi-al-qalam ʻallama al-insāna mā lam yaʻlam, wa-jaʻalahu samīʻan baṣīran, wa-khalaqahu fī aḥsan ṣūrah, mā shāʼa rakkabahu fa-sawwāh, fa-ʻaddalhu wa-akramahu fī al-ākhirah bi-mā aʻadda la-hu, wa-sharrafahu bi-al-ʻaql wa-faḍḍalah ..."
Secundo folio of al-ʻUqūd al-jawharīyah bi-al-juyūd al-mashrifīyah: min al-khayrāt, wa-la-ʻamrī.

2. Incipit of Nūr al-ʻuyūn fī talkhīṣ siyar al-amīn al-maʼmūn: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ḥāfiẓ al-muttaqī al-Muḥaddith, Abū al-Fatḥ Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Muḥammad ibn Sayyid al-Nās, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Baʻda ḥamd Allāh fātiḥ abwāb al-hudá wa-māniḥ athwāb al-hidá, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad alladhī ibtaʻathahu maḥajjatan li-man ihtadá wa-ḥujjatan li-man iʻtadá ... lammā waḍaʻtu kitābī al-musammá 'ʻUyūn al-athar fī funūn al-maghāzī wa-al-shamāyil wa-al-siyar ... raʼaytu an ulakhkhiṣahu fī hādhihi al-awrāq ... wa-sammaytuhu Nūr al-ʻuyūn fī talkhīṣ siyar al-amīn al-maʼmūn ..."
Secundo folio of Nūr al-ʻuyūn fī talkhīṣ siyar al-amīn al-maʼmūn: Ḥalīmah bint Dhuwayb al-Hudhalīyah.

3. Incipit of Kitāb al-Ikhtilāj: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad ibn Hishām ʻan thiqātihi, ʻan Abī ʻAbd Allāh Jaʻfar ibn Muḥammad al-Ṣādiq ... annahu qāl, wa-qad dhakarnā bi-ḥaḍratihi Dhū al-Qarnayn wa-ḥikmatahu, wa-mā fassarahu min ikhtilāj al-aʻḍāʼ, fa-qāl, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu: Inna al-ikhtilāj yumayyizu al-abdān wa-mā iʻtād ʻalayhi min al-tajribah ʻalá mamarr al-azmān ..."
Secundu folio of Kitāb al-Ikhtilāj: shuqq raʼsihi al-ayman yuṣībuhu ghamm.

4. Incipit of Bushrá al-kaʼīb bi-liqāʼ al-ḥabīb: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh, wa-salāmuhu ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīna iṣṭafá. Hādhā al-juzʼ, wa-sammaytuhu 'Bushrá al-kaʼīb bi-liqāʼ al-ḥabīb', lakhkhaṣtuhu min kitāb [kitābī] al-kabīr alladhī allaftuhu fī aḥwāl al-barzakh, qaṣartuhu ʻalá al-bushrá bi-mā yalqāhu al-muʼmin min ʻind mawtihi wa-fī qabrihi min al-takrīm wa-al-tarḥīb, wa-billāh al-tawfīq. Dhikr faḍl al-mawt wa-annahu khayr min al-ḥayāh ..."
Secundo folio of Bushrá al-kaʼīb bi-liqāʼ al-ḥabīb: fī al-kabīr ʻan ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻAmr.

5. Incipit of Iljām al-ʻawāmm ʻan ʻilm al-kalām: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī tajallá li-kāffat ʻibādih bi-ṣifātih wa-asmāʼih, wa-nabbaha ʻuqūl al-ṭālibīn fī baydāʼ kibriyāʼih, wa-taqirru ajniḥat al-afkār dūna ḥimā ʻizzatih, wa-taʻālá bi-jalālih ʻan an tudrika al-afhām kunha ḥaqīqatih ... Ammā baʻd, fa-qad saʼaltanī, arshadaka Allāh, ʻan al-akhbār al-mūhimah lil-tashbīh ʻinda al-raʻāʻ wa-al-juhhāl min al-ḥashawīyah al-ḍullāl ..."
Secundo folio of Iljām al-ʻawāmm ʻan ʻilm al-kalām: jānib wa-muḥāfaẓah ʻalá taʻṣīb li-madhhab.

6. Incipit of Ṣalāḥ al-arwāḥ: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī tafarrada bi-al-ʻizz wa-al-baqāʼ, wa-tawaḥḥada bi-al-ʻaẓamah wa-al-kibriyāʼ, wa-tamajjada bi-al-rifʻah wa-al-thanāʼ, wa-taqaddasa ʻan al-naẓīr wa-al-shurakāʼ, wa-tanazzaha ʻan al-wālid wa-al-abnāʼ, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, ḥakama ʻalá al-ʻālamīn bi-al-fanāʼ ... Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhā kitāb ittakhadhtuhu mawʻiẓatan li-nafsī, wa-arjū in shāʼ Allāh, nafʻahu yawma ramsī ... kitāb al-tazawwud lil-Dār al-Ākhirah ..."
Secundo folio of Ṣalāḥ al-arwāḥ: fa-qāla Yā Muḥammad akhbirnī ʻan al-Islām.
15 x 21 cm; written surface: varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: In light brown leather (in 15 unnumbered quires).
The manuscripts are written in the same hand, in good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper, headings and markings in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb Nūr al-ʻuyūn fī talkhīṣ sirr [siyar] al-amīn al-muʼmūn [al-maʼmūn], ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. M."
On folio 48a: "Hādhihi muqaddimah nadhkuru fīhā 'Ikhtilājāt al-aʻḍāʼ wa-adʻiyatahā' ʻalá al-tamām."
On folio 54a: Four verses of poetry on nostalgia.
There are four blank leaves between folios 54 and 55.
On folio 55a: "Kitāb Bushrá al-kaʼīb bi-liqāʼ al-ḥabīb, taʼlīf al-Imām al-ḥāfiẓ Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatihi wa-ghufrānih. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. M."
On folio 74b-75b: Invocations written in coarse naskh.
There is a blank leaf between folios 75 and 76.

On folio 76b: An anecdote about Jesus and John the Babtist, that they were first cousins from their mothers side. And about the number of days in the Hijrī months and their corresponding Syrian months.
There is a blank leaf between folios 76 and 77.

On folio 77a: "Kitāb Iljām al-ʻawāmm, taṣnīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, rukn al-Islām, ʻimād al-anām, sharaf al-aʼimmah, Zayn al-Dīn Abī Ḥāmid Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Ghazzālī al-Ṭūsī, naḍḍara Allāh wajhahu, wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahu, wa-jaʻala al-Jannah maʼwāh. Āmīn. Āmīn. M. M."
There is a blank leaf between folios 103 and 104.

On folio 104a: An endowment statement (waqf): "Awqafa wa-sabbala wa-tabarraʻa bi-ikhtiyārihi wa-ṭīb khāṭirih hādhihi al-kitāb Sī Aḥmad ibn al-Ḥusayn al-Murʻib ilá al-Shaykh Maḥmūd al-Kurdī, thumma baʻda mawtihi ilá ʻulamāʼ al-Muslimīn. Sanat 1193 [of the Hijrah = 1779/1780]."

1. Colophon of al-ʻUqūd al-jawharīyah bi-al-juyūd al-mashrifīyah: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā aradnā taʻlīqahu ʻalá 'al-Asʼilah'. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh awwalan wa-ākhiran, wa-bāṭinan wa-ẓāhiran. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-tābiʻīhi wa-muḥibbīhi wa-sllama taslīman kathīran. Tamm.

Translation of the colophon of al-ʻUqūd al-jawharīyah bi-al-juyūd al-mashrifīyah: "This is the end of what we wanted to comment upon the 'Questions'. God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning. Praise be to God in the beginning and at the end, implicitly and explicitly. May God pray on Our Master and Leader Muḥammad, and on his family, his companions, his followers, and those who love him, and grant them abundant peace. It is completed.
2. Colophon of Nūr al-ʻuyūn fī talkhīṣ siyar al-amīn al-maʼmūn: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tammat al-Risālah al-Sharīfīyah bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Laṭīf."
Translation of the colophon of Nūr al-ʻuyūn fī talkhīṣ siyar al-amīn al-maʼmūn: "Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. The Sharīfīyah epistle was completed by the help of the Gracious King."
3. Colophon of Kitāb al-Ikhtilāj: "Tammat al-Ikhtilājāt."
Translation of the colophon of Kitāb al-Ikhtilāj: "al-Ikhtilājāt are completed."

4. Colophon of Bushrá al-kaʼīb bi-liqāʼ al-ḥabīb: "Wa-hādhā ākhir al-kitāb. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh al-hādī ilá al-ṣawāb. Wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon of Bushrá al-kaʼīb bi-liqāʼ al-ḥabīb: "This is the end of the book. Praise be to God who guides to what is correct. He suffices me. He is the best advocate. There is no power nor might except in God Almighty. May God pray on Muḥammad, his family, and his companions, and grant them abundant peace.
5. Colophon of Iljām al-ʻawāmm ʻan ʻilm al-kalām: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb ʻalá yad aḍʻaf al-ʻibād Darwīsh M Ḥ M W D [Maḥmūd]. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon of Iljām al-ʻawāmm ʻan ʻilm al-kalām: "The book was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King, by the hand of the feeblest servant M Ḥ M W D [Maḥmūd]. It is completed. It is completed. It is completed."

6. Colophon of Ṣalāḥ al-arwāḥ: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... Wa-qāla Aʻrābī: Yā Rasūla Allāh, hal fī al-Jannah ʻinab. Qāla: Naʻam. Qāl: Fa-mā ʻiẓam al-ʻunqūd. Qāl: Masīrat al-ghurāb al-abqaʻ shahran. Fa-qāl: Yā Rasūl Allāh: Inna al-Jannah tushbiʻunī wa-ahl baytī. Qāl: Naʻam, wa-ʻāmmat ʻashīratik. Wa-qāla Aʻrābī: Yā Rasūl Allāh: Inna Allāh taʻālá dhakara fī al-Qurʼān shajaratan muʼdhiyah, wa-mā kuntu ará fī al-Jannah shajar tuʼdhī ṣāḥibahā. Qāl: Mā hiya ..."

record.title: Treatises on Arab astronomy and mathematics : manuscript.
record.note: 1. Title of Jadāwil al-nisbah al-sittīnīyah from folio 1a.
2. Title of Astronomical tables in Arabic and Persian supplied by cataloger.
3. Title of Itḥāf al-ḥabīb bi-maʻrifat al-tawqīʻāt wa-al-awqāt wa-al-Qiblah bi-al-taqrīb from folios 2a and 21a.
4. Title of Maʻrifat al-Nīl al-mubārak from incipit (folio 67a).
5. Title of Laqṭ al-jawāhir fī maʻrifat al-khuṭūṭ wa-al-dawāʼir from folio 68a.
6. Title of Hidāyat al-ḥāʼir li-waḍʻ faḍl al-dāʼir from incipit (folio 74b).
7. Title of Taʼlīf fī maʻrifat al-ʻumud al-basīṭah li-kull ʻarḍ ʻalá al-asṭiḥah al-muwāziyah lil-ufuq from incipit (folio 77b).
8. Title of al-Mulakhkhaṣ fī al-hayʼah from incipit (folio 79b).
9. Title of al-Kawākib al-thābitah wa-abʻāduhā ʻan muʻaddal al-nahār wa-jihat al-buʻd fī al-shamāl wa-al-janūb from folio 104a.
10. Title of al-Mufaṣṣal fī al-ʻamal bi-niṣf al-dāʼirah al-muʻaddil from incipit (folio 109a).
11. Title of Astronomical treatise supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
1. Incipit of Jadāwil al-nisbah al-sittīnīyah: Astronomical tables.
Secundo folio of Jadāwil al-nisbah al-sittīnīyah: Astronomical tables.
2. Incipit of Astronomical tables in Arabic and Persian: Tables.
Secundo folio of Astronomical tables in Arabic and Persian: Tables.

3. Incipit of Itḥāf al-ḥabīb bi-maʻrifat al-tawqīʻāt wa-al-awqāt wa-al-Qiblah bi-al-taqrīb: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ḥamdan laka, Yā Man jaʻala al-falak al-dāyir wa-al-kawkab al-sāyir ʻalá waḥdānīyah min aqwá al-adillah al-qawāṭiʻ, wa-shukran laka Yā Man tafaḍḍala ʻalá al-wujūd bi-ishrāq shams al-maʻārif min ashraf al-maṭāliʻ ... Ammā baʻd, fa-lammā kānat al-ṣalāh iḥdá daʻāʼim al-Islām, wa-kānat maʻrifat dukhūl awqātihā mutaʻayyanah ʻalá kull mukallaf min al-anām, wa-taḥṣīluhā ʻalá al-ḥaqīqah li-kull ṭālib ghayr sahl al-marām, amaranī man yajibu ʻalayya imtithāl awāmirihi al-sharīfah ... an aktuba risālatan muntaẓimat al-niẓām qarībat [qarībah] ilá al-afhām, lā yuḥtāju maʻahā illā li-yasīr al-ʻamal wa-al-bankām, tataḍammanu maʻrifat al-Qiblah wa-al-awqāt fī al-aḍwāʼ wa-al-ẓulumāt, wa-mā ishtahara fī al-ayyām min al-tawqīʻāt, wa-yakūnu mā yakhtaṣṣu min dhālika bi-ʻarḍ wa-waḍʻ min al-awḍāʻ mawḍūʻan fīhā li-ʻarḍ Miṣr al-maḥrūsah ..."
Secundo folio of Itḥāf al-ḥabīb bi-maʻrifat al-tawqīʻāt wa-al-awqāt wa-al-Qiblah bi-al-taqrīb: dūna ghayrihā min al-biqāʻ.

4. Incipit of Maʻrifat al-Nīl al-mubārak: "Maʻrifat al-Nīl al-mubārak. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ajrá min baḥr jūdih baḥran, wa-jaʻalahu dalīlan ʻalá tawḥīdihi, li-yanālū bi-hi baʻda al-ʻusr yusran, wa-jaʻala al-Nīl al-mubārak dāllan ʻalá gharīb qudratih wa-ʻajīb ḥikmatih, fa-subḥāna man khaṣṣa bi-hi Miṣran ..."
Secundo folio of Maʻrifat al-Nīl al-mubārak: al-ḥaml ʻinda al-munqalab al-Ṣayfī la-kāna ajwad.

5. Incipit of Laqṭ al-jawāhir fī maʻrifat al-khuṭūṭ wa-al-dawāʼir: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khātim al-nabīyīn wa-al-mursalīn, wa-raḍiya Allāh ʻan aṣḥābihi wa-al-tābiʻīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi muqaddimah awradtu fīhā mā yajibu istiḥḍāruhu li-man yabtadiʼu fī ʻilm al-mīqāt, fa-aqūlu ..."
Secundo folio of Laqṭ al-jawāhir fī maʻrifat al-khuṭūṭ wa-al-dawāʼir: ilá al-muḥīṭ mutasāwiyah waḥdawīyatuhā.

6. Incipit of Hidāyat al-ḥāʼir li-waḍʻ faḍl al-dāʼir: "Wa-la-hu ayḍan Hidāyat al-ḥāyir li-waḍʻ faḍl al-dāyir, wa-hiya maqālatayn wa-khātimah. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ʻāqibah lil-muttaqīn, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh shahādata al-mukhliṣ ... Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi muqaddimah adhkuru fīhā maʻrifat waḍʻ khuṭūṭ faḍl al-dāʼir ʻalá al-basāʼiṭ wa-al-qāʼimāt bi-ṭarīq dāʼirat al-muʻaddil, wa-sammaytuhā 'Hidāyat al-ḥāʼir li-waḍʻ faḍl al-dāʼir' ..."
Secundo folio of Hidāyat al-ḥāʼir li-waḍʻ faḍl al-dāʼir: wa-adir ʻalayhi dāʼirah fa-hiya dāʼirat muʻaddil al-nahār.

7. Incipit of Taʼlīf fī maʻrifat al-ʻumud al-basīṭah li-kull ʻarḍ ʻalá al-asṭiḥah al-muwāziyah lil-ufuq: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā 'Taʼlīf fī maʻrifat al-ʻumud al-basīṭah li-kull ʻarḍ ʻalá al-asṭiḥah al-muwāziyah lil-ufuq'. Idhā aradta fa-mudda fī al-saṭḥ khaṭṭan, wa-sammihi niṣf al-nahār ..."
Secundo folio of Taʼlīf fī maʻrifat al-ʻumud al-basīṭah li-kull ʻarḍ ʻalá al-asṭiḥah al-muwāziyah lil-ufuq: fa-huwa madār al-Ḥamal.

8. Incipit of al-Mulakhkhaṣ fī al-hayʼah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Kafā afḍālih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūlihi Muḥammad wa-ālih. Yaqūlu al-Shaykh al-Imām al-afḍal al-akmal Maḥmūd ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻUmar al-Jaghmīnī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih: Innī allaftu kitāb fī hayʼat al-ʻālam, tadhkiratan minnī baʻdī li-kull ʻālim, mutaḥarriyan fīhi al-talkhīṣ maʻa al-bayān, wa-ījāz al-alfāẓ ilá basīṭ al-maʻānī, ʻalá ḥasb al-imkān. Wa-sammaytuhu 'al-Mulakhkhaṣ fī al-hayʼah' li-yakūna ismuhu dāllan ʻalá maʻnāh, wa-ẓāhiruhu mukhbiran ʻan faḥwāh, yashtamilu ʻalá muqaddimah wa-maqālatayn ..."
Secundo folio of al-Mulakhkhaṣ fī al-hayʼah: mukhtalifat al-ṭabāʼiʻ ka-al-maʻdanīyāt.

9. Incipit of al-Kawākib al-thābitah wa-abʻāduhā ʻan muʻaddal al-nahār wa-jihat al-buʻd fī al-shamāl wa-al-janūb: Starts with "Jadwal al-taḥqīqāt al-wafīyah bi-taḥrīk al-kawākib al-thābitah al-sumaytīyah bi-al-uṣūl al-Sulṭānīyah al-Ulugh Bīkīyah al-Samarqandīyah, li-awwal sanat 998 ʻArabīyah Hijrīyah ..."
Secundo folio of al-Kawākib al-thābitah wa-abʻāduhā ʻan muʻaddal al-nahār wa-jihat al-buʻd fī al-shamāl wa-al-janūb: Astronomical tables.

10. Incipit of al-Mufaṣṣal fī al-ʻamal bi-niṣf al-dāʼirah al-muʻaddil: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh muʻaddil al-layl wa-al-nahār, wa-mufaṣṣil āyāt al-awqāt nujūman li-ulī al-abṣār, bāʻith Sayyidinā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, bayna yaday al-sāʻah bi-al-tabshīr wa-al-indhār ... Wa-baʻd, fa-lammā istaqāma taʻdīl kawākib al-faḍl, wa-qāma shākhiṣ al-iḥsān wa-al-ʻadl mumtaddan bi-wujūd Mawlānā ... Yashbak min Mahdī amīr silāḥ wa-dawādār kabīr ... fa-raʼaytu an akhdima Ḥaḍratahu al-karīmah bi-hādhihi al-durrah al-yatīmah al-musammāh bi-al-Mufaṣṣal fī al-ʻamal bi-niṣf dāʼirat al-muʻaddil ..."
Secundo folio of al-Mufaṣṣal fī al-ʻamal bi-niṣf al-dāʼirah al-muʻaddil: No secundo folio.

11. Incipit of Astronomical treatise: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... tashtamilu ʻalá faṣlayn: al-Awwal fī al-tārīkh al-ʻArabī wa-maʻrifat awāʼil sinīyihi wa-shuhūrih, wa-maʻrifat al-shahr wa-al-māḍī minhu idhā juhilā, aw aḥadihimā, wa-kawn al-sanah kabīsah, aw basīṭah, wa-al-thānī fī al-tārīkh al-Qibṭī kadhālik. Wa-al-bāb al-awwal fī asmāʼ al-burūj wa-al-manāzil wa-maʻrifat burj al-Shams wa-al-qamar wa-manzilatihimā, wa-al-ṭāliʻ bi-al-fajr min al-manāzil, wa-ghayr dhālik ..."
Secundo folio of Astronomical treatise: wa-halumma jarran. Wa-ʻalá hādhā yataḥaṣṣalu.
12.3 x 17.3 cm; written surface: 8 x 12.5; lines per page vary.
Binding: In dark blue buckram; black cloth on spine.

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper, headings and markings in red; tables and drawings; few notes on the margins; leaves aslo numbered in East Arabic (Indian) numerals (137-266); catchwords.

On the flyleaf: "Majmūʻ. ʻAdad 157. Risālat al-Sayyid al-Ṭaḥḥān. Itḥāf al-ḥabīb. 137. Jadwal al-nisbah al-sittīnīyah. 147. Fī sāʻāt al-layl wa-al-nahār. 216. Laqṭ al-jawāhir fī maʻrifat al-khuṭūṭ wa-al-dawāʼir. 242. al-Kawākib al-thābitah wa-abʻāduhā ʻan muʻaddil al-nahār. 205. Maʻrifat al-Nīl al-mubārak. 218. al-Mulakhkhaṣ fī ʻilm al-hayʼah."
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Jadāwil al-nisbah al-sittīnīyah, raḥmat Allāh taʻālá ʻalá muʼallifihā. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 2a: "Hādhihi risālah lil-Sayyid al-Ṭaḥḥān, al-musammá bi-Itḥāf al-ḥabīb bi-maʻrifat al-tawqīʻāt wa-al-awqāt wa-al-Qiblah bi-al-taqrīb, raḥim Allāh muʼallifahā wa-jaʻalahā nāfiʻan. Āmīn."
On folio 21a "... wa-sammaytuhā Itḥāf al-ḥabīb bi-maʻrifat al-tawqīʻāt wa-al-awqāt wa-al-Qiblah bi-al-taqrīb ..."
On folio 68a: "Hādhā kitāb Laqṭ al-jawāhir fī maʻrifat al-khuṭūṭ wa-al-dawāʼir, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-humām Badr al-Dīn Sibṭ al-Māridīnī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatihi. Āmīn. Tamm."

On folio 103b: An astronomical table, starts with: "Hādhā jadwal yuʻlam minhu intiqāl al-Shams ilá raʼs al-burj, aw, al-darajah allatī turīd ..." It ends with: "... Iʻlam: Idhā kamula al-burj, aw, al-darajah, wa-law bi-thāniyah, yakūnu al-buʻd lil-Shams, wa-idhā lam yakmul yakūnu al-buʻd lil-burj, aw, al-darajah. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb."

On folio 104a: "al-Kawākib al-thābitah wa-abʻāduhā ʻan muʻaddal al-nahār wa-jihat al-buʻd fī al-shamāl wa-al-janūb, wa-maṭāliʻ tawassuṭihā bi-al-falak al-mustaqīm, wa-aqdāruhā, wa-huwa ʻiẓamuhā, wa-jamīʻ hādhihi muḥarrakah li-awwal sanat 998 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah [10 November 1589], wa-dhālika min ḥisāb al-Shaykh Sulaymān al-Falakī al-Ḥanafī al-ʻUthmānī, ʻufiya ʻanhu. Amīn."
1. Colophon of Jadāwil al-nisbah al-sittīnīyah: No colophon. Ends with astronomical tables.
2. Colophon of Astronomical tables in Arabic and Persian. No colophon. Ends with astronomical tables.

3. Colophon of Itḥāf al-ḥabīb bi-maʻrifat al-tawqīʻāt wa-al-awqāt wa-al-Qiblah bi-al-taqrīb: "Tammat fī yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, 24 Muḥarram al-ḥarām, sanat 1063. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah." Directly after the colophon, the following statement: "Wa-ṭarīqat rasm faḍl al-dāyir fī khalf hādhihi al-ṣafḥah [i.e., folio 66b], fa-taʼammal turshad. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."

Translation of the colophon of Itḥāf al-ḥabīb bi-maʻrifat al-tawqīʻāt wa-al-awqāt wa-al-Qiblah bi-al-taqrīb: "It was completed on blessed Thursday, the 24th of sacred al-Muḥarram, of the year 1063 [of the Hijrah = 25 December 1652]. Praise be to God alone." Directly after the colophon, the following statement: "The way to draw 'faḍl al-dāyir' [i.e., for timekeeping and direction of the Qiblah] is behind this page [i.e., folio 66b]. Look attentively and you will be guided. But God is more knowledgeable."

4. Colophon of Maʻrifat al-Nīl al-mubārak: No colophon. The text ends on how to measure the height of the flooding of the Nile in a particular year, as follows: "... Ṭarīqah ukhrá fī maʻrifat miqdār irtifāʻ Nīl Miṣr an tanẓura wuqūʻ al-nuqṭah min al-shahr al-ʻArabī al-Hilālī wa-tazīduhu ʻalá khamsah wa-thamānīn, wa-huwa al-uss, thumma wa-tazīdu ʻalayhi miqdār mā taḥarrara min irtifāʻ al-qāʻidah fī tilka al-sannah al-maʼkhūdhah fī yawm al-Jumʻah alladhī qabla ʻĪd al-Bishārah bi-yawm, wa-huwa khamsah wa-ʻishrīn min Baʼūnah, yaḥṣalu miqdār, thumma taʼkhudhu khums al-majmūʻ, yakūnu miqdār irtifāʻ al-nīl fī tilka al-sanah. Wa-Allāh taʻālá aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb [But God Almighty is more knowledgeable of what is correct]."
5. Colophon of Laqṭ al-jawāhir fī maʻrifat al-khuṭūṭ wa-al-dawāʼir: "Wa-Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻā[lá] aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb."
Translation of the colophon of Laqṭ al-jawāhir fī maʻrifat al-khuṭūṭ wa-al-dawāʼir: "But God Almighty is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning."
6. Colophon of Hidāyat al-ḥāʼir li-waḍʻ faḍl al-dāʼir: "Wa-Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, aʻlam. Tammat al-risālah bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá wa-ḥusn tawfīqih."
Translation of the colophon of Hidāyat al-ḥāʼir li-waḍʻ faḍl al-dāʼir: "But God Almighty is more knowledgeable. The epistle was completed by the help of God Almighty and his abundant benevolence."
7. Colophon of Taʼlīf fī maʻrifat al-ʻumud al-basīṭah li-kull ʻarḍ ʻalá al-asṭiḥah al-muwāziyah lil-ufuq: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl."

Translation of the colophon of Taʼlīf fī maʻrifat al-ʻumud al-basīṭah li-kull ʻarḍ ʻalá al-asṭiḥah al-muwāziyah lil-ufuq: "It was completed by the praise of God and His help. God suffices us. He is the best advocate."

8. Colophon of al-Mulakhkhaṣ fī al-hayʼah: "Wa-li-yakun hādhā khātimat al-kitāb. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Nabīyinā wa-ḥabībinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihi fī al-yawm al-Aḥad, al-tāsiʻ ʻashar min Ṣafar al-khayr, min shuhūr sanat 1063 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-taḥīyah."

Translation of the colophon of al-Mulakhkhaṣ fī al-hayʼah: "Let this be the conclusion of the book. But God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning. May God pray on Our Master, our Prophet, and our beloved, Muḥammad, on his family, and on his companions, and grant them peace. Praise be to God alone. The copy was completed on Sunday, the nineteenth of the blessed month of Ṣafar, of the year 1063 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [19 January 1653], may the best prayer and the most perfect greeting be upon Him."

9. Colophon of al-Kawākib al-thābitah wa-abʻāduhā ʻan muʻaddal al-nahār wa-jihat al-buʻd fī al-shamāl wa-al-janūb: The astronomical tables end with: "Baqīyat jadāwil maṭāliʻ tawassuṭ al-kawākib al-thābitah bi-al-falak al-mustaqīm min awwal al-Jadī ..."

Translation of the colophon of Kawākib al-thābitah wa-abʻāduhā ʻan muʻaddal al-nahār wa-jihat al-buʻd fī al-shamāl wa-al-janūb: The astronomical tables end with: "The rest of the tables of the rising of the intermediateness of the fixed stars in the straight celestial sphere, from the beginning of Capricorn."

10. Colophon of al-Mufaṣṣal fī al-ʻamal bi-niṣf al-dāʼirah al-muʻaddil: No colophon. The text ends abruptly with: "... Tanbīh: Mattá kānat al-Shams lā shuʻāʻ lahā fa-aqim dāʼirat al-mayl maqām khayṭ al-musātarah wa-kammil al-ʻamal yaḥṣul al-maṭlūb. Wa-in ḥaṣṣalta al-bāqī lil-zawāl waqt al-shurūq, aw, al-māḍī minhu waqt al-ghurūb ḥaṣula niṣf al-qaws ..."

11. Colophon of Astronomical treatise: No colophon; text ends abruptly with: "... Tatimmat qaws al-nahār huwa majmūʻ niṣf al-qaws al-Sharqī wa-al-Gharbī, wa-mā baqiya baʻda isqāṭihi min thalāthimiʼah wa-sittīn huwa qaws al-layl, wa-baʻda isqāṭ ḥiṣṣatay al-fajr wa-al-shafaq min qaws al-layl yabqá jawfuhu, aw, ḥiṣṣat al-fajr faqaṭ yabqá al-dāyir lil-fajr min al-ghurūb ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Qawl al-muḥkam ʻalá dībājat Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Ismāʻīl ibn Ghunaym al-Jawharī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b)
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī zayyana manṭiq dhawī al-ʻirfān bi-talkhīṣ lawāmiʻ al-bayān, wa-khaṣṣa man iṣṭafāhu bi-ikhrāj durar al-natāʼij min biḥār al-afkār ʻalá qawānīn ahl al-mīzān ... Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá raḥmat Mawlāhu al-ghanī, Ismāʻīl ibn al-Shaykh Ghunaym al-Jawharī: Hādhā taqyīd laṭīf ʻalá dībājat Sharḥ al-Sullam, li-muʼallifihi al-ʻAllāmah al-Akhḍarī, lā zālat jawāhir alfāẓihi turwá ʻan Ṣiḥāḥ al-Jawharī ... wa-sammaytuhu 'al-Qawl al-muḥkam ʻalá dībājat Sharḥ al-Sullam' ..."
Secundo folio: in kānat al lil-ḥaqīqah min ḥaythu.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16.5 cm; 23-24 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of the original treatise in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "al-Qawl al-muḥkam fī sharḥ muqaddimat al-Sullam."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr Muṣṭafá al-Ushmūnī."
Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihā yawm al-Jumʻah al-mubārak, ākhir shahr Jumādá al-Akhīr, sanat 1149 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. H."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy was completed on blessed Friday, the end of the month of Jumādá al-Akhīr, of the year 1149 of the Hijrah [2 November 1736], may the best prayer and peace be upon Him. H."

record.title: 880-01 Mukhtaṣar min al-Durrah al-fākhirah fī ʻilm al-Ākhirah : manuscript.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyid al-Mursalīn, Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā 'Mukhtaṣar min al-Durrah al-fākhirah fī ʻilm al-Ākhirah'. al-Bāb al-awwal min al-maqālah al-ūlá. Iʻlam, anāra Allāh qalbaka, Inna Allāh, tabāraka wa-taʻālá, kāna mawjūdan bi-dhātihi wa-ṣifātihi fī al-azal al-awwal, wa-lam yakun maʻahu shayʼ, fa-lammā arāda Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, ījād al-kāʼināt khalaqa shajarah wa-lahā arbaʻat aghṣān, fa-sammāhā shajarat al-yaqīn, thumma khalaqa al-nūr al-muqaddas al-muʻaẓẓam alladhī awjada Sayyidanā Muḥammad ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-ḥujub wa-al-kawākib wa-al-samāwāt.
16.2 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 15.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb Mukhtaṣar al-Durrah al-fākhirah fī aḥwāl al-ākhirah, taʼlīf al-Imām al-ʻallāmah al-muḥaqqiq al-mudaqqiq al-Shaykh al-Ghazzālī, raḥmat Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 31b: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá ʻAlī [... ... ...]."
Colophon: "Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah ʻalá yad al-faqīr ʻĪsá al-Sunbāwī al-Shāfiʻī. Wa-kānat kitābatuhā yawm al-Thulāth al-mubārak, 23 Shawwāl, sanat 1185."

Translation of the colophon: "This copy was completed by the hand of the poor ʻĪsá al-Sunbāwī al-Shāfiʻī. It was transcribed on blessed Tuesday, 23 Shawwāl, of the year 1185 [of the Hijrah = 29 January 1772]."

record.title: 880-03 Fatʹḥ al-Mubdiʻ fī sharḥ al-Muqniʻ : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jabara qulūb al-ʻulamāʼ bi-amdād jadhrihi al-matīn, wa-fataḥa la-hā bāb istikhrāj al-majhūl min al-maʻlūm al-razīn ... Wa-baʻd, fa-inna al-Muqniʻ al-manẓūm ʻalá baḥr al-ṭawīl fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah, lil-Imām al-muḥaqqiq, wa-al-ḥabr al-mudaqqiq, Abī al-ʻAbbās al-Shihāb Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī, al-shahīr bi-Ibn al-Hāʼim al-Shāfiʻī, ṭayyaba Allāh tharāh, wa-jaʻala al-Jannah maʼwāh, lammā kāna min abdaʻ kitāb fī al-jabr nuẓim ... ṭalaba minnī baʻḍ al-aʻizzah ʻalayya min al-fuḍalāʼ al-mutaraddidīn ilayya, an aḍaʻa ʻalayhi sharḥan yaḥullu alfāẓah, wa-yubayyinu murādah ... fa-ajabtuhu ilá dhālik ... wa-sammaytuhu bi-Fatʹḥ al-Mubdiʻ fī sharḥ al-Muqniʻ ..."
Secundo folio: ay maqṭūʻ al-barakah.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 15.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of "al-Muqniʻ fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah" in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ al-Muqniʻ fī al-jabr, lil-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, wa-al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, Shaykh al-Islām, Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-al-raḥmah wa-al-ruḍwān, wa-askanahu aʻlá farādīs al-jinān, bi-jāh Muḥammad walad ʻAdnān. Āmīn. Āmīn."

On folio 18b (to the left of the colophon), an undated "Ijāzah" (a certificate, or, a license), to transmit the contents of a book, given by Jamāl al-Dīn al-ʻArabī (could not be identified) to ʻUmar ibn Aḥmad al-Khanāʼī al-Shāfiʻī (could not be identified), as follows: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh [alladhī] khabara qulūb al-awliyāʼ bi-hi bi-ḥusn al-muqābah [al-muqābalah] yawma al-ḥisāb, wa-ḥaṭṭa ʻnahum al-awzār, wa-rafaʻa qadrahum, wa-ajzala lahum al-thawāb. Ammā baʻd, fa-qad qaraʼa ʻalayya, al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-qāṣir al-ḥaqīr, jamīʻ hādhā al-sharḥ, al-Shaykh al-fāḍil ʻUmar ibn Aḥmad al-Khanāʼī al-Shāfiʻī, wa-ajaztuhu bi-qirāʼatihi, wa-qirāʼatuhu maʻa al-thabt wa-murājaʻat al-mashāyikh al-muʻtabarah fī al-fann, maʻa al-taqwá, li-annahā al-sabab al-aqwá. Wa-katabahu al-faqīr Jamāl al-Dīn al-ʻArabī, ghafara Allāh la-hu."

Colophon: "Tamma hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak ʻalá yad al-faqīr Muḥammad al-Manzalāwī al-mudhnib, ghafara Allāh [la-hu] wa-li-wālidayhi, fī yawm al-Khamīs alladhī fī awākhir Shaʻbān, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-ithnayn wa-thamānīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed book was completed by the hand of the poor Muḥammad al-Manzalāwi, the sinner, may God forgive him and his parents, on Thursday, at the end of the month of Shaʻbān, of the year 1182 [of the Hijrah = 5 January 1769]."

record.title: 880-02 Shams al-ṭarīqah fī bayān al-Sharīʻah wa-al-ḥaqīqah : manuscript / ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz ibn Aḥmad al-Dīrīnī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá mā ahdá wa-arshad, wa-ashkuruhu limā waffaqa wa-qarraba wa-saddad, wa-asʼaluhu al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi al-musammá Muḥammadan wa-Aḥmad, wa-ālihi al-ḥujaj ʻalá man waḥḥada wa-alḥad, wa-ʻalá aṣḥābihi al-muʼminīn bi-mā waʻada wa-awʻad. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi nubdhah jazīlah daqīqah, tanjū bi-hā min al-mahāwī al-saḥīqah ... wa-laqqabtuhā bi-Shams al-ṭarīqah fī bayān al-sharīʻah wa-al-ḥaqīqah ..."
Secundo folio: bi-al-khātimah wa-hiya al-sābiqah wa-al-ḥujjah bālighah.
16 x 23 cm; written surface: 9 x 13 cm; 19-21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Shams al-ṭarīqah fī bayān al-Sharīʻah wa-al-ḥaqīqah, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-kabīr al-ʻārif billāh taʻālá, Sayyidī ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz al-Dīrīnī, raḍiya Allāh [ʻanhu], wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

On folio 1a: The last page and colophon of an unidentified previous treatise on the Ḥadīth and its transmitters, copied, or, authored (?), by Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī (-1783?). The colophon is as follows: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi yawm al-Khamīs, ʻalá yad al-ʻuwayjiz Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Sujāʻī al-Shāfiʻī al-Azharī, fī shahr Shawwāl, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-sabʻ wa-sittīn, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-lil-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of the unidentified previous treatise on the Ḥadīth and its transmitters (folio 1a): "The copy was completed on Thursday, by the hand of the little feeble one, Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Sujāʻī al-Shāfiʻī al-Azharī, in the month of Shawwāl, of the year 1167 [of the Hijrah = 25 July 1754], may God forgive him, his shaykhs, and the Muslims. Amen. Amen."

Colophon of Shams al-ṭarīqah fī bayān al-Sharīʻah wa-al-ḥaqīqah: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi yawm al-Aḥad al-mubārak, sādis Dhī al-Qaʻdah, ʻalá yad al-ʻuwayjiz al-ḍaʻīf al-munkasir Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Badrāwī al-Sujāʻī al-Shāfiʻī al-Azharī al-Aḥmadī ṭarīqatan, tilmīdh quṭb al-ʻaṣr bi-al-taḥqīq, man huwa bi-ummat Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, raʼūfun wa-shafīq, wa-man bi-barakatihi yakūnu al-duʻāʼ mujāb, Sayyidī wa-Ustādhī, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Wahhāb al-ʻAfīfī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi fī al-dārayn, wa-jaʻalanā wa-īyāhu wa-aḥibbatahu wa-al-Muslimīn min khayr al-farīqayn, wa-shaffaʻa fīnā Sayyid al-Kawnayn, wa-ʻaṭafahu ʻalaynā. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ḥaqqa ḥamdih, ḥamdan yadūmu bi-dawāmih wa-dawām mulkih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā wa-dhukhrinā wa-shafīʻinā, hādī al-ummah wa-kāshif al-ghummah wa-mujllī al-ẓulamh, Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-awlādihi wa-jamīʻ ikhwānihi min al-nabīyīn wa-al-mursalīn wa-al-malāʼikah al-muqarrabīn, mā dhakaraka al-dhākirūn wa-ghafila ʻan dhikrihim [dhikrika] al-ghāfilūn, wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of Shams al-ṭarīqah fī bayān al-Sharīʻah wa-al-ḥaqīqah: "It was copied on blessed Sunday, the sixth of Dhū al-Qaʻdah [of the year 1167 of the Hijrah = 25 August 1754], by the hand of the feeble one, the weak, and the broken-hearted, Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Badrāwī al-Sujāʻī al-Shāfiʻī al-Azharī of the Aḥmadīyah order, a student of the undisputed pivot of the time, the kind and compassionate to the nation of the Messenger of God, may God pray on him and grant him peace, he whom by his blessing the invocation is answered, my Master and Teacher, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Wahhāb al-ʻAfīfī, may God benefit us by him in the two abodes [i.e., here and the Hereafter]. May God count us with him, his loved ones, and the Muslims, among the best of the two groups [i.e., mankind and Jinn]. May He [God] grant us the advocacy and sympathy of the Master of the two Realms [i.e., the seen and the unseen, Prophet Muḥammad]. Amen. Amen. Amen. A sincere praise to God, an everlasting praise, as long as His existence and His kingdom last. May God pray, and grant peace to our Master, our leader, our treasure, our intercessor, the guide of the nation, the disperser of grief, and the elucidator of darkness, our Master Muḥammad, to his family, his companions, his children, and all his brethren, the prophets, the messengers, and the closest angels, as long as Thou art mentioned by those who mention Thee and forgotten by those who forget to mention Thee. Amen. Amen." The Hijrah year 1167 was taken from the colophon of the previous manuscript (folio 1a).

record.title: 880-02 ʻAqīdat al-masākīn fī ahwāl al-dunyā wa-al-Ākhirah : manuscript / al-Shaykh Faraḥ.
record.note: Title from colophon (folio 11b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūl Allāh, Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Iʻlam inna aḥkām al-Sharīʻah khamsah: Wājib, wa-mandūb, wa-muḥarram, wa-makrūh, wa-mubāḥ. Wa-qawāʻid al-Islām khamsah: al-Tawḥīd, al-ṣalāh, al-ṣawm, al-zakāh, al-ḥajj. Wa-arkān al-īmān sittah: al-Īmān billāh, wa-al-īmān bi-al-rusul, wa-al-īmān bi-al-malāʼikah, wa-al-īmān bi-al-kutub al-samāwīyah, wa-al-īmān bi-al-yawm al-ākhir, wa-al-īmān bi-al-qadar ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-irādah wa-al-ʻilm wa-al-ḥayāh.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 12 x 16.5 cm; 20 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good calligraphic Maghribī script, in black ink, on thick paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ḥusn ʻawnih wa-tawfīqih 'ʻAqīdat al-masākīn fī ahwāl al-dunyā wa-al-Ākhirah', taʼlīf al-Shaykh Sayyidī Faraḥ, farraḥahu Allāh fī al-dunyā wa-al-Ākhirah, wa-farraḥanā maʻahu. Āmīn. Yā Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-Nabī al-ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam, ʻadada mā dhakaraka wa-dhakarahu al-dhākirūn, wa-ʻadada mā ghafila ʻan dhikrika wa-dhikrihi al-ghāfilūn. Āmīn. Yā Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ākhir daʻwānā an al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. H."

Translation of the colophon: "ʻAqīdat al-masākīn fī ahwāl al-dunyā wa-al-Ākhirah was completed by the praise of God and His abundant help and benevolence, authored by my Master al-Shaykh Faraḥ, may God gladden him, and us with him, in this world and the Hereafter. Amen. O Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, the Illiterate Prophet, and on his family and companions, and grant them peace, the number You and Him are mentioned by those who remember, and the number You and He are forgotten by those who forget. Amen. O Lord of the Universe. Our last invocation is Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. H."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ Taṣrīf al-ʻIzzī : manuscript / Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar al-Taftāzānī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Sharḥ Taṣrīf al-ʻIzzī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Inna arwá zahr yakhruju fī riyāḍ al-kalām min al-akmām, wa-abhá ḥibar tuḥāku bi-banān al-bayān wa-asnān al-aqlām ḥamdan lillāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, ʻalá tawātur naʻmāʼihi al-wāfirah al-ẓāhirah, wa-tarāduf ālāʼihi al-mutawāfirah al-mutaẓāfirah, thumma al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad, al-mabʻūth min ashraf jarāthīm al-anām ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Allāh al-Ghanī, Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar al-Taftāzānī ... lammā raʼaytu mukhtaṣaran min al-Taṣrīf alladhī ṣannafahu ... ʻIzz al-Millah wa-al-Dīn al-Zanjānī ... mukhtaṣaran ... sanaḥa lī an ashraḥa la-hu sharḥan yudhallilu min al-lafẓ ṣiʻābahu ..."
Secundo folio: al-lughawī ishʻāran lil-munāsabah.
16 x 21 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 17 cm; 24-31 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 5 numbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ Taṣrīf al-ʻIzzī lil-muḥaqqiq Saʻd al-Dīn al-Taftāzānī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: An excerpt from an unidentified work about "al-ṣarf" (morphology).

The unidentified excerpt on morphology (folios 43b-46b) starts with: "Iʻlam inna taʻallum ʻilm al-ṣarf farīḍah ka-taʻallum al-ṣalāh wa-al-zakāh, wa-dalīluhu qawluhu taʻālá: Innā anzalnāhu Qurʼānan ʻArabīyan ..." It ends with: "... Wa-ammā ism al-tafḍīl naḥwa anṣar, fa-huwa mushtaqq min fiʻl al-mawṣūf bi-ziyādah ʻalá ghayrihi. Wa-ism al-makān wa-al-zamān, naḥwa manṣar, wa-ism al-ālah, minṣar, kull minhā mushtaqq min al-fiʻl al-muḍāriʻ, wa-al-mīm fīhimā qāʼimah maqām ḥarf al-muḍāraʻah. Intahá."

Colophon of Sharḥ al-Taṣrīf al-ʻIzzī (folio 43a): "Wa-Allāh, subḥānuh wa-taʻālá aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb. Tamma al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-ṣalli Allāhumma ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-Nabī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallim. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Sanat 1258."

Translation of the colophon of Sharḥ al-Taṣrīf al-ʻIzzī: "God, Almighty and All Powerful, is more knowledgeable of what is correct. The book was completed by the help of God, the Abundant Giving King. To Him is the reference and returning. O God! Bless our Master Muḥammad, the Illiterate Prophet, His family and His companions, and grant them peace. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. Year 1258 [of the Hijrah = 1842/1843]."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Muqaddimah al-Azharīyah fī ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah : manuscript / Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger, based on incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá jamīʻ al-aḥwāl, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīk lah, al-munazzah kalāmuhu ʻan al-alfāẓ bi-al-ḥurūf fī al-maqāl. Wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, al-mumayyiz bayna al-hudá wa-al-ḍalāl ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Mawlāh al-Ghanī, Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Abī Bakr al-Azharī: Qad saʼalanī man aʻtaqidu ṣalāḥahu, wa-lā tasaʻunī mukhālafatuhu an ashraḥa Muqaddimatī al-Azharīyah fī ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah ..."
Secundo folio: allatī amlaytuhā li-baʻḍ al-ṭalabah.
15.5 x 22 cm; written surface:7.5 x 12 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.

In large clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; phrases of "al-Muqaddimah al-Azharīyah fī ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah" in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; some wormholes without loss of text; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb Sharḥ al-Azharīyah lil-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-Shaykh Khālid al-Azharī al-Shāfiʻī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-bi-ʻulūmih fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn."
On the upper left corner of folio 1a: "ʻIddat karārīs 10."
At the end of the copyist's colophon: An invocation.

Author's colophon: "Wa-fī hādhā al-qadr kifāyah lil-mubtadī. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā li-hādhā, wa-mā kunnā li-nahtadī lawlā an hadānā Allāh. Qāla muʼallifuhu, raḥimahu Allāh wa-raḍiaya ʻanhu: Faraghat hādhihi al-musawwadah yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ, sābiʻ ʻashar al-Ḥijjah al-ḥarām, ākhir shuhūr sanat ithnayn wa-tisʻimiʼah, maʻa shughl fikr wa-ḍīq ṣadr wa-ḍarar zāyid. Wa-al-ḥamdu [lillāh] wa-kafá, wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīna iṣṭafá, wa-raḍiya Allāh ʻan al-arbaʻah al-khulafā, wa-aʼimmat al-dīn al-ḥunafā. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This amount is sufficient for the beginner. Praise be to God who guided for this. We would not have been guided if God did not guide us. Its author, may God have mercy upon him and be pleased with him, said: I finished this rough draft on Wednesday, the 17th of sacred al-Ḥijjah, the last month of the year 902 [of the Hijrah = 25 August 1497], with troubled thought, tightness of chest, and much damage. Praise be [to God]. That is enough. Peace be unto His chosen servants. May God be pleased with four Caliphs, the true leaders of the religion. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and his companions and grant them peace."

Copyist's colophon: "Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah yawm al-Aḥad, iḥdá ʻashar min shahr Jumād al-Thānī, sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-khams wa-tisʻīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam"

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on Sunday, the eleventh of the month of Jumādá al-Thānī, of the year 1195 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [4 June 1781], may the best prayer and peace be upon him."

record.title: 880-02 Bidāyat al-hidāyah : manuscript / Abū Ḥāmid Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Ghazzālī.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ḥaqqa ḥamdih, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Rasūlih wa-ʻabdih Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi min baʻdih. Ammā baʻd, fa-iʻlam ayyuhā al-ḥarīṣ ʻalá iqtibās al-ʻilm, al-muẓhir min nafsihi ṣidq al-raghbah wa-farṭ al-taʻaṭṭush ilayh, innaka in kunta taqṣidu ṭalaba al-ʻilm al-munāfasah [lil-munāfasah] wa-al-mubāhāt [wa-al-mubāhāh] wa-al-taqaddum ʻalá al-aqrān wa-istimālat wujūh al-nās ilayk wa-jamʻ ḥuṭām al-dunyā, fa-anta sāʻin fī hadm dīnik wa-ihlāk nafsik wa-bayʻ ākhiratika bi-dunyāk ..."
Secundo folio: wa-ẓāhir wa-bāṭin wa-lā wuṣūl.
15 x 21 cm; written surface: 11 x 15.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; few collations and notes on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Abjād [?] al-qawīyah fī al-asrār al-khafīyah lil-Shaykh ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz", with an astrological diagram (8 x 8) in Arabic and Persian.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-irfaʻ yadayka ʻinda al-takbīr baʻda irsālihimā awwalan ilá minkabayk, wa-humā mabsūṭān [mabsūṭatān], wa-aṣābiʻuhumā manshūrah, lam tatakallaf ḍammahumā, wa-lā tafrujhmā, wa-irfaʻ bi-ḥaythu tujāzī [tuḥādhī] ibhāmayk shaḥmatay udhunayk, wa-ruʼūs aṣābiʻaka aʻālī udhunayk, wa-tujāzī [wa-tuḥādhī] bi-kaffayka minkabayk, fa-idhā istaqarratā fī maqarrihimā fa-kabbir, thumma arsilhumā bi-rifq, wa-lā tadfaʻ yadayka ʻinda al-rafʻ wa-al-irssāl ilá quddām dafʻan, wa-lā ilá khalf, wa-lā tanfuḍhumā yamīnan wa-shimālan, fa-idhā arsaltahumā fā ..."

record.title: Notes from Jonathan Knight lectures : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.

record.title: 880-02 al-Alghāz al-naḥwīyah : manuscript / Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-iʻānah. al-Ḥamdu lillāh musbigh al-ʻaṭāyā, kāshif al-ḍarr, al-mashkūr fī al-shiddah wa-al-rakhāʼ, aḥmaduhu, wa-lā maḥmūd ʻalá al-ḥaqīqah siwāh, wa-ashkuruhu shukran lā yaʼbāh wa-lā yastaʼnāh ..."
Secundo folio: laysa khabar li-mubtadaʼ maḥdhūf.
17 x 24 cm; written surface: 9 x 15.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Alghāz al-Shaykh Khālid al-Azharī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-bi-ʻulūmihi. Āmīn. ʻAlá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl. Āmīn. M. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, kullamā dhakarahu al-dhākirūn wa-ghafala ʻan dhikrihi al-ghāfilūn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-Nabī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."
Text folios 1b-9b. Some leaves seem to be missing between folio 1 and 2. Folio 10 is blank.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitāb hādhihi al-nuskhah yawm al-Thulāth al-mubārak, 10 khalat min shahr Rajab, sanat 1282, alf wa-miʼatayn ithnān wa-thamānūn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-Nabī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "This copy was completed on blessed Tuesday, 10 [nights] having passed from the month of Rajab, of the year 1282 [of the Hijrah = 29th November 1865]. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, the Illiterate Prophet, on his family, and on his companions, and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-01 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... kullamā wajadtu [wajadtu] fāʼidah aw shāridah waḍaʻtuhā ʻalá hāmish al-nuskhah. Fa-lammā kāna fī awwal ʻushr al-thalāthīn baʻda al-miʼah wa-al-alf, khiftu min ḍayāʻ al-kitābah allatī bi-al-hawāmish, adkhaltuhā fīhā. Wa-kuntu kullamā wajadtu ʻibārah lahā tataʻallaqu wa-munāsibah bi-shayʼ min al-ʻulūm, wa-law adná munāsabah, waḍaʻtuhā ʻinda al-munāsib lahā, ḥattá innī waḍaʻtu baʻḍ ʻibārāt Ṣūfīyah, wa-baʻḍ mawāʻiẓ wa-āthār min āthār al-salaf al-ṣāliḥ wa-ghayr dhālik ..."
Secundo folio: abtar wa-fī riwāyah bi-al-ḥamd lillāh.
16 x 23 cm; written surface: 10 x 17 cm; 25 lines per page.

Binding: The thirty quires are inside a dark blue buckram cover, with brown leather spine tooled in gold, and printed with the words "Ḥāshiyat al-Shaykh Khālid" and the name of the owner "Muḥammad ʻĀrif".
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some comments and corrections on the margins in purple; the phrases on the original text in purple and red; catchwords.
The pages of the manuscript are numbered in East Arabic (Indian) numerals: 3-602.

Colophon: No colophon. The text ends with: "... wa-mithl hādhā raṭlun min zayt, wa-kaylun min qamḥ, wa-dhirāʻun min arḍ, wa-thalāthatun min rijāl. Qālahu fī Sharḥ al-Tashīl. Wa-min hādhā al-nawʻ, ay, al-iḍāfah, bi-maʻná min iḍāfat al-aʻdād ilá al-maqdūdāt [al-maʻdūdāt] wa-al-maqādīr ilá al-maqdūrāt, kamā maththalnā bi-hi.
