Wa-iʻlam inna al-iḍāfah ʻalá ḍarbayn, maʻnawīyah wa-lafẓīyah, fa-al-maʻnawīyah kamā dhakarahā fī kalām al-muṣ. [al-muṣannif], wa-hiya an yakūna al-muḍāf ghayr waṣf, muḍāf ilá maʻmūlihi, wa-summiyat maʻnawīyah ..."

record.title: Sharḥ Tuḥfat al-ikhwān fī ʻilm al-bayān : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Dardīr.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá mā anʻama min al-bayān wa-alhama min al-tibyān, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyid al-anām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-aʼimmah al-aʻlām. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā sharḥ laṭīf ʻalá al-risālah allatī jaʻaltuhā fī bayān al-majāz wa-al-tashbīh wa-al-kināyah, yūḍiḥu maʻāniyahā, wa-yaḥullu mabāniyahā, fa-aqūlu, wa-billāh al-tawfīq, rājiyan minhu, taʻālá, an yasluka binā anfaʻ ṭarīq ..."
Secundo folio: ʻalá Rasūl Allāh. al-Maʻná.
16.8 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 7 x 14 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; light brown leather on spine and flap (in 3 unnumbered quires).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Tuḥfat al-ikhwān fī ʻilm al-bayān" in red; many commentaries on the margins of the pages of the first quire; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb 'Sharḥ Risālat al-Dardīr fī ʻilm al-istiʻārah' ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl."
Text folios 1b-21b; folio 22 is blank.

Colophon: "Wa-qad tamma hādhā al-sharḥ al-mubārak kitābatan, yawm al-Thulāthāʼ, awwal Rajab, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-dhalīl al-mawṣūf bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, al-rājī ghafr al-masāwī wa-al-dhunūb wa-al-hafawāt, Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad Buraʻī, al-Saʻdī ṭarīqatan, al-Mālikī madhhaban, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh. Āmīn. Wa-li-ikhwānihi, wa-aḥbābihi, wa-aʻdāʼihi, wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. M."

Translation of the colophon: "The writing of this blessed commentary was completed on Tuesday, the beginning of Rajab, [year not given], by the hand of the poor servant, the wretched, the despicable, who is characterized by incapacity and laxity, who aspires for the forgiveness of the shortcomings, the sins, and the offenses, Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad Buraʻī, al-Saʻdī ṭarīqatan, al-Mālikī madhhaban, may God forgive him and his parents. Amen. And [forgive] his brethren, his loved ones, his enemies, and the Muslims. Amen. M."

record.title: 880-02 al-Kawākib al-darārī fī sharḥ Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Kirmānī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... li-anna wifādatahum kānat sanat thamān, ʻāma al-fatḥ. Wa-nazalat farīḍat al-ḥajj sanat tisʻ min al-Hijrah, aw, li-annahu, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, ʻalima annahum lā yastaṭīʻūn al-ḥajj, immā bi-sabab kuffār Muḍar, wa-immā li-ghayrihi. Qawluhu 'min al-maghnam', ay, min al-ghanīmah, wa-hiya tuqsamu ʻalá khamsat akhmās, arbaʻat akhmās lil-ghuzāh, wa-al-khums yukhammas thāniyan lil-maṣārif al-khamsah al-mashhūrah fī al-fiqhīyāt. Fa-in qulta li-ma ʻadala ʻan lafẓ al-maṣdar al-ṣarīḥ ilá mā fī maʻná al-maṣdar, wa-hiya [wa-huwa] ātin maʻa al-fiʻl al-muḍāriʻ, qultu ishʻāran bi-maʻná al-tajaddud ..."
Secundo folio: wa-kadhālika hādhā fī al-siqāʼ al-muzfat.
13.5 x 18 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 13.5 cm; 20 lines per page.
Binding: In dark blue leather.
In fair naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink on white paper; the phrases of al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaḥīḥ preceded by the word "qawluhu" (his saying); some commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
Inside the back cover: Muḥammad Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn. Muḥammad. Muḥammad."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-hādhā Ḥadīth fīhi iḍṭrāb. Qāl: Saʼaltu Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl, ay, al-Bukhārī: Ay al-riwāyāt fī hādhā ʻan Abī Isḥāq aṣaḥḥ, fa-lam yaqḍi fīhi bi-shayʼ, wa-kaʼannahu raʼá Ḥadīth Zuhayr ʻan Abī Isḥāq ʻan ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Aswad ʻan abīhi ʻan ʻAbd Allāh ashbah, wa-waḍaʻahu fī Kitāb al-Jāmiʻ. Wa-aṣaḥḥ shayʼ ʻindī Ḥadīth Isrāʼīl ʻan Abī Isḥāq ʻan Abī ..."

record.title: 880-03 al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah fī al-qawāʻid al-manṭiqīyah : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn ʻUmar al-Qazwīnī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Wa-rattabtuhu ʻalá muqaddimah wa-thalāth maqālāt wa-khātimah, muʻtaṣiman bi-ḥabl al-tawfīq min wāhib al-ʻaql, wa-mutawakkilan ʻalá jūdih al-mufīḍ lil-khayr wa-al-ʻadl, li-annahu khayr muwaffiq wa-muʻīn. Ammā al-muqaddiamh fa-fīhā baḥthān: al-Awwal fī māhīyat al-manṭiq wa-bayān al-ḥājah ilayh ..."
Secundo folio: ka-kawnihā kullīyah wa-juzʼīyah wa-dhātīyah.
14.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 7 x 16 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In dark cardboard cover (in one quire)
In good naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on white paper; overlined keywords; few corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Shamsīyah. Taṣawwurāt Shamsīyah sī. Ṣāḥib al-khayrāt wa-al-ḥasanāt ʻAbd Allāh ibn Ruḍwān. Ṭalaban li-marḍāt Allāh taʻālá waqf īlmishdar. Allāh ʻaẓīm al-shān ajrīlh maʼujūr [...]."
The text ends with: "... wa-yajibu an yaḥtariza min istiʻmāl alfāẓ ʻArabīyah [gharībah], waḥshīyah, ghayr ẓāhirah al-dāllah bi-al-qiyās ilá al-sāmiʻ, li-kawnihā mufūt [mufawwitah] lil-gharaḍ."
Colophon: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb."
Translation of the colophon: "The book was completed by the help of God the Abundant Giving King."

record.title: 880-02 Hidāyat al-ḥikmah : manuscript / Athīr al-Dīn al-Abharī.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Qawl. al-Qism al-thānī fī al-ṭabīʻīyāt, wa-huwa murattab ʻalá thalāthat funūn: al-Fann al-awwal fīmā yaʻummu al-ajsām, wa-huwa mushtamil ʻalá fuṣūl. Faṣl fī ibṭāl al-juzʼ, al-juzʼ alladhī lā yatajazzá. Law faraḍnā juzʼ bayna juzʼayn, fa-immā an yakūna al-wasaṭ māniʻan min talāqī al-ṭarafayn, aw, lā yakūn, lā sabīl ilá al-thānī, li-annahu law lam yakun māniʻan la-kāna al-ajzāʼ mutadākhilah, fa-lā yakūnu al-wasaṭ wa-al-ṭaraf wasaṭan wa-ṭarafan ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-infiṣāl fī ḥāl wāḥid.
15 x 22 cm; written surface: 9-13 x 15 cm; 20 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown cardboard.
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red, some overlined in black; some phrases underlined in black; catchwords.

On folio 1a: An ownership statement dated Dhū al-Qaʻdah 1218 of the Hijrah (February/March 1804), as follows: "Ṣāḥib wa-mālik Khalīl Afandī ūghlū Idrīs Afandī yikish ṣūlī fī Zalqaʻdah, fī sanat 1218." And two stamps in the name of "Idrīs".
On folio 1a: "Risālah fī al-ṭabīʻīyāt" (in copia pencil).

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-huwa ghayr mulāʼim limā sa-yajīʼu, min annahā law kānat jisman la-kānat murakkabah min al-huyūlá wa-al-ṣūrah, wa-kull wāḥid minhā basṭ. Ammā annahu lā yajūzu an yakūna khaṭṭan, fa-li-anna wujūd al-khiṭṭah ʻalá sabīl al-istiqlāl, ay, al-jawharī, muḥāl, li-annahu idhā intahá ilayhi ṭarafā al-saṭḥayn qayyadahumā baʻḍuhum bi-al-mustaqmay [bi-al-mustaqīmī] al-aḍlāʻ. Aqūlu: Hādhā al-qayd muḍirr lanā, li-annahu lā yatimmu al-khaṭṭ illā bi-ibṭāl al-khaṭṭ al-jawharī muṭlaqan, sawāʼun kāna mustaqīman aw ghayrahu, wa-hādhā ..."

record.title: 880-02 Mirʼāt al-shurūḥ : manuscript / Muḥammad Mubīn ibn Muḥammad al-Laknawī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 2b): "... wa-sammaytuhu bi-Mirʼāt al-shurūḥ ..."
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir wa-tammim bi-al-khayr. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī rafaʻa darajāt al-adhkiyāʼ wa-jaʻla fīhim anbiyāʼ aṣfiyāʼ wa-awliyāʼ ʻurafāʼ wa-ḥukamāʼ wa-ʻuqalāʼ, wa-khafaḍa manāzil al-aghbiyāʼ ḥattá ṣāra minhum kuffāran [kuffārun] juhalāʼ, munhakimīn fī warṭat al-ẓalmāʼ, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Rasūlih Muḥammadin [Muḥammad] alladhī akhraja al-nās min ẓulmat al-ḍalālah ilá nūr al-hidāyah, wa-min sūʼ al-ghabāwah ilá ḥusn al-zakāwah ... Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf ... al-muʻtaṣim bi-ḥabl Allāh al-matīn Muḥammad Mubīn ... Inna kitāb Sullam al-ʻulūm kāna min rwaq [arwaq] al-mutūn al-muṣannafah fī al-manṭiq ..."
Secundo folio: al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn. Āmīn. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn.
16 x 21 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 15.5 cm; 14 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown buckram.
In large naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on thin paper; markings in red; catchwords.
Inside the front cover: "Sharh Sullem-il-ulum, an Arabic Book on logic with commentary by Muhammad Mabīn, in Arabic."
Inside back cover: A sticker: "LUZAC & CO̲ ORIENTAL BOOKSELLERS AND PUBLISHERS LONDON W.C."
On the lower left corner (in pencil): "Sharh Sullamul ulum".
On spine: "1447." Under it: "[Sahrḥ] Sullam al-ʻulūm."

Colophon. No colophon. The text ends with an invocation by the author, as follows: "... Wa-asʼalu Allāh min faḍlih al-akbar an yantafiʻa min hādhā al-shurūḥ [al-sharḥ] al-wālid [al-walad] al-aʻazz al-musammá bi-Muḥammad Ḥaydar, ṭāla ʻumruhu wa-baqāʼuh, wa-zāda ʻilmuhu wa-dhakāʼuh. Waffaqahu Allāh al-istikmāl, wa-raqqāhu ilá maʻārij al-kamāl. Innahu Huwa al-ʻAlī al-Mutaʻālī, wa-minhu al-jūd wa-al-ifḍāl, wa-al-ʻaṭāʼ wa-al-nawāl. Tamm."

record.title: 880-01 Risālah fī al-tawḥīd mutaʻalliqah bi-Sūrat al-Ikhlāṣ : manuscript.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-qāʼim bi-dhātii, al-mutafarrid bi-ʻizzatih, al-qayyūm ʻalá sāʼir mubtadaʻātih, al-muqtadir bi-saṭwatih, al-dāʼim fī sarmadīyatihi, al-sarmadī fī daymūmatih, al-awwal fī ābād abadīyatih, al-ākhir fī āzāl azalīyatih ..."
Secundo folio: sudan bal jaʻalahum lil-taklīf mawridan.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 10 x 15.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two unnumbered quires).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on thick paper; the verses of Sūrat al-Ikhlāṣ in red; markings in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Risālah fī al-tawḥīd mutaʻalliqah bi-Sūrat al-Ikhlāṣ, li-baʻḍ al-fuḍalāʼ al-madhkūr fī al-taʻallum."
On folio 1a: "Kitāb jawhar fī sharḥ durr, la-hu nūrun min al-maʻná sanī, li-ḥabr fāḍil, shaykh nabīl."
On folio 1a: A crude drawing of what seems to be a large ship towing two small ships, with the names of cities in North Africa, Egypt, Sudan, Syria, Turkey, Hejaz, and their distances.

On folio 1b: An ownership statement: "Fī nawbat afqar al-ʻibād ilá Rabbihi al-Mālik, al-munjī man shāʼ min al-mahālik. Arjūhu bi-ḥaqqihi wa-bi-ḥaqq Nabīyihi, ṣallá Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi wa-sallam, an yaghfira lī wa-li-wālidayya, wa-li-mashāyikhī, wa-li-ikhwān [wa-li-ikhwānī] al-mudhnibīn, bi-ʻafwihi wa-karamihi wa-iḥsānihi wa-imtinānih."
Text folios 2b-15a.
On folio 7b: An invocation by Muḥammad Aḥmad al-Najjārī.

On folio 16a: A quotation from Ibn ʻĀdil's "Tafsīr", commentary on the Qurʼān (Probably: al-Lubāb fī ʻulūm al-Kitāb, of ʻUmar ibn ʻAlī ibn ʻĀdil al-Dimashqī al-Ḥanbalī, died after 1475), includes an invocation for protecting the crops from locusts and worms.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak, al-ḥādī wa-al-ʻishrīn min shahr Ṣafar al-khayr alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat thamāniyat ʻashar wa-miʼatayn baʻda al-alf, ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr ilá al-Mawlá al-Mutaʻāl, Ibrāhīm al-Rashīdī al-shahīr bi-al-Fawwāl, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-ikhwānihi, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Bi-jāh Sayyid al-Mursalīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on blessed Saturday, the 21st of the blessed month of Ṣafar, of the year 1218 [of the Hijrah = 12 June 1803], by the hand of its copyist, the poor to the Sublime Lord, Ibrāhīm al-Rashīdī, known as al-Fawwāl, may God forgive him, his parents, his brethren, and all Muslims. Amen. By the high status of Sayyid al-Mursalīn [Prophet Muḥammad]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and on his companions, and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ Qaṭr al-nadá : manuscript / Yāsīn ibn Zayn al-Dīn al-ʻUlaymī.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Allāhumma bi-ka istaʻantu, wa-ʻalayka tawakkaltu. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī lā yukhayyibu man najjāh, al-fāʻil limā yashāʼ, fa-lā rādda li-mafʻūl qaḍāʼih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá man rafaʻahu Allāh ʻalá al-afāḍil, wa-naṣabahu ʻalaman li-tamyīz al-ḥaqq min al-bāṭil, Sayyidinā Muḥammad ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr li-raḥmat Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, Yāsīn ibn Zayn al-Dīn al-ʻUlaymī ... Alhamanī Allāh ... an uṭarriza bi-tilka al-fawāʼid ... Sharḥ al-Qaṭr, lil-fāḍil ... ʻAbd Allāh ibn Aḥmad, al-shahīr bi-al-Fākihī ..."
Secundo folio: al-mujrim wa-al-sitr ʻalayhi.
15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 11 x 16 cm; 29 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; central medallion embossed on cover and flap.

In fair small naskh script, in black ink, on laid paper; headings and markings in red; the phrases of al-Fākihī's commentary preceded by the word "qawluhu" in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; at the head of some numbered quires: "... kurrās min al-ḥāshiyah lil-Shaykh Yāsīn", or, "... min Shaykh Yasīn ʻalá al-Fākihī"; some leaves seem to be missing between folios 1 and 2; catchwords.

At the head of folio 1b: An ownership statement: "Bi-mulk al-ʻabd al-mudhnib, al-faqīr al-fānī, ʻabduhu Muḥammad ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn al-marḥūm al-Sayyid ʻAbd Allāh Afandī al-Usṭuwānī, bi-al-shirāʼ al-sharʻī min tarikat [... ... ...]"
On folio 1b (in red): "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-ʻAllāmah al-Shaykh Yāsīn ʻalá Sharḥ al-Qaṭr lil-ʻAllāmah al-Fākihī, raḥimahumā Allāh."

Author's colophon: "Wa-li-yakun hādhā ākhir mā aradnā jamʻahu fī hādhihi al-ḥawāshī, jaʻalahu Allāh khāliṣan li-wajhihi al-karīm, wa-sababan lil-fawz bi-Jannāt al-Naʻīm, innahu al-Wahhāb al-Karīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam ʻalá Mawlānā wa-Sayyidinā wa-ḥabībinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi, kullamā dhakarahu al-dhākirūn wa-ghafala ʻan dhikrihi al-ghāfilūn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh awwalan wa-ākhiran, wa-bāṭinan wa-ẓāhiran, wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Let this be the last of what we wanted to compile in these glosses. May God render it purely for His gracious face, and a means to attain the Gardens of Bliss. He is the Abundant Giving and Generous. May God pray and grant peace to our Leader, our Master and our Beloved Muḥammad, to his family, and his companions, whenever he is mentioned by those who mention him, and the heedless forget to mention him. Praise be to God, in the beginning and at the end, implicitly and explicitly. There is no power nor might except in God the Almighty, the All Powerful."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-ḥāshiyah nahār al-Jumʻah, baʻda ṣalāt al-Jumʻah, nahār al-arbaʻah [sic], min al-Muḥarram, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat sabʻ wa-miʼah baʻda al-alf, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, al-rājī raḥmat Rabbihi, Muḥammad ibn Ḥabīb, al-maʻrūf bā al-Khalīfah [bi-al-Khalīfah (?)] al-Quṣayrī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu, wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-mashāyikhihi, wa-li-kull al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The writing of this gloss was completed on Friday, after the Friday prayer, the fourth [probably the first] day of the month of al-Muḥarram, of the year 1107 [of the Hijrah = 12 August 1695], by the hand of the poor, who admits his guilt and negligence, who hopes for the mercy of his Lord, Muḥammad ibn Ḥabīb, known as al-Khalīfah al-Quṣayrī al-Shāfiʻī, may God forgive him, his parents, his shaykhs, and all Muslims entirely."

record.title: 880-03 al-Mawāʻiẓ wa-al-iʻtibār fī dhikr al-khiṭaṭ wa-al-āthār : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Maqrīzī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... wa-lā ikhtiṣār, bal wasṭ bayna al-ṭarafayn wa-ṭarīq bayna bayn. Fa-li-hādhā sammaytuhu 'Kitāb al-Mawāʻiẓ [...] wa-al-akhbār fī dhikr al-khiṭaṭ wa-al-āthār. Wa-innī la-arjū an yaḥẓá, in shāʼ Allāh, ʻinda al-mulūk, wa-lā yanbū ʻanhu ṭibāʻ al-ʻāmmī al-ṣuʻlūk, wa-yajilluhu al-ʻālim al-muntahī, wa-yaʻjabu minhu al-ṭālib al-mubtadī, wa-tarḍāhu khalāʼiq al-ʻābid al-nāsik, wa-lā yamujjuhu al-khalīʻ al-fātik, wa-yattakhidhuhu ahl al-rafāhiyah wa-al-biṭālah samaran ..."
Secundo folio: alladhī nashaʼa ʻanhā kharāb iqlīm Miṣr.
18 x 27 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 19.5 cm; 33 lines per page.
Binding: The leaves/quires are within a grey cardboard cover (17.5 x 22.5 cm)
In small fair script, in black ink, on thick paper; headings and markings in red; some headings in black with the work "maṭlab" (subject/issue); catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-lammā qadim al-Ustādh Muʼnis al-Khādim min Baghdād ilá Miṣr, istadʻā Abū ʻAlī al-Ḥusayn ibn Aḥmad al-Mādarānī, al-maʻrūf bi-Ibn Zanbūr, al-daqqāq, wa-huwa alladhī nusammīhi al-yawm al-ṭaḥḥān, wa-qāl: Inna al-Ustādh Muʼnis qad wāfā, wa-lī bi-Mashtūl qadr sittīn alf irdib qamḥan, fa-idhā wāfā fa-qum la-hu bi-al-waẓīfah. Fa-kāna yaqūmu la-hu bi-mā yaḥtāju min daqīq ḥawwārī muddata shahr. Fa-lammā kamula al-shahr, qāla kātib Muʼnis lil-daqqāq: Kam laka ḥattá nadfaʻuhu ilayak laʼin [ʻaynan (?)], fa-aʻlamahu al-khabar, fa-qāl: Mā aḥsabu al-Ustādh yarḍá an yakūna fī ḍiyāfat Abī ʻAlī. Wa-aʻlama Muʼnis bi-dhālik, fa-qāl: Anā ākulu khubza Ḥusayn. Lā yabraḥu al-rajul ḥattá yaqbuḍa mā la-hu. Fa-maḍá al-daqqāq wa-aʻlama Abā Zanbūr, fa-qāma min fawrihi ilá Muʼnis, fa-akabba ʻalá rijlayh, fa-iḥtashama minhu, wa-qāl ..."

record.title: Genealogy of the Colton family : manuscript.
record.note: Title taken from page four.

record.title: 880-01 Majmūʻ al-fatāwá al-Khayrīyah ʻalá madhhab al-Imām al-Aʻẓam Abī Ḥanīfah al-Nuʻmān : manuscript.
record.note: Title from the flyleaf.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Kitāb Adab al-Qāḍī. al-Adab huwa al-takhalluq bi-al-akhlāq al-jamīlah wa-al-khiṣāl al-ḥamīdah fī muʻāsharat al-nās wa-muʻāmalatihim. Wa-adab al-qāḍī iltizāmuhu bi-mā nadaba ilayhi al-sharʻ, min basṭ al-ʻadl, wa-rafʻ al-ẓulm, wa-tark al-mayl, wa-al-muḥāfaẓah ʻalá ḥudūd al-sharʻ, wa-al-jary ʻalá sunan al-Sunnah ..."
Secundo folio: wa-aqwam bi-hi wa-mukhayyar fīhi.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; central medallion embossed on cover and flap; light brown leather on spine.
In fair naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on thick laid paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
At the head of the flyleaf: "Collection of fatawie."
On the flyleaf: "Kitāb Majmūʻ al-Fatāwá al-Khayr[īyah] ʻalá madhhab al-Imām al-Aʻẓam Abī Ḥanīfah al-Nuʻmān, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu."
On the flyleaf: "al-Khayrīyah. Thamanuhu 100."
On the flyleaf: An ownership statement (?): "al-Faqīr Aḥmad Wahbī, ghafara Allāh [...]. M."
On the flyleaf: An ownership statement (?), dated 1247 of the Hijrah (1831/1832): "al-Faqīr Ḥāmid Sinān, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh. 1247. M."
On the back of the flyleaf: Miscellaneous fatwas.

On the back of the flyleaf: Table of contents: "Kitāb Adab al-qāḍī. Kitāb al-Daʻwá. Kitāb al-Shahādāt. Kitāb al-Qāḍī ilá al-qāḍī. Kitāb al-Wakālah. Kitāb al-Iqrār. Kitāb al-Ṣulḥ. Kitāb al-Muḍārabah. Kitāb al-Wadīʻah. Kitāb al-ʻĀriyah. Kitāb al-Hibah. Kitāb al-Ijārah. Kitāb al-Ikrāh. Kitāb al-Ḥajj. Kitāb al-Maʼdhūn. Kitāb al-Ghaṣb."
At the head of folio 1a: "ʻAdad awrāq 226" (in East Arabic/Indian numerals).

On folio 1a: "Fihris al-kitāb. Kitāb [...], min 'al-Muḥīṭ al-Burhānī [fī al-fiqh al-Nuʻmānī', of Burhān al-Dīn Maḥmūd ibn Aḥmad al-Marghīnānī, 1156 or 1157-1219 or 1220]. Kitāb al-Ghaṣb wa-al-jināyāt, min al-Muḥīṭ al-Burhānī. Kitāb al-Ashribah, min al-Muḥīṭ al-Burhānī. Kitāb al-Rahn, min Sharḥ al-Ṭaḥāwī [probably, Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Ṭaḥāwī, 852?-933]. Kitāb al-Shafʻah. Kitāb al-Qismah. Kitāb al-Farāʼiḍ. Kitāb al-Waṣāyā. Kitāb al-Jināyāt. Kitāb al-Ṣayd. Kitāb al-Dhabāʼiḥ. Kitāb al-Uḍḥiyah. Kitāb al-Karāhiyah. Kitāb al-Istiḥsān. Kitāb Alfāẓ kufr. Kitāb Maḥāḍir wa-sijillāt."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Min mann Allāh subḥānuh ʻalá al-rājī iḥsānah, Muḥammad al-Ḥāfiẓ ibn Jamāl al-Dīn al-Maqdisī al-Qāḍī bi-al-Manṣūrah sābiqan, ʻufiya ʻanhumā."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Min kutub al-faqīr al-Ḥājj Muḥammad Sinān." 2. "Thumma intaqala ilá mulk al-faqīr ilá raḥmat Rabbihi al-Hādī, ʻabduhu ʻAlī al-ʻImādī al-Ḥanafī, ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-luṭfihi al-khafī."

On folio 1a: A reader's statement, from Damascus (Syria): "Naẓara fīhi multaqiṭan min farāʼid fawāʼid mā yaḥwīhi, dāʻiyan li-mālikih wa-munshiʼihi, al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá raḥmat Rabbihi al-Salām, Ibrāhīm kātib al-fatwá bi-Dimashq al-Shām."
On the tail edge: "al-Niṣf al-thānī min Majmūʻ al-fatāwī."

Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb al-majmūʻah bi-ʻawn Allāh ʻazza wa-jall, ʻalá yad aḍʻaf al-ʻibād, Muṣṭafá ibn Sayyidī ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad, ghafara Allāh lahum wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, bi-ḥurmat rūḥ Muḥammad, ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi afḍal al-ṣalawāt, fī sanat thamān wa-sabʻīn wa-alf, yawm al-Ithnayn, al-akhīr min shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyid al-Anām."

Translation of the colophon: "The compiled book was completed by the help of God, be praised and glorified, by the hand of the feeblest of the servants, Muṣṭafá ibn Sayyidī ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad, may God forgive them, and all Muslim men and women, by the sanctity of the spirit of Muḥammad, may the best prayers be upon him and upon his companions. Dated, Monday, the last day in the month of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, of the year 1078 [of the Hijrah = 19 September 1667. Praise be to God on the completion, and prayer and peace be upon the Leader of Mankind."

record.title: 880-02 Adʻūka bi-al-sirri al-maṣūni wa-ālihi : manuscript / Muṣṭafá ibn Kamāl al-Dīn al-Bakrī al-Ṣiddīqī.
record.note: Title of al-Bakrī's poem from the first and last verses (folios 1b and 7b, respectively).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of al-Bakrī's poem: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Adʻūka bi-al-sirri al-maṣūni wa-ālihi // wa-bi-ʻarshihi al-aʻlá bi-nūri jalālihi. Bi-rafīʻi dhātin quddisat wa-tawaḥḥadat // wa-bi-mā narāhu min badīʻ fiʻālihi ..."
Secundo folio: Bi-Zabūri Tawrātin wa-Injīlin wa-Qrʼānin.
9.5 x 15.5 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 11.5 cm; 10 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; text fully vocalized; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi qaṣīdah li-Sayyidī Muṣṭafá al-Bakrī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hā. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."
Text of al-Bakrī's poem on folios 1b-7b.
Folios 8a-10a are blank.

On folio 10b: An invocatory poem in seven verses, probably by ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Suhaylī (1114 or 1115-1185). The poem starts with: "Yā man yará mā fī al-ḍamīri wa-yasmaʻu // Anta al-muʻiddu li-kulli mā yutawaqqaʻu." It ends with: "Ḥāshā li-jūdika an yuqanniṭa ʻāṣiyan // al-jūdu ajzalu wa-al-mawāhibu awsaʻu."
al-Bakrī's poem ends with: "... Wa-ighfir li-ʻabdika Muṣṭafá mā unshidat // Adʻūka bi-al-sirri al-maṣūni wa-ālihi."
Translation of the last verse of al-Bakrī's poem: "... Pardon Your servant Muṣṭafá whenever recited // 'I invoke You by the well-guarded secret and His family' ..."
Colophon of al-Bakrī's poem: "Tammat al-qaṣīdah al-mubārakah bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi."
Translation of the colophon of al-Bakirī's poem: "The blessed poem is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad and his family."

record.note: 1. Title of "al-Nuzʹhah fī qalam al-ghubār" from folio 1a.
2. Title of Kitāb fī ʻilm al-jadwal from folio 35a.
3. Title of al-Nasmah al-fayḥīyah from incipit (folio 45b).
4. Title of Dāʼirat al-muʻaddil from incipit (folio 52b).
5. Title of Risālah fī al-ʻamal bi-al-jayb from incipit (folio 61a).
6. Title of Risālah fī al-ʻamal bi-al-rubʻ al-mujayyab from incipit (folio 63b).
7. Title of al-Nasmah al-fayḥīyah from incipit (folio 76b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "al-Nuzʹhah fī qalam al-ghubār": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Ammā baʻd ḥamd Allāh al-wāḥid bi-kull wajh wa-iʻtibār, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad khayr man ikhtār, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-bararah al-akhyār, fa-inna kitābī al-mawsūm bi-'al-Murshidah fī ṣināʻat al-ghubār', lammā talaqqá al-qabūl wa-ḥaẓ [wa-ḥaẓiya] bi-al-intishār, kalafa bi-hi ṣadīq lī yahwá al-ikhtiṣār, wa-iltamasa minnī an ulakhkhiṣahu mubālighan fī al-iqtiṣār, fa-ajabtuhu ṭāmiʻan fī duʻāʼihi lī bi-ḥusn al-khātimah, ḥāṣiran la-hu fī muqaddimah wa-bābayn wa-khātimah ..."
Secundo folio of the colophon of "al-Nuzʹhah fī qalam al-ghubār": al-tāsiʻ fa-huwa ṣūrat al-tisʻah.

2. Incipit of "Kitāb fī ʻilm al-jadwal": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī, wa-al-iʻānah ʻalay, wa-ʻalayhi al-tiklān. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ʻāqibah lil-muttaqīn, wa-lā ʻudwān illā ʻalá al-ẓālimīn, wa-afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-taslīm ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad Khātim al-Nabīyīn wa-Imām al-Mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu awḥad al-ʻulamāʼ al-ʻāmilīn, al-faqīr ilá raḥmat Rabbihi al-qawī al-matīn, al-Jalālī Jalāl al-Dīn ibn al-Shaykh Khayr al-Dīn al-Karakī al-Shāfiʻī al-Burhānī, taghammadahumā Allāh taʻālá bi-raḥmatih wa-askanahumā buḥbūḥat Jannatih wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn: Qad thalaja ṣadrī al-taʻarruḍ li-maʻrifat al-jadwal alladhī waḍaʻahu wālidī lil-munāsakhāt wa-qismat al-tarikāt bi-hi fī kitābihi 'al-Zubad al-muhimmah fī al-jadwal wa-al-qismah ..."
Secundo folio of "Kitāb fī ʻilm al-jadwal": al-thānī ishārat mawtih.

3. Incipit of "al-Nasmah al-fayḥīyah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn ʻalá al-qawm al-kāfirīn. Qāla ʻAlīyun wa-huwa Ibnu Ghānimi // kāna min al-khayrāt khayra ghānimi. Aḥmadu Rabba al-ʻĀlamīna waḥdahu // thumma al-ṣalātu wa-al-salāmu baʻdahu. ʻAlá al-Nabīyi wa-ālihi wa-al-ṣaḥbi // wa-baʻda hādhā naẓmu ʻilmi al-jaybi. Kitābu khayri fāḍilin imāmi // al-Māridīnīyi al-fatá al-himāmi. Āthartuhu li-kathrati al-fawāʼidi // fīhi wa-qad ṣīna ʻani al-zawāʼid. Baʻda iqtirāḥi wājibi al-ijābati // wa-Allāhu ḥasbī wa-la-hu inābatī. Sammaytuhā bi-al-Nasmati al-fayḥīyati // ḍammantuhā al-Risālata al-Fatḥīyati. Abwābuhā ʻishrūn maʻ muqaddimah // wa-ismu al-rusūmi awwalan nuqaddimah ..."
Secundo folio of "al-Nasmah al-fayḥīyah": ṭarīqat imsākihi lil-rubʻi.

4. Incipit of "Dāʼirat al-muʻaddil": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻĀlim al-ʻAllāmah, waḥīd al-dahr wa-farīd al-ʻaṣr, Abū al-Faḍl ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz Muḥammad al-Wafāʼī, al-muʼaqqit bi-al-Jāmiʻ al-Muʼayyidī wa-ghayrih bi-al-diyār al-Miṣrīyah, asbagha Allāh ʻalayhi ẓilālah, wa-khatam bi-al-ṣāliḥāt aʻmālah. Ammā baʻd ḥamd Allāh wa-ṣalātihi wa-salāmihi ʻalá Rasūlihi Muḥammad, khayr khalqihi, saʼalanī baʻḍ al-aṣdiqāʼ́ fī ʻamal risālah ʻalá al-ālah allatī sammaytuhā bi-Dāʼirat al-muʻaddil, fa-ajabtuhu ilá suʼālih, wa-asʼalu Allāh an yanfaʻa bi-hā mālikahā wa-qāriʼahā wa-al-nāẓir fīhā, innahu ʻalá mā yashāʼu qadīr. Wa-qad rattabtuhā ʻalá muqaddimah wa-khamsata ʻashara bāban wa-khātimah ..."
Secundo folio of "Dāʼirat al-muʻaddil": qaws al-ʻaṣr wa-al-mayl ʻalayhā.

5. Incipit of "Risālah fī al-ʻamal bi-al-jayb": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, khayr khalqihi, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-jundih. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi risālah nāfiʻah ghāyat al-intifāʻ fī al-ʻamal bi-al-jayb wa-al-bukhsh fī ākhir al-qaws, wa-hiya mushtamilah ʻalá ʻashart abwāb. al-Bāb al-awwal fī maʻrifat akhdh al-irtifāʻ ..."
Secundo folio of "Risālah fī al-ʻamal bi-al-jayb": al-juzʼī wa-rudda fī al-mankūs ilá khaṭṭ al-istiwāʼ.

6. Incipit of "Risālah fī al-ʻamal bi-al-rubʻ al-mujayyab": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-taslīm ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khātim al-nabīyīn wa-al-mursalīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi 'Risālah fī al-ʻamal bi-al-rubʻ al-mujayyab', mushtamilah ʻalá muqaddimah wa-ʻishrīn bāban, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Jamāl al-Dīn ʻAbd Allāh al-Māridīnī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-askanahu fasīḥ jannatih, wa-ḥasharanā fī zumratih. Āmīn ..."
Secundo folio of "Risālah fī al-ʻamal bi-al-rubʻ al-mujayyab": al-markaz wa-huwa al-khurm alladhī fīhi al-khayṭ.

7. Incipit of "al-Nasmah al-fayḥīyah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir. [Qāla] ʻAlīyun huwa Ibn Ghānimi // kāna min al-khayrāti khayr ghānimi. Aḥmadu Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn waḥdahu // thumma al-ṣalātu wa-al-salām baʻdahu, ʻAlá al-Nabīyi wa-ālihi wa-al-ṣuḥbi // [wa-baʻda] hādhā taʻlamu ʻilma al-jaybi. Yaḥwī kitāb al-fāḍili al-Imāmi // al-Māridīnīyi al-Badri dhī al-tamāmi. Āthartuhu li-kathrati al-fawāʼid // fīhi wa-qad ṣīna ʻani al-zawāʼid. Naẓamtuhu li-yashula al-ḥifẓu ʻalá // ṭullābihi yazīduhu Rabbī ʻulā. Baʻda iqtirāḥi wājib al-ijābah // wa-Allāhu Rabbī wa-la-hu inābah. Sammaytuhu bi-al-Nasmati al-nafḥīyah // ḍammantuhā al-Risālata al-Fatḥīyah. Abwābuhu ʻishrūn maʻ muqaddimah // wa-ismu al-rusūmi qablu fa-li-nuqaddimah ..."
Secundo folio of "al-Nasmah al-fayḥīyah": Tusammá khuṭūṭun fīhi bi-al-mabsūṭati.
10.5 x 15.5 cm; written surface: varies cm; 23 lines per page vary.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; light brown leather on spine and flap.

The first manuscript is in fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords. The second manuscript is written in good naskh script; headings and markings in red; many diagrams and charts in red and black; catchworks. The third manuscript is written in the same hand as the second manuscript. The fourth manuscript is written in the same hand as the second and third. The fifth letter is written in fair naskh script; markings in red; some notes on the margins; catchwords. The sixth manuscript is written in fair naskh script, markings in red, some notes and corrections on the margins; some catchwords. The seventh treatise is written in good naskh; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb 'al-Nuzhah fī qalam al-ghubār', taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻĀlim al-ʻAllāmah, Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn al-Hāʼim taghammada[hu] Allāh bi-raḥmatih wa-askanahu <wa-askanahu> fasīḥ jannatih, bi-Muḥammad wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Mulk al-faqīr Aḥmad Ḥaribīyah al-Nashnāzī, ʻufiya ʻanhu. Āmīn." 2. "Intaqala ilá mulk ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Muṣliḥ al-ʻAmūdī, bi-al-shirá al-sharʻī, sanat 1249 [lil-Hijrah = 1833/1834]. Qīmat 12 [...], ʻind [?] niṣf Riyāl [...]." "Qīmatuhu 36- [... ... ...]."
Folio 34 is blank.

On folio 35a: "Kitāb fī ʻilm al-jadwal, li-waḥīd dahrihi wa-farīd ʻaṣrihi al-Jalālī Jalāl al-Dīn ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh Khayr al-Dīn al-Karakī al-Shāfiʻī al-Burhānī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-asrārihim fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm."
Folios 42-44 are blank.

On folio 45a: "Kitāb Naẓm al-Qismah al-fayḥīyah, ḍimnīyatuhā al-Risālah al-Fatḥīyah, li-waḥīd dahrihi wa-farīd ʻaṣrihi ʻAlī ibn Ghānim, fī ̄ʻilm al-jabr, lil-Shaykh al-Māridīnī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn."

On folio 52a: Kitāb Dāʼirat al-muʻaddil, li-waḥīd dahrihi wa-farīd ʻaṣrihi ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz [ibn] Muḥammad al-Wafāʼī, al-muʼaqqit bi-al-Jāmiʻ al-Muʼayyidī wa-ghayrih bi-al-diyār al-Miṣrīyah. Raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn."
On folio 77b: "Fawāʼid" (Miscellaneous useful quotations).

1. Colophon of the author of "al-Nuzʹhah fī qalam al-ghubār": "Fa-hādhā al-qadr al-muqtaṣar ʻalayhi fī hādhā al-mukhtaṣar mimmā lā yasaʻ al-ṭālib al-muḥaṣṣil jahluhu. Wa-man arāda al-ziyādah ʻalá dhālik, fa-yakfīhi aṣluhu, wa-man arāda al-tabaḥḥur fī al-taṣarruf fī al-majhūlāt bi-al-aʻdād al-mutanāsibah, fa-ʻalayhi bi-'al-Maʻūnah' allatī fāqat kutub hādhā al-fann qāṭibatan. Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Wa-lillāh al-ḥamd, awwalan wa-ākhiran, ẓāhiran wa-bāṭinan."

Translation of the colophon of the author of "al-Nuzʹhah fī qalam al-ghubār": "This limited quantity which we introduced in this compendium; the learning student cannot afford not to know. However, if he needed more than this, its origin will be sufficient. But, if one wants to dive deeply into how to handle the unknowns of the proportionate numbers, he should study 'al-Maʻūnah' which surpassed all the books in this art. But God is more knowledgeable. To Him is the praise in the beginning and at the end, explicitly and implicitly."

1a. Colophon of the copyist of "al-Nuzʹhah fī qalam al-ghubār": "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, tāsiʻ Rabīʻī al-Thānī min shuhūr sanat 1064 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad ʻabduhu alladhī lā nabī baʻdah, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon of the copyist of "al-Nuzʹhah fī qalam al-ghubār": "This copy was completed on blessed Thursday, the ninth of the month of Rabīʻī al-Thānī, of the year 1064 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [27 February 1654]. May the best prayer and peace be upon Him. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on His servant, our Master Muḥammad, whom no prophet comes after him, and on his family and companions and grant them peace."
2. Colophon of "Kitāb fī ʻilm al-jadwal": "Wa-qad tanāhá talkhīṣuhā. Wa-Allāh subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá aʻlam."
Translation of the colophon of "Kitāb fī ʻilm al-jadwal": "Its [the book's] summary is completed. But God, the Glorious Almighty, is more knowledgeable."

3. Colophon of "al-Nasmah al-fayḥīyah". No colophon. The manuscript ends with the following verses: "... Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāhi ʻalá mā anʻamā // min naẓmi aḥkāmin tuḥākī anjumā. Fī laylatin min thālithin min rābiʻin // min khāmisin min sābiʻin yā sāmiʻī. Min ʻāshirin min Hijrati al-Mukhtāri // ʻalayhi wa-al-āli ṣalātu al-Bārī. Abyātuhā Qāfun wa-Ḥāʼun Ṣādu // fa-iʻná akhī bi-ḥifẓihā tusādu. Tamma bi-ḥamdi Allāh wa-ʻawnih [It was completed by the praise of God and His help]."

4. Colophon of the author of "Dāʼirat al-muʻaddil": "Wa-fī hādhā al-qadr kifāyah li-man arāda al-ʻamal bi-hādhihi al-ālah, wa-illā fa-yumkinu istikhrāj aʻmāl ukhar bi-maʻrifat inḥirāf al-khīṭān min ghayr wujūd al-Shams, wa-ghayr dhālik, wa-hādhā ẓāhir li-man la-hu adná riyāḍah. Wa-Allāh taʻālá aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb."

Translation of the colophon of the author of "Dāʼirat al-muʻaddil": "This amount is sufficient for him who wants to use this device. Otherwise, it is possible to deduct other functions by knowing the deviation of the threads, without the Sun being present, in addition to other things, as this is obvious for him who has the least knowledge of mathematics. But God Almighty is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning."

4a. Colophon of the copyist of "Dāʼirat al-muʻaddil": "Wa-wāfaq al-farāgh min naskhihā fī yawm al-Aḥad al-mubārak, sābiʻ shahr Dhī al-Ḥijjah al-ḥarām hilālan, wa-thāminuhu ḥisāban, khitām sanat 1136, al-muwāfiq la-hu thālith ʻashar min shahr Misurī al-Qibṭī, khitām sanat 1439, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim li-ʻafw al-Malik al-Jawwād, al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-fānī, Ḥusayn Manṣūr al-Qabbānī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu."

Translation of the colophon of the copyist of "Dāʼirat al-muʻaddil": "The copy was completed on blessed Sunday, the seventh crescent day of the sacred month of Dhī al-Ḥijjah, the eighth day in calculation, the end of the year 1136 [of the Hijrah = 27 August 1724], equivalent to the thirteenth day of the month of Misurī, the end of the Coptic year of 1439, by the hand of the poorest of the servants and the neediest to the forgiveness of the Abundant Giving King, the poor and perishing servant, Ḥusayn Manṣūr al-Qabbānī, May God pardon him."

The copyist wrote the following poem at the end of the colophon of the fourth treatise "Dāʼirat al-muʻaddil", praising the book and its author, urging the owner to read it and benefit from its contents, and invoking blessings for both the author and the owner, using "play on words" of the mathematical terms of the treatise, as follows: "Hā niṣfu dāʼirat al-muʻaddili fa-iqtaḍi // bi-al-ʻilmi aʻmālan ʻalá al-āfāqī. Bi-al-Shamsi wa-al-Qamri al-muḍīʼi wa-najmihi // taḥẓá bi-awqāti al-ālati al-bāqī. Juyūbuhu muliʼat khayran li-mālikih // wa-rabʻuhu bi-al-khayrāti maʻmūru. Khudh fī ʻilmihi al-jayba al-āfāqī // taḥẓá bi-awqāti al-ālati al-bāqī. li-ṣāḥibihi al-saʻādatu wa-al-salāmah // wa-ṭūlu al-ʻumri mā nāḥat ḥamāmah. ʻIzzun li-ṣāḥibihi yadūmu // mā dāma fī falikin nujūmu."
5. Colophon of "Risālah fī al-ʻamal bi-al-jayb": "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of "Risālah fī al-ʻamal bi-al-jayb": "But God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on Him who no prophet comes after Him. Amen."

6. Colophon of "Risālah fī al-ʻamal bi-al-rubʻ al-mujayyab": "Wa-li-yakun dhālika khātimat al-risālah, wa-billāh al-tawfīq. Wa-tuwuffiya muʼallifuhā ilá raḥmat Allāh taʻālá laylat al-Jumʻah, wa-dufina ṣabāḥahā, tāsiʻ Jumādá al-Awwal, sanat 809, wa-dufina bi-Turbat al-Sādah al-Ṣūfiyah, bi-Khāniqāh Saʻīd al-Suʻadā, khārij Bāb al-Qaṣr, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of "Risālah fī al-ʻamal bi-al-rubʻ al-mujayyab": "Let this be the conclusion of the epistle. From God comes success. Its author departed to the mercy of God Almighty, on Friday night, and was buried the next morning, on the nineth of Jumādá al-Awwal, of the year 809 [of the Hijrah = Friday, 31 October 1406], in the cemetery of 'al-Sādah al-Ṣūfīyah' (Sufi Masters), located at the Khāniqāh of Saʻīd al-Suʻadā, outside of Bāb al-Qaṣr. May God have mercy upon him. Amen."

7. Colophon of "al-Nasmah al-fayḥīyah": No colophon. The text ends abruptly with: "... Wa-al-jaybu lā yazīdu ʻan sittīnī // yujazzā wa-in tahabbaṭa min al-sittīnī. Bi-qadri jaybin qawsuhā ṭilbatuhu // lil-qawsi fīhā al-qawsu qad aṣabtahu ..."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Risālah al-waḍʻīyah : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Qūshjī.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī khaṣṣa al-insān bi-maʻrifat awḍāʻ al-kalām wa-mabānīhi, wa-jaʻala al-ḥurūf uṣūl kalimihi wa-ẓurūf maʻānīh, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá al-mushtaqq min maṣdar al-faḍl wa-al-ḥikam, al-jāmiʻ li-maḥāsin al-afʻāl wa-makārim al-shiyam, al-mawṣūl bi-alfāẓihi anwāʻ al-saʻādah wa-al-hudá, al-muḍmir fī ishārātihi aṣnāf al-ḥikmah wa-al-tuqá, Muḥammad, al-madhkūr ismuhu fī al-Tawrāt wa-al-Injīl, wa-ʻalá ālihi, muẓhir al-ḥaqq wa-mubṭil al-abāṭīl, mā ẓahara al-najm fī al-ʻalam wa-mā ishtahara al-najm fī al-ʻalam ..."
Secundo folio: wa-lam yakun lahā buddun min sharḥ.
17 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 7.5x 14 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two unnumbered quires).
In good large naskh script, in black ink, on laid paper; the phrases of the original in red; many notes and commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ al-Samarqandī ʻalá Risālat al-waḍʻ."
On folio 1a: Three pieces of poetry praising [al-Imām] al-Shāfiʻi (3 by 2 by 2 verses)
Leaf 14 is blank.

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Āmīn.

Translation of the colophon: "God, the Glorious Almighty, is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning. Prayer and peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, on his family and all his companions. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 al-Taṣrīḥ bi-maḍmūn al-Tawḍīḥ : manuscript / Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla Sayyidunā wa-Mawlānā, al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, waḥīd dahrihi wa-farīd ʻaṣrih, jahbadh al-fuḍalā wa-raʼīs al-nubalā, Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-mulhim li-taḥmīdih ḥamdan muwāfiyan li-niʻamih, mukāfiyan li-mazīdih, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdah, lā sharīka lah, shahādata mukhliṣin fī tawḥīdih ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūl ... Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī ... inna al-sharḥ al-mashhūr bi-al-Tawḍīḥ ʻalá Alfīyat Ibn Mālik fī ʻilm al-naḥw, lil-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻAllāmah al-Rabbānī, Jamāl al-Dīn ibn Yūsuf ibn Hishām al-Anṣārī ... fī ghāyat ḥusn al-waqʻ ʻinda jamīʻ al-ikhwān ... wa-sammaytuhu 'al-Taṣrīḥ bi-maḍmūn al-Tawḍīḥ' ..."
Secundo folio: mazajtu sharḥi bi-sharḥihi.
17 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In grey paper wrapper (in eleven unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases on the original text in red; some comments and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. The text ends abruptly with: "... wa-mā la-hu ṣadr al-kalām yamnaʻu mā qablahu an yaʻmala fīmā baʻdahu. Wa-hādhihi al-lām, wa-in kānat mutaʼakhkhirah fī al-lafẓ, martabatuhā al-taqdīm ʻalá inna, wa-innamā ukhkhirat liʼallā yadkhula ḥarf al-tawkīd ʻalá mithlih, wa-lam tuʼ́akhkhar inna li-qūwatihā bi-al-ʻamal, wa-innamā futiḥat fī naḥw ʻalimtu anna Zaydan la-faʻal, li-anna al-lām laysat lil-ibtidāʼ li-dukhūlihā ʻalá al-fiʻl al-māḍī, wa-sa-yaʼtī annahā lā tadkhulu ʻalayhi illā maʻa qad ẓāhirah wa-muqaddarah, aw, taqaʻu khabaran ʻan ism dhāt ghayr mansūkh, naḥwa Zayd innahu fāḍil, li-anna al-maṣdar lā yukhbaru bi-hi ʻan asmāʼ al-dhawāt illā bi-taʼwīl, wa-dhālik mumtaniʻ maʻa anna, aw, mansūkh ..."

1. Incipit of "al-Fawāʼid al-bahīyah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Sūrat al-Nabaʼ, wa-yusammá [wa-tusammá] Sūrat ʻAmma yatasāʼalūn. Qawluhu 'Makkīyah' bi-al-ittifāq. Qawluhu 'wa-āyuhā arbaʻūn, aw, iḥdá wa-arbaʻūn. Wa-al-ikhtilāf qarīban. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qawluhu 'fa-ḥadhafa al-awwal', li-mā marr, ay, fī awwal al-niṣf. al-Ṭībī. Qāla al-Jurjānī fī mā al-istifhāmīyah yuḥdhafa alifuhā tafriqan baynahā wa-bayna kawnihā khabaran ..."
Secundo folio of "al-Fawāʼid al-bahīyah": ʻaṭf ʻalá qawlihi li-ahl Makkah.

2. Incipit of: "An eschatological treatise on Hell and Paradise": "Bāb fī dhikr ahl al-nār wa-ṭaʻāmuhum wa-sharābuhum. Qāla al-Nabī, ʻalayhi al-salām: Inna ahl al-nār aswad al-wujūh wa-ẓulmat al-abṣār wa-yadhhabu al-ʻuqūl wa-raʼsuhum ka-al-jibāl wa-abdānuhum ka-al-fujjār wa-ʻuyūnuhum ..."
Secundo folio of "An eschatological treatise on Hell and Paradise": al-silsilah wa-fīhā nahr al-raḥīq al-makhtūm.

3. Incipit of "Aḥwāl al-Qiyāmah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Idhā zalzalah [zulzilat] al-arḍ, wa-dhālika anna al-nās kānū yarawn fī badʼ al-Islām anna Allāh taʻālá lā yuʼākhidhuhum bi-al-ṣaghāʼir min al-dhunūb wa-lā yuʻāqibu illā fī al-kabāʼir, ḥattá nazalat hādhihi al-āyah, wa-qāl: 'Fa-man yaʻmal mithqāla dharratin khayran yarah, wa-man yaʻmal mithqāla dharratin sharran yarah ..."
Secundo folio of "Aḥwāl al-Qiyāmah": No secundo folio. The text is only one leaf.

4. Incipit: "Tafsīr Sūrat Yāsīn". "Sūrat Yāsīn Makkīyah, wa-āyuhā thalāth wa-thamānūn. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yāsīn, ka-Alif Lām Mīm, fī al-maʻná wa-al-iʻrāb, wa-qīla: Maʻnāhu yā insān, bi-lughat Ṭayyiʼ, ʻalá anna aṣlahu Yā unaysīn, fa-iqtaṣara ʻalá shaṭrahu li-kathrat al-nidāʼ bi-hi, kamā qīla 'Munu Allāh' fī 'Aymun Allāh', wa-quriʼa bi-al-kasr ka-jisr, wa-bi-al-fatḥ ʻalá al-bināʼ ka-ayn wa-kayf ..."
Secundo folio of "Tafsīr Sūrat Yāsīn": fa-lā tukhallīhim yuṭaʼṭiʼūna ruʼūsahum.

5. Incipit of "Min Tafsīr Abī al-Layth": "Sūrat al-Raḥmān Makkīyah, wa-yuqāl hiya Madanīyah. Sittah wa-sabʻūn āyah. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla Allāh, tabāraka wa-taʻālá al-Raḥmān ʻalam al-Qurʼān, wa-dhālika lammā nazala qawluhu taʻālá Usjudū lil-Raḥmān. Qāla kuffār Makkah: Wa-mā al-Raḥmān. Wa-qālaū: Mā naʻrifu al-Raḥmān. Alā sāʼa Musaylimah al-Kadhdhāb. Fa-anzala Allāh taʻālá al-Raḥmān, fa-akhbara ʻan nafsihi, wa-dhakara ṣifat tawḥīdih, fa-qāl: al-Raḥmān, yaʻnī al-Raḥmān alladhī ankarūhu, ʻallama al-Qurʼān ..."
Secundo folio of "Min Tafsīr Abī al-Layth": ʻalá aṣḥābihi Sūrat al-Raḥmān.

6. Incipit of "Min Tafsīr al-ʻuyūn lil-Shaykh Shihāb al-Dīn": "Sūrat al-Nabaʼ. Arbaʻūn āyah. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-ʻawn. ʻAmmā, aṣluhu ʻanmā, istifhām li-tafkhīm al-mustafham ʻanhu, ḥadhafa al-alif farqan baynahu wa-bayn al-khabarīyah, wa-huwa kathīr, wa-yustaʻmalu al-aṣl qalīlan. Wa-maʻná ʻamma, ʻan ayy shayʼ ʻaẓīm al-shaʼn yatasāʼalūn, ay, ahl Makkah, yasʼalu baʻḍuhum baʻḍan, aw, yasʼalūn min al-muʼminīn ʻan shaʼn Muḥammad, ʻA. M. wa-khabarihi ʻan al-baʻth ʻan ṭarīq al-istihzāʼ ..."
Secundo folio of "Min Tafsīr al-ʻuyūn lil-Shaykh Shihāb al-Dīn": li-yuʼminū wa-kadhdhabū bi-āyātinā kidhdhābā.

7. Incipit of "Min Anwār al-tanzīl wa-asrār al-taʼwīl": "Rabbi yassir wa-lā tuʻassir. Rabbi zidnī ʻilman nāfiʻan. Wa-Rabbi tammim bi-al-khayr. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn, wa-niʻma al-muʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī nzzala al-Furqān ʻalá ʻabdihi li-yakūna lil-ʻālamīn nadhīran, fa-taḥaddá bi-aqṣar sūrah min suwarihi maṣāqiʻ al-khuṭabā [al-khuṭabāʼ] min al-ʻArab al-ʻarbāʼ, fa-lam yajid bi-hi qadīran, wa-afḥama man taṣaddá li-muʻāraḍatihi ʻAdnān wa-bulaghāʼ Qaḥṭān ḥattá ḥasibū annahum suḥḥirū tasḥīran ..."
Secundo folio of "Min Anwār al-tanzīl wa-asrār al-taʼwīl": ʻan al-iqdām wa-yamnaʻunī min al-intiṣāb.

8. Incipit of "Ḥāshiyat ʻIṣām al-Dīn ʻalá al-Bayḍāwī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qawluhu: Aṣluhu ʻan mā, fa-ḥadhafa al-alif ḥadhfan kathīran ilá an qall al-aṣl, wa-sabab al-ḥadhf al-mushār ilayhi bi-qawlihi li-mā marra, yaʻnī li-sabab, aw, li-qāʻidah marrat fī Sūrat al-Ṣaff. Inna li-ma murakkabah min lām al-jarr wa-mā al-istifhāmīyah, wa-al-akthar ʻalá ḥadhf alifihā maʻa ḥarf al-jarr li-kathrat istiʻmālihimā maʻan, wa-iʻtināqihimā fī al-dalālah ʻalá al-istifhām ..."
Secundo folio of "Ḥāshiyat ʻIṣām al-Dīn ʻalá al-Bayḍāwī": aw turāʼūnahum wa-yaṣiḥḥu al-istishhād.

9. Incipit of Excerpts from Anwār al-Tanzīl wa-asrār al-taʼwīl: "Sūrat al-Mulk Makkīyah, wa-tusammá al-Wāqiyah wa-al-Munjiyah, li-annahā taqī wa-tunjī qāriʼahā min ʻadhāb al-qabr, wa-āyuhā thalāthūn āyah. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Tabāraka alladhī bi-yadihi al-mulk, bi-qabḍatihi, qudratuhu al-taṣarruf fī al-umūr kullihā, wa-Huwa ʻalá kull shayʼ qadīr, ʻalá kull mā yashāʼu qadīr, alladhī khalaqa al-mawt wa-al-ḥayāh, qaddarahumā, aw, awjada al-ḥayāh wa-azālahā ḥasba mā qaddarahu, wa-qaddama al-mawt, li-qawlihi Wa-kuntum amwātan fa-aḥyākum ..."
Secundo folio of Excerpts from Anwār al-Tanzīl wa-asrār al-taʼwīl: mutaʼammilan fīhā li-tuʻāyina mā ukhbirta bi-hi.

10. Incipit of "An unidentified commentary on the Qurʼān": "Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū lā taqūlū rāʻinā wa-qūlū unẓurnā. al-Raʻy ḥifẓ al-ghayr li-maṣlaḥatihi. Wa-kāna al-Muslimūn yaqūlūn li-Rasūl Allāh ʻA M: Rāʻinā, ay rāqibnā wa-taʼanna bi-nā fīmā talaqqaynā, ḥattá nafhamahu. Wa-samiʻa al-Yahūd wa-iftaraṣūhu, wa-khāṭabū, murīdīna nisbatahu ilá al-raʻan, aw, sabbuhu bi-al-kalimah al-ʻImrānīyah [al-ʻIbrānīyah] allatī kānū yatasābbūna bi-hā, wa-huwa [wa-hiya] 'rāʻinā' [rāʻīnā], fa-nuhiya al-muʼminūn ʻanhā ..."
Secundo folio of "An unidentified commentary on the Qurʼān": taraka al-ʻāṭif wa-mā lakum min dūn Allāh.
14.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: Dark brown leather on spine and flap; remnants of dark brown leather on the edges of the cover.
In fair naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on white paper; some headings and markings in red; some comments and corrections on the margins; some inserts; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Tafsīr Saʻd Chalabī."
On the folio 1a: The names and numbers of the numerals (1 to 10, 100, 1000), in Persian.
On folio 1a: "Munlā Sulaymān [... ... ...], and the date 1134 of the Hijrah (1721/1722).
On folio 1a (in pencil): "Tafsīr Juzʼ ʻAmma. Qiṭʻah min tafsīr ḥāshiyat al-ʻIṣām ʻalá al-Bayḍāwī. Tafsīr Sūrat al-Mulk wa-Juzʼ ʻAmma."
On folio 17a: Miscellaneous quotations from the Ḥadīth and other sources.
On folios 24a-26b: Miscellaneous quotations, mostly in Ottoman Turkish, some in Arabic.
At the head of folio 27a: "Min Tafsīr Abī al-Layth."
On folio 35b: Eschatological quotations.
At head of folio 36a: "Min Tafsīr al-ʻUyūn lil-Shaykh Shihāb al-Dīn, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayh."
On folio 68a: Miscellaneous quotations.
On folio 69a: "... nāwiyan an usammiyahu baʻda an utammimahu bi-'Anwār al-tanzīl wa-asrār al-taʼwīl' ..."
On folio 110a: "Hādhā ʻIṣām al-Dīn ʻalá al-Qāḍī al-Bayḍāwī bayyaḍa Allāh wajhahu fī al-ākhirah."
On folio 153a: Miscellaneous quotations.
On folios 222a-223a: Miscellanea about "al-Nāsikh wa-al-mansūkh" (Abrogator and abrogated verses in the Qurʼān).

1. Colophon of "al-Fawāʼid al-bahīyah": No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-ʻalá khiṭāb al-insān bi-iʻtibār al-lafẓ, yaʻnī wa-fī qirāʼat ghayrihim min al-sabʻah, ʻalá khiṭābihi bi-iʻtibār al-maʻná, li-anna al-murād al-jins, wa-bi-al-kasr, ay, wa-quriʼa bi-kasr al-bāʼ, wa-iḥtajja bi-hi Abū Ḥ, raḥimahu. Dhakkara ḍamīr al-āyah, bi-taʼwīl al-Qurʼān, aw, al-naẓm. Sūrat al-Burūj Makkīyah, wa-āyuhā thintān wa-ʻishrūn. Bismillāh. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ..."

2. Colophon of "An eschatological treatise on Hell and Paradise": No colophon. Text ends with: "... Qawluhu taʻālá: 'Alam tara ilá Rabbika kayfa madd al-ẓill', yaʻnī qabla ṭulūʻ al-Shams wa-baʻda ghurūbihā. Wa-ruwiya ʻan al-Nabī, ʻA M, annahu qāl: Alā un biʼkum [unbiʼkum] bi-sāʻatin hiya ashbahu sāʻah [bi-sāʻat] al-Jannah, wa-hiya sāʻah [al-sāʻah] allatī qabla ṭulūʻ al-Shams, wa-ẓilluhā dāʼim, wa-rāḥatuhā qāʼim basīṭ, wa-barakatuhā kathīr. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."

3. Colophon of "Aḥwāl al-Qiyāmah": No colophon. Text ends with: "... Mā min aḥadin yawm al-qiyāmah illā wa-yalūmu nafsahu. Fa-in kāna muḥsinan: Lima lā zidta iḥsānan. Wa-in kāna ghayra dhālik: Lima lā raghibta ʻan al-maʻāṣī. Wa-hādhā ʻinda muʻāyanat al-thawāb wa-al-ʻiqāb. Thumma qāla, ʻazza wa-jall, Fa-man yaʻmal mithqāla dharratin khayran yarah, yaʻnī miqdāra dharrah, wa-huwa alladhī yruá fī al-shuʻāʼ [shuʻāʻ] al-Shams, yaʻnī yará thawābahu fī al-ākhirah. Wa-man yaʻmal mithqāla dharratin sharran yarah, yaʻnī yará jazāʼ [jazāʼahu] fī al-ākhirah. Tammat."

4. Colophon of "Tafsīr Sūrat Yāsīn": No colophon. Text ends with: "... Wa-ayyumā Muslimin qaraʼa Yāsīn, wa-huwa fī sakarāt al-mawt, lam yaqbiḍ malak al-mawt rūḥahu ḥattá yajīʼahu Ruḍwān bi-shurbah min al-Jannah, fa-yashrabuhā, wa-huwa ʻalá firāshihi, wa-yaqbiḍ rūḥahu wa-huwa rayyān, wa-yamkuthu fī qabrihi wa-huwa rayyān, wa-lā yaḥtāju fī ḥawḍ min ḥiyāḍ al-anbiyāʼ ḥattá yudkhilahu al-Jannah wa-huwa rayyān."

5. Colophon of "Min Tafsīr Abī al-Layth": No colophon. Text ends with: "... fa-sabbiḥ bi-ism Rabbika al-ʻaẓīm, yaʻnī udhkur isma Rabbika bi-al-tawḥīd. Wa-yuqāl nazzahahu Allāh ʻan al-sūʼ, yaʻnī qāla subḥān Allāh. Wa-yuqālu ṣalli lillāh taʻālá. Wa-ruwiya ʻan ʻAbd Allāh ibn Masʻūd annahu qāl: Samiʻtu Rasūl Allāh, ʻalayhi al-salām, annahu qāl: Man qaraʼa Sūrat al-Wāqiʻah fī kull yawm marrah lam tuṣibhu [yuṣibhu] faqr. Tafsīr Abī al-Layth."

6. Colophon of "Min Tafsīr al-ʻuyūn lil-Shaykh Shihāb al-Dīn": No colophon. Text ends with: "... Qāla ʻUthmān ibn Wāqid: Saʼaltu min Muḥammad ibn al-Munkadir ʻan al-Muʻawwidhatayn, ahumā min Kitāb Allāh taʻālá. Qāl: Man lam yazʻum annahumā min Kitāb Allāh, fa-ʻalayhi laʻnat Allāh wa-al-malāʼikah wa-al-nās ajmaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām, wa-li-Rasūlihi afḍal al-kalām. Tamm. Tamm."

7. Colophon of "Min anwār al-tanzīl wa-asrār al-taʼwīl": No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... qīla lam yaʼmurhu an yaḍriba ḥajaran bi-ʻaynih. Wa-lākin lammā qālū kayfa bi-nā law afḍaynā ilá arḍ lā ḥijārah bi-hā, ḥamala Mūsá ḥajaran fī mikhlātihi, wa-kāna yaḍribu bi-ʻaṣāhu idhā nazala, fa-yanfajir, wa-yaḍribuhu idhā irtaḥal fa-yaybas. Fa-qālū infaqad [in faqada] Mūsá ʻaṣāhu mitnā ʻaṭashan. Fa-awḥá Allāh ilayhi: Lā taqraʻ al-ḥijārah, wa-kallimhā tuṭiʻka, laʻallahum yaʻtabirūn. Wa-qīl ..."

8. Colophon of "Min Ḥāshiyat ʻIṣām al-Dīn ʻalá al-Bayḍāwī: No colophon. Text ends with: "... al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī waffaqanā bi-sharḥ hādhā al-tafsīr al-Bayḍāwī min al-ṭarafayn, min awwalihi wa-min ākhirihi, wa-nasʼaluhu an yantafiʻa bi-hi ulū al-afhām, lā yaḥrimanā min al-bayn, wa-mumhilanā muwaffiqan li-īṣāl al-awwal bi-al-ākhir, wa-yulhimanā ḥaqāʼiq al-Qurʼān ka-al-ẓāhir. Tammat al-ḥāshiyah al-sharīfah li-Mawlānā Shāfiʻī ʻIṣām al-Dīn al-wāqiʻah ʻalá al-Qāḍī al-Bayẓāwī [al-Bayḍāwī], raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

9. Colophon of Excerpts from "Anwār al-Tanzīl wa-asrār al-taʼwīl": No colophon. Text ends with a conclusion and an invocation by the author, as follows: "Qāla al-muṣannif, qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahu: Qad ittafaqa itmām taṭīq [tabyīḍ] sawād hādhā al-kitāb al-munṭawī ʻalá fawāʼid dhawī al-albāb, al-mushtamil khulāṣat aqwāl akābir al-aʼimmah, wa-ṣafwat ārāʼ aʻlām al-ummah fī tafsīr al-Qurʼān, wa-taḥqīq maʻānīhi, wa-al-kashf [ʻan] ʻawīṣāt mabānīhi, maʻa al-ījāz al-khālī ʻan al-ikhlāl wa-al-talkhīṣ al-ʻārī min al-imlāl, al-mawsūm bi-'Anwār al-tanzīl wa-asrār al-taʼwīl', wa-asʼalu Allāh an yaʻumma nafʻuhu lil-ṭullāb, wa-lā yakhlá saʻ [saʻy] man yatʻabu fīhi min al-ajr wa-al-thawāb, wa-yakhtima kull khātimat amrī bi-tawbah tukhalliṣunī ʻan al-āthām, wa-tublighunī aʻlá manāzil Dār al-Islām fī al-ʻillīyīn, maʻa al-nabīyīn wa-al-ṣiddīqīn wa-al-shuhadāʼ wa-al-ṣāliḥīn, wa-ḥasuna ulāʼika rafīqan. Wa-Huwa, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, ḥaqīq bi-an yuḥaqqiqa rajāʼ al-rājīn taḥqīqan. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá khayr khalqih, Muḥammad wa-ālihi al-ṭayyibīn wa-al-ṭāhirīn, wa-atbāʻihim ajmaʻīn. Tammat."

10. Colophon of "An unidentified commentary on the Qurʼān": No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-ʻan Ibn Masʻūd, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, annahu mansūkh bi-Āyat al-Sayf, wa-fīhi naẓar, idh al-amr ghayr muṭlaq. Inna Allāh ʻalá kull shayʼ qadīr, fa-yaqdir ʻalá al-intiqām minhum. Wa-aqīmū al-ṣalāh, wa-ātū al-zakāh, ʻaṭf ʻalá fa-iʻfū, ka-annahu amarahum bi-al-ṣabr wa-al-mukhālafah wa-al-lajāʼ [wa-al-lujūʼ] ilá Allāh bi-al-ʻibādah wa-al-birr, wa-mā tuqaddimū li-anfusikum min khayr ka-ṣalāt [ka-ṣalāh], aw, ṣadaqah, wa-Qurʼān. Tuqaddimū min iqdām tajidūhu, ay, thawābahu ʻinda Allāh ..."

record.title: Miscellaneous Islamic treatises : manuscript.
record.note: 1. Title of "Ḥurmat al-laʻib wa-al-lahw wa-al-laghw" from folio 1b.
2. Title of Tafsīr Sūrat al-Nabaʼ supplied by Hartford Seminary.
3. Title of "Kitāb Ayyuhā al-walad" from folio 49b.
4. Title of "Mushakkalāt Kulistān" from incipit (folio 65b).
5. Title of "Muqaddimah fī al-ṣalāh" from reference sources.
6. Title of "Miscellaneous quotations from the Ḥadīth with commentaries" supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Ḥurmat al-laʻib wa-al-lahw wa-al-laghw" : "al-Bāb al-sādis wa-al-thamānūn. Fī Ḥurmat al-laʻib wa-al-lahw wa-al-laghw. Subḥāna alladhī ḥarrama al-laʻiba wa-al-lahwa ʻalá al-ʻibād, wa-nahāhum ʻan al-laghw wa-al-fusq wa-al-fasād, kaylā yaqaʻa bi-irtikābihim al-juzʼī [al-khizy] fī Yawm al-Tanād, wa-yaṣila bi-istimāʻihim al-dhull wa-al-hawān fī al-maʻād ..."
Secundo folio of "Ḥurmat al-laʻib wa-al-lahw wa-al-laghw": wa-fī Khulāṣat al-fatāwá fī al-karāhiyah.

2. Incipit of "Tafsīr Sūrat al-Nabaʼ": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. ʻAmma. Aṣluhu ʻan mā. Istifhām li-tafkhīm al-mustafham ʻanhu, thumma ḥudhifat al-alif farqan baynahu wa-bayna al-khabar. Wa-huwa kathīr, wa-yustaʻmalu al-aṣl qalīlan, wa-maʻnāhu, ay, maʻná ʻamma, ʻan ayyi shayʼ ʻaẓīm al-sahaʼn yatasāʼalūn, ay, ahl Makkah, yasʼalu baʻḍuhum baʻḍan, aw, yasʼalūna min al-muʼminīn, ʻan shaʼn Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-khabarihi ʻan al-baʻth, ʻalá ṭarīq al-istihzāʼ ..."
Secundo folio of "Tafsīr Sūrat al-Nabaʼ": wa-banaynā fawqakum sabʻan shidādan.

3. Incipit of "Kitāb Ayyuhā al-walad": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ʻāqibah lil-muttaqīn, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn. Iʻlam inna wāḥidan wāḥidan min ṭalabat al-mutaqaddimīn lāzama khidmat al-Shaykh Zayn al-Dīn Ḥujjat al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn Abī Ḥāmid Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Ghazzālī, RḤ, wa-ishtaghala bi-al-taḥṣīl wa-qirāʼat al-ʻilm ʻalayhi, ḥattá jamaʻa minhu daqāʼiq al-ʻulūm, wa-istakmala faḍāʼil al-nafs, thumma innahu tafakkara yawman fī ḥāl nafsihi wa-khaṭara ʻalá bālihi, qāl: Innī qarāʼtu [qaraʼtu] anwāʻan min al-ʻulūm wa-ṣaraftu rayʻān ʻumrī ʻalá taʻallumihā wa-jamʻihā, wa-al-ān yanbaghī an aʻlama ayyu nawʻihā yanfaʻunī ghadan wa-yuʼnisunī fī qabrī ḥattá afʻaluhu, wa-ayyuhā lā yanfaʻu ḥattá atrukahu ..."
Secundo folio of "Kitāb Ayyuhā al-walad": wa-aʻmalu bi-mā fīhā muddata ʻumrī.

4. Incipit of "Mushakkalāt Kulistān": "Mushakkalāt Kulistān Qism-i avval: Dar taʻbīr-i taḥt al-lafẓ kalām-i sharīf, Khudā-yi Raḥīm. Qism-i duvvum: Dar taʻbīr-i aḥādīs̲-i laṭīf-i Rasūl-i Karīm. Qism-i suvvum: Dar taʻbīr-i ḥukamāʼ-i kūh va nis̲r. Qism-i chahārum: Dar taz̲kīr-i abyāt-i tārī siḥr-i ās̲ar. Qism-i Panjum: Dar bayān-i lughāt ..."
Secundo folio of "Mushakkalāt Kulistān": Ataʼmurūn al-nāsa bi-al-birri wa-tansawna anfusakum.

5. Incipit of "Muqaddimah fī al-ṣalāh": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ʻāqibah lil-muttaqīn, wa-lā ʻudwān illā ʻalá al-ẓālimīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá khayr al-barīyah, Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Qāla al-faqīh Abū al-Layth, raḥmat Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi: Iʻlam bi-anna al-ṣalāh farīḍah qāʼimah wa-sharīʻah thābitah, ʻurifat farīḍuhā [farīḍatuhā] bi-al-Kitāb wa-al-Sunnah wa-ijmāʻ al-ummah ..."
Secundo folio of "Muqaddimah fī al-ṣalāh": wa-al-amr min Allāh taʻālá.

6. Incipit of "Miscellaneous quotations from the Ḥadīth with commentaries": "Qāla al-Nabī, ʻalayhi al-salām: al-Ḥimār min ḥajar al-Jannah, wa-al-khayl min rīḥ al-Jannah, wa-al-baqar min zaʻfarān al-Jannah, wa-al-baʻīr min ʻanbar al-Jannah, wa-al-ghanam min ʻasal al-Jannah, wa-al-maʻz min misk al-Jannah ..."
Secundo folio of "Miscellaneous quotations from the Ḥadīth with commentaries": wa-al-ʻushūr bi-ṣarf, ay, thamāniyat aṣnāf.
14.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: In dark red leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion.
In fair and good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some commentaries on the margins in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish; some text within red frames; catchwords.
On an inserted card: "This is a commentary on the Sūrat al-Nabāʼ. The author's name is not given. This commentary does not coincide with either of the three listed in Ahlwart."
On folio 1a: "Mawʻiẓah, maʻa Tafsīr Nabaʼ, maʻa Kitāb Ayyuhā al-walad, maʻa Mushakkalāt Kulistān, maʻa Muqaddimah."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Min kutub al-faqīr al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Wāʻiẓ, tamalluk li-Jāmiʻ Murādīyah dar Adirnah." Under it an illegible stamp.
On folio 3a: A quotation from "Rawḍat al-muttaqīn".
At the head of folio 3b: "Sūrat al-Nabaʼ Makkīyah."
At the head of folio 49b (in red): "Kitāb Ayyuhā al-walad."
Folios 63b-65a are blank.
Folios 79a-82a are blank.
On folio 82b: "Hādhā kitāb Muqaddimat Abū al-Layth, raḥmat Allāh taʻālá ʻalayh." "Sharḥ Muqaddimat Abī al-Layth."
Folios 133a-137a are blank.

1. Colophon of "Ḥurmat al-laʻib wa-al-lahw wa-al-laghw". No colophon. Text ends with: "... Wa-fī Tatimmat al-fatāwá: Man qāla ʻinda ibtidāʼ shurb al-khamar wa-al-zinā wa-akl al-ḥarām "Bismillāh" kafar. Wa-law qāla baʻda al-akl: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh", ikhtalafū fīhi. In arāda bi-hi al-ḥamd ʻalá annahu rizq kafar. Naʻūdhu billāh. Maṭlaʻ al-anwār."

2. "Tafsīr Sūrt al-Nabaʼ" ends with: "... Qāla ʻUthmān ibn Wāqid: Saʼaltu min Muḥammad ibn al-Munkadir ʻan al-Muʻawwidhatayn, ahumā min Kitāb Allāh taʻālá. Qāl: Man lam yazʻum annahumā min Kitāb Allāh taʻālá, fa-ʻalayhi laʻnat [laʻnah] Allāh wa-al-malāʼikah wa-al-nās ajmaʻīn."
2a. Colophon of Tafsīr Sūrat al-Nabaʼ: "Bi-ʻawn Allāh Malik [al-Malik] al-Wahhāb, katabahu al-faqīr Ismāʻīl Yikicharyāh, dar Kāh-i ʻĀlī, blūk 19. Tammat fī 26 Shawwāl, sanat 73 [1173?]."

Translation of the colophon of "Tafsīr Sūrat al-Nabaʼ": "Written by the help of the Abundant Giving King, by the poor Ismāʻīl Yikicharyāh, at Kāh-i ʻĀlī, blūk 19. Completed on 26 Shawwāl, of the year 73 [1173? of the Hijrah = 31 May 1760?]."

3. Colophon of "Kitāb Ayyuhā al-walad": No colophon. Text ends with an invocation, as follows: "... Allāhumma lā takilnā ilá anfusinā ṭurfata ʻayn. In takilnā ilá anfusinā ṭurfata ʻayn tuqarribnā min al-sharr wa-tubāʻindnā min al-khayr." And on the left margin, the copyist quoted the following Ḥadīth: "Qāla Rasūlu Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Man akala ṭaʻāman fa-qāla: al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aṭʻāmanā [aṭʻamanā] hādhā al-ṭaʻām, wa-razaqanā min ghayr ḥawl minnā wa-lā qūwah, bi-raḥmatika yā arḥam al-rāḥimīn, ghufira la-hu mā taqaddama min dhanbih. Tammat."
4. Colophon of "Mushakkalāt Kulistān". No colophon. Text ends with the translation of some words into Turkish.

5. Colophon of "Muqaddimah fī al-ṣalāh": "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb, fī shahr Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, yawm al-Thulāth, fī waqt al-ḍuḥá, sanat 1108." Under the colophon are written three verses of poetry in Ottoman Turkish.

Translation of the colophon of "Muqaddimah fī al-ṣalāh": "The book was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King, in the month of Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, the third day, in the early morning, of the year 1108 [of the Hijrah = 30 October 1696]." Under the colophon are written three verses of poetry in Ottoman Turkish.

6. Colophon of "Miscellaneous quotations from the Ḥadīth with commentaries": No colophon. Text ends with: "... Nūr [Nawm (?)] al-ʻālim khayr min ʻibādat al-jāhil. Qāla al-Nabī, ʻalayhi al-salām: Khayrukum man taʻallama al-Qurʼān wa-ʻallam. Ṣadaqa Rasūl Allāh."

record.title: 880-02 Mukhtaṣar Sharḥ Talkhīṣ al-Miftāḥ. Al-Fann al-awwal : manuscript / Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar al-Taftāzānī.
record.note: Title from the printed versions.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... aw, naḥwa dhālik. Wa-ammā taqyīduhu, ay, al-fiʻl, bi-al-sharṭ, mithl ukrimuka wa-in [in] tukrimnī, wa-in tukrimnī ukrimka, wa-li-iʻtibārāt wa-ḥālāt taqtaḍī taqyīdahu bi-hi lā tuʻrafu illā bi-maʻrifat mā bayna adawātihi, yaʻnī ḥurūfahu wa-asmāʼahu min al-tafḍīl. Wa-qad tabayyan dhālika al-tafḍīl fī ʻilm al-naḥw, wa-fī hādhā al-kalām ishārah ilá anna al-sharṭ fī ʻurf ahl al-ʻArabīyah qayd li-ḥukm al-jazāʼ, mithl al-mafʻūl wa-naḥwih, fa-qawluka 'In jiʼtanī ukrimk', bi-manzilat qawlika 'ukrimuka waqta majīʼika īyāya' ..."
Secundo folio: al-isrāfa mimmā lā yanbaghī an yaṣdura ʻan al-ʻāqil.
14 x 18.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 14 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; cover and flap tooled with geometric design.

In fair naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on thick paper; markings in red; extensive commentaries on the margins and interlinear; the last leaf in written in good naskh in a different hand; catchwords.
Inside the front cover: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr ilá Allāh ʻĪsá Aḥmad ʻAlī" and a drawing, in red and brown, of a "Miḥrāb" (prayer niche).

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... al-ṭibāq ḍarbān, ṭibāq al-ījāb, kamā marr, wa-ṭibāq al-salb, wa-huwa an yajmaʻa bayna fiʻlay maṣdar wāḥid, aḥaduhumā <mimmā> muthbat, wa-al-ākhar manfī, aw, aḥaduhumā amr, wa-al-ākhar nahy. Fa-al-awwal naḥwa qawlihi taʻālá 'wa-lākinna akthara al-nās lā yaʻlamūn, yaʻlamūna ẓāhiran min al-ḥayāt al-dunyā. Wa-al-thānī qawluhu taʻālá 'Lā takhshaw al-nāsa wa-ikhshūnī'. Wa-min al-ṭibāq mā sammāhu baʻḍuhum tadhbījan [tadbījan], min dhabbaja [dabbaja] al-maṭaru al-arḍa, zayyanahā, wa-fassarahu bi-an yadhkura fī maʻnan min al-madḥ, aw, ghayrihi alwān ..."

record.title: 880-01 On faith, Sufism, the beginning of creation, and stories of the prophets : manuscript.
record.note: Title of the first manuscript (al-Iltijāʼ ilá al-Mannān fī asbāb ḥifẓ al-īmān) from folio 1b.
Title of the second manuscript (On Sufism) supplied by the cataloger.
Title of the third manuscript (On the beginning of creation and stories of the prophets) supplied by the cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of the first manuscript (al-Iltijāʼ ilá al-Mannān fī asbāb ḥifẓ al-īmān): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī anʻama ʻalá ʻibādihi bi-niʻmat al-īmān, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá afḍal khalq Allāh, Sayyidinā Muḥammad, sayyid walad ʻAdnān, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-tābiʻīhim bi-iḥsān. Ammā baʻd, fa-qad ṭalab minnī baʻḍ ahl al-ʻilm min ikhwānī al-ṣāliḥīn an ajmaʻa lahum mā dhakarahu al-ʻulamāʼ min al-asbāb al-mūjibah li-ḥifẓ al-īmān wa-al-dīn, fa-jamaʻtu hādhihi al-nubdhah, wa-sammaytuhā 'al-Iltijāʼ ilá al-Mannān fī asbāb ḥifẓ al-īmān', fa-naqūlu wa-billāh al-mustaʻān: Qāla al-Imām, khātimat al-ḥuffāẓ al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī fī al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaghīr, fī ḥarf al-Shīn: al-Shirk fīkum akhfá min dabīb al-naml, wa-saʼadulluka ʻalá shayʼ in faʻaltahu adhhaba Allāh ʻanka ṣighār al-shirk wa-kibārahu ..."
Secundo folio of the first manuscript (al-Iltijāʼ ilá al-Mannān fī asbāb ḥifẓ al-īmān): No secundo folio; text ends on the same page (folio 1b).

2. Incipit of the the second manuscript (On Sufism): The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... annahu lā yuḥibbunī ʻabd min ʻabīdī aʻlamu ṣidq dhālik min nīyatihi illā kuntu shughlahu alladhī yashtaghilu bi-hi, wa-samʻahu alladhī yasmaʻu bi-hi, wa-baṣarahu alladhī yubṣiru bi-hi, wa-lisānahu alladhī yadhkuru bi-hi, fa-idhā kuntu kadhālik baghghaḍtu ilayhi al-ashghāl, wa-adamtu fikratahu fīmā yūṣiluhu ilayyya ..."
Secundo folio of the second manuscript (On Sufism): ʻalá man ṣāma fīhi.

Incipit of the third manuscript (On the beginning of creation and stories of the prophets): The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... wa-al-laʻnah wa-al-ghaḍab wa-al-sukhṭ. Qāla Wahab, raḥimahu Allāh: Khalaqa Allāh taʻālá Ādam, ʻalayhi al-salām, yawm al-Jumʻah, wa-fīhā Ādam dakhala al-Jannah, wa-aqāma fīhā niṣf yawm, miqdār khams miʼat ʻām, wa-uhbiṭa mā bayna al-ẓuhr wa-al-ʻaṣr min bāb yuqālu la-hu 'al-Mubram', wa-huwa hādhā al-bayt al-maʻmūr. Wa-kadhālika qāla Mujāhid. Illā annahu qāl min bāb al-miʻrāj uhbiṭ. Wa-qāla ʻAmr ibn al-ʻĀṣ: Uhbiṭa min bāb al-tawbah. Qāl: Uhbiṭa Ādam, ʻalayhi al-salām, ilá bilād al-Hind, ʻalá jabal min jibālihā, yuqālu la-hu Būd ..."
Secundo folio of the third manuscript (On the beginning of creation and stories of the prophets): ʻan al-bukāʼ miʼat ʻām.
15 x 20.5 cm; written surface varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark brown leather on spine and flap.

The first manuscript (21 lines only) is written in good naskh script; written surface 10.5 x 15.5 cm. The second manuscript is written in fair naskh script; written surface 10 x 14 cm; 23 lines per page. The third manuscript is written in good naskh script; written surface 9 x 17 cm; 28-30 lines per page. In black ink; some headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

1. Colophon of al-Iltijāʼ ilá al-Mannān fī asbāb ḥifẓ al-īmān: No colophon. Text ends abruptly on the same page (folio 1b) with: "... aqūlu wa-yuḥtamalu ayḍan an yaqūluhā ṣabāḥan wa-masāʼan thalāthan ..."

2. Colophon of the second manuscript (On Sufism): No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... Qāla Ibrāhīm: Fa-ḥarraktuhu fa-idhā huwa mayyit. Fa-lammā aṣbaḥa al-ṣabāḥ, wa-idhā bi-qawmin qad ataw, wa-ʻalayhim nūr ʻaẓīm, fa-sāʻadūnī ʻalá ghaslih wa-takfīnih, wa-ṣallaynā ʻalayh, wa-dafannāh, fa-raʼaytuhu tilka al-laylah fī al-manām, wa-huwa fī rawḍah khaḍrāʼ, wa-ʻalayhi ḥullah khaḍrāʼ, wa-huwa yamshī wa-yatabakhtar, fa-lammā raʼānī, tabassama, wa-aqbala ilayya wa-ʻānaqanī, fa-qultu: Mā hādhā alladhī arāhu ʻalayk? Qāl: Hādhihi darajat al-ʻāmilīn wa-khulaʻ al-maqbūlīn. Wa-qīl: Awḥá Allāh taʻālá ilá Dāwūd, ʻalayhi al-salām: Innī aqsamtu bi-nafsī ʻalá nafsī annahu ..."

3. Colophon of the third manuscript (On the beginning of creation and stories of the prophets): No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... Ḥadīth al-āyāt allatī taẓharu qabla nuzūl ʻĪsá, ʻalayhi al-salām. Qāla Kaʻb al-Aḥbār: Wa-lā budda min nuzūl ʻĪsá wa-dukhūlihi fī dīn Nabīyinā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-li-qatl al-Dajjāl. Wa-lā budda an yaḥdutha qabla nuzūlihi ʻalāmāt wa-ḥurūb wa-fitan. Fa-awwal mā yakhruju wa-yaghlibu ʻalá al-bilād rajulun ismuhu al-Aṣhab min bilād al-Jazīrah, wa-yakhruju ʻalayhi al-Jurhumī min al-Shām, wa-yakhruju al-Qaḥṭānī bi-arḍ al-Yaman. Fa-baynamā hāʼulāʼ al-thalāthah fī mawāḍiʻihim qad taghallabū ʻalá amkinatihim bi-al-ẓulm wa-al-jawr, idhā hum bi-al-Sufyānī qad kharaja min ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Durrah al-fākhirah fī aḥwāl al-Ākhirah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Suḥaymī.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... Allāh ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Man labisa al-ḥarīr fī al-dunyā lam yalbashu fī al-ākhirah, wa-in dakhala al-Jannah labisahu ahl al-Jannah wa-lam yalbashu. Wa-akhraja al-Ḥākim wa-ṣaḥḥaḥahu ʻan Abī Rāfiʻ, qāl: Qāla Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Man kaffana mayyitan kasāhu Allāh min sudndus wa-istabraq al-Jannah. Wa-akhraja al-Ṭabarānī ʻan Jābir marfūʻan: Man ʻazzá muṣāban kasāhu Allāh ḥullatayn min ḥulal al-Jannah lā taqūmu lahumā al-dunyā ..."
Secundo folio: ʻalayhim bi-āniyah min fiḍḍah wa-akwāb.
17 x 24 cm; written surface: 10 x 17 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 26 unnumbered quires).
In large fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; catchwords.

Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu: Wa-hādhā ākhir mā yassarahu Allāh ʻalá yad muʼallifihi Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī Nūr al-Dīn al-Ḥasan al-Qurashī al-Sayjīmī [al-Suḥaymī] al-Qulaʻī al-Azharī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá raḥmatan wāsiʻah. Wa-kān al-farāgh min khatm hādhā al-kitāb al-mustaṭāb fī ṣabīḥat yawm al-Ithnayn, ʻiddat thamāniyat ʻashar yawman khalat min shahr Rabīʻ al-Thānī, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼatayn 68, min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-taslīm, ʻalá yad kātibihi al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-dhalīl, al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, Faraj al-Shubrāwī baladan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban al-Aḥmadī ṭarīqatan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "Its author said: This is the end of what God facilitated by the hand of its author, Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī Nūr al-Dīn al-Ḥasan al-Qurashī al-Sayjīmī [al-Suḥaymī] al-Qulaʻī al-Azharī, may God have abundant mercy upon him. The copy of this pleasant book was concluded on the morning of Monday, 18 days having passed from the month of Rabīʻ al-Thānī, of the year 1268 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [10 February 1852], may the best prayer and the most perfect peace be upon Him, by the hand of its copyist, the poor, wretched, and despicable, he who admits his shortcoming and inadequacy, Faraj al-Shubrāwī baladan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban al-Aḥmadī ṭarīqatan, may God forgive him and his parents. Amen. Amen. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, his family, and his companions, and grant them abundant peace. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 al-Lumʻah al-Māridīnīyah fī sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah : manuscript / Badr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Mārdīnī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b) and reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aḥṣá kull shayʼ ʻadadan, wa-jaʻala al-amawāl li-man aʻṭá wa-ittaqá wa-ṣaddaqa bi-al-ḥusná saʻādatan sarmadā, wa-ʻalá man bakhula wa-istaghná wa-kadhdhaba bi-al-ḥusná kuʻūb shuʼm tūqiʻu fī al-radā [al-radá]. Aḥmaduhu wa-ashkuruhu an jaʻalanā ummatan wasaṭan, li-nakūna ʻalá al-nās shuhadāʼ ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu faqīr raḥmat rabbihi, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Māridīnī: Hādhā taʻlīq ʻalá al-urjūzah al-Yāsamīnīyah fī ʻilm al-jabr, mukhtaṣar jiddan, lam yasʼalnī ʻalayhi aḥad, wa-innamā ūliʻtu fīhi min al-baṭālah wa-al-kasal, hurūban min al-ishtighāl wa-al-malal ... wa-laqqabtuhu bi-'al-Lumaʻah al-Māridīnīyah ʻalá [nuskhah: fī sharḥ] al-Yāsamīnīyah' ..."
Secundo folio: al-ḍarb isman ākhar huwa al-jadhr.
16 x 22.8 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 15.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In medium, good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of "al-Yāsamīnīyah" in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ al-Yāsamīnīyah lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Māridīnī, nafaʻanā Allāh taʻālá bi-hi wa-bi-ʻulūmihi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

al-Yāsamīnīyah of Ibn al-Yāsamīn starts with: ʻAlá thalāthatin yadūru al-jabr // al-mālu wa-al-aʻdād thumma al-jadhru. Fa-al-mālu kullu ʻadadin murabbaʻin // wa-jadhruhu wāḥidu tilaka al-aḍluʻi. Wa-al-ʻadadu al-muṭlaqu mā lam yunsabi // lil-māli aw lil-jadhri fa-ifham tuṣibi ..." It ends with: Wa-ḍarbu kullu zāʼidn wa-nāqiṣin // fī mithlihi ziyādatun lil-fāḥiṣi. Wa-ḍarbuhu fī ḍiddihi nuqṣānu // fa-ifham hadāka al-Maliku al-Dayyānu. Thumma ṣalātu Allāhi wa-al-salāmu // ʻalá al-Nabīyi mā injalā al-ẓalām.

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā qaṣadnāhu min al-taʻlīq. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdahu. Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād, ʻAlī al-Ghūlī al-Sarasī, fī nahār al-Aḥad, al-sādis ʻashar min shahr Jumādá al-Akhīr, sanat 1176."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what we intended of the commentary. Praise be to God alone. It was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence, by the hand of the poorest of the servants, ʻAlī al-Ghūlī al-Sarasī, on Sunday, the sixteenth of the month of Jumādá al-Akhīr, of the year 1176 [of the Hijrah = 2 January 1763]."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Akhḍarī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-ṣalla [wa-ṣallá] Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallma. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala qulūb al-ʻulamāʼ samāwāt tatajallá fīhā shumūs al-maʻārif, wa-wassaʻa dawāyir afhāmihim fa-awlajahum qibāb al-mukhaddarāt min ʻarāyis al-maʻānī wa-al-laṭāyif, wa-ḥabāhum bi-ḥadāyiq al-ʻuqūl fa-tanāwalū min thamarātihā, fa-aṣbaḥt āfāq ʻuqūlihim mushriqah bi-aqmār al-ʻulūm, fa-fāqū man ʻadāhum min al-wará ... Ammā baʻd, fa-lammā waḍaʻtu al-urjūzah al-musammāh bi-al-Sullam al-munawraq fī ʻilm al-manṭiq ... rāwadanī baʻḍ al-ikhwān min al-ṭalabat [al-ṭalabah] ... an aḍaʻa ʻalayhā sharḥan mufīdan ... fa-ajabtuhu li-dhālik ... wa-billāh al-tawfīq ..."
Secundo folio: al-Ḥamdu lillāhi alladhī qad akhrajā.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 15 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (the leaves are wrapped in folded brown sheet of paper 23.5 x 20.22 cm).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; few notes and corrections on the margins; the verses of al-Sullam in red; markings in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Sharḥ al-Sullam fī al-manṭiq lil-Imām al-ʻAllāmah Abū Zayd ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Akhḍarī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi."

The text of 'al-Sullam al-murawnaq fī ʻilm al-manṭiq' starts with: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī qad akhraja // natāʼij al-fikr li-arbāb al-ḥijā. Wa-ḥaṭṭa ʻanhum min samā al-ʻaqli // kulla ḥijābin min saḥābi al-jahl. Ḥattá badat lahum shumūs al-maʻrifah // raʼaw mukhaddarātihā munkashifah ..."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... Tanbīh. Ḥīna mā yustathná ʻayn al-muqaddam, fa-akthar mā yustahallu al-sharṭīyah bi-lafẓ in, fa-innahā mawḍūʻah li-taʻlīq al-wujūd bi-al-wujūd, wa-ḥaythu yustathná naqīḍ al-tālī, fa-akthar mā yuʼtá bi-law, fa-innahā wuḍiʻat li-taʻlīq al-ʻadam bi-al-ʻadam, wa-hādhā qiyās yusammá qiyās al-khulf, wa-huwa ithbāt al-maṭlūb bi-ibṭāl naqīḍihi. Thumma iʻlam inna al-qiyās al-munfaṣil mā kāna muʼallafan min qaḍāyā munfaṣilah ..."

record.title: 880-01 Sharaf al-anām wa-badr al-tamām fī mawlid al-muẓallal bi-al-ghamām : manuscript.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Istihlāl al-Mawlid al-Sharīf: al-Salāmu ʻalayka zayna al-anbiyāʼi // al-Salāmu ʻalayka atqá al-atqiyāʼi. al-Salāmu ʻalayka aṣfá al-aṣfiyāʼi // al-salāmu ʻalayka azká al-azkiyāʼi. al-Salāmu ʻalayka min Rabbi al-Samāʼi // al-Salām ʻlayka yā jālī al-ʻamāʼi ..."
Secundo folio: al-Salāmu ʻalayka yā māḥī al-dhunūbi.
18 x 25.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 18.5 cm; 12 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in five unnumbered quires).
In thick, good naskh script, in black ink, on thick paper; some phrases and markings in red; some notes on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb 'Sharaf al-anām wa-badr al-tamām fī mawlid al-muẓallal bi-al-ghamām', ʻalayhi afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl. Āmīn."

After two "istihlāls" (introductions), folios 1b-3b and 4b-5a, the text of the Mawlid itself starts on folio 5b, as follows: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī sharrafa al-anām bi-ṣāḥib al-maqām al-aʻlá, wa-kammala al-suʻūd bi-akram mawlūd ḥawá sharafan wa-faḍlan, wa-sharrafa bi-hi al-ābāʼ wa-al-judūd, wa-malaʼa al-wujūd bi-wujūdihi ʻadlan ..."

On folio 52 a: A poem by Ḥassān ibn Thābit (-674), in 5.5 verses: "Hādhihi qaṣīdah li-Ḥassān ibn Thābit, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu. Rasūla Allāhi ḍāqa biya al-faḍāʼu // wa-jalla al-khaṭbu wa-inqaṭaʻa al-ikhāʼu ..." It ends with: "Wa-ẓannī fīka Yā Ṭāhā jamīlu."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with: "... Āmīn. Yā Allāh. Āmīn. Yā Allāh. Āmīn. Yā Allāh. Yā Rāḥim al-muʼminīn. Ṣallá Allāh Rabbunā ʻalá al-nūr al-mubīn, Aḥmad al-Muṣṭafá Sayyid al-Mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Subḥāna Rabbika Rabbi al-ʻIzzati ʻammā yaṣifūn, wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

record.title: 880-02 Mukhtaṣar Sharḥ Talkhīṣ al-Miftāḥ. Al-Fann al-awwal : manuscript / Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar al-Taftāzānī.
record.note: Title from the printed versions.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... wa-ammā al-jazāʼ fa-li-anna ḥuṣūlahu muʻallaq ʻalá ḥuṣūl al-sharṭ, wa-yamtaniʻ taʻlīq ḥuṣūl al-ḥāṣil al-thābit ʻalá ḥuṣūl mā yaḥṣal fī al-mustaqbal, wa-lā yukhālaf dhālika lafẓan illā li-nuktah, li-imtināʻ mukhālafat muqtaḍá al-ẓāhir min ghayr fāʼidah. Wa-qawluhu lafẓan ishārah ilá anna al-jumlatayn, wa-in juʻilat kiltāhumā aw iḥdāhumā ismīyah aw fiʻlīyah māḍawīyah fa-al-maʻná ʻalá al-istiqbāl ..."
Secundo folio: al-sharṭ ʻalá intifāʼ al-ḥukm innamā huwa.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 15.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In greenish brown leather; cover tooled with geometric design (in 17 numbered quires).

In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the original text in red; extensive commentaries on the margins and interlinear; some wormholes without loss of text; text within double red frame; catchwords.

Author's colophon: "Khatam Allāh lanā bi-al-ḥusná, wa-yassara lanā al-fawz bi-al-dhukhr al-asná, bi-jāh Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-akramīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."
