Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap.
In fair large clear naskh script, in black ink, on thick paper; catchwords.
On the label pasted to the front cover: "al-Juzw al-khāmis min Qiṣṣat [... ... ...] Qamar al-Zamān wa-Shams al-Nahār. ʻAd[ad] 5."
On folio 1a (in red): "Qamar Zamān wa-Shams al-Nahār."

On folio 1a: Statements for two readers, as follows: 1. "Qad naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu al-faqīr ʻAlī al-Qurabī, ʻafā ʻanhu Rabbuhu al-Qadīr, fī ghurrat Ramaẓān, khams wa-ʻishrūn, sanat thalāthah wa-thalāth miʼah baʻda al-alf [27 June 1886]." 2. "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn Maḥmūd Nāṣir al-Nabājānī, ghufira la-hu wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Rabīʻ Awwal 15, sanat 1305 [1 December 1887]."

On folio 1b: Statements for three readers, as follows: 1. "318 [1318], naẓara fīhi Ḥasan ibn Khālid Ḥabīb al-Karakūzātī, fī Rabīʻ Thānī 2 [31 July 1900]." 2. "Wa-naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-Karīm, al-Sayyid Ḥusayn Afandī al-ʻAlamī wa-waladuhu Amīn. M M M. Wa-qad naẓarnā fī al-kutub alladhī qablahum al-arbaʻah. ʻAdad 4. M." " 3. "Naẓara fīhi Muḥyī al-Dīn Diyāb."

At the head of the back of the end leaf: Statements for a reader, as follows: 1. (in pencil): "Qad naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu al-ḥaqīr al-faqīr, al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, Muḥammad Ṣabrī Abū al-Dhahab, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn." 2. "Wa-qad naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu al-ḥaqīr al-faqīr, al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-Qadīr, Muḥammad Ṣabrī Abū al-Dhahab, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidihi, wa-ilá jamīʻ al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... fa-lammā samiʻat al-ʻajūz kalāmahā, ʻalimat bi-ʻayn al-firāsah annahā ʻāshiqah, fa-hazzat raʼsahā wa-iltafatat ilá al-Malikah Shams, wa-qālat la-hā: Yā Sayyidatī, an mā aḥad ʻalá wajh al-arḍ yuḥibbuki mithlī, fa-lā tukhfī ʻannī amraki, wa-akhbirīnī bi-maknūn sirriki, wa-lā yukhfī ʻannī shayʼ, wa-aʻlimīnī bi-ḥājatiki, fa-anā khāyifah lā yakūn ..."

record.title: 880-01 Badr al-ḥulal wa-Nūr al-Durar : manuscript.
record.note: 1. Title of "Badr al-Ḥulal wa-Nūr al-Durar" supplied by Hartford Seminary.
2. Title of "Qiṣṣat al-ʻuṣfūr wa-al-fakhkh wa-al-ṣayyād" from the colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of "Badr al-Ḥulal wa-Nūr al-Durar": The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... bi-janb qaṣr al-Malik al-aḥmar wa-qarīb minhu, bi-sharṭ an yusāʻidanā al-Malik ʻalayhi, thumma an natajahhaza fī ʻimāratihi, an yakūna mā fī maʻmūr al-arḍ aḥsan minhu wa-lā aʻjab min ḥarakātih, thumma nuṣawwir fīhi ḥāl al-ṣabīyah kayfa kānat ḥamāmah, wa-kayfa taʼallafat bi-dhālik ..."
Secundo folio of "Badr al-Ḥulal wa-Nūr al-Durar": wa-fī al-īwān al-rābiʻ.

Incipit of "Qiṣṣat al-ʻuṣfūr wa-al-fakhkh wa-al-ṣayyād": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ḥukiya, wa-Allāh aʻlam fī ghaybihi wa-aḥkam, fīmā maḍá wa-taqaddam wa-salaf, min aḥādīth al-umam, annahu kāna fī qadīm al-zamān wa-sālif al-ʻaṣr wa-al-awān, rajul faqīr baṭṭāl, lā shughl wa-lā ʻamal, ilá yawm min baʻḍ al-ayyām qālat la-hu zawjatuhu: Yā rujjāl qūm iʻmal lak shaghlah aw kār, bassak baṭṭāl balā shughl qāʻid, qūm iʻmal lak ḥarakah ..."
Secundo folio of "Qiṣṣat al-ʻuṣfūr wa-al-fakhkh wa-al-ṣayyād": wa-qāl al-salām ʻalayka ayyuhā al-fakhkh.
11 x 16 cm; written surface: 8 x 13 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard cover; brown leather on spine.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some leaves seem to be missing between folios 40 and 41; catchwords.

On the label pasted to the front cover: Three statements, as follows: 1. "Wa-al-thālith min Qiṣṣ[at]. Min kutub al-Sayyid Muḥammad [...] al-Jundī al-Nāṣirī al-ʻAnzī [?]." 2. "Badr al-Ḥulal wa-yalīhā Qiṣṣat al-ʻuṣfūr wa-al-fakhkh. 3." 3. "Numrah 3. Min kutub Ṣubḥī al-Ḥalabī fī jiwār al-Umawī."
On the right margin of folio 40b: A reader's statement: "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu al-faqīr Riḍā ibn [... ...] min maḥallat [...] 24 Ṣafar [?] 216 (?)]."

The text of "Badr al-Ḥulal wa-Nūr al-Durar" ends with: "... wa-lam yazālū sāyir bi-al-mawākib ilá an dakhalū al-balad bi-al-mawākib, wa-Badr al-Ḥulal yubaddir al-amwāl ʻalá al-ʻālam, wa-al-khalāyiq tadʻū la-hu bi-ṭūl al-ʻumr, ilá an waṣalū ilá al-sarāyā, fa-nazalū ʻan ẓuhūr al-khayl, fa-rafaʻat al-jawāshīsh adyālahum bi-al-jawākīn al-dhahab, wa-hum yaqūlū: Lā taʻjab lil-mulk, al-mulk lil-Wāḥid al-Qahhār. Wa-dakhala wa-waladahu al-qaṣr wa-jalasū bi-al-hanā wa-al-surūr, ilá an atāhum hādim al-ladhdhāt, wa-mufarriq al-jamʻāt, wa-muʻammir al-qubūr, wa-mukharrib al-quṣūr."

Colophon of "Badr al-Ḥulal wa-Nūr al-Durar": "ʻAlá yad aḍʻaf al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim ilá bāb Rabb al-ʻIbād, al-ʻabd al-faqīr, al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, Muḥammad Shuʻayb ibn al-Sayyid Ḥusayn ibn al-Sayyid Ḥusayn ibn al-Sayyid Nāṣir al-Dīn ibn al-Sayyid Muḥammad al-Jundī al-Nāṣirī al-Maʻarrawī, al-qāṭin bi-Dimashq al-maḥmīyah, ṣānahā Rabb al-Barīyah, wa-dhālika fī ʻashrat ayyām khalāt [khalat], min shahr Shawwāl al-mubārak, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat al-tisʻah wa-sabʻūn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, min Hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon of "Badr al-Ḥulal wa-Nūr al-Durar": "By the hand of the weakest of the servants and their neediest to the gate of the Lord of the Servants, the poor servant, who admits his sin and insufficiency, Muḥammad Shuʻayb ibn al-Sayyid Ḥusayn ibn al-Sayyid Ḥusayn ibn al-Sayyid Nāṣir al-Dīn ibn al-Sayyid Muḥammad al-Jundī al-Nāṣirī al-Maʻarrawī, who resides in protected Damascus, may it be preserved by the Lord of Creation, ten days having passed from the blessed month of Shawwāl, of the year 1279 of the Hijrah of Him to whom belongs glory and honor [31 March 1863]. It is completed. It is completed. It is completed."

Colophon of "Qiṣṣat al-ʻuṣfūr wa-al-fakhkh wa-al-ṣayyād (there seems to be a gap between folios 40 and 41; the beginning of the colophon is missing, it starts with": "... min Qiṣṣat al-ʻuṣfūr wa-al-fakhkh wa-al-ṣayyād. Wa-mā katabnā wa-naqalnā illā mā wajadnāhu fī al-awrāq. Wa-nastaghfiru Allāh taʻālá min al-ziyādah wa-al-nuqṣān wa-ʻatharāt al-lisān. Wa-ghafara Allāh li-kātibihā, wa-nāqilihā, wa-qāriʼihā, wa-sāmiʻihā, wa-ilá kull al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of "Qiṣṣat al-ʻuṣfūr wa-al-fakhkh wa-al-ṣayyād": "... of the Story of th sparrow, the snare, and the hunter. We did not record except what we found in the leaflets. We seek the help of God Almighty from increase or decrease, and from the slip of the tongue. May God forgive its author, its copyist, its reader, him who listens to it, and all Muslims. Amen. Amen. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-01 Badr al-Ḥulal wa-Nūr al-Durar : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... ḥāluhu, fa-baynamā huwa dākhil fī dihlīz al-qaṣr, idh yasmaʻ waladahu yabkī, wa-yadhkuru ṣifatahā allatī fī al-dībājah, wa-huwa qāyim ʻalá ḥaylih, wa-yaḍummu al-dībājah wa-yunshidu: Yā ṣūrata al-fuʼādī sāqat li-tukhbiranā [?] // wa-aḥramat muqlatī min nawmihā al-wasanā. Yā laytanī lam akun shāhadtu taʼakhkhurahā // wa-lam yakun dhāka al-ʻaqlu marra binā ..."
Secundo folio: minhu. Qāla al-rāwī.
16 x 23 cm; written surface: 10 x 17 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; brown leather on spine.
In large good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; catchwords.
Includes a slip with notes in English about the manuscript.
On the labels pasted to the front cover: "Badr al-Ḥulal. 2. Min kutub Luṭf [...]." "Min kutub Ṣubḥī al-Ḥalabī fī jiwār al-Umawī."
On the upper left margin of folio 1a: "Badr al-Ḥulal. Badr al-Ḥulal. ʻAdad 2."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-khashītu yā ʻajūz annanī in jaziʻtu wa-lam aṣbir yaqaʻ lī kamā waqaʻa li-baʻḍihim, sujina marratan wāḥidah, fa-arsala ilá baʻḍ aṣdāqihi yashkū ilayhi ḥālahu, fa-arsala ilayhi ṣadīquhu yaqūlu la-hu: Iṣbir, wa-qūl al-ḥamdu lillāh, fa-ṣaʻuba ʻalayhi hādhā al-jawāb, wa-qāl: al-Ḥamdu lillāh taʻālá, iqāmah fī al-sijn ithnay ʻashar sanah, fa-arsala ilá ṣadīqihi ..."

record.title: 880-03 al-Muḥarrar : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn Muḥammad al-Rāfiʻī.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir. Subḥānuka Allāhumma, wa-bi-ḥammdika usabbiḥuka bi-kibriyāʼika wa-iʻlāʼika, wa-aḥmaduka ʻalá wufūr naʻmāʼika wa-ālāʼika, wa-uṣallī ʻalá Muḥammad alladhī iṣṭafaytahu min anbiyāʼika wa-akhdamtahu al-malāʼikah, wa-asʼaluka an tajʻlanī maʻa alladhīna anʻamta ʻalayhim, min al-nabīyīn wa-al-ṣiddiqīn wa-al-shuhadāʼ wa-al-ṣāliḥīn, wa-ḥasuna ulāʼika [rafīqan], wa-astwfiquka limā hamamtu bi-hi min naẓm mukhtaṣar fī al-aḥkām, muḥarrar ʻan al-ḥashw wa-al-taṭwīl ... wa-arghabu ilayka fī tashīl hādhā al-muḥarrar ʻalá muḥaṣṣilīhi bi-faḍlika al-ʻaẓīm, wa-fī taqabbulihi minnī. Innaka anta al-samīʻ al-ʻalīm ..."
Secundo folio: al-sābiq minhumā nuẓir fīmā qablihimā.
9 x 21.7 cm; written surface: 5.5 x 18.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with central medallion.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; at the head of folio 1b a decoration in blue and gold; numerous commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On the flyleaf: A statement by a reader (or owner): "Tuḥfat al-anām fī Mukhtaṣar ʻUmdat al-aḥkām li-Shaykh Walī Allāh al-Dihlawī, aṣluhu lil-Ghazzālī."
On folio 1a: "Safīnah. Waqf."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with "Bāb al-Kitābah" (on slaves buying themselves from their masters by paying in installments), as follows: "... wa-al-ḥaqq fī al-walad lahā aw lil-sayyid, fīhi qawlān, ashbahuhumā al-thānī, wa-yanbanī ʻalá al-qawlayn anna al-qīmah li-man takūn idhā qutila al-walad, wa-al-aṣaḥḥ anna arsh al-jināyah ʻalayhi, wa-kasbuhu wa-al-mahr yunfaqu minhumā ʻalayhi, wa-mā faḍula yūqafu, fa-in ʻutiqa al-walad fa-huwa la-hu, wa-in ruqqa li-ʻajz al-umm fa-huwa lil-sayyid. Lā yuʻtaqu shayʼ min al-mukātab bi-adāʼ baʻḍ al-nujūm, wa-innamā yataʻallaqu ʻitquhu bi-adāʼ ākhirihā, fa-in māt wa-qad baqiya ʻalayhi shayʼ ..."

record.title: Collection of three treatises : manuscript.
record.note: 1. Title of "Nūr al-qulūb li-nayl al-maṭlūb" from folio 1a.
2. Title of "al-Muqaddimah al-Jazarīyah fī al-tajwīd" from reference sources.
3. Title of "Ṣuḥuf Ibrāhīm wa-Mūsá" supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Nūr al-qulūb li-nayl al-maṭlūb": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī nawwara qulūb aḥibbāʼihi al-ʻārifīn, wa-jaʻalahā maḥallan lil-hidāyah wa-al-fayḍ wa-al-yaqīn, wa-iṣṭafā man shāʼa min ʻibādihi lil-qiyām bi-dīnihi al-matīn, wa-kāna, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá maʻahum, kamā qāla fī muḥkam al-āyāt wa-al-dhikr al-mubīn: 'Mā yakūnu min najwá thalāthah illā huwa rābiʻuhum wa-lā khamsah illā huwa sādisuhum wa-lā adná min dhālika wa-lā akthar illā huwa maʻahum' bi-al-naṣr wa-al-tawfīq ilá ḥiṣnihi al-ḥaṣīn ..."
1. Secundo folio of "Nūr al-qulūb li-nayl al-maṭlūb": al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam.

2. Incipit of "al-Muqaddimah al-Jazarīyah fī al-tajwīd": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yaqūlu rājī ʻafwa Rabbin sāmiʻi // Muḥammadu ibnu al-Jazarīyi al-Shāfiʻī. al-Ḥamdu lillāhi wa-ṣallá Allāhu // ʻalá Nabīyihi wa-Muṣṭafāhi Muḥammadi. Wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbiihi wa-muqriʼi al- // Qurʼāni maʻ muḥibbihi. Wa-baʻdu innā hādhihi muqaddimah // fīmā ʻalá qāriʼihi an yaʻlamah. Idh wājibun ʻalayhumu muḥattamau // qabla al-shurūʻi awwalan an yaʻlamū ..."
2. Secundo folio of "al-Muqaddimah al-Jazarīyah fī al-tajwīd": Wa-al-ṭāʼi wa-al-dāli wa-tā minhu wa-min.

3. Incipit of "Ṣuḥuf Ibrāhīm wa-Mūsá": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. al-Ṣaḥīfah al-ūlá. Yaqūlu Allāh, tabāraka wa-taʻālá: Shahidtu ʻalá nafsī li-nafsī an lā ilāha illā anā waḥdī, lā sharīka lī, Muḥammad ʻabdī wa-rasūlī, fa-man lam yarḍa bi-qaḍāʼī, wa-lam yaṣbir ʻalá balāʼī, wa-lam yashkur ʻalá naʻmāʼī, wa-lam yaqnaʻ bi-ʻaṭāʼī. fa-li-yaʻbud rabban siwāy ..."
3. Secundo folio of "Ṣuḥuf Ibrāhīm wa-Mūsá": hadama kaʻbatī bi-yadayh.
14.5 x 20 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 14 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 14 unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Nūr al-qulūb li-nayl al-maṭlūb, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-ḥabr al-fahhāmah, al-Shaykh Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad, Sayyidī al-Majdalī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi dunyā wa-ukhrá, wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam ajmaʻīn."

At the upper left corner of folio 1a: A reader's statement: "Ṭālaʻa fī hādhā al-kitāb al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi [...] ʻUmar al-Sharīf al-Ḥusaynī, wa-dhālika fī sanat iḥdá wa-khamsīn wa-alf [1641/1642]."

To the left of the colophon (folio 118a): "Kitāb al-Jazarīyah, lil-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-fahhāmah al-ʻumdah, al-Shaykh Muḥammad ibn al-Jazarī al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-al-raḥmah [...] wa-al-ruḍwān. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

1. The text of "Nūr al-qulūb li-nayl al-maṭlūb" ends with: "Wa-hādhā mā yassarahu al-Karīm al-Mannān min jamʻ hādhihi al-fawāʼid wa-al-ghurar al-ḥisān, wa-raḥima imraʼan raʼá ʻayban fa-saddah, aw khalalan fa-aṣlaḥah. Wa-nafaʻa Allāh al-Karīm bi-hi man qaraʼah, aw katabah, aw naẓara fīhi, aw waqafa ʻalayhi. Wa-khatama bi-al-ṣāliḥāt aʻmālanā, wa-satara zalalanā, wa-saddada āmālanā, wa-ghafara lanā wa-li-wālidayanā, wa-li-mashāyikhinā, wa-li-ikhwāninā fī Allāh taʻālá, wa-li-aḥbābinā, wa-li-aṣḥābinā, wa-li-jīrāninā, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Innahu ʻalá mā yashāʼu qadīr, wa-bi-ʻibādihi laṭīfun khabīr. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-ṭāhirīn, wa-ṣaḥābatihi ajmaʻīn."

1. Colophon of "Nūr al-qulūb li-nayl al-maṭlūb": "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taʼlīfihi ṣabīḥata yawm al-Sabt, yawm ʻĀshūrāʼ, sanat thalāthīn baʻda al-alf. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taʻlīq hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah yawm al-Aḥad, li-ithnay ʻashar yawman maḍat min shahr Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, sanat ithnayn wa-thalāthīn baʻda al-alf, aḥsana Allāh khitāmahā, wa-mā baʻdahā bi-khayr, ʻalá yad muʼllifihā, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-mashāyikhihi, wa-li-ikhwānihi, wa-li-jīrānihi, wa-li-aḥbābihi, wa-li-man naẓara fīhi, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

1. Translation of the colophon of "Nūr al-qulūb li-nayl al-maṭlūb: "It was completed on Saturday morning, the ʻĀshūraʼ day [tenth of Muḥarram], of the year 1030 [of the Hijrah = 5 December 1620]. This blessed copy was completed, by the hand of its author, on Sunday, twelve days having passed from the month of Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, of the year 1032 [of the Hijrah = 13 February 1623], may God end it, and what comes after it, favorably. May God forgive him [the author], his parents, his shaykhs, his brethren, his neighbors, his friends, he who looks into it, and all Muslims. Amen."

2. The text of "al-Muqaddimah al-Jazarīyah fī al-tajwīd" ends with: "... Wa-qad taqaḍḍá naẓmiya al-Muqaddimah // minnī li-qāriʼi al-Qurʼān taqdimah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh lahā khitāmu // thumma al-ṣalātu baʻdu wa-al-salāmu. ʻAlá al-Nabīyi al-Muṣṭafá wa-ālihi // wa-muḥibbihi wa-tābiʻ min wālihi [minwālihi]."

2. Colophon of "al-Muqaddimah al-Jazarīyah fī al-tajwīd": "Tammat al-nuskhah bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

2. Translation of the colophon of "al-Muqaddimah al-Jazarīyah fī al-tajwīd": "The blessed copy was completed by the praise of God and His help. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May God pray on owr Master Muḥammad, his family, and companions and grant them abundant peace until Judgement Day. Amen. Amen. Amen. Amen. Amen. Amen."

3. Colophon of "Ṣuḥuf Ibrāhīm wa-Mūsá": No colophon. Text ends abruptly with "al-Ṣaḥīfah al-ḥādiyah wa-al-thalāthīn" (Tablet 31) as follows: "... Ayyuhā al-nās man qaṣadanaī ʻarafanī, wa-man ʻarafanī arādanī, wa-man arādanī ṭalabanī, wa-man ṭalabanī wajadanī, wa-man wajadanī dhakaranī wa-lam yansānī, wa-man dhakaranī wa-lam yansānī dhakartuhu wa-lam ansāhu. Yā Ibna Ādam: Innaka lā tukhliṣu ʻamalaka ḥattá tadhūqa mawtāt arbaʻah: Mawtan aḥmar, wa-mawtan abyaḍ, wa-mawtan aṣfar, wa-mawtan aswad. Fa-ammā al-mawt al-aḥmar fa-iḥtimāl al-jazāʼ ..."

record.title: 880-02 Masʼalat al-dābbah : manuscript / Aḥmad Budayr al-ʻAzīzī al-Shāfiʻī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá tawfīqihi wa-inʻāmihi, wa-mazāyā faḍlihi wa-ilhāmih ... Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ... Aḥmad Budayr ibn Aḥmad ibn Sālim al-ʻAzīzī baladá, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, al-Aḥmadī ṭarīqatan: Qad iṭṭalaʻtu ʻalá jawāb suʼāl mansūb ilá al-Imām ... al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-ʻArūsī, fa-taʻajjabtu min ṣudūr hādhā al-jawāb minhu, alladhī minhu al-ṣawāb ʻadīm, wa-karihtu nisbatahu ilá hādhā al-Imām al-ʻaẓīm, limā fīhi min al-khaṭaʼ al-ṣarīḥ al-dhamīm ... wa-murād al-sāʼil bi-dhālik alladhī lā yakhfá suʼāluhu wa-iltimāsuhu li-hādhā al-jawāb min al-dasāʼis wa-al-tadlīs ʻalá man ʻarafa al-ḥāl min dhawī al-albāb ..."
Secundo folio: lā lawma ʻalayhi innamā yastaḥiqqu al-lawm.
16.5 x 2.5 cm; written surface: 13 x 18.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on paper; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Risālah tusammá bi-Masʼalat al-dābbah, li-Mawlānā al-ʻumdah al-fāḍil, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-Shaykh Aḥmad Budayr al-ʻAzīzī al-Shāfiʻī al-Aḥmadī, ʻufiya ʻanh bi-mannihi. Āmīn."

At the end of the colophon: An appology and request by the copyist, in poetry and prose, that readers turn a blind eye to his mistakes, as follows: "In tajid ʻayban fa-sudda al-khalalā // tabqá ʻinda Allāhi fī ʻayn al-malā. <wa-> Lā tuʻāyir man fīhi ʻaybun // <wa-> qad jalla man lā fīhi ʻaybun wa-ʻalā. Saʼaltuka billāh yā qāriʼa khaṭṭī // in wajadta al-ʻayba ghaṭṭī. Fa-inna ibna Ādama ʻaqluhu mā zāla yukhṭī. Saʼaltuka billāh yā qāriʼ hādhā al-kitāb tadʻū lī yahūnu ʻalayya al-ḥisāb." After it: Two ownership statements, as follows: "Hādhā milk al-faqīr Muḥammad ʻAbd Rabb al-Nabbī al-Badrāwī." "Wa-milkuhā lil-Shaykh al-Bukhārī."

Colophon: "Tammat. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihā yawm al-Aḥad al-mubārak, arbaʻah wa-ʻishrūn yawman maḍat min shahr Shawwāl, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat khamsūn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, baʻda al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr ilá Allāh al-Ghanī, Ṣāliḥ al-Badrāwī al-Shāfiʻī [ʻufiya] ʻanhu bi-mannihi."

Translation of the colophon: "It is completed. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, his family, and his companions, and grant them peace. The copy was completed on blessed Sunday, twenty-four days having passed from the month of Shawwāl, of the year 1250 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and peace be upon him, by the hand of its copyist the poor to the Affluent God, Ṣāliḥ al-Badrāwī al-Shāfiʻī, may he [be forgiven] by His grace."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Miʻrāj al-Nabī : manuscript / Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad al-Qalyūbī.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: Folios 1-17 are missing. Text (folios 18-67) begins as follows: "... fī Ghār Ḥirá qabla al-isrāʼ, wa-inkāruhā taʻannut, li-annahā mimmā yumkinu al-wuṣūl ilayhā, wa-ḥaythu thabatat hādhihi fī al-arḍ lazam thubūt allatī fī al-samāʼ, wa-qīl ḍamīr raʼāh rājiʻ ilá Allāh, ay, raʼá Muḥammad Rabbahu marrah ukhrá qabla hādhihi, wa-huwa ghayr mustaqīm, idh lam yarid fīhā dalīl, wa-al-aḥkām lā tathbutu bi-al-iḥtimāl, wa-ʻalayhi, fa-qīla ruʼyatuhu fīhimā bi-al-baṣar, wa-qīla al-awlá bi-al-qalb, thumma ashār ilá maḥall ruʼyat al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, li-Jibrīl fī al-samāʼ bi-qawlihi ʻinda ..."
Secundo folio: al-Burāq Mīkāyīl fa-hādhā mufassir
15 x 21 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16 cm; 24 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with central medallion.

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some of the phrases of the original "Miʻrāj" and markings in red; some phrases underlined; some commentaries and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
At the back of the flyleaf: "Miʻrāj" and "miraj"
On the lower right corner of folio 48b: A collation statement, as follows: "Balagha ʻalá khaṭṭ muʼallifihi."

Colophon: "Najazat kitābat hādhā 'al-Miʻrāj' fī yawm al-Aḥad, khāmis shahr Rajab al-fard, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat ithnayn wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼah baʻda alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Katabahu bi-yadihi al-fāniyah li-nafsihi al-faqīr ʻAlī Shammākh ibn ʻAlī Shammākh al-Ṭanūlī [?], ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-man qaraʼa fīhi, wa-li-man daʻā lahum bi-al-maghfirah. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-sallam taslīman kathīran. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "The writing of this 'Miʻrāj' was completed on Sunday, the fifth of the unique month of Rajab, of the year 1122 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and peace be upon Him. Copied by the perishing hand, of the poor ʻAlī Shammākh ibn ʻAlī Shammākh al-Ṭanūlī [?], for himself, may God forgive him, his parents, he who reads it, and those who invoke forgiveness for them. Amen. Amen. Amen. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, and on his family, and grant them abundant peace. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 al-Maḥāmid al-thamāniyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Idrīs.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Allāhumma ṣalli wa-sallim wa-bārik ʻalá Mawlānā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi fī kull lamḥah wa-nafas, ʻadad mā wasiʻahu ʻilm Allāh. Allāhumma innī uqaddimu ilayka bayna yaday kull nafas wa-lamḥah wa-ṭarfah yaṭrifu bi-hā ahl al-samāwāt wa-al-arḍ, wa-kull shayʼ huwa fī ʻilmika, kāʼin aw qad kān, uqaddimu ilayka bayna yaday dhālika kullih ..."
Secundo folio: al-ḥamdu ḥamdan dāʼiman kathīran.
13 x 17 cm; written surface: 6.7 x 10.5 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on modern ledger paper; text fully vocalized; commentaries between the inner and outer frames; pages numbered in East Arabic (Indian numerals) 1-134; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā al-Ḥizb al-musammá bi-al-Maḥāmid al-thamāniyah, wa-bi-hāmishihi, huwa, wa-mā baʻdahu min al-aḥzāb, al-risālah al-musammāh bi-al-Qawāʻid, wa-al-risālah al-musammāh bi-al-Asās, wa-al-kitāb al-musammá bi-Rūḥ al-Sunnah. Jamīʻ dhālik li-Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā, quṭb zamānihi, wa-farīd ʻaṣrihi wa-awānih, Shaykhinā wa-Ustādhinā, Aḥmad ibn Idrīs, nafaʻa Allāh al-Muslimīn bi-hi wa-bi-ʻulūmihi. Āmīn. Wa-raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-arḍāhu, wa-jaʻala al-Jannah munqalabahu wa-mathwāhu. Āmīn. Wa-ayḍan kitāb Kīmiyāʼ al-yaqīn, wa-khilāfuh."

Colophon: "Wa-qad tamma naql hādhihi al-awrād al-jalīlah al-Idrīsīyah min al-nuskhah al-maṭbūʻah bi-Darb al-Unsīyah, bi-Miṣr al-Qāhirah al-Muʻizzīyah, Idārat al-rājī min Allāh al-mazīd, Ḥaḍrat al-Shaykh Muḥammad Abī Zayd, bi-qalam al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá ʻAbd al-Khāliq Ḥaqqī, fī awākhir shahr Rajab al-muḥarram, sanat arbaʻ wa-thalāthimiʼah wa-alf, min Hijrat Sayyidinā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ʻalá ālihi, wa-aṣḥābihi, wa-azwājihi, wa-sharrafa wa-karram, bi-taṣḥīḥ al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, ʻAlī Abī al-Nūr al-Ḥarbī al-Sakandarī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu. Āmīn. M."

Translation of the colophon: "These glorious Idrīsīyah 'awrāds' were transcribed from the copy which was printed at Darb al-Unsīyah, in Miṣr al-Qāhirah al-Muʻizzīyah, under the management of the servant who aspires for the increase from God, Ḥaḍrat al-Shaykh Muḥammad Abī Zayd, by the pen of the poor to God Almighty, ʻAbd al-Khāliq Ḥaqqī, at the end of the sacred month of Rajab, of the year 1304 of the Hijrah [24 April 1887] of our Master Muḥammad, may God pray on him and grant him peace, likewise his family, his companions, and his wives, may He honor and glorify them. Corrected by the servant, poor to God Almighty, ʻAlī Abī al-Nūr al-Ḥarbī al-Sakandarī, may God forgive him. Āmen. M."

record.title: Collection of three Arabic folktales : manuscript.
record.note: 1. Title of "Qiṣṣat Tamīm al-Dārī" from folio 1b.
2. Title of "Ḥikāyat al-ṣayyād wa-al-qumqum" from folio 19a.
3. Title of "Qiṣṣat al-Miqdād ibn al-Aswad" from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Qiṣṣat Tamīm al-Dārī": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-mimmā rawathu al-nāqilūn wa-ahl al-siyar al-māḍiyūn, wa-al-akhbār min al-thiqah al-akhyār, wa-al-atqiyāʼ al-abrār, wa-al-mustaʻān bi-al-Raḥmān, wa-al-tawfīq min al-Malik al-Dayyān. ʻAn ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻAbbās, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, qāl: Kunnā fī ayyām ʻUmar ibn al-Khaṭṭāb, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, wa-huwa yawmidhin al-khalīfah, wa-qad khalā bi-al-nās, wa-huwa jālis fī al-miḥrāb, wa-al-nās ḥawlahu, wa-hum yatadhākarūn ʻahd Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam ..."
1. Secundo folio of "Qiṣṣat Tamīm al-Dārī": wa-al-Anṣār fa-raddū ʻalayhā al-salām.

2. Incipit of "Ḥikāyat al-ṣayyād wa-al-qumqum": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Dhukira, wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-ghaybihi wa-aḥkam, fīmā maḍá wa-taqaddama wa-salaf, min aḥādīth al-umam, fī sālif al-zamān wa-māḍī al-ʻaṣr wa-al-awān, annahu kāna rajul ṣayyād, wa-kāna shaykhan kabīran, wa-kāna la-hu zawjah wa-thalāth banāt, wa-kān rajul faqīr lā yamliku shayʼan min suḥt al-dunyā, wa-kān ṣanʻatuhu ṣayyād lil-samak, wa-huwa faqīr lā yamliku qūt yawm bi-yawm ..."
2. Secundo folio of "Ḥikāyat al-ṣayyād wa-al-qumqum": ramá dhālika al-ḥimār wa-nafaḍa shabakatahu.

3. Incipit of "Qiṣṣat al-Miqdād ibn al-Aswad": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Qāla al-rawī [al-rāwī] ʻalá annahu kāna fī zamān al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, qabilat [qabīlat] ʻArab, yuqālu lahā Banī Kindah, wa-kāna sayyiduhum yuqālu la-hu Jābir al-Ḍaḥḥāk, wa-kāna kathīr al-māl wa-al-rizq wa-al-khayl wa-al-jimāl, wa-kānat la-hu bint kaʼannahā quḍub al-khuzrān, subḥāna khāliqahā min māʼ mahīn, wa-jaʻalahā fitnatan lil-nāẓirīn ..."
Secundo folio of "Qiṣṣat al-Miqdād ibn al-Aswad": rāghibīn fa-qālat la-hu ijʻalī.
14.5 x 19.5 cm; written surface: varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: In brown leather. Binding deteriorated, exposing manuscript waste.
In fair naskh script (in different hands), in black ink, on white paper; some texts within double red frames; catchwords.
Inside the front cover: Four names of (readers/owners): Āminah bint Bakrī al-Sawwāḥ. Khalīl ibn Ilyās al-Maʻarrāwī. Saʻīd al-Mubayyiḍ. ʻAlī al-Fākihānī.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā al-kitāb fīhi Ḥikāyat al-ṣayyād wa-al-qumqum. Wa-hādhā al-kitāb fīhi Ḥikāyat Tamīm al-Dārī, wa-Qiṣṣat al-Miqdād ibn al-Aswad. Nathr [... Kitāb ... ... ... ]. A reader's statement dated Rabīʻ al-Thānī, 1236, as follows: "Naẓara fī hādhā al-kitāb al-faqīr al-sayyid Muḥyī al-Dīn ibn al-marḥūm al-Sayyid Aḥmad al-Ḥallāq, fī Rabīʻ al-Thānī, sanat 1236 [January/February 1821] ...". And two names: "ʻAlī al-Taysīr." "Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Muḥammad Aʻrābī ibn ʻUrābī ibn Maḥmūd Aʻrābī."
At the head of folio 1b: A decorative semicircle in red and black, inscribed with: "Wa-hādhihi ʻujbah. Hādhā Qiṣṣat Tamīm al-Dārī".
Between folios 13 and 14: An insert with a list of names and calculations.
Folios 17b-18a are blank.

On folio 18b: Four readers' statements, as follows: 1. "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-muʻtarif fī al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr Muṣṭafá ibn al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Ghazzī, Amīn al-Fatwā. Ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-kull al-Muslimīn. Yā Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Allāh laṭīf fī ʻibādihi. Ṣadaqa Allāh al-ʻAẓīm." 2. "Naẓara fīhi ʻAbd al-Laṭīf al-Ranjajī." 3. "Naẓara fīhi al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-muqirr bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, al-rajī [al-rājī] ʻafwa Rabbihi al-Karīm, Muḥammad Saʻīd ibn al-Sayyid Muḥammad al-Ṣalāḥī, fī 7 Rabīʻ Thānī, sanat 1236 [12 January 1821]." 4. "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala rumūzahu wa-maʻāniyahu al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhunūb wa-al-taqṣīr, al-Ḥājj Bakrī ibn al-Ḥājj Muḥammad, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidihi, wa-li-kull al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Sanat 1237, fī Jumād al-Thāniyah, khalat [khalat] liyyām [li-ayyām] 15 [9 March 1822]."
On folio 19a: "Hādhihi Ḥikāyat al-ṣayyād wa-al-qumqum [... ... ...]." And an incantation/spell "li-ḥall al-maʻqūd" (untying the bewithed).
On folio 27b: "Hādhihi Qiṣṣat al-Miqdād. Nuẓima bi-al-tamām wa-al-kamāl. M."

On folio 56b: Three readers' statements, as follows: 1. "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-Ghanī, al-Sayyid ʻAbbūd ibn al-Ḥājj ʻUbayd al-Ṭammāʻ, ghafara Allāh la-hū wa-lī wālidayhi, wa-lī jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn." 2. "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, ʻazza wa-jall, al-mudhnib ilá Mawlāhi al-Ghanī, al-Ḥājj ʻUmar ibn Qarā Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥājj Ibrāhīm ibn al-Ḥājj Muḥammad ibn al-Falāḥ al-Ḥalabī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-ilá wālidayhi [... ...] ilá ʻafwihi. Ḥurrira fī 22 R [Rajab (?)], sanat 1236 [25 April 1821]." 3. "Qad ṭālaʻahu al-ʻabd al-faqīr, al-muqirr bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-Karīm, Muḥammad Saʻīd ibn Muḥammad al-Ṣalāḥī, fī 7 Rabīʻ Thānī, sanat 1236 [12 January 1821]."

Inside the back cover: A reader's statement, as follows: "Naẓara fī hādhā al-kitāb Ḥusayn Abū ʻAbbās [ibn (?)] al-marḥūm ʻArābī al-Qafadār al-Khayyāṭ [... ...] wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-kull al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Nahār thalāthah, 2 J Thānī, sanat 1240 [23 January 1825]."

1. Colophon of "Qiṣṣat Tamīm al-Dārī": "Wa-hādhā mā intahá ilaynā min Qiṣṣat Tamīm ibn Ḥabīb al-Anṣārī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-qiṣṣah al-mubārakah nahār al-Arbaʻah, thālith ʻasharī Jumādá al-Thānī, sanat khamsah wa-tisʻīn wa-miʼah wa-alf, 1195. M. Nammaqahā faqīr ʻafw Rabbihi al-Qawī, Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-ʻAdwadkī al-ʻAdwī al-ʻUmarī, ghafara Allāh lī wa-li-wālidayya, wa-li-man naẓara fī hādhā al-kitāb, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of "Qiṣṣat Tamīm al-Dārī": "This is what has reached us of the Story of Tamīm ibn Ḥabīb al-Anṣārī, may God be pleased with him. The copy of this blessed story was completed on Wednesday, 13 Jumādá al-Thānī, of the year 1195 [of the Hijrah = 6 June 1781], by the poor to the forgiveness of his Almighty Lord, Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-ʻAdwadkī al-ʻAdwī al-ʻUmarī, may God forgive me, my parents, whoever looks into this book, and all Muslims. Amen."
2. Colophon of "Ḥikāyat al-ṣayyād wa-al-qumqum": "Wa-hādhā mā intahá ilaynā min 'Ḥikāyat al-ṣād [al-ṣayyād] wa-al-qumqum bi-al-tamām wa-al-kamāl. Wa-huwa min kutub al-Ḥājj [... ... ...]."

2. Translation of the colophon of "Ḥikāyat al-ṣayyād wa-al-qumqum": "This is what has reached us of the Tale of the hunter and the long-necked bottle, completely and thoroughly. It is of the books of al-Ḥajj [... ... ...]."

3. Colophon of "Qiṣṣat al-Miqdād ibn al-Aswad": No colophon. Text ends with: "... Wa-raḥalū jamīʻuhum li-Yathribī // li-ʻindi Ṭāhā al-Hāshimīyi al-ʻArabī. Wa-jaddadū Islāmahum ʻalayhi // wa-iltajaʼū jamīʻuhum ilayhi. Wa-qad nahaynā Qiṣṣata al-Miqdādī // ʻan yadi al-anzaʻi ibn ʻammi al-Hādī. Wa-ṣallū jamʻan] ayyuhā al-ḥaḍārī // ʻalá al-Muṣṭafá huwa ṣāḥibu al-anwārī. Tamm."

record.title: Collection of two folktales, miscellaneous invocations, and useful quotations : manuscript.
record.note: 1. Title of "Qiṣṣat ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Mubārak maʻa al-jāriyah Maryam" from folio 1a.
2. Title of "Qiṣṣat al-Ḥajjāj maʻa Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn ibn al-Imām al-Ḥusayn" from folio 6a.
3. Title of "Miscellaneous invocations and useful quotations" supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Qiṣṣat ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Mubārak maʻa al-jāriyah Maryam": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Mubārak, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, qāl: Kharajtu urīdu al-ḥajj ilá Bayt Allāh al-Ḥarām, wa-ziyārat qabr Muḥammad, ʻalayhi afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Qāl: Fa-baynamā anā fī baʻḍ al-ṭarīq, fa-junna ʻalayya al-layl, fa-nimtu, thumma istayqaẓtu min manāmī, fa-idhā anā bi-jāriyah fī rijlihā naʻlān min khūṣ, wa-bi-yadihā rakwah, wa-hiya tatlū hādhihi al-āyah ..."
1. Secundo folio of "Qiṣṣat ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Mubārak maʻa al-jāriyah Maryam": al-Raḥīm salāmun qawlan min Rabbin Raḥīm.

2. Incipit of "Qiṣṣat al-Ḥajjāj maʻa Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn ibn al-Imām al-Ḥusayn": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rawá ʻAbd Allāh al-Kūfī, qāl: Baynamā naḥnu julūsun ʻinda al-Ḥajjāj, wa-qad ghuṣṣa al-majlis bi-al-nās, qāl: Dakhala shābbun ṣaghīr al-sinn, rathth al-thiyāb, wa-qad ghayyar al-faqr ṣūratah, qāl fa-sallama ʻalá al-ḥāḍirīn, fa-qāla la-hu al-Ḥajjāj: Min ayna anta yā ṣabī. Qāl: Min Miṣr. Fa-qāla la-hu al-Ḥajjāj: Anta min dār al-fāsiqīn ..."
2. Secundo folio of "Qiṣṣat al-Ḥajjāj maʻa Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn ibn al-Imām al-Ḥusayn": ḥayārá lā Yahūd wa-lā Naṣārá.

3. Incipit of "Miscellaneous invocations and useful quotations": "Hādhā 'Duʻāʼ ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Sulṭān'. Fa-innahu idhā qāma min qabrihi Yawm al-Qiyāmah, wa-wajhuhu yuḍīʼ mithl al-qamar, wa-yaqūlūn: Hādhā nabī am malak min al--muqarrabīn. Fa-yaqūlu Jibrīl, ʻalayhi al-salām: Laysa huwa nabī wa-lā malak, bal huwa ʻabdun min banī Ādam, qad akramahu Allāh taʻālá bi-qirāʼat hādhā al-istighfār wa-aʻṭāhu hādhihi al-manzilah ..."
3. Secundo folio of "Miscellaneous invocations and useful quotations": wa-lā yasaʻuka illā ḥilmuka.
10 x 15.7 cm; written surface: 6.5 x 11 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown cardboard.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on laid paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qiṣṣat ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Mubārak maʻa al-jāriyah Maryam, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhumā ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. M." "Qiṣṣat ʻAbd [Allāh] ibn al-Mubārak." And ownership statements: "Ṣāḥibuhu Ḥasan Bāshā Amīn." "Yūsuf Bīk." "Ḥasan Bīk. Ajmaʻīn."
On folio 6a: "Hādhihi Qiṣṣat al-Ḥajjāj maʻa Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn ibn al-Imām al-Ḥusayn, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhumā ajmaʻīn. Āmīn."
At the lower margin of folio 37a: A name "Khālid Hāshim."
On folio 37b: A text in Ottoman Turkish, in poetry and prose.

1. Colophon of "Qiṣṣat ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Mubārak maʻa al-jāriyah Maryam": No colophon. Text ends with: "... aʻāda Allāh ʻalaynā min barakātihā wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-Nabī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi, wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Āmīn."
2. Colophon of "Qiṣṣat al-Ḥajjāj maʻa Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn ibn al-Imām al-Ḥusayn": "Wa-hādhā mā intahá ilaynā min 'Qiṣṣat al-Ḥajjāj' ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

2. Tranaslation of the colophon of "Qiṣṣat al-Ḥajjāj maʻa Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn ibn al-Imām al-Ḥusayn": "This is what has reached us of the 'Story of al-Ḥajjāj' completely and thoroughly. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

3. Colophon of "Miscellaneous invocations and useful quotations": No colophon. Text ends with: "... Wa-Rabbuka ʻalá kull shayʼ ḥafīẓ. Allāh ḥafīẓ ʻalayhim. Wa-mā anta ʻalayhim bi-wakīl, wa-ʻindanā kitābun ḥafīẓ li-kull awwāb ḥafīẓ, wa-innā ʻalaykum la-ḥāfiẓīn kirāman. Allāhumma iḥfaẓ ḥāmilat kitābī min jamīʻ al-ʻilal wa-al-asqām bi-alf alf 'Lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Samarqandīyah : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad ʻIṣām al-Asfarāyīnī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi. Yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá alṭāf Rabbihi al-khafīyah, ʻIṣām al-Dīn ibn Muḥammad, ḥabāhu Allāh bi-maʻrifatihi al-jalīyah: Inna aḥsan mā tuzādu bi-hi al-niʻam al-wafīyah, wa-tudfaʻu bi-hi al-balīyah, fī al-bukrah wa-al-ʻashīyah, al-ḥamd lillāh al-wāhib al-ʻaṭīyah, ay, kull ʻaṭīyah, aw, al-ʻaṭīyah al-maʻhūdah allatī nazilat bi-hā al-sūrah, fa-ḥīnaʼidhin tatanāsabu fiqratā al-ḥamd wa-al-salāmah ashadd tanāsub ..."
Secundo folio: bi-al-kināyah fa-taʼammal qad dhukirat.
16.2 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16.5 cm; 23-24 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 1 numbered quire).
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on laid paper; the phrases of "al-Samarqandīyah" in red; some commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ ʻIṣām al-Dīn ʻalá al-Istiʻārāt lil-Khawājā al-Samarqandī, nafaʻanī Allāh bi-hi, wa-aʻāda ʻalayya wa-ʻalá al-Muslimīn min barakātih. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: "Yā Kubaykij iḥfaẓ al-waraq." "Yā Kubayk iḥfaẓ al-Waraq."
On folio 14b: "Yā Kubayk iḥfaẓ al-Waraq."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with: "... wa-al-aẓhar anna mā yaḥḍuruhu al-sāmiʻ awwalan, fa-huwa al-qarīnah, wa-mā siwāhu tarshīḥ. Wa-laka an tajʻala al-jamīʻ qarīnah fī maqām shiddat al-ihtimām bi-al-īḍāḥ. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá tamām al-iṣbāḥ baʻda al-ẓalām al-mukhrij ilá al-miṣbāḥ, wa-narjū al-intiẓām bi-hi fī silk duʻāʼ al-ṭalabah fī al-ṣabāḥ wa-al-rawāḥ. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Samarqandīyah al-ṣaghīr : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī al-ḥamdu la-hu ḥaqīqatan, wa-huwa li-ghayrihi majāz, al-muḥīṭ ʻilmuhu bi-asrār al-balāghah wa-wujūh al-barāʻah wa-dalāʼil al-iʻjāz. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-muwashshaḥ bi-al-āyāt wa-al-dalāʼil, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-man tabiʻahum ilá Yawm al-Dīn bi-al-fawāḍil wa-al-faḍāʼil. Ammā baʻd, fa-qad sharaḥtu Risālat al-Imām al-Samarqandī fī al-istiʻārāt, wa-washshaḥtuhā bi-laṭāʼif al-ẓarāʼif wa-ʻawārif al-maʻārif wa-nafāʼis al-ʻibārāt wa-daqāʼiq al-iʻtibārāt, thumma inna baʻḍ al-ikhwān saʼalanī an aṣrifa al-himmah naḥwa ikhtiṣārih wa-al-iqtiṣār ʻalá bayān maʻānīhi wa-kashf asrārih, maʻa takthīr al-fawāʼid, wa-al-ityān bi-al-mthilah wa-al-shawāhid, li-mā annahu lam yaqaʻ li-hādhā al-matn sharḥ ʻalá hādhā al-wajh, yakūnu lil-mubtadī nāfiʻan ... fa-ajabtuhu ilá dhālik ... wa-mā wajadtahu ayyuhā al-wāqif ʻalayhi ... wa-min ṣawāb, fa-huwa mustamadd min fayḍ Shaykhinā Sayyidī ʻAbd Allāh ibn Muḥammad al-Maghribī al-Qaṣrī al-Kinkisī ..."
Secundo folio: al-ʻahd ashadd thumma inna al-ḥamd.
15 x 21 cm; written surface: 9 x 16 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair large naskh script, in black ink, on laid paper; the phrases of "al-Samarqandīyah" in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ al-Mullawī ʻalá al-Samarqandīyah."

On folio 20b: Twenty fully vocalized verses, in a different hand, from "Gharāmī ṣaḥīḥ", a treatise in verse, by Ibn Faraḥ al-Ishbīlī (Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad, -1300), on the terminology of the Ḥadīth. It starts with: "Gharāmī ṣaḥīḥun wa-al-rajá fīka muʻḍilu // wa-ḥuznī wa-damʻī mursalun wa-musalsalu. Wa-ṣabrī ʻalaykum yashhadu al-ʻaqlu annahu // ḍaʻīfun wa-matrūkun wa-dhilliya ajmalu ..." and ends with: "... Fa-khudh awwalan min ākhirin thumma awwalan // mina al-niṣfi minhu fa-huwa fīhi mukmilu. Ubirru [idhā aqsamtu] innī bi-ḥubbihi // ahīmu wa-qalbī bi-al-ṣabābati mushʻalu ..."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, ākhir shahr Dhī al-Ḥijjah al-muḥarram, min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah thalāth wa-arbaʻīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, wa-raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻan kull al-Ṣaḥābah ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "This copy was completed on blessed Thursday, the end of the sacred month of Dhū al-Ḥijjah, of the year 1141 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [5 July 1731], may the best prayer and peace be upon Him. May God Almighty be pleased with all and entire Companions. Amen. Amen. Amen. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Waraqāt : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Maḥallī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi, wa-sallam. Hādhihi waraqāt qalīlah, tashtamilu ʻalá maʻrifat fuṣūl min uṣūl al-fiqh, yantafiʻu bi-hā al-mubtadī wa-ghayruhu. Wa-dhālika, ay, lafẓ uṣūl al-fiqh, muʼallaf min juzʼayn mufradayn, min al-ifrād muqābil al-tarkīb, li-anna muqābil al-tathniyah al-jamʻ ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-mandūb wa-al-mubāḥ wa-al-maḥẓūr wa-al-makrūh.
15 x 22 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 17 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two unnumbered quires).
In fair ruqʻah script, in black ink, on laid paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Waraqāt lil-Jalāl al-Maḥallī."

The text ends with: "... man ijtahada wa-aṣāba fa-la-hu ajrān, wa-man ijtahada wa-akhṭaʼ fa-la-hu ajrun wāḥid. Wa-wajh al-dalīl anna al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, khaṭṭaʼa al-mujtahid tāratan wa-ṣawwabahu tāratan. Wa-al-Ḥadīth rawāhu al-Shaybī wa-al-Bukhārī wa-Muslim. Wa-lafẓ al-Bukhārī: Idhā ijtahada al-ḥākim fa-ḥakama fa-aṣāba fa-la-hu ajrān, wa-idhā ḥakama fa-akhṭaʼa fa-la-hu ajr."
Colophon: "Tammat. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn."
Translation of the colophon: "It is completed. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and his companions, and grant them peace. Amen. Amen."

record.title: Collection of two folktales, and miscellaneous proverbs : manuscript.
record.note: 1. Title of "Qiṣṣat al-Ḥajjāj ibn Yūsuf al-Thaqafī wa-mā jarā la-hu maʻa Muḥammad ibn Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn" from incipit (folio 1b).
2. Title of "Qiṣṣat al-ḥarāmī wa-al-qāḍī" from incipit (folio 12b).
3. Title of "Miscellaneous proverbs" supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Qiṣṣat al-Ḥajjāj ibn Yūsuf al-Thaqafī wa-mā jarā la-hu maʻa Muḥammad ibn Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn": "Qiṣṣat al-Ḥajjāj ibn Yūsuf al-Thaqafī wa-mā jarā la-hu maʻa Muḥammad ibn Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, Khātim al-Nabīyīn, wa-Imām al-Mursalīn, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī, wa-ʻalayhi al-tiklān. Qāla al-Shaykh Abū ʻAbd Allāh al-Karkhī: Ḥaḍartu majlis al-Ḥajjāj yawman bi-al-Kūfah, wa-al-nās min ḥawlihi muḥdiqīn, wa-min haybatihi muṭriqīn, wa-huwa baynahum ka-al-asad al-waththāb, idh akhala ʻalaynā ṣabīun bi-taghayyur al-lawn, fa-sallama wa-taraḥḥama, fa-radda ʻalayhi al-Ḥajjāj al-salām ..."
1. Secundo folio of "Qiṣṣat al-Ḥajjāj ibn Yūsuf al-Thaqafī wa-mā jarā la-hu maʻa Muḥammad ibn Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn": al-makr wa-al-ʻanād qāla al-ghulām.

2. Incipit of "Qiṣṣat al-ḥarāmī wa-al-qāḍī": "Qiṣṣat al-ḥarāmī wa-al-qāḍī, wa-mā jarā lahumā min ẓarāfat al-kalām wa-shahāmat al-maqām. Ḥukiya, wa-Allāh aʻlam, annahu kāna bi-madīnat Baghdād Qāḍī Quḍāt al-Islām, wa-kāna ismuhu Muḥammad ibn Muqātil, wa-kāna ṣāḥib māl wa-dīn, wa-kāna dhāt laylah min al-layālī, idh ḍāqa ṣadruhu, fa-amar khādimahu an yaqīda [yaqida] la-hu al-sirāj li-yuṭāliʻa fī al-kutub, idh waqaʻa naẓaruhu ʻalá saṭr maktūb fīhi ..."
2. Secundo folio of "Qiṣṣat al-ḥarāmī wa-al-qāḍī": fa-qāla al-liṣṣ ḥaddathanī abī ʻan jaddī.

3. Incipit of "Miscellaneous proverbs": "... Thawb al-ʻīrah mā yadūm. Thiql al-khurāfī al-ṣarm. Thalāthah yaʼtī fī alf al-lawqah wa-al-junūn wa-al-ʻamá. Ḥarf al-Jīm: Jīt aḍṭād ṣādūnī. Jawr al-turk wa-lā ʻadl al-ʻArab. Jibt al-aqraʻ yuwannisnī kashaf qarʻatahu khawwafnī ..."
3. Secundo folio of "Miscellaneous proverbs": Sammūk saḥar qāl faragh Ramaḍān.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 13 x 16 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap.
In fair clear medium naskh script, in black ink, on thick paper (the tears on folio 8 are stiched with green fiber); markings in red; few corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: Excerpts from an unidentified text of religious advices and conduct of life.
On folio 7b: Two illegible stamps.

The text on folio 12b is followed by two riddles (in two verses each), as follows: 1. "Lighz fī al-ḍirs: Lī ṣāḥibun lam amalla al-dahra ʻishratahu // yabtaghī li-nafʻī wa-yasʻá saʻya mujtahidi. Lam ansahu ḥīna taṣāḥabnā wa-ḥīna badā // li-nāẓirayya iftaraqnā firqata al-abadi." 2. "Lighz fī al-fīl: Wa-mā shayʼun yaqūmu bi-ghayri rijli // wa-yaṭʻanu man yashā bilā yadayni. Wa-yastariqqu al-kalāma bi-ghayri samʻin // wa-yanẓuru man yashā bi-ghayri ʻayni."

1. Colophon of "Qiṣṣat al-Ḥajjāj ibn Yūsuf al-Thaqafī wa-mā jarā la-hu maʻa Muḥammad ibn Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn": "Wa-hādhā mā intahá ilaynā min amr al-Ḥajjāj, huwa wa-al-ṣabī Muḥammad ibn al-Imām ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib, karrama Allāh wajhahu, wa-raḍiya ʻanhu, wa-raḥimanā bihim fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon of "Qiṣṣat al-Ḥajjāj ibn Yūsuf al-Thaqafī wa-mā jarā la-hu maʻa Muḥammad ibn Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn": "This is what has reached us of the account of al-Ḥajjāj with the lad Muḥammad ibn al-Imām ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib, may God honor his face and be pleased with him, and have mercy upon us through them, in this world and the hereafter. Amen. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and his companions, and grant them peace."

2. Colophon of "Qiṣṣat al-ḥarāmī wa-al-qāḍī": No colophon. The text ends abruptly, as follows: "... thumma al-liṣṣ qāl ayyuhā al-qāḍī: Qad bāna lī fī bayt al-māl annaka talbasu ghadan khilʻah malīḥah jadīdah badīʻah min khilaʻ al-Khalīfah al-ghāliyah al-rafīʻah, wa-anā ushīru ʻalayka ayyuhā al-qāḍī bi-shayʼ tafʻaluhu, wa-huwa annka tadkhulu al-balad wa-anta ʻuryān, wa-lā takhshá min aḥad, wa-lā tastaḥī abadan, wa-anta rākib ʻalá birdhawnika hādhā, wa-talbas hādhihi al-ʻabāh, wa-tuṭaylis bi-al-kanfūsh, wa-tadkhul ..."
3. Colophon of "Miscellaneous proverbs": No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... Ḥarf al-Wāw: Waḥsh wa-yatalaʻbaṭ ʻalá al-katf. Wāḥid sammawhu ʻAnbar ..."

record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... mā huwa al-murād min al-taʻrīf bi-ṭarīq (iʻādat. nuskhah) al-tanwīʻ ifādatan lil-ishāratayn al-sābiqatayn, ihtimāman bi-qawlihi (fa-qawluhu. ṣaḥḥ) amr. Kull amr qaḍīyah kullīyah, yaʻnī lā mafhūm kullī, kamā tawahhama dhālika al-baʻḍ. Munṭabiq, ay, mushtamil bi-al-qūwah, yaʻnī mundarij fīhi bi-ṭarīq al-ijmāl ʻalá juzʼīyātih, ay, ʻalá aḥkām juzʼīyāt mawḍūʻih ..."
Secundo folio: maʻa annahu laysa bi-athar lil-ʻāqilah.
15 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15 cm; 18-21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in five unnumbered quires).

In medium naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; the phrases of the original text preceded by the word "qawluhu" (his saying) in red; catchwords.

Colophon: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb. Tammat al-kitābah fī shahr Dhī al-Qaʻdah, fī yawm al-thālith, fī waqt al-ḍuḥá, fī Madsah-ʼi [Madrasah-ʼi] Bayāḍidīyah, fī Wilāyat Marʻash, fī dawr Sulṭān Ibrāhīm Khān, nawwara Allāh marqadah. Ṣāḥibuhu wa-mālikuhu Muṣṭafá ibn Ḥamz [Ḥamzah] ibn Muṣṭafá ibn ʻUthmān ibn Amarzah, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi, wa-li-jamīʻ al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, wa-al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, bi-raḥmatika Yā Arḥam al-Rāḥimīn. Āmīn. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. Tārīkh sanat arbaʻah khamsīn wa-alf. Tārīkh sanah fī Hijrah al-Nabawīyah 1554 [1054 = 1 January 1645]."

Translation of the colophon: "The book was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King. God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. The copy was completed in the month of Dhū al-Qaʻdah, on the third day, in the morning, at the Bayāḍidīyah Madrasah, in Wilāyat Marʻash, during the reign of Sultan Ibrāhīm Khān, may God illuminate his resting place. Copied and owned by Muṣṭafá ibn Ḥamz [Ḥamzah] ibn Muṣṭafá ibn ʻUthmān ibn Amarzah, may God forgive him and his parents, and be benevolent to them and to him, and to all believers, men and women, and the Muslims, men and women, by Your mercy. O You who are the most merciful of all merciful. Amen. O Lord of the Universe. Dated in the year 1054 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [1 January 1645]."

record.title: Collection of three Arabic folktales : manuscript.
record.note: 1. Title of "Sīrat Sayf al-Mulūk wa-Badīʻat al-Jamāl" from colophon (folio 22a)
2. Title of "Ḥikāyat Faras al-Abnūs" from folio 22a.
3. Title of "ʻAlī Shāh wa-Zumurrud" supplied by Hartford Seminary
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Sīrat Sayf al-Mulūk wa-Badīʻat al-Jamāl": The incipit is missing. Text starts with: "... al-Malik aʻlama akhāhu Tāj al-Mulūk bi-salāmat ibnatih. Fa-lammā samiʻa fariḥa faraḥan shadīd mā ʻalayhi min mazīd, wa-rakiba fī al-ḥāl wa-atá ilá madīnat akhāhu, wa-ijtamaʻa ʻalá ibnatihi Dawlat Khātūn, wa-fariḥū faraḥ zāyid al-ḥadd, wa-qaʻida Tāj al-Mulūk ʻinda akhīhi miqdār jumʻah min al-zamān. Qāla al-rāwī: Wa-baʻda dhālika akhadha ibnatahu wa-Sayf al-Mulūk wa-sāfarū ilá an waṣalū ilá Sanarndīb ..."
1. Secundo folio: "Sīrat Sayf al-Mulūk wa-Badīʻat al-Jamāl": min al-furjah fa-akhadhūhu.

2. Incipit of "Ḥikāyat Faras al-Abnūs": "Ḥukiya, wa-Allāh aʻlam fī ghaybihi wa-aḥkam, fīmā maḍá wa-taqaddama wa-salaf min aḥādīth al-umam, annahu kāna malik min mulūk al-Akāsirah, qad malaka al-aqālīm wa-al-bilād, wa-aṭāʻathu al-mulūk wa-al-ʻibād. Wa-kāna fī kull ʻām la-hu ʻīd yuqālu la-hu ʻĪd al-Nayrūz. Wa-kāna fī yawm ʻīdihi yajlisu ʻalá kursīyihi li-sāyir al-nās ḥattá yaridū ilayhi ..."
2. Secundo folio of "Ḥikāyat Faras al-Abnūs": dhahab wa-ḥawluhu ithnā ʻashar farkhah.

3. Incipit of "ʻAlī Shāh wa-Zumurrud": "Dhakarū, wa-Allāh aʻlam fī ghaybihi wa-aḥkam, fīmā maḍá wa-taqaddama wa-salaf min aḥādīh al-umam, annahu kāna fī qadīm al-zamān wa-al-ʻaṣr wa-al-awān rajul min akābir al-tujjār. Fa-lammā danat wafātuhu wa-istalafa ḥāluhu, wa-kāna dhū māl ʻaẓīm, fa-aḥḍara waladahu ilá bayn yadayh, wa-kāna mā ruziqa ghayrahu, wa-kāna ismuhu ʻAlī Shāh, fa-qāla la-hu: Yā waladī, iḥfaẓ ʻannī hādhihi al-waṣīyah ..."
3. Secundo folio of "ʻAlī Shāh wa-Zumurrud": Fa-kam ṣadīqin li-ajli al-māli yuṣḥibunī.
16 x 21 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 18.5 cm; 16-18 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard cover with flap; remnant of dark brown leather on spine, flap, and the upper edges.
In clear large naskh script, in black ink, on thick paper; catchwords.
Four handwritten slips of notes in English about the three tales are laid in.

On the front of the flyleaf: Two readers statements, as follows: 1. "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu al-faqr [al-faqīr] ilá Allāh al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá ibn al-Sayyid ʻAbd al-Raḥmān, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-kull al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Ḥurrīra [Ḥurrira] fī shahr Jumād alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1192 [June/July 1778]. Tamma wa-bā-khayr [wa-bi-al-khayr] ʻammat". 2. "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu Dālī Aḥmad ibn Muṣṭafá fī shahr Muḥarram, sanat 1194 [January/February 1780]. Yarjū min Rabbihi ṭībat al-wafā Dālī Aḥmad ibn Muṣṭafá."
On the back of the flyleaf: An ownership statement: "Dakhala hādhā al-kitāb fī milk Muḥammad ʻAlī al-Rajlah."

On the front of the end leaf: Two Readers statements, as follows: 1. "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyah al-faqr [al-faqqīr] ilá Allāh, al-Sayyid Muṣṭfá ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-waladihi wa-lī kull al-Salamīn [al-Muslimīn] ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tammat. Sanat 1192 [1778/1779]." 2. "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu al-faqīr ilá Allāh al-Sayyid Ḥusayn ibn Ḥasan al-Ḥallāq, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-waladihi wa-li-kull al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Sanat 1194 [1780]."

On the back of the end leaf: "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu al-faqīr ilá Allāh al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Ghanī ibn al-Ḥājj ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-marḥūm ʻUbayd al-Ḥāyik, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-awladihi [wa-li-wālidihi] wa-li-kull al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Sanat 1207 [1792/1793]."

1. Colophon of: "Sīrat Sayf al-Mulūk wa-Badīʻat al-Jamāl": "Wa-hādhā mā intahá ilaynā min 'Sīrat Sayf al-Mulūk wa-Badīʻat al-Jamāl' ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl. Wa-yatlūhu Ḥikāyat Faras al-Abnūs wa-al-malik wa-awlāduhu wa-al-ḥukamā, ʻalá al-tamām."

1. Translation of the colophon of: "Sīrat Sayf al-Mulūk wa-Badīʻat al-Jamāl": "This is what has reached us of the 'Tale of Sayf al-Mulūk and Badīʻat al-Jamāl' completely and perfectly. It will be thoroughly followed by the tale of the Ebony horse and the king and his children, and the wisemen."

"Hikāyat Faras al-Abnūs" ends with: "... fa-qāla la-hu al-malik abūhā: Qad zawwajtuhā bi-ibnika Qamar al-Aqmār, wa-raḍītuhu an yakūna lahā baʻlan, wa-hiya takūnu la-hu zawjatan. Fa-ʻinda dhālika inqāmat al-afrāḥ, wa-aḥḍarū al-qāḍī wa-al-shuhūd, wa-katabū kitābahā ʻalá Qamar al-Aqmār, wa-dakhala ʻalayhā, wa-ijtamaʻa bi-hā, wa-ijtamaʻū fī khayr wa-salāmah, wa-dāmū ʻalá dhālik wa-hum fī hanā wa-surūr ilá an atāhum hādim al-ladhdhāt wa-mufarriq al-jamāʻāt."
2. Colophon of "Ḥikāyat Faras al-Abnūs": "Wa-hādhā mā intahá ilaynā min Sīrat Qamar al-Aqmār wa-al-Faras al-abnūs ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl. Tamm. Tammat. Wa-yatlūhu Ḥikāyat Zumurrud al-Sattūrīyah."

2. Translation of the colophon of "Hikāyat Faras al-Abnūs": "This is what has reached us of the Tale of Qamar al-Aqmār and the Ebony horse, completely and perfectly. It is completed. It is completed. It will be followed by the Tale of Zumurrūd al-Sattūrīyah."

3. Colophon of "ʻAlī Shāh wa-Zumurrud": No colophon. Text ends abruptly with a poem, that ends as follows: "... Ḍamantu li-man yaʼtī bashīran bi-qurbikum // baqīyta ʻumarī wa-al-salāmu ʻalaykumu. Qāla wa-ṣāra ..."

record.title: 880-02 Sīrat al-Ẓāhir Baybars : manuscript.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn ʻalá al-qawm al-kāfirīn. Hādhihi shajarah min awwal sīrat al-Ẓāhir al-ʻādil al-qāhir, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayhi, wa-ʻalá man tuwuffiya min al-Muslimīn al-ṭayyibīn al-ṭāhirīn. Wa-yarjiʻ al-faṣl ilá al-Malik al-Ṣāliḥ Ayyūb wa-ruʼyatihi ilá al-manām, wa-taʻbīr al-manām ʻalá yad Aḥmad ibn Daqīq al-ʻĪd, an yadulla ʻalá mushtarāt al-riqq wa-mujī ʻAlī min madīnat al-Shām wa-irsāluhu fī al-tijārah ..."
Secundo folio: Mīr ʻAlī min Burṣá.
10.5 x 16 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 14.5 cm; 13-20 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather. Binding deteriorated, exposing manuscript waste.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on thick paper; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Wa-hādhā al-kitāb yashtamilu ʻalá 'Sīrat al-Ẓāhir'; siyar, faṣl baʻda faṣl, min mubtadāh ilá ākhirihi, ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-naʻūdhu billāh min al-ziyādah wa-al-nuqṣān. M."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Kitāb ʻAbd Allāh al-Ḥakawātī al-Idlibī, wa-huwa kitāb ʻajīb, muṭrib, gharīb, wa-huwa taʼṣīl al-sīrah al-Ẓāhiriyah. M."

On folio 1b-2b: A poem in "takhmīs" format (quintuplication), a poetical device in which a poet expands a poem by adding three hemistiches to the two hemistiches of each verse of the original poem. Starts with: "Wa-law kuntum saḥāb min samāʼ // wa-arwaytum araḍī bi-māʼ. Taraknā al-shurba law mutnā ẓimāʼ // yuʻāru ʻalá al-usūdi yaridna māʼ. Idhā kāna al-kilābu yalighna fīhi ..." It ends with: "... Wa-lā tuʻlim bi-sirrika qaṭṭu thānī // li-annī buḥtu qablaka bi-zamānī. Lusiʻtu mina al-ʻadūwi fa-mā dahānī // siwā man buḥtu fī al-asrār ilayhi."
On folio 149b: A remnant of what seems to be a magical spell, dated Rabīʻ al-Ākhir 1242 (November 1826).
Colophon: No colophon. The text at the end is illegible.
