record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Maqṣūr wa-al-mamdūd : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan ibn Durayd.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Bāb mā yuftaḥu awwaluhu fa-yuqṣaru wa-yumaddu, wa-al-maʻná mukhtalif: Lā tarkunanna ilá al-hawá // wa-iḥdhar muʻāraqata al-hawā. Yawman taṣīru ilá al-thará // wa-yafūzu ghayruk bi-al-tharā. al-Hawá, maqṣūr, hawá al-nafs, wa-tathniyatuhu hawayān, wa-kitābatuhu bi-al-yāʼ. Wa-al-hawā, bi-al-madd, mā bayna al-samāʼ wa-al-arḍ. Taṣīru, min al-ṣayrūrah. Wa-al-thará, maqṣūr, al-nurāb al-nadī, wa-tathniyatuhu tharayān, wa-kitābatuhu bi-al-yāʼ. Wa-al-tharā, mamdūd, al-māl ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-ṣafā mamdūd ikhlāṣ al-maḥabbah.
14 x 18 cm; written surface: 9 x 12.5 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of the "al-Maqṣūr wa-al-mamdūd" in bold calligraphic naskh ; catchwords.

On the upper left corner of folio 1a: Two ownership statements: One defaced, the other by "Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī al-Shāfiʻī" (probably the well-known Egyptian scholar: Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī -1783?), as follows: "Fī nawbat Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī al-Shāfiʻī."

On folio 1a: "al-Ḥamdu lillāhi bi-hi aʻtaṣimu // thumma ʻalá Nabīyihi usallimu. Najazat bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ʻawnihi, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Sayydinā Muḥammad Nabīyihi wa-Rasūlihi wa-ḥabībihi, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn, wa-dhālika fī tāsiʻ ʻashar Ṣafar al-mubārak, sanat thalāth wa-sittīn wa-sabʻimiʼah [26 December 1361]. Kātibuhā al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad [... ... ...]."
Colophon: "Tamma al-Maqṣūr wa-al-mamdūd. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."
Translation of the colophon: "al-Maqṣur wa-al-mamdūd is completed. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, his family, and his companions, and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-03 al-Kāfīyah al-badīʻīyah fī al-madāʼiḥ al-Nabawīyah : manuscript / Ṣafī al-Dīn ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz ibn Sarāyā al-Ḥillī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... Anā al-mufarriṭu aṭlaʻtu al-ʻadūwa ʻalá // sirrī wa-awdaʻtu nafsī kaffa mukhtarimi. Fa-hiya tuḥaddithu ʻan sirrī fa-mā ẓaharat // sarāʼiru al-qalbi illā min ḥadīthi fami. La-anta ʻindī akhaṣṣu al-nāsi manzilatan // idh kunta aqdarahum ʻindī ʻalá al-sulumī ..."
Secundo folio: Rajawtu an yarjiʻū yawman wa-qad rajiʻū.
13.5 x 17.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 14.5 cm; 7-9 lines per page.
Binding: In Unbound (in one quire)
In good large naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses have partial vocalization; no catchwords.
The poem ends with: "... Fa-in saʻidtu fa-madḥī fīka mūjibuhu // wa-in shaqītu fa-dhanbī mūjibu al-niqami."
Colophon: "Tammat al-qaṣd [al-qaṣīdah] al-maʻrifah [al-maʻrūfah] bi-'al-Badīʻīyah', inshāʼ al-Shaykh Ṣafī al-Dīn ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz ibn Sarāyā al-maʻrūf bi-al-Ḥillī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu."
Translation of the colophon: "The poem known as 'al-Badīʻīyah', composed by al-Shaykh Ṣafī al-Dīn ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz ibn Sarāyā al-maʻrūf bi-al-Ḥillī, may God forgive him, is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥadīth al-Isrāʼ wa-khabar al-Miʻrāj : manuscript / Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn ibn Muḥammad al-Barzanjī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Subḥāna alladhī asrá bi-ʻabdihi laylan min al-Masjid al-Ḥarām ilá al-Masjid al-Aqṣā alladhī bāraknā ḥawlahu li-nuriyahu min āyātinā, innahu huwa al-samīʻu al-baṣīr. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Asrá bi-ʻabdihi laylan min al-Masjid al-Ḥarām ilá al-Masjid al-Aqṣá, wa-khṣṣaṣahu bi-al-ḥubb, wa-naʻʻamahu bi-al-qurb, wa-aʻṭāhu al-karāmāt wa-al-faḍāʼil allatī lā tuḥṣá ..."
Secundo folio: al-Wāḥid al-Aḥad al-Fard al-Ṣamad.
15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 15 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In large good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; keywords in red; text in double red frame, fully vocalized; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "al-Liwāʼ al-maḥmūd wa-al-maqām al-isrá [al-asná] fī qiṣṣat al-Miʻrāj, al-jāmiʻ bayna faḍīlatay al-ʻilm wa-al-nasab, wa-al-sharaf al-wahbī wa-al-muktasab, Mawlānā al-Sayyid Muḥammad Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn ibn al-marḥūm Muḥammad Zayn al-Sayyid al-Hādī al-Barzanjī al-Ḥusaynī al-Madanī, nafaʻanī Allāh bi-hi wa-biʻlūmihi, wa-aʻādahu ʻalaynā min barakātihi. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Ḥadīth al-Isrāʼ wa-khabar al-Miʻrāj li-Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."
A the end of the text a decoration in black, green, yellow, and gray.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with an invocation, as follows: "Subḥāna Rabbika Rabbi al-ʻIzzati ʻammā yaṣifūn. Wa-salāmun ʻalá al-Mursalīn. Wa-al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Sanat 1281 [1864/1865]."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Miʻrāj al-Nabī : manuscript / Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad al-Qalyūbī.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... wa-yaṣūmūn wa-yaḥujjūn. Qāla baʻḍuhum: Wa-yankaḥūn, fa-rājaʻahu, wa-dhālika kulluhu ziyādah fī ujūrihim, idh lā taklīf baʻda al-mawt, wa-lā māniʻ min ilḥāq ghayrihim bi-him, khuṣūṣan al-shuhadāʼ, wa-fī hādhā al-ijtimāʻ karāmah La-hu, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. 'Fa-naẓara ilayhim fa-ʻaraf al-nabīyīn' min ghayrihim, bi-ṣifah, aw bi-ilhām, aw qawl, aw ishārah min Jibrīl ..."
Secundo folio: ittakhadhanī khalīlan ilá ākhir mā qāl.
15 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 16 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in six quires; the first three are numbered: 4, 5, 6; the last three are unnumbered).
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of the original "Miʻrāj" in purple; some commentaries on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām, wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God on the completion. There is no power nor might except in God the Almighty, the All Powerful. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and on his companions, and grant them abundant peace. Amen. Amen. It is completed."

record.title: 880-01 Sharḥ Faṣl al-khiṭāb fī ʻilmay al-manṭiq wa-al-ādāb : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary, based on the title of the original work mentioned on folio 5a (... "wasammaytuhu ... bi-Faṣl al-khiṭāb ... fī ʻilamy al-manṭiq wa-al-ādāb ...").
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... wa-yuqayyidu muṭlaqah, wa-yūḍiḥu muʻḍilah, wa-yufaṣṣilu mujmalah, wa-uqaddimuhu hadīyatan ilá ʻallāmat al-ʻālam, wa-sayyid wuld Ādam, Shaykh al-Islām wa-marjiʻ al-ʻulamāʼ al-aʻlām, bāb madīnat al-ʻilm, wa-rāfiʻ liwāʼ al-ʻadl wa-al-ḥukm, man sāmá al-Farqadayn bi-majdih, wa-malaka al-faḍl mulkan lā yanbaghī li-aḥadin min baʻdih, wa-kamā qultu fīhi: Mawlan idhā bakhula al-ghamāmu afāḍa min // yumnāhu bi-al-iḥsāni khamsata anhuri. Watara al-kamāla fa-man raʼá ahla al-ʻulá // min dūnihi amsá ka-man lam yūtari ..."
Secundo folio: mayl nafsānī li-muḥtāj ghāyatihā.
14.5 x 25 cm; written surface: 8 x 18.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.

In good naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on cream colored paper; the phrases of the original "Faṣl al-khiṭāb fī ʻilamy al-manṭiq wa-al-ādāb" and markings in red; some commentaries on the margins; text within gold and black frames; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with: "... Tammat al-munāẓarah. Wa-sammá ʻajz al-muʻallil ifḥāman, w-al-sāʼil ilzāman, wa-ammā qudratuhumā lā ilá al-nihāyah fa-muḥāl, li-imtināʻ ithbāt umūr lā nihāyah la-hā fī azminah mutanāhiyah, wa-iḥāṭat al-dhihn bi-mā lā nihāyah la-hu; idh law aḥāṭa bi-hi la-kāna mutanāhiyan. Wa-lā yakhfá mā fī al-kalām min ḥusn al-khitām. Wa-afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Khātim al-Rusul al-Kirām, mā ṭalaʻ badr al-tamām. Tamm."

record.title: 880-01 Sharḥ Alfīyat al-taṣawwuf : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn, wa-Huwa thiqatī fī kull al-umūr. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī lā ilāha illā huwa, muḥyī khalqahu bi-ṣifāt tuʻrafu lahum bihā, fa-bi-hi tāhū, alladhī jaʻala al-insān fī aḥsan taqwīm, wa-ṣayyarahu maḥtida asrārih wa-ṣirāṭihi al-mustaqīm, muqarribuhu ilayhi bilā wāsiṭah min ḥaythu ḥaqīqatuhu al-jāmiʻah al-barzakhīyah, bi-iʻtibār al-wujūb wa-al-imkān bi-aḥkāmihimā ..."
Secundo folio: wa-jahrahu wa-ashkuruhu ʻalá an jaʻala minhum.
17 x 22.2 cm; written surface: 10 x 16 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in three unnumbered quires).
In fair, hastily written naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of "Alfīyat al-taṣawwuf" and markings in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On the margin of folio 2a: The name of the son of the author of "Alfīyat al-taṣawwuf" is written as: "Abū al-Futūḥ, Muḥammad Kamāl al-Dīn ibn Muṣṭafá ... al-Ṣiddīqī nasaban, al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan, al-Ḥanafī madhhaban ..."
On folio 2b: The name of the author of "Alfīyat al-taṣawwuf" is written as: "Muṣṭafá ibn Kamāl al-Dīn ibn ʻAlī ibn Kamāl al-Dīn ... ... ... ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ... ibn ... Abī Bakr al-Ṣiddīq ..."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with the commentary on the verse: "Wa-kullu mā jāʼa bi-hi al-Mukhtāru // la-hu bilā taraddudin nakhtāru", as follows: "... bilā, ay bi-dūn taraddud, ay tashkīk, nakhtāruhu wa-naqbaluhu, idh Huwa, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, lā yanṭuqu ʻan al-hawá, in huwa illā waḥyun yūḥá, lāsīmā mā kāna fī amr al-waḥy, wa-al-duʻāʼ ilá Allāh taʻālá, wa-al-ikhbārāt al-ghaybīyah, bi-khilāf mā kāna fī amr al-dunyā, wa-shahida la-hu Ḥadīth thābir [taʼbīr] al-nakhl, wa-lafẓuhu: 'Antum aʻlam bi-amr dunyākum'. Qāla al-Manāwī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: 'minnī wa-anā aʻlamu bi-amri ukhrākum minkum. Fa-inna al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-rusul innamā buʻithū li-inqādh al-khalāʼiq min al-shaqāwah ..."

record.title: 880-02 Fī ʻilm al-nujūm : manuscript / Fakhr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn ʻUmar al-Rāzī.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Min kalām al-Shaykh al-Imām Fakhr al-Dīn al-Rāzī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Hādhihi umūr yajibu an takūn maḥfūẓah ʻalá khāṭir man yuʻānī ṣināʻat al-nujūm. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Burj al-Ḥamal dhakar nahārī nārī munqalib ḥārr yābis rabīʻī muʻwajj al-ḍulūʻ Sharqī, wa-huwa bayt al-Mirrīkh, wa-sharaf al-Shams, wa-hubūṭ Zuḥal, wa-wabāl al-Zuhrah. Burj al-Thawr unthá laylī arḍī bārid yābis janūbī rabīʻī muʻwajj al-ḍulūʻ, wa-huwa bayt al-Zuhrah, wa-sharaf al-Qamar, wa-wabāl al-Mirrīkh, wa-laysa fīhi hubūṭ. Burj al-Jawzāʼ ..."
Secundo folio: umūr al-māl wa-al-taqlīd wa-al-tazwīj wa-al-muṣādaqah.
14.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 16 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In light brown cardboard.
In good medium naskh script, in black ink on white laid paper; headings in red (in the text and also on the margins); some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On the front of the flyleaf: Miscellaneous verses of poetry and quotations in Arabic.
On folios 1a and 1b: Two circular astronomical diagrams (in Persian).
Text of "Fī ʻilm al-nujūm" (folios 1a-10a).
On folios 10b-11b: Miscellaneous popular and talismanic recipes.
On folios 12a-12b: Miscellaneous verses of poetry in Ottoman Turkish and Arabic.
On folios 13a-13b: The names of the numerals from 36-78 in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish, and their representations in East Arabic (Indian) numerals, and in letters (the traditional "abjad" format).
At the head of folio 13b and inside the back cover: An oval stamp of "CASE MEMORIAL LIBRARY HARTFORD SEMINARY FOUNDATION".
On the front of the end leaf: Titles of a collection of forty books on different subjects (mostly Arabic language and Islamic law)
On the back of the end leaf: A mathematical diagram for calculation and distribution of inheritance.

Inside of the back cover: A debt document bearing the names of the creditor, debtors, witnesses, and recorder, dated 8 Muḥarram, 1207 of the Hijrah (26 August 1792), as follows: "Aḥmad ʻAṭṭār. ʻIndanā ilá al-Ḥājj ʻAbd Allāh al-ʻAṭṭār thaman [... ... ...] fī 8 Muḥarram, sanat 1207 [...]. Aḥmad ibn Ḥajj ʻUbayd ʻAṭṭār. Shuhūd al-ḥāl ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Farrā al-Laṣīqī, ʻAbbās ʻAṭṭār bi-al-Sukkarīyah. Kātibuhu Sayyid Muḥammad Yaḥyá al-Sayyāf."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends on folio 10a, as follows: "... ḥulūl al-Qamar bi-al-Rishā. Lahā ḥarf al-Ghayn, wa-hiya manzilah māʼīyah saʻīdah. Iʻmal nārinjīyāt ʻaṭf al-qulūb wa-al-mawaddah, wa-ḥulla al-sumūm, wa-ʻālij al-rūḥānīyah, wa-iʻmal ṭillasmāt, wa-izraʻ al-ghallah, wa-sāfir, wa-udkhul ʻalá al-mulūk wa-al-ikhwān, wa-tazawwaj, wa-ishtarī al-raqīq wa-al-dawābb wa-al-māshiyah, wa-ilbis al-thiyāb al-judud, wa-istaftiḥ fīhā bi-al-aʻmāl li-annahā mubārakah, wa-man walad fīhi kāna saʻīdan ṣāliḥan, ḥasan al-ḥāl maḥmūdan. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb."

record.title: 880-02 Risālat tataʻallaqu bi-abḥāth al-kalām ʻalá al-Basmalah : manuscript / Ismāʻīl ibn Ghunaym al-Jawharī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Iftataḥa jamīʻ kutubihi bi-al-Basmalah, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-Hādī li-ummatihi min al-ḍalālah. Wa-baʻd, fa-aqūl: Inna al-Basmalah yataʻallaqu bi-hā sabʻat mabāḥith. al-Baḥth al-awwal fī dalīl al-ibtidāʼ bi-hā fī al-umūr al-ʻalīyah. al-Baḥth al-thānī fī maʻānīhā. al-Baḥth al-thālith fī iʻrābihā ..."
Secundo folio: al-Kutub al-Samāwīyah khuṣūṣan.
16.7 x 24.4 cm; written surface: 9 x 16 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair large naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Risālah tataʻallaqu bi-abḥās [abḥāth] al-kalām ʻalá al-Basmalah, lil-Shaykh Ismāʻīl al-Jawharī."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... Inna sharʻ mā qablanā laysa sharʻan lanā ḥattá yarida fī sharʻinā mā nuqarriruhu, wa-taqrīruhu wāḍiḥ fī maḥallih, wa-alladhī la-hu mumārathah bā-al-Sunnah [mumārasah bā al-Sunnah] lā yakhfá ʻalayhi dhālika, ḥattá yaḥtāja ilá ishkāl wa-jawāb. Wa-ayḍan inna al-taʻāruḍ lā yaʼtī illā ʻinda ʻadam al-ʻamal, aw yataraddadu fī ayyihi mā ʻumila bi-hi. Wa-al-Sunnah qad awḍaḥat dhālika, wa-laysa huwa min al-muraghghab fīhi al-maskūt ʻanhu. Wa-hādhā mā ẓahar lī, wa-lillāh al-ḥamd. Wa-lafẓ ..."

record.title: 880-03 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Mawlid al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Dardīr : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Bājūrī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh dhī al-faḍl wa-al-inʻām, alladhī anār al-wujūd bi-Mawlid Sayyid al-Anām, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, imām kull imām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābih, wa-dhurrīyatihi, wa-ahl baytihi al-kirām. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu Ibrāhīm al-Bājūrī, dhū al-taqṣīr, ghafara la-hu Mawlāhu al-Khabīr al-Baṣīr: Qad ṭalaba minnī baʻḍ al-ikhwān, aṣlaḥ Allāh lī wa-la-hu al-ḥāl wa-al-shān, 'kitābah laṭīfah ʻalá Mawlid al-Bashīr al-Nadhīr', lil-ʻārif bi-Rabbihi, Abī al-Barakāt Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Dardīr, nafaʻanī Allāh wa-al-Muslimīn bi-barakātih, wa-aʻāda ʻalayya wa-ʻalayhim min ṣāliḥ daʻawātih, fa-ajabtuhu li-mā ṭalab, mutawassilan bi-Sayyid al-ʻAjam wa-al-ʻArab, fa-aqūlu wa-billāh al-tawfīq: Qawluhu ..."
Secundo folio: an yazīda sajʻatan rābiʻah ʻalá al-Dāl.
16.7 x 24 cm; written surface: 12 x 18 cm; 27 lines per page.

Binding: Unbound. The three numbered quires are placed between two printed separate invitation cards from the Trustees and Faculties of Hartford Seminary Foundation for the inauguration of Robbins Wolcott Barstow, D.D., 1834-1930, as president, dated 28 October 1930.

In fair small naskh script, in black ink, on laid white paper; the phrases of "Mawlid" of al-Dardir are preceded by the word "Qawluhu" (his saying, in black, sometimes in red); some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi 'Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Mawlid al-Bashīr al-Nadhīr', lil-ʻārif bi-Rabbihi Abī al-Barakāt Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Dardīr, taṣnīf al-Shaykh al-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, Jalāl al-Dīn, Sayyidī al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Bājūrī, ḥafiẓahu Allāh. Āmīn. Tamm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā yassarahu Allāh taʻālá ʻalá Mawlid al-Ḥabīb, aʻadda Allāh lanā awfar naṣīb, wa-aʻādhanā Allāh min sharr kull ḥāsid wa-raqīb, innahu samīʻ qarīb mujīb. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak fī 15 khalat min Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-tisʻah wa-khamsūn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād ilá Rabbih, al-faqīr Ḥusayn al-Nuzlī al-Shāmī, ghafara Allāh la-hu w-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-sallam. Tamm. Tamm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what God Almighty facilitated on the Birth of the Beloved, may God prepare for us the best destiny, and may God protect us from the evil of every envious and watchful, for He hears, He is near, and He answers. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. God is more knowledgeable of what is correct, to Him is the reference and returning. This blessed copy was completed on blessed Monday, 15 [days] having passed from Rabīʻ al-Awwal, of the year 1259 of the Hijrah of the Porphet [15 April 1843], may the best prayer and peace be upon Him, by the hand of the poorest of the servants to his Lord, the poor Ḥusayn al-Nuzlī al-Shāmī, may God forgive him, his parents, and the Muslims. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, and on his family, and grant them peace. It is completed. It is completed. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and on his companions, and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-01 Sharaf al-anām wa-badr al-tamām fī mawlid al-muẓallal bi-al-ghamām : manuscript.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Allāhumma ṣalli wa-sallim ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad fī al-awwalīn, wa-ṣalli wa-sallim ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad fī al-ākhirīn, wa-ṣalli wa-sallim ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad fī al-mursalīn, wa-ṣalli wa-sallim ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad fī kull waqt wa-ḥīn ..."
Secundo folio: al-maqām al-maḥmūd alladhī wāʻadtahu.
17 x 25.5 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 19 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 3 unnumbered quires).

In large good calligraphic naskh script, in black ink, on cream colored paper; headings and markings in orange; text in poetry and prose, fully vocalized; some singing/recitation notations on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā [...] al-Mawlid min kitāb 'Sharaf al-anām wa-badr al-tamām', li-qillat al-taṭwīl iqtaṣarnā ʻalá al-qalīl. Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Wa-fīhi al-baʻḍ min 'Mawlid al-Shaykh al-Majdhūb', wa-al-baʻḍ min 'Mawlid al-Shaykh al-Barzanjī', nafaʻanā Allāh bi-al-jamīʻ. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, al-muwāfiq khamsah maḍat min shahr [...]. Nasakhahu bi-yadihi al-fāniyah Muṣṭafá al-Faṣīḥī, Imām Jāmiʻ Barbar wa-nāẓir awqāfihi, ʻufiya ʻanhu wa-ʻan kull al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "It [the Mawlid] was completed on blessed Thursday, five days having passed from the month of [...]. It was copied by the perishing hand of Muṣṭafá al-Faṣīḥī, the Imām of 'Jāmiʻ Barbar' and the custodian of its waqfs (endowments), may he be forgiven and all Muslims men and women. Amen. Amen. Amen."

record.title: Treatises on Arabic terms and phrases : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī.
record.note: 1. Title of "Fatḥ al-Mālik bimā yataʻallaqu bi-qawl al-nās 'Wa-huwa kadhālik'" from incipit (folio 1b).
2. Title of "Qaṣīdah fī maʻānī lafẓ 'al-ʻAyn'" supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Fatḥ al-Mālik bimā yataʻallaqu bi-qawl al-nās 'Wa-huwa kadhālik'": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī azāla ẓulam al-jahl bi-anwār al-ʻilm, wa-waffaqa bi-faḍlihi man shāʼa li-maʻrifat al-manṭūq wa-al-mafhūm, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad alladhī awḍaḥa Allāh la-hu kull mushkil, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-qāmiʻīn li-ahl al-ḍalāl, wa-bi-hi al-zaygh ubṭil. Āmīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-al-maqṣūd bayān marjiʻ al-ḍamīr wa-al-ishārah fī qawl baʻḍ al-nās 'Wa-huwa kadhālik', mujīban li-man qāl: Anā uḥibbuka, muzīlan lil-ilbās wa-mutbiʻan bi-al-kalām ʻalá al-ʻaṭf, wa-mā yataʻallaqu bi-al-tarkīb, li-yakūna dhālik tuḥfatan li-kull ḥādhiqin ʻāqilin adīb. Wa-sammaytuhu 'Fatḥ al-Mālik bimā yataʻallaqu bi-qawl al-nās 'Wa-huwa kadhālik' ..."
1. Secundo folio of "Fatḥ al-Mālik bimā yataʻallaqu bi-qawl al-nās 'Wa-huwa kadhālik'": wa-waḥīd dahrih Sayyidunā al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Ḥifnī.

2. Incipit of "Qaṣīdah fī maʻānī lafẓ 'al-ʻAyn'": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh khāliq al-ʻayn wa-mubdiʻ ḥawar al-ʻayn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá man maḥā bi-sayf al-ḥaqq kulla mayn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ṣalātan wa-salāman yadfaʻu bi-hā ʻannā kulla ruʼyah. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi qaṣīdah fī fannihā gharībah, qad iḥtawat ʻalá maʻānin fī lafẓ 'ʻAyn', min al-Qāmūs al-muḥtawī ʻalá funūn ʻajībah. Fa-in qaraʼta mā ibtadaʼa bi-hi awwal al-abyāt wajadta isma nāẓimihā, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-ikhwānihi jamīʻ al-zallāt. Qāla ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu: Ayā ẓabya al-falā wa-kaḥīla ʻaynī // wa-yā badra al-dujā wa-ḍiayāʼa ʻaynī. Ḥumīta min al-makārihi yā ghazālan // ḥawá kulla al-maḥāsini bi-dūni ʻaynī ..."
2. Secundo folio of "Qaṣīdah fī maʻānī lafẓ 'al-ʻAyn'": Raʼūfun bi-al-ʻibādi raḥīmu qalbin.
16.3 x 23 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 18 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In fair elementary naskh script, in black ink, on laid white paper; notes on the margins of the second treatise in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb Fatḥ al-Mālik bimā yataʻallaqu bi-qawl al-nās 'Wa-huwa kadhālik', li-jāmiʻihi al-muḥaqqiq Shaykhinā al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. M."

1. Colophon of "Fatḥ al-Mālik bimā yataʻallaqu bi-qawl al-nās 'Wa-huwa kadhālik'": "ʻAlá yad jāmiʻihā al-ʻabd al-faqīr Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī al-Shāfiʻī al-Azharī, ḥaqqaqa Allāh la-hu āmālahu, bi-jāh Sayyidinā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Tamma ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-dhalīl ʻAbduh ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Shurunbulālī, tilmīdh al-muʼallif, raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn."

1. Translation of the colophon of "Fatḥ al-Mālik bimā yataʻallaqu bi-qawl al-nās 'Wa-huwa kadhālik'": "By the hand of its compiler, the poor servant, Aḥmad ibn al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī al-Shāfiʻī al-Azharī, may God realize his hopes, by the high status of our Master Muḥammad, may God pray on him, and grant him peace. Amen. The copy was completed by the hand of the poor and submissive servant, ʻAbduh ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Shurunbulālī, a student [either he, or his father] of the author, may God have mercy upon him. Amen. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and on his companions, and grant them peace. Amen."

2. Colophon of "Qaṣīdah fī maʻānī lafẓ 'al-ʻAyn'": "Tammat ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-dhalīl, ʻAbduh ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Shurunbulālī, tilmīdh al-muʼallif, raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

2. Translation of the colophon of "Qaṣīdah fī maʻānī lafẓ 'al-ʻAyn'": "It was completed by the hand of the poor, despicable, and submissive servant, ʻAbduh ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Shurunbulālī, a student [either he, or his father] of the author, may God have mercy upon him. Amen. Amen. It is completed."

record.title: 880-03 al-Sullam al-munawraq fī ʻilm al-manṭiq : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Akhḍarī.
record.note: Title from incipit (verse 12).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāhi alladhī qad akhrajā // natāʼija al-fikri li-arbābi al-ḥijā. Wa-ḥaṭṭa ʻanhum min samāʼi al-ʻaqli // kulla ḥijābin min saḥābi al-jahli. Ḥattá badat lahum shumūsu al-maʻrifah // raʼaw mukhaddarātihā munkashifah ... Sammaytuhu bi-al-Sullami al-munawraqi // yurqá bi-hi samāʼu ʻilmi al-manṭiqi ..."
Secundo folio: Wa-al-naẓarīyu mā yaḥtāju lil-taʼammuli.
12 x 17.7 cm; written surface: 7 x 13.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white laid paper; headings in bold script; catchwords.

Colophon. No colophon. Text ends with: "Wa-qul li-man yantaṣifu li-maqṣadī // al-ʻudhru ḥaqqun wājibun lil-mubtadī. Wa-li-ibni iḥdá wa-ʻishrīna sanatan // maʻdhiruatun maqbūlatun mustaḥsanah. Lāsīyamā fī ʻāshiri al-qurūni // dhī al-jahli wa-al-fasādi wa-al-futūni. Wa-kāna fī awāʼili al-Muḥarrami // taʼlīfu hādhā al-rajazi al-munaẓẓami. Min sanat iḥdá wa-arbaʻīna // min baʻdi tisʻatin min al-miʼīni. Thumma al-ṣalātu wa-al-salāmu sarmadā // ʻalá Rasūli Allāhi khayri man hadā. Wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-thiqāt // al-sālikīna subula al-najāti. Mā qaṭaʻat shamsu al-nahāri abrujā // wa-ṭalaʻa al-badru al-munīru fī al-dujā. Tamm."

record.title: 880-03 al-ʻAwāmil al-miʼah : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Qāhir ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Jurjānī.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-iʻlam innahu lā budda li-kull ṭālib maʻrifat al-iʻrāb min maʻrifat miʼat shayʼ, sittūn minhā tusammá ʻāmilan, wa-thalāthūn tusammá maʻmūlan, wa-ʻashrah tusammá ʻamalan wa-iʻrāban; fa-ubayyinu laka bi-idhni Allāh taʻālá hādhihi al-thalāthah, ʻalá ṭarīq al-ījāz, fī thalāthat abwāb. al-Bāb al-awwal fī al-ʻāmil, al-bāb al-thānī fī al-maʻmūl, al-bāb al-thālith fī al-iʻrāb ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-ḥādiyah ʻashrah wāw al-qasam.
13 x 18 cm; written surface: 6.5 x 12 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on thin white laid paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "ʻAwāmil al-naḥw."
Colophon: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ʻāqibah lil-muttaqīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn, wa-sallama taslīman kathīran."

Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. The good ending will be for the righteous. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and all his companions, and grant them abundant peace."

record.title: 880-02 al-Qaṭarāt al-yasīrah min al-anhār al-kathīrah : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Sulṭān Muḥammad al-Qārī al-Harawī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a and the colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yā Fattāḥ. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-kafá, wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīna iṣṭafá, wa-ʻalá ḥizbihi aṣḥāb al-ṣafá wa-arbāb al-wafā. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu afqar ʻibād Allāh al-Ghanī, ʻAlī ibn Sulṭān Muḥammad al-Harawī, al-muqrī bi-al-Ḥaram al-Makkī, ʻāmalahumā Allāh bi-luṭfihi al-khafī wa-karamihi al-wafī: Lammā kāna al-dhikr an aʻraifa maʻnāhu ḥaẓẓuhu akmal, wa-tarattub al-ajr ʻalayhi ajzal, istadʻá [... ...] min al-ikhwān fī al-dīn [... ... ... script illegible].
Secundo folio: fa-kuntu uqaddimu rijlan iqbālan.
16 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 14.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in eight numbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white laid paper; the phrases of the original in red; text within double red frame; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Shaykh Abī al-Ḥasan al-Bakrī al-Ṣiddīqī, al-musammá bi-'al-Qaṭarāt al-yasīrah min al-anhār al-kathīrah', taʼlīf al-faqīr al-ʻĀlim al-ʻAllāmah ʻAlī ibn Sulṭān Muḥammad al-Qārī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu, wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Āmīn."

Most of the leaves are stamped with an oval "waqf" stamp, dated in the year 1193 of the Hijrah (1779/1780) which reads: "Yā Mawlāy Yā Wāḥid Waqafa lillāh taʻālá ʻazza shaʼnuhu hadhā al-kitāb al-Sayyid Muḥammad Abū al-Anwār al-Sādāt 1193."

Text ends with: "Tammat 'al-Qaṭarāt al-yasīrah min al-anhār al-kathīrah' allatī afāḍa ʻalaynā mashāyikhunā al-kirām, wa-afādanā ʻulamāʼunā al-aʻlām, al-mustafīḍūn min al-baḥr al-aʻẓam, wa-al-mustafīdūn min al-ḥabr al-afkham, Mawlānā wa-Sayyidunā, wa-qudwatunā, wa-sayyidunā [wa-sanadunā], Shaykh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, wa-ʻayn al-wāṣilīn, al-Shaykh Abī al-Ḥasan al-Bakrī, wālá Allāh ʻalayhi anwār al-minan, wa-adāma hādhihi al-martabah al-ʻalīyah wa-al-mazīyah al-jalīlah fī dhurrīyatihi al-ṭayyibah al-ṭāhirah ilá an tattaṣila al-dunyā bi-al-ākhirah. Wa-kamā anna li-jaddihim al-akbar kāna al-ḥaẓẓ al-awfar fī al-martabah al-awwalīyah wa-al-rutbah al-afḍalīyah min al-marātib al-īmānīyah wa-al-darajāt al-īqānīyah al-Ṣiddīqīyah yakūnu li-jaddihim al-ākhir minhum wa-ijtihādihi al-naṣīb al-awfá fī al-nuqṭah al-ākhirīyah min dāʼirat al-Quṭbīyah, li-tattaṣila al-ūlá bi-al-ukhrá, wa-al-adná bi-al-aʻlá. Fa-lillāh al-ākhirah wa-al-ūlá, wa-nafaʻanā bi-ʻulūmihim wa-barakatihim, wa-ḥasharanā fī dhumratihim [zumratihim], innahu ʻalá mā yashāʼu qadīr wa-al-bi-al-ijābah jadīr. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-ḥizbihi."

Colophon: "Tamma al-sharḥ al-mubārak fī yawm al-Arbaʻ al-mubārak, fī ḥādī wa-ʻishrīn shahr Muḥarram al-ḥarām, ifttitāḥ sanat sabʻ wa-thamānīn wa-miʼah wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed commentary was completed on blessed Wednesday, the twenty-first of the sacred month of al-Muḥarram, the beginning of the year 1187 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [14 April 1773], may prayer and peace be upon Him."

record.title: 880-02 Taqyīdāt ʻalá Sharḥ Umm al-barāhīn fī ʻilm al-kalām : manuscript / Muḥammad al-Dīk.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger (based on the incipit and colophon).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam taslīman, wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. al-Ḥamdu li-Wājib al-Wujūd alladhī aghraqa al-ʻālam fī biḥār al-iḥsān wa-al-jūd, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad, wāsiṭat ʻiqd al-nabīyīn, wa-muqaddam jaysh al-mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi alladhīn shādū manār al-dīn wa-ḥamawhu bi-al-asinnah wa-al-barāhīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr Muḥammad al-Dīk: Hādhihi 'Taqyīdāt ʻalá Sharḥ Umm al-sabt [probably al-thabt]' li-muʼallifihā Sayyidī Muḥammad ibn Mursī al-Ghanūsī [probably Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī], askanahu Allāh farādīs al-jinān, wa-aʻāda ʻalaynā min barakātihi wa-jamīʻ al-ikhwān, jamaʻtuhā min taqrīr Shaykhinā al-ʻAllāmah Abī al-Ḥasan ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad al-Ṣaʻīdī al-ʻAdwī, wa-min ghayrihi, jaʻalahā Allāh khāliṣah li-wajhihi al-karīm, wa-aʻtaṣimu bi-hi min al-Shayṭān al-rajīm, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Qawluhu 'Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm'. al-Kalām ʻalá al-Basmalah shahīr, wa-lākin lā baʼsa bi-al-taʻarruḍ li-shayʼ munāsib lil-fann al-mashrūʻ fīhi, fa-naqūl ..."
Secundo folio: ʻalam shakhṣī ʻalá al-dhāt faqaṭ.
15 x 22 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 18 cm; 24 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 24 numbered quires).

In large fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "Sharḥ Umm al-barāhīn fī" preceded by the word "Qawluhu" (his saying) in red. No commentaries or corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Ḥāshiyat al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Dīk ʻalá Sharḥ Umm al-Sabt fī ʻilm al-tawḥīd, li-kātibihā Ibrāhīm Nawfal, raḥimahu Allāh, wa-askanahu dār al-jinān. Tammat bi-ḥusn tawfīqih. Āmīn."

Author's colophon: "Wa-li-yakun hādhā khātimat hādhihi 'al-Taqyīdāt'. Khatama Allāh lanā bi-al-ḥusná, wa-manaḥanā fī al-Ākhirah bi-al-maqām al-asná, wa-shafaʻa fīnā, wa-fī wālidaynā, wa-mashāyikhinā, wa-aḥabbatinā khayr al-anbiyāʼ al-kirām. Qāla al-muʼallif: Wa-kāna al-farāgh min inshāʼ hādhihi al-taqyīdāt yawm al-Jumʻah, rābiʻ ʻashar shahr Shaʻbān, sanat 1214, arbaʻat ʻashar wa-miʼatayn wa-alf Hilālīyah, wa-dhālika thānī ʻām min istīlāʼ al-Faransīs ʻalá Miṣr, aʻādahā Allāh lil-Islām. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl, niʻma al-mawlá wa-niʻma al-naṣīr, wa-salāmun ʻalá jamīʻ al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Let this be the end of these 'Taqyīdāt' (Glosses). May God seal our end preferably, and grant us in the Hereafter the glorious position. May the best of the honorable prophets [Prophet Muḥammad], intercede on our behalf, and on behalf of our parents, our shaykhs, and our loved ones. The author said: These 'Taqyīdāt' (Glosses) were completed on Friday, 14 Shaʻbān, of the Lunar year 1214 [11 January 1800], the second year of the French occupation of Egypt, may God return It to Islam. God suffices us, He is the best advocate, the best Lord, and the best protector. Peace be upon all the prophets and messengers. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

Colophon of the copy of the previous commentary: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihā yawm al-Thulāthāʼ al-mubārak, li-arbaʻat ʻashar yawman maḍat min shahr Dhī al-Qaʻdah al-ḥarām alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1157, sabʻ wa-khamsīn wa-miʼah wa-alf min al-Hijrah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr al-rājī shafāʻat al-Nabī al-mamdūḥ, ʻAlī ibn Fattūḥ al-Mālikī al-Nizārī baladan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-li-aḥbābihi wa-li-kull al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran dāʼiman abadan ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of the copy of the previous commentary: "It was completed on blessed Tuesday, fourteen [probably 24 days] having passed from the sacred month of Dhī al-Qaʻdah, of the year 1157 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [29 December 1744], may the best prayer and peace be upon Him, by the hand of its copyist, the poor who aspires for the intercession of the Praiseworthy Prophet, ʻAlī ibn Fattūḥ al-Mālikī al-Nizārī baladan, may God forgive him, his parents, his shaykhs, his loved ones, and all Muslims entirely. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and his companions, and grant them abundant, continuous, and everlasting peace, until the Day of Judgement. Amen. Amen. Amen. Amen."

record.title: Collection of four manuscripts on Arabic grammar and logic : manuscript.
record.note: 1. Title of Unidentified commentary on an unidentified work on Arabic grammar supplied by cataloger.
2. Title of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá 'Sharḥ Īsāghūjī supplied by cataloger.
3. Title of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī from reference sources.
4. Title of Kitāb "Īsāghūjī" from Incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of Unidentified commentary on an unidentified work on Arabic grammar: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-ʻawn. Yulāʼimuhu li-yakūna ʻalá wajh akmal al-istīʻāb. Inna istīʻāb al-ḥamd li-kilā al-maʻnayayn, aʻnī maʻná al-maʻlūm wa-maʻná majhūl. al-Istighrāq, ay, istighrāq al-ḥamd li-kull fard, wa-al-naql min al-waṣfīyah ilá al-ismīyah, fa-ifham. Qīla li-iʻtirāḍ ʻalá jaʻl al-shān fī mā yatalaffaẓu bi-hi al-insān, wa-al-lafẓ aʻamm min an yakūna mufradan, aw murakkaban bi-annahu lā yaṣiḥḥu iṭlāq al-lafẓ ʻalá al-murakkabāt bi-iʻtibār al-aṣl, li-annahu fī al-aṣl maṣdar, fa-huwa ism jins yashmalu al-kathīrīn ʻalá sabīl al-badal, lā ʻalá sabīl al-ijtimāʻ, fa-lā yakūnu iṭlāquhu bi-iʻtibār aṣlihi illā ʻalá wāḥid wāḥid, wa-lā yaṣiḥḥu iṭlāq al-lafẓ ʻalá majmūʻ al-lafẓīyah ..."
Secundo folio of Unidentified commentary on an unidentified work on Arabic grammar: wa-huwa buṭlān thubūtihi bi-al-qiyās.

2. Incipit of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá 'Sharḥ Īsāghūjī': "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn. Qāla: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-wājib wujūduhu. Aqūlu: Iftataḥa kitābahu bi-al-ḥamd baʻda al-ibtidāʼ bi-al-Basmalah, li-anna adāʼ al-wājib min shukr naʻmāʼihi wājib. al-Ḥamd huwa al-waṣf bi-al-jamīl ʻalá jihat al-taʻẓīm wa-al-tabjīl. Qaṣada awfá hādhā al-taʻrīf ishāratan ilá anna mawrid al-ḥamd huwa al-lisān waḥdahu, li-anna al-mafhūm min lafẓ al-waṣf ḍimnan huwa dhikr al-lisān, fa-innaka in qulta waṣaftu Zaydan bi-kadhā lam yatabādir minhu illā fiʻl al-lisān ..."
2. Secundo folio of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá 'Sharḥ Īsāghūjī: wa-lam yataḥaqqaq hādhā fī al-akhras.

3. Incipit Sharḥ Īsāghūjī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-wājib wujūduhu, al-mumtaniʻ naẓīruhu, wa-al-mumkin siwāhu wa-ghayruhu, al-ṣādir bi-ikhtiyārihi sharruhu wa-khayruhu, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad alladhī intashara nahyuhu wa-amruhu, wa-ālihi al-makhtaṣṣīn bi-mā lā yudraku ghawruhu. Ammā baʻd, fa-inna kitāb al-Shaykh al-Imām, qudwat al-ḥukamāʼ Athīr al-Dīn al-Abharī, ṭayyaba Allāh tharāhu wa-jaʻala al-Jannah maʼwāh, al-mashhūr bi-Īsāghūjī, lammā kāna ʻalá baʻḍ al-ikhwān mutaʻassir, wa-ʻalá baʻḍihim muyassaran, aradtu an aktuba bi-iltimāsihim awrāqan li-tuzīla taʻassurahu wa-tuʻammima tayassurahu, wa-Allāh khayr al-muyassirīn wa-al-muwaffiqīn ..."
3.Secundo folio of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī: juzʼ la-hu lākin lā maʻná la-hu.

4. Incipit of Kitāb Īsāghūjī: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Naḥmadu Allāh ʻalá tawfīqihi wa-nasʼaluhu hidāyat ṭarīqih, wa-nuṣallī ʻalá Muḥammad wa-ʻashīratih wa-ālih. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi risālah fī al-manṭiq, awradnā fīhā mā yajibu istiḥḍāruhu li-man yabtadiʼu shayʼan min al-ʻulūm, mustaʻīnan billāh, innahu mufḍī al-khayr wa-al-jūd. Īsāghūjī, al-lafẓ al-dāll ʻalá tamām mā wuḍiʻa la-hu bi-al-muṭābaqah, wa-ʻalá juzʼihi bi-al-taḍammun, in kāna la-hu juzʼ, wa-ʻalá mā yulāzimuhu min al-dhihn bi-al-iltizām ka-al-insān, fa-innahu yadullu ʻalá al-ḥayawān al-nāṭiq bi-al-muṭābaqah ..."
4. Secundo folio of Kitāb Īsāghūjī: an yuqāla li-qāʼilihi innahu ṣādiq fīhi aw kādhib.
16 x 21.5 cm; written surface: varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: Remnant of light brown leather on the deteriorated cover, exposing manuscript waste.

In fair naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on thick white laid paper; some headings written on the margin; some in red; the phrases of the original preceded by the word "Qāla" (he said) in bold script; extensive commentaries on the margins and interlinear of the second manuscript; catchwords.
On the label pasted to the front cover (probably an ownership statement): "Ṣamad ibn Jalabī."
On folio 1a: A quotation from "Baḥr al-Jawāhir [could not be identified]" on "Ṣalāt al-kaffārah [Prayer of atonement]".
On folio 1a: Meteorological and astronomical quotations (in Persian), mostly illegible and fading.
On the upper right margin of folio 1b cover (probably an ownership statement): "Kitāb Ṣamad ibn Jalabī."
On the left margin of folio 2a: "Ḥāshiyat ʻAbd al-Ghafūr." And "Ḥasan Afandī Ḥasan."
On folio 27b: Miscellaneous quotations.
At the head of folio 86a (in red): "Hādhā kitāb Īsāghūjī."
1. Colophon of Unidentified commentary on an unidentified work on Arabic grammar: "Tammat tamām shad. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb. Ḥarrama Allāh laḥma kātibihi ʻalá al-nār. Tārīkh sanat 1162."

1. Translation of the colophon of Unidentified commentary on an unidentified work on Arabic grammar: "It is completed. God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. May God deliver the flesh of its copyist from fire. Dated in the year 1162 [of the Hijrah = 1748/1749]."

2. Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ Īsāghūjī ends with: "... wa-al-ghalaṭ fīhi min ḥayth anna mawḍūʻ al-muqaddamatayn laysa bi-maqṣūd, idh laysa shayʼ mawjūd yaṣduqu ʻalayhi annahu insān wa-faras, wa-kawaḍʻ al-qaḍīyah al-ṭabīʻīyah maqām al-kullīyah, ka-qawlinā al-insān ḥayawān, wa-al-ḥayawān jins, yantuju an al-insān jins, aw muʼallaf ʻan muqaddimāt wahmīyah kādhibah wa-ghayr muṭābiqah lil-wāqiʻ, wa-hiya qaḍīyah yaḥkumu fīhā wahm al-inshāʼ, wa-fī umūr ghayr maḥsūsah qiyāsan ʻalá al-umūr al-maḥsūsah, kamā yaḥkum bi-anna kull mawjūd wa-mutakhayyar li-annahu yudrakān, wa-kull mushāhad maḥsūs fa-huwa mutakhayyar. Wa-al-gharaḍ min al-mughālaṭah taghlīṭ al-khaṣm wa-dafʻuhu."
2. Colophon of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ Īsāghūjī: "Tamma al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb."
2. Translation of the colophon of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá 'Sharḥ Īsāghūjī: "The book was completed by the help of God the Abundant Giving King."

3. Sharḥ Īsāghūjī ends with: "... wa-minhā al-mughālaṭah, wa-hiya qiyās murakkab min muqaddimāt kādhibah shabīhah bi-al-ḥaqq, aw bi-al-mashhūrah, aw murakkabah min muqaddimāt wahmīyah kādhibah. Wa-al-ghalaṭ, immā min jihat al-ṣūrah, aw min jihat al-maʻná. Ammā mā yakūnu min jihat al-ṣūrah, fa-kaqawlinā li-ṣūrat al-faras al-manqūsh ʻalá al-judrān innahā faras, wa-kull faras ṣahhāl, yantuju anna tilka al-ṣūrah ṣahhālah. Wa-ammā mā yakūnu min jihat al-maʻná, fa-ka-qawlinā kull insān wa-faras fa-huwa insān, wa-kull insān wa-faras fa-huwa faras, yantuju anna baʻḍ al-insān faras. Wa-iʻlam anna mā ʻalayhi al-iʻtimād wa-al-taʻwīl min hādhihi al-qiyāsāt innamā huwa al-burhān li-kawnihi murakkaban min al-muqaddimāt al-yaqīnīyah."

3. Colophon of Sharḥ Īsāghūjī: "Wa-li-yakun hādhā ākhir mā katabnāhu min al-awrāq li-īḍāḥ mā fī kitāb Īsāghūjī. Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-ʻAzīz al-Wahhāb, ʻalá yad al-ḥaqīr al-faqīr Qadar Minallāh [Qadar Min Allāh] ibn Bik Muḥammad ibn Baysam Ḥāfiẓ, ṣānahā [ṣānahumā] Allāh taʻālá ʻan āfāt al-dunyā wa-al-ākhir. Sanat 11[... ...?]."

3. Translation of the colophon of Ḥāshiyah ʻalá 'Sharḥ Īsāghūjī': "Let this be the end of what we wrote of these leaflets to elucidate what is in the book of Īsāghūjī. The book was completed by the help of the Almighty, the Abundant Giving, by the hand of wretched poor Qadar Minallāh [Min Allāh] ibn Bik Muḥammad ibn Baysam Ḥāfiẓ, may God protect both from the calamities of this world and the hereafter. In the year 11[... ...?]."

4. Kitāb Īsāghūjī ends with: "... Wa-al-jadal huwa qiyās muʼallaf [min] muqaddimāt mashhūrah. Wa-al-khiṭābah qiyās murakkabah min muqaddimāt maqbūlah ʻan shurūṭ muʻtaqad fīhā, aw maẓnūnah. Wa-al-shiʻr qiyās muʼallaf min muqaddimāt kādhibah tanbasiṭu minhā al-nafs, aw tanqabiḍ. Wa-al-mughālaṭah, wa-hiya qiyās muʼallaf min muqaddimāt shabīhah bi-al-ḥaqq, aw al-mashhūr, aw muqaddimāt wahmīyah kādhibah. Fa-al-ʻumdah huwa al-burhān, lā ghayruh."
4. Colophon of Kitāb Īsāghūjī: "Wa-li-yakun hādhā ākhir al-risālah fī al-manṭiq. Tammat bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá."
4. Translation of the colophon of Kitāb Īsāghūjī: "Let this be the end of the epistle on logic. It was completed by the help of God Almighty."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Fatḥ al-Qarīb al-Mujīb fī Sharḥ alfāẓ al-Taqrīb : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Birmāwī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala al-tafaqquh fī al-dīn min aʻamm al-maqṣūdāt, wa-ajalla al-ʻulamāʼ bi-al-tawfīq lil-khayr wa-al-ṭāʻāt, wa-khaṣṣahum bi-al-maʻrifah fī ʻilm al-fiqh li-annahu min aʻẓam al-muhimmāt, wa-zādahum faḍlan wa-sharafan fa-ṣārū ʻindahu fī arfaʻ al-darajāt. Aḥmaduhu subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá ḥamdan yadfaʻu ʻannā al-balīyāt, wa-ashkuruhu ʻalá mā ḥaqqa ʻalaynā bi-hi min niʻmat al-Islām, fa-hiya min aʻẓam al-minnāt ... Ammā baʻd, fa-lammā kāna waladī Aḥmad mimman waffaqahum Allāh taʻālá lil-Irshād lil-ʻilm, wa-kāna fī badʼ amrihi mimmā aḥabb ilayhi qirāʼat wa-muṭālaʻat Sharḥ al-Ghāyah, lil-ʻAllāmah al-Ghazzī, saʼalanī an umliyahu ʻalayhi ḥāshiyah laṭīfah yantafiʻu bi-hā, fa-ajabtuhu ilá suʼālih ..."
Secundo folio: wa-ṣughrá fa-al-kubrá khilāfat al-Rasūl.
16 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 13 x 18 cm; 24-27 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white laid paper; no notes or corrections on the margins; some leaves seem to be missing or misplaced; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-ʻAllāmah al-Birmāwī, ʻalá Sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah Ibn Qāsim al-Shāfiʻī, ʻalayhimā saḥāʼib al-raḥmah wa-al-ruḍwān. Āmīn."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... li-anna al-dūd wa-naḥwahu qad yufsiduhā bi-tark dhālik, wa-kull min al-hawāʼ wa-ʻubūq rāʼiḥat al-arḍ bi-hā yadfaʻuhā. Ḥattá law lam yajid man yalbas al-thawb al-ḥarīr, fa-yajūzu la-hu libsuhā, bal yajibu ʻalayhi dhālik, bi-maʻná an yaḍmanahu, lā annahu yaʼthamu bi-tarkihi, wa-yalzamuhu ayḍan siyāsat al-dābbah qadran yandafiʻu bi-hi rihānuhā. Wa-ammā law wajada man yajūzu la-hu libsuhā lākinnahu imtanaʻa min dhālik illā bi-ujrah, fa-hal la-hu an yalbasahā ʻinda dhālik wa-yakūnu ʻudhran la-hu fī dafʻ al-ḥurmah ʻanhu, wa-annahu yadfaʻu al-amr ilá al-ḥākim, fa-yajʻalu la-hu ujrah maʻlūmah. Ẓāhir kalāmihim wujūb al-libs. Wa-naẓara fīhi Shaykhunā al-Shabrāmallisī, wa-qāla yanbaghī la-hu rafʻ al-amr lil-ḥākim fa-yastaʼjir la-hu man yalbasuhā ..."

record.title: 880-01 Awrād wa-aḥzāb Ṣūfīyah : manuscript.
record.note: Title of the collection supplied by cataloger. Titles of the individual seven manuscripts are also supplied by the cataloger, based on information from the texts.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Of manuscript 1. only the following text remains: "Wird al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Kīlānī": "Wird Sayyidī al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Kīlānī, quddisa sirruhu. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Huwa Allāh alladhī lā ilāha illā huwa, al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, al-Malik al-Quddūs, al-Salām, al-Muʼmin, al-Muhayymin, al-ʻAzīz, al-Jabbār, al-Mutakabbir, al-Khāliq al-Bāriʼ, al-Muṣawwir, al-Ghaffār, al-Qahhār, al-Wahhāb, al-Razzāq, al-Fattāḥ, al-ʻAlīm, al-Qābiḍ, al-Bāsiṭ, al-Khāfiḍ, al-rāfiʻ ..."
1. Secundo folio of manuscript 1. No second folio. Only folio 1b is left of the first manuscript.

2. Incipit of manuscript 2. "Awrād al-layl wa-al-nahār li-ayyām al-usbūʻ al-sabʻah". The beginning is missing. Text starts with part of "Wird yawm al-Aḥad", as follows: "... wa-qūwatī, wa-irḥam ʻajzī wa-fāqatī, fa-qad ḍāqa ṣadrī, wa-tāha fikrī, wa-taḥayyartu fī amrī, wa-Anta al-ʻālim bi-sirrī wa-jahrī, al-mālik li-nafʻī wa-ḍurrī, al-qādir ʻalá tafrīj karabī wa-taysīr ʻusrī. Rabbi irḥam man ʻaẓuma maraḍuhu, wa-ʻazza shifāʼuhu, wa-kathura dāʼuhu, wa-qalla dawāʼuhu ..."
2. Secundo folio of manuscript 2. "Awrād al-layl wa-al-nahār li-ayyām al-usbūʻ al-sabʻah": muṣāb qad baʻuda ʻan al-ahl wa-al-awṭān.

3. Incipit of manuscript 3. "Munājāh": "Hādhihi Munājāt [munājāh] Ibn ʻAṭāʼ Allāh al-Iskandarī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu. Ilāhī anā al-faqīr fī ghināy, fa-kayfa lā akūnu faqīran fī faqrī. Ilāhī anā al-jāhil fī ʻilmī, fa-kayfa lā akūnu jahūlan fī jahlī. Ilāhī inna ikhtilāf tadbīrika, wa-surʻat ḥulūl maqādīrika saʻā [manaʻā] ʻibādaka al-ʻārifūn [al-ʻārifīn] bi-ka ʻan al-sukūn ilá ʻaṭāʼ, wa-al-yaʼs minka fī balāʼ ..."
3. Secundo folio of manuscript 3. "Munājāh": minnī wa-mā abʻdanī ʻanka.

4. Incipit of manuscript 4. "al-Dawr al-aʻlá": "Hādhā 'Ḥizb' Sayyidī Muḥyī al-Dīn ibn ʻArab[ī], quddisa sirruhu al-ʻazīz, al-musammá bi-'al-Durr al-aʻlā' [al-Dawr al-aʻlá] . Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yā Ḥayy, Yā Qayyūm, bi-ka taḥaṣṣantu, fa-iḥminī bi-ḥimāyah kifāyah, wiqāyah ḥaqīqīyah, burhān ḥirz amān bismillāh, wa-adkhilnī Yā Awwal, Yā Ākhir fī ghayb maknūn, sirr kanz dāʼirat Mā shāʼa Allāh, lā qūwata illā billāh, wa-asbil Yā Sattār, Yā Ḥalīm ʻalayya kanafa ḥijāb ṣiyānat najāh ..."
4. Secundo folio of manuscript 4. "al-Dawr al-aʻlá": dhātika dhālika khayr dhālika.

5. Incipit of manuscript 5. "Qaṣīdat ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz al-Zamzamī": "Li-Sayyidī al-Shaykh al-fāḍil, al-akmal, al-ʻārif billāh ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz al-Zamzamī, quddisa sirruhu. al-Nāsu qad shughilū bi-al-māli wa-al-amali // fa-mayyalū ʻan ṭarīq al-ʻilmi wa-al-ʻamali. Ẓannū bi-annahumu lā yusʼalūna ghadan // ʻammā janawhu min al-āthāmi wa-al-zalali ..."
5. Secundo folio of manuscript 5. "Qaṣīdat ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz al-Zamzamī": Sīrū ilá Aḥmada al-Mukhtāri fa-huwa lahā.

6. Incipit of manuscript 6. "Wird al-Khalwatīyah al-shahīr bi-al-Wasāʼil": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yaqra: al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, Malik Yawm al-Dīn, Īyāka naʻbudu, wa-Īyāka nastaʻīn, Ihdinā al-ṣirāṭa al-mustaqīm, ṣirāṭa alladhīna anʻamata ʻalayhim, ghayri al-maghḍūbi ʻalayhim, wa-lā al-ḍāllīn. Āmīn. Thumma yaqraʼu baʻdahā Sūrat al-Dukhān ilá ākhirihā ..."
6. Secundo folio of manuscript 6. "Wird al-Khalwatīyah al-shahīr bi-al-Wasāʼil": wa-al-Ākhirah khayrun wa-abqá.

7. Incipit of "Silsilat Mashāyikh Ṭarīqat al-Khalwatīyah": "Wa-hādhihi 'Silsilat Mashāyikh Ṭarīqat al-Khalwatīyah', raḍiya Allāh ʻanhum. al-Shaykh al-Sayyid Muḥammad al-ʻAbbāsī al-Khalwatī al-Ṣāliḥī, al-mutalaqqin dhālika min shaykhihi wa-ustādhihi al-Shaykh Muḥammad Shāh Walī ibn Qabā Nāyib al-ʻIntābī, al-mutalaqqin dhālika min shaykhihi al-Shaykh Yaʻqūb al-ʻIntābī, al-mutalaqqin dhālika min shaykhihi wa-ustādhihi al-Shaykh Shams al-Dīn al-Rūmī al-Khalwatī ..."
8 x 15.3 cm; written surface varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: In rose color cardboard with dark brown leather on spine.
The codex is written in different hands, in fair to good naskh script, in black ink, on thin beige paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Wird al-Ghawth al-Aʻẓam wa-al-sirr al-mubham wa-al-nūr al-Raḥmānī wa-al-sirr al-Ṣamadānī, Sayyidinā wa-Ustādhinā al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Kīlānī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-arḍāh, wa-raḍiya ʻannā bi-hi, wa-ʻan sāyir al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: A quotation from "... Sayyidī Abū Bakr Muḥammad ibn Ḥāmid ..."
At the head of folio 1a: A "ḥilyah" (decoration) in in black and red.
Some leaves seem to be missing between folios 1 and 2.
On folio 32b: Miscellaneous quotations in prose and poetry.
On folio 33a: An invocation "duʻā" of al-Shaykh Muḥyī al-Dīn al-Akbar (Ibn ʻArabī), quoted by ʻAbd al-Karīm al-Jīlī (Jīlī, ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn Ibrāhīm, 1365 or 1366-) in his book "Ḥaqīqat al-ḥaqāʼiq".
On folio 34b: "Mawwāl" (colloquial form of sung poetry), attributed to al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Nābulusī (1641-1731), in six verses, refuting the prohibition of "shurb al-tutun" (smoking tobacco).
On folio 33a: A "fāʼidah" (popular useful advice/recipe) on how to expel mosquitos: "Fāʼidah. Tubakhkhir al-makān bi-al-filfil yadhhabu al-baqq minhu. Mujarrab."
On folio 40a-41b: Miscellaneous quotations and invocations in poetry and prose, in different hands.
On folio 42a: "Duʻāʼ lil-Ṭāʻūn" (Invocation against the plague).
On folios 42b-43a: Anecdotes about Aḥmad ibn al-Rifāʻī (probably the master Ṣufī Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Rifāʻī, 1106?-1182)
At the head of folio 43b: "Hādhā Wird al-Khalwatīyah al-shahīr bi-al-Wasāʼil."

Included in "Wird al-Khalwatīyah" (folios 51b-53a): "Qaṣīdat al-Munfarijah" of Abū Ḥāmid al-Ghazzālī (1058-1111). It starts with: "al-Shiddatu awdat bi-al-muhaji // Yā Rabbu fa-ʻajjil bi-al-faraji. Wa-al-anfusu aḍḥat fī ḥarajin // wa-bi-yadika tafrīju al-ḥaraji. Hājat li-duʻāka khawāṭirunā // fa-al-waylu lahā in lam taliji. It ends with: "... Yā Rabbu bi-him wa-bi-ālihim // ʻajjil bi-al-naṣri maʻa al-faraji. Wa-ikhtim ʻamalī bi-khawātimihā // li-akūna ghadan fī al-ḥashri najī."

On folio 55b: An anecdote about Dhū al-Nūn al-Miṣrī (Thawbān ibn Ibrāhīm, -approximately 861), quoted from "al-Ṭabaqāt al-kubrá" of al-Shaʻrānī (ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn Aḥmad, approximately 1493-1565 or 1566), and an invocation.
1. The first manuscript "Wird al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Kīlānī": ends with: "... XXXXX

2. Colophon of the second manuscript "Awrād al-layl wa-al-nahār li-ayyām al-usbūʻ al-sabʻah": No colophon. Text ends with: "... wa-asʼaluka Allāhumma ḥaml dhālika li-dhātī ʻalá yad fasīḥ nasīm ḥayātī li-arwāḥ taḥīyātī fī ṣalawātika al-ṭayyibāt, wa-taslīmātika al-dāʼimāt ʻalá wasīlat ḥuṣūl al-maṭālib, wa-waṣlat [waṣlah] wuṣūl al-ḥabāyib, wa-ʻalá kull mansūb ilayhi fī kull al-marātib. Innaka al-Ḥaqq al-mubīn. Wa-ijʻalnā min khawāṣṣ khuddāmihim. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Subḥāna Rabbika Rabbi al-ʻIzzati ʻammā yaṣifūn, wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

3. Colophon of the third manuscript: "Munājāh": No colophon. Text ends with: "... wa-Anta al-Jawwād bi-al-ʻaṭāʼ min qabl ṭalab al-ṭālibīn, wa-Anta al-Wahhāb lanā. Thumma Anta limā wahabtanā min al-mustaqraḍīn. Ilāhī uṭlubnī bi-raḥmika [bi-raḥmatika] ḥatta aṣila ilayk. Ilāhī inna rajāʼī lā yanqaṭiʻu mink wa-in ʻaṣītuka, kamā anna khawfī lā yuzāyilunī wa-in aṭʻ[tuka]. Ilāhī qad dafaʻatnī al-ʻawālim ilayk, qad awqafanī ʻil[mī] bi-karamika ʻalayk."

4. Colophon of the fourth manuscript: "al-Dawr al-aʻlá": No colophon. Text ends with: "... Asʼaluka bi-ḥurmat hādhihi al-asmāʼ wa-al-āyāt wa-al-kalimāt, asʼaluka sulṭānan nāṣiran, wa-rizqan kathīran, wa-qalban qarīran, wa-ʻilmn ghazīran, wa-ʻamalan barīran, wa-qabran munīran, wa-ḥisāban yasīran, wa-mulkan kabīran. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-al-Fātiḥah ilá rūḥ al-qāriʼ wa-al-kātib wa-ilá jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-mayyitīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Allāhumma ṣallī ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad Khātim al-Nabīyīn wa-al-Mursalīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

5. Colophon of the fifth manuscript: "Qaṣīdat ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz al-Zamzamī". No colophon. The poem ends with: "... Madḥtu khayra al-wará arjū shafāʻatahu // ʻinda al-ṣrāṭi wa-hādhā muntahā suʼulī. Thumma al-ṣalātu ʻalá al-Mukhtāri Sayyidinā // khayri al-khalīqati min ḥāfin wa-muntaʻili."

6. Colophon of the sixth manuscript "Wird al-Khalwatīyah": No colophon. Text ends with: "... Wa-raḍiya Allāh tabāraka wa-taʻālá ʻan sādātinā dhawī al-qadr al-jalī Abī Bakrin wa-ʻUmara wa-ʻUthmāna wa-ʻAlī, wa-ʻan sāʼir aṣḥāb Rasūl Allāh ajmaʻīn, wa-al-tābiʻīn lahum bi-iḥsānin ilá Yawm al-Dīn, iḥshirnā wa-irḥamnā maʻahum bi-raḥmatika, Yā Arḥam al-Rāḥimīn. Yā Allāh, Yā Ḥayy, Yā Qayyūm, lā ilāha illā Anta. Yā Allāh, Yā Rabbanā, Yā wāsiʻ al-maghfirah, Yā Arḥam al-Rāḥimīn. Āmīn. Thumma yadhkuru Allāh ilá an yaṭluʻa al-fajr, thumma yuṣallī al-ṣubḥ. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

7. "Silsilat Mashāyikh Ṭarīqat al-Khalwatīyah" ends with: "... al-Ṭāʼī, al-mutalaqqin dhālika min shaykhihi wa-ustādhihi al-ʻAjamī, al-mutalaqqin dhālika min shaykhihi wa-ustādhihi al-Baṣrī, al-mutalaqin dhālika min shaykhihi wa-ustādhihi ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib, al-mutalaqqin dhālika min shaykhihi wa-ustādhihi wa-ibn ʻammihi Nabīyinā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, bi-wāsiṭat al-Rūḥ al-Amīn Jubraʼīl, ʻan Ḥaḍrat Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn."
7. Colophon of the seventh manuscript: "Silsilat Mashāyikh Ṭarīqat al-Khalwatīyah": "Sawwadahu afqar al-wará, ʻAlī Ṭuʻmah ibn Aḥmad Biqāʻī, sanat alf wa 10, sanat 1132."

7. Translation of the colophon of "Silsilat Mashāyikh Ṭarīqat al-Khalwatīyah": "Copied by the poorest of mankind, ʻAlī Ṭuʻmah ibn Aḥmad Biqāʻī, in the year one-thousand and 10 [?], year 1132 [of the Hijrah = 1719/1720]."

record.title: 880-02 Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī al-mukhtār : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Jazūlī.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā lil-īmān wa-al-islām, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Muḥammad Nabīyihi alladhī istanqadhanā bi-hi min ʻibādat al-awthān wa-al-aṣnām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-nujabāʼ al-bararah al-kirām ..."
Secundo folio: mā taʻlamu wa-al-tark li-sayyiʼ mā taʻlam.
10.5 x 15 cm; written surface: 5.7 x 9.5; 9 lines per page.
Binding: In dark red leather, with flap; cover and flap tooled with geometric design.

In good naskh script, in black ink on thin laid beige paper; headings and keywords in red; large gold dot at the end of sentences; text fully vocalized, within red frame, folio 1b decorated in red, blue and gold, within large gold frame; extensive commentaries in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish on the margins; some collations with other copies; catchwords.

On the right margin of folio 1b: A note by al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Madanī (could not be identified), as follows: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-kafá, wa-salāmuhu ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhina iṣṭafá. Ammā baʻd, fa-lammā raʼaytu iqbāl al-nās ʻalá qirāʼat 'Dalāʼil al-khayrāt', wa-huwa jadīr bi-dhālik, lākin minhu nusakh kathīrah Sahlīyah, wa-ghayruhā, aḥbabtu an adhkurahā mumayyazah, bi-an ajʻala al-Sahlīyah maktūbah bi-midād aswad ghāliban, wa-mā yukhālifuhā, in kānat nuskhatan badal mā fī al-nuskhah al-Sahlīyah, aktubuhā bi-midād akhḍar, wa-in kānat zāʼidah ʻalayhā aktubuhā bi-midād aḥmar, wa-aktubu al-fuṣūl bi-aḥmar ayḍan. Katabahu al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Madanī."
Some leaves seem to be missing between folios 1 and 2.

On folios 90b-93b: An invocation by al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Nakhlī al-Makkī (could not be identified). It starts, as follows: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Allāhumma ishraḥ bi-al-ṣalāh ʻalayhi ṣudūranā, wa-yassir bi-hā umūranā, wa-farrij bi-hā humūmanā, wa-ikshif bi-hā ghmūmanā, wa-ighfir bi-hā dhunūbanā, wa-iqḍi bi-hā duyūnanā." And ends with: "... wa-ikhtim bi-al-saʻādah ājālanā. Hādhā dhullunā ẓāhirun bayna yadayk, wa-ḥālunā lā yakhfá ʻalayk. Amartanā fa-taraknā, wa-nahaytanā fa-rakibnā, wa-lā yasaʻunā illā ʻafwuka, fa-uʻfu ʻannā yā khayra maʼmūl wa-akrama masʼūl. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam taslīman. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

On the lower right margin of folio 90b: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, Huwa ākhir al-kitāb fī al-nuskhah al-Sahlīyah, ʻalá mā ʻinda jaddī, lil-Imām Abī al-ʻAbbās Aḥmad ibn Yūsuf al-Fāsī, raḥimahumā Allāh taʻālá, wa-ʻinda ghayrihi ʻanhā, kamā fī ghayrihā ziyādat wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ilá ākhirihi. Wa-zāda fī baʻḍ al-nusakh: Wa-huwa ḥasbunā wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Fāsī."
On the lower right margin of folio 93b: Two verses of poetry in Ottoman Turkish.

Colophon: No colophon. The text of "Dalāʼil al-khayrāt" ends on folio 90b, as follows: "... Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Allāhumma ighfir li-muʼallifihi wa-irḥamhu, wa-ijʻalhu min al-maḥshūrīn fī zumrat al-Nabīyīn wa-al-Ṣiddiqīn Yawm al-Qiyāmah, bi-faḍlika Yā Raḥmān. Min al-Fāsī Sahlīyah."

record.title: 880-02 Majmūʻ al-aḥzāb wa-al-awrād al-Bakrīyah : manuscript / Muṣṭafá ibn Kamāl al-Dīn al-Bakrī al-Ṣiddīqī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Māliki Yawm al-Dīn. Īyāka naʻbudu wa-Īyāka nastaʻīn. Ihdinā al-ṣirāṭ al-mustaqīm. Ṣirāṭ alladhīna anʻamta ʻalyhim, ghayri al-maghḍūbi ʻalayhim wa-lā al-ḍāllīn. Āmīn ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-fulk allatī tajrī fī al-baḥr.
10.7 x 15.6 cm; written surface: 7 x 10 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; brown leather on spine.
In good large naskh script, in black ink, on laid white paper; keywords and markings in red; few corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Majmūʻ al-aḥzāb wa-al-awrād al-Bakrīyah, lil-Ustādh al-aʻẓam wa-al-malāz [al-malādh] al-afkham al-akram, Shaykh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, wa-ʻumdat al-ʻulamāʼ al-ʻālimīn al-ʻāmilīn, Mawlānā wa-Ustādhunā, farīd ʻaṣrihi wa-awānihi, al-Shaykh Abū al-Ḥasan al-Bakrī al-Ṣiddīqī al-Shāfiʻī, ṣibṭ [sibṭ] Āl al-Ḥasan, taghammadahu Allāh bi-al-raḥmah wa-al-ruḍwān, wa-askanahu aʻlá farādīs al-jinān, bi-mannihi wa-karamih, wa-nafaʻanā Allāh wa-al-Muslimīn bi-hi. Āmīn. Bi-jāh Sayyid al-Mursalīn. M."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... tubdī al-ʻajāyib min shuʼūni maʻrifatika, wa-tuẓhiru al-gharāʼib min masarrāt Ḥaḍratika, wa-tarshuqu bi-hā min thanāyā zaharāti tawḥīdika rayyiqa ghamāʼim tanazzulātika, wa-tushriqu bi-hā barāʻāt ʻibārāt al-taḥdīth ʻan taʻyīnātika. Allāhumma, wa-lamsan ḥassāsan bi-mubāsharat hayākili al-nūr madrakan li-maẓāhir al-buṭūn wa-al-ẓuhūr, lā yaqaʻu illā ʻalá asṭiḥat al-ajrām al-nūrānīyah, wa-lā yamāssu ghayr al-taʻayyunāt ..."

record.title: 880-01 Awrād Ṣūfīyah : manuscript.
record.note: Title of the collection supplied by cataloger. Titles of the individual three manuscripts supplied by the cataloger based on information from their texts.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of manuscript 1. "Awrād al-usbūʻ al-laylīyāt wa-al-nahārīyāt": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá ḥusn tawfīqih, wa-asʼaluhu al-hidāyah ṭariqih [ṭarīqih] wa-ilahām al-ḥaqq bi-taḥqīqih, wa-qalban muʼminan bi-taṣdīqih, wa-ʻaqlan nūrānīyan bi-ʻināyat tasbīqih, wa-rūḥan rūḥānīyan bi-tashrīqih, wa-nafsan muṭmaʼinnatan min al-jahl wa-taṭbīqih, wa-fahman lammāʻan bi-ilmāʻ al-fikr wa-barīqih ..."
1. Secundo folio of manuscript 1. bi-salsabīl al-fatḥ wa-raḥīqih.

2. Incipit of manuscript 2. "Awrād al-ayyām al-sabʻah": "Hādhihi 'Awrād al-ayyām al-sabʻah li-Sayyidinā al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī, qaddasa Allāh sirrahu al-ʻazīz. Āmīn. Hādhā wird yawm al-Aḥad. Huwa Allāh alladhī lā ilāha illā Huwa, al-Jamīl, al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, al-Laṭīf, al-Ḥalīm, al-Raʼūf, al-ʻAfūw, al-Muʼmin, al-Naṣīr, al-Mujīb, al-Mughīth, al-Sarīʻ, al-Karīm, Dhū al-Jalāl wa-al-Ikrām ..."
2. Secundo folio of manuscript 2. "Awrād al-ayyām al-sabʻah": yaqṭaʻu ʻanhu īlām.

3. Incipit of manuscript 3. "Awrād al-yawm al-sittah": "Wa-hādhā 'Wird al-isharāq' lil-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jalān [al-Jīlānī], qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahu. Ashraqa nūr Allāh, wa-ẓahara kalām Allāh, wa-thabat amr Allāh, wa-nafadha ḥukm Allāh. Istaʻantu billāh, tawakkaltu ʻalá Allāh, mā shāʼa Allāh, wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh. Taḥaṣṣantu bi-khafī luṭf Allāh wa-bi-laṭīf ṣunʻ Allāh ..."
3. Secundo folio of manuscript 3. "Awrād al-yawm al-sittah": ʻuyūnī [ʻuyūn] al-qawm al-ẓālimīn bi-qudratik.
10 x 15 cm; 5.5 x 12; 13 lines per page.
Binding: marbled cardboard with flap; red leather on spine, the edges, and flap.

The codex is written in different hands, in good naskh script, in black ink, on thin laid white paper; headings, keywords, and markings in red; texts fully vocalized; few corrections on the margins; catchwords.
Inside the front cover: "GAL 1, 447 (121)."
At the head of folio 1b: "Hādhihi 'Awrād al-usbūʻ al-laylīyāt wa-al-nahārīyāt' lil-Shaykh al-Akbar Muḥyī al-Dīn, qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu."

1. Colophon of the first manuscript "Awrād al-usbūʻ al-laylīyāt wa-al-nahārīyāt": "Tammat al-Awrād bi-ḥamd Allāh. Wa-qad kammalahā al-faqīr al-Sayyid ʻAbd al-Ghanī ibn al-Sayyid Diyāb Hāshim, ghafara Allāh la-hu. Āmīn. Ḥurrira 15 Dhilḥijjah, sant 1266."

1. Translation of the colophon of the first manuscript "Awrād al-usbū al-laylīyāt wa-al-nahārīyāt": "The Awrād are completed. Copied by the poor ʻAbd al-Ghanī ibn al-Sayyid Diyāb Hāshim, may God forgive him. Amen. Dated, 15 Dhilḥijjah, of the year 1266 [22 October 1850]."

2. Colophon of the second manuscript "Awrād al-ayyām al-sabʻah": No colophon. Text ends with: "... Allāhumma kun lī jāran min sharrihim, jalla thanāʼuka, wa-ʻazza jāruka, wa-lā ilāha ghayruka, tafʻalu mā tashāʼ, wa-Anta ʻalá kull shayʼ qadīr. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

3. Colophon of the third manuscript: "Awrād al-yawm al-sittah": The manuscript ends with "Wird al-ʻishāʼ wa-huwa al-ḥizb al-ṣaghīr", as follows: "... Allāhumma ṣallī ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-sābiq lil-khalq nūruhu, wa-al-raḥmah lil-ʻālamīn ẓuhūruhu, ʻadada man maḍá min khalqika wa-man baqiya, wa-man saʻada minhum wa-man shaqiya, ṣalātan tastaghriqu al-ʻadd wa-tuḥīṭu bi-al-ḥadd, ṣalātan lā ghāyah la-hā wa-lā intihāʼ, wa-lā amad wa-lā inqiḍāʼ, ṣalātaka allatī ṣallayta ʻalayhi, ṣalātan dāʼimatan bi-dawāmik, bāqiyatan bi-baqāʼik, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-ʻatratihi kadhālika, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá dhālika."

record.title: Sufi invocations in prose and poetry : manuscript / by Muṣṭafá ibn Kamāl al-Dīn al-Bakrī al-Ṣiddīqī.
record.note: 1. Title of "Wird al-saḥar" from folio 1a.
2. Title of the first poem "Ilāhī bi-ahl al-dhikr wa-al-mashhadi al-asmá" supplied by cataloger, based on the opening verse of the poem.
3. Title of "al-Qaṣīdah al-Munbahijah" from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Wird al-saḥar": "Aʻūdhu billāhi mina al-Shayṭāni al-Rajīm. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Māliki Yawm al-Dīn. Īyāka naʻbudu wa-Īyāka nastaʻīn. Ihdinā al-ṣirāṭ al-mustaqīm. Ṣirāṭ alladhīna anʻamta ʻalyhim, ghayri al-maghḍūbi ʻalayhim wa-lā al-ḍāllīn ..."
1. Secundo folio of "Wird al-saḥar": Alif Lām Mīm. Dhālika al-Kitābu lā rayba fīhi.

2. Incipit of "Ilāhī bi-ahl al-dhikr wa-al-mashhadi al-asmá": "Ilāhī bi-ahl al-dhikr wa-al-mashhadi al-asmā // bi-man ʻarafū fīka al-maẓāhira bi-al-asmā. Bi-nūrin badā fī ghayhabi al-wahmi fa-injalā ..."
2. Secundo folio of "Ilāhī bi-ahl al-dhikr wa-al-mashhadi al-asmá": ẓalāmun wa-dhāka al-nūru mā khalfahu marmā.
3. Incipit of "al-Qaṣidah al-Munbahijah": "Qum naḥwa ḥimāhu wa-ibtahij // wa-ʻalá dhāka al-muḥayyā fa-ʻuj. Wa-daʻi al-akwāna wa-qum ghasaqan // wa-uṣduqhu fī al-shawqi wa-fī al-lahaji ..."
3. Secundo folio of "al-Qaṣīdah al-Munbahijah": naḥwa al-khumāri abī al-suruji.
11 x 16 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 12.5 cm; 8 lines per page.
Binding: In dark red leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion and tooled with geometric design.
In good large naskh script, in black ink, on thick white paper; markings in red; text fully cocalized; no catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Wird saḥar [al-Saḥar], li-Sayyidī Muṣṭafá al-Bakrī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. M."
The first poem is followed by an invocation, prayer, and peace upon the Prophet.
The second poem is also followed by an invocation, prayer, and peace upon the Prophet.

1. Colophon of "Wird al-saḥar": No colophon. Text ends with: "... wa-ṣalli wa-sallim Allāhumma ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá Abīhi Ibrāhīm khalīlika, wa-Dāwūd khalīfatika, wa-Mūsá kalīmika, wa-ʻĪsá rūḥika, wa-Isḥāq dhabīḥika, wa-ʻalá jamīʻ ikhwānihim min al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

2. Colophon of "Ilāhī bi-ahl al-dhikr wa-al-mashhadi al-asmá": No colophon. Text ends with: "... Wa-arsalahu yadʻū al-barāyā li-qurbihi // wa-khaṣṣaṣahu fī al-kawni an yataqaddamā. Wa-ālin wa-aṣḥābin luyūthin ḍawāyirī // Wa-lāsīmā al-Ṣiddīqu man fīhi hayyamā. Wa-Fārūquhu ʻUthmān thumma ibnu ʻammihi // wa-awlāduhu al-sādātu thumma man intamā. Wa-atbāʻuhu wa-al-nāhijīn sabīlahu // madā al-dahri mā habba al-ṣabā wa-tanassamā."

3. Colophon of "al-Qaṣīdah al-Munbahijah": No colophon. Text ends with: "... Mā māla muḥibbun naḥwahumu // aw sāra al-rakbu ʻalá al-suruji. Aw mā dāʻin yadʻū al-Mawlá // yarjū lil-naṣri maʻa al-faraj."

record.title: 880-02 Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī al-mukhtār : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Jazūlī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam taslīman. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā lil-īmān wa-al-islām, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Nabīyihi alladhī istanqadhanā bi-hi min ʻibādat al-awthān wa-al-aṣnām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-nujabāʼ al-bararah al-kirām. Wa-baʻd, fa-al-gharaḍ fī hādhā al-kitāb dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam wa-faḍāʼilihā, adhkuruhā maḥdhūfat al-asānīd li-yashula ḥifẓuhā ʻalá al-qāriʼ, wa-hiya min ahamm al-muhimmāt li-man yurīdu al-qurb min Rabb al-Arbāb. Wa-tsamiyatuhu bi-kitāb Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī al-mukhtār ibtighāʼ li-marḍāt Allāh taʻālá, wa-maḥabbatan fī Rasūlihi al-Karīm, Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallama taslīman ..."
Secundo folio: istanqadhanā bi-hi min ʻibādat al-awthān.
10 x 10 cm; written surface: 5.5 x 6 cm; 9 lines per page.
Binding: In dark red leather, with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion.
In good Maghribi script, in black ink, on thick white paper; headings and keywords in red; text within double red frame; some leaves seem to be missing; catchwords.
Text of "Dalāʼil al-khayrāt" is on folio 1b-106a; on folios 107a-116b are miscellaneous quoutations from the Ḥadīth, etc., and the 201 names of the Prophet Muḥammad (folios 111b-116a).

Colophon: No colophon. The text of "Dalāʼil al-khayrāt" ends on folio 106a with an invocation, as follows: "... Wa-nasʼaluka Allāhumma bi-nūr wajhika alladhī malaʼa arkān ʻarshika an tazraʻa fī qalbī maʻrifatika ḥattá aʻrifaka ḥaqqa maʻrifatika, kamā yanbaghī an tuʻrafa bi-hi. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khātim al-nabīyin wa-imām al-mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-Huwa ḥasbunā wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Intahá bi-ḥamd Allāh."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ mukhtaṣar ʻalá al-Mukhtaṣar. Al-Juzʼ 2 : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Dardīr.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Title starts with: "... al-sitt qablahā fa-thābitah, wa-in lam yatarāfʻū ilaynā. Wa-fī kalām al-muṣ musāmaḥah, li-anna al-bāʼiʻ lā dakhla la-hu, lākin ḥamalahu ʻalá al-jamʻ al-ishārah ilá annahu lā yatawaqqafu al-ḥukm ʻalá riḍá al-shafīʻ wa-al-mushtarī illā idhā kāna kull min al-thalāthah dhimmīyan, aw, kāna al-shafīʻ muḥabbisan li-ḥiṣṣatihi qabla bayʻ sharīkihi, fa-la-hu al-akhdh bi-al-shufʻah li-yuḥabbisa al-shaqṣ al-maʼkhūd ayḍan ..."
Secundo folio: bi-milk ghayr lāzim li-bayʻ al-khayār.
16 x 22.7 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown cover with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion and tooled with broad frame (in 40 unnumbered quires).

In clear large naskh script, in black ink, on white laid paper; phrases of "al-Mukhtaṣar" of Khalīl ibn Isḥāq al-Jundī, in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; many wormholes (mostly on the margins and cover) with some loss of text; catchwords.

On the upper left margin of folio 391a: An auditing, editing, and a collation note with the handwritten copy of the author, as follows: "Balagha ḥuḍūran, wa-taḥrīran ʻalá muʼallifihi, wa-muqābalatan ʻalá nuskhatihi bi-khaṭṭihi, wa-lillāh al-ḥamd."

The text ends with: "... Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá afḍal ṣādiq fī al-aqwāl wa-al-afʻāl, Sayyidinā Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻAbd al-Muṭṭalib, badīʻ al-jamāl, rafīʻ al-jalāl, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi, wa-ʻalá sāʼir al-ʻulamāʼ wa-al-mujtahidīn, wa-ʻalá tābiʻīhim bi-iḥsān ilá Yawm al-Dīn, wa-ʻalá ashyākhinā hudāt al-ṭālibīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Colophon: "Wa-qad tamm jamʻan baʻda ʻaṣr yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ, al-khāmis wa-al-ʻishrīn min shahr Allāh Rajab al-muḥarram, sanat 1197 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihi laylata al-Ithnayn al-mubārakah, aḥad ʻashar shahr al-Qaʻdah al-ḥarām alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah tisʻah wa-tisʻīn, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād, Sulaymān ibn Muḥammad al-Ghifārī, bi-Sharqīyat Bilbays, ghafara Allāh li-muʼallifihi, wa-kātibihi, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, wa-al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-amwāt, innaka samīʻun, qarībun, mujīb al-daʻawāt. Āmīn. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "The compilation was completed in the afternoon of Wednesday, the twenty-fifth of Rajab, the sacred month of God, of the year 1197 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [26 June 1783], may the best prayer and peace be upon Him. The copy was completed on the blessed night of Monday, the eleventh of the sacred month of al-Qaʻdah, of the year 1199 [of the Hijrah = 15 September 1785], by the hand of the poorest of the servants, Sulaymān ibn Muḥammad al-Ghifārī, in Sharqīyat Bilbays [Egypt]. May God forgive its author, its copyist, all Muslim men and women, and all believers, men and women, the living among them and the dead, for You hear, are near, and answer prayers. Amen. It is completed. It is completed. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Tuḥfat al-muḥtāj bi-Sharḥ al-Minhāj : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with part of quire 5, as follows: "... min farḍ al-ukhrá baqīyah. Wa-in qulta taʻayyana lubs khuffihā li-yamsaḥa ʻalayhimā. Wa-in lam yabqa minhu shayʼ masaḥa ʻalá al-ukhrá waḥdahā, wa-dhakarahu hunā li-tamām munāsabatihi bi-al-wuḍūʼ, li-annahu badl min ghasl al-rijlayn fīhi, bal dhikruhu jamʻ fī khāmis furūḍihi, li-bayān ann al-wājib al-ghasl, aw al-masḥ, wa-ākhiruhu jamʻ ʻan al-tayammum, li-anna fī kull masḥan mubīḥan, wa-aḥādīth ṣaḥīḥah kathīrah, bal mutawātirah. Wa-min thamma qāla baʻḍ al-Ḥanafīyah: Akhshá an yakūna inkāruhu, ay min aṣlihi, kufran ..."
Secundo folio: ʻan al-manqūl al-muʻtamad fī al-Majmūʻ wa-ghayrihi.
21 x 31 cm; written surface: 14 x 23 cm; 33 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion; front cover missing (in 34 numbered quires).
In clear large naskh script, in black ink, on white laid paper; phrased of Minhāj al-ṭālibīn in red; few noted and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
Original foliation included 426 leaves; all before leaf 130 are missing.
Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman dāʼiman ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Sanat 1002."

Translation of the colophon: "The book was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, his family, and his companions, and grant them abundant and continuous peace until Judgement Day. The year 1002 [of the Hijrah = 1593/1594]."

record.title: 880-01 Sharḥ Dīwān Imruʼ al-Qays : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... banathu Hind maʻa qaṭīnihā ilá ʻUwayr [...] al-ʻUṭāridī, fa-ajārahum, fa-lammā balaghahu qatlu Banī Asad Ḥujran, wathaba ʻalayhi Banū Saʻd, fa-qālū kull amwālihim [...], fa-jaʻalū yanuṣṣūnahu, fa-yanfalitu minhum, fa-yaʼkhudhu al-turāb fa-yarmī bi-hi fī wujūhihim, thumma yaʻūdūna fa-yanuṣṣūnahu ḥattá yafluta minhum, fa-lammā wārá damsun masāʼan ittakhadha al-layl jamalan bi-jīrānihi, kamā qāla: Wa-laylatin ẓalmāʼ ḍaḥyāʼ wa-saḥābah mukarah waṭfāʼ. Thumma akhadha bi-khiṭām Hind, wa-hiya ʻadīlat ummihi ..."
Secundo folio: Inna Banī ʻAwfin ibtanaw ḥasaban ḍayyaʻahu al-dukhullalūna idh ghadarū.
15.5 x 22 cm; written surface: 8 x 15 cm; 11 lines per page.
Binding: In blue cardboard; green cloth on spine.
In good large naskh script; in black ink, on white thick paper; the verses of the "Dīwān" of Imruʼ al-Qays in red; catchwords.
Includes a folded sheet of paper in English, with comparison notes between the editions of Lyall and Ahlwardt.

On folio 1a: An endowment statement (waqf), as follows: "Awqafa wa-ḥabasa wa-taṣaddaqa bi-hādhā al-kitāb al-Ḥājj Aḥmad Bāshā al-Jazzār, fī jāmiʻihi alladhī bi-ʻAkkā, al-Nūr al-Aḥmadīyah, ʻalá ṭālib [... ...] min maḥallihi, waqfan ṣaḥīḥan [...] lā yubāʻ wa-lā yurhan wa-lā yubaddal, fa-man baddalahu baʻdamā samiʻahu, fa-innamā ithmuhu ʻalá [... ...] Inna Allāha [... ...]."
On folio 1b: A partly legible large black oval stamp of al-Jazzār's "waqf".
On folio 2a: two circular blue stamps.

After the colophon: An ownership statement: "Wa-qad tamallaka hādhā al-kitāb Saʻd al-Dīn al-Hanāhir [...] hādhihi al-asṭur fī ghurrat Tammūz, fī sanat 1188 [21 Rabīʻ al-Thāni 1188 of the Hijrah = 1 July 1774]."
Inside the back cover: "Hijrīyah 1184 fī Jumād Awwal, Rūmīyah Shamsīyah 1182 fī Tammūz."
The text ends with the commentary on the following verse: Raʼat falakan bi-nijābi al-Ghabīṭ // fa-kādat tajid li-dhāka al-hijārā.
Colophon: "Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah nahār al-Sabt, fī Jumād Awwal, sanat 1184."
Translation of the colophon: "This copy was completed on Saturday, in Jumād Awwal, of the year 1184 [of the Hijrah = 25 August 1770]."

record.title: 880-03 al-Risālah al-dāmighah lil-fāsiq : manuscript / Ḥamzah ibn ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "al-Risālah al-dāmighat lil-fāsiq, al-radd ʻalá al-Nuṣayrīyah [al-Nuṣayrī], laʻanahu al-Mawlá fī kull kaw[r] wa-dawr. Tawakkaltu ʻalá Mawlānā al-Bārr al-ʻAlī, Subḥānuhu. Ammā baʻd, ayyadakum al-Mawlá bi-taʼyīdih, annahu warada ilayya kitāb allafahu baʻḍ al-Nuṣayrīyah al-kāfirīn bi-Mawlānā jalla dhikruhu, al-mushrikīna bi-hi, al-kādhibīna ʻalayhi, al-ghāwī lil-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, al-ṭālib lil-shahawāt al-bahīmīyah, wa-barāzat al-ṭabīʻīyah, wa-dīnuhu dīn al-Nuṣayrīyah al-danīyah ..."
Secundo folio: wa-ʻalayhim laʻnatu Mawlānā subḥānuhu.
14.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 15.5 cm; 9 lines per page.
Binding: In light blue cardboard cover; light blue thick paper on spine.
In large good naskh script; in black ink, on white laid paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords.

Colophon: "Wa-al-ḥamd wa-al-niʻmah li-Mawlānā, wa-ʻalayhi ittikālunā fī al-sarrāʼ wa-al-ḍarrāʼ, wa-al-shiddah wa-al-rakhāʼ, wa-huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-naṣīr al-muʻīn. Tamma Kitāb Taqsīm al-ʻulūm wa-ithbāt al-ḥaqq wa-kashf al-maknūn. Wa-kāna farāghuhu salkha al-Muḥarram al-thālith min sinīn ẓuhūr ʻabd Mawlānā wa-mamlūkihi, hādī al-mustajībīn, al-muntaqim min al-mushrikīn bi-sayf Mawlānā subḥānuhu, wa-bi-hi astaʻīn. Naqalnā hādhihi al-rasāʼil min al-nuskhah al-aṣlīyah al-qadīmah, al-nādirat al-wujūd, bi-ghāyat al-diqqah, ṭibqa al-aṣl. Wa-al-salām ʻalá man ittabaʻa al-hudá."

Translation of the colophon: "Praise and grace be to our Lord, on whom we rely for better or for worse, in distress and in ease. He suffices me. He is the best ally and the best helper. The book 'Taqsīm al-ʻulūm wa-ithbāt al-ḥaqq wa-kashf al-maknūn' is completed. It was written at the end of al-Muḥarram, the third year of the appearance of the servant and slave of our Lord, guide of the compliant, the avenger of the polytheists by the sword of our Almighty Lord, from whom we seek help. We transcribed these epistles from the original old rare copy, precisely and faithfully. Peace be upon him who follows guidance."

Wa-in kāna hādhā huwa al-shirk, fa-qad raḍiya ʻAlī bi-dhālik, wa-bāyaʻa Abā Bakar wa-ʻUmar wa-ʻUthmān. Wa-hum yarwūna ʻan ʻAlī bi-annahu ḍarab ʻalá khuffihi fa-māta ʻishrūna alf rajul min ahl al-Nahrawān, wa-man kānat hādhihi ṣifatuhu lā yadkhulu taḥta al-ʻajz ..."
