Wa-jismuhu huwa al-sayf alladhī awʻadanī bi-hi Mawlānā jalla dhikruhu, wa-huwa lā yakhlifu al-mīʻād, fa-in ..."

record.title: 880-02 Muqaddimah ʻalá sabīl al-ikhtiṣār fī al-kalām ʻalá al-Basmalah wa-al-Ḥamdalah : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá mā tafaḍḍala bi-hi min naʻmāʼihi, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad Khātim Anbiyāʼihi, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-aṣfiyāʼihi. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi 'Muqaddimah ʻalá sabīl al-ikhtiṣār fī al-kalām ʻalá al-Basmalah wa-al-Ḥamdalah', wa-ʻalá al-ḥamd wa-al-shukr wa-al-madḥ lughatan wa-ʻurfan, maʻa bayān al-nisbah baynahumā, wa-maʻa dhikr fawāʼid muhimmah ..."
Secundo folio: qawluhu taʻālá wa-ʻallama Ādama al-asmāʼ kullahā.
15.5 x 22 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Sharḥ al-Basmalah wa-al-Ḥamdalah, li-Shaykh al-Islām, bi-al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu [...]. Āmīn. Wa-raḥima Allāh muʼallifahu raḥmatan wāsiʻah bi-mannihi. Āmīn."

On folio 1a (in two conic shape design, attached upside down at their heads): "Hādhā kitāb Sharḥ al-Basmalah wa-al-Ḥamdalah ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdahu wa-kafá. Āmīn. Tamm. Wa-raḥima Allāh muʼallifahu raḥmatan wāsiʻah. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: A quotation from Yaḥyá ibn Muʻādh (died 872), on love of the world.

Colophon: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá, wa-ʻawnihi, wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi. Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillah waḥdah. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhihi al-nuskhah yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, al-rābiʻ wa-al-ʻishrūn min shahr al-Qaʻdah, sanat 1072. Katabahu al-faqīr [... ...]."

Translation of the colophon: "It is completed by the praise of God Almighty, His help, and His abundant benevolence. God is more knowledgeable. Praise be to God alone. The copy was completed on blessed Thursday, the twenty-fourth of the month of al-Qaʻdah, of the year 1072 [11 July 1662]. Copied by the poor [... ...]."

Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Risālah fī ʻilm al-mūsīqī": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī sharrafa al-insān bi-nuṭq al-lisān, wa-faḍḍalahu bi-ikhtilāf al-alfāẓ wa-al-alḥān, wa-ṣarrafahu bi-tafḍīl al-bayān wa-al-banān, wa-jaʻala ṭabʻahu li-qiyām al-awzān ka-al-mīzān. Aḥmaduhu ḥamdan mutalāʼim, wa-uṣallī wa-usallim ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallm, alladhī sharrafa bi-waṭʼi qadamihi ẓahra al-Burāq, wa-iftakhara bi-hi al-Ḥijāz ʻalá al-ʻIrāq, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-ḍāribīna ʻinda al-īqāʻ bi-al-kuffār, wa-al-ākhidhīna min dhawī al-shirk bi-mūjib al-awtār, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalayhim mā iṣṭakhaba al-ḥajīj mathná wa-thulāth ..."
1. Secundo folio of "Risālah fī ʻilm al-mūsīqī": al-ṭālib wa-al-maṭlūb.

2. Incipit of "al-Manẓūmah al-sanīyah fī bayān al-asmāʼ al-lughawīyah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā // li-millati al-Islāmi wa-ijtabānā. Bi-mannihi wa-jūdihi iṣṭafānā // bi-faḍli tawḥīdin fa-lā nubālī. Thumma al-ṣalātu baʻdu wa-al-salāmu // ʻalá Nabīyin dīnuhu al-Islāmu. Huwa al-Rasūlu al-Khātimu al-Imāmu // fa-ludh bi-hi tanjū mina al-nakāli. Wa-baʻda taslīmī ʻalá khayri Nabī // naẓamtu min Muthallathāti Quṭrubi. Urjūzatan ladhīdhatan fī al-mashrabi // wa-zidthā min kutubin ṭiwālī ..."
2. Secundo folio of "al-Manẓūmah al-sanīyah fī bayān al-asmāʼ al-lughawīyah": Wa-ṣulbahu al-aḥjāru fa-al-kalāmu.

3. Incipit of "Excerpt from an unidentified treatise on useful and harmful foods": The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... wa-qarribhu li-kull man kāna qalbuhu ṣaḥīḥ. Ayyuhā al-nās, ʻibāda Allāh: Aklu al-ṭayyib al-ṣāliḥ yudhhibu al-kasal wa-yudāwī al-qalb al-jarīḥ min al-ʻilal, fa-bādirū li-akl al-tuffāḥ al-mukhaḍḍab, wa-al-safarjal al-mukaʻʻab, wa-al-tīn al-mukattab, wa-al-ʻinab al-muṭayyab, fa-ʻammā qalīl tansakibu al-amrāq fī al-qiṣaʻ al-ghimāq, wa-tashkhuṣu naḥwahā al-abṣār wa-al-aḥdāq, wa-taʼtī al-harāyis, wa-al-samnu min fawqihā māyis ..."
3. Secundo folio of "Excerpt from an unidentified treatise on useful and harmful foods": There is no secundo folio.
16 x 21 cm; written surface: varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: The cover is deteriorated exposing manuscript waste, remnants of dark brown leather on spine.
The codex is written mostly in the same hand, in clear good naskh script; in black ink, on white thick paper; headings and markings in red; some inserts; catchwords.
Inside the front cover: Two verses of poetry about refraining from lending one's books, dated 1218 of the Hijrah (1803/1804), and a mostly illegible ownership statement.
On folio 1a: A reader's statement: "Hādhihi safīnat al-Shaykh Yūsuf Musaddī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn." And miscellaneous scribbles.

On folio 70b: Two readers' statements: 1. By Muḥammad Amīn al-Jundī, dated 1 Shaʻbān, 1263 (15 July 1847), in the city of Ḥimṣ (Syria). 2. By Saʻīd al-Sibāʻī ibn Muḥammad al-ʻUmar, dated 25 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 1267 (21 October 1851).

Between folios 93 and 94: A receipt of 256.5 Qirsh from ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Ḥājj Ḥamū Sabqā by Muḥammad Salīm al-Bizm, as follows: "2562. Faqaṭ miyātayn wa-sittan wa-khamsūn lā ghayr. Waṣala ilaynā min al-Sayyid ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Ḥājj Ḥamū Sabqā awwal qiṣṭ min thālith ʻashar Rabīʻ Awwal ilá thālith ʻashar Jumād Ākhir, al-mablagh al-muḥarrar aʻlāh, wa-qadruhu miyātayn wa-sitt wa-khamsūn wa-niṣf Qirsh lā ghayr. Ḥurrira fī 13 Jumād Ākhir, sanat 91 [1291 of the Hijrah = 28 July 1874]. al-Muʻtazz bi-mā fīhi Muḥammad Salīm al-Bizm."

On folio 111b: Three readers' statements 1. By al-Sayyid Sharīf Jundī, dated in the month of Ramaḍān of the year 1280 (February/March 1864). 2. By Muḥammad Sharīf Jundī (undated). 3. By Muḥammad ʻAlī ibn al-Sayyid Diyāb Yaghmūr, dated 1 Shaʻbān, 1288 (16 October 1871).
On folio 112b: A wedding statement and date, as follows: "Tazawwaja akhī Muḥammad al-Khālid ibn al-Shaykh Yūsuf al-Musaddī fī niṣf shahr Rajab, laylat al-Jumʻah, fī sanat 1283 [23 November 1866]."
Folio 113a is blank.

On folio 113b: A reader's statement: "Hādhihi majmūʻah ḥāwiyah li-baʻḍ abyāt wa-alghāz wa-ashghāl min kalām al-fuṣaḥāʼ. Ḥurrira fī al-yawm al-tāsiʻ ʻashar khalat min shahr Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, min shuhūr sanat iḥdá wa-thamānīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf [19 Rabīʻ al-Ākhir 1281 = 21 September 1864]."

On folio 114b: Two readers' statements, as follows: 1. "Ḥarrara hādhihi al-abyāt al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-rājī ʻafawa Rabbihi al-Karīm al-Sayyid ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jundī ibn al-marḥūm al-Sayyid Ḥasan Āghā al-Jundī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, fī 17 L [Shawwāl (?)], sanat 1252 [25 January 1837]." 2. "Hādhā al-kitāb latt fī latt min ghayr ṭūlat sharḥ."
On folio 115a: Scribbles, an incantation, a defaced reader's statement, and a date "Ḥurrira al-jamīʻ fī 2 R1 [Rabīʻ Awwal], sanat 1281 [5 August 1864]."

On folio 115b: A reader's statement about two "mukhammas" (quintuplicating) of ghazal poems, as follows: "Ḥarrara hādhihi al-abyāt al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-Karīm al-Sayyid ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jundī ibn al-marḥūm al-Sayyid Ḥusayn Āghā al-Jundī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Fī 17 L [Shawwāl (?)], sanat 1252 [25 January 1837]", a defaced reader's note, dated 18 Ṣ [Ṣafar], sant 68 [1268 = 13 December 1851]", and a reader's statement: "Naẓara [fīhi] al-Sayyid Ghayth al-Sibāʻī."

On folios 116a: Scribbles, invocations, and four readers' statements, as follows: 1. "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu al-faqīr ilayhi taʻālá Muḥammad Abū al-Jūd ibn al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá Ḥajjū al-Khānī, ghafar Allāh la-hu wa-lī wālidayhi wa-li-kāffat al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Ḥurrira fī 15 Jā [Jumād Awwāl (?) sanat 1270 [13 February 1854]." 2. "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu al-Sayyid Saʻīd ibn al-Sayyid Muḥammad ʻUmar al-Sibāʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Ḥurrira fī 25 Tammūz sanat 1267 [26 Ramaḍān 1267 = 25 Tammūaz/July 1851]. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá ashraf makhlūqātih, wa-ḥasharanā Allāh maʻa awliyāʼihi al-ṣāliḥin. M." 3. "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu al-Sayyid ʻUmar al-Sibāʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-jamiʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Ḥurrira fī niṣf shahr Muḥarram al-ḥarām. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Āmīn." 4. A defaced reader's statement: "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala <wa-taʼammala> maʻāniyahu al-faqīr [ilá] Allāh taʻālá, [ghafara Allāh] la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

On folio 116b: Scribbles and a reader's statement, as follows: "Kataba hādhā al-kitāb al-Sayyid ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn al-Sayyid Ḥusayn Āghā Jundī ibn Salīm, raḥimahu Allāh wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. 3 fī Ṣ [Ṣafar], sanat 1251 [31 May 1835]."
Inside the back cover: Scribbles and a reader's statement, as follows: "ʻAbd al-Raḥīm al-Buraʻī, qaddasa Allāh sirrah."

1. Colophon of "Risālah fī ʻilm al-mūsīqī": No colophon. Text ends with: "... ʻIrāq ʻAjam yaʼkhudh kardānīyah yaḥuṭṭ Rahāwī, yaslamak sakūsāz, yashīl min al-zīd afakand, yulāʼim al-Ḥijāz wa-yaḥuṭṭ ʻalá al-dūkāh. Faras qazaq, yashīl min al-nawá wa-yaḥsun bi-al-buzurk, wa-yaḥuṭṭ ʻalá al-Rahāwī. Nagham al-makhfī, yashīl ʻushshāq, yaḥuṭṭ Ḥusaynī Aṣfahān, nawá ʻIrāq. Zankūlah Buzurk, Ḥijāz Rāst, ʻushshāq, zīrafkand, Rahāwī busalīk Ḥusaynī. Tafarraqat aḥrufuhā ʻalá al-ithnay ʻashar nagham al-aṣlīyah min al-dāʼirah, wa-hiya qāʻidah. Tammat wa-bi-al-khayr ʻammat."

2. Colophon of "al-Manẓūmah al-sanīyah fī bayān al-asmāʼ al-lughawīyah": No colophon. Text ends with: "... Wa-imraʼatu al-ibni tusammá kannah // wa-ghaṭyatun lil-shayʼi fa-hiya kunnah. Wa-al-ismu fī shaqīqihi fa-kinnah // wa-naqluhā ṣaḥḥun bi-lā muḥāli. Wa-al-bughḍu lil-ḥubbi fa-huwa qalbun // naʻam wa-ʻuṣfūrun fa-dhāka qulbun."

3. Colophon of "Excerpt from an unidentified treatise on useful and harmful foods": No colophon. Text ends with: "... Allāhumma yassir lanā akl al-baqlāwāt wa-al-kināfāt, wa-lā taḥrumnā min akl al-qishṭah wa-al-ḥalāwāt, innka samīʻun qarībun mujību al-daʻawāt. Allāhumma ijʻalnā qādirīn ʻalá akl laḥm al-ʻajīn, wa-al-bādinjān bi-al-laḥm al-samīn, ḥattá naʼkul wa-nuṭʻim al-miskīn. Wa-ijʻal Allāhumma dawlatanā hādhihi dawlatlīyīn qādirīn, wa-lā tajʻalhum min al-muflisīn al-muqardaḥīn, wa-yarfusukum al-jamal laʻallakum tidrakalūn. ʻIbāda Allāh: Inna Allāha aḥalla lakum al-ukūlāt al-ṭayyibāt, fa-kulū wa-iʻmalū al-ṣāliḥāt qabla ḥulūl al-mamāt."

record.title: 880-02 Muqaddimah tataʻallaqu bi-al-Basmalah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Mūsá al-Bīlī al-ʻAdawī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh aladhī iftataḥa Kitābahu bi-al-Basmalah, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá man ṭalab al-ibtidāʼ bi-hā fī al-umūr al-mujbilah [?], wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-ʻālimīn bi-ḥadīthihā fī al-aqwāl wa-al-afʻāl al-mustakmalah. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu Aḥmad al-Bīlī, dhū al-ʻuyūb al-jumlah [?], ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-jamīʻ al-ummah: Qad iltamasa minnī baʻḍ al-ikhwān, ṣāḥib al-himmah, an aktuba la-hu mimmā yataʻallaqu bi-kalimāt al-Basmalah jumlatan ʻalá wajh ʻajīb, ghayr mā ishtahara fī al-kutub al-jammah ..."
Secundo folio: al-awwal anna al-Alif fīhā taraffuʻ wa-takabbur.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16 cm; 22 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on beige laid paper; headings in red; wormholes on the margins with some loss of text; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi 'Muqaddimah tataʻallaqu bi-al-Basmalah', taʼlīf al-ʻUmdah al-ʻAllāmah al-Shaykh Aḥmad Bīlī al-ʻAdawī al-Mālikī, ḥafiẓahu Allāh. Āmīn"; "ʻAdad awrāqihā arbaʻah".

On folio 1a: An altercation in verse between an atheist and Ibn Muqbil (could not be identified), as follows: "Qāla shāʻir al-dahrīyah: Ḍaḥiktu wa-kāna al-ḍiḥku minnā safāhatan // wa-ḥuqqa li-sukkān al-ḥaqīqati an yabkū. Tuḥaṭṭimunā al-ayyāmu ḥattá kaannanā // zujājun wa-lākin lā yuʻādu lanā sabku'. Qāla Ibn Muqbil, min akābir Ahl al-Sunnah: 'Kadhibta wa-Baytu Allāh akhbara ṣādiqan // sayabʻathunā baʻda al-thará man la-hu al-mulku. Wa-narjiʻu ajsāman ṣiḥāḥan salīmatan naʻārafu fī al-Firdaws mā ʻindanā shakkū'."

Text ends with: "... wa-li-anna Allāh taʻālá muʻṭī al-ʻaṭāʼ, wa-al-Raḥmān huwa al-mutajāwiz ʻan zallāt al-awliyāʼ, wa-al-Raḥīm huwa al-mutajāwiz ʻan al-khaṭāyā, fa-kaannahu taʻālá yaqūlu: Aʻlamu minka mā law ʻalimahu abūka la-fāraqaka, wa-law ʻalimathu al-marʼah la-jafatka, wa-law ʻalimathu al-amah la-aqdamat ʻalá al-firār minka, wa-law ʻalima al-jār la-saʻá fī takhrīb al-dār, wa-anā aʻlamuhu wa-asturuhu faḍlan wa-karaman."
Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā qaṣadtu jamʻahu tuḥfatan li-man yalqá Allāha samʻuhu, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-sallam."
Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what I intended to compile, a gift to him who hearkens to God. May God pray and grant peace to our Master Muḥammad."

record.title: 880-01 Treatises on nikāḥ and wuḍūʼ : manuscript.
record.note: 1. Title of "Māniʻ al-sifāḥ fī taʻlīm ʻaqāʼid al-nikāḥ" from folio 2a: "... wa-sammaytuhu 'Māniʻ al-sifāḥ fī taʻlīm ʻāqid al-nikāḥ' ...".
2. Title of "al-Ṣuwar allatī yuzawwiju fīhā al-ḥākim" from incipit (folio 8a).
3. Title of "Sharḥ 'Shurūṭ al-wuḍūʼ'" supplied by cataloger (based on the incipit folio 10a)
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Māniʻ al-sifāḥ fī taʻlīm ʻāqid al-nikāḥ": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ḥarrama al-sifāḥ wa-aḥalla al-nikāḥ, wa-jaʻala ḥallahu bi-ʻaqd walī wa-shāhiday ʻadl, kullā minhumā samīʻan baṣīran, wa-jaʻala min al-nisāʼ ḥarāman wa-ḥalālan, wa-bayyana al-ḥarām wa-al-ḥalāl ʻalá lisān man arsalahu bi-al-ḥaqq bashīran wa-nadhīran, wa-jaʻala lil-muṭallaqāt wa-al-mutawaffá ʻanhunna ʻidadan li-yakūna al-ʻāqid lil-nikāḥ bi-dhālika khabīran ..."
1. Secundo folio of "Māniʻ al-sifāḥ fī taʻlīm ʻāqid al-nikāḥ": al-bāṭil wa-al-fāsid fa-ajabtuhu ilá dhālik.

2. Incipit of "al-Ṣuwar allatī yuzawwiju fīhā al-ḥākim": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻĀlim al-ʻAllāmah, al-ʻumdah Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu wa-arḍāh: Wa-baʻd ḥamd Allāh taʻālá ʻalá tawfīqih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih wa-ṣadīqih, fa-qad waqaftu ʻalá naẓm qaṣīdah ṭawīlah li-Shaykh al-Islām Sirāj al-Dīn al-Bulqīnī al-Shāfiʻī, raḍiya Allāh ʻahu wa-arḍāh, jamaʻa fīhā al-ṣwar allatī yuzawwiju fīhā al-ḥākim, wa-awṣalahā ilá ʻishrīn ṣūrah, fa-naẓamtuhā fī khamsat abyāt, wa-aradtu an ūridahā hunā mashrūḥatan li-yatimma al-intifāʻ bi-hā, wa-billāh al-tawfīq. ʻUshrūna zawwaja ḥākimun ʻadamu al-walī // wa-al-faqdu wa-al-iḥrāmu wa-al-ʻaḍlu al-safara ..."
2. Secundo folio of "al-Ṣuwar allatī yuzawwiju fīhā al-ḥākim": al-ḥajj qabla al-taḥallul bi-ʻamal ʻumrah.

3. Incipit of "Sharḥ 'Shurūṭ al-wuḍūʼ'": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻĀlim al-ʻAllāmah, al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, muftī al-Muslimīn wa-ḥujjat al-munāẓirīn, Abū al-ʻAbbās Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Ḥamzah al-Ramlī al-Anṣārī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatihi wa-ruḍwānih, wa-askanahu fasīḥa jinānih, bi-jāh Muḥammad wa-ālih. Āmīn. [al-Ḥamdu lillāh] alladhī jaʻala al-ṣalāh afḍal al-ʻibādāt baʻda al-īmān, wa-jaʻala al-wuḍūʼ min aʻẓam shurūṭihā, wa-rattaba ʻalá ḥuṣūlihi al-ghufrān ... li-dhālika aḥbabtu an ūḍiḥa shurūṭ al-wuḍūʼ al-madhkūrah fī al-abyāt al-ātiyah, wa-laqad qīl innahā lil-Imām Muḥyī al-Dīn al-Nawawī, wa-qīl li-Walī al-Dīn al-ʻIrāqī, shāriḥ 'al-Bahjah', wa-hiya hādhihi al-abyāt: Ayā ṭāliban minnī shurūṭa wuḍūʼihi // fa-khudhhā ʻalá al-tartībi idh anta sāmiʻu. Shurūṭu wuḍūʼin ʻashratun thumma khamasatun // fa-khudh ʻaddahā wa-al-ghuslu lil-ṭuhri jāmiʻu ..."
Secundo folio of "Sharḥ 'Shurūṭ al-wuḍūʼ'": wa-al-rukn mā tashtamilu ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh.
16.4 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 11 x 17.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two unnumbered quires).
In fair medium naskh script, in black ink, on white laid paper; keywords in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb fī ʻaqd al-nikāḥ, lil-Shaykh al-ʻĀlim al-ʻAllāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, Shaykh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Munayyir al-Shāfiʻī, ʻufiya ʻanhu. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Two verses of poetry, by an unidentified poet, on deliverance and repentance, as follows: "Man laysa yasʻá fī al-khalāṣi li-nafsihi // kānat siʻāyatuhu ʻalayhā lā lahā. Inna al-dhunūba bi-tawbatin tumḥá kamā // yamḥū sujūdu al-sahwi ghaflata man sahá."

1. The text of "Māniʻ al-sifāḥ fī taʻlīm ʻāqid al-nikāḥ" ends with: "... wa-ṣīghat al-rajʻah an yaqūla: Rājaʻtu zawjatī ilá ʻiṣmatī, aw, ilá ʻaqd nikāḥī, fa-taʻūdu la-hu bi-mujarrad dhālik, wa-lā taḥtāju ilá ʻaqd jadīd. Fa-iʻlam dhālik, ayyuhā al-ʻāqid, wa-ʻallimhu, li-yaḥṣula laka al-thawāb al-jazīl min al-Malik al-Jalīl. Wa-Allāh taʻālá aʻlam."

1. Colophon of "Māniʻ al-sifāḥ fī taʻlīm ʻāqid al-nikāḥ": "Tammat hādhihi al-risālah al-nāfiʻah bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá, wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Raḥima Allāh muʼallifahā, wa-kātibahā, wa-al-nāẓir fīhā, min al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."

1. Translation of the colophon of "Māniʻ al-sifāḥ fī taʻlīm ʻāqid al-nikāḥ": "This useful epistle is completed by the praise of God Almighty and His abundant benevolence. May God have mercy upon its author, its copyist, and him who looks into it of the Muslims. Amen."

2. Colophon of "al-Ṣuwar allatī yuzawwiju fīhā al-ḥākim". No colophon. Text ends with: "... al-Ṣūrah al-ʻishrūn: al-Amah allatī ʻulliqa ʻatquhā bi-ṣifah yuqṭaʻu bi-wujūdihā wa-aslamat, fa-lā tubāʻ li-maṣlaḥat intiẓār al-ʻatq, fa-in kānat, qad tuʼajjar, wa-qad lā tuʼajjar, bīʻat. Wa-Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá aʻlam."

3. Colophon of "Sharḥ 'Shurūṭ al-wuḍūʼ'": Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-Ghanī Muḥammad al-Sākit al-Basyūnī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu, wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-sallam. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of "Sharḥ 'Shurūṭ al-wuḍūʼ'": "This blessed copy was completed by the hand of the poor to his Rich Lord, Muḥammad al-Sākit al-Basyūnī al-Shāfiʻī, may God forgive him, his parents, and all Muslims. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and grant him peace. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Alghāz : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Yūsuf ibn Hishām.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Lā ilāha illā Allāh, Muḥammad Rasūl Allāh. al-Ḥamdu lillāh musbigh al-ʻaṭāʼ, musbil al-ghiṭāʼ, muṣṭafī al-niʻmah wa-al-ālāʼ, al-maḥmūd ʻalá al-sarrāʼ wa-al-ḍarrāʼ, al-mashkūr fī al-shiddah wa-al-rakhāʼ, aḥmaduhu, wa-lā maḥmūda fī al-ḥaqīqah siwāh, wa-ashkuruhu shukran lā yaʼbāh wa-lā yansāh, wa-uṣallī ʻalá Muḥammad Nabīyihi alladhī min khayr al-ʻanāṣir iṣṭafāh ... Wa-baʻd, fa-innī lammā naẓartu fī kutub al-ʻArabīyah, wa-waqaftu ʻalá daqāʼiqih wa-ḥaqāʼiqihi, wa-rājaʻtu kutub al-ʻulamāʼ wa-taṣānīfahum, wajadtuhā mushtamilah ʻalá abyāt min al-shiʻr muṣaʻʻabat al-mabānī, mughammaḍat al-maʻānī, qad alghaza qāʼiluhā iʻrābahā, wa-dafana fī ghāmiḍ al-ṣanʻah ṣawābahā ... aradtu an ajmaʻa minhā mā tayassar li-ūḍiḥa mushkilahu wa-ubayyina mujmalahu ... wa-jaʻaltuhu bi-rasm al-Khizānah al-Mawlawīyah al-Sulṭānīyah al-Malakīyah al-Kāmilīyah ..."
Secundo folio: fīhi li-annahu ism inna quddima fīhi al-khabar.
16.5 x 23.4 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 19 cm; 29 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound; the manuscript is wrapped in a sheet of thin cardboard, folded to 14.5 x 20.3 cm.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on laid white paper; the verses of the riddles and markings in red; markings in red; some commentaries on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Alghāz fī al-naḥw wa-ajwibatuhā, li-Ibn Hishām, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl. Tamm. ʻAllaqahu bi-yadihi al-fāniyah al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-ʻAlī, ʻAbd al-Ḥāfiẓ al-Ḥiṣṣāwī al-Azharī, ghafara Allāh [la-hu]."
Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. [Tamma] bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-sallam."
Translation of the colophon: "[It was completed] by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and grant him peace."

record.title: 880-02 Risālah fīmā yataʻallaqu bi-jumlat al-Basmalah hal hiya khabarīyah am inshāʼīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Ghunaymī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh mālik al-ḥamd wa-mustaḥiqqihi, al-mutafaḍḍil ʻalá man shāʼa min ʻibādihi bi-laṭāʼif tawfīqihi wa-rifqihi, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, jāmiʻ al-maḥāmid wa-al-mafākhir, al-munzal ʻalayhi fī Kitābihi al-ʻAzīz: 'Innamā yuʻmuru masājida Allāhi man āmana billāhi [wa-al-Yawmi] al-Ākhir, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-muqtadá bihim lil-hidāyah fī al-bāṭin wa-al-ẓāhir. Āmīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá raḥmat Rabbihi, asīr waṣmat dhanbihi, Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Ghunaymī al-Anṣārī, laṭufa Allāhu bi-hi: Lammā alqaytu dars al-tafsīr bi-Jāmiʻ Ṭūlūn, bi-ishārat baʻḍ al-mawālī al-ʻiẓām, malādh ahl al-faḍl al-kirām, khaṭara lī an ajmaʻa mā alqaytuhu min ghayr an yakūna bi-yadī shayʼ min al-tafāsīr ... fa-qultu, wa-billāh al-tawfīq [crossed over] al-mustaʻān, wa-ʻalayhi al-tiklān, mubtadiʼan bi-baḥth fī jumlat al-Basmalah ..."
Secundo folio: laysa kadhālik li-anna kullan min muṣāḥabat al-ism.
15 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on laid white paper; some commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: The following testing of the pen proverbial phrase: "Lā falaḥa man ẓalama [He who commits injustice will never succeed]."
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi risālah katabahā al-Ghunaymī fīmā yataʻallaqu bi-jumlat al-Basmalah hal hiya khabarīyah am inshāʼīyah."

On folio 1a: A statement by a reader: "Iʻlam inna al-muṣ[annif], raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, lam yusammi hādhihi al-risālah fīmā ʻalimtu, wa-al-lāʼiq an tusammá bi-'al-Fawāʼid al-sanīyah fī jawāb Hal jumlat al-Basmalah khabarīyah am inshāʼīyah' li-tashtahir, wa-billāh al-mustaʻān. Wa-ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad, al-Nabī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá jamīʻ al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn wa-ālihim wa-ṣaḥbihim ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Qālahu faqīr Rabbihi wa-asīr dhanbihi, ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Maḥallī al-Shāfiʻī al-Azharī al-Ashʻarī bi-Raml [?] Dimyāṭ, aḥsana Allāh ʻāqibatahu. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: A quotation from an unidentified work on logic, on the difference between "al-Kull" (total) and "al-Kullī" (totality), as follows: "Fāʼidah. al-Farq bayna 'al-kull' wa-'al-kullī', min wujūh, minhā anna al-kull huwa al-maqūl ʻalá mawjūd tarakkaba min juzʼayn aw ajzāʼ tatawaqqafu ʻalá jamīʻ ajzāʼihi, li-anna ḥaqīqatahu innamā taqūmu bi-al-ajzāʼ bi-khilāf al-kullī, wa-huwa al-maqūl ʻalá dhī afrād ghayr mutanāhiyah dhihnan, fa-innahu lā yatawaqqafu ʻalá shayʼ min juzʼīyātih, bal kull min juzʼīyātih yatawaqqafu ʻalayhi, li-tarakkubihi min al-kullī wa-shayʼ ākhar. Wa-minhā anna al-kull lā yaṣiḥḥu ḥamluhu ʻalá shayʼ min ajzāʼihi, wa-innamā yaṣiḥḥu ḥamluhu ʻalá majmūʻihā."

Colophon: "Wa-li-yakun hādhā ākhir mā jará bi-hi al-qalam min al-khaṭarāt fī hādhā al-mabḥath al-sharīf li-hādhā al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf. Wa-Allāh yaqūlu al-ḥaqq, wa-Huwa yahdī al-sabīl. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-hādhā ākhir mā awradnāhu min al-mabāḥith allatī jamaʻahā al-ʻAllāmah al-Ghunaymī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "Let this be the end of what the pen ran with, of the thoughts about this noble study, by this feeble servant. God says the truth and guides the way. God suffices us. He is the best advocate. This is what we introduced of the searches which were compiled by the learned scholar al-Ghunaymī, may God Almighty have mercy upon him. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Tuḥfat al-aḥbāb bi-mā jāʼa bi-al-Wāw wa-al-Yāʼ min kalām al-Aʻrāb : manuscript / Muḥammad al-Ḥudaynī al-Damanhūrī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Laka al-ḥamd, wa-li-Nabīyika al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, wa-ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-muṣṭafayn al-aʻlām. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu faqīr raḥmat Rabbihi al-Ghaffār Muḥammad al-Ḥaddīnī al-Damanhūrī, dhū al-maʼāthim wa-al-awzār: Lammā kānat al-manẓūmah fī al-alfāẓ allatī atat ʻan al-ʻArab bi-al-Wāw wa-al-Yāʼ, al-mansūbah lil-ʻAllāmah Shihāb al-Dīn Maḥāsin al-Ḥalabī al-maʻrūf bi-al-Shawwāʼ ḥāwiyah li-jull mā wujida minhā, wa-kānat tisʻatan wa-arbaʻīna baytan, thumma tammamahā al-ʻAllāmah al-Sujāʻī bi-sabʻata ʻashara baytan, fa-kāna al-majmūʻ thamāniyah wa-sittīn baytan, wa-sharaḥa al-majmūʻ bi-sharḥ naḥw al-kurrāsayn, aḥbabtu an akhtaṣirahā li-yashula ḥifẓuhā ... fa-jāʼat ... ʻasharat abyāt ... fa-ʻanna lī an ulakhkhiṣa ʻalayhā sharḥan min al-sharḥ al-madhkūr, fa-mā ghādartu fī manẓūmatī wa-sharḥī minhā shayʼan illā aḥṣaytuhu fī al-suṭūr, kamā yaʻlamu al-wāqif ʻalá al-kitābayn, wa-iqtaṣartu fī al-muḍāriʻ ʻalá iḥdá al-lughatayn, wa-sammaytuhu 'Tuḥfat al-aḥbāb bi-mā jāʼa bi-al-Wāw wa-al-Yāʼ min kalām al-Aʻrāb' ..."
Secundo folio: al-ʻaṣā laḥawtuhā laḥwan.
16.5 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 12 x 19.5 cm; 29 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In good clear naskh script, in black ink, on laid white paper; headings and markings in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

Author's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taswīd hādhā al-sharḥ al-mubārak fī yawm al-Jumʻah, al-tāsiʻ ʻashar min shahr Shaʻbān al-mubārak, sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-tisʻah wa-ʻishrīn min Hijrat Khayr al-Anbiyāʼ wa-al-Mursalīn. Wa-kuntu ḥīna al-naẓm wa-al-sharḥ gharīban bi-thaghr Dimyāṭ al-maḥfūẓah bi-luṭf Rabbinā al-Wahhāb, kharajtu min al-Azhar li-ziyārat man fīhā min al-aḥbāb wa-al-aqṭāb, waqāhā Allāh kayd al-ashrār wa-laṭafa bihā fīmā yanzilu bihā min al-aqdār, [ra]ddanī Allāh ʻalayhi raddan jamīlan, wa-razaqanā al-maktha fīhi zamanan ṭawīlan bi-jāh Sayyidinā Muḥammad khayr al-anām, ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Ih. kalām al-muʼallif, ḥafiẓahu Allāh taʻālá."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This blessed commentary was completed on Friday, the nineteenth of the blessed month of Shaʻbān, of the year 1229 of the Hijrah of the Best of the Prophets and Messengers [6 August 1814]. I was during the composition of the poem and its commentary sojourning in the region of Dimyāṭ [Damietta (Egypt)], the protected by the benevolence of our Abundant Giving Lord. I left al-Azhar to visit the loved ones and the authorities who are in It, may God protected it from the intrigue of the evil ones, and be kind to it in the calamities that befell It. May God return me to It in the best of wellbeing, and grant me to stay in It for a long time, by the high status of our Master Muḥammad, the best of mankind, may the best prayer and peace be upon him and his family. The discourse of the author, may God Almighty protect him, is completed."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-katabahu bi-yadihi ʻabduhu al-faqīr Sālim ʻAlī al-Anbābī, fī yawm al-Ithnayn al-māḍī min shahr Rajab fī ghurratihi, sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-sabʻah wa-thalāthīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi. Āmīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "Copied in the hand of the His poor servant Sālim ʻAlī al-Anbābī, last Monday, the beginning of the month of Rajab, of the year 1237 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [24 March 1822], may the best prayer and peace be upon him. It was completed by the praise of God and His help. Amen."

record.title: Treatises on Islamic doctrines, Sufism, and recitation of the Qurʼān : manuscript.
record.note: 1. Title of "al-Iqtiṣād sharḥ al-Kawkab al-waqqād" supplied by Hartford Seminary (based on the incipit)
2. Title of "Tuḥfat al-aṭfāl" from incipit (folio 7a)
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "al-Iqtiṣād sharḥ al-Kawkab al-waqqād": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Allāha aḥmadu ʻalá an jaʻalanī Muʼminan, wa-uṣallī wa-usallimu ʻalá Muḥammad alladhī qāma bi-nuṣrat al-dīn muʻlinan, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-al-tābiʻīn ilá Yawm al-Ghanāʼ. Hādhā taʻlīq waḍaʻtuhu ʻalá al-Kawkab al-waqqād lil-Shaykh ʻAlam al-Dīn al-Sakhāwī, fī uṣūl al-dīn wa-al-taṣawwuf, nāfiʻ in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá, sammaytuhu bi-al-Iqtiṣād, wa-Allāh asʼalu al-mawt ʻalá al-Islām wa-al-khulūd fī Dār al-Salām. Qāla al-nāẓim, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamd, ay al-thanāʼ bi-al-jamīl ʻalá wajh al-taʻẓīm ..."
1. Secundo folio of "al-Iqtiṣād sharḥ al-Kawkab al-waqqād": alladhī sabaqa ghayrahu wa-lam yasbiqhu ghayruhu.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface for the first treatise: 15 x 19 cm; 32 lines per page. The second treatise is one leaf only (in 47 lines).

2. Incipit of "Tuḥfat al-aṭfāl": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yaqūlu rājī raḥmata al-ghafūri // dawman Sulaymānu huwa al-Jamzūrī. al-Ḥamdu lillāhi muṣalliyan ʻalá // Muḥammadin wa-ālihi wa-man talá. Wa-baʻdu hādhā al-naẓmu lil-murīdi // fī al-Nūni wa-al-tanwīni wa-al-mamdūdi. Sammaytuhu bi-Tuḥfati al-aṭfāli // ʻan Shaykhinā al-Mayhabī dhī al-kamāli. Arjū bi-hi an yanfaʻa al-ṭullāba // wa-al-ajra wa-al-qabūla wa-al-thawāba. Aḥkām al-Nūn al-sākinah wa-al-tanwīn. Lil-Nūni an tusakkana wa-lil-tanwīni // arbaʻu aḥkāmin fa-khudh tabyīni. Fa-al-awwalu al-iẓhāru qabla aḥrufī // lil-ḥalqi ruttibat fal-tuʻrafī .."
2. No secundo folio for "Tuḥfat al-aṭfāl" (the manuscript is one leaf only).
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).

The first treatise is written in good naskh script, in black ink, on laid white paper; the verses of the original in red; catchwords. The second treatise is written in fair naskh script, in black ink, on laid white paper.
On folio 1a: "Risālah fī al-taḥwaḥīd [al-tawḥīd]."
Folio 6a and folio 8 are blank.
1. Colophon of "al-Iqtiṣād sharḥ al-Kawkab al-waqqād": "Dhālika ākhir al-kitāb. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

1. Translation of the colophon of "al-Iqtiṣād sharḥ al-Kawkab al-waqqād": "This is the end of the book. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, his family, and his companions, and grant them peace. Amen. Amen. Amen."

The last verses of "Tuḥfat al-aṭfāl" enclude the date of composing the treatise and the number of its verse in "ḥisāb al-jummal" (Alphabetical reckoning); i.e., the year 1198 of the Hijrah (1783/1784); and 61 verses.

The text of "Tuḥfat al-aṭfāl" ends with the following verses: "... Wa-tamma dhā al-naẓmu bi-ḥamdi Allāhi // ʻalá tamāmihi bilā tanāhī. Abyātuhu naddun badā li-dhī al-nuhá // tārīkhuhā bushrá li-man yutqinuhā [i.e. the year 1198 of the Hijrah = 1783/1784]. Thumma al-ṣalātu wa-al-salāmu abadā // ʻalá khitāmi al-anbiyāʼi Aḥmadā. Wa-al-āli wa-al-ṣuḥbi wa-kulli tābiʻin // wa-kulli qāriʼin wa-kulli sāmiʻi."
2. Colophon of "Tuḥfat al-aṭfāl": "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

2. Translation of the colophon of "Tuḥfat al-aṭfāl": "It was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and his companions, and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 Juzʼ fī faḍl al-dīk : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd Allāh Abū Nuʻaym al-Iṣbahānī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi astaʻīn. Rabbi zidnī ʻilman. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Wa-baʻd, fa-qad allafa al-Ḥāfiẓ Abū Nuʻaym al-Iṣbahānī juzʼan fī faḍl al-dīk. al-Muqaddimah: al-Dīk bi-al-kasr, wa-jamʻuhu duyūk, wa-adyāk, wa-diyakah, li-fardihi, wa-qad yuṭlaqu ʻalá al-dajājah, wa-zaqā al-dīk zaqqan, wa-kunyatuhu Abū Ḥassān ..."
Secundo folio: wa-rawá al-Shaykhān wa-Abū Dāwūd.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 10 x 16 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In good large, stylistic naskh script, in black ink, on laid white paper; catchwords.
Folios 1a and 10 are blank; text folios 1b-9b.
Colophon: "Tammat fī 25 shahr Jumād Ākhir, sanat 1179, ʻalá yad afqar al-makhlūqīn Ḥasan ibn Nāṣir al-Dīn al-Jīrī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu."

Translation of the colophon: "It was completed on the 25th of the month of Jumād Ākhir, of the year 1179 [of the Hijrah = 9 December 1765], by the hand of the poorest of the creatures, Ḥasan ibn Nāṣir al-Dīn al-Jīrī, may God forgive him."

record.title: 880-02 Tanqīḥ al-ʻibārah bi-adná ishārah fī fann al-istiʻārah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Budayrī al-Dimyāṭī al-Shāfiʻ̣ī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a and incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ishtamala Kitābuhu al-ʻAzīz ʻalá aʻlá ṭabaqāt al-balāghah wa-al-ījāz, wa-jaʻala fahma maʻānīhi mutawaqqifan ʻalá maʻrifat al-ḥaqīqah wa-al-majāz, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad afḍal man ʻalá al-ṣirāṭ jāz, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi mā staʻāra [istaʻāra] mustaʻīr istiʻāratan wa-jāz. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā "Tanqīḥ al-ʻibārah bi-adná ishārah fī fann al-istiʻārah", ajabtu bi-hi suʼāl ʻalīm, fataḥa Allāh ʻalayhā lī [taʻālá] ʻalayhi, wa-talaqqāhu bi-qalbin salīm, wa-jaʻalahu bi-faḍlihi al-ʻamīm khāliṣan li-wajhihi al-karīm, fa-aqūlu mustaʻīnan bi-qudrat al-Qadīr, niʻma al-Mawlá, wa-niʻma al-Naṣīr ..."
Secundo folio: qarīnah lākin lā yushṭarat [yushtaraṭ] an takūna māniʻah.
16.5 x 24 cm; written surface: 10 x 15.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair, medium naskh script, in black ink, on laid white paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords.

The text ends with: "... Intahá, wa-ilá Allāh al-muntahá, wa-hāka matnan, maʻa suhūlat ḥifẓihi wa-ʻudhūbat lafẓihi, min bi-hi yaʻtanī ʻan al-muṭawwalāt yaghtanī, li-annahu jamaʻa anwāʻ al-majāz wa-al-istiʻārāt, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī bi-niʻmatihi tatimmu al-ṣāliḥāt, wa-afḍal al-ṣalāh ʻalá afḍal al-anām, Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-awwal wa-al-khitām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-atbāʻihi, wa-al-salām. Āmīn."
Copyist's colophon: "Katabahu al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi, Aḥmad al-Ghazzī baladan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, ʻufiya ʻanhu wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."
Translation of the copyist's colophon: "Copied by the poor to his Lord, Aḥmad al-Ghazzī baladan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, may he and the Muslims be forgiven. Āmīn."

record.title: 880-02 al-Iḥrāz fī anwāʻ al-majāz : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b): "... wa-sammaytuhu 'al-Iḥrāz fī anwāʻ al-majāz' ..."
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "[Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-]Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. [... ... ...] mā shiʼtu min rawḍ al-maʻārif rayyāhu [... ... ...] fī al-tibyān badīʻ al-maʻānī al-daqīqah [... ... ...] al-bāʻithah ilayhi al-ghaflah [... ... ...] ibn al-Sujāʻī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh [... ... ...al-ṣi]rāṭ al-mustaqīm al-mubayyin ḥaqīqat al-majāz ilá al-Sharīʻah al-samḥāʼ wa-al-dīn al-qawīm ... Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu faqīr Mawlāh Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī, ballaghahu Allāh min faḍlihi mā yatamannāh min ḥusn al-masāʻī: Qad naẓamtu fī fann al-majāz naẓman badīʻ al-maghānī, jazīl al-maʻānī, wa-aradtu an ubayyina mā inṭawá taḥta niqābih, wa-akshifa mā khafiya min lubābih bi-sharḥ laṭīf wa-uslūb ẓarīf, sālikan sabīl al-ikhtiṣār, wa-muqtaṣiran ʻalá al-muhimm min al-fann, ḥasbamā afādahu mashāyikhunā al-akhyār, wa-sammaytuhu 'al-Iḥrāz fī anwāʻ al-majāz ..."
Secundo folio: ʻalá musabbibihi al-baʻīd fa-takūnu ṣifah.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 11 x 18 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In large fair naskh script, in black ink, on laid thick white paper; the verses of the original poem in red; some comments on the margins; catchwords.

Includes a printed invitation card from the Trustees and Faculties of Hartford Seminary Foundation for the inauguration of Robbins Wolcott Barstow, D.D., 1834-1930, as president, dated 28 October 1930.

The upper left side of folio 1 is torn. On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Shar[ḥ ...] li-manẓūmat al-ʻAllāmah [... ... ...] al-Shaykh Aḥmad [... ... ...] nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-biʻulū[mih ... ...] wa-ghafara Allāh lanā wa-la-hu wa-li-wāli[... ... ...], wa-li-kull al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn, bi-mannihi wa-karamihi, innahu ʻalá mā yashāʼu qadīr. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

Author's colophon: "Intahá. Askananā Allāh bi-mannihi al-ghuraf al-ʻalīyah, wa-jamaʻa lanā bayna khayray al-Dārayn, bi-jāh Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad khayr al-barīyah, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-kirām, wa-ʻalá sāʼir atbāʻihim, wa-ʻalaynā maʻahum bilā infiṣām."

Translation of the author's colophon: "It is completed. May God, by his benevolence, make us dwell in the lofty rooms, and grant us to have the blessings of the two Abodes, by the high status of our Master and Leader Muḥammad, the best of creation, may God pray on him, on his family, on his noble companions, on all their followers, and on all of us with them, incessantly."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh yawm al-Aḥad al-mubārak, fī khamsah wa-ʻishrīn min shahr Jumād al-Akhīr, alladhī huwa min shuhūr ithnān wa-thamānūn wa-miʼah wa-alf, min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-taslīm. Katabahu li-nafsihi Ismāʻīl al-ʻAdwī. Tammat. Tamm."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "It was completed on blessed Sunday, the 25th of the month of Jumād al-Akhīr, of the year 1182 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [6 November 1768], may the best prayer and peace be upon Him. Copied by Ismāʻīl al-ʻAdwī for himself. It is completed. It is completed."

After the colophon: The following date: "Fī shahr Ṣafar, sanat alf wa-miʼah thāniyah wa-thamānūn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah [In the month of Ṣafar, of the year 1182 of the Hijrah of the Prophet = June/July 1768]."

record.title: A few medical recipes : derived from various physicians : manuscript.
record.note: Title of the section written by Mary Huntley Sigourney Russell: "Domestic economy, dedicated by permission to the Lady Sarah Everest".

record.title: 880-02 Naẓm Mukhtaṣar al-Sanūsī fī ʻilm al-manṭiq : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-faqīru al-Mullawīyu Aḥmadu // al-murtajī li-ʻafwi Rabbin yuʻbadu. al-Ḥamdu lillāhi alladhī qad anʻamā // bi-al-ʻaqli wa-al-bayāni jalla munʻimā. Thumma al-ṣalātu wa-al-salāmu abadan // ʻalá Muḥammadin ajalli man hadá. Man jāʼanā bi-al-bayyināti al-wāḍiḥah // wa-bi-al-barāhīni al-ḥisāni al-nāṣiḥah ... Wa-baʻdu fa-al-maqṣūdu naẓmu mukhtaṣar // dhī al-ʻilmi wa-al-taqwá wa-ṣāʼibi al-naẓar. Aʻnī al-Imāma al-murtaḍá al-Sanūsī // ʻalayhi raḥmātun min al-Quddūsi ..."
Secundo folio: Aʻnī bi-hādhā al-ʻĀrifa ibna ʻArafah.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 10 x 14 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In fair large naskh script, in black ink, on laid white paper; few corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Naẓm al-Shaykh al-Mullawī Mukhtaṣar al-Sanūsī fī ʻilm al-manṭiq, ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Āmīn. Am. M."

Includes a printed invitation card from the Trustees and Faculties of Hartford Seminary Foundation for the inauguration of Robbins Wolcott Barstow, D.D., 1834-1930, as president, dated 28 October 1930.

Colophon: No colophon. The poem ends with: "... Bi-al-ākharayni wa-bi-hādhā qad khatam // Sayyidunā al-Ḥabru al-Sanūsīyu al-ʻalam. Jazāhu ʻannā afḍala al-jazāʼi // Rubbu al-ʻUlā al-Wahhābu dhū al-ālāʼi. Thumma al-ṣalātu wa-al-salāmu sarmadā // fī kulli waqtin lil-Nabīyi Aḥmadā. Wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-al-tābīʻi // wa-al-ḥamdu lillāhi al-Laṭīfi al-Nāfiʻi. Tamm."

record.title: 880-03 al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaghīr min Aḥādīth al-bashīr al-nadhīr : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Abī Bakr al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a (Part one).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Part one: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī baʻatha ʻalá raʼs kull miʼat sanah man yujaddidu li-hādhihi al-ummah amr dīnihā, wa-aqāma fī kull ʻaṣr man yaḥūṭu li-hādhihi al-millah bi-tashdīd arkānihā, wa-taʼyīd sunanihā wa-tabyīnihā, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lah, shahādatan yuzīḥu ẓalām al-shukūk ṣubḥ yaqīnihā, wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidinā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, al-mabʻūth li-rafʻ kalimat al-Islām wa-tashyīdihā, wa-khafḍ kalimat al-kufr wa-tawhīnihā ... Hādhā kitābun awdaʻtu fīhi min al-kalim al-Nabawīyah ulūfan, wa-min al-ḥikam al-Muṣṭafawīyah ṣunūfan, iqtaṣartu fīhi ʻalá al-Aḥādīth al-wajīzah, wa-lakhkhaṣtu fīhi min maʻādin al-athar ibrīzahu, wa-bālaghtu fī taḥrīr al-takhrīj, fa-taraktu al-ghashsh [al-ghathth] wa-akhadhtu al-lubāb ..."
Secundo folio of Part one: lil-Ḥakimi fī mustarakihi aṭlaqtu.

Incipit of Part two: "al-Thānī min al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaghīr lil-Jalāl al-Ḥāfiẓ al-Suyūṭī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanh. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ḥarf al-Shīn. Shābbu sakhī ḥasan al-khulq aḥabbu ilá Allāh min shaykh bakhīl ʻābid. Sayyiʼ al-khulq. K, fī tārīkhihi ʻan Ibn ʻAbbās. Shārib al-khamr ka-ʻābid wathan, wa-shārib al-khamr ka-ʻābid al-Lāt wa-al-ʻUzzah. al-Ḥārith ʻan Ibn ʻUmar ..."
Secundo folio of Part two: ka-al-ʻāmil bi-hi Fr ʻan Abī Hurayrah.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 9 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 48 quires (27 and 21, respectively), mostly unnumbered)

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on laid thick white paper; headings and abbreviations of the references in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; text within double red frame; some wormholes, mostly on the margins; catchwords.
The codex is in two parts: Part one is 269 leaves (27 quires, foliation 1-269), part two is 207 leaves (21 quires, foliation 1-207).
On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaghīr min Aḥādīth al-bashīr al-nadhīr, li-Shams al-Sunnah, khātim al-ḥuffāẓ, al-Jalāl al-Suyūṭī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu.."

On folio 1a a praise for al-Suyūṭī in eight verses of poetry, by an unnamed poet, starts as follows: "Hādhā madḥ lil-Ustādh al-muʻaẓẓam, man naḥnu fī ḥaḍratihi wa-bayna yaday kitābihi al-mukarram, al-Shaykh al-Jalāl, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu. Nafaʻanā Allāh bi-ʻulūmihi, bi-ḥurmat al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam ..."
Colophon of Part one: "Wa-qad tamma al-niṣf al-awwal min hādhā al-matn al-mubārak, wa-lillāh al-ḥamd wa-al-minnah."
Translation of the colophon: "The first half of this blessed text is completed. Praise and gratitude be to God."

Colophon of Part two. No colophon. Text ends abruptly with the Ḥadīths beginning with the letter Yāʼ, as follows: "... Yustajābu li-aḥadikum mā lam yaʻjal bi-qawlihi: Daʻawtu fa-lam yustajab lī. Q D T H. ʻAn Abī Hurayrah: Yassirū ..."

record.title: 880-03 al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaghīr min Ḥadīth al-bashīr al-nadhīr : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Abī Bakr al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with part of the letter Alif, as follows: "... Abī Hurayrah. Ayyumā rajulin massa farjahu fa-li-yatawaḍḍaʼ, wa-ayyumā imraʼatin massat farjahā fa-li-tatawaḍḍaʼ. Ḥm Qṭ, ʻan Ibn ʻUmar: Ayyumā imriʼin Muslim aʻtaqa imraʼan Musliman fa-huwa fakākuhu min al-nār, yujzá bi-kull ʻaẓmin minhā (min al-nār, crossed over) minhā. Wa-ayyumā imriʼin Muslim aʻtaqa imraʼatayn Muslimatayn fa-humā fakākuhu min al-nār, yujzá bi-kull ʻaẓmin [ʻaẓm] minhā ʻaẓman minhu ..."
Secundo folio of Part two: ka-al-ʻāmil bi-hi. Fr ʻan Abī Hurayrah.
16.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 21 quires, numbered between 16 to 43; some quires are missing).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on laid white paper; headings in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; text within double red frame; catchwords.
At the head of each quire the endowment word: "Waqf".

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with part of the letter Lām, as follows: "... Lā tamassa al-Qurʼān illā wa-anta ṭāhir Qṭ K. ʻAn Ḥakīm ibn Ḥuzām: Lā tamassu al-nār Musliman raʼānī, aw, raʼá man raʼānī. T wa-al-Ḍiyāʼ ʻan Jābir Lā tamsaḥ ..."

record.title: 880-03 al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaghīr min Ḥadīth al-bashīr al-nadhīr : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Abī Bakr al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with part of the letter Mīm, as follows: "... Buraydah T N wa-al-Ḍiyāʼ ʻan Zayd ibn Arqam. Ḥ. Man kuntu walīyahu fa-ʻalayya walīyahu. Ḥm T K. ʻAn Buraydah Ḥ. Man labisa al-ḥarīr fī al-dunyā lam yalbashu fī al-ākhirah. Ḥm Q N H. ʻAn Anas. Man labisa thawb shuhrah aʻraḍa Allāh ʻanhu ḥattá yaḍaʻahu. Matá waḍaʻahu. H wa-al-Ḍiyāʼ ʻan Abī Dharr. Man labisa thawba shuhrah albasahu Allāh Yawm al-Qiyāmah thawban mithlahu thumma talhabu fīhi al-nār. D H ʻan Ibn ʻUmar. Man labisa al-ḥarīr fī al-dunyā albasahu Allāh Yawm al-Qiyāmah thawban min nār. Ḥm ʻan Juwayrīyah Ḥ. Man laṭama mamlūkahu, aw, ḍarabahu, fa-kaffāratuhu an yuʻtiqahu Ḥm ..."
Secundo folio: Man lam yukhallil aṣābiʻahu bi-al-māʼ khallalahā bi-al-nār Yawm al-Qiyāmah.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 6 unnumbered quires).

In fair large naskh script, in black ink, on laid thick white paper; headings and abbreviations in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; wormholes on the margins; text within double red frame; catchwords.

Text ends with: "... al-yawm al-mawʻūd Yawm al-Qiyāmah, wa-al-yawm al-mashhūd Yawm ʻArafah, wa-al-shāhid yawm al-Jumʻah, wa-mā ṭalaʻat al-Shams wa-lā gharabat ʻalá yawm afḍal minhu, fīhi sāʻah lā yuwāfiquhā ʻabdun Muslim yadʻū Allāh bi-khayr illā istajāba Allāh la-hu, wa-lā yastaʻīdhu min shayʼ illā aʻādhahu Allāh minhu. T Hq ʻan Abī Hurayrah."

Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih. Qāla muʼallifuhu, al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻAllāmah, khātim al-muḥaddithīn, walī Allāh taʻālá, al-Shaykh Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Suyūṭī al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh taʻālá bi-raḥmatih, wa-askanahu fasīḥ Jannatih: Farghtu minhu yawm al-Ithnayn, thāmin ʻashar [probably thāmin ʻishrīn] Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat sabʻ wa-tisʻimiʼah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn.". On the right side of the colophon, the copyist wrote: "Wulida al-muʼallif, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, sanat 849, wa-māta, raḥimahu Allāh, sanat 911."

Translation of the colophon: "The blessed book was completed by the praise of God and His help. Its author, al-Shaykh, the learned Imām, seal of the Ḥadīth scholars, friend of God Almighty, al-Shaykh Jalāl al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Suyūṭī al-Shāfiʻī, may God Almighty encompass him with His mercy, and make him dwell in His spacious Paradise, said: I completed it on Monday, the eighteenth [probably the twenty-eighth] of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, of the year 907 [of the Hijrah = 21 October 1501]. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, his family, and his companions, and grant them peace. Amen." On the right side of the colophon, the copyist wrote: "The author, may God Almighty have mercy upon him, was born in the year 849 [of the Hijrah = 1445/1446], and died, may God have mercy upon him, in the year 911 [of the Hijrah = 1505/1506]."

record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of the first "Ijāzah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Aḥmadu man ʻallama bi-al-qalam, ʻallama al-insān mā lam yaʻlam, wa-uṣallī musalliman ʻalá akmal man tajallá la-hu bi-ismaih al-ʻAlīm, fa-ʻallama mā ʻallam ... Ammā baʻd, fa-inna ajdá mā ishraʼabbat ilayhi baṣāʼir al-umam ... tatwīj hām al-ʻaql bi-tāj ʻilm al-sharʻ ... wa-inna man shāma barqa tasannum qinan hādhihi al-marātib ... al-akh al-nājiḥ ... al-Shaykh Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Shaṭbī ... lam ajid min ijābatihi bi-ijāzatihi buddan, fa-katabtu ... qāʼilan qad ajaztuhu bi-jamīʻ mā sāgha lī isāghatuhu ..."
1. Secundo folio of the first "Ijāzah": al-nufūs wa-nādá lisān shadhā ʻilmih.

2. Incipit of the second "Ijāzah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī khaṣṣa hādhihi al-ummah bi-al-isnād, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad ashraf al-ʻibād ... Ammā baʻd, faqad ṭalab minnī akhī al-ʻumdah ... al-Shaykh Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Shuṭbī al-Asyūṭī an ujīzahu, kamā huwa ʻādat ahl al-ʻilm al-muḥaṣṣilīn ... fa-lammā insharaḥa ṣadrī lidhālik ... qultu ... Qad ajaztuhu bi-mā yajūzu lī riwāyatuhu min al-manqūl wa-al-maʻqūl ..."
2. Secundo folio of the second "Ijāzah": No secundo folio (Text on folio 5a only).

3. Incipit of the third "Ijāzah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī rafaʻa al-ʻulamāʼ aʻlá al-marātib, wa-jaʻalahum warathat al-anbiyāʼ wa-ḥarasa al-Sharīʻah, fa-nālū bidhālika aʻlá al-marātib ... Ammā baʻd, fa-inna al-ʻilm afḍal mā yaktasibahu al-insān ... wa-mimman tamassaka bi-ṭarīq al-qilm al-qawīm ... akhūnā al-ʻumdah al-fāḍil ... al-Shaykh Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Shuṭbī al-Asyūṭī ... fa-ajaztuhu bimā talaqqāhu min maʻqūl wa-manqūl, wa-bi-jamīʻ kutub al-Sunnah ʻalá al-ʻumūm wa-al-shumūl ..."
3. Secundo folio of the third "Ijāzah": jaʻalanī Allāh wa-īyāhu min ahl dhālik.

4. Incipit of the fourth "Ijāzah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-kafá, wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīna iṣṭafá. Ammā baʻd, fa-qad ijtamaʻa ʻalaynā al-ʻumdah al-fāḍil al-Shaykh Aḥmad ibn al-mukarram ʻAlī al-Shuṭbī, wa-lāzamanā fī al-ḥuḍūr muddah ṭawīlah fī samāʻ kutub fī fann al-fiqh, wa-al-mawārīth, wa-al-naḥw, wa-al-manṭiq, wa-al-uṣūl, wa-al-istiʻārāt, wa-al-Mawlid, wa-al-Miʻrāj, wa-baʻḍ min al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaghīr, wa-qad ṭalab minnā an nujīzahu bimā samiʻahu minnā ... fa-istakharnā Allāh ... wa-ajznāhu bi-mā samiʻahu minnā tadrīsan, wa-iftāʼan, wa-riwāyatan ..."
4. Secundo folio of the fourth "Ijāzah": No secundo folio (Text on folio 6a only).
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 1 quire).

The four "Ijāzahs" are written in the handwriting of their issuers, and stamped with their stamps, in fair naskh script (large, medium, medium, and small, respectively), in black ink, on laid white paper; catchwords.
Texts folios 3a-6a; folios 1, 2, and 6b are blank.

1. Colophon of the first "Ijāzah": "Qālahu bi-famihi wa-khaṭṭahu bi-qalamihi ʻAlī ʻAbd al-Ḥaqq al-Qūṣī al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh la-hu, fī ḍaḥwat yawm al-Jumʻah al-mubārak, khāmis Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat 1245." Stamp.

1. Translation of the colophon of the first "Ijāzah": "Said by the mouth of, and written by the pen of, ʻAlī ʻAbd al-Ḥaqq al-Qūṣī al-Mālikī, may God forgive him, in the morning of blessed Friday, the fifth of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, of the year 1245 [of the Hijrah = 4 September 1829]." Stamp.
2. Colophon of the second "Ijāzah": "Katabahu al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Ibrāhīm al-Bājūrī al-Shāfiʻī al-Azharī, ghafara Allāh la-hu. Āmīn." Stamp.
2. Translation of the colophon of the second "Ijāzah": "Written by the poor to God Almighty, Ibrāhīm al-Bājūrī al-Shāfiʻī al-Azharī, may God forgive him. Amen." Stamp.

3. Colophon of the third "Ijāzah": "Wa-katabahu bi-qalam al-madhallah al-faqīr Muḥammad Fatḥ Allāh ibn al-Shaykh ʻUmar al-Samadīsī al-Mālikī al-Azharī ... yawm ʻishrīn min Muḥarram, ibtidāʼ sanat 1245, khamsah wa-arbaʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min Hijrat dhī al-majd wa-al-sharaf, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam." Stamp.

3. Translation of the colophon of the third "Ijāzah": "Written in the pen of humbleness, by the poor Muḥammad Fatḥ Allāh ibn al-Shaykh ʻUmar al-Samadīsī al-Mālikī al-Azharī ... on the twentieth day of Muḥarram, the beginning of the year 1245 of the Hijrah of His glory and honor [22 July 1829], may God pray on Him and grant Him peace." Stamp.

4. Colophon of the fourth "Ijāzah": "Wāfaqa dhālika yawm al-Jumʻah al-mubārak, khāmis shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat khamsah wa-arbaʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf. Qālahu wa-katabahu al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Muḥammad al-Qaltī al-Shāfiʻī." Stamp.

4. Translation of the colophon of the fourth "Ijāzah": "Said and written on blessed Friday, the fifth of the month of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, of the year 1245 [of the Hijrah = 4 September 1829], by ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Muḥammad al-Qaltī al-Shāfiʻī." Stamp.

record.title: 880-02 Faṣl al-khiṭāb fī uṣūl lughat al-Aʻrāb : manuscript / Nāṣīf ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Yāzijī al-Lubnānī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ʻilmuhu yastaghriqu al-asmāʼ wa-al-afʻāl, wa-bi-yadihi al-taṣrīf wa-al-salāmah wa-al-ṣiḥḥah wa-al-iʻlāl, ḥamdan yuzlifunā ilayh yawma tablá al-sarāʼir wa-taẓhar al-ḍamāʼir. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhā mukhtaṣarun jaʻaltuhu ka-al-bāb fī qawāʻid al-taṣrīf wa-al-iʻrāb, tastaʻīnu bi-hi al-ṭalabah al-aṣāghir ʻalá al-dukhūl ilá majlis al-akābir, wa-qad sammaytuhu 'Faṣl al-khiṭāb fī uṣūl lughat al-Aʻrāb', wa-qasamtuhu ilá kitābayn yashtamilān ʻalá abwāb wa-fuṣūl tataḍammanu mā yaḥtamilu mithluhu min hādhihi al-uṣūl, wa-astamiddu Allāh subḥānuhu al-maysarah, wa-altamisu min ahl al-naẓar al-maʻdhirah, wa-Allāh ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl ..."
Secundo folio: al-Ṣarf ʻilmun bi-uṣūlin tuʻrafu bihā aḥwāl abniyat al-kalimah.
10.5 x 17.2 cm; written surface: 7 x 13 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; dark brown leather on spine.
In good naskh script, in black ink on white paper; headings in bold script; catchwords; seals of Hartford Seminary embossed on folios 1 and 45.
Inside the front cover: "PRESENTED BY REV. THOMAS LAURIE [probably: Laurie, Thomas, 1821-1897]."
On the first flyleaf: "T Laurie Missonary House Oct 8th 1846."
On the second flyleaf: "Arabic grammar in the handwriting of the author Naseef-El-Yazijee. He boasted that he had made it so terse that dropping a single and anywhere would spoil the sense."

Colophon: "Qāla al-faqīr ilayhi taʻālá, Nāṣīf ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Yāzijī al-Lubnānī: Hādhā mā aradtu taʻlīqahu fī hādhā al-kitāb min uṣūl hādhihi al-ṣināʻah, muqtaṣiran ʻalá dāniyāt al-quṭūf min al-muhimmāt al-muṭaridah dūna al-daqāʼiq wa-al-shawārid, taqrīban li-fahm mā yuqraʼu minhu, wa-ḥifẓ mā yufhamu. Wa-Allāh subḥānuhu al-mannān bi-mannihi wa-karamih, wa-Huwa aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb. M."

Translation of the colophon: "The poor to the Almighty Nāṣīf ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Yāzijī al-Lubnānī says: This is what I wanted to introduce in this book, regarding the fundamentals of this art. I have limited myself to the easiest and the straightforward of the most important, excluding the minute and the irregular, so that what is being read is easier to understand and what is comprehendible can be memorized. God Almighty is the abundant giver by His grace and generosity. He is the more knowledgeable of what is correct. M."

record.title: 880-02 al-Futūḥāt al-wahbīyah bi-sharḥ al-Arbaʻīn al-Nawawīyah : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Marʻī ibn ʻAṭīyah al-Shabrakhītī al-Mālikī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī waffaqa li-ḥaml al-Ḥadīth man iṣṭafāhu min al-anām, wa-hadá man irtaḍāhu li-fahm mā fīhi min al-aḥkām, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lah, al-Malik al-ʻAllām, wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh alladhī ūtiya jawāmiʻ al-kalim wa-badāyiʻ al-ḥikam al-ʻiẓām, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥābatihi al-kirām ṣalātan mutaḍāʻafah mutarādafah ʻalá mamarr al-shuhūr wa-al-aʻwām wa-sallama taslīman. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḍaʻīf al-multajī ilá Mawlāhu al-Qawī al-Laṭīf, Ibrāhīm ibn ʻAṭīyah al-Shabrākhītī al-Mālikī, satara Allāh ʻuyūbahu wa-ghafara dhunūbahu wa-ballaghahu fī al-dārayn maṭlūbahu: Inna awlá́ mā unfiqat fīhi nafāʼis al-aʻmār, wa-ṣurifat ilayhi jawāhir al-afkār, wa-istuʻmilat fīhi al-asmāʻ wa-al-abṣār Ḥadīth Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-kānat al-Arbaʻūn al-Nawawīyah allatī allafahā Walī Allāh al-ʻAllāmah Muḥyī al-Dīn Abū Zakarīyā Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Nawāwī min jawāmiʻ kalāmihi, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, al-mushtamil ʻalá ablagh al-maʻānī wa-aḥkam al-mabānī, ḥattá wuṣifa aktharuhā bi-anna ʻalayhi madār al-Islām wa-ibtināʼ al-aḥkām ..."
Secundo folio: wa-sammaytuhu 'al-Futūḥāt al-wahbīyah bi-sharḥ al-Arbaʻīn al-Nawawīyah'.
16.5 x 22 cm; written surface: 10 x 16 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather with flap (in 35 numbered quires); cover and flap embossed with central medallion.

In large good and clear naskh script, in black ink on cream color paper; headings in red; the phrases of "al-Arbaʻūn al-Nawawīyah" in red; extensive commentaries and some corrections on the margins; text within double red frame; catchwords.
The codex is accompanied by a brown leather case with manuscript waste pasted inside; the codex and the leather case are housed together.
On the label pasted to the flap of the codex case: "Sharḥ al-Arbaʻīn al-Nawawīyah lil-Shaykh Ibn ʻAṭīyah."

On the back of the flyleaf: An ownership statement, indicating that the owner ordered this copy to be written exclusively for himself: "Qad istaktabahu li-nafsihi, dūna ghayrihi, al-faqīr li-raḥmat Rabbihi, ʻAlī ibn al-Shaykh Yūsuf al-Faqīh al-Daysaṭī al-Mālikī ibn Walī Allāh taʻālá, al-Ustādh al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-ʻIrāqī, al-ḥāll ḍarīḥuhu fī al-nāḥiyah al-madhkūrah, wa-jumlat kulfathih thalāthah Riyāl ḥajar, fī ghāyat shahr Rajab min shuhūr sanat aḥad wa-arbaʻīn wa-miʼah baʻda tamām al-alf, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tamm. Wa-qad qūbila fī shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1145, bi-ujrah qadrahā Riyāl Ḥajar Bunduqī, waṣala li-yaday al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Balkūsī wa-al-Shaykh Ḥasan al-ʻAmrūsī. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī manna ʻalaynā bi-taḥṣīlihi. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad afḍal khalqihi, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-jundih." Under the statement: An octatagonal stamp on which is written: "Tawakkulī ʻalá Khāliqī. ʻAlī al-Daysaṭī al-Mālikī."

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Futūḥāt al-Wahbīyah bi-sharḥ al-Arbaʻīn al-Nawawīyah, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻĀlim al-ʻAllāmah wa-al-ʻumdah al-fahhāmah, Shaykh Mashāyikh al-Islām, wa-ʻumdat al-aʼimmah al-aʻlām, Mawlānā al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm ibn al-Shaykh Marʻī ibn ʻAṭīyah al-Mālikī, saqá Allāh qabrahu saḥāʼib al-ghufrān wa-askanahu al-jinān, bi-Muḥammad wa-ālihi. Āmīn. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Three ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Dakhkhāl fī milk al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá ʻAlī Ṭāhā al-Dāwūdī al-Dajānī, fī 21 Dhulḥijjah, sanat 1264 [18 November 1848]. 2. "Milk al-faqīr li-raḥmat al-Qadīr, al-muʻtarif [bi-al-dhanb] wa-al-taqṣīr [... ... ...]." 3. "Intaqala ilá nawbat mālikihi al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá ʻafw Mawlāhu al-Qadīr, ʻAlī al-Damīrī al-Mālikī, sanat 1154 [1732/1733]."
Foliation after folio 300 not correct.

On the upper margin to the left of the colophon: A quotation from [Ibn (?)] Ḥajar (?) indicating why the author added two Ḥadīths to the original forty, as follows: "Wa-iʻlam inna al-muṣ raḥimahu Allāh wa-shakar saʻyahu ṣaddara fī al-khuṭbah annahu yaʼtī bi-arbaʻīn Ḥadīthan, wa-qad zāda ʻalayhā ithnayn, fa-zāda khayran, fa-ka-annahumā aʻjabāhu, wa-humā jadīrān bi-dhālik, fa-nāsaba al-khatma bihimā, li-anna awalahumā min bāb al-waʻẓ bi-mukhālafat al-hawá wa-mutābaʻat al-Sharʻ, wa-hādhā jāmiʻ li-jamīʻ mā fī hādhihi al-Arbaʻīn wa-sāʼir dawāwīn al-Sunnah, bal wa-limā fī al-Kitāb al-ʻAzīz ayḍan kamā marra, wa-thānīhimā targhīb fī al-duʻāʼ wa-al-rajāʼ wa-al-istighfār min al-dhunūb wa-al-ṭamaʻ fī raḥmat Allāh ʻallām al-ghuyūb. AH. [Ibn] Ḥajar, raḥimahu Allāh."

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā sahhala Allāh taḥṣīlah ʻalá ḥasb al-imkān, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh al-Karīm al-Mannān, alladhī hadānā li-hādhā wa-mā kunnā li-nahtadiya lawlā an hadānā Allāh, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá al-Nabī Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-man wālāh. Wa-innī astaghfiru Allāh mimmā yaʻlamuhu minnī min al-jurʼah ʻalá sharḥ qawl man lā yanṭuqu ʻan al-hawá, maʻa quṣūrī fī hādhihi al-māddah wa-qillat sulūkī fī hādhihi al-jāddah, wa-nasʼalu Allāh taʻālá an yamunna ʻalaynā bi-tawbatin tamḥū ʻannā kulla jarīmah, wa-an yakhtuma lanā bi-al-ḥusná, wa-yamunna ʻalaynā bi-al-maṭlūb al-asná, wa-an yashmula fī dhālika jamīʻ ahlinā wa-mashāyikhinā wa-aḥbābinā wa-man ammana ʻalá hādhā al-duʻāʼ mimman samiʻahu, wa-man daʻā lanā bi-mithlihi wa-kull al-Muslimīn. Wa-qad qīla: Yā man ghadā nāẓiran fīmā jamaʻtu wa-qad // aḍḥá yuraddidu fī afnāʼihi al-naẓarā. Saʼaltuka Allāha in ʻāyanta min khaṭaʼin // fa-ustur ʻalayya fa-khayru al-nāsi man satarā. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran dāʼiman ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what God facilitated of what I gathered, to the best of my ability. Praise be to God the Generous and the Gracious, He who guided us to this, for we would not have been guided had God not guided us. May prayer and peace be upon the Prophet Muḥammad, on his family, his companions, and those who follow him. I seek forgiveness from God for what He knows of my daring to comment on the saying of Him who does not speak whimsically, despite my deficiency in this subject, and my lack of treading in this path. We implore God to grant us repentance that wipes off from us all offence, seal our end favorably, and grant us the more radiant desire, including all our relatives, our masters, our loved ones, and those who say 'Amen' after this invocation, whoever hears it, or utters an invocation on our behalf like it, and on behalf of all Muslims. It has been said: O you who looks at what I have compiled // turning your gaze through it. I request, if you find a mistake, to cover it // for the best of the people is he who covers mistakes. God suffices us, He is the best advocate. There is no power nor might except in God, the All Mighty, the All Powerful. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, his family, and his companions, and grant them abundant and continuous peace, until Judgement Day. Amen."
