record.title: 880-03 Kitāb al-kāfī liman kāna bi-al-maʻrifah li-Kitāb Allāh muwāfī : manuscript / Yūsuf ibn Salāmah al-ʻAskarī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a and folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-ʻalayhi tawkalah [tawakkaltu (?)]. Qāla al-Shaykh al-fāḍil, al-Imām al-ʻallāmah, al-baḥr al-zākhir al-fahhāmah, farīd al-jīl, ʻāliman min ʻulamāʼ Isrāʼīl, qāyim al-layl al-ṭawīl, fī umūr al-tasbīḥ wa-al-tahlīl, al-ʻm al-marḥūm, al-maʻfw ʻan rūḥihi al-sharīfah, Mhadhdhab al-Dīn Yūsuf ibn al-marḥūm Salāmah ibn al-marḥūm Yūsuf al-ʻAskarī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-al-raḥmah wa-al-ruḍwān, wa-askanahu Firdaws al-Jinān. Āmīn. Allāhumma. Āmīn ..."
Secundo folio: wa-ḥaṣala ʻalá rutbah ʻāliyah wa-darajah sanīyah.
21 x 34 cm; written surface: 13.5 x 21 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 9 unnumbered quires).
In good medium naskh script, in black ink on laid cream color paper; headings and markings in purple; Samaritan quotations in purple; catchwords.
The pages of the codex are numbered in East Arabic (Indian) numerals: 1-182.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb al-kāfī, taʼlīf al-marḥūm al-Shaykh al-ʻAllāmah Yūsuf al-ʻAskarī, raḍā Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu wa-qaddasa ḍarīḥahu, wa-yaḥtawī ʻalá ithnayn wa-thalāthūn bāb, ay, BL. Wa-asʼaluhu taʻālá an yanfaʻanā min barakātihi. Āmīn."

On folio 2a: "... wa-kāna al-ibtidá bi-jamʻihi nahār al-Arbaʻah, ʻāshir shahr Ḥazīrān al-Rūmī, al-muwāfiq li-thāmin ʻashar shahr Jumād al-Thānī, sanat arbaʻmiʼah wa-thalāthah wa-thalāthūn li-Mamlakat Banī Hājir ..."
On folio 2a: "... wa-sammaytuhu 'Kitāb al-kāfī liman kāna bi-al-maʻrifah li-Kitāb Allāh muwāfī' ..."

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā mā inwajada min hādhā al-kitāb li-ḥadd hunā, wa-mā naʻlam aysh nihāyatuhu. Wa-Allāh subḥānuhu aʻlam. al-Kamāl lillāh taʻālá. Fī 10 Rajab, sanat 1333." Followed by three lines in Samaritan.

Translation of the colophon: "This is what was found in this book until here, but we do not know what is its end. God Almighty is more knowledgeable. Perfection is for God Almighty. On the 10th of Rajab, of the year 1333 [of the Hijrah = 24 May 1915]." Followed by three lines in Samaritan.

record.title: 880-02 Kitāb al-ṭabbākh : manuscript / Abū al-Ḥasan al-Ṣūrī.
record.note: Title from caption folio 1a and the colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi athiqu. Qāla murattib uṣūl al-ʻilm wa-al-dīn, al-fāḍil al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-Shaykh al-jalīl Abī al-Ḥasan al-Ṣūrī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, wa-yajibu minnā ʻalayhi al-taraḥḥum, wa-nasʼlu Allāh taʻālá yuskinuhu jinān al-naʻīm. Āmīn: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-munfarid fī al-wujūd, al-wāḥid al-qadīm al-maʻbūd, alladhī abdaʻa al-makhlūqāt bi-ḥikmatih, wa-rattabahum bi-ʻaẓīm ṣanʻatih, wa-rafaʻa al-samāʼ bi-qudratih, wa-basaṭa al-arḍ bi-mashīʼatih ..."
Secundo folio: text in Samaritan script.
21 x 32.7 cm; written surface: 13 x 21.5 cm; 30 lines per page.
Binding: In dark green buckram; black cloth on spine; black cloth tab attached to the back cover to be used as page marker.
In good medium naskh script, in black ink on laid cream color paper; Samaritan quotations in purple; some comments on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a-1b: A table of contents of the codex: "Hādhihi fahrasat 'Kitāb al-ṭabbākh' al-mansūb ilá al-ʻĀlim al-Shaykh Abī al-Ḥasan al-Ṣūrī, taghammadahu Allāh taʻālá bi-raḥmatih wa-askanahu Firdaws Jannatih. Āmīn."
On the back of the end leaf: The twenty-two letters of the Samaritan Alphabet.
On folio 69b: Three pieces of poetry (in seven verses), warning against lending books.

Colophon: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-Qādir alladhī qaddara wa-ʻāna min faḍlihi wa-jazīl inʻāmihi hādhā al-ʻabd al-ḥaqīr ʻalá naskh hadhā al-kitāb al-madʻū bi-'Kitāb al-ṭabbākh', alladhī huwa min taʼlīf Sayyidinā al-ʻĀlim al-fāḍil Abī al-Ḥasan al-Ṣūrī al-Danafī, ẓallala Allāh ḍarīḥahu bi-saḥāʼib raḥmatih wa-ghufrānih, wa-askannā naḥnu wa-īyāhu naʻīmahu. Wa-kāna dhālika fī masāʼ nahār al-Aḥad, ghāyat Jumādá al-Thānī, sanat 1326, alf wa-thalāthimiʼah wa-sittah wa-ʻishrīn Hijrīyah, al-muwāfiq li-khamsat ʻashar yawm min shahr Ḥazīrān al-Rūmī, sanat 324. Wa-anā al-ʻabd al-dhalīl, al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, Munīr ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-marḥūm al-maʻfw ʻanhu Murjān ibn Salāmah ibn Murjān ibn ʻAbd al-Laṭīf ibn Yaʻqūb ibn Murjān ibn Ibrāhīm ibn Ismāʻīl al-Danafī al-Mūsawī al-Isrāʼīlī al-Sāmirī. Wa-qad jaʻaltuhu bi-rasmī wa-rasm ikhwatī al-maḥrūsīn bi-ʻināyat Allāh taʻālá, Salīm wa-Badr wa-Rūḥī, wa-lubb fuʼādī wa-nūr ʻuyūnī, rajāʼ Allāh yajʻaluhu mubārak ʻalaynā wa-ʻalayhim. Āmīn." Followed by two lines in the Samaritan script. And an a request: "Wa-man wajada ʻayban wa-aṣlaḥ fī jamīʻ umūrihi yanjaḥ. Āmīn [He who finds a blemish and corrects it will be successful in all his affairs. Amen]."

Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God who enabled and helped by His favor and abundant kindness this wretched servant, to copy this book, titled 'Kitāb al-ṭabbākh', which was written by our Master, the eminent scholar Abī al-Ḥasan al-Ṣūrī al-Danafī, may God shade his tomb by the clouds of his mercy and forgiveness, and make us and him dwell in His abode of bliss. Copied on the evening of Sunday, the end of Jumādá al-Thānī, of the year 1325 [of the Hijrah = end of July 1908], corresponding to the fifteenth of the month of Ḥazīrān al-Rūmī, of the year 324 [could not be identified]. I, the humble servant, who admits his short coming and inadequacy, Munīr ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-marḥūm al-maʻfw ʻanhu Murjān ibn Salāmah ibn Murjān ibn ʻAbd al-Laṭīf ibn Yaʻqūb ibn Murjān ibn Ibrāhīm ibn Ismāʻīl al-Danafī al-Mūsawī al-Isrāʼīlī al-Sāmirī, have made it for myself and for my brothers who are protected by the providence of God Almighty, Salīm, Badr, and Rūḥī, the core of my heart and the light of my eyes. May God render it a blessing to us and to them. Amen." Followed by two lines in the Samaritan script. And a request: "He who finds a blemish and corrects it will be successful in all his affairs. Amen."

To the right of the colophon a note by the copyist indicating that ink was split over the colophon which he wiped out and amended the text, as follows: "ʻInda hādhā al-masḥ nazal ʻalayhi al-ḥibr, fa-iltazamtu an amsaḥahu wa-aʻmalahu."

record.title: 880-02 al-Jawāhir al-muntaẓimāt fī ʻuqūd al-Maqūlāt : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Ḥamdan li-man tanzzaha ʻan simāt al-makhlūqāt wa-taqddasa ʻan al-kam wa-al-kayf wa-sāʼir al-munqaṣāt, wa-ṣalātan wa-salāman ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-jāmiʻ lil-ḥikam, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi jawāhir al-faḍl, man bi-him ʻiqd al-maʻārif intaẓam. Āmīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu faqīr Mawlāh Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī, lā zāla fī sabīl al-khayrāt sāʻī: Hādhā sharḥ laṭīf wa-unmūdhaj sharīf li-naẓmī 'al-Maqūlāt' yutammimu mafādahu wa-yubayyinu murādahu, wa-mustamiddan dhālik min 'al-Mawāqif' wa-shurūḥih, wa-ghayrihā min al-kutub al-muʻtabarāt, sālikan sabīl al-ījāz maʻa tawḍīḥ al-murād, wa-billāh astaʻīnu wa-astaʻīdh min shayāṭīn al-nins wa-al-jinn fī al-dunyā wa-yawm al-tanād, wa-sammaytuhu 'al-Jawāhir al-manẓūmāt fī ʻuqūd al-Maqūlāt ..."
Secundo folio: anwāʻan wa-lam yathbut al-ḥaṣr.
17 x 24 cm; written surface: 11 x 16.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on laid white paper; the verses of the original poem "al-Maqūlār" in red; few corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi 'al-Jawāhir al-muntaẓimāt fī ʻuqūd al-maqūlāt' lil-faqīr Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī al-Shāfiʻī, laṭafa Allāh bi-hi wa-bi-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Milk al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Najjārī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

On folio 1a: The text of the original eight verses of "al-Maqūlāt", as follows: "Inna al-Maqūlāti ladayhim tuḥṣaru // fī al-ʻshri wa-hiya ʻaraḍun wa-jawharu. Fa-awwalun la-hu wujūdun qāmā // bi-al-ghayri wa-al-thānī bi-nafsin dāmā. Mā yaqbalu al-qismata bi-al-dhāti fa-kam // wa-al-kayfu ghayru qābilin bi-hā irtasam. Ayna ḥuṣūlu al-jismi bi-al-makāni // matá ḥuṣūlun khuṣṣa bi-al-azmāni. Wa-nisbatun takarrart iḍāfatun // naḥwa ubūwatun ikhā laṭāfah. Waḍʻun ʻurūḍu hayʼatin bi-nisbatin // li-juzʼihi wa-khārijun fa-athbiti. Wa-hayʼatun bi-mā aḥāṭa wa-intaqil // milkun kathawbin aw ihābin ishtamal. In yafʻali al-taʼthīru an yanfaʻilā // taʼthīru mā dāma kullun kamulā."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min tabyīḍ hādhā al-sharḥ yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, li-sitt maḍayna min Rabīʻ al-Awwal alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-ithnayn wa-thamānīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ghafara Allāh lahu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The fair copy of this commentary was completed on blessed Thursday, six [nights] having passed from Rabīʻ al-Awwal, of the year 1182 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [21 July 1768], may the best prayer and peace be upon Him. May God forgive him, his parents, and all Muslims."

record.title: 880-02 Ṭulūʻ al-Thurayyā bi-iẓhār mā kāna khafīyan : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: Title partly supplied by Hartford Seminary, and from the printed versions and reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... bi-ḥāl lil-ijtihād fīhi fa-yanzilu ʻalá anna dhālika ʻindahu ʻan al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, kamā qāla al-Shāfiʻī, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu, fī ṣalāt ʻAlī, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu, fī al-kusūf fī kull rakʻah akthar min rukūʻayn. Intahá kalām Sharḥ al-Nukhbah. Wa-qāla al-Ḥāfiẓ Ibn Ḥajar fī Nukatihi ʻalá Ibn al-Ṣalāḥ, mā qālahu al-Ṣaḥābī, mimmā lā majāla lil-ijtihād fīhi, fa-ḥukmuhu al-rafʻ ka-al-ikhbār ʻan al-umūr al-māḍiyah, min mabdaʼ al-khalq, wa-qiṣaṣ al-anbiyāʼ, wa-ʻan al-umūr al-ātiyah, ka-al-malāḥim, wa-al-fitan, wa-al-baʻth, wa-ṣifat al-jannah wa-al-nār, wa-al-ikhbār ʻan ʻamal mā yaḥṣula bi-hi thawāb makhṣūṣ, aw ʻiqāb makhṣūṣ, fa-hādhihi ashyāʼ lā majāl lil-ijtihād fīhā, fa-yuḥkamu lahā bi-al-rafʻ ..."
Secundo folio: hādhā yakūnu ṣaḥābīyan wa-kān yaquṣṣ bi-Makkah ʻalá ʻahd ʻUmar.
16 x 21 cm; written surface: 10 x 14 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on thick laid white paper; headings in red; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-rawá Aḥmad wa-Abū Dāwūd Ḥadīth 'Kull maytin yukhtamu ʻalá ʻamalihi illā alladhī māta murābiṭan fī sabīl Allāh fa-innahu yanmū ʻamaluhu ilá yawm al-qiyāmah wa-yuʼmanu min fattānay al-qabr'. Wa-rawá al-Nasāʼī Ḥadīth anna rajulan qāl: Yā Rasūl Allāh mā bāl al-muʼminīn yuftanūn fī qubūrihim illā al-shahīd. Qāl: Kafá bi-bāriqat al-suyūf ʻalá raʼsihi fitnatan. Wa-rawá Juwaybir min Ḥadīth Ibn ʻAbbās, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhumā, qāl: Shahid Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, janāzata rajul min al-Anṣār, fa-dhakar al-Ḥadīth, wa-fīhi suʼāl al-malakayn, wa-qāl: Hiya ashaddu fitnah tuʻraḍu ʻalá rajul. Fa-hādhihi Aḥādīth marfūʻah ṣarīḥah, fī anna al-murād bi-fitnat al-qabr suʼāl Munkar wa-Nakīr, wa-kadhā ..."

record.title: 880-01 Qiṣṣat al-Isrāʼ wa-al-Miʻrāj : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Ruwiya fī al-Ḥadīth al-Sharīf, ʻan al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, annahu qāl: Fa-bimā bayna [Fa-baynamā (?)] dhāta laylah min al-layālī, wa-kānat laylata raʻdin wa-barqin wa-maṭar, wa-idhā atā al-Malak Jubrāʼīl, ʻalayhi al-salām, fī al-ṣūrah allatī khalaqahu Allāh taʻālá, wa-huwa abyaḍ wa-janāḥuhu akhḍar wa-shaʻruhu ajʻad, la-hu sabʻīn alf dhuʼbah muṭawwaqah bi-al-dhahab, mukallalah bi-al-aṣnāf wa-al-jawhar, wa-bayna ʻaynayhi maktūb bi-al-nūr: Ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdah lā sharīka lah, wa-anna Muḥammad ʻabduhu wa-Rasūluh ..."
Secundo folio: wa-barakātuh, fa-qultu ʻalayka al-salām.
11 x 16 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 11.5 cm; 11 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-bayna yaday al-kursī nahrun yuqālu la-hu al-Kawthar, fī aṭrāfihi khiyām min durr, wa-ḥaffatayhi min misk, wa-janāzīruhu min al-yāqūt, wa-mawjuhu al-luʼluʼ, wa-ḥaṣāhu zumurrud, wa-jumānuhu kāfūr wa-ʻanbar, wa-ʻalá ḥafyat [ḍiffat (?)] al-nahr qubbah min al-zumurrud al-akhḍar wisʻuhā farsakh, fī kull farsakh qubbah, fī kull qubbah arbaʻat abwāb, fī kull bāb min dhahab ..."

record.title: Kensington Palace household inventory scroll : manuscript.
record.note: At the head of the scroll recto: "Anno XXVI R[eg]ni R[egi]s Georgii Sec[undi] 1753 : Mercurii xviii die Julij 1754. Pro Regal et Fam Apud Kensington Dispens[i]s".

record.title: Treatises on Arabic Grammar : manuscript.
record.note: 1. Title of "Naẓm fī al-asmāʼ al-muʼannathah bi-ghayr ʻalāmah" from folio 1a.
2. Title of "Dhāt al-ḥulal wa-mahāt al-kulal" supplied by Hartford Seminary.
3. Title of "al-Qawl al-faṣl fī hamzat al-waṣl" from folio 10a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Naẓm fī al-asmāʼ al-muʼannathah bi-ghayr ʻalāmah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Min naẓm al-Shaykh ʻAlam al-Dīn al-Sakhāwī, raḥimahu Allāh, fī al-asmāʼ al-muʼannathah bi-ghayr ʻalāmah, mimmā jamīʻuhu bi-khaṭṭ al-Shaykh Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, wa-min khaṭṭihi naqaltu. Nafsī al-fidāʼ li-sāʼilin wāfānī // bi-masāʼila fāḥat ka-ghuṣni al-bāni. Asmāʼu taʼnīthin bi-ghayri ʻalāmatin // hiya yā fatá fī ʻurfihim ḍarbāni. Qad kāna minhā mā yuʼannathu thumma mā // huwa fīhi khayrun bi-ikhtilāfi maʻānī. Ammā allatī lā budda min taʼnīthihā // sittūna minhā al-ʻaynu wa-al-udhunāni. Wa-al-nafsu thumma al-dāru thumma al-dalwu min // aʻdādihā wa-al-sinnu wa-al-katifāni. Wa-Jahannamun thumma al-saʻīru wa-ʻaqrabun // wa-al-arḍu thumma al-istu wa-al-ʻaḍudān ..."
1. Secundo folio of "Naẓm fī al-asmāʼ al-muʼannathah bi-ghayr ʻalāmah": Wa-kadhāka fī kabidin wa-fī karshin wa-fī // saqarin wa-minhā al-ḥarbu wa-al-naʻlān.

2. Incipit of "Dhāt al-ḥulal wa-mahāt al-kulal": "Qāla al-Shaykh ʻAlam al-Dīn al-Sakhāwī: Bi-ḥamdi Allāhi Rabbi al-ʻālamīnā // wa-Rabbi al-ʻArshi abdaʼu mustaʻīnā. Wa-ṣallá Allāhu khallāqu al-barāyā // ʻalá khayri al-barīyati ajmaʻīnā. Muḥammadin al-Nabīyi wa-ālihi wa-al- // qarābati wa-al-ṣaḥābati wa-al-banīnā. Wa-baʻdu fa-innanī aẓhartu mā law // ḥawāhu siwāya kāna bi-hi ḍanīnā. Kunūzu mā ihtadá ghayrī ilayhā // fa-ubrizu jawharn minhā dafīnā ..."
2. Secundo folio for "Dhāt al-ḥulal wa-mahāt al-kulal": Wa-laysa bi-dhī ʻudhrin wa-laysa musāfiran.

3. Incipit of "al-Qawl al-faṣl fī hamzat al-waṣl": "al-Qawl al-faṣl fī hamzat al-waṣl. Qāʻidah. Hamzah al-waṣl immā an takūna fī ism aw fiʻil aw ḥarf. Wa-ammā al-ism, fa-lā yakūnu hamzatuhu hamzata waṣl illā fī nawʻayn: Aḥaduhumā asmāʼ ghayr maṣādir, wa-hiya ʻasharah maḥfūẓah: ism wa-ist wa-ibn wa-ibnum wa-ibnah wa-imruʼ wa-ithnān wa-ithnatān wa-aymunu Allāh, fī al-qasam, wa-tathniyat al-sabʻah al-ūlá bi-manzilatihin, bi-khilāf al-jamʻ, fa-inna hamzatuhu hamzat qaṭʻ ..."
3. Secundo folio of "al-Qawl al-faṣl fī hamzat al-waṣl": No secundo folio.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface for the first two treatises: 8 x 13 cm; 15 lines per page. The written surface for the third treatise is 12 x 21 cm (one leaf only in 30 lines).
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).

al-Sakhāwī's two treatises are written in the same hand; the first in good naskh script, the second in good to fair naskh script. The third treatise is written in a different hand, in fair naskh script. The codex is written in black ink, on cream color paper; some headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; no catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Fī al-asmāʼ al-muʼannathah bi-ghayr ʻalāmah, wa-mā baʻdahu min al-alghāz lil-Shaykh ʻAlam al-Dīn al-Sakhāwī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Tamm."
On folio 1a: Miscellaneous quotations, proverbs, and anecdotes in prose and poetry, in different hands.

1. Colophon of "Naẓm fī al-asmāʼ al-muʼannathah bi-ghayr ʻalāmah": No colophon. The poem ends with: "Fa-qaṣīdatī tabqá wa-innīya aktasī // thawba al-fanāʼi wa-kull shayʼin fānī. Wa-nasītu dhikra al-Rabbi arjū ʻafwahu // wa-Allāhu yaghfiru zallata al-insāni."

2. The poem of "Dhāt al-ḥulal wa-mahāt al-kulal" ends with: "... Jalawtu qaṣidatan kusiyat bahāʼan // wa-ḥusnan rāʼiʻan malaʼa al-ʻuyūnā. Fa-qad raḥima al-Raḥīmu fatan ḥabāhu // bi-jalwatihā tusirru al-nāẓirīnā. Wa-ṣallá Allāhu afḍala mā yuṣallī // ʻalá man sāda fī al-faḍli al-qurūnā. Muḥammadin al-Nabīyi wa-ālihi wa-al- // ṣiḥābi al-ṭayibīna al-akramīnā."
2. Colophon of "Dhāt al-ḥulal wa-mahāt al-kulal": "Tammat bi-ḥamdi Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Intahá. Sanat 1048."

2. Translation of the colophon of "Dhāt al-ḥulal wa-mahāt al-kulal": "It was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. It is completed. The year 1048 [of the Hijrah = 1638/1639]."

3. Colphon of: "al-Qawl al-faṣl fī hamzat al-waṣl": No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... Iʻlam inna ḥarakat hamzat al-waṣl, minhā mā yuḥarraka bi-al-kasr fī al-akthar, wa-bi-al-ḍamm fī lughah ḍaʻīfah, wa-huwa ism, wa-minhā mā yuḥarraku bi-al-fatḥ ..."

record.title: 880-02 Radd al-muftarī ʻan al-ṭaʻn fī al-Shushtarī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Nābulusī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a and the incipit (folio 2a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-kafá, wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīna iṣṭafá. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu Shaykhunā al-ʻAllāmah al-fahhāmah, miṣbāḥ al-tawḥīd wa-ṣayyāḥ ahl al-taghrīd, farīd ahl al-ʻaṣr fī al-ʻawārif, wa-waḥīd ahl al-dahr fī al-maʻārif, ṣāḥib al-ʻilm al-Qudsī wa-al-qurb al-unsī, Sayyidī wa-Mawlāy, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Nābulusī al-Dimashqī al-Ḥanafī, khādim kalām al-Sādāt, wa-ḥāmil niʻāl al-fuqarāʼ arbāb al-siyādāt: Ṭalaba minnī baʻḍ al-ikhwān kitābat shayʼ min fayḍ al-Malik al-Mannān, bi-ṭarīq al-sharḥ li-qaṣīdat al-ʻārif billāh al-Shushtarī, tilmīd al-Shaykh al-ʻārif al-kāmil ʻAbd al-Ḥaqq Ibn Sabʻīn, qaddasa Allāh rūḥahumā, wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahumā, ʻalá wajh al-ʻiyān ... fa-ajabtuhu ilá dhālik ... wa-sammaytuhu 'Radd al-muftarī ʻan al-ṭaʻn fī al-Shushtarī' ..."
Secundo folio: bi-ṭarīq al-sharḥ li-qaṣīdat al-ʻārif billāh al-Shushturī.
11.5 x 17 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 12 cm; 11 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi kurrāsah tusammá 'Radd al-muftarī ʻan al-ṭaʻn fī al-Shushtarī' bi-al-tamām."

On folio 9b al-Nābulusī comments on al-Shushtarī's usage of Christian terminology in his poetry, as follows: "... wa-kāna al-Shushtarī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, min aṣḥāb hādhā al-maqām, qad istaʻmala fī naẓmihi iṣṭilāḥāt al-Injīl, wa-salaka hātīka al-masālik al-ʻĪsawīyah al-Rabbānīyah, wa-huwa Muḥammadī, wa-lākinnahu ʻĪsawī fī hādhā al-mashrab al-madhkūr, wa-kalimatuhu ʻArabīyah Muḥammadīyah, li-annahā kalimah Ilāhīyah, wa-lākinnahā fī hādhā al-mashrab Suryānīyah lā ʻArabīyah ..."

al-Lāmīyah of al-Shushtarī starts as follows: "Taʼaddab bi-bābi al-dayri wa-ikhlaʻ bi-hi al-naʻlā // wa-sallim ʻalá al-ruhbān wa-uḥṭuṭ bi-him raḥlā. Wa-ʻaẓẓim bi-hi al-qissīsa in shiʼta ḥuẓwatan // wa-kabbir bi-hi al-shammās in shiʼta an taʻlā. Wa-dūnaka aṣwātu al-shamāmīsi fa-istamiʻ // li-alḥānihim wa-iḥdharka an yaslubū al-ʻaqlā. Badat fīhi aqmāru shumūsin ṭawāliʻi // yaṭūfūna bi-al-ṣulbāni fa-iḥdharka an tablā. Wa-īyāka an tasmaʻ lahunna bi-ḥikmatin // wa-īyāka an tajmaʻ lahunna bika al-shamalā. Fa-in kāna hādhā al-sharṭu waffayta ḥaqqahu // wa-lam tanquḍan minhu ʻuhūdan wa-lā qawlā. Daʻawka bi-qissīsin wa-sammawka rāhiban // wa-abdaw laka al-asrāra wa-istaḥsanū al-ʻaqlā. Wa-aʻṭawka miftāḥ al-kunayyisati allatī // bihā ṣūratu ʻĪsá rahābīnuhum shaklā ..."
Some leaves seem to be missing between folios 13 and 14.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... thumma akhbara annahu qāl la-hu: Mā murādī hādhihi al-ʻibārāt wa-lā maʻrifat hādhā al-kalām alladhī qultahu lī, wa-innamā murādī an adhūqa anā fī nafsī hādhihi al-ḥaqāʼiq, wa-ataḥaqqaqa bi-hā fī dhātī wa-taṣīra lī mashraban, li-annī asmaʻuhā minka, wa-afhamu mujarrada maʻānīhā. Thumma akhbara anna khamratahu al-maqṣūdah la-hu huwa kashfuhu ʻan al-Ḥaḍrah al-Qadīmah allatī laysa lahā qabl, wa-lā tattaṣifu bi-al-qablīyah li-shayʼ aṣlan, allatī tuʻṭī al-taḥaqquq li-man kushifa la-hu ʻanhā bi-al-ism al-Ilāhī wa-bi-al-tawḥīd al-dhawqī al-ʻiyānī al-kashfī, wa-tuʻarrifuhu bi-al-ḥaqīqah ..."

record.title: 880-01 Munājāt Sayyidinā Mūsá : manuscript.
record.note: Title from folios 1a and 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ruwiya ʻan Jaʻfar ibn Muḥammad al-Ṣādiq ibn [ʻan] Wahb ibn Munabbih ʻan Kaʻb al-Aḥbār, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, anna Mūsá, ʻalayhi al-salām, lammā kharaja ilá munājāt Allāh, ʻazza wa-jall, istakhlafa akhāhu Hārūn, ʻalayhi al-salām, ʻalá Banī Isrāʼīl, thumma ṣaʻida fawqa Jabal al-Ṭūr yantaẓiru amra Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, arbaʻīna yawman, wa-huwa shahr Dhī al-Qaʻdah wa-ʻasharah min Dhī al-Ḥijjah, kadhā ṣaḥḥa ʻan aṣḥāb al-Ḥadīth wa-al-akhbār ..."
Secundo folio: la-hu, la-hu al-mulk wa-la-hu al-ḥamd.
11.5 x 17 cm; written surface: 7 x 12.5 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire)
In large good naskh script, in black ink, on thick white paper; headings in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Munājāt Sayyidinā Mūsá ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl."
On folio 1b: An unreadable brown circular stamp with its shadow on folio 2a.
On folio 2a: "Hādhihi Munājāt Sayyidinā Mūsá, ʻalayhi al-salām, ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl. Āmīn. Tamm." And some calculations, and a magic square.
Text folios 2b-10b; folio 11 is blank.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... thumma khalaqtu al-qalam baʻda dhālika kullihi bi-sabʻīn alf ʻām wa-qultu la-hu: Uktubu mā huwa kāyin ilá Yawm al-Qiyāmah, thumma khalaqtu baʻda dhālika kullihi al-lawḥ al-maḥfūẓ qabla al-samāwāt wa-al-arḍ wa-al-jannah wa-al-nār, thumma khalaqtu al-jinn min nār al-sumūm, thumma khalaqtu min al-jinn ummah kathīrah, thumma khalaqtu abāka Ādam min ṭīn, fa-hal aḥṣayta dhālika kullahu Yā Mūsá, fa-kharra maghshīyan ..."

record.title: 880-01 Kitāb Ḥadīth al-Miʻrāj : manuscript.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā Kitāb Ḥadīth al-Miʻrāj, laylata an usriya bi-hi, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, min al-Masjid al-Ḥarām, ilá al-Masjid al-Aqṣá, ilá Bayt al-Maqdis, ilá al-samāwāt al-sabʻ, Ilá Allāh ʻazza wa-jall, wa-rajiʻa fī firāshihi, fī laylah wāḥidah, wa-dhālika ʻalá Allāh yasīr. Ruwiya ʻan Ibn Isḥāq, ʻan Ibn ʻAbbās, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhumā, anna al-isrāʼ kānat laylat sabʻah wa-ʻishrūn fī Rajab ..."
Secundo folio: laylat al-Ithnayn wa-idhā bi-ṭāriq yaṭruqu al-bāb.
11.5 x 17.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 14 cm; 12-23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
The manuscript is written in two different hands; in fair naskh script (medium and large), in black ink, on thick white paper; some pages are lined; text within a single black frame; catchwords.
Text folios 1b-25a; folios 25b-28b are blank.

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā mā intahá ilaynā min 'Ḥadīth al-Miʻrāj' alladhī ʻaraja fīhi, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-naʻūdhu billāh min al-dhal [al-zalal] wa-al-khaṭaʼ wa-al-nisyān wa-al-nuqṣān. Wa-Allāh taʻālá yaʻlamu al-ṣawāb. Ghafara Allāh li-kātibihi Muḥammad Khalīl wa-al-Shaykh Ḥasan Muḥammad, wa-li-wālidīhim wa-ahlihim wa-jamīʻ ummat Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalyahi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Yā Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what has reached us of 'Ḥadīth al-Miʻrāj', the account of the ascension of [Prophet Muḥammad], may God pray on Him and grant Him peace. We take refuge in God from error and mistake, from forgetfulness and omission. God Almighty knows what is correct. May God forgive its copyists Muḥammad Khalil and al-Shaykh Ḥasan Muḥammad, their parents, their families, and the entire 'ummah' (community) of Muḥammad, may God pray on Him and grant Him peace. Amen. O Lord of the Univers."

record.title: 880-02 al-Ījāz ʻalá ḥusn al-majāz li-ḍabṭ ʻalāqāt al-majāz : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Sandūbī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi astaʻīn. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻĀlim al-ʻAllāmah, al-ʻumdah al-ḥabr al-fahhāmah, Shaykh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, al-Imām al-awḥad Sayyidī Aḥmad: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ḥamdan li-man la-hu al-ḥamd ḥaqīqatan wa-li-ghayrihi majāz, wa-ṣalātan wa-salāman ʻalá man khuṣṣa bi-jawāmiʻ al-kalim wa-al-ījāz. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-ʻAlī, Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad al-Sandūbī ibn ʻAlī: Lammā kāna naẓm 'ʻAlāqāt al-majāz' lil-Imām al-ʻAllāmah wa-al-farīd al-fahhāmah, Sulaymān ibn Yūsuf ibn ʻUmar al-Muzanaī al-Shāfiʻī, aḥsan mā ṣunnifa fī hādhā al-shaʼn, li-tawḍīḥ naẓmaihi ʻalá al-ikhwān, ṭalaba minnī baʻḍ al-aṣḥāb min al-muʻtaqidīn al-aḥbāb an ashraḥahā wa-ubayyina mughlaqahā, fa-rajiʻtu al-qahqará li-quṣūrī ʻan bulūgh tilaka al-dhurá ... wa-sammaytuhu 'al-Ījāz ʻalá ḥusn al-majāz li-ḍabṭ ʻalāqāt al-majāz ..."
Secundo folio: tilka al-jauzʼīyat wa-lākin kathīran mā yuqaddamu.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 18.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on laid white paper; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ matn al-ʻalāqāt al-khams wa-ʻishrīn ʻalāqah lil-ʻĀlim al-ʻAllāmah al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Sundūbī, ʻafá́ Allāh ʻanhu. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: "Nimrah 6570."

The poem of al-Muzanī starts with: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh dhī al-aḥkām wa-al-ḥikami // wa-bāʻith al-khalqi baʻda al-mawti wa-al-ʻadam. Thumma al-ṣalātu ʻalá al-Mukhtāri min Muḍarin // Khayri al-Nabīyīna wa-al-amlāki kullihim ..."

The text of al-Sandūbī ends with the commentary on the last two verses of al-Muzanī, as follows: "... Thumma al-ṣalātu kadhā al-taslīmu yaṣḥabuhā // ʻalá alladhī fāqa kulla al-khalqi fī al-karami. Wa-al-āli wa-al-ṣaḥbi mā ghannat muṭawwaqatun // ʻalá al-ghuṣūni wa-mā ablat mina al-naghami. Wa-al-kalām ʻalá hādhayn al-baytayn maʻlūmun maʻrūf."
Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. M. M. M."
Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and his companions, and grant them peace. M. M. M."

record.title: 880-02 al-Durrah al-muḍīyah fī al-aʻmāl al-shamsīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Haykal al-Akhṣāṣī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi athiq. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khātim al-nabīyīn wa-al-mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-al-tābiʻīn, ṣalātan wa-salāman dāʼimayn mutalāzimayn ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi jadāwil yuʻlamu minhā awāʼil al-sinīn al-ʻArabīyah wa-shuhūrihā, wa-madākhil awāʼil al-sinīn al-Qibṭī fīhā, wa-maʻrifat awāʼilihā wa-shuhūrihā, wa-awāʼil al-sinīn al-Suryānīyah wa-shuhūrihā, wa-mawḍiʻ al-Shams min falak al-burj, wa-maʻrifat al-ṭāliʻ minhā wa-al-māḍī wa-al-bāqī min al-shuhūr. Wa-min kull mā aradtahu yaẓharu laka in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá. Wa-sammaytuhā 'al-Durrah al-muḍīyah fī al-aʻmāl al-shamsīyah'. Ammā al-tārīkh al-ʻArabī fa-mabdaʼ min al-sanah allatī hājara fīhā Nabīyunā, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, min Makkah al-Musharrafah ilá al-Madīnah al-Munawwarah, wa-awwaluhu yawm al-Khamīs ..."
Secundo folio: ʻalāmat tilka al-sannah.
15.3 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 14.5 cm; 18 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on laid cream color paper; headings in red; some notes on the margins; text within double red frames; catchwords.
At the head of folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā lillāh taʻālá Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."

On folio 1a: "al-Durrah al-muḍīyah fī al-aʻmāl al-shamsīyah, li-Shaykhinā al-ʻĀlim al-ʻAllāmah wa-al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Akhṣāṣī, al-muwaqqit bi-Jāmiʻ al-Azhar, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn."
On folio 1a: Two verses of poetry on God's providence, and two unreadable verses in a different hand.
Under the astronomical table on folio 1a: "ʻAmal Ḥasan al-Ṭablāwī."

At the end of folio 4a: "Wa-Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Min ʻamal al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Allāh subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá Ḥasan al-Ṭablāwī."
At the head of folio 5a: "Min ʻamal al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Ḥasan al-Ṭablāwī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu bi-mannihi wa-karamih."
At the head of some tables: "Ḥisāb al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad al-Akhṣāṣī ibn al-Shaykh Haykal al-Akhṣāṣī, al-muwaqqit bi-Jāmiʻ al-Azhar."
Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with an astronomical table, titled: "Baqīyat maṭāliʻ al-shafaq al-aḥmar idhā kānat munḥaṭṭah min al-ufuq."

record.title: 880-02 Tuḥfat al-ṭullāb li-jamʻ mā tafarraqa min al-awrād : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad al-Junaydī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 2a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-muʻṭī al-wahhāb, mujrī al-saḥāb, fātiḥ al-abwāb, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad dhū al-faḍl wa-al-amdād. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu afqar al-ʻibād ilá Allāh taʻālá, al-mutaṭaffil ʻalá abwāb al-dhull wa-al-iftiqār, Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad, al-shahīr bi-Maghribī al-Junaydī al-Maymūnī al-Shāfiʻī, al-murtajī riḍá al-Ghaffār, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn. Iʻlamū ikhwānī, waffaqnī Allāh wa-īyākum li-ṭāʻatihi, wa-saqānā wa-īyākum min kuʼūs maḥabbatihi, inna ṭarīq al-qawm khaṭirah, fa-lā yahtadī lahā wa-yantafiʻu minhā illā man waffaqahu Allāh la-hā, wa-tawfīq Allāh ʻazīz, wa-li-dhālika lam yudhkar fī al-Qurʼān illā marratan wāḥidah fī qawlihi taʻālá: 'Wa-mā tawfīqī illā billāh'. Wa-li-nadhkur hunā li-man yurīdu ṭarīq al-qawm wa-yasīru bi-sayr ahlihā kalāman fī faḍl ṣalawāt al-tahajjud, wa-fī faḍl al-qiyām bi-al-asḥār ... wa-sammaytuhā 'Tuḥfat al-ṭullāb li-jamʻ al-mutafarriq min al-awrād ..."
Secundo folio: bi-al-asḥār wa-al-wuqūf fī tilka al-awqāt.
12 x 17 cm; written surface: 6.5 x 12 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in five unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on thick laid cream color paper; few corrections on the margins; few headings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Tuḥfat al-ṣidq wa-al-taḥqīq li-man arāda an yasīra bi-sayr ahl al-ṭarīq, wa-samahā 'Tuḥfat al-ṭullāb lil-jamʻ wa-al-tafrīq', minhu li-Aḥmad al-Junaydī Abū Maghribī al-Maymūnī al-Shāfiʻī. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: Four verses of Sufi poetry, as follows: "Qum yā nadīmī ʻalá al-awrād wa-itlīhā. Wa-ishrab mudāman ṣafat min yadi sāqīhā. Khammāruhā al-Bakrīyu Ḥifnī bi-yasqīhā. Hiya al-jalāʼu li-man yafham maʻānīhā."

Author's colophon: "Wa-fī hādhā al-qadr kifāyah liman arāda an yasluka ṭarīq al-qawm, wa-yasīr bi-sayr ahlihā. Wa-qad tammat hādhihi al-risālah ʻalá yad jāmiʻihā, afqar al-ʻibād ilá Allāh taʻālá wa-aḥqarihim, Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad al-Junaydī al-Maymūnī al-Shāfiʻī mashhaban al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan, yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, li-khamsah wa-ʻishrūn khalawna min Rajab, sanat 1235, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi, wa-liman qaraʼa fīhā, wa-li-man raʼá fīhā hafwatan aw laḥnatan, wa-ṣallaḥahā ʻalá mā yafhamuhu ahl al-taḥqīq. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi, wa-sallama taslīman ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This amount is sufficient for him who wants to follow in the path of the kinsfolk [the Sufis], and walk in their way. This epistle was completed by the hand of its compiler, the poorest of the servants to God Almighty, and the most despicable of them, Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad al-Junaydī al-Maymūnī al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan, on blessed Monday, twenty-five [nights] having passed from the month of Rajab, of the year 1235 [of the Hijrah = 8 May, 1820], may God forgive him, his parents, his shaykhs, its reader, and him who finds an error or a mistake and corrects it according to what the people of investigation [scholars] understand. Amen. Amen. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and his companions, and grant them abundant peace until Day of Judgment. Amen."

Under the author's colophon, a reader wrote the following three verses: "Shiʻr. Katabtu wa-qad amlaytu lā shakka annanī // sa-yablá yamīnī wa-al-ḥurūfu rawātibu. al-Khaṭṭu yuqrā zamānan baʻda kātibihi // wa-kātibu al-khaṭṭi yablá wa-huwa maktūbu. Yā Rabbu taghfir li-ʻabdin kāna kātibuhu // yā qāriʼ al-khaṭṭi qul billāhi Āmīnā."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-risālah al-mubārakah yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, awwal shahr Muḥarram al-ḥarām, sanat alf wa-miʼatayn sabʻah wa-thalāthīn, ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr Muḥammad ʻAzzāz, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-li-ikhwānihi wa-lil-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, wa-al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-amwāt, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The copy of this blessed epistle was completed on blessed Monday, the beginning of tht sacred month of al-Muḥarram, of the year 1237 [of the Hijrah = 1 October 1821], by the hand of its copyist, the poor Muḥammad ʻAzzāz, may God forgive him, his parents, his shaykhs, his brethren, the Muslims, men and women, and the believers, men and women, the living among them and the dead. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and his companions, and grant them abundant peace until Day of Judgment. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. Amen."

record.title: Arabian tales : manuscript.
record.note: Title of the codex supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of the selections from the "Arabian nights": The beginning is missing, text starts with: "... Mā zāla wajhuka mushriqan mutahallilan // in lam yarāka wajhu al-zamān. Awlayta min faḍlika al-muná allatī // faʻalat binā fiʻla al-saḥāb. Wa-ramayta mālaka bi-al-nadā man yahlaku // ḥattá balaghta min al-maʻānī maṭlabā. Qāla al-rāwī: Fa-lammā faragha min shiʻrihi nahaḍa la-hu al-malik qāʼiman wa-ʻānaqahu, wa-ajlasahu ilá jānibihi, wa-aqbala ʻalayhi wa-ḥādathahu, wa-ḍaḥika fī wajhihi, wa-akhlaʻa ʻalayhi khilʻah sanīyah. Wa-kāna al-Malik Yūnān lammā kharaja min al-ḥammām naẓara ilá jasadihi fa-lam yajid ʻalá jasadihi shayʼ min dhālika al-baraṣ, wa-ṣāra jasaduhu naqīyan mithl al-fiḍḍah al-bayḍāʼ, fa-fariḥa al-malik ghāyata al-faraḥ, wa-ittasaʻa ṣadruhu wa-insharaḥ ..."
Secundo folio of the selections from the Arabian nights: wa-lil-sharri ahlun yuʻrafū bi-sukātihim.

Incipit of "Qiṣṣat Madīnat al-nuḥās": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Hādhihi Qiṣṣat Madīnat al-nuḥās bi-al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-muḥaqqiq al-mudaqqiq, farīd ʻaṣrihi Abū al-ʻAbbās ibn Sīrīn, mufassir manāmāt al-nās al-wāridīn ʻalayhi min al-aqṭār, nafaʻanā Allāh taʻālá bi-ʻulūmihi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn. Qāla min akhbār al-nāqilīn ilayhi ʻan salaf al-mutaqaddimīn, ʻan mulūk al-arḍ, wa-hum min nasl al-Ḥusayn, min awlād al-Khulafāʼ al-Rāshidīn. Wa-kāna al-mutakhallif min baʻd inqirāḍ al-khulafāʼ rajul min naslihim yuqālu la-hu al-Amīr ʻAbd al-Malik ibn Marwān, wa-kāna khalīfah fī al-nās, yaʼmuru bi-al-maʻrūf wa-yanhá ʻan al-munkar ..."
Secundo folio of "Qiṣṣat Madīnat al-nuḥās": Qāla Ibn Sīrīn fa-arsala Amīr al-Muʼminīn rijālan.
15.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: Cover and flap deteriorated, remnants of light brown leather on the edges; dark brown leather on spine.

The codex is written in different hands, in large clear naskh script, in black ink, on thick laid paper of different colors: White, yellow, purple, and blackish brown; some headings and markings in red; some notes on the margins; some leaves seem to be missing; some pages framed; catchwords.

Inserted in the codex are eight slips of notes in English, and two letters in French (dated 12/12/[19]26 and 31 January 1927), by Aḥmad Zakī Bashā (Zakī Pāshā, Aḥmad, 1867-1934, an Egyptian intellectual and author), sent from Jīzah, Egypt).
The first 28 leaves are blank.

Colophon of the selections from the "Arabian nights": No colophon. Text ends abruptly with part of "al-Laylah al-tāsiʻah wa-al-khamsūn" (Night fifty-nine), as follows: "... fa-qultu la-hu naʻam. Thumma dakhaltu wa-farashtu la-hu al-makān, wa-ajlastuhu, wa-nazaltu ilá al-sūq wa-hayyaʼtu la-hu mā yanbaghī min al-ashribah wa-al-ḥalāwāt al-muftakharah wa-al-dajāj, wa-jīt bi-al-jamīʻ ilá bayna yadayhi wa-qultu la-hu: Bismillāh. Qāla naʻam, wa-taqaddama ilá al-māʼidah, wa-madda yadahu al-shamāl wa-akala maʻī, fa-taʻajjabtu minhu fī nafsī, wa-qultu Subḥāna Allāh, fa-akaltu maʻahu. Fa-lammā faraghtu kabbaytu ʻalá yadihi shayʼan min al-māʼ, wa-nāwaltuhu shayʼan yamsaḥu fīhi yadahu, wa-jalasnā lil-ḥadīth baʻdamā qaddamtu shayʼan min al-ḥalwá, wa-qultu: Yā Sayyidī, farrij ʻannī kurbatan, mā laka akalta maʻī bi-yadika al-shamāl ..."

Colophon of "Qiṣṣat Madīnat al-nuḥās": "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb. Wa-hādhā ākhir mā intahá ilaynā min Qiṣṣat Madīnat al-nuḥās wa-al-qamāqim bi-al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, min ghayr ziyādah wa-lā naqṣ. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl. Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, fī 14 shahr Ramaḍān al-mubārak al-sharīf, nahār al-Khamīs al-mubārak, 1236." After the colophon, the copyist wrote: "Yā qāriʼa al-khaṭṭi bi-al-ʻaynayni tanẓuruhu // lā tansa ṣāḥibahu billāhi udhkuruhu. Wa-hab la-hu daʻwatan billāh ṣāliḥatan // laʻallahā fī surūf al-dahri tanfaʻuhu. Allāhumma Ṣalli ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallim. M.M.M."

Translation of the colophon of "Qiṣṣat Madīnat al-nuḥās": "God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. This is the end of what has reached us of the Story of the 'City of cupper' and the 'qamāqim' (bulgy long-necked bottles), thoroughly and completely, without increase or decrease. Praise be to God in every situation. This blessed copy was completed, by the help of God and His abundant benevolence, on blessed Thursday, the 14th of the blessed and noble month of Ramaḍān, 1236 [of the Hijrah = 15 June 1821]. After the colophon the copyist wrote in poetry and prose: "O reader of the script who is looking at it in the eyes // Do not forget its originator. For God! Remember him. Grant him, For God! a good invocation // which will benefit him in the adversities of time. O God. Pray on our Master Muḥammad, on His family, and on his companions, and grant them peace. M.M.M."

record.title: 880-03 Dīwān Manjak Bāshā : manuscript / Manjak ibn Muḥammad al-Manjakī.
record.note: Title from the printed version.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... Inna al-hadāyā wa-khayru al-qawli aṣdaquhu // tafná baqīta wa-tabqá hādhihi al-kalimu. Wa-qāla yamdaḥu al-ʻAllāmah Bahāʼ Afandī, Muftī al-Islām: Yuʻaddu ʻalá anfāsī dhunūban // idhā mā qultu afdīhi ḥabīban. Wa-abʻadu mā yakūnu al-wuddu minhu // idhā mā bāna min amalī qarīban. Ḥabībun kullamā yalqāhu ṣabbun // yaṣīru ʻalayhi man yahwá raqīban. Yaʻāfu manāzila al-ʻushshāqi kibran // wa-law firishat masālikuhā qulūban ..."
Secundo folio: Fa-annā alladhī alqá bi-bābika raḥlahu.
14.3 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 13.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in five unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script; in black ink, on cream color paper (thick and thin); headings in red and green; some leaves seem to be missing; catchwords.
On folio 1a-1b: Miscellaneous verses in different hand.

On folio 19b: Three verses of poetry, dating in "ḥisāb al-jummal" (alphabetical reckoning) the building of a "khān" (caravansary) in the city of al-Nabk (Syria), by Ṣāliḥ Aghā (Walī of Damascus), in the year 1075 of the Hijrah (1664/1665), as follows: "Wa-qāla muʼarrikhan ʻimārat al-khān alladhī Ṣāliḥ Āghā fī al-Nabk ʻammarahu: Ṣāliḥun lil-khayri lammā an baná // mukhliṣan khānan bi-fiʻlin mutqani. Wa-huwa Wālī al-Shāmi man aḍḥá la-hu // ḥusnu dhikrin fī jamīʻ al-alsuni. Qāla dāʻī al-khayri bushrá arrikhū // fī sabīli Allāh khānun qad bunī [On the margin: 090 + 102 + 066 + 651 + 104 + 062 = 1075]."

On folios 49b-50a: Quotation in eight verses poetry (emulating the meter of "Bānat Suʻād") by "Abū Saʻīd Shaʻbān ibn Muḥammad al-Qurashī nasaban wa-al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban wa-al-Athāribī manshaʼan wa-al-Miṣrī baladan wa-al-Qādirī taṣawwufan [Probably: Āthārī, Zayn al-Dīn Shaʻbān ibn Muḥammad, 1364-1425]."

On folio 50b: A dated reader's statement, as follows: "Sawwadahu al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá ʻAlī al-Shaʻʻāl fī shahr Ramaḍān al-mubārak, fī yawm 27, sanat 1248 [17 February 1833]." And several verses of poetry.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly on folio 48b, as follows: "... Wa-qāla yamdaḥu Muṣṭafá Afandī, Qāḍī Dimashq: Wafada al-ṣabāḥu wa-zālati al-aḥlāku // wa-tanaṣṣalat min naḥsihā al-aflāku. Wa-inbashsha wajhu al-nujḥi baʻda ʻubūsihi // faraḥan wa-mubtasamu al-muná ḍaḥḥāku. Bi-qudūmi mawlan baʻḍu al-yusri mā ḥawá // yaḥtāru fīhi al-ʻaqlu wa-al-idrāku. Fa-idhā ashāra mukhāṭiban fa-kalāmuhu // durarun la-hā afhāmunā aslāku. Huwa ..."

record.title: Collection of manuscripts on medicine and theology : manuscript.
record.note: Title of the codex supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of Selections from "al-Mughnī fī sharḥ al-Mūjiz": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Muṣ. raḥimahu Allāh. al-Fann al-rābiʻ fī al-amrāḍ allatī lā takhtaṣṣu bi-ʻuḍw dūna ʻuḍw, wa-immā an yasquma al-badan kulluhu, aw yaḥduthu fī ay ʻuḍw kān, ay yumkinu ḥudūthuhu fī kull wāḥid min al-aʻḍāʼ ka-al-waram, ay ʻalá al-madhhab al-ḥaqq wa-bi-ʻurf al-ittiṣāl, wa-shamala hādhā al-fann ʻalá sittat abwāb. al-Bāb al-awwal fī al-ḥummīyāt, al-bāb al-thānī fī al-buḥrān wa-ayyāmih, al-bāb al-thālith fī al-awrām wa-al-buthūr wa-al-judhām wa-al-wabāʼ wa-al-taḥarruz minhu, al-bāb al-rābiʻ fī al-kasr wa-al-wathy wa-al-khalʻ wa-al-saqṭah wa-al-ṣadmah wa-al-ḍarbah wa-al-shujāj wa-al-sajḥ, al-bāb al-khāmis fī al-zīnah, al-bāb al-sādis fī al-sumūm wa-al-iḥtirāz minhā ..."
1. Secundo folio of Selections from "al-Mughnī fī sharḥ al-Mūjiz": min kutub al-Qānūn. al-Ḥummá ḥarārah gharībah tashtaʻilu fī al-qalb.

2. Incipit of Selections from an unidentified treatise on "ʻIlm al-kalām": The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... al-imkān al-ʻāmm, wa-huwa salb al-ḍarūrah, bi-maʻná al-wujūb ʻan al-ṭaraf al-mukhālif faqaṭ. Fa-inn qulta Allāh mawjūd bi-al-imkān al-ʻāmm kāna al-maʻná anna al-ṭaraf al-mukhālif, wa-huwa ʻadam thubūt al-wujūd la-hu taʻālá laysa bi-wājib, wa-ammā al-ṭaraf al-muwāfiq fa-huwa wājib hunā, wa-innamā lam yaṣiḥḥ irādat al-imkān al-ʻāmm hunā li-dukhūl al-wājibāt fī al-mumkināt ..."
2. Secundo folio of Selections from an unidentified treatise on "ʻIlm al-kalām": li-annahu khurūj ʻan al-muqām
The two treatises have the same measurements: 16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 8 numbered quires)

The two treatises are written in different hands; in clear naskh script, in black ink, on laid thick cream color paper; phrases of the original in purple; headings on the margins in purple; some notes on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Sharḥ al-fann al-rābiʻ min al-kitāb al-thālith min al-Qānūn. M.M."

On folio 78a, al-Kāzarūnī states: "... Aqūlu, wa-anā Sadr [Sadīd (?)] al-Kāzarūnī ... Hādhā ākhir Sharḥ al-Mūjiz, wa-qad jamaʻtu fīhi khulāṣat kalām al-ḥukamāʼ al-awwalīn wa-al-ākhirīn, min al-Imām al-muqaddam Abiqrāṭ wa-Jālīnūs wa-Ḥunayn wa-al-Rāzī, wa-min shurūḥ al-Qānūn, wa-khuṣūṣan al-sharḥayn alladhayn aḥaduhumā li-Ustādh al-wará, shaykh al-kull fī al-kull, Mawlānā Quṭb al-Ḥaqq wa-al-Dīn al-Shīrāzī ... wa-al-thānī al-Imām al-ʻAllāmah ʻAlāʼ al-Dīn al-Qurashī, raḥimahu [Allāh], wa-aṣl al-kull min nuṣūṣ al-Qānūn alladhī lil-Shaykh al-Raʼīs, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayhi, fa-innahu qad jamaʻ fīhi zubad kalām al-ḥukamāʼ wa-lubābahā ... wa-li-dhālika qad iʻtamadtu ʻalayhi kull al-iʻtimād ..."
Folios 79 and 80 are blank.

1. Colophon of the Selections from "al-Mughnī fī sharḥ al-Mūjiz" (folio 78b): "Qad tamma hādhā al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá wa-ḥasbihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih ʻalá yad kātibihi al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muʻtārif [al-muʻtarif] bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, rajī [rājī] ʻafwa Rabbihi al-Karīm, Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm ibn al-Ḥājj Ḥasan Abī Ghazālah, ghafara Allāh lī wa-lahum, wa-raḥmānā wa-īyahum [wa-raḥimanā wa-īyāhum], wa-jaʻalanā wa-īyahum [wa-īyāhum] fī al-Jannah wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Subḥāna Rabbika Rabbi al-ʻIzzati ʻammā yaṣifūn, wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. M. Wa-in tajid ʻayban fa-sudda al-khalalā // jallā [jalla] man lā ʻayba fīhi wa-ʻalā. Nasʼalu Allāh al-ʻAẓīm an yaghfira lī wa-al-Muslimīn." At the right margin of the colophon. "Sanat 1277."

1. Translation of the colophon of the Selections from "al-Mughnī fī sharḥ al-Mūjiz": "This book was completed by the help of God, His favor, and His abundant benevolence, by the hand of its copyist, the poor and wretched, who admits his shortcoming and insufficiency, he who aspires for the forgiveness of his Generous Lord, Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm ibn al-Ḥājj Ḥasan Abī Ghazālah, may God forgive me and them, may He have mercy upon us all, and place us and all Muslims in Paradise. Praise be to thy Lord, the Lord of Might, far is He from what they falsely ascribe to Him. May peace be upon the messengers, and praise be to God Lord of the Universe. M. If you were to find a blemish close the gap // Mighty and Sublime is the One in whom no blemish exists. We implore the Mighty Lord to forgive me and all Muslims". At the right margin of the colophon. "Year 1277 [1860/1861]."

Colophon of the Selections from the unidentified treatise on "ʻIlm al-kalām": No colophon. Text ends abruptly as follows: "... fa-law tarākhat al-thāniyah ʻan al-ūlá muddah ṭawīlah lam yaṣiḥḥ Islāmuhu ʻalá al-muʻtamad ayḍan, wa-an yakūna bālighan ʻāqilan, fa-lā yaṣiḥḥu Islām ṣabī wa-lā majnūn illā tibʻan, wa-an lā yaẓhara minhu mā yunāfī al-inqiyād, fa-lā yaṣiḥḥu Islām al-mukrah, illā idhā kāna ḥarbīyan aw murtaddan, illā anna al-karāhah Ḥ bi-ḥaqq wa-an yuqirra bi-hā ..."

record.title: 880-02 Targhīb al-mushtāq fī aḥkām masāʼil al-ṭalāq : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Muʻṭī ibn Sālim al-Simillāwī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b): "... wa-sammaytuhu 'Targhīb al-mushtāq fī aḥkām masāʼil al-ṭalāq ..."
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ḥaththa ʻalá al-nikāḥ wa-kariha al-ṭalāq, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka la-hu shahādatan addakhiruhā ʻinda yawm al-talāq, wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh, al-makhṣūṣ bi-makārim al-akhlāq. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, ʻAbd al-Muʻṭī ibn Sālim ibn ʻUmar ibn ʻĀmir al-Shiblī al-Simillāwī: Saʼalanī baʻḍ al-ikhwān, lā khalā minhum al-zamān wa-al-makān, wa-ʻāmalanī Allāh wa-īyāhum bi-jazīl al-iḥsān, an ulakhkhiṣṣa baʻḍ masāʼil wa-furūʻ fiqhīyah tataʻallaqu bi-al-ṭalāq wa-ghayrihi, maʻzūwāt fī naqlihā li-qāʼilihā, ʻalá madhhab al-Imām al-Aʻẓam, Sayyidī Muḥammad ibn Idrīs al-Shāfiʻī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-bi-ʻilmihi, li-yashula bi-dhālika al-kashf wa-al-intifāʻ lil-mubtadī ʻinda al-iḥtiyāj, fa-ajabtuhu ... wa-sammaytuhu 'Targhīb al-mushtāq fī aḥkām masāʼil al-ṭalāq' ..."
Secundo folio: yaḥnathu fa-ajāba annahu lā yaḥnathu.
16.5 x 23.7 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 17 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire)

In clear fair naskh script, in black ink, on laid thick cream color paper; headings in light green and in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; text on folios 1a-1b framed and decorated in red, black, and yellow; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb yusammá Furūʻ al-Simillāwī fī al-ṭalāq, taʼlīf al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, al-ʻumdah al-fāḍil, ʻAbdī [ʻAbd] al-Muʻṭī ibn Sālim ibn ʻUmar ibn ʻĀmir al-Shiblī al-Simillāwī ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyid walad ʻAdnān, ʻalayhi afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá mamarr al-layālī wa-al-ayyām, ʻalayhi ṣalātan wa-salāman dāʼimayn mutalāzimayn ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Allāhumma. Āmīn. al-Mālik la-hu Ṭāhā Jabr al-Wakīl al-Zaʻbalāwī baladan, ʻufiya ʻanhu."
On folio 1a: Several fatwas about divorce and inheritance.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... Masʼalah. Shakhṣ qāl: Mattá makkanat zawjatī aḥadan min fulānah wa-fulānah wa-fulānah min al-dukhūl manzilahā kānat ṭāliqan, fa-makkanat aḥadan min al-dukhūl, thumma al-baqīyah minhu fī ʻiddatihā aw baʻda rajʻatihā, fa-hal yaqaʻu bi-tamkīn ghayr al-ūlá ṭalāq am lā, fa-ajāb: Lā yaqaʻu bi-hi ṭalāq. Masʼalah. Qāl: Matá waqaʻa ṭalāqī ʻalá zawjatī kāna muʻallaqan aw mawqūfan ʻalá an tuʻṭiyanī kadhā kadhā dīnāran wa-ḥakam bi-ṣiḥḥat ..."

record.title: Miscellaneous Islamic tracts : manuscript.
record.note: 1. Title of "Ahl al-Ṣuffah" from folio 1a and incipit.
2. Title of "Risālah fī faḍl akl al-baṭṭīkh" from folio 1a.
3. Title of "Tadhyīl" from folio 38a.
4. Title of "Nawādir ʻan Abū ʻAbd Allāh Fihr ibn Tamīm al-Kilābī al-maʻrūf bi-al-Ashajj" supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Ahl al-Ṣuffah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, awwalan wa-ākhiran, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad <wa-> al-Nabī al-Ummī, wa-ālihi wa-sallama kathīran, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī lam yakhlu waqt min al-awqāt min nabī yadʻū al-khalq ilayhi, aw walī yuhtadī bi-hadyihi wa-yadʻū al-khalq ilá sunnatih, wa-nadbihim ʻalá ṭarīqatih wa-sunanihi, wa-jaʻala imām awliyāʼ́ihi Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, Aṣḥāb al-Ṣuffah, wa-hum al-fuqarāʼ al-muhājirūn alladhīna ukhrijū min diyārihim wa-amwālihim, fa-amara al-Nabī, ʻalayhi al-salām, bi-mujālasatihim, wa-an lā yuṣrafa baṣaruhu ʻanhum, fa-hum sādāt al-awliyāʼ min al-ummah wa-al-qudwah fī taṣḥīḥ al-muʻāmalāt wa-istiqāmat al-aḥwāl ... wa-sammaytuhu 'Taʼlīf Ahl al-Ṣuffah' ..."
1. Secundo folio of "Ahl al-Ṣuffah": Khallād ibn Muḥammad ʻan Abī Ḥamzah al-Sukkarī.

2. Incipit of "Risālah fī faḍl akl al-baṭṭīkh": The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... al-Namaṭī bi-Nīsābūr yaqūlu: Yurwá fī baʻḍ al-akhbār anna Allāh taʻālá yaqūlu: Mā min niʻmatin anʻamtu bi-hā ʻalá Banī Ādam illā wa-uḥāsibuhu ʻalayhā Yawm al-Qiyāmah illā ʻalá al-baṭṭīkh fa-innī lā uḥāsibu ākilahā abadan, wa-mā min ṭaʻām fī al-Jannah illā wa-fīhā min ṭaʻm al-baṭṭīkh. Akhbaranā Abū al-Faḍl al-Jārūdī qāla Anā. Abū Bakr ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Aḥmad ibn Saʻīd al-Anmāṭī bi-Marw qāl Nā. Abū Muḍar, yaʻnī al-Ribāṭī qāl Nā. Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd Allāh, wa-huwa al-Faryānānī, qāla Sufayl ibn ʻUyaynah ʻan ʻUmar ibn Dīnār ʻan Ibn ʻAbbās qāl uhdiya li-Rasūl Allāh ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam baṭṭīkh min al-Ṭāʼif fa-waḍaʻahu ʻalá anfihi fa-shammahu, wa-qāl: Tafakkahū wa-ʻaẓẓimū al-baṭṭīkh fa-innahu min ḥulal al-Jannah wa-māʼuhu raḥmah wa-rīḥuhu wa-ḥalāwatuhu min al-Jannah ..."
2. Secundo folio of "Risālah fī faḍl akl al-baṭṭīkh": Aḥmad ibn Ḥāmid ibn Jābir qāl.

3. The text of "Tadhyīl" is as follows: "Wa-hādhā 'Tadhyīl'. Fī al-tafsīr, lammā kallama Allāh Mūsá, ʻalayhi al-salām, kāna ʻalayhi ṣūf, fa-qāla taʻālá: Yā Mūsá, wa-ʻizzatī wa-jalālī, law khalaqtu thawban aḥabbu ilayya min al-ṣūf la-kallamtuka fīhi Yā Mūsá. Inna al-ṣūf libās al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-awliyāʼ. Wa-ruwiya anna ʻĪsá, ʻalayhi al-salām, lammā rafaʻahu Allāh ilayhi kāna ʻalayhi marqaʻah, aṣluhu [aṣlahā] min ṣūf, fa-nūdiya min al-ʻulá: Yā malāʼikatī hātū bi-ʻĪsá maʻa marqaʻatihi <hiya>. Qāla Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: 'Law kāna al-ẓulm baytan fī al-Jannah la-sallaṭa Allāh ʻalayhi al-kharāb'. Aʻādhanā Allāh min al-ẓulm wa-al-ṭughyān."

4. Incipit of "Nawādir ʻan Abū ʻAbd Allāh Fihr ibn Tamīm al-Kilābī al-maʻrūf bi-al-Ashajj": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-ḥawl wa-al-qūwah. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá khayr khalqihi, Muḥammad wa-ālihi al-ṭayyibīn wa-aṣḥābihi al-ṭāhirīn. Ḥaddathanā al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-ʻābid, Ṣafī al-Dīn ... Abū Isḥāq ʻUmar ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥusayn ibn Aḥmad al-Jarbādhaqānī, bi-madīnat Akhlāṭ, fī al-Madrasah al-Jarātīnīyah, fī yawm al-sādis min shahr Dhī al-Qaʻdah, iḥdá shuhūr sanat iḥdá wa-sittimiʼah ... Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ajall al-zāhid al-ḥāfiẓ, Abū ʻAbd Allāh Fihr ibn Tamīm al-Kilābī, al-maʻrūf bi-al-Ashajj, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, wa-fī riwāyah ismuhu Qays ..."
4. Secundo folio of "Nawādir ʻan Abū ʻAbd Allāh Fihr ibn Tamīm al-Kilābī al-maʻrūf bi-al-Ashjj": ibn sittah wa-ʻishrīn sanah wa-qad kāna faṣl al-Rabīʻ.
15.8 x 22 cm; written surface: 10.3 x 16 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in five unnumbered quires)

The four tracts are written in the same hand, in fair naskh script, in black ink, on laid thick white paper; headings in red; text within double red frame, no notes or corrections on the margins; some leaves seem to be missing; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb 'Risālat Ahl al-Ṣuffah' raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhum, wa-yalīhi 'Risālah fī faḍl akl al-baṭṭīkh' raḍiya Allāh ʻan muʼallifihā."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mimmann [Min] mann Allāh ʻalá al-faqīr Ḥasan Baghdād [?]."
On folio 1a: Four unreadable stamps.

1. Colophon of "Ahl al-Ṣuffah": No colophon. Text ends abruptly, as follows: "... Qāla Mūsá ibn ʻAlī ibn Rabāḥ, qāl samiʻtu Abī yaqūlu samiʻtu ʻUqbah ibn ʻĀmir yaqūlu kharaja ʻalaynā Rasūl Allāh ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam wa-naḥnu fī al-Ṣuffah, faqāl: Ayyukum yuḥibbu an taghduwa la-hu Buṭḥān aw al-ʻAqīq, wa-dhakara al-Ḥadīth, Anā. Muḥammad ibn al-Muʼammil ibn al-Ḥasan qāl: Nā. al-Faḍl ibn Muḥammad qāl Nā. ʻAbd Allāh ..."

2. "Risālah fī faḍl akl al-baṭṭīkh" ends with: "... Akhbaranā Abū Yaʻqūb al-Sarakhsī qāl Anā. Abū Yūsuf Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Sarakhsī qāl samiʻtu Abā Bakr al-Qurashī yaqūlu anshadanī Abū al-Ṭayyib al-Jurjānī: Sal Shībata al-Badri ʻannā Jaʻfaran // Jaʻfaran ʻannā Shībata al-Badri sal. Kul min al-baṭṭīkhi aḥlá mā tajid // mā tajid aḥlá mina al-baṭṭīkhi kul. Bul ʻalá al-ḥāyiṭ tuʻṭá dirhaman // dirhaman tuʻṭá ʻalá al-ḥāyiṭ bul."

2. Colophon of "Risālah fī faḍl akl al-baṭṭīkh": "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb, minhu al-mabdaʼ wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

2. Translation of the colophon of "Risālah fī faḍl akl al-baṭṭīkh": "The book is completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King, from Him is the beginning and to Him is the reference and returning. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and his companions, and grant them peace."
4. Colophon of "Nawādir ʻan Abū ʻAbd Allāh Fihr ibn Tamīm al-Kilābī al-maʻrūf bi-al-Ashajj": "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."

4. Translation of the colophon of "Nawādir ʻan Abū ʻAbd Allāh Fihr ibn Tamīm al-Kilābī al-maʻrūf bi-al-Ashajj": "It was completed by the praise of God and His abundant benevolence. God is more knowledgeable."

record.title: 880-01 Mazāmīr Dāʼūd : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by Hartford Seminary.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṭūbá li-rajulin lā yasluku ṭarīq al-athamah, wa-fī ṭarīq al-khaṭṭāʼīn lā yaqūmu, wa-fī majālisihim lā yajlisu, wa-lākin fī nāmūs al-Rabb yadrusu al-layla maʻa al-nahār, fa-mathaluhu ka-mathali shajaratin ʻalá shāṭiʼ al-miyāh, lā yatanātharu waraquhā, wa-lā yanqaṭiʻu thamaruhā, wa-laysa al-munāfiqu kadhālika, li-anna Allāh yaʻlamu sabīl al-munāfiqīn, wa-yaʻfū ʻan al-tawwābīn, wa-yaghfiru lil-khaṭṭāʼīn ..."
Secundo folio: waraquhā wa-lā yanqaṭiʻu thamaruhā.
14 x 20 cm; written surface: 7 x 14 cm; 11 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion.
In beautiful naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; few headings and markings in red; text fully vocalized; catchwords.
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Malakahu min faḍl Rabbihi, aḥqar al-wará, khuwaydim al-fuqarā, al-Ḥājj Sulaymān Āghā ibn ʻAbd Allāh, fī sanat 1180 [1766/1667]."

On folios 134b-136a: Genealogy and biographical information about Prophet David, according to Islamic interpretation, quoted from "ʻArāʼis al-majālis fī qiṣaṣ al-anbiyāʼ" of al-Thaʻlabī (Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad, -1035), "Fatḥ al-Bārī" of Ibn Ḥajar al-ʻAqallānī (1372-1449), and "Wasāʼil al-mabarrāt" (?).

Text of ends with Psalm 170, as follows: "... wa-law karramtumūnī, kamā yadhkurū [yadhkuru] baʻḍukum baʻḍan la-sallamat ʻalaykum al-malāʼikah bukratan wa-ʻashīyan, wa-law aḥbabtum ʻibādatī kamā tuḥibbūna al-dunyā la-akramtukum krāmata al-abrār wa-al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn, wa-lā tumayyilū qulūbakum bi-ḥubb al-dunyā, fa-zawāluhā qarībun qarīb. Tammat."

Colophon: "Qad istarāḥ al-qalam min ṭayy tayhāʼ zabīr zabr al-awwlīn, wa-istabāḥa fī farhāʼ ḥabīr ḥabr al-āmilīn, al-qalam alladhī aqdama tāmman fī katb kitāb al-munīr, al-mutarjam min Kitāb Allāh al-Qadīr, al-munzal ʻalá Sayyidinā Dāwūd ibn Īshā ibn ʻŪbid ibn Bāʻir, al-muntamī nasabuhu al-sharīf ilá Ibrāhīm Khalīl al-Raḥmān, ṣalawāt Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhim ajmaʻīn, ʻalá yad aḍʻaf al-ʻibād, al-ṭālib sabīl al-rashād, al-bāʼis al-faqīr, rājī luṭf al-Muʻṭī, Badr al-Dīn ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Muʻṭī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu, wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah wa-al-raḥmah, wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-mashāyikhihi, wa-li-jamīʻ al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, wa-dhālika fī yawm --- fī shahr Rajab al-mubārak, sanat thamānīn wa-miʼah wa-alf."

Translation of the colophon: "The pen has now rested from traversing the trackless records of what the formers wrote, and is savoring the coziness of the delight of the hopeful, the pen that ventured unflinching to write down the illustrious book, that has been translated from the Book of God Almighty, which was revealed to our Master Dāwūd son of Īshā son of ʻUbid son of Bāʻir, whose noble genealogy goes back to Abraham, the Friend of the Merciful, may the prayers of God Almighty be upon all of them. Copied by the hand of the feeblest of the servants, who is seeking the guided path, the wretched poor, who aspires for the kindness of the Abundant Giver, Badr al-Dīn ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Muʻṭī al-Shāfiʻī, may God forgive him, he who invokes forgiveness and mercy for him, his parents, his shaykhs, and all believers, men and women, on the --- day, of the blessed month of Rajab, of the year 1180 [of the Hijrah = December 1766]."

record.title: 880-02 Fatāwá Ibn Nujaym : manuscript / Zayn al-Dīn ibn Ibrāhīm ibn Nujaym.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1a)
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla Allāh taʻālá: 'Kulū min thamarihi idhā athmara wa-ātū ḥaqqahu yawma ḥaṣādihi'. Rufiʻa ilá Mawlānā wa-Sayyidinā Muḥammad Afandī al-shahīr bi-Ibn al-Muʻīd al-muftī bi-al-Shām kān, taghammadahu Allāh bi-al-raḥmah wa-al-ruḍwān, suʼāl fī tafsīr hādhihi al-āyah al-sharīfah. Mā qawl Shaykh mashāyikh al-Islām, nafaʻa Allāh taʻālá bi-ʻulūmihi al-anām, fī tafsīr qawlihi taʻālá: 'Kulū min thamarihi idhā athmara wa-ātū ḥaqqahu yawma ḥaṣādihi', min anna al-murād min al-ḥaqq al-madhkūr fīhā mā huwa, wa-min anna al-amr bi-al-ītāʼ yawm al-ḥaṣād mā maʻnāh, wa-fī anna istiḥqāq al-ʻaṭāyā al-sulṭānīyah lil-qurrāʼ wa-al-quḍāh wa-al-ʻulamāʼ al-ʻāmmat al-nafʻ wa-ghayrihim min alladhīn yurzaqūn min bayt māl al-Muslimīn, kayfa yakūnu, wa-fī ayyi waqt yataḥaqqaqu al-istiḥqāq, wa-kadhā aḥwāl istiḥqāq al-awqāf ʻalá anḥāʼ shattá, aftūnā [mashkūr]īn, wa-ubsuṭū al-jawāb, athābakum Allāh bi-faḍlihi."
Secundo folio: al-Nūrī fī Adhkārih.
14.3 x 21 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 16 cm; 19-23 lines per page.
Binding: Cover deteriorated exposing manuscript waste; dark brown leather on spine.

In large clear good script, in black ink, on laid thick cream color paper; headings in red; some notes and headings on the margins; some wormholes; catchwords. Some leaves seem to be missing between folios 1 and 2.

Inside the front cover: An ownership statement: "Dakhala fī milk al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn Mullā ʻAbd al-Karīm, al-maʻr[ū]f bi-Jāmiʻ al-[U]mawī, ʻafā ʻanhu al-Malik al-Qawī, wa-dhālika fī shahr Jumād al-[A]wwal, sanat 1018 [August 1609]."
On folio 1a: "Fatāwá Ibn Nujaym, raḥiamahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: "Fī madhhab al-Imām al-Aʻẓam Abū Ḥanīfah al-Nuʻmānī, adkhala Allāh man akhadhahā al-Jannah, wa-nafaʻa bi-hā al-Muslimīn."
On folio 1a: Two ownership statements, as follows: 1. "Dakhala fī milk al-faqīr Aḥmad Ḥijāzī." 2. "Dakhala fī milk al-Sayyid Maḥmū[d] al-Ḥarrānī."
Inside the back cover: A borrowing statement: "Istaʻār kātib al-aḥruf, al-faqīr Maḥmūd, thalāth karārīs min Sharḥ al-Bukhārī."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with a fatwá about "shābb amrad" (beardless young man) and his employer, as follows: "... Suʼila fī shābb amrad khaddamahu man huwa fī khidmatihi li-maʻná huwa aʻlam bi-shaʼnihi wa-ḥaqīqatih, fa-kharaja min ʻindihi, fa-ittahamahu annahu [ʻamada (?)] ilá sabatihi wa-kasarahu fī khilā[l] ghaybatihi, wa-akhadha minhu kadhā, bi-mablagh sammāhu, wa-qāmat imārah ʻalayhi bi-anna gharaḍahu bi-dhālik istīfāhu [istibqāʼuhu] wa-istiqrāruhu fī yadihi ʻalá mā yatawakhkhāhu, hal yasmaʻu al-qāḍī, wa-al-ḥāl hādhihi ʻalayhi, daʻwāhu wa-tuqbal shahādat man huwa mutaqayyad bi-khidmatihi ... wa-al-ḥāl annahu maʻrūf bi-ḥubb al-ghilmān. al-Jawāb, wa-lakum fasīḥ al-jinān. Ajāb ... bi-annahu yuḥarramu ʻalá al-qāḍī samāʻ mithl hādhihi al-daʻwá, muʻallilan bi-anna mithl hādhihi al-ḥīlah maʻhūdah fīmā bayna al-fajarah, wa-ikhtilāqātuhum fīmā bayna al-nās mushtahirah. Wa-min lafẓihi, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá fīhā: Lā budda lil-ḥukkām an lā yuṣghū ilá mithl hādhihi al-daʻāwī, bal yuʻazzar al-muddaʻī wa-yaḥjurūhu ʻan al-taʻarruḍ li-mithl dhālika al-ghumr al-munkhadiʻ ... fa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Innā lillāh wa-innā ilayhi rājiʻūn. Mā shāʼa Allāh kān, wa-mā lam yashaʼ lam yakun wa-Allāh aʻlam."

record.title: Treatises on God's unity and Islamic doctrines : manuscript.
record.note: 1. Title of "Qaṣidah fī al-tawḥīd" from folio 1a.
2. Title of "Risālat al-Banūfarī" from incipit (folio 9b)
3. "Naẓm al-Khamsīn ʻaqīdah" from incipit (folio 10b)
4. Title of "Qaṣīdat Shakwá" from incipit (folio 12a)
5. Title of "Fawāʼid nāfiʻah" supplied by cataloger, based on incipit (folio 13b)
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Qaṣīdah fī al-tawḥīd": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Bi-ḥamdi Allāhi fātiḥi kulli bābi // bi-hi istaftaḥtu naẓmī fī kitābi. Wa-uhdī zākiyātin min ṣalātin // wa-taslīmin ilá lubbi al-lubābi. Muḥammadin al-Nabīyi wa-tābiʻīhi // min ālin ṭāhirīna wa-min ṣiḥābi. Wa-baʻda al-ḥamdi wa-al-ṣalāti naʼtī // bi-tawḥīdi al-Ilāhi bilā irtiyābi ..."
1. Secundo folio of "Qaṣīdah fī al-tawḥīd": taḥaqqaqa ʻilmu dhālika ʻan ṣawābi.

2. Incipit of "Risālat al-Banūfarī": "Hādhihi Risālat al-Banūfarī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanh. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Shahidtu muʻtaqidan jazman bi-ghayri murā // an lā ilāha siwá Allāhi alladhī qaharā. Rabbun ghanīyun ʻani al-ashyāʼi ajmaʻihā // wa-kullu shayʼin ilá iḥsānihi iftaqarā. Mawjūdu bāqin qadīmun dhū mukhālafatin // li-khalqihi wa-limā bi-al-bāli qad khaṭarā ..."
2. Secundo folio of "Risālat al-Banūfarī": Rabbun bi-ījādi kulli al-khalqi munfaridun.

3. Incipit of "Naẓm al-Khamsīn ʻaqīdah": "Hādhā Naẓm al-Khamsīn ʻaqīdah lil-ʻAllāmah Ḥusayn ibn Yūsuf ibn Ḥusayn ibn ʻAlī al-Fīshāwī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāhi al-qadīmi al-ṣamadi // thumma al-ṣalātu wa-al-salāmu al-sarmadī. ʻAlá al-Nabīyi al-Muṣṭafá wa-al-āli // wa-al-ṣaḥbi ahli al-ʻilmi wa-al-ijlāli. Wa-baʻdu fa-al-Mawlá la-hu ṣifātu // qadīmatun ka-al-ismi wājibātu. Wa-hiya ʻishrūna al-wujūd wa-al-qidam // kadhā al-baqāʼu lā yashībuhu al-ʻadam ..."
3. Secundo folio of "Naẓm al-Khamsīn ʻaqīdah": Wa-baʻdahā salbīyatun wa-hādhihi.

4. Incipit of "Qaṣīdat Shakwá": "Hādhā naẓm Shaykhinā wa-Ustādhinā al-Shaykh Mūsá ibn Saʻd Kallah, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakātihi wa-ʻulūmihi. Āmīn. Wa-hiya hādhihi. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Hādhihi Qaṣīdat Shakwá, lil-ʻārif billāh taʻālá, al-Quṭb al-shahīr wa-al-jahbadh al-kabīr, Sayyidī Abī al-ʻAbbās al-Mursī, anshaʼahā al-faqīr Mūsá ibn Saʻd min qarīḥah jāmidah wa-fiṭnah khāmidah, fī ʻām <sanat> alf wa-miʼatayn wa-khamsah wa-tisʻīn, fī shahr Dhī al-Qaʻdah, awwaluhā: Yammatukum mutawassilan bi-janābikum // wa-ʻalimtukum ahlan fa-ludhtu bi-bābikum. Wa-qaṣadtu ahlan lil-karāmati idh anā // ḍayfun nazaltu bi-thaghrikum wa-bi-ḥayyikum ..."
4. Secundo folio of "Qaṣīdat Shakwá": Arjūkumu fī kull khaṭbin nāzilin.

5. Incipit of "Fawāʼid nāfiʻah": "Fāʼidah ʻaẓīmah fī al-siwāk wa-fawāʼid ukhrá nāfiʻah. Qāla al-Ḥakīm al-Tirmidhī: Wa-tajʻalu al-khunṣur yamīnuka asfal al-siwāk, wa-al-bunṣur wa-al-wusṭá wa-al-sabbābah min fawqihi, wa-lā taqbuḍ ʻalayhi, li-anna dhālika yūrithu al-nisyān, ka-al-siwāk fī al-khalāʼ, wa-al-bawl fī al-māʼ al-dāʼim, wa-ṭūl shaʻr al-ʻānah, wa-al-taʻammum qāʻidan, wa-al-tasarwul qāʼiman. Qāla al-Shaykh Dharrūq [Zarrūq] fī al-naṣīḥah: Wa-akl suʼr al-fār, wa-al-tuffāḥ al-ḥāmiḍ, wa-kans al-bayt bi-al-khirqah, wa-akl al-kusbarah al-khaḍirah, wa-qirāʼt kitābat al-qubūr, wa-al-naẓar ilá al-maṣlūb, yaʻnī al-mashnūq ..."
5. Secundo folio of "Fawāʼid nāfiʻah": wa-al-akl ʻalá al-jabbānah.
14.3 x 20.3 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 15 cm; 18 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two unnumbered quires).

The five treatises are written in the same hand, the poems are in large calligraphic naskh script; the prose in good clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; few corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a (in pencil): "Qaṣīdah fī al-tawḥīd li-farīd ʻaṣrihi al-Shaykh Mūsá Saʻd Kullah, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-lil-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt. Āmīn."
The pages are numbered in East Arabic (Indian) numerals: 1-28. Folio 16 is blank.

1. "Qaṣīdah fī al-tawḥīd" ends with: "... Wa-ṣallá Allāhu wa-al-amlāku ṭurran // ʻalá al-Mukhtāri min ʻUrbin ʻIrābi. Muḥammadin al-Nabīyi wa-man talāhu // bi-iḥsānin ilá yawmi al-maʼābi. Maʻa al-taslīmi mā habbat riyāḥun // tafūḥu bi-ʻiṭri zaharāti al-rawābī. Wa-ḥasbī Sayyidī fī kulli amrin // ʻalayhi tawakkulī wa-bihi iḥtisābī."
1. Colophon of "Qaṣīdah fī al-tawḥīd": "Tammat bi-ḥamdi Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih."
1. Translation of the colophon of "Qaṣīdah fī al-tawḥīd": "It was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence."

2. "Risālat al-Banūfarī" ends with: "... Nabīyunā Aḥmadu al-Mukhtāru khātimuhum // ṣallá ʻalayhi Ilāhu al-ʻArshi mā dhukirā. Wa-al-āli wa-al-ṣaḥbi thumma al-tābiʻīna lahum // mā habba rīḥun ʻalá al-akwāni aw ʻabarā."
2. Colophon of "Risālat al-Banūfarī": "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-tawfīqihi."
2. Translation of the colophon of "Risālat al-Banūfarī": "It was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence."

3. "Naẓm al-Khamsīn ʻaqīdah" ends with: "... Wa-muʻjizāti al-Muṣṭafá wa-al-Jannah // wa-al-nāri wa-al-mawti kadhā fī al-Sunnah. Wa-al-baʻthi wa-al-ḥashri wa-bi-al-malāʼikah // wa-al-anbiyā wa-al-kutbi fa-iḥfaẓ dhālikah. Wa-al-yawmi al-ākhiri wa-bil-ḥisābi // wa-al-wazni wa-al-mīzāni wa-al-ʻiqābi. Wa-bi-shāfāʻati al-Nabīyi al-Muṣṭafá // wa-akhdhinā yawma al-ḥisābi al-ṣuḥufā. Wa-bi-al-ṣirāṭi wa-bi-hawli al-mwaqfi // wa-bi-al-suʼāli fī al-qubūri fa-iʻrifi. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāhi wa-ṣallá Rabbī // ʻalá al-Nabī wa-al-āli thumma al-ṣuḥbi."
3. Colophon of "Naẓm al-Khamsīn ʻaqīdah": "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-tawfīqihi."
3. Translation of the colophon of "Naẓm al-Khamsīn ʻaqīdah": "It was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence."

4. Colophon of "Qaṣīdat Shakwá": "Wa-asʼalu Allāh taʻālá min faḍlihi al-ʻāmm an yataqabbalahā, wa-yarḍá ʻan qalb al-Ustādh al-madhkūr, wa-an yuṣliḥa lī al-ḥāl wa-al-shān, wa-an yuwaffiqanī lil-ʻilm wa-al-ʻamal bi-hi, wa-lā yaqṭaʻanī wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad ʻadada khalqihi, wa-riḍā nafsihi, wa-zinata ʻarshihi, wa-raḍiya ʻan ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn."

4. Translation of the colophon of "Qaṣīdat Shakwá": "I implore God Almighty, by His abundant favor, to accept it and be pleased wiht the heart of the said Master [Abū al-ʻAbbās al-Mursī], and to fix my situation and affairs, to guide me in knowledge and work with it, and not to cut me off and all Muslims. May God's prayer and peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, the number of his creation, the contentment of His being, and the weight of His throne, and may He be pleased with his family, and all his companions."
5. Colophon of "Fawāʼid nāfiʻah": "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh."
5. Translation of the colophon of "Fawāʼid nāfiʻah": "It was completed by the praise of God."

record.title: 880-01 Adʻiyah wa-ṣalawāt : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The codex starts with the invocations of Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn, for the seven days of the week, as follows: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam. Yawm al-Aḥad. Ilá Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu. Adʻiyāʼ [Adʻiyat] al-ayyām al-sabʻah. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Bissmillāh alladhī lā arjū illā faḍlahu, wa-lā akhshá illā ʻadlahu, wa-lā aʻtamidu illā qawlahu, wa-lā umsiku illā bi-ḥablihi. Bika astajīru Yā dhā al-ʻafw wa-al-ruḍwān min al-ẓulm wa-al-ʻudwān wa-min ghadr al-zamān wa-tawātur al-aḥzān, wa-min ainqiḍāʼ al-muddah qabla al-taʼahhub wa-al-ʻiddah ..."
Secundo folio of the codex: al-shirk wa-al-ilḥād wa-ukhliṣu laka duʻāʼī.
14.3 x 21 cm; written surface: 8 x 14.5 cm; 22 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; red leather on spine and flap (in four numbered quires)
In good Maghribī script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings, keywords, and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
Inside the front cover (in red): "Duʻāʼ al-Imām Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn."
On folio 1a: Stamp of "Maktabat al-ʻArab li-ṣāḥibihā al-Shaykh Yūsuf Tūmā al-Bustānī bi-Shāriʻ al-Fajjālah bi-Miṣr."
Text folios 1b-33a; folios 34-38 are blank.
Pages are numbered in East Arabic (Indian) numerals 6-70.

The codex ends with "Duʻāʼ Ismihi taʻālá al-ʻAzīz" (Invocation of the Name of God Almighty), as follows: "... Wa-min baʻd tamām al-ʻadad taqūlu: Wa-iḥfaẓnī wa-irfaʻnī ilá rutbat al-awliyāʼ wa-al-ṣāliḥīn, wa-thabbitnī kamā thabbata awliyāʼaka al-muqarrabīn wa-ahla ṭāʻatika ajmaʻīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-Nabī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Thumma taqūlu: Yā Sarīʻ mā istaṭaʻta, min wāḥid ilá thalātha ilá miʼah. IH."

record.title: Omens, divination, and fortune-telling : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Sayyidī al-Shaykh ... min ṭarīq al-Zinātī, wa-ṭarīqat al-ʻamal bi-hi, min al-ṣubḥ ilá al-zawāl, qabla al-ẓuhr, wa-huwa annka idhā ḍamarta ʻalá shayʼ, fa-innaka tunaqqiṭ nuqaṭan bi-ghayr ʻadad arbaʻah, intaẓar, wa-baʻda dhālika taʻudd, wa-tushakkil kull ithnayn maʻa baʻḍihim, fa-in faḍala nuqṭah wāḥidah tunzilhā mithl dhālika |, wa-in lam yakun shayʼan fa-tunzilhu mithl ₋₋₋₋ wa-in faḍala fī thālith tanẓur zawj fa-tunzilhu hākadhā ₋₋₋₋ wa-in faḍala fard fa-tunzilhu hākadhā |, fa-ʻalá ḥasb hākadhá, fa-qulta fī kull shayʼ wa-Allāh ʻalīm wa-Huwa hadānī turá fa-innahum turshad ..."
Secundo folio: yaslam fa-hum bi-mā turīd fa-mā ʻalayka tankīd.
18.5 x 26.5 cm; written surface: 16.5 x 14 cm; 17-24 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In large fair naskh script, in black ink, on thick cream color paper; headings in red; magic square and markings in black; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with: "... al-qawl ʻalá al-bayt al-sādis ʻashar. ʻAlá shakl jamāʻah. Qāla Allāh taʻālá: 'Muttakʼīna fīhā ʻalá al-arāʼiki lā yarawna fīhā shamsan wa-lā zamharīran'. Abshir ayyuhā al-sāʼil bi-saʻādah, wa-faraḥ, wa-ʻīshah hanīyah, wa-himmah ʻāliyah, wa-ḥusn al-ʻāqibah, fa-qad atāka min al-ashkāl al-jamāʻah, wa-hiya bayt al-mubāsharah wa-al-saʻādah wa-al-afrāḥ. Wa-hādhā al-fāl mā ẓahara bi-mahmūm illā farraja Allāh hammahu wa-ghammahu wa-qiḍyān ḥawāʼijihi, fa-iʻzim ʻalá al-ḥājah allatī ḍamarta ʻalayhā."
