record.title: Collection of two Sufi treatises : manuscript.
record.note: 1. Title "al-Hidāyah lil-insān ilá al-Karīm al-Mannān" from incipit (folio 1b).
2. Title of "Sharḥ Mashāhid al-asrār al-Qudsīyah wa-maṭāliʻ al-anwār al-Ilāhīyah" supplied by cataloger based on folio 78a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "al-Hidāyah lil-insān ilá al-Karīm al-Mannān": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá ʻAlī al-Bayyūmī al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, al-Aḥmadī khurqatan: Hādhā sharḥ laṭīf li-Ḥikam al-ʻĀrif billāh taʻālá, Abī al-Faḍl Tāj al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn ʻAṭāʼ Allāh al-Iskandarī, wa-sammaytuhu bi-'al-Hidāyah lil-insān ilá al-Karīm al-Mannān'. Qāla, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Min ʻalāmāt al-iʻtimād ʻalá al-ʻamal nuqṣān al-rajāʼ ʻinda wujūd al-dhalal [corrected to al-zalal (in pencil)], fa-lā yajūzu al-iʻtimād ʻalá ghayrihi taʻālá, kāʼinan mā kān dhālika al-ghayr, li-annahu waṣf al-jāhilīn al-ghāfilīn, wa-al-iʻtimād ʻalá Allāh naʻt al-ʻārifīn al-muwaḥḥidīn ..."
1. Secundo folio of "al-Hidāyah lil-insān ilá al-Karīm al-Mannān": fī baḥr al-tawḥīd fa-lā yazīdu rajāʼuhum li-ʻillah wa-lā yanquṣu li-zallah.

2. Incipit of "Sharḥ Mashāhid al-asrār al-Qudsīyah wa-maṭāliʻ al-anwār al-Ilāhīyah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá mā jāda bi-hi min al-kunūz wa-al-maʻārif al-Ilāhīyah wa-fataḥ, wa-manna bi-hi [min (?)] al-ādāb al-Rabbānīyah wa-manaḥ, wa-asmaʻa ahla al-fahm ʻanhu alsinat al-ḥaqāʼiq, fa-afsaḥ wa-sharaḥa ṣudūrahum bi-mā amlāhu ʻalá lisān tarjumān al-asmāʼ al-Ilāhīyah li-mā tarjama ʻanhā wa-sharaḥ, ḥattá bāna li-dhawī al-ʻirfān bi-nūr al-bayān subul al-maʻārif wa-ittaḍaḥ, wa-tahayyaʼa nāẓir al-himmah minhum li-idrāk [mā] khafiya ʻalá al-ishārah wa-lamaḥ, sālikan bi-dhālika sabīla mūratihi [mawaddatihi] alladhī kammala Allāh bi-hi makārim al-khlāq wa-al-mulaḥ, wa-thaqula bi-hi mīzān al-ḥaqq wa-rajaḥ ..."
2. Secundo folio of "Sharḥ Mashāhid al-asrār al-Qudsīyah wa-maṭāliʻ al-anwār al-Ilāhīyah": wa-ṣalāḥ wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam.
15.5 x 23.8 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16 cm; 16 lines per page.
Binding: In black buckram cover; black leather on spine.

In clear ruqʻah script, in black and blue ink, on cream color paper; the phrases of the originals of both texts in red, some notes and corrections on the margins; text within triple frames; catchwords; pages numbered in East Arabic (Indian) numerals 1-158 and 1-140, respectively.
On the spine (printed in gold): "Sharḥay al-Ḥikam wa-al-Mashāhid" and the owner's name: "Ḥāmid ʻAbd al-Raḥmān".
On the label pasted to the spine: "127".
On folio 1a (in pencil): "Ḥāmid ʻAbd al-Raḥmān. Sharḥay al-Ḥikam wa-al-Mashāhid".

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-ʻĀrif billāh taʻālá Sayyidī ʻAlī al-Bayyūmī ʻalá Ḥikam Ibn ʻAṭāʼ Allāh al-Sakandarī, nafaʻanā Allāh bihimā, Āmīn, al-musammá 'al-Hidāyah lil-insān ilá al-Karīm al-Mannān'."
On folio 78a: "Hādhā Sharḥ Sayyidī Ismāʻīl Ṣadr al-Dīn al-Qūnawī ʻalá Kitāb al-Mashāhid li-Sayyidī Muḥyī al-Dīn ibn al-ʻArabī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-nafaʻanā bi-ʻulūmihi. Āmīn. Āmīn. M."
Pages 154-[159] are blank.
On page [160]: An index of contents of the 14 "mashhads" of the second treatise.

1. Colophon of: "al-Hidāyah lil-insān ilá al-Karīm al-Mannān": Taḥrīran bi-Qinā, fī yawm al-Aḥad, 21 Ramaḍān al-mukarram, sanat 1339 H. Katabahu al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá ʻAlī ʻAlī al-Manṣūrī bi-Qinā. M."

Translation of the colophon of: "al-Hidāyah lil-insān ilá al-Karīm al-Mannān": "Dated at Qinā, on Sunday, the 21st of noble Ramaḍān, of the year 1339 H [29 May 1921]. Copied by the poor to God Almighty, ʻAlī ʻAlī al-Manṣūrī, in Qinā. M."

2. Colophon of: "Sharḥ Mashāhid al-asrār al-Qudsīyah wa-maṭāliʻ al-anwār al-Ilāhīyah": "Kalimah li-kātib hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhu. Yaqūlu al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-dhalīl, ʻAlī ʻAlī al-Manṣūrī: Qad farghtu min naskh hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah naqlan ʻan nuskhatayn bi-khaṭṭ al-Sayyid, baʻda an ṣaḥḥaḥtu, ḥasba al-ṭāqah, mā bi-himā min al-aghlāṭ, ḥasba al-rājiḥ fī aḥadihimā, wa-dhālika bi-musāʻadat Sayyidī al-fāḍil al-ṣāliḥ al-taqī, Ḥaḍrat Ḥāmid Afandī ʻAbd al-Raḥmān, al-muhandis bi-Taftīsh Rayy Qinā, aṣlaḥ Allāh lī wa-la-hu al-ḥāl, wa-jaʻala ʻamalanā hādhā khāliṣan li-wajh [li-wajhihi] al-Karīm, bi-jāh Sayyid al-Mursalīn, Sayyidinā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Wa-dhālika fī yawm al-Ithnayn 14 Shawwāl, sant 1339 Hijrīyah. ʻAlī ʻAlī al-Manṣūrī."

2. Translation of the colophon of: "Sharḥ Mashāhid al-asrār al-Qudsīyah wa-maṭāliʻ al-anwār al-Ilāhīyah": "A word from the writer of this honorable copy, may God pardon him. The poor, wretched, and despicable, ʻAlī ʻAlī al-Manṣūrī says: I have finished transcribing this honorable copy, from two copies in the handwriting of the Master, after I corrected, as much as possible, their errors, according to what is the most correct in either of them, with the help of my virtuous, righteous, and pious Master, His Eminence Hāmid Afandī ʻAbd al-Raḥmān, the engineer at the 'Inspection of Irrigation in Qinā', may God fix the situation of both me and him, and render this work of ours purely for His gracious face, for the sake of the high status of the Master of Messengers, our Master Muhammad, may God's prayers and peace be upon him. On Monday, 14 Shawwāl, 1339 of the Hijrah [21 June 1921]. ʻAlī ʻAlī al-Manṣūrī."

record.title: Miscellaneous anecdotes and quotations in Arabic prose and poetry : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Starts with: "... Wa-min dhālika mā ḥakāhu ṣāḥib 'al-Mustaṭraf fī kull fann mustaẓraf' ʻan Kaʻb al-Aḥbār, 'Mālik', wa-huwa min alladhīn intahá ilayhim al-jūd fī al-Jāhilīyah, yurwá ʻanhu annahu jāda bi-nafsihi, wa-āthara rafīqahu bi-al-māʼ al-bārid fī al-mafāzah wa-māt ʻaṭashan ..."

The "urjūzah" of al-Suyūṭī starts with: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-Islām // wa-al-shukru lillāhi ʻalá al-inʻāmi ... Wa-hādhihi urjūzatun mufīdah // ḍammantuhā fawāʼida ʻadīdah. Fī fitnati al-maqbūri ḥīna yusʼalu // wa-mā atá bi-hi al-Nabīyu al-Mursalu ..." It ends (folio 8a) with: "... Hādhā tamāmu mā aradtu naẓmahu // fa-al-ḥamdu lillāhi alladhī atammahu. Naẓamtuhu lil-muʼminīna tabṣirah // arjū bi-hi al-tathbīta ʻinda al-thartharah. Fī miʼatayni qad ghadat sarīyah // abyātuhu ka-al-anjumi al-durrīyah. Wa-aḥmadu Allāha ʻalá mā yulhimu // thumma ʻalá Nabīyihi usallimu."
Secundo folio of the "urjūzah" of al-Suyūṭī: Alā tará Jibrīla ḥīna anzalah // bi-al-waḥyi takalluman ka-mithli al-ṣalṣalah.
12 x 17 cm; written surface: 8 x 13 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on laid thick cream color paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords; some leaves seem to be missing between folios 10 and 11.

Colophon: No colophon. The anecdotes end abruptly with: "... Wa-qāla baʻḍuhu: ʻAsharah tūrithu ʻasharah. al-Nadāmah tūrithu al-tawbah, wa-ruʼyat al-minnah tūrithu al-fikr, wa-al-istiʼnās bi-al-nās yūrithu al-tawakkul, wa-al-ʻuzlah tūrithu al-salāmah, wa-kaẓm al-ghayẓ yūrithu riyādat al-ʻaql, wa-ḥubbu al-riʼāsah tūrithu al-halakah ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Kāfī fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qawāfī : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbbād al-Khawwāṣ.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāhi ʻalá al-inʻām, wa-al-shukru la-hu ʻalá al-ilhām, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khayr al-anām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-sādah al-aʻlām. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā taʼlīf kāfī fī ʻilamay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qawāfī. al-Awwal: Fīhi muqaddimah wa-bābān wa-khātimah. Fa-al-muqaddimah fī ashyāʼ lā budda minhā: Aḥruf al-taqṭīʻ allatī tatʼallafu minhā al-ajzāʼ ʻashrah, yajmaʻuhā qawluka 'Lamaʻat suyūfunā', fa-al-sākin mā ʻurriya min al-ḥarakah, wa-al-mutaḥarrik mā lam yuʻarra ʻanhā..."
Secundo folio: al-uṣūl minhā faʻūlun mafāʻīlun mufāʻalatun fāʻilātun.
12 x 17 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 12 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 1 quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on laid cream color paper; headings and markings in red; some notes on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Matn al-Kāfī fī ʻilamay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qawāfī. Wa-ṣallá [Allāh] ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: Miscellaneous verses of poetry.

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā aradnā īrādahu fī al-mukhtaṣar. Wa-lillāh al-ḥamd awwalan wa-ākhiran, sirran wa-ʻalāniyatan. Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what we intended to introduce in the compendium. Praise be to God in the beginning and at the end, covertly and overtly. It is completed by the praise of God and His help. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and on his family and companions and grant them abundant peace."

record.title: Selections from an unidentified biography of the Prophet : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

The beginning of the first fragment on the marriage of the Prophet to Khadījah and on her trade is missing, text starts with: "... Ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-tazawwaja bihā, wa-yaḥkumu fī amwālihā wa-mawāshihā wa-jamīʻ mā kāna lahā, wa-lam tazal maʻahu ilá an baʻathahu Allāh taʻālá Rasūlan, wa-nafaqat jamīʻ amwālahā fī sabīl Allāh taʻālá, wa-jaʻalahā min ummahāt al-muʼminīn, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhā ..."

Incipit of the second fragment "Masāʼil ʻAbd Allāh ibn Salām": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Hādhā al-faṣl fī Masāʼil ʻAbd Allāh ibn Salām li-Nabīyinā Muḥammad, ʻalayhi afḍal al-ṣalāt wa-atamm al-salām, wa-fīhi fawāʼid kathīrah wa-ʻulūm ghazīrah, wa-yazīdu hādhā al-kitāb rawnaq wa-bahjah. Ruwiya ʻan ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻAbbās, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhumā, qāl: Buʻitha al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, fa-atāhu Jibrīl, ʻalayhi al-salām, wa-qāla la-hu: Yā Muḥammad, Rabbuka yaqrūka [yaqrīka] al-salām wa-yakhuṣṣuka bi-al-taḥīyah wa-al-ikrām, wa-yaʼmuruka an tukātiba mulūk al-kuffār wa-tadʻīhim ilá ʻibādat al-Malik al-Jabbār ..."
Secundo folio of the second fragment "Masāʼil ʻAbd Allāh ibn Salām": wa-arbaʻ masāʼil min khawāṣṣihā wa-atawajjahu bihā ilayh.
15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 12 x 15.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (one quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on laid thick cream color paper; text framed; catchwords.

Colophon of the first fragment on the marriage of the Prophet to Khadījah, and on her trade: "... Wa-hādhā mā intahá min 'Ḥadīth al-tijārah wa-zawāj al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, bi-Khadījah', ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-naʻūdhu billāh min al-ziyādah wa-al-nuqṣān. Tamma wa-kamula, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāt wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Tammat. Tammat. M."

Translation of the colophon of the first fragment, on the marriage of the Prophet to Khadījah, and on her trade: "... This is the end of what has reached [us] of the 'Account about the trade and the marriage of the Prophet, may God's prayer and peace be upon Him, to Khadījah', thoroughly and completely. We take refuge in God from increase and decrease. It is ended and completed. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May prayer and peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, on his family and all his companions. It is completed. It is completed. M."

Colophon of the second fragment "Masāʼil ʻAbd Allāh ibn Salām": No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... fa-akhbirnī mā yaṣnaʻu Allāh bi-al-muʼminīn ḥīnaʼidhin. Qāl: Idhā ṣāra ahl al-Jannah fī al-Jannah, wa-ahl al-Nār fī al-Nār atā [atá] al-mawt kaannahu kabshun amlaḥ, fa-yaqifu bayna al-Jannah wa-al-Nār, fa-yuqālu li-ahl al-Jannah, wa-hum fī al-naʻīm: Hādhā al-mawt. Fa-yaqūlu: Naʻam, Yā malāʼikat Rabbinā. Fa-yaqūlu ahl al-Nār, bi-aʻlá ṣawṭ [ṣawt]: Yā malāʼikat al-Raḥmān, arsilū lanā hādhā, yaqḍī ʻalaynā, namūtu fa-nastarīḥ, fa-ʻinda dhālika yandhabiḥu al-mawt bayna al-Jannah wa-al-Nār, fa-yaʼisū ahl al-Nār min al-khurūj minhā, wa-taṭamʼana ahl al-Jannah bi-al-khulūd fīhā. Qāl: Ṣadaqta Yā Muḥammad, Yā Rasūla Allāh ..."

record.title: 880-01 Selections from the Dīwān of Imruʼ al-Qays : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The selections from the poetry of Imruʼ al-Qays start with the poet's well-known "Muʻallaqah", as follows: "Qaṣīdah. Qāla Imruʼ al-Qays ibn Ḥujr ibn ʻAmr al-Kindī: Qifā nabki min dhikrá ḥabībin wa-manzili // bi-Siqṭi al-Liwá bayn al-Dakhūli fa-Ḥawmali. Fa-Tūḍiḥa fa-al-Miqrāti lam yaʻfu rasmuhā // limā nasajathu min janūbin wa-shamʼali ..."
Secundo folio: Idhā mā al-Thurayyā fī al-samāʼi taʻarraḍat // taʻarruḍa athnāʼi al-wishāḥ al-mufaṣṣali.

The Muʻallahqa of Ṭarafah ibn al-ʻAbd (folios 3a-5b), starts as follows: "Wa-qāla Ṭarafah ibn al-ʻAbd al-Bakrī: Li-Khawlata aṭlālun bi-Burqati Thahmadi // talūḥu ka-bāqī al-washmi fī ẓāhiri al-yadi. Wuqūfan bi-hā ṣaḥbī ʻalayya maṭīyuhum // yaqūlūna lā tahlik asan wa-tajalladi ..." It ends with: "... La-ʻamruka mā al-ayyāmu illā muʻāratun // fa-mā isṭaʻta min maʻrūfihā fa-tazawwadi. ʻAni al-marʼi lā tasʼal wa-abṣir qarīnahu // fa-inna qarīnan bi-al-muqārini yahtadī."
17 x 24 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 18 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script; in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; extensive commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi qaṣīdat Imruʼ al-Qays ibn Ḥujr ibn ʻAmr al-Kindī, nafaʻanā Allāh [bi-hi]. Āmīn. sanat 1272, 18 R1 [28 November 1855]."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Milk al-fqīr ilá Rabbihi al-Mannān Muḥammad ibn ʻUmar ibn Sulaymān al-Tūnisī, ʻufiya ʻanhu. Āmīn. sanat 1272, 18 R1 [28 November 1855]."
Colophon: The codex ends with: "Tammat hādhihi al-qaṣīdah bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih. Wa-astaghfir Allāh al-ʻAẓīm. M."
Translation of the colophon: "This poem was completed by the praise of God and His help. I seek forgiveness from God Almighty. M."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ Alfīyat Ibn Mālik : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAqīl.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla Muḥammadun huwa ibnu Māliki // Aḥmadu Rabb[ī] Allāha khayra Māliki. Muṣalliyan ʻalá al-Rasūli al-Muṣṭafá // wa-ālihi al-mustakmalīn al-shurufā. Wa-astaʻīnu Allāha fī Alfīyah // maqāṣidu al-naḥwi bi-hā maḥwīyah ..."
Secundo folio: ʻan an yaqūla fāʼidah yaḥsunu al-sukūt ʻanhā.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 16 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 14 numbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on thick white paper; the verses of the "Alfīyah" in red; headings in red; markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a (in ink and pencil): "Ibn ʻAqīl ʻalá Alfīyat Ibn Mālik, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu. Tammat wa-kamulat. M."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly, as follows: "... Wa-mā yalī al-muḍāfa yaʼtī khalafan // ʻanhu fī al-iʻrābi idhā mā ḥudhifā. Yuḥdhafu al-muḍāf li-qiyām qarīnah tadullu ʻalayhi, wa-yuqāmu al-muḍāf ilayhi muqāmuhu, fa-yuʻrabu bi-iʻrābihi, ka-qawlihi taʻālá: 'Wa-ushribū fī qulūbihim al-ʻijla', aw, ghayr dhālik lā ..."

record.title: 880-01 Ḥikāyāt wa-ḥikam : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; starts with part of "al-Ḥikāyah al-ūlá" (First tale), as follows: "... fa-qāl: Kayfa tuḥibbu aqbiḍu rūḥak. Fa-qāl: Idhā ṣallaytu wa-sajadtu fa-iqbiḍ rūḥī wa-anā sājid. Fa-faʻala malak al-mawt mā ṭalab wa-akhadha rūḥahu wa-huwa sājid yuṣallī bayna yaday Allāh taʻālá. al-Ḥikāyah al-thāniyah. Qīla kāna malik min al-mulūk qad jamaʻa mālan ʻaẓīman kathīran min kull nawʻ khalaqahu Allāh taʻālá min matāʻ al-dunyā, thumma baná qaṣran ʻaẓīman hāʼil al-bināʼ murtafiʻan sāmiyan, wa-rakkaba ʻalayhi bābayn muḥkamayn, fa-aqāma ʻalayhi al-ghilmān wa-al-ḥars wa-al-jnād wa-al-bawwābīn, thumma amara an tuṣnaʻa la-hu walīmah ʻaẓīmah, thumma jamaʻa ahlahu wa-ḥashamahu wa-aṣḥābahu, thumma jalasa ʻalá sarīr mulkihi, wa-ittakaʼa ʻalá wisādatihi, fa-qāla fī nafsihi: Qad jamaʻtu niʻam al-dunyā, wa-al-ān ukhallī bālī, wa-ākul min hādhihi al-niʻam muhannaʼan bi-al-ʻumr al-ṭawīl wa-al-ḥaẓẓ al-jazīl ..."
Secundo folio: al-Ḥikāyā al-thālithah: Qāla Yazīd al-Ruqāshī.
15 x 21 cm; written surface: 10 x 15.5 cm; 20 lines per page.
Binding: The five unnumbered quires are within dark blue marbled cardboard cover; black cloth on spine.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on thick polished cream color paper; headings in red; catchwords.
Includes a slip card of notes in English and Arabic about the manuscript.

The chapters in the present manuscripts are titled as follows: al-Bāb al-awwl (Chapter one): "Fī naʻt al-nisāʼ wa-mā fīhinna min khayr wa-sharr (folios 18b-20a). al-Bāb al-thānī (Chapter two): "Fī siyāsat al-wuzarāʼ wa-sīratihim" (folios 23b-25b). al-Bāb al-thālith (Chapter three): "Fī dhikr al-kuttāb wa-ādābihim" (folios 23b-25b). al-Bāb al-rābiʻ (Chapter four): "Fī dhikr ʻulū sumū al-himam (folios 25b-28a). al-Bāb al-khāmis (Chapter five): "Fī dhikr ḥikmat al-ḥukamāʼ" (folios 28a-51b).

Colophon: "Tamma dhālika wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah, ḥamdan yuwāfī niʻamah wa-yukāfī mazīdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi al-ṭayyibīn al-ṭāhirīn, wa-ṣaḥābatihi ajmaʻīn, wa-sallama taslīman kathīran dāʼiman ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhu yawm al-Aḥad al-mubārak, sādis shahr Ramaḍān al-muʻẓẓam qadruhu, min shuhūr sanat arbaʻah wa-khamsīn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍala al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, al-rāj̄ī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-Ṣamad, Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Aḥmadī al-Nāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-al-Muslimīn. Allāhumma ṣallī wa-sallim wa-bārik ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ālihi, wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallim taslīman dāʼiman."

Translation of the colophon: "It is completed. Praise be to God alone, a praise congruent to His blessings and adequate to His abundance. May God's prayer and abundant and continuous peace, until Judgement Day, be upon our Master Muḥammad, his genial and virtuous family, and all his companions. The copy was completed on blessed Sunday, the sixth of the glorious month of Ramaḍān, of the year 1054 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and peace be upon Him, by the hand of the poor servant, who confesses his guilt and negligence, who begs for the forgiveness of his Lord, the Eternal One, Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Aḥmadī al-Nāfiʻī, may God forgive him, his parents, and all Muslims. O God. Pray, grant peace, and bless our Master Muḥammad, his family, and his companions, abundantly and continuously."

record.title: Phylactery.
record.note: Layout: single column.
Script: bolorgir.

Colophon indicates scroll was written by the scribe Ōhan of Č'imiškacak and completed on 1 September AE 1198 (= AD 1749). Name of original owner has been erased and that of a subsequent owner, Łazar or Łazaros, added in a different hand. Łazar's name also inscribed in red at the end of a number of prayers.
Beginning of scroll is wanting. Fragment from another scroll has been added to the end.

record.title: Collection of two Sufi treatises : manuscript.
record.note: 1. Title of "Risālat al-Shaykh Khālid al-Naqshabandī ilá ḥulafāʼihi wa-muʼayydīh" supplied by cataloger, based on incipit (folio 1b).
2. Title of "Risālat al-maʻārif al-ʻāliyah wa-al-ʻulūm al-sāmiyah" supplied by cataloger, base on incipit (folio 7a)
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Risālat al-Shaykh Khālid al-Naqshabandī ilá ḥulafāʼihi wa-muʼayydīh": "Fa-hādhihi ṣūrat al-kitāb alladhī arsalahu al-Imām al-Rabbānī wa-al-muḥaqqiq al-Ṣamadānī, Mawlānā al-Shaykh Khālid al-Naqshabandī al-Baghdādī, jawāban li-ḥulafāʼihi wa-muʼayyidīh bi-Dār al-Khilāfah al-ʻAlīyah, ṣānahā Rabb al-Barīyah bi-baqāʼ dawlat rāʻīhā, sulṭān salāṭīn al-Islām, wa-huwa hādhā: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh, wa-salāmuhu ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīna iṣṭafá. Min al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-mustahām Khālid al-Naqshabandī, al-mutamassik bi-ittibāʻ sunnat Khayr al-Anām, ʻalayhi afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ilá al-ikhwān al-mukhliṣīn al-kirām min sukkān Dār al-Khilāfah al-ʻUẓmá, lā dhālat [zālat] maṣūnah ʻan kayd al-khāʼinīn wa-maqrūnah bi-nuṣrat ḥāmīyhā wa-ḥāmī bilād al-Muslimīn ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Āmīn. al-Salām al-tāmm, wa-al-taḥīyah wa-al-ikrām. Ammā baʻd, fa-qad waradat mukātabātukum al-dāllah ʻalá siḥḥat dhawātikum, fa-awrathat al-masarrah al-mushīrah ilá thabātikum, ʻalá ṭarīqat al-Sunnah al-sanīyah, maʻa muzāḥamat al-munkirīn ..."
1. Secundo folio of "Risālat al-Shaykh Khālid al-Naqshabandī ilá ḥulafāʼihi wa-muʼayydīh": al-tāmm bi-al-Kitāb al-ʻAzīz wa-Sunnat al-Rasūl.

2. Incipit of "Risālat al-maʻārif al-ʻāliyah wa-al-ʻulūm al-sāmiyah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūlihi Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi risālah ʻajībah gharībah mushtamilah ʻalá al-maʻārif al-ʻāliyah wa-al-ʻulūm al-sāmiyah allatī tafarrada bi-hā al-Imām al-Rabbānī, Mujaddid al-Alf al-Thānī, Ḥaḍrat al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Fārūqī al-Sirhindī, quddisa sirruhu, bi-al-taʻlīm al-Ilāhī wa-al-ilhām al-Rabbānī, wa-layst tilka al-maʻārif wa-al-ʻulūm marwīyah min aḥad min al-ʻurafāʼ, wa-bayānuhā mundarij fī mukātabātihi al-sharīfah ... fa-huwa ... yantasibu ilá Amīr al-Muʼminīn ... ʻUmar al-Fārūq ... wa-kāna la-hu ... yad ṭūlá fī al-ʻulūm al-naqlīyah wa-al-ʻaqlīyah ..."
2. Secundo folio of "Risālat al-maʻārif al-ʻāliyah wa-al-ʻulūm al-sāmiyah": wa-kāna quddisa sirruhu qad iltazama.
12.5 x 18.5 cm; written surface: 6.5 x 13.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In thin cream color cardboard.
In large ruqʻah script, in black ink, on laid cream color paper; headings and markings in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Mukātabāt al-Shaykh Khālid al-Naqshabandī. Risālat al-Maʻārif al-ʻāliyah wa-al-ʻulūm al-Ilāhīyah."
On folio 1a: A lending statement: "ʻĀriyat ʻabd al-faqīr Sulaymān min Ṣafar ilá Dhī al-Qaʻdah 1298, ilá Shaykh Ṣādiq Afandī al-Maydānī."

1. Colophon of "Risālat al-Shaykh Khālid al-Naqshabandī ilá ḥulafāʼihi wa-muʼayydīh": No colophon. The letter ends with the following advice/instruction: "... Wa-hādhā al-faqīr yūṣīkum bi-jamīʻ mā taqaddama min al-ādāb, wa-yukhbirukum bi-annahu yabraʼu ilá Allāh taʻālá min kull [man] yukhālifu al-Sunnah wa-al-Kitāb wa-lam yattabiʻ hudá al-Nabī wa-al-Aṣḥāb, wa-yaʼmurukum bi-ṣāliḥ al-duʻāʼ, fī al-ṣabāḥ wa-al-masāʼ, li-dawām taʼyīd al-Dawlah al-ʻAlīyah al-ʻUthmānīyah allatī ʻalayhā madār al-Islām wa-nuṣratuhā ʻalá aʻdāʼ al-dīn, min al-Naṣārá al-mallāḥīn wa-al-aʻājim al-murtaddīn al-liʼām, wa-al-salām ʻalaykum wa-raḥmt Allāh wa-barakātuhu fī al-badʼ wa-al-khitām. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

"Risālat al-maʻārif al-ʻāliyah wa-al-ʻulūm al-sāmiyah" ends with: "... wa-fī kathrat Ism al-Dhāt taʼtī al-jadhbah, wa-min kathrat al-tahlīl yaḥṣalu al-fanāʼ wa-yazūlu al-khawāṭir wa-yaqill al-amānī, wa-min kathrat al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, yará al-ruʼyā al-ṣāliḥah, wa-min kathrat al-tilāwah yakthuru al-anwār, wa-min kathrat al-ṣalāh yaḥsala al-taḍarruʻ faqaṭ."

2. Colophon of "Risālat al-maʻārif al-ʻāliyah wa-al-ʻulūm al-sāmiyah": "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Tammat al-Risālat al-sharīfah al-mutarjamah min al-Fārisīyah, wa-aṣluhā li-Sayyidinā al-Shaykh ʻAbd Allāh al-Dihlawī, quddisa sirruhu wa-nuwwira ḍarīḥuhu, maʻa ḍamm ziyādāt ilayhā sharīfah, wa-hiya ayḍan maʼkhūdhah min risālātihi wa-malfūẓātihi, quddisa sirruhu wa-nuwwira ḍarīḥuhu. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

2. Translation of the colophon of "Risālat al-maʻārif al-ʻāliyah wa-al-ʻulūm al-sāmiyah": "God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning. The noble epistle which was translated from Persian is completed. Its source is for our Master al-Shaykh ʻAbd Allāh al-Dihlawī, may his secret be sanctified, and his tomb be illuminated. It was supplemented with some noble additions which were also extracted from his epistles and utterances, may his secret be sanctified, and his tomb be illuminated. It is completed. It is completed. It is completed."

record.title: Phylactery.
record.note: Layout: single column.
Script: notragir.
Decoration: right and left margins in red. Headpieces at beginning of prayers; one larger ornate headpiece with a cross in the center. At the end of the scroll and picture of a church.
Colophon indicates scroll was copied by scribe Daniēl in AE 1245 (=AD 1796). The owner's name, Vardan (also spelled Vart'an), is written at the end of a number of prayers.

record.title: Collection of three treatises on Islamic doctrines : manuscript.
record.note: 1. Title of "Risālat al-Kaydānī" supplied by cataloger, based on cover and folio 1b.
2. Title of "Waṣīyat al-Imām al-Aʻẓam" from cover.
3. Title of "Risālah fī bayān al-īmān al-ijmālī wa-al-tafṣīlī" from caption (folio 9a)
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Risālat al-Kaydānī": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá nawālih, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad wa-ālih. Wa-baʻd, fa-inna hādhihi al-risālah ʻalá ʻashrat fuṣūl. al-Faṣl al-awwal, fī bayān al-farḍ, wa-al-wājib, wa-al-mubāḥ, wa-al-ḥarām, wa-al-makrūh, wa-al-Sunnah, wa-al-mustaḥabb. Ammā al-farḍ fa-huwa mā amarahu Allāh taʻālá thābitan bi-dalīl, lā shubhah fīhi, yakūnu tārikuhu lāyiqan li-ʻadhāb Jahannam, wa-munkiruhu kāfiran. Wa-ammā al-wājib, fa-huwa mā amarahu Allāh taʻālá, wa-kāna amruhu taʻālá thābitan bi-dalīl fīhi shubhah, yakūnu tārikuhu lāyiqan lil-ʻadhāb wa-munkir wujūbīyatihi lā yukaffar ..."
1. Secundo folio of "Risālat al-Kaydānī": al-rijlayn maʻa al-kaʻbayn marratan.

2. Incipit of "Waṣīyat al-Imām al-Aʻẓam": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn. Qāl: al-Īmān huwa iqrār bi-al-lisān wa-taṣdīq bi-al-jinān. Wa-al-iqrār waḥdahu lā yakūnu īmānan, li-annahu law kāna īmānan, la-kāna al-munāfiqūn kulluhum muʼminīn. Wa-kadhālika al-maʻrifah waḥdahā lā takūnu īmānan, li-annahā law kānat īmānan la-kāna Ahl al-Kitāb alladhīna ātaynāhum al-Kitāb yaʻrifūnahu kamā yaʻrifūna abnāʼahum ..."
2. Secundo folio of "Waṣīyat al-Imām al-Aʻẓam": law zaʻama aḥadun anna al-taqdīr.

3. Incipit of "Risālah fī bayān al-īmān al-ijmālī wa-al-tafṣīlī": "Hādhā 'Risālah fī bayān al-īmān al-ijmālī wa-al-tafṣīlī'. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūlihi Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Qāla Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi wa-sallam: al-Īmān an tuʼmina billāh wa-malāʼikatihi wa-kutubihi wa-rusulihi wa-al-yawm al-ākhir, wa-al-qadar, khayrihi wa-sharrihi. Iʻlam inna al-īmān bi-hādhihi al-ashyāʼ al-sittah, ʻalá nawʻayn, ʻalá sabīl al-ijmāl, wa-huwa yakfī li-ṣiḥḥat al-īmān ʻalá al-ṣaḥīḥ, wa-dhālika bi-an yaqūl: Āmantu billāh wa-malāʼikatihi wa-kutubihi. Ah ..."
3. Secundo folio of "Risālah fī bayān al-īmān al-ijmālī wa-al-tafṣīlī": min al-ṣaghāʼir ʻamdan wa-min al-kabāʼir muṭlaqan.
15 x 21 cm; written surface: 7 x 14.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In cream color thin cardboard cover.
In small naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on laid white paper; headings in red; many comments on the margins and interlinear; many wormholes without loss of text; catchwords.
On cover (in pencil): "Risālat Kaydānī, wa-maʻahā Waṣīyat al-Imām al-Aʻẓam."
At the head of folio 1b (in red): "Hādhā Risālah-ʼi Kaydānī."
At the head of folio 6a (in red): "Waṣīyat nānimah-ʼi [nāmah-ʼi] Imām Aʻẓam Abū Ḥanīfah Kūfī, raḥmat Allāh ʻalyhi, wa-bika al-ʻawn, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn."
On folio 6a: Miscellaneous quotations.

1. Colophon of "Risālat al-Kaydānī": "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Khallāq, ʻalá yad aḍʻaf al-ḍaʻīfah, Muḥammad ibn ʻUthmān, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi, sanat 1099."

1. Translation of the colophon of "Risālat al-Kaydānī": "The book was completed by the help of God the Creator, by the hand of the weakest weak, Muḥammad ibn ʻUthmān, may God forgive him and his parents, and be kind to them and to him. In the year 1099 [of the Hijrah = 1687/1688]."

2. Colophon of "Waṣīyat al-Imām al-Aʻẓam": No colophon. The treatise ends as follows: "... Wa-ammā kufr al-muʻānadah, fa-huwa an yaʻrifa bi-qalbihi wa-yuqirra bi-lisānihi, wa-lā yatadayyanu bi-hi, ka-kufri Abī Ṭālib, ḥaythu yaqūlu: Wa-laqad ʻalimtu dīn Muḥammad ḥaqq adyān al-barīyah dīnan, lawlā al-malāmah, aw ḥadhar masabbah la-wajadtanī samḥan bi-dhālika mubīnan. Wa-ammā kufr al-nifāq, fa-ann yuqirra bi-lisānihi wa-yakfur bi-qalbihi. Nuqila min Tafsīr al-Wasīṭ li-ʻAlī al-Wāḥidī. Tammat al-madhkūrāt sanat 1099 [1687/1688]."

3. Colophon of "Risālah fī bayān al-īmān al-ijmālī wa-al-tafṣīlī": No colophon. The treatise ends as follows: "... wa-al-qadar, jaʻl kull shayʼ ʻalá mā huwa ʻalayh, min khayr aw sharr, aw ḥusn aw qubḥ, aw ḥikmah aw sufh, wa-bayān mā yaqaʻu ʻalayhi kull shayʼ, min zamān wa-makān, wa-mā la-hu min thawāb wa-ʻiqāb. Wa-ʻinda al-Mashāʻirah, huwa irādatuhu al-Azalīyah al-mutaʻalliqah bi-al-ashyāʼ ʻalá mā hiya ʻalyh, fīmā lā yazāl, wa-qadaruhu ījāduhu ayyan ʻalá qadr makhṣūṣ wa-taqdīr muʻayyan fī zawātihā [dhawātihā] wa-aḥwālihā, kadhā fī 'Sharḥ al-Mawāqif'. Tammat sant 1099 [1687/1688]."
At the end of the text (folio 10b): "Ṣalwat Istikhārah" (prayer for guidance) in seven lines, in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish.

record.title: Collection of two treatises on Arabic grammar and parsing : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of the short treatise on Arabic grammar: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-kalām lafẓ murakkab mufīd mawḍūʻ, ajzāʼuhu: Ism, fa-fiʻl, thumma ḥarf la-hu maʻná. Wa-numayyizu al-ism bi-khafḍ, wa-tanwīn, wa-al, wa-ḥarf jarr, wa-al-fiʻl bi-qad, wa-sīn, wa-sawfa, wa-tāʼ taʼnīth sākitah [sākinah], wa-al-ḥarf yaʻdamu qabūl shayʼ min dhālik ..."
1. Secundo folio of the short treatise on Arabic grammar: ka-lan yafʻalā aw wāw jamʻ ka-lan yafʻalū.

2. Incipit of the second treatise on "iʻrāb" parsing of the first treatise: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-kafá, wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīna iṣṭafá. Qāla, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: 'al-Kalām'. Mubtadaʼ marfūʻ bi-ḍammah ẓāhirah fī ākhirihi. 'Lafẓ'. Khabar al-kalām, wa-huwa marfūʻ bi-ḍammah ẓāhirah fī ākhirihi. 'Murakkab'. Naʻt lafẓ, wa-huwa marfūʻ bi-ḍammah ẓāhirah fī ākhirihi. 'Mufīd'. Naʻt thānin li-lafẓ, wa-huwa marfūʻ bi-ḍammah ẓāhirah fī ākhirihi. 'Mawḍūʻ'. Naʻt thālith li-lafẓ, wa-huwa marfūʻ bi-ḍammah ẓāhirah fī ākhirihi ..."
2. Secundo folio of the second treatise on "iʻrāb" parsing of the first treatise: bi-kasrah ẓāhirah fī ākhirihi.
15 x 20.7 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In yellow cardboard with flap; black cloth on the spine of cover and flap.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on thick cream color paper; headings in red; few notes on the margins; catchwords.
1. Colophon of the short treatise on Arabic grammar: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad."
1. Translation of the colophon of the short treatise on Arabic grammar: "It was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad."

2. Colophon the second treatise on "iʻrāb" parsing of the first treatise: "Tammat hādhihi al-risālah bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-Nabī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi, wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Āmīn."

2. Translation of the second treatise on "iʻrāb" parsing of the first treatise: "This epistle was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, the Illiterate Prophet, on his family, and on his companions, and grant them abundant peace. Amen."

Bound with John Edwards, Directions for Making the Best Composition of Casting, Grinding and Polishing, and Giving Them the True Parabolic Figure, London, [1783?], and another autograph notebook on astronomical instruments. Number 3 of 3 titles bound together. Volume extent: 356 pages.

record.title: Calendar, composed by the Vardapet Antōn of Constantinople : manuscript.
record.note: Layout: one column of 30 lines.
Script: notragir.
Binding: modern leather.
Decoration: zodiac diagram.
Title on title page: Indications of the seasons, which include astronomy, calendars, and calendars of feasts of the Latins, Armenians, and Greeks, including their calendars.
No colophons present; author from title page.

record.title: Commentaries on the divine liturgy, and the catechism of Cyril of Jerusalem : manuscript.
record.note: Layout: one (ff. 1r-7r, 52r-162v) and two (ff. 7v-51v) columns of 30 lines.
Script: notragir.
Decoration: headpiece, marginal ornaments. Rubrication. Decorated edges.
Binding: stamped leather over boards, with flap. Striped pink and white linen spine supports.

Principal colophon (ff. 161v-162v) indicates manuscript was written by the scribe Laǰin (also spelled Lač'in) Kilikec'i, son of Połos and Mariam, for himself and his son Połos, and completed on 14 October AE 1155 (=AD 1706). Colophon does not mention location of copying; inscription on f. 51 indicates manuscript was written at Dokiay (that is, Tokat). This copy of Cyril's catecism was made from an early witness in erkat'agir. Colophon also describes the ecclesiastical and social conditions among the Armenians in Laǰin's time.

record.title: 880-01 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Mawlid al-Barzanjī : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger based on incipit and colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Kitāb yataḍammanu baʻḍ 'ḥawāshī kalimāt min 'Mawlid al-Ustādh al-Barzanjī', kull kalimah minhu bi-numrah makhṣūṣah. Qawluhu 'Taḥbīr' (1), ay taḥsīn. Qawluhu 'Abrād' (2), jamʻ burd, bi-ḍamm fa-sukūn, huwa al-thawb al-mukhaṭṭaṭ. Wa-qawluhu 'Ashnaf' (3), fī al-Qāmūs, 'al-shnaf' al-qirṭ al-aʻlá. Wa-qawluhu 'al-ʻAbharīyah' (4), nisbah lil-ʻabhar, wa-huwa al-narjis, aw, al-yāsamīn. Wa-qawluhu 'Min ṣayyib' (5), ay min inṣibāb, wa-al-murād al-munṣabb, ʻalá ḥadd qawlihi taʻālá: 'Aw kaṣayyibin mina al-samāʼ ..."
Secundo folio: wa-Ubayy ibn Kaʻb wa-ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Qurṭ.
18 x 25 cm; written surface: 12 x 19 cm; 14-15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (the leaves are tied with a thread).
In large clear naskh script, in black ink, on thick cream color paper; few corrections on the margins; catchwords.

The text ends as follows: "... Qawluhu 'al-Rafrafīyah' (137), nisbah ilá al-rafraf, wa-huwa alladhī minhu laqiya Allāh taʻālá bi-Ḥaḍrat al-Quds, wa-qāma bi-muqām al-uns, wa-rufiʻa al-ḥijāb, wa-samiʻa al-khiṭāb, wa-kāna qāba qawsīni aw adná, lā bi-al-ṣūrah wa-lākin bi-al-maʻná. Qawluhu 'Dabbaja' (138), ay zayyana. Wa-qawluhu 'ʻIrāṣ' (139), bi-al-kasr, jamʻ 'ʻaraṣah', bi-fatḥ fa-sukūn, wa-hiya buqʻah bayna al-dūr wāsiʻah laysa fīhā bināʼ. Wa-qawluhu 'Nafḥa kubāh' (140), bi-al-ḍamm, jamʻ 'kibāʼ', bi-al-kasr, ka-kisāʼ, wa-huwa ʻūd al-bakhūr, aw ḍarb minhu. Intahá."
Colophon: "Wa-tammat al-ḥāshiyah ʻalá al-tamām, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl. Āmīn."
Translation of the colophon: "The gloss was completed perfectly. Praise be to God in all circumstances. Amen."

record.title: 880-01 Taqrīrāt ʻalá Sharḥ Ādāb al-baḥth : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger, based on folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyid al-Mursalīn, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-akramīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi 'Taqrīrāt sharīfah wa-taḥqīqāt munīfah' min khaṭṭ Shaykhinā ʻUbādah ʻalá Shaykhihi al-ʻAdawī, ʻalá 'Ādāb al-baḥth', aʻṭāhumā Rabbuhumā min al-ḥusná al-ziyādah. Qawluhu: Laka, khabar muqaddam, wa-al-ḥamd mubtadaʼ muʼakhkhar. Wa-iʻlam annahu ukhtulifa fī al-ḥamd alladhī yubdaʼu bi-hi al-kutub, hal huwa al-ḥamd al-lughawī aw al-ʻirfī, wa-maʻlūmun anna baynahumā ʻumūm wa-khuṣūṣ min wajh, fa-qīla huwa al-ḥamd al-ʻirfī, wa-qīla huwa al-ḥamd al-lughawī ..."
Secundo folio: inna al-munāsib lil-khiṭāb an yaqūla ʻalá al-ḥuḍūr.
17 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 13 x 20.5 cm; 30-40 lines per page.
Binding: In thin cream color folded sheet of cardboard.

In small fair script, in black ink, on laid thick cream color paper; the phrases of the original commentary preceded by the phrase "Qawluhu" (his saying) in red; markings in red; few corrections on the margins; catchwords.
At the upper left corner of folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Dakhala fī milk al-faqīr ʻAbduh al-Sharbatlālī, ʻufiya ʻanhu."
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi 'Taqrīrāt al-Ustādh al-Muḥaqqiq al-ʻAdawī ʻalá Sharḥ Ādāb al-baḥth' naqlan min khaṭṭ al-marḥūm al-fahhāmah Shaykhinā al-Shaykh Muḥammad ʻUbādah, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-al-jamīʻ."

On folio 1a: The copyist's statement: "Yā Rabb. al-Wafā[h] ʻalá al-Islām. Wa-kātibuhā al-ḥaqīr Ismāʻīl Muṣliḥ al-Ṣaʻīdī al-ʻAdawī, wa-atammahā laylat al-Aḥad, li-thalāthat ʻashar yawman baqīna min shahr Ṣafar al-khayr, sanat alf wa-miʼah khamsah wa-tisʻīn min Hijrat Ḥabīb al-ʻĀlamīn [11 February 1781]. Wa-al-maṭlūb mimman naẓara ilayahā al-duʻāʼ bi-khayrihi li-kātibihā, ʻasá an yuqbala. Wa-Allāh al-Walī al-Ḥamīd."

Translation of the copyist's statement: "O Lord. [Grant] its copyist, the wretched Ismāʻīl Muṣliḥ al-Ṣaʻīdī al-ʻAdawī, death on Islam. Completed on the night of Sunday, thirteen days remaining from the gracious month of Ṣafar, of the year 1195 of the Hijrah of the 'Beloved of Humankind' [11 February 1781]. I request those who look into it, out of their charity, an invocation for its copyist, that it may be accepted by God, the Beneficent Guardian."
On folio 1a: A magical incantation (includes magical gibberish).

On folio 1a: Three verses of poetry by an unidentified poet lamenting the betrayal of his of friends, as follows: "Wa-ikhwānun ḥasibtuhumu durūʻan // fa-kānūhā wa-lākin lil-aʻādī. Wa-khiltuhumu sihāman ṣāʼibātin // fa-kānūhā wa-lākin fī fuʼādī. Wa-qālū qad ṣafat minnā qulūbun // fa-qad ṣadaqū wa-lākin ʻan widādī."
The text ends with: "... Qawluhu: 'Quddisa sirruhu', kināyah ʻan nuzūl al-raḥmah ʻalayhi, li-annahu duʻāʼ la-hu baʻda al-mawt, wa-madlūluhu: 'Ṭahhara Allāh qalbahu', li-anna al-sirr majāzan al-qalb."
Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh."
Translation of the colophon: "But God is more knowledgeable. It was completed by the praise of God."

record.title: Collection of two treatises on miscellaneous Islamic topics : manuscript.
record.note: 1. Title of "Kitāb al-Asʼilah wa-al-ajwibah" from folio 1a.
2. Title of "Irshād al-ʻummāl ilá mā yanbaghī fī Yawm ʻĀshūrāʼ wa-ghayrihi min al-aʻmāl" from incipit (folio 14b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Kitāb al-Asʼilah wa-al-ajwibah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-ʻawn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-kafá, wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīna iṣṭafá. Ammā baʻd, fa-qad suʼiltu fī ruqʻatin ʻan asʼilah ʻadīdah, fa-waffaqa Allāh taʻālá al-ajwibah ʻalayhā, in shāʼa Allāh, sadīdah. Wa-hā anā ūridu al-asʼilah awwalan, thumma ūridu al-ajwibah ʻaqibahā, fa-aqūlu mustaʻīnan billāh waḥdahu, mutawakkilan ʻalayhi, ṭāliban rifdahu: Ammā al-asʼilah, fa-ṣūratuhā, baʻda al-ḥamd lillāh: Mā qawlukum, raḍiya Allāh ʻankum, fī aḥwāl al-mawtá, hal yaʼkulūn fī qubūrihim, wa-hal yaʻrifūn man yazūruhum min al-aḥyāʼ, wa-hal tasmaʻu al-mawtá nidāʼa man yazūruhum wa-law min buʻd, wa-hal yaruddūna al-salām ʻalá man yusallimu ʻalayhim, wa-hal yatazāwarūn, wa-hal yastaʼnisūn bi-al-zāʼir wa-yafraḥūna bi-hi ka-al-aḥyāʼ ..."
1. Secundo folio of "Kitāb al-Asʼilah wa-al-ajwibah": fī al-ākhirah, wa-hal idhā qāla shakhṣ li-ākhar.

2. Incipit of "Irshād al-ʻummāl ilá mā yanbaghī fī Yawm ʻĀshūrāʼ wa-ghayrihi min al-aʻmāl": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi al-ʻawn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-Malik al-ʻAllām alladhī faḍḍala ʻalá lisān Nabīyihi Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, Yawma ʻĀshūrāʼ ʻalá kathīr min al-ayyām, wa-ḥaththa ʻalá fiʻl al-khayrāt, min naḥwi ṣadaq, wa-dhikr, wa-ṣiyām, wa-jaʻala dhālika sababan li-rafʻ al-darajāt wa-maḥw al-āthām. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi risālah laṭīfah ẓarīfah, mukhtaṣarah munīfah, tatalaʼlaʼu maṭāliʻuhā nūran, wa-yazdādu muṭāliʻuhā bihā ḥubūran, fīmā yuṭlabu Yawma ʻĀshūrāʼ ... Wa-sammaytuhā 'Irshād al-ʻummāl ilá mā yanbaghī fī Yawm ʻĀshūrāʼ wa-ghayrihi min al-aʻmāl' ..."
2. Secundo folio of "Irshād al-ʻummāl ilá mā yanbaghī fī Yawm ʻĀshūrāʼ wa-ghayrihi min al-aʻmāl": ʻāshir al-Muḥarram wa-fīhi lughāt.
17 x 24 cm; written surface: 9 x 16.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two numbered quires).
In large clear naskh script, in black ink, on laid white paper; headings in black on the margins; markings in purple; text in red double frames; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā 'Kitāb al-Asʼilah wa-al-ajwibah', lil-Imām al-ʻĀlim al-ʻAllāmah, shaykh al-muḥaddithīn wa-imām al-ʻulamāʼ al-rāsikhīn, al-Shaykh Najm al-Dīn al-Ghayṭī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakatihi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Wa-yalīhi 'Irshād al-ʻummāl' lil-Shaykh al-Budayrī, al-shahīr nasabuhu bi-Ibn al-Mayyit, raḥimahu Allāh wa-raḥimanā bi-hi. Āmīn. Āmīn. tamm."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement, dated 15 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 1279 (3 June 1863), as follows: "Milk al-faqīr al-Sayyid Muḥammad al-Shuʻaybī, ʻufiya ʻanhu. Āmīn."

At the head of folio 14b: "Kitāb 'Irshād al-ʻummāl ilá mā yuṭlabu fī Yawm ʻĀshūrāʼ wa-ghayrihi min al-aʻmāl', taʼlīf Shaykh al-Islām, al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Badrī, al-shahīr nasabuhu bi-Ibn al-Mayyit, raḥimahu Allāh, [wa-]raḥimanā. Āmīn."

1. Colophon of "Kitāb al-Asʼilah wa-al-ajwibah": "Wa-hādhā mā tayassara tasṭīruhu min hādhihi al-ajwibah al-mufīdah ʻalá tilka al-asʼilah al-ʻadīdah min fayḍ Allāh al-ʻAẓīm, wa-fawqa kulli dhī ʻilmin ʻAlīm, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam, wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm, wa-Huwa ḥasbunā wa-niʻma al-wakīl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

Translation of the colophon of "Kitāb al-Asʼilah wa-al-ajwibah": "This is what was facilitated, by the emanation of Almighty God, in writing these useful answers to those various questions. But the All Knowledgeable is above all who have knowledge. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and on his companions, and grant them peace. There is no power nor might except in God the Almighty, the All Powerful. He suffices us, and He is the best advocate. Praise be to God alone."

2. Colophon of "Irshād al-ʻummāl ilá mā yanbaghī fī Yawm ʻĀshūrāʼ wa-ghayrihi min al-aʻmāl": No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... fa-qāla fī nafsihi: Li-man hādhān al-qaṣrān. Fa-qāla la-hu al-hātif: Kānā laka law qaḍayta ḥājat al-faqīr, fa-lammā radadtahu ṣārā li-fulān al-Naṣrānī. Fa-intabaha al-Qāḍī marʻūban yunāy [yunādī] ʻalá nafsihi bi-al-wayl wa-al-thubūr. Thumma dhahaba ilá al-Naṣrānī wa-qāla la-hu: Biʻnī mā faʻalta al-bāriḥah min al-ṣadaqah ʻalá dhālika al-faqīr. Fa-qāla la-hu al-Naṣrānī: Lā [a]bīʻu dhālika bimā ʻalá wajh al-arḍ kullih. Thumma naṭaqa bi-al-Shahādatayn, wa-fāza bi-saʻādat al-dārayn. Intahá. Fa-unẓur yā akhī mā aḥsana al-muʻāmalah maʻa Allāh al-Jalīl, fa-innahu min karamihi tuʻṭá al-ʻaṭāʼ al-jazīl ʻalá al-ʻamal al-qalīl. Wa-mā aḥsana mā qīl: Lā yalḥaqnnaka ..."

record.title: Treatise on Islamic theology and eschatology : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger based on context.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... wa-al-Tawrāt ʻalá Mūsá, wa-al-Zabūr ʻalá Dāwūd, wa-al-Injīl ʻalá ʻĪsá, wa-al-Qurʼān ʻalá Nabīyinā. Wa-qāla baʻḍuhum: Anzala Allāh ʻalá Ādam ʻashr ṣaḥāʼif, wa-ʻalá Idrīs khamsīn, wa-ʻalá Nūḥ ʻishrīn, wa-ʻalá Ibrāhīm ʻashrah, wa-ʻalá Mūsá ʻashrah, thumma al-Tawrāt, wa-al-Zabūr, wa-al-Injīl, wa-al-Qurʼān. Wa-qad naẓamtuhā ʻalá al-khilāf, fa-qultu: Wa-ṣaddiq bi-kutubi Allāhi ʻashran li-Ādama // bi-sittīna aw khamsīna Shīthun taqaddamā. Thalāthūn aw khamsūna li-Idrīsa najlihi // wa-Nūḥun la-hu ʻishrūna qul li-Khalīlihi. Thalāthūna aw ʻashrun wa-ʻashrun Kalīmuhu // ka-Tawrātihi thumma al-Zabūru bi-waʻẓihi. Li-Dāwūda Injīlun li-ʻĪsá Nabīyunā // la-hu unzila al-Qurʼānu fīhi thawābunā ..."
Secundo folio: ʻan al-aʻyun kamā summiya al-janīn janīnan.
17 x 24 cm; written surface: 10 x 17 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 17 unnumbered quires).
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on laid white paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly, as follows: "... wa-minhā yawma lā yanṭuqūn, ay al-kuffār fīhi bi-shayʼ, wa-lā yuʼdhanu bi-al-ʻuthr fa-yaʻatdhirūn, ʻaṭf ʻalá yuʼdhan min ghayr tasabbub ʻanhu, fa-huwa dākhilun fī ḥayyiz al-nafy, ay lā idhna, fa-lā iʻtidhār, wa-dhālika ḥīna qāla lahum: Ikhsaʼū fīhā wa-lā tukallimūni. Wa-tuṭbiqu ʻalayhim Jahannam ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Majālis al-Sinānīyah al-kabīrah : manuscript / Ḥasan ibn Aḥmad Ummī Sinān.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger from the printed version ([Istanbul] : Sharikat Ṣaḥāfīyah ʻUlūmīyah, 1260 [1844]).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. al-Majlis al-awwal. Fī Sūrat al-Fātiḥah. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, Mālik Yawm al-Dīn, Īyāka naʻbudu wa-Īyāka nastaʻīn, ihdinā al-ṣirāṭ al-mustaqīm, ṣirāṭa alladhīna anʻamta ʻalayhim, ghayri al-maghḍūbi ʻalayhim, wa-lā al-ḍāllīn. Āmīn. Ṣadaqa Allāh al-ʻAẓīm, wa-ballagha Rasūluhu al-Karīm. Allāhumma ṣalli wa-sallim ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ʻalá jamīʻ al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Rawá ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Ruhāwī, bi-ḍamm al-Rāʼ, nisbah ilá al-Ruhā bi-al-ḍamm fī awwal Kitāb al-Arbaʻīn, wa-kadhā al-Khaṭīb ʻan Abī Hurayrah bi-isnād ḥasan ..."
Secundo folio: min al-barakah wa-al-khayr baʻḍun quyyida bi-qawlihi.
20 x 29 cm; written surface: 11.3 x 20.3 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather cover with embossed central medallion and corner decorations.

In clear medium naskh script, in black ink, on laid white paper; headings in red; the phrases of the Qurʼanic verses in red; some commentaries on the margins, mostly in Arabic with some in Ottoman Turkish; some corrections on the margins; text framed in red; leaves numbered in East Arabic (Indian) numerals; the upper left corners of folios 208-307 are torn; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with the commentary on verses from Sūrat Muḥammad (Qurʼān: Chapter 47), as follows: "... Wa-Allāh yaʻlamu munqalabakum, yaʻnī [aḥwālakum fī al-dunyā fa-innahā marāḥil lā budda min] qaṭʻihā, wa-mathwākum, ay manzilatakum fī al-ʻuqbá, fa-innahā [dār iqāmatikum] fa-ittaqū Allāh wa-istaghfirūhu, wa-aʻiddū li-maʻādikum, dhakarahu al-Bayḍāwī, raḥimahu Allāh. Wa-qīla yaʻlamu jamīʻ aḥwālakum, fa-lā yakhfá ʻalayhi shayʼ minhā. Abū al-Saʻūd, raḥimahu Allāh. Fa-man tayaqqana annahu taʻālá yaʻlamu al-sirra wa-al-khafīyāt, wa-lā yaʻzibu ʻan ʻimlihi [ʻilmihi] shayʼ fī al-araḍīn wa-al-samāwāt yakūnu ʻalá ḥayāʼ min Allāh taʻālá wa-yashtaghilu ilá al-ṭāʻāt wa-al-ḥasanāt, saʻyan ilá afḍal al-ḥasanāt, wa-hiya kalimat al-tawḥīd, bihā al-najāh la-hu min al-Jaḥīm wa-al-darakāt, wa-bi-hā al-wuṣūl ilá al-Jannah wa-al-darajāt." After that three verses in Persian from "Mathnawī" (al-Jild al-thālith).

record.title: 880-02 al-Nukat al-ẓarīfah fī tarjīḥ madhhab Abī Ḥanīfah : manuscript / Akmal al-Dīn al-Bābartī Muḥammad ibn Maḥmūd.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... bashīran wa-nadhīran, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi alladhīna adhhaba Allāh ʻanhum al-rijs wa-ṭahharahum taṭhīran. Ammā baʻd, inna al-zamān lammā intahá ilá waqt taḍaʻḍaʻa fīhi arkān ribāʻ al-ʻulūm, wa-taqaʻqaʻa fīhi bunyān biqāʻ al-maʻlūm, wa-khalat ghābātuhā ʻan usāmah abī al-shiblayn, ḥattá ḍajja fīhā thuʻālah abū al-ḥuṣayn, wa-shāʻa al-ḥadīth fī al-ṭaʻn ʻalá madhhab al-aqdamīn, wa-dāʻin iddaʻā anna Abā Ḥanīfah alladhī huwa aqdam al-mujtahidīn, lam yaʻlam Aḥādīth al-Bukhārī, wa-khālafa Ḥadīth Sayyid al-Mursalīn, wa-kāna dhālika mūhiman li-wahn madhhabihi ʻinda ḍuʻafāʼ al-yaqīn, ashāra ilayya baʻḍ al-ikhwān alladhīna hum bi-manzilat al-insān lil-ʻayn wa-al-ʻayn lil-insān, an aktuba risālah tuqawwī iʻtiqād ḍaʻafat al-Ḥanafīyah fī madhhab Imāmihim, wa-tuʻarrif mā al-nās ʻalayhi fī ghālib al-buldān min al-iḥtiyāj ilá madhhabihi min khalfihim wa-imāmihim, fa-katabtuhā mushtamilah ʻalá muqaddimah wa-maqṣad wa-khātimah ..."
Secundo folio: ghābātuhā ʻan usāmah abī al-shiblayn.
15.7 x 21.2 cm; written surface: 10 x 15 cm; 5 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.

In large calligraphic naskh script, in black ink, on laid white paper; text fully vocalized (some in blue); headings in gold and red; sporadic decorative circles in gold, black, and red; text within double red frame; catchwords.
At the head of folio 48a: An endowment statement: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá."
On folio 48b: Quotations from the Qurʼān in a different hand.

The text ends abruptly, with an address to a certain king, praising him and the Ḥanafī tradition, and asking him to adhere to the Ḥanafī doctrine, like the other rulers of the Islamic regions, as follows: "... Wa-ammā al-khātimah, fa-fī al-taʻrīḍ bi-al-gharaḍ min waḍʻ hādhihi al-risālah, ayyuhā al-Malik, ayyadaka Allāh wa-khallada mulkaka, wa-naṣara anṣāraka, wa-khadhala aʻdāʼaka, wa-nawwara baṣīrataka, an tanẓura bi-fikrika al-ṣāʼib, wa-dhihnika al-thāqib, wa-khāṭirika al-yaqẓān, wa-intibāhika al-ʻaẓīm al-shān, anna mithla hādhā al-madhhab alladhī huwa al-muqtadá fī uṣūl al-sharāʼiʻ wa-furūʻihā ʻalá mā marra taqrīruhā fī al-masāʼil al-madhkūrah, wa-ʻalayhi ʻāmmat ʻulamāʼ al-ʻālam wa-salāṭīnihi bi-al-Hind, wa-al-Sind, wa-Khurāsān, wa-Turkustān, wa-al-ʻIrāq, wa-Dawsht Khaljān, wa-bilād Yūnān, wa-Ādhirbayjān, wa-umarāʼihim, wa-ghālib al-umarāʼ al-Miṣrīyah, wa-al-bilād al-Shāmīyah, min ḥākim ..."

Colophon: Some leaves seem to be missing between folios 47 and 48, the colophon starts as follows: "... waḥdahu, wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi. Tamma al-kitāb al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-tawfīqih."

Translation of the colophon: "... alone, God suffices us, He is the best advocate. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and on his companions. The blessed book is completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence."

record.title: Illuminated copy of the Qurʼān : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
Starts with Sūrat al-Fātiḥah, and ends with Sūrat al-Nās.
Secundo folio: Beginning of Sūrat al-Baqarah.
13 x 19 cm; written surface: 6 x 12 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; cover embossed with central medallion and embossed corner decorations; flap embossed with central medallion.
In beautiful medium naskh script, in black ink, on white thin paper; text fully vocalized and illuminated, within gold and blue frames; catchwords.

Colophon (folio 303a): "Katabahu al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr ilá raḥmat Rabbihi al-Qadīr, al-Sayyid ʻUmar al-Khulū̄ṣī, min talāmidh al-Ḥājj Ḥāfiẓ ʻUthmān al-Fawzī, ghafara Allāh lahumā, wa-li-wālidayhimā, wa-li-jamīʻ al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, sanat thamān wa-thamānīn wa-miʼatayn baʻda al-alf, min Hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf. 15 Muḥarram, sanat 1288."

Translation of the colophon: "Copied by the wretched, the poor to the mercy of his Almighty Lord, al-Sayyid ʻUmar al-Khulūṣī, a student of al-Ḥajj Ḥāfiẓ ʻUthmān al-Fawzī, may God forgive both of them, their parents, and all believers, men and women, in the year 1288 of the Hijrah of Him to whom belongs glory and honor. 15 Muḥarram, of the year 1288 [6 April 1871]."
On an inserted sheet of paper: "Received Feb 26, 1959. Koran illuminated from Organist Mr. Lyman Bunnell of Emanuel Cong. Church."

record.title: 880-02 Multaqá al-abḥur : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Ḥalabī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 7a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī waffaqanā lil-tafaqquh fī al-dīn alladhī huwa ḥabluhu al-matīn, wa-faḍluhu al-mubīn, wa-mīrāth al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn, wa-ḥujjat Allāh al-dāmighah ʻalá al-khalq ajmaʻīn wa-maḥajjatuhu al-sālikah ilá al-aʻlá ʻillīyīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá khayr khalqihi Muḥammad al-mabʻūth raḥmah lil-ʻālamīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-al-tābiʻīn wa-al-ʻulamāʼ al-ʻāmilīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-muftaqir ilá raḥmat Rabbihi al-Ghanī, Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Ḥalabī: Qad saʼalanī baʻḍ ṭālibī al-istifādah an ajmaʻa la-hu kitāban yashtamilu ʻalá masāʼil al-Qudūrī, wa-al-Kanz, wa-al-Mukhtār, wa-al-Wiqāyah, bi-ʻibārah sahlah ghayr mughlaqah, fa-ajabtuhu ilá dhālik, wa-aḍaftu ilayhi baʻḍ mā yuḥtāju ilayhi min masāʼil al-Majmaʻ, wa-nubdhah min al-Hidāyah, wa-ṣarraḥtu bi-dhikr al-khilāf bayna aʼimmatinā, wa-qaddamtu min aqāwīlihim mā huwa al-arjaḥ, wa-akhkhartu ghayrahu ... wa-sammaytuhu 'Multaqá al-abḥur' li-yuwāfiqa al-ism al-musammá ..."
Secundo folio: al-istifādah an ajmaʻa la-hu kitāban.
9.5 x 16.6 cm; written surface: 4.6 x 12 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; cover embossed with central gold medallion; cover and flap tooled with decorative gold frame.

In good clear naskh script, in black ink, on white laid paper; headings and markings in red; numerous comments on the margins and interlinear; leaves numbered in East Arabic (Indian) numerals 1-251; text within small and large red frames; catchwords.
On the label pasted to the front cover (in pencil): "Yāzmah ʻArabī ʻulūm dīnīyah".

On flyleaf 1: A borrowing/lending testimony, dated 2 Mayis 330 (1330 of the Hijrah = 2 March 1912), as follows: "Ashhadu anna hādhā al-kitāb li-rafīqī al-muḥtaram, wa-akhī fī Allāh, Shākir ʻAdnān Afandī, nāla [?] Allāh bi-luṭfihi al-khafī wa-al-jalī, wa-arjū anna hādhihi al-suṭūr takūnu khāṭirah takhṭuru li-rafīqī ilá zamān taḥṣīlihi wa-shabābihi, wa-sāniḥah takūnu sababan li-farīd adwārihi. 2 Māyis, 330. Katabahu al-faqīr, aḍʻaf al-ʻibād, Muḥammad Ṣāliḥ Wajdī al-Burkawī."
On flyleaf 2: An ownership statement in Ottoman Turkish, by Muḥammad al-Sāʻī al-Sunaydibī, dated 15 Shaʻbān [?] 228 (13 August (?) 1813).
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "al-Milk li-malik al-milk. Li-Ḥāfiẓ Muḥammad Shākir al-Sunaydibī" and a "Ṭughrā" signature.
On folio 2a: A list of various weights and their measures.
On folio 2b-6a: A detailed index of the contents of the codex.
On folio 6a: An ownership statement: "Istaṣḥabahu Ismāʻīl Ḥaqqī ibn Ḥusayn Rushdī, ghufira lahumā." And an illegible stamp.

At the lower right corner of folio 256b: A note indicating that the author made a fair copy "tabyīḍ" of his work on Tuesday, the thirteenth of Rajab, of the year 923 of the Hijrah (11 August 1517), as follows: "Wa-qad tamma tabyīḍuhu bayna al-ṣalātayn, yawm al-Thulāthāʼ, al-thālith ʻashar min Rajab al-muʻaẓẓam, sanat thalāth wa-ʻishrīn wa-tisʻimiʼah, ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá Allāh al-Ghanī, Ibrāhīm al-Ḥalabī. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn."
On folio 257b: An ownership, or, reading statement: "al-Sayyid al-Ḥājj Ismāʻīl Ḥaqqī ibn al-Ḥājj Ḥusayn Rushdī, ghafara lahumā al-Bārī."

Author's colophon: "Qāla al-faqīr: Hādhā ākhir 'Multaqá al-abḥur', wa-lam ālu juhdan fī ʻadam tark shayʼ min masāʼil al-kutub al-arbaʻah, wa-altamisu min al-nāẓir fīhi in iṭṭalaʻa ʻalá al-ikhlāl bi-shayʼ minhā an yulḥiqahu bi-maḥallihi, fa-inna al-insān maḥall al-nisyān, wa-li-yakun dhālika baʻda al-taʼammul fī maẓānn tilka al-masʼalah, fa-innahu rubbamā dhakartu baʻḍ al-masāʼil fī baʻḍ al-kutub al-madhkūrah fī mawḍiʻ wa-fī ghayrihi fī mawḍiʻ ākhar, fa-iktafaytu bi-dhikrihā fī aḥad al-mawḍiʻayn, thumma innī zidtu masāʼil kathīrah min al-Hidāyah wa-min Majmaʻ al-baḥrayn, wa-lam azid shayʼan min ghayrihimā ḥattá yashula al-ṭalab ʻalá mā ishtabaha ʻalayhi ṣiḥḥat shayʼ mimmā laysa fī al-kutub al-arbaʻah. Wa-Allāh ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī yassara lanā al-itmām, wa-ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi alladhīna hum sanad al-khawāṣṣ wa-al-ʻawām. Allāhumma irḥam li-man daʻā li-kātibihi fī Yawm al-Qiyām. Wa-qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min taswīdihi fī yawm al-ḥādī wa-al-ʻishrīn min shahr Awwal al-Rabīʻayn, min shuhūr sanat arbaʻ wa-ʻishrīn wa-tisʻimiʼah min Hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf."

Translation of the author's colophon: "The poor man said: This is the end of 'Multaqa al-Abhar' (Confluence ot the seas). I made all effort not to leave any of the issues of the four books. Because I mentioned some of the issues in some of the books in one place, and other issues in another place, I limited mentioning them only in one of the two places. However, I added many issues from "al-Hidāyah" and from the "Majmaʻ al-baḥrayn", but I did not add anything from others, so that it will be easier to detect the validity of something suspected not to be in the four books. God suffices me, He is the best advocate. Praise be to God who facilitated our completion, and upon His Prophet Muhammad the best prayer and peace, and upon his family and companions who are the support of the private and the common people. On the twenty-first day of the month of the first of the two Rabīʻs (i.e., Rabīʻ al-Awwal), of the year nine hundred and twenty-four after the Hijrah of Him to whom belongs glory and honor [12 April 1518]".

Copyist's colophon: "Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min taḥrīr hādhā al-kitāb biʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-ʻAzīz al-Wahhāb, ʻalá yad [al-]mudhnib al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-khaṭāyā wa-al-taqṣīr Aḥmad Yāzijī Miyānah, fī yawm al-ḥādī wa-al-ʻishrīn min shahr Rajab al-murjib, sanat thalāth wa-sittīn wa-miʼah wa-alf. M."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The copy of this book was completed by the help of God, the Almighty, the Abundant Giving King, by the hand of the sinner, the poor servant, who admits his sins and shortcoming, Aḥmad al-Yāzijī Miyānah, on the twenty-first day of the sacred month of Rajab, of the year one thousand one hundred and sixty-three [of the Hijrah = 26 June 1750]. M."

record.title: Astronomical tables : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: Starts with: "Asmāʼ buldān. Ṭūl ʻarḍ: Kūtāhiyah, Mūrīnah, Barūsah, Aznīk, Aznakmīd, Aynah Būli, Ṣāmsūn, Anqarah, Qayṣarīyah, Qūniyah, ʻArabkar, Sīwās, Mālaṭīyah, Mīḥālīj, Maghnīsiyhā, Jashmah ..."
Secundo folio: Asmāʼ buldān Ūd Qalʻahsī, Baghjah, sarāy.
11.5 x 17.8 cm; written surface: 7.7 x 15.5 cm; 28-32 lines per page.
Binding: In thin cream color cardboard.
In fair naskh script, in black and red ink, on laid white paper; no comments; no catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Jadwal asmāʼ buldan [buldān] fī al-falak."
At the head of folio 1b: "Jadwal asmāʼ buldān mashhūrah bi-qawl rāṣid jadīd Qusaynī."
On folios 1b-3a: The names of 194 well-known cities with their longitudes and latitudes in different the regions of the Ottoman Empire.
On folios 3b-10a: Miscellaneous astronomical, astrological, and mathematical calculations in Ottoman Turkish.
On folios 10b-11a: "Jadwal anṣāf aqṭār fī jamīʻ al-ʻurūḍ ʻalá anna niṣf quṭr madār al-Ḥamal wa-al-Mīzān Lr [...] K wa-bi-miqyās [...]."
On folios 11b-28a: "Baqīyat jadwal anṣāf aqṭār bi-miqyās [...]."
On folios 28b-29a: "Jadwal anṣāf al-aqṭār al-maḥsūb ʻalá anna niṣf quṭr madār al-Ḥamal [...] wa-bi-miqyās [...] li-rasm rubʻ al-hilālī wa-sāʼirih."
Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with an astronomical table.

record.title: 880-03 Kashf al-wujūh al-ghurr li-maʻānī Naẓm al-durr : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Razzāq al-Qāshānī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī khalqa bi-qudratihi ṣubḥ al-wujūd ʻan ghasaq al-ʻadam, fa-jaʻalahu āyah mubṣirah, li-yuqīma ʻalayhi dalīlan, wa-fataqa bi-ḥikmatihi ratqa al-jamʻ fī ʻayn al-qidam, fa-faṣṣala kulla shayʼ tafṣīlan, khalaqa al-ʻālam mirʼātan majlūwah bi-rūḥ Ādam, fa-shāhada fīhā ʻaynahu ʻiyānan, wa-aṭlaʻa min (fī) samāʼ al-dhāt shumūs al-asmāʼ wa-aqmār al-ṣifāt hidāyatan wa-bayānan, tajallá bi-dhātihi fī marāyā al-ṣifāt, wa-bi-ṣifatihi fī maẓāhir al-maknūnāt, ʻalá ḥasb istiʻdād al-mutajllī fīhi, wa-tasattara min jihat iṭlāqihi bi-kull mā ẓahara fīhi min al-mutaʻayyināt ..."
Secundo folio: ishtaraṭa fīhi al-ṭalāq.
13.5 x 18 cm; written surface: 9 x 12.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard; dark brown cloth on spine (some quires are numbered).

In clear good naskh script, in black ink, on thick cream color laid paper; headings in red; text fully vocalized; few notes and corrections on the margins; folio 1 is replaced in a different hand; some leaves seem to be missing; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Kashf al-wujūh al-ghurr li-ḥall maʻānī 'Naẓm al-durr', lil-ʻārif al-muḥaqqiq al-mudaqqiq, al-Shaykh al-muʼallif ʻAbd al-Razzāq al-Qāshānī al-Tūnisī, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu. Āmīn. Tamm."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Tamallakahu bi-al-shirāʼ al-sharʻī afqar ʻibād Allāh ilayhi ʻAlī ibn al-ʻAllāmah al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Ḥaqq al-Ḥajjājī."

On folio 1a: An endowment statement, dated the beginning of Rajab, of the year 942 of the Hijrah (5 January 1536), as follows: "Awqafa al-Janāb al-mukarram Sulaymān Āghāh Darandalī ʻalá rūḥ wālidihi al-marḥūm bi-karam Allāh Aḥmad Āghāh Darandalī, fī ghurrat Rajab, sanat 942, wa-jaʻalahu taḥta yad kātibihi ʻAlī ʻAbd al-Ḥaqq al-Ḥajjājī." Under it a "ṭughrā" signature of the Sulaymān Āghāh and an illegible stamp.

The text ends as follows: "... wa-lā yaṣiḥḥu bayʻ al-ḥinṭah fī sunbulihā bi-ṣāfiyah, wa-hiya al-muḥāqalah, wa-lā al-ruṭab ʻalá al-nakhl bi-thamar, wa-hiya al-muzābanah, wa-yurakhkhaṣ bi-bayʻ al-ḥarāyā [al-ʻarāyā], wa-huwa al-ruṭab ʻalá al-nakhl bi-thamar fī al-arḍ, aw al-ʻinab fī al-shajar bi-zabīb fīmā dūn khamsat awsuq, wa-law zāda fī ṣafqatayn jāza, wa-yushtaraṭu al-taqāyuḍ bi-taslīm al-thaman kaylan, wa-al-takhliyah fī al-nakhl, wa-al-aẓhar annahu lā yajūzu fī sāʼir al-thimār, wa-annahu lā yakhtaṣṣu bi-al-fuqarāʼ."

Colophon: The colophon is written in red, in a different hand, as follows: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Tammat fī ʻām thamāniyah wa-thalāthūn baʻda al-thamānimiʼah, ʻalá dhimmat al-muʼallif, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Razzāq al-Tūnisī, bi-Tūnis al-Jazāʼir."

Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable. It was completed in the year 838 [of the Hijrah = 1434/1435], on behalf of the author, al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Razzāq al-Tūnisī, in Tūnis al-Jazāʼir."
