record.title: Frederick Temple Blackwood, Marquis of Dufferin and Ava, letter to George Augustus Sala : manuscript.
record.note: Printed caption on photograph mount: "George Augustus Sala, Esq. Photographed from life by Lock and Whitfield, 178, Regent Street, London".

record.title: Melchite liturgy book from Dayr al-Mukhalliṣ Mashmūshah : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bi-ism al-Āb wa-al-Ibn wa-al-Rūḥ al-Quds al-Ilāh al-Wāḥid. Istiʻdād al-kāhin qabla khidmat al-quddās al-Ilāhī. Kull yawm al-mazmūr ʻa. 83. Mā aḥabba masākinaka, ilkh. Wa-al-mazmūr ʻa. 115. Āmantu li-dhālika takallamtu, ilkh. al-Mazmūr 129. Min al-aʻmāq, ilkh. Afshīn. Amil ayyuhā al-Ilāh al-ḥalīm ādhāna raʼfatika naḥwa masāʼilinā, wa-anir qulūbanā bi-rūḥika al-quddūs li-nakūna ahlan li-nakhdima asrāraka al-Ilāhīyah wa-nuḥibbaka ilá abad al-ābidīn. Āmīn ..."
Secundo folio: qalbī wa-iḥfaẓnī min al-muḍāddāt kullihā.
15 x 21.3 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 15.5 cm; 20 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather; cover and spine decorated in gold designs with religious symbols.
In good naskh script; in black ink, on laid white paper; headings in red; text in double red frame; catchwords.

On folio 175b (at the end of the text): An endowment statement and an oval stamp with Greek letters: "Waqf Dayr al-Mukhalliṣ Mashmūshah bi-ism al-Qiss CHP Bāsīliyūs ʻAṭā Allāh." Under it: "Qad intaqala li-tamalluk kātibihi al-Qiss Ibrāhīm BM. Waqf li-rahbanatihi, wa-dhālika sanat 1835, fī 20 K2."

Colophon: No coliphon. Text ends with: "... fa-lā taʻjabū min hādhā, innahu sa-taʼtī sāʻatun, yasmaʻu fīhā jamīʻ man fī al-qubūr ṣawtahu, fa-yaqūmūn, ammā alladhīna ʻamilū al-ṣāliḥāt ilá qiyāmat al-ḥayāh, wa-alladhīna ʻamilū al-sayyiʼāt ilá qiyāmat al-daynūnah. Lastu aqduru an aʻmala shayʼan min dhāt nafsī, wa-innamā aḥkumu bi-mā asmaʻu, wa-ḥukmī ʻādil huwa, li-annī last aṭlubu mashīʼatī bal mashīʼat al-Āb alladhī arsalanī ḥaqqan. M."

record.title: 880-02 Khuṭbat al-bayān : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib.
record.note: Title from caption (folio 1a) and colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-Malik al-Mutaʻāl ʻan idrāk al-ʻuqūl bi-ḥayth [bi-ḥasb] al-ʻirfān, al-wājib al-wujūd bilā kayf wa-shakāl (?), ay lā jawhar wa-lā ʻaraḍ, maḥabbat al-jismān, al-aḥad al-ṣamad, lā zād wa-lā nawāl, bal huwa rāziq al-ʻibād min al-ins wa-al-jān wa-sāyir al-ḥayawān, al-ḥayy al-qayyūm, ʻalá ḥāl bilā aḥwāl, mā dāmat al-samāwāt wa-al-araḍīn bi-adwār al-dawarān wa-al-zamān, al-dāyim al-bāqī fī mulkihi, abadī bilā intiqāl wa-irtiḥāl, thābit muthbat bi-al-thubūt wa-al-tibyān, al-qāyim fī salṭanatihi bilā iʻtizāl wa-inzāl, innahu sulṭān al-salāṭīn fī al-sirr wa-al-iʻlān ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-ikrām. Iftaḥ lī abwāb al-kalām bi-miftāḥ ilhām.
15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 12 x 18.5 cm; 20-25 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; dark brown leather on spine and edges; spine deteriorated.
In fair large naskh and ruqʻah scripts; in black ink, on laid cream color paper; phrases of "Khuṭbat al-bayān" in red; text framed in red; catchwords.
On the label pasted to the front cover (in pencil): "Khuṭbat al-bayān. Khuṭbat al-bayān".
At the head of folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Khuṭbat al-bayān. Imām ʻAlī Raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, karrama Allāh wajhahu."
On folio 103b: A statement in Ottoman Turkish.
On folio 103b: An ownership statement: "Ṣāḥib al-khayrāt al-Sayyid al-Ḥājjī Ḥusayn Rūfāʻ" and a stamp "al-Sayyid al-Ḥājj Ḥusayn al-Rifāʻī".
Colophon: "Tamma Khuṭbat al-bayān bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Mannān, wa-bi-ḥamdihi, [...] wa-ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn. Bi-raḥmatika Yā Arḥam al-Rāḥimīn. tamma bi-al-khayr. M. M. M."

Translation of the colphon: "Khuṭbat al-bayān was completed by the help of the God the Munificent King and His praise, [...] and his family and all his companions. By Your mercy, O You who is the Most Merciful of all merciful. It was well completed. M. M. M."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah : manuscript / Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-ghanī, al-Syakh [crossed over] Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Abī Bakr al-Azharī, ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-luṭfihi al-khafī, wa-ajrāhu ʻalá ʻawāʼid birrihi al-ḥafī: al-Ḥamdu lillāh rāfiʻ maqām al-muntaṣibīn li-nafʻ al-ʻabīd, al-khāfiḍīn janāḥahum lil-mustafīd, al-jāzimīn bi-anna tashīl al-naḥw ilá al-ʻulūm, mann Allāh, min ghayr shakk wa-lā tardīd ... Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā Sharḥ laṭīf li-alfāẓ al-Ājurrūmīyat fī uṣūl ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah, yantafiʻu bi-hi al-mubtadī, in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá, wa-lā yaḥtāju ilayhi al-muntahī, ʻamiltuhu lil-ṣighār ..."
Secundo folio: fa-al-ism yuʻrafu bi-al-khafḍ.
13.5 x 18 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 11 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard cover with flap; brown leather on spine and flap.

In small good naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; the phrases of al-Ājurrūmīyah preceded by the word "qawluhu" in red; markings in red or bold script; some overlined phrases in red or black; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: Miscellaneous statements: Ownerships, readings, etc., as follows: 1. "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah lil-Shaykh Khālid, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn." 2. "Hādhā Kitāb Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah." 3. "Hādhā Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah lil-Shaykh Khālid." 4. (in Latin script) "shirch ajromiyeh." 5. "Li-ḥafaẓatihi mā astawdiʻ." 6. "Naḥwa Ifranqiʻū ʻannī." 7. "Hādhā al-sharḥ li-Muḥyī ibn Mullā Muḥammad al-Ghurāb Zādah, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn." 8. "Malakahu al-faqīr al-Sayyid Muḥammad Abū al-Saʻūd al-Ghazzī, ʻufiya [ʻanhu]." 9. "Muḥammad Sayyid al-Kawthar[ī]."
On the right margin of the colophon (in red calligraphic naskh): "Ṣabartu ʻalá al-dunyā bi-kulli balīyatin // mufāraqatu al-aḥbābi wa-Allāhi aṣʻabu."

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Tammat kitābat sharḥ al-durrah al-naḥwīyah fī Sharḥ al-Jarfaʻīyah [al-Ājurrūmīyah ?] bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-mannih."

Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable. He suffices me, He is the best advocate. There is no power nor might except in God, the Almighty, the All Powerful. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and on his companions, and grant them abundant peace until Judgement Day. The commentary of the grammatical jewel, 'Sharḥ al-Jarfaʻīyah [al-Ājurrūmīyah]' was completed by the praise of God and His gracious giving."

record.title: 880-01 Mawlūdīyāt, madāʼiḥ, wa-azjāl : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger based on the contents of the codex.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The codex starts with: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih. Wa-li-muḥibb Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, Sayyidī Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Ḥayy al-Ḥallabī: Ṣalli Yā Rabbi ʻalá al-mukhtāri man // nūruhu fī al-qalbi yasrī wa-al-jasad. Sayyidu al-kawnayni zaynu al-thaqalayn // al-Ḥabību al-Muṣṭafá baḥru al-rashad. Fī sabīli Allāhi qalbī mā wajad // wajada al-ḥubba ʻadhāban lil-abad ..."
Secundo folio: Yā Rasūla Allāhi kun lī shāfiʻan.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 18 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; dark red leather on spine and corners.
In large good Maghribī script, in black ink, on laid white paper; headings in red; text fully vocalized; catchwords.
Includes two slip cards of notes in English about the poems of the codex.

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Tamallaka bi-hādhā al-majmūʻ ʻubayd Rabbihi Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad, al-mulaqqab Sharrād, al-maʻrūf bi-al-Safaṭī, fī ʻishrīn khalat min shahr Juwān, sanat 1899 Masīḥīyah.
On folio 1a: "Qaʻkabīrah [?] min al-madhkūr aʻlāh lil-fāḍil al-adīb al-ʻAllāmah al-Shaykh Sayyidī Muḥammad Rashīd al-Quwaytilī, ḥafiẓa Allāh al-jamīʻ bi-mannih."

Colophon: No colophon. The codex ends with the following verses: "... Yā khayra man waffá al-ʻuhūd // jud lī bi-iḥsāni. Wa-al-wālidayn wa-al-judūd // wa-ʻumma ikhwāni. Thumma al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām // ʻalá Rasūli Allāh. Wa-al-ṣaḥbi wa-al-āli al-kirām // dhawī al-ʻulā wa-al-jāh. Mā qāla man ṣāgha al-niẓām // yabghī riḍá Mawlāh. Muḥammadun rūḥu al-wujūd // wa-sayyidu al-akwān. Imāmu aṣḥābi al-sujūd // fa-mā la-hu min thān. Intahat bi-ḥamd Allāh."

record.title: 880-01 Sīrat Muḥammad al-Kurdī. Al-Juzʼ 1 : manuscript.
record.note: Title from the label on the front cover.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ḥukiya, wa-Allāh aʻlam fī ghaybihi wa-aḥkam, fīmā maḍá wa-taqaddama wa-salafa min aḥādīth al-umam, akhbār ʻajībah, wa-umūr muṭribah gharībah, tanfī al-hamm ʻan al-ṣudūr, wa-tajlibu al-faraḥ wa-al-surūr, li-anna aḥsan mā nuqila fī al-ṭurūs mā tanshariḥu bi-hi al-nufūs, wa-dhālika min al-musāmarāt al-laṭīfah wa-al-nukat al-ẓarīfah ... Wa-baʻd, fa-qad nuqila ilaynā min al-akhbār ʻalá lisān man naqal, annahu kāna fī al-ʻaṣr al-sālif rajul min ʻibād Allāh yusammá Karakhān, wa-kān rajul Kurdī min al-Akrād al-ṣulaḥāʼ, wa-kāna min alladhīn yaskunūn al-bādiyah ..."
Secundo folio: fa-qaddara Allāh taʻālá annahu qad atá ʻalá al-bilād qaḥṭ.
15 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 12 x 18 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; dark red leather on spine.
In clear fair large naskh script, in black ink, on thick white paper; catchwords.
On the label pasted to the front cover (in pencil): "al-Juzʼ al-awwal min Sīrat Muḥammad al-Kurdī."
On folio 8b: A reader's statement: "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammal maʻāniyahu al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-Karīm, Muḥammad Khālid al-Bābā, fī 10 Ṣafar, sanat 1307 [6 October 1889]."
On folio 10a: A reader's statement: "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammal maʻāniyahu [...] Niqūlā ibn Ilyās [... ...], wa-dhālika fī 28 [... ...]."

Colophon: No colophon. Part one of "Sīrat Muḥammad al-Kurdī" ends as follows: "... fa-lā taqtulhu, wa-lākin urīdu an uʻallimak ʻalá darb taqtuluh, fa-taqtuluhu bi-sababihi, fa-huwa alyaq min qatlihi bilā darb. Fa-qāla al-malik: Mā huwa ayyuhā al-Wazīr. Fa-qāl: Murādī tursilu warāʼahu wa-taqūlu la-hu: Yā Muḥammad, malikayn fī balad mā yaṣīr, wa-lākin murādī minka tuʻammir lī qaṣr libnah min fiḍḍah wa-libnah min dhahab. Wa-al-kamāl fī al-kitāb al-thānī."

record.title: 880-03 Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī al-Mukhtār : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Jazūlī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit (folio 1b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā lil-īmān wa-al-islām, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Muḥammad Nabīyihi alladhī istanqadhanā min ʻibādat al-awthān wa-al-aṣnām, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-nujabāʼ al-bararah al-kirām. Wa-baʻd hādhā, fa-al-gharaḍ fī hādhā al-kitāb dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam wa-faḍāʼilihā, ankuruhā [adhkuruhā] maḥdhūfat al-asānīd li-yashula ḥifẓuhā ʻalá al-qāriʼ, wa-hiya min ahamm al-muhimmāt li-man yurīdu al-qurb min Rabb al-Arbāb. Wa-sammaytuhu bi-Kitāb Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī al-Mukhtār, ibtighāʼan li-marḍāt Allāh taʻālá wa-maḥabbatan fī Rasūlihi al-Karīm ..."
Secundo folio: ʻalayhi wa-sallam taslīman.
10 x 15.8 cm; written surface: 6 x 11 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion and tooled with decorative design in gold.

In beautiful small naskh script, in black ink, on thin laid cream color paper; markings in gold; text fully vocalized and framed in gold; a colorful design at the head of folio 1b; some notes on the margins in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish; some corrections and collations on the margins; catchwords.
On folios 46a-47b: Duʻāʼ khatm Dalāʼil al-khayrāt (Invocation to be recited at the end of Dalāʼil al-khayrāt).

On folios 48a-49b: An "Ijāzah" (Certificate of authorization) to transmit "Dalāʼil al-khayrāt" given to Muḥammad Shawqī ibn al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá ibn al-Sayyid Muḥammad ibn al-Sayyid Aḥmad al-Anqarawī al-Ḥusaynī, by Sulaymān ibn Ḥusayn ibn Sulaymān ibn Ḥusayn al-Ḥusaynī al-Anqarawī, al-Iskadārī mawlidan wa-mawṭinan, wa-al-Ḥanafī madhhaban, wa-al-Māturīdī iʻtiqādan, dated 7 N (Shaʻbān (?) or Ramaḍān (?), of the year 1217 of the Hijrah (1802/1803).
On folios 50a-50b: Statements in Ottoman Turkish poetry and prose dating some births, on 8 Rabīʻ al-Thānī 1249 of the Hijrah (25 August 1833) and 9 Jumādá al-Ūlá 1252 (22 August 1836).
Colophon (folio 47b): "Katabahu al-faqīr al-Sayyid Muḥammad Shawqī min talāmīdh ʻUmar al-Waṣfī, Andarūn Humāyūn khānah-ʼi Sufralī. Sanat 1242."
Translation of the colophon: "Copied by the poor al-Sayyid Muḥammad Shawqī, of the students of ʻUmar al-Waṣfī, Andarūn Humāyūn khānah-ʼi Sufralī. Year 1242 [of the Hijrah = 1826/1827]."

record.title: 880-01 Alf laylah wa-laylah. Al-Kitāb 1 : manuscript.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Ḥukiya, wa-Allāh aʻlam fī ʻilm ghaybihi wa-aḥkam mimmā maḍá wa-taqaddam, fī aḥādīth al-umam, annahu kāna fī qadīm al-zamān wa-sālif al-ʻaṣr wa-al-awān malik kabīr al-shān, ṣāḥib junūd wa-aʻwān, wa-khadam wa-ghilmān, wa-kāna ismuhu al-Malik Shahrabān, wa-kāna la-hu zawjah dhāt ḥusn wa-jamāl, wa-qadd wa-iʻtidāl, thumma bahāʼ wa-kamāl, wa-kāna al-malik mashghūf bi-ḥubbihā, wa-qad sallamahā sāyir qiyādahu, wa-ḥakkamahā fī jamīʻ bilādih ..."
Secundo folio: bilādahu thumma innahu arsala khalfahu.
17 x 24 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 19.5; 19 lines per page.

Binding: In cream color thick paper cover, formerly for a map copybook for school children, on which is printed: "Kharīṭah daftarī. Yakhuṣṣu al-tilmīdh ----- Fī Madrasat ----- Fī al-ṣaff -----. Maḥall mabīʻihi fī "Maktabat al-Hilāl al-ʻUthmānī bi-al-Shām". Khāṣṣat Salīm al-Qaṣabātī," with geographic illustrations and maps of the Eastern and Western hemispheres.
Script: In large clear naskh script, in black ink on thick white paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords.
At the head of folio 1a: "Awwal kitāb min Alf laylah wa-laylah."
On the upper left corner of folio 1a: A partially legible statement, with the names of "Ṣābir al-Māzinī" and "Yaḥyá al-Marʻashlī" (probably a lender and borrower of the manuscript).
On folio 29a and 29b: A remnant of an unidentified tale, in a crude hand, in red.

Colophon: No colophon. The text ends as follows: "... Thumma innahu ṭalaʻa wa-idhā bi-al-shābb wāqif maʻa al-ṣayyād wa-al-wazīr wa-al-ʻaskar, fa-atá wa-sallama ʻalá al-shābb, wa-qāl: Atasīru maʻī ilá madīnatī wa-illá taqʻudu fī baladik. Fa-qāl taʻlam ayyuhā al-malik qaddaysh baynak wa-bayn madīnatik. Qāl: Masīrat yawm. Qāl: Iʻlam anna baynaka wa-bayn baladika sanah kāmilah. Fa-qāl: Naḥnu jīnā fī yawm. Fa-qāl: Iʻlam annahā kānat al-balad masḥūrah. Fa-qāl: laadrī. Wa-al-ān, tuqīmu hā hunā wa-illā tasīru maʻī. Qāl: Asīru maʻaka. Thumma innahu wallá wazīrahu ʻalá madīnat al-ghulām. Thumma innahu thār [sār], wa-lam yazāl sāyir ḥattá waṣala ilá madīnatihi, fa-ṭalaʻū ilá multaqāh, wa-dakhala bi-yawm ʻaẓīm. Thumma innahu saʼala al-ṣayyād hal la-hu banāt. Qāl: Bintayn. Fa-tazawwaja al-malik wāḥidah wa-al-ghulām wāḥidah. Wa-istaqarra al-ṣulṭān wa-al-shābb. Wa-ammā al-ṣayyād, fa-innahu ightaná ghināʼ kathīr, wa-ṣārū banātuhu zawjāt al-mulūk, wa-aqāmū ḥattá yaʼtīhim al-mawt."

record.title: U.S.S. Erie's requisitions for the pursers, surgeons, masters, gunners, boatswains, and carpenters : manuscript.
record.note: Title from cover.
One page has been removed from volume before acquisition by the library.
Binding: Paper wrappers.

record.title: Legal compendium : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Numbering: [64], 91, 101-184, [6, index] pages, with a few additional blanks.
Bound in contemporary blind-ruled sheep.

record.title: A inventory of the household goods & furniture of Christopher Jeffreson Esqr. deceased, late of Dullingham at his mansion house in Cambridgeshire, taken and appraised this 13 mo. March 1748/9 : manuscript.
record.note: Title from item.
11 unnumbered pages, with a few additional blanks; in original plain card wrapper.

record.title: 880-02 Dalāʼil al-khayrāt : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān al-Jazūlī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit (folio 1b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam taslīman. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā lil-īmān wa-al-islām, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Muḥammad Nabīyihi alladhī istanqadhanā bi-hi min ʻibādat al-awthān wa-al-aṣnām, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-nujabāʼ al-bararah al-kirām. Wa-baʻd hādhā, fa-al-gharaḍ fī hādhā al-kitāb dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam wa-faḍāʼilihā ..."
Secundo folio (Some leaves seem to be missing between folios 1 and 2): min (minhu, nuskhah) ʻalá shawqin minnī.
10.5 x 16.5 cm; written surface: 5.5 x 12 cm; 11 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather, with embossed central medallion and corner decorations in gold.

In beautiful naskh script, in black ink, on thick laid cream color paper; keywords in red; markings in red and gold; text fully vocalized and framed in gold; many collations on the margins; catchwords.

On the preliminary two leaves: Miscellaneous prayers in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish; text of "Dalāʼil al-khayrāt" is on folios 1b-89a; on folios 89b-91a "Duʻāʼ khatm Dalāʼil al-khayrāt" (An invocation to be read at the end of "Dalāʼil al-khayrāt"); on folios 91b-100b, miscellaneous prayers in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish, and miscellaneous quotations from the Qurʼān; at the end leaf, prayers in Arabic.
On the upper right margin of folio 1b: "al-Thābit fī al-nuskhah al-Sahlīyah wa-ghayrihā taqaddum lafẓ Muḥammad ʻalá lafẓ Nabīyihi, wa-yaqaʻa fī baʻḍihā bi-al-ʻakas ..."
On folios 2b-5b: A list of the names of the Prophet: "Asmāʼ Sayyidinā wa-Nabīyinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, miʼatān wa-wāḥid, wa-hiya hādhihi ..."
On folio 89a: A date 1173 of the Hijrah (1759/1760).

The text of "Dalāʼil al-khayrāt" ends on folio 89a with an invocation, as follows: "... Wa-nasʼaluka Allāhumma bi-nūr wajhika alladhī malaʼa arkān ʻarshika an tazraʻa fī qalbī maʻrifatika ḥattá aʻrifaka ḥaqqa maʻrifatika, kamā yanbaghī an tuʻrafa bi-hi. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khātim al-nabīyin wa-imām al-mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-Huwa ḥasbunā wa-niʻma al-wakīl."

Colophon (folio 99a): "Mashaqqat al-mudhnib al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá ibn al-Sayyid Ḥasan, ghafara Allāh [la-hu] wa-li-wādayhi [wa-li-wālidayhi], wa-li-jamīʻ al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, [raḥmat Allāh] ʻalayhim ajmaʻīn. Sanat 1173."

Translation of the colophon: "The endeavor of the sinner al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá ibn al-Sayyid Ḥasan, may God forgive him, his parents, and all believers, men and women, may God have mercy upon all of them. In the year 1173 [of the Hijrah = 1759/1760]."

record.title: 880-03 Tafsīr al-manāmāt : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Sīrīn al-Baṣrī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn ʻalá al-qawm al-kāfirīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Hādhā kitāb Ibn Sīrīn fī tafsīr al-manāmāt, wa-ʻibārāt tadullu ʻalá al-ruʼyā minhā. Min al-ʻibārāt qāla qāʼilun akhbirnī ʻan al-manāmāt wa-al-aḥlām, kayfa yarāhā al-insān al-nāʼim wa-huwa dhāhib al-ʻaql wa-al-ḥiss wa-al-fahm wa-al-samʻ wa-al-baṣar, wa-qad ʻudima dhālika kullahu bi-al-nawm, fa-kayfa yastayqinu shayʼan man lā yafhamu wa-lā yaʻqilu, wa-kayfa yumayyizu shayʼan min dhahāb ʻaqlihi wa-fahmihi wa-samʻihi wa-qūwatihi wa-ḥarakatih, ishraḥ lī dhālika wa-ʻarrifnī maʻnāh, wa-akhbirnī ʻan al-aḥlām, wa-ẓuhūr mā qad yurá minhā, wa-akhbirnī ʻan al-ruʼyā al-wāḥidah alladhī yarāhā al-rajulān, wa-akhbirnī ʻan aḥlām al-layl wa-al-nahār, wa-ayyihimā aqwá wa-aḥdaq [wa-aḥdhaq] ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-ʻaql wa-al-fahm lil-nafs wa-al-rūḥ.
15.5 x 21.7 cm; written surface: 13 x 18.5 cm; 24-30 lines per page.
Binding: In bluish black buckram with a flap (in 3 unnumbered quires). Cover embossed with central medallion and tooled with decorative design.
In fair large naskh script, in black ink, on laid cream color paper; headings and keywords in purple; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā 'Kitāb Ibn Sīrīn fī Tafsīr al-manāmāt' wa-ʻibārāt tadullu ʻalá ṣiḥḥat al-ruʼyā min ʻadam ṣiḥḥatihā, wa-huwa kurrāsayn wa-thalāthat waraqāt maktūbah lā ghayr."

On folio 1a: A reader's statement: "Wa-lā yaʻlamu al-ghayb illā Allāh subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, jalla shaʼnuhu. Wa-ammā qawl Ibn Sīrīn huwa ʻalá wajh al-taqrīb min nawʻ al-firāsah wa-al-munāsabah li-ḥāl al-rāʼī."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Dakhala hādhā fī ḥiyāzat Muḥammad Amīn ibn al-marḥūm al-Ḥājj Mūsá Afandī khādim al-ʻilm al-sharīf wa-khalīfat al-ṭarīqah al-Qādirīyah, wa-huwa min sulālat Sayyidī Abī Ayyūb al-Anṣārī ṣaḥābī Sayyid al-Awwalīn wa-al-Ākhirīn, Sayyidinā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-azwājihi wa-dhurrīyatihi wa-man tanāsalā [tanāsala] minhum ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Āmīn."
The year of copying in the colophon was erroneously altered, to appear earlier, from "1259" (20 May 1843) to "1159" (12 May 1746) in numerals and in letters. The original date appears to be correct.
Folios 32-34 are blank; text folios 1b-31b.

The text of "Tafsīr al-manāmāt" ends as follows: "... Wa-hādhā mā wajadnāhu min 'Kitāb Tafsīr al-manāmāt' ʻan Ibn Sīrīn, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu wa-arḍāh wājaʻala [wa-jaʻala] al-Jannah munqalabahu wa-mathwāh, wa-ghafara lanā wa-li-wālidaynā wa-li-wālidayhi wa-mashāyikhinā wa-mashāyikhihi wa-wālidayhim wa-al-Muslimīn. Wa-nasʼalu Allāh taʻālá lanā wa-li-wālidaynā wa-li-ikhwāninā wa-ahlīnā wa-al-Muslimīn al-ʻāfiyah wa-al-amn wa-al-naẓar ilá wajhihi al-karīm bi-jāh Sayyid al-Mursalīn Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Allāhumma ṣalli wa-sallim wa-bārik ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Subḥāna Rabbika Rabbi al-ʻIzzati ʻammā yaṣifūn, wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak, 20 Rabīʻ Ākhir, sanat 1259 [changed to 1159], tisʻah wa-khamsīn wa-miʼatayn [changed to wa-miʼah] wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl."

Translation of the colophon: "This copy was completed on blessed Saturday, 20 Rabīʻ Ākhir, of the year 1259 [changed to 1159], one thousand two [changed to one] hundred and fifty-nine of the Hijrah of the Prophet [20 May 1843, changed to 12 May 1746], may the best prayer and peace be upon Him. Praise be to God in all circumstances."

record.title: 880-01 Ḥadīth : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Bāb Ḥadīth al-Ifk. Wa-al-ifk bi-manzilat al-najs wa-al-najas. Yuqālu ifkuhum, wa-ufkuhum, wa-afkuhum. Wa-man qāla afakahum yaqūlu ṣarafahum ʻan al-īmān wa-kadhdhabahum, kamā qāla yuʼfaku ʻanhu min ufika, yuṣrafu ʻanhu min ṣurifa. Ḥaddathanā ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz ibn ʻAbd Allāh, ḥaddathanā Ibrāhīm ibn Saʻd, ʻan Ṣāliḥ, ʻan Ibn Shihāb, ḥaddathanī ʻUrwah ibn al-Zubayr wa-Saʻīd ibn al-Musayyab wa-ʻAlqamah ibn Waqqāṣ wa-ʻUbayd Allāh ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUtbah ibn Masʻūd, ʻan ʻĀʼishah zawj al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, ḥīna qāla lahā ahl al-ifk mā qālū ..."
Secundo folio: aqraʻa bayna azwājih wa-ayyuhunna kharaja sahmuhā kharaja bihā.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 9 x 15.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather with flap (in 54 numbered quires), cover and flap embossed with central medallion.
In good clear naskh script, in black ink, on laid cream color paper; headings in red; some notes and collations on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with "al-Juzʼ al-thālith" (Part three), as follows: "... Bāb 'Idhā tathāʼaba fa-li-yaḍaʻ yadahu ʻalá fīhi'. Ḥaddathanā ʻĀṣim ibn ʻAlī, ḥaddathanā Ibn Abī Dīb, ʻan Saʻīd al-Maqbarī, ʻan abīhi, ʻan Abī Hurayrah, ʻan al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, qāl: Inna Allāh yuḥibbu al-ʻuṭās wa-yakrahu al-tathāʼub, fa-idhā ʻaṭasa aḥadukum wa-ḥamada Allāh kāna ḥaqqan ʻalá kull Muslim samaʻahu yaqūlu la-hu yarḥamuka Allāh. Wa-ammā al-tathāʼub fa-innamā huwa min al-Shayṭān. Fa-idhā tathāʼaba aḥadukum fa-li-yaruddahu mā istaṭāʻ, fa-inna aḥadakum idhā tathāʼaba ḍaḥika minhu al-Shayṭān. Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Tamma al-Juzʼ al-thālith bi-ḥamd Allāh."

record.title: 880-01 Kitāb al-buyūʻ : manuscript.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Kitāb al-buyūʻ. Wa-qawl Allāh ʻazza wa-jall: Wa-aḥalla Allāh al-bayʻ wa-ḥarrama al-ribā, wa-qawluhu: Illā an takūna tijāratun ḥāḍirah tudīrūnahā baynakaum. Bāb mā jāʼa fī qawl Allāh taʻālá: Fa-idhā quḍiyat al-ṣalāh fa-intashirū fī al-arḍi wa-ibtaghū min faḍli Allāhi wa-udhkurū Allāha kathīran laʻallakum tufliḥūn. Wa-idhā raʼaw tijāratan aw lahwan inqaḍḍū ilayhā wa-tarakūka qāʼiman. Qul mā ʻinda Allāh khayrun min al-lahw wa-min al-tijārah wa-Allāh khayru al-rāziqīn. Wa-qawluhu: Lā taʼkulū amwālakum baynakum bi-al-bāṭil illā an takūna tijāratun ʻan tarāḍin minkum ..."
Secundo folio: ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam.
18 x 25 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 15 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; black cloth on spine.
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on thick white paper; headings in red many commentaries on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "Bāb bayʻ al-walāʼ wa-hibatihi. Ḥaddathanā Abū al-Walīd, Ḥaddathanā Shuʻbah, qāl akhbaranī ʻAbd Allāh [ibn] Dīnār, qāl samiʻtu Ibn ʻUmar, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhumā, yaqūlu: Nahá Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, ʻan bayʻ al-walāʼ wa-ʻan hibatihi, ḥaddathanā ..."

record.title: 880-01 Sīrat Muḥammad al-Kurdī. Al-Juzʼ 2 : manuscript.
record.note: Title from the label pasted on the front cover.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The text continues from the end of part one, as follows: "... libnah min fiḍḍah wa-libnah min dhahab, wa-yakūn ʻalá miqdār mīl fī al-baḥr, wa-yakūn jisr min al-qaṣr ilá qaṣrī, wa-yakūn ḥawl al-jisr min al-yamīn wa-min al-shamāl maghrūs fawākih bi-ghayr awānihā, fa-in ʻamila mā qulta ʻanhu, fa-iʻlam innaka mā taqdur ʻalayh, wa-law annaka amartahu wa-mā ʻamila fa-innaka taqduru ʻalayhi wa-taqtuluhu. Fa-qāl: Hādhā huwa al-raʼy, fa-aṣbaḥa min al-ṣubḥ arsala warāʼahu. Fa-baynamā Muḥammad jālis, wa-idhā bi-al-ghilmān dākhilīn ʻalayhi, wa-qālū la-hu: al-Malik yaṭlubuka. Wa-kāna al-wazīr mushīr tilka al-laylah arsala ilayhi kitāb yuʻlimuhu bimā ḍāmir ʻalayhi al-malik, wa-qāla la-hu: In kunt maʻak ʻazm ibnīh, wa-illā in tahāwant qutilt, wa-al-salām ..."
Secundo folio: li-annahu mā raʼá shayʼ mimmā ṭalab.
15 x 19.7 cm; written surface: 12 x 18 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; dark brown leather on spine.
In clear fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; catchwords.
On the label pasted to the front cover: "al-Juzʼ al-thānī min Sīrat Muḥammad al-Kurdī."
Inside the front cover: "Juzʼ thānī, wa-bi-hi intahá. Tābiʻ kitāb al-awwal min Sīrat Muḥammad al-Kurdī."

Inside the front cover: An ownership statement: "Bi-ism kātibihi Qusṭanṭīn Niqūlā Māridī, fī 11 Tishrīn 1 [October], sanat 1838, fī 26 Shawwāl 1295 [The Hijrī date does not correspond to the Milādī date]."
The last leaf is replaced in a different hand in bluish color paper.
To the left of the colophon: An ownership statement: "Dakhala fī milk ... Qusṭanṭīn ... ... sanat 1296." And an illegible circular stamp.

Inside the back cover: Two owhnership statements, as follows: 1. "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammal maʻāniyahu al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr ilá Rabbihi al-Qadīr al-Ḥājj Muḥammad al-Aghawānī, kātib al-khutūmah, fī 25 Rabiʻ Thānī, sanat 99 [1299 of the Hijrah = 16 March 1882]." 2. "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammal maʻāniyahu al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-Karīm Muḥammad Riḍā al-Bābā, fī ghurrat Ṣafar, sanat 1307 [of the Hijrah = 27 September 1889]."

Part two of "Sīrat Muḥammad al-Kurdī" ends as follows: "... thumma al-Malik Ḥasan aqām malik wa-sulṭān, wa-akhawātuhu wuzarā ʻan yamīnihi wa-ʻan shamālihi, wa-ṣārah [ṣarat] jamīʻ bilād al-Ṣīn taḥmilu ilayhi al-māl wa-al-nawāl wa-al-kharāj, wa-aqāma fī arghad ʻaysh wa-ahnāh [wa-ahnā] bāl, wa-qad ṣār la-hu waqāyiʻ wa-ḥurūb wa-aḥwāl yaṭūlu sharḥuhā. Wa-lākin tammamnā hādhā al-juzʼ ilá hādhā al-makān. Wa-qad naqalat arbāb al-siyar anna mulūk al-Ṣīn lā tazāl min silsilat al-Malik Muḥammad al-Kurdī ibn Karkhān, wa-lā tazāl ilá an tattaṣil bi-Jalāl al-Dīn al-Ikhshīd, wa-yuqālu innahu min silsilat dhālika al-malik, wa-al-ʻilm ʻinda Allāh. Wa-nasʼalu Allāh taʻālá an lā yuwākhidhanā fīmā naṭaqat bi-hi alsinatunā min al-ziyādah wa-al-nuqṣān."
Colophon: "Wa-hādhā mā intahá ilaynā min hādhā al-kitāb."
Translation of the colophon: "This is what has reached us of this book."

record.title: 880-01 Ḥikāyat Fayrūz Shāh. Al-Juzʼ 2 : manuscript.
record.note: Title from the label pasted to the front cover.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing, text starts with: "... bi-alladhī kānū fātiḥīn dakākīnahum ṣārū yashkurū, fa-qāla al-khayyāṭ: Qum Yā Sayyidī wa-ghīb lak sāʻah ilá an yuʻaddī al-mawkib, ḥayth inna hādhā al-mawkib lā yarāh dhakar, wa-kull man qaṣada ruʼyāh qutil, wa-laysa la-hu shafāʻah, min ibn sabʻat sinīn ilá ibn miʼah sanah. Fa-qultu la-hu: Yā Sayyidī, innanī sahrān wa-mā numtu abadan, wa-ṭūl al-layl wa-anā māshī wa-mā dakhaltu ilá hādhihi al-baldah illā fī hādhā al-yawm wa-lā aʻrifu makān āwī ilayhi, fa-arjū min iḥsānik an tunʻimalī bi-al-manām fī hādhihi al-dukkān ..."
Secundo folio: tamāmihi, fa-ḍahaja al-sūq minhā.
15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 11 x 17.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark brown leather on spine and flap.
In large clear naskh script, in black ink, on thick white paper; catchwords.
On the label pasted to the front cover: "al-Juzw al-thānī min ... Ḥikāyat Fayrūz Shāh."
On the inserted slip card (in English and Arabic): "vol. 2 of Ḥikāyat Fīrūz Shāh."

On folio 1a: A reader's statement: "Qad naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu, wa-fī al-kitāb al-awwal wa-al-thālith, naẓara fīhim Yaḥyá Shihāb [?], fī 16 Jumādá al-Thānī, sanat 1313 [4 December 1895]."
On the end leaf: A reader's statement: "Qad naẓara fī al-kitāb al-awwal wa-al-thālith, naẓara fīhim al-Sayyid Ṣāliḥ al-Sawdā, fī 16 Jumādá al-Thānī, sanat 1311 [25 December 1893."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly, as follows: "... fa-lammā an shift dhālika al-shawfah Yā Amīr al-Muʼminīn, ṭār al-ʻaql min raʼsī, wa-qultu lahā: Yā malʻūnah, antī takrahī al-rijāl, wa-hādhā fiʻluki, fa-ṣārat tatalamlam wa-lā tatakallam, li-anna lisānahā inʻaqad, fa-ṭalaʻtu li-quddām Sabʻ al-Yaman wa-qultu la-hu: Kayf al-ʻamal bi-hāʼulāʼī, fa-qāla lī: Amruka, turīdu taqtuluhum jumlatan, am taqtulu al-ʻabīd ..."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Maqṣūrat Ibn Durayd : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan ibn Durayd.
record.note: 1. Title of Sharḥ Maqṣurat Ibn Durayd supplied by cataloger based on incipit and reference sources.
2. Title of al-Sawābigh fī sharḥ al-Nawābigh from folio 92.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Maqṣūrat Ibn Durayd": "Qaṣīdat Ibn Durayd mukhammasah bi-rasm khizānat Mawlānā al-Sulṭān al-Malik al-Muẓaffar, aʻazza Allāh naṣrahu. Maqṣūrat Abī Bakr ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan ibn Durayd al-Azdī. 1. Yā ẓabyatan ashbaha shayʼin bi-al-mahā // rātiʻatan bayna al-ʻAqīqi wa-al-Liwá. Wa-yurwá Sadīr. al-Mahā jamʻ mahāt, wa-hiya al-baqarah al-waḥshīyah, yushabbahu bihā wa-bi-al-ẓabyah al-maʻshūq, wa-al-Sadīr wa-al-Liwá mawḍʻān, wa-kaʼanna al-awwal maʼkhūdh min al-sidr, wa-al-thānī min liwá al-raml ..."
1. Secundo folio of Maqṣūrat Ibn Durayd: Amā tará raʼsiya ḥāká lawnuhu // ṭurrata ṣubḥin taḥta adhyāli al-dujā ..."

2. Incipit of "al-Sawābigh fī sharḥ al-Nawābigh: "Allāhumma inna mimmā manaḥtanī min al-niʻam al-sawābiʻ [al-sawābigh] ilhām hādhihi al-kalām [al-kalim] al-nawābigh. al-Ilahām huwa min qawlihim alhamahu Allāh al-khayr ilhāman, ay alqāhu fī rawʻihi, ay qalbihi, wa-huwa lā yakūnu illā min Allāh taʻ. H. Ka-annī ulqinu bihā Majallat Luqmān, wa-aṣifu bihā ḥikmat Āṣif Sulaymān. al-Talqīn al-tafhīm. Āṣif huwa Āṣif ibn Brakhyā, wa-kāna ḥakīman wazīran li-Sulaymān ..."
2. Secundo folio of "al-Sawābigh fī sharḥ al-Nawābigh: fa-hab lahā man yarghabu fī al-ādāb al-sanīyah al-Sunnīyah.
12.5 x 19 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 14.5 cm; 16-19 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; white paper on the spine and corners.
In stylistic naskh script, in black ink, on thick white paper; text on recto only (verso is blank); some notes in abbreviated Latin on the margins and interlinear; catchwords.

Maqṣūrat Ibn Durayd, starts with: "Yā ẓabyatan ashbaha shayʼin bi-al-mahā // rātiʻatan bayn al-ʻAqīqi fa-al-Liwá." It ends with: Aw an urá mukhtaḍiʻan li-nakbatin // aw li-ibtihājin faraḥan aw muzdahá."
On spine: "IBN DOREID ET ELNAWABIG"
On the flyleaf: "Qaṣīdat Ibn Durayd."
Folios 92-150 are numbered 1-59.
On folio 92: "Kitāb al-Sawābigh fī sharḥ al-Nawābigh lil-Zamakhsharī."
There are five blank leaves between folios 91 and 92, and 31 blank leaves after folio 150.

1. Colophon of "Maqṣūrat Ibn Durayd": "Tamma bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-faragha min taḥrīrihi al-ʻabd al-mudhnib al-muḥtāj ilá raḥmat Allāh, Maḥmūd ibn Muḥammad al-Qūnawī al-Kātib, fī al-thāmin ʻashar min Rajab, sanat ithnayn wa-sabʻīn wa-sittimiʼah."

1. Translation of the colophon of "Maqṣūrat Ibn Durayd": "It is completed by the help of God and His abundant benevolence. Copied by the sinner servant who is in need of the mercy of God, the Scribe Maḥmūd ibn Muḥammad al-Qūnawī, in the year 672 [of the Hijrah = 4 February 1274]."

2. Colophon of "al-Sawābigh fī sharḥ al-Nawābigh". No colophon. Text ends with: "... ṭahharta fāka bi-masāwīk lawlā annka najjastahu bi-masāwīk. al-Sharah ʻalá al-ṭaʻām min akhlāq al-ṭaghām. Aʻmāluka nīyah (nīʼah) in lam tunḍijhā nīyah. Lā taqaʻu al-aʻmāl sanīyah mā lam taqaʻ Sunnīyah. Ṭūbá li-man khātimatu ʻumrihi ka-fātiḥatihi, wa-laysat aʻmāluhu bi-fāḍiḥatihi."

record.title: 880-01 Risālah fiqhīyah : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with part of "Bāb kayfa yubāyiʻu al-imāma al-nās", as follows: "... ibn Abī Ḥusayn wa-Saʻīd ibn Ziyād, ʻan Abī Salamah, ʻan Abī Saʻīd, qawluhu wa-qāla ʻAbd Allāh ibn Abī Yaʻfar, ḥaddathanī Ṣafwān ʻan Abī Salamah, ʻan Abī Ayyūb, samiʻtu al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, Bāb Kayfa yubāyiʻu al-imāma al-nās. Ḥaddathanā Ismāʻīl, ḥaddathanī Mālik, ʻan Yaḥyá ibn Saʻīd, qāl akhbaranī ʻUbādah ibn al-Walīd, qāl akhbaranī abī ʻan ʻUbādah ibn al-Ṣāmit, qāl bāyaʻnā Rasūl Allāh ʻalá al-samʻ wa-al-ṭāʻah fī al-manshaṭ wa-al-makrah wa-an lā nunāziʻa al-amra ahlahu, wa-an naqūma, aw naqūla bi-al-ḥaqq, ḥaythu mā kunnā, lā nakhāfu fī Allāh lawmata lāʼim ..."
Secundo folio: ibn ʻAbd Allāh qāl bāyaʻtu Rasūl Allāh.
14 x 18 cm; written surface: 9 x 14 cm; 14 lines per page.
Binding: Cover torn off; remnant of dark brown leather on spine; codex wrapped in brown sheet of paper.

In good large naskh script, in black ink, on thick white paper; headings in red; text fully vocalized; few notes and corrections on the margins; some wormholes (mostly on the margins) with some loss of text; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with "Bāb 'Idhā aṣāb qawmun min rajul hal yuʻāqabūn, aw yuqtaṣṣu minhum kullihim', as follows: "... wa-qāla Mughīrah ibn Ḥakīm, ʻan arbaʻah qatalū ṣabīyan, fa-qāla ʻUmar mithlahu. Wa-aqāda Abū Bakr wa-ʻAlī wa-Ibn al-Zubayr wa-Suwayd ibn Muqrin min laṭmah, wa-aqād ʻUmar min ḍarbah bi-al-durrah, wa-aqāda ʻAlī min thalāthat aswāṭ, wa-iqtaṣṣa Shurayḥ min sawṭ wa-khumūsh. Ḥaddathanā Musaddid, ḥaddathanā Yaḥyá ʻan ..."

record.title: 880-01 Aḥādīth wa-āthār : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: Text starts with: "'Maṭl al-ghanī ẓulm' muttafaq ʻalayh min Ḥadīth Abī Hurayrah. Ḥadīth 'Kul mimmā yalīk' muttafaq ʻalayhi min Ḥadīth ʻUmar ibn Abī Salamah. Ḥadīth 'Idhā lam tastaḥī fa-iṣnaʻ mā shīt' al-Bukhārī min Ḥadīth Abī Masʻūd. Ḥadīth 'Lā tankaḥu al-marʼatu al-marʼah' Ibn Mājid min Ḥadīth Abī Hurayrah bi-sanad ḥasan ..."
Secundo folio: Ḥadīth rajm al-muḥṣin muttafaq ʻalayhi min Ḥadīth Abī Hurayrah.
12.5 x 16.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 13 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In black buckram.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on thick cream color paper; headings in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.

The text ends with "Āthār jamāʻah min al-Ṣaḥābah fī dhammihim lil-qiyās", as follows: "... wa-ʻanhu ayḍan 'Īyākum wa-araʼayta wa-araʼayt', fa-innamā halaka man kāna qablakum bi-'Araʼayta wa-araʼayt', wa-lā taqīsū shayʼan bi-shayʼ fa-tazilla qadamun baʻda thubūtihā, rawāhu al-Ṭabarānī bi-isnād munqaṭiʻ, wa-fīhimā Jābir al-Jaʻfī, wa-huwa ḍaʻīf, wa-ʻanhu ayḍan, yaḥduthu qawmun yaqīsūna al-umūra bi-raʼyihim fa-yanhadimu al-Islām wa-yuthlam, rawāhu al-Ṭabarānī wa-al-Bayhaqī fī al-Madkhal, wa-fīhi Mujālid ibn Saʻīd takallama fīhi. Wa-ʻan ʻAlī, law kāna al-dīn bi-al-raʼy la-kāna asfal al-khuff awlá bi-al-masḥ min aʻlāh, rawāhu Abū Dāwūd."

Colophon: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh awwalan wa-ākhiran. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. [Nasakhahā (?)] Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥasanī lil-Suyūṭī [could not be identified], li-arbaʻ layālin in baqīna min Shawwāl al-mubārak, sanat 212 [1212 of the Hijrah = 13 April 1798]. Ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-Wakīl." To the left of the colophon: "Balagha muqābalatan wa-taṣḥīḥan bi-al-aṣl."

Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God in the beginning and at the end. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and on his companions, and grant them peace. [Copied by (?)] Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥasanī, for al-Suyūṭī [could not be identified], four nights, if they were to remain, from blessed Shawwāl, of the year 212 [1212 of the Hijrah = 13 April 1798]. To the left of the colophon: "The collation and correction against the original is completed."

record.title: 880-01 Risālah fī ʻilm al-waḍʻ : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī dalla ʻalá wujūb wujūdihi istiḥālat al-dawr wa-imtināʻ taʼthīr al-athar al-lāḥiq fī muʼaththirihi al-sābiq, wa-iʻtarafa bi-hi buṭlān al-tasalsul al-mubarhan bi-burhān al-taṭbīq, wa-al-ṣalāt ʻalá man hadānā ṭarīqa al-sawāʼ wa-sawāʼ al-ṭarīq, wa-al-salām ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi azimmat al-taḥqīq. Wa-baʻd, fa-naqūlu: ʻIlm al-waḍʻ uṣūl bāḥithah ʻan aḥwāl al-lafẓ min ḥaythu al-waḍʻ; fa-mawḍūʻuhu al-lafẓ min ḥaythu al-waḍʻ, wa-ghāyatuhu maʻrifat al-waḍʻ. Fa-al-waḍʻ lughatan jaʻl al-shayʼ fī ḥayyiz, wa-ʻurfan taʻyīn al-lafẓ bi-adāʼ al-maʻná li-yadulla ʻalayhi bi-nafsihi aw bi-al-qarīnah ..."
Secundo folio: al-taṭbīq wa-al-ṣalāt ʻalá man hadānā.
12.5 x 18.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 8.5 cm; 5-10 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard cover which seems to have been a printed cover for a map book, with colored cloth (in red, blue, and green) on spine.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; few corrections on the margins; no comments; no catchwords.
The pages of the manuscripts are also numbered in East Arabic (Indian numerals) 1-42.
On the label pasted to the front cover: "Yāzmah bināʼ."
On folio 22a: Seven verses of Persian poetry, attributed to Jāmī (1414-1492), written in a different hand, in red: "Abyāt Mawlānā Jāmī, quddisa sirruhu al-sāmī."
On folio 22b: Two quotations, the first, on grammar (in Ottoman Turkish), the second on semantics (in Arabic), about the different meanings of the verb "Qāla" (to say).
Inside the back cover: Two dates: "22 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat 326" (1326 of the Hijrah = 24 April 1908); 31 Māris sanat 325 (i.e., 16 Ṣafar 1325 of the Hijrah = 31 March 1907).

The text ends as follows: "... Aṭbaqa al-bulaghāʼ ʻalá anna al-majāz wa-al-kināyah ablagh min al-ḥaqīqah wa-al-taṣrīḥ, li-anna al-intiqāl fīhimā min al-mulzam ilá al-lāzim fa-huwa ka-daʻwá unishiʼa bi-bayyinah, wa-al-taʻrīḍ lafẓ murakkab urīda bi-hi maʻnāhu al-waḍʻī ḥaqīqatan aw majāzan aw kināyatan, wa-ushīra bi-hi ilá maʻnan ākhar, ka-qawlika liman yuʼdhīka 'Ādhaytanī, fa-sa-taʻrifu jazāʼ al-īdhāʼ', wa-anta turīdu al-mukhāṭaba wa-ghayrahu, lākinna al-mukhāṭab murādun min nafs al-lafẓ, wa-ghayrahu min sawqihi wa-khārij al-kalām."
Colophon: "Tammat. Ḥarrarahu al-ḥaqīr al-faqīr ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz li-ajl akhīhi al-ladhīdh, aʻnī bi-hi Munlā Yūsuf Afandī. Allāhuma ighfir lahumā wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."
Translation of the colophon: "It is completed. Copied by the wretched and poor ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz for his delightful brother, I mean Munlā Yūsuf Afandī. O God. Forgive both and all Muslims. Amen."

record.title: 880-01 Khabar Kalʻād al-Malik maʻa wazīrihi Shīmās : manuscript.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: Bismillāh al-Ḥayy al-Azalī al-Sarmadī, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīnu wa-naktubu 'Khabar Kalʻād al-Malik maʻa wizīrihi Shīmās'. Qīla kāna fī arḍ al-Hind malikan yuqālu la-hu Kalʻād, wa-kāna fī mamlakatihi ithnayn wa-sabʻīn malikan, jamīʻuhum taḥta yadihi, wa-thalāth miʼah wa-sittīn qāḍiyan, wa-kāna la-hu sabʻīn wazīr, ʻalá kull ʻasharah minhum rayyisan, wa-kāna muqaddamuhum rajul yuqālu la-hu Shīmās, wa-kāna ʻumruhu ithnayn wa-ʻishrīn sanah, wa-kāna al-Malik Kalʻād qad basaṭa fī ahl mamlakatihi al-ʻadl wa-al-iḥsān wa-al-takhfīf fī kharājihim, wa-al-taʻāhud li-kabīrihim wa-ṣghīrihim mā lam yafʻalhu malik ākhar qablahu, wa-maʻa hādhā lam yakun la-hu waladan ..."
Secundo folio: al-ghulām wa-ayqaḍa Shīmās wa-qāla la-hu.
15.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 11 x 15 cm; 17-19 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather; cover embossed with central medallion and corner designs.
In clear large clear naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings in red; catchwords.
The pages of the manuscript are also numbered (1-141) in East Arabic (Indian) numerals.

Colophon: No colophon. Part of leaf 71 is cut off at the bottom and some parts of the last lines are missing. Text ends as follows: "... wa-kull mā māt minhum [al-nisāʼ] wāḥidah tatimmu fī al-sijn ḥattá yamūtū kulluhum wa-yabātū fī ḍīq dhālika al-sijn, wa-natan baʻẓihim yakfī baʻẓ, wa-taslamu anta min madhammatihim wa-damihim, li-an hādhā al-raʼy ʻindī, wa-huwa jará minhum. Wa-qad qīl: 'Man iḥtafara bīran wa-lam yattaqī nawāyib al-dahr yaqaʻu fīhi'. Wa-in al-Malik [... ... ...] al-wazīr wa-zāda fī martabatihi [... ... ...] al-nisāʼ wa-dakhkhalūhum ilá [... ... ...] kull yawm shayʼ yasīr min al-ṭaʻām [... ... ...]. Wa-ammā al-nisāʼ fa-ḥazinū [... ...] wa-tanaddamū ḥaythu lam yanfaʻ al-nadāmah, wa-akhadhū jazāhum fī dhālika al-sijn dhī al-ʻiqāb al-karīh wa-al-natan wa-al-rāyiḥah. Wa-lam zālū yamūtū nās baʻd nās ilá an halakū jamīʻan fī dhālika al-ḥabs bi-ayyām qalāyil. Wa-shāʻa al-khabar fī mawāḍiʻan shattā. Wa-hādhā mā intahā ilaynā min hādhā al-khabar bi-al-tamām wa-lillāh al-ḥamd ʻalá al-dawām."

record.title: 880-02 Taʻlīq al-fawāḍil ʻalá Iʻrāb al-ʻAwāmil : manuscript / Ḥusayn ibn Aḥmad Zaynīʹzādah.
record.note: Title from reference sources and information from the incipit (folio 1b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alldhī rafaʻa al-samāwāt bilā ʻimād, wa-khafaḍa al-arḍ, wa-naṣaba al-jibāl li-intifāʼ [li-intifāʻ] al-ʻibād, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá man lam yuʻrib al-waṣṣāfūn kāffata kamālātihi, lil-ʻajz ʻammā fīhi min afʻālihi wa-maʻmūlātih, wa-ʻalá ālihi alladhīna ʻamilū bi-aḥkāmihi, wa-aṣḥābihi alladhīna jazamū bi-ṣiḥḥat kalāmih. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-rājī min Rabbihi al-ḥusná wa-al-ziyādah, Ḥusayn ibn Aḥmad al-shahīr bi-Zaynī Zādah: Qad kuntu aʻrabtu al-ʻAwāmil al-jadīd bi-iltimās baʻḍ khullaṣ abnāʼ al-zamān wa-ilḥāʼih [wa-ilḥāḥih], baʻda al-himmah naḥwa ikhtiṣārih, maʻa al-ziyādah fī fawāʼidihi, fa-ajabtu masʼūlahum, al-bashar [?] wa-innamā huwa shaʼn khāliq al-qadar, wa-sammaytuhu bi-'Taʻalluq al-ghawwāṣ [Taʻlīq al-fawāḍil] ʻalá Iʻrāb al-ʻAwāmil', wa-min sakhāʼihi al-iʻānah, wa-ilayhi al-zulfá, wa-Hwa ḥasb man tawakkala ʻalayhi, wa-kafá ..."
Secundo folio: wa-taʻālá fiʻl māḍin mabnī ʻalá al-fatḥ taqdīran.
12.5 x 19 cm; written surface: 6.8 x 12.7 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; cover embossed with central medallion and corner decorations; flap embossed with central medallion.
In clear naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on white laid paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; text framed in red; catchwords.

On folio 73a: "Taqrīḍāt [Taqrīẓāt]" (Laudation/Praise) for the book and its author by "Muḥammad Afandī al-Kadūsī" (could not be identified), written by "Ṣidqī Zādah Aḥmad Rustah, al-Qāḍī bi-ʻAskar Rūm Īlī" (could not be identified), dated 10 Muḥarram of the year 1234 of the Hijrah (7 January 1819).

Author's colophon: "Hādhā ākhir mā awradnāhu min al-iʻrāb ʻalá 'ʻAwāmil' al-Shaykh al-kāmil al-murshid ilá al-ṣawāb, iʻānatan li-ṭalabah [lil-ṭalabah] al-kirām, bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-ʻAllām. Wa-al-marjū min al-ikhwān, min dhawī al-ʻirfān, iṣlāḥ <iṣlāḥ> mā yaqbalu al-iṣlāḥ, ibtighāʼa jazāʼ al-ḥamd ʻalá al-ṣalāḥ, wa-lā tubādir ilá al-takhṭiʼah fīmā hunālik li-tukhṭiʼa ibn ukht khālatika. Allāhumma ijʻal [ijʻalhu] khāliṣan li-wajhika al-karīm wa-sababan li-jazīl al-thawāb, yawma lā yanfaʻu mālun wa-lā banūn, illā man atá ilá Allāh bi-qalbin salīm, wa-ṣalli ʻalá Muḥammad alladhī la-hu al-shafāʻah al-kubrá Yawma al-Ḥisāb, wa-ālihi alladhīna yatbaʻūnahu fī sabīl al-ṣawāb. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá dhālika al-karam al-ʻuẓām kulla ḥīnin ilá yawm al-kirām. M."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This is the end of what we have introduced about the parsing of 'ʻal-ʻAwāmil' of the perfect Shaykh, the guide to the right path, to help the honorable students, by the assistance of the All-Knowing King. It is hoped from the discerning brothers, to correct what needs to be corrected, so that they attain the praise of doing what is correct. I request that you do not rush to err me in what was introduced herein, as you do with the son of the sister of your maternal aunt. O God, make it pure for the sake of Your honorable face, and a reason for the great reward, on the day when neither wealth nor children will be useful, except for he who comes to God with a sound heart. Bless Muhammad, who has the greatest intercession on the Day of Judgment, and his family who follow him in the path of righteousness. Praise be to God for that great generosity every time until the Day of Honor comes. M."

Copyist's colophon: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb li-itmām hādhā al-kitāb, ʻan yad aḍʻaf al-ʻibād wa-askhaf al-kutāb, al-marghūb wa-al-mutadāwal bayna al-ṭullāb, Ḥāfiẓ Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr al-Tarāwanīkī, al-maʻdūd min al-ṭullāb, ḥāmidan wa-muṣallīyan li-tawfīq tanmīq thānī hādhā al-kitāb, fī waqt al-ḍuḥá, min yawm al-thālith, min shahr Rabīʻ al-Ūlá, [alladhī] wulida fīhi khayr khalq al-Wahhāb, baʻd muḍī sanat sittah wa-tisʻīn wa-miʼah wa-alf, min Hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf wa-ḥusn al-maʼāb. Tamm."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "Praise be to God, the Abundant Giving King, for the completion of this desirable and popular book among students, by the hand of the weakest servant and the most feeble-minded of the scribes, Ḥāfiẓ Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr al-Tarāwanīkī, counted amongst students, praising and praying, for having the good fortune to complete the second copy of this book, on the morning of the third day of of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, the month in which the Best of the Creatures of the Abundant Giving was born, of the year 1196 of the Hijrah [16 February 1782] of Him to whom belongs glory, honor, and the best return. It is completed."

record.title: 880-01 Suwar min al-Qurʼān al-Karīm : manuscript.

record.title: 880-03 al-Shifā fī taʻrīf ḥuqūq al-Muṣṭafá : manuscript / ʻIyāḍ ibn Mūsá ibn ʻIyāḍ al-Yaḥṣubī.
record.note: Title from reference sources and folio 249b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Shifā Sharīf. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Faqīh al-Qāḍī al-Imām Abū al-Faḍl ʻIyāḍ ibn Mūsá ibn ʻIyāḍ al-Yaḥṣubī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-munfarid bi-ismihi al-asmá, al-mukhtaṣṣ bi-al-mulk al-aʻazz al-aḥmá, alladhī laysa dūnahu muntahá, wa-lā warāʼahu marmá, al-ẓāhir lā takhayyulan wa-lā wahman, wa-al-bāṭinu lā taqaddusan wa-lā ʻudmā, waḍaʻa kulla shayʼin <shayʼin> raḥmatan wa-ʻilman, wa-asbagha ʻalá awliyāʼihi niʻaman ʻumman, wa-baʻatha fīhim rasūlan min anfusihim anfasahum ʻUrban wa-ʻUjman, wa-azkāhum maḥtidan wa-manmá, wa-arjaḥahum ʻaqlan wa-ḥilaman, wa-awfarahum ʻilman wa-fahman, wa-aqwāhum yaqīnan wa-ʻazman ..."
Secundo folio: maghnam al-saʻādah qisman.
13.8 x 21.3 cm; written surface: 6-8.5 x 13.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; gold central medallion and decorative design embossed on cover and flap.

In good medium naskh script, in black ink, on white laid paper; headings in red; some commentaries on the margins; text framed in red; a decorative design at the head of folio 1b; folios 1b and 2a within an elaborate design in gold, red, and black; catchwords.
On the upper and lower sides: "Shifā Sharīf".

On folio 1a: A statement by a son (probably a grandson) of the author, dated 1284 of the Hijrah (1867/1868), as follows: "Bā khaṭṭ al-ʻAllāmah al-fāḍil wa-mudaqqiq al-kāmil, aʻnī bi-hi al-Sayyid ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Quyūjāqī. Wa-anā ibnuhu al-faqīr al-Sayyid Muḥammad ʻAbbās [?], ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-al-aqrabīn. Āmīn. Bi-ḥurmat Sayyid al-Mursalīn [...]. Sanat 1284 [1867/1868]." A stamp, and a washed out stamement and a stamp (both in red).

Colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb, al-Shifā bi-taʻrīf ḥuqūq al-Muṣṭafá, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-shurafāʼ, mā bazagha najmun wa-khafā, <wa-sallam>. Tamma al-Shifā min yad muḥarririhi. Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min taswīd hādhā al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb, yawm al-Arbaʻah, fī awākhir Jumād al-Akhīr, sanat wāḥid wa-tisʻīn wa-miʼah wa-alf."

Translation of the colophon: "Completed is the book of al-Shifā bi-taʻrīf ḥuqūq al-Muṣṭafá, God bless Him and grant Him peace, with His family and noble companions, as long as a star rises and disappears. al-Shifā is completed by the hand of its copyist. The copy of this book was completed by the help of God, the Abundant Giving King, on Wednesday, the end of Jumād al-Akhīr of the year 1191 [of the Hijrah = 30 July 1777]."

On folio 250a a stetment by the copyist, as follows: "... Hādhā rajāʼ ʻabdika al-mudhnib, Sayyid ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Sayyid Walī al-Dīn, min bilād Aydin, irḥamhumā wa-ighfirhumā, innaka arḥam al-rāḥimīn, wa-ṣalli ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn. Fī 24 J 1, sanat 1191."

Translation of the statement of the copyist on folio 250a: "... This is the hope of Your servant, the sinner Sayyid ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Sayyid Walī al-Dīn, from the region of Aydin, have mercy upon them and forgive them, and pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions. On the 24th of J 1 [probably Jumādá al-Thāniyah] of the year 1191 [of the Hijrah = 30 July 1777]."

At the end of folio 250a: a statement by "Muḥammad ʻĀṭif", a son of the author, as follows: "Katab hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah Mawlá al-wālid, al-muḥaqqiq wa-fāḍil al-mudaqqiq, ʻallāmah zamānih, wa-fakhāmat awānihi, waḥīd dahrih wa-farīd ʻaṣrih, al-mushtahir fī al-āfāq bi-al-faḍl wa-al-kamāl wa-al-taqwá bi-al-ittifāq, wa-huwa al-Sayyid ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Sayyid Walī al-Dīn al-Quyūjāqī, min bilād Liwāʼ al-Aydīn. Māt Mawlá al-marḥūm fī madīnat Izmīr, ḥīna qāḍiyan fīhi, fī shahr Ramaḍān al-mubārak, sanat sabʻah wa-miʼatayn wa-alf. Nashar Mawlá al-marḥūm min ʻulūm kathīran, arbaʻīn, bi-baldat al-Qusṭanṭinīyah. Wa-anā ibnuhu al-faqīr al-Sayyid Muḥammad ʻĀṭif, al-mudarris bi-Dār al-Khilāfah al-ʻalīyah al-maḥmīyah, ḥamāhu ʻan al-āfāt wa-al-balīyah. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

Translation of the statement at the end of folio 250a by "Muḥammad ʻĀṭif", a son of the author: "This honorable copy was written by the Mawlá, my father, the meticulous and accurate master, the scholar of his time, and the eminence of his era, the only one of his age, and the unique of his period, the famous in the horizons by consensus, for his virtue, perfection, and piety, al-Sayyid ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn al-Sayyid Walī al-Dīn al-Quyūjāqī, from the lands of the Province of Aydīn. The late Mawlá died in the city of Izmīr, when he was a judge there, in the blessed month of Ramaḍān, in the year 1207 [of the Hijrah = April/May 1793]. The Mawlá published in many sciences, numbering forty, in the city of Constantinople. And I, his son, the poor Sayyid Muḥammad ʻĀṭif, the teacher in the protected Sublime Abode of the Caliphate, may it be guarded from harms and calamities. It is completed. It is completed. It is completed."

record.title: 880-01 Awrād wa-ashʻār Ṣūfīyah : manuscript.
record.note: Title of the codex supplied by cataloger.
1. Title of the first poem "al-Burdah" of al-Būṣīrī from reference sources.
2. Title of the second poem "Badʼ al-amālī" of al-Ūshī from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of the first poem: "al-Faṣl al-awwal fī al-taghazzul". Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Amin tadhakkuri jīrānin bi-Dhī Salamin // mazajta damʻan jará min muqltain bi-dami. Am habbati al-rīḥu min tilqāʼi Kāẓimatin // wa-awmaḍa al-barqu fī al-ẓalmāʼi min Iḍami ..."
1. Secundo folio of the first poem: wa-awmaḍa al-barqu fī al-ẓalmāʼi min Iḍami.

2. Incipit of the second poem (folio 39b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yaqūlu al-ʻabdu fī badʼi al-amālī // li-tawḥīdin bi-naẓmin ka-al-laʼālī. Ilāhu al-khalqi Mawlānā qadīmun // wa-mawṣūfun bi-awṣāfi al-kamāli. Huwa al-ḥayyu al-mudabbiru kulla amrin // Huwa al-Ḥaqqu al-muqaddiru dhū al-jalāli ..."
2. Secundo folio of the second poem: "Murīdu al-khayri wa-al-sharri al-qabīḥi // wa-lākin laysa yarḍá bi-al-muḥāli.
11.5 x 17.5 cm; written surface: 6 x 12.2 cm; 5 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion.
In good calligraphic naskh script, in black ink, on laid cream color paper; text framed in gold; markings in gold; catchwords.
On folio 1a: An invocation in Arabic; a description of the meter of the first poem in Ottoman Turkish; a date "sanat 1289" (year 1289 of the Hijrah = 1872/1873); and five illegible stamps.
At the head of folio 1b: A decorative design in gold, red, and blue.
On the upper right margin of folio 1b: "Wird yawm al-Jumʻah" (An invocation for Friday), and a stamp of "al-Sayyid Ḥasan".
At the left margin of folio 6a: "Wird yawm al-Sabt".
On the right margin of folio 10b: "Wird yawm al-Aḥad".
On the left margin of folio 15a: "Wird yawm al-Ithnayn."
On the right margin of folio 18b: "al-Faṣl al-khāmis fī dhikr barakat al-duʻāʼ."
On the right margin of folio 19b: "Wird yawm al-Thalāthah."
On the right margin of folio 22b: "al-Faṣl al-sābiʻ fī dhikr asrār miʻrāj al-Nabī."
On the left margin of folio 24a: "Wird yawm Arbaʻ."
On the left margin of folio 29a: "Wird yawm al-Khāmis."
On the right margin of folio 29a: "al-Faṣl al-tāsiʻ fī al-istighfār wa-al-istighnāʼ."
On the lower right margin of folio 33b: Two verses of poetry in Ottoman Turkish.
Folio 35a is blank.

On folio 34b: An "Ijāzah" (certificate of authorization to transmit the poem) given by al-Sayyid Muḥammad al-Qayṣarī to Muṣṭafá ibn al-Ḥājj Ḥasan, as follows: "Fa-lammā istajāza minnī akhī al-labīb Muṣṭafá ibn al-Ḥājj Ḥasan, aḥsana Allāh ḥālahu, wa-kabbara Allāh mālahu wa-awlādahu, wa-anā al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-Sayyid Muḥammad al-Qayṣarī, al-maʼdhūn min al-ʻālim al-fāḍil al-kāmil al-mudaqqiq, al-mushtahir bayna al-ṭullāb, Baṣāyirī ʻAbd Allāh Afandī Zādah, shakara Allāh masāyiʻahu [masāʻiyahu], wa-nāla mazādahu [murādahu], wa-jaʻala al-Jannata maskanahu. Āmīn. Tamm. Tamm. Āmīn. M.M."

On folio 35b: Four verses of a laudatory poem, praising the Prophet, his family, his companions, and his followers, as follows: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yā Rabbi ṣalli ʻalá al-Mukhtāri min Muḍarin // wa-al-anbiyā wa-jamīʻ al-rusli mā dhukirū. Wa-ṣalli Rabbi ʻalá al-Hādī wa-shīʻatihi // wa-ṣaḥbihi man li-ṭayyi al-dīni qad nasharū. Wa-jāhadū maʻahu fī Allāhi wa-ijtahadū // wa-hājarū wa-la-hu āwaw wa-qad naṣarū. Wa-bayyanū al-farḍa wa-al-masnūna wa-iʻtaṣamū // billāhi wa-iḥtasabū lillāhi wa-intaṣarū."
Folios 36a-37a are blank.
On folio 37b: An invocation in four verses in Ottoman Turkish and a statement on the right margin also in Ottoman Turkish, dated "fī 5 B [Rajab (?)], sanat 1214" (3 December 1799).
On folio 38a: An invocation in four lines (in red) in Arabic.
folio 38b is blank.
On folio 39a: A statement describing the meter of the second poem: "Hādhihi al-qaṣīdah min baḥr al-wāfir mufāʻalatun mufāʻalatun faʻūlun."

1. The first poem ends with: "... Waʼdhan li-suḥbi ṣalātin minka dāʼimatan // ʻalá al-Nabīyi bi-munhallin wa-munsajimi. Wa-al-āli wa-al-ṣuḥbi wa-al-tābiʻīna lahum // ahli al-tuqá wa-al-nuqá wa-al-ḥilmi wa-al-karami. Mā rannaḥat ʻadhabāti al-bāni rīḥu ṣabā // wa-aṭraba al-ʻīsa ḥādī al-ʻīsi bi-al-naghami."

1. Colophon of the first poem (folio 34a): "Katabahu al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr Ḥusayn al-Sirrī Afandī ibn Muḥammad, bi-Siliwrī, ghufira lahumā, wa-li-ustādhinā, wa-li-man naẓara ilayhi, wa-lil-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, bi-raḥmatika Yā Arḥama al-Rāḥimīn. Tārīkh sanat 48. Tammat. M.M.M."

1. Translation of the colophon of the first poem: "Copied by the wretched poor, who admits his incapacity and insufficiency, Ḥusayn al-Sirrī Afandī ibn Muḥammad, in Silivri, may both be forgiven, our teacher, he who looks into it, and the believers, men and women, by Your mercy, You the Most Merciful. Dated in the year 48 [probably 1148 of the Hijrah = 1735/1736]. It is completed. M.M.M."

2. The second poem ends with: "... Wa-innī al-dahra adʻū kunha wusʻī // li-man bi-al-khayri yawman qad daʻāli [daʻā lī]. Wa-inna al-Ḥaqqa adʻū kulla waqtin // li-man bi-al-khayri yawman qad daʻāli [daʻā lī]. Tammat al-qaṣīdah."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Marāḥ al-arwāḥ : manuscript / Shams al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd Allāh Dīkqūz.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Allāhumma. Yā muṣarrif al-qulūb, ṣarrif qulūbanā naḥwa riḍāʼika, wa-ṣalli ʻalá man ūtiya jawāmiʻ al-kalim min anbiyāʼika, wa-ʻalá al-āmirīn bi-al-maʻrūf wa-al-nāyīna ʻan al-munkar min ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-azwājihi wa-aḥibbāʼihi, wa-ʻalá al-muqtafīn ilá al-muttabiʻīn bihim fī maṣādirihim wa-mawāridihim. Rabbanā lā tuākhidhnā bi-al-faraṭāt al-māḍiyah, wa-saddid umūranā bi-al-faraṭāt fī al-ḥāl wa-al-istiqbāl, wa-iḥfaẓnā min al-iʻtilāl wa-al-iḍlāl fī al-aqwāl wa-al-afʻāl, wa-irziqnā ṣaḥīḥat al-nīyāt fī abwāb al-khayrāt. Qāla al-muṣ, raḥimahu [Allāh], ʻamalan bi-al-Ḥadīth wa-al-khabar al-maʼthūr, wa-iqtidāʼan bi-al-Kitāb al-Karīm: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm ..."
Secundo folio: Qāla wa-antum al-fuqarāʼ wa-tayammunan bi-mā ṣadara ʻan ṣadr al-Nubūwah.
13.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 6.5 x 15 cm; 18 lines per page.
Binding: Binding deteriorated; remnant of dark brown leather on cover and flap.
In small fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; many comments on the margins and interlinear; the first two leaves have been replaced; catchwords.
On cover: "Yāzmah kitāb."
At the head of folio 1b: "Sharḥ wa-naqd Maraḥ. M.M.M."

Colophon: Some of the words in the colophon are not clear and/or illegible: "Tamma al-kitāb bimaʻūnat Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb, ʻalá yad aḍʻaf al-ʻibād wa-afqarihim, al-muftaqir ilá raḥmat Allāh taʻālá wa-ghufrānih, ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn Mullā Ḥājī [?] Muḥammad lil-ʻazīz [?] Sandūk [?] fī khidmat Mawlānā [... ...] Ismāʻīl ibn Mullā Tamirkhāṭir [?] fī al-ashhur [...] Ṣafar [?] yawm al-Khamīs, waqt al-ẓuhr, fī tārīkh sanat [...] alf wa-miʼah wa-ithnay wa-ʻishrīn min Hijrat al-Nabī, ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Allāhumma ḥarrim laḥm kātibihi ʻalá al-nār, bi-ḥaqq Muḥammad wa-ālihi al-akhyār."

Translation of the colophon: Some of the words in the colophon are not clear and/or illegible: "The book was completed by the help of God, the Abundant Giving King, by the hand of the feeblest of the servants and their poorest, who is in need of the mercy of God Almighty and His forgiveness, ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn Mullā Ḥājī [?] Muḥammad, for the honorable [?] Sandūk [?], in the service of Mawlānā [... ...] Ismāʻīl ibn Mullā Tamirkhāṭir [?] in the months [...] Ṣafar [?] on Thursday, at noon time, dated in the year 1122 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [3 (?) April 1710], may prayer and peace be upon Him. O God! Prohibit the flesh of its copyist from fire, for the sake of Muḥammad and his righteous family."

record.title: Treatises on inheritance and God's unity : manuscript.
record.note: Title of the codex supplied by cataloger.
1. Title of the first treatise "al-Farāʼiḍ al-Sirājīyah" of al-Sajāwandī from reference sources.
2. Title of the second Treatise "Sharḥ Badʼ al-amālī" of al-Anṭākī supplied by cataloger (based on the incipit).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "al-Farāʼiḍ al-Sirājīyah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ḥamda al-shākirīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Khayr al-Barīyah Muḥammad wa-ālihi al-ṭayyibīn al-ṭāhirīn. Qāla Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: 'Taʻallamū al-farāʼiḍ wa-ʻallimūhā al-nās fa-innahā niṣf al-ʻilm'. Qāla ʻulamāʼunā, raḥimahum Allāh: Tataʻallaqu bi-tarikat al-mayyit ḥuqūq arbaʻah. Awwalan yubdaʼu bi-tajhīzihi wa-takfīnih, min ghayr tabdhīr wa-lā taqtīr, thumma tuqḍá duyūnuhu min jamīʻ mā baqiya min mālihi, thumma tunaffadhu waṣāyāhu min thulth mā baqiya min al-dayn, thumma yuqsamu al-bāqī bayna warathatihi bi-al-Kitāb wa-al-Sunnah wa-ijmāʻ al-ummah; fa-yubdaʼu bi-aṣḥāb al-farāʼiḍ, wa-hum alladhīna lahum sihām muqaddarah fī Kitāb Allāh, thumma al-ʻaṣabāt min jihat al-nasab, wa-al-ʻuṣbah kull man yaʼkhudhu mā abqathu al-farāʼiḍ ..."
1. Secundo folio of "al-Farāʼiḍ al-Sirājīyah": Taʻallamū al-farāʼiḍ wa-ʻallimūhā al-nās.

2. Incipit of the second "Sharḥ Badʼ al-amālī" (folio 85b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ḥamdan laka yā man taqaddasa dhātuhu ʻan mulāḥaẓat al-afkār, wa-tanazzahat ṣifātuhu ʻan iḥāṭat al-anẓār, wa-ṣalātun ʻalá afḍal man abdā dalāʼil al-tawḥīd, wa-afṣaḥ man naṭaqa bi-āyāt al-waʻd wa-al-waʻīd, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi alladhīn al-iqtidāʼ bihim ihtidāʼ, wa-al-zaygh ʻan manhajihim ḍalālun wa-iʻtidāʼ. Fa-yaqūlu al-muftaqir ilá raḥmat Rabbihi al-ghanī, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn Abī Bakr ibn ʻUmar al-Anṭākī: Hādhihi awrāq waḍaʻtuhā bi-ʻawn Allāh ʻalá qaṣīdat al-Shaykh Abī al-Ḥasan Sirāj al-Dīn ʻAlī ibn ʻUthmān al-Ūshī al-Farghānī, bi-iltimās baʻḍ al-ikhwān, mutawakkilan ʻalá khāliq al-qiwá wa-al-qadar. Qāla: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ibtidāʼī aw abtadiʼu bi-ism dhāt Wājib al-Wujūd ..."
2. Secundo folio of "Sharḥ Badʼ al-amālī": fī ḥawāshī al-Kashshāf.
14.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface of "al-Farāʼiḍ al-Sirājīyah": 7 x 10 cm; 5 lines per page; written surface of "Sharḥ Badʼ al-amālī": 10 x 15 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding deteriorated; remnant of dark brown leather on spine and flap.

The two treatises are written in different hands. "al-Farāʼiḍ al-Sirājīyah" is written in fair naskh script, in black ink, on thick cream color paper; many comments on the margins and interlinear; some headings and markings in red; some pages framed in red; an insert in Ottoman Turkish; catchwords. "Sharḥ Badʼ al-amālī" is written in fair naskh script, in black ink, on thick cream color paper; some comments on the margins and interlinear; markings in red; catchwords.
On cover "ʻIlm farāʼiḍ."
Inside the front cover: Statements in Ottoman Turkish.

On folio 1a: Statements in Ottoman Turkish; a circle with the names of the week in Persian; the date "7 Jumādá Ūlá sanat 1320 [12 August 1902]"; a reader's statement: "Tafsīr al-Ghāyah al-amānī min taʼlīf Shaykhī al-Kūrānī" (Probably the commentary on the Qurʼān: "Ghāyat al-amānī fī tafsīr al-kalām al-Rabbānī" of al-Shaykh al-Kūrānī (Aḥmad ibn Ismāʻīl, 1410 or 1411-1487 or 1488).
On folio 73b: Miscellaneous quotations in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish.
On folios 74a-81a: Tables/diagrams on distribution of inheritance.
On folios 81b-84b: Miscellaneous quotations in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish.
On folio 85a: "Sharḥ Amālī."
On the end leaf: An owner's statement: "Kutub al-faqīr Munlā Mūsá ibn Ismāʻīl." And a statement in Ottoman Turkish about "akyāl" (dry measures) of (75000 + 95000 + 65000 = 235000).
1. Colophon of "al-Farāʼiḍ al-Sirājīyah": "Tammat bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn. Tārīkh sanat tisʻimiʼah wa-thamānūn wa-ithnay[n]."

1. Translation of the colophon of "al-Farāʼiḍ al-Sirājīyah": "It is completed by the help of God and His abundant blessing. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, and all his family. Dated in the year 982 [1574/1575]."
Under the colophon of "al-Farāʼiḍ al-Sirājīyah": An owner's statement: "Ṣāḥibuhu wa-mālikuhu Muḥammad Budhayr Qāḍī ibn Dāwūd." "Tārīkh sanat 982 [1574/1575]."

2. Colophon of "Sharḥ Badʼ al-amālī": No colophon. Text ends abruptly, as follows: "... Qawluhu, ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām: Inna Rabbakum ḥayīyun karīm, yastaḥī min ʻabdihi idhā rafaʻa yadayhi ilayhi an yaruddahā ṣifran. Wa-qawluhu, ʻalayhi al-salām: Udʻū Allāh wa-antum mūqinūn bi-al-ijābah, wa-iʻlammū inna Allāh lā yastajību al-duʻāʼ min qalbin ghāfilin lāhin. Wa-dunyānā, wa-hiya ʻibārah ʻan al-aʻyān wa-al-aʻrāḍ, ḥadathat, ay mukhrajah min al-ʻadam ilá al-wujūd, bi-maʻná annahā kānat maʻdūmah fa-wujidat, khilāfan lil-falāsifah, ḥaythu dhahabū ilá qidam al-samāwāt bi-mawāddihā wa-ṣuwarihā wa-ashkālihā, wa-qidam al-anāṣir [?] bi-mawāddihā wa-ṣuwarihā, lākin bi-al-nawʻ, bi-maʻná annahā lam takhlu qaṭṭ ʻan ṣūrah. Naʻam, aṭlaqū al-qawl bi-ḥudūth mā siwá Allāh, taʻ., lākin bi-maʻná al-iḥtiyāj ..."

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Maqālah al-ūlá 'Fī dhikr al-adwiyah al-mufradah'. Wa-nadhkuruhā ʻalá ḥarf al-muʻjam, li-nufarriqa mā yuḍṭarru ilá sharḥihi min afʻālihā wa-ṭabʻihā, fa-naqūlu: Aqwá al-adwiyah minhā, wa-hiya al-ḥarārah wa-al-ruṭūbah wa-al-yubūsah wa-al-burūdah, wa-minhā thāniyah tābiʻah li-hādhihi lā yakhtaṣṣu fiʻluhā bi-ʻuḍw, fa-nadhkuruhā hunā. Mā yuḥtāju ilayhi min ṣināʻat al-ṭibb, fa-naqūlu: al-dawá al-muḥallil mā yuhayyiʼu al-māddah lil-tabkhīr, wa-al-mulaṭṭif mā yurfiqu qiwāmahā, wa-al-jamālī [wa-al-jālī] mā yuzīlu al-ruṭūbah min saṭḥ al-ʻuḍw, wa-al-munḍij mā yuʻaddilu aqwām al-khalṭ wa-yuhayyiuhu lil-dāfiʻah, wa-al-mufattiḥ mā yanfudhu fī al-majārī fa-yukhriju al-māddah al-sāddah ..."
Secundo folio: abār wa-huwa al-raṣāṣ al-maḥrūq.
21 x 29.5 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 19.5 cm; 24-37 lines per page.
Binding: In cream color sheet of paper pasted to the first and last leaves.

In clear good naskh script, in black ink, on thin cream color paper, headings in red; pages lined in gold; text framed in gold and blue; numerous notes and commentaries on the margins (some in red); broad margins around the text to allow for commentaries, framed in red; catchwords.
The manuscript is listed in Hartford Seminary Collection as "Taḥrīr Tanqīḥ al-Lubāb" by Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī
Text folios 1b-29a; leaves 29b-32a are blank. Pages of the text are numbered in East Arabic (Indian numerals) 1-57.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly as follows: "Wa-man ḥabba an takūna al-marʼah tashtahī al-jamāʻ fa-li-yadussa ilayhā hādhā al-dawāʼ, arbaʻ mathāqīl, tudaqqu wa-tulqá fī dihn zanbaq, qad mā yakhluṭuhu, wa-tataḥammal bi-hi fī khurqah maṣrūrah, wa-ablagh mā dhakarnāhu an tataḥammala bi-ṣamgh al-shūnīz, fa-innahu ʻajīb al-fiʻl. al-Maʻjūn al-maʻrūf bi-maʻjūn al-saqnūqūr, fīhi thalāthat manāfiʻ: Yuṣallib al-iḥlīl wa-yuqawwīhi, wa-yudhhib al-jadhb minhu, wa-yusriʻ al-inzāl bi-ṭībah. Akhlāṭuhu sabʻat ajzāʼ, wa-hiya min saqanqūr dirhamayn, luʼluʼ ghayr mathqūb, wa-kuthayrāʼ, wa-bahman, wa-anīsūn, min kull niṣf dirham ..."

1. Incipit of "Badʼ al-amālī": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yaqūlu al-ʻabdu fī badʼi al-amālī // li-tawḥīdin bi-naẓmin ka-al-laʼālī. Ilāhu al-khalqi Mawlānā qadīmun // wa-mawṣūfun bi-awṣāfi al-kamāli. Huwa al-ḥayyu al-mudabbiru kulla amrin // Huwa al-Ḥaqqu al-muqaddiru dhū al-jalāli ..."
1. Secundo folio of "Badʼ al-amālī": Wa-mā al-Qurʼānu makhlūqan taʻālá // kalāmu al-Rabbi ʻan jinsi al-maqāli.

2. Incipit of al-Burdah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Amin tadhakkuri jīrānin bi-Dhī Salamin // mazajta damʻan jará min muqltain bi-dami. Am habbati al-rīḥu min tilqāʼi Kāẓimatin // wa-awmaḍa al-barqu fī al-ẓalmāʼi min Iḍami ..."
2. Secundo folio of al-Burdah: A translation in Ottoman Turkish of the verse: Wa-athbata al-wajdu khaṭṭay ʻabratin wa-ḍanan // mithla al-bahāri ʻalá khaddayka wa-al-ʻanami.

3. Incipit of "al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī ādāb al-baḥth wa-al-munāẓarah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yā man waffaqanā li-waẓāʼif al-baḥth fī al-taḥrīrāt wa-al-taḥqīqāt, wa-yā man yassaranā li-tamyīz samīnihā min saqīmihā fī al-taqrīrāt, ṣalli ʻalá man ṣaḥḥaḥa al-Sharīʻat al-gharrāʼ bi-aṣaḥḥ al-taṣḥīḥāt, wa-abṭala naqāʼish al-mukābirīn bi-awḍaḥ al-barāhīn wa-al-tawḍīḥāt, wa-ʻalá man ʻarrafū ishāratihi al-ʻalīyah bi-aʻraf al-taʻrīfāt, wa-qāsamūhā baʻdamā istanadū bi-asānīd sawīyah. Fa-hādhihi 'ʻUjālah kāfiyah li-wasāʼil al-sāʼilīn li-waẓāʼif al-kalām wa-ghulālah shāfiyah li-ʻilal al-muʻallilīn ʻalá ṣiḥḥat al-maqāl wa-al-marām', wa-jāmiʻah lil-farāʼid al-manẓūmah maʻa mā ḥafaẓat min al-ʻulamāʼ al-aʻlām, ghayr muqtaṣirah ʻalá mā huwa al-mashhūr fīmā bayn al-muḥaṣṣilīn min al-anām ..."
3. Secundo folio of "al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī ādāb al-baḥth wa-al-munāẓarah": al-taqdīrīyah bi-ithbāt khilāf al-murād.

4. Incipit of "Sharḥ ʻalá al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī ādāb al-baḥth wa-al-munāẓarah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yā man waffaqnā li-waẓāʼif al-baḥth. Wa-kalimat Yā mushtarakah bayna al-aḥwāl al-thalāthah fa-lā yaḥtāj ilá tawjīh al-ʻallāmah, wa-al-murād bi-hā ghāyat maʻnāhā, wa-hiya al-ijābah, wa-al-tawfīq lughatan jaʻl al-asbāb mutawāfiqah naḥwa al-musabbib, wa-iṣṭilāḥan khalq al-qudrah ʻalá al-ṭāʻah, wa-al-baḥth lughatan al-taftīsh, wa-iṣṭilāḥan ithbāt al-muddaʻá bi-al-dalīl nafyan aw ithbātan, wa-huwa al-ẓāhir, wa-al-murād bi-al-waẓāʼif al-muwajjahah hāhunā, aʻnī al-munūʻ al-thalāthah wa-amthālahā wa-huwa al-aẓhar ..."
4. Secundo folio of "Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī ādāb al-baḥth wa-al-munāẓarah": min wajhayn kamā lā yakhfá ʻalá al-muwajjihīn.

5. Incipit of "Ṭabaqāt al-kitāb": No Basmalah. The treatise starts as follows: "Iʻlam ayyuhā al-ṭālib al-ʻulūm al-ākhirah, inna ibtidā kull kitāb ʻalá thalāthat ṭabaqāt. al-Ṭabaqah al-ūlá ṭabaqat al-aʻlá, wa-al-ṭabaqah al-thāniyah ṭabaqat al-awsaṭ, wa-al-ṭabaqah al-thālithah ṭabaqat al-adná. Wa-al-ṭabaqah al-aʻlá min al-Basmalah ilá ammā baʻd, wa-al-ṭabaqah al-awsaṭ min ammā baʻd ilá thumma al-lafẓ, wa-al-ṭabaqah al-adná min thumma al-lafẓ ilá ākhir al-kitāb. Fa-al-ṭabaqah al-aʻlá yusammá khuṭbah, wa-al-ṭabaqah al-awsaṭ yusammá dībājah, wa-al-ṭabaqah al-adná yusammá taʼlīfan ..."
5. Secundo folio of "Ṭabaqāt al-kitāb": wa-ṣiḥḥat al-badan fī aqyisah mutawāfiqah li-musabbibātih.

6. Incipit of "al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-faqīr ilá Allāh ʻazza wa-jall, Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad, al-maʻrūf bi-Abī al-Jaysh al-Anṣārī al-Andūlasī: Aḥmadu Allāh wa-atawakkal ʻalayhi, wa-uṣallī ʻalá Nabīyihi Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-usallimu taslīman. Wa-baʻd, fa-qad qaṣadtu fī hādhā al-mukhtaṣar an adhkura ʻilal al-aʻārīḍ al-arbaʻ wa-al-thalāthīn, wa-al-ḍurūb al-thalāthah wa-al-sittīn khāṣṣatan, wa-lā ataʻarraḍu li-shayʼ min zuḥāf al-ḥashw ghāliban, wa-ṣanaʻtu fīhi sittata ʻashara baytan, awwal lafẓah min al-bayt yuʻṭī al-laqab ..."
6. Secundo folio of "al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī": mafʻūlātun minhā ʻinda al-Jawharī

7. Incipit of "An unidentified commentary on an unidentified treatise on Arabic rhetoric": No Basmalah. The treatise starts as follows: "Qawluh 'Iʻlam' khiṭāb shāmil li-kull aḥad, yaṣluḥu li-an yukhāṭaba fī hādhā al-maqām. Aqūlu: ʻUmūm al-khiṭāb wa-shumūluhu li-kull aḥad ʻalá sabīl al-badal, li-kawn al-ṣīghah mufradah, kamā afādahu al-niḥrīr al-Taftāzānī fī Sharḥ al-Talkhīṣ fī qawl al-muṣ. Wa-qad yutraku al-khiṭāb ilá ghayr muʻayyan. Lākinnahu lammā kāna al-maʼmūr bi-hi, wa-huwa al-ʻilm hāhunā ghayr mukhtaṣṣ bi-mukhāṭab dūna mukhāṭab afāda al-ʻumūm al-shumūl bi-hādhihi al-qarīnah ..."
7. Secundo folio of "An unidentified commentary on an unidentified treatise on Arabic rhetoric": al-āyah ḥaythu istuʻīra al-ḥabl lil-ʻahd.

8. Incipit of "Sharḥ al-Mafātīḥ al-durrīyah fī ithbāt al-qawānīn al-Darīyah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāhw wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūlihi Muḥammad, wa-ālihi, wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi 'Fawāʼid jalīlah bi-ḥall mushkilāb al-Darīyah' naḍamtuhā fī silk al-taqrīr wa-simṭ al-taḥrīr lil-ṭullāb al-rāghibīn bi-ʻilm al-Furs, ḥafiẓahum Allāh, subḥānuhu, min mūjibāt al-talahhuf wa-al-taʼassuf, wa-sammaytuhā bi-'al-Muʼallafāt al-ṭullābīyah' li-annahum li-hādhā al-jamʻ wa-al-taʼlīf ka-al-ʻillah al-ghāʼīyah, nafaʻahum Allāh bihā wa-sāʼir al-ʻulūm ..."
8. Secundo folio of "Sharḥ al-Mafātīḥ al-durrīyah fī ithbāt al-qawānīn al-Darīyah": yuʻlamu bi-hi al-Khāliq, sawāʼun kāna min dhawī al-ʻilm aw lā.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap.

The treatises of the codex are written in different hands, in good, and fair naskh, and fair naskh/ruqʻah scripts, in black ink, on laid white paper; some headings and markings in red; some inserts; catchwords.
At the head of folio 1b: "Hādhā Kitāb amālī."
On folios 13a-13b: Quotations from an unidentified work on logic and debate.
Folios 17a-18b are blank.
Folios 34a-36a are blank.
Folios 38b-39b are blank
On folio 40a: A quotation on logic in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish.
At the head of folio 41b: "Kitāb ʻarūḍ."
Folio 44a-44b is blank.
Folios 48a-49a are blank.
Folios 64b-70a are blank.

1. Colophon of "Badʼ al-amālī": "[Tammat al-nuskhah] al-mubārakah ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-mudhnib, al-rājī ilá Allāh taʻālá, Muḥammad ibn Muṣṭafá, ghaafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi, wa-li-jamīʻ al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt. Āmīn. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. Fī tārīkh sanat tisʻah wa-khamsīn wa-miʼatayn wa-ulūf. Tammat."

1. Translation of "Badʼ al-amālī": "The blessed [copy was completed] by the hand of the feeble and guilty servant, who aspires to God Almighty, Muḥammad ibn Muṣṭafá, may God forgive him and his parents, and be kind to them and to him, and to all believers, men and women. Amen. O Lord of the Universe. Dated in the year 1259 [1843/1844]. It is completed."
2. Colophon of al-Burdah. The colophon is in Ottoman Turkish: "Tammat tamām ... sanat 1259."
2. Translation of the colophon: "It is completed ... in the year 9521 [1259 of the Hijrah = 1843/1844]."

3. Colophon of "al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī ādāb al-baḥth wa-al-munāẓarah": "Tammat al-awrāq bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Razzāq, min yad al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-mudhnib, al-muftaqir iftiqāran tāmman ilá raḥmat Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, Muḥammad ibn Bakr al-Amīrṭāgh, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi. M.M.M."

3. Translation of the colophon of "al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī ādāb al-baḥth wa-al-munāẓarah": "The leaflets were completed by the help of God, the Sustaining King, by the hand of the feeble and guilty servant, who is completely in need of the mercy of Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, Muḥammad ibn Bakr al-Amīrṭāgh, may god forgive him and his parents, and be kind to them and to him. M.M.M."

4. "Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī ādāb al-baḥth wa-al-munāẓarah" ends with: "... wa-thāminuhā ʻan al-maunāẓarah maʻa ahl al-mahābah wa-al-iḥtirām, li-allā yashghula dhihnahu bi-jalālat qadr al-khaṣm wa-al-iḥtishām. Wa-tāsiʻuhā an yaḥtasiba anna khaṣmahu ḥaqīr ḍaʻīf, li-allā yuʼaddī istiḥqāruhu ilá ṣudūr kalām sakhīf, fa-yakūnu maghlūb al-khaṣm al-ḍaʻīf bi-al-ifḥām, maʻa anna hādhā ashnaʻ wujūh al-ilzām. Wa-ʻalá Allāh al-tawakkul, wa-bi-hi al-iʻtiṣām. Ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, bi-ḥurmat Muḥammad ʻalayhi al-ṣalāah wa-al-salām."
4. Colophon of "Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī ādāb al-baḥth wa-al-munāẓarah": "Tammat al-awrāq bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Razzāq. M.M.M."
4. Translation of the colophon of "Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Ḥusaynīyah fī ādāb al-baḥth wa-al-munāẓarah": "The leaflets are completed by the help of the Sustaining King. M.M.M."

5. Colophon of "Ṭabaqāt al-kitāb": No colophon. Text ends abruptly, as follows: "... lā shayʼ min al-shakl al-rābiʻ yulāʼiqu dhikrahu hāhunā, li-anna al-shakl al-rābiʻ baʻīd ʻan al-ṭabʻ jiddan. Wa-kull mā huwa shaʼnuhu laysa bi-lāʼiq dhikruhu hunā. Ah. al-Shakl al-rābiʻ baʻīd ʻan al-ṭabʻ jiddan, li-anna al-shakl al-rābiʻ ka-annahu fī intiqāl dhihn al-insān min al-ḥadd al-awsaṭ ilá al-aṣghará [al-aṣghar] ʻusrah. Wa-kull mā shaʼnuhu kadhā baʻīd. Ah. Yantuju ʻayn al-daʻwá ..."
6. Colophon of "al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī": "Tamma al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb."
6. Translation of the colophon of "al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī": "The book was completed by the help of God, the Abundant Giving King."

7. Colophon of "An unidentified commentary on an unidentified treatise on Arabic rhetoric": No colophon. Text ends as follows: "... wa-kullamā kānat ṣughrāhā sālibah kullīyah fa-hiya ṣughrá thānī al-thānī, wa-kullamā kānat sālibah juzʼīyah fa-hiya ṣughrá rābiʻ al-thānī, yantuju anna al-ṣughrá al-maṭwīyah immā ṣughrá awwal al-thānī, aw ṣughrá thālith al-thānī, aw ṣughrá thānī al-thānī, aw ṣughrá rābiʻ al-thānī, wa-kullun minhā ṣughrá al-shakl al-thānī, ilkh."

8. Colophon of "Sharḥ al-Mafātīḥ al-durrīyah fī ithbāt al-qawānīn al-Darīyah": "Tamma Sharḥ al-Mafātīḥ al-durrīyah bi-ʻināyat Allāh al-Malik al-ʻalīyah, maʻa alf quṣūr wa-futūr, ʻafā ʻannā wa-ʻankum al-Malik al-Ghafūr. Taḥammaltu al-ʻanā li-ajl al-duʻā. Yā nāfilan fīhi sal billāh marḥamatan // ʻalá al-muṣannifi wa-istaghfir li-ṣāḥibihi. Wa-uṭlub li-nafsika min khayrin yazīdu bihā // min baʻdi dhālika ghufrānan li-kātibihi. Qad faraghtu min taswīd hādhā al-sharḥ al-mukhtaṣar, wa-anā ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-mudhnib, al-muḥtāj ilá raḥmat Rabbihi al-Ghafūr. Tammat. Wa-al-kātib Muṣṭafá ibn Ismāʻīl, ʻalayhimā raḥmat al-Bārī, bi-raḥmatika Yā Arḥam al-Rāḥimīn. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

8. Translation of the colophon of "Sharḥ al-Mafātīḥ al-durrīyah fī ithbāt al-qawānīn al-Darīyah": "The commentary on 'al-Mafātīḥ al-durrīyah' was completed by the sublime providence of God the King, with a thousand insufficiency and apathy, may the Forgiving King forgive us and you. I forbear the hassle for the sake of your invocation. O you who will benefit from it ask for God's mercy to be bestowed upon the author and forgiveness for its owner. Ask that abundant blessing to be bestowed upon you then ask that forgiveness be bestowed upon its copyist. I finished copying this brief commentary, I the feeble and guilty servant, who needs of the mercy of his Forgiving Lord. It is completed. The copyist is Muṣṭafá ibn Ismāʻīl, may the mercy of the Creator be upon both, by Your mercy, You who is the most merciful. It is completed. It is completed. It is completed."
