2. Title of "Risālat Ḥayy ibn Yaqẓān" from folio 22b.
3. Title of "Dīwān Abī Miḥjan" from folio 90b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of Mukhtaṣar tārīkh al-Harāmisah: "Mukhtaṣar tārīkh al-Harāmisah, taʼlīf al-Ḥakīm Ḥunayn ibn Isḥāq al-ʻIbādī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh khāliq al-kull, wa-wāhib al-ʻaql, wa-bāʻith makhlūqātihi yawm al-faṣl. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá anbiyāʼihi al-akramīn, wa-khaṣṣa bi-ṣalawātihi wa-maḥabbatihi Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbiih. Wa-baʻd, ikhtalafa ʻulamāʼ al-umam fī awwal man takallama fī al-ḥikmah wa-arkānihā, min al-riyāḍah wa-al-manṭiq wa-al-ṭabīʻī wa-al-ilāhī, fa-kull firqah dhakarat al-awwal ʻindahā, wa-laysa dhālika huwa al-awwal ʻalá al-ḥaqīqah. Wa-lammā amʻana al-nāẓirūn al-naẓrah raʼaw anna dhālika kāna nubūwatan unzilat ʻalá Idrīs al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh taʻālá ʻalá Nabīyinā wa-ʻalayhi ..."
1. Secundo folio of Tārīkh al-Harāmisah: dhakara mā umira bi-hi min taqrīb al-qarābīn.

2. Incipit of "Risālat Ḥayy ibn Yaqẓān": "Risālat Ḥayy ibn Yaqẓān. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-faqīh, al-Imām, al-ʻĀlim al-fāḍil, al-kāmil al-ʻārif, Abū Jaʻfar ibn Ṭufayl, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayhi: al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-ʻaẓim al-aʻẓam, al-qadīm al-aqdam, al-ʻalīm al-aʻlam, al-ḥakīm al-aḥkam, al-raḥīm al-arḥam, al-karīm al-akram, al-ḥalīm al-aḥlam, alladhī ʻallama bi-al-qalam ʻallama al-insāna mā lam yaʻlam, wa-kāna al-faḍl [faḍl] Allāh ʻalayhi ʻaẓīman ... Saʼalta ayyuhā al-akh al-karīm, al-ṣafī al-ḥamīm, manaḥaka Allāh al-baqāʼ al-abadī, wa-asʻadaka al-saʻd al-sarmadī, an abuththa ilayka mā amkananī baththuhu min asrār al-ḥikmah al-mashriqīyah allatī dhakarahā al-Shaykh al-Imām al-Raʼīs Abū ʻAlī Sīnā. Wa-iʻlam inna man arāda al-ḥaqq alladhī lā jamjamah fīhi fa-ʻalayhi bi-ṭalabihā wa-al-jidd fī iqitnāʼihā ..."
2. Secundo folio of "Risālat Ḥayy ibn Yaqẓān": fī al-irtiyāḍ thumma innahu la-yūghila fī dhālika ḥattá yaghshāh.

3. Incipit of the nine verses excerpted from the "Dīwān" of Abū Miḥjan al-Thaqafī with the commentary (folio 89b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla Abū ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Aʻrābī wa-Abū Yūsuf ibn al-Sikkīt: Qāla Abū Miḥjan al-Thaqafī, wa-kāna Abū ʻUbayd qutila bi-Quss al-Nāṭif, yawma laqiyat al-ʻArab al-ʻAjam, wa-kāna maʻahum fīl, fa-lam taqdir al-khayl al-dunū minhu, ḥattá danā Abū ʻUbayd, fa-ḍaraba mishfarahu, fa-istadār, wa-huzima al-qawm, wa-qutila yawmaindhin min Banī Zāyidah nāsun kathīr, fa-qāla Abū Miḥjan: Anná tasaddat naḥwanā ummu Yūsufin // wa-min dūni masrāhā fayāfin majhalu [majāhilu]. Tasaddat, jāzat ilaynā. Yaqūlu Kayfa fayāfin jāzat ilaynā. Wa-yuqālu Yūsufu wa-Yūsifu wa-Yūsafu. Wa-masrāhā muddatu sayrihā bi-al-layl. Yaqūlu dūna mā baynī wa-baynihā fayāfin wa-hiya al-ṣaḥārī, wāḥiduhā fayfāh, wa-al-majhal [al-majāhil] allatī lā ʻalama bihā wa-lā ṭarīq yuhtadá bi-hā ..."
3. Secundo folio of the nine verses excerpted from the "Dīwān" of Abū Miḥjan al-Thaqafī with the commentary: Wa-ḥattá raʼytu muhratī muzwaʼrratun // ladá al-fīli yudmá naḥruhā wa-al-shawākilu.
21 x 26 cm; written surface varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: In green buckram.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper.
The leaves of the codex are numbered from left to right.
On folios 8b-10b: A text in Latin.
On folios 10b-20b: A text in Latin, a comparison of the Hijrī years with the Mīlādi years, from the year 1/622 to 1270/1853.

On folios 21a-22a: A text in Latin which includes the Arabic names of some of the Muslim philosophers and scholars: Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Ghazzālī al-Ṭūsī, Ḥujjat al-Islām Zayn al-Dīn. Abū Bakr Muḥammad ibn Yaḥyá ibn al-Ṣāyigh. Abū al-Walīd Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Rushd, ʻummira ʻumran ṭawīlan. Muwaffaq al-Dīn Abū al-ʻAbbās Aḥmad ibn al-Qāsim ibn Khalīfah ibn Yūnus, al-maʻrūf bi-Ibn Abī Uṣaybiʻah. Abū al-Qāsim al-Junayd ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Junayd, sulṭān al-ṭāʼifah al-Ṣūfīyah. al-Ḥusayn ibn Manṣūr al-Ḥallāj, Mā fī al-jubbah illā Allāh."
Folios 40a-88a, and 91a-92a are blank.
On folio 90b: "Dīwān Abī Miḥjan."
On 92b: Seventeen statements in Latin, numbered I-XVII.
On spine, printed in gold: "Syriaca ... Hebraica."

1. Colophon of "Mukhtaṣar Tārīkh al-Harāmisah": No colophon. Text ends as follows: "... Wa-kāna Aflāṭūn idhā ḥaḍara aṣḥābahu lil-taʻallum qāma ʻalá rijlayh wa-alqana ʻalayhim al-durūs min al-ʻilm wa-huwa māshī, fa-yaʼkhudhūna minhu mā yulqīhi ʻalayhim wa-hum ʻalá tilka al-ḥālah, fa-summū al-māshiyīn bi-dhālik. Wa-lammā istakmal iḥdá wa-thamānīn sanah min ʻumrihi māta wa-dufina bi-al-basātīn fī Aqādīmiyā. Wa-alladhī khallafahu min al-tarikah al-basātīn al-madhkūrah wa-mamlūkayn wa-qadaḥan wa-qirṭan min dhahab kāna yalbasuhu, wa-huwa libās ashrāf al-Yūnān. Wa-ammā mā ṣāra ilayhi min Diyūnūsiyūs jabbār Ṣiqillīyah wa-ghayri[hi] min al-aṣdiqāʼ fa-innahu anfaqahu fī tazwīj banāt ukhtihi. Wa-lammā qubira kutiba ʻalá qabrihi: 'Hāhunā mawḍūʻun rajulun, wa-huwa Arsiyūfilīs ilāhī, wa-qad taqaddama al-nās wa-malaʼahum bi-al-ʻiffah wa-akhlāq al-ʻadl, fa-man kāna yamdaḥu al-ḥikmah akthar min sāyir jamīʻ al-ashyāʼ fa-innahu yamdaḥu hādhā jiddan, li-anna fīhi akthar al-ḥikmah, wa-laysa fī dhālika jasad'. Wa-min al-jihah al-ukhrá: 'Ammā al-arḍ fa-innahā tughaṭī jasad Aflāṭūn hādhā, wa-ammā nafsuhu fa-innahā fī martabat man lā yamūt'."

2. The text of "Risālat Ḥayy ibn Yaqẓān" ends as follows: "... Wa-anā asʼalu ikhwatī al-wāfiqīn ʻalá hādhā al-kalām an yaqbalū ʻudhrī fīmā tasāhaltu fī tabyīnih wa-tasāmaḥtu fī tathbītih, fa-lam afʻal dhālik illā li-annī tasannamtu shawāhiqa yazillu al-ṭarf ʻan marmāhā, wa-aradtu taqrīb al-kalām fīhā ʻalá wajh al-tartīb wa-al-tashwīq fī dukhūl al-ṭarīq. Wa-asʼalu Allāh al-tajāwuz wa-al-ʻafwa, wa-an yūridanā min al-maʻrifah bi-hi al-ṣafw. Innahu munʻimun karīm. Wa-al-salām ʻalayka ayyuhā al-akh al-muftaraḍ isʻāfuhu, wa-raḥmat Allāh wa-barakātuhu."

2. Colophon of "Risālat Ḥayy ibn Yaqẓān": "Kamula al-kitāb. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdahu. Taḥrīran, al-yawm 28 fī al-shahr Awghust, sanat 1844. Kutiba wa-tamma. Hādhā al-kitāb Atqar Qūptachinī al-Ḥakīm."

2. Translation of the colophon of "Risālat Ḥayy ibn Yaqẓān": "The book is completed. Praise be to God alone. Dated on the 28th day of the month of August, of the year 1844. It is written and completed. This book is for Philosopher Atqar Qūptachinī."

3. The nine excerpted verses from the "Dīwān" of Abū Miḥjan al-Thaqafī are the following: "1. Anná tasaddat naḥwanā ummu Yūsufin // wa-min dūni masrāhā fayāfin majhalu [majāhilu]. 2. Ilá fityatin bi-al-Ṭaffi nīlat sarātuhum // wa-ghūdira afrāsun lahum wa-rawāḥilu. 3. [Wa-]aḍḥá Abū Jabrin khalāʼan buyūtuhu // bi-mā kāna yaʻfūhā al-ḍiʻāfu al-majāhilu. 4. Wa-aḍḥá Banū ʻAmrin ladá al-jisri minhumu // ilá́ jānibi al-abnāʼi judun wa-nāʼilu. 5. Wa-mā lumtu nafsī fīhimu ghayra annahā // lahā ajalun lam yaʼtihā wa-huwa ājilu. 6. Wa-mā rumtu ḥattá kharraqū bi-rimāḥihim thiyābī // wa-jādat bi-al-dimāʼi al-abājilu. 7. Wa-ḥattá raʼytu muhratī muzwaʼrratun // ladá al-fīli yudmá naḥruhā wa-al-shawākilu. 8. Wa-mā ruḥtu ḥattá kuntu ākhira rāʼiḥin // wa-ṣurriʻa ḥawlī al-ṣāliḥūna al-amāthilu. 9. Marartu ʻalá al-Anṣāri wasṭa riḥālihim // fa-qultu alā hal minkumu al-yawma qāfilu. "

Incipit of "Qiṣṣat Uns al-Wujūd wa-al-Ward fī al-Akmām": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ḥukiya, wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-ghaybihi, fī mā maḍá wa-taqaddam, annahu kāna fī qadīm al-zamān, wa-sālif al-ʻaṣr wa-al-awān, malik min mulūk al-Yaman, ysammá bi-al-Malik Shāmikh, wa-kāna min ʻadlihi ʻammara al-bilād wa-aṭāʻthu al-ʻibād, wa-kāna la-hu wazīr yusammá Ibrāhīm, wa-kāna li-wazīrihi ibnah jamīlah, ʻāqilah labībah, wa-kāna ismuhā 'al-Ward fī al-Akmām', li-faṣāḥatihā wa-ḥusn al-kalām, wa-kāna abīhā yuḥibbuhā maḥabbah ʻaẓīmah, wa-kāna al-Malik Shāmikh la-hu maḥbūb yusammá 'Uns al-Wujūd', wa-kāna mughraman bi-maḥabbatihi ..."
Secundo folio of: "Qiṣṣat Uns al-Wujūd wa-al-Ward fī al-Akmām": Mā ism hādhā al-shābb al-malīḥ.

Incipit of "Qiṣṣat Ahl al-Kahf": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Ruwiya ʻan Ibn ʻAbbās, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhumā, annahu qāl: Kāna ʻalá zaman al-ʻAmāliqah bi-madīnah yuqālu lahā Ṭarsūs malik jabbār ʻanīd, aw fājir balīd, yaʻbudu al-aṣnām, dūna al-Malik al-ʻAllām, wa-kāna yaʼmur jundahu bi-ʻibādat al-ṣnām. Qāla al-rāwī: Wa-kāna la-hu awlād khāl sittah min al-rijāl, wa-kāna fīhim rajul shadīd yuqālu la-hu Yamlīkhā. Qāla al-rāwī: Fa-baynamā Yamlīkhā al-madhkūr dhāta laylah min al-layālī idh raʼá ilá al-samāʼ al-kawākib, fa-kashafa Allāh ʻan qalbihi ḥijāb al-ghaflah, fa-tafakkara wa-tadhakkara, wa-qāla fī nafsihi: Lā budda min ilāh khalaqa hādhā ..."
Secundo folio of "Qiṣṣat Ahl al-Kahf": ʻalá anfusinā wa-ahlinā wa-amwālinā.
10.5 x 16 cm; written surface: 7 x 11 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: In thin yellow cardboard.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on thick cream color paper; some wormholes on the margins; catchwords.
On cover: "Ḥikāyah min Alf laylah wa-laylah, wa-Ḥikāyat Ahl al-Kahf."
Inside the front cover: An ownership statement: "ʻInda al-Shaykh Ṣāliḥ al-Kātib [... ...]. 137. Siʻr 225."

On folio 1a: The following statements: 1. "Qiṣṣat Uns al-Wujūd wa-al-Ward fī [al-Akmām] wa-mā jará lahum ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-naʻūdhu billāh min al-ziyādah wa-al-nuqṣān." 2. A reader's statement: "Naẓara fī hādhihi al-qiṣṣah al-faqīr ilayhi subḥānuhu." 3. "Farigha khāṣṣ fī 161 [?]." 4. A reader's statement, dated in the year 1134 of the Hijrah (1721/1722): "Naẓara fī hādhihi al-qiṣṣah ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn Muḥammad al-Qaḥf, ghafara Allāh la-hu, wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-lil-Muslimīn ajamaʻīn. Sanat 1134."
On folio 22a: "Hādhihi Qiṣṣat Ahl al-Kahf, wa-mā tamma lahum maʻa Duqyānūs wa-ghayrihi, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhum ajmaʻīn. Tamm."
Inside the back cover: Calculations for amounts received for selling and buying of quntities of "ʻafṣ" (gallnuts), including the names of al-Shaykh Ṣāliḥ, Ḥājj Muṣṭafá Qāẓitiqjī, Abū al-ʻĀfiyah.

Colophon of "Qiṣṣat Uns al-Wujūd wa-al-Ward fī al-Akmām": No colophon. Text ends as follows: "... Qāla al-rāwī: Thumma jalasū fī al-ḥammām wa-istaḥammū, wa-ʻādū ilá qaṣrihim, wa-qaʻadū fī arghad ʻaysh, ilá an atāhum hādim al-ladhdhāt wa-mufarriq al-jamāʻāt, wa-Allāh ʻlam."

"Qiṣṣat Ahl al-Kahf" ends as follows: "... fa-qabaḍa Allāh arwāḥ Ahl al-Kahf. Wa-ammā al-malik wa-man kāna maʻahu, fa-innahu taqaddama qarīban min al-kahf, fa-idhā bi-al-bāb qad <qad> iltaḥama, fa-lam yaqdirū ʻalá al-dukhūl ilayhim, fa-kān yusallimū ʻalayhim barrā min [?] al-aṣābiʻ, wa-rajiʻa al-malik wa-ahl al-madīnah mutaʻajjibīn min dhālik, wa-Allāh aʻlam."
Colophon of "Qiṣṣat Ahl al-Kahf": "Tammat 'Qiṣṣat Ahl al-Kahf', raḍiya Allāh ʻanhum. Tamm."
Translation of the colophon of ""Qiṣṣat Ahl al-Kahf": "The story of the 'People of the Cave", may God be pleased with them, is completed. It is completed."

Under the colophon of "Qiṣṣat Ahl al-Kahf": The last lines of "Qiṣṣat Maryam" (Story of Mary), as follows: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. [... (?)] wa-ḥarīran, fa-qultu lahā: Wa-ayana makānuki fī al-Jannah Yā Maryam. Qālat: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Fī maqʻadi ṣidqin ʻinda Malīkin Muqtadir. Tammat 'Qiṣṣat Maryam', wa-Allāh aʻalm."

record.title: 880-01 Qiṣṣat Naṣūḥā al-ʻĀbid wa-zawjatih : manuscript.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Dhukira, [wa-]Allāh aʻlam bi-ghaybihi wa-aḥkam, fīmā maḍá wa-taqaddama wa-salaf, min aḥādīth al-umam, annahu kāna rajul tājir, wa-kāna kathīr al-amwāl, wa-lam yurzaq min al-dunyā ghayr walad dhakar, wa-kāna sammāhu Naṣūḥā. Fa-lammā kabira Naṣūḥā zawwajahu imraʼah ṣāliḥah ʻābidah, thumma intaqala wāliduhu bi-al-wafāh ilá raḥmat Allāh taʻālá, fa-qālat la-hu zawjatuhu: Yā Naṣūḥā, mā nafʻalau bi-hādhihi al-amwāl wa-lam yarzuqnā Allāh taʻālan walad yarithunā ..."
Secundo folio: nabīʻu jamīʻ mā ʻindanā wa-nunfiqhum ʻalá al-fuqarāʼ.
10.3 x 14.6 cm; written surface: 8 x 12 cm; 11 lines per page.
Binding: In thin brown cardboard.
In fair large naskh script, in black ink, on thick white paper; catchwords.
On cover: A date "1269" of the Hijrah (1852/1853).

On folio 1a: The following statements: 1. "Hādhihi Qiṣṣat Naṣūḥā al-ʻĀbid wa-zawjatihi bil-tamām wa-al-kamāl. M." 2. "MSṬFY" (Muṣṭafá). 3. Four verses in dialectical Arabic, as follows: "Habnī al-hawā ramānī fī ʻalālīhim. wa-itkhāṭafūnī ithnayn yā maḥsan layālīhim. Hātū al-qalam wil-lawḥ naktub asāmīhim. [... ...] wa-lā man yurāḍīhim."

The text of "Qiṣṣat Naṣūḥā al-ʻĀbid wa-zawjatih" ends abruptly, as follows: "... Qāla Naṣūḥā: Yā Jibrīl innī urīdu min Allāh annahu lā yunzilu kitāban min al-samāʼ illā yadhkaru ismī fīhi. Fa-anzala Allāh taʻālá al-Tawrāt ʻalá Mūsá, wa-dhakarahu fīhā. Wa-anzala Allāh 'Wa-tūbū ilá Allāh tawbatan naṣūḥā'. Wa-anzala Allāh al-Injīl ʻalá ʻĪsá, ʻalayhi al-salām, wa-dhakarahu fīhā [fīhi]. Wa-anzala al-Zabūr ʻalá Dāwūd wa-dhakarahu fīhi. Wa-anzala al-Qurʼān, wa-anzala fīhi "Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū tūbū ilá Allāh tawbatan naṣūḥā. Wa-fāraqa Allāha Jibrīlu. Wa-anshada, qāl ..."
Colophon: "Tammat. Bilkhayr ʻammat. ʻAlá yad Bakr ibn al-marḥūm Muṣṭafá Bāshā Shawshān al-Laḥḥām. Sanat 1196."
Translation of the colophon: "It is completed. May it be in goodness widespread. By the hand of Bakr ibn al-marḥūm Muṣṭafá Bāshā Shawshān al-Laḥḥām. In the year 1196 [of the Hijrah = 1749/1750]."
To the left of the colophon: "Tajribat qalam" (Pen trial), as follows: "Tajribat ʻqlam. ʻAlī Ṭās. Lā [...] man ẓalam al-nās. Sanat 1196 [of the Hijrah = 1781/1782]."

record.title: 880-03 Akhtarī kabīr : manuscript / Muṣṭafá ibn Aḥmad al-Akhtarī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī sharrafanā bi-al-nuṭq wa-al-bayān, wa-faḍḍalanā bi-al-faṣāḥah wa-al-tibyān, wa-razaqanā al-ihtidāʼ ilá tamyīz al-lughāt wa-al-lisān, allatī yamtāzu bihā al-insān min sāyir al-ḥayawān ... Wa-baʻd, qāla al-faqīr al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf ... al-shahīr bi-al-Akhtarī Muṣṭafá ibn Akhtarī ibn Shams al-Dīn al-Qarah Ḥiṣārī tawalludan, wa-al-Kūtāhiyawī majīdan [maḥtidan], ʻafá ʻanhumā al-Barr al-Bārī: Lammā raʼytu raghbat al-ʻulamāʼ fī dark al-maʻānī al-naqlīyah wa-al-ʻaqlīyah ilá maʻrifat al-lughāt [al-lughah] al-ʻArabīyah kathīrah, wa-iḥtiyājahum ilayhā shadīdah, aradtu an ajmaʻa fī hādhā al-kitāb kalimāt ʻArabīyah mimmā kathura wuqūʻuhu wa-ʻasura ʻuthūruhu, fa-iltaqaṭṭuhā min Ṣiḥāḥ al-Jawharī, wa-al-Dustūr, wa-al-Takmilah, wa-al-Muḥbal [wa-al-Mujmal], wa-al-Mughrib [wa-al-Muʻarrab], wa-al-Taqdimah, wa-ghayrihā min al-muṣannafāt al-muʻtabarāt fī al-alfāẓ wa-al-lughāt ..."
Secundo folio: wa-qāmishah dakhī darlar qaṣab.
19.5 x 28.7 cm; written surface: 11 x 21 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; dark brown leather on spine.
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on laid cream color paper; headings and markings in red; text framed in red; many commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On the lower side: "Lughat Akhtarī kabīr."

On the flyleaf: 1. "Hādhā Kitāb Akhtarī kabīr al-akbar. Qīmat Ghurūsh [...]." 2. An ownership statement: "Ḥasbuka Allāh wa-kafá. Istaṣḥabahu al-faqīr al-Saʻdawī ʻUthmān Ḥamdī al-mudarris bi-Dār al-Salṭanah al-Sanīyah, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi." 3. Four illegible stamps. 4. "Wa-huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl."
At the head of folio 1b: A colored design in dark blue and gold.

Colophon: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Khallāq, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Ḥabīb Rāziq al-Arzāq, Muḥammad, ṣāḥib al-tāj wa-al-Burāq, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi dhawī al-iḥsān wa-al-akhlāq. Wa-qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min taswīd hādhihi al-lughah al-sharīfah fī Qusṭanṭinīyah, ḥumiyat ʻan al-baʼsāʼ wa-al-balīyah, fī awāʼil Shaʻbān al-muʻaẓẓam, fī laylat yawm al-Sabt, ʻinda yad al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf, al-ḥaqīr, al-naḥīf, al-rājī ilá raḥmat Rabbihi al-Laṭīf, wa-shafāʻt Nabīyihi al-Sharīf, ṣaghīr al-jirm, kabīr al-jurm, Muḥammad ibn Muṣṭafá, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-ṭāba tharāhum, wa-jaʻala al-jannah mathwāhum, wa-aḥsana ilayhim wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn wa-a-Muslimāt, wa-al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Sūwida fī sanat ithnā wa-thamānīn wa-tisʻimiʼah."

Translation of the colophon: "The book was completed by the help of the King Creator. Prayer be upon the Beloved of the Provider of Sustenance, Muḥammad, of the Crown and the Burāq, and upon his family and companions, possessors of charity and morals. This noble language book was completed in Qusṭanṭinīyah (Constantinople/Istanbul), may it be protected from distress and calamity, in the beginnings of glorious Shaʻbān, at Saturday night, by the hand of the feeble servant, the wretched and debilitated, who aspires to the mercy of his Gracious Lord, and the intercession of His Noble Prophet, he of the little stature and the great offence, Muḥammad ibn Muṣṭafá, may God forgive him and his parents, perfume their earth, make Paradise their abode, and be kind to them and to all Muslims and believers, men and women. May God pray upon our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions. Copied in the year 982 [30 November 1574]."

record.title: 880-02 Taqrīrāt jalīyah wa-taḥqīqāt sanīyah : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Ghumrāwī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ḥamdan li-man rafaʻa bi-al-ʻilm maqām man naḥá naḥwa ḥimāh, wa-naṣaba qawām man khafaḍa janāḥahu li-ʻulāh, fa-aʻraba ʻan ḍamīrihi, wa-ṣarafa juhdahu fī naẓīrihi, fa-baná ʻalá al-ṭāʻah fī al-ḥāl, wa-ṣaḥḥaḥa maksūr al-maqāl ... Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi 'Taqrīrāt jalīyah wa-taḥqīqāt thanīyah [sanīyah]', li-muʼallifihā al-murtajī min Rabbihi ghufrān al-masāwī, al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Ghumrāwī, ʻalá ḥāshiyat al-Sayyid Muḥammad Abī al-Najā, ʻalá sharḥ al-Shaykh Khālid, arjū min Allāh taʻālá an yanfaʻa bihā kamā nafaʻa bi-aṣlihā ..."
Secundo folio: al-naḥw ʻilm bi-uṣūl yuʻrafu bihā aḥwāl al-kalimāt.
17 x 25 cm; written surface: 9.5-14.5 x 17.5-21.5 cm; 21-27 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; dark brown leather on spine and flap; in 21 unnumbered quires.
The manuscript is written in different hands, in medium to large fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
Folios 89b-93b are blank.
On folio 219b: A reader's note: "ʻInda al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Ruṭbī. Taghyīruhu [?] min hādhā al-taqrīr."

Author's colophon: "Wāfaqa al-farāgh min tabyīḍihi baʻda ṣalāt al-ʻaṣr, yawm al-Jumʻah, li-arbaʻ ʻashrah baqiyat min Rajab al-mubārak, sanat sittah wa-thamānīn wa-miʼatayn baʻda al-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad jāmiʻihi al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Muḥammad Muḥammad al-Ghumrāwī, ghafara Allāh la-hu, wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-mashāyikhihi, wa-muḥibbīhi, wa-ikhwānihi. Wa-arjū mimman raʼāhu, aw ṭālaʻa fīhi, an yaqraʼa al-Fātiḥah, wa-yahaba thawābahā li-jāmiʻihi. Subḥāna Rabbika Rabbi al-ʻIzzati ʻammā yaṣifūn, wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh wa-sallama wa-bāraka ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi <wa-sallam>."

Translation of the author's colophon: "The fair copy was completed after the afternoon prayer, on Friday, fourteen days remaining from blessed Rajab, of the year 1286 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and the most perfect peace be upon Him, by the hand of it compiler, the wretched poor, who admits his shortcoming and inadequacy, ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Muḥammad Muḥammad al-Ghumrāwī, may God forgive him, his parents, his shaykhs, his loved ones, and his brethren. I request from him who looks at it or reads it, to recite 'al-Fātiḥah', and to grant its reward to the compiler. Praise be to thy Lord, the Lord of Might, far is He from what they falsely ascribe to Him. May peace be upon the messengers, and praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May God pray, grant peace, and bless our Master Muḥammad, his family, and his companions <and grant them peace>."

record.title: 880-01 Alf laylah wa-laylah. Al-Juzʼ 8 : manuscript.
record.note: Title from the label pasted to the front cover.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with "... yā annhum yunajjūnī, aw yusakkirūnī wa-yatrukūnī, ḥattá innī aghīb ʻan al-wujūd, wa-yaqūmū yaʼkhudhū al-khātam min iṣbiʻī, wa-yuqsimū ʻalayk bi-mā huwa maktūb ʻalá al-khātam, fa-taḥḍur, wa-rubbamā annahum yaʼmurūk fa-taqtulunī, aw tarmīnī fī bilād baʻīdah, wa-fī al-baḥr. Fa-ʻinda dhālika nataʻa al-ṣabī ʻalá kāhilihi, wa-lammā dabbahu ilá ʻanān al-samāʼ wa-lam yazāl ṭāyir bi-hi ilá an ramāh fī balad min al-buldān ..."
Secundo folio: ilayhā wa-akhraja al-khātam wa-aqsama ʻalá Maymūn.
10.5 x 15 cm; written surface: 8 x 12; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; dark brown leather on spine.
Script: In clear large clear naskh script, in black ink on white paper; catchwords.
Three slips of notes, in English and Arabic, are laid in about the contents of the stories in the codex.
On the label pasted to the front cover: "al-Juzw al-thāmin min sīrat Alf laylah wa-laylah."
Inside the front cover: A reader's statement, dated in the year 1251 of the Hijrah (1835/1836), as follows: "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammal maʻāniyahu al-Ḥājj Muḥammad, sanat 1251."
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Juzʼ al-thāmin min sīrat Alf laylah wa-laylah, wa-huwa min kutub al-Ḥājj Aḥmad al-Rabbāṭ al-Ḥalabī. M."

On folio 1a: A reader's statement, dated 22 Rajab, of the year 1266 of the Hijrah (3 June 1850), as follows: "Naẓara fī hādhā al-kitāb Amīr Ballūṭ Muḥammad Afandī min al-ʻAmārah, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayhi, wa-ʻalá kull man. Fī 22 Rajab, sanat 1266."

On folio 63a: Statements by three readers, as follows: 1. An ''obscenity". 2. Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-Karīm, al-Ḥājj Muḥammad, sanat 1251 [1835/1836]." 3. "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr al-Sayyid al-Ḥājj ʻAbd Allāh, wa-shahida wa-aqarra wa-qāl: 'Lā ilāha illā Allāh, Sayyidunā Muḥammad Rasūl Allāh, ṣallā Allāh ʻalayhi wa-salām [wa-sallam]. Khitām Muḥarram al-ḥarām, sanat 1263 [18 January 1847]. al-Rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-Karīm."

On folio 63b: A reader's statement: "Naẓara fī hādhā al-kitāb al-Sayyid Aḥmad Wahbah al-ʻAṭṭār, fī 18 R 1 [Rabīʻ al-Awwal], sanat 1269 [30 December 1852]." And a statement in Ottoman Turkish, dated 22 Rajab, of the year 1266 of the Hijrah (3 June 1850).

The text ends with: "... fa-ṣarakhtu ṣawt min ṣamīm fuʼādī, wa-idhā bi-al-jāriyah dākhilah ʻalay, wa-hiya tabkī wa-taṣrukh, wa-qālat lī: Yā Sayyidī, ummuka ṭalabat al-ʻashāʼ fa-sakabnā la-hā, wa-idhā bi-bint ʻammika dākhilah, wa-lā aʻrifu mā waḍaʻat fī al-ṭaʻām, fa-ḥaṭṭaytu al-ṣufrah quddāmahā, fa-akalat, awwal luqmah dhahaba laḥmuhā ʻan ʻaẓmihā, fa-shilnā al-ṣufrah min quddāmihā ilá al-maṭbakh, wa-qad iltaqaynā bi-ummika, fa-rajiʻtu anā ilá al-maṭbakh lā anẓuru ilá al-ṣufrah min khawfī, lā aḥad yaʼkul minhā, fa-mā raʼaytuhā, fa-saʼaltu ʻanhā, fa-qālū lī ʻammuk [?]."
Colophon: "Wa-tamma al-kitāb bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá."
Translation of the colophon: "The book was completed by the praise of God Almighty."

record.title: Treatise on Islamic law : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts wirh: "... li-annahu akh li-ibnihā min al-raḍāʻah wa-laysa li-ibn li-zawjihā, fa-yuḥarram ka-al-nasab, wa-tubāḥu ummuhu la-hu min al-nasab wa-akhtuhu min al-raḍāʻ, li-anna ummuhu tubāḥu li-abīh min al-nasab, fa-ka-dhālika min al-raḍāʻ, wa-akhīhi min al-nasab li-annahā ukht li-abīhi, wa-lā raḍāʻ baynahumā, wa-laysat ummuhā zawjah la-hu, fa-yuḥarramu bi-dhālika kamā fī al-nasab, wa-kadhālika tubāḥu ummuhu min al-nasab wa-ukhtuhu minhu li-akhīhi min al-raḍāʻ, li-annahu lā raḍāʻ baynahumā kamā sabaqa, fa-yubāḥān la-hu ka-dhālika. Qāla, raḥimahu Allāh: Wa-man arḍaʻat bi-laban walad zinā, aw al-manfī bi-al-liʻān ṭiflan ṣāra waladahā min al-raḍāʻah, wa-lam yaṣir waladan lil-zānī wa-al-mulāʻan, wa-qīla yaṣīru waladan lahumā, wa-qīla yaṣiru waladan lil-zānī dūna al-mulāʻan ..."
Secundo folio: al-waḍʻ lam yazid wa-lam yanquṣ fa-innah yakūnu lahumā fī al-manṣūṣ ʻalá mā ḥakāhu al-muṣannif.
18.5 x 26.4 cm; written surface: 13.5 x 19 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.

In large fair naskh script, in black ink, on thick cream color paper (some reddish); few notes and corrections on the margins; some headings in red and some in large bold script; includes some inserts; catchwords.

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh taʻālá aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah, wa-ṣalawātuhu ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi, wa-sallam [wa-salāmun] ʻalá asḥāb Rasūl Allāh ajmaʻīn, wa-raḍiya Allāh ʻanhum ajmaʻīn." Under the colophon in a diffeerent hand: "Wujida fī al-nuskhah al-manqūl minhā: 'Idh yassara Allāh taʻālá li-itmām hādhā al-kitāb, bi-annī muʻtarif min nafsī bi-al-quṣūr, wa-annī lastu ahlan lil-taṣnīf, lākin qad jamaʻtu fīhi min kutub aṣḥābinā min al-adillah wa-al-taʻlīl bi-mā waṣala ilayhi juhdī, wa-awdaʻtuhu min al-īḍāḥ ḥaythu [ḥasba] ṭāqatī'. Fa-idhā [... ... ...] wa-anʻāmihi wa-alṭāfihi al-wāṣilah lī [... ... ...] dhālika, wa-iṣlāḥ al-khalal, in shāʼa Allāh. [... ... ...]. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "But God Almighty is more knowledgeable of what is correct. Praise be to God alone. May His prayers be on our Master Muḥammad, and on his family and companions. Peace be upon all the companions of the Messenger of God; may God be pleased with them all." Under the colophon in a different hand: "It was found in the copy from which the transcription was made: 'As God Almighty facilitated the completion of this book, I admit the insufficiency of my effort, and that I am not qualified for authorship. I only collected in it, from the books of our companions, evidence and explanation, according to what my effort reached, and deposited in it clarification according to my ability'. Then [... ... ...] His blessings and graciousness bestowed upon me [... ... ...] that, and to fix the defect, God willing [... ... ...]. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-03 Lubāb al-taʼwīl fī maʻānī al-tanzīl : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Khāzin al-Baghdādī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... mā fahimū min al-Qurʼān takallamū fī maʻānīhi, wa-qad daʻā al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, li-Ibn ʻAbbās, fa-qāl: Allāhumma faqihhu fī al-dīn wa-ʻallimhu al-taʼwīl, fa-kāna akthar mā nuqila ʻanhu <wa> al-tafsīr. Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Q. ʻAn Abī Mūsá al-Ashʻarī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, qāl: Qāla Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Taʻāhadū hādhā al-Qurʼān, fa-wa-alladhī nafsu Muḥammadin bi-yadih, fa-huwa ashaddu tafallutan min al-ibil fī ʻaqlihā. Q. ʻAn Ibn ʻUmar, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, anna Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, qāl: Innamā mathal ṣāḥib al-Qurʼān ka-mathal ṣāḥib al-ibil al-muʻqalah, in taʻāhada ʻalayhā amsakahā, wa-in aṭlaqahā dhahabat al-ibil al-muʻqalah allatī ḥubisat bi-al-ʻiqāl. Wa-hādhā mathal ḍarabahu li-ṣāḥib al-Qurʼān, fa-fīhi al-ḥathth ʻalá taʻāhudihi bi-kathrat al-tilāwah wa-al-takrār li-allā yunsá ..."
Secundo folio: nasakhū, wa-amara bi-mā siwá dhālika min al-Qurʼān fī kull ṣaḥīfah an yuḥraqa.

Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min kitābatihi fī al-dār al-wāqiʻ bi-qurb jisr nahrī Jihān, al-wāqiʻ fī dār al-naṣr wa-al-maymanah Adirnah al-maḥmīyah, wa-dhālika fī awākhir shahr Shaʻbān, sanat khams wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼah wa-alf."

Translation of the Colophon: "Copied by the poor Ibrāhīm, may God forgive him, his parents, his teacher, and all the copyists of the Qurʼān. record.title: 880-01 Qiṣṣat Tawaddud al-Jāriyah : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.

Wa-qīl: Taʻlamu ghaybatī wa-lā aʻlamu ghaybataka. Qāla: Fa-mā taqūlina fī qawlihi taʻālá: Yā ayyuhā alladhīna āmanū lā tuḥarrimū ṭayyibāti mā aḥalla Allāh lakum. Qālat: Ḥaddathanī shaykhī, raḥimahu Allāh, ʻan al-Ḍaḥḥāk, annahu qāl, hum qawm min al-Muslimīn, qālū naqṭaʻau mudhākaratanā [madhākīranā] wa-nalbasu al-musūḥ, fa-nazalat hādhihi al-āyah. Wa-qāla Qatādah: Innahā nazalat fī jamāʻh min aṣḥāb Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, minhum ʻAlī, karrama Allāh wajhahu, wa-ʻUthmān, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu, qālū nakhṣī anfusanā wa-nalbasu al-shaʻr wa-natarahhab, fa-nazalat hādhihi al-āyah ..."
Secundo folio: wa-barakātin ʻalayka. Wa-al-āyah allatī fīhā miʼah wa-arbaʻūn ʻaynan.

record.title: 880-01 Kitāb Huwa al-Fattāḥ al-ʻAlīm : manuscript.
record.note: Title from folio 2b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla Muḥammad ibn Sallām: Ḥaddathanī rajul min Quraysh, qāl: Kharaja Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Ghashrī [al-Qasrī] yataṣayyadu, wa-huwa amīr al-ʻIrāq, fa-infarad min aṣḥābihi, fa-idhā huwa bi-Aʻrābī, ʻalá atānin la-hu, hazīl, wa-maʻahu ʻajūz, qāl: Fa-qāla la-hu Khālid: Mimman al-rajul. Qāl: Min ahl al-maʼāthir wa-al-ḥasab wa-al-mafākhir. Qāl: Anata idhan min Muḍar, fa-min ayyihā anta. Qāl: Min al-ṭāʻinūn ʻalá al-khuyūl al-muʻāniqūn ʻinda al-nuzūl. Qāl: Anta idhan min ʻĀmir ..."
Secundo folio: idhan min Jaʻfar, fa-min ayyihā anta.
17 x 23 cm; written surface: 11 x 15.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In dark red leather binding; cover embossed with central medallion.
In large fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; few corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 2b: "Hādhā Kitāb Huwa al-Fattāḥ al-ʻAlīm. Yā Karīm."
On folio 104a: "Qad faragha ʻalá yad al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr Muḥammad Hāshim ibn Ḥājī ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Aylūdī/Īlūdī, tābiʻ Bastak."

Colophon: "Tammat. Tamām hādhā [al-]kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh [al-]Maliki al-Wahhāb, bi-qalam al-ḥaqīr al-faqīr, [al-muʻtarif] bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, Muḥammad Hāshim ibn Ḥājī ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Mullā Abū al-Qāsim Aylūdī/Īlūdī, tābiʻ Bastak, sanat 1277. Allāhumma ighfir lanā wa-li-wālidaynā, bi-ḥurmat Sayyid al-Mursalīn. Wa-al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "It is completed. This book was completed by the help of God the Abundant Giving King, by the hand of the wretched poor, [who admits his] guilt and negligence, Muḥammad Hāshim ibn Ḥājī ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Mullā Abū al-Qāsim Aylūdī/Īlūdī, tābiʻ Bastak, in the year 1277 [of the Hijrah = 1860/1861]. O God forgive us and our parents, for the sake of the Master of Messengers. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-01 Ḥikāyāt : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, Subḥān al-Awwal bi-lā bidāyah wa-al-Ākhir bi-lā nihāyah. Subḥāna man la-hu fī kull shayʼ āyah tadullu ʻalá annahu al-Wāḥid al-Aḥad, al-Fard al-Ṣamad, wa-law kāna la-hu sharīkun fī al-mulk la-infasad, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-Nabī al-mumajjad, khayr mā wujid fī al-dunyā wa-mā yūjad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn, min al-mubtadā ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-baʻd, Subḥāna man jaʻala siyar al-awwalīn ʻibratan wa-mawʻiẓatan lil-ākhirīn, fa-inna khayr al-nās al-ʻārifīn, fa-lā yuqāsū bi-al-jāhilīn. Wa-innī bi-ʻawn Allāh jamaʻtu min ḥakāyā al-sālifīn wa-nukat al-mustaẓrafīn ..."
Secundo folio: qāla taḥfaẓu al-Qurʼān. Qāla Naʻam.
10.5 x 15.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 12 cm; 14-15 lines per page.
Binding: Cover deteriorated; remnants of brown leather on cover and flap.
In large fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; each new tale starts with the phrase "Wa-ḥukiya" (and it was narrated); catchwords.
The collection starts with the story of al-Ḥajjāj and the boy, and ends with the story of al-Tiryāqī and his wife.

Inside the front cover: A statement by a reader/owner, dated Tuesday, 5 Jumād Awwal, 1216 of the Hijrah (13 September 1801), as follows: "Intaqalnā li-bayt Abū Aḥmad yawm al-Thulāth, 5 Jumād Awwal, sanat 1216", and some calculations.

On folio 1a: 1. An owner's statement (written twice): "Mulk al-faqīr Ḥusayn al-ʻUmarī." 2. A reader's statement: "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu al-Sayyid ʻUmar ibn al-Sayyid Muḥammad al-Sukkarrī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-[li-wālidayhi]. 3. Some calculations.

On folio 1b: The following statements: 1. "481". 2. "al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn." 3. An owner's statement: "Ṣāḥibuhu wa-mālikuhu Sayyid Shākir ibn Sayyid ʻAbd Allāh Āghā ibn Sūqīyah. Āmīn." 4. "Miʼah wa-thalāth ʻashar ḥikyah wa-nuktah wa-salām." 5. Partially legible statement about interest on a debt, as follows: "Fawāyid dayn Ḥasan Āghā al-Ḥamawī ilá Ibn al-Muhtār [...] muʼajjalah ilá tisʻ ashhur, min niṣf Rabīʻ al-Awwal [... ... ...] mutaʻāraf [... ... ...] bārūdah bilā [... ... ...] al-Afandī"

On folio 127a: The following readers' statements: 1. "Naẓara fīhi wa-tammala maʻniyahu [wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu] al-faqīr ilá al-Malik al-Jalīl, al-rajī [al-rājī] ʻafwa Rabb [Rabbihi] al-Qadīr, ʻĪd al-Sayyid Ismāʻīl ibn al-Ḥājj ʻĪsá Jarbaḥī [?], ghafara Allāh la-hu [wa-li-wālidayhi] wa-li-jamīʻ (?) Ummat Muḥammad, ṣallā Allāh ʻalayhi wa-al-salām [wa-sallam]. M M. Fī Muḥarram al-ḥarām, iftitāḥ sanat 1191 [9 February 1777]. 2. Naẓara fīhi Sayyid Shākir ibn Sayyid ʻAbd Allāh ibn Sūqīyah. Sanat 1203 [1788/1789]." 3. "Naẓara fīhi wa-tammala maʻniyahu [wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu] al-faqīr al-Sayyid Ḥasan ibn al-Sayyid ʻAlī [...] ibn al-Sayyid Ibrāhīm.". 4. Two partially legible readers' names.
On folio 127b. Partially legible 16 verses of Arabic dialectical poetry which seem to be a love song.

On folio 128a: A reader's statement: "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammal maʻāniyahu al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-mujīb, ʻabduhu Muḥammad ʻĪd ibn al-Ḥājj Fāris al-Mahāyinī, fī 23 Rabīʻ al-Thānī, sanat 1277 [8 November 1860]."
Colophon (folio 126b): "Tamma al-kitāb al-mustaẓraf, wa-yarjū muʼallifuhu raḥmat Allāh wa-istighfārahu bi-al-Fātiḥah, wa-lakum al-ajr wa-al-thawāb min al-Malik al-Wahhāb."

Translation of the colophon: "The elegant book is completed. Its author hopes for God's mercy and forgiveness, [requesting to recite for him] al-Fātiḥah, that you may have the reward and recompense from the Abundant Giving King."

1. Incipit of "Arbaʻūn Ḥadīthan jamaʻt qawāʻid al-Islām": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, qayyūm al-samāwāt wa-al-araḍīn, mudabbir al-khalāʼiq ajmaʻīn, bāʻith al-rusul, ṣalawātuhu wa-salāmuhu ʻalayhim ajmaʻīn, wa-ilá al-mukallafīn li-hidāyatihim, wa-bayān sharāʼiʻ al-dīn bi-al-dalāʼil al-qaṭʻīyah wa-wāḍiḥāt al-barāhīn ... Ammā baʻd ... wa-qad istakhartu Allāh taʻālá fī jamʻ arbaʻīn Ḥadīthan iqtidāʼan bi-hāʼulāʼ al-aʼimmah al-aʻlām wa-ḥuffāẓ al-Islām ..."
1. Secundo folio of "Arbaʻūn Ḥadīthan jamaʻt qawāʻid al-Islām": ṭuruq kathīrāt bi-riwāyāt mutanawwiʻāt.

2. Incipit of "Waṣīyat al-Imām al-Aʻẓam Abī Ḥanīfah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Kitāb 'Waṣīyat al-Imām al-Aʻẓam Abī Ḥanīfah', raḥimahu Allāh li-aṣḥābihi, ruḍwān Allāh ʻalayhim ajmaʻīn, ʻalá madhhab Ahl al-Sunnah wa-al-Jamāʻah. Lammā mariḍa Abū Ḥanīfah, raḥimahu Allāh, qāl: Iʻlamū, aṣḥābī wa-ikhwānī, inna madhhab Ahl al-Sunnah wa-al-Jamāʻah ʻalá ithnatā ʻashrah khiṣlah ..."
2. Secundo folio of "Waṣīyat al-Imām al-Aʻẓam Abī Ḥanīfah": wa-maḥabbatihi wa-riḍāʼihi wa-qaḍāʼihi wa-qadarih.

3. Incipit of "Ḥikāyat al-Ṣabī maʻa al-Ḥajjāj": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Hādhihi Ḥikāyat al-ṣabī maʻa al-Ḥajjāj, wa-kāna rajul saffāk al-dimāʼ, fa-arāda an yaqtula al-ṣabī, fa-qāla la-hu: Min ayna anta yā ṣabī. Fa-qāla: Min al-Shām. Qāl: Anta min anḥas al-bilād ..."
3. Secundo folio of "Ḥikāyat al-Ṣabī maʻa al-Ḥajjāj": ʻinda qawmin ḥamawhu wa-naṣarūhu ʻalá raghmi anfik.

4. Incipit of "Kitāb sharīf wa-majmūʻ laṭīf yaḥwī kull maʻná ẓarīf wa-faḍl munīf": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ʻāqibah lil-muttaqīn, wa-lā ʻudwān illā ʻalá kull jabbār min al-ẓālimīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh taʻālá wa-sallama ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā 'Kitāb sharīf wa-majmūʻ laṭīf yaḥwī kull maʻná ẓarīf wa-faḍl munīf', nafaʻanā Allāh taʻālá bi-hi, mālikahu, wa-qāriyahu, wa-kātibahu, wa-sāmiʻahu, wa-man ittaʻaẓa bi-hi wa-ʻamila bi-mā fīhi ..."
4. Secundo folio of "Kitāb sharīf wa-majmūʻ laṭīf yaḥwī kull maʻná ẓarīf wa-faḍl munīf": ṭamaʻan ka-mudkhilin yadahu fī fami thuʻbānī.

5. Incipit of "Ḥadīths and traditions": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Man qaraʼa Sūrat al-Ḍuḥá kāna la-hu min al-ajr mithāl man waqafa bi-Miná wa-ʻArafāt, wa-idhā qaraʼahā ʻalá ism al-ghāʼib wajaʻa [rajiʻa] ilá manzilihi wa-waṭanihi sāliman fī asraʻ waqt, wa-idhā qaraʼa ʻalá shayʼ athīth qad nasiya ṣāḥibuhu fa-yaʻrifu mawḍiʻahu, wa-man ḍāʻa la-hu ḍāʼiʻ wa-qaraʼahā sabʻ marrāt wajadahu ..."
5. Secundo folio of "Ḥadīths and traditions": ʻalá mā yakhāfu min al-ṭaʻām ṣarafa Allāh ʻanhu mā yuʼdhīh.

6. Incipit of "Muʻjizāt al-Nabī": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Bāb Muʻjizāt al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-hiya tisʻat muʻjizāt. al-Ūlá: Samiʻtu annā [anna] Abā Jahl, laʻanahu Allāh taʻālá, lam yazal yuʻādī al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-yuʼdhīhi, wa-yuwallifu ʻalayhi man yuʼdhīhi, fa-akhadha yawman jamāʻatan min ashrāf Quraysh, thumma dakhala bihim ilá Abī Ṭālib ..."
6. Secundo folio of "Muʻjizāt al-Nabī": ʻamm al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam.

7. Incipit of "Qiṣṣat al-ruhbān wa-al-ṭuyūr wa-al-mamsūkhīn": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi 'Qiṣṣat al-rāhib wa-al-ruhbān, wa-ḥadīth al-ṭuyūr, wa-ḥadīth al-mamsūkhīn, wa-kam kānū, wa-ayy [wa-li-ayy] dhanb masakhahum Allāh taʻālá', ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl ..."
7. Secundo folio of "Qiṣṣat al-ruhbān wa-al-ṭuyūr wa-al-mamsūkhīn": al-Dhāriyāt mā hunna wa-ʻan al-Jāriyāt mā hunna.

8. Incipit of "Faṣal fī faḍl Sūrat al-Qadr": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. 'Faṣl fī faḍl Sūrat al-Qadr'. ʻAn ʻAlī, raḍiya Allāh [ʻanhu] wa-karrama wajhahu, annahu qāl: 'Man qaraʼa Sūrat al-Qadr sabʻ marrāt baʻda al-ʻishāʼ ʻafāhu Allāh min kull balāʼ ḥattá yuṣbiḥ, wa-ṣallá ʻalayhi sabʻūna alf malak wa-daʻaw la-hu bi-al-Jannah, wa-shayyaʻahu ilá qabrihi sabʻūna alf malak ilá al-Mawqif, yazuffūnahu zaffan, wa-yubashshirūnahu bi-anna Allāh ʻanhu raḍī ..."
8. Secundo folio of "Faṣal fī faḍl Sūrat al-Qadr": wa-jīrānihi, wa-ṣāfaḥathu al-malāʼikah ḥattá yakhruja min qabrih.

9. Incipit of "Faḍl al-dīk al-abyaḍ": "ʻAn Muʻādh ibn Jabal, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, ʻan Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, annahu qāla fī faḍl al-dīk al-abyaḍī [al-abyaḍ]: Qāla al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Khalaqa Allāh taʻālá dīkan taḥta al-ʻarsh wāqifan ʻalá qubbah min al-yāqūt al-akhḍar, wa-li-tilka al-qubbah ʻāmūdayn min al-nūr, wa-ʻalá al-dīk sabʻumiʼat alf janāḥ ʻan yasārihi min zabarjad wa-ʻanbar wa-zaʻfarān, maktūb ʻalá kull janāḥ 'Lā ilāha illā Allāh Muḥammad Rasūl Allāh', wa-qad nahá Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, ʻan qatl al-dīk al-abyaḍ, wa-qāl: Lātadhbaḥūhu, fa-inna al-dīk al-abyaḍ ṣadīq Allāh wa-ṣadīqī ..."
9. Secundo folio of "Faḍl al-dīk al-abyaḍ": tanaḥḥá ʻanhu wa-law ʻalimtum mā lakum fī al-dīk al-abyaḍ lakuntum tashrūna[hu] bi-waznihi dhahaban.

10. Incipit of "Qiṣṣat al-Aʻrābī maʻa al-Nabī": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Ruwiya ʻan Ibn ʻAbbās, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhumā, annahu qāl: Qāla Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Ṣallá binā ṣalāt al-ṣubḥ, thumma jalasa wa-asnada ẓahrahu ilá miḥrābihi al-sharīf, idh aqbala ʻalayhi Aʻrābī min al-barrīyah, ʻalá jasadihi farwah, wa-ʻalá raʼsihi ṭāqīyah muqaṭṭaʻah, wa-huwa yanqulu khaṭwahu musriʻan, ilá an waqafa bi-bāb al-masjid ..."
10. Secundo folio of "Qiṣṣat al-Aʻrābī maʻa al-Nabī": wa-al-wajh al-munīr, dhāka Muḥammadun Sayyid al-Awwalīn wa-al-Ākhirīn.

11. Incipit of "Fawāʼid ʻaẓīmah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi 'Fawāʼid ʻaẓīmah', yudhkaru fīhā ṣalāt al-layl wa-al-nahār, fa-aqūlu, wa-billāh al-tawfīq: Ṣalāt yawm al-Aḥad. ʻAn Abī Hurayrah, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, annahu qāl: Qāla Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Man ṣallá yawm al-Aḥad arbaʻ rakʻāt, yaqraʼu al-Fātiḥah fī al-rakʻah al-ūlá, wa-Āman al-Rasūlu bimā unzila ilayhi min Rabbihi ..."
11. Secundo folio of "Fawāʼid ʻaẓīmah": billāh wa-malāʼikatihi wa-kutubihi wa-rusulihi.

12. Incipit of "Ṣalāt al-layl": "Ṣalāt al-layl ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Ṣalāt laylat al-Aḥad. Ruwiya ʻan Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, annahu qāl: Man ṣallá laylat al-Aḥad sitt rakʻāt, yaqraʼu fī kull rakʻah al-Fātiḥah marrah, wa-al-Ikhlāṣ sabʻ marrāt, aʻṭāhu Allāh thawāb shukr al-shākirīn wa-al-ṣābirīn wa-aʻmāl al-muttaqīn, wa-kataba la-hu ʻibādat arbaʻīn sanah ..."
12. Secundo folio of "Ṣalāt al-layl": al-ʻamal, ghafara Allāh laka mā taqddama min dhanbika wa-mā taʼakhkhar.

13. Incipit of "Ṣalāt al-istikhārah": "Hādhihi Ṣalāt al-istikhārah. Man hamma bi-amr wa-lam yadrī [yadri] in fiʻluhu aw tarkuhu, khayran la-hu aw sharran la-hu fī ruʼyatihi, fa-qad amar al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, an yuṣalliya rakʻatayn, yaqraʼu fī al-rakʻah al-ūlá Fātiḥat al-Kitāb marrah, wa-Qul Yā ayyuhā al-kāfirūn fī awwal rakʻah ..."
13. Secundo folio of "Ṣalāt al-istikhārah": Innī astakhīruka bi-ʻilmika wa-astaqdiruka bi-qudratik.

14. Incipit of "Miscellaneous anecdotes": "Qāla al-Faḍl ibn ʻIyāḍī [ʻIyāḍ], ʻan al-Awzāʻī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, qāl: Marra Masyarah [Maysarah] bi-al-maqbarah yawman min al-ayyām, fa-qāl: al-Salāmu ʻalaykum yā ahla al-qubūr, antum lanā salafan wa-naḥnu lakum nafaʻan [tabaʻan], fa-raḥimanā Allāh wa-īyākum, wa-ghafara Allāh lanā wa-lakum fī al-qudūm ʻalayhi, idhā ṣirnā mā ṣrtum ilayhi. Qāl: Fa-radda, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, al-rūḥ fī wāḥidin minhum, fa-ajābahu bi-lisānin faṣīḥ ..."
14. Secundo folio of "Miscellaneous anecdotes": fī al-arḍ illā ʻalá Allāh rizquhā.

15. Incipit of "Miscellaneous quotations": "al-Qawl ʻinda lubs al-thawb al-jadīd: al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī kasānī hādhā wa-razaqanī (qinyatan) min ghayr ḥawl minnī wa-lā qūwah. Wa-man ṣallá ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, laylata al-Jumʻah, thamānīna marratan, ghafara Allāh la-hu dhunūb miʼatay ʻām mutaqaddimah wa-miʼat ʻām mutaʼakhkhirah ..."
15. Secundo folio of "Miscellaneous quotations": bi-ʻadad waraq hādhā [hādhihi] al-ashjār.

16. Incipit of "Miscellaneous anecdotes in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish": "al-Nīl al-mubārak, laysa fī al-dunyā aṭwal minhu, li-annahu masīrat shahrīn fī al-Islām, wa-shahrayn fī al-kufr, wa-shahrayn fī al-barrīyah, wa-arbaʻat ashhur fī al-kharāb, wa-makhrajuhu min bilād Jabal al-Qamar khalq [khalf] khaṭṭ al-istiwāʼ ..."
16. Secundo folio of "Miscellaneous anecdotes in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish": wa-khawāṣṣihā. Ḥaká al-Masʻūdī anna Ādam, ʻalayhi al-salām.

17. Incipit of "Waṣīyat al-Suhrawardī": "Hādhihi waṣīyat Shaykhinā, shaykh al-shuyūkh, Shihāb al-Dīn al-Suhrawardī, qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu, wa-awṣala ilaynā futūḥahu. "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Waṣṣá bihā ibnahu wa-murādahu, huwa wa-man kāna murīdahu, ḥuḍūran aw ghaybatan, ilá Yawm al-Qiyāmah. Yā bunayy, ūṣīka bi-taqwá Allāh wa-khishyatih, wa-luzūm ḥaqq Allāh wa-ḥaqq Rasūlihi, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ḥaqq al-dīn, wa-ḥaqq al-m̄ashāyikh ajmaʻīn ..."
17. Secundo folio of "Waṣīyat al-Suhrawardī": waḍaʻahu Allāh, wa-ʻalayka bi-al-adab fī jamīʻ al-aḥwāl.

18. Incipit of "Anecdotes in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish": "Warada fī al-khabar anna Qayṣar malik al-Rūm kataba ilá ʻUmar ibn al-Khaṭṭāb, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, kitāban fīhi: 'Innā najidu fī al-Injīl anna man qaraʼa sūratan khāliyah ʻan sabʻat aḥruf fa-lahu al-Jannah, wa-hiya: al-Tāʼ, wa-al-Jīm, wa-al-Khāʼ, wa-al-Zāʼ, wa-al-Shīn, wa-al-Ẓāʼ, wa-al-Fāʼ, fa-qad ṭalabnāhā fī al-Injīl, fa-lam najid, fa-unẓurū fī Kitābikum ..."
18. Secundo folio of "Anecdotes in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish": yaḥtāju al-ʻilāj. Wa-qāl arbaʻah min al-naṣāʼiḥ.

1. Colophon of "Arbaʻūn Ḥadīthan jamaʻt qawāʻid al-Islām": "Wa-hādhā ākhir <wa> mā qaṣadtuhu min bayān al-Aḥādīth allatī jamaʻat qawāʻid al-Islām wa-taḍammanat mā lā yuḥṣá min anwāʻ al-ʻulūm fī al-uṣūl wa-al-furūʻ wa-al-adāb wa-sāʼir wujūh al-aḥkām. Wa-lillāh al-ḥamd awwalan wa-ākhiran, wa-ẓāhiran wa-bāṭinan. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn."

1. Translation of the colophon of "Arbaʻūn Ḥadīthan jamaʻt qawāʻid al-Islām": "This is the end of what I intended by the exposition of the Ḥadīths which summarized the doctrines of Islam, and included uncountable different sciences, the essentials among them and the subsidiaries, in addition to decorum literature and various laws. Praise be to God in the beginning and at the end, explicitly and implicitly. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and his companions and grant them abundant peace until Judgement Day."

2. Colophon of "Waṣīyat al-Imām al-Aʻẓam Abī Ḥanīfah": "Tammat al-waṣīyah bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tamma wa-kamula. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."

2. Translation of the colophon of "Waṣīyat al-Imām al-Aʻẓam Abī Ḥanīfah": "The testimony was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and on his companions, and grant them abundant peace until Judgement Day. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. It is concluded and completed. But God is more knowledgeable."
3. Colophon of "Ḥikāyat al-Ṣabī maʻa al-Ḥajjāj": "Tammat al-qiṣṣah bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih. Tamm."
3. Translation of the colophon of "Ḥikāyat al-Ṣabī maʻa al-Ḥajjāj": "The story was completed by the praise of God and His help. It is completed."

4. Colophon of "Kitāb sharīf wa-majmūʻ laṭīf yaḥwī kull maʻná ẓarīf wa-faḍl munīf": "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Man lā nabī baʻdah, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Tamm."

4. Translation of the colophon of "Kitāb sharīf wa-majmūʻ laṭīf yaḥwī kull maʻná ẓarīf wa-faḍl munīf": "Praise be to God alone. May God pray on Him who no prophet comes after Him, on His family, and all His companions. God suffices us, He is the best advocate. It is completed."
5. Colophon of "Ḥadīths and traditions": "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá."
5. Translation of the colophon of "Ḥadīths and traditions": "It was completed by the praise of God Almighty."
6. Colophon of "Muʻjizāt al-Nabī": "Tammat bi-Muʻjizāt [Muʻjizāt] al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam."
6. Translation of "Muʻjizāt al-Nabī": "The Miracles of the Prophet, God's prayer and peace be upon him, are completed."

7. Colophon of "Qiṣṣat al-ruhbān wa-al-ṭuyūr wa-al-mamsūkhīn": "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, Sayyid al-Sādāt, wa-maʻdin al-faḍl wa-al-siyādāt, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tammat 'Qiṣṣat al-ruhbān'."

7. Translation of the colophon of "Qiṣṣat al-ruhbān wa-al-ṭuyūr wa-al-mamsūkhīn": "Praise be to God for everything. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, the Master of Masters, and the essence of virtue and suzerainty, may God's prayer and peace bi upon him, on his family, and on his companions. The 'Story of the monks' is completed."
8. Colophon of "Faṣal fī faḍl Sūrat al-Qadr": "Tammat."
8. Translation of the colophon of "Faṣal fī faḍl Sūrat al-Qadr": "It is completed."
9. Colophon of "Faḍl al-dīk al-abyaḍ": "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl."
9. Translation of the colophon of "Faḍl al-dīk al-abyaḍ": "It was completed by the praise of God and His help. Praise be to God for everything."
10. Colophon of "Qiṣṣat al-Aʻrābī maʻa al-Nabī": "Tammat."
10. Translation of the colophon of "Qiṣṣat al-Aʻrābī maʻa al-Nabī": "It is completed."
11. Colophon of "Fawāʼid ʻaẓīmah": "Tammat 'Ṣalāt al-nahār' ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl."
11. Translation of the colophon of "Fawāʼid ʻaẓīmah": "The 'Daytime prayer' is completed entirely and perfectly."

12. Colophon of "Ṣalāt al-layl": "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Ghafara Allāh li-kātibihi, wa-qārīhi, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

12. Translation of the colophon of "Ṣalāt al-layl": It was completed by the praise of God and His help. May God's prayer and peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and on his companions. May God forgive its copyist, its reader, and all Muslims. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe."
13. Colophon of "Ṣalāt al-istikhārah": "Wa-Allāh taʻālá al-muwaffiq lil-ṣawāb, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."
13. Translation of the colophon of "Ṣalāt al-istikhārah": "God Almighty is He who guides to success. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe."
14. Colophon of "Miscellaneous anecdotes": "Tammat."
14. Translation of the colophon of "Miscellaneous anecdotes": "It is completed."
15. Colophon of "Miscellaneous quotations": "Furigha min taʻlīqihā bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."
15. Translation of the colophon of "Miscellaneous quotations": "The copy was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. Praise be to God alone."

16. Colophon of "Miscellaneous anecdotes in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish": No colophon. Text ends with a statement in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish, as follows: "... wa-qāla Allāhu akbar, Allāhu akbar wa-lillāh al-ḥamd. Wa-li-hādha al-sabab yaqūlū: Jahār bīr wa-jahār takbīr. Wa-[Allāh] aʻlam."
17. Colophon of "Waṣīyat al-Suhrawardī": "Tammat al-risālah al-tabīhīyah [al-tanbīhīyah]."
17. Translation of the colophon of "Waṣīyat al-Suhrawardī": "The exhortative epistle is completed."
18. Colophon of "Anecdote in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish": "Tammat."
18. Translation of the colophon of "Anecdotes in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish": "It is completed."

record.title: Treatises on Islamic philosophy and logic : manuscript.
record.note: Title of the codex supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Manuscript 1: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... huwa kamm, wa-kadhā al-khaṭṭ lil-saṭḥ. Qawluhu: Fa-yalzam an yakūna al-jism al-muṣaghghar musāwiyan. Qāla dhālika al-baʻḍ. Hādhā al-luzūm bi-al-naẓar ilá al-musāwāh aw ilá al-lāmusāwah, fa-yalzamu an lā yutaṣawwar al-tasāwī bayna al-ajsām, fa-yalzamu an yaṭūla aw yaqṣura al-jism alladhī huwa miqdār bāshara ʻanhu ākhar kadhālika ..."
Secundo folio of Manuscript 1: taʻaqqul al-kunh yastalzimu taʻaqqul ijrāʼ al-māhīyah lā ijrāʼ al-wujūd.

Incipit of Manuscript 2: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... Qawluhu: Aṣbaḥat ismīyah, ilkh. Aqūlu: Yaʻnī al-wujūh al-thalāthah, tumsaku lahā al-nisbah, lil-awwal minhā anna al-fikr law afāda al-ʻilm fa-dhālika al-ʻilm al-ḥāṣil ʻaynuhu immā an yakūna ḍarūrīyan aw naẓīran [?] lil-awwal, li-anna kathīran mā yankashifu lil-nāẓir khilāf mā iʻtaqadahu, wa-law kāna ḍarūrīyan lamā kāna kadhālika, idh al-ḍarūrī lā yumkinu inqilābuhu, wa-al-thānī ayḍan muḥāl wa-illā la-iftaqara ilá naẓar ākhar, wa-al-kalām fī lāzim al-naẓar al-thānī, ay ka-al-kalām fī lāzim al-naẓar al-awwal ..."
Secundo folio of Manuscript 2: al-shayʼayn yastalzimu ḥuṣūluhumā fī al-dhihn.

Incipit of Manuscript 3: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... al-naẓar ʻammā baʻdahā li-kathrat istiʻmāl al-māhīyah fī al-kullīyāt, wa-immā maʻa mulāḥaẓat mā baʻdahā faqaṭ fī al-dalālah. Taʼammal. Qawluhu: Wājib ʻan hādhā al-dalīl, lahā taqrīr al-jawab anna al-inḍimām maʻa al-imtiyāz zamānan wa-in kāna mutaqaddiman ʻalayhi dhātan, wa-lā istiḥālah fī dhālik kamā fī ikhtiṣāṣ al-fuṣūl takhṣīṣ al-ajnās wa-tawḍīḥuhu ..."
Secundo folio of Manuscript 3: li-annahu yajūzu an yakūna nafs al-wujūb ay māhīyatahu.

Incipit of Manuscript 4: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... Ittafaqa akthar al-mutaʼakhkhirīn ʻalá anna al-ʻillah al-tāmmah laysat bi-mutaqaddimah ʻalá al-maʻlūl. Qāla ṣāḥib al-Mawāqif fī mabāḥith al-ʻillah wa-al-maʻlūl: Wa-ammā al-ʻillah al-tāmmah fa-majmūʻ umūr, kull wāḥid minhā mutaqaddim. Wa-ammā taqaddumm al-kull min ḥaythu huwa kull fa-fīhi naẓar, idh majmūʻ al-ajzāʼ ʻalá al-ajzāʼ [crossed over] al-māhīyah, fa-lā yutaṣawwaru taqaddumuhā ʻalá nafsihā faḍlan ʻanhā ..."
Secundo folio of Manuscript 4: irtibāṭ baynahumā wa-ammā kawnuhumā nafs al-maʻlūl.

Incipit of Manuscript 5: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... ʻan wāhib al-ṣūrah wa-lawlā anna al-ḥukm ṣūrah idrākīyah lamā ṣaḥḥa dhālika, li-annahu law kāna fiʻlan lamā kāna li-nuqṣānihi min al-wāhib, wa-dhālika li-anna al-taṣawwurāt al-mutaʻalliqah bi-al-nisbah wa-al-ṭarafayn ḥāṣilah qabla al-fikr, fa-law kāna al-ḥukm fiʻlan lahā la-kāna nisbatuhā ilayhi bi-al-ṣudūr ʻanhā, lā bi-al-qabūl min al-mabdaʼ al-fayyāḍ, wa-fīhi lā yantafiḍu dalīluhu ʻalá kawn al-ḥukm al-badīhī idrākan, Allāhumma illā an yuqāla bi-tamāthul al-ḥukm al-badīhī wa-al-kasbī, aw yuqālu ʻadam al-faṣl thābit ..."
Secundo folio of Manuscript 5: qīla innahu qasīm al-mutaṣawwurāt la-lazima iʻtibār indirājihimā taḥta aʻamm minhumā wa-lazima al-maḥdhūr al-mujtanab.
12.7 x 17.7 cm; written surface: varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: In cardboard binding; front cover missing.

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some of the phrases of the original text preceded by the word "Qāla" (He said), in red; markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On a laid in slip of paper (in pencil): "This is a commentary, as yet unidentified, on al-Baidawi's Ṭawāliʻ al-anwār. This section begins at page 62 of the lithograph edition of Istanbul 1305. GAL 418."
On folio 1a: Scribbles.
On folio 1b: Titles of books (some illegible).
On the upper left corner of folio 138a: "al-Sayyid ʻAlī ʻalá Sayyid al-Taṣawwurāt. Nāqiṣ."

Manuscript 1 ends as follows: "... fa-law kānat al-huyūlá mawjūdah bi-al-fiʻl mutaḥaṣṣilah mutashakhkhiṣah li-dhātihā lā taḥtāju fī tashakhkhuṣihā ilá ṣūrah, bal fī taḥaṣṣulihā bi-hi nawʻan yaḥtāju ilayhā, fa-qad ṣarraḥa bi-khilāfihi fī mabāḥith al-waḥdah wa-al-kathrah fa-lā yufīduhu, bal yakfī bi-hi ʻanhā."
Colophon of Manuscript 1: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi wa-ālihi al-kirām. Tammat bi-ʻawn Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb."
Translation of the colophon of Manuscript 1.: "Praise be to God on the completion. Prayer be upon His Prophet and His noble family. It was completed by the help of God the Abundant Giving King."

Colophon of Manuscript 2: "Wa-qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min kitābat hādhā al-kitāb, bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb, yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ, fī shahr Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, min shuhūr sanat khamsah w-tisʻīn wa-tisʻimiʼah, fī baldat [... (?)] al-maḥrūsah." At the upper left corner of folio 125b a note about the phrase "hādhā al-kitāb" in the colophon, as follows: "alladhī huwa Sharḥ al-Ṭawāliʻ li-Sayyid al-muḥaqqiqīn, quddisa sirruhu" (probably "Maṭāliʻ al-anẓār fī sharḥ Ṭawāliʻ al-anwār" of al-Jurjānī),

Translation of the colophon of Manuscript 2: "The copy of this book was completed, by the help of the Abundant Giving King, on Wednesday, in the month of Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, of the year 995 [of the Hijrah = 11 March 1587], in the protected city of [... (?)]. At the upper left corner of folio 125b a note about the phrase "hādhā al-kitāb" (this book) in the colophon, as follows: "which is 'Sharḥ al-Ṭawāliʻ' (Commentary on al-Ṭawāliʻ), of the Master of Authenticators, may his secret be sanctified." Probably The "ḥashiyah" (gloss) of al-Jurjānī on "al-Ṭawāliʻ", titled "Maṭāliʻ al-anẓār fī sharḥ Ṭawāliʻ al-anwār".

Colophon of Manuscript 3. No colophon. The text ends with: "... Qawluhu: al-Murād min al-ishtirāk la-hu. Hādhā jawāb ʻan suʼāl muqaddar, taqdīruhu inna al-mutabādar min al-ishtirāk al-ḥaqīqah, wa-min al-tashābuh al-tawāṭuʼ, wa-lima lā yajūzu an yakūna dalālatuhu ʻalá baʻḍ tilka al-maʻānī bi-al-majāz, wa-baʻḍuhā bi-al-ḥaqīqah, wa-an yakūna ʻalá baʻḍihā bi-al-tawāṭuʼ, wa-ʻalá baʻḍihā bi-al-tashkīk, fa-ajāb al-Sharīf bi-taʻmīm al-ishtirāk wa-al-tashābuh. Tadabbar. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

Colophon of Manuscript 4. No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... idh qad yatawaqqafu al-maʻlūl ʻalá sharṭ wujūdī aṣlan, wa-illā fa-al-tarkīb ʻalá taqdīr ʻadam taṣawwur al-māniʻ yakūnu faraḍīyan, lā ḥaqīqīyan. Hādhā baqiya hāhunā baḥth, wa-huwa anna al-maʻlūl kamā yatawaqqafu ʻalá dhāt al-fāʻil yatawaqqafu ʻalá imkān fāʻilīyatihi, wa-anna māhīyat al-mumkin ʻillat fāʻilīyatih, ʻalá anna iʻtibār al-ṣādir fī jānib al-maʻlūl lā yamnaʻu iʻtibārahu fī jānib al-ʻillah ayḍan, alā yurá anna kullan min al-juzʼ al-ṣūrī wa-al-māddī, maʻa annahu juzʼ min al-maʻlūl juzʼ min al-ʻillah al-tāmmah ayḍan, fa-law ..."

Colophon of Manuscript 5. No colophon. Text ends with: "... Qāla al-Ustādh al-mudaqqiq, rḥ [raḥimahu Allāh]: Inna al-murād bi-al-taʻyīn hāhunā al-taʻyīn al-nawʻī, aw kull ʻillah muʻayyanah bi-al-nawʻ, ka-al-nār mathalan tadullu ʻalá maʻlūl muʻayyan bi-al-nawʻ ka-al-ḥarārah al-mutaḥidah bi-al-nawʻ, lā tadullu ʻalá ʻillah muʻayyanah bi-al-nawʻ, qīla ʻalayhi fa-hādhā al-kalām mabnī ʻalá kawn al-ḥarārah al-thalāth, aʻnī al-nārīyah wa-al-shamsīyah wa-al-ḥarakīyah muttaḥidat al-nawʻ. Ujība bi-annahā kadhālika ʻalá mā sa-nubayyinu, wa-law salima fa-kalāmunā fī muṭlaq al-ḥarārah ghāyatuhu annahā yakūnu nawʻan iḍāfīyan, fa-qīla ʻalayhi: Inna al-nār mathalan nawʻ ḥaqīqī, fa-yalzamu iʻtibār al-taʻaddud fī al-naʻt ..."

record.title: Collection of folktales, anecdotes, and Ṣūfī poetry : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.

1.Incipit of the folktales: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Ḥukiya, Allāh aʻlam ʻan ghaybihi, wa-aḥkam, wa-alṭaf, wa-arḥam, fī mā maḍā wa-taqaddam, ʻan aḥādīth al-umam, huwa annahu altafaqa, Yā mustamiʻī al-kalām, wa-rāyiqīn al-adhhān, ilá rajul ṣayyād, yuqālu la-hu Sindibād. Yawm min al-ayyām akhadh al-shabak wa-ṭalab qāṣid al-baḥr ka-jārī al-ʻawāʼid. Fa-lammā waṣala Sindibād al-ṣayyād ilá ḥāffat al-baḥr armā ilá shabakatihi, wa-arāda an yajdhibahā, yaltaqīhā thaqīlah, fa-qāla fī ẓann bālihi annahā takūnu samakah min al-samak al-kibār, fa-badaʼa yasḥabu dhālika al-shabakah wa-yajurruhā ḥattá innahu aṭlaʻahā ilá al-barr ..."
1. Secundo folio of the folktales: afāqa min ghashwatihi yarfaʻu naẓarahu.

2. Incipit of the Ṣūfī poem of al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī: "Hādhihi Qaṣīdat al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī, qaddasa Allāh sirrahu wa-nafaʻanī bi-hi. Āmīn. Shahidtu bi-anna Allāh wālī al-wilāyatī // la-hu al-ḥukmu wa-al-taṣrīfu fī kullin li-ḥālatī. Saqāniya Rabbī min raḥīqi sharābihi // fa-askaranī ḥaqqan wa-himmtu bi-sakratī. Wa-mallakanī kulla al-bilādi wa-mā ḥawat // wa-kullu al-mulūki [mulūki] al-ʻālamīna raʻīyatī ..."
2. Secundo folio of the Ṣūfī poem of al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī: Anā kuntu fil-ʻalayā wa-nūru Muḥammadin.
10 x 14.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 13 cm; 19-25 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard cover with flap; dark red leather on spine and flap.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on bluish white paper; headings in purple; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb samar. Fīhi Ḥikāyat al-ṣayyād wa-al-qumqum, wa-al-samak al-mughannī, wa-al-malik wa-ibn al-tājir, wa-al-ṭillasm, wa-Qaṣīdat al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī, wa-fawāʼid, wa-ḥikāyāt wa-ghayruhu."
On folio 1a: An owner's statement, dated in the year 1279 of the Hijrah (1862/1863): "Min kutub ʻAlī Riḍā al-Ḥakawātī, bi-al-ʻAmārah, sanat 1279 [of the Hijrah = 1862/1863]."

1. Colophon of the folktales: The text ends with: "... Qāla al-rāwī: Qāla al-malik ilá Sindibād, wa-anta wazīrī, wa-hādhā baqā mithl waladī, wa-huwa yaḥkumu fī al-mulk ʻiwaḍī. Qāla al-rāwī: Thumma inna al-malik ajlasa dhālika al-ghulām yataʻāṭā fī al-aḥkām ʻalá kursī al-mulk, huwa wa-Sindibād wazīruhu al-akbar. Wa-ammā al-malik nazala ilá mawḍiʻ wa-qaʻada yaʻbudu Allāh subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá. Wa-hādhā mā jarā min al-akhbār, wa-kull man ʻalayhi dhanb yaqūlu: Astagfiru Allāh. Tammat."

2. Colophon of the Ṣūfī poem of al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī: The text ends with the following verses (mostly unmetered), as follows: "... Wajadtu Imām al-Mursalīna Muḥammadan // kallamtu Rabbī bi-lisāni al-ḥaqīqatī. Uʻammiduhā bi-dhikrin baʻda khulūwihā // wa-mā ghibtu illā ʻan ʻuyūnin uʻmiyatī. Fa-kun qādiran li-waqti Allāhi mukhliṣan // li-tabqá saʻīdan fī al-dunyā wa-Yawmi al-Qiyāmati. Wa-ṣallá [al-]Ilāhu bukratan wa-ʻashīyatan // ʻalá al-Muṣṭafá wa-al-āli [a]dhká taḥīyatī. Tammat."

record.title: Collection of folktales and miscellaneous anecdotes : manuscript.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn, al-ṭayib[īn] al-ṭāhirīn. Qāla al-rāwī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Wa-lammā taqābala Dhū al-Khimār ilá al-amām ʻalá al-Karrarī fī ḥawmat al-maydān, wa-jará la-hu min al-ḥarb al-shadīd mā jará, wa-baʻda dhālik ṭalaʻa Dh[ū] al-Khimār ilá al-amām bi-rumḥihi, fa-qām yadahu, ḥattá dakhala al-rumḥ taḥta bāṭih, ittaká fīhi, inkasar niṣfayn, hādhā wa-Dhū al-Khimār iswaddat al-dunyā fī ʻaynayhi wa-mā ʻād yanẓur bayna yadayhi ..."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement, dated 5 Jumādá al-Ūlá of the year 1279 of the Hijrah (29 October 1862): "Min kutub ʻAlī Riḍā al-Ḥakawātī, bi-al-ʻAmārah. Sanat 1279, Jā 5. Ishtirāʼ."

At the end of folio 18a: An ownership statement, dated 29 Jumādá al-ākhir of the year 1320 of the Hijrah (18 January 1893), as follows: "Tārīkh yawm ishtaraynāhum fī 29 Jumādá Ākhir, sanat 1310, alf wa-thalāthumiʼah wa-ʻashrah Hijrīyah. Ḥaqīr faqīr ilá [al-]Rabb al-Jalīl, Muḥammad ʻAlī ibn Ḥasan al-Miṣrī ʻArāyis."

1. Colophon (folio 18a): Text ends with: "... fa-lammā faraghat ummuhum min shiʻrihā, Yā Amīr al-Muʼminīn, fa-qumnā wa-hamamnā bi-tajhīz al-jāriyah, fa-ghassalatʹhā ummuhā wa-kaffanatʹhā, wa-ṣallaynā ʻalayhā wa-dafannāhā, raḥmat Allāh ʻalayhā wa-ʻalá amwāt al-Muslimīn. Fa-qumtu ʻalá ḥaylī wa-nāwaltuhā baqīyat ḥawāyij ibnihā wa-silāḥahu, wa-ṣabbartuhā ʻalá ibtilāhā wa-al-zamān, wa-inṣaraftu wa-anā mutaʻajjib min ṣidq nīyatihā maʻa Allāh taʻālá. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Sifr awwal. Sanat 1262."

Binding: In marbled cardboard.
In large good naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords.
The leaves were originally numbered 1-64 (in East Arabic/Indian numerals); folios 34, 37, 38, 41, 50, and 51 are missing. Some quires are numbered: 14, 15, 16, 17, 20.

The tale ends as follows: "... wa-ammā al-nisāʼ ḥazinū li-dhālika ḥuznan ʻaẓīman wa-nadimū ḥaythu lam tanfaʻhum al-nadāmah, wa-akhadhū jazāhum fī dhālika al-sijin dhī al-ʻāqibah wa-al-kurh al-rāyiḥah, al-qalīl al-uns. Wa-lam zālū fī halāk, nās baʻd nās, ilá an halakū jamīʻan fī al-sijn fī ayyām qalāʼil, wa-shāʻa khabaruhu fī mawāḍiʻ shattā."

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā mā intahá ilaynā min tamām al-khabar. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-kāna al-najāz min nuskhat hādhihi al-ḥikāyah al-mubārakah, nahār al-Khamīs awākhir [crossed over] fī intiṣāf shahr Shaʻbān, sanat alf wa-sabʻah wa-khamsīn lil-Hijrah al-Islāmīyah. Allāhumma [tammim (?)] al-ʻāqibah ilá khayr. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh dāʼiman."

Translation of the colophon: "This is what has reached us of the entire affair. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. This blessed copy was completed on Thursday, the end [crossed over], the middle of Shaʻbān, of the year 1057 of the Islamic Hijrah [15 September 1647]. O God end it well."

Secundo folio: li-ukht imraʼat akhī imraʼatihi.
13 x 20 cm; written surface: 8 x 11 cm; 9 lines per page.

In good naskh script, in black ink on cream color paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; some wormholes on the margins without loss of text; includes quotations in the Samaritan script; catchwords.
Folios 10b-11a are blank.

Colophon: No colophon. The text ends as follows: "... wa-mā anā khuṣūṣan bi-ṣadadihi min inshidhādh al-khāṭir wa-al-tafakkur, ʻalá ʻadad al-sāʻāt wa-tajdīd al-laḥaẓāt, fīmā qad āla al-amr ilayhi min al-khawf al-ẓāhir wa-al-wajal al-ḥāḍir wa-al-taraqqub limā yajibu li-ajlihi ʻalá jamīʻinā, al-inqiṭāʻ ilá Allāh taʻālá bi-al-nīyāt al-khāliṣāt, fī kifāyat al-maḥdhūr fīhi [...] māddah dhirāʻayhi, wa-Allāh yurshidunā limā yurḍīhi, wa-yulhimunā limā yazlufu ladayhi in shāʼa, wa-bi-hi al-thiqah wa-al-ʻawn, wa-ʻalayhi al-muʻtamad wa-al-muttakal fī jamīʻ al-umūr [space]. al-Ḥamdu lillāh waḥdahu, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-kafá, wa-niʻma al-wakīl [... ...] ʻumūm."

record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text strarts with: "... immā ʻalá annahu mawḍūʻ bi-al-waḍʻ al-shakhṣī, fa-hiya ʻaqlīyah ʻurfan. Qawluhu mathalan, mafʻūl li-fiʻl maḥdhūf, ay, umaththilu bi-Zayd mathalan, fa-mathaluhu ʻUmar, wa-Bakr, wa-Khālid, ilkh. Fa-inna qāʼim, ay mathalan ka-rāqid wa-qāʻid, ilkh, wa-musammá Zayd, al-dhāt al-mushakhkhaṣah, aw musammá qāʼim dhāt ittaṣafat bi-al-qiyām. Fa-idhā ʻurifa kull minhumā ʻalá infirādihi wa-sumiʻa wa-huwa Zayd qāʼim, ay wa-sumiʻa lafẓ Zayd qāʼim muʻraban bi-iʻrābihi al-makhṣūṣ ..."
Secundo folio: ʻan al-aqsām ay ḥālat kawn al-aqsām.
19 x 26.5 cm; written surface: 10.5-18 x 17.5-21.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two unnumbered quires).

In good naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings and markings in red; the phrases of the original preceded by the word "Qawluhu" (his saying) in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with: "... Qawluhu: Fa-al-iʻrāb ẓāhir, ay idhā lam yamnaʻ minhu māniʻ, ka-al-iḍāfah ilá yāʼ al-mutakallim, naḥwa jāʼa ghulāmī. Qawluhu: Wa-al-Yāʼ taqdīr [tuqaddaru] fīhā al-ḥarakah, ay al-ḍammah wa-al-kasrah wa-kadhā al-fatḥah al-thāniyah ʻan al-kasrah fīmā lā yanṣarifu, fa-tuqaddaru ʻalá al-Yāʼ, kamā taqaddama, fī naḥw marra marratan bi-jiwār, wa-ammā al-fatḥah fa-taẓharu li-khiffatihā kamā taqaddam, wa-kadhālika tuqaddaru al-ḍammah faqaṭ fī al-Wāw wa-al-Yāʼ fī al-fiʻl al-muḍāriʻ alladhī ākhiruhu Wāw aw Yāʼ, naḥwa yadʻū wa-yarmī, wa-taẓharu al-fatḥah ʻalayhā li-khiffatihā. [Qawluhu]: Talāthat aḥwāl, ḥāl tuqaddaru fīhi al-ḥarakah lil-istithqāl, wa-ḥāl taqaddaru fīhi lil-taʻadhdhur, wa-ḥāl taẓharu fīhi ḥaythu lā taqaddaru ..."

record.title: 880-01 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Tajrīd : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... hādhā al-taṣdīq wa-kull mā huwa min taṣawwurāt hādhā al-taṣdīq badīhī, fa-taṣawwur al-wujūd badīhī. Qulnā in aradta anna jamīʻ hādhihi al-taṣawwurāt bi-al-kunh badīhī, fa-mimma, wa-mādhakartahu min ḥuṣūl hādhā al-taṣdīq lil-bulh wa-al-ṣibyān lā yadullu ʻalayhi, wa-in aradta annahā bi-wajhin mā badīhī fa-lā nizāʻa fīhi. Wa-ammā buṭlān al-wajh al-thānī fa-li-annā namnaʻu anna al-wujūd mutaṣawwar bi-kunh ḥaqīqatih, wa-in arāda annahu mutaṣawwar bi-wajhin mā badīhī fa-lā najidu bi-hi nafʻan li-anna al-khilāf fī taṣawwur al-kunh ..."
Secundo folio: ajnabīyah hiya anna al-shayʼ lā yakūnu mawjūdan bi-wujūd ghayrihi wa-lā maʻdūman bi-ʻudm ghayrih.
12 x 20 cm; written surface: 6.5 x 12 cm; 22 lines per page.
Binding: In dark red leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion.

In small naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; some wormholes with some loss of text; three cards of notes laid in, in English and Arabic, about the manuscript; catchwords.
Inside the front cover: "Ḥāshiyat ... Mīrzā ... Tajrīd."

On folio 59b: A quotation from Ibn Sīnā (Avicena), as follows: "... ʻalá mā yuḥká ʻan Abī ʻAlī annahu suʼila ʻan hādhihi al-masʼalah, wa-qad kāna yaʼkulu al-mishmish, fa-qāla: al-Jāʻil lam yajʻal al-mishmish mishmishan bal al-mishmisha mawjūdan. Wa-qad yūjadu fī baʻḍ al-nusakh hunāka qawluhu, wa-yalḥaquhu wujūb lāḥiq, wa-qad sabaqa hādhā fī al-matn bi-ʻibārah ukhrá ..."

Text ends with: "... wa-yakfī fī wuqūʻihi tilka al-awlawīyah, fa-lā ḥājah ilá sabab, wa-wajhuhu mā sabaq min anna al-mumkin lā yakūnu aḥad ṭarafayhi awlá bi-hi li-dhātihi, wa-imtināʻ al-baqāʼ, bi-maʻná imtināʻ ijtimāʻ ajzāʼihi lā yaqtaḍī dhālika, wa-ʻalá taqdīr al-awlawīyah fī wuqūʻihi ʻalá mā sabaqa bayānunu. Wa-min al-ʻilal al-muʻaddah mā yuʼaddī ilá mithlihi ka-al-ḥarakah ilá muntaṣaf al-masāfah al-muʼaddīyah ilá al-ḥarakah ilá muntahāhā, aw khilāf, ka-al-ḥarakah al-muʼaddīyah ilá al-sukhūnah allatī hiya mukhālifah lil-ḥarakah aw ḍidduhā, ka-al-ḥarakah ilá fawq al-muʼaddīyah ilá al-ḥarakah ilá al-asfal, wa-al-iʻdād qarīb, ka-iʻdād al-janīn bi-al-nisbah ilá ṣūrat al-insānīyah, aw baʻīd ka-iʻdād al-nuṭfah bi-al-nisbah ilayhā. Wa-min al-ʻilal al-ʻaraḍīyah mā huwa muʻadd, yaʻnī anna baʻḍ al-ʻilal al-fāʻilīyah al-ʻaraḍīyah yakūnu ʻillah muʻaddah dhātīyah bi-al-nisbah ilá mā hiya ʻillah fāʻilīyah ʻaraḍīyah la-hu, fa-inna shurb al-saqmūniyā ʻillah fāʻilah ʻaraḍīyah li-ḥuṣūl al-burūdah, maʻa annahu ʻillah muʻaddah dhātīyah li-ḥuṣūl al-burūdah."

Colophon: "Qad tamma al-juzʼayn al-akhīrayn fī yawm al-Khamīs waqt al-ʻaṣr, ṣāʼiman, ḥāmidan Allāh al-Karīm, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-mudhnib, al-rājī [...] Rabbihi, al-multajī ʻAbd al-Rājī al-Jīlānī. Allāhumma waffiqhu wa-ḥaṣṣil maṭālibahu bi-ḥaqqika wa-bi-ḥaqq Khayr Khalqika, ʻalayhi ṣalawātuka wa-raḥamatuka, fī sanat thalāth wa-sittīn wa-alf. M.". After the colophon an oval stamp in the name of "Muḥammad Ismāʻīl" and an unread square shape stamp.

Translation of the colophon: "The last two parts were completed on the afternoon of Thursday, while I was fasting and praising Generous God, by the hand of the guilty servant, who aspires to [...] of his Lord, the refuge seeker, ʻAbd al-Rājī al-Jīlānī. O God, grant him success and fulfill his needs, for Your sake and the sake of the Best of Your Creation [Prophet Muḥammad], may Your prayers and mercy be upon him. In the year 1063 [of the Hijrah = 31 July 1653]. M.". After the colophon an oval stamp in the name of "Muḥammad Ismāʻīl" and an illegible square shape stamp.

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Dīwān Ibn al-Fāriḍ : manuscript / al-Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad al-Būrīnī.
record.note: 1. Title of "Sharḥ Banat Suʻād" by al-Suyūtī from the front of the preceding leaf.
2. Title of "Sharḥ Dīwān Ibn al-Fāriḍ" by al-Būrīnī from reference sources.
3. Title of the unidentified commentary on "al-Burdah" of al-Būṣīrī from the colophon (folio 144a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Sharḥ Bānat Suʻād": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala Qaṣīdat Kaʻb, ʻalá nāẓimihā abraka kaʻb, wa-anṭaqahu bi-dhikr Suʻād tafāʼulan, fa-fāza min al-isʻād bimā sahhala ʻalayhi min ṭuruq al-rashād kulla ṣaʻb, wa-afāḍa ʻalá al-muddāḥ ṣayyiba sayl munhamir, fa-min mughtarif bi-kaff, wa-mātiḥ bi-dalw, wa-nāziḥ bi-gharab ..."

2. Incipit of "Sharḥ Dīwān Ibn al-Fāriḍ": The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... iblālī, ʻalá anna al-iblāl ʻalá wazn ikrām, muḍāf ilá Yāʼ al-mutakkalim, wa-maʻnāhu [...] al-najāh min al-maraḍ, wa-yakūnu al-murād inna najātī min al-maraḍ huwa al-balāʼ wa-al-bilbāl. al-Bilbāl al-ḥuzn, li-annahu lammā ṭalaba riḍā al-ḥabīb, wa-law ʻalā al-naḥīb wa-al-ḥuzn, wa-lā yaʻlū al-naḥīb illā maʻa wujūd al-balāʼ wa-al-bilbāl. Wa-al-ḥāṣil innahu yaqūlu riḍāya riḍāka, wa-lā abtaghī siwāka. Wa-qad qultu fī al-maʻná: Lastu Mawlāya abtaghī minka waṣlā // lā wa-lā abtaghī iqtirāba ḥimākā. Innamā munyatī wa-ghāyatu qaṣdī min al-zamāni riḍākā. Wa-hādhā aḥsanu mā yuqālu fī maʻná al-bayt ..."
Secundo folio: "Sharḥ Dīwān Ibn al-Fāriḍ": wa-al-maʻná wa-ḥayyā Allāh muḥayyā ʻādhilin.

3. Incipit of the unidentified commentary "Sharḥ al-Burdah": The beginning is missing. Text starts as follows: "... al-madhkūrīn min takhayyulāt al-shuʻarāʼ. Wa-ḥukiya ʻan al-nāẓim annahu qāl: Ḥaṣala lī khalṭ fālij abṭala niṣfī, fa-anshaʼtu hādhihi al-qaṣīdah wa-numtu, fa-raʼaytu al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, fa-masaḥa bi-yadihi al-mubārakah ʻalayya, fa-ʻūfītu min waqtī, wa-kharajtu awwala al-nahār, fa-laqiyanī baʻḍ al-fuqarāʼ, wa-saʼalanī hādhihi al-qaṣīdah, wa-lam akun aʻlamtu bihā aḥadan, wa-qāla lī: Samiʻtuhā al-bāriḥah tunshadu bayna yaday al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-huwa yatamāyalu tamāyula al-qaḍīb, fa-aʻṭaytuhā la-hu, wa-ishtaharat yutabāraku bi-hā. Qāl: Wa-raʼá fulānun fī al-nawm, wa-qad ashrafa fī ramadihi ʻalá al-ʻamá, qāʼilan yaqūlu la-hu: Ijʻal al-Burdah ʻalá ʻaynayka tafiq, fa-ḥaṣṣlahā wa-quriʼat ʻalayhi, fa-ʻūfiya li-waqtihi. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."
21.7 x 16 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16.3 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard, dark red leather on spine, inscribed in gold with the title "al-Qawl al-ṣaḥīḥ fī ʻilm al-tashrīḥ". The cover seems to have belonged to a work on "tashrīḥ" (anatomy).

In medium good naskh script; in black ink, on cream color laid paper; the verses of the "Dīwān" of Ibn al-Fāriḍ in red (some in light green); headings in large bold calligraphic naskh script (some in light green); few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On the front of the separate leaf preceding "Sharḥ Dīwān Ibn al-Fāriḍ" are the following statements: 1. "Kitāb Sharḥ 'Bānat Suʻād' lil-Imām al-Suyūṭī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn. M." 2. Two invocative verses, as follows: "Lastu Mawlāya abtaghī minka waṣlan // lā wa-lā abtaghī iqtirāba ḥimākā. Innamā munyatī wa-ghāyatu qaṣdī // wa-surūrī mina al-zamāni riḍākā." 3. "K 1. Jumlat karārīs 9." 4. An endowment statement: "Waqf al-Amīr [... ...] ʻalá ṭalabat al-ʻilm." 5. An ownership statement: "Dakhala fī milk al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá al-Ḥājj ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn al-marḥūm al-Ḥājj Khalīl Maḥfūẓ." 6. An ownership statement dated in the month of Dhū al-Qaʻdah, 1111 of the Hijrah (April/May 1700), as follows: "Kilfat [kallafat] hādhihi al-nuskhah ʻalá afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim ilá ʻafw Rabbihi al-karīm al-mannān, al-faqīr Muḥammad Aḥmad Abū al-A[...] al-Jarrārī, mablaghan qadruhu min al-fiḍḍah al-ʻadadīyah, fiḍḍīyah ʻadad 10, wa-dhālika fī shahr Dhī al-Qaʻdah al-ḥarām, sanat 1111." 7. A verse of love poetry: "Tukallifunī ḥamla al-ṣudūdi wa-innanī // la-aʻjazu ʻan ḥamli al-qamīṣ wa-aḍʻafu." 8. "Bānat Suʻā[d]."
At the head of the text of "Sharḥ Banat Suʻād" by al-Suyūtī: A decorative design in black, red, and gold.

1. Colophon of "Sharḥ Bānat Suʻād" by al-Suyūtī: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ... ṣallá Allāh wa-sallama ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi alladhīna [...] maḥabbatihi al-akhillāʼ, fa-samaw ilá rutab al-kamāl, wa-tanawwaʻat fī [...] maqāṣiduhum, fa-min mādiḥin bi-lisān, wa-dhāʼidin bi-sayf, wa-jāʼidin bi-māl ..."

2. Colophon of "Sharḥ Dīwān Ibn al-Fāriḍ" by al-Būrīnī: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with the commentary on the verse "ʻAlá al-buʻd lam yakhṭur siwākum ʻalá bālī // wa-in qarraba al-akhṭāra min jasadī al-bālī", as follows: "... wa-siwākum fāʻil yakhṭuru, wa-ʻalá al-buʻd mutaʻalliq bi-hi, wa-ʻalá bālī kadhālik. Qawluhu wa-in qarraba al-akhṭāra min jasadī al-bālī. al-Wāw hunā, qīla ḥālīyah, wa-qīla ʻāṭifah, wa-qīla iʻtirāḍīyah, ʻalá iṣṭilāḥ ahl al-bayān, wa-in hunā waṣlīyah lā taḥtāju ilá al-jawāb, li-annahā li-mujarrad al-taʼkīd, kamā naṣṣa ʻalá dhālika ahl al-bayān, wa-ḍamīr qarraba rājiʻ ilá al-buʻd, wa-al-akhṭār jamʻ ..."

3. Colophon of the unidentified commentary on "al-Burdah" of al-Būṣīrī (folio 144a): "Tamma al-kitāb al-musammá bi-'Sharḥ al-Burdah' fī yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, li-arbaʻah ʻashar baqīna min shahr Jumādá al-Thāniyah min shuhūr sanat sittah wa-miʼah wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām wa-azká al-taḥīyah. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tamm."

3. Translation of Colophon of the unidentified commentary on "al-Burdah" of al-Būṣīrī: "The book titled 'Sharḥ al-Burdah' was completed on blessed Monday, fourteen days remaining from the month of Jumādá al-Thāniyah, of the year 1106 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and peace, and the purest regards be upon Him. God suffices us, He is the best advocate. May God pray on Our Master and Leader Muḥammad, on his family, and his companions, and grant them peace. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥadāʼiq al-ḥaqāʼiq : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr al-Rāzī.
