Incipit: The text starts with "al-Bāb al-awwal" (Cahpter one) "Fī al-Tawbah" (On Repentance), as follows: "al-Tawbah fī al-lughah al-rujūʻ ʻan al-dhanb, wa-ka-dhālika al-tawb. Qāla Allāh taʻālá: Ghāfir al-dhanb wa-qābil al-tawb ..."
Secundo folio: ʻalá qulūbihim min ʻaẓamat Allāh.
15.3 x 21.3 cm; written surface: 10 x 14.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard cover (smaller than the leaves: 15 x 19.2 cm), with black cloth on spine.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Nihāyat al-amal fī al-ʻamal lil-Maḥallī" (the title and the author of this work could not be identified).
The beginning of the table of contents at the beginning of the manuscrip is missing; it starts with: "al-Bāb al-thānī wa-al-ʻishrūn" (Chapter twenty-two) Fī al-Taqwá (On Piety), etc.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with al-Bāb al-sittūn "Fī alfāẓ ahl al-ḥaqīqah wa-iṣṭilāḥātihim" (On the terms of the people of truth (the Ṣufīs) and their idioms), as follows: "... al-Rābiʻah yanbaghī an lā yaʼkula qabla al-qawm, fa-inna fāʻil dhālik yunsabu ilá farṭ al-jūʻ wa-al-sharah, kadhā aṭlaqahu al-nāẓim, wa-huwa muqayyad bimā idhā lam yakun ..."

record.title: Note concerning the Jean de Serres translation of Plato : manuscript.
record.note: Inscribed in two different hands at the foot of the recto: "Mang PMEL" and "Philippus Melanchthon".

record.title: 880-01 al-Farāʼiḍ al-majīdah fī al-aʻmāl al-ḥamīdah : manuscript.
record.note: The title "al-Farāʼiḍ al-majīdah fī al-aʻmāl al-ḥamīdah" is written in a later hand on a patch of paper pasted to folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir. Kitāb al-farāʼiḍ, ay masāʼil qismat al-mawār[īth]. Farīḍah bi-maʻná mafrūḍah, ay muqaddarah limā fīhā min al-sihām [...] fa-ghalabat ʻalá ghayrihā. Wa-al-farḍ lughatan al-taqdīr, wa-yaridu bi-maʻná [...] wa-al-tabyīn wa-al-inzāl wa-al-iḥlāl wa-al-ʻaṭāʼ, wa-sharʻan [naṣīb (?)] muqaddar lil-wārith. wa-taʻrīf hādhā 'al-ism' [crossed over] al-ʻilm huwa al-fiqh al-mutaʻalliq bi-al-irth, wa-al-ʻilm al-mūṣil li-maʻrifat qadr mā yajibu li-kull dhī ḥaqq [...]. Wa-al-aṣl fīhā, qabla al-ijmāʻ, āyāt al-mawārīth, wa-akhbār, ka-khabar [...] Alḥiqū al-farāʼiḍ mimmā baqiya, fa-li-awlá rajul dhakar ..."
Secundo folio: al-ḍayāʻ [?] al-awlá maṭʻūm jins makīl aw mawzūn li-yashmala mā yuʼkal wa-yushrab.
19 x 26.5 cm; written surface: 13.5 x 20 cm; 20-24 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (some quires are numbered)
In large clear naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; some leaves are deteriorated and stuck together; catchwords.
On the on the patch of paper pasted to folio 1a (written in a later hand): "Hādhā Kitāb al-Farāʼiḍ al-majīdah fī al-aʻmāl al-ḥamīdah."

On folio 1a: "[Bismillāh al-ra]ḥmān al-Raḥīm. [Ashhadu] an lā ilāha illā Allāh, wa-ashhadu anna Muḥammadan Rasūlu Allāh. [... ... ...] Muḥammad Aḥmad Abū al-Faḍl al-Ḥusaynī [... ... ...] wa-ʻuyaūbahu fataḥ Allāh wa-ʻalá kull ṭālib ʻilm, bi-ḥaqq Sayyid al-Awwalīn wa-al-Ākhirīn, Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh, [ṣallá Allāh] ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran dāʼiman abadan ilá Yawm al-Dīn."
On folio 1a: A statement from an owner (or borrower), vowing not to lend the book to anyone: "Wa-Allāh lā uʻīruhu li-aḥadin abadan."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... bi-yadihi al-khayr, wa-Huwa ʻalá kull shayʼ qadīr. Lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdah, ṣadaqa waʻdah, wa-naṣara ʻabdah, wa-hazama al-aḥzāb waḥdah. Lā ilāha illā Allāh, mukhliṣīna la-hu al-dīn, wa-law kariha al-kāfirūn. Thumma yanzilu min al-Ṣafā wa-yamshī naḥwa al-Marwah. Fa-idhā qaruba min al-mīl al-akhīr alladhī bi-fināʼ al-Masjid, bi-naḥwin min sittati adhruʻ, saʻá shadīdan, fa-idhā ḥādhá al-mīlayn al-akhīrayn ḥidhāʼ dār al-ʻAbbās, bi-fināʼ al-Masjid, mashá wa-taraka al-saʻī, ḥattá idhā waṣala al-Marwah raqiya ʻalayhā, fa-kabbara wa-ṣanaʻa mā ṣanaʻa ʻalá al-Ṣafā min dhikr wa-tahlīl. Wa-yustaḥabbu an yakūna mā yaqūluhu min dhikr wa-tahlīl ʻalá al-Ṣafā wa-al-Marwah yakūnu thalāthan, wa-dhālika alladhī saʻāhu [... ... ...] yuḥsabu la-hu marratan. Wa-mina al-Marwah yarjiʻu ilá al-Ṣafā marratan [... ... ...] wa-yasʻá mawḍiʻa saʻyihi. Fa-idhā waṣala ilá al-Ṣafā raqiya [... ... ...] ..."

record.title: Collection of two treatises on "ʻIlm al-kalām" : manuscript.
record.note: Title of the codex supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of the first manuscript is missing. Text starts with: "... bi-hi fa-taʻayyana al-awwal, fa-al-wujūh al-arbaʻah ṭuruq iqnāʻīyah, wa-al-ḥāṣil min al-tazwīd ṭarīqat al-burhān (fa-lā taṭwīl fī kalām al-muṣ. Ṣaḥḥ), idh fī al-maṭālib al-ʻāliyah nurāʻī ṭuruq al-ʻawāmm wa-al-khawāṣṣ takmīlan lil-taʻlīm kamā la-hu. Qāla Allāh taʻālá: Udʻu ilá sabīli Rabbika bi-al-ḥikmah wa-al-mawʻiẓah al-ḥasanah wa-jādilhum billatī hiya aḥsan. Wa-li-hādhā jaʻala shāriḥ al-Maqāṣid al-istidlāl bi-imkān ajsām al-ʻālam wa-aʻrāḍihā ..."
Secundo folio of the first manuscript: li-qawlihim ʻalá al-jumlah lā yajūzu an yakūna juzʼahā.

Incipit of the second manuscript is missing. Text starts with: "... Qawlunā al-wujūd mawjūd yataḍammanu wujūd khāṣṣ lil-wujūd al-muṭlaq in kāna al-tardīd fī al-muṭlaq, aw lil-wujūd al-khāṣṣ al-ākhar in kāna fī al-khāṣṣ, wa-lā maḥdhūr fī thubūt qūwat al-shayʼ la-hu wa-li-fardihi al-ākhar. Naʻam, yastalzimu thubūt [...] li-nafsihi fī ḍimnihi, fa-raddahu, lākinnahu laysa yastaḥīlu li-anna hādhā iʻtibārī yakfīhi al-muʻāyadah ..."
Secundo folio of the second manuscript: Qīla inna hādhā al-ẓuhūr muṣarraḥ fī baʻḍ shurūḥ al-Muḥaṣṣal.
12.8 x 17.7 cm; written surface: 8 x 12 cm; the first manuscript is 17 lines per page; the second manuscript is 21 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding; dark brown leather on spine; back cover missing.

The first manuscript is written in small naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; the phrases on the original are preceded by the word "qawluhu" (his saying) in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords. The second manuscript is written in fair naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on cream color paper; the phrases of the original are preceded by the word "qawluhu" (his saying) in red; many commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
On the sticker on the front cover: "599".

On the flyleaf: An ownership statement, as follows: "Min kutub al-faqīr ilá alṭāf Rabbihi al-ghanī al-qadīr, Mudarris Zādah al-Sayyid ʻAbd al-Karīm [...] kāna Allāh la-hu. Fī 17 Ṣ [Ṣafar], sanat 177 [1177 of the Hijrah = 27 August 1763]."
Laid in: card (in pencil): "Arabic MS from E. E. Calverley. Jan 26, 1966."

Laid in: a slip of paper, a note about the first manuscript, as follows: "This is the end of a commentary, as yet unidentified, on al-Mawāqif of al-Ījī. The MS begins at p 466 of the Būlāq ed of 1266 in library of D B M."
At the lower left corner of folio 50b: "Ḥāshiyah dar Sharḥ mawāqif [...] ilāhīyāt [...]."

The first manuscript ends as follows: "... Qawluhu li-isnādihim afʻāl al-ʻibād ilá qadarihim. Lammā warada ʻalayhi anna al-munāsib Ḥ al-Qudrī, bi-ḍamm al-Qāf, ashār al-shāriḥ ilá dafʻihi bi-qawlihi wa-inkāruhum al-qadar fīhā yurīdu anna isnād al-fiʻl ilá qadarihim yastalzimu inkār al-qadar bihā, fa-lidhā luqqibū bihā. Aqūlu: Isnād al-afʻāl ilá qadarihim yastalzimu kawnahā bi-qadarihim, ay taqdīrihim, ḥattá qāla fī tafsīr al-Qāḍī: Inshiqāq al-qudrah min al-qadar, fa-tasmiyatuhum bi-al-Qadarīyah aẓhar, wa-in khafiya ʻanhu ghaflat al-luzūm wa-al-ishtiqāq. Tamm."

The second manuscript ends abruptly as follows: "... Qawluhu wa-kawn al-mujarradāt ʻālim lahā. Qāla baʻḍ al-afāḍil kawn ʻilm baʻḍ al-mujarradāt bi-al-ḥuṣūl ḍarūrī bi-al-wijdān wa-al-adillah al-muqāmah ʻalayhi mithl al-faras [?] al-basharī, Allāhumma, illā an yandarija fī al-māddīyāt li-qūwat taʻalluqihā bi-al-māddah al-badanīyah. Qawluhu inna al-kayfīyah nafsahā lā tuqārinuhā kayfīyah, qāla dhālika al-baʻḍ 'Inna al-saṭḥ kamm ʻāriḍ lil-jism alladhī' [This phrase is crossed over] inna al-ḥarf kayfīyah ʻāriḍah lil-ṣawt alladhī huwa kayfīyah ukhrá, fa-in rudda ʻalayhi bi-anna al-kamm lahā, qāla dhālika al-baʻḍ, inna al-saṭḥ kamm ʻāriḍ lil-jism alladhī huwa kamm ..."
Folios 51-53 are blank.

record.title: Collection of miscellaneous Arabic poems : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The collection starts with: "Dawr. Qultu Yā Sittī Raḥmah // mā tuʻāmilīnī bi-al-maʻrūf. Dūl wulaydāt Miṣr milāḥ // wa-yaḍḥakū wa-awlād maʻrūf. Mā ḥad ʻāshartuhu qablaki // illā wa-yabqā ʻalá al-makshūf. ʻAlá shān mā innī madmūkah // fī khiff wa-yā shaʻrīyah. Qultī ʻalayya la-akīduhu // yaʻnī ka-minki shalabīyah ..."
Secundo folio: Alfayn jamal Yā Sittī Raḥmah // wa-aḥmāl tusāfiru quddāmī.
17 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 12 x 17 cm; 20 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound. Some quires are numbered.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on bluish white paper; headings and markings in red; few notes on the margins; catchwords.
Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... Wa-qāla baʻḍ al-muḥibbīn min al-ghazal ayḍan: Saqānī shurbatan min rīqi fīhi // wa-ḥayya bi-al-ʻidhāri wa-mā yalīhi. Wa-bāta ..."

record.title: 880-03 Qūt al-qulūb fī muʻāmalat al-maḥbūb : manuscript / Abū Ṭālib Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Makkī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... fa-ẓahart al-ān ʻinda al-firāq limā kānat ushhidat fī al-talāq, wa-iʻtarafat fī al-ākhir bimā kānat naṭaqat wa-ʻalimat fī al-awwal, fa-kharajat al-rūḥ ʻalá mā shahidat, wa-shahidat hāhunā mā kānat bi-hi qadīman ushhidat, fa-rajiʻat bi-shahādatihā al-ūlá ilá al-maʼāl, idh qāmat al-yawm taḥkumu bi-shāhidihā fīmā kān, wa-Allāhu ghālibun ʻalá amrih wa-lākinna akthara al-nāsi lā yaʻlamūn. Fa-hādhā kāna khabaran li-sābiqah allatī adrakat al-arwāḥ fī al-ajsām limā jamaʻat ʻinda al-khātimah ..."
Secundo folio: al-tawḥīd fa-aʻlim al-nās annī muttu ʻalá ghayr al-Islām.
15.5 x 20.2 cm; written surface: 12 x 14.5 cm; 26 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard cover; dark red leather on spine.
In small naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings in red; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
At the head of folio 1a: "Qūt al-qulūb."
Inside the front cover: The following statements: 1. "Bāb 40." 2. "Kitāb ʻArabī mushtarak maʻa Mīkhāyil Ḥittī." 3. An illegible signature.

On the flyleaf: The following statements: 1. "Qūt [al-qulūb] li-Abī Ṭālib al-Makkī, raḥimahu Allāh." 2. Illegible phrases. 3. An ownership statement: "Qad dakhala fī milk, tamallakahu awwal al-muḥtājīn wa-aktharihim khaṭaʼan wa-dhalalan [wa-zalalan] Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl al-Aṣfahānī." 4. "Qūt al-qulūb."
Laid in: card (in pencil): "Arabic MS. from E. E. Calverley. Jan 26, 1966."
Laid in: folded printed receipt in the name of "Edwin E. Calverley Esq., 143 Sigourney Street, Hartford, Conn., U.S.A."

On the printed slip pasted inside the back cover: "MAKKI (Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn ʻAtīyah al-Makkī). Qūt al-qulūb fī muʻāmalat al-maḥbūb, wa-wasf ṭarīq al-murīd ilá maqām al-tauḥīd: A mystical Treatise on the duties of the true Believers. Sm.4to., a MS. in Naskhī; imperfect both at beginning and end; containing 38 chapters out of 48; the lower margins stained throughout; half bound. Early 19th cent."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... fa-hādhā alladhī dhukir ḥalla fī maqām bi-ʻaynihi bi-mushāhadat ʻayn man ʻaẓamatuhu munfaridah li-mutafarrid, wa-qaruba ʻan waṣf qarīb muttakhadh li-muwaḥḥid, wa-li-yanfarid warāʼ hādhā al-ittiḥād wa-al-aḥadīyah wa-al-infirād wa-al-waḥdānīyah fawqa dhālik, wa-al-āḥād al-afrād al-mufradūn bi-mā afrada, wa-al-muwaḥḥidūn bi-mā waḥḥadū, al-dhākirūn bi-dhikrihi alladhī dhakarū, wa-al-musabbiḥūn bi-subuḥātihi allatī sabbaḥū, al-muʻaẓẓimūn bi-ʻaẓamatihi allatī bi-hā ʻaẓẓamū. Hum ḥujjāb hādhā al-maqām, wa-khuzzān hādhā al-maʻná ka-taʻẓīmihim li-hādhā al-sirr, huwa minhum kufr. Wa-Allāh ghālibun ʻalá amrih wa-lākinna akthara al-nāsi lā yaʻlamūn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Bal aktharuhum lā yaʻlamūn. Fa-wuffiqū maʻa al-amr li-ghalabat al-qahr, wa-sakanū li-ajl al-ḥamd, fa-rasamū la-hu al-ḥamd, wa-hākadhá ..."

record.title: Illuminated copy of the Qurʼān : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
9.5 x 16 cm; written surface: 5.5 x 11 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; cover embossed with central medallion and decorative frame in gold.

In good medium naskh script, in black ink, on laid thin cream color paper; some of the leaves seem to be repaired; text fully vocalized and illuminated, titles of the sūrahs in purple; the verses end with circles in gold; catchwords.
The word "waqf" (endowment) is written on the margin of some leaves.
Colophon: The colophon (written within a decorative design in gold) is erased. Under the colphon are two illegible oval stamps.

Binding: Parchment over boards.

record.title: Life and adventures of Thomas Hatch : manuscript / By Jonathan Snagg LLD.
record.note: Title from cover.

"Crookshank & Co. Publishers" and the date "1857" appear in manuscript lettering on the front cover. The bottom left edge of the cover is missing, leaving only the final two letters ("wn") of what might have been a place name.

The book has been stitched together and the spine and edges of the original wrappers reinforced with cloth. The lower right corner of the front cover has been torn off and loosely stitched back into place. The frontispiece, featuring a portrait of Thomas Hatch, has also been torn and stitched back together.

record.title: Treatises on Arabic grammar, Sufism, Islamic law and doctrines : manuscript.
record.note: Title of the codex supplied by cataloger.
1. Title of "Sharḥ alfāẓ Ibn Kutaybah" from folio 1a.
2. Title of "Mūqid al-adhhān wa-mūqiẓ al-wasnān" from incipit (folio 1b).
3. Title of Treatise on Sufism supplied by cataloger.
4. Title of Treatise on Islamic law and doctrines supplied by cataloger.
5. Title of Treatise of Islamic miscellanea supplied by cataloger.
6. Title of "Fatḥ al-Raḥmān fī Risālat al-Walī Raslān" from incipit (folio 120a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Sharḥ alfāẓ Ibn Kutaybah": "Hādhā Sharḥ al-alfāẓ li-Ibn Kutaybah, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih wa-askanahu fasīḥ Jannatih. Innahu ʻalá mā yashāʼu qadīr wa-bi-al-ijābah jadīr, wa-Huwa niʻma al-Mawlá wa-niʻma al-naṣīr. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl."

2. Incipit of "Mūqid al-adhhān wa-mūqiẓ al-wasnān": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Jamāl al-Dīn Abū Muḥammad ʻAbd Allāh ibn Yūsuf ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Hishām al-Anṣārī, taghammadahu Allāh taʻālá bi-raḥmatih: Ammā baʻda ḥamd Allāh, al-fātiḥ ʻinda al-iʻwāz, al-māniʻ bi-al-ījāz, jāʻil ʻilm [al-naḥw] fī al-ʻulūm ka-al-ṭirāz, fīhi tufakkaku muqfalāt al-alghāz, wa-yattaḍiḥu mā fī al-Tanzīl min al-ījāz wa-wajh al-iʻjāz ... fa-qad jamaʻt fī hādhihi al-waraqāt al-yasīrah shadharatan min al-alghāz al-naḥwīyah, wa-nubdhah min al-nukat al-adabīyah, jaʻaltuhā li-istikhrāj al-aḥājī ʻunwānan, wa-ʻalá <wa-ʻalá> mā lam adhkurhu min dhālika miʻwānan ... wa-sammaytuhu 'Mūqid al-adhhān wa-mūqiẓ al-wasnān' ..."

3. Incipit of Treatise on Sufism. The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... wa-maʻná al-Ism al-Aʻẓam li-man uhhila la-hu, wa-billāh al-tawfīq. al-Mughnī huwa muʻṭī al-ghinā wa-al-kifāyah li-man shāʼa min ʻibādih. Tanbīh. Man ʻarafa annahu al-mughnī istaghná bi-hi, wa-man ʻarafa annahu al-ghanī iftaqara ilayhi. Wa-al-taqarrub bi-hādhā al-Ism taʻalluqan an takūna bimā fī yad Allāh awthaq minka bimā fī yadika, wa-takhalluqan bi-wujūd al-sakhāʼ wa-al-badhl ghāyata al-juhd, wa-Allāh aʻlam ..."
3. Secundo folio of Treatise on Sufism: ḥattá āmannā bi-Muḥammadin, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam.

4. Incipit of Treatise on Islamic law and doctrines. The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... wa-qawluhu lil-jawf huwa al-ṣawāb, kamā ʻalayhi Ibn ʻArafah wa-man wāfaqahu. Wa-qawluhu: Qīla wa-waṣala li-ḥalqihi ṣaḥīḥ fī al-qaḍāʼ bi-al-wuṣūl ghalabatan, wa-mithluhā al-nisyān. Wa-ammā qawluhu: Wa-taʻammudan, kufr ayḍan, fa-yuḥmalu ʻalá al-wuṣūl lil-jawf, lā lil-ḥalq, kamā yaqtaḍīhi mā qabluhu ..."
4. Secundo folio of Treatise on Islamic law and doctrines: wa-kadhā mā naqalahu al-sh [al-shāriḥ] wa-qawl al-Risālah tudhbaḥu ḍaḥwatan.

5. Incipit of Treatise of Islamic miscellanea. The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... fa-raʼaytu bi-khaṭṭ Ibn al-Qammāḥ fī majmūʻ la-hu, qāla Ibn al-Ṣalāḥ: Waqaftu ʻalá kitāb fī al-shurūṭ lil-Ustādh Abī Ṭāhir ibn Maḥmish al-Ziyādī dhakar fīhi anna Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, arrakha min al-Hijrah ḥīna kataba al-kitāb li-Naṣārá Najrān, wa-amar ʻAlīyan an yaktuba fīhi annahu kutiba li-khams min al-Hijrah, fa-al-muʼarrikh bi-al-Hijrah idhan Rasūl Allāh [ṣallá Allāh] ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-qad tabiʻahu ʻalá dhālika ..."
5. Secundo folio of Treatise of Islamic miscellanea: wa-minhu qawluhu taʻālá: Wa-muhayminan ʻalayhi yaʻnī shāhidan.

6. Incipit of "Fatḥ al-Raḥmān fī Risālat al-Walī Raslān": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Qāla Sayyidunā wa-Mawlānā wa-Shaykhunā, Qāḍī al-Quḍāh, wa-Shaykh Mashāyikh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn, Zayn al-Millah wa-al-Dīn, Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh taʻālá bi-raḥmatihi, wa-aʻāda ʻalaynā min madadihi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah, bi-Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu li-man tafarrada bi-al-waḥdānīyah, wa-taʻazzaza bi-al-niʻmah al-Rabbānīyah, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá al-Nabī wa-ṣaḥbihi, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ḥizbih. Ammā baʻd, fa-inna ʻilm al-tawḥīd min ashraf al-ʻulūm, bal ashrafuhā, wa-mimmā ullifa fīhi 'al-Risālah al-Raslānīyah', li-al-Imām al-ʻārim [al-ʻārif] billāh taʻālá Raslān al-Dimashqī, ṭayyaba Allāh tharāh, wa-jaʻala al-Jannata maʼwāh. Wa-lammā kānat min abdaʻ kitāb fī ʻilm al-tawḥīd ṣunnif, wa-ajmaʻ mawḍūʻ fīhi, ʻalá miqdār ḥajmaihā ullif, istakhartu Allāh taʻālá an ashraḥahā sharḥan yaḥullu alfāẓahā wa-yubayyinu murādahā, wa-sammaytuhu bi-'Fatḥ al-Raḥmān fī Risālat al-Walī Raslān' ..."
6. Secundo folio of "Fatḥ al-Raḥmān fī Risālat al-Walī Raslān": bi-hi mā dhakarahu baʻdu, wa-qad yurādu bi-hi al-ʻilm muṭlaqan.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 14 cm; 19-23 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard binding; black cloth on spine.

The manuscripts are written in different hands; in fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; phrases of the originals and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: A grammatical riddle and its answer in verse, as follows: "Ayyuhā al-fāḍilu fīnā aftinā // wa-azil ʻannā bi-futyāka al-ʻanā. Kayfa iʻrābu nuḥāti al-naḥwi fī // Anā anta al-ḍāribī anta anā. Jawābuhu: Anā anta al-ḍāribī mubtadaʼun // fa-iʻtabirhā Yā Imāmī lasanā. Anta baʻda al-ḍāribī fāʻiluhu // wa-anā khabbara ʻanhu ʻalanā. Thumma inna al-ḍāribī anta anā // khabarun ʻan anta mā fīhi inthanā. Wa-anā al-jumlatu ʻanhu khabarun // wa-hiya min anta ilá anta anā."

On folio 120a: "Kitāb Lawāqiḥ al-Raḥmān fī Risālat al-Walī Raslān, lil-Imām al-ʻĀlim al-ʻAllāmah, al-ḥabr al-fahhāmah, imām al-mutakallimīn, wa-ḥujjat al-nāẓirīn, wa-muḥyī sunnat Sayyid al-Mursalīn, Abī Yaḥyá Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī, barrada Allāh ḍarīḥahu, wa-jaʻala al-Jannata muqalabahu wa-mustawdaʻahu. Āmīn."
1. Colophon of "Sharḥ alfāẓ Ibn Kutaybah": "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

1. Translation of the colophon of "Sharḥ alfāẓ Ibn Kutaybah": "It was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. Praise be to God for the completion and conclusion. Praise be to God in all circumstances. It is completed. It is completed. It is completed. It is completed."

2. Colophon of "Mūqid al-adhhān wa-mūqiẓ al-wasnān": No colophon. The text ends abruptly as follows: "... Qāla al-shāʻir: Alam tasmaʻī Ay ʻAbdu fī rawnaqi al-ḍuḥá // bukāʼa ḥamāmātin lahunna hadīru. Wa-iʻlam inna fī tasmiyat 'Yā' wa-'Ay' ʻāmilayn tajawwuzan wa-irtikāb al-madhhab al-ḍaʻīf, wa-illā, fa-al-ḥaqq anna al-ʻāmil al-fiʻl al-muqaddar, wa-ka-qawlihi ayḍan: Mā ism manṣūb, wa-maʻná ..."

3. Colophon of Treatise on Sufism. Text ends as follows: "... ilá an qāl: Wa-maḥalluhā al-qalb. al-Māzirī, wa-huwa madhhab akthar al-fuqahāʼ wa-aqall al-falāsifah, wa-waqtuhā ʻindanā iltabasa bi-al-fiʻl, wa-huwa hunā ibtidāʼ al-mafrūḍ ʻalá al-mashhūr, wa-in taqddamat bi-al-zaman al-kathīr, fa-qāla al-Mazirī: Lā yuʻtaddu bihā ittifāqan, aw bi-al-yasīr, fa-qawlān mashhūrān bi-al-ajzāʼ wa-ʻadamuhu, wa-ḥukmuhā al-wujūb, wa-al-maqṣūd minhā tamyīz al-ʻibādāt min al-ʻādāt, wa-tamyīz muwāfiqihā farḍan wa-naqlan wa-adāʼan wa-qaḍāʼan wa-ghayr dhālik, wa-sharṭuhā ʻadam al-ityān bi-munāfin. Intahá."

4. Colophon of Treatise on Islamic law and doctrines. No colophon. Text ends abruptly, as follows: "... wa-al-amr bi-al-shayʼ nahyun ʻan ḍiddih, wa-al-nahyu ʻan al-shayʼ amrun bi-ḍiddih. Fa-idhā qāla uskun, kāna nāhiyan la-hu ʻan al-taḥarruk, aw lā tataḥarrak kāna amran la-hu bi-al-sukūn. Wa-al-nahy istidʻāʼ al-tark bi-al-qawl mimman huwa dūn ʻalá ..."

5. Colophon of Treatise of Islamic miscellanea. No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... Fāʼidah li-'Qūwat al-baṣar'. ʻAn al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, annahu qāl: Man taraqqaba li-ruʼyat al-hilāl, awwal laylah, aw thānī laylah, aw thālith laylah, fa-ḥīna yaqaʻu baṣaruhu ʻalayhi yaqūlu ʻinda ruʼyatihi baʻda an yamsaḥa bi-yadihi ʻalá ʻaynayhi, wa-huwa yaqraʼu Sūrat Fātiḥat al-Kitāb ..."

6. "Fatḥ al-Raḥmān fī Risālat al-Walī Raslān" ends as follows: "... Wa-al-ḥāṣil inna al-nafs al-kāfirah lā yanfaʻuhā īmānuhā ḥīnaʼidhin, wa-lā al-nafs al-muʼminah al-ghayr al-kāsibah khayran khayruhā ḥīnaʼidhin.
6. Colophon of "Fatḥ al-Raḥmān fī Risālat al-Walī Raslān": "Intahá, wa-Allāh aʻlam. Tammat al-Risālah al-mubārakah sanat 1113."

6. Translation of the colophon of "Fatḥ al-Raḥmān fī Risālat al-Walī Raslān": "It is completed, but God is more knowledgeable. The blessed epistle was completed in the year 1113 [of the Hijrah = 1701/1702]."

record.title: Illuminated copy of the Qurʼān : photomechanical print.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
12.5 x 19.5 cm; written surface: 6.7 x 12.5 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with geometrical design.

In beautiful naskh script, reproduced in black ink, on thin cream color paper; the text is framed in gold with colorful illuminations and designs at the head of the "sūrahs" (chapters) and on the margins; catchwords.

laid in: three handwritten slips of paper, as follows: 1. "Quran illum. 1292 AH ??. Gift of Russell Stafford." 2. "dated 1046. no # 1270. Qurʼan." 3. "Gift of Russell H. Stafford. Qurʼan - illuminated. the earliest date in the Qurʼan is 1291 [1874-1875]." Under this statement is written in a different hand: "No. This is the date of a later owner. The date of writing is a part of the beautiful text (10)46 A.H. WZH."
On folio 338b: Three statements in Ottoman Turkish. The first bears the dates 21 Muḥarram 1291 (10 March 1874), and 5 Shaʻbān 291 (1291 = 17 September 1874), and the stamp of Muḥammad ʻAṭā Allāh.
On folio 339b: An illegible stamp.

Colophon: "Yā Man yūṣilu kātiba Kitābihi ilá al-saʻādat al-ʻuẓmá ... naḥmaduka bi-maḥāmidika allatī lā tuʻaddu wa-lā tuḥṣá ... Wa-baʻd, falammā umirtu bi-kitābat hādhā al-Muṣḥaf al-Sharīf min ṭaraf al-Sulṭān ... Maḥmūd Khān ... bādartu bi-imtithāl amrihi ... muqtafiyan athar al-Shaykh al-ḥāʼiz qaṣaba al-sabq fī ḥalbat khiṭaṭ al-khuṭūṭ wa-rihān ḥusnihā [Ḥamd Allāh al-Amāsī] ... wa-qablahu kuntu qad katabtu ithnayn fa-ʻazzazanī bi-thālith amruhu. Wa-ʻazamtu bi-tilka al-ʻizzah an utbiʻahu bi-rābiʻ wa-khāmis, wa-halumma jarran ... fa-kamula wa-tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh al-ḥamīd ... fī shahr Jumādá al-Ākhirah, li-sanat sitt wa-arbaʻīn khalat min Hijrat Khātam al-Nabīyīn. Wa-anā aḍʻaf al-kuttāb wa-aḥwajuhum ilá al-maghfirah al-Sayyid al-Ḥājj Muḥammad al-maʻrūf bi-Shakarzādah ..."

Translation of the colophon: "O You Who makes the copyist of His Book attain the ultimate happiness ... we praise you for your praises which cannot be numbered nor counted ... Henceforth, when I was ordered to copy this Noble Book by al-Sulṭān ... Maḥmūd Khān ... I proceeded to obey his command ... following in the footsteps of the al-Shaykh who has won the lead in the arena of writing and calligraphy [Ḥamd Allāh al-Amāsī] ... Before this, I had written two [copies], so I was strengthened by his command to write a third. I resolved with that honor to follow it with a fourth, a fifth, and so on... It was completed, and concluded, praise be to God, the Praised One ... in the month of Jumadá al-Ākhirah, of the forty-sixth year of the Hijrah of the Seal of the Prophets [i.e. 1146 = November/December 1733], by me, the weakest of scribes who is in need of forgiveness, al-Sayyid al-Ḥājj Muḥammad, who is known as Shakerzadeh ..."

record.title: Manuals on naval science, navigation, and astronomy : manuscipt / by Sulaymān ibn Aḥmad al-Mahrī.
record.note: Title of the codex supplied by cataloger.
1. Title of "al-Minhāj al-fākhir fī ʻilm al-zākhir" from incipit (folio 1b).
2. Title of "al-ʻUmdah al-Mahrīyah fī ḍabṭ al-ʻulūm al-baḥrīyah" from incipit (folio 35b).
3. Title of "Tuḥfat al-fuḥūl fī tamhīd al-uṣūl" from incipit (folio 85b).
4. Title of "Ḥāshiyah (or Ḥawāshin) ʻalá 'Tuḥfat al-fuḥūl fī tamhīd al-uṣūl'", partly from folio 1a, and from incipit (folio 92b).
5. Title of "Mirʼāt al-sullāk li-kurāt al-aflāk" from incipit (folio 127a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "al-Minhāj al-fākhir fī ʻilm al-zākhir": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī zayyana al-samāʼ bi-al-zāhirāt, wa-jaʻalahā hidāyatan fī al-buḥūr al-ʻamīqāt, wa-dalālatan fī masālik jawb al-falawāt. Aḥmaduhu ḥamdan fī kull ānin wa-ḥīn min al-awqāt, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Nabīyinā Muḥammad Sayyid al-barīyāt, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-bararah al-thiqāt. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhā kitāb jāmiʻ li-ʻilm al-buḥūr al-maʻmūrāt min al-dīrāt wa-al-qiyāsāt wa-al-masāfāt, wa-jaʻaltuhu ʻalá sabʻat abwāb wa-muqaddimah wa-khātimah. Sammaytuhu "al-Minhāj al-fākhir fī ʻilm al-zākhir", asʼalu Allāh al-nafʻa bi-hi wa-lil-Muslimīn, innahu samīʻun mujīb ..."
1. Secundo folio of "al-Minhāj al-fākhir fī ʻilm al-zākhir": al-Bāb al-rābiʻ fī al-masāfāt ʻalá qiyās al-jāh wa-al-Farqadayn.

2. Incipit of "al-ʻUmdah al-Mahrīyah fī ḍabṭ al-ʻulūm al-baḥrīyah": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ḥaqqa ḥamdih, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Man lā Nabī baʻdah, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-tābiʻīn li-rushdih. Ammā baʻd, lammā raʼaytu ʻilm al-baḥr qalīl taʼlīf kutubihi al-muḥaqqaqah, bal fī wurayqātin mulaffaqah, wa-arājīz mutafarriqah, fa-ʻanna lī an uwallifa kitāban yakūnu ḍābiṭan li-masāyilih al-aṣlīyāt wa-al-farʻīyāt min al-ikhtilāf al-kāʼin fī al-dīrāt wa-al-qiyāsāt bi-al-tajribah al-mutawātirah min al-natakhāt wa-al-majārāt mimmā ʻāyantuhu wa-mā lam uʻāyinhu ... wa-sammaytuhu bi-'al-ʻUmdah al-Mahrīyah fī ḍabṭ al-ʻulūm al-baḥrīyah', wa-billāh al-tawfīq."
2. Secundo folio of "al-ʻUmdah al-Mahrīyah fī ḍabṭ al-ʻulūm al-baḥrīyah": lil-miḥwar tusammá dāʼirat niṣf al-nahār.

3. Incipit of "Tuḥfat al-fuḥūl fī tamhīd al-uṣūl": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Nabīyinā Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh, Sayyid al-awwalīn wa-al-ākhirīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhā kitāb laṭīfun ḥajmuhu, kathīrun ʻilmuhu fī uṣūl ʻilm al-baḥr, lā yastaghnī kull ʻārif fī fann ʻilm al-baḥr ʻanhu. Sammaytuhu 'Tiḥfat al-fuḥūl fī tamhīd al-uṣūl', mushtamil ʻalá sabʻat abwāb wa-khātimah, wa-billāh al-tawfīq ..."
3. Secundo folio of "Tuḥfat al-fuḥūl fī tamhīd al-uṣūl": thumma falak al-Zuhrah thumma falak al-shams.

4. Incipit of "Ḥāshiyah (or Ḥawāshin) ʻalá 'Tuḥfat al-fuḥūl fī tamhīd al-uṣūl'": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad al-amīn, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi ḥawāshin ʻallaqtuhā ʻalá kitābī al-musammá bi-'Tuḥfat al-fuḥūl fī tamhīd al-uṣūl', fī uṣūl ʻilm al-baḥr, li-yantafiʻa bihā man la-hu ishtighāl fī al-kitāb al-madhkūr. Wa-al-ʻudhr kull al-ʻudhr, min wajhayn. al-Awwal, allaftuhu bi-ʻajalah, maʻa tashawwush khāṭir; wa-al-thānī, lam usbaq li-mithlihi, fa-takūnu māddatī min dhālika al-sābiq, bal istakhrajtuhu min ʻulūm shattá, wa-jamaʻtuhu li-nafsī wa-lisāʼir al-ikhwān. Fa-Allāh al-mustaʻān, wa-ʻalayhi al-tiklān. Wa-ibtadaʼtu bi-hi min Bāb al-awwal. Qultu al-bāb al-awwal fī ṣifat al-aflāk wa-al-kawākib fīhā ..."
4. Secundo folio of "Ḥāshiyah (or Ḥawāshin) ʻalá 'Tuḥfat al-fuḥūl fī tamhīd al-uṣūl'": al-aflāk wa-al-kawākib fīhā ay ṣifat ashkālihā.

5. Incipit of "Mirʼāt al-sullāk li-kurāt al-aflāk": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh, Sayyid aṣfiyāʼih wa-khātam anbiyāʼih. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi muqaddimah fī ʻilm al-hayʼah, wa-huwa ʻilm yuʻrafu bi-hi aḥwāl al-ajrām al-samāwīyah, sammaytuhā 'Mirʼāt al-sullāk li-kurāt al-aflāk', mushtamilah ʻalá ithnay ʻashar bāban wa-khātimah. Wa-billāh al-tawfīq ..."
5. Secundo folio of "Mirʼāt al-sullāk li-kurāt al-aflāk": bi-al-māʼ wa-bi-mā ẓahara min al-arḍ thumma al-nār.
13 x 20 cm; written surface: 9 x 14.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In dark red leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion and geometrical design in gold.

In clear fair naskh script, in black ink, on thin, laid, cream color paper; headings and keywords in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; some wormholes on the margins; text within double red frame; catchwords.

On folio 1a: A table of contents: "Mā ḥawāhu al-majmūʻah: [1]. al-Minhāj al-fākhir fī ʻilm al-zākhir (ay, al-baḥr liman arād yaʻrif al-juzur fī al-baḥr, wa-yaʻrif al-masāfah baynahā, wa-yaʻrif kayfa al-wuṣūl ilayhā, wa-matá yaḥsun al-safar). [2]. al-ʻUmdah al-Mahrīyah fī ḍabṭ al-ʻulūm al-baḥrīyah (bi-hi yaṭṭaliʻ al-musāfir ʻalá al-maṭāliʻ al-munāsibah li-tawajjuhihi ilá al-maḥall alladhī yurīduhu). [3]. Tuḥfat al-fuḥūl fī tamhīd al-uṣūl. [4]. Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Tuḥfat al-fuḥūl (wa-bi-al-jumlah, huwa kitāb nāfiʻ li-man arāda an yajūba ʻalá baṣīrah fī sayrihi fī al-baḥr li-ayy makān yurīd, wa-bi-hi yaʻlamu ism al-juzur allatī fī al-baḥr, fa-huwa kitāb nādir fī fannih). [5]. Mirʼāt al-sullāk li-kurāt al-aflāk (fī ʻilm al-hayʼah)."

On folio 1a: A small circular stamp, inscribed with "Mā shāʼa Allāh. Lā qūwata illā billāh." And a larger oval stamp, inscribed with "Min mutamallakāt al-faqīr al-Ḥājj Muṣṭafá Ṣidqī, ghufira la-hu."

On the right margin of folio 32b: A collation note, dated 5 Rajab, of the year 975 of the Hijrah (15 January 1568), as follows: "Balagha al-muqābalah fī 5 Rajab sanat 975." And the number "18" in West Arabic numerals.

On folios 33b-34b: Miscellaneous "Fawāʼid" (Useful quotations), titled: 1. "Fī waṣf al-barr min al-Karāzī li-Karāshī." 2. "Fī maʻrifat khams qiyāsāt fī jāh thalāthah." 3. "Fī maʻrifat min barr al-sawāḥil ilá Juzur al-Qamar." And two verses of poetry, encouraging/urging people to travel (by sea), as follows: "Naffis khiyāmaka fī al-falā // wa-daʻi al-ghawānī fī al-quṣūr. Lawlā al-tanaqqulu mā irtaqā durru al-buḥūri ilá al-nuḥūr."
On the lower right margin of folio 34b: A collation statement, as follows: "Balagha al-maqābalah bi-ḥasb al-ṭāqah wa-al-imkān."
Folios: 33a, 35a, 84b-85a, 92a, and 127a are blank.
On folio 155b: An unfinished circular diagram.
On folio 156a: A circular astronomical diagram.

1. Colophon of "al-Minhāj al-fākhir fī ʻilm al-zākhir": "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam taslīman. Tamm."

1. Translation of the colophon of "al-Minhāj al-fākhir fī ʻilm al-zākhir": "The book was completed by the praise of God and His help. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, his family, and his companions, and grant them abundant peace."

2. Colophon of "al-ʻUmdah al-Mahrīyah fī ḍabṭ al-ʻulūm al-baḥrīyah": "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-luṭfihi. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

2. Translation of the colophon of "al-ʻUmdah al-Mahrīyah fī ḍabṭ al-ʻulūm al-baḥrīyah": "The book was completed by the help of God and His benevolence. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, his family, and his companions, and grant them peace."

3. "Tuḥfat al-fuḥūl fī tamhīd al-uṣūl" ends with a "Tanbīh" (Advice/Cautioning), as follows: "Iʻlam inna akhdh ʻilm kull makān min ahlihi, fa-huwa aṣaḥḥ min al-ghayr, illā in kāna (al-ghayr qad jarrabahu, wa-huwa mimman yuʻtabaru bi-hi fī al-fann, aw kāna. Ṣaḥḥ) dhālika al-ghayr muḥaqqiqan wa-ṣāḥib al-makān qalīl al-maʻrifah bi-al-fann, fa-min al-muḥaqqiq aṣaḥḥ. Wa-billāh al-tawfīq, wa-ʻalayhi al-tiklān."
3. Colophon of "Tuḥfat al-fuḥūl fī tamhīd al-uṣūl": "Tammat wa-bi-al-khayr [ʻammat]. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Khayr Khalqih, Muḥammad wa-ālihi ajmaʻīn."
3. Translation of the colophon of "Tuḥfat al-fuḥūl fī tamhīd al-uṣūl": "It is completed and [well] spread. May God pray on the Best of His Creation, Muḥammad and all his family."

4. Colophon of "Ḥāshiyah (or Ḥawāshin) ʻalá 'Tuḥfat al-fuḥūl fī tamhīd al-uṣūl'": "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā awradnā min sharḥ hādhā al-mukhtaṣar, wa-billāh al-tawfīq, wa-ʻalayhi al-tiklān. Wa-huwa ḥasbī. Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawnihi." To the right of the colophon, the following collation statement: "Wa-faragha bi-tārīkh awwal Ramaḍān. Balagha al-muqābalah. Kātib al-ḥurūf ʻAbd al-Raḥmān. Qābala maʻa Sayyidī Aḥmad Badr al-Dīn."

4. Translation of the colophon of "Ḥāshiyah (or Ḥawāshin) ʻalá 'Tuḥfat al-fuḥūl fī tamhīd al-uṣūl'": "This is the end of what we introduced about the commentary on this compendium. Success comes from God, and on Him is the reliance. He suffices me. The book was completed by His help. It is completed." To the right of the colophon, the following collation statement: "It was complete at the first of Ramaḍān. The collation was completed. Written by ʻAbd al-Raḥmān. It was collated with Sayyidī Aḥmad Badr al-Dīn."

5. The text of "Mirʼāt al-sullāk li-kurāt al-aflāk" ends on folio 155a, as follows: "... wa-ammā al-Shams fa-hiya bi-miqdār al-Arḍ miʼah wa-sittah wa-sittūn marrah wa-rubʻ wa-thumn, thumma Zuḥal huwa mithl tisʻah wa-tisʻīn marrah wa-niṣf mithl al-Arḍ, thumma al-Mushtarī wa-huwa mithl ithnayn wa-thamānīn wa-niṣf wa-rubʻ marrah min al-Arḍ, thumma al-Zuhrah wa-hiya juzʼ min arbaʻah wa-arbaʻīn juzʼan min al-Arḍ, thumma ʻUṭārid wa-huwa juzʼ min miʼah wa-ithnayn wa-thalāthīn juzʼan min al-Arḍ, thumma al-Qamar wa-huwa juzʼ min tisʻah wa-thalāthīn juzʼan wa-rubʻ juzʼ min al-Arḍ. Fa-hādhihi maqādīr ajrām al-kawākib, wa-bihā nakhtum al-kitāb. Tamm. M. M. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... wa-ʻĀṣim wa-Ḥamzah wa-al-Kisāʼī wa-Khalaf bi-kasr al-Qāf wa-fatḥ al-Yāʼ mukhaffafah, wa-qaraʼa al-bā[qūn] bi-fatḥ al-Qāf wa-kasr al-Yāʼ maʻa al-tashdīd. Qawluhu taʻālá: 'Millat Ibrāhīm Ḥanīfan', qaraʼa Hishām 'Ibrāhām' bi-al-Alif wa-fatḥ al-Hāʼ qablahā, wa-al-bāqūn bi-al-Yāʼ al-taḥtīyah wa-kasr al-Hāʼ qablahā. Qawluhu taʻālá: 'wa-maḥyāya wa-mamātī lillāh', qaraʼ Nāfiʻ bi-iskān Yāʼ 'maḥyāy' bi-khilāf ʻan Warsh, wa-fatḥ Yāʼ 'mamātiya' fī al-waṣl, wa-qaraʼa Abū Jaʻfar bi-fatḥ Yāʼ maḥyāya wa-mamātiya maʻan, wa-qaraʼ al-bāqūn bi-fatḥ Yāʼ maḥyāya wa-iskān Yāʼ mamātī ..."
Secundo folio: fa-taḍribu thalāthah fī thalāthah bi-tisʻah.
15 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 14.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding deteriorated (in 16 quires; some numbered); back cover missing.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on thick white laid paper; the verses of the different verses of the Sūrahs of the Qurʼān in red; few notes on the margins; catchwords.
The words "al-Budūr" and "al-Budūr al-zāhirah" are written at the beginning of some of the numbered quires.
The leaves of the codex are numbered 20-175.
On the front cover: "The 10 various Readings of the Koran."
Inside the front cover: Two medicinal recipes.

Author's colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā tayassara, wa-lillāh al-ḥamd wa-al-minnah. Wa-katabahu bi-yadihi al-fāniyah faqīr raḥmat Rabbihi al-bāqiyah muʼallifuhu ʻAmr [ʻUmar] ibn Qāsim ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī al-Nūs [Abū Ḥafṣ] al-Nashshār, kafāhu Allāh sharr al-ashrār bi-jāh Muḥammad al-Mukhtār. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taʻlīqihi fī yawm al-Aḥad al-mubārak, thālith ʻashar Dhī [al-]Qaʻdah al-ḥarām, sanat aḥad wa-tisʻimiʼah, aḥsana Allāh ʻāqibatahā. Āmīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taʼlīfihi sādis ʻasharī shahr Rajab al-fard al-ḥarām, sanat thamān wa-tisʻīn wa-thamān miʼah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This is the end of what was facilitated. Praise and gratitude be to God. Completed by the perishing hand of the poor to the everlasting mercy of his Lord, its author ʻAmr [ʻUmar] ibn Qāsim ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī al-Nūs [Abū Ḥafṣ] al-Nashshār, may he be spared the evil of the evil ones, for the sake of Muḥammad the Chosen One. It was completed on blessed Sunday, the thirteenth of sacred al-Qaʻdah, of the year 901 [of the Hijrah = 2 August 1496], may God end it favorably. Amen. It was written on the sixteenth of the unique and sacred month of Rajab, of the year 898 [of the Hijrah = 12 May 1493]. May God's prayer be upon our Master Muḥammad, his family, and all his companions. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

Copyist's colophon: "Tamma al-kitāb al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi al-Sabt, ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-musīʼ bi-fiʻlihi, al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, aḥwaj al-nās ilá raḥmat Allāh taʻālá wa-ilá ʻafwihi, al-faqīr Ibrāhīm Yaqʻūb al-Sindī baladan, al-Rifāʻī ṭarīqatan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-mashāyikhihi, wa-li-man qaraʼahu, wa-li-man qaraʼ fīhi wa-daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The copy of the blessed book was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence, on Saturday, by the poor and wretched, of offensive deeds, who admits his guilt and inadequacy, the neediest of the people to the mercy of Almighty God and His forgiveness, the poor Ibrāhīm Yaʻqūb al-Sindī baladan, al-Rifāʻī ṭarīqatan, may God forgive him, his parents, his shaykhs, those who read the book, those who read it and invoke forgiveness for him, and all Muslims. Amen. May God's prayer be upon our Master Muḥammad, his family, and all his companions. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. Amen. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Rubʻ al-Muhlikāt min al-Maḥajjah al-bayḍāʼ fī iḥyāʼ al-Iḥyāʼ : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Murtaḍá Fayḍ al-Kāshī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 2b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Kitāb Sharḥ ʻajāʼib al-qalb, wa-huwa al-kitāb al-awwal min Rubʻ al-Muhlikāt min al-Maḥajjah al-bayḍāʼ fī iḥyāʼ al-Iḥyāʼ. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī tataḥayyaru dūna idrāk jalālihi al-qulūb wa-al-khawāṭir, wa-tudhashu fī mabādī ishrāq nūrihi al-aḥdāq wa-al-nawāẓir, al-muṭṭaliʻ ʻalá khafīyāt al-sarāʼir, al-ʻālim bi-maknūnāt al-ḍamāʼir, al-mustaghnī fī tadbīr mulkihi ʻan al-mushāwir wa-al-muwāzir, muqallib al-qulūb wa-ghaffār al-dhunūb, wa-sattār al-ʻuyūb, wa-mufarrij al-kurūb ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-ʻaql wa-al-qalb wa-mā huwa al-murād bi-hādhihi al-asāmī.
16 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 17.5 cm; 28 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather.
In good small naskh script, in black ink, on laid cream color paper; headings and marking in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On a laid in slip of paper: "Iḥyāʼ of Imām al-Gazalī, v. 3. Date 1105 H. M.Y."

On folio 1a: An index of contents: "Hādhā Kitāb al-Rubʻ al-thālith min Kitāb Maḥajjah [al-Maḥajjah] al-bayḍāʼ, wa-huwa Rubʻ al-Muhlikāt, wa-yashmalu ʻalá ʻashr kutub: Kitāb Sharḥ ʻajāʼib al-qalb, Kitāb Riyāḍat al-nafs, Kitāb Kasr al-shahwatayn shahwat al-baṭn wa-shahwat al-farj, Kitāb Āfāt al-lisān, Kitāb al-Ghaḍab wa-al-ḥiqd wa-al-ḥasad, Kitāb Dhamm al-dunyā, Kitāb Dhamm al-māl wa-al-bukhl, Kitām Dhamm al-jāh wa-al-riyāʼ, Kitāb Dhamm al-kubr wa-al-ʻujb, Kitāb Dhamm al-ghurūr."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Huwa. Qad intaqal bi-al-mubāyaʻah al-sharʻīyah hādhā al-mujallad al-mumajjad, maʻa sāʼir mujalladātihi tamāman, bi-juhd shadīd wa-saʻy balīgh, fī baldat Shārī, ṣānahā Allāh min al-ḥadathān wa-al-bawārī. Wa-anā al-ḥaqīr Muḥammad ibn Abū al-Faḍl al-Tādiʼī, ʻufiya ʻanhumā bi-mannihi wa-jūdih."

On folio 2a: 1. An ownership statement: "Dakhala fī Mktabat al-ʻArab li-ṣāḥibihā al-Shaykh Yūsuf al-Bustānī al-Lubnānī, fī 9/12/937." 2. A statement in Persian and an illegible stamp. 3. An ownership statement dated in the year 1256 of the Hijrah (1840/1841): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī manna ʻalá ʻabdihi al-ḍaʻīf bi-intiqāl hādhā al-rubʻ min al-kitāb ilayya, al-musammá 'al-Maḥajjah al-bayḍāʼ', min Ibn ʻUmar, adāma Allāh ḥifẓahu, baʻdamā kuntu atmamtuhu fī layālī wa-ayyām wa-shuhūr wa-aʻwām, razaqanī Allāh al-ʻamal bimā fīhā [... ... ...] fī sanat sittah wa-khamsīn baʻda al-alf wa-al-miʼatayn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah [1840/1841], ʻalá muhājirihā alf salām wa-ṣalāh wa-taḥīyah." And an illegible stamp.
On the upper left corner of folio 3a: A name "Takallufī Ṣādiq Sulṭān", and two illegible stamps, one recatangular and the other oval.
On the end leaf: Two statements in Persian.

The text ends on folio 169b as follows: "Hādhā ākhir al-kalām fī Kitāb Dhamm al-ghurūr, wa-bi-tamāmihi tamma Rubʻ al-Muhlikāt min al-Maḥajjah al-bayḍāʼ fī iḥyāʼ al-Iḥyāʼ, wa-yatlūhu, in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá, fī Rubʻ al-Munjiyāt, Kitāb al-Tawbah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh awwalan wa-ākhiran wa-ẓāhiran wa-bāṭinan."

Translation of the end of the text (folio 169b): "This is the end of the discourse on 'Kitāb Dhamm al-ghurūr' (Book of Disparagement of snobbery). With its completion, 'Rubʻ al-Muhlikāt' (Quarter on Perilous acts) of 'al-Maḥajjah al-bayḍāʼ fī iḥyāʼ al-Iḥyā' will be followed, God willing, by 'Rubʻ al-Munjiyāt' (Quarter on Deliverance acts), beginning with 'Kitāb al-Tawbah' (Book on Repentance). Praise be to God in the beginning and at the end, explicitly and implicitly."

Author's colophon: "Ṣūrat khaṭṭ al-muʼallif. Faragha min taswīdihi muʼallifuhu, aqall al-ʻibād ʻamalan, wa-aktharuhum zalalan, wa-aʻẓamuhum rajāʼan wa-amalan, al-musīʼ al-mulaqqab bi-'Muḥsin' [on the right margin: Muḥammad ibn Murtaḍá al-Kāshānī], aḥsana Allāh ḥālahu, wa-jabara bi-luṭfihi ikhtilālahu, wa-khatama bi-al-bāqiyāt al-ṣāliḥāt aʻmālahu, bi-Muḥammad wa-ālih, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ālih. Fī awākhir shahr Ṣafar, min shuhūr sanat sabʻ wa-arbaʻīn baʻda al-alf al-Hijrīyah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh."

Translation of the author's colophon: "A copy of the author's statement: Its author, the least among the servants in deeds, the most slippery, and the greatest in hope and expectation, the offender nicknamed 'Muḥsin' (Beneficent) [on the right margin: Muḥammad ibn Murtaḍá al-Kāshānī], may God ameliorate his condition, redress with His kindness his imbalance, and seal with the enduring good deeds his acts, for the sake of Muḥammad and his family, may God's prayer be upon Him and His family. Dated, the end of the month of Ṣafar, of the year 1047 of the Hijrah [23 July 1637]. Praise be to God."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-faragha min tanmīqihi kātibuhu al-ʻabd al-waḍīʻ Ibn Muḥammad Raḍī, Muḥammad Badīʻ, ballaghahu Allāh mā yatamannāh, wa-jaʻala ākhiratahu khayran min ūlāh, fī shahr Shawwāl, min shuhūr al-muntaẓam fī silk shuhūr al-sanah al-khāmisah allatī hiya min sinī al-miʼah al-thāniyah min al-ʻushr al-thānī baʻda al-alf al-Hijrīyah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi wa-ālihi wa-sallama taslīn kathīran."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The embellishment of the copy was completed by its scribe, the meek servant Muḥammad Badīʻ ibn Muḥammad Raḍī, may God convey to him what he desires, and make his end better than his beginning. In the month of Shawwāl, the fifth year of the second decade of the second hundred years, of the Hijrī millennium [i.e., 1115 of the Hijrah = February/March 1704]. Praise be to God, and blessings and abundant peace be upon His Prophet and his family."

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Astaftiḥu bāb al-ʻawn bi-aydī maḥāmid Allāh, ʻazza wa-jall, kullihā, wa-astanjiḥu saʻya al-qaṣd bai-ayādīhi al-ghurr wa-ballihā, wa-astalmiḥu barq al-ḥaqq li-ʻayn sarīratī fī maqʻd ẓillihā, wa-astasqīhi li-maṣādir afʻālī min mawārid afḍālihi nahlihā wa-ʻallihā, wa-astashfīhi min īdhāʼ adhwāʼ nafsī fī ḥālatay ṣafwihā wa-ʻallihā ..."

On folio 1a: A distorted ownership statement: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qad tamallaktu hādhā al-kitāb. al-Mulk lillāh. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá (wa-tabāraka ʻalá) Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-al-nabīyīn wa-al-malāʼikah ajmaʻīn, wa-ʻibād Allāh al-ṣāliḥīn, wa-al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt ajmaʻīn. Katabahu al-Shaykh Muḥammad ibn Salīm Ḥimṣī."
At the head of folio 1b: A decorative design in gold, red, and violet.
At the head of the text on folio 1b: "Hādhā kitāb Bahjat al-asrār wa-maʻdin al-anwār fī manāqib Shaykh al-Islām, quṭb al-ʻārifīn, al-Shaykh Muḥyī al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu."
On folio 2b: "... wa-sammaytuhu 'Bahjat al-anwār wa-maʻdin al-asrār' ..."

Colophon: "Ākhir mā buyyiḍa min hādhā al-kitāb, wa-huwa kitāb 'Bahjat al-asrār wa-maʻdin al-anwār' fī manāqib Shaykh al-Islām, quṭb al-ʻārifīn, Muḥyī al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlī, qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu wa-nawwara ḍaīḥahu, jamʻ al-faqīr ilá raḥmat Rabbihi, ʻazza wa-jall, al-ghanī bi-hi, ʻAlī ibn Yūsuf ibn Jarīr ibn Miʻḍād ibn Faḍl al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hum. Āmīn. Wa-la-hu [... ... ...] in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣalātuhu ʻalá Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Taḥrīran fī tārīkh ghurrat shahr Ramaḍān al-mubārak, sanat thalāth wa-alf, dar baldat Baghdād, sih sanah sadah."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of the fair copy of the book titled 'Bahjat al-asrār wa-maʻdin al-anwār' on the virtues of Shaykh al-Islām, the axle of the sages, Muḥyī al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlī, may God sanctify his spirit and enlighten his tomb, which was compiled by the poor to the mercy of his Lord, may He be exalted and glorified, who is enriched by Him, ʻAlī ibn Yūsuf ibn Jarīr ibn Miʻḍād ibn Faḍl al-Shāfiʻī, may God forgive them. Amen. And for him [... ... ...], God Almighty willing. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May His prayer be upon Muḥammad, on his family, and all his companions. Written and dated at the beginning of the blessed month of Ramaḍān, of the year 1003 [of the Hijrah = 10 May 1595], in the city of Baghdād, in the third year of the century."

Secundo folio: yamluk mā kān abīh mā kān fa-khallā al-māl fī al-baḥr.
8.5 x 12 cm; written surface: 7 x 10.5 cm; 10-14 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In large fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; markings in red, includes few words/notations in Coptic; some leaves are stuck together; catchwords.
On folio 30a: "Madīḥah lil-Sitt al-Sayyidah ʻalá ṭarīqat [two words in Coptic]", starts with: "Amdaḥ fī al-Batūl wa-ashraḥ fīhā wa-aqūl wa-hiya aṣl al-uṣūl Yā jawhar maknūn ..."
On folio 32a: "Madīḥah li-Yūsuf ibn Yaʻqūb wa-Rāḥīl ummih ..."
Folios 34a-37a and folio 113b are blank.
On folio 37b-70b: "Madīḥat al-ghurūb min qawl Abū al-Saʻd lil-Sayyidah Maryam."
On folio 71b : "Madīḥah li-tasliyat al-nafs min qawl Abū al-Saʻd."

The text about al-Qiddīs Jirjis ends as follows: "... wa-al-tasbīḥ wa-al-taqdīs ilá dahr al-dahrīn fī ṭūl al-azmānī // billāh Mārī Jirjis billāh al-fawqānī, wa-tusāmiḥ lil-ḥuḍḍār billāh bi-al-ghufrānī, wa-tusāmiḥ lillī hunā qāʻidīn ḥaddānī, illī qāʻidīn wa-illī rāḥ yā ikhwānī. Tamma fa-kamul."
Colophon: No colophon. The last page is illegible.

record.title: 880-03 Nathr al-laʼālī : manuscript / al-Faḍl ibn al-Ḥasan al-Ṭabarsī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Hādhā Kitāb Nathr al-laʼālī min kalām Mawlānā Amīr al-Muʼminīn ʻAlī ibn Abīṭālib, ʻalayhi al-salām, ʻalá tartīb ḥurūf al-muʻjam, rawāhu al-Shaykh al-ajall Abū ʻAlī al-Ṭabarsī, ṣāḥib 'Majmaʻ al-bayān fī tafsīr al-Qurʼān', ṭayyaba Allāh tharāh."
Secundo folio: Īmān al-marʼ yuʻrafu bi-aymānih.
10.5 x 17.5 cm; written surface: 6 x 13 cm; 8 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard cover; red cloth on spine.
In fair large calligraphic naskh script; in black ink, on cream color paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords.
On the sticker pasted to the front cover: "Ṭabarsī. Nathr al-laʼālī."
On folio 1a: Illegible scribbles.
Laid in card: "From the previous sayings of ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib, as it is arranged and narrated by Abū ʻAlī al-Ṭabarsī. Ḥadīth ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib as narrated by al-Ṭabarsī. Arranged alphabetically."
Laid in card: "MS Ḥadīth of ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib."
Colophon: "Tammat al-kalimāt al-murtaḍawīyah wa-al-ʻibārāt al-ʻAlawīyah bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh awwalan wa-ākhiran wa-ẓāhiran wa-bāṭinan."

Translation of the colophon: "The gratifying sayings and the Alawite/Sublime statements were completed by the praise of God and His abundant benevolence. Praise be to God in the beginning and at the end, explicitly and implicitly."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat al-Ṣabbān ʻalá Sharḥ al-Ushmūnī ʻalá Alfīyat Ibn Mālik : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān.
record.note: Title from reference sources and the printed versions.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... Qawluhu: Wa-ammā qawluhum ilkh. Hādhā wārid ʻalá qawlihi wa-lā yastanidu illā ilá al-ism. Zaʻamū maṭīyat al-kadhib, ay maṭīyat al-ḥākī qawl ghayrihi ilá nisbat al-kadhib ilá al-qawl alladhī yaḥikīyhi ʻalá mā qālahu Shaykhunā, wa-yaḥtamilu anna al-murād maṭīyat al-kādhib ilá ḥikāyat al-qawl al-kadhib alladhī yaḥkīhi ka-al-maṭīyah fī al-tawaṣṣul ilá al-maqṣ[ūd]. Yurwá miẓannah bi-al-ẓāʼ al-mushālah wa-al-nūn ism lil-fiʻl, ay ʻalam ʻalá shakhṣayn lil-lafẓ al-wāqiʻ fī ghayr hādhā al-tarkīb min al-tarkīb al-mustaʻmal fīhā al-lafẓ fī maʻnāh kamā fī sirtu min al-Baṣrah wa-ḍaraba Zaydun, kamā marra mufaṣṣalan. Tamyīzan tamyīzan ay tamyīzan, li-anna al-thābit lil-ism lā al-tamyīz alladhī huwa fiʻl al-fāʻil, fa-huwa min iṭlāq al-maṣdar ʻalá al-ḥāṣil bi-hi ..."
Secundo folio: al-fāʻil al-Tāʼ al-dāllah bi-al-muṭābaqah ʻalá man wujida minhu al-fiʻl.
17 x 24 cm; written surface: 11 x 18 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 21 unnumbered quires)
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... fa-innahu lā athara lil-ʻaṭf fīhi, ay ʻalá al-jumlah al-ṣughrá, yʻayyanu annhu lā yaṣiḥḥu al-ʻaṭf ʻalayhā li-annahu yalzamu ʻalayhi tasalluṭ mā al-taʻajjubīyah ʻalá al-jumlah al-maʻṭūfah, wa-huwa lā yaṣiḥḥu li-ʻadam qaṣd al-taʻajjub bi-hā, fa-al-rājiḥ al-rafʻ ʻalá al-ʻaṭf ʻalá majmūʻ al-jumlah al-ismīyah bināʼan ʻalá khabarīyatihā, aw jawāz ʻaṭf al-khabar ʻalá al-inshāʼ, wa-yajūzu al-naṣb ʻalá al-ʻaṭf al-madhkūr wa-in lam yakun fīhi tanāsub al-mutaʻāṭifayn yamnaʻān al-naṣb bināʼan ʻalá anna al-ʻaṭf ʻalá al-ṣughrá li-ʻadam al-rābiṭ kamā fī al-Taṣrīḥ, fa-lā yunāfī ʻuzū al-muṣ. fī Tashīlihi ilá al-Akhfash wa-man wāfaqahu tarjīḥ al-rafʻ lā wujūbuhu li-annahu mabnī ʻalá anna al-ʻaṭf ʻalá al-kubrá li-fawāt al-tanāsub fī ..."

record.title: 880-01 Murhij al-Mirhajān : manuscript.
record.note: Title from the sticker on cover.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: Incipit missing. Text starts with: "... Yā Sādah, wa-kāna dhālik al-qaṣr qaṣr ʻāmir alldhī kunnā dhakarnāhu fī awwal al-sīrah, huwa alladhī qalaʻahu al-Malik al-Farshaq akhū Shamhawrash, malik al-jānn, wa-huwa ʻamm al-Jamaldaq, wa-qallaʻa minhu aṣḥābahu wa-iḥtawá ʻalayhi bi-man maʻahu min al-jānn, wa-taʼahhalū fī dhālika al-makān. Wa-qad sāqat al-aqdār lil-Malik Mahdawih ilá tilka al-diyār. Qāla al-rāwī: Wa-kāna al-Malik Mahdawih min ḥīn najjāhu Allāh min al-baḥr wa-ṭalaʻa li-dhālika al-wādī raʼathu al-Malikah al-Thurayyā bint al-Malik al-Farastaq, fa-akhfat nafsahā minhu, fa-samiʻathu yabkī wa-yatanahhad, fa-raqqa qalbuhā ilayhi, maʻa kufrihā. Fa-subḥāna muḥannin al-qulūb ..."
Secundo folio: Lā ilāha illā Allāh, Muḥammad Rasūl Allāh.
16.2 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 11 x 18 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; dark red leather on spine.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; catchwords.
On the label pasted to the front cover: "Murhij al-Marhajān. Min kutub Luṭfī al-Rahwanjī, ṣāḥib al-Maktabah al-Adabīyah bi-Sūq al-Miskīyah."
At the head of folio 1a (in pencil): "ʻAlī al-Shāghūrī"; "ʻAdad 3 Murhij Mirhajān".

On the right margin of folio 34b: A reader's statement dated in the year 317 (1317 of the Hijrah = 1899/1900), as follows: "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammal maʻāniyahu al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-Karīm Muḥammad Jawdat ibn ʻUmar Bāshā sanat 317."

On folio 35b: The following three statements: 1. An ownership statement dated in the year 1300 of the Hijrah (1882/1883), as follows: "Qad dakhala hādhā al-kitāb fī milk al-Sayyid Khālid Shuʻayb al-Jundī, wa-min baʻdihi awlāduhu, sanat 1300." 2. A reader's statement dated 12 Muḥarram of the year 1318 of the Hijrah (12 May 1900), as follows: "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-jalīl, Naʻīm ibn al-Ḥājj Ḥusayn Fākihānī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Ḥurrira 12 Muḥarram, sanat 1318." 3. A reader's statement dated 14 Muḥarram of the year 1319 of the Hijrah (3 May 1901), as follows: "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-jalīl, Ṣādiq al-Mallāḥ, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu, wa-ʻalá wālidayhi, wa-ʻalá jamīʻ al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. Ḥurrira fī 14 Muḥarram, sanat 1319."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... fa-dakhala Badr al-Dujā ʻalá abīhi al-Malik Khālid wa-aʻlamahu bi-al-khabar. Fa-lammā samiʻa al-Malik Khālid dhālika al-khabar min ibnihi Badr al-Dujā shaqqa ʻalayhi dhālik wa-ayqana bi-al-mahālik, wa-ḥazina ʻalá al-Mihrajān al-ḥuzn al-shadīd, wa-kadhālika zawjatuhu Shams al-Nahār lammā samiʻat bi-tilka al-akhbār bakat bukāʼ shadīd mā ʻalayhi min mazīd. Wa-lā zālū fī al-bukāʼ wa-al-naḥīb ānāʼ al-layl wa-aṭrāf al-nahār. Qāla al-rāwī: Fa-hādhā mā kāna li-hāʼulāʼ. Wa-ammā mā kāna ..."

record.title: 880-03 al-Fawāʼid al-Ḍiyāʼīyah : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Aḥmad al-Jāmī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. The text starts with: "... li-maʻná. al-Maʻná mā yuqṣadu li-shayʼ, fa-huwa immā mafʻal, ism makān bi-maʻná al-maqṣad, aw maṣdar mīmī bi-maʻná al-mafʻūl, aw mukhaffaf maʻná ism mafʻūl ka-marmá. Wa-lammā kāna al-maʻná maʼkhūdhan fī al-waḍʻ, fa-dhikr al-maʻná baʻdahu munbiʼ ʻalá tajrīdihi ʻanhu, fa-kharaja bi-hi al-muhmalāt wa-al-alfāẓ al-dāllah bi-al-ṭabʻ, idh lam yataʻallaq bihimā waḍʻ wa-takhfīḍ aṣlan, wa-baqiyat ḥurūf al-hijāʼ al-mawḍūʻah li-gharaḍ al-tarkīb, lā bi-izāʼ al-maʻná wa-kharajat bi-qawlihi waḍʻuhā li-maʻná aw li-gharaḍ al-tarkīb lā bi-izāʼ al-maʻná ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-ḥarf wa-al-khabar wa-al-jumlah wa-ghayrihā.
14.7 x 22 cm; written surface: 7 x 14.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion and decorative frame in gold.
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on cream color paper; the phrases of "al-Kāfiya" in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; text framed in gold; catchwords.
At the head of folio 1b: A decorative design in gold, dark blue, red, and gray.

Author's colophon: "Qad istarāḥa min kamad al-intihāḍ li-naql hādhā al-sharḥ min al-sawād ilá al-bayāḍ al-ʻabd al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Jāmī, waffaqahu Allāh, subḥānuhu, fī waẓāʼif ʻubūdīyatihi lil-iʻrāḍ ʻan muṭālabat al-aʻwāḍ wa-al-aghrāḍ, ḍaḥwat al-Sabt, al-ḥādī ʻashar min Ramaḍān, al-muntaẓim fī silk shuhūr sanat sabʻ wa-tisʻīn wa-thamānimiʼah min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalayhi afḍal al-taḥīyah."

Translation of the author's colophon: "The poor servant, ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Jāmī, has rested from the worry of arousing to move this commentary from rough drafting to fair drafting. May the Glorious God grant him success to fulfill the duties of his servitude, that he may refrain from asking for rewards or benefits. On Saturday morning, the eleventh of the month of Ramaḍān, of the year 897 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best greeting be upon him [16 July 1492]."
Copyist's colophon: "Khutimat bi-al-khayr fī al-thānī min Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, sanat 1251 (fī yawm al-Thulāth [this phrase is on the right margin of the colophon]), sanat 1251."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "It was well completed on the second of Rabīʻ al-Ākhir (on Tuesday [this phrase is on the right margin of the colophon]), of the year 1251 [of the Hijrah = 28 July 1835]."

record.title: Treatises on Arabic morphology : manuscript.
record.note: 1. Title of "Mabādiʼ fī al-taṣrīf" from reference sources.
2. Title of "Laṭāfat al-ṣarf" from incipit (folio 8a).
3. Title of "Naẓm ʻAwāmil al-Jurjānī" supplied by cataloger based on the verses at the end of the treatise.
4. Title of "Bughyat al-āmil min taḥqīq al-ʻAwāmil" from incipit folio 37b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Mabādiʼ fī al-taṣrīf": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Iʻlam inna abwāb al-taṣrīf khamsah wa-thalāthūn bāban, sittah minhā lil-thulāthī al-mujarrad. al-Bāb al-awwal minhā faʻala yafʻalu, mawzūnuhu naṣara yanṣuru, wa-ʻalāmatuhu an yakūna ʻayn fiʻlihi maftūḥan fī al-māḍī wa-maḍmūman fī al-muḍāriʻ, wa-bināʼuhu lil-taʻdiyah ghāliban, wa-qad yakūnu lāziman, mithāl al-mutaʻaddī naḥwa naṣara Zaydun ʻAmran ..."
1. Secundo folio of "Mabādiʼ fī al-taṣrīf": mithāl al-mutaʻaddī naḥwa ḍaraba Zaydun ʻAmaran.

2. Incipit of "Laṭāfat al-ṣarf": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alldhī yuṣarrifu al-umūr kayfa yashāʼ, wa-yumḍī amrahu ʻalá al-ḥāl wa-al-istiqbāl, ʻalá mā shāʼ, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá man arsalahu bi-al-hudá, wa-huwa tāj al-anbiyā, wa-ʻalá ālihi al-aṣfiyāʼ wa-aṣḥābihi al-atqiyāʼ. Ammā baʻd, fa-innī jamaʻtu baʻḍ al-masāʼil al-ṣarfīyah al-kathīrat al-manfaʻah lil-mubtadī bi-ʻibārah sahlah, wa-sammaytuhu bi-'Laṭāfat al-ṣarf', wa-Allāh walī al-rashād wa-ʻalayhi al-iʻtimād ..."
2. Secundo folio of "Laṭāfat al-ṣarf": wa-aḍārīb wa-aḍrabūn wa-ḍurab wa-ḍurabyāt.

3. Incipit of "Naẓm ʻAwāmil al-Jurjānī". The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... isman ʻalá al-tamyīzi fīmā awjabū. al-Nawʻ al-tāsiʻ. Hayhāta shattāna wa-surʻāna thabat // lil-ismi baʻdahā ḥaythu attat. Balha ruwaydan dūnakā ʻalaykahā // hā ḥayhala tanṣub bihā ilaykā. al-Nawʻ al-ʻāshir. Wa-tarfaʻu al-isma wa-tanṣubu al-khabar // kāna wa-ṣāra bāta amsá ka-al-qamar ..."

4. Incipit of "Bughyat al-āmil min taḥqīq al-ʻAwāmil": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā sharḥ laṭīf waḍaʻtuhu ʻalá al-ʻawāmil al-naḥwīyah allatī allafahā al-Shaykh al-Imām ʻAbd al-Qāhir al-Jurjānī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih wa-askanahu buḥbūḥ jannatih, wa-sammaytuhu 'Bughyat al-āmil min taḥqīq al-ʻAwāmil', wa-Allāh al-hādī ilá sawāʼ al-sabīl, wa-huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl ..."
4. Secundo folio of "Bughyat al-āmil min taḥqīq al-ʻAwāmil": ay min al-lafẓīyah sabʻat ʻawāmil bi-al-dalīl al-madhkūr.
15 x 20.2 cm; written surface: varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: In cardboard cover; dark brown leather on spine.

The codex is written in different hands, in fair to good naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; some leaves are smudged; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Zanjānī fī al-ṣarf, wa-nuskhah fī al-ṣarfī ayḍan."
On the upper right margin of folio 1b: Two illegible stamps.

1. Colophon of "Mabādiʼ fī al-taṣrīf": No colophon. The text ends as follows: "... wa-al-thālith mumtaniʻ, wa-huwa an yakūna al-awwal min al-mutajānisayn mutaḥarrikan wa-al-ḥurūf [wa-al-ḥarf] al-thānī sākinan bi-sukūn aṣlī, naḥwa madadtu, wa-immā mahmūz wa-huwa an yakūna aḥad ḥurūfihi al-aṣlīyah hamzah, naḥwa akhadha wa-saʼala wa-qaraʼa, fa-in kānat al-hamzah fī muqābalat al-fāʼ yusammá mahmūz al-fāʼ, wa-in kānat fī muqābalat al-ʻayn yusammá mahmūz al-ʻayn, wa-in kānat fī muqābalat lāmihi yusammá mahmūz al-lām. Wa-hādhihi aqsām sabʻah yajmaʻuhā hādhihi [hādhā] al-bayt: [... ... ...] ṣaḥīḥ ast mithāl ast muḍāʻafun // [...] nāqiṣun mahmūzun ajwafu. Tammat. M M M M."

2. Colophon of "Laṭāfat al-ṣarf": "Qad faraghtu min taʼlīf mā lā budda minhu lil-madá [lil-mubtadī], wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá dhālik, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Nabīyihi wa-ālih wa-aṣḥābihi kadhālik." After the colophon an invocation (in a different hand) in three verses, as follows: "Yā man yarā madda al-baʻūḍi janāḥahā // fī ḍulmati al-layli al-bahīmi al-alyali. Wa-yará manāṭa ʻurūqihā fī naḥrihā // wa-al-mukhkha fī tilka al-ʻiḍām al-nuḥḥali. Ighfir li-ʻabdin tāba ʻan faraṭātihi // mā kāna minhu fī al-zamāni al-awwali."

2. Translation of the colophon of "Laṭāfat al-ṣarf": "I have finished writing what is necessary for the beginner. Praise be to God for this. May prayer be upon His Prophet, on his family, and on his companions." After the colophon an invocation (in a different hand) in three verses, as follows: O You who sees the mosquito spreading its wings // In the darkness of the jet-black night. And sees the stretching of its veins in its throat // and the marrow in those tender bones. Forgive a servant who repents of his excesses // what was committed in a bygone time."

3. "Naẓm ʻAwāmil al-Jurjānī" ends with: "... Tamma bi-dhā 'ʻAwāmilu al-Jurjānī' // naẓman bi-ḥamdi Allāhi dhī al-iḥsāni. Wa-bi-al-ṣalāti wa-al-salāmi al-dāʼimi // ʻalá al-Nabīyi al-ʻArabīyi al-Hāshimī. Wa-ālihi ashrafi kulli ʻāmili // wa-ṣaḥbihi al-hudāti wa-al-amāthili."

3. Translation of the end of "Naẓm ʻAwāmil al-Jurjānī": "The 'ʻAwāmil' of al-Jurjānī are now completed // versified by the praise of Benevolent God. By prayer and perpetual peace // upon the Arab Hashemite Prophet. Upon His family, the most noble agents // and upon His companions the exemplary guides."

3. Colophon of "Naẓm ʻAwāmil al-Jurjānī": "Waqaʻa al-farāgh min hādhihi al-ʻAwāmil lil-Jurjānī bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi ʻalá yad al-aqall [aqall] ʻibād Allāh wa-aḥwajihim ilá ʻafw Rabbihi al-qadīm [... ...] Muẓaffar, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn."

3. Translation of the colophon of "Naẓm ʻAwāmil al-Jurjānī": "The 'ʻAwāmil' of al-Jurjānī were completed by the praise of God and His well-granted success, by the hand of the least of the servants and the neediest to the forgiveness of his Sempiternal Lord [... ...] Muẓaffar, may God forgive him and his parents. Amen."

4. Colophon of "Bughyat al-āmil min taḥqīq al-ʻAwāmil": "Qāla muʼallifuhu, Sayyidunā wa-barakatunā wa-shaykhunā, al-Shaykh al-muḥaqqiq, al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-mudaqqiq, ʻAbd al-Malik ibn al-marḥūm al-Mullā Jamāl al-Dīn al-ʻIṣāmī, fasaḥ Allāh wa-adām al-nafʻa bi-hi wa-aʻāda ʻalaynā min barakātihi: Tamma taʼlīf hādhā al-sharḥ al-mubārak bayna ṣalātay al-ẓuhr wa-al-ʻaṣr, yawm al-Aḥad, rābiʻ ʻashar Rabīʻ al-Awwal, min al-sanah al-rābiʻah ʻashar baʻda al-alf, khatama Allāh lanā bi-al-ḥusná. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad afḍal al-khalāʼiq ajmaʻīn. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

4. Translation of the colophon of "Bughyat al-āmil min taḥqīq al-ʻAwāmil": "Its author, Our Master, our blessing, and our teacher, the erudite scholar and the learned meticulous authority, ʻAbd al-Malik ibn al-marḥūm al-Mullā Jamāl al-Dīn al-ʻIṣāmī, may God expand and perpetuate his benefit, and repeat for us his blessings, said: This blessed commentary was completed between the noon and afternoon prayers, on Sunday, the fourteenth of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, of the year 1014 [of the Hijrah = 30 July 1605]. May God seal us with goodness. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. May God's prayer and peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, the best of all creation. It is completed. It is completed. It is completed."

record.title: 880-03 al-Fann al-thālith ʻashar min Kitāb al-Shifāʼ fī al-Ilāhīyāt : manuscript / Ibn Sīnā.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Fann al-thālith ʻashar min Kitāb al-Shifāʼ fī al-Ilāhīyāt, ʻashr maqālāt. al-Maqālah al-ūlá. Faṣl fī ibtidāʼ ṭalab mawḍūʻ al-falsafah al-ūlá, li-yatabayyana ānīyatuhu fī al-ʻulūm. Wa-idh qad waffaqanā Allāh, walī al-raḥmah wa-al-tawfīq, fa-awradnā mā wajaba īrāduhu min maʻānī al-ʻulūm al-manṭiqīyah wa-al-ṭabīʻīyah wa-al-riyāḍīyah, fa-bi-al-ḥarī an nashraʻa fī taʻrīf maʻānī al-ḥikmīyah, wa-nabtadī mustaʻīnīna billāh, fa-naqūlu: Inna al-ʻulūm al-falsafīyah, kamā qad ushīra ilayhi fī mawāḍiʻa ukhrá min al-kutub, munqasim ilá al-naẓarīyah wa-ilá al-ʻamalīyah, wa-qad ushīra ilá al-farq baynahumā ..."
Secundo folio: istikmāl al-qūwah al-naẓarīyah bi-ḥuṣūl al-ʻilm al-taṣawwurī.
10 x 19 cm; written surface: 5 x 13 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In dark red leather.
In good naskh/taʻlīq script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; text framed in gold; catchwords.
On the upper edge of the manuscript: "Shifā".

On folio 1a: The following statements: 1. "Kitāb Shifā [...]." 2. "ʻAdad awrāq maktūbah 235. ʻAdad [... ...] 8835." 3. An ownership statement: "Min mumtalakāt aqall al-khalīqah, bal lā shayʼ fī al-ḥaqīqah, Ibn Hidāyat Allāh." 4. An illegible rectangular stamp. 5. A statement in Persian: "Īn nuskhah bā wujūd ḥusn-i khaṭṭ, nihāʼī ṣiḥḥat ast, va nāqiṣ-i qaḍīyah-i kullīyah ast." 6. An illegible rectangular stamp. 7. Two statements in Persian.
Laid in blue card: "Al-Ṭabīʻiyyāt of Al-Shifa of Ibn Sina. No ... is missing.M.Y. Signatury."
Laid in slip of paper: "A- Zanjani on morphology. B- and a commentary. nr. is missing."
On folio 234b: An ownership statement dated in the year 1275 of the Hijrah (1858/1859): "Min mumtalakāt aqall al-khalīqah Muḥammad ʻAlī. 1275."

Text ends with: "... Wa-hayʼat al-tawassuṭ fī al-ghaḍabīyāt kullihā, mithl al-khawf, wa-al-ghaḍab, wa-al-ghamm, wa-al-anafah, wa-al-ḥiqd, wa-al-ḥasad, wa-ghayr dhālik. Wa-hayʼat al-tawassuṭ fī al-tadbīrīyah, wa-ruʼūs hādhihi al-faḍāʼil ʻiffah, wa-ḥikmah, wa-shajāʻah, wa-majmūʻuhā al-ʻadālah, wa-hiya khārijah ʻan al-faḍīlah al-naẓarīyah. Wa-man ijtamaʻat la-hu maʻahā al-ḥikmah al-naẓarīyah fa-qad saʻida, wa-man fāza, maʻa dhālika, bi-al-khawāṣṣ al-nabawīyah, kāda an yaṣīra rabban insānīyan, wa-kāda an taḥilla ʻibādatuhu baʻda Allāh taʻālá, wa-huwa sulṭān al-ʻālam al-arḍī wa-khalīfat Allāh fīhi."

Colophon: "Tammat bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-tawfīqih, fī awāʼil shahr Rajab al-Murjib, sanat sabʻ wa-sittīn baʻda al-alf, min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah al-Muṣṭafawīyah, ʻalayhi wa-ālihi alf alf salām wa-alf alf ṣalāh wa-al-taḥīyah. Katabahu aqall al-khalīqah Muḥammad Riḍā." After the colophon: An illegible rectangular stamp.

Translation of the colophon: "It was completed by the help of God and His granted success, at the beginning of the Awesome month of Rajab, of the year 1067 of the Hijrah of the Chosen Prophet [15 April 1657], may a thousand thousand peace, and a thousand thousand prayer and greeting be upon Him and His family. Copied by the least of creation, Muḥammad Riḍā." After the colophon: An illegible rectangular stamp.

record.title: 880-03 al-Juzʼān al-awwal wa-al-thānī min tajziʼat khamsat ʻashar juzʼan min Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl al-Bukhārī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger based on the colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The biginning is missing, text starts with: "... ʻalayhi wa-sallam, fa-kānū fī al-Ṣuffah. Wa-qāla ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Abī Bakr: Kāna aṣḥāb al-Ṣuffah al-fuqarạ̄ʼ. Ḥaddathanā Musaddad, qāl ḥaddathanā Yaḥyá ʻan ʻUbayd Allāh ibn ʻUmar, qāl ḥaddathanī Nāfiʻ, akhbaranī ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUmar annahu kāna yanāmu, wa-huwa shābb aʻzab lā ahla la-hu fī Masjid al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Ḥaddathanā Qutaybah ibn Saʻīd, qāl ḥaddathanā ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz ibn Abī Ḥāzim, ʻan Abī Ḥāzim, ʻan Sahl ibn Saʻd, qāl: Jāʼa Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, bayta Fāṭimah fa-lam yajid ʻAlīyan fī al-bayt, fa-qāl: Ayna ibn ʻammiki ..."
Secundo folio: al-Zubayr ʻan ʻAmr ibn Sulaym al-Zuraqī
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 14 cm, 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good large naskh script, in black ink on cream color paper; headings in red, some in green; numerous comments on the margins; the word "waqf" (endowment) is written on some leaves; catchwords.

Colophon: "Ākhir al-Juzʼ al-thānī min Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, min tajziʼah khamsat ʻashar juzʼan. Wa-yatlūhu fī al-Juzʼ al-thālith 'Bāb Rafʻ al-imām yadahu fī al-istisqāʼ. al-Ḥamdu lillāh waḥdahu, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Man lā Nabī baʻdah, Muḥammad, wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "The end of the second part of the fifteen parts of 'Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī', may God Almighty have mercy upon him. It will be followed in the third part by the chapter on 'Raising of the imām his hand during the prayer for rain'. Praise be to God alone. May God's prayer and peace be upon Him, who no Prophet comes after Him, Muḥammad, upon His family and upon His companions."

record.title: 880-03 ʻArāʼis al-majālis fī qiṣaṣ al-anbiyāʼ : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Thaʻlabī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Barhīm al-Thaʻlabī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣalawātuhu ajmaʻīn wa-salāmuhu ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-Nabī al-Ummī wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-muhtadīn wa-sallama taslīman kathīran dāʼiman ilá Yawm al-Dīn: Hādhā Kitāb Nafāyis al-ʻarāyis shamala ʻalá qiṣaṣ al-Qurʼān bi-al-sharḥ wa-al-bayān, wa-ʻalá Allāh al-tiklān ..."
Secundo folio: wa-qāla taʻālá: Yrīdu Allāh an yukhaffifa ʻankum.
22.5 x 32.5 cm; written surface: 16.5 x 25.5 cm; 31 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather cover with flap; cover and flap embossed with red central medallion; spine deteriorated.
In fair large naskh script, in black ink, on thick cream color paper; headings in red; catchwords.
Laid in card: "Arabic MS from E E Calverly. Jan 26 1966."

On folio 1a: "Kitāb Nafāyis al-ʻarāyis wa-ẓaharat arwāḥ al-nafāyis. Kitāb Nafāyis al-ʻarāyis wa-zāhiyah al-ʻuyūn wa-al-majālis, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Barhīm al-Thaʻlabī, taghammadahu Allāh taʻālá bi-raḥmah, wa-askanahu buḥbūḥ jannatihi. Āmīn. Āmīn."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement, as follows: "Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-sallam. Bi-ʻawn Allāh qad dakhala hādhā al-milk fī silk milk al-ḥaqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn Muḥammad ibn [...], ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Yā Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá. Yassara Allāh al-farāgh min tatimmat Kitāb Nafāyis <al-ʻArās> al-ʻArāyis, ṣubḥa yawm al-arbaʻ layālin khalat min shahr Rabīʻ Awwal, sanat sitt wa-sabʻīn wa-miʼatayn baʻda alf min Hijrat al-Muṣṭafá, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, bi-khaṭṭ al-ḥaqīr al-faqīr khāk-i qadam-i [above it: turāb rijl] darvīhān va miskīnān, ʻAbd al-Ghafūr ibn Ḥājjī Muḥammad ibn Mullā Abū al-Qāsim Aylūdī, sākin qaryat Bāgh." After it an invocation statement in Persian.

Translation of the colophon: "May God be exalted and glorified. God facilitated the completion of the book of 'Nafāyis al-ʻarāyis', in the morning, four nights having passed from the month of Rabīʻ Awwal, of the year 1276 of the Hijrah of al-Muṣṭafá [1 October 1859], may God's prayer and peace be upon Him, in the handwriting of the wretched poor, the soil of the foot of the dervishes and the poor ones [the Ṣūfīs], ʻAbd al-Ghafūr ibn Ḥajjī Muḥammad ibn Mullā Abū al-Qāsim Aylūdī, resident of the village of Bāgh." After it an invocation statement in Persian.

record.title: 880-01 al-Ajbiyah al-muqaddasah : kitāb al-sabʻ ṣalawāt al-laylīyah wa-al-nahārīyah : manuscript.

Secundo folio: Amil Yā Rabbu qalbī ilá shahādatika lā ilá al-takabbur.
8 x 11 cm; written surface: 5 x 7.5 cm; 9 lines per page.
Binding: In grained black cardboard; black cloth on spine. Pasted to the inside the front and back cover is the image of the shield of "FABRICA DI CARTA BUSTE REGISTRI"; some quires are numbered.
In large fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords.
Laid in card: "Istanbul. Christian."

record.title: Syriac legal text on the laws of inheritance : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... āḥayhūn d-hālén ʼḥrānē meṭūl d-law taqnē enūn manú zādeq dandabar la-ṭlayē. Šrayā. B-ʼídāy gabrā d-daḥel l-Alāhā zadeq d-nehwe yúrtanhún da-ṭlāye ʼen men bytāyē u-ʼen men núkrāyē ..."
Secundo folio: malkā ḥameš pesqātā mh b-shúālā ʻal bét deqlē u-karmē.
20.5 x 27.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 23.5 cm; in two columns, 66-74 lines per column.

In small East Syriac script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings in red.

record.title: 880-03 Ḥekmtā Alāhāytā : manuscript / Bār ʻEbrāyā.
record.note: Title of "Ḥekmtā Alāhaytā" from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of "Ḥekmtā Alāhāytā" (Divine wisdom): "ʻAl ḥayleh d-Abā ʻeltā u-ʻudrāneh da-Brā Meltā u-Rúḥ Qúdšā ḥdā ítútā mšārē dawyā mlē ḥṭītā l-mektab mimrē d-Ḥekmtā Alāhāytā d-āmīr l-ḥad men pílasúpē d-Súryāyútā. Qadmaytā. Hab lí ḥaylā d-bak ēšārē // u-āp ʻudrānā b-bak ēšalem. Pgaʻ bí b-ʻalmā ṭlítā d-maghar l-Šemašā zíwah ..."
Secundo folio of "Ḥekmtā Alāhāytā" (Divine wisdom): u-zargān ʻayneh wa-pʼē ḥezwāh.
Incipit of "Núhārē d-remzē": "Tarʻā A. Ṭlítā d-maghar. H. Ḥekmtā btúltā hí meṭul d-lā ʼnāš adrkah ayk d-ítéh. U-ʼemā hí b-hāy d-menāh ʼeteled kulhén yadʻātā u-ḥekmātā d-ʻalmā ..."
Secundo folio of "Núārē d-remzē": d-ʼemrat ba-Šlémún da-bríš beryāteh brāny ú-šarkā.
16.3 x 20 cm; written surface: 11 x 14 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good East Syriac script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings in red.
Text on folio 1b is framed by a decorative design.
Folio 22 is blank.

The poem "Ḥekmtā Alāhāytā" (Divine wisdom) ends as follows: "... Āpen ʻatír gazak wa-mlē kul tʼegrātā. Wa-l-sagīyē maʻtar sagí ba-špíʻútā. Tawdí l-ḥúbak mārā d-kulhún mārāwātā. Sgīd ant b-abúk ʻam Rúḥ Qúdšā d-lā plígútā."
Colophon of "Ḥekmtā Alāhāytā" (Divine wisdom): "Šlem miʼmrā d-'Ḥekmtā Alāhāytā'. Túb 'Núhārē d-remzē da-ʻbíd l-Mār Yawsep Trāyānā Telkipyāyā."
Translation of the colophon of "Ḥekmtā Alāhaytā" (Divine wisdom): "The poem on 'Divine wisdom' is completed. Followed by 'Elucidation of the symbols' authored by Mār Yawsep Trāyānā Telkipyāyā."
"Núhārē d-remzē" ends as follows: "... U-hānā šaplā. H. Pagrā ʻam bar melkeh akelgarṣā. Mnīp pawšā. H. Pāqid da-nqāwē b-mapúltan u-nesbúk b-arʻānāyātā."

record.title: Collection of three lectionaries fragments : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Fragment 1 starts with: "Men Lúqā Msabr. U-metkrek hwā ba-mdínātā wa-b-qúryā kad malep u-mardítā ʻbad hwā l-ʼUršlem. Emar dén 'naš leh Maryā en zʻúrē hānún d-meštazbín. Hú dén emar lwathún Etkatašw l-meʻal b-tarʻā alíṣā ..."
Fragment 2 starts with: "d-Ramšā d-Ḥad b-šabā d-tlāt d-ṣawmā b-Lūqā. Wa-hwā b-ḥad men yawmātā u-hū ītāwhy d-malep u-ītayhún hwaw d-yātbīn Prašē u-malpānāy nāmúsā ..."
Secundo folio of Fragment 2: l-kūn min Abā haw rúḥā da-šrārā.
Fragment 3 starts with: "... qāmw ʻlayhén ba-lbúšē da-mbarqín kad b-deḥltā dén hway u-marknān hway parṣúpayhén ʻal arʻā. Emar lwathén manā baʻetén l-ḥayā ʻam mítē lā ītawhy harkā ..."

Fragment 1: 31.5 x 45 cm (in two columns); written surface: 9.5 x 30 cm; 22 lines per column. Fragment 2: 30.5 x 43.5 cm (in two columns); written surface: 19.5 x 27.5 cm; 20 lines per column. Fragment 3: 16.5 x 22.7 cm (in two columns); written surface: 9 x 14 cm; 11 lines per column.

record.title: An outline of the grammar of the modern Syriac : manuscript / David Tappan Stoddard.
record.note: Title from unnumbered leaf 1.

November 1855 I sent this grammar to Lebanon with all its imperfections, regretting that I can accompany it with only 88 printed pages. I trust the whole printed grammar will reach us soon, when I shall be most happy to send a copy to the capital, and would then request a return of this manuscript & the 88 pages which are in print. In an appendix recent. sent to America, I have added about one hundred new verbs."
On the back of unnumbered leaf 1: A statement about the origin of the Syriac language spoken by the people of the region and its ancient history.

Secundo folio of "Ktābā d-lúqāṭe": ḥúbā ḥyābīn l-meprʻāk ʼO aḥún ḥabíban.
