Secundo folio of "Mʻārat gāzē": ú-kulhún tegmē ú-mašryātā ú-núhrā ú-ḥešúkā.
15.5 x 21.3 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16.5 cm; 22-25 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown cover; flap missing.
In East Syriac script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings in red.

On laid in printed card: "Syriac MS. containing the "Cave of treasures" and the "Book of the Bee". Dated 1686 A.D. Lent by Professor C.C. Torrey." With a note in pencil: "of 82b (Kānūn II. A Seluc 1998 = Jan. 1687."
On the handwritten second laid in card: "Syriac MS. Containing "Book of the Bee" and the "Cave of treasure". Both complete. Good text."
Text on folio 1b is framed a decorative design.
On the right margin of folio 4b (in pencil): "One whole page is missing."
Folio 73b is blank.
The last page (folio 134b) is mostly illegible.
Colophon of "Ktābā d-lúqāṭe": "Šlem b-ʻedrān Māran ú-Alāhan ktābā hānā d-Lúqāṭē d-metqré Debúrítā ú-l-Alāhā šúbḥā <uqbal> uqúbal ṭaybútā ba-tlítúyat qnúmāwhy šwayā u-lā sdíqē. ʼÍn u-Amín."

Translation of the colophon of "Ktābā d-lúqāṭē": "Ktābā d-lúqāṭē, called the 'Bee" was completed by the help of our Lord and God. Glory and thanksgiving be to God in His three equal and undivided persons. Yes, and Amen."

Copyist's colophon of "Ktābā d-lúqāṭe": "Šlem Ktābā hānā d-Debúrítā b-ʼíraḥ Kānún .. BṬ .. beh b-yúm Šabtā, da-šnat AṢṢḤ .. l-Yawn .. b-íday ʻabdā ḥaṭāyā Qašíšā Zayʻā bar Šamāšā Šlémún bar Qašíšā Géwargís men ṭúhmā d-kāhnē. ʼÍn ú-Āmín."

Translation of the colophon of the copyist of "Ktabā d-lúqāṭē": "The Book of the Bee was completed in the month of Kānún [January] .. the 28th day of it, on Saturday, of the year 1998 of the Greeks [1687], by the hands of the guilty servant, Priest Zayʻā son of Deacon Šlémún son of Priest Géwargís of the priests' community. Yes, and Amen."

Colophon of "Mʻārat gāzē": "Šlem l-mektab ktābā hānā d-metqrē Mʻarat gāzē. Eštrí ú-eštlem ktābā hānā ba-šnat ālep wa-tšaʻmaʼā ú-tešʻīn wa-tmānyā šnīn d-Aleksandrús Malkā d-Yawnāyé b-yawmāy ... Māry Šemʻún Qatúlíqā Paṭryarkís d-Kaldāyé ... etkteb dén ktābā hānā b-atrā d-Arní, b-Qrítā mbaraktā HWB(S)N tḥet mṭalteh d-naṣíḥ b-qadíšē wa-zríz b-atlíṭē Māry Qúryaqús sāhdā naṣíḥā ... katbeh dén la-ktābā hānā ʼnāš ḥaṭāyā ... Zayʻa da-b-šem Qašíšā bar Šamāšā Šlémún bar Qašíšā Gewargís men ṭúmā d-kahnē ... Šlem b-yarḥā Šbāṭ ʻesrín ú-ḥamšā beh b-yúm ʻRúbtā ʻesrín d-ṣawmā pārúqāyā ..."

Translation of the colophon of "Mʻārat gāzē": "The writing of the book called 'Cave of treasures' is completed. This book was begun and completed in the year one thousand nine hundred and ninety-eight of Alexander, King of the Greeks [1687], during the days ... of Mār Šemʻún, the Catholicos and Patriarch of the Chaldeans ... This book was written in the region of Arní, in the blessed village of HWB(S)N, under the patronage of the noble among the saints and the enthusiast among the diligent, Mār Qúryaqús, the noble martyr ... This book was copied by a guilty person ... Zayʻā, by name a priest, son of the Deacon Šlémún son of the Priest Gewargís, of the priests' community ... It was completed in the month of Šbāṭ [February], the twenty-fifth day of it, on Friday, the twentieth day of the redemptive fasting ..."

11 x 18 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 14 cm; 17 lines per page.

In good East Syriac script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings in red.
Laid slip 1: "Hagiography. Described in Arnold Look's Yale dissertation, History of Abba Marcus of Mount Tharmaka, p. xi."
Laid in slip 2: "Wright, apocr. acts of the apost. I QB-QKW. II 93 to 115 (trans.). Tischendorf, acta apost. apocr. 132-166. Lipsiu, 11."
Pages are numbered 1-104; folio 53 is blank.
On folio 2a: "Tašʻítā d-Māry Matāy wa-d-Mārī Andrʼāwus Šlíḥē ṭúbānē kad talmed la-mdínat Kalbín d-ʻāmúréh aklín hwaw bisrā da-bnāynāšā."
Translation of the text on folio 2a: "Story of Saint Mathew and Saint Andrew the righteous Apostles as they evangelized the city of Kalbīn whose inhabitants used to eat human flesh."
At the head of folio 52b: "Ba-šrarā hākíl emarw mkatbānē d-nāsí yatír min mā d-ḥāyaʼr qbarníṭí lmína níḥā d-elfeh mṭāraptā."
Translation of the text at the head of folio 52b: "It is true then what the authors/scribes, who suffer much say, like the captain as he looks at the safe harbor of his afflicted ship."

1. Translation of the end of "Tašʻítā d-Māry Matāy wa-d-Māry Andrʼāwus Šlíḥē": "... and they were shouting and saying: One is the God of Andrew, and One is our Lord Jesus Christ to whom belongs glory and honor ... now and every time and for ever and ever."
2. Colophon of "Tašʻítā d-Abbā Marqús Tarmaqāyā": "Ṣalāw ʻal ḥaṭāyā Sargís d-qārē b-Kalíjā d-ʼÚrūmyā Gúgtapah da-sraṭ d-ṭab netḥanan ba-ṣlawatkún."
2. Translation of the colophon of "Tašʻítā d-Abbā Marqús Tarmaqāyā": "Pray for the sinner Sargís of ʼÚrūmyā Gúgtapah, the copyist, that he may have mercy through your prayers."

Colophon of the codex: "ʼEtekteb ktābā hānā men Sargís bar Yawsep bar Sargís ... d-mātā briktā d-Gúgtapah kad qārē hwā b-Kalijyā d-Úrúmyā kad bar tšaʻsar šnín. Amín u-Amín. Etkteb Tešrín Trāyānā d-Madnḥāyē d-b-šantā Mšíḥ APPḤ 1888. Amín. Ktāb b-arbaʻ yawmātā kad qārē hwā b-Madrasā. Ṣalāw ʻlāy kulkún qārāyē u-kulhún šamúʻē qdām Māryā Alāhā."

Translation of the colophon of the codex: "This book was copied by Sargís bar Yawsep bar Sargís ... from the blessed region of Gúgtapah as he was studying at the Úrúmyā College, when he was nineteen years old. Amen and Amen. It was copied on the fourth of Eastern November of the Christian year 1888. Amen. It was written in four days when he was studying at the School. Pray for me all you readers and all you listeners in front of the Lord God."

Below the colophon (folio 209a): "Agzret la-ktābā hānā da-Ḥdātā Maqdšāyā ʻÍsā bar [?] Ḥasan men Qrítā mbaraktā Mʻarrē maʻmar lāh Maryā. Amín. D-nehwe leh mnātā ʻam kínē u-ʻam zadíqe b-malkútā da-šmayā. Amín. l-ʻIdtā qadištā da-Bnāy Šmúné wa-l-ʻIdtā rabtā Māry Sābā u-Māry Dúmeṭ ṣlāwathún nehwún ʻlayn b-yāṣípúteh d-Qašīšā Yešúʻ bar Saʻdō bar Kawdā u-kul man d-šaqel leh b-ʻelat yaʻnútā garbeh d-Geḥazí telbaš beh u-rúmḥā d-ʻebrat b-Ḥānā teʻbar beh ba-šnat APZ". Further statements on folios 203b and 210b mostly faded and difficult to read (some in Arabic).

Translation of the colophon (folio 208b-209a): "This book was started, ended, collated, and corrected, by much effort, in the year one-thousand two-hundred and twenty-nine of Alexander the Macedonian, corresponding to the Islamic year three-hundred and five [917/918], at the Holy Monastery of the righteous, Mar Eliya, located on the River Tigris, which was established by the Holy Spirit, near the protected city of Mosul, in the days of the virtuous, His Beatitude, Mār Abraham, the Catholicos and Patriarch, by whose prayers the church will be protected until the advent of our Lord, in Whom salvation was bestowed upon all of Adam's children. Amen ... Pray for the wretched who collated it as much as he could, whose name is ʻN. ʻZ WWʻN WWʻN. If you were to find a deficiency, O reader, correct it, and do not blame my wretchedness. Pray for me." Below the colophon (folio 209a): "I designated this book of the New Testament, I, Maqdšāyā ʻÍsā bar [?] Ḥasan, of the blessed village of Mʻarrē, may the Lord prosper it, Amen, that he [i.e., I] may have a share with the pious and the righteous in the Kingdom of Heaven, Amen, for the holy Church of Bnāy Šmúné, and for the big Church of Mār Sābā and Mār Dúmeṭ, may their prayers be with us, by the endeavor of Priest Yešúʻ bar Saʻdō bar Kawdā. May the leprosy of Gehazi garb him who in greed takes it, and may the spear that penetrated Ḥanā penetrate him. In the year APZ [1087 of the Greeks = 1495/1496]. Further statements on folios 203b and 210b (some in Arabic), mostly faded and difficult to read.

Translation of the end of the table of contents: "The Qudiqus, that is, what is in the book (table of contents) of 'Mnārat Qúdšē" was completed ... by a person who is stranger to the art, of ill deeds, and of bitter luck, who by name is called monk and priest, but by works is far away from them, Míkhā bar Barṣawm, from the blessed fortress of ʻÚrboyš, in the year 1901 of the Greeks, 1590 of Christ, at the Monastery of Mār Abḥāy."
Pages 391-392 and 394-396 are blank.

Translation of the colophon of Mnārat Qúdšē: "It is completed. Praise be to God for ever."

record.title: 880-02 Ktābā d-Húdāyē : manuscript / Bar ʻEbrāyā.
record.note: Title from the text and reference sources

Incipit: The codex starts with a table of contents, as follows: "B-yad Alāhā Marē kūl mašarénan l-mektab 'Ktābā d-Húdāyē' meṭūl qānūnē ʻidtānāyē ú-nāmúsē ʻelmānāyē men syāmē d-Abún Māry Grígúríyos Mapryānā d-Madnḥā" (By the help of God, Lord of All, we start to write the 'Book of Directions' about the eclesiastical and secular laws, which is authored by our Father, Mār Grigorios, Maphrian of the East).
17.5 x 27.5 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 20.5 cm (in two columns; 34 lines per column).
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap.
In good West Syriac script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings in red.
The pages of the codex are also numbered in Syriac letters.

Table of contents (folios 1b-2a).

At the end of table of contents, the following statement: "Šlem menyān qeplē d-Ktābā d-Húyāyē, d-qārēʼ hākíl nṣālē ʻlay b-ḥúbā" (The listing of the chapters of the 'Book of Directions' is completed. Let him who reads pray for me in love).

The table of contents is followed by the titles of the three supplementary works, as follows: 1. "Ḥušbānā d-yārtūtā ayk nāmúsā d-Ṭayāyē." 2. "Nāmúsā d-malkē Krisṭíyāne." 3. "Nāmúsā Krisṭíyānā d-sím men Malkā Qúsṭanṭínús ú-Tāʼúdúsíyús ú-Lā́ún Malkā Rúmāyē."
On folio 3b (in pencil): "Ktābā d-Húdāyē d-sím l-Mapryānā Bar ʻEbrāyā d-lā síqúmā" (Book of Direction authored by Maphrian Bar Hebraeus is without date).

On folio 4a: An endowment statement (in Garshūnī and some Syriac) dated 5 February 1884, as follows: "Wāqif Kānīst Mār Buṭrus wa-Mār Būluṣ bi-Ūrfah: Ṭīmutāwus Aps Būlus Úrhoyo / 5 Šbāṭ 84 M" (The endower to the Church of Saint Peter and Saint Paul in Urfa [al-Ruhā / Edessa] is Timotheus Aps. Paulus Urhoyo / 5 February 84 M).

At the end of page 337: Statement of the original endowment by the unnamed donor (in Garshūnī with some Syriac) as follows: "Lammā ḥaḍarnā fī al-Ruhā fī sanat BY Yūnānīyah waqafnā hādhā 'Kitāb al-Hadāyā' ilá Kanīsat Mār Buṭrus wa-Būlus waqfan ṣaḥīḥan. Wa-kulman yaṭmaʻ ʻalayhi wa-yukhrijuhu min al-waqfīyah yakūnu taḥta kalimat Allāh, wa-yakūnu maḥūm min fam Māry Buṭrus wa-Māry Būlus. Āmīn ú-Ābūn ba-šmāyā u-šarkā."

Translation of the original statement of endowment: "When we arrived in al-Ruhā [Urfa/Edessa], in the Greek year BY [i.e. 2012 = 1699/1700] we endowed this 'Book of Directions' to the Church of Saints Peter and Paul, an authentic lawful endowment. Anyone who covets it and takes it out of its endowment location shall be under the word of God and will be excommunicated by the mouth of Saint Peter and Saint Paul. Amen. 'Our Father who art in Heaven', etc."
The last five leaves of the manuscript are blank.
Colophon of "Ktābā d-Húdāyē": "Šlem 'Ktābā d-Húdāyē' ú-l-Alāhā šúbḥā d-ḥayel ú-ʻadar wa-ʻlayn raḥmāwhe l-ʻālam ʻālmí. Amín ú-Amín."
Translation of the colophon: "The Book of Directions is completed. Praise be to God who empowered and helped. May His mercies be upon us for ever and ever. Amen and Amen."

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Kalimah lafẓ wuḍiʻa li-maʻná mufrad. Wa-hiya ism wa-fiʻl wa-ḥarf, li-annahā immā an tadulla ʻalá maʻná fī nafsihā aw lā. al-Thānī al-ḥarf. Wa-al-awwal immā an yaqtarin bi-aḥad al-azminah al-thalāthah aw lā. al-Thānī al-ism, wa-al-awwal al-fiʻl. Wa-qad ʻulima bi-dhālika ḥadd kull wāḥid minhā. al-Kalām mā taḍammana kalimatayn bi-al-isnād, wa-lā yataʼattá dhālika illā fī ismayn ..."
Secundo folio: lam yushbih mabná al-aṣl wa-ḥukmuha an yakhtalf ākhiruh.
11 x 18.7 cm; written surface: 5.7 x 11.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; cover and flap embossed with central medallion and decorative design.

In good naskh script, in black ink, on thin polished cream color paper; headings and markings in red; sentences and paragraphs end with large gold circles; text framed in gold; extensive commentaries on the margins and on the laid in (or inserted) slips (thirty in number, in light green or mauve color, also framed in gold); catchwords.
Glued to the flyleaf: White wax seal with coat of arms of "Richard Montgomery Gilchrist Potter".
Laid in: A photograph (6.5 x 9 cm) of a little girl holding a doll.
On a laid in card (in pencil): "Arabic manuscript found in the Thompson collection of books. 7-18-94."
On a laid in printed card: Information about the manuscript and its author.
On folio 38b: A reader (or owner) statement: "al-Faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-dāʻī (an illgible stamp). 9 Jā sant 301 [9 Jumādá al-ūlá 1301 = 7 March 1884]."

Colophon (written inside a decorative design): "Tammat al-risālah bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá. M M M. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Sayyid al-anām wa-ʻalá ālihi al-ʻiẓām wa-aṣḥābihi al-fikhām. Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min hādhihi al-nuskhah al-laṭīfah wa-al-kitābah al-munīfah yawm al-Khamīs waqt al-ḍaḥwah al-kubrá min shahr Ramaḍān, li-sanat tisʻīn wa-miʼah wa-alf. Wa-anā al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-dhalīl al-muḥtāj ilá raḥmat Rabbihi al-Jalīl Khalīl ibn Muḥammad, ghafara Allāh dhunūbahumā wa-satara ʻuyūbahumā."

Translation of the colophon: "The treatise was completed with the help of God Almighty. M M M. Praise be to God for the completion, and prayer be upon the Master of Mankind, upon his great family, and his noble companions. This dainty copy and outstanding text were completed on the dawn of Thursday, in the month of Ramadan, of the year one-thousand one-hundred and ninety [October/November 1776], by me, a weak and humble servant, who is in need of the mercy of his Exalted Lord, Khalil ibn Muhammad. May God forgive their sins and cover their faults."

Secundu folio: Sūrat al-Muʼminūn. Makkīyah.
22.5 x 17.5 cm; written surface: 13.5 x 17 cm; 14 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in loose leaves).
In fair Maghribī script, in black ink on thick cream color paper; text vocalized in red, titles of the Sūrahs in red; catchwords.
Laid in: A folded sheet (four pages) of invocations.

The manuscript ends with part of Sūrat Ghāfir (Chapter 40), as follows: "... Wa-mā yastawī al-aʻmá wa-al-baṣīr wa-alladhīna āmanū wa-ʻamilū al-ṣāliḥāt wa-lā al-musīʼu qalīlan mā tatadhakkarūn. Inna al-sāʻata la-ātiyatun lā rayba fīhā wa-lākinna akthara al-nāsi lā yuʼminūn. Wa-qāla Rabbukum udʻūniya astajib lakum inna alladhīna yastakbirūna ʻan ʻibādatī ..."

record.title: Treatises on faith and the Eucharist : manuscript / Yúḥanān bar Zúʻbí.
record.note: Title of the codex supplied by cataloger.
1. Title of "ʻAl šarbā d-haymānútā" from colophon (folio 93a).
2. Title of "Púšāqā d-rāzē" from incipit (folio 94b).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "ʻAl šarbā d-haymānútā": The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... ʻawāle ʻamā díly qareb ú-amítúhy ba-zqípā ú-túb b-hay d-dāreh rāmez lan d-law barnāšā hwā šḥíma elā meltā ksē hwā beh d-lā metedrek kyān ʼítúteh ..."
1. Secundo folio of "ʻAl šarbā d-haymānútā": hwat kad pagrā lā eštamlí.

2. Incipit of "Púšāqā d-rāzē": "Túb b-yad Alāhā ú-súyāʻā d-raḥmāwhy mšarénān l-mektab mímrā d-Púšaq ʼrāzē díleh kad díleh d-Raban Yúḥanān ḥsé dúkrānā. Mārān ʻadarayny b-raḥmayk. Šawē l-šúbḥā yamā rabā d-basímútā. d-Meṭú ḥúbeh brā la-brítā men lā medem ..."
2. Secundo folio of "Púšāqā d-rāzē": wa-l-lā sākā d-metedʻānē yaḥdeh b-napšeh.
15 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 14 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Bound in wooden boards, covered with dark brown leather.
In good East Syriac script, in black ink, on thick cream color paper; headings, keywords, and markings in red.
At the beginning of the manuscript is a loose leaf from an unidentified manuscript on the front of which are scribbled what seem to be pen trials.

The following slips are inside the envelope laid in the manuscript: 1. Note in English: "Nestorian homilies on the chief points of Nestorian faith, by John bar Zuʻbī, who flourished at the beginning of the thirteenth century. The MS was probably written in the year 1685 and is in a good Nestorian hand. I only know of two other copies of this work - one in the Vatican, and the other in the Royal Library at Berlin. The language is Syriac." 2. "Nestorian homilies". 3. Small torn fragment from an unidentified Syriac manuscript (8.5 x 3.5 cm). Glued to the envelope are two other Syriac fragments.
Inside the back cover: "Ex libris" L.E. Waterman (with picture of fountain and pen nib).

1. Colophon of "ʻAl šarbā d-haymānútā": "Šlem b-ʻedrān Mārān ú-súyāʻā d-ṭaybúteh l-mektab miʼmrā da-ʻbīd b-múšḥatā ʻAl šarbā d-haymānútā artadúksāytā l-ṣalmā da-myatrútā ú-maḥzítā d-íḥídāyútā ú-šúprah d-dayrāyútā ú-yamā d-malpānútā nahír yídaʻtā mríq pārúšútā ḥatít ba-msarqútā wa-kdín b-ʻanwāyútā zhē nakpútā wa-mqasmas b-kulhén paʼyātā Rabban Yúḥanān ḥdānāy zabneh pílāsúpā d-rúḥ ʻatírā da-srík wa-mʻatrānā d-miskín d-kúnāyā leh Bar Zúʻbí. Mārān nepqūd búsāmeh ʻam sísartā d-qadíšē. Amín." After the colophon someone scribbled: "Pílāsúpā wa-mqasmas. Pílāsúpā wa-mqasmasā."

1. Translation of the colophon of "ʻAl šarbā d-haymānútā": "Completed, by the help of our Lord and His abundant benevolence, is the discourse written in verse, on matter of the orthodox faith, by the personification of virtue, the mirror of ascetism, the beauty of monasticism, and the sea of scholarship, the enlightened of intellect, of pure discerning, the firmly established in devotion, the steady in worship, the shining in virtue, and the adorned in all beauties, the Teacher Yuhanan, the unique of his time, the philosopher of the spirit, the rich who is poor, and the enricher of the poor, who is called Bar Zúʻbí. May our Lord destine that his happiness be with the fold of the holy ones. Amen."

2. Colophon of the codex of the two treatises: "Púšaq haymānútā" and "Púšāqā d-rāzē": "Šlem b-ʻedrān ʼItútā Mšabaḥtā wa-Mtúmaytā wa-Mʻalaytā ... ktābā hānā d-Púšaq haymānútā ú-Miʼmarā d-Púšāq ʼrāzē d-ʻbídín l-Qadíšeh d-Alāhā Mary ú-Raban Yúḥanān d-metknē Bar Zúʻbí ba-šnat ālep wa-tšʻmā ú-tišʻín wa-šbaʻ l-Yawnāyē bríkē b-yúm Ḥamšabšabā b-íraḥ Kānún ʼḥrāy BA beh b-yawmāy ... Abún Qadíšā ú-ṭúbtānā b-kul Mārān ú-mārhún d-ḥayayn Māry Elíyā, Qatúlíqā Patríyarkís d-Madnḥā ... Etkteb dén tḥét ṭelāleh da-škínteh d-Māry Zayʻā Ṭúbtānā."

2. Translation of the colophon of "Púšāqā d-rāzē": "Completed by the help of the Glorious, Eternal, and Sublime Being ... the book of 'Explanation of faith' and the 'Poem on the Explanation of mysteries", which were written by the holy one of God, the Teacher, Mār Yúḥanān, called Bar Zúʻbī, in the year one-thousand nine-hundred ninety-seven of the blessed Greeks [1997 = 1686], on Thursday, 21 of Kānún II, in the days of ... our Holy Father, the All Virtuous, our Lord and the Lord of our life, Mār Elíyā, the Catholicos, Patriarch of the East ... Written under the shadow of the sanctuary (shrine/tomb) of the Virtuous Mār Zayʻā."

record.title: Miscellaneous Christian Syriac texts : manuscript.
record.note: Title of the codex supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
Incipit of the codex: The beginning of the manuscript is missing. Text starts with: "... ḥlí maqšeṭ ... špíʻā b-ṭaybútā ú-ḥúbā da-sṭúr hā lí Malkā Rabā d-āmrin bad tašʻítā ú-šarbā ..."
Secundo folio: eškārā d-lilyā ʼenā yún Alāhā.
11.5 x 16 cm; written surface 7 x 12.5; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In wooden boards covered with dark brown leather.
In East Syriac script, in black ink, on cream color paper.
Laid in: Three folded slips of paper (in folded cardboard sheet) in modern Syriac, and one in English, about the contents of the codex.
On folio 93a: "... bí šantā AṢʻG l-Yawnāyē yímar l-kā ʼnāšā dawyā Qāšā Yawsep Talkʼepnāyā ..." (... in the year 1973 of the Greeks [1661] by a wretched person, Priest Yawsep of Talkīf ..."

On folio 136b: "... be-šnat trén alpín ú-maʼā wa-trén metqran AAQB l-Aleksanadrús ... Šelmat dúraktā hādē bi-ʼíday Šamašā Kānún" (in the year 2201 of Alexander (1790). This 'dúraktā' (poem) was completed by the hand of Deacon Kānún).

On folio 137a: "Šelmat dúraktā hādē da-ʻbídā l-Qāšíšā Yawsep Telkapnāyā. Amín, b-yarḥā bríkā Ādār (illegible creptic numbers) b-yúm Trén b-Šabā. Amín. Etkatbat dén b-yawmāy Abā d-Abāhātā ú-Ríšā d-Rāʻāwātā Māry Elíyā Qatúlíqā Paṭíryarkís d-Madnḥā netqayam kúrsyeh l-súf yawmātā. Amín." Under it: "Etkatbat ba-Qrítā bríktā Taqyā, Mšíḥā nnaṭríh ba-ṣlútā d-Marty Maryam." (This 'dúraktā' (poem) written by Priest Yawsep Telkapnāyā is completed. Amen. In the blessed month of March (illegible cryptic numbers) on Monday. Amen. It was written in the days of the Father of Fathers, the head of the shepherds, the Catholicos Mar Elíyā, Patriarch of the East. May his throne be established until the end of days. Amen." Under it: (It was written in the blessed village of Taqyā. May Christ protect it by the prayer of Our Lady Mary).

On Folio 137a: "ʻAl ḥaylā d-Mārān Yešúʻ Mšíḥā mšarín l-mektab qalíl tarʻē da-Ktābā d-Pardaysā awkít Maqamat ..." (By the power of our Lord Jesus Christ we start to write few chapters of the Book of Paradise, that is the Maqāmāt ...).
On folio 143b: "Túb b-yad Alāhā kātebnā 'Tešbúḥtā' d-Māry Elíyā d-Ṣawbā ..." (Also, by the hand (might) of God, I write the 'Praise poem' of Mar Eliya of Ṣawbā [Nisibis]) ...)

On folio 158a: "Šlem Tešbúḥtā d-Māry ʼĪlíyā d-Ṣawba ú-l-Alāhā šú[bḥā] wa-ʻlayn raḥmawhy. Amín." (The Praise poem of Mar Eliya of Ṣawbā [Nisibis] is completed. Praise be to God, and may His mercies be upon us. Amen).
On folio 162a: "Šlām lek Maryam malyat Ṭaybútā ..." (Hail Mary, full of grace ...).

record.title: Treatises on inheritance and Islamic doctrines : manuscript.
record.note: Title of the codex and of the two treatises supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of the first treatise: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi [thiqatī]. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Man māta yukhraju min tarikatihi arbaʻat ashyāʼ: al-Kafan wa-al-dayn wa-al-waṣīyah wa-al-mīrāth. al-Awwal al-kafan, min jamīʻ mālihi, thumma al-dayn, thumma al-waṣīyah min thulth al-māl, thumma al-mīrāth, wa-in taraka aban fa-al-māl kulluhu la-hu ..."
1. Secundo folio of the first treatise: wa-in taraka aban wa-ibnan wa-bintan.

2. Incipit of the second treatise: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Qāla al-Shaykh Abū Isḥāq al-Tūnisī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-raḍiya ʻanhu wa-ʻan jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn: Wa-baʻda dhālika saʼalanī baʻḍ ikhwānī al-ṭālibīn al-rāghibīn fī ṭalab al-ʻilm ʻan al-īmān wa-al-Islām, hal humā makhlūqān am ghayr makhlūqayn, fa-ajabtuhu ilá dhālik ṭalaban lil-thawāb raghban ilá Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb ..."
2. Secundo folio of the second treatise: wa-al-īmān thumma dawwara dāʼiratan bi-yadihi.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 16.5 cm; 14-17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In good large naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings in red; few notes on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1b: "Hādhā kitāb mushtamil ʻalá taqsīm al-irth, wa-ʻalá masāʼil fī al-tawḥīd, wa-asʼilah wa-ajwibah fī al-dīn, wa-Allāh aʻlam."

On folio 1b: Two verses of poetry and a prose statement, as follows: 1. "Idhā shaḥḥa al-ṣadīqu ʻanka yawman // bi-shayʼin wa-anta muḥtājun ilayhi. Ṣawwir la-hu fī al-arḍi qabran // wa-qul māta wa-lā tabkī ʻalayhi." 2. "Thalāthat ashkhāṣ fī al-Jannah: Ẓālim li-nafsihi (1), muqtaṣid (2), sābiq bi-al-khayrāt (3). IH."

1. The first treatise ends with: "... wa-in taraka ibnan wa-bintan wa-bint ibn wa-ibn ibn, al-māl bayna al-ibn wa-al-bint lil-dhakar mithl ḥaẓẓ al-unthayayn, wa-saqaṭa ibn al-ibn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."
2. The second treatise ends abruptly with: "... Fa-in saʼalaka sāʼil wa-qāla laka: Mā al-farq bayna al-khāliq wa-al-makhlūq, al-jawāb an taqūla la-hu bi-arbaʻat ashyāʼ, aḥaduhum lā [...?] ..."

record.title: Selections from the Arabian nights : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... fa-huwa that yawm jālis ʻalá firāshihi wa-ʻaṣātuhu fī yadihi, fa-ʻaraḍ la-hu fikr fī amr al-samn wa-ghalātih, fa-qāla fī dhātihi: Lā budda an abīʻa hādhā al-samn alladhī ʻindī sirran wa-ashtariya lī bi-thamanihi naʻjah wa-ushārika ʻalayhā aḥad al-fallāḥīn, yakūnu la-hu kabsh, fa-innahā awwal ʻām talidu dhakar am unthá, wa-thānī ʻām talidu unthá am dhakar ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-ʻulamā wa-al-udhabā wa-al-ruwasā ḥattá lil-sulṭān bi-ʻaskarih.
10.5 x 15.5 cm; written surface: 6 x 11.5 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; back cover half torn; dark red leather on spine.
In large good naskh script, in black ink, on thick cream color paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords.
The leaves of the manuscript are also numbered (12-60) in East Arabic (Indian) numerals.

On the labels glued to the front cover: 1. "Juzʼ al-awwal min [Suhrāb/Sahrāt (?)] al-Malik [wa-]al-sabʻ wuzarā. Kutub al-Sayyid Khālid al-Ḥalabī." 2. "al-Malik wa-al-sabʻ wuzarā." 3. "Kutub Ṣubḥī al-Ḥalabī fī jiwār al-Umawī." Under it (in pencil): "1/11."
Inside the back cover: Four readers' statements, as follows: 1. "Naẓara fīhi Muḥammad Ḥasan [...]." 2. "Naẓara fīhi ʻUmar [...]." 3. "Naẓara fīhi ʻAbd al-Qā[dir ...]." 4. "Naẓara fīhi Khalīl [...]."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly, as follows: "... qāla al-ghulām: al-Naṣīḥah wa-al-ijtihād fī al-sirr wa-al-ʻalāniyah, wa-ibdāʻ al-raʼy idhā istashārahu, wa-katm mā yūdiʻuhu min al-asrār, wa-lā yakthumuhu [yaktumuhu] shayʼan bi-mā huwa muḥaqqiqan ʻilmahu, wa-qillat al-ghaflah ʻammā wakkalahu wa-khawwalahu īyāhu, wa-ṭalab riḍāhu wa-ijtināb sukhṭihi. Qāla Shīmās: Akhbirnī ayḍan mā yajibu lil-wazīr an ..."

record.title: 880-03 Lawāqiḥ al-anwār fī ṭabaqāt al-akhyār : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn Aḥmad al-Shaʻrānī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing; text starts with: "... ṭawīlan ḥattá dhahaba al-dīn, thumma taʻāyashū bi-al-murūʼah ṭawīlan ḥattá dhahabat al-murūʼah, thumma taʻāyashū bi-al-ḥayāʼ ṭawīlan ḥattá dhahaba al-ḥayāʼ, thumma taʻāyashū al-ān bi-al-raghbah wa-al-rahbah, wa-sayaʼtī baʻda dhālika mā huwa ashadd minhu. Wa-kāna yaqūlu: Yā laytanī lam ataʻallam ʻilman wa-kharajtu min al-dunyā kafāfan, lā ʻalayya wa-lā liya. Wa-kāna yaqūlu: Mā bakaynā qaṭṭu [min zamānin] illā wa-bakaynā ʻalayhi. Wa-kāna yaqūlu: Adraknā al-nās lā yuʻallimūna al-ʻilm illā li-ʻāqilin nāsik, wa-qad ṣārū al-ān yuʻallimūnahu li-man lā ʻaqla la-hu wa-lā nusk. Tuwuffiya, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, bi-al-Kūfah, sanata arbaʻ wa-miʼah, wa-hiya al-sanah allatī wulida fīhā al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī, ʻan sabʻ wa-tisʻīn sanah. Wa-minhum Māhān ibn Qays, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu ..."
Secundo folio: ʻan nafsihi qallamā jāʼahum mā ʻarafū min al-ḥaqq kafarū bi-hi.
21 x 30 cm; written surface: 14 x 22.5 cm; 27-30 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in loose leaves).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on pollished cream color paper; headings in red; few notes on the margins; catchwords.
On the lower right corner of folio 1a: "Sāqiṭ waraqatayn" (Two leaves are missing).

Colophon: No colophon; text ends abruptly, with the biography of "Ibrāhīm al-Taymī", as follows: "... wa-kāna yaqūlu: Idhā raʼaytum al-ruajul yatahāwan fī al-takbīrah al-ūlá maʻa al-imām fa-ighsilū aydiyakum minhu. Tuwuffiyá, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, fī ḥabs al-Ḥajjāj, sanata ithnayn wa-tisʻīn. Wa-kāna sabab ḥabsihi anna al-Ḥajjāj ṭalaba Ibrāhīm al-Nakhʻī, fa-jāʼa Ibrāhīma al-rasūl, fa-qāla: Akhrijū Ibrāhīm, fa-akhrajū Ibrāhīm al-Taymī. Fa-lammā waṣala ilá al-Ḥajjāj fa-amara bi-ḥabsihi fī al-dīmās, wa-lam yakun la-hu ẓill min al-shams wa-lā kinn min al-bard, wa-kāna kull ithnayn fī silsilah, fa-taghayyar Ibrāhīm wa-ḍaniya jasaduhu ḥattá ..."

record.title: Selections from the Qurʼān : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The manuscript begins with "Sūrat Maryam" (Chapter 19), as follows: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. KHYʻṢ. Dhikru raḥmati Rabbika ʻabdahu Zakarīyā. Idh nādá Rabbahu nidāʼan khafīyan. Qāla Rabbi innī wahana al-ʻaẓmu minnī wa-ishtaʻala al-raʼsu shayban ..."
Secundu folio: wa-yawma ubʻathu ḥayyan.
17.5 x 22 cm; written surface: 13 x 18 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in loose leaves).
In fair Maghribī script, in black ink on thick cream color paper; text vocalized in red, titles of the Sūrahs in red; vocalization in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Sūrat Maryam. Makkīyah."
The manuscript ends with part of verse 20 of Sūrat al-Mujādalah (Chapter 58), as follows: "... Inna alladhīna yuḥāddūna Allāha ..."

record.title: 880-01 ʻIlm al-ḥisāb : manuscript.
record.note: Title from folio 20b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "S. Mā kayfīyat kitābat al-arqām al-tisʻah al-basīṭah. J. al-Arqām al-tisʻah al-basīṭah tuktabu hākadhā: Wāḥid (1), ithnayn (2), thalāthah (3), arbaʻah (4), khamsah (5), sittah (6), sabʻah (7), thamāniyah (8), tisʻah (9) ..."
Secundo folio: J. al-Qāʻidah al-ʻumūmīyah li-ṭarḥ ʻadad ṣaḥīḥ min ākhar.
17 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 18 cm; 20-22 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings in bold script; text framed in pencil.
Laid in: Folded leaf (4 pages) in French and Arabic (in black ink and in pencil), of miscellaneous tales.
Folios 25b-32a, and folio 33 are blank.

On folio 20b (middle of the page): "Tamma al-juzʼ al-awwal min 'ʻIlm al-ḥisāb', wa-yalīhi al-juzʼ al-thānī. al-Juzʼ al-thānī, wa-fīhi ʻiddat fuṣūl. al-Faṣl al-awwal fī tarbīʻ al-aʻdād wa-akhdh judhūrihā."
At the head of folio 23a (in red): "Madrasat Bāb al-Shaʻrīyah" (School of Bāb al-Shaʻrīyah, probably in Cairo, Egypt).

On folio 33b: "Bayān qīmat al-ʻumlah al-fiḍḍah al-ṣādir ʻanhā manshūr min al-ḥukūmah sanat 1293 ..." (A government circular dated 1293 (of the Hijrah = 1876/1877) about the value of the different silver currencies, and those accepted or not accepted).

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with the chapter titled "Fī al-nisbah wa-al-tanāsub" (On ratio and proportion), as follows: "S. Mā kayfīyat istikhrāj al-judhūr al-kaʻbīyah lil-kusūr al-aʻshārīyah wa-al-iʻtiyādīyah. J. Li-istikhrāj al-judhūr al-kaʻbīyah li-kasr aʻshārī aw iʻtiyādī nujrī ʻalayhi al-ʻamal kamā fī al-tarbīʻ, innamā yalzam takʻīb mā kāna yalzamu tarbīʻuhu hunāk. Fī al-nisbah wa-al-tanāsub ..."

record.title: 880-01 Kitāb al-Farāʼiḍ : manuscript.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Kitāb al-Farāʼiḍ, ay, Masāʼil qismat al-mawārīth, jamʻ farīḍah, bi-maʻná mafrūḍah, ay, muqaddarah, limā fīhā min al-sihām al-muqaddarah, ghalabat ʻalá ghayrihā. Wa-al-farḍ lughatan al-taqdīr, wa-yaridu bi-maʻná al-qaṭʻ wa-al-tabyīn wa-al-inzāl wa-al-iḥkām wa-al-ʻaṭāʼ, wa-sharʻan hunā naṣīb muqaddar lil-wārith. Wa-taʻrīf hādhā al-ʻilm huwa al-fiqh al-mutaʻalliq bi-al-irth, wa-al-ʻilm al-mūṣil li-maʻrifat qadr mā yajibu li-kull dhī ḥaqq min al-tarikah, wa-al-aṣl fīhā, qabl al-ijmāʻ, āyāt al-mawārīth wa-akhbār ka-khabar al-Shaykhayn: Alḥiqū al-farāʼiḍ bi-ahlihā ..."
Secundo folio: ilá thalāthat ʻulūm, ʻilm al-fatwá bi-an yaʻlama naṣīb kull wārith.
16.5 x 24 cm; written surface: 10 x 16.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (leaves sewn in black thread).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on thick cream color paper; phrases of the original in red; catchwords.
Folios 1a and 8b are blank.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... wa-taḥjibu bi-hi al-ukhrá, kamā yaḥjibu abūhā abūhā [abāhā]. Naʻam, al-Tanzīl innamā huwa bi-al-nisbah ilá al-irth, lā al-ḥajb, kamā afādahu al-wālid, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Fa-law māta ʻan zawjah wa-bint bint lā taḥjubuhā ilá thumn, wa-kadhā al-baqīyah, aw, ʻan thalāth banāt akhawāt mutafarriqīn fa-al-suds li-bint al-akh lil-umm, wa-al-bāqī li-bint al-akh min al-abawayn, iʻtibāran bi-al-ābāʼ wa-bint al-akh min al-ab ..."

record.title: Miscellaneous Arabic anecdotes and quotations : manuscript.
record.note: Title of the collection supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of the "Nawādir": The beginning is missing. Text starts with part of anecdote "80 (?)", as follows: "... fa-qāla: al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá ḥusn raʼyī, fa-law kuntu labistu al-markūb la-kāna tamazzaqa, wa-lam akun aʻrifu uṣliḥahu fī al-muddah allatī taṭību fīhā rijlī. al-Nādirah al-ḥādiyah wa-al-thamānūn (ʻA. 81). Ḥukiya anna waladan kāna fī balad baʻīdah ʻan abīhi, fa-arsala la-hu abūhu khabaran fī al-silk annahu yashtarī la-hu markūban wa-yursiluhu la-hu, fa-ishtarāhu, thumma taḥayyara kayfa yursiluhu la-hu, fa-qaṣada annahu yursiluhu la-hu fī al-būsṭah ..."
1. Secundo folio of the "Nawādir": takhluqu mā tashāʼu wa-tafʻalu mā turīdu.

2. Incipit of the "quotation" about the poet "al-Aʻshá" (folio 1b): "Akhbār al-Aʻshá wa-nasabuhu. al-Aʻshá huwa Maymūn ibn Qays ibn Jandal ibn Sharāḥīl ibn ʻAwf ibn Ḍubayʻah ibn Qays ibn Thaʻlabah al-Ḥiṣn ibn ʻUkābah ..."
2. Secundo folio of the "quotation" about the poet "al-Aʻshá" (folio 2b): lam ara qaṭṭu aḥsana minhu wa-huwa yaqūlu man yufākhirunī.

2a. Incipit of the "quotation" about the poet "Jarīr": Text starts in the middle of folio 20b, as follows: "Nasab Jarīr wa-akhbāruhu. Jarīr ibn ʻAṭīyah ibn al-Khaṭafá, wa-al-Khaṭafá laqab, wa-ismuhu Ḥudhayfah ibn Badr ibn Salamah ibn ʻAwf ibn Kulayb ibn Yarbūʻ ibn Ḥanẓalah ibn Mālik ibn Zayd Manāt ..."
2a. Secundo folio of the "quotation" about the poet "Jarīr": al-Akhfash qālā ḥaddathanā Abū Saʻīd al-Sukkarī.
The "Nawādir" manuscript is 16.5 x 22 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 18 cm; 21 lines per page.
The "Taʻālīq" (quotations) manuscript is 16.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 13.5 x 17.5 cm; 20 lines per page.

Binding: The "Nawādir" (anecdotes) manuscript is unbound, in four quires, three of which have former numbers (3, 4, 5), and is laid in the "Taʻālīq" (quotations) manuscript, a modern copybook, with black cardboard cover.
The "Nawādir" (anecdotes) manuscript is copied In fair naskh script, in black ink, on thick cream color paper; headings in red; some leaves seem to be missing; catchwords.
The "Taʻālīq" (quotations) manuscript is written in fair naskh script in blank ink on white lined paper of a modern copybook, the notes in English and Arabic are on the verso of the opposite leaves.
Laid in the "Taʻālīq" (quotations) copybook: Two slips of notes in Arabic and English about some of the meters of Arabic poetry and a conjugation table "taṣrīf".
On folio 1a of the "Taʻālīq" (quotations) manuscript: "Taʻālīq min al-kitāb al-musammá Kitāb al-Aghānī" [Quotations from the book called "Book of songs"].
Folios 25-30 of the "Taʻālīq" copybook are blank.

1. Colophon of the "Nawādir" (anecdotes): No colophon. The manuscript ends abruptly with part of anecdote 207, as follows: "... Ḥukiya annahu istadʻá baʻḍ al-khulafāʼ shuʻarāʼ Miṣr, fa-ṣādafahum shāʻir faqīr, kāna fī yadihi jarratun dhāhiban bi-hā ilá al-baḥr li-yamlaʼahā māʼan, fa-tabiʻahum ilá an dakhalū dār al-khilāfah, fa-bālagha al-khalīfah bi-ikrāmihim wa-al-inʻām ʻalayhim, wa-raʼá dhālika al-rajul wa-al-jarrah ʻalá katifihi, wa-naẓara ilá thiyābihi al-raththah, fa-qāla la-hu: Man anta wa-mā ḥājatuk. Fa-anshada: Wa-lammā raʼaytu al-qawma shaddū riḥālahum // ilá baḥrika al-ṭāmī ataytu bi-jarratī. Fa-qāla al-khalīfah: Imlaʼū al-jarrah fiḍḍatan li-hādhā al-shāʻir, fa-muliʼat, wa-akhadhahā al-shāʻir, wa-kharaja ilá al-bāb wa-farraq al-jamīʻ, wa-balagha al-khalīfah dhālik, fa-istadʻāhu wa-ʻātabahu ʻalá dhālik, fa-qāla: Yajūdu ..."

2. Colophon of the "quotation" about the poet "al-Aʻshá": No colophon. Text ends with: "... wa-al-ghināʼ li-Maʻbad khafīf thaqīl awwal bi-al-sabbābah fī majrá al-wusṭá. Wa-qad dhakara Ḥammād ibn Isḥāq ʻan abīhi anna hādhā al-ṣawt manḥūl ilá Maʻbad, wa-annahu mimmā yushbihu ghināʼahu. Wa-dhakara Ibn al-Kalbī ʻan Muḥammad ibn Yazīd anna Maʻbad akhadha laḥn sāʼib khāʼir min Afāṭim mahlan baʻḍu hādhā al-tadalluli, fa-ghanná fīhi: Amin āli Laylá bi-al-malā mutarabbaʻu."

2a. Colophon of the quotation about the poet Jarīr (folio 25b): No colophon. Text ends as follows: "... Wa-ʻāwin ʻawā min ghayri shayʼin ramaytuhu // bi-qāriʻatin anfādhuhā taqṭuru al-damā. Kharūjun bi-afwāhi al-ruwāt kaannahā // qarā hunduwānīyin idhā huzza ṣammamā. Fa-atbaʻahu al-rāʻī yasʼaluhu ʻan al-baytayn. Qāla Jarīrun qāla law ijtamaʻa ʻalá hādhā jamīʻ al-jinn wa-al-ins mā aghnaw fīhi shayʼan. Thumma qāla li-man ḥaḍara: Wayḥakum, aʼulāmu ʻalá an yaghlibanī mithlu hādhā."

record.title: 880-01 Selections from "Sīrat ʻAntarah" : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... ʻAntar min Ghaṣūb dhālika al-kalām alladhī bi-hi qad naṭaq, zāda bi-hi al-ghayẓ wa-al-ghaḍab, wa-tamannā annahu lam yukhlaq, wa-qāla la-hu: Ifʻal mā badā lak, sawfa unzilu bika khibālak, wa-lawlā waswās khaṭara bi-qalbī wa-afkār mā kāna anā ʻalayk ākhir al-nahār illā wa-anta fī al-asr wa-al-iḍrār, wa-lākin ghadāta ghadan uʻdimuka shabābak wa-ufarriqu aṣḥābak ..."
Secundo folio: wa-aqwá minhā wa-aqbaḥ ḥattá baqā yasʼaluhā fī khalawātihā.
15.5 x 22 cm; written surface: 13.5 x 17 cm; 16-17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In large clear naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; catchwords.

Text ends abruptly with: "... fa-qāla ʻAntar: Yā shaykh, kullumā samiʻtahu ṣaḥīḥ, wa-alladhī akhbara bi-hi mā kadhiba, bal ṣarraḥa taṣrīḥ, wa-inna al-qalb min hunāk qad [...] inqalaba, wa-al-raʼs baqā dhanab, wa-kull shayʼ la-hu sabbab, wa-qad jarā lī amr yūjib al-infirād ʻanhā wa-al-ghaḍab, wa-qad ḥalaftu yamīnan bi-mā ʻan aʻyun al-khalq iḥtajab annanī lā ʻudtu ilayhā wa-law ḥawwaqatnī nār ..."

Fa-lammā akhadhahu wa-qaraʼahu, wa-idhā fīhi: Min bayn ayādī al-Thurayyā al-ḥaqīrah al-dhalīlah al-walhānah ilá bayn ayādī Ustādī al-Malik Muḍar, fa-al-murād min aʻālī himmatik al-sharīfah an taʼdhinlī fī al-ḥuḍūr ilá bayn ayādīk ..."
Secundo folio: bayn ayādīhi māyidah min al-ṭaʻām.

Thumma innahā ṣārat tuʻallilunī wa-tuṭʻimunī shayʼ min al-muqawwiyāt ilá an ṣaḥḥayt wa-rajiʻt ilá ḥāl al-ʻāfiyah, wa-ṭalabat minnī dhālika al-maʻnā, wa-rajiʻtu maʻahā ilá ḥālinā al-awwal muddat arbaʻat ashhur ayḍan ukhar, ḥattá lam baqā lī ḥāl wa-lā qūwwī, wa-qad ʻajizt ʻan dhālik, fa-qultu lahā: Yā Sittāh aʻtiqīnī li-an ..."

record.title: 880-01 Dīwān al-ʻUnaysī Fāḍil maʻa al-Zayn bint Maʻmar : manuscript.
record.note: Title from colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... tashtumu al-ʻUnaysī sirran, illā annahā lam taqdir tujāfīhi li-ʻulū manzilatihi, wa-kāna ḥassa ʻalayhā al-ʻUnaysī, fa-nādāhā: Yā khālatī, lā tashtumīnī, wa-laki minnī ʻashrat nūq sūd al-ḥadaq ḥumr al-wabar. Fa-qālat la-hu: Mā bi-sinḥī asubbuka, wa-lākin ʻammāl adʻī ʻalayka anna Allāh taʻālá yarmīka fī hawá al-Zayn bint Maʻmar, karīmat al-ḥasab wa-al-nasab, li-annahā ahlakat rijāl kathīr, wa-mā nālū minhā gharaḍ. Fa-mā kammalat la-hu illā wa-al-ʻUnaysī ḥālan tasharbaka fī hawá al-Zayn bint Maʻmar, wa-ka-annahu naẓarahā ʻiyānan, fa-qāla lahā: Yā khālatī, armaytīnī fī buḥūr al-hawá wa-al-gharām ..."
Secundo folio: idrāʻa wa-tajannada bi-lāmat ḥarbihi wa-jāb qalam wa-qirṭās wa-dawāyī min al-dhahab al-khāṣṣ.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 17.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good medium naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; some headings and markings in red; catchwords.
Text folio 1a-34b; folio 35a and folio 36 are blank.
On folio 35b: Four verses of poetry in colloquial Arabic about a deceitful friend.

The text ends with: "... wa-lammā intahá min kalāmih istaqāma ʻalá kursī aḥkāmihi baʻdamā balagha min al-ḥabīb marāmah, wa-ḥakama wa-ʻadala, wa-istaqāma maʻa al-Zayn bint Maʻmar bi-al-hanā wa-al-inshirāḥ, ilá an atāhum hādim al-ladhdhāt wa-mufarriq <wa> al-jamāʻāt. Subḥāna Rabb al-arḍ wa-al-samāwāt."

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā mā intahá ilaynā min 'Dīwān al-ʻUnaysī Fāḍil maʻa al-Zayn bint Maʻmar' ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-naqūlu: Astaghfiru Allāh min al-ziyādah wa-al-nuqṣān wa-ʻatharāt al-lisān. ʻAlá yad ṣāḥibihi wa-mālikihi wa-kātibihi al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr al-Sayyid Shākir bin al-Sayyid Aḥmad al-Ḥabbāl, wa-ghafara Allāh lahum jamīʻan. Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhā fī khamsat layālī ḍallat min Rajab al-mubārak, sanat 1247."

Translation of the colophon: "This is what has reached us of 'Dīwān al-ʻUnaysī Fāḍil maʻa al-Zayn bint Maʻmar' thoroughly and completely. We say: I ask God for forgiveness from increase and decrease and the slips of the tongue. By the hand of its holder, its owner, and its copyist, the poor servant who admits his guilt and shortcoming, al-Sayyid Shākir bin al-Sayyid Aḥmad al-Ḥabbāl, may God forgive all of them. It was completed five nights remaining from the blessed month of Rajab, of the year 1247 [of the Hijrah = 30 December 1831]."

record.title: Treatise on Arabic grammar : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ashraf al-mursalīn, Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Qawluhu nazal mā sa-yaḥṣulu, ay, al-qawl alladhī sa-yaḥṣulu, manzilat al-ḥāṣil, ay al-qawl al-ḥāṣil. Qawluhu fa-ʻabbara ʻanhu bi-qāla, ay ʻabbara ʻammā sa-yaḥṣulu, wa-huwa al-qawl fī al-mustaqbal bi-ḥaythu yakūnu madlūlan li-qāla, wa-qawluhu fa-al-tajawwuz fī al-Tanzīl, al-murād bi-al-tajawwuz irtikāb khilāf al-aṣl, wa-laysa al-murād bi-hi istiʻmāl al-lafẓ fī ghayr mā wuḍiʻa la-hu, li-ʻalāqah wa-qarīnah ḥattá yarida mā awradahu baʻḍuhum min annahu lā maʻná lil-tajawwz fī al-Tanzīl li-annahu lays bi-kalimah ..."
Secundo folio: al-maṣdarayn, thumma yasrī ilá mā fī ḍimnay al-fiʻlayn.
17 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 18 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard cover with brown leather on spine and the edges (in ten numbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
Glued to the back cover a printed page from what seems to be a financial source with different items and calculations.
Laid in: A folded sheet in Ottoman Turkish, in pencil.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... thumma in kāna hādhā huwa al-riwāyah fa-dhāka, wa-illā, fa-min jihat al-maʻná lā yataʻayyanu, bal yaṣiḥḥu ka-ʻinda. al-Ṭāʼ ism al-fāʻil li-naqṣihi, ilkh. Laʻallahu li-ḍīq al-nafaqah, aw yakūnu al-murattab zāyidan ʻalá al-ḥājah. Yazīd ibn ʻAbd al-Malik, fī al-Ṣabbān, Ibn al-Walīd ibn ʻAbd al-Malik. Lam yurid an yuthbita lahum ilkh. Ay, ḥattá yafīd al-kalām anna fī buyūtihim ʻizzatan wa-ṭawlan, maʻa annahu laysa kadhālika. Qawluhu ..."

record.title: 880-02 Kitāb al-Jirāḥ : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-ʻImād.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá [Sayyidinā Muḥammad]. Kitāb al-Jirāḥ. al-Jirāḥ bi-kasr al-Jīm, jamʻ jirāḥah, wa-al-murād mā yaḥṣalu bi-hi al-zuhūq, aw al-imātah, aw mā yaḥṣulu wāḥidun minhumā, wa-ʻabbara fī al-Tanbīh bi-al-jināyāt, wa-hiya ashmal li-ṣidqihā ʻalá al-maḥdūd wa-al-muttaṣil, wa-lā kadhālika al-jirāḥ, fa-lima ʻadala al-Shaykh ʻan dhālik. Wa-ujīb bi-anna al-jirāḥ aghlab, wa-al-aṣl fī al-kitāb al-Kitāb wa-al-Sunnah wa-ijmāʻ al-ummah. Qāla al-Rāfiʻī: Wa-qatl al-nafs bi-ghayr ḥaqq min akbar al-kabāʼir ..."
Secundo folio: maḥdūdan kāna aw muthqalan fa-ʻamdun maḥḍ.
18 x 28 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 19 cm; 29 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard; red leather on spine and edges.
In fair medium naskh script, in black ink, on thick cream color paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; some leaves seem to be missing; catchwords.
Laid in: Slip of notes about the book and its author.
On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Jirāḥ fī al-Sunnah wa-ijmāʻ al-ummah."

On folio 229b: A reader's/owner's statement: "Nabīyī Muḥammadun khayr al-barīyah. Wa-imāmī Muḥammadun baḥr al-Shāfiʻīyah. Wa-shaykhī Muḥammadun sāda al-wāsaṭīyah. Wa-ismī Muḥammadun, wa-bi-dhāka arjū min faḍl Rabbī azká ʻaṭīyah."

Author's colophon: "Wa-Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran, kullamā dhakarahu al-dhākirūn, wa-ghafila ʻan dhikrihi al-ghāfilūn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhihi al-aḥruf al-mubārakah yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, al-sādis [above it "al-sābiʻ"] wa-al-ʻishrīn min shahr Shaʻbān, ʻāma wāḥid wa-sabʻīn wa-thamānī miʼah, ʻalá yad Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn al-ʻImād, ghafara Allāh la-hu, wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-khayr wa-lil-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Āmīn." On the left margin of the colophon (folio 229a): A collation statement (not clear if it is by the author, or someone else), as follows: "Balagha muqābalatan, bi-ḥasb al-ṭāqah wa-al-imkān, bi-tārīkh shahr Allāh al-Muḥarram, sanat arbaʻ wa-sabʻīn wa-thamān miʼah."

Translation of the author's colophon: "God, may He be glorified and exalted, is more knowledgeable of what is correct, to Him is the reference and returning. May God's abundant prayer and peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, upon his family, and upon his companions, whenever He is remembered by those who remember, and whenever the heedless forget to remember Him. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. God suffices us, He is the best advocate. These blessed letters were completed on blessed Thursday, the twenty-sixth [above sixth: seventh] of the blessed month of Shaʻbān, of the year 871 [of the Hijrah = 11 April 1467], by the hand of Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn al-ʻImād, may God forgive him, and those who invoke goodness for him and the Muslims. Amen. Amen." On the left margin of the colophon (folio 229a): A collation statement (not clear if it is by the author, or someone else), as follows: "The collation was completed, according to what is possible and attainable, during God's month of al-Muḥarram, in the year 874 [of the Hijrah = July/August 1469]."

record.title: 880-02 Muqaddimah ʻalá sabīl al-ikhtiṣār fī al-kalām ʻalá al-Basmalah wa-al-Ḥamdalah : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
record.note: On folio 1a (in the same hand): A remnant of an unidentified work on "Ṣalāt" (Islamic prayer), starts with: "Masʼalah. al-Iqtidāʼ bi-al-Shāfiʻī. al-Madhhab, innamā yajūzu idhā lam yūjad minhu mā yufsidu ṣalāt al-muqtadī, fa-idhā wujida fa-lā yajūzu al-iqtidāʼ, kamā idhā lam yatawaḍḍaʼ min al-faṣd wa-al-ḥijāmah wa-khurūj al-najas min ghayr al-sabīlayn, wa-kamā idhā qāla bi-kalimat al-tashkīk fī al-īmān, bi-an qāla: Anā muʼminun inshāʼ Allāh, wa-kadhā idhā kāna yatawaḍḍaʼu min qullatayn ..."
Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of "Muqaddimah ʻalá sabīl al-ikhtiṣār fī al-kalām ʻalá al-Basmalah wa-al-Ḥamdalah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla Sayyidunā wa-Mawlānā, Qāḍī al-Quḍāh, Shaykh Mashāyikh al-Islām, malik al-ʻulamāʼ al-aʻlām, ʻumdat al-muḥaqqiqīn, zayn al-millah wa-al-dīn, Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih, wa-askanahu fasīḥa jannatih, wa-aʻāda ʻalaynā wa-ʻalá al-Muslimīn min barakatih fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá mā tafaḍḍala bi-hi min naʻmāʼihi, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad Khātim Anbiyāʼihi, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-aṣfiyāʼihi. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi 'Muqaddimah ʻalá sabīl al-ikhtiṣār fī al-kalām ʻalá al-Basmalah wa-al-Ḥamdalah', wa-ʻalá al-ḥamd wa-al-shukr, wa-al-madḥ, lughatan wa-ʻurfan, maʻa bayān al-nisbah baynahā, wa-maʻa dhikr fawāʼid muhimmah ..."
Secundo folio of "Muqaddimah ʻalá sabīl al-ikhtiṣār fī al-kalām ʻalá al-Basmalah wa-al-Ḥamdalah": mufradan ʻalá maʻná fī nafsihi, ghayr mutaʻarriḍ bi-bunyatihi li-zamān.
16.5 x 22 cm; written surface: 9 x 15 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled paper cover.
In good large naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; keywords in red; text fully vocalized; some wormholes (with some loss of text); catchwords.
On the two labels glued to the front cover: 1. "Risālah ʻalá al-Basmalah li-Shaykh al-Islām." 2. "Numrah 5. 100."
At the head of folio 1a (in red): "Hādhihi Risālah min al-Basmalah li-Abī Yaḥyá Dhakarīyā al-Anṣārī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. 1222."
On the left margin of folio 1a (in pencil): An owner/dealer, statement: "Lā adrī mimman ishturiyat, wa-lā bi-kam" (I do not know from whom it was bought and for howmuch)."

The remnant of the unidentified work on "Ṣalāt" (Islamic prayer) ends with: "... wa-qāla al-Hindawānī lā yajūzu. Wa-qawl al-Hindawānī Aqyas limā zaʻama al-imām anna ṣalātahu layst bi-ṣalāh, wa-kāna al-iqtidāʼ bi-hi ḥīnaʼidhin bināʼ al-mawjūd ʻalá al-maʻdūm fī zaʻm al-imām, wa-huwa al-aṣl, fa-lā yajūzu al-iqtidā. Kadhā fī al-nihāyah min al-Ḍiyāʼ al-maʻnawī ʻalá Muqaddimat al-Ghaznawī, li-Abī al-Baqāʼ Aḥmad ibn al-Ḍiyāʼ al-Qurayshī al-Ḥanafī, raḥimahum Allāh."

Colophon of the remnant of the unidentified work on "Ṣalāt" (Islamic prayer): "Wa-qad tamma hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak fī ʻashr al-Muḥarrām al-ḥarām, sanat 1179 min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyh, [ʻalá ṣāḥibihā (?)] afḍal al-ṣalāh. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon of the remnant of the unidentified work on "Ṣalāt" (Islamic prayer): "This blessed book was completed on the tenth of the sacred al-Muḥarram, of the year 1179 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [29 June 1765], may the best prayer be upon Him. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, on his family, and on his companions, and grant them peace."

Colophon of "Muqaddimah ʻalá sabīl al-ikhtiṣar fī al-kalām ʻalá al-Basmalah wa-al-Ḥamdalah: "Wa-kāna farāghun min naskh hādhihi al-Muqaddimah, fī yawm al-Jumʻah, qabla al-ʻaṣr, tāsiʻ shahr al-Muḥarram al-ḥarām, iftitāḥ sanat 1179, alf wa-miʼah wa-tisʻah wa-sabʻīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām."

Translation of the colophon of "Muqaddimah ʻalá sabīl al-ikhtiṣār fī al-kalām ʻalá al-Basmalah wa-al-Ḥamdalah": "The copy of this 'Introduction' was completed on Friday, before the afternoon prayer, on the ninth of the sacred month of al-Muḥarram, the beginning of the year 1179 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [28 June 1765], may the best prayer and peace be upon Him."

The colophon of "Muqaddimah ʻalá sabīl al-ikhtiṣar fī al-kalām ʻalá al-Basmalah wa-al-Ḥamdalah" is followed by two quotations: 1. An anecdote about the Patriarch Abraham quoted from "al-Manār al-kabīr sharḥ al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaghīr." 2. Ḥadith quoted from "al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaghīr".

Secundo folio: wa-al-salaf al-ṣāliḥ baʻdahu wa-al-khayr kulluhu fī al-ittibāʻ.

In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of the original treatise and markings in red, few corrections on the margins; catchwords.

Innaka dhū wafāʼ wa-dhimmah, ay, ṣāḥib ʻahd wa-wafāʼ, wa-qad waʻdta bi-al-raḥmah man māta wa-lam yushrik bika shayʼan. Allāhumma, ay, Yā Allāh, Qihi, ay, Najjihi min fitnat al-qabr, ay, mā yanshaʼu ʻinda al-suʼāl fī al-qabr, wa-huwa ʻadam al-thabāt, wa-al-ʻiyādh billāh taʻālá, wa-Qihi min ʻadhāb Jahannam, Allāhumma ighfir la-hu wa-irḥamhu, wa-iʻfu ʻanhu, wa-ʻāfihi, ay, adhhib ʻanhu ..."

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi 'Nubdhah yasīrah wa-lumʻah sarīyah fī nafaḥāt athīrah, mathār dhawāt amdād ghazīrah wa-fuyūḍ marwīyah mumīrah min imlāʼāt imām al-muhtadīn, qudwat al-sālikīn, wa-imām al-ʻārifīn, ṭirāz ʻiṣābat al-kāmilīn dhī al-irth al-nafīs, Mawlānā al-Sayyid Aḥmad Abū al-ʻAbbās al-ʻArāyisī ..."

record.title: 880-03 Ādāb al-akl : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn al-ʻImād al-Aqfahsī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.

The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... Wa-ighsil yadayka wa-lā tamsaḥ bi-minshafatin // qabla al-ṭaʻām fa-fīhi al-amnu min ʻilali. Wa-awwalan yaghsilu al-ṣibyānu aydiyahum // qabla al-shuyūkhi wa-lā tamsaḥ min al-balali. Wa-ākhiran yaghsilu al-ashyākhu qablahumu // inna al-karāmata farqun bayyinu al-jadali. Sharḥ. 'Ghasl al-yad' warada fī al-Ḥadīth yanfī al-faqr, wa-baʻda al-ṭaʻām yanfī al-lajam, wa-al-lajam al-junūn. Wa-lā yustaḥabbu tanshīfuhā qabla al-ṭaʻām, li-annahu rubbamā kāna fī al-mindīl shayʼ yaʻlaqu bi-al-yad. Wa-yustaḥabbu taqdīm al-ṣibyān ʻalá al-shuyūkh, wa-aydī al-ṣibyān aqrab ilá al-wasakh bi-khilāf mā baʻd al-ṭaʻām, fa-inna taqdīm al-shuyūkh karāmah lahum, dhakarahu al-Nawawī ..."
Secundo folio: li-annahu yantaṣiru bihā mimman ẓalamah.
15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 14.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (loose leaves).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; the verses of the poem in red; some leaves seem to be missing; catchwords.

The poem of "Ādāb al-akl" ends with the following verses: "... Min al-basīṭi atá hādhā al-qarīḍu fa-khudh // wa-iqṣid li-naẓmin atá min shiʻri murtajili. Li-Ibn al-ʻImādi al-qarīḍu al-shiʻru min ḥikamin // yanfī ʻamá al-jahli ʻan ḥāfin wa-muntaʻili. Awdaʻtuhu ḥikaman aḍḥá bihā ḥakaman // fa-ikhtarhu muntaḥilan tuksa min al-ḥulali. Wa-baʻda qawlī li-Rabbī kullu maḥmadatin // ṣallá al-Ilāhu ʻalá al-Mukhtāri fī al-Rusuli. Wa-al-muṣṭfayna wa-kullu al-rusli yutbiʻuhum // Rabbu al-Salāmi salāman zākiya al-ʻamali."

Colophon: Tamma al-kitāb bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusni tawfīqih. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskhihi yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, khāmis ʻishrī[n] shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat miʼah wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá muhājirihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-azká al-taslīm. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl, wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm."

Translation of the colophon: "The book was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. There is no power nor might except in God the Almighty the All Powerful. It was copied on blessed Monday, the twenty-fifth day of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, of the year 1100 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [17 January 1689], may the best prayer and the purest peace be upon Him. God suffices us, He is the best advocate. There is no power nor might except in God the Almighty the All Powerful."

The colophon is followed by six verses of poetry about "al-Ayyām al-naḥisāt" (Jinx days) of the month: "Fī al-ayyām al-naḥisāt allatī tudhkaru fī kull shahr, wa-qad naẓamahā baʻḍuhum, fa-qāl: Tawaqqá min al-ayyāmi sabʻan kawāmilan // fa-lā yanbaghī fīhinna bayʻun wa-lā safar. Wa-lubsuka lil-thawbi al-jadīdi fa-khallihi // wa-tazwījuka al-niswāna wa-al-gharsu lil-shajar. Wa-ḥafruka biʼran aw li-sirdābin yā fatá // wa-qurbuka lil-ḥukkāmi fa-al-ḥadhara al-ḥadhar. Thalāthan wa-khamsan thumma thālitha ʻashratin // wa-sādisa ʻashrin maʻdhara al-khawfi wa-al-ḍarar. Wa-iḥdá wa-ʻishrīna fa-tilka muṣībatun // wa-rābiʻu ʻashrin wa-fī al-khamsi lil-ashar. Wa-yawmu rabūʻin lā yadūru fa-innahu // ka-ayyāmi ʻĀdiin laysa tubqī wa-lā tadhar."

Secundo folio: wa-taʻālá, Yā Ibna Ādam, shahidat nafsī bi-nafsī an lā ilāha illā anā.
11 x 16 cm; written surface: 8 x 13 cm; 10-17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords.

Colophon: "Tammat hādhihi al-ṣaḥīfah bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl, wa-tabārakta Yā Dhā al-Jalāl wa-al-Ikrām. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-Nabī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm." Followed by a statemet amd a request from the copyist, as follows: "Katab[tu] kitābī, wa-arjū min Allāh al-qabūl wa-al-ghufrān. Yadhūbu al-kaff fī al-turāb wa-yabqá al-khaṭṭ fī al-kitāb. Asʼaluka billāh yā qāriy hādhihi al-ṣaḥīfah an tadʻuwa li-kātibihā bi-al-maghfirah wa-lil-Muslimīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This text was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. Praise be to God in every case. Praise be to You, O Possessor of Majesty and Honor. May God pray on Our Master Muḥammad, the Illiterate Prophet, on his family, and his companions, and grant them peace. Amen. Amen. It is completed." Followed by a statement and a request from the copyist, as follows: "I wrote my book, requesting from God acceptance and forgiveness. The palm dissolves in the dirt, but the handwriting remains in the book. I request you, by God, O reader of this text, to invoke forgiveness for its writer and for the Muslims."

Binding: Unbound (in 6 quires, numbered 20-25; leaves are numbered in East Arabic (Indian) numerals 195-251. A leaf between 223 and 224 is not numbered).
In small clear naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings in red; some notes on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon. No colophon. Text ends ends abruptly, as follows: "... Fāʼidah. Idhā ijtamaʻa al-ḥaqqān, quddima ḥaqq al-ʻabd li-iḥtiyājihi, ʻalá ḥaqq Allāh taʻālá li-ghināhu bi-idhnihi, illā fīmā idhā aḥrama wa-fī milkihi ṣayd wajaba irsāluhu ḥaqqn lillāh taʻālá, wa-minhum man yaqūlu innahu min bāb al-jamʻ baynahumā, lā al-tarjīḥ, wa-li-hādhā yursiluhu ʻalá wajh lā yaḍīʻ. Wa-hādhā mā raʼaynāhu. Wa-Allāh, subḥānuhu, aʻlam. Tamma al-fann al-thālith min 'al-Ashbāh wa-al-naẓāʼir', wa-yatlūhu al-fann al-rābiʻ min 'al-Ashbāh wa-al-naẓāʼir', wa-huwa fann ..."

record.title: 880-01 Ḥikāyat Qamar al-Zamān : manuscript.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Ḥukiya, Allāh aʻlam fī ghaybihi wa-aḥkam ʻammā maḍā wa-taqaddama wa-salaf min aḥādīth al-umam, annahu kāna fī qadīm al-zamān wa-sālif al-ʻaṣr wa-al-awān malik min mulūk al-zamān wa-kā[n] ṣāḥib ʻasākir wa-fursān wa-junūd wa-aʻwān, wa-kā[na]t madīnatuhu tusammá madīnat Ḥaftakān, wa-kāna yuḥibbu al-ʻadl wa-al-inṣāf, wa-yakrahu al-jawr wa-al-isrān [wa-al-isrāf], wa-kāna qad ruziqa walad, khuluquh sharīfah wa-maḥāsin ẓarīfah, kāmil al-maʻānī, subḥān khāliquhu, bilā thānī, wa-kāna al-malik yusammá Shahrabān, wa-lammā atāhu dhālik al-mawlūd sammāhu Qamar al-Zamān, tasallamthu al-marāḍiʻ maʻa al-dāyāt, wa-waqafat fī khidmatihi al-jawār wa-al-khaddāmāt, ilá an kharaja min faṣl al-raḍāʻ, wa-balagha min al-ʻumr sabʻ sinīn ..."
Secundo folio: Qamar al-Zamān muddah min al-zamān.
15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In cardboard cover; dark brown leather on spine.
In fair naskh script (in different hands), in black ink, on cream color paper; headings in red; catchwords.
On the first label pasted to the front cover: "Qamar al-Zamān".
On the second label pasted to the front cover: "Min ḥikāyah, min kutub Ṣubḥī al-Ḥalabī fī jiwār al-Umawī."
On folio 1a: "Ḥikāyat Qamar al-Zamān wa-al-malikah ... al-malik al-ghayūr wa-mā yajrī lahum min al-ʻajāyib wa-al-umūr."

On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Naẓara fīhi maʻāniyahu al-ḥaqīr Muḥammad ibn al-Shaykh Ḥamzah, raḥmat Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá jamīʻ al-Muslimīn." And an illegible statement, dated 1276 of the Hijrah (1859/1860).

At the head of folio 19b: A reader's statement, dated 5 Dhū al-Qaʻdah, 1248 of the Hijrah (26 March 1833), as follows: "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammal maʻāniyahu al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-mudʻá bi-al-zanb ... 5 Zī al-Qaʻdah, sanat 1248."

At the head of folio 28b: A reader's statement, dated 24 Jumād Thānī, 1292 of the Hijrah (28 July 1875), as follows: "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammal maʻāniyahu al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muḥtāj ilá raḥmat Rabbihi al-Karīm Muḥammad ibn al-Sayyid ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-ʻIṭrī. 24 Jumād Thānī, sanat 1292."

At the head of folio 29b: A reader's statement, dated 5 Dhū al-Qaʻdah, 1287 of the Hijrah (27 January 1871), as follows: "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammala maʻāniyahu al-mudaʻá bi-al-zanb [...] Murād ibn al-marḥūm Yaḥyá Sūlī, 5 Zī al-Qaʻdah, 1287."

On folio 30a: A reader's statement, dated 4 R [Rabīʻ (?)] 1272 of the Hijrah (14 November or December, 1855) "Naẓara fīhi al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr, al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-Qadīr, Muḥammad Amīn Blūk Amīn ibn Ḥājj Ṣāliḥ al-Ḥalabī ibn Jamālī, 4 R, sanat 1272." Followed by another statement by the same reader in Ottoman Turkish.

On folio 30b: A reader's statement, dated 19 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 1201 of the Hijrah (2 October 1787), as follows: "Naẓara fīhi Muḥammad Muḥammad al-Ṣawwāf, fī 19 Dhī al-Ḥijjah 1201." And a statement in Ottoman Turkish.

Inside the back cover: A reader's statement, dated 24 (?) Shawwāl (?) 1295 (21 October 1878), as follows: "Naẓara fīhi wa-taʼammal maʻāniayhu al-ḥaqīr al-faqīr Maḥmūd al-Barbar. Fahima mā fahima, lākin fahima. Maḥmūd al-Barbar, wa-al-salām. Waṣalahu [?] jamīʻ ... 1295 Shawwāl [?] 24 [?]."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly, as follows: "... qāl: Thumma innahu ghushiya fī al-bustān, fa-ʻathara, fa-waqaʻa ʻalá wajhihi, wa-jāʼat qūratuhu [jabhatuhu (?)] ʻalá kūrāyah [jūrāyah (?)] bihā ḥajar, fa-jará damuhu wa-qad ikhtalaṭa bi-dumūʻihi, wa-ghamiya ʻalayhi, thumma fazza ʻalá ḥaylihi, wa-masaḥa damahu, wa-nashshafa dumūʻahu wa-shadda raʼsahu, wa-tadhakkara ḥālatahu wa-anshada ..."

record.title: Statement of Sufi initiation and chain of transmission : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Allāhumma Yā dhā al-mann wa-lā yumannu ʻalayhi. Yā dhā al-jalāl wa-al-ikrām, Yā dhā al-ṭawl wa-al-inʻām, lā ilāha illā Ant ..."
Secundo folio: al-Shaykh Manṣūr al-Nafrāwī wa-huwa labisahā min Shaykhihi al-Shaykh ʻAbd Rabb al-Nabī.
12 x 18.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 15 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on thick white paper; some phrases in violet; catchwords.

On folio 1b: "Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr min kull man ẓahara min dhunūbihi wa-awzārih, al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, Ḥāfiẓ al-Nafrāwī: Innī talaqqaytu al-ṭarīq bi-qalbin salīm ʻan Shaykhī wa-Ustādhī ... al-Shaykh Manṣūr al-Nafrāwī ..."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with the "Ḥizb" (invocation/prayer) of ʻAlī al-Bayyūmī, as follows: "... Dhālikum Allāh Rabbukum, lahu al-Mulk, lā ilāha illā Huwa, Dhī al-ṭawl, lā ilāha illā Huwa, Dhālikum Allāh Rabbukum, Khāliq kull shayʼ, lā ilāha illā Huwa, Huwa al-Ḥayy, lā ilāha illā Huwa, yuḥyī wa-yumīt, fa-iʻlam annahu lā ilāha illā Allāh, Huwa Allāh, alladhī lā ilāha illā Huwa, ʻālim al-ghayb wa-al-shahādah, Huwa al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, Huwa Allāh alladhī lā ilāha illā Huwa ..."

record.title: 880-01 Daʻawāt wa-fawāʼid : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

The invocations start with "Daʻwat al-Sabāsib" (folio 1b), as follows: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, ilkh, wa-ilāhukum ilāhun wāḥidun, ilá al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Āyat al-Kursī, ilkh. Āman al-Rasūl, ilkh. Jāʼakum rasūlun min anfisikum, ilkh. Qāla fa-ukhruj minhā fa-innka rajīm, ilá al-dīn. Fa-idhā qaraʼta al-Qurʼan, ilá al-rajīm, wa-ʻanat al-wujūh, ilá qawlihi haḍman ..."
Secundo folio of "Daʻwat al-Sabāsib": Wa-Allāh akbar. Ajībū yā khuddām hādhihi al-asmāʼ.

The "Fawāʼid" (Useful advices), start (folio 7b), as follows: "Fāʼidah fī dhikr 'Daʻwat Alam nashraḥ'. Iʻlam, waffaqanī Allāh wa-īyāka li-ṭāʻatih, inna hādhihi al-sūrah lahā khawāṣ ʻajībah, fa-idhā ardta dhālika fa-ṣum thalāthat ayyām bi-shurūṭ al-riyāḍah ..."
Secundo folio of "Fawāʼid" (Useful advices): al-nār, Yā Allāh qinā sharr al-ẓālimīn.
16.5 x 22 cm; written surface: 14.5 x 19 cm; 19-26 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; catchwords.

On folio 5b: An "Ijāzah" (Authorization) to recite "Daʻwat al-Sabāsib", given by Aḥmad al-Nārī to al-Shaykhah Ruqayyah bint al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-ʻĀlim al-Manzilāwī, as follows: "Ajaztu al-Shaykhah Ruqayyah bint al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-ʻĀlim al-Manzilāwī bi-qirāʼat 'Daʻwat al-Sabāsib' marrah fī al-ṣabāḥ wa-marrah fī al-masāʼ li-jamīʻ al-maqāṣid, wa-anā al-faqīr Aḥmad al-Nārī, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu."
Folios 6a-7a are blank.

Colophon of "Daʻwat al-Sabāsib" (folio 5b): "Kamula al-zajr al-mubārak bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Allāhumma atmim bi-khayr. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of "Daʻwat al-Sabāsib": "The blessed preventive rebuke was completed by the help of God and His abundant benevolence. May God's blessings and peace be upon our Master Muhammad, his family, and his companions. O God, bring about a good end. Amen."

"al-Fawāʼid" (Useful advices), end as follows: "... Allāhumma innī asʼaluka bi-Ṣād al-ṣidq, wa-Mīm al-majd wa-al-mulk, wa-bi-Yāʼ al-yaqẓah wa-al-yaqīn, an tajʻalanī ṣādiqan ṣadūqan, mālikan majīdan, nāhiḍan bi-al-yaqẓah wa-muʻtaqidan bi-al-yaqīn, mamdūdan min ʻaẓīm karamika, bi-ṣadīqin min malāʼikatika, astaʻīnu bi-hi ʻalá ṣalāḥ umūrī al-dunyawīyah wa-al-ukhrawīyah, wa-ijʻal lī ʻawnan ʻalá dhālik min ghayr sabq bi-maḍarrah ilá al-abad. Lam yalid wa-lam yūlad, wa-lam yakun la-hu kufuwan aḥad, Ilāhī al-ghanī bi-Kāf kifāyatika, ḥattá lā altajī ilá aḥadin min khalqika, wa-nawwirnī bi-nūrika ḥattá yuḥīṭa binā al-fawz wa-al-najāh, innaka ʻalá kull shayʼ qadīr, wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Tamm. Tamm, bi-ʻawnihi."

record.title: 880-01 Kitāb al-nikāḥ : manuscript.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Kitāb al-nikāḥ. Sunnah muʼakkadah, li-qawlihi, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Yā maʻshara al-shabāb man istaṭāʻ minkum al-bāʼah fa-li-yatazawwaj, wa-man lam yastaṭiʻ fa-ʻalayhi bi-al-ṣawm, fa-innahu wijāʼun la-hu. Wa-sunna li-walī al-bikr an yuzawwijahā ʻājilan ..."
Secundo folio: [ṣallá Allāh] ʻalayhi wa-sallam, hallā bikran tulāʻibuhā wa-tulāʻibuk.
12 x 17 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 12 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In fair naskh script, in black and brown ink, on thick cream color paper; some notes on the margins; catchwords.
Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with miscellaneous questions and fatwas on marriage and divorce.

record.title: 880-02 Manāsik al-Ḥajj : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Shirbīnī.
record.note: 1. Title of "Manāsik al-ḥajj" from folio 1a.
2. Title of "Dimāʼ al-ḥajj" from incipit (folio 14a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Manāsik al-ḥajj": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala al-Bayt mathābatan lil-nās wa-amnan, wa-amara al-mustaṭīʻa ilayhi sabīlan ḥajjahu, wa-jaʻalahu lil-nās ruknan. Wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lahu wa-lā ṣifah wa-lā naẓīr, wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-Rasūluhu al-bashīr al-nadhīr ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu faqīr ʻafw Rabbihi al-mujīb Muḥammad al-Shirbīnī al-Khaṭīb: Iʻlam inna aʻmāl al-ḥajj ʻalá thalāthat aqsām, arkān wa-wājibāt wa-sunan ..."
1. Secundo folio of "Manāsik al-ḥajj": hadyahu bi-kull dalīlin munīr.

2. Incipit of "Dimāʼ al-ḥajj" (folio 14a): "Wa-hādhihi 'Dimāʼ al-ḥajj' li-Ibn al-Muqrī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Arbaʻatun dimāʼu ḥajjin tuḥṣaru // fa-al-awwalu al-murattabu al-muqaddaru. Tamattuʻun fawtun wa-ḥajjun qurinā // wa-tarku ramyin w-al-mabītu bi-Minā. Wa-tarkuhu al-miqāta wa-al-Muzdalifah // aw lam yuwaddiʻ aw ka-mashyin akhlafah ..."
2. Secundo folio of "Dimāʼ al-ḥajj": In lam yajid qawwamahu thumma ishtará // bi-hi ṭaʻāman ṭuʻmatan lil-fuqarā.
11 x 16 cm; written surface: 6.5 x 11 cm; 11 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In large good naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings in red; some catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb Manāsik al-ḥajj al-sharīf ʻalá madhhab al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Muḥammad al-Shirbīnī al-Khaṭīb, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhum, wa-nafaʻnā Allāh bihim wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm. Yā khayra man wahab ighfir liman qaraʼa wa-man katab."
Folio 16 is blank.

1. The text of "Manāsik al-ḥajj" ends as follows: "... fa-idhā arāda al-safar waddaʻa al-Masjid bi-rakʻatayn, wa-atá al-qabra al-sharīf, fa-yusallimu ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-yasʼaluhu al-shafāʻah, wa-yaqūlu: Allāhumma lā tajʻal hādhā ākhira al-ʻahd baynanā bi-ḥurmat Rasūlika Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-yassir liya al-ʻawd ilá al-Ḥaramayn al-Sharīfayn. Tammat."

1. Colophon of "Manāsik al-ḥajj": "Tammat 'al-Manāsik' bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, wa-Allāh aʻlam, wa-lā yafʻalu dhālik illā man waffaqahu Allāh taʻālá li-qaḍāʼ al-farāʼiḍ al-khams, wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb."

1. Translation of "Manāsik al-ḥajj": "The 'Rituals' were completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence, but God is more knowledgeable. No one does this except him whom God allows to fulfil the five obligatory duties. But God is more knowledgeable of what is correct."

2. Colophon of "Dimāʼ al-ḥajj". No colophon. Text ends with the following verses: "... Lil-shakhṣi niṣfun aw fa-ṣum thalāthan // tajuththu mā ijtathathtahu ijtithāthan. Fī al-ḥalqi wa-al-qalami wa-libsi duhnī // ṭībun wa-taqbīlun wa-waṭyu sanī. Wa-bayna taḥlīlī dhawī iḥrāmi // hādhihi dimāʼ al-ḥajji bi-al-tamāmi."

record.title: In defense of Abū Ḥanīfah : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī malaʼa qulūb aḥibbatihi min maḥabbatihi surūran, wa-kasā wujūhahum min ishrāq ḍiyāʼ bahjatihi nūran, wa-tawwajahum bi-tījān al-bahāʼ, wa-kataba lahum bi-al-wilāyah manshūran, wa-hadāhum ilá ṭarīq maʻrifatihi, fa-dāwamū ʻalá khidmatihi wa-mā ghayyarū taghyīran ..."
Secundo folio: wa-sammaytahu bi-al-Muzzammil wa-al-Muddaththir wa-Ṭāhā wa-Yāsīn.
15 x 21 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; catchwords.
At the head of folio 1a "K 3" (Quire 3).
On folio 3b: An endowment statement: "Waqf".

The text ends with: "... wārith ʻulūm Khayr al-Barīyah, al-Imām al-Aʻẓam Abū Ḥanīfah al-Nuʻmān ibn Thābit al-Kūfī, al-qāʼil: Nuʻību zamānanā wa-al-ʻaybu fīnā // wa-mā li-zamāninā ʻaybun siwānā. Wa-nahjū bi-al-zamāni bi-ghayri dhanbin // wa-law naṭaqa al-zamānu binā hajānā. Wa-laysa al-dhiʼbu yaʼkulu laḥma dhiʼbin // wa-naʼkulu baʻḍunā baʻḍan ʻiyānan. Allāhumma irḍa ʻanhu, wa-arḍāhu, wa-jaʻala al-Jannata munqalabahu wa-mathwāh. Wa-uʻlu Allāhumma darajatahu fī ʻillīyīn, wa-ijʻalhu Yā Rabbanā min al-shāhidīn ilayka, al-nāẓirīna ilayka al-muʻtamidīna ilayka fī al-raḥmah, Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn."
Colophon: "Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Tamm."
Translation of the colophon: "It was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. It is completed."

record.title: 880-01 Kitāb al-ashribah : manuscript.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Mawlānā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman. Kitāb al-ashribah, wa-qawl Allāh taʻālá: 'Innamā al-khamru wa-al-maysiru wa-al-anṣābu wa-al-azlāmu rijsun min ʻamali al-Shayṭāni fa-ijtanibūhu laʻallakum tufliḥūn'. Ḥaddathanā ʻAbd Allāh ibn Yūsuf, qāl, Anā. Mālik, ʻan Nāfiʻ, ʻan ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUmar, anna Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, qāl: 'Man shariba al-khamra fī al-dunyā thumma lam yatub minhā ḥurimahā fī al-ākhirah ..."
Secundo folio: Aḥmad ibn Ṣāliḥ qāl.
15.3 x 20.6 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In good Maghribī script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings in red and in black bold script; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hadīyah li-ʻAllāmat al-ʻaṣr wa-natījat al-dahr, man lam yasmaʻ al-zamān bi-mithlihi, Sayyid al-Ashrāf, min nasl Āl [...] al-Sayyid Muḥammad Abī al-Hudá Afandī, ḥafiẓahu al-Mubdī. Āmīn. Khuwaydim niʻālikum al-Sayyid ʻAbd al-Wahhāb al-Ḥusāmī."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with "Bāb al-shurb min fam al-siqāʼ" (Chapter on drinking from the mouth of a container; waterskin, jar, bottle, etc.), as follows: "... Bāb al-shurb min fam al-siqāʼ. Nā ʻAlī ..."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat al-Ṣafatī ʻalá sharḥ Ibn Turkī ʻalá al-ʻAshmāwīyah : manuscript / Yūsuf ibn Saʻīd al-Ṣafatī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... al-Ḥākim anna Ṭalḥah ibn ʻAbd Allāh saʼala Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, ʻan maʻná 'Subḥāna Allāh', fa-qāl: Tanzīh Allāh ʻan kull sūʼ. Wa-rawá ibn Abī Ḥātim ʻan ʻAlī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, annahu qāl: 'Subḥāna Allāh' kalimah aḥabbahā Allāh wa-raḍiyahā wa-aḥabba an tuqāl. Wa-qawluhu 'wa-bi-ḥamdihi' qīla al-Wāw lil-ḥāl wa-al-Bāʼ lil-maʻīyah, ay, usabbiḥu multabisan bi-al-ḥamd min ajl tawfīqihi lil-tasbīḥ, wa-qīl huwa min jumlat ʻaṭf jumlah ʻalá ukhrá, wa-al-taqdīr wa-naḥmaduhu subḥatahu ..."

The text ends as follows: "... wa-aḥsanu mā yusʼalu Allāh bi-hi al-ʻāfiyah, ilakh. al-ʻĀfiyah hiya al-salāmah min al-balāʼ, wa-al-ʻafw, yaʻfū Allāh ʻan al-dhanb. Qālat ʻĀʼishah, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhā: Law raʼaytu Laylat al-Qadr mā saʼaltu Allāh illā al-ʻafwa wa-al-ʻāfiyah. Wa-Allāh asʼaluhu al-ʻafwa wa-al-ʻāfiyah al-dāʼimah fī al-dīn wa-al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah, wa-al-riḍá wa-al-ikhlāṣ wa-al-tawfīq wa-ḥusn al-khātimah, bi-jāh Sayyidinā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Wa-Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá aʻlam. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-khitām, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Wa-Allāh subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá aʻlam. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-khitām, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad Sayyid al-Anām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn.

Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on blessed Thursday, of the year 1276 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best prayer and peace be upon Him, by the hand of its copyist, the poor Ḥasan ʻUways Shams al-Dīn, may God forgive him and his parents. Amen. It is completed."

Colophon: "Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-Allāh al-muwaffiq lil-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. M.M."
