record.title: 880-02 Kāfī al-muḥtāj ilá Sharḥ al-Minhāj : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn al-Ḥasan al-Isnawī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... qudwat al-rajul bi-al-marʼah khilāfan li-Abī Thawr wa-al-Muzanī ʻalá ikhtilāf fī taḥrīr madhhabihimā, lanā qawluhu, ʻalayhi al-salām: Lan yufliḥa qawmun wallaw amrahum imraʼah, rawāhu al-Bukhārī min ḥadīth Abī Bakr, wa-l-annahā ʻawrah, wa-fī imāmatihā iftitān bihā. al-Thāniyah lā yaṣiḥḥu iqtidāʼ al-khunthá bi-al-marʼah, li-jawāz kawnihi rajulan. al-Thālithah lā yajūzu iqtidāʼ al-rajul bi-al-khunthá, li-jawāz kawnihi imraʼah. al-Rābiʻah lā yajūzu iqtidāʼ al-khunthá bi-al-khunthá li-jawāz kawn al-imām imraʼah wa-al-maʼmūm rajulan. Tanbīhān: Aḥaduhumā annahu qad fuhima min kalāmihi ṣiḥḥat iqtidāʼ al-marʼah bi-al-marʼah, wa-qad sabaqa īḍāḥuhu fī awwal al-bāb, wa-ṣiḥḥat iqtidāʼ al-marʼah bi-al-khunthá, li-anna aswaʼ aḥwālihi an yakūna imraʼah ..."
Secundo folio: lil-maʻná al-awwal wa-li-annahu ʻalayhi al-kalām.
13.5 x 27.5 cm; written surface: 13 x 19.5 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 8 unnumbered quires).

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings and markings; few notes and corrections on the margins; some leaves are smudged and stuck together; some leaves seem to be missing; the last quire is written in a different hand; catchwords.
The author quotes from several works by the author of "Sharḥ al-Minhāj", for example: "Taṣḥīḥ al-Tanbīh", "Sharḥ al-Muhadhdhab", and "Mukhtaṣar al-Tadhnīb" (all by al-Nawawī).
Colophon: No colophon. The last section of the last leaf of the manuscript is smudged and unreadable.

record.title: 880-02 Ghidhāʼ al-albāb : sharḥ Manẓūmat al-ādāb : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Saffārīnī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... al-Nawawīyah fī qawlihi, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Wa-man salaka ṭarīqan yaltamisu fīhi ʻilman sahhala Allāh bi-hi ṭarīqan ilá al-Jannah. Qāl: Sulūk al-ṭarīq li-iltimās al-ʻilm yadkhulu fīhi sulūk al-ṭarīq al-ḥaqīqī, wa-huwa al-mashī bi-al-aqdām ilá majālis al-ʻulamāʼ, wa-yadkhulu fīhi sulūk al-ṭarīq al-maʻnawīyah al-muʼaddiyah ilá ḥuṣūl al-ʻilm, mithl ḥifẓihi wa-dirāsatihi wa-mudhākaratihi wa-muṭālaʻatihi wa-kitābatihi wa-al-tafahhum la-hu wa-naḥwa dhālika min al-ṭuruq al-maʻnawīyah allatī yutawassalu bihā ilá al-ʻilm ..."
Secundo folio: wa-akhraja al-Tirmidhī wa-qāl ḥasanun gharīb.
17 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 11 x 18.5 cm; 31 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (loose leaves).

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; the verses of "Manẓūmat al-ādāb" are written on the margin in red, and the words of the verses in the commentary also in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly, as follows: "... wa-al-murād hunā, yukabbu al-insān fī al-nār al-maʻhūdah al-maʻlūmah, wa-hiya nār Jahannam allatī waqūduhā al-nās wa-al-ḥijārah allatī man dakhalahā khasira khisāratan ʻaẓīmah wa-khābat minhu al-ṣafqah wa-al-tijārah, wa-hiya iḥdá al-ʻaẓīmatayn allatayn amar al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, allā yunsayā. Akhraja Abū Yaʻlá ʻan Ibn ʻUmar, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhumā, ʻan al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, annahu khaṭaba, fa-qāl: Lā tansaw al-ʻaẓīmatayn al-Jannah wa-al-Nār, thumma baká ḥattá jará, aw balla, dumūʻuhu jānibay liḥyatih, thumma qāl: Wa-alladhī nafsu Muḥammadin bi-yadih, law taʻlamūna mā aʻlamu ʻan al-Ākhirah la-mashaytum ilá al-ṣaʻīd wa-la-ḥathaytum ʻalá ruʼūsikum al-turāb. Wa-rawá ʻan Anas ..."

record.title: 880-01 Mawwālāt : manuscript.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... ṣaḥiya al-malik min ghasyih, rafaʻ raʼsahu wa-qāl: Bintī iṭlubī wa-tammannay ʻalayyā. Fa-qālat la-hu: Yā Abī, baddī qaṣr ʻālī, yakūn libnī min fiḍḍah wa-libnī min dhahab. Fa-qāla la-hā abūhā: ʻAlá al-rās thumma al-ʻayn. Fa-ḥālan ṭaliʻ ilá al-dīwān, wa-arsal khalf shaykh issīyāgh, wa-amarahu an yuʻammir lahā qaṣr, libnī min fiḍḍah wa-libnī min dhahab. Fa-rāḥ shaykh al-sīyyāgh wa-jamaʻ al-sīyīghīn, wa-badaw yashtaghilū muddah min al-ayyām. Khaliṣ al-qaṣr, fa-qāl al-Malik ilá Nūr al-Ṣabāḥ an taṭlaʻ ilá al-qaṣr, fa-ṭaliʻat wa-farashathu al-qadhdh [al-qazz] wa-al-dībāj, wa-ʻammara lahā ayḍan fī ṣarāyatihā ḥammām. Fa-yawm min dhāt al-ayyām kānat fī al-ḥammām, hiya wa-laʼyatuhā [ʻam tataḥammam] fa-qālat ilá al-laʼya: Yā Laʼlātī ..."
Secundo folio: Mawwāl 5. Yāllāʼtī unẓurī al-ʻaṭṭār biddukān yabīʻ min ʻulbatihi ashkāl alwān.
18 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 16 x 20 cm; 20-23 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown cardboard cover.
In large fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; the last third of folio 1 is torn and patched with blank piece of paper; catchwords.
At the head of folio 1a: "Mawwālāt".
Pages numbered in East Arabic (Indian) numerals: 5-24.
The "Mawwāls" are numbered 1-111.
Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with "Mawwāl 111", as follows: "... Awʻattanī Yā Qamar innak tajī ʻindah // wa-qashshaynā al-zahr min khaddak al-wardah. Innahā ḥattá ..."

record.title: 880-01 Sharḥ duʻāʼ Abī Dharr : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing, text starts with: "... taʻajjabat al-malāʼikah minhu fa-udʻu bi-hi, fa-saʼalahu ʻan duʻāʼihi, fa-qāla Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, Yā Abā Dharr, duʻāʼun tadʻū bi-hi fī kull yawm marratayn. Qāl, Naʻam, fidāka abī wa-ummī, mā samiʻtuhu min bashar, wa-innamā huwa ʻasharatu aḥrufin, alhamanī Rabbī ilhāman, wa-anā adʻū bi-hi fī kull yawm marratayn, astaqbilu al-qiblah fa-usabbiḥu Allāh malīyan, wa-aḥmaduhu malīyan, wa-uhalliluhu malīyan, wa-ukabbiruhu, thumma adʻū bi-tilka al-ʻashr kalimāt: Allāhumma innī asʼaluka īmānan dāʼiman, wa-asʼaluka qalban khāshiʻan, wa-asʼaluka ʻilman nāfiʻan ..."
Secundo folio: al-malakūt muʻāyanatan qad waritha qalbuhu al-khishyah.
16.5 x 22 cm; written surface: 9 x 16 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (loose leaves).
In medium good naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; the phrases of "Duʻāʼ Abī Dharr" and markings in purple; some notes on the margins in purple; catchwords.
Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with "... Qāla al-Shaykh al-Quṭb Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Salām, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, mukhāṭiban li-wārithihi ..."

record.title: Treatise on Islamic law : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, idh sa-yaʼtī al-kalām ʻalá mā yataʻallaqu bi-al-Basmalah wa-al-Ḥamdalah. al-Ḥamdu lillāh, ay, ishtamala kalāmuhu min hunā ilá wa-baʻd ʻalá thintay ʻashrata sajʻah, minhā thintān ʻalá al-Mīm al-mawṣūlah bi-Alif al-iṭlāq, wa-humā al-ūlayān, wa-thamāniyah ʻalá al-Mīm al-sākinah, wa-thintān ʻalá al-Nūn al-sākinah, wa-laysa fī kalāmihi sajʻ ʻalá al-Hāʼ wa-al-Lām, wa-in kāna kalām al-ʻAllāmah al-Ujuhūrī yaqtaḍī anna fīhi sajʻan ʻalayhimā, ḥaythu qāl: Ikhtāra khalīlahu ʻalá ḥabībihi li-ajl al-sajʻ ..."
Secundo folio: ḥamdan al-ṣirāṭ al-mastaqīm in urīda bi-hi al-dīn al-ḥaqq.
16.5 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 17 x 16 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 33 unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, white paper; few notes on the margins; some leaves seem to be missing; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with "... wa-la-hu, ay, lil-mutawaḍḍī, salīman aw marīḍan, wa-kadhā al-junub, wa-qawluhu, li-annahu yajūzu tafrīq afʻālihi, ay, al-salīm, lā yaḥullu kull al-badan, ilakh. wa-yashīn, ʻalá al-khilāf, al-īmān wa-al-taʻālīq, wa-qawluhu, wa-yartafiʻu, ay, ʻalá kull min al-qawlayn, wa-qawluhu, wa-innamā lam yajuz radd li-shubhat al-ḍaʻīf al-qāʼil bi-annahu yaḥullu kull al-badan, wa-qawluhu fīmā taqaddama qaṭʻuhā al-muāsib qaṭʻuhu, wa-qawluhu ka-al-riddah, ay, wa-ka-qaṣd ghasl al-aʻḍāʼ ʻan ..."

record.title: 880-03 Taʻlīq laṭīf malīḥ ʻalá Burdat al-madīḥ : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Maḥallī.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-ʻalayhi atawakkalu. Qāla Sayyidunā wa-Mawlānā, al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻAllāmah, shaykh al-Islām wa-baqīyat al-ʻulamāʼ al-aʻlām, Jalāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Maḥallī al-Shāfiʻī, qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahu. Āmīn. al-Ḥamdu wa-al-shukru lillāh, wa-al-ṣalātu wa-al-salāmu ʻalá Sayyidinā Rasūl Allāh. Hādhā 'Taʻlīqun laṭīf malīḥ ʻalá Burdat al-madīḥ', yufhamu bi-hi maqāṣidu nāẓimihā, wa-qad jarrada min nafsihi nafsan khāṭabahā, fa-qāl: Amin tadhakkuri jīranin, bi-kasr al-Jīm, bi-Dhī Salami mazajta, bi-fatḥ al-Tāʼ, damʻan jará min muqlatin, ay, ʻayn, bi-damin minka. Am habbati al-rīḥu min tilqāʼ, ay, jihat, Kāẓimatin wa-awmaḍa al-barqu, ay, lamaʻa ..."
Secundo folio: mā zāʼidah li-ifādat al-taqlīl.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 10-15 x 16.5-23 cm; 15-36 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two unnumbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some notes and on the margins; folios 14b-18b are written in a different hand; catchwords.
Laid in: A folded sheet (4 pages) of Ḥadīth, in Maghribī script, seems to have belonged to an unidentified work (7.5 x 10 cm; written surface 5 x 7.5 cm; 11 lines per page)
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah Jalāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Maḥallī ʻalá Burdah madīḥ Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Yā Fattāḥ. Iftaḥ."
On folio 1a: Miscellaneous Ḥadīths.

Author's colophon: "Qāla al-muʼallif, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Tamma al-kitāb fī al-khāmis wa-al-ʻishrīn min shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanata arbaʻ wa-arbaʻīn wa-thamānī miʼah, wa-lillāh al-ḥamd, wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl."

Translation of the author's colophon: "The author, may God Almighty have mercy upon him, said: The book was completed on the 25th of the month of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, of the year 844 [of the Hijrah = 2 September 1440]. Praise be to God. God suffices us, He is the best advocate."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-qad kamulat hādhihi al-nuskhah fī tisʻata ʻashar khalat min shahr Ramaḍān, sanat alf wa-miʼatayn wa-sittah wa-tisʻīn, ʻalá yad ṭālib al-futūḥ min Allāh, bi-jāh al-ʻAdnānī Muḥammad, Muḥammad al-Akhmīmī al-Ḥamadānī, ʻāmalahu [Allāh], wa-muḥibbīhi bi-alṭāfihi al-khafīyah, wa-dafaʻa ʻanhu wa-ʻanhum kull balīyah, bi-jāh dhī al-akhlāq al-marḍīyah. Āmīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This copy was completed on the 19th of the month of Ramaḍān, of the year 1296 [of the Hijrah = 6 September 1879], by the hand of the seeker of God's enlightenments, for the sake of the high status of Muḥammad, Muḥammad al-Akhmīnī al-Ḥamadānī, may [God] treat him and his loved ones, according to His hidden graces, and drive away from him and them all calamities, for the sake of Him of the pleasant characters. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah : manuscript / Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Kafrāwī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... yaḍribu mabnī ʻalá al-sukūn fī maḥall rafʻ, lā mawḍiʻa lahā min al-iʻrāb, wa-mā ḍaraba illā antumā lil-mutnanná al-mukhāṭabīn, mudhakkaran aw muʼannathan, fa-inna man antumā fāʻil yaḍribu mabnī ʻalá al-sukūn fī maḥall rafʻ, wa-al-Tāʼ ḥarf khiṭāb lā mawḍiʻa lahā min al-iʻrāb, wa-al-Mīm ḥarf ʻimād, wa-al-Alif ḥarf dāll ʻalá al-tathniyah, wa-mā ḍaraba illā antum li-jamʻ al-dhukūr al-mukhāṭabīn, fa-inna man antum fāʻil ḍarab mabnī ʻalá al-sukūn fī maḥall rafʻ ..."
Secundo folio: marfūʻ [space for a word to be written in red] ism mawṣūl naʻt thānin lil-ism mabnī ʻalá al-sukūn fī maḥall rafʻ.
16.5 x 24 cm; written surface: 9 x 17 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (one quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases and parsed words of al-Ājurrūmīyah in red; one correction on folio 2a; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly as follows: "... wa-al-muḍmar, wa-iʻrābuhu, al-Wāw ḥarf ʻaṭf aw lil-istiʼnāf, al-muḍmar mubtadaʼ marfūʻ bi-al-ibtidāʼ, ithnā ʻashar khabar al-mubtadaʼ marfūʻ bi-al-Alif niyābatan ʻan al-ḍammah li-annahu mulḥaq bi-al-muthanná, wa-ʻashar fī muqābalat al-nūn, ithnān yaʻnī anna al-qism al-thānī al-mubtadaʼ al-muḍmar, wa-huwa mā dalla ʻalá musammāhu bi-qarīnat takallum, aw khiṭāb, aw ghaybah, wa-dhakara al-ithnay ʻashar bi-qawlihi wa-hiya, al-Wāw lil-istiʼnāf, hiya ..."

record.note: Title from reference sources.

Translation of the author's colophon: "He said that and wrote it, on the ninth of Jumād Awwal, of the year nine hundred and fifty-three, the poor to the forgiveness and generosity of his Lord, who is taking refuge in His [God's] City [Mecca] and His Sanctuary, fleeing from the greatness of his sin and his iniquity, Aḥmad ibn Ḥajar, may God forgive him, his sheikhs, and his parents, uttering the "Ḥamdalah", the "Taṣliyah" the "Taslimah", the "Ḥasbalah", the "Ḥawqalah", the "Sabḥalah", delegating and handing over himself [to God]. Fī Shahr Ṣafar al-khayr, min shuhūr sanat alf wa-mi ..."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The helpless and weak servant, the hopeful for the forgiveness of his Gracious Lord, Muṣṭafá ibn Rizq Walnabīlī [?] baladan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, had the honor of writing, and the joy of his eyes reading, what was in there, invoking for the author ample pardon, forgiveness, and mercy, that he be thankful for the great goodness and benevolence bestowed upon him. May God Almighty forgive him [the copyist], his parents, his sheikhs, and all believing men and women, and the Muslims, men and women, the living among them and the dead. May God's blessings be upon our Master Muhammad. Dated in the good month of Safar, of the year one-thousand and ..."

Secundo folio: wa-nabdaʼu bi [...?] al-Fiṣḥ wa-ʻalá kull qiṭʻah yaqūlu al-majdu li-anātika al-muqaddasah.
14 x 21 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 18.5 cm; 18 lines per page.
Binding: Remains of cover, manuscript waste.
In large good naskh script; in black ink, on cream color paper; headings in red and black bold script; catchwords.
Laid in two handwritten notes in English about the manuscript and its provenance.

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-najāz min nasākhat hādhā al-khaṭṭ wa-taṣlīḥihi, ay, al-Bindīkistārī al-Khamsīnī al-muqaddas, nahār al-Jumʻah, fī 31 Ādhār, min al-Jumʻah alladhī baʻda al-Fiṣḥ, min shuhūr sanat 1844 lil-tajassud al-Ilāhī, wa-qad tamma bi-rasm Ḥaḍrat Abīnā al-Aqdas wa-al-ināʼ al-ṭāhir al-anfas, al-Khūrī Yūsuf ibn al-marḥūm al-Khūrī Mūsá, wa-qad ʻulliqat bi-yadihi al-fāniyah wa-anāmilihi al-mutalāshiyah al-ʻabd al-khāṭī Ṣāliḥ ibn al-marḥūm Jabbūr, min ahālī qaryat al-Raynah, al-muqāribah ilá madīnat al-Nāṣirah, wa-huwa yasʼalu kull man qaraʼa fīhi wa-raʼá fīhi ghalṭah ṣallaḥahu, yuṣliḥu Allāh umūrahu dunyā wa-ākhirah. Fa-anta ayyuhā al-qāriʼ lā tuwākhidh al-kātib, li-anna al-kamāl huwa lillāh waḥdahu, fa-iqbal ʻudhrī wa-nashāṭī, kamā qabila Rabbunā filsayn al-armalah, wa-narjū minkum taraḥḥamū ʻalá al-nāsikh, Allāh yarḥamunā wa-yarḥamu jamīʻ al-Masīḥīyīn al-Urthūduksīyīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The copy of the Holy Bindīkistārī al-Khamsīnī was completed on Friday, the 31st of March, i.e., the Friday after Easter, of the year 1844 of the Divine Incarnation, for our holy Father and immaculate precious vessel, al-Khūrī Yūsuf ibn al-marḥūm al-Khurī Mūsá, by the perishing hand and vanishing fingers of the sinful servant, Ṣāliḥ ibn al-marḥūm Jabbūr, of the people of the village of al-Raynah, near the city of al-Nāṣirah (Nazareth). He requests everyone who reads it and sees a mistake in it, to fix it, may God fix his affairs in this world and the next. You, reader, do not blame the scribe, because perfection is for God alone. Accept my excuse and my endeavor, as our Lord accepted the two Filses (Pennies) of the widow. We implore you to invoke mercy for the copyist. May God have mercy on us and on all the Orthodox Christians. Amen."

Text starts with: "... jārr wa-majrūr laysa bi-zāʼid wa-lā mimmā yustathná bi-hi, lā budda an yataʻallaqa bi-al-fiʻl, aw mā yushbihuhu, aw mā uwwila bi-mā yushbihuhu aw yushīru ilá maʻnāhu, wa-al-mutaʻalliq immā an yakūna malfūẓan bi-hi aw muqaddaran, wa-al-muqaddar immā wājib al-ḥadhf aw lā, wa-wājib al-ḥadhf fī thamāniyat mawāḍiʻ dhakarahā fī al-Mughnī, wa-lā yukhbaru bi-ism al-zamān, al-mubtadaʼ al-jawhar al-muʻabbar ʻanhu bi-ism al-dhāt, fa-lā yuqālu Zaydun al-yawma, li-ʻadam al-fāʼidah, fa-in ḥaṣalat jāza, ka-an yakūna al-mubtadaʼ ʻāmman wa-al-zamān khāṣṣan, naḥwa fī shahr kadhā ..."
Secundo folio: innamā al-ḥayāh al-dunyā laʻibun wa-lahwun wa-zīnatun wa-tafākhurun baynakum wa-takāthur.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.

In fair medium naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; the phrases of al-Fākihī's commentary in red; markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; some leaves seem to be missing; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly as follows: "... wa-al-ṣaḥīḥ annahā lā takūnu illā lil-tashbīh, wa-lā taʼtī lil-ẓann, bal wa-lā lil-taqrīb, wa-lā lil-taḥqīq, wa-mā awhama khilāf al-tashbīh fa-huwa muʼawwal bi-hi. Wa-layta wa-hiya mawḍūʻah lil-tamannī, wa-huwa ṭalab mā lā ṭamaʻa fīhi, naḥwa [alā] layta al-shabāba yaʻūdu yawman // fa-ukhbirahu bi-mā faʻala al-mashīb. Fa-inna ʻawdahu mustaḥīlun ʻādatan, aw mā fīhi ʻusru, naḥwa layat lī mālan fa-aḥujja minhu, fa-inna ḥuṣūl al-māl mumkinun wa-lākin fīhi ʻusrun, wa-taʻalluq al-tamannī bi-al-mustaḥīl kathīr wa-bi-al-mumkin qalīlan, fa-lā yakūnu fī al-wājib, wa-yajibu fī al-tamannī idhā kāna <kāna> mutaʻalliquhu mumkinan an lā yakūna laka tawaqquʻun wa-ṭamāʻīyatun fī wuqūʻihi wa-illā ..."

record.title: Collection of four treatises on geometry, Arabic grammar, and inheritance : manuscript.
record.note: Title of the codex supplied by cataloger.
1. Title of "Baʻḍ al-muzakhrafāt al-mutaʻalliqah bi-al-shakl al-thālith min ashkāl al-taʼsīs" from incipit (folio 1b).
2. Title of "Risālah fī bayān al-qaḍīyah allatī ṣādara bi-hā Iqlīdis fī awwal kitābih" from incipit (folio 9b).
3. Title of "Sharḥ mukhtaṣar li-Lāmīyat al-afʻāl " supplied by cataloger based on incipit (folio 34a)
4. Title of "al-Urjūzah al-Raḥbīyah" from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Baʻḍ al-muzakhrafāt al-mutaʻalliqah bi-al-shakl al-thālith min ashkāl al-taʼsīs": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-kafá, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Muṣṭafá, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ahl al-wafá. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr ilá man khalaqa al-fiʻl al-awwal fa-al-falik al-tāsiʻ, khādim al-fuqarāʼ, sīyamā al-Naqshabandīyah, ʻAbd al-Wāsiʻ: Inna hādhihi 'Baʻḍ al-muzkhrafāt al-mutaʻalliqah bi-al-shakl al-thālith min ashkāl al-taʼsīs' lil-Sayyid al-muḥaqqiq al-Sayyid Shams al-Dīn al-Samarqandī alltī khaṭarat bi-bālī bi-Madīnat al-Salām Baghdād, ḥarasahu Allāh min al-sharr wa-al-fasād, fī al-sanah 1172 min al-Hijrah, ḥīna ishtighālī bi-tadrīsihi lil-akh al-wafī al-ṣafī Mullā Ismāʻīl al-Ashʻarī al-Ḥanafī wa-al-Sayyid al-amjad Muḥammad, ballaghahumā Allāh al-Mutaʻāl aqṣá madārij al-kamāl. Fa-li-nadhkur awwalan ʻibārātihi makhṭūṭatan bi-baʻḍ ʻibārāt al-sharḥ, thumma nurdifuhu bi-mā sanaḥ lī mutawakkilan ʻalá al-Malik al-ʻĀdil, fa-aqūlu ..."
1. Secundo folio of "Baʻḍ al-muzakhrafāt al-mutaʻalliqah bi-al-shakl al-thālith min ashkāl al-taʼsīs": al-dākhilatayn allatayn fī jihah wāḥidah min dhālika al-khaṭṭ.

2. Incipit of "Risālah fī bayān al-qaḍīyah allatī ṣādara bi-hā Iqlīdis fī awwal kitābih": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu li-man yastaḥiqquhu, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá man yastawjibuhā. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi 'Risālah fī bayān al-qaḍīyah allatī ṣādara bihā Iqlīdis fī awwal kitābih', wa-hiya inna kull khaṭṭayn mustaqīmayn waqaʻa ʻalayhimā khaṭṭ mustaqīm ākhar wa-ṣayyara al-zāwiyatayn al-dākhilīyatayn fī jihatihi aṣghar min qāʼimatayn, fa-inna dhaynika al-khaṭṭayn idhā ukhrijā fī tilka al-jihah talāqayā ..."
2. Secundo folio of "Risālah fī bayān al-qaḍīyah allatī ṣādara bi-hā Iqlīdis fī awwal kitābih": aʻẓam min al-aʻẓam wa-hādhihi qaḍīyah bayyinah bi-nafsihā.

3. Incipit of "Sharḥ mukhtaṣar li-Lāmīyat al-afʻāl": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-ḥamīd al-majīd, al-mubdī al-muʻīd, al-faʻʻāl li-mā yurīd, ḥamdan yuwāfī niʻamahu wa-yukāfī al-mazīd. Wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu, lā sharīka lah, wa-ashhadu anna Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluhu, ṣallá Allāh wa-sallama ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn, wa-ʻalá al-tābiʻīn lahum bi-iḥsānin ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-baʻdm fa-innī kuntu sharaḥtu al-Qaṣīdah al-Lāmīyah al-musammāh Abniyat al-afʻāl fī ʻilm al-ṣarf, lil-Imām Jamāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Mālik, raḥimahu Allāh, bi-sharḥ basaṭahu bi-kathrat al-amthāl ... thumma raʼytu an ajruda min maqāṣidihi wa-asruda min fawāʼidihi mā bayyanathu ʻazāʼim al-ṭālibīn ..."
3. Secuno folio of "Sharḥ mukhtaṣar li-Lāmīyat al-afʻāl": taʻālá. al-Ḥamdu lillāh huwa al-thanāʼ bi-al-lisān ʻalá al-maḥmūd.

4. Incipit of "al-Urjūzah al-Raḥbīyah": "al-Ḥamdu lillāh. Kitāb al-Raḥbīyah taṣnīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah Muwaffaq al-Dīn Abī ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Ḥusayn al-Raḥbī al-Shāfiʻī, qaddasa Allāh rūḥahu wa-nawwara ḍarīḥahu. Āmīn. Wa-Allāh subḥānuhu aʻlam. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Awwalu mā nastaftiḥu al-maqālā // bi-dhikri ḥamdi Rabbinā taʻālá. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāhi ʻalá mā anʻamā // ḥamdan [bi-hi] yajlū ʻani al-qalbi al-ʻamā ..."
Secundo folio "al-Urjūzah al-Raḥbīyah": fī faḍlihi munabbihan.
12 x 19.5 cm; written surface: varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: In dark brown leather, light brown leather on spine; cover embossed with central medallion.

Manuscripts 1 and 2 are written in good naskh script, in black and purple ink, on cream color paper; few notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords (written surface: 5.5 x 14 cm; 17 lines per page).

Manuscript 3 is written in good naskh/taʻlīq script; in black ink, on cream color paper; headings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords (written surface: 5.5 x 12.5 cm; 15 lines per page)..
Manuscript 4 is written in fair naskh script; in black ink, on thin beige paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords (written surface: 9 x 13.5 cm; 14-16 lines per page).
On folio 1a: "Sharḥ abniyah. Qaṣīdah al-Lāmīyah al-musammā Abniyat al-afʻāl fī ʻilm al-ṣarf wa-nusakh fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb."
On folio 1b: Remnant of a handwritten letter (in ruqʻah script) about a disputed piece of land with a person named Ḥamad ibn Fadaʻ, and about financial matters with other other persons.
On the lower left margin of folio 8a: An editor's note: "Ṣaḥḥaḥahu Ibrāhīm ibn Isḥāq" (Corrected by Ibrāhīm ibn Isḥāq).
Folios 9a, 33b, 104b-106a, 114a are blank.
On the upper left corner of folio 34a: A black oval stamp partially legible.
On folio 34a: "al-Ṣarf umm al-ʻulūm wa-al-naḥw abūhā."

On folio 34a: "Sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah al-Lāmīyah al-musammāh bi-abniyat al-afʻāl fī ʻilm al-ṣarf, min muṣannafāt al-Shaykh al-Imām Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Mālik al-Ṭāʼī al-Jayyānī al-Shāfiʻī, wa-lahā sharḥ kabīr, hādhā al-sharḥ mukhtaṣar minhu. H."
On folio 114b: Calculations of amounts paid to different people.
On a laid in folded sheet: "Arabic grammar. Author ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Jāmī (written in 897 H.). This copy was done in 1251. WZH."
On a laid in card: "Collection of treatises on mathematics and geometrical subjects."
On a laid in card: "Arabic MS. Received from E E Calverly Jan 26, 1966."
On the back of a laid in printed small calendar leaf (5.5 x 8 cm), dated: Friday, December 23, 1932: "Kitāb al-Raḥbīyah."
1. Author's colophon of "Baʻḍ al-muzakhrafāt al-mutaʻalliqah bi-al-shakl al-thālith min ashkāl al-taʼsīs": "Fa-li-nakhtum al-kalām hāhunā ḥāmidan muṣallīyan musalliman. Tammat. M M M M M M."

1. Translation of the author's colophon of "Baʻḍ al-muzakhrafāt al-mutaʻalliqah bi-al-shakl al-thālith min ashkāl al-taʼsīs": "Let us here conclude the discourse, with praise, prayer, and greetings of peace."
1. Copyist's colophon of "Baʻḍ al-muzakhrafāt al-mutaʻalliqah bi-al-shakl al-thālith min ashkāl al-taʼsīs": "Katabahu al-faqīr Ismāʻīl ibn Ibrāhīm ʻufiya ʻanhumā. M M M M."
1. Translation of the copyist's colophon of "Baʻḍ al-muzakhrafāt al-mutaʻalliqah bi-al-shakl al-thālith min ashkāl al-taʼsīs": "Copied by the poor Ismāʻīl ibn Ibrāhīm, may both be forgiven. M M M M."

2. "Risālah fī bayān al-qaḍīyah allatī ṣādara bi-hā Iqlīdis fī awwal kitābih" ends as follows: "... wa-iʻlam inna lil-ʻAllāmah al-Shīrāzī wajhan ākhar qad iftakhara bi-hi, dhakarahu fī 'Durrat al-tāj', wa-anā bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá dhakartuhu maʻa mā awradtu ʻalayhi fīmā ʻallaqtuhu ʻalá 'Sharḥ ashkāl al-taʼsīs', wa-man arāda mulāḥaẓatahu fa-ʻalayhi bi-al-rujūʻ ilá dhālika al-taʻlīq."

2. Author's colophon of "Risālah fī bayān al-qaḍīyah allatī ṣādara bi-hā Iqlīdis fī awwal kitābih": "Wa-li-nakhtum al-kalām hāhunā ḥāmidan muṣalliyan musalliman. Wa-qad waqaʻa al-farāgh minhu fī yawm al-Sabt min ayyām al-ʻushr al-awsaṭ min shahr Shawwāl, khutima bi-al-iqbāl, sanat 1172. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tawfīq. M."

2. Translation of the author's colophon of "Risālah fī bayān al-qaḍīyah allatī ṣādara bi-hā Iqlīdis fī awwal kitābih": "Let us here conclude the discourse, with praise, prayer, and greetings of peace. The writing was completed on Saturday, the middle tenth of the month of Shawwāl, may it end in success, in the year 1172 [of the Hijrah = 9 June 1759]. M."
3. Colophon of "Sharḥ mukhtaṣar li-Lāmīyat al-afʻāl": "Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ḥusn tawfīqih."
3. Translation of the colophon of "Sharḥ mukhtaṣar li-Lāmīyat al-afʻāl": "It is completed by the praise of God and His abundant benevolence."

4. "al-Urjūzah al-Raḥbīyah" ends with the following verses: "Wa-afḍalu al-ṣalāti wa-al-taslīmi // ʻalá al-Nabīyi al-Muṣṭafá al-Karīmi. Muḥammadin khayri al-anām al-ʻāqibi // wa-ālihi al-ghurri dhawī al-manāqibi. Wa-ṣaḥbihi al-afāḍili al-akhyāri / al-sādat al-amājidi al-abrāri."

4. Colophon of "al-Urjūzah al-Raḥbīyah": "Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah bi-qalam al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-muqirr bi-al-zalal wa-al-taqṣīr, khāʼif wa-yarjī ʻafwa Rabbihi Yawm al-Maṣīr, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Wa-nasʼaluhu al-tawfīq, fa-Huwa al-muʻīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad al-Nabī al-ṣādiq al-amīn. Sanat 1219."

4. Translation of the colophon of "al-Urjūzah al-Raḥbīyah": "This blessed copy was completed by the pen of the wretched poor, who admits his guilt and negligence, the fearful who hopes for the forgiveness of His Lord at the Day of Destiny, may God forgive him and all Muslims. We ask Him for success, for He is the Helper. May prayer and peace be upon Muḥammad, the Honest and Faithful Prophet. In the year 1219 [of the Hijrah = 1804/1805]."

record.title: Text of the Qurʼān with translation and commentary in Persian : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

The beginning is missing. Text starts with verse 155 of Sūrat al-Ṣāffāt (Chapter 37), as follows: "... A-fa-lā tadhkurūn. Am lakum sulṭānun mubīn. Faʼtū bi-kitābikum in kuntum ṣādiqīn. Wa-jaʻalū baynahu wa-bayna al-jinnati nasaban wa-laqad ʻalimati al-jinnatu innahum la-muḥḍarūn ..."
Secundo folio is illegible.
25.5 x 32.5 cm; written surface: 18 x 28 cm; 16 lines per page.
Binding: Cover missing; remnants of dark brown leather on spine.

The verses of the Qurʼān are written in large bold calligraphic naskh script; the interlinear Persian translation and commentary is in large good naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; titles of the sūrahs in red; few notes on the margins; several laid in cards and slips of paper.
Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with the commentary on Sūrat al-Fatḥ (Chapter 48).

record.title: 880-02 Majmaʻ al-manāfiʻ al-badanīyah : manuscript / Dāʼūd ibn ʻUmar al-Anṭākī.
record.note: Title from the printed version.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... aw bād zahr ḥifẓan lil-qūwah wa-al-rūḥ wa-dafʻan li-ḍarar al-sumūm, wa-huwa ism li-ḥajar yafʻalu dhālik, fa-yushbihu baʻḍ al-adwiyah li-shiddat qūwatihi wa-nafʻih. Wa-idhā qīla māʼ al-ʻasal, fa-huwa an taʼkhudha min al-māʼ juzwayn wa-min al-ʻasl juzwan, wa-yughlá ilá an yadhhaba al-thulth, wa-ʻamaluhu bi-māʼ al-maṭar al-muʻattaq ajwad. Wa-idhā uṭliqa lisān al-thawr wa-lisān al-ʻuṣfūr fa-al-murād bi-himā al-nabātayn. Wa-idhā qīla dānaq fa-huwa suds dirham, wa-huwa thamān ḥabbāh [ḥabbāt] shaʻīr muʻtadilāt. Wa-Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá aʻlam ..."
Secundo folio: al-Bāb al-thāmin. Fī dhikr manāfiʻ tataʻallaqu bi-al-ḥalq li-taskīn ḥurqatih.
16.5 x 24 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 16 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (one quire)
In fair naskh script, in black ink on cream color paper, headings in bold script; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with a statement by the author and a poem in 37 verses summerizing his medical themes, as follows: "... Fa-hādhā kāfin li-ʻāqilin fī ʻilm al-ṭibb wa-al-ḥikmah. Wa-qad naẓamtu qaṣīdatan tajmaʻu ʻilm al-ṭibb wa-murāʻāt ḥifẓ [al-ṣiḥḥah (?)], wa-jaʻaltuhā khātimat al-faṣl, wa-hiya hādhihi: al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī khalaqa al-wará // wa-qaḍá wa-anfadha mā yashāʼu wa-qaddarā. Jaʻala al-ṭabāʼiʻa aṣla kulli khalīqatin // wa-aqāma minhā al-kāʼināti wa-dabbarā ..." The poem ends with: "... Khudhhā bi-ʻilmin wa-al-ʻAlīmu huwa alladhī // bi-al-ḥaqqi anṭaqanī wa-lī kullahā dabbarā. Wa-ʻalá al-Nabīyi wa-ālihi wa-ṣiḥābihi // ṣallá Ilāhu al-ʻArsh mā ..."

At the end of the text a medical recipe, as follows: "Ṣfat maʻjūn wujid fī khizānat al-Malik Zakarīyā, ṣāḥib madīnat Tūnis, wa-huwa yuqawwī al-dhakar wa-yuṣallibuhu wa-yughzir al-minī wa-yazīdu fī al-bāh wa-yuḥbil al-marʼah. Yuʼkhadh bizr lift khams mathāqīl, wa-mithluhu bizr jarjīr, wa-bizr jazar ʻasharat mathāqīl, wa-bizr halyūn khams mathāqīl, wa-islanjīnīn mithluhu, wa-ʻāqir qarḥā mithluhu wa-ar ..."

record.title: 880-02 al-Faṣl fī uṣūl ʻilm al-raml : manuscript / Muḥammad al-Zinātī al-Falakī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a and incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā 'Kitāb al-Faṣl fī uṣūl ʻilm al-raml' ʻalá ḥukm al-qawāʻid al-aṣlīyah al-Idrīsīyah. Qāla al-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Muḥammad al-Zinātī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Iʻlam fa-inna li-kull ʻilm bidāyah, wa-li-kull ʻilm muqaddimah, wa-nurīdu an nadhkura muqaddimāt min ʻilm al-raml, mā fīhi kifāyah lil-mubtadī, wa-uṣūl turḍī al-ʻārif al-muntahī, fa-nabtadī, bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih, fa-naqūlu: In ʻilm al-raml mansūbun ilá nabī min anbiyāʼ Allāh ..."
Secundo folio: [... ... ...] min aqwá al-ḥurūf al-mawjūdah.
15.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 8 x 13.5 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (loose leaves)
In good naskh script, in black ink, on tattered cream color paper, some notes on the margins; magic squares; magic signs; some leaves seem to be missing; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb al-Faṣl fī uṣūl ʻilm al-raml ʻalá al-qawāʻid al-Idrīsīyah, taʼlīf al-Shaykh Muḥammad Abū Ḥāmid al-Zinātī, raḥimahu Allāh."
On folio 1a: Magical words and signs.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly as follows: "... wa-kadhālika ʻUṭārid la-hu baytān, al-Jawzāʼ wa-al-Sunbulah, fa-yakūnu al-ijtimāʻ lil-Jawzāʼ wa-al-jamāʻah lil-Sunbulah, wa-kadhālika al-Qamar, la-hu burj al-Saraṭān, nuqṭatay [?] al-māʼ wa-al-hawá yadullān ʻalá al-wujūd, wa-nuqṭatay [?] al-nār wa-al-turāb yadullān ʻalá al-ʻadam. Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Wa-iʻlam inna al-raml kullahu rājiʻ dhālika ʻashrat ashkāl, minhum arbaʻah thābitah, wa-hum [four signs] wa-sittah munqalibah wa-hum [six signs] fa-ṣārat ithnay ʻashar shaklan. Thumma iʻlam inna al-kawākib saʻdān wa-naḥsān wa-nīrān wa-mamāzij, fa-al-saʻdān al-Mushtarī wa-al-Zuhrah, wa-al-naḥsān Zuḥal wa-al-Marrīkh, wa-al-nīrān al-Shams wa-al-Qamar, wa-ammā ..."

record.title: Fragments from four unidentified manuscripts on geomancy, divination, fortune-telling, and magic : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Manuscript 1 (1 leaf) starts with: "... yattafiqu rasūl yaʼtī bi-kitāb sulṭān ʻādil, dābbah min sulṭān, ḥukm min ḥākim, shukhūṣ muttafiqah, amr yubṭī, khayr kāfī, maʻāsh khiṣb wa-māl li-man yuḥibb, ittiṣāl rizq ʻājil, wa-huwa khayr kulluhu ..." It ends with: "... mawt fajʼah, ghalabah, qahr, buʻd ʻan al-aḥbāb, wa-hādhihi al-dāllah ʻalá al-sannah, ʻan wa-ʻalá al-infirād, wa-hiya kāfiyah fī alladhī sharaṭnāh ..."

Manuscript 2 (1 leaf) starts with: "... tilka wa-zādat nuqṭah ʻalá kull shakl fī al-khaṭṭ nuqṭatayn, wa-naʻlamu al-thamāniyat ashkāl al-tāmmah kamā ṣārat nuqaṭuhā ..." It ends with: "... al-ḥādī ʻashar bayt al-rajāʼ wa-al-amal wa-sahm al-saʻādah wa-mā yalī al-watid, wa-kullamā huwa ātin wa-yurjá ḥuṣūluhu, wa-huwa bayt al-dāyah allatī taqʻudu taḥt al-walad li-annahu kharaja min 5 wa 6 bayt ummihi fa-ʻurifa min dhālika ..."

Manuscript 3 (1 leaf) starts with: "... ṣāḥibuhā [magical sign] tūjad bāqiyah [magical sign] fa-ẓahara minhu al-maṭlūb, fa-qulnā inna maṭlūbaka ẓahar min bayt al-afrāḥ li-anna al-khāmis mā yalī al-watid wa-huwa al-surūr ..." It ends with: "... wa-huwa asfal al-ʻanāṣir li-annahu yuqālu nār, hawāʼ, māʼ, turāb, wa-majmūʻ dhālika fī al-ṭarīq, wa-minhum man qāla innahā umm al-raml, wa-al-mashhūr hiya abūhu, li-anna al-jamāʻah hiya al-umm, wa-iʻlam inna al-ʻanāṣir al-maʻrūfah ..."

Manuscript 4 (3 leaves) starts with: "... 1212 wa-mahmā faʻala maʻaka fa-imshī bi-hi ʻalá al-buyūt wa-taḥkum bi-hi awwal jadwalah [magic squar]. Faṣl fī al-ashkāl al-fārighah fī maʻrifat al-shakl al-malʼān. al-Ashkāl al-fārighah, al-ashkāl al-nāṭiqah, al-ashkāl al-ṣammāʼ [magical signs] ..."
Secundo folio of manuscript 4: yakūnu rajul muʻtadil al-qāmah, abyaḍ al-lawn, ṣaghīr al-raʼs.

Manuscript 1. 20 cm; 15 x 20 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15.5 cm; 15 lines per page. Manuscript 2. 23 cm; 16 x 23 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 17 cm; 21 lines per page. Manuscript 3. 23 cm; 15.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 17.5 cm; 23 lines per page. Manuscript 4. 21 cm; 14.7 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 17 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (loose leaves)

Manuscript 1 is written in good naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper. Manuscript 2 is written in fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper. Manuscript 3 is written in fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper. Manuscript 4 is written in fair medium naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; magical squares and magical signs; catchwords.

Colophon of manuscript 4: No colophon. Text ends abruptly as follows: "... wa-in naẓarta la-hu al-saʻd tarjiʻu wa-illā bi-ḍiddihi, wa-in kānat [magical sign] mutakarrir fī aḥad ilá azwāj al-zawāyid lam tarid, wa-lā sīyamā in kān al-shakl khārij [magical sign] al-ṭālib wa-al-maṭlūb, idhā infataḥa nār al-shakl wa-hawāhu fa-huwa ṭālib, wa-in infataḥa māʼuhu wa-turābuhu fa-huwa maṭlūb, wa-in infataḥa nāruhu wa-turābuhu aw hawāhu wa-māʼuhu fa-huwa ṭālib wa-maṭlūb, fa-in ..."

record.title: Houghton family leases and library catalogue : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Sewn within contemporary marbled wrappers.

Internal evidence suggests a mid-18th century date for cataloging the library. The watermark (Pro Patria, with countermark GR) suggests that the laid paper dates from around 1750. The latest publication date of the volumes listed is Whiston’s Josephus (London 1737). Perhaps the library left by John Houghton and inherited by his son John.

record.title: 880-02 Risālah fī ʻilm al-waḍʻ : manuscript / Mūsá al-Sūsī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi nubdhah laṭīfah tataḍammanu aqsām al-waḍʻ, maʼkhūdhah min risālat al-ʻAḍud wa-sharḥihā lil-Samarqandī, maʻa ziyādah min ḥāshiyat ustādhinā al-Ḥifnī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi, wa-mā zīda ʻuziya li-qāʼilih, rattabtuhā ʻalá muqaddimah wa-taqsīm wa-khātimah. al-Muqaddimah. al-Waḍʻ lughatan jaʻl al-shayʼ fī ḥayyiz, wa-iṣṭilāḥan jaʻl lafẓ mushakhkhaṣ aw maḍbūṭ bi-ḍābiṭ kullī bi-izāʼ maʻnāhu immā li-yadulla ʻalayhi bi-nafsihi aw bi-qarīnah ghayr māniʻah ʻan iradat al-maʻná al-aṣlī ..."
Secundo folio: aw uḥissa fa-yashmalu al-khuṭūṭ wa-naḥwahā.
16.2 x 23 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 14.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (one quire).
In large good naskh script, in black ink on cream color paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly as follows: "... wa-iʻtabara dhālika ahl al-bayān ḥaythu jaʻalū al-istiʻārah fī al-fiʻl wa-bāqī al-mushtaqqāt tabaʻīyah li-ʻadam istiqlāl al-mushtaqq bi-nafsihi, sawāʼ kāna fiʻlan aw isman, bi-sabab mulāḥaẓat al-nisbah al-juzʼīyah fīhi, kamā fī al-Mullawī ʻalá al-Samarqandīyah, fa-li-ayyi shayʼin ṣaḥḥa al-ḥukm bi-al-ism al-mushtaqq wa-ʻalayhi dūna al-fiʻl wa-fāʻilihi, ujīb bi-anna al-nisbah ẓāhirah min ḥaythu innahā tuqṣadu bi-al-ifādah min rabṭihā bi-al-fāʻil, wa-fī al-ism ..."

record.title: Fragments of treatises on magic, divination, and the occult : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of fragment 1: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... bi-ʻillah tusqá minhā ʻurūquhu ḥattá lā yasmaʻa. Ibn Shaṭṭām, Ibn Mihmāl, ṣāḥib al-amrāḍ al-thiqāl, Ibn al-Qahramān ṣāḥib al-waswasah wa-al-ʻadhāb ..."

Incipit of fragment 2: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... Qawluhu taʻālá: Subḥānaka lā ʻilma lanā illā mā ʻallamtanā innaka anta al-ʻalīmu al-ḥakīm. 10 marrāt. Thumma tatlū hādhihi al-asmāʼ: Yā Hādī, Yā Khabīr, Yā Mubīn, Yā ʻAllām al-ghuyūb 1000 marrah. Wa-li-hādhihi al-asmāʼ sirr ..."
Secundo folio of fragment 2: wanaqusha ʻalá tilka al-ṣūrah al-ism wa-alqī al-ism wa-al-ṣūrah fī al-nār.

Incipit of fragment 3: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... Innamā amruhu idhā arāda shayʼan an yaqūla la-hu kun fa-yakūn, fa-subḥāna alladhī bi-yadihi malakūtu kull shayʼ wa-ilayhi tarjiʻūn. Wa-idhā akhlaṣa al-nīyah wa-al-ʻamal fa-inna khādim al-asmāʼ yaʼtī bi-nafaqah zāʼidah, wa-rubbamā wajadahā fī kull ṣabāḥ ʻinda raʼsihi, wa-yaktubu hādhihi al-awfāq fī aṭlas akhḍar ..."
Secundo folio of fragment 3: [Qul Yā ahla] al-Kitāb hal tanqimūna minnā illā an āmannā billāhi wa-mā unzila ilaynā wa-mā unzila min qablu wa-inna aktharakum fāsiqūn.
16 x 23 cm; written surface varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper, headings in red; magic squares; catchwords.
Colophon of fragment 1. No colophon. Text ends with a magic square and "Āyat al-Kursī" (Qurʼān. Sūrat al-Baqarah. Verse 255).

Colophon of fragment 2: No colophon. Text ends with a magic square and a text which ends abruptly as follows: "... wa-hādhā al-jadwal kamā tará, wa-bakhkhirhu bi-ṭīb mithl al-misk wa-al-ʻanbar wa-al-Jāwirī, wa-tuqabbil ʻalá hādhihi al-āyah qabla an taḍaʻahu fī ʻimāmatika, wa-huwa kamā tará, wa-al-dhikr yakūnu fī waqt tafzaʻu fīhi nafsuka, wa-jumlat al-dhikr thamāniyat ayyām, wa-al-ijābah bi-faḍl Allāh aqrab min dhālik, wa-ammā ṣifatuhā li-kashf al-ʻulūm an taqraʼa al-āyah shī 1000 marrah, thumma taqraʼu ..."

Colophon of fragment 3: No colophon. Text ends abruptly as follows: "... Fāʼidah jalīlah. Wa-man lāzama fī kull laylah ʻinda al-nawm ṣalāt arbaʻ rakaʻāt, yaqraʼu fī al-ūlá Fātiḥat al-Kitāb wa-Sūrat al-Ikhlāṣ ʻishrūna marrah, wa-fī al-rakʻah al-thālithah al-Fātiḥah wa-Sūrat al-Ikhlāṣ thalāthūna marrah, wa-fī al-rābiʻah yaqraʼu ..."

record.title: 880-03 Aqrab al-masālik li-madhhab al-Imām Mālik : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Dardīr.
record.note: Title from folio 2b and reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... baṣaruhu fī ākhir ʻumrih fa-ishtaghala bi-taʻlīm al-aṭfāl Kitāb Allāh taʻālá, fa-ḥafiẓa al-Qurʼān ʻalá yadayhi khalq kathīr, wa-kāna yuʻallimu al-fuqarāʼ ḥisbatan lillāh taʻālá, wa-lā yaʼkhudhu minhum ṣrfatan wa-lā ghayrahā, bal rubbamā wāsāhum min ʻindihi, wa-kāna kathīr al-sukūt, lā yatakallamu illā nādiran, wa-wirduhu fī ghālib awqātihi ṣalāt Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Salām ibn Mashīsh, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu ..."
Secundo folio: yajūzu ʻaṭf al-fiʻlīyah al-inshāʼīyah ʻalá al-ismīyah.
17 x 24 cm; written surface: 9 x 15 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in two quires).
In large good naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; phrases of "Aqrab al-masālik ilá madhhab al-Imām Mālik" in red; numerous notes on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 2a: "Fa-hādhā kitāb jalīl iqtaṭaftuhu min thimār Mukhtaṣar al-Imām Khalīl."
On folio 2b: "Sammaytuhu Aqrab al-masālik li-madhhab al-Imām Mālik."

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly as follows: "... fa-lā mafhūma lil-quyūd allatī dhakarahā al-Shaykh bi-qawlihi wa-bawl faras li-ghāzin bi-arḍ ḥarb, aw, athar dhubāb min najāsah wa-dam wa-ḥijāmah musiḥa ḥattá yubrá, ay, yuʻaffá min athar al-dhubāb, yaqaʻu ʻalá al-qidrah aw al-bawl wa-al-dam bi-arjulhi aw famihi thumma yaṭīru wa-yaḥuṭṭu ʻalá thawb aw badan, fa-qawlunā min najāsah bayān li-athar huw aʻamm min qawlihi ʻudhrah, idh lā mafhūma lahā, wa-mithl al-dhubāb ..."

record.title: Treatise on the miracles of Prophet Muḥammad : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... fāsiq fa-in kāna muwāfiqan li-murādihi fa-yusammá istidrājan, wa-in kāna ʻalá khilāf murādihi fa-yusammá ihānah. Wa-iʻlam inna muʻjizātihi, ṣallá Allāh ʻlayhi wa-sallam, kathīrah jiddan, minhā al-Qurʼān, wa-huwa aʻẓamuhā, wa-minhā inshiqāq al-Qamar firqatayn, firqah fawqa Jabal Abī Qubays, wa-firqah dūnahu, shāhada dhālika al-baʻīd wa-al-qarīb ..."
16.2 x 24 cm; written surface: 9 x 15.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (one leaf only).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly as follows: "... thumma ishtuqqa min al-ṣalāh al-māḍiyah ṣallá, bi-maʻná yuṣallī, istiʻārah taṣrīḥīyah tabaʻīyah, ay, asʼaluka Yā Allāh an tuṣalliya ʻalayhi, fa-hiya jumlah khabarīyah lafẓan, wa-maʻnāhā al-ṭalab likay lā yaḥtāja ilá istiḥḍār ..."

record.title: Arabic quotations, maxims, aphorisms, etc. : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Fī waṣf al-khamr wa-mā fīhā min al-ḍurr wa-al-nafʻ. Qāla al-aṭibbāʼ fī waṣf al-khamr: Innahā tuḥassinu al-jism, wa-tujawwidu al-haḍm, wa-turaṭṭibu al-aʻḍāʼ, wa-tusakkinu al-ʻaṭash idhā muzijat, wa-tadurr al-bawl, wa-tusahhilu al-ṭabīʻah, wa-tusirru al-nafs, wa-tuḥdithu al-ṭarab wa-al-aryaḥīyah, lāsīyamā fī al-abdān al-muʻtadilah, hādhā fī ḥadd al-qaṣd ..."
Secundo folio: Fī al-wadāʻ. Wa-lammā waqfnā lil-wadāʻ wa-damʻuhā // yabuththu bi-majrāhu al-ṣabābata wa-al-wajdā.
1 sheet 24.5 x 19.2 cm (folded to 12.25 x 19.2 cm); written surface varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings in red.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends as follows: "... Fī al-yaʼs ayḍan. Yā man alaḥḥa ʻalayhi al-hammu wa-al-fikrau // wa-ghayyar ḥālahu al-ayyām wa-al-ghiyaru. Amā samiʻta limā qīla fī mathalin // ʻinda al-iyāsi fa-ayna Allāhu wa-al-qadaru."

record.title: Leaf from an unidentified Arabic manuscript : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

On the front of the leaf are the following seven statements: 1. A statement by a copyist/owner, dated in the year 1069 of the Hijrah (1658/1659), as follows: "[... ...] ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-luṭfihi al-khafī, li-nafsihi, ḥāmidan muṣallīyan [...] sanat 1069." 2. A statement dated in the year 1070 of the Hijrah (1659/1670), by a son of al-Mutawakkil ʻalá Allāh Amīr al-Muʼminīn al-Qāsim ibn Muḥammad (probably al-Qāsim ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī (1559-1620), the Zaydī Imām/govrernor of Yemen), as follows: "Niṣf al-thā[... ... ...] bi-mā fī [...] li-ibn [...] ʻalá Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahumā Allāh raḥmat al-abrār, wa-ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam ʻalá Nabīyihi al-Karīm wa-ālihi al-akhyār. Wa-kataba al-Mawlá [... ...] wa-sanad al-Muslimīn, al-Mutawakkil ʻalá Allāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn [...] ibn Amīr al-Muʼminīn al-Qāsim ibn Muḥammad, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhum, sanat 1070." 3. "Ṣaḥīḥ lā saqṭa fīhi, fa-lillāh al-ḥamd wa-al-minnah."

4. A statement dated in the year 1057 of the Hijrah (1647/1648), as follows: "[... ... ...] al-Imām al-Muʼayyad, raḥimahu Allāh [... ...] sanat 1057". 5. An ownership statement (?): "[...] ʻAlī ishtaraytuhu [...]. 6. An ownership statement dated in the month of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, of the year 1112 of the Hijrah (August/September 1700), by al-Muʻizz lillāh ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm, as follows: "[... ...] al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-la-hu al-ḥamd [... ...] lil-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Allāh, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm, al-Muʻizz lillāh, wa-dhālika fī shahr Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat ithnā ʻashar wa-miʼah wa-alf." 7. An endowment statement (waqf), as sollows: "[...] Aḥmad ibn Nāṣir, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá [...] thumma ilá al-awlá min dhurrīyatihi al-ʻAzīz ibn Aḥmad ibn Nāṣir."

On the back of the leaf is an excerpt from "Kitāb al-Ḥajj wa-al-ʻUmrah" (Book of pilgrimage), as follows: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Kitāb al-Ḥajj wa-al-ʻUmarah. Yashtamilu ʻalá thalāth [...] fī wājibihimā wa-mutaʻallaqātihimā, wa-fīhi fuṣūl. Awwaluhā [...] Qāla Allāh taʻālá: 'Wa-lillāhi ʻalá al-nāsi ḥajju al-Bayti man [istaṭāʻa ilayhi sabīlā wa-man] kafara, fa-inna Allāh ghanīyun ʻan al-ʻālamīn'. Qāla ʻIkrimah [...] qāla al-Shāfiʻī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, mā ashbaha qawl [...] li-anna hādhā kafara bi-farḍ al-ḥajj al-munzal fī Kitāb [Allāh] mimmā unzila. Wa-ʻan Ibn ʻAbbās [anna (?)] al-Aqraʻ, raḍiya [... ...] Yā Rasūla [Allāh] awamarratan fī al-ʻumr, fa-qāl bal marrah, fa-man [... ...] dalla ʻalayhā al-Sunnah wa-al-Ijmāʻ, wa-hiya [...] wa-rāḥilah maʻa al-qudrah ʻalá al-thubūt [... ... ...] fa-inna hādhayn idhā wajada immā yastaʼjir [... ... ...] qāla ..."
16.7 x 24 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 17.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
In fair large naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper.

record.title: Islamic miscellanea : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Manuscript 2 (1 leaf). On the front of the leaf: "Hādhā Matn al-Sanūsīyah lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, al-ʻumda[h] al-fāḍil al-Shaykh al-Sanūsī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-biʻulūmihi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. On the back of the leaf: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Iʻlam anna al-ḥukm al-ʻaqlī yanḥaṣiru fī thalāthat aqsām: al-Wujūb, wa-al-istiḥālah, wa-al-jawāz ... fa-mimmā yajibu li-Mawlānā, jalla wa-ʻazz, ʻishrūn ṣifah, wa-hiya: al-Wujūd, wa-al-qidam, wa-al-baqāʼ, wa-mukhālafatuhu ..."

Manuscript 3. Miscellaneous quotations from the Qurʼān and the Ḥadīth. Starts with: "... al-ḥājah ilayhā. Qāla Allāh taʻālá: Kullu nafsin dhāʼiqatun al-mawt. Wa-qāla Allāh taʻālá: Kullu man ʻalayhā fānin, wa-yabqá wajhu Rabbika dhū al-jalāli wa-al-ikrām ..."
Secundo folio of manuscript 3: kāna fī aydīnā wa-kunnā lā nunfiqu fī sabīl Allāh.

Manuscript 3 ends with: "... ruwiya ʻan Ibn ʻAbbās, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhumā, ʻan al-Nabī, ṣallá allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam annahu qāl: Nazala Jibrīl, ʻalayhi al-salām, dhāta yawm mutaghayyir al-lawn wa-qad nazalat ..."

Manuscript 4. On Islamic law. Starts with: "... wa-ammā al-ʻabd fa-li-annahu mashghūlun bi-khidmat mawlāhu. Wa-qāla Aḥmad fī riwāyatihi ʻanhu: Tajibu ʻalá al-ʻabd dūnahumā, wa-ikhtalafū fī al-ʻabd al-maʼdhūn la-hu wa-al-mukātib wa-muʻtaq al-baʻḍ wa-al-ʻabd alladhī ḥaḍara bāb al-jāmiʻ li-ḥifẓ dābbat mawlāhu. Qīla tajibu ʻalayhim, wa-qīla lā. Wa-ittafaqū ayḍan ʻalá anna al-khuṭbatayn qabla al-ṣalāh bi-sharṭ ṣiḥḥat inʻiqād al-jumʻah ..."
Secundo folio of manuscript 4: bi-ʻadam wujūdihā ʻalayhā fa-yasquṭu farḍ al-jumʻah.

Manuscript 4 ends with: "... wa-ittafaqū ʻalá jawāz iqtidāʼ al-mutanaqqil bi-al-muftaraḍ, wa-ikhtalafū fī iqtidāʼ al-muftaraḍ bi-al-mutanaqqil, fa-qāla Abū Ḥanīfah wa-Mālik wa-Aḥmad lā yajūz, qālū wa-lā man yuṣallī farḍan khalfa man yuṣallī farḍan ākhar, qāla al-Shāfiʻī yajūz. Faṣl ..."

Manuscript 5 (one leaf). From the life of the Prophet. On the front of the leaf: "Kitāb Qiṣṣat inshiqāq al-Qamar li-Sayyid al-bashar, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam". On the back of the leaf: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá [khātim] al-mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn ..." It ends with: "... Ruwiya ʻan Anas ibn Mālik, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, qāl: Baynamā Rasūl ..."

Manuscript 6. Selections from the Ḥadīth. Starts with: "... tarḍá urḍīhi Yā Muḥammad. Fa-qultu: Sayyidī wa-Mawlāy: Urḍīhi kull al-riḍā. Thumma amsaka Rabbī al-kalām sāʻah, thumma qāl: Yā Muḥammad, fa-qultu labbayka Sayyidī wa-Mawlāy, fa-qāl Yā Muḥammad, qad faraḍtu ʻalayka wa-ʻalá ummatika khamsīn ṣalātan ..."
Secundo folio of manuscript 6: ummatin, wa-futiḥ al-bāb, fa-lammā dakhalnā al-Jannah.
Manuscript 6 ends with: "... fa-qultu li-man anti yā jāriyah, fa-qālat al-jāriyah Shabmah (Fiḍḍah?) al-ʻAlawīyah (al-Nūbīyah?) innī jāriyah li-Fāṭimah al-Ẓahrah [al-Zahrāʼ], wa-naḥnu qalīl ..."

Manuscript 7. From the life of the Prophet. Starts with: "... hādhihi al-masʼalah. Qāla Abū Jahl: Naḥnu naʻrifu mā lā yaʻrifuhu ghayrunā. Naḥnu arsalnā la-hu rajulan yuqālu la-hu al-Walīd ibn Saʻd li-qatlihi, fa-ikhtafá la-hu khalfa bāb al-Kaʻbah, fa-lammā faragha Muḥammad min ṣalātihi, nādá Muḥammad: Yā Walīd, man yaʼtī fī qatlat al-aḥbāb yakhtafī khalfa al-bāb ..."
Secundo folio of manuscript 7: wa-yaṭūfu bi-al-Kaʻbah al-muʻaẓẓamah wa-qad aqbala wa-maʻahu hadāyā wa-tuḥaf.
Manuscript 7 ends with: "... fa-qāla al-Malik: Yā Abā Ṭālib, uḥibbu an arāhu wa-asmaʻa kalāmahu. Fa-qāla Abū Ṭālib ursilu ilayhi man yaʼtī bi-hi ..."

Manuscript 8. Miscellaneous selections. Starts with part of "al-Burdah" of al-Būṣīrī (Sharaf al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd, 1213?-1296?), a poem in praise of the Prophet Muḥammad, as follows: "... wa-rudda wāriduhā bi-al-ghayẓi ḥīna ẓumī. Ka-anna bi-al-nāri mā bi-al-māʼi min balalin // ḥuznan wa-bil-māʼi mā bi-al-māʼi min ḍarami ..."
Secundo folio of manuscript 8: taqīhi ḥarra waṭīsin lil-hajīri ḥumī.

Manuscript 8 ends with quotations from the Qurʼān, as follows: "... fa-suḥqan li-aṣḥābi al-saʻīr. Inna alladhīna yakhshuawna Rabbahum bi-al-ghaybi lahum maghfiratun wa-ajrun kabīr. Wa-asirrū qawlakum aw ujhurū bi-hi innahu ..."
Binding: The fragments are placed inside a bluish marbled cover with black cloth on spine.
The fragments are written in fair naskh script, in different hands, in black ink, on cream color paper; catchwords.

record.title: Fragments of treatises on Islamic doctrines : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... wa-al-wāḥidah hiya aqall al-witr, wa-aktharuhu aḥad ʻashar rakʻah, wa-waqtuhu bayna ṣalāt al-ʻishāʼ wa-ṭulūʻ al-fajr, fa-law awtara qabla al-ʻishāʼ ʻamdan aw sahwan lam yuʻtadda bi-hi, wa-al-rawātib al-muʼakkadah min dhālik ʻashr rakaʻāt, rakʻatān qabl al-ṣubḥ wa-rakʻatān qabla al-ẓuhr wa-rakʻatān baʻdaha wa-rakʻatān baʻda al-maghrib wa-rakʻatān baʻda al-ʻishāʼ, wa-thalāth nawāfil muʼakkadāt, ghayr tābiʻah lil-farāʼiḍ, aḥduhā ṣalāt al-layl ..."
Secundo folio: sitruhā fī ghayr al-ṣalāh ʻan al-nās wa-fī al-khalwah.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: Unbound (loose leaves).
In large fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper, some phrases in red; some notes on the margins; some leaves seem to be missing; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly as follows: "... wa-fī baʻḍ al-nusakh wa-banāt al-ibn wa-al-ukhtān min al-ab wa-al-umm fa-akthar, wa-al-ukhtān min al-ab fa-akthar, wa-hādhā ʻinda infirād kull minhumā ʻan akhawātihin [... ... ...] tuḥjabu, wa-huwa idhā lam yakun lil-mayyit walad, wa-lā walad ibn, wa-lā ibn min ikhwah ..."

record.title: Fragment of a treatise on Islamic law : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... wa-lā yudfanu ithnān fī qabr wāḥid illā li-ḥājah, wa-Allāh aʻlam. Kitāb al-zakāh. Tajibu al-zakāh fī khamsat ashyāʼ, wa-hiya: al-Mawāshī, wa-al-athmān, wa-al-zurūʻ, wa-al-thimār, wa-ʻurūḍ al-tijārah. Wa-ammā al-mawāshī, fa-tajibu al-zakāh fī thalāthat ajnās minhā: <wa> al-Ibil, wa-al-baqar, wa-al-ghanam. Wa-sharāʼiṭ wujūb al-zakāh fīhā sittat ashyāʼ ..."
Secundo folio: sabʻ sharāʼiṭ idhā kāna al-marāḥ wāḥid wa-al-masraḥ wāḥid.
11.5 x 16 cm; written surface 9.5 x 13 cm; 16-17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (two loose leaves).
In large fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper, headings in red; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly as follows: "... Kitāb al-Ṣiyām. Wa-sharāʼiṭ wujūb al-ṣiyām arbaʻat ashyāʼ: al-Islām, wa-al-bulūgh, wa-al-ʻaql, wa-al-qudrah ʻalá al-ṣawm. Wa-farāʼiḍuhu arbaʻat ashyāʼ: al-Nīyah ..."

record.title: Selections from the Qurʼān : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

The first leaf starts with verse verse 115 of Sūrat Ṭāhā (Chapter 20) as follows: "... Wa-laqad ʻahidnā ilá Ādama min qablu fa-nasiya wa-lam najid la-hu ʻazman. Wa-idh qulnā lil-malāʼikati usjudū li-Ādama fa-sajadū illā Iblīsa abá ..." It ends with the beginnig of Sūrat al-Anbiyāʼ (Chapter 21), as follows: "... Sūrat al-Anbiyāʼ, ʻalayhim al-salām, miʼah wa-aḥad ʻashar āyah, Makkīyah. 'Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. 'Iqtaraba lil-nāsi ḥisābuhum wa-hum fī ghaflatin muʻriḍūn' ..."

The second leaf starts with verse 48 of Sūrat al-Anbiyāʼ (Chapter 21) as follows: "... Wa-laqad ātaynā Mūsá wa-Hārūna al-Furqāna wa-ḍiyāʼan wa-dhikran lil-muttaqīn. Alladhīna yakhshawna Rabbahum bi-al-ghaybi wa-hum min al-sāʻati mushfiqūn ..." It ends with verses 76-77, as follows: "... Wa-Nūḥan idh nādá min qablu fa-istajabnā la-hu fa-najjaynāhu wa-ahlahu mina al-karbi al-ʻaẓīm. Wa-naṣrnāhu mina al-qawmi alladhīna kadhdhabū bi-āyātinā innahum kānū qawma sūʼin fa-aghraqnāhum ajmaʻīn ..."
13.5 x 18.5 cm; written surface 9.5 x 12.5 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (two loose leaves).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper, titles of the sūrahs in red; catchwords.

record.title: 880-02 Leaf from 'al-Maqāmah al-wardīyah fī al-rayāḥīn wa-al-zuhūr' : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger (based on the printed version).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... wa-maṭbūkhī ṭarīyan wa-yābisan yanfaʻu min al-ramad bi-al-ḍamād, wa-maṭbūkh yābisī ṣāliḥun li-ghilaẓ al-jufūn, wa-masḥūquhu idhā dhurra fī firāsh al-majdūr wa-al-maḥṣūb nafaʻa min al-ʻufūn, wa-man tajarraʻa min māʼī yasīran nafaʻa min al-ghishī wa-al-khafaqān kathīran ..."

Text ends with a contest between "al-ward" (roses) and "al-narjis" (narcissus), as follows: "... ataghtarru bi-burdika al-shaqīb [al-qashīb] wa-anta al-jālib lil-mashīb, fa-iḥfaẓ bi-al-ṣamt ḥurmatak, wa-illā aksiru bi-qāʼim sayfī shawkatak, wa-yakfīka qawl Ibn al-Rūmī fīka: Yā mādiḥa ..."
13 x 18.5 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 15 cm; 17 lines per page.
In large good naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings and markings in red; some commentaries on the margins; catchwords.

record.title: 880-01 Ḥikāyat Fayrūz Shāh : manuscript.
record.note: Title from colophon.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... al-ʻabīd wa-nubqīhā, fa-qultu la-hu in kān nutawwibuhā wa-naqtulu al-ʻabīd. Fa-lammā samiʻa minnī dhālika al-kalām masaka al-thalāthah, kull thalāthat aqdām fī yad wa-fasakhahum, fa-rāḥū sittat qiṭaʻ, fa-ḥadhafahum min yadayh wa-qāla lī: Yā khāyin, yā qalīl al-murūwah, wa-Allāh lawmā al-maʻrūf alladhī sabaqa mink la-kunt afʻal maʻak kamā faʻaltu maʻahum. Wa-al-ān, lā kunt wa-lā istakant wa-lā ʻumirat bika awṭān. Wa-rafaʻanī ʻalá yadihi wa-akhadhanī ilá al-dīwān, wa-qāl li-ṣihrī al-Darwīsh: Khudhhu wa-irmīhi fī bilād al-ghīlān ..."
Secundo folio: amshī wa-ākul min thimār tilka al-ashjār.
18 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 12 x 18 cm; 13-16 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 3 unnumbered quires)
In clear large naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper (quire 1 and 3), and white paper (quire 1); catchwords.
The pages of the manuscript are also numbered in East Arabic (Indian) numerals: 1-67.
The statement "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm" at the head of the text on folio 1a seems to be a later addition; as the beginning of the text is missing.
Colophon: "Wa-hādhā mā intahá ilaynā min 'Ḥikāyat Fayrūz Shāh' bi-ʻawnihi wa-karamih."
Translation of the colophon: "This is what has reached us of the 'Tale of Fīrūz Shāh' by His help and benevolence."

record.title: 880-02 al-Ādāb al-sharʻīyah wa-al-minaḥ al-marʻīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Mufliḥ al-Maqdisī.
record.note: Title from the printed versions.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

The beginning of the first quire is missing. Text starts with: "... Wa-qāla ākhar: Wa-innī la-arjū Allāh ḥattá kaannamā // ará bi-jamīli al-ẓanni mā Allāhu ṣāniʻu. Wa-qāla Manṣūr al-faqīh: Qaṭaʻtu rajāʼī min banī Ādama ṭurran // fa-aṣbaḥtu min riqq al-rajā lahum ḥurrān ..."
Secundo folio of the first quire: wa-yastaʼdhinu wālidayhi fa-yaʼdhanā la-hu.

The beginning of the second quire is missing. Text starts with: "... al-Ḥasan al-Baṣrī qāl: Nadam lil-qalb wa-istighfār bi-al-lisān wa-tark bi-al-jawāriḥ wa-iḍmār an lā yaʻūd. Wa-qāla al-Baghawī fī tafsīrih: Qāla ʻUmar wa-Ubayy wa-Muʻādh, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhum: al-Tawbah al-naṣūḥ an yatūba thumma lā yaʻūdu ilá al-dhanb kamā lā yaʻūdu al-laban ilá al-ḍarʻ. Kadhā qāl. wa-al-Kalām fī ṣiḥḥatihi ʻanhum, thumma laʻalla al-murād al-tawbah al-kāmilah bi-al-nisbah ilá ghayrihā ..."
Secundo folio of the second quire: yadullu ʻalá anna al-ʻazm ʻalá muʻāwadat al-dhanb maʻa al-taṣmīm.

The beginning of the third quire is missing. Text starts with: "... fa-ḥadhafa al-mubtadá, thumma saʼala fa-qāla: Mā la-hu, ay, mā shaʼnuhu, wa-hādhā aḥsan min iʻlāmihi, fa-inna fī iʻlāmihi ziyādat īdhāʼ la-hu, fa-in taḍarrara al-insān bi-mā ʻalimahu min shatmihi ablagh min taḍarrurihi bi-mā lā yaʻlamu, thumma qad yakūnu dhālika sabab al-ʻudwān ʻalá al-ẓālim awwalan, idh al-nufūs lā taqifu ghāliban ʻinda al-ʻadl wa-al-inṣāf ..."
Secundo folio of the third quire: ʻaẓīm wa-tafrīj kurbāt al-nufūs min āthār al-maʻāṣī wa-al-maẓālim.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 17 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 3 separate unnumbered quires: 10 by 10 by 4 leaves)
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper, keywords and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

The first quire ends abruptly with: "... Qāla Saḥnūn: Ashqá al-nās man bāʻa ākhiratahu bi-dunyā ghayrih. Wa-qāl: Fitnat al-jawāb bi-al-ṣawāb ashaddu min fitnat al-māl. Wa-qāla Sufyān: Adraktu al-fuqahāʼ wa-hum yakrahūna an yujībū fī al-masāʼil wa-al-futyā ḥattá lā yajidū buddan min an yuftū. Wa-qāl: Aʻlam al-nās askatuhum ..."
The second quire ends abruptly with: "... Wa-tawbat al-kāfir min kufrihi qabūluhā maqṭūʻun bi-hi, jazam bi-hi fī Sharḥ Muslim wa-ghayrihi, wa-sabaqa kalām Ibn ʻAqīl annahu lā yajib, wa-yajūzu ..."

The third quire ends abruptly with: "... Wa-qāla Abū Bakr al-Ājurrī, baʻda an dhakara al-khabar: Inna al-shahādah tukaffiru ghayr al-dayn. Qāla hādhā innamā huwa fīman tahāwana bi-qaḍāʼ daynihi, wa-ammā man istadān daynan wa-anfaqahu fī ghayr saraf wa-lā tabdhīr, thumma lam yumkinhu qaḍāʼuhu fa-inna Allāh taʻālá yaqḍīhi ʻanhu, māta aw qutila. Intahá kalāmuhu. Fa-inna ḥamala kalām Ibn ʻAqīl ʻalá ẓāhirihi wa-ḥamalahu ʻalá murādihi, wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-ḥamlihi qiṣṣat alladhī ḍamina ʻalá al-maṭl lā ʻalá al-qudrah ʻalá al-wafāʼ ṣāra fīman tahāwana bi-qaḍāʼ al-dayn aw bi-iqrār minhu wa-lam ..."

record.title: Fragment of an unidentified dīwān : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with part of "qāfiyat al-dāl" (dāl rhyme), as sollows: "... Wa-lā taṭluban waznan fī al-rumūzi fa-innahu // qarībun wa-in taṭlubhu fī al-ramzi yabʻudi. Wa-lā tuṣghiyan fīhi ilá lughz lāghizin // fa-dhālika min taḍlīlihi ʻan taʻammudi. Fa-in rumta fī al-ajzāʼi faḍla ziyādatin // ʻalá al-wazni lam yaqbal wa-lam yatazayyadi. Fa-in shiʼta an taḥẓá bi-ḥikmati Hirmisin // wa-man baʻduhu min wāḥidin baʻda wāḥidi. Fa-dūnaka hādhā al-qāsiʼu al-khālid alladhī // yudabbaru bi-al-duhni al-laṭīfi al-muqayyadi. Huwa al-ʻālamu al-maʻlūmu fī kulli baldatin // huwa al-ziʼbaqu al-mashhūru fī kull mashhadi ..."
Secundo folio: Hunālika yabdū fī ghulālati narjisin // ʻalayhā burūdan min shaqāʼiqi nāziʼī.
11.5 x 17 cm; written surface: 8 x 12 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In clear medium naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings in bold script; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with part of "qāfiyat al-zāy" (zāy rhyme), as follows: "... Wa-man bāʻa bil-Firdawsi dāra muqāmihi // min al-arḍ injāzan fa-khayru munājizi. Fa-shattāna bayna ithnayni hādhā mukawkabun // yadūru wa-hādhā markazun lil-marākizi. Wa-innahumā ʻinda al-ḥakīmi la-wāḥidun // li-annahumā min wāḥidi mutamāyizi. Fa-hādhā ʻalá hādhā yadūru wa-hādhihi // lahā markazu raʼsin bi-qudrati rākizi. Wa-baynahumā ḍiddāni ʻālin wa-sāfilun // liqāʼuhumā fardayni laysa bi-jāʼizi. Wa-man ..."

record.title: 880-03 al-Kāfī fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qawāfī : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbbād al-Khawwāṣ.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... wa-mutaḥarrikān baynahumā sākin, watid mafrūq, wa-thalāth baʻdahā sākin fāṣilah ṣughrá, wa-arbaʻ baʻdahā sākin fāṣilah. Qawluka: lam ara ʻalá jabalin samakatan, tataʼallafu min al-mafāʻīl, wa-hiya thamāniyah, lafẓuhā ʻashrah, ḥukmuhā ithnān khumāsīyān, wa-thamāniyah subāʻīyah, minhā faʻūlun maʻāʻīlun mufāʻalatun fāʻilatun ..."
Secundo folio: sākin ʻalá mā ākhiruhu watid majmūʻ.
11.5 x 17 cm; written surface: 6 x 12.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (one quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; catchwords.
Folio 6b is blank.

Secundo folio: tāʼiban fa-lil-walī [al-ʻafw] li-anna qatlahu ḥīnaʼidhin qiṣāṣ lā yasquṭu bi-majīʼihi tāʼiban.

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; phrases of "al-Sharḥ al-ṣaghīr ʻalá Aqrab al-masālik li-madhhab al-Imām Mālik" in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: "Yaqūlu nāqil takmīl al-sharḥ, al-faqīr Muṣṭafá al-ʻAqabāwī, sāaḥahu Allāh wa-al-muʼminīn min jamīʻ al-masāwī: al-Ḥāmil lī ʻalá dhālik imtithāl amr Walī Allāh, khalīfat Shaykhinā al-muṣannif, al-Shaykh Ṣāliḥ al-Sibāʻī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi fī al-dārayn: Hādhā, wa-mā wajdtahu min ṣawāb fa-min fayḍ Shaykhinā al-quṭb al-muṣannif, wa-imdādāt khātimat al-muḥaqqiqīn, man muniḥa al-ʻilm al-ẓāhirī wa-al-bāṭinī, Shaykhinā al-ʻAllāmah Sayyidī al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Amīr. Wa-nasʼalu Allāh min faḍlihi an yaʻfwa ʻannā wa-yarḥamanā wa-wālidaynā, wa-an yakhtuma lanā bi-al-īmān al-kāmil. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá wāsiṭat ʻiqd al-mursalīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-kān al-farāgh min tabyīḍihi ghurrata Rabīʻ al-Awwal, sanat 1220. Wa-nasʼalu Allāh an yufarrija karaba Āl Bayt Nabīyinā wa-al-muʼminīn, innahu laṭīfun karīmun ḥalīm, bi-jāh jaddihim Sayyid al-Mursalīn, ʻalayhi afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-taslīm. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "The transcriber of the supplementary commentary, the poor Muṣṭafá al-ʻAqabāwī, may God forgive him and the believers of all iniquities, says: My motivation is to comply with the command of the close to God, the successor of the author, our Shaykh, al-Shaykh Ṣāliḥ al-Sibāʻī, may God benefit us through him in both worlds. However, what you find correct is from the outpouring of our Shaykh, the authoritative author, and the sustentations of the seal of the investigators, who is granted the explicit and esoteric knowledge, our Shaykh, the scholar, Sayyidī al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Amīr. We ask God of His bounty to pardon us and have mercy upon us and upon our parents, and to seal us with complete faith. May God's blessing be upon the Foremost among the messengers, and upon all his family and companions. The fair copy was completed at the beginning of Rabi` al-Awwal, of the year 1220 [of the Hijrah = 30 May 1805]. We implore God to relieve the anguish of the family of our Prophet and of the believers, for He is kind, generous, and forbearing, for the sake of their grandfather, the Master of the messengers, may the best prayers and the most perfect peace be upon Him. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. Amen. Done."

Āmīn. Āmīn]."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author and compiler, ʻAbd al-Salām ibn al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Mālikī al-Laqānī, said: I finished compiling it [the book] on Thursday, the twentieth of the month of Ramaḍān [of the year 1047 of the Hijrah of the Prophet = 5 February, 1638], may the best prayer and peace be upon Him. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions, and grant them peace. Amen. Amen]."

record.title: The order for the installation of the Ladies of the most noble Order of the Needle instituted in 1761 ; The rules of the most Noble Order of the Needle instituted on July the 25th 1761 : manuscript / by Miss F-nkl-d.
record.note: Titles from captions at the head of each of the two works.
"By Miss F-nkl-d" on first page, upper right corner, suggests the author of the first manuscript, "The Order for the installation," as a member of the Frankland family.

The second work is attributed to Mary Joanna Russell based on a manuscript also entitled "The rules of the most Noble Order of the Needle" in the British Library (Add MS 69390). The online record for that copy states that it was drawn up by Mrs. Russell for her daughter and nieces and their friends.
One signature, sewn and unbound, with watermarked laid paper, horizontal chainlines; crowned watermark with lion rampant, countermark 'EH'. Pages with text are unnumbered; final 8 pages are blank.

Author's colophon: "Qāla muqayyiduhu al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad: Hādhā mā yassara Allāh mimmā qaṣadtu min hādhā al-kitāb. Wa-astaghfiru Allāh al-ʻAẓīm mimmā zalla bi-hi al-lisān aw dākhalahu zuhūl [dhuhūl] wa-nisyān. Wa-man ẓafira bi-khaṭaʼ aw taqṣīr fa-li-yumahhid ʻathratī li-ḍaʻfī wa-ʻajzī wa-qillat biḍāʻatī. Wa-asʼalu Allāh taʻālá an yanfaʻa bi-hi man ṭālaʻahu, aw qaraʼahu, aw ḥaṣṣalahu, aw saʻá fī shayʼ minhu, wa-an yuʻāmilanā jamīʻan bi-faḍlihi, wa-an yakhtima lanā bi-al-ḥusná bi-raḥmatih, wa-an yaḥshuranā fī zumrat Sayyid al-Mursalīn maʻa al-ābāʼ wa-al-ajdād wa-al-ashyākh wa-al-aḥibbah wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-wāfaqa al-farāgh min taqyīdihi ḍaḥwata yawm al-Ithnayn, al-thālith ʻashar min Rajab al-fard, ʻāma alf wa-miʼah khamsah wa-thalāthīn, ʻarrafanā Allāh khayrahu, wa-kafānā sharrahu, bi-mannihi wa-karamihi. Āmīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author, the poor Abd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad, said: This is what God has facilitated of what I intended for this book. I ask forgiveness from God Almighty for what the tongue has slipped or ignored. Whoever finds mistake or negligence in it, let him correct my shortcoming, because of my weakness, my incapacity, and the lack of my merchandise. I ask God Almighty to benefit from it whoever investigates it, or reads it, or strives for something from it, and to treat us all with His grace, to seal us with goodness in His mercy, and to gather us in the fold of the Master of Messengers, with our fathers, grandfathers, sheikhs, loved ones, and all Muslims. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. Written on Monday morning, the thirteenth of Rajab al-Farad, of the year one thousand one hundred and thirty-five [of the Hijrah = 19 April 1723]. May God bestow upon us its goodness, and suffice us its evil, by His grace and generosity. Amen."

Copyist's colophon: "Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah, bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih, ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr ʻAlī Mīrah, ghaffara [ghafara] Allāh [la-hu] wa-li-wālidayh, wa-lil-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-kāna dhālika yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ al-mubārak, 23 shahr Jumād [?], sanat 1270. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This copy was completed by the praise of God and His help, by the hand of its copyist, the poor ʻAlī Mīrah, may God forgive him, his parents, and the Muslims. Amen. On blessed Wednesday, the 23rd of the month of Jumād [?] of the year 1270 [of the Hijrah = 21 February, or, 23 March 1854]. It is completed. It is completed. It is completed. It is completed. It is completed."

2. Incipit of "al-Ināfah fī rutbat al-khilāfah" (folio 11b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn alladhī awjada al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, raḥmatan li-khalīqatihi, wa-jaʻala saʻādata al-dārayn maqrūnatan bi-biʻthathihi, wa-istakhlafa min baʻdihi khulafāʼ yaqūmūna fī ummatihi, wa-waʻada bi-dhālika al-ṭayyibīna al-ṭāhirīna min ālihi wa-ʻitratih, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallama ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥābatih. 2. Secundo folio of "al-Ināfah fī rutbat al-khilāfah": "balaghanī anna rijālan minkum yuḥaddithūna Aḥādīth laysat fī Kitāb Allāh.

1. Translation of the colophon of "al-Fānīd fī ḥalāwat al-asānīd": "This is the end of the book. God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May God forgive its author, its reader, its owner, and the Muslims. Amen. Amen. Amen. Amen. It is completed."

2. "al-Ināfah fī rutbat al-khilāfah" ends as follows: "... Wa-akhraja Ibn ʻAsākir fī Tārīkhihi ʻan Ibn ʻAbbās, qāl: Dakhaltu ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, fa-qāla lī: Inna Jibrīl qad awṣá bika khayran, wa-qāl: Inna ʻAbd Allāh min khiyār hādhihi al-ummah, wa-inna waladahu yurzaqūn al-khilāfah fī ākhir al-zamān."
2. Colophon of "al-Ināfah fī rutbat al-khilāfah": "Tamm. Wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-Niʻma al-Wakīl. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

2. Translation of the colophon of "al-Ināfah fī rutbat al-khilāfah": "It is completed. God suffices us. He is the best advocate. May God's prayer and peace be upon our Master Muḥammad and upon His companions. Praise be to God alone."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This copy was completed on the night of blessed Thursday, after the evening prayer, on the sixteenth of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, of the year 1262 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [14 March 1846], may the best prayer and peace be upon Him, by the hand of him who aspires to the forgiveness of his Mighty Lord, Muṣṭafá Afandī Karam al-Miṣrī baladan, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, al-Aḥmadī ṭarīqatan, al-Ashʻarī iʻtiqādan. May God's blessing and peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, the Illiterate Prophet, and upon His family and companions. If you were to find a blemish close the gap // Mighty and Sublime is the One in whom no blemish exists."

Script: In fair naskh script; in black ink, on white paper; some commentaries on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: "Hādhā, wa-al-marjū min ṣāḥib al-ʻaql al-salīm wa-al-khuluq al-qawīm an yastura hafawātī wa-yuqīla ʻatharātī, fa-innahu qalla an yakhluṣa muṣannifun min al-hafawāt, aw, yanjuwa muʼallifun min al-ʻatharāt, maʻa ʻadam taʼahhulī li-dhālika wa-quṣūrī ʻan al-wuṣūl ilá mā hunālika, mutawassilan bi-ṣāḥib al-wasīlah wa-al-maqām al-maḥmūd an yajʻlahu yawm al-wurūd waṣlatan li-ḥawḍihi al-mawrūd, wa-an yanfaʻa bi-hi kamā nafaʻa bi-uṣūlihi, wa-an yajʻalahu khāliṣan li-wajhihi, mutafaḍḍilan bi-qabūlihi, innahu ʻalá mā yashāʼ qadīr. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-tābiʻīhim ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Tammat al-nuskhah."

Translation of the colophon: "Moreover, it is hoped, that the owner of sound mind and upright morality would cover my lapses and remove my stumbling blocks, for it is rare for a compiler to be saved from lapses, or, for an author to be saved from stumbling blocks. Let alone my disability in this, and inability to reach what is in there, begging Him, the Owner of the Means and the Possessor of the Praiseworthy Status [Prophet Muḥammad], to make it, on the Day of Judgement, a link to His targeted basin. May [God] make it beneficial, like its origins, purely for the sake of His face, and to kindly accept it, for He is capable of whatever He wills. May God's blessings be upon our master Muhammad, his family, his companions, and their followers until the Day of Judgment. The copy is completed."

Colophon: "Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihā ṣubḥa yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak, ghurrata Dhī al-Qaʻdah al-ḥarām, min shuhūr sanat 1221, iḥdá wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, min Hijrat Ṣāḥib al-ʻIzz wa-al-Sharaf, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran, ʻalá yad al-faqīr li-Rabbihi, al-mutawassil bi-ahl al-bāṭin wa-al-ẓāhir, fī ẓāhirihi wa-lubbihi, al-wāthiq bi-Rabbihi al-Qāhir, Muḥammad Ṣādiq ibn Muḥammad Ṭāhir, Dīwān Afandī sābiq bi-Makkah al-Musharrafah, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi. Āmīn. Tamm. Yā Rabbu wa-ighfir li-ʻabdin kāna kātibahu // Yā qāriʼa al-khaṭṭi qull billāhi Āmīnā."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant grace. It was written on the morning of blessed Saturday, the beginning of the sacred month of Dhū al-Qaʻdah, of the year 1221, of the Hijrah of Him to whom belongs Glory and Honor, may God's prayer and abundant peace be upon Him, His is family, and His companions, by the hand of the poor to his Lord, who pleads with the people of the esoteric and the exoteric, in his outward and inward, trusting in his Lord the Omnipotent, Muḥammad Ṣadiq bin Muḥammad Ṭāhir, a former 'Dīwān Afandī' in Honorable Mecca, may God forgive him and his parents. Amen. It is completed. O Lord, forgive the servant who wrote it // O reader of the script, say, for the sake of God, Amen."

The 21 lines of the present one page manuscript are as follows: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī faqqaha fī al-dīn man ikhtārahau min ʻibādihi, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdah, lā sharīka la-hu, shahādatan tūṣilunā ilá ṭarīq rashādih. Wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammad ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh al-amīn, al-qāʼil: Man yurid Allāh bi-hi khayran yufaqqihhu fī al-dīn, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-anṣārihi wa-atbāʻihi wa-aḥbābihi wa-aḥzābihi. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu asīr al-shahawāt wa-kathīr al-masāwī wa-al-hafawāt, ʻabduhu Yūsuf ibn al-Shaykh Saʻīd al-Ṣafatī al-Mālikī, aḥsana Allāh ʻamalahu wa-ballaghahu fī al-dārayn amalah: Hādhihi kalimāt qalīlah ʻalá sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah Ibn Turkī ʻalá al-ʻAshmāwīyah, ataytu fīhā bi-al-aqwāl al-muʻtamadah al-marḍīyah, muʻtamidan fī dhālika ʻalá Ḥāshiyat al-Khurashī wa-ghayrihā li-Shaykhinā wa-shaykh mashāyikhinā wa-ashyākhihim, al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-Ṣaʻīdī al-ʻAdwī, ʻalayhi saḥāʼib al-raḥmah wa-al-ruḍwān, wa-nabbahtu fīhā ʻalá baʻḍ aqwāl ḍaʻīfah waqaʻat la-hu fī ḥāshiyatihi ʻalá hādhā al-kitāb qad rajaʻa ʻanhā fī Ḥāshiyat al-Khurashī wa-ghayrihā min kutubihi allatī ʻamma nafʻuhā lil-ṭullāb, wa-nabbahtu ayḍan ʻalá baʻḍ aqwāl ḍaʻīfah waqaʻat fī sharḥ al-Shabrakhītī wa-al-Sakandarī wa-al-Aṣīlī, muʻtamidan fī dhālika ʻalá Ḥāshiyat al-Khurashī allatī ʻalayhā al-taʻwīl wa-washshaḥt [dhālika bi-fawāʼid munīfah] wa-abḥāth ..."
