Wāfaqa farāgh hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah 14 khalat min shahr Ṣafar al-mubārak, yawm al-Aḥad, ʻalá yad kātibihā Aḥmad Muḥammad ʻAbd al-Ghanī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-wālid wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, wa-al-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-amwāt. Innaka samīʻun qarībun mujīb al-daʻawāt. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. Tammat 1292. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad kullamā dhakarahu al-dhākirūn wa-ghafala ʻan dhikrihi al-ghāfilūn. Wa-raḍiya, tabāraka wa-taʻālá, ʻan aṣḥāb Rasūl Allāh ajmaʻīn, wa-ʻan al-tābiʻīn lahum bi-iḥsānin ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Ghafara Allāh lanā wa-lahum. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "God, Praise and Glory be to Him, is more knowledgeable of what is in there. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. Prayer and peace be upon the most honorable of the messengers, our Master Muḥammad, His family, and all His companions. This blessed copy was completed on Sunday, the 14th of the blessed month of Ṣafar, by the hand of its copyist, Aḥmad Muḥammad ʻAbd al-Ghanī. May God forgive him, his parents, their parents, the Muslims, men and women, and the believers, men and women, the living among them and the dead. You are near, hearer, and answering prayers. O Lord of the Universe. Completed in 1292 [of the Hijrah = 22 March 1875]. May God's blessings be upon our Master Muḥammad whenever He is remembered by those who remember him, and is forgotten to be remembered by the heedless. May the Blessed and Most High be pleased with all the companions of the Messenger of God, and those who follow them in goodness, until the Day of Judgment. May God forgive us and them. Amen. Amen."

record.title: 880-03 Pardaysā da-ʻDen : manuscript / ʻAbdisho bar Berīkā.
record.note: Title from folio 10b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
The manuscript starts on folio 2a with part of "Tarʻā d-Yūd" (Chapter Yūd), as follows: "... Yīdaʻta man mnaṣḥa layna d-bah ethadi. Yaduʻa den itawhe ayna d-ḥuba qadi ..."
Secundo folio: Sūcalā gramaṭīqū kad l-lešana mawrḥa.
23 x 33.5 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 18 cm; 18 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (loose leaves)

In clear East Syriac script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings decoratively calligraphed; some texts in partial decorative frames; includes drawings of decoratively colored crosses, circles and other symbols; leaf 20 is torn; leaves not in order.

Accompanied by a handwritten letter in English by Jane Montgomery to Mr. Babcock (i.e., Robert G. Babcock, former curator of early materials at Yale's Beinecke Library) about the provenance of the manuscript.

On folio 7b and 9a (in pencil): "W. A. Shedd" (i.e., William Ambrose Shedd, 1865-1918; missionary of the American Presbyterian Church to Persia) whom the donor (Jane Montgomery) states was her grandfather.

On folio 10b: A verse in Persian with the name of the scribe: "Īn nivishtam tā bimānad rūzgār // man namānam khaṭṭ bimānad yādgār. Dāwūd Amīlī Khawājah Pā Shāh" (I write this to remain for times // I will not last but the script will be remembered. Dāwūd Amīlī Khawājah Pā Shāh).

Colophon (folio 10b): "Etkteb den b-yawmay Abūn Qadīša raʻya ʻīra wa-mdabranā ḥakīmā abā d-abahatā u-rabā d-raʻawatā u-rišā d-ʻallane wa-mšaknanā d-šūkane Mar Šemʻūn Qatūlīqā Paṭaryarkīs d-Kursyā Šlīḥayā dab-Madnḥā. Maryā nawrek šnay ḥayawhy. Amīn. Ktabe da-ktabā d-Pardaysā da-ʻDen Dawīd bar Mūqdūsī ṣed dqrsanlūqā qagsī bar Ismaʻīl d-sūldaqz d-matā kīnā ʻam kuleh lqaṭe d-īt gaweh. Amīn.

Translation of the colophon: "It was written in the days of our Holy Father, the alert shepherd, and the wise manager, the Father of Fathers, the Head of the shepherds, the director of the directors, and the donor of the endowments, Mar Šemʻūn, the Catholicos Patriarch of the Apostolic Sea of the East. May the Lord lengthen the years of his life. Amen. The book of 'Pardaysa da-ʻDen' was copied by Dawīd bar Mūqdūsī ṣed daqarsanlūqā qagsī bar Ismaʻīl d-sūldaqz d-matā kīnā, with all the other pieces which are in it. Amen."
Ends with part of "Tarʻa d-Ṭet" (Chapter Ṭet), as follows: "Ṭayša ema d-kul Umanūn layna daqnīṭ."

record.title: Fragment of an unidentified treatise on "ʻIlm al-kalām" : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... ṭabīʻī ka-al-ihāb lil-ḥayawān, wa-irādī ka-al-thawb lil-badan, wa-al-iḍāfah, wa-hiya nisbatun lā tuʻqalu illā bi-al-qiyās ilá nisbah ukhrá lā tuʻqalu ayḍan illā bi-al-qiyās ilá al-ūlá, ka-al-ubūwah wa-al-bunūwah, wa-huwa al-muḍāf al-ḥaqīqī, wa-huwa maʻa maʻrūḍihi al-mashhūrī, ka-al-ab wa-al-ibn, wa-al-fiʻl, wa-huwa hayʼah taḥṣul lil-shayʼ bi-sabab taʼaththurihi bi-ghayrihi mā dāma yataʼaththaru ..."
Secundo folio: wa-hiya mā yakūnu ʻurūḍuhā li-dhāt al-jism bi-nafsihi.
16.8 x 20.7 cm; written surface: 8 x 12 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In clear large naskh script, in black ink, on thin cream color paper; markings in purple; large commentaries and few corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folios 2a and 2b: Collation statements as follows: "Tamma muqābalatan" and "Balagha muqābalatan".

Text ends as follows: "... Wa-iʻlam inna al-ḥarakah ʻinda al-mutakallimīn kawn al-jism fī ḥayyiz ʻaqiba kawn[ihi] fī ḥayyizin ākhar, wa-al-sukūn kawn al-jism (fī ḥayyizin ʻaqiba kawnihi fīhi, wa-qīla kawnnuhu [ṣaḥḥ]) fī ḥayyizin muṭlaqan, wa-ushtihira anna [annahumā] kawnān fī ānayn fī makānayn, kamā anna al-sukūn kawnān fī ānayn fī makānin wāḥid."
Colophon: "Wakhatam Allāh lanā bi-al-saʻādah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tammat kitābatuhā ʻalá yad kātibihā Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Ṣabbāgh al-Shāfiʻī, ghufira la-hu."
Translation of the colophon: "May God seal us with happiness. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. It was copied by Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Ṣabbagh al-Shāfiʻī, may God forgive him."

record.title: 880-02 al-Arbaʻūn al-Nawawīyah : manuscript / Abū Zakarīyā Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Nawawī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... ʻalayhi, wa-huwa niṣf al-Islām, aw thulthuhu, aw naḥwa dhālika, thumma altazimu fī hādhihi al-arbaʻīn an takūna ṣaḥīḥatan, wa-muʻẓamuhā fī Ṣaḥīḥay al-Bukhārī wa-Muslim, raḥimahumā Allāh taʻālá, wa-adhkuruhā maḥdhūfat al-asānīd li-yashula ḥifẓuhā wa-taʻumma [wa-yaʻumma] al-intifāʻ bi-hā, in shāʼ Allāh taʻālá, thumma utbiʻuhā bi-bābin fī ḍabṭ khafī alfāẓihā ..."
Secundo folio: fī al-bunyān thumma inṭalaqa fa-labitha malīyan.
15 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 15 cm; 15-21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (loose leaves).
In large good naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings and markings in red; text fully vocalized; some commentaries and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon. No colophon. Text ends abruptly with "al-Ḥadīth al-rābiʻ wa-al-ʻishrūn" (the twenty-fourth Ḥadīth) as follows: "... al-Ḥadīth al-rābiʻ wa-al-ʻishrūn. ʻAn Abī Dharr, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, ʻan al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, fīmā yurwá ʻan Allāh, ʻazza wa-jall, annahu qāl: Yā ʻibādī, innī ḥarramtu al-ẓulma ʻalá nafsī wa-jaʻaltuhu baynakum muḥarraman, fa-lā taẓālamū, yā ʻibādī. Kullukum ḍāllun, illā̕ man hadaytuhu, fa-istahdūnī ahdikum ..."

record.title: 880-03 Tawḍīḥ maqāṣid al-Alfīyah : manuscript / al-Ḥasan ibn Qāsim al-Murādī.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Secundo folio: Fa-al-awwalu al-iʻrābu fīhi quyyidā.
17.5 x 22 cm; written surface: 9 x 14.5 cm; 23 lines per page.

In good naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; the verses of the "Alfīyah" in red; some notes on the margins; catchwords.

Wa-qawluhu: Taqḍi ḥukma lāziman, yaʻnī fī ghayr ḍarūrat al-shiʻr, wa-ammā fī al-ḍarūrah fa-qad tathbuth hādhihi al-aḥruf, wa-yuqaddaru al-jazm, ka-qawl al-shāʻir: Alam yaʼtika wa-al-anbāʼ tamná (wa-tamāmuhu: bi-mā lāqat qalūṣu Banī Ziyādi), wa-kaqawl al-ākhar: lam tahjū ..."

record.title: Fragment of an unidentified folkloric treatise on creation and eschatology : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... fa-qālat al-arḍ: Minnī takhluqu khalqan yakūnu lil-nār. Qāla: Naʻam. Fa-bakat, fa-infajart minhā al-ʻuyūn ilá Yawm al-Qiyāmah. Wa-baʻatha Allāh ilayhā Jibrīl li-yaʼtiyahu bi-qabḍatin min zawāyāhā al-arbaʻ, li-yuṣawwira minhā khalqan, wa-qāl: In istaghāthat bika fa-aghithhā, fa-atāhā li-yaʼkhudha min turābihā, fa-istaghāthat bi-ʻizzat Allāh min dhālik, li-allā yakūna minhā naṣībun ilá al-nār, fa-tarakahā wa-rajiʻa, wa-qāl: Yā Rabb qad istaghāthat laka al-arḍ minnī fa-karihtu an uqdima ʻalayhā ..."
Secundo folio: al-Jannah fa-raḥalū yasʻawna fī al-arḍ.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 10 x 17 cm; 21 lines per page.

record.title: 880-02 Mujīb al-nidā ilá sharḥ Qaṭr al-nadá́ : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Aḥmad al-Fākihī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... wa-yajūzu taqdīm hādhihi al-ḥāl ʻalá al-maṣdar ʻinda al-Baṣrīyīn, wa-tawassuṭ maʻmūlihā baynahā wa-bayn al-maṣdar wa-maʻmūlihi, lā tawassuṭihā bayna al-maṣdar wa-maʻmūlihi lil-faṣl bayanhumā, wa-kharaja bi-qawlihi al-mumtaniʻ ilakh. al-ṣāliḥ jaʻluhā khabaran lil-mubtadaʼ, fa-al-rafʻ fīhi wājibun naḥwa ḍarbī Zaydan shadīdun, wa-ammā qawluhum ḥukmuka mutasammiṭan, ay, ḥukmuka laka muthbatan fa-shādhdh ..."
Secundo folio: dirhaman ay muddata dawāmika muṣīban.
17 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 16.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; the phrases of "Qaṭr al-nadá wa-ball al-ṣadá" in red; some notes and quotations on the margins; catchwords.

Wa-lammā faragha min kāna wa-akhawātihā akhadha yatakallamu ʻalá mā ḥumila ʻalá laysa, wa-huwa mā wa-lā wa-lāta, wa-badaʼa bi-mā, fa-qāla: Wa-mā al-nāfiyah ʻinda al-Ḥijāzīyīn ka-laysa fī rafʻ al-ism wa-naṣb al-khabar li-shubhihā bihā fī nafī al-ḥāl wa-al-dukhūl ʻalá al-maʻārif wa-al-nakirāt wa-fī dukhūl al-bāʼ fī al-khabar, wa-Banū Tamīm lā yuʻmilūnahā, bal hiya ʻindahum muhmalah, wa-huwa al-qiyās li-annahā ḥarf lā yakhtaṣṣu ..."

record.title: Miscellaneous fragments from ten unidentified texts : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Text on Arabic grammar starts with: "... fī wuqūʻihi wa-illā ṣāra tarajjiyan, wa-laʻalla wa-hiya mawḍūʻah lil-tarajjī wa-huwa tawaqquʻ al-maḥbūb ..." It ends with: "... ḥāla kawnihā mukhaffafah min al-thaqīlah bi-an uskina nūnuhā, wa-lākinna al-ihmāl kathīr li-zawāl ikhtiṣāṣihā bi-al-asmāʼ wa-innamā uʻmilat ..."

2. Text on prayer starts with: "... raʼsahu min al-sujūd wa-iʻtadala jālisan wa-sallama kāna dhālika al-sujūd huwa al-wājib ..." It ends with: "... Khāmis ʻashartihā. al-Iʻtidāl fī faṣl al-arkān, wa-qāl ..."

6. Text on invocations and their benefits starts with: "... al-maqīt, fa-ismān jalīlān, dhākiruhumā yanbajisu la-hu aʻyun al-rizq, wa-yatafajjaru la-hu anhāruhā fa-yaʻīshu mastūran ..." It ends with: "... wa-ammā ismuhu taʻālá al-Walī fa-huwa ismun sharīf, wa-ism al-rūḥ al-makhlūq min ʻadadihi Karmāyīl ʻalayhi al-salām ..."

7. Text of Prayer and peace for the Prophet starts with: "... laḥẓata ʻadad kull ḥādith wa-ḥādith qadīm. Allāhumma ṣallī wa-sallim wa-bārik ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-fātiḥ li-mā ughliq ..." Wa-ṣallá wa-sallama wa-bāraka ʻalá ..."

8. Text on faith starts with: "... nawāhiyahu li-qawlihi taʻālá: Wa-mā ātākumu al-Rasūlu fa-khudhūhu, wa-mā nahākum ʻanhu fa-intahū. al-Āyah. Wa-ammā maḥlluhu fa-al-ṣadr. It ends with: "... wa-minhum man qāl: al-Islām wa-al-īmān shayʼun wāḥid, wa-minhum man qāl shayʼān, wa-iḥtajja bi-qawlihi taʻālá: Qālat al-Aʻrābu āmannā. al-Āyah. Wa-minhum man qāl: Shayʼun wāḥid, wa-iḥtajja bi-qawlihi taʻālá: fa-akhrajnā ..."

Text on prohibition of smoking starts with: "... al-Makkī ḥāmidan wa-muṣallīyan wa-musalliman, wa-lā yakhfá ʻalá ʻāqilin mā fī al-naẓm wa-al-nathr, wa-lā yalzamu ʻan iḍrābī ʻanhumā ṣafḥan an akūna multaziman limā zāda ʻalá maqṣūdī ..." It ends with "... wa-huwa al-dhikr al-ḥakīm wa-al-ṣirāṭ al-mustaqīm, wa-huwa alladhī lā tazīghu bi-hi al-ahwāʼ, wa-lā taltabisu bi-hi al-alsinah, wa-lā tashbaʻu minhu al-ʻulamāʼ, wa-lā yakhluqu ʻalá kathrat al-radd, wa-lā tanqaḍī ʻajāʼibuhu. Man qāla bi-hi ṣadaq, wa-man ʻamila bi-hi ..."

Text on Arabic particles starts with: "... wa-al-Riyāshī, wa-ikhtārahu al-Zamakhsharī, wa-al-ṣaḥīḥ al-awwal, wa-li-suhūlat qawlihim kharajtu fa-idhā Zaydan [crossed over] in Zaydun bi-al-bāb, bi-kasr in ,.." It ends with: "... al-thāniyah min al-kalimāt allatī jāʼat ʻalá thalāthat awjuh lammā bi-fatḥ al-lām wa-tashdīd al-mīm, fa-yuqālu fīhā fī naḥwi lammā jāʼa Zaydun jāʼa ʻAmrun, wa-ḥarf wujūd li-wujūd, fa-wujūd majīʼ ʻAmr li-wujūd majīʼ Zayd, wa-takhtaṣṣu bi-al-dukhūl ..."

Binding: Unbound (loose leaves).

Iʻlam idhā māta al-insān awwalan yubdaʼu min al-tarikah bi-al-takfīn wa-al-tahjiʼah [?] wa-al-jīrah [?] yaḥtāju ilayhi min dhālik, thumma yuqḍá duyūnuhu in kān, thumma yunaffadhu waṣāyahu idhā kān, thumma yqassamu al-bāqī bayna al-warathah. The invocation starts as follows: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. kulludhī mulkin fa-mamlūkun lillāh, wa-kulludhī qūwatin fa-ḍaʻīfun ʻinda Allāh, wa-kullu jabbārin fa-ṣaghīrūn [fa-ṣaghīrun] ʻinda Allāh, wa-kullu ẓālimin lā maḥīṣa la-hu min Allāh. Yā aʻdāʼ ḥāmilī kitābī hādhā wa-yā ḥāsidīhi min al-jinn wa-al-ins wa-al-shayāṭīn wa-al-ʻafārīt khātam Sulaymān ibn Dāwūd, ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá afwāhikum ..."
16 x 21.3 cm; written surfaces: vary; lines per pages vary.
Binding: In dark red leather cover with embossed central medallion.

In fair naskh and naskh/taʻlīq scripts (in different styles, in different hands), in black ink, on cream color paper; some headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; some catchwords.
On laid in card: "Arabic MS from E E Calverly. Jan. 26, 1966."
Laid in: Two slips of paper in Arabic.
On the back of the front cover: An ownership statement, as follows: "Qad dakhala hādhā al-kitāb fī milk Ibrāhīm ibn Isḥāq."

On folio 1a: Miscellaneous statements in Arabic and Persian, as follows: 1. Colophon of a previous book: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb ʻalá yad aḍʻaf al-ʻibād ʻAbdī ibn Ūstā ʻAlī al-Dabbāgh bi-Karkūk." 2. A statement by a reader or owner: "Fulān al-ḥaqīr, dīgar Turāb aqdāmikum al-ḥaqīr fulān, dīgar Fulān al-faqīr, dīgar [...] fulān al-ḥaqīr, dīgar Muḥibb, mukhliṣ, fākr fulān al-aḥqar, dīgar [...] al-warā fulān al-ḥaqīr, dīgar al-ʻAbīd fulān al-ḥaqīr, dīgar Khāliṣ al-fuʼād [...] al-widād wa-bandah fulān al-munqād." 3. Medicinal recipes in Persian. 4. Statement of death of a son (dated Thursday, 4 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 1261 of the Hijrah = 4 December 1845): "Qad intaqala al-walad al-bārr bi-wālidayhi Khalīfah walad al-ḥaqīr Mubārak bi-yawm al-Khamīs, rābiʻ min Dh[ī] al-Ḥijjah, sanat 1261, 1261 [repeated]." 5. A statement of a debt, as follows: "ʻIn Ṣāliḥ ibn ʻAlī ... bi-khamsah ... Farānsah ... qurūsh ʻaynī yuʼkhadh min ..." 6. Arabic maxim: "al-ʻĀqil yakfīhi al-ishārah. al-Ḥimār mismār fīhi al-jūbah [?]."

On folio 67b-68a: 1. A riddle and "Fawāʼid" (useful quotations): Recipe for treating "al-Quwabāʼ" (tetter, a skin disease), and "Fāʼidah", in poetry and prose, for memorizing the names of the months and the number of their days: "Fī maʻrifat asmāʼ al-shuhūr al-Rūmīyah wa-ʻadad ayyāmihā."
On folio 71b: Four verses of Arabic poetry about The movement of the Sun through the zodiac: "Fī maʻrifat zawal al-Shams ẓill al-istiwá fī kull burj" (Movement of the Sun through the zodiac)
On folios 71b-75b: Magical formulas for different purposes, quoting verses from the Qurʼān, and magic squares.
Folio 76a is blank.
Folios 84b-85a are blank.
On folios 85b-90b: Miscellaneous quotations in poetry and prose.
Folio 91a is blank.
On folios 112a-112b: Ledger calculations.

2. Colophon of "Kitāb al-Raḥmah fī al-ṭibb wa-al-ḥikmah": "Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Fa-hādhā mā awradnā wa-ilayhi qaṣadnā min kitābinā hādhā al-musammá bi-Kitāb al-ṭibb al-raḥmah wa-al-ḥikmah. Fa-saʼaltu Allāh an yanfaʻa bi-hi jamīʻ al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt. Āmīn, bi-ḥurmat Sayyid al-Mursalīn. Tammat al-kitāb. " Under the colophon (in red): "Taʼlīf Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Maghribī, nafaʻa Allāh bi-hi min barakātihi."

2. Translation of the colophon: "But God is more knowledgeable. This is what we have introduced, and what we intend in this book of ours, titled The Book of Medicine, Mercy and Wisdom. I ask God to make it beneficial for all Muslims, men and women. Amen, by the sanctity of the Master of the Messengers. The book is completed. Under the colophon (in red): "It was written by Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Maghribī, may God make it beneficial by his blessings."

4. Medico-magical treatise in Arabic ends as follows: "... Lil-bawāsīr: Bizr qaṭrīz mithqāl, qarn al-kūzī, min kull wāḥid mithqāl, thumma yuʼkhadh niṣf mithqāl mardāsinj yuḥammā wa-yuṭfá fī al-māʼ 7 marrāt, wa-yuʼkhadh niṣf mithqāl kuḥl wa-yudaqq al-jamīʻ maʻa baʻḍihim baʻḍ wa-yutaḥammal bi-hi."

5. Astrological meteorological treatise in verse ends with: "... Wa-kullu farʻin minhumā najmāni // kaʼannamā al-awwalu shaklu al-thānī. Arbaʻatun nujūmuhu idh tudhkaru // muqaddamun wa-baʻduhu muʼakhkharu."

6. Author's colophon of Questions and "Fatwas" on "al-Subḥah" and "Ṣalāt al-Tarāwīḥ": "Wa-qad wāfaqa al-farāgh min jamʻihi yawm al-Ithnayn, thānī shahr Ramaḍān al-mubārak ʻām 1270, alf wa-miʼatayn wa-sabʻīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā alf salām wa-taḥīyah yatawāradān ʻalayhi bukratan wa-ʻashīyah, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi alladhīna nālū bi-sababihi min al-khayr kull umniyah. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

6. Translation of the author's colophon of Questions and "Fatwas" on "al-Subḥah" and "Ṣalāt al-tarāwīḥ": "It was completed on Monday, the second day of blessed Ramaḍān, of the year 1270 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [29 May 1854], may a thousand peace and greetings be bestowed upon Him every morning and evening. May God's blessings be upon Him and upon His family and companions who because of Him obtained all the goodness they wished. Amen. Amen. Amen. Amen. Amen."

6. Copyist's colophon of Questions and "Fatwas" on "al-Subḥah" and "Ṣalāt al-tarāwīḥ": "Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah yawm al-Jumʻah, thamāniyat ʻashar min shahr Rajab al-murjib ʻām 1271, alf wa-miʼatayn wāḥid wa-sabʻīn min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, bi-qalam ʻAbd Allāh ibn Mullā Ḥusayn Ūzī al-Fārisī, ghafara Allāh la-hu dhunūbahu, wa-satara fī al-dārayn ʻuyūbahu, wa-mashāyikhihi, wa-qarābatih, wa-aḥbābihi. Āmīn. Āmīn."

6. Translation of the copyist's colophon of Questions and "Fatwas" on "al-Subḥah" and "Ṣalāt al-Tarāwīḥ": "This noble copy was completed on Friday, the 18th of the sacred month of Rajab, of the year 1271 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [6 April 1855], blessings and peace be upon Him, by ʻAbd Allāh ibn Mullā Ḥusayn Ūzī al-Fārisī, may God forgive his sins in the two abodes, and those of his shaykhs, his relatives, and his loved ones. Amen. Amen."

7. Colophon of the Sufi treatise: No colophon. Text ends abruptly as follows: "... Wa-dakhala yawman Abū Ḥāzim ʻalá Sulaymān ibn ʻAbd al-Malik ibn Marwān, ḥīna waliya al-khilāfah, fa-qāl: Yā Abā Ḥāzim, mā lanā nakrahu al-mawt, fa-qāl: li-annakum ʻammartum dunyākum wa-akhrabtum ākhiratakum, fa-antum takrahūn al-naql min al-ʻamār ilá al-kharāb, fa-qāl akhbirnī kayfa al-qudūm ʻalá Allāh taʻālá, fa-qāl Yā Amīr al-Muʼminīn al-muḥsin yuqdimu ʻalá Allāh taʻālá ka-al-ghāʼib ḥīna yaqdumu ʻalá ahlihi, wa-al-musīyʼ yaqdumu ʻalá Allāh taʻālá ka-al-ābiq min sayyidihi, fa-yaʼtī mawlāhu khāʼifan maḥzūnan, qāl fa-ayy al-aʻmāl ..."

8. Colophon of Miscellaneous magical formulas in poetry and prose and magic squares: "Tamma al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb, taḥrīran fī yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak, yawm ʻĀshūrāʼ, sanat 1139. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman."

Translation of the colophon of Miscellaneous magical formulas in poetry and prose and magic squares: "The book was completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King, written on blessed Saturday, on the Day of ʻĀshurāʼ [10th of Muḥarram] of the year 1139 [of the Hijrah = 7 September 1726]. May God's blessing and abundant peace by upon our Master Muḥammad, upon His family, and His companions."

9. Colophon of Treatise on magic with magic squares: No colophon. Text ends abruptly as follows: "... wa-ammā al-musaddas al-ḥarfī, fa-aḥsan ṭuruqihi an tabsuṭa al-ḥurūf fī awwal al-ḍilʻ min al-musaddas fa-tamlaʼahu, thumma taʼkhudh al-ḥarf al-awsaṭ, wa-huwa alladhī fī ākhir al-niṣf al-awwal min al-ḍilʻ al-awwal ..."

10. Ḥizb al-Baḥr ends as follows: "... Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Aqfāluhā thiqatī, billāh mafātīḥuhā, lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh. Adfaʻu bika Allāhumma ʻan nafsī mā uṭīqu wa-mā lā uṭīq. Lā ṭāqata li-makhlūqin maʻa qudrati al-Khāliq. Ḥasbiya Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

11. The invocation ends as follows: "... Allāhumma man ʻādāhu fa-ʻādihi, wa-man kādahū fa-kadhī [fa-kādihi], wa-man naṣaba la-hu fakhkhan fa-khudhu wa-[...] nāra man arāda bi-hi ʻudwānan wa-sharr, wa-farrij ʻanhu kulla dhīq [ḍīq], wa-lā tuḥammilūhu mā lā yaqwā wa-lā yuṭīq. Innaka Anta alladhī lā ilāha illā anta, al-Ḥaqq al-Ḥaqīq. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Wa-qad tamma kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah nahār al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, al-muwāfiq 20 Rajab, sanat 1301 khalat min Hijrat Sayyid al-Mursalīn wa-Khātim al-Nabīyīn wa-al-Mursalīn, wa-qad tammat kitābatuhā ʻalá yad aḍʻaf al-kittāb ʻAbd Allāh ʻAzīz al-Dīn, al-faqīr ilá Rabbihi al-Jalīl. Allāhumma. Āmīn. Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn ajmaʻīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the last of the Ḥadīths that summed up the foundations of Islam and included countless etiquettes and rulings. This honorable copy was written on blessed Monday, corresponding to the 20th of Rajab, in the year 1301 of the Hijrah of the Master of the Messengers and the Seal of the Prophets and the Messengers. It was written by the weakest of the scribes, ʻAbd Allāh ʻAzīz al-Dīn, the poor to his Glorious Lord. O God, forgive me and my parents, and the Muslim men and women, and the believing men and women, generally and entirely, the living among them and the dead, for the sake of Him who water sprouted from his palm, and He watered the whole army from it, our Master Muḥammad, may God bless Him, His family, His companions, His supporters, His followers, and the followers of His followers, O God, Amen, O Lord of all the worlds."

Secundo folio: ilá istinbāṭihā wa-ammā al-mukaddī fa-innahu idhā ṭalaba.

Wa-innamā ʻilāj kull ʻillah bi-muḍāddat sababihā, fa-tuʻāliju ḥubb al-shahawāt bi-al-qanāʻah bi-al-yasīr, wa-tuʻāliju ṭūl al-amal bi-kathrat dhikr al-mawt wa-al-naẓar fī mawt al-aqrān wa-ṭūl taʻabihim fī jamʻ al-māl wa-ḍayāʻihi baʻdahum, wa-tuʻāliju iltifāt al-qalb ilá al-walad bi-anna khāliqahu khalaqa maʻahu rizqahu, wa-kam min waldin lam yarith min abīhi mālan wa-ḥāluhu aḥsan mimman waritha, wa-bi-an yaʻlama annahu yajmaʻu al-māl li-waladihi yurīdu an yatruka waladahu bi-khayr wa-yanqalibu huwa ilá shurūr ..."

After the last paragraph are written, in a different hand, six verses of poetry, attributed to ʻUmar ibn al-Fāriḍ (ʻUmar ibn ʻAlī, 1181 or 1182-1235), reflecting similar themes, that God is the Provider for both humans and animals, starting with: "Wa-kam min fatan amsá wa-aṣbaḥa ḍāḥikan // wa-qad nusijat akfānuhu wa-huwa lā yadrī. And end with: "Wa-law kānati al-arzāqu taʼtī bi-qūwatin // lamā ḥaṣṣala al-ʻuṣfūru shayʼan maʻa al-nasri."

record.title: 880-02 Tanbīh al-ṣighār ʻalá mā khafiya ʻan baʻḍ al-afkār : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn ʻUmar al-Mīhī.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-sallam. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī anzala al-Qurʼān, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá sayyid wald ʻAdnān, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ulī al-faṣāḥah wa-al-bayān. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr ilá raḥmat Rabbihi ʻAlī al-Tamīmī [al-Mīhī] al-Shāfiʻī, al-baṣīr bi-qalbihi: Hādhā taʻlīq wāfin bi-riwāyat al-Imām Ḥafṣ ʻan al-Imām ʻĀṣim al-Kūfī, min ṭarīqah al-Shāṭibīyah, sakattu fīhi ʻammā yuwāfiq al-muʻtād bayna al-nās ḥadharan min al-wuqūʻ fī al-iltibās, wa-dhakartu kulla shayʼ fī mawḍiʻihi, illā mā kathura takarruruhu, wa-rubbamā dhakartu kalimāt mujmaʻan ʻalayhā, maʻa al-tanbīh ʻalá mā huwa al-ṣawāb ladayhā. Wa-sammaytuhu: 'Tanbīh al-ṣighār ʻalá mā khafiya ʻan baʻḍ al-afkār', wa-Allāh al-masʼūl an yanfaʻa bi-hi, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl ..."

Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā lil-īmān wa-al-Islām, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad Nabīyihi alladhī istanqadhanā bi-hi min ʻibādat al-awthān wa-al-aṣnām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-nujabāʼ al-bararah al-kirām. Wa-baʻd hādhā, fa-al-gharaḍ fī hādhā al-kitāb dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-faḍāʼilihā, adhkuruhā maḥdhūfat al-asānīd li-yashula ḥifẓuhā ʻalá al-qāriʼ, wa-hiya min ahamm al-muhimmāt li-man yurīdu al-qurb min Rabb al-Arbāb. Wa-sammaytuhu bi-kitāb 'Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa-shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-Nabī al-Mukhtār' ibtighāʼan li-marḍāt Allāh taʻālá, wa-maḥabbatan fī Rasūlihi al-Karīm Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallama taslīman. Wa-Allāh al-masʼūl an yajʻalanā li-Sunnatihi min al-tābiʻīn, wa-li-dhātihi al-kāmilah min al-muʻjabīn, fa-innahu ʻalá dhālika qadīr, lā ilāha ghayruhu, wa-lā khayra illā khayruhu, wa-Huwa niʻma al-Mawlá wa-niʻma al-naṣīr, wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwat illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm ..."

Wa-baʻd, faqad warada ʻan Abī Hurayrah, ʻan al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, annahu qāl: al-Īmān biḍʻun wa-sabʻūn, wa-fī riwāyah, biḍʻun wa-sittūn, shuʻbah, wa-al-ḥayāʼ shuʻbah min al-īmān, akhrajahu al-khamsah ... wa-kuntu zamanan ṭawīlan ataṭallabu ʻadadahā, ḥattá waqaʻtu ʻalayhi fī 'Maṭāliʻ al-anwār al-Muṣṭafawīyah fī Sharḥ Mashāriq al-anwār al-Nabawīyah', lil-Shaykh al-ʻĀlim al-jalīl Saʻīd Muḥammad ibn Masʻūd al-Kāzarūnī thumma al-Balyānī, fa-khaṭara lī an uqayyidahā, fa-raqamtuhā fī hādhihi al-awrāq ... wa-sammaytuhā 'Nawāfiḥ al-riḍwān bi-maʻrifat ʻadad shuʻab al-īmān' ..."

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tamma hādhā al-sharḥ al-mubārak, bi-ḥamd Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb, yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, ithnayn wa-ʻishrīn khalat min shahr Ṣafar al-khayr, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼatayn sabʻah wa-sittīn min Hijratihi, ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, Muḥammad al-Rashīdī baladan al-Mālikī madhhaban al-Azharī nisbatan lil-Jāmiʻ al-Azhar, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi, wa-li-man raʼá fī hādhā al-sharḥ ʻayban wa-aṣlaḥahu, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn, bi-mannihi wa-karamih. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "And God, Glory be to Him, the Most High, knows best what is right, to Him is the reference and the return, may God's blessings and peace be upon our Master Muhammad, and upon his family and companions. This blessed commentary was completed, by the praise of God, the Abundant Giving King, on the blessed Thursday, twenty-two days having passed of the blessed month of Safar, of the year one thousand two hundred and sixty-seven of the Hijrah of the Prophet [27 December 1850], blessings and peace be upon Him, at the hand of the servant the poor to God Almighty, Muḥammad al-Rashīdī baladan al-Mālikī madhhaban al-Azharī nisbatan lil-Jāmiʻ al-Azhar. May God forgive him, his parents, his sheikhs, and those who see a flaw in this commentary and corrected it, and all Muslims, by His benevolence and generosity. "Amen. It is completed."

On folio 3a: The following statement by the author: "Qāla muʼallif hādhā al-sharḥ al-mubārak ʻAlī Abū al-Ḥasan al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-li-mashāyikhihi, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn: Wa-anā akhtumu hādhā al-sharḥ, wa-huwa rābiʻ sharḥ lī ʻalá al-Risālah, bi-mā khatama bi-hi Ibn Shās [ʻAbd Allāh ibn Najm al-Khallāl, -1219] al-Jawāhir [ʻIqd al-jawāhir al-thamīnah fī madhhab ʻĀlim al-Madīnah]: Iʻlam inna ijmāʻ al-khayr kullihi fī taqw[á] Allāh ..."

Translation of the author's statement on folio 3a: "The author of this blessed commentary, ʻAlī Abū al-Ḥasan al-Māliki, may God forgive him, his parents, his shaykhs, and all Mulsims, said: I am concluding this commentary, which is my fourth on al-Risālah, by what Ibn Shās [ʻAbd Allāh ibn Najm al-Khallāl, -1219] concluded his 'al-Jawāhir' [ʻIqd al-jawāhir al-thamīnah fī madhhab ʻĀlim al-Madīnah]: Know that the consensus of all goodness lies in fear of God ..."

Author's colophon (folio 4a-4b): "Qāla muʼallifuhu raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Wa-qad faraghtu min taʼlīf hādhā al-sharḥ fī sābiʻ ʻashar Dhī al-Ḥijjah al-ḥarām, sanat 925, khams wa-ʻishrīn wa-tisʻimiʼah, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Intahá."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author, may God Almighty have mercy upon him, said: I finished writing this commentary on the seventeenth of sacred Dhū al-Ḥijjah, of the year 925 [of the Hijrah = 20 December, 1519]. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

Copyist's colophon: "Tammat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah fī shahr Rajab, fī iḥdā wa-ʻishrīn yawman khalat minhu, sanat 1288, ʻalá yad kātibihā wa-mālikihā al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, ʻAbd Rabbihi, Sālim al-Maḥraṣāwī, al-Mālikī madhhaban, al-Qādirī ṭarīqatan. Tamm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This blessed copy was written in the month of Rajab, twenty-one days having passed from it, in the year 1288 [of the Hijrah = 6 October 1871] by the hand of its copyist and owner, the poor to God Almighty, the servant of his Lord, Sālim al-Maḥraṣāwī, al-Malikī madhhaban, al-Qādirī ṭarīqatan. It is completed. May God's blessing and peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, and upon His family and His companions."

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā akhir mā yussira min Allāh al-Karīm ʻalá sabīl al-ikhtiṣār, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskh hādhā al-kitāb yawm al-Thulāth, khāmis ʻashar khalat min shahr Jumād al-Ākhir, sanata alf wa-miʼatayn wa-sabʻīn min al-Hijrah al-Nababwīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihihā atamm al-salām wa-azká al-taḥīyah, ʻalá yad kātibihi al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-Karīm, ʻAlī ibn Ibrāhīm, al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-kāffat al-muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what God the Most Generous has facilitated, in brevity. Praise be to God, Lord of the Worlds. May God's blessings and peace be upon our Master Muhammad, and upon His family and His companions. The copy of this book was completed on Tuesday, the fifteenth of the month of Jumād al-Ākhir, of the year one thousand two hundred and seventy of the Hijrah of the Prophet [15 March 1854], may the most perfect peace and the most sincere greetings be upon Him, by the hand of its copyist, the poor to his Generous Lord, ʻAlī ibn Ibrāhīm, al-Shafiʻī madhhaban, al-Khalwatī ṭarīqatan. May God forgive him, his parents, and all Muslims. Amen. Amen."

Translation of the colophon: "This book was completed, by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence, by the hand of its copyist and owner, the poorest of the servants, and most in need of his Glorious Lord, His servant, Ṭuḥaymir Aḥmad al-Wakīl al-Zuʻbullāwī baladan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban. The original treatise "al-Muqniʻ fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah" of Ibn al-Hāʼim, ends with the following six verses, stating that the poem is in 59 verses, and it was written during the month of Rabīʻ [al-Awwal] of the year 804 of the Hijrah (October 1401) at al-Jāmiʻ al-Aqṣá (in Jerusalem), as follows: "... Wa-lā budda min ittqāni naḥwi wasīlatī // wa-illā fa-lā taṭmaʻ bi-annaka dākhilu. Wa-hādhā alladhī awradtuhu fīhi maqnaʻun // wa-lillāhi ḥamdun dāʼimun yatawāṣalu. Wa-tatlū ṣalātan tustadāmu ʻalá al-Raḍī // Muḥammadin al-hādī al-karīmi al-shamāʼili. Taʻummu al-ulá hum āluhu thumma ṣaḥbuhu // wa-azwājuhu al-ghurru al-kirāmu al-afāḍilu. Wa-abyātuhā tisʻun wa-khamsūna unshiʼat // bi-al-aqṣá wa-shahri al-yumn fa-hiya tuṭāwilu. Rabīʻun min al-ʻāmi alladhī ḍaṭu ʻaddihi // bi-Dālin wa-Ḍādin fa-al-thanā yatakāmalu. [ʻĀm 804]."

Colophon: "Najaza al-kitāb bi-ḥamdi Allāh taʻālá wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusni tawfīqihi yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ al-mubārak baʻda al-ʻaṣr bi-al-Jāmiʻ al-Azhar, yawma thalāthah wa-ʻishrīn khalat min shahr Rajab al-aṣamm al-aṣabb, sanat 1209, tisʻah wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-muqṣṣir, al-ṭāmiʻ fī raḥmat Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, Muḥammad in al-marḥūm ʻAbduh al-Qahāwī baladan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "The book was completed, by the praise of God Almighty, His help, and His abundant benevolence, on blessed Wednesday, after the afternoon prayer, at al-Jāmiʻ al-Azhar, the twenty-third day of the blessed and tender month of Rajab, in the year 1209, one thousand two hundred and nine [of the Hijrah = 13 February 1795], by the hand of its poor, despicable, and negligent copyist, who aspires for the mercy of God Almighty and Most High, Muhammad son of the late ʻAbduh al-Qahāwī baladan, al-Shafiʻī madhhaban, may God forgive him, his parents, and the Muslims. May God's blessings and peace be upon our master Muḥammad, and upon his family and companions. It is completed."

To the right of the colophon a reader, or, owner wrote the following "shahādah (testimony of faith): "Awdaʻtu fī hādhā al-kitāb: 'Ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh, wa-ashhadu anna Muḥammadan Rasūlu Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam taslīman dāʼiman abadan ilá Yawm al-Dīn, wa-al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn'."

record.title: 880-02 Qaṣīdat Aṭiʻ amranā narfʻ li-ajlika ḥujbanā : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Wafā.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger (based on the first stanza of the poem).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of "Qaṣīdat Aṭiʻ amranā narfʻ li-ajlika ḥujbanā": "Wa-li-baʻḍihim, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu. Āmīn. Aṭiʻ amranā narfaʻ li-ajlika ḥujbanā // fa-innā manaḥnā bi-al-riḍā man aḥabbanā. Wa-ludh bi-ḥimānā wa-iḥtamī bi-janābinā // li-naḥmīka mimmā fīhi asbābu khalqinā. Wa-ʻish fī ḥimānā khāḍiʻan mutadhallilan // wa-akhliṣ lanā talqa al-masarrata wa-al-hanā ..."
Secundo folio of "Qaṣīdat Aṭiʻ amranā narfʻ li-ajlika ḥujbanā": Aradnāhu aḥbabnāhu ḥattá aḥabbanā.

Incipit of the unidentified treatise on "Tawḥīd": The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... wa-mimmā yajibu li-Mawlānā, ʻazza wa-jall, ʻishrūn ṣifah, wa-hiya al-wujūd wa-al-qidam, wa-al-baqāʼ, wa-mukhālafatuhu taʻālá lil-ḥawādith, wa-qiyāmuhu taʻālá bi-nafsihi, ay, lā yaḥtāju ilá maḥall wa-lā mukhaṣṣaṣ, wa-al-waḥdānīyah, ay, lā thāniya la-hu fī dhātihi wa-lā fī ṣifātihi wa-lā fī afʻālihi, fa-hādhihi sitt ṣifāt, al-ūlá nafsīyah, wa-hiya al-wujūd, wa-al-khamsah salbīyah, thumma yajibu li-Mawlānā sabʻ ṣifāt tusammá ṣifāt al-maʻālī ..."
Secundo folio of the unidentified treatise on "Tawḥīd": wa-Shuʻayb wa-Mūsá wa-Hārūn wa-Zakarīyā wa-Yaḥyá wa-ʻĪsá.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface of the first treatise: 9 x 15.5 cm; 11 lines per page. Written surface of the second treatise: 14 x18; 19-21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire, and one separate leaf).

Script: The first treatise is written in large good caligraphic naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; text fully vocalized; markings in red; catchwords. The second treatise is written in fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; no catchwords. The separate leaf is written in fair naskh script, in balck ink, on cream color paper; catchwords.

On folio 10b: 1. Two verses of love poetry (Written in calligraphic naskh, text fully vocalized): "Salāmun ʻalaykum wa-al-manāmu ḥarāmu // wa-man fāraqa al-aḥbāba kayfa yanāmu. Fa-wallāhi mā kāna al-firāqu bi-khāṭirin // wa-lākin kadhā faʻalat binā al-ayyāmu." 2. Calculations (in pencil). 3. A statement in English (in pencil): "36 pamphlets. Complete."

Colophon of "Qaṣīdat Aṭiʻ amranā narfʻ li-ajlika ḥujbanā": The poem ends as follows: "... Wa-ʻarraftanā īyāka fa-al-ḥamdu dāʼiman // li-wajhika idh alhamtanā minka rushdanā. Wa-ṣalātu Rabbī dāʼiman wa-salāmuhu // ʻalá man bi-hi yawma al-qiyāmati yuʻtanā. Kadhā al-ālu wa-al-aṣḥābu mā qad unshidat // Aṭiʻ amranā narfaʻ li-ajlika ḥujbanā. Tammat."

Colophon of the an unidentified treatise on "Tawḥīd": The treatise ends as follows: "... wa-mimmā yajibu al-īmān bi-hi: al-ʻArsh, wa-al-kursī, wa-al-kutub al-samāwīyah, wa-al-ṣirāṭ, wa-al-mīzān, wa-al-ḥawḍ, wa-anna al-shuhadāʼ aḥyāʼ, wa-anna man māta yusʼalu fī qabrihi, wa-yubʻathu Yawm al-Qiyāmah, wa-yuḥsharu, wa-yamurru ʻalá al-ṣirāṭ, wa-yuḥāsabu, wa-tūzanu aʻmāluhu, fa-in rajaḥat al-sayyiʼāt fa-ilá al-nār allatī yajibu al-īmān bihā, wa-anna Allāh aʻaddahā dāra ʻiqāb lil-ʻiṣyān, wa-in rajaḥat al-ḥasanāt fa-ilá al-Jannah allatī yajibu al-īmān bihā wa-anna Allāh aʻaddahā dāra naʻīm lil-muttaqīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad."

record.title: Panegyrical poem in praise of the Prophet : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Salāmun mina al-mushtāqi fī kulli sāʻati // wa-azká taḥīyātin li-sākini Ṭaybati. Muḥammadin al-mabʻūthi faḍlan wa-raḥmatan // amīnan faṭīnan ḥāza kulla balāghati. Nabīyun ḥalīmun fāqa badran jamāluhu // raḥīmun li-khalqin qad ḥawá kulla raʼfati, Muṭahharu akhlāqin wa-kāmilu khalqatin // tanazzaha ʻan shaynin wa-ʻan kulli waṣmati ..."
Secundo folio: Fa-lā ghayru man anshāka yaqdiru ʻaddahā.
17 x 22 cm; written surface: 8 x 15 cm; 19-21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
Script: In fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; text fully vocalized; extensive commentaries on the margins; catchwords.
Folios 1a and 4b are blank.
Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhā: Tammat bi-Maqām al-Ḥusayn ibn al-Imām ʻAlī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhumā, wa-ʻan kull al-ṣaḥābah wa-al-tābiʻīn wa-tābiʻīhim. Āmīn. Āmīn. M."

Tanslation of the colophon: "Its author said: It was completed at the Shrine of al-Ḥusayn son of al-Imām ʻAlī, may God be pleased with them both, and with all the Companions [of the Prophet], their successors, and their followers. Amen. Amen. M."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat al-Amīr al-Kabīr ʻalá Sharḥ al-Samarqandīyah lil-Mullawī : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Kabīr.

Secundo folio: Wa-ramayta mālaka bil-nadā fī mahlakin // ḥattá balaghta min al-maʻālī maṭlabā.

Haddī. ʻAdūwī hādhā aṣdaq al-nās ilayya, wa-aʻazzuhum ʻindī, wa-aḥẓāhum ladayy, li-an hādhā al-Ḥakīm dāwānī bi-shayʼ qabaḍtuhu bi-yadī wa-abrānī min maraḍī alladhī ʻajizat al-aṭibbāʼ ʻanhu wa-aʻyā al-ḥukamāʼ, wa-hadhah mā yūjadu mithluhu fī hādhā al-zamān, gharban wa-sharqan, wa-buʻdan wa-qurban, wa-anta taqūlu ʻanhu hādah, wa-min al-yawm la-hu fī kull shahr alf dīnār ..."

record.title: 880-02 Kitāb fī al-ṣalāh wa-ʻiẓam khaṭarihā wa-mā yalzamu al-nās min tamāmihā wa-aḥkāmihā : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn Aḥmad ibn Ḥanbal.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Hādhā Kitāb fī al-ṣalāh wa-ʻiẓam khaṭarihā wa-mā yalzamu al-nās min tamāmihā wa-iḥkāmihā mimmā yaḥtāju ilayhi ahl al-Islām, li-mā qad shamalahum min al-istikhfāf bihā li-taḍayyuʻ [wa-al-taḍyīʻ] lahā, wa-musābaqat al-imām fīhā, katabahu Abū ʻAbd Allāh Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥanbal, raḍiya Allāh ʻanh, ilá qawmin ṣallá maʻahum baʻḍ al-ṣalawāt. Ay qawm, innī ṣallaytu maʻakum fa-raʼaytu min ahl masjidikum man yasbiqu al-imām fī al-rukūʻ wa-al-sujūd wa-al-rafʻ wa-al-khafḍ, wa-laysa li-man yasbiqu al-imām ṣalāh, bi-dhālika jāʼat al-Aḥādīth ʻan al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ʻan aṣḥābihi, ruḍwān Allāh ʻalayhim ..."
Secundo folio: fa-qāla la-hu mā ṣallayta waḥdaka wa-lā ṣallayta maʻa al-imām.

record.title: Unidentified texts on Islamic doctrines : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of text 1: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... al-iḥsān, fa-jaʻala al-īmān bāṭinan wa-al-Islām ẓāhiran, wa-lā yaṣilu, ay, al-bāṭin illā bi-al-ẓāhir, wa-lā, ay, al-ẓāhir illā bi-al-bāṭin, li-anna al-ẓāhir wa-al-bāṭin munshabik baʻḍun bi-baʻḍ, li-anna al-īmān wa-al-Islām mathaluhum kamathal shajarah, aṣluhā al-īmān wa-thamaratuhā al-Islām. Praise be to God, Lord of the Worlds. by the hand of its poor writer Farghalī Zinatī ʻĀmir Muḥammad, may [God] have mercy upon him."

Incipit of text 2 (Fatwá): "Mā qawlukum, mā dāma faḍlukum, fī qaryah mutaqāribah min baʻḍihā, ʻalá aqall, ka-farsakh, wa-kull qaryan minhā jāmiʻ mathalan, wa-lam yuʻlam al-sābiq min al-jawāmiʻ, fa-hal yaṣiḥḥu li-kull qaryah tuṣallī fī al-jāmiʻ alladhī fīhā aw lā, wa-al-mawḍūʻ anna al-qaryah tataqarrabu bihim. Afīdū al-jawāb ..."

2. Text 2 (Fatwá) ends as follows: "... Qāla Abū al-Barakāt al-Quṭb al-Dardīr, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi: Wa-law aḥdatha jamāʻah tataqarrabu bihim qaryah bi-balad ʻalá ka-farsakh min balad al-Jumʻah la-wajabat ʻalayhim al-Jumʻah istiqlālan, wa-al-ṣiḥḥah tābiʻuhā. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."

3. Incipit of text 3: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ashraf al-mursalīn, Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-hā anā ashraʻu fī bayān maʻná Alif, ilá qawlihi Y, fa-aqūlu: Qāla Kaʻb al-Aḥbār, raḍiya [Allāh ʻanhu]: Wa-hiya min al-ṣuḥuf allatī unzilat ʻalá Abīnā Ādam ḥīna baʻathahu Allāh ilá dhurrīyatih rasūlan, wa-kāna yatlū dhālika al-ṣuḥuf, thumma amarahu Allāh taʻālá an yaktubahā bi-al-qalam, fa-akhadha julūd al-ḍaʼn, fa-dhabaḥahā [fa-dabaghahā (?)] ḥattá ṣārat riqqan, wa-kataba fīhā al-ḥurūf al-tisʻah wa-al-ʻishrīn ḥarfan, wa-hiya al-Tawrāt, wa-al-Injīl, wa-al-Zabūr, wa-al-Furqān, awwaluhā: Anā Allāh al-wāḥid al-aḥad, al-fard al-ṣamad, alladhī lam yazal ..."

3. Text 3 ends as follows: "... ḥattá baʻatha Allāh Idrīs, ʻalayhi al-salām, wa-anzala ʻalayhi khamsīn ṣaḥīfah, wa-anzala hādhihi al-ḥurūf bi-ʻaynihā fa-katabahā Idrīs, wa-huwa awwal man khaṭṭa bi-al-qalam baʻda Ānūsh ibn Shīth, wa-kāna Idrīs, ʻalayhi al-salām, ʻallamahā li-awlādihi, fa-qāla lahum: Iʻlamū yā baniyya annkum Ṣābiʼūn, wa-taʻallamū al-qirāʼah fī ṣigharikum li-tantafiʻū bihā fī kibarikum, wa-al-Ṣābiʼūn hum al-katabah, fa-lam yazālū yatawārathūna ṣuḥufa Shīth ibn Ādam wa-Idrīs wa-rusūm Ādam ilá zaman Nūḥ wa-Hūd wa-Ibrāhīm, ʻalayhi al-salām. Intahá."

3. Colophon of text 3: "Qad kamula tabyīḍ hādhihi al-risālah yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak sanata thalāthah wa-tisʻīn wa-alf baʻda Hijrati man la-hu ghāyat al-sharaf, wa-innī lā aṭmaʻu fī raḥmatin ghalabat al-ghaḍab, wa-fayḍin lā yakhuṣṣu man ṭalab, wa-in kuntu lastu ahlan, li-an urḥama, fa-Rabbunā al-Karīm ahlan li-an yarḥama. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

3. Translation of the colophon of text 3: "The fair copy of this epistle was completed on the blessed Thursday of the year one thousand ninety-three after the Hijrah [1682] of the One who has the utmost honor. I do not covet mercy that has overcome wrath, and an abundance that does not belong to the one who requests it. Even if I am not worthy of having mercy, Our Generous Lord is worthy of having mercy. God bless our Prophet Muhammad, and His family and companions and grant them peace."
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 11 x 17 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (one quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings and markings in purple; some notes on the margins; catchwords.

record.title: Fragments of three unidentified treatises of Islamic miscellany : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. The beginning of the first fragment is missing. Text starts with: "... ilayhi wa-qultu la-hu mā amartanī bi-hi, fa-mā wathiqa bi-kalāmī, fa-qāla la-hu fī ghadan [sic] idhhab ilayhi wa-qul la-hu: Mithla mā tuṣallī ʻalá al-Nabī ṣallá Allāh ʻlayhi wa-sallam, kulla laylatin bi-hādhihi al-ṣalāh, wa-hiya tanūbu ʻan sabʻīna alf ṣalāh, wa-tusāwī kulla thawāb 'Dalāʼil al-khayrāt', wa-kāna dhālika, idh dhāka al-Hindī yaqūluhā fī nafsihi, wa-lam yaṭṭaliʻ ʻalayhi aḥad illā Allāh taʻālá, fa-ḥīna aṣbaḥa sāra ilayhi wa-qāla la-hu: Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, yuqrīka al-salām wa-yaqūlu laka mithla mā tuṣallī ʻalayhi fī kull laylah bi-hādhihi al-ṣalāh, wa-hiya: Allāhumma ṣallī ʻalá al-dhāt al-muṭalsam wa-al-ghayb al-muṭamṭam, lāhūt al-jamāl wa-nāsūt al-wiṣāl ..."
1. Secundo folio of the first fragment: wa-al-ʻilm wa-al-ḥikam muẓhir sirr al-jūd al-juzʼī wa-al-kullī.
1. Colophon of the first fragment: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Tamma hādhā al-sharḥ al-mubārak bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih."

1. Translation of the colophon of the first fragment: "Praise be to God alone. May God blessings be upon Him who no prophet comes after Him. This blessed commentary was completed by the help of God and His abundant benevolence."

2. Incipit of the second fragment: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-azká al-taslīm ʻalá ashraf khalqihi, Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-qad ṭalaba minnī man lā yasaʻunī mukhālafatuhu an ashraḥa la-hu alfāẓ ṣalāt al-Quṭb, Sayyidī Muḥyī al-Dīn ibn al-ʻArabī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, fa-ajabtuhu li-dhālika, wa-in kuntu lastu ahlan li-dhālika, fa-alhamanī Allāh mā tayassara min maʻānī ghawāmiḍ alfāẓihā bi-ḥasbi maqāmī wa-fahmī al-saqīm, fa-aqūlu: Lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm. Qawluhu, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu: Allāhumma ṣalli ʻalá al-dhāt al-muṭalsam ..."
2. Secundo folio of the second fragment: fī azalihi annahu lam yakun hunāka qalbun ashwaq ilayhi min Muḥammad.

2. Colophon of the second fragment: "Tamma hādhā al-sharḥ al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-al-wālidayhi [wa-li-wālidayhi] wa-lil-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt, wa-al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt, al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-amwāt, sanat 1275. Āmīn. 3 Shawwāl."

2. Translation of the colophon of the second fragment: "This blessed commentary was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. May God forgive him [no name mentioned], his parents, the believers, men and women, the Muslims, men and women, the living among them and the dead. Amen. On 3 Shawwāl, of the year 1275 of the Hijrah [6 May 1859]."

3. Incipit of the third fragment: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Qāla al-Shaykh Abū Isḥāq al-Tūnisī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-raḍiya ʻanhu wa-ʻan jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-qad saʼalanī baʻḍ ikhwānī al-ṭālibīn al-rāghibīn fī ṭalab al-ʻilm ʻan al-īmān wa-al-Islām, hal humā makhlūqān am ghayr makhlūqān [six], fa-ajabtuhu ilá dhālika ṭāliban lil-thawāb rāghiban ilá Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb ..."

3. The third fragment ends abruptly as follows: "... mathal al-īmān wa-al-Islām ka-mathal shajarah, aṣluhā al-īmān wa-thamaratuhā al-Islām; taqūlu thamarah min shajarah, wa-lā taqūlu shajarah min thamarah, al-īmān aṣl wa-al-Islām farʻ. Fa-hādhā naql al-bāʼis, raḥimahu Allāh, li-qawlihi fī al-Islām, wa-mā maḥalluhu, wa-mā dawāʻīhi, wa-mā shurūṭuhu. Ammā al-Islām huwa al-istislām, wa-al-ististlām huwa al-inqiyād, wa-al-inqiyād huwa al-imtithāl li-amr Allāh taʻālá wa-al-ijtināb ʻan nawāhīhi ..."
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 18 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (loose leaves).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, cream color paper; phrases of the original red; markings in red; catchwords.

record.title: 880-01 Khatm ʻalá ākhir al-Azharīyah fī ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah : manuscript.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh awwalan wa-ākhiran, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá man kāna lil-rusl khātiman, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-ṭāhirīn, ṣalātan wa-salāman dāʼimayn ilá yawm al-dīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā 'Khatm ʻalá ākhir al-Azharīyah fī ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah'. Qawluhu 'Qul', min al-maʻlūm anna qul fiʻl amr mawḍūʻ lil-ṭalab, thumma yuḥtamal anna al-murād bi-hi al-ṭalab al-nafsī, wa-huwa ṭalab al-nafs wa-mayluhā lil-maṭlūb, li-annahu yufhamu min al-ṣīghah, wa-ʻadam fahmihi minhā fī baʻḍ al-aḥyān yakūnu li-qarīnah ..."
Secundo folio: wa-huwa ḥathth al-mukhāṭab ʻalá al-maṭlūb wa-taḥḍīḍuhu ʻalayhi bi-al-ṣīghah.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 16 cm; 26 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (one quire).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; few corrections on the margins; some underlined phrases; catchwords.
Folio 1a is blank.

Colophon. No colophon. Text ends abruptly as follows: "... wa-ammā al-nās fa-yuwaswasūn fī al-ṣudūr bi-wāsiṭat waswasatihim fī al-idhn, wa-yukhsaʼūn idhā zujirū. Fa-in qulta qad tawālá al-sajʻ hunā ʻalá lafẓ al-nās, wa-huwa naẓīr al-īṭāʼ al-muʻīb fī al-shiʻr, wa-al-jawāb inna maḥall al-ʻayb idhā ittaḥada al-maʻná, wa-naḥnu naqūlu: Qul aʻūdhu bi-Rabbi al-nās, ay, al-ṣighār, li-annahum aḥwaj shayʼ ilá al-tarbiyah, Maliki al-nās, ay, al-shabāb, li-annahum aḥwaj al-nās ilá malikin yasūsuhum, wa-yaksir hayajān shubūbīyatihim, Ilāhi al-nās, ay, mustaḥiqq ʻibādat al-nās, ay, al-shuyūkh, li-annahum aḥwaj shayʼ ..."

record.title: 880-01 Sharḥ al-Isrāʼ wa-al-Miʻrāj : manuscript.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... fa-qatāduhā, wa-qīl al-qāʼil dhālik al-Muṭʻim ibn ʻAdī, arāda bi-dhālika kadhibahu, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-qīl al-qāʼil la-hu dhālik Abū Bakr al-Ṣiddīq iẓhāran li-ṣidqihi, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, li-annahu ʻālimun annahu lā yanṭuqu ʻan al-hawá, wa-iẓhārn li-khizyi man kadhdhaba maqālatahu, wa-lam yuṣaddiq bi-qawlihi, (kayfa bināʼuhu) min ḥajarin aw ājurr aw ghayr dhālik, (wa-kayfa hayʼatuhu) min ṭūl aw qiṣar, (wa-kayfa qurbuhu min al-jabal) hal huwa qarībun am baʻīd, (wa-fī al-qawm man sāfara ilayhi) wa-ʻarafahu ḥaqq al-maʻrifah, wa-ʻinda al-imtiḥān yukramu al-marʼ aw yuhān ..."
Secundo folio: bi-al-Jāhilīyah yusammá bi-dhālika li-ṣidqihi li-annahu kāna fī al-Jāhilīyah raʼīsan wajīhan.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 13 x 17.5 cm; 25 lines per page.

Text ends abruptly with: "... fa-qāla Yā Rabb, man hādhā alladhī qaranta ismahu bi-ismika, fa-qāla Allāh: Yā Ādam, hādhā ḥabībī wa-ṣafwatī min khalqī, wa-lawlā[hu] mā khalaqtu insānan wa-lā jinnan, wa-lā samāʼan wa-lā arḍan, wa-lā jannatan wa-lā nāran, wa-lā shamsan wa-lā qamaran, wa-lā anta yā Ādam, wa-mā khalaqtu al-dunyā illā li-ajlihi, wa-mā khalaqtuhu illā li-ajl al-ākhirah. record.title: Two fragments in verse on Arabic morphology : manuscript.
record.note: Title of the collection supplied by cataloger.
Title of the first fragment "Naẓm al-Maqṣūd fī ʻilm al-ṣarf" from reference sources.
Title of the second fragment "al-Taʻrīf bi-al-taṣrīf" from incipit (folio 3a)
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

1. Incipit of "Naẓm al-Maqṣūd fī ʻilm al-ṣarf": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Yaqūlu baʻda ḥamdi Dhī al-Jalāli // muṣalliyan ʻalá al-Nabī wa-al-Āli. ʻAbdun asīru raḥmati al-Karīmi // ay, Aḥmadu ibnu ʻĀbid al-Raḥīmi. Fiʻlun thulāthīyun idhā yujarradu // abwābuhu sittun kamā sa-tusradu. Fa-al-ʻaynu in tuftaḥ bi-māḍin fa-iksiri // aw ḍumma aw fa-iftaḥ la-hā fī al-ghābiri ..."
1. Secundu folio of "Naẓm al-Maqṣūd fī ʻilm al-ṣarf": iftaʻala faʻʻala kadhā tafaʻʻalā // naḥwa taʻallama wa-zid tafāʻalā.

2. Incipit of ". "al-Taʻrīf bi-al-taṣrīf": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla ibnu ʻAbdi al-Wāḥidi al-Miknāsī // nazīlu Khayri Mursalin lil-nāsi. al-Ḥamdu lillāhi alladhī qad ṣarrafa // afʻālahu fī mulkihi wa-ʻarrafā. Man shāʼa min ʻibādihi bi-fiʻlihi // wa-bi-ismihi wa-waṣfihi wa-faḍlihi. Thumma ʻalá khayri al-anāmi Aḥmadā // azká al-ṣalāti wa-al-salāmi sarmadā. Wa-baʻdu fa-al-taṣrīfu ʻilmun ṭulibā // fa-hāka fīhi rajazan muhadhdhabā. Sammaytuhu 'al-Taʻrīfu bi-al-taṣrīfi' // munaqqaḥa al-ashṭāri fī al-taʼlīfi ..."
2. Secundo folio of "al-Taʻrīf bi-al-taṣrīf": Ammā ʻalá al-tafṣīli wa-al-bayāni // fa-innahā tuḥṣaru fī thamāni.

record.title: Rainbow nation without borders : toward an ecotopian millennium : printout / By Alberto Ruz Buenfil.
record.note: Title from title page.

record.title: Captain George Hancock's diary of an English prisoner-of-war during the French Revolution : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger, based on dealer's description.
Diary spans 26 leaves, with 4 additional leaves of French phrases with English translations; also several blanks, with a couple of (possible blank) leaves torn away at the front.

With a late nineteenth-century transcription by Walter Hancock Gutch, attributing the diary to a relative: ‘Captain George Hancock of Poole Dorset’. The transcription has the bookplate of Peter Shand Kydd, step-father of Diana, Princess of Wales.

record.title: Etat des sciences et des arts en Lorraine, depuis le milieu du XIe siècle, jusqu'à la fin du seizieme, prouvé par les monumens : manuscript.
record.note: Title transcribed from title page.
The first chapter is paginated 1-38; the second chapter is paginated until 21 (several pages are unpaginated and skipped); afterwards unpaginated.
Binding: contemporary green leather binding over pasteboard.

The cuttings in chapter 2 are numbered 1-55 (cuttings 56-57 are missing) and are subdivided into 10 sciences: grammar (cuttings 1-9), poetry (cuttings 10-17), physics (cutting 18), rhetoric (cutting 19), arithmetic (cuttings 20-24), astronomy (cuttings 25-33), geography (cuttings 34-38), music (cuttings 39-43), theology (cuttings 44-46), law (cuttings 47-51), medicine (cuttings 52-55).
Each science is cataloged separately as a number of cuttings. Search for call number: GEN MSS VOL 1204.

Colophon: "Wa-qad tammat al-manẓūmah bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh taʻālá waḥdahu. Wa-Allāh taʻālá aʻlam. Tammat yawm al-Aḥad al-mubārak, 3 fī shahr Shaʻbān al-muʻaẓẓam, min shuhūr sanat 1191, bi-madīnat Aswān, bi-al-Ṣaʻīd al-Aʻlá. Ghafara Allāh li-kātibihā wa-qārīhā. Milk al-faqīr [the name is erased], ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu, wa-ghafara la-hu dhunūbahu, wa-satara fī al-dārayn ʻuyūbahu, wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: " "The 'Manẓūmah' (treatise in verse) was completed with the praise of God, His help, and His Abundant benevolence. Praise be to God Almighty alone. God Almighty knows best. It was completed on blessed Sunday, the 3rd of the glorious month of Shaʻbān, of the year 1191 [6 September 1777], in the city of Aswān, in Upper Egypt. May God forgive its writer and reader. Owned by the poor [Name erased], may God pardon him, forgive his sins, and cover his faults in both worlds, and all Muslims. Amen."

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā mā intahá jamʻuhu wa-lukhkhiṣa waḍʻuhu ḥasba al-juhd wa-al-ṭāqah wa-al-imkān, li-kawn annī lam akun min fursān hādhā al-maydān. Jaʻalahu Allāh taʻālá nāfiʻan qāṣidahu, muʼaththiran manāfiʻuhu. Wa-Allāh asʼalu an yaghfira lī wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn, wa-an yarḥamanī wa-sāʼir al-muʼminīn. Wa-jaʻaltuhā ṭayyibah lil-nufūs, tujlá ka-al-ʻarūs, rājiyan min al-Faḍl al-Maʼmūl an yajʻala mahrahā al-qabūl. Wa-nasʼalu min al-Mawlá al-Sattār an yublighanā fīka aṭwal al-aʻmār, maʻa al-ṣiḥḥah wa-dawām al-ʻāfiyah wa-al-niʻmah wa-al-faḍāʼil al-wāfiyah. Wa-anā al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr ilá al-Mawlá al-Jalīl al-Karīm, Ibn Abī Bakr al-Ṣāliḥī Ibrāhīm, thumma al-ʻAwfī al-Ḥanbalī, ghafara Allāh taʻālá la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-liman daʻá ilayhi. Āmīn. Tamm. M."

Translation of the colophon: "This is what I finished collecting and summarizing, according to effort, energy, and ability, since I am not one of the knights in this field. May God Almighty render it beneficial to those who intended to use it and benefit from it. I implore God to forgive me and all Muslims, and to have mercy upon me and all other believers. I wrote it to be good for the souls, adorned like a bride, hoping from Whom favor is expected, to accept it for a dowry. We ask the All Protecting Lord to grant us through it the longest of lives, with health, lasting well-being, blessings, and abundant virtues. I, the poor and despicable one, confessing my inability and shortcomings to the Glorious and Generous Lord, Ibn Abi Bakr al-Ṣalhī Ibrāhim, then al-ʻAwfī, then al-Ḥanbalī, may God Almighty forgive him, his parents, and those who ask forgiveness on his behalf. Amen. It is completed. M."

Qad intahá al-sharḥ al-mubārak bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqhi yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, rābiʻ Jumād Ākhir, sanat alf wa-miʼah tisʻah wa-sabʻīn Hilālīyah, min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihim ilá Mawlāh al-Ghanī, ʻAlī Shaymash al-Fayyūmī al-Mālikī al-Azharī, khatama Allāh la-hu bi-al-ḥusná. Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. The blessed commentary has ended with praise to God, His help, and His abundant benevolence, on blessed Thursday, the fourth of Jumād Ākhir, of the Lunar year one thousand one hundred and seventy-nine, of the Hijrah of the Prophet, may the best blessings and peace be upon Him, by the hand of the poorest of the servants and the most in need of His Rich Master, ʻAlī Shaymash al-Fayyūmī al-Malikī al-Azharī, may God seal him with goodness. Amen."

Under the colophon, the following owner's statement: "al-Khaṭṭu yabqá zamānan baʻda kātibihi // wa-kātibu al-khaṭṭi yablá wa-huwa maktūbu. Fa-Yārabbu ighfir li-ʻabdin kāna kātibahu // wa-yā q̄ariʼa al-khaṭṭi qul bi[llāhi] Āmīnā. Āmīn. Milk al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr, rājī ʻafwa al-mathāwī [al-masāwī] Muḥammad Abū Shuʻyāb [Shuʻayb (?)] Yūnus al-Minshāwī."

Translation of the owner's statement under the colophon: "The script remains for a long time after its writer // and the writer of the script wears out while it is written. O Lord, forgive the servant who wrote it // And O [reader] of the handwriting, say by [God] Amen. Amen. Owned by the despicable poor, seeking the pardon of his shortcomings, Muḥammad Abū Shuʻyāb [Shuʻayb (?)] Yūnus al-Minshawī."

Text ends as follows: "... qāla fī al-Aṭwal: Wa-laka an turīda bi-al-qaṣrayn al-qaṣr bayna al-mubtadaʼ wa-al-khabar wa-al-qaṣr bayna ghayrihimā wa-huwa aqrab, ifrādan wa-qalban wa-taʻyīnan, ẓāhiruhu anna dhālika khāṣṣ bi-ghayr al-ḥaqīqī, li-anna hādhihi aqsāmuhu, wa-laysa kadhālika, fa-kāna al-aḥsan an yaqūla: Wa-yakūnu ḥaqīqīyan wa-ghayr ḥaqīqī ifrādan wa-qalban wa-taʻyīnan li-mā sabaqa ay min sharṭ al-manfī bi-lā an lā yakūna manfīyan qablahā bi-ghayrihā."

Colophon: "Tamma al-Juzʼ al-awwal min Ḥāshiyat al-Tajrīd ʻalá Mukhtaṣar al-Saʻd ʻalá al-tamām wa-al-kamāl, wa-al-ḥamd lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon: "The First part of 'Ḥashiyat al-Tajrīd ʻalá Mukhtaṣar al-Saʻd' is thoroughly completed. Praise be to God on all conditions. May God's blessings and peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, upon His family, and His companions. Amen. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Raḥbīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻUmar al-Baqarī.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... idh kāna dhāka, ay, al-madhkūr min al-ibānah wa-al-tawakhkhī, min ahamm al-gharaḍ, ay, al-qaṣd, wa-aṣl al-gharaḍ mā yarmī ilayhi al-rumāh, fa-lammā kāna qāṣidan li-ṭarīqatin yurīdu summiya gharaḍan lil-mushābahah, wa-huwa Zayd ibn Thābit, yukanná Abā Saʻīd, wa-qīl Abā ʻAbd al-Raḥmān, wa-qīl Abā Khārijah, qadima al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, al-Madīnah, wa-huwa ibn khamsa ʻashra sanah, wa-tuwuffiya bi-al-Madīnah baʻda al-Hijrah, sanata khams wa-arbaʻīn, wa-manāqibuhu shahīrah, wa-maʼāthiruhu kathīrah ..."
Secundo folio: ihlākihi wa-ʻabbara bi-dhālika li-yadulla ʻalá annahu lā yubqá minhu shayʼ.
17 x 21 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 18.5 cm; 23-29 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair large naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; some notes and corrections on the margins; some leaves seem to be missining; catchwords.

Author's colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā tayassara jamʻuhu. Wa-nasʼalu Allāh an yakhtuma lanā bi-khātimat al-saʻādah, wa-an yaʻfuwa ʻannā, wa-an yuʻāmilanā bi-jamīl iḥsānih, wa-an yudkhilanā al-Jannah bi-faḍlihi wa-imtinānih, bi-ghayr sābiqat ʻadhāb wa-lā ʻatāb, bi-jāh Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-Nabī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbih wa-sallam."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This is the end of what we were able to collect. We ask God to seal us with the seal of happiness, to pardon us, to treat us with the beauty of His benevolence, and to admit us to Paradise, with His grace and favor, without precedence of torment or reproach, for the sake of our Master Muḥammad, His family, and His companions. May God's blessings and peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, the Illiterate Prophet, and upon his family and companions."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak, <alladhī huwa min shuhūr Jumād Ākhir, min khamsat ʻashar yawman khalat> min shahr Jumād Ākhir, min ʻashrat yawman khalat minhu, sanat 1251, ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Shaykh al-Ṭaḥlāwī al-Mālikī madhhaban, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-li-man daʻā lahum bi-al-maghfirah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-Nabī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Āmīn. Yā Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The writing of this copy was completed on blessed Saturday, <of the month of Jumād Ākhir, fifteen days having passed from it> of Jumād Ākhir, ten days having passed thereof, in the year 1251 [of the Hijrah = 3 October 1835], by the hand of the poor to God Almighty, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Shaykh al-Ṭaḥāwī al-Mālikī, may God forgive him, his parents, and the Muslims. Amen. And to those who pray for forgiveness for them. May God's blessings and abundant peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, the Illiterate Prophet, and upon His family and companions, until the Day of Judgment. Amen. O Lord of the worlds."

It was completed with God's praise, His help, and His abundant benevolence. There is no power nor might except in God, the Most High, the Almighty. It is completed."

record.title: 880-02 Badīʻ al-inshāʼ wa-al-ṣifāt fī al-mukātabāt wa-al-murāsalāt : manuscript / Marʻī ibn Yūsuf al-Karmī.

record.title: 880-02 al-Arbaʻūn al-Nawawīyah : manuscript / Abū Zakarīyā Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Nawawī.

Incipit: "Hādhā matn al-Arbaʻīn Ḥadīth, lil-Shaykh al-ʻālim, al-Nawawī, taghammadahu Allāh bi-al-raḥmah wa-al-ruḍwān. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qayyūm al-samāwāt wa-al-araḍīn, mudabbir al-khalāʼiq ajmaʻīn, bāʻith al-rusul, ṣalawāt Allāh wa-salāmuhu ʻalayhim, ilá al-mukallafīn, li-hidāyatihim wa-bayān sharāʼiʻ al-dīn bi-al-dalāʼil al-qaṭʻīyah wa-wāḍiḥāt al-barāhīn ..."
Secundo folio: al-Qiyāmah fī zumrat al-fuqahāʼ wa-al-ʻulamāʼ.
15.5 x 22 cm; written surface: 10 x 16.5 cm; 13 lines per page.

(This is the end of what I intended to mention of the Ḥadīths that summed up the doctrines of Islam, and included countless types of sciences, on the principles, branches, etiquette, and all other aspects of provisions ...)
On folios 23a-28b: A chapter on the problematic words (in the 40/42 Ḥadīths): "Bāb al-Ishārah ilá al-alfāẓ al-mushkilāt".

Qawluhu 'Qurāb al-arḍ', bi-ḍamm al-qāf wa-kasrihā, lughatān, ruwiya bihimā, al-ḍamm ashhar, wa-maʻnāhu mā yuqrabu milʼuhā ..."

15.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 14.5 cm; 19 lines per page.

record.title: 880-02 Masʼalat al-jāriyah : manuscript / Ibrāhīm ibn Muḥammad al-Birmāwī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger (based on folio 1a and the incipit).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad. Qāla Sayyidunā wa-Mawlānā, Shaykh Mashāyikh al-Islām al-Shihāb, al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Birmāwī, laṭafa Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh māniḥ al-ʻulamāʼ bi-al-ʻaṭāyā wa-māniʻ al-juhhāl min al-mazāyā, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, Sayyid al-awwalīn wa-al-ākhirīn min al-barāyā, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-makhṣūṣīn bi-ruʼyā al-khabāyā, ṣalātan wa-salāman dāʼimayn mutalāzimayn ilá yawm mujāzāt al-khalq ʻalá al-ḥasanāh (al-ḥasanāt) wa-al-khaṭāyā. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi risālah jamaʻtu fīhā aṭrāf 'Masʼalat al-jāriyah' al-mashhūrah bayna ṭalabat al-ʻilm bi-al-ṣuʻūbah min ḥaythu taʻdād ṣuwarihā wa-kathīr mā yakhtalif al-ʻadad fīhā ..."
Secundo folio: wa-ḥāṣil mā dhakarahu fī hādhihi al-ṣuwar al-arbaʻ min ḥaythu al-ḥukm bi-al-buṭlān wa-ʻadamih.
15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15.5 cm; 15-25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (the three leaves are stiched with thread).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi risālah jamaʻa fīhā aṭrāf 'Masʼalat al-jārīyah' al-ʻĀlim al-ʻAllāmah al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Birmāwī, raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Milk al-faqīr Ziyādah al-Basyūnī al-Shāfiʻī al-Azharī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi."

Author's colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Birmāwī: Wa-jumiʻat baʻda al-ʻishāʼ, laylat al-Jumʻah, min al-laylah al-rābiʻah ʻashar, min shahr Rabīʻ al-Thānī al-mubārak, min shuhūr sanat 1055, khamsah wa-khamsīn wa-alf, min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author, al-Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Birmāwī, said: It was collected after the evening prayer, on Friday, the fourteenth night of the blessed month of Rabīʻ al-Thānī, of the year 1055, one thousand and fifty-five, of the Prophet's Hijrah [9 June 1645], may the best blessings and peace be upon Him."
Copyist's colophon: "Taḥrīran fī thānī Rabīʻ al-Thānī min shuhūr sanat 1066, sittah wa-sittīn wa-alf, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr Muḥammad (?)."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "Copied on the second day of the month of Rabīʻ al-Thānī, of the year 1066, one thousand sixty-six [of the Hijrah = 29 January 1656], by the poor servant Muhammad (?)."

Aqsamtu ʻalaykum ayyuhā al-arwāḥ al-muqaddasah al-nūrānīyah, al-khuddām li-hādhihi al-asmāʼ al-ʻiẓām, alā mā ajabtum daʻwatī, wa-barartum qasamī, wa-tamashshaytum li-qaḍāʼ ḥājatī, wa-simatuhā kayt wa-kayt, min kull mā yurḍī Allāh taʻālá, wa-fīhi ṣalāḥ amrī, bi-ḥaqq nūr wajh Allāh al-ʻAẓīm al-Aʻẓam, wa-ʻaẓamatihi wa-kibriyāʼihi ʻalaykum, idh lā yūṣifu al-wāṣifūn kunha ʻaẓamatihi, bi-ḥaqq ḥaqqihi ʻalaykum wa-ḥurmatihi wa-qudratihi ladaykum, wa-qālū samiʻnā wa-aṭaʻnā, ghufrānuka Rabbanā wa-ilayka al-maṣīr, wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl, niʻma al-Mawlá wa-niʻma al-naṣīr."

record.title: Collection of Arabic folktales : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of "Qiṣṣat Naṣūḥā al-ʻĀbid": The beginning is missing. Text starts as follows: "... Naṣūḥā wa-kāna dhā mālin wāsiʻ ilá ghāyat mā yakūnu, wa-kāna fī ayyām al-fatrah, bayna ʻĪsá rūḥ Allāh wa-bayna Muḥammad ḥabīb Allāh, qāla fa-lammā kāna dhālika zādat al-fikrah ʻalá Naṣūḥ fī ḍayāʻ ʻumrihi wa-fī ittibāʻ al-Shayṭān, wa-zādahu Allāh taʻālá naẓaran fī tawbatihi wa-baṣīratihi wa-ḥaqīqat tawbatihi, qāla wa-kāna la-hu zawjah muwāfiqah wa-lā tukhālifuhu fī jamīʻ afʻālihi, kāna dhālika min amr Allāh taʻālá wa-min maʻūnatihi ..."
Secundo folio of "Qiṣṣat Naṣūḥā al-ʻĀbid": wa-murādī bi-murādika wa-ikhtiyārī bi-ikhtiyārika.

Incipit of "Qiṣṣat Faḍlūn al-ʻĀbid": "Hādhā Qiṣṣat Faḍlūn al-ʻĀbid. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-huwa mā ruwiya ʻan Ibn ʻAbbās, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhumā annahu qāl: Qāla Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, dhāta yawm ṣallá al-ṣubḥ, thumma istanada bi-ẓahrihi al-sharīf ilá miḥrābihi, kaannahu al-badr fī tamāmihi wa-kamālih, wa-jalasa Abū Bakr ʻan yamīnihi, wa-ʻUmar ʻan shamālihi, wa-ʻUthmān wa-ʻAlī bayna yadayhi ..."
Secundo folio of "Qiṣṣat Faḍlūn al-ʻĀbid": wa-al-ikrām wa-yaqūlu laka innahu sa-yaqaʻu li-rajulin min ummatika ysammá Faḍlūn.
11.5 x 17 cm; written surface: 7.5 x 12 cm; 11-17 lines per page.
Unbound (in three unnumbered quires).
In fair clear naskh script (in different hands), in black ink, on cream color paper; headings and keywords in red; catchwords.

"Qiṣṣat Naṣūḥā al-ʻĀbid" ends as follows: "... fa-istajāba Allāh taʻālá daʻwatahu, fa-anzala Allāh al-Tawrāt ʻalá Mūsá ibn ʻImarān, wa-dhakara fīhā Naṣūḥā bi-al-ʻIbrānīyah 'Tūbū ilá Allāh tawbatan Naṣūḥā', wa-anzala al-Injīl ʻalá ʻĪsá ibn Maryam, ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, wa-dhakara fīhi Naṣūḥā bi-al-Suryānīyah 'Tūbū ilá Allāh tawbatan Naṣūḥā', wa-anzala al-Qurʼān ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-huwa sayyid al-ʻArab wa-al-ʻAjam, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-ʻalá sāʼir al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tammat."

"Qiṣṣat Faḍlūn al-ʻĀbid" ends abruptly as follows: "... thumma qāma al-Imām ʻAlī ilá ʻUmar, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhumā, wa-istaʼdhanahu fī al-rujūʻ ilá al-Kūfah, fa-adhina la-hu, thumma waddaʻa al-Muslimīn wa-rajiʻa ilá al-Kūfah. Qāla thumma inna al-Imām amhala al-jāriyah ḥattá waḍaʻat ḥimlahā, fa-waḍaʻat ghulāman aswad wa-māta li-waqtihi, fa-amarahum bi-qatlihā, wa-aqāma Faḍlūn yaʻbudu Allāh ʻazza wa-jall ilá an ..."

record.title: Fragment of an unidentified treatise on Arabic morphology : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts as follows: "... qāmat wa-in kānat mabdūʼatan bi-ḥarf min ḥurūf anaytu wa-qabilat lam fa-hiya fiʻl muḍāriʻ, naḥwa lam aqul, wa-in dallat ʻalá al-ṭalab wa-qabilat yāʼ al-muʼannathah fa-hiya fiʻl amr, naḥwa akhribī, wa-in lam taqbal shayʼan min ʻalāmāt al-ism wa-lā min ʻalāmāt al-fiʻl fa-hiya ḥarf naḥwa layta. Faṣl. Thumma al-kalimah immā an yalzama ākhiruhā ḥālah wāḥidah min ghayr ʻāmil, wa-yusammá dhālika bināʼan, wa-sa-yaʼtī, wa-immā an yantaqila min ḥālah ilá ḥālah bi-sabab al-ʻawāmil al-dākhilah ʻalayhā, wa-yusammá dhālika iʻrāban ..."
Secundo folio: hunā kull ism dalla ʻalá wāḥid ka-Zayd wa-ʻUthmān wa-ʻurbūn wa-ghislīn wa-ʻArafāt.
12 x 19 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 14 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; text framed; catchwords.
Folios 16b-20b are blank.

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā mā tayassara jamʻuhu wa-tartībuh, ghayra maqṣūdin bi-hi taḥrīruhu wa-tahdhībuh, bal tashīl al-ṭarīq ilá wuṣūlihi li-fahm al-mubtadī wa-taqrībih, wa-innamā li-kulli imriʼin mā nawá, manna Allāh ʻalayya wa-ʻalá ikhwānī bi-iṣābat al-hudá wa-al-siwá, wa-ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam ʻalá Nabīyihi al-dāll ʻalá al-hudá, al-āmiri bi-al-iʻrāḍ ʻan ṭarīq man ḍalla wa-ghawá. Tammat."

Translation of the colophon: "This is what has been made possible to collect and arrange. It is not intended to be edited and refined, rather to facilitate the way to reach and be closer to the understanding of the beginner. For, each person gets what he intends to have. May God bestow upon me and upon my brethren the path of guidance and uprightness. May God's blessings and peace be upon His Prophet, the guide to righteousness, who commands turning away from those who went astray and erred. It is completed."

record.title: 880-03 al-Ajurrūmīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ājurrūm.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... wa-al-lām wa-ḥurūf al-qasam, wa-hiya al-wāw wa-al-bāʼ wa-al-tāʼ, wa-al-fiʻl yuʻrafu bi-qad wa-al-sīn wa-sawfa wa-tāʼ al-taʼnīth al-sākinah, wa-al-ḥarf mā lā yaṣluḥu maʻahu dalīl al-ism wa-lā dalīl al-fiʻl. Bāb al-iʻrāb. al-Iʻrāb huwa taghyīr awākhir al-kalim li-ikhtilāf al-ʻawāmil al-dākhilah ʻalayhā lafẓan aw taqdīran, wa-aqsāmuhu arbaʻah, rafʻun wa-naṣbun wa-khafḍun wa-jazm. Fa-lil-asmāʼ min dhālika al-rafʻ wa-al-naṣb wa-al-khafḍ wa-lā jazma fīhā, wa-lil-afʻāl min dhālika al-rafʻ wa-al-naṣb wa-al-jazm wa-lā khafḍa fīhā ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-fiʻl al-muḍāriʻ idhā dakhala ʻalayhi nāṣib wa-lam yattaṣil bi-ākhirihi shayʼ.
10.5 x 15.2 cm; written surface: 5.5 x 11.5 cm; 10 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (loose leaves).
In large good naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; headings in red; text fully vocalized; some leaves seem to be missing; some notes on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly as follows: "... wa-al-muḍmar ithnay ʻashar, wa-hiya: Anā wa-naḥnu wa-anta wa-anti wa-antumā wa-antum wa-antunna wa-huwa wa-hiya wa-humā wa-hum wa-hunna, naḥwa qawlika anā qāʼimun wa-naḥnu qāʼimūn wa-mā ashbaha dhālika, wa-al-khabar qismān mufrad wa-ghayr mufrad, fa-al-mufrad naḥwa qawlika Zaydun qāʼimun wa-ghayr ..."

record.title: 880-02 Ṣifat al-silsilah wa-al-waẓīfah lil-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Mulwānī : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Ismāʻīl al-Mulwānī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger (based on incipit).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Hādhihi 'Ṣifat al-silsilah wa-al-waẓīfah' li-Sayyidī al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Mullawānī bi-sanadihi al-muttaṣil bi-Sayyidī Aḥmad Zarrūq. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī bi-dhikrihi taṭmaʼinnu al-qulūb wa-turfaʻu al-darajāt, wa-bi-duʻāʼihi tukshafu al-kurūb wa-taḥṣulu al-raghabāt, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad fātiḥ abwāb al-saʻādāt, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-tābiʻīhim fī al-khayrāt, wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ʻalá mamarr al-awqāt. Wa-baʻd, yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá Mawlāhu al-Jalīl, Aḥmad ibn Ismāʻīl al-Kātib, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn: Akhadhtu wa-ẓīfat Sayyidī Aḥmad Zarrūq wa-ghayrahā ʻan al-Shaykh ... Aḥmad al-Mallawī ..."
Secundo folio: al-Kātib, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-lil-Muslimīn.
10.5 x 16 cm; written surface: 6 x 11.5 cm; 11 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.

In calligraphic naskh script, in black ink, on thick cream color paper; headings and keywords in red; markings in gold; text fully vocalized and framed in gold; some wormholes on the margins without loss of text; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly, as follows: "... qāla kāna al-Nawawī yadhkuruhu thalāthan ṣabāḥan wa-thalāthan masāʼan, yaqūlu fīhi: Allāhumma innī amsaytu ilá ākhirihi, wa-ḥaqqun ʻalá Allāh an yutimma niʻmatahu ʻalayhi, akhrajahu Abū Dāwūd wa-ghayruhu min ḥadīth Ibn ʻAbbās, wa-anna Allāhumma mā aṣbaḥa bī min niʻmatin aw bi-aḥad min khalqika ilá ākhirihi, akhrajahu Abū Dāwūd min ḥadīth ʻAbd Allāh ibn Ghānim, qāʼilan: Man qālahu ṣabāḥan addá shukra laylatihi wa-masāʼan ..."

record.title: Fragment of an unidentified treatise on Salat : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts as follows: "... Faṣl fī mūjibāt al-ghusl, tūjibuhu ghuyūbat al-ḥashafah ʻalá al-fāʻil wa-al-mafʻūl bi-hi, wa-inzāl al-minī ʻalá wajh al-dafq wa-al-shahwah, wa-wujdān al-minī wa-al-midhī fī thiyābihi baʻda al-nawm, wa-man dhakar al-ḥilm wa-lam yara balalan fa-lā ghusla ʻalayhi idhā kāna rajulan, wa-ammā idhā kāna imraʼatan fa-istayqaẓat wa-hiya ʻalá qafāhā fa-ʻalayhā al-ghusl, wa-inqiṭāʻ al-ḥayḍ wa-al-nafās wa-tamām ayyām al-ḥayḍ lil-mustaḥāḍah wa-ʻinda al-Jumʻah wa-al-ʻīdayn wa-al-ikhrām sunnah, wa-lā yajūzu lil-junub wa-al-muḥdith mass al-Muṣḥaf illā bi-ghilāfihi al-ghayr al-musharraz ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-bawl wa-al-ṣadīd wa-al-dam wa-al-qayḥ wa-al-qayʼ.
11 x 16 cm; written surface: 6 x 10.5 cm; 11 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in three unnumbered quires).
In medium good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some leaves seem to be missing; text partially vocalized and framed in red; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with an invocation, as follows: "... Aʻūdhu bika min sharr mā ṣanaʻtu, abūʼ laka bi-niʻmatika ʻalayya, wa-abūʼu bi-dhanbī fa-ighfir lī dhunūbī, fa-innahu lā yaghfiru al-dhunūba illā anta, lā ilāha illā anta, subḥānaka, innī kuntu min al-ẓālimīn, wa-anta arḥam al-rāḥimīn, Allāhumma aʻūdhuka min an ushrika bika shayʼan wa-an ..."

record.title: 880-01 Qiṣṣat Qiryāqūs wa-ummihi Yūlīṭā : manuscript.

Secundo folio: al-ḥaqq alladhī aqāma hāʼulāʼ min bayn al-amwāt.

record.title: 880-03 al-Insān al-kāmil fī maʻrifat al-awākhir wa-al-awāʼil : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn Ibrāhīm al-Jīlī.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu li-man aqāma bi-ḥamdihi isma Allāh, fa-tajallá fī kull jamālin istaḥaqqahu wa-iqtaḍāh, wa-ḥaṣara bi-nuqṭat khālihi ḥurūf al-jamāl wa-istawfāh, samiʻa ḥamda nafsihi bi-mā athná ʻalayhi al-maʻbūd, fa-huwa al-ḥāmid wa-al-ḥamd wa-al-maḥmūd, ḥaqīqat al-wujūd al-muṭlaq, ʻayn huwīyat al-musammá bi-al-ḥaqq wa-al-khuluq, maḥtid al-ʻālam al-ẓāhir ʻalá ṣūrat Ādam ..."

record.title: 880-03 Sharḥ Umm al-barāhīn fī ʻilm al-kalām : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Sanūsī.

Secundo folio: ʻan al-maqṣad wa-al-marām fa-kayfa bimā naḥnu fīhi min al-talaffut ʻan mahīʻ al-istiqāmah.
17 x 24 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 18 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
In fair medium naskh script, in black ink, on thick white paper; some commentaries on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly, as follows: "... wa-illā fa-yataʻayyanu taqdīr shayʼ qabla illā li-yaḥṣula al-ikhrāj maʻahu, lākin innamā uḥwija ilá hādhā al-taqdīr taṣḥīḥ al-maʻná, fa-yatabayyanu min hādhā al-maʻná alladhī qulnāhu anna al-maqṣūd fī al-kalām alladhī laysa bi-tāmm innamā huwa ithbāt al-ḥukm al-manfī qabla illā li-mā baʻdahā, wa-anna al-istithnāʼ laysa al-maqṣūd, wa-li-hādhā ittafaqa al-nuḥāh ʻalá anna al-madhkūr baʻda illā fī naḥw mā qāma illā Zaydun maʻmūlun lil-ʻāmil alladhī qablahā, wa-lā shakka anna al-maqṣūd min hādhā al-tarkīb al-sharīf amrān, wa-humā nafī ..."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Ājurrūmīyah : manuscript / Abū al-Najā Muḥammad Mujāhid al-Ṭantidāʼī̄.
