Author's colophon. al-Ramlī concludes his treatise with the following invocation: "Nasʼaluka Allāhumma an tuʻīdhanā min al-nār wa-tudkhilanā al-jannah, wa-Anta rāḍin ʻannā, bi-raḥmatin minka, Yā Ghaffār, wa-tumattiʻanā bi-al-naẓar ilá Wajhika al-Karīm, maʻa aḥibbāʼika al-aṣfiyāʼ al-akhyār al-muqarrabīn al-abrār, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdahu, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-Nabī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ʻāqibah lil-muttaqīn, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Ashraf al-Mursalīn. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."

Translation of the author's concluding invocation: "We beseech You, O God, to protect us from Hell, and to admit us to Paradise, and that You are pleased with us, by Your mercy, O Forgiver, and that we enjoy looking at Your Honorable Face, with Your pure, good, close, and righteous loved ones. Praise be to God alone. May God's blessings and abundant peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, the Illiterate Prophet, and upon His family and companions, until the Day of Judgment. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. May the outcome be for the righteous, and prayers and peace be upon the Most Honorable of the Messengers. God knows better."

Copyist's colophon: "Kātibuhu al-faqīr al-muʻtarif [?] bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr Muḥammad al-Jazzār al-Marjāwī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-wālid wālidayhi, wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-aḥibbāʼihi wa-maḥbūbīhi, wa-li-man daʻá la-hu bi-al-maghfirah, Yā Rabba al-ʻĀlamīn. Subḥāna Rabbika Rabbi al-ʻIzzati ʻammā yaṣifūn, wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-Nabī al-Ummī, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīn kathīran ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "Its poor copyist, who confesses [?] his sin and negligence, Muḥammad al-Jazzār Al-Marjāwī, may God forgive him, his parents, his parents' parents, his shaykhs, his companions, his loved ones, his beloved ones, and those who pray for his forgiveness, O Lord of the Univers. Glory be to your Lord, Lord of Glory, far is He from what they ascribe to Him. Peace be upon the messengers. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. May God's blessings and abundant peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, the Illiterate Prophet, and upon his family and companions, until the Day of Judgment. God knows better."

record.title: Letter from Henry Rivington Hill to his sister describing George IV's Coronation, 1821 July 26 : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.

With a detailed hand-drawn map of the procession route, along with the original envelope addressed to "Miss Hannah Maria Hill" and annotated "Containing what I saw of the procession at the Coronation of George the 4th in 1821." Also with a small piece of black fabric claimed to be from the Coronation robe.

record.title: Valuation of Donnington Castle Plantation, negroes, stock &c., taken by us this 21st of May 1789 at the request of William Mitchell & George Cuthbert Esquires attornies, to Sir John Dalling Bart. : manuscript.
record.note: Caption title.

Six elephant folio pages, written entirely in ink manuscript on thick paper; one bifolium and one separate leaf of equal size. Docketed on page [6]. The first four pages are a bifolium attached at the upper left corner to a separate leaf with binding string.

record.title: 880-02 Aḥādīth fī faḍāʼil al-aʻmāl : manuscript / jamaʻahā Khaṭṭāb ibn ʻUmar ibn Ibrāhīm al-Shahālī al-Azharī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger (based on incipit).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: Hādhā kitāb al-Aḥādīth al-ṣaḥīḥah wa-ghayrihā min al-kutub al-mashhūrah al-munʻaqad [al-muttafaq (?)] ʻalayhā ʻinda jamāʻat al-Muslimīn, Ahl al-Sunnah wa-al-Jamāʻah, fī faḍāʼil al-aʻmāl, mimmā ijtamaʻa ʻalayhi ahl al-Ḥadīth. Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Qāla ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Man saʻá li-akhīhi al-Muslim fī ḥājatin, quḍiyat la-hu aw lam tuqḍá, ghafara Allāh la-hu mā taqaddama min dhanbihi wa-mā taʼakhkhar wa-kataba la-hu barāʼatān, barāʼah min al-nār wa-barāʼah min al-nifāq ..."
Secundo folio: Amīr al-Muʼminīn Abī Ḥafṣ ʻUmar ibn al-Khaṭṭāb raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu.
17 x 23 cm; written surface: 10,5 x 10.5 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in five unnumbered quires).
In large clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings in red; some leaves seem to be missing; few notes on the margins; catchwords.

Colophon: "Wa-fī hādhā kifāyah, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-hidāyah, wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-qad jamaʻa hādhihi al-Aḥādīth kullihā al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá ʻafw Rabbihi wa-karamih, Khaṭṭāb ibn ʻUmar ibn Ibrāhīm al-Shahālī al-Azharī, ʻafā Allāh ʻanhu wa-ghafara la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-ikhwānihi min al-Muslimīn, wa-li-man qaraʼahu aw naẓara fīhi wa-raʼá ʻayban fa-aṣlaḥahu, wa-li-kull al-Muslimīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "This is sufficient. Praise be to God for guidance. There is no power nor might except in God, the Most High, the Almighty. May God's blessings and peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, his family, and his companions. All of these Ḥadīths were compiled by the servant who is poor to the pardon and generosity of his Lord, Khaṭṭāb ibn ʻUmar ibn Ibrāhīm al-Shahālī al-Azharī. May God pardon and forgive him, his parents, his Muslim brethren, and whoever reads it, or looks into it, and sees a defect and corrects it, and all Muslims. May God's blessings and peace be upon our Master Muhammad, His family, and His companions."

record.title: Fragment of an unidentified treatise on Sufism : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... yaqūlūna Rabbanā atmim lanā nūranā wa-ighfir lanā innaka ʻalá kull shayʼ qadīr, wa-qawluhu taʻālá: Wa-awfū bi-ʻahdi Allāhi idhā ʻāhadtum wa-lā tanquḍū al-aymāna baʻda tawkīdihā wa-qad jaʻaltumu Allāha ʻalaykum kafīlan inna Allāha yaʻlamu mā tafʻalūna ..."
Secundo folio: wa-fī ṣalāt al-ḍuḥá wa-al-ishrāq.
17 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 15 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 4 quires)
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and marking in red; some leaves seem to be missing; catchwords.

Colophon. No colophon. Text ends abruptly as follows: "... fa-qad waqaʻa dhālika li-Sayyidī Abī al-Ḥasan al-Shādhilī, wa-li-Sayyidī Muḥammad Abī Maḥmūd al-Ḥanafī, wa-li-Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlī, wa-amthālihim, fa-suʼila Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlī man shaykhuka yā Sayyidī, fa-qāl ammā fīmā maḍá fa-kāna shaykhī Ḥammād al-Dabbāsī, wa-ammā al-ān fa-innī astaqī wa-artawī min baḥrayn, baḥr al-futūwah wa-baḥr al-nubūwah, fa-baḥr al-futūwah ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib, wa-baḥr al-nubūwah al-Nabī, ṣallá Allāh ..."

record.title: Fragment of an unidentified treatise on Islamic doctrines, Islamic ethics, and conduct of life : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

The beginning is missing. Text starts with part of "al-Bāb al-sābiʻ" (Chapter seven), as follows: "... Wa-qāla, ʻalayhi al-salām: Ṭalab al-ʻilm farīḍah ʻalá kull Muslim. Wa-qāla, ʻalayhi al-salām, fī dhamm man lam yaʻmal bi-ʻilmihi: Ashadd al-nās ʻadhāban Yawm al-Qiyāmah ʻālimun lā yanfaʻuhu Allāh bi-ʻilmihi. Wa-qāla, ʻalayhi al-salām: Man izdāda ʻilman wa-lam yazdad hudan lam yazdad min Allāh illā buʻdan, fa-man arāda al-saʻādah al-kāmilah fa-li-yaʻmal bimā yaʻlamu li-yuḥshara fī zumrat al-Nabīyīn, fa-yuṭahhira nafsahu min radhāʼil al-akhlāq, wa-an yatafarragha lil-ʻilm ..."
Secundo folio: fa-man raḍiya fa-lahu al-riḍá wa-man sakhaṭa fa-la-hu al-sukhṭ.
17 x 23 cm; written surface: 9 x 17 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in eight unnumbered quires).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and keywords in red; notes and corrections on the margins; some quires seem to be missing; catchwords.
The endowment statement "Waqf lillāh taʻālá" appears at the head of seven of the quires.
On folios 64b-65b: Miscellaneous quotations in poetry and prose.
Folilos 1 and 66 are blank.

On folio 65a: The following endowment statement by al-Ḥājj Sālim Jumʻah, dated 9 N [Shaʻbān/Ramaḍān (?)], of the year 1279 of the Hijrah (1863): "Waqafa wa-ḥabasa wa-taṣaddaqa al-Ḥājj Sālim Jumʻah hādhā al-kitāb ʻalá ṭalabat al-ʻilm, lā yubāʻ wa-lā yūhab wa-lā yurhan, fa-man baddalahu baʻda mā samiʻahu fa-innamā ithmuhu ʻalá alladhīna yubaddilūnahu, inna Allāh samiʻun ʻalīm, wa-jaʻala al-naẓar fīhi lil-Shaykh Yāsīn Makhlūf, thumma min baʻd mawtihi yakūnu al-naẓar fīhi li-dhurrīyatihi, wa-jaʻala al-wāqif dhālika ibtighāʼ wajh Allāh, wa-yurīdu al-najāh min Rabb al-barīyāt alladhī lahu mā fī al-samāwāt wa-mā fī al-arḍ, wa-Allāh aʻlam. al-Mukarram al-Ḥājj Sālim Jumʻah, ʻufiya ʻanhu. Amīn. 9 N, sanat 1279."

Translation of the endowment statement: "al- Ḥājj Sālim Jumʻah endowed, restricted the use of, and gave this book as charity to the students of religious studies. It cannot be sold, given away, or pawned. Whoever changes it [the endowment statement] after he has heard it, his sin is only upon those who change it. Indeed, God is All-Hearing, All-Knowing. He [al-Ḥājj Sālim Jumʻah] assigned its supervision to al-Shaykh Yāsīn Makhlūf, then after his death, the supervision will be for his descendants. The endower did this seeking the face of God, and salvation from the Lord of Creation, to Whom belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth, and God knows best. May the honorable al-Ḥājj Sālim Jumʻah be pardoned. Amen. 9 N [Shaʻbān/Ramaḍān (?)] of the year 1279 [of the Hijrah = 1863]."

Author's colophon: "Wa-qad tamma hādhā al-kitāb bi-ḥamd al-Malik al-Wahhāb wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqihi, ʻalá yad jāmiʻihi, faqīr ʻafw Rabbihi wa-asīr waṣmat dhanbihi, ghafara Allāh la-hu, wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-mashāyikhi, wa-muḥibbīhi, wa-dhurrīyatihi, wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-ḥusná, wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn ... wa-kāna al-farāgh min taʼlīfihi yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, ʻashr shahr Jumād al-Awwal, sanat 1194, alf wa-miʼah wa-arbaʻah wa-tisʻīn, baʻda al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This book was completed with the praise, help, and abundant benevolence of the Abundant Giving King, by the hand of its compiler, the poor to the forgiveness of his Lord, and the prisoner of the stain of his sin. May God forgive him, his parents, his shaykhs, his lovers, his descendants, those who pray for his goodness, and all Muslims... Its writing was completed on blessed Monday, the tenth of the blessed month of Jumad al-Awwal, of the year 1194, one thousand one hundred and ninety-four, after the Hijrah of the Prophet [14 May 1780], may the best blessings and peace be upon Him."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min tamām naskh hādhā al-kitāb al-mubārak yawm al-Thulāth al-mubārak, ithnayn shahr Rajab al-aṣamm alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1279, alf wa-miʼatayn tisʻah wa-sabʻīn, ʻalá yad kātibihi Ibrāhīm al-Bakrī ibn al-Sayyid ʻAlī al-Bakrī, ʻufiya ʻanhu. Āmīn."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This blessed book was completed on blessed Tuesday, the second of the honored month of Rajab, of the year 1279, one thousand two hundred and seventy-nine [of the Hijrah = 24 December 1862], at the hand of its copyist, Ibrāhīm al-Bakr̄ ibn al-Sayyid ʻAlī al-Bakrī, may he be pardoned. Amen."

record.title: 880-01 Naṣīḥat al-ikhwān min shurb al-dukhān ʻinda qirāʼat al-Qurʼān : manuscript.
record.note: Title from incipit.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

The beginning is missing. Text starts as follows: "... wa-dhullihā wa-ṣāra fī majālis al-adhkār wa-al-Aḥādīth wa-al-Qurʼān, bi-hi yutadāʻá, wa-iqtadá ʻawām al-bashar bi-ʻulamāʼihim wa-ahmalū mā shurriʻa min al-aḥkām li-ajl ladhdhātihim, wa-kāna min al-wājib ʻalá kull Muslim an yunkir dhālik, sharaʻtu fī kitābat risālah fī dhālika, wa-in kuntu lastu ahlan li-jawalān hādhā al-maydān, wa-lā mimman yarkabu qarbūs hādhā al-ʻinān, iqtaṭaftuhā min aghṣān maʻādinihā wa-rashshaḥtuhā bi-shawārid iqtanaṣtuhā min masākin ghāyatihā, wa-sammaytuhā 'Naṣīḥat al-ikhwān min shurb al-dukhān ʻinda qirāʼat al-Qurʼān'. Wa-hādhā awān al-shurūʻ fī al-maqṣūd, wa-billāh al-tawfīq ..."
Secundo folio: ʻalá ḥurmat tanāwulihā mā ʻadā ṣirf al-khamr.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 8 x 15 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (one quire and one loose leaf).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on thick cream color paper; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly as follows: "... anna al-dukhān qalla an yanfakka ʻan luḥūq ḍarar bi-al-jism maʻa ifsādihi al-māl li-annahu yushtará bi-al-darāhim dhāt al-bāl. Wa-iʻlam anna al-ʻudūl qad ikhtalafū, mimman kāna yataʻāṭāhu wa-mimman huwa muṣirrun ʻalayhi, fī al-ikhbār ʻanhu, fa-minhum man yaḥkum bi-ḍararihi, wa-minhum man yanfīhi, wa-minhum man yaqifu wa-yashukku fīhi. Wa-ʻindī law tasāwá al-ikhbār wa-taʻadhdhara al-tarjīḥ ʻinda taʻāruḍ al-ikhbār la-amkana al-jamʻ bi-ikhtilāf al-ṭibāʻ, aw bi-iʻtibār al-ḥāl wa-al-māl, lākinna al-jamʻ lil-aghlab wa-al-farīq alladhī alḥaqa ..."

record.title: Fragment of an unidentified commentary on an unidentified treatise on Islamic law : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts as follows: "... aw ghayr dhālik, lā yamussu al-Muṣḥaf, wa-la-hu an yafʻala bi-hi mā akhrajahu, wa-kadhā lā taḍurru nīyat rafʻ ḥadath faqaṭ maʻa dhikr ghayrihi ḥayth lam yukhrijhu, fa-in dhakarahu wa-akhrajahu fa-yaḍurru, sawāʼun kāna al-mukhraj wa-al-manwī mashkūkayn aw mutayaqqanayn, aw al-mukhraj mashkūkan wa-al-manwī mutayaqqanan, aw ʻaksuhu, wa-kadhā lā yaḍurru bi-al-awlá idhā nasiya ḥadathan kharaja minhu wa-dhakara ākhirahu wa-nawá mā dhakarahu faqaṭ ..."
Secundo folio: ʻan al-ʻādāt wa-tamyīz muwāfiqihā farḍan wa-naflan.
17 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 16 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 14 quires, numbered 15-26).
In medium clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; phrases of the original in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
Folio 136b is blank.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly, as follows: "... (lā budda an yakūnū ʻadad tataqarrá bihim) ghāliban (qaryatun mustaghnīn) ʻaṭf bayān (ʻan ghayrihim āminīn ʻalá anfusihim) bi-an yumkinuhum al-iqāmah wa-al-dafʻ ʻan anfusihim (wa-hādhā al-ʻadad) alladhī laysa bi-maḥdūd (sharṭun fī al-ibtidāʼ), ay fī awwal jumʻah tuqāmu fī al-balad, fa-yushtaraṭu ḥuḍūr al-jamīʻ bi-ṣalātihā, hādhā mafāduhu ka-ghayrihi. Wa-qāla Ḥ al-muʻtamad al-iktifá bi-ithnay ʻashar ḥattá fī awwal Jumʻah tuqāmu ḥaythu kāna ahl al-balad tataqarrá bihim āminīn. Qāl ʻAj wa-yumkinu ḥaml al-awwalīyah, ay fī al-Mukhtaṣar wa-al-ibtidā ..."

record.title: Fragment of an unidentified commentary on an unidentified treatise on Islamic law : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts as follows: "... fa-kull maʻṣiyah uḍīfat ilá mā fawqahā fa-hiya ṣaghīrah, wa-idhā uḍīfat ilá mā dūnihā fa-hiya kabīrah, wa-al-kabīrah al-muṭlaqah hiya al-kufr, idh lā dhanba akbar minhu, kadhā qālahu al-ʻAllāmah Saʻd al-Dīn fī Sharḥ al-ʻAqāʼid. Qāla al-Ghazzī wa-iʻtaraḍ al-Kamāl ibn al-Sharīf fī ḥāshiyatihi ʻalá mā qīla kull maʻṣiyah aṣarra ʻalayhā al-ʻabd fa-hiya kabīrah, wa-kull mā istaghfara ʻanhu fa-hiya ṣaghīrah bi-annahu mukhālifun li-qawlihi, taʻālá In tajtanibū kabāʼira mā tunhawana ʻanhu nukaffir ʻankum sayyiʼātikum ..."
Secundo folio: yanbaghī an yurajjaḥa al-nahy hā hunā ʻalá al-amr ʻamalan bi-al-qāʻidah al-madhkūrah.
16 x 23 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 19 cm; 29 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 8 quires, numbered 18-25).
In medium clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
Folio 136b is blank.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly, as follows: "... al-Wilāyah al-khāṣṣah awlá ilakh. al-Ṣawāb lā ʻamala lil-wilāyah al-ʻāmmah maʻa al-wilāyah al-khāṣṣah, kadhā dhakarhu al-Bīrī, wa-hādhā, ay, mā dhakarahu min al-taṣwīb yubtaná ʻalá mā waqaʻa fī nuskhatihi min qawlihi awlá, wa-illā fa-alladhī fī nuskhatinā aqwá, wa-ʻalayhi, fa-lā ḥājata lil-taṣwīb, li-anna afʻal ..."

record.title: Fragment of an unidentified treatise on Arab medicine : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... yustaʻmalu ḍimād al-thūm wa-al-milḥ ḥattá yabraʼ, wa-idhā ʻujina al-thawm wa-al-filfil wa-al-zanjabīl bi-al-ʻasal wa-ustuʻmila aklan wa-ḍimādan yaqṭaʻu al-bawāsīr al-sayyālah wa-al-jāmidah, wa-Allāh aʻlam, wa-ghidhāʼ al-nawʻīn jamīʻan khubz khamīr al-ḥinṭah wa-marīq al-farārīj, wa-yutajannabu kull ḥāmiḍ wa-kull bārid raṭib, fa-inna dhālika jayyid nāfiʻ mujarrab. al-Nawāṣīr hiya ʻurūq tanbutu mawāḍiʻ al-bawāsīr bi-laḥm ka-al-thaʼālīl al-ṭiwāl, wa-huwa nawʻ min al-bawāsīr illā annahā aṭwal wa-adaqq bayna al-diqqah wa-al-ghilẓah ..."
Secundo folio: wa-lā shayʼ ghayruhu aḥsan minhu wa-huwa ṣaḥīḥ mujarrab.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 15.5 cm; 18 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (one quire).

In fair small naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; markings in red; some corrections on the margins; some notes on the margins and interlinear; some leaves seem to be missing; parts on folios 3 and 4 are torn with loss of text; parts of the leaves are affected by dampness; catchwords.

Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly, as follows: "... Wajaʻ al-ḍirs wa-huwa ḍarbān, daqīq ay shadīd al-alam bi-mawḍiʻ al-ḍirs al-wajīʻ, sababuhu ziyādat bard ʻāriḍ, aw dūdah tataḥarraku fī dākhil al-ḍirs, tawalladat min al-ʻufūnāt. al-ʻIlāj. Yusḥaq al-filfil wa-al-thūm, yuʻjanān bi-lubāb khamīr al-ḥinṭah ḥārran wa-yuḍammu bi-hi al-ḍirs al-wajiʻ wa-mā ḥawālayhi min jamīʻ al-mawḍiʻ al-alīm, wa-qīla idhā ʻujina daqīq al-filfil wa-al-ḥalbah bi-al-ʻasal wa-waḍaʻahu al-insān ʻalá al-ḍirs al-wajīʻ wa-araqqahu, wa-kāna yamtaṣṣu mā nazala ..."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Muqaddimah al-Azharīyah fī ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah : manuscript / Khālid ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: The beginning is missing. Text starts with: "... min al-kall wa-al-taʻab, wa-kull man ʻalima wa-lam yaʻmal bi-ʻilmihi fa-huwa mithluhu, wa-kharaja ʻan dhālika al-jumlah al-inshāʼīyah wa-ghayr al-mukhaṣṣaṣah, fa-innahumā lā yakūnān ḥālan min maʻrifah wa-lā naʻtan li-nakirah, (ḥukm al-ẓurūf) al-zamānīyah wa-al-makānīyah (wa-al-majrūrāt) bi-al-ḥurūf al-aṣlīyah (ka-ḥukm al-jumal) al-khabarīyah al-maḥḍah, fa-baʻda al-maʻārif al-maḥḍah lafẓan wa-maʻnan (aḥwāl, naḥwa jāʼa Zaydun ʻalá al-faras aw fawqa al-nāqah), fa-al-jārr wa-al-majrūr wa-al-ẓarf ḥālān min Zayd li-annahu maʻrifah maḥḍah ..."
Secundo folio: wa-huwa ʻāmilun madhkūr (am ḥudhifa sawāʼun ḥudhifa wujūban naḥwa yawm al-Khamīs ṣumtu fīhi).
16 x 21 cm; written surface: 10 x 15 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (loose leaves).
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; phrases of "al-Muqaddimah al-Azharīyah fī ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah" in red; catchwords.

Colophon. Text ends as follows: "... wa-jumlat (yuwaswisu) min al-fiʻl wa-al-fāʻil ṣilat (alladhī), wa-ʻāʼiduhā fāʻil yuwaswisu al-mustatir fīhi (fī ṣudūr) jārr wa-majrūr mutaʻalliq bi-yuwaswisu, (al-nās) muḍāf ilayhi, (min al-jinnati) mutaʻalliq ayḍan bi-yuwaswisu, (wa-al-nās) maʻṭūf ʻalá al-jinnah. Wa-fī hādhā al-qadr kifāyah lil-mubtadī. Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran."

At the end of the text on folio 4b (written in a different hand) six verses from the "Alfīyah" of Ibn Mālik, start with: "Kalāmunā lafẓun mufīdun ka-istaqim // wa-ismun wa-fiʻlun thumma ḥarfun al-kalim ..." and end with: "... Wa-māḍiya al-afʻāli bi-al-tāʼi miz wa-sim // bi-al-nūni fiʻla al-amr in amrun fuhim."

Wa-ammā al-zuḥāf, fa-yajrī al-khabn fī kull fāʻilātun wa-fāʻilun wa-fī fāʻilān wa-fāʻilīyān, wa-yajrī fī kull fāʻilātun ..."

Wa-kāna al-farāgh min injāz hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah yawm al-Khamīs, 19 shahr Ṣafar, sanat 1160, ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá, Ḥusayn al-ʻIrāqī al-Shāfiʻī, ghafara Allāh la-hu, wa-li-man daʻá la-hu. Āmīn. Wa-in tajid ʻayban fa-sudda al-khalalā // <wa-qul> jalla man lā fīhi ʻaybun wa-ʻalā."

Translation of the colophon: "The conclusion took place by the grace of the Forgiver God. May blessing and peace be upon the Messenger of God, the All-Knowing King. The completion of this honorable copy was on Thursday, the 19th of the month of Ṣafar, of the year 1160 [of the Hijrah = 2 March 1747], by the hand of the poor to God Almighty, Ḥusayn al-ʻIrāqī al-Shāfiʻī, may God forgive him and those who pray for him. Amen. If you were to find a blemish close the gap // <and say> Mighty and Sublime is the One in whom no blemish exists."

IH, fa-nasʼalu Allāh taʻālá an yaḥshuranā fī zumratihim."

Author's colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā tayassara jamʻuhu. Wa-nasʼalu Allāh taʻālá an yakhtuma lanā bi-khātimat al-saʻādah, wa-an yaʻfuwa ʻannā, wa-an yuʻāmilanā bi-jamīl iḥsānih, wa-an yudkhilanā al-Jannah bi-faḍlihi wa-imtinānih, min ghayr sābiqat ʻadhāb wa-lā ʻiqāb, bi-jāh Sayyidinā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, wa-al-āl wa-al-aṣḥāb, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh al-Karīm al-Wahhāb. Tammat bi-ḥamdi Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Tamm."

Translation of the author's colophon: "This is the end of what we were able to collect. We ask God to seal us with the seal of happiness, to pardon us, to treat us with the beauty of His benevolence, and to admit us to Paradise, with His grace and favor, without precedence of torment or punishment, for the sake of our Master Muḥammad, may God's blessings and peace be upon Him, and upon His family, and companions. Praise be to God, the Generous, the Abundant Giving. It was completed by the praise of God, His help, and His abundant benevolence. It is completed ..."

Secundo folio: wa-al-baṣar yataʻallaqān bi-kull mawjūd huwa raʼy al-Sanūsī wa-man tabiʻahu.

This is the end of what God facilitated of His favor. May God's blessings be upon our master Muhammad, and upon his family, his companions, and his household, whenever those who remember mention him, and those who are heedless neglect to mention him. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe. Amen. Amen."

Secundo folio: an yuktafá fī al-khirṣ bi-ʻadlin wāḥid.
16 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 13 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in one quire).
Script: In large clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "al-Taqrīb" in red; one correction on the margin of folio 6b; catchwords.

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir 'Sharḥ Kitāb Ghāyat al-ikhtiṣār' bi-lā iṭnāb (wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh) li-Rabbinā al-munʻim al-wahhāb, wa-qad allaftuhu ʻājilan fī muddatin yasīrah, wa-al-marjū mimman iṭṭalaʻa fīhi ʻalá hafwatin ṣaghīrah aw kabīrah an yuṣliḥahā in lam yakun al-jawāb ʻanhā ʻalá wajhin ḥasan, li-yakūna mimman yadfaʻu al-sayyiʼah bi-allatī hiya aḥsan, wa-an yaqūla <mim>man iṭṭalaʻa fīhi ʻalá al-fawāʼid, man jāʼa bi-al-khayrāt, inna al-ḥasanāt yudhhibna al-sayyiʼāt. (Jaʻalanā Allāh) bi-ḥusn al-nīyah fī taʼlīfihi maʻa al-nabīyīn wa-al-ṣiddiqīn wa-al-shuhadāʼ wa-al-ṣāliḥīn, wa-ḥasuna [ulāʼika rafīqn]."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of 'Sharḥ Kitāb Ghāyat al-ikhtiṣār' without verbosity. (Praise be to God) our Most Benevolent and Abundant Giving Lord. I wrote it quickly, in a short period of time. I hope that whoever sees in it a small or major lapse will correct it, if the answer to it is not satisfactory, so that he will be among those who repel the bad by what is better. And whoever has seen the benefits in it, the bestower of good, may say, "Indeed, good deeds remove bad deeds." (May God associate us), for our good intentions, with the prophets, the truthful, the martyrs, and the righteous, the best [companions]."

Secundo folio: bi-al-dunyā ʻan al-dīn. Yā Abā Hurayrah, law anna al-muʼmina ʻabada Allāh taʻālá ka-ʻibādati Nūḥ.

Colophon: "Intahat. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyid al-Anām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-sādah al-kirām, wa-al-tābiʻīn lahum bi-iḥsānin ilá Yawm al-Zuḥām. Āmīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min tabyīḍihā fī al-sāʻah al-sābiʻah min yawm al-Aḥad al-mubārak, thālith ʻashar Ṣafar, sanat ithnayn wa-khamsīn wa-miʼatayn baʻda al-alf min [al-Hijrah = 30 Ayyār/Māyū 1836] ..."

May blessings and peace be upon the Master of Mankind, and upon His family and companions, the honorable masters, and those who follow them in good deeds until the Day of Rush. Amen. The fair copy was completed at the seventh hour of blessed Sunday, the thirteenth of Safar, of the year two hundred and fifty-two after thousand of [the Hijrah = 30 May 1836] ..."

Secundo folio: mukhtaṣṣ bi-hi wa-al-ʻibrah bi-ḥamd man dhukir fa-lā farda minhu li-ghayrihi.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 10 x 15.5 cm; 23-25 lines per page.

In fair naskh script, in black ink, on cream color paper; the phrases of "Mukhtaṣar fī al-fiqh ʻalá madhhab al-Shāfiʻī" in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; the leaves are not in order, and some seem to be missing; the endowment statement "Waqf lillāh taʻalá" is written at the head of some of the pages; catchwords.

Colophon (partial): "Qāla al-muṣannif, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Hādhā ākhir mā yassara Allāh taʻālá min 'al-Iqnāʻ fī ḥall alfāẓ Abī Shujāʻ', fa-dūnaka muʼallafan mūḍiḥ al-masāʼil wa-muḥarrir al-dalāʼil, fa-law kāna la-hu nafsun nāṭiqah wa-lisānun munṭaliqah la-qāla bi-maqālin ṣarīḥ wa-kalāmin faṣīḥ: Lillāhi darru muʼallif hādhā al-taʼlīf al-raʼīs, wa-lā shullat yadu muʼallif hādhā al-taṣnīf al-rāʼiq al-nafīs, wa-hādhā al-muʼallaf lā budda an yaqaʻa li-aḥad rajulayn, immā ʻālimun yuḥibbu muṣnif [muḥibbun munṣif] fa-yashhadu lī bi-al-khayr wa-yaʻdhurunī fīmā ʻasá yajiduhu min al-ʻithār alladhī huwa lāzim al-ikthār, wa-immā jāhilun mubghiḍun mutaʻaṣṣif [mutaʻassif] fa-lā iʻtibāra bi-waʻwaʻatihi wa-al-iʻtidād bi-waswasatihi, wa-mithluhu lā yuʻbaʼ bi-muwāfaqatihi wa-lā mukhālafatihi, wa-innamā al-iʻtibār bi-dhī al-naẓar alladhī yuʻṭī kulla dhī ḥaqqin ḥaqqahu. <Wa-> Idhā raḍiyat ʻannī kirāmu ʻishratī [ʻashīratī] // fa-lā zāla ghḍbānan ʻalayya liʼāmuhā. Fa-inn ..."

Translation of the colophon (partial): "The author, may God Almighty have mercy upon him, said: This is the end of what God Almighty facilitated of 'al-Iqnāʻ fī ḥall alfāẓ Abī Shujāʻ'. Here for you a book that explains the issues and presents the evidence. If it were that it has a speaking soul and an eloquent tongue, it would have said with an unequivocal statement and voluble words: May God bless the author of this outstanding work and may the hand of the author of this fine and precious masterpiece not be paralyzed. This book can only fall to one of two men: Either a loving and fair scholar who can bear good witness on my behalf, and excuse me for what he may find of missteps, those that are inevitable with an extensive work, or, an ignorant, hateful, and arrogant person, so there is no need to consider his hustle bustle or care for his nonsense, a person like him is useless to agree with or disagree, rather to look for one that gives every person his due. The honorable members of my clan are pleased with me // but their mean ones will still be angry. For..."

record.title: Student notes on and drawings of human anatomy : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.

Binding: sheets of paper are housed in a contemporary brown marbled paper binding over pasteboard, though unbound. Binding's spine has broken apart; hence, binding now consists of separated front and back cover.

Anatomical drawings: of a skull in profile, of a skull in 3/4 view (manuscript note: non omnis moriar, Στεφανος τους [sic] αθανατοις), of the clavicle and its articulations, of the larynx (3 different perspectives), of the lungs and heart (also includes a sketch of the same drawing; heart itself lifts up to reveal the vascular system), of the male reproductive system (covered by different layers of drawn feathers; includes a copious amount of moveable flaps), of the brain (also with moveable flaps), of the muscles of the ear, and of a man's head. The last drawing is particularly intricate: the top flap shows the man's skin; the three following flaps show muscles; the next shows the skull with an additional flap for the eye; then a flap for the brain matter; final few flaps show a variety of muscles and the larynx. Drawings measure from about 20 x 20 cm to 46.5 cm x 33 cm. They are housed in a large white paper sheet, separately from the notes.

Printed certificate is unsigned, undated, and otherwise unidentified: Theatre London Hospital, Mr. ... has diligently attended ... course of Anatomical Demonstrations and Dissection delivered during the Session ... Certificate was meant to be filled out with manuscript material, but was left unfilled.
Also includes engraved hand-coloured print of an eye: A Diagram of the Human Eye. Published as the Act directs; 1803, J. Murray, Fleet Street.
Sheets with student notes generally consist of multiple sheets of folio paper glued together (up to 9 sheets) and are folded. Longest sheet measures about 195 cm.
